reviews.review: Mischief Managed. Completed the Harry Potter quest with a few minutes to spare and had great fun. Age range of group was 14 to 37 and we all had an awesome time! Puzzles were hard enough to be challenging but not too many hints were needed so there was still a sense of achievement. Even with expectations you will be pleasantly surprised :) Turn up a bit earlier to have a lounge in the very nice waiting area complete with foozeball table and a coffee / hot chocolate machine. We actually stayed there for a half hour after the quest just relaxing and playing the harry potter trival pursuit. All in all a very pleasant experience both before and after. A quick mention and thanks to Shane who was an awesome quest master and host.

Really fun and great idea. Planned this for a VERY belated birthday present for my friend as she loves Harry Potter. I had never done an escape the room before, but this did NOT disappoint! Not as easy as you think, but really fun and the guy running it was really nice ( and did have to help us out a couple of times). Really easy to find, so central.Could not recommend more - we will be back to do the heist one soon!!Thank you very much!
Magical experience. Its a must for any Harry potter fan, not too difficult but still challenging and really really fun. I had such an amazing evening. Thanks Enigma Quests !
Fantastic. We went as a family (all adults) and it was very fun. The problems are all achievable in the time limit, although you can get hints if you are stuck. I would recommend it to everyone!
So much fun!. This was so much fun! 4 of us went. Was challenging but enjoyable. Highly recommended. Really enjoyed the atmosphere and small touches that made the experience.

Magical Night. This was easily the best escape room I've been to in London! I've gone to 3 others and this one was better in every way. For starters, the relax, pre-prep area is super cozy and nice. There's free hot drinks and water along with trivia cards, games and fun decoration. The host we had (can't remember her name) was super sweet! We got lockers for our stuff then went into the game. The props are all handmade and the place itself looks fantastic. A lot of work was put into this escape room and you can tell. Our host was super relaxed and answered all of our questions afterwards! We were a group of four with 8 minutes to spare. The level of difficulty was perfect. Not too hard to get to your next step!Lastly, we were the last group of the night as we finished for 1030 and she let us hang out in the prep room until they closed! Super friendly staff, amazing props, fantastic escape experience and free, nice hot drinks. I would totally recommend to anyone! A new bank heist room is opening soon and I definitely plan to go back to see how that one is! 10 out of 10!

Fantastic night!. Really enjoyed this, was given as a birthday present. Huge Harry Potter fan and loved all the special effects and ideas behind the game. Would definitely recommend. Was an escape room with a twist.

Great Escape Room for Harry Potter fans. I really enjoyed my first Escape Room in Enigma Quest. I felt like I was in Hogwarts for an hour! The puzzles were hard enough to make us think and easy enough to have fun. The staff there was very friendly and helpful.

Absolutely brilliant!. It really breathes the Harry Potter atmosphere in there! The effects are cool, puzzles are interesting and the whole scene is keeping you entertained. Highly recommended for any escape room fans and even more for those who also happen to love the franchise. Oh and... There were only three of us in our group (and for one it was the very first escape room ever), but we managed to get through the puzzles within the time limit. So do not fret even if you're in a smaller group, it is possible and it's loads of fun!

Lots of fun! . This was my and my friends' first "escape room" game and we had a great time! One of my friends was worried that she needed to have read the Harry Potter books but you don't need to. The puzzles were challenging enough and it was really fun working as a team to find all the clues. The venue is conveniently close to Liverpool St station. Highly recommended.

Harry Potter fan's dream! . The School of Witchcraft and Wizardry met every hope and expectation of a HP themed escape room. For the avid Harry Potter fan there are a number of links to the books/films as well as robes to wear throughout the experience, however if you are with people who do not share the obsession the clues and puzzles do not require background knowledge to pass. It was a fantastic hour... and we passed all 6 subjects!

Such Fun!. The end of a perfect weekend in London, we did both the Harry Potter plays the day before so we were definitely in the mood for some wizardry, then on the Sunday morning we did this on our way to liverpool Street Station (its very close) A fun hour was had by all. The staff member who looked after us was fantastic and we were very grateful for the clues (without them I'm quite sure we would still be in there now!!)

Harry Potter . We have done plenty of escape rooms now and this was our third room in a day, I would say this has been the favourite one we've done. The detail in the room is fantastic and you feel truly immersed from the moment you open the initial door. This is a fantastic room for first timers and difficult enough for experienced players to enjoy as well . Even if you have never heard of Harry Potter, you should this game, if you love Harry Potter, why haven't you done this already book now you won't regret it.
Enigma quests. The panic room was very fun and interesting, and I'd definitely do it again! There was a lot to find and figure out.

Magic and mystery!. Two teenage girls and their mothers had a fabulous hour solving puzzles and working as a team. So much thought had gone into the theme and preparing the game. For our first time in an escape room we had such a buzz and keen to do more based on our experience. Whilst the Harry Potter and Hogwarts references were great, people shouldn't be put off if their HP knowledge is limited or none, it wouldn't attract from the game at all.

Best hour of our lives. My two flatmates and I booked in this escape room as part of an evening out, as one of us was leaving after four years. None of us had done an Escape Room before, so we had no idea what to expect.We absolutely loved it. It was perfectly themed, not too difficult (but still challenging!) and the props and effects were amazing. It was so much fun and ended on a perfect high. We spent the whole journey home talking about it. I couldn't recommend it more!

Childhood Dream come True. I am from a generation who grew up on harry potter. No where near to Hogwarts still a good reminder of why we love mystery and puzzles so much. Very rewarding experience and rated to a substantial strength. 60 minutes to solve the puzzle was fun and did not realize where the time went. Would highly recommend to people as one of the fun things to do if quests are your cup of tea and if you would like to bristle with your inner Sherlock!

Fun Wizard Themed Escape Room. We had a great time at the escape room, the theming was good and clearly a lot of thought had gone into the game. Using more logic puzzles rather than key and locks made the experience more immersive and fun and we felt like we had used our brains!
Excellent experience!. Everything was great! We bought it as. Birthday present for a friend and we all loved it. Very clever and if you like harry potter you will love it!
Great experience. We enjoyed the activity a lot. It was fun and we had some small clues just when we needed them. I woukd reccommend it!

Top notch fun for a group. We've been to a few "escape rooms" and this was really up there as one of the most fun. The Harry Potter theme was done very well, all the props were excellent. I wouldn't say it was the most challenging room, but that's not a bad thing. I think it was the right level of problem solving without being ridiculously convoluted and remaining enjoyable. We only needed guidance a couple of times and finished with a couple of minutes to spare. Overall we had a great night, and their waiting room is also good, with snacks, drinks and other things to keep you entertained while you wait.
Lots of fun, we all loved it. The kids (from 5 to 13) they all participated and loved the game. It was our first experience but is not going to be last!

Fantastic!. It was a fantastic expirience, all the tasks and puzzles weren't too difficult however you do need to think the atmosphere is awesome, music from HP, decorations etc. make you feel as you are a real wizard passing your exams and school. Well done!

Such a fun activity. This was a really great activity to do especially as we did one that had a Harry Potter vibe and we are all big fans. The challenges were hard enough to be fun and make you think but not so hard they left you feeling stupid. Great atmosphere and the props really made the activity even more fun.
Loved it!. We had a really great time; the puzzles were challenging and the layout of the room was very well thought. I have been to many escape games and this has been my favourite! Loved it!
Amazing!!. It was such a great experience, felt like we were in Hogwarts itself. Would definitely rec for major Harry Potter fans.

Fun day out. I spent an afternoon here with friends and had a wonderful time. It was tricky to get to but once we got there it was truly magical, definitely one to do with a group of friends for a birthday, an event or just cause. Thank you for a great time! Will definitely be coming back.

Fun and well thought game. Amazing experience, you'll need to think smart and quick, search for everything everywhere, be fast and work all together. I 100% recommend the "School of Witchcraft and Wizardry" Enigma Quest it's very well made, every HP fan should try it :)

An Amazing Day!. I bought tickets for my sister to try out this exercise after being recommended it by my colleague; something different and Harry Potter themed, so I thought why not! We spent the day in London before our quest and ended up being a little late, but Shane was accommodating and so friendly on our arrival. The area is easy to find and set out so well, with a warm welcome from the team. We enjoyed the Harry Potter puzzle room immensely- the 3 of us worked together to solve the mysteries (thank god you could ask for clues!) And it was so professional, well hosted and the accessories and decorations were fantastic- I really felt like I was in Hogwarts! We earned our badges (slightly over the hour.. the puzzles made us think!) I would go back in a heartbeat to try the next puzzle room and urge everyone else to go, you can't beat it. Thank you Shane and the team!

Excellent birthday present!. I booked the experience as a birthday present for my other half, with three family members coming along, and it exceeded my expectations! It was a slick operation, with a friendly, relaxed and knowledgeable host, and the quest itself was very well-designed, fun and challenging to just the right level. Plus the theme puts a nice spin on the 'escape room' idea. It was our first escape room and it has inspired us to do more in the future! Thank you!

Excellent hour enjoyed by all. First escape room I have done, and I was not disappointed! The attention to detail was amazing and the level of difficulty felt just about right! 100% recommend to Potter fans and non fans alike.
Will be looking at doing more rooms in the future!

Great theme!. We've done a lot of escape rooms (over 20...I might be a teensy bit obsessed!), and this one, the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, has made it into our top 5! Yes, it helped that I've always wanted to go to a school of witchcraft and wizardry so that was all very exciting, but my friend who isn't a big Potter fan also thoroughly enjoyed it based solely on its merit as a well-themed, well executed escape room. The puzzles were challenging enough to keep us entertained, but it all felt doable. We came out and immediately went online and booked their next room, the Million Pound Heist, looking forward to it!
My birthday treat. What a laugh - this is our third escape room and definitely the most fun. The special effects and puzzles are extremely clever. Can't wait to see their new one upstairs

21st Birthday family celebration. Mum Dad, sister (18) and girlfriend took our son for his 21st to the School of Wizardry and Witchcraft. it was our first experience of this type of thing so did not know what to expect but it was such absolute fun we will definitely do it again. Initially we waited in the games room as we were early where we had fun with table football and various games set out and drinks were available. Our host then explained what we were about to do and that we could ask for a clue to help us at any time. We set to the task enthusiastically. There was a full range of cryptic clues and problem solving involved which required some thought but which were achievable so we were really motivated to go as far as we could in the allotted time. Clues were given along the way to assist us if we were stuck on a particular problem. Overall I think the content of the tasks required was spot on. We all thoroughly enjoyed our time and are really looking forward to doing it again.

Excellent Escape Adventure - For Potter and non-Potter fans alike. This was our 2nd escape adventure and our family of 4 (2 adults + 2 tweens) had so much fun. Even though 1 of us was not familiar with the Harry Potter series, we were able to successfully complete the adventure. Of the two escape adventures we had done, this was definitely one that required more wits than just relying on logic. The staff gave appropriate hints throughout, which we definitely needed, and the last room revealed was a little creepy (I had to keep reminding myself out loud that it was not real). After we completed the room, the staff had time to do a de-brief with us showing us some things we had missed along the way, which was almost as much fun as the actual run. I look forward to the next adventures they are developing. Great times!!!!

Birthday Treat. Do this! Five of us (aged 18 to 50 something) enjoyed a fabulous evening of Witchcraft and Wizardry for a birthday treat for my daughter (22), who knows as much about the magical world as Dumbledore himself. Her dad was worried that he might be a bit of a spare part, as his only experience of Harry Potter is falling asleep in front of the films at Christmas time. He was just as immersed and involved as everyone else.The puzzles are clever and creative and really make you work as a team. We all had such fun - definitely the highlight of the summer. Our host was fantastic and his occasional hints were just enough to keep us on track without giving the game away. We can't wait to give the Million Pound Heist a go when it opens.

The best birthday present. My daughter and her friends came here for her 16th birthday and loved every minute of it. My daughter is the only Harry Potter fan, but that didn't make any difference, as all the girls had a really good time working out the clues and moving their way through the rooms. They made it with 30 seconds left to my daughters delight. The staff are really friendly and helpful and it was a bonus that they could sit and relax after with a drink and snack. The photo taken of the group was lovely a fabulous momento of the day. Would highly recommend.

Perfect for a kid into Magic and Wizarding.. Four of us (2 kids; 2 parents) went first thing in the morning. My daughter is 10 and we were really there for her, though my 13 year old got into it as well. She had a blast as did the rest of us helping her solve the riddles. By the end, the entire family is running around figuring things out.A few of the riddles might be too tough for a kid to reason out on their own, but most can be reasoned through with some parental guidance and help from a mysterious voice in the room. It took us the entire hour to complete the whole thing.(WARNING: There is one puzzle that is really a wild goose chase resulting in a plug for the company's logo. It has nothing to do with the rest of the story. We lost some time figuring it out only to realize it had nothing to do with the rest of the task at hand. That seemed a little unfair since you only have an hour.)Very fun event and well worth it for tourists looking for some wizarding fun.
Great day out!. We had such a good time at Enigma Quests although as big Harry Potter fans we would have liked more of the tasks to be centred around the books.

Magic day out. My wife and I went with our two daughters (13&14) and niece (15). Our third escape room and the best one so far. Varied challenges, good level for teens, good reveals and special effects. Strong Harry Potter influence but no prior knowledge required.

The School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The School of Witchcraft and Wizardry was a thoroughly enjoyable experience and I would highly recommend it! The setup was fantastic with wonderful details and with a lot of effort put in. The tasks themselves were challenging yet achievable and the help given when asked was enough to not give anything away. It was great that you didn't need to know every detail from the books in order to complete the tasks. Additionally, the waiting room beforehand was lovely with table foot and coffee!I could not recommend this more highly if you want a fun activity which lasts an hour or so and like your Harry Potter!

Great Themed Escape Room. Loved our day out here. Staff we're very friendly and puzzles were suitably hard to crack, with great attention to detail on the room and props.We brought an extra person to play on the day & were worried they wouldn't let her in as the game specifies only 5 can play at a time, but the staff were wonderful and let us pay extra on the door for one more to join us, which was very relieving.Would highly reccomend :)

Excellent fun for all ages. We visited here having done another puzzle game before and seen it recommended in Time Out. We're a group of late 30s women and we had a great time. The level of difficulty was quite high (we needed so help) so we were definitely challenged – there were only three of us, so more people would probably be better. Well worth a visit, especially if you're a Harry Potter fan.

A highlight of our trip. I booked this attraction for my children (13 & 10) & my self (little over 21) after leaving it too late to book the Studio Tour. My son, in particular, is a huge Harry Potter enthusiast and would have encyclopaedic knowledge of books and films. Not only this compensate for missing out on the Studio Tour it was a fantastic experience. It is very well set up, lovely attention to detail, our 'guide' was very welcoming and kind to the children (not to mention patient!). We were totally immersed in the challenge and really enjoyed ourselves. My children would love to do it again and I loved the energy and enthusiasm it inspired in them. I would definitely recommend this quest, also very easy to get to from Liverpool Street Station, we booked for 10 am on a Sunday morning which was perfect.

Exciting and challanging escapa room. The Enigma quest escape room was excellent fun for our entire family which has both Potter fanatics and just ordinary Muggles. The guy at the reception was very patient with our being late and all around helpful and friendly. The challenges were fun and required creativity and team work. A lot of details and care was put into the design of the rooms, which made it even more engulfing. We had a great time, thank you Enigma team
Escape room fun. Was first go at an escape room and am a big Harry Potter fan. We had 2 teams of 5 people and even those who weren't that into HP had a great time.
Great fun!. We went here for a 30th birthday surprise. Everyone really enjoyed themselves and we were talking about it all day. Definitely can't wait to do their new one when ready.

Great way to spend an hour with the family. Good location, Very nice overall story. Welcoming waiting room with tea/coffee and games. As first timers we found the puzzle a bit difficult, but still enjoyed it thoroughly. There were many types of puzzles included (codes, hidden items, verbal puzzles etc..) and we got just enough hints from the operators to finish in time

The School of Witchcraft & Wizardry was magical. I'm a massive Harry Potter geek, and a huge fan of escape-the-room games. This was definitely my favourite to date. They've put it together fantastically well - it feels like you're taking lessons at Hogwarts. I highly recommend it!

Thoroughly enjoyed the quest . We went as a family of 5 with 2 teenagers. Many Harry Potter fans in the group but knowledge of the films is not necessary. The experience was lots of fun and great for team work, we were all totally buzzing by the end. Our guide was great (can't remember his name sorry)

Awesome!. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience! The puzzles were pitched perfectly so they were a challenge but not impossible. Host was friendly and helpful, and both the waiting room and the puzzle rooms were very well set up. Excellent value for money.

Loved it!. Really well thought out escape game. Do not need to have read the books.
Friendly staff.
Thoroughly enjoyed by our team of 3.

Simply Magic !. The experience was even better than we believed. It helped that everyone in the group had a different skill set and that helped with the clues and the challenges. The staff is very helpful and even showed us at the end a behind the scenes look at how the magic is created. The quest was challenging but also doable. It did in fact feel like most of the objects were bewitched so it was a great way to feel immersed into the world of Harry Potter .Definitely recommend it for any harry potter fans out there !

Great for HP super fans and everyone else too. Absolutely loved our quest experience. If you are a Harry Potter fan the detail will really appeal to you and if you're not the challenges are interesting enough to keep you motivated anyway. All of our party had a great time and only criticism was to wish it was longer! Thank you Enigma for a fabulously different afternoon!
Great fun. I got taken here for a 30th birthday surprise. All of us had a really good time even the one who is not a Harry Potter fan. Really well thought out.
Fun and exciting. Great teamwork needed to solve the puzzles and get to the next level, as a family there was yelling, laughing, panic and running!
A wonderful family occasion. A really excellent family bonding session. The problems are ingenious and the atmosphere electric. Our ages ranged from 19 to 58 and we all loved it.

Great fun!. Four of us went and had a blast! We're all big HP fans, and loved the references. The host was great, and it was good to hang out in the waiting room beforehand with all the games, sweets, drinks etc. Thanks!

Great experience!. Our quest at Enigma was amazing- many magical and mysterious details, riddles and puzzles, all in the spirit of magic and wizardry. Very well done and with real atmosphere, and one of our best experiences in London.If you are a fan of magic (and even if not)- go do that! It was a unifying adventure, and we had a great time and loads of fun! If these guys do more quests we will definitely be returning.
Tricky and fun. Good mix of easier and trickier types of challenges across the game - good fun. You're given an hour to solve them

Its Magic. A challenging hour, puzzles were well planned and we all enjoyed it immensely.
Love to do it again but!!!!!

HARRY POTTER ESCAPE BAM. So, basically this lovely beautiful Greek goddess met us as we went down these stairs which are ridiculously yellow? We discovered later on that the stairs aren't owned and cannot be repainted so please do not be alarmed by the zombie apocalypse stairs. Anyways, the waiting room/reception is sick. We're talking a Foosball table and lots and lots of games and a sweet coffee/tea machine that I didn't want to leave there, as I sat in the bean bag and merked someone in Jenga. The actual room itself, well no spoilers, but we all scrambled to solve the puzzles. Bish bash bosh, we solved them, thanks to our Greek Goddess guide who was laughing at us the whole time with the muted microphone honestly, but she helped us when we needed it, completely un-sarcastically. But yeah it's a lot of fun, definitely worth the money and it's an interesting experience, something different to do!

So much fun!. I did this for my birthday. Different to traditional room escapes - in that you don't escape the room! Thoroughly entertaining and great fun for me and my Harry Potter mad friends. 100% recommend
Perfect!. Such a fantastic way to spend 90 minutes! Honestly one of the best ways to expand the mind and have fun at the same time, not forgetting achieve an 'owlstanding' grade at the end!

Great fun!. We did this quest as a group of four friends and it was suitably challenging, meaning we all had to really work together! We all had so much fun, so glad we did this! It's an absolute must for any Harry Potter fan and we'll definitely be back for more escape rooms soon!

Amazing magical experience. I got this as a birthday present & had so much fun cracking the clues with my friends, we raved about it to everyone else. I would definitely recommend Enigma Quests to others!

Fun times. Very accommodating team and overall fun experience. Those of us who were already into the fantasy idea were into it from the start. For the people in our group who were dragged into coming, their interest really piqued when we started solving the first couple puzzles. In the end, everyone had a good time. I would recommend this to all.

Even Dumbledore would be proud. This was my very first experience in an escape room quest, and I can safely say I am now a HUGE fan. The puzzles were mind boggling but so fun to complete with friends, we each had a different skill to bring to the group which helped complete the different tasks. The location is perfect and bright yet you feel on edge (I guess because you know you're about to be locked in a room with only your wits and smarts to get you out) I absolutely would try another escape room experience with Enigma Quests. I also loved the fact that you don't have to know every tiny detail of Harry Potter as well you can go in to the game with a bare minimum knowledge and still have oodles of fun. :) P.S. Adding the spells in the magic room that reacts to the wand made my inner potterhead squeal with delight.

Witch and Wizardary. Fantastic. Don't be put off by the outside of the building. Once you are in the room it's great especially if you are a Harry Potter fan. Took two children aged 15. Once you get into it the quests are hard but not too hard. Really recommend for an hours fun and entertainment is you are into quizes

A magical time. I cannot rate this highly enough! The room was so immersive, from the lady who talked us through beforehand to the task itself! I don't want to give too much away but we were nervous beforehand but we really enjoyed it! You don't need to know anything about Harry Potter to see this, my friends were concerned because they hadn't read the books (weirdos). It's fun for all ages and abilities! Book immediately!!

Great fun- a really unique challenge!. We did this as 2 family teams , one after the other. No one in either group had ever done anything like this before so had no idea what to expect. Everyone agreed it was excellent and we would definitely highly recommend this experience. A definite must for all the would be wizards and witches with lots of surprises.

must do for Harry Potter fans!. The game was so amazing and most definitely my favourite escape that I've ever done. I'm a big Harry Potter fan so I enjoyed it even more but even muggles can do it!
It's a unique experience that I wish I could do again- hopefully they make another one!!

Magical. Lovely evening doing the Witchcraft and Wizardry themed escape room. When we arrived the main lobby was being redecorated and we were a bit wary of what was t home but all concerns immediately evaporated when the game started. Really unique take on an escape the room and no Harry Potter knowledge is required to complete the room however potter heads will appreciate the nods to the series hidden throughout the room and the attention to detail taken.

So much fun. This is so much fun, we arrived 15 mins before our 4 pm game we waited in a games room where you can help yourself to a hot drink or water couple bowls sweets, we played a game of table football, then the guy came in to explain what the game consists of , without giving to much away you have to find the clues crack the codes and work out the riddles .. Very clever using your brain but in a way where it's just so much fun, all four of us lived it and had a photo taken at the end we thought for the money it was well worth it and would recommend this to anyone

Excellent fun. Went to Enigma Quests with my 10,8 and 5 year old. A very well spent hour of fun and puzzle solving. The wizardry and witchcraft room was very Harry Potter-esque and lots of fun with good brain teasers that get you working as a team. While my 8 year old was initially a little scared she soon got into the solving and teamwork aspect, and while my 5 year old is probably a year too young he really helped with finding puzzle pieces and helping out. All in all, a great hour adventure for the family.
A+. loads of fun. Easy to get to, loved the theme, puzzles were fun. Host was also nice.A bit different to other escape rooms too.Reasonably priced

Fun for all. This was our first escape game, and all 4 of us (mum and three boys of 14, 12 and 9) had a great time. Even without English as our native langbane, we had no problem understanding the tasks, and we god help not too early and not too late. A fun hour!

The most fun I've had in a long time!. We were a team of 3 age 9, 16 and 42. We went at my daughters request. I had worried that it would be a waste of money. How wrong was I? Rarely have I enjoyed myself so much..it was mayhem, befuzzling, confounding, delightful and exciting. We were epic! Solved with 5 minutes to spare. Do go..it is a wonderfuly rare chance to escape and have the most enchanting and laughterful time! You'll feel clever too!

Family Fun. Really fantastic experience. My daughter cannot wait to do it again. Brilliant fun for all the family. You get really engrossed in the quest and its great fore the brain trying to work things out.

Absolutely brilliant!. We went as a family with two boys aged 11 and 12. It was very cleverly themed and the puzzles needed different skills to solve so we were able to share the puzzles with the children. It was very exciting and just the right difficulty as we had done a few before. This has been our favourite as the children were so involved and excited by the rooms. We all loved it and the children are still talking about it now. A really great experience and we were very well looked after at the beginning and the end. I would definitely recommend it and have told all our friends so that they can enjoy it too. It's easy to get to as its right next to Liverpool St Station or Moorgate Tube. There is tea and coffee available when you get there plus lots of games and a table football. It's not scary and I would think children as young as 8 would enjoy it but it is also cleverly set so that a team of adults would also find it taxing if they didn't ask for hints. I wish the Enigma Quests team all the best for their hard work and care over details. I can't wait until they open your next one! Wonderful!
Challenging enough, but certainly fun. Some friends and I did this very recently, and it was brilliant. Great if you're fan, and it should be OK so long as you can behind the theme anyway.

Great fun!. We went as a group of 5 (not all were HP fans) and it was a fantastic experience! The host was super nice and the puzzles got everyone thinking and running around. Would definitely recommend it!

Dive into the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. My friend found this themed escape room and we decided we had to do it when a group of us visited London. I had completed an escape room before so I was familiar with the concept, but I was particularly excited for the "Harry Potter" theme as a fan of the books and movies. You do not need to be familiar with the books/movies to be successful, though it does make it more exciting. It does make you think a certain way, so this is recommended for those who enjoy different types of brain teasers/puzzles. (You can ask for hints, so don't worry if you get stuck). I would highly recommend this for HP fans, puzzlers, or anyone looking for an hour of excitement and fun!

Absolutely awesome and endlessly cool!. If you come to London and if you are a bit into Harry Potter and very much into solving riddles and puzzles this is the place to go.We have been here with our two daughters and it was great.If you act as a team, you can solve all 6 puzzles and achieve the high score.The rooms are richly and authentically furbished. You only can proceed from one room to the next if you solve the respective puzzles -- congratulation to the creators for this decent electronic system. When the first door opened and we found the wand we really like were a bit surprised. It is like "magic".1000% recommendation. One of the coolest things I ever did in my life - and I am old!Visit Enigma and have fun.

9 3/4 out of 10 ;). My friend and I decided we simply HAD to try this Harry Potter-inspired escape room even though there were only two of us. We had been told it was possible, but a bit more difficult, to complete the room with only two people, but we did it! Previous knowledge of Harry Potter is not required to solve the puzzles, but does make some of the pieces more fun. This was only our second escape room experience, but we are hooked! We highly recommend this room for puzzle and/or Harry Potter fans! Also, is it just us, or does the first puzzle at escape rooms seem to be finding it?

Fantastic, fantastic. We love puzzle rooms (aka escape rooms) and have done a number of them in many cities, in multiple countries. This is our all-time favorite one. Great puzzles, super-cool theme, friendly staff, intriguing props. If you love Harry Potter, you will adore this puzzle room. Even if you don't, you will enjoy it immensely. The only downside is the front entrance of the building... not Enigma Quests' fault as tenants, but the building management needs to clean up the rather dodgy entryway. So very glad that we pushed past that experience and stayed for the game.

Enigma Quests - great escape room experience!. We did the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry escape room with Enigma Quests and it was brilliant! Our team was a mix of people in their 30s, some of whom had done an escape room before and some hadn't, some had read Harry Potter, some hadn't. But it honestly didn't matter as the room appealed to all of us, challenged us all, kept us on our toes and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. The team were nice, friendly and welcoming. The room was very imaginative and offered challenges that meant we had to work together at times, whilst splitting up to solve clues individually at others. I would totally recommend this company and the Witchcraft & Wizardry room itself.

Perfect experience. We had the chance to meet these lovley people and this amazing room (School of Witchcraft and Wizardry). We really can recommend going there and enjoy the time. We stayed 4 days in London and on the last day in the morning, we went to Enigma Quest. It was definitely the right decision! At the end, we were sad, that we just booked one room :)

Witchcraft and Wizardry escape game. I organised this for my sister's birthday - she is a huge family - we played with my parents and we all thought it was fantastic. My parents had never done an escape game before but were able to quickly get into the game using the starting instructions. The game was the right level of challenge to keep the four of us busy for the whole hour, we did at some stages need help through the speaker but the hints given by the organiser didn't give away too much detail to spoil the challenge but just help us move onto the next stage. The set design, costume features, digital and gadget effects were spot on and created a great atmopshere to forget you were in an underground box room in the city of London!We couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the day and I am already waiting for the Heist tickets to go on sale to get booked on!

Great team-bonding experience. This game was indeed magical! I felt like I was living my dreams of being in Harry Potter. Even those of us who weren't fans thought the game was a challenge and a lot of fun.

BEST ESCAPE ROOM EVER. My A friends and I secured highly coveted Harry Potter and the Cursed Child tickets and decided to build a trip to London (we're from Los Angeles) around all Harry Potter-related activities. Whilst researching, I stumbled upon Enigma Quests and it was hands down one of the best parts of the trip. Out of our group of 4, 2 of us had prior escape room experience and they both thought this was the best escape one they've ever tried. Granted, our opinion may be slightly biased because of the whole "magic" component, but, without spoiling any part of the game, it was a fantastic combination of the logical (puzzles, critical thinking, etc.) and the magical (theme, setting, etc.). The place itself was easy to find--they send you very helpful and accurate directions. Once you make it into the waiting room area (painted a bright yellow, with a coffee station, assorted sweets, and mounds of games, including a Foosball table), they give you a few minutes to settle down. A bathroom key is handed to you and there are lockers for your things. I am hugely embarrassed to say we do not remember the name of our guide---Shane? Scott? SORRY! Under any other circumstances, we would've definitely remembered (as he was rather cute, especially with that British accent), but we were too excited about the game/distracted by said accent and promptly lost our wits. He gave us a quick introduction to the game, offered some general advice, and told us we could ask for help if necessary. You are given an hour to finish the game. The game itself was hugely thrilling. There is plenty for everyone to do--we felt like our group of 4 was totally sufficient--and we were absolutely screaming with laughter and excitement throughout, especially at the end. We were given some helpful but not obvious nudges along the way from our cute guide, who did an extraordinarily good job of knowing just what to tell us over the speaker system, and there was definitely alot of wand waving and shrieks of "I KNEW I WAS A WIZARD." It's a bit spooky and a bit old-timey feeling and a bit everything that any Harry Potter fan could ever want of an escape room.Once you finish the game, hopefully successfully within the hour, your guide comes in to take a "graduation photo"--cue draping thyself in wizards robes, grabbing wands, shoving on the sorting hat, and propping round spectacles on your nose. We are smiling so widely in our photo, you would think we'd actually gone to Hogwarts. O for OUTSTANDING!!!

Amazing fun. I had an amazing experience for my birthday with my friends. The set up was and clues really well thought out. it was challenging but possible to complete in the time. We will definitely be back for the next one!

Fantastic Experience. Just loved it...it was challenging but we were pleased to complete it. We went first time to any escape room and as a family we loved the whole experience. Will definitely come back to find money next...

Spell binding!. Really well put together, puzzles are a good variation of geometric puzzles, codes, tactile activities. Harry Potter fans will love the theme, non HP fans will still enjoy the games! We were a group of 3 which I think is perfect, any more and it could get cramped. Less and you can't do it!
Great experience for a Harry Potter fan of any age. Great fun (even for adults)!! The staff are very friendly and the attention to detail is wonderful!!

Excellent family fun!. We visited with 3 young adults 20, 16 and 13 and we had a really good time, the venue was easy to find and the staff welcoming. on arrival there is a lounge area with drinks, sweets and some games. This was the first time we had played an escape room so were given tips when needed. the game was well organised and very enjoyable. look forward to going back and I would highly recommend.

A great concept and immense fun. Didn't quite know what to expect as this was my first experience of this type of entertainment. I was very pleasantly surprised. We went as a group and found our different skills fantastic in helping us solve all of the examinations!! Each part of the quest was pitched at the right level, not too easy that you ploughed your way through your one hour time limit, but not so difficult that you became frustrated. The layout and content of the room was very authentic. Our host was extremely friendly and helpful. Brilliant day out, would recommend to all puzzle fiends out there!!
Absolutely amazing experience. So lovingly fitted to the theme, and technically very, very well executed. Absolutely do it!! Can really recommend.
Epic!. We had an absolutely amazing time - the experience is so clever and fun to do. Luckily we solved it with 5 mins to spare :)
Most fun ever. Completed with 2 friends. Loved the challenges and the explanation afterwards was great too! Would definitely recommend for any Harry Potter fans!
Beautiful room and well thought out. Very nice staff.. Thank you for a fun, exciting and challenging experience. Plus the waiting room was really nice and inviting.

Brilliant fun!. Purchased this unusual gift for a friends 40th who is a big fan of the wizarding world. I have to say we were a bit dubious when we arrived but once the game started the hour flew by and was probably one of hours we've ever spent, even the people in our team who weren't wizarding fans still managed to compete clues without a problem and we completed the game with 2 seconds to spare! Well worth the money, gets your mind working hard and being a team really helps.

Absolutely Lovely. We were excited to try Enigma Quests from the moment we saw their website. We weren't exactly sure what to expect when we got there, but from the moment the door closed behind us everything was perfect. We did the wizard themed quest and every detail was thought of and every challenge was hard enough to be interesting but not so easy that the magic was lost. Overall we all LOVED our experience and would absolutely go back!

Great time at Enigma Quests!. Went with a crew of myself and 3 others to do a Witchcraft & Wizardry themed escape room challenge. We had loads of fun, the challenges kept us on our toes all the way through! I would love to go back again sometime for another quest!
My experience. It was absolutely amazing! My group were able to finish with exactly 30 seconds to spare and we all had so much fun! I recommend it if you go to London and have a free day!

Potter magia. I did the quest with my two sons, 7 & 10 years old. My husband and my 2 year old daughter waited at the lounge. I loved this!! It was amazing!I had never done anything like this, but we are all huge Potter fans, so we wanted to do this. My children do not speak english more than a few words. I was a bit nervours but everything went great.There are all kinds of tasks, most of them are for english speaking adults but some were good for children, too. And they are all perfect for Potter fans!If one wishes for no assistance, one should ask them not to help, I think that a group oh adulst may (may!) complete the quest in time without any help but our goal was just to finnish. They give hints if one wants, so dont be afraid to do this! If You are a Potter fan and a little bit childish in a good way, then You should definetely do this!!!!!!

A great way to spend an hour. We really enjoyed this escape room - it is really well done and looks brilliant, and the puzzles are pretty challenging - we did finish all the tasks but not much time to spare! Would definitely recommend this room especially for a first go at escape rooms

Great fun for magic & riddle lovers!. Two of us booked this for a mates birthday and we had a great time. Perfect if you love Harry Potter and magic or enjoy cracking riddles, codes and finding clues. Great for teams of friends or families. Wish I could do it again!

GREAT FUN FOR ALL AGES. We were a group of women all over 50 and we thoroughly enjoyed graduating in the school of wizardry.Really well thought out clues and props.A few of us had taken part in similar games but this was a particularly good one.We managed to get out with 5 minutes to spare so we felt chuffed that our brains still work .Really friendly staff EXCELLENT !!

Great team building. We went here as a work team building event. We are a very small company with only 4 people so this was perfect. We had a great time. It's challenging enough to be interesting but not so hard that you feel frustrated.Highly recommended.

Excellent. We did this as part of my 30th birthday family day out and we all loved it. A bit daunting when you go into the room with absolutely no guidance of where to start, but it was great fun. My Harry Potter nut of a sister was particularly over excited. The tasks themselves are sufficiently challenging but you can ask for clues if you want. Mum was a bit worried beforehand as she gets claustrophobic sometimes but the room was big enough not to cause a problem and unlike 'escape rooms' you aren't actually locked in, which helps.

A highlight of the holiday. I took my two American 18 year old cousins (one being a Harry Potter fan!) and it is definitely one of the highlights of their trip here. For me too! Being new to the experience, we found it challenging, but solved the puzzles eventually which made us feel pretty chuffed with ourselves :) We loved the themed rooms. The magic. The friendly staff. Our graduation photo! 3 days on, we're still excitedly telling people about it. Well recommended.
We're real wizards now!!. I don't want to spoil anything - so all I will say is, drop everything you're doing, buy a tickets, and go... NOW!

Harry Potter themed escape room. 6 of us did the Harry Potter themed escape room and it was fantastic. Great fun was had by all. We were all novices at escape rooms and found it quite difficult but there was help along the way! I would thoroughly recommend this escape room and I think we as a family are now bitten with the escape room bug and certainly will be doing some more in the future!

The school of witchcraft and wizardy. I booked this for my son's 10th birthday. Our group consisted of two adults and four 10yr old boys. It was a fabulous experience. The puzzels were entertaining and really kept the game going. Never a dull moment and the boys were never bored at any point. The props and the rooms were fantastic not to mention the interactive tools. Love the entire event. My son's friends were telling everyone at school about it the next day. I highly recommend it as an alternative to birthday parties or a movie for this age group. So glad we did this.

OUR FIRST ESCAPE ROOMS. This experience did not disappoint! The lady running it was friendly, informative and made us feel extremely welcome. The game had a variety of puzzles and was well thought out. Would recommend for all ages. We played as a family of four and will definitely be returning when the new game is open.

Great Hogwarts adventure. This was such a fun and imaginative 'escape room' event. The space was very creatively set up and the attention to detail was obvious. We were completely engaged for the entire time. After the event our host was really wonderful at answering our questions and sharing how we could be better competitors in our next adventure. Great way to spend family time with our daughter who is a Harry Potter fan.

A very fun afternoon and great Hogwarts challenge for HP fans!. As three Harry Potter fans, we were very much looking forward to the 'School of Witchcraft and Wizardy' challenge. It did not disappoint. We felt very immersed into the world of Harry Potter and desperately wanted to pass our Hogwarts tests with flying colours! The quests were challenging at the right level, the design was great and very suitable, and it had many well thought out references to the books and world of Hogwarts. The person who met us there and ran the quest for us was also really welcoming and obviously a true Harry Potter fan as well! The room we waited in before (and hang around in for a bit after) was fun with board games and quizzes, which was helpful on a rainy afternoon. Would definitely recommend and also return to for another challenge.

Amazing escape quest!. We played the "School of Witchcraft and Wizardry" as a team of 2 and thoroughly enjoyed the game. As escape room owners and enthusiasts ourselves, we have played plenty of escape rooms worldwide. Enigma Quest is definitely amongst our favourite ones. The game is designed with a very creative and clever approach. When we entered the room, it was immediately clear that a lot of effort was involved to build up the quest. The room was decorated very well to immerse you into the world of wizardry. We can't reveal too much of the game without spoiling the fun but you will for sure be "WOWed" like we did.In addition, they have a very spacious reception area with plenty of puzzles and board games for people to play while they wait. The staff was also very friendly and approachable. We had a lovely chat afterwards. Would highly recommend it to everyone who has an inquisitive mind or wants to become a wizard :P. Can't wait to go back for their next room!

Great fun. Went with my sisters as we are all Harry Potter fans. The quest was very well thought out and imaginative and it was challenging enough that we needed a few hints to help us along the way. The guy who was our host was really friendly and helpful. It was the first time doing an escape room style challenge for most of us and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. We agreed that we would definitely do another Enigma quest and would highly recommend it.

Brilliant experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the school of witchcraft & wizardry quest - it was brilliantly done, fab design, the right level of challenging, and really the highlight of our hen weekend. The Enigma Quest team were lovely and enthusiastic and the facilities were nice, with coffee, snacks and games while we were waiting. I'd thoroughly recommend this quest.
Great fun day with the girls!. This was a brilliant escape room, lots of interesting things to get our brains working! Thank you guys!

Great fun, highly recommended. We thoroughly enjoyed our time playing this game. We needed hints to help us on the way, but were delighted to finish (and graduate) just about within the time allowed.Very imaginative, would appeal to all ages except very young children.

Brilliant & Creative!. Easy to find, greeted by friendly staff and led into a waiting room full of games with free tea & coffee. The game itself was very fun and creative. We choose the Hogwarts Escape Room, but you don't need prior knowledge of it to be able to do it. As a team of only 3 we did struggle a little and went over time - but did manage to complete the room!

Amazing time at the school of witchcraft and wizardry. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and waited in the area with lots of games to keep us entertained, as well as free tea and coffee. Our time in the escape room started on time, and the puzzles were just the right level - tricky but solveable when we all worked together! The attention to detail was amazing and it felt as though we were really doing magic.
Fantastic . It was great. First time to an escape room will definitely come again. 5 of us went its a great thing to do as a day out

We were so delighted !!!. It was a surprise date for my boyfriend. He loves to play escapes games on IPhone and it was something to give him real experience of a real game. He was so delighted and happy ! We are not kids ( 32 and 45 years old) but we really felt like we are inside the game! Unusual and very intellectual experience!!! We completed task just 10 seconds before the time deadline). It is fantastic way to boost a relationship spark as you have to work as a team and work together! We will go again for a new quest !!! Can not wait to be back again !!! We loved it SO MUCH !!! Thank you for our amazing date !!!

Amazing!!. Booked for a birthday, so much fun for a range of ages, 20's and 50's! Puzzles were defiantly hard enough to keep us occupied with a few clues! Didn't need any harry potter knowledge but it made it even more fun!Can't wait to do another one! 100% recommend!!!

Loads of fun!. This was such a lot of fun for 5 of us ages 15, 18, 26, 45 and 56!We love games and puzzles and Enigma quest was recommended by a friend. The set up is excellent, the time pressure to complete the tasks makes it more exciting and the fact that you have to work out what is expected of you keeps you all on your toes.Everyone contributed their part. Cant wait to do the next quest.

So much fun! . I booked this for a friend's birthday - we're all in our twenties and Harry Potter fans and we had so much fun! The clues were definitely hard enough to keep us occupied and we just about completed the room in the time given. Will definitely visit again when their new rooms are open!

Wizarding magic. Had a great time with enigma quests, we took an 8 yr old for her birthday admirably supported by older sister and parents. All of us enjoyed the game which had puzzles for everyone and great staging. Would recommend

AMAZING!!!!!!. This was so much fun! We had never done anything like this and decided to take our Harry Potter mad son for his birthday. We had as much fun as he did proving that whatever your age you will love it!! We would highly recommend it and will be looking to try some of the other escape rooms now.

Magic! . Myself and four friends had the pleasure of doing the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry escape room, which the best! All but me had never done an escape room before, and we all had a blast! The place is fantastically decorated and, although we needed a few pushes in the right direction, the puzzles were at just the right level to be 'puzzling' but not impossible. There are so many cool props, even Hogwarts robes to wear as you try to solve the puzzles! Lots of cool effects, magical puzzles and even giant monsters!A perfect day out for Harry Potter fans, or people looking for something different to do on a day out. They are planning on opening a new super hard room next month, once we've got some more practise in, we shall return! Very reasonably priced for an escape room, check it out - it's magic!

Amazing take on the break out room experience. Having completed a few of the break rooms in London we decided to give the witches and wizards themed room in Engima Quests . Unlike others the object is not to break out but solve all the clues to pass various challenges.There was a group of 5 of us, 3 experienced room players and 2 new to the genre and everyone loved it.Great fun and very detailed inside , they have a nice chill out area which we where invited to relax in for a bit after.Cant wait for their new room to open - we will be back.

Good Fun, highly recommend. I did the Harry Potter themed Escape room with Enigma Quests with four other friends (mid twenties). We turned up with harrry potter scars on our forehead buzzing to go! The lady talked us through the scenario and then lead us into the room where we had an hour to complete the challenge. I can't give any detail on the room but we had great fun working out the puzzles and progressing through the challenge. You do not need an indept knowledge of Harry Potter to do the tasks but you do appreciate the decorations/twists.Really enjoyed it and will definitely be doing more escape rooms.

Wonderful game. I've done a bunch of escape games and this is one of the best. We did the school of witchcraft and wizardry game. So well thought out with very clever puzzles and very high production value. Thoroughly recommend!
Very nice experience. Lots of fun, well organised, worth the money and time :) We felt like we can just relax and be a kid again!
Great fun!. This was well organised and lots of fun! A perfect introduction to an escape room theme :) no prior knowledge of Harry Potter is necessary. Definitely recommended!
Magically fun. An absolutely amazing hour. Went for my little sisters birthday with my mum and brother. Was so much fun from beginning to end! Great games!
Awesome. Really enjoyed, a lot of fun, not too nerdy, and the setting really works. Despite being 4 scientists, we completed only in the last 30 seconds. Really recommended.

Absolutely amazing!. I booked the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry at Enigma Quests for my girlfriend's birthday after looking around at what escape rooms London had to offer.While the game we played wasn't a traditional escape room, it was one of the best experiences we've ever had, her being a huge Harry Potter fan and me really disliking it, I still loved it here!The room(s) were beautiful decorated and immersive and we were so impressed at the love that has gone into this quest. We were allowed to play as a 2 but were told we would have to book for a group of 3 and they would give us hints if it was too tough. It seemed a little expensive but well worth it after all.We managed to complete all of the tasks in the room with 3 minutes to go and it was exhilarating right until the end. Without giving too much away, there was an excellent variety of challenges, from potion making and solving maths puzzles to riddles and simple searching of the room(s).We had the best time at Enigma Quests and will definitely be back to play their other games, they made my girlfriend's birthday!!Thank you!

Absolutely bloomin brilliant!. We had an absolutely fab time. The hosts were really friendly and most of all we graduated from Hogwarts with an O for outstanding.A really fantastic well thought through set up with clever tasks.We have already booked for the Bank Heist. We're hooked!

Unique Experience. Easy to book, fantastic service and a great game. Going in one of my friends was certain we'd either fail the room or pass in 5 minutes. It actually took us 59:50 our last few seconds trickling away as we passed our final harry potter exam. Manic, challenging and immersive. Great fun!

An amazing hour of fun. This was a birthday treat for my son's 16th birthday, and was absolutely fantastic. An amazing hour, so much fun and exciting. Wonderful props,so much thought had clearly gone into it, and John was really helpful and friendly . Cannot wait to try their new room, and I am already recommending this to all my friends.

Brilliant fun. I've been to 8 other escape rooms and this one, without doubt, has the best props and decorations. The effort that has gone into making them is staggering, the level of detail outstanding. The game itself is an intermediate standard, not hugely challenging. I went with a group of 4 friends (27-31 years old) and we found it fairly straightforward though we finished with only 5 minutes to spare. I'd imagine a family with kids (10+) would really enjoy this and find it a tough challenge.On the whole I found the game really good fun, though not as tough as other games I've played (such as Cluequest). The spectacular scenery and effort that has gone into making them deserves 5 stars alone.

Great Fun!. It was a 21st birthday and we fancied doing something different, so happened to choose this particular escape game. It did not disappoint, with clues, riddles and puzzles to solve. Interactive and magical, we would definitely recommend!

A magically unique experience for fans of London and the world of magic alike. A truly enchanting hours' spent, this very interesting take on the roomescape formula will knock even hardcore gamers out of their boots. If you're a fan of puzzles and the Harry Potter story, there isn't much to dwell on here. Everything is authentic, from the atmosphere to the decorations. This is your one hour trip to Hogwarts that you musn't miss! Also, the staff was incredibly polite and helpful, and it is instantly noticeable how much effort they are putting into this. The puzzles themselves are innovative and in the vein of Hogwarts, so that's a big plus. If you're a newcomer to games, they will know how to intervene and help you at the right moment, so don't back out of trying because of that.Simply put; magical! Not a recommendation but a must see for everyone!

Fantastic fun. We took our 11 year daughter and 9 year old son to the school of witchcraft and wizardry and everyone had a great time. Our daughter is a massive Harry Potter fan and she was thrilled with the attention to detail and how welcome everyone made us feel. The puzzles are challenging but hints are available if you need them which makes it fun for even the youngest players. Thanks to Enigma Quest for a good day out and we'd highly recommend the experience

Mischief Managed!. Easy to find, welcomed into the relaxed and inviting waiting room by our friendly host John who provided a concise explanation about the game. The School of Witchcraft and Wizardry theme is perfect for any Harry Potter fans but also for those who appreciate a strong, cohesive theme which is reflected in the set design, magical elements and the type of tasks that you have to solve. It's a refreshing change to have an Escape Room game without a padlock in sight and that you have to ask for help when you're stumped so it doesn't feel like you're helped along unnecessarily and gives you time to think it through. An intermediate level type of Escape room which makes it suitable for a mixed group with children and big kids at heart.A fun filled, brain teasing and magical hour quickly flew by. The sad part is it went by too quickly, we wanted more!Thank you Enigma Quests, we're looking forward to your next Escape Room :)

Fun for all!. I took my nieces (8, 10 & 14) to Enigma Quests and we had a brilliant time. The quest was suitable for all - challenging me but also accessible to the youngest. The game and set design is superb and you really feel like you're in the world. You could easily come here with a group of adult friends and have a fantastic time or bring the kids and keep them really entertained. I can't recommend it highly enough!

Awesome!. I went in a team of four: 2 mums and 2 13 year old Harry Potter fans. We had an amazing time. The attention and detail that has gone into making the puzzles is staggering. We got totally consumed by trying to solve the challenges and completely forgot that of course they would let us out at the end.... we worked against the clock like our lives depended on it. We had a bit of help as we missed the first clue to get us started but after that we did ok and got out with 3 minutes to spare. We felt very welcome there (we were never rushed) and chilled out in the games room for about an hour after. Highly recommend it.

Unusual and entertaining. I took my 12 year old daughter and 3 of her friends on the school of witchcraft and wizardry quest and they all thoroughly enjoyed it. We got plenty of hints to help us along (which we needed) but not so many that we didn't feel as though we'd achieved anything. An unusual treat for kids and I can quite see the appeal for a group of adults, but be sure to take your glasses if you wear them as I forgot mine and struggled reading some of the clues!
Fiendishly Fun!. We've done quite a few escape rooms and this is definitely one of the best. Really different, a little bit scary towards the end and superb puzzles. Highly recommended.

Awesome Experience! . Came here with my colleagues for a team celebration. We split into teams of 4 and 5 and competed with each other to finish fastest. We had so much fun. The puzzles are smart and challenging. We did the Harry Potter one and really enjoyed completing all our tasks to pass the 'magic exams'. You don't need any knowledge of Harry Potter to do well. Both teams completed the Enigma just in time. I definitely recommend Enigma Quests, it was so much fun and great for team building.

Absolutely brilliant!. Have to admit, we were skeptical about how this would work with kids (9 and a very teenage 11) but they loved it! You arrive at a doorway that looks like a service entrance to an office block & make your way to a basement room where the excellent team make you feel really welcome.The experience itself is brilliant - challenging but always fair. As they tell you 'if you're stuck it's because you missed something'!As a family, we loved this. We were bought it as a present so not sure about value for money but would definitely recommend as part of a day out!

Great Escape Room. Beautifully themed and decorated - the five of us had a great time! Having done a few escape rooms between us this one was up there aongst the best with great games, puzzles and even special effects

Unlike any locked room game I've done before!. Enigma Quests isn’t like any locked room game company I’ve encountered and their School of Witchcraft and Wizardry game isn’t like any I’ve ever played. In fact, they don’t even call it a locked room game. Instead they see it as a quest. A quest to graduate from the school of witchcraft and wizardry.Basically in order to graduate you have to complete a series of puzzles that test their skills in various classes such as potions and ancient runes. As you figure out each of these you are rewarded with a wooden ball to show that you have passed in this subject. We spent the first five minutes in complete awe at our surroundings as the attention to detail in the rooms was beyond anything I have ever seen. A lot of locked room games don’t really have a cohesive theme or story but here the complete opposite is true.What sets Enigma Quests apart from the others that I have taken part it is that it’s impossible to completely fail the game. Even if you only obtain four out of five of the wooden balls you still feel as though you have achieved something and are also given the opportunity to carry on even after the time limit is up so you can experience the game to the full. They also don’t rely on too many padlocks and codes instead using some really remarkable technology to give the illusion of real magic.I’ve done a total of four “escape rooms” now and have made it out of each one successfully. This one was by far the hardest though and we graduated with less than a minute to spare! It was a really intense ending.

Great fun. Interesting puzzles and themes. We did it in 56 minutes!I would definitely try it again and recommend it to everyone.We had a special quest for Easter to find chocolate eggs. That was really nice too, and we could keep it at the end.

30th birthday fun. I would thoroughly recommend any Harry Potter fan to try the witchcraft and wizardry escape room. It was tremendous fun so excellent value. My friend and I went for my 30th birthday and they all equally enjoyed it. You don't need to be a Harry Potter expert or genius to figure out the puzzles but it was still challenging enough. The staff were really friendly and took plenty of group photos for us.

INCREDIBLE FUN.. The lengths Enigma quest went to to create a highly interactive and enjoyable day out were huge. There is no detail ignored and the team were also highly attentive hosts which made the entire experience even greater. We were a team of beginners and we just managed to complete the game, and for a group who had no clue what to expect or where to start - that was quite impressive. It is a child friendly challenge - but even the grown ups were stumped at times! The dress up elements made it twice the fun and all in all the entire location looked incredible - a job well done, a definite must do when in London. It was a quirky day out but a great one at that. Thanks a million!

Amazing and well made. My friends and I had been wanting to try an escape the room for a while and this one was truly amazing. It is so well made with all of the props and quite honestly, we thought it'd bee too easy but it was really tough! Only made it through with some hints!

We had a good time. We went for my sons 13th birthday, one adult and 4 children. We had lots of fun and found the room very imaginative and fun. The staff were very helpful and the whole place was very pleasant.

Great fun, satisfying team game. This was my first escape room experience and I loved it. Five middle aged women on a birthday quest, we enjoyed solving the clues and each using our different strengths.it was atmospheric fun and challenging, without feeling impossible. Staff were very friendly, enthusiastic and helpful. We did feel stuck a couple of times but hints were given which prompted us in the right direction. I would have given it 5 stars, but as it's my first time, I wanted to leave myself somewhere to go in rating the next one. What I can say is I will definitely be coming back to try another one!!
Awesome! . Great puzzles and attention to detail! It was very entertaining and the puzzles took a lot of thought and creative thinking; but not so difficult as to frustrate first timers.
ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. Absolutely amazing experience. Could not sing the praises of this escape room loud enough! It really lived up to expectations and its reputation. An absolute must.

Most fun I've had in a long time. I can't wait until the next one opens, I had the best time. I would recommend this to anyone and I have, I have told all my family and friends about it and even my work colleagues!

Brilliant!. One of the best room escape style games I have done, the theming is incredible very cleverly done, I would definitely recommend going if you are a fan of the genre or have never tried one before!

You're a wizard, Harry!. Excellent escape room. Incredibly well themed. The puzzles were nice, not terribly difficult, puzzles. We did it with two adults and three kids and all were able to help at various points.
HP enigma. Great staff, really friendly and welcoming. Lovely atmosphere pre-game. Escape game was really fun-can't recommend this highly enough. looking forward to the next one!

Magical!. Great fun! Our team managed to complete the challenge with almost ten minutes to spare, so we were rather proud of ourselves. The atmosphere is great and we really enjoyed the puzzles and the theme! It is Harry Potter-inspired, but you don't need to have any trivia stored in your head, which was a relief, because it's been a while since I read the books! This was an excellent way to revisit that magical feeling that the Harry Potter books gave me when I was growing up. Highly recommended. We even hung around for a great cup of coffee in the game-filled waiting room afterwards. I'll be back for any future quests on offer!

Loved the theme and attention to detail. Our group escaped with 3 minutes to spare! We had 8 people so split in 2 groups back to back. We waited in the waiting room where they have games you can play, tea and coffee.Between us we had people who had never tried escape rooms before and people who tried only 1, which made it a good balanced group.There's no need to have a knowledge of Harry Potter to do the game, but it's a lot more enjoyable as you will understand the references.Nargiza was a great host and shared a lot of the background behind the room and their plans to expand.What a great night with friends :-)

Excellent room for beginners, amazing hosts, facilities, atmosphere and very fun game with props!. Super fund escape room with amazing host - Nargiza. From the very beginning I could see they put so much love and effort into building this room. Great location (<10 mins from Liverpool street, Moorgate and Bank stations), very good facilities (free coffee & tea, chocolates, bean bags & party games, puzzles, foosball to solve while waiting) and really nice themed room. Flow was really good and not a padlock in sight! It's not a very hard room so I would recommend for 3 advanced players or 4-5 beginners, you do need to work together but there is enough to keep everyone occupied! Afterwards Nargiza asked for our opinion and was really sweet, taking time to take pics and discuss our experience, even recommend other escape rooms! I can't wait for their second room to open.

Fantastic Team Building. My team and I spent a fantastic 55 minutes graduating from the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. We all had fantastic fun and it was a great way to learn how to work together better as a team. I'd recommend it to any Harry Potter fan!!!!!!
Fantastic Fun. Don't want to give too much away but we had a great time. The staff were really helpful, the puzzles were fun and the settings brilliant. Totally recommend it.

Felt like a wizard for an hour!. It's not important if you're a wizard master or only a muggle of escape games. You will find there what you were looking for: a magic and well thought experience at Hogwarts.
Went there for my son's 14th, Really fun!. Friendly staff, directions are good, riddles are challenging but doable and staff is on hand to give a hint if needed. An hour of great fun.

Great Mother's Day Activity. We were here just last night in a group of 4. My family don't really spend any time together, so this was great for us to bond over. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Could not recommend this more!

A fantastic Chamber of Secrets!. We arrived on a rainy morning a little bit frazzled as our friends were running late!As soon as we arrived the staff assured us there was no problem with the late running party members and brought us to a lounge with some nice tea/coffee making facilities and a bunch of board / trivia games to pass the time and get you in the mood!The lounge also houses a set of lockers for you to store your valuables in whilst you play the game.The game itself.. well I can't go into much detail as it would spoil the surprises in store but suffice to say, the puzzles really suit the theme of the room we went into (Witches and Wizards). From the intro to the music right down to the smallest prop in the rooms, everything lent itself to a strongly and effectively themed Harry Potter like experience! My group managed to finish without any clues being needed (We were informed this was only the 5th time this has happened since the room opened!). My only complaint is now I know all the puzzles so I cannot go back immediately! Highly recommended. Do yourself a favour and book today!
Captivating experiance. For any fan of adventures and puzzles, this is the place to be :D. Best experienced with friends. Enjoy

Was so sad when it was over!. What a FANTASTIC experience! We bought this as a gift for my dad as we know it would test his competitive nature and we are all avid Harry Potter fans. It was absolutely fantastic, and so so challenging (without being impossible)! No real serious Harry Potter knowledge required, but just makes all the little touches/attention to detail even more hilarious and appreciated! It was just amazing how interactive and creative they had been in just 1 room. Having never done these type of 'quests' before, it's opened doors to so many more future fun Sunday afternoon activities. Such wonderful staff during the introduction, as well as being so attentive to my emails.My only criticism it that I was gutted when the time was up. Can't wait to try another!

A great event. My daughter bought me this experience for a birthday present. 5 of us turned up on Sunday morning and were son into an anonymous office basement. I had no idea what was going on but it was sufficiently odd to peek my interest. The rules were then explained and we went to our first room. It was so well organised. The props, the staging, the clues themselves all were very well constructed. You ask for help and it was given and given at just the right level to enable us to proceed through the tasks. It was team work too, as they said. We laughed we screamed we love every single minute. And we completed it with 20 seconds to spare. Phew. Do it. I'll certainly go back

Best Day Ever!!. As avid Harry Potter fans, this was amazing!! Puzzles, riddles and magic spells, this chance to go and graduate from Hogwarts was a once in a lifetime experience. Can't recommend this highly enough! :)

Everyone should do this!!. The team at Enigma Quests was amazing! The room was well thought out and an over-all wonderful experience! I would recommend this to everyone looking for a locked room experience!

School of Witchcraft and Wizardry: a wonderful, top-notch experience. We'd visited the School of Witchcraft & Wizardry escape room.The escape quest was very well thought out and built to accomodate different kinds of teams with different rates of progress.There were really great technical props; a lot of technical ingenuity that went into making them an integral part of the quest (tongue-in-cheek, this reminds me of the Arthur C. Clarke's quote on sufficiently advanced technology being indistinguishable from magic)The quest does not assume any advance knowledge (it is somewhat inspired by a well known book series involving wizardry education, but all elements are unique and original).The staff lady was very professional, positive and after the quest told us about some of the awesome stuff going on behind the scenes .Two couples is the right group size of group to enjoy this escape quest.

A magical experience!. We were a group of 4 and had so much fun during this escape game! Of course, as harry potter fans, we were thrilled about the great details and the chance to finally be wizards and witches ourselves! You have to solve a good variety of riddles and puzzles so everyone really gets the chance to prove their strengths. 2 of us were newbies to escape games and 2 of us have already done another one and it was great fun and we enjoyed our time. (even if this hour was gone so quickly!) Thanks for having us!

Really enjoyable for Harry Potter fans (but not only!). We were 4 playing the game and that was really fun so not only for teenagers, it is fun for adults too ! You'll meet a friendly & passionate staff there. The game room is really cool as well with Trivial pursuit (HP of course!), Jenga, etc. Do not hesitate to come earlier to spend some time there before the game.
Great escape experience!. Very well organised, and more techy than you first expect. Looking forward for the new room to open.

Great passion and attention to detail.. It was our group's (5) first escape game, but everyone thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We had one or two harry potter fanatics within the group but I felt you didn't necessarily need the background knowledge.Nargiza and co seemed very passionate about their work, and took plenty of time before and after to discuss the game and explain certain elements.We completed the puzzle with time to spare and I would definitely try one of their other quests.
A good escape room for beginners. A decent escape room with a good theme and good scoring system. Our team of novices and experienced 'escapers' had a good time!
