Great 13th birthday celebration for our daughter. I can highly recommend Enigmas Quests. We booked the Witchcraft & Wizardry challenge for my daughters 13th birthday. It was really easy to find, very close to both Liverpool Street Station and Moorgate Station. We were warmly welcomed and shown to a fun room with beanbags and table football. There were nice touches like bowls of sweets, games and tea and coffee making facilities. The 'rules' of the game were explained to us and we were the shown to the room. We had such a great time trying to solve all the puzzles and riddles, we needed a few hints but we managed to solve all the challenges and graduate within the hour! All the kids and adults thoroughly enjoyed it and would love to do another one. It wasn't too easy or too hard, a bit challenging but with the odd hint it was really fun to solve all the clues. The set up of the rooms was fantastic, really authentic and very clever how they do things. They took some lovely photos of us afterwards and emailed them to us a couple of days later. We will definitely be back for the new bank robber challenge :-) Thank you for a great birthday celebration.

Amazing morning of fun! . Visited with my family for a birthday and we did the school of witchcraft and wizardry game which was absolutely brilliant! Really nicely set up and welcoming hosts and the game was very engaging - the hour flew by! The puzzles were really clever and a great mix to play to a teams different strengths. Would definitely do again.

O for Outstanding!. A fantastic experience! I'm not a Harry Potter fan but you don't need to be! The puzzles are challenging but fair, the set and the props are brilliantly done, and the hosts are lovely! Definitely definitely worthwhile! Go tomorrow!

What a fantastic experience!. I arranged for myself and nine friends to play at Enigma Quests as a joint birthday party for myself and a friend. A couple of us had played an escape game before, but weren't sure what to expect from this, and others were complete beginners.What a fantastic experience it turned out to be! The staff were so friendly and accommodating (big thank you to our host, Nargiza!), and the game itself – while I won't spoil anything – was very well-designed. The puzzles are challenging but flow really well once you get into the swing of things, and Harry Potter fans will appreciate all the details, both small and big, that are involved in the design of the rooms, and the puzzles themselves (although there's no prior knowledge of Harry Potter actually required for the puzzles, so it's suitable for your less geeky friends to join in with as well). There's excellent use of physical effects throughout as well, which do a wonderful job of immersing you in the game world.I don't want to say anything else lest I ruin the magic of it all, but if you're a fan of Harry Potter, escape games, or both, definitely give this one a go!As we were in two groups, we were able to play consecutively in the same time slot (the booked time slots are every 2 hours, but the game itself lasts an hour), with each group waiting in the lounge area with complimentary drinks and snacks, and various games and puzzles to play with.Can't wait to come back for future games!

Brilliant! . Even if you aren't a Harry Potter fan, this place is brilliant fun! The challenges are hard and definitely keep you busy! Extremely well organised and professional! I recommend this to anyone!we came for my boyfriends 30th birthday and was a really different way to spend the day rather than boring sight seeing
A spellbinding experience!. I went to the Harry Potter themed escape room with some friends and had so much fun! The decor was amazing and puzzles really exciting, would definitely recommend!
This hour was a very very good hour ;D. We were 3 girls, having an absolutely great hour we will probably never forget! I just loved it, and I´ll definitely visit the new game as soon as it opens ;D

Amazing experience. We booked for 5 of us, 3 adults and 2 kids, aged 9 and 7 - we weren't at all sure what to expect as we hadn't done anything like it before. It was absolutely fantastic, we all loved it and everyone got really involved. We can't wait for them to open their next one!Would highly recommend.

A magical experience. I got this as a Christmas present for my family and they absolutely loved it and haven't stopped talking to their friends about it. You don't have to be a Harry Potter fan to enjoy this or complete the tasks (though if you are you will be in Hogwarts heaven with all the thoughtful little details). Unlike most escape rooms you are not actually trying to escape but instead graduate from the school passing as many classes as possible in the time allowed. Our team of 4 managed to complete all 6 subjects in the allotted time for a graduation mark of outstanding. You will get some mild prompting if you get stuck, but don't expect to be lead to the answers like in some escape games(which spoils all the fun of the accomplishment). Some delightful surprises wait in store for those who venture forth into the school for witchcraft and wizardry. We can't wait to try your new rooms as soon as they are ready!!

We solemnly swear we are up to no good.. "That was the most fun I have ever had!" - quote from one of our team members after completing this room. We went as 4 Harry Potter obsessed adults, and absolutely loved it. The puzzles were very challenging, although you don't have to be a fan of the theme to get by. The intricacies of the room and puzzle solving went above and beyond other puzzle rooms we have been to. Magic was definitely involved ;) Thank you for a great afternoon – from the welcome, to the room itself, and facilities after we completed the room. This is one of the best things to do in London!
Skeptical but great!. Was a bit skeptical of this at first but in fact it was very challenging and very enjoyable! The hosts were very accommodating and made us feel very welcome!
An enjoyable attraction. This Escape Room is a must visit attraction for anyone that enjoys Harry Potter or anyone that enjoys having their brain teased.

Great fun Harry Potter themed puzzles and escape room. I took my 14 year old son for his birthday with 3 of his friends. They all thought it was tremendous and are very keen to do some of the others in London. The escape room was cleverly done, had about the right level of challenge (with the odd hint) and was great fun. The staff were very friendly.
Harry Potter escape room. The most fun hour of Harry Potter nerdiness that I've had in a long time!! Such a good mix of skills needed and do able (just) with a minimum group of three!!!

Great Christmas present. Took my kids and friend;s kids and they loved it. Staff were really friendly, the games were really challenging but fun and all we could hear (from the lovely waiting room - complete with complimentary coffee/tea etc) was laughter and excited voices. Kids were aged 12-17 and they al loved it.

One of the best Escape games in London. Very clever game that has a lot more thought behind the puzzles compared to other games. The makers have clearly taken a lot of time to think through these intricate Harry Potter inspired puzzles

Magical experience. Went with 3 friends, are first impressions of the building weren't great. However once we were inside we were greated by very friendly staff. The quest room itself was really well done and we enjoyed are time there!

Good fun but not the best Escape Room out there. We were a group of 2 adults and a 12 year old. If you have been to Cluequest, you might find that this game is not as intuitive and that you need more guidance from the team outside the room than you previously have done. However, the Harry Potter theme was really fun, and we did enjoy it.

Great Night Out. We were a group of five adults and I was a little worried that due to the Harry Potter theme, this particular escape room may have been a little too childish perhaps. I was wrong, though certainly I'm sure child friendly this was definitely a challenging game and exceptionally fun for adults. But never fear, handy hints come through on a microphone if very stuck (which we were!)A lot of effort has gone into making the room look believable and there's secret doors, passages and hidey holes galore. Worth the money and thoroughly recommended, it is also right by Liverpool St Station as an added bonus so no searching for it for ages on a cold, rainy night.I wish the very friendly owners every success.

A magical morning!. This was my favorite thing we did in London! I am a big Harry Potter fan, but anyone would enjoy this. It was the perfect amount of fun and challenging. I cannot emphasize how cool it was to use a wand that worked. The entire atmosphere made you feel like you were in Hogwarts. I would recommend anyone to try this.

Excellent experience. Really great attention to detail and really friendly staff - from the moment we entered Enigma Quests, we were given tea and sweets, which is always welcomed. The room has so much detail this is a must for any Harry Potter fans. Puzzles are really fun too, such a great experience and I would definitely recommend.
Ready for Hogwarts. Great afternoon, testing all our knowledge. Very good experience, well thought out and attention to detail. Would recommend

Fantastic!!!!. Went with a 13 and 11 year old, and from the moment we arrived the hosts infectious enthusiasm gave us a good idea of how well this was organised. Great fun, the hour flew by, would recommend to anyone.

Great family experience. We have just completed the wizardry quest with our 2 boys (11 and 13), and had a great experience. I've done escape the rooms before and this was by far the best. The puzzles were very well thought out and the attention to detail in the rooms was amazing - a quality experience. The hosts were enthusiastic and really cared that you had a great time. We couldn't recommend it more and are looking forward to doing the bank raid quest when it's finished.

Fantastic from the start to the end. It was a great way to spend one hour of our trip in this mystery room. We were three girls from Denmark and we all had a lot of fun - even though one of us wasn't a big harry potter fan! It was one of the best mystery room I've ever tried!

Best hour you can have!. We are a family of 4 where our girls are 23 and 21. One visiting us here in London from Paris and the other from Georgia, USA. We wanted something different to do and this was exactly what we found. If you like to figure clues and puzzles, you will love it. We did the Harry Potter event and had a blast. Won the game with 2 minutes to spare. Was really cook how secret passageways would open or doors would open. Was like bring in a haunted mansion. Highly recommend.

As much of an immersive 'experience' as a puzzle room. I've done quite a few escape rooms now and as an overall experience this was one of the very best. In particular, it really felt like a coherent challenge, far more so than any other room I've done - the puzzles all really felt like we were trying to pass our witchcraft/wizardry exams (as per the "story" of the room), whereas most rooms feel more like a room with some arbitrary puzzles to solve to get an exit code. The various magical happenings that we came across were a fun touch that really helped this feeling of the whole thing being in character.It's certainly not the hardest room I've done - our team of 4 passed all of our exams in 40 minutes without any hints - but we were faster than most and I suspect most groups would need the whole hour.Overall I'd really recommend this for 'seasoned' escapers (as an experience rather than a challenge, necessarily) and first-timers (as a great introduction to the genre) alike.

Great fun. Went one night in a group of 5 to the school of witchcraft and wizadry quest. Had a great time and we were able to complete all the puzzles. Looking forward to them opening up the bank robbery room, will definitely visit again when they do.

A magical evening's entertainment. Went with 4 colleagues and wasn't sure what to expect - I haven't done an escape room before. The game was fun and challenging, and the couple running the venue are very friendly and helpful. While the theme of the first room they've built is HarryPotterish, you don't need to know anything about the books or films to take part or enjoy this.The decoration of the room is brilliant and really helps you get into the spirit of it. Tip: go to the pub after, not before. You don't want to play the game with a fuzzy brain and a full bladder!

Excellent evening!. We went as a team of five for the witches and wizardry quest. It was one of the best nights we have had in ages! So much thought and detail into each puzzle (six in total) I had no clue what to do when we started but soon got into a bit of a groove and managed to successful solve all six tasks in the hour. The staff were super friendly and offered small hints when required.Would recommend it to everyone and anyone!

Birthday Surprise. My friends arranged this as a surprise for myself and another friends birthday as both of us love Harry Potter. We had a great time, the staff were really helpful and friendly and the challenges were fun and perfect for a HP fan. Easy to get to and find. Will be recommending this to friends and family.

Brilliant fun with friends or family. Really enjoyed the experience- you have an hour to solve the clues and puzzles to escape the rooms! The venue's between Moorgate and Liverpool street. It's really easy to book your hour long slot online. They have a great social area with games, sofas and tea and coffee so if you arrive early you have something to do. We were a team of four adults which seemed to work really well, but I think older children would also enjoy this. I don't want to spoil the surprise but it was a high tech experience and there were good clues to solve but not so many that it was a truly frantic experience. The theme worked really well. They are opening another two more difficult experiences in 2016 and I can't wait to try them out.

Family friendly fun in London with no queuing. very enjoyable.. Completed the boy wizard theme escape room with family, 2 adults, 2 children ages 11&14. This one is different to other escape rooms, and was a challenge but very enjoyable. Book in advance as its one of the few things you can do in London for families that doesn't involve queuing, as every other attraction seems to do. Located near Finsbury Square in financial district. Friendly staff, would recommend this as an outing for families who want to do something different in London.

Challenging evening out with friends!. If you are hesitant and not sure if you will enjoy it / be able to do it - just take the plunge - we did.My friends and I enjoy doing adventure style evenings out - whether it be a murder mystery or a ghost tour - and this certainly was one of the best.We have never done one of these escape style rooms - so were not sure what to expect. We did the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry room. It consisted of a few rooms with puzzles and other bits and pieces to solve. We managed to complete all the tasks in 49 minutes - which was great considering we have never done an escape style room before!We will defiantly be back for the bank robbery / space craft rooms when they open!

Great fun for all the family. I arranged the trip for my parents, husband and we even took our three year old daughter along. The staff were really helpful and particularly accommodating with the smallest team member - She obviously couldn't take part in the puzzles (and found one or two things a bit 'scary') but really enjoyed helping to find things in the room, dressing up in the cape and eating chocolate coins, which meant that we could all do something fun that we wanted to without having to find childcare. We'll definitely look out for future quests and would recommend the wizard themed one to anyone.

Well thought-out game with incredible staff. Enigma Quests turned out to be a great Christmas present choice for my dad. Four of us attended, and from the outset Nargiza and the team went out of their way to give us a fantastic experience. The well-kitted out social area was a nice touch, as was the coffee and sweets. The game itself (School of Witchcraft and Wizardry) was well thought-out and varied, with some nice twists that kept things fresh. At the end of the game (we completed it!), the great hospitality continued, with opportunities for photos and an explanation of some of the finer points of the clues we'd been solving. I would definitely recommend this to anyone seeking an escape game experience in London.

Well organised, helpful staff and fun activity for all ages. Thank you to the very helpful staff, being flexible with our timing to help us fit in with a birthday meal. we all enjoyed the experience and the hour flew by - we are looking forward to when the other rooms open up so we can try those too. Good central location with parking outside free on Sundays ! great birthday treat for my son who turned 16.

The most fun I've had in a long time. We bought the Harry Potter room escape experience from Enigma Quests for our friend's birthday. (She loves Organised Fun and Harry Potter - win win.) In our team of four, none of us had ever played a room escape game before. It was so much fun! We all came out saying we wanted to play more, and looking at Enigma Quest's website to see what the next room would be. It was the most fun I've had in a long time. We played last week, and we're all still talking about it now.It was a great touch to get the photos afterwards as well. I 100% recommend it. I don't know how it compares to other companies on price, we were a bit cautious when we first saw it... but it's 100% worth it. Think of it like going to the theatre, £25 doesn't seem too much for a ticket to the theatre. And this time, you're in the play. It's brilliant. Just go.

Perfect for Harry Potter fans!. My friends and I had a great time exploring all rooms and solving puzzles. Difficulty level varies per task so good to have a mix of people in the team. Ask for hints if in doubt! The hosts are friendly and the free photos in the end is a great souvenir - will definitely come back for the other themes!

Outstanding!!! . I had an awesome time. A great way to spend time with friends and family. The organisers were very friendly and professional throughout. I would recommend this to anybody that wants a fun time that is different to the norm. Very smart game. Loved the theme.

Brilliant escape room. Have done loads of escape rooms in the past. This one has been by far my favourite with inventive clues and a great Harry potter theme. The difficulty level is average but the thought, detail and very obvious love which has gone into it makes it magical.
Great fun; beautifully done. Really recommend - the escape room was great fun and the set was fantastic. They even provide Harry Potter robes for the full experience.

Great fun for any Harry Potter fan. Having done numerous room escapes previously, this one is definitely a different type of "quest" which is good for a bit of a change in challenge. You do not need any prior Harry Potter knowledge, but the attention to detail is great for anyone with a bit of an interest. Looking forward to the next room opening.

Magical!!. Amazing escape game led by some very creative and passionate hosts! We did the Hogwarts themed quest, and can honestly say we had such a great time! We felt very welcomed as soon as we arrived, and the puzzles and rooms were flawless! Friends of mine who did not know much about Harry Potter still had an amazing time so don't let that deter you - you will still really enjoy solving all the puzzles and finding all the clues.A truly magical time! I would definitely recommend it!

Xmas Team Building!. Fantastic! I booked this as a team building exercise & we all really enjoyed it! Everyone was able to get involved & 'do their bit' - all had a fab time! The guys at Enigma Quests are great, nothing too much hassle! Booking was easy! We booked in 2 teams & whilst the other team was playing, we had full use of the waiting area, which has free tea/ coffee, board games, table football etc! This worked really well for us! The challenge was great! The best I have been too, loved the Harry Potter theme! We were also sent a photo of the team (in Harry Potter robes!!) which was a really nice touch! Oh & we managed to get out in a speedy time ;) - very pleased!! Thanks all at Enigma Quests - we'll be back!!

Amazing time! . My friends and I had an amazing time here. The hosts are great and the room is decorated incredibly well. Different twist to a normal escape room and especially good for Harry Potter fans, loved it!

Loved it . I went today to this with three other friends as a pre Christmas fun day. Was so great and challenging. Loved the set up and the challenges themselves. Very cleverly done and would completely recommend to anyone looking for a fun activity to do with friends. I'm excited to go back for the new rooms they have planned. We managed to get the tasks done with three minutes to go. Was so exciting when we were told we only had 15 mins left to solve all the challenges. Go check it out for sure. Also loved the organisers. They're so passionate about it.
Super enigma quests. I am obsessed with quests now! Attention to the details is the key to real emotions! Now I am obsessed with quests and will have more in the near future
Enigma. Great experience to spend time with your friend and a great way for team building! Highly recommended! Will enjoy it for sure! And we are waiting for new rooms being opened!

Genius and a great experience!. Having done a few escape rooms before, this ingenuity behind this one really stood out! When speaking to the hosts (who are super friendly!), it is apparent that a lot of thought and research had gone into the room! Definitely recommended! Also, complimentary coffee machine is a great touch!

Magical Experience and Awesome Escape Room!. Had an absolutely brilliant time with my family completing this escape room. Having done quite a few in the past I was impressed with the variation of puzzles. It definitely offers something different and unique compared to other escape games out there.It's good to point out that you don't need to be a Harry Potter fan to complete the puzzles but if you love the books and films you will really appreciate all the detail, love and care that has been put into the theme of this escape room.Not only did we have a great time but the owners were so friendly and welcoming. We had a lovely chat with them after the game going over all the puzzles and all the funny stories behind the creation of the room!So much fun and wish I could do it all over again! Can't wait to see what the next Enigma Quest brings!

Different to the rest- in a very good way. Thanks guys, I have done escape rooms across the world from UK- China- Australia and this was right up there with the best. Very different experience to most of them which is most definitely not a bad thing. I would say my best bits but then id be giving it away wink emoticon for those looking to experience a new type of escape room this is one to try. P.s Please keep me updated on the opening of the second room, we are already planning that in January smile emoticon thanks again
So much fun!. We completed the Wizard School quest and had a great time. It was challenging but do-able. We're telling all our friends to give it a go and we'll be back.

Lovely themed, beautifully designed. In this live game your team of 3-5 has 60 minutes to master a number of tests (i.e., solve a number of puzzles) that let you "graduate from the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry". The hosts are very friendly and enthusiastic about their game and you definitely get the feeling that it's not "just a business". The interor design is beautiful and the puzzles original - definitely one of the better escape-room-like activities in London!
Great experience. Don't be fooled by the unassuming entrance and the bare reception area - most resources have been applied to the room itself and you will enjoy it thoroughly !

Brilliant for a team-building evening. I'm lucky to work with 5 colleagues who have similar tastes to me - so this made for a fantastically fun team exercise, and even better as a Harry Potter fan because I could appreciate all the little touches and nods to the canon! Although there are one or two things which show it is still in early stages (I think it opened a month ago) and could be tweaked to improve it, we found ourselves getting so into it. Finished in 45 minutes which we were proud of.As an aside, they went above and beyond to accommodate us - one of our colleagues turned up just as we were finishing and therefore missed the session. However the owners reset the rooms for us and let us back in to do a speedy version of the game. It was so kind and the late colleague was hugely appreciative!I recommend to friends, family with older kids (the younger kids might get a bit frustrated with how surprisingly tricky it is!) and colleagues alike. Not something for a solo trip - you wouldn't reach all the clues as one!

Magical experience at the school of witchcraft & wizardry. This is more of a quest than an escape room in the fact that you have missions to complete, however the concept is the same. In the Harry Potter themed room you must solve clues to achieve passes in a variety of Witchcraft & Wizardry subjects.The clues and problems were brilliant and the technology behind the mechanisms is second to none. There is a great story and attention to detail is brilliant. Which sets you up for a truly magical experience.For me the real positive is the creators whose enthusiasm was infectious, I know that this room is just the beginning of even greater quests from Enigma Quests.I would recommend this to both newbies and experienced escape room participants.Me and my newly qualified witches and wizards cant wait to take on the bank heist.

An excellent escape room, great theme and more!. We've done the Harry Potter themed room. This room is a bit different from usual escape rooms in that the goal is not to escape, but to pass the 6 exams from the school under 60 minutes. Don't be put off by the fact that they are underground. The atmosphere of the room put us very quickly in the wizardry world. As an experienced room-escaper, I should especially congratulate them on the quality of the puzzles and the whole story that leads to solve each of them.Little things could probably be improved, but they've just opened, so I expect them to learn from the experience of the players, and they are definitely leading the way in how escape rooms should be done.Highly recommended, even for non-Harry Potter fans.Also, very nice people :)

Harry Potter fan's dream and great escape room in its own right!. This was a great quest that both older and younger (adults who still feel like kids!) members of the family enjoyed. The theme is any Harry Potter fan's dream - references to the books are definitely in there - but the quest doesn't rely on any knowledge of the books, it's open to all!The hosts were really friendly, welcoming us with offers of tea and coffee. We had a brief explanation of how the game would work before getting started. The puzzles are clever and at a good difficulty level, perhaps just slightly easier than Plan 52 at ClueQuest, but still with some red herrings along the way. Solving the puzzles was very satisfying - things did "magically" happen if you solved them correctly!The use of technology combined with the great design work and atmospheric decoration of the room works brilliantly. The way our hosts talked about the puzzles and the experience as a whole shows their enthusiasm and attention to detail. Clearly some very careful planning in making sure only the correct solution to a puzzle that allows you to proceed in the quest.The creators can be proud of designing and building a quest that stands up alongside more established escape rooms such as those at ClueQuest whilst doing so in their own way and with their own style. I look forward to the heist one being open!

Love the theme, had a such good time there!. The design, decor and puzzles are really thought-through, was quite impressed! I went there with my bf, who is a serious banker, and he really liked it too, even though he never watched or read Harry Potter!

Fun escape room with a great theme. If you've never played an escape room before, then this is a fantastic introduction. I must have played around 30 different rooms now across Europe, and this stacked up well. From the moment you arrive, it's clear the hosts are enthusiastic about and proud of their game. They were still decorating the reception and waiting areas, but once inside the room there were no worries on that front. Even better, you won't spend your time unlocking a tedious series of padlocks or cracking unrelated puzzles. All the puzzles relate to the main theme and felt natural in the room. There was a good variety and the solutions were very satisfying.If I had to criticise, it was probably that the totality of the puzzles was a little too easy - we got out with over twenty minutes to spare. That said, I think for most people you'll get close to an hour's entertainment, but for those who've done quite a few escape rooms, you might find it a little short for your liking. Caveat: they're still fine tuning the room, so while I don't expect major shifts, I can well imagine they'll add a little complexity to some of their puzzles to ratchet up the difficulty. I'm looking forward to them opening up other rooms - there's a combination of set design and mechanics that I've not seen in many escape companies.

Really good fun. Would definitely recommend doing this, although I think it would be quite difficult with less than 3 people. A suggestion for improvement would be to include music in the background; however, the activity was very challenging and definitely contained a suitable amount of puzzles.
Lots of fun, just the right challenge level. This was a great activity and 'a bit different'! The time went fast and even the most skeptical of our group enjoyed it!

Great room. We did the Da Vinci room and it was amazing, without giving anything away it has sone great puzzles and unexpected twists. Ive done a lot of escape rooms and this is definitely one of the better ones. The receptionist was pleasent enough without being the most animated or excitable, somthing that most escape room staff seem to be, but with it being a Sunday that can be forgiven especially with the quality of the room.

Had so much fun. We booked this in last minute but definitely that was a wise choice.We went there on weekend and by its location we thought it would be pricey but comparing to other escape game rooms this one was quite reasonable.Comparing to other escape rooms I did in other countries, this one involves more mechanisms which was quite impressive. I would say both rooms' difficulty were quite challenging yet not very difficult but you do have quite a number of locks to unlock. The only part which would be quite disappointing is they only have 2 rooms which we did both on the same day, so we won't go back again shortly until they have their new rooms ready.ps. Service was quite good too.

Last minute, but not regretting it. . Made a mistake in booking with another escape room and had free time so found this one was available. Had been interested previously and to get a chance to go was great. Welcoming and knowledgeable owner, and two types of room to play. Da Vinci's room was well thought out and fairly challenging with some fiendish puzzles, and a couple of twists. Looking forward to playing the other room and thankyou very much.

Great fun!. We were briefed by the staff upon arrival and we were given a walkie talkie before we began our mission in the professor Oxford room. At first we were a bit lost as we realised there were lots of codes and locks to unlock. Staff were helpful at the right moments as some of the puzzles were quite difficult. It really made us work as a team and get our brains working. The last few minutes were really intense. There were some good surprises and we had a fabulous time. We definitely wouldn't have escaped with 20 seconds to spare if the staff didn't help us along with some of the puzzles. I highly recommend.
Great fun. Went to Escape Land with two of my friend's for their birthdays. We all had a great time and would definitely go back

Loads of fun!!. we went as a group of 4. having never been to an escape room before we werent sure what to expect. we had a quick brief and were left to. we were given a walkie talkie for hints and tips which we ended up being really grateful for as some of the clues were not that easy for us to solve. i was pleasently surprised that it was a series of three rooms to get through in order to escape! each room had a different theme and one was in the dark!!this is super close to Tottenham court road station and easy to find. i would definately recommend trying this with a group of friend if you are into puzzles, riddles etc.

Fun factor is high. We went to oxford street to play escape game. It was so funny with lots of laugh with my friends we had a little bit more than 3 minutes left, I am so happy to escape in time. I will try to find another time to play their other room. Staff was very friendly.

Challenging & Quirky Family Fun. Had an enjoyable time yesterday with my husband and three children (1 teenager and 2 young adults). It was our first experience of an 'Escape The Room' challenge. . We had no problem finding the venue – just make sure you have the address as it would be easy to walk past the entrance. Once through the door you go down the stairs to the basement. Some have mentioned that the reception area was tatty - I felt that it added to the experience. There are two escape rooms to choose from – we booked the ‘Da Vinci Exploration’ . The challenge appealed to us as we like games and problem solving - we escaped with ten minutes to spare. Everyone joined in and now we’re keen to do another one! Great for families and team building.
Challenging but fun. I finished the professor room with my friends. It isn't for experienced groups only as we had beginers and hobbyists alike in our group and we all had fun. Highly recommend it
Best experience in my life. This was my first time i went to an escape room, i had such a fun! Friendly staff, wicked time i had!!! Thanks a million, definetely going back again

Escape Land - great for the kids. This was booked as a surprise birthday gift for my 13 year old. There were 4 teenagers and myself and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. The time flew but we completed the challenge - Escape Room #1 Prof. Oxford - with time to spare so it felt like we'd really accomplished something! Highlight for me was observing my teenage boys working together; collaborating rather than arguing. Worth every penny. Can't wait to do another.

Amazing. We wanted to try an escape game last weekend, and we went to Escape Land to play their first room, Professor Oxford's Experiments. This was our first escape room and we had a blast! There were lots of clever puzzles, fun games and surprising elements in the room. We nearly escaped in time, the host was kind enough to give us a few extra minutes at the end. It was a brilliant experience.
Really enjoyed it. We booked a room last weekend to Escape Land and had a fantastic time there.The puzzles were very smart and well thought out.We could barely escape with a few minutes to spare.
Excellent first time in an escape room. Really enjoyed our first trip with a group four in the professor room. Challenging , interesting puzzles. A great experience , thoroughly recommended.

Good fun games but could do with some decor improvement. This is the second escape room I've done, the first was in another city, and one thing I'm finding is that these places are always a dump. You'll have to search to find the entrance which is a small doorway with very little signage and then head down to the basement. It's a mess down there with tatty sofas and boxes everywhere. That's the negative out of the way and the reason for knocking off a star. The game itself is a lot of fun, we made it out with 90 seconds to spare and there were 4 of us. A few puzzles we really struggled with and needed a clue for and there are a couple of inventive parts to the rooms. Good fun afternoon, just could do with a makeover at front desk.

Great fun. We have done escape room first time 4 of us, it was great day. Everything was just perfect. Sometimes we worked together,but a the end we just split and everybody was focused and concentrated to resolve bits of the problem.Definitely well worth it.

Absolutely perfect birthday gift. We bought this as a present for my daughters birthday and she loved it. The game was great and I'm not going to give away any spoilers but it was really challenging and so rewarding when you managing to solve the clues and progress. Absolutely brilliant and will be back to try the other room.

Adventure in the heart of London :). It was a memorable fun, totally worth it. You need to work together in order to escape :) Great room and friendly game masters! I'll go back with my family soon. Absolutely recommended!!!

amazing experience. It was a great experience and good way to spend an hour with friends. The design was realistic and the challenges were imaginative. I am pretty sure that we will speak and laugh about it later. Totally recommended.

cool entertainment with creative games. We went to try the Da Vinci room last week and we spent a pleasent 1 hour with the games. Good fun, the clues came always in time from the game master. The walkie-talkie was very useful. Location is excellent, just about 50 meters from the Tottenham Court Road station, it was easy to organise with my friends. I am planning to try the other room as well.
Once again!. That was a great prog. for us. The whole familiy are talking about it since last week,.. We will check the other room next time.

exciting game, friendly hosts, easy accessibility!. It was a refreshing teambuilding event, with several rooms. Logic+fun 2in1. Recommend it to everybody, we had a great time! Not too easy but can be done in time! Thanks guys, hope you make more rooms soon!
Good Fun!. @ Da Vinci was a great fun with the guys. Good location (near the metro station)... The stuff was very polite. Most recomended!!

Had a fantastic time. We visited Escape Land this weekend with two of my friends. The location was very easy to get to, it`s just opposite the big primark on Oxford Street. We did the Professor room and absolutely loved it. The puzzles were great and it had many fun elements that I haven`t seen in any other escape rooms. I can wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone who loves solving puzzles and riddles and is not afraid of a challenge.

Fun. Last minute booking and was good fun. However it's a bit of an amateur set up and doesn't feel overly professional in the way the rooms are designed. For instance room 2 had a broken lock which when span got entrance to the next room with no clues being solved. There is also a very unclear part with a jacket with sewn in arrows. Unfortunately the arrows were ripped so we had to radio in. Overall it was fun but not sure it can justify the 26 gbp price compared to the more established places.

Amazing!. Went with 8 other friends. 5 did mad scientist and 4 did da Vinci. I did da Vinci escape room. The reason I'm writing this is that I didn't find enough reviews of the da Vinci room here. It's very good. We solved in about 65 minutes. Because we were close to solving, they gave us 5 extra minutes. No prior knowledge of da Vinci is required. A very enjoyable experience. Don't be shy from asking for help over wallow talkie. They don't blurt out the stuff and are very helpful in a positive way. Overall a very good experience.
Amazing. it was the first time that we went to unescape game and it was amazing. Easy to find. very friendly staff.
Nice quiz!. All the games were very nice. Can't wait to try the other room and see which one is best. Worth to go!!

Excellent escape game!! a must do. It is rather surprising that this escape game is only ranked 20+ on tripadvisor. We tried the Mad Professor's room and it is definitely one of the better escape rooms in London. We have tried about 14 before. At the beginning, maybe the setting and the items are not as new or high tech as some of the other rooms out there and the theatre in the presentation was absent but if you are a purist and just want good quality puzzles that are different, this has them!! Very clever puzzles that are neither too hard or too simple and set at the right level for a good fun game. Creative as well with new different things from the usual. Okay, if you are looking for theatre or fancy toys then maybe go for something like Time Run or the latest ClueQuest room but if you are into just solving really good puzzles, this is the one!

Not as good as we were hoping. We went as a family group of four and had a good time, but we didn't find it particularly challenging or nearly as clever as Hinthunt which two of us had been to before. With just a couple of hints we got out with 17 minutes to spare and felt a bit cheated really that we completed it so quickly. Nice host though and convenient location. Would try somewhere else another time.
Great fun for teams!!!. Thank you to the hosts of the escape rooms! It was great fun and some awesome brainteasers for all kinds of teams. Very recommended for a teambuilding excercize

Fantastic! . We were playing with my husband, was a really good and joyful time. I can't wait to try the new room as well! The location of this game is very convenient, it is in the heart of the city. I will definitely recommend it to all my friends! 5*

Fantastic weekend activity. We visited Escape Land this weekend and played The Mad Professor's Room. We went with a group of friends, most of whom hadn't previously played an escape room. We had a lot of fun, racing against the clock and trying to solve the puzzles. The location was excellent, really central and easy to find. Would highly recommend to all ages!
Fun and challenging. Went to try the game on Oxford Street. Very nice and very challenging. Was easy to find and it was a fantastic one hour. I absolutely loved it! Highly recommended!!

Well done!!. Very nice experience, amazed by the room and the space. Went to play on Saturday and loved it! The location is very easy to find so it took no time! Definitely going to try the other room as well!

Don't be put off by the location. This is a great place to start your escape game addition... The games are frustrating and the array of locks baffling. Regardless of your experience this game sets you on the trail, it has red herrings and clues so obvious, you kick yourself for missing them.There are other puzzles that are so cleverly constructed you scream! A great place to take a first timer.

Highly recommended. This was our third time playing an escape game and we enjoyed it just as much as the first two. I expected us to get better at it and to have an easy time, but some of the clues were rather challenging for us. I felt that this escape game has been the hardest so far. Thankfully the host was really kind and gave us hints through a walkie talkie that was provided. Without that we would have been hopeless. I recommend to have at least 4 players, with only three it's quite tricky!

Really Surprised me. After looking at the photos I wasn't too sure what to expect. But, once there I was straight away drawn in to think about any of it. From the go there's so much to explore. You have to be eagled eyed and work on instinct. Only downside was there wasn't really any point of the plot in the end and the scene could have been set a bit better. But apart from that it was amazing. I recommend anyone to try. Each puzzle or clue is different and because of this the time limit seems a lot quicker than expected.
Really enjoyed it. We thoroughly enjoyed this escape game. There were 4 of us and it was the first game of this kind that we have done but we thought it was great.
Good fun!. We had no idea what to expect, but really enjoyed it. It was very exciting to escape with two seconds to go!

hard but great. we were 5 people and tried an escape game for the first time. we finished the game with 5min left. it was very diversified with a lot of key and number locks. the two rooms are quite challenging! cool setup
Great escape room!. It was our first escape room experience and we had an amazing time! The puzzles were quite fun and diverse, so the hour went very quick! I would definitely recommend it!

Amazing Time!. I took my 12 year old daughter and 3 of her friends on a day out, and we decided to try out and escape room. Escape Land is the first one we've ever done, and it was brilliant. The girls loved it, the time flew by and the host (and owner) were completely on hand for us and really helpful. We highly, highly recommend this for anyone who wants to have a bit of fun!

Great fun!. This was the first escape room I've been to and I had a brilliant time. We went as a group of 3 and were able to escape in time. The host was friendly and explained the game well. The room itself was nicely decorated in a steampunk style, it did seem a bit bare at first but as soon as you start emptying drawers and rummaging through the mannequins clothing the room quickly starts to fill up with puzzle clues. There were lots of satisfyingly challenging puzzles to solve and the host was on hand with a walkie talkie to prompt you if you get stuck. All in all this was a really well made escape room that left us grinning all day and we all highly recommend it! :)

A fun day out. We visited Escape Land earlier today and had a really good time.We have done a few of these rooms before and found that the puzzles here really fun, varied and linked together well.The location of this is very convenient and its not too far from the tube and across the road from an overground station. They also had air conditioning and a fan inside the rooms which was really helpful in the London heatwave weather.Finally I thought the owner was a great guy, he was really friendly and accommodating throughout our time here. I would definitely recommend stopping by here if you get the chance.

great fun and challenge, with helpful host/owner/designer. Our family of four (incl 12 + 8 year old sons) had a super time at Escape Land. Many tricky puzzles to solve to work through the two rooms. The owner/designer/host Sandor was great, accommodating our request for an "in between" time and offering just enough help/clues when he saw we were stuck. Excellent experience. Also, just 5 minute walk from free V&A Children's Museum, which is definitely worth a visit.

Really enjoyed it!. I booked this as a birthday activity for my partner. We originally booked for 5 people but they were happy to accommodate for 6 people. As a group of six we managed to get out with nine minutes to spare but I think this was purely as we had the extra pair of eyes and hands! It was very challenging, I think others in the group solved some of the more difficult puzzles, I was more than happy to look around the room for clues and collaborate, there was plenty to do for everyone. I really enjoyed it, we came out feeling very accomplished. For six it worked out at about £18, reasonable considering whilst researching I saw similar rooms for much more. I enjoyed it, would be good for team building.
Team work. Absolutely amazing. Puzzles are difficult but not impossible. The owner is very kind. The bigger the group, the higher the chance of solving the puzzles.

Great fun, very clever. First escape game for our party - was really well designed & we completed it about a minute over time (with a few hints!). We had a great time and the hour went really fast. I will definitely do more of them!A couple of comments as I assume they read these reviews:1) I think it would be good to add some music to the last 5 mins or so to raise tension - as we were quite close to finishing it, I think it would have been quite funny! A bit more crystal maze-esque!2) The waiting room is a bit shabby - I don't think it would take much to make it look a little more slick (same with all of the discarded furniture outside). It's East London chic I guess but I believe it made it look more amateur than it need be.Definitely would recommend!ThanksAlex

The only thing missing was Richard O'Brien.... Really great! Thanks Shandor! We had a wonderful time in an excellently planned game experience. Challenging and varied games with an interesting plot underlying them. The only disappointment was the performance of my team-mates...

Great experience!. The guy who created this game is an absolute genius. The games were very cleverly put together and we had the most fantastic time! You have 1 hour to solve all the puzzles and escape from the room, great fun with friends. A brilliant day out, I didn't want it to end! We paid £88 for four of us which, worked out £22 each. Well worth the money for such an original experience. The guy in charge was so friendly and helpful and supported us throughout the game when needed, via walkie talkie :) This place was also very easy to find as it's just a short walk from Bethnal Green station. Highly recommended!

Excellent puzzles!. My friends and I had a blast here. Even though one of us was 30 minutes late (ahem, me), Sandor was a fantastic host and waited for us, as there were no people in the next time slot. Thank you Sandor!

We escaped our first escape room!!!!. We absolutely loved our first escape room experience. A bit nervous of what to expect but the 4 of us (adults) got stuck in and surprised how well we worked as a team. Lots of complex puzzles, some practical, plenty that were brain taxing and some that just required good old fashioned communication. Something for everyone. The puzzles were well thought out and varied, and the theme was good. The hour passed in a flash but we felt like we got our monies worth. We got out with 12 minutes to spare, so we felt very smug for our first attempt but the adrenaline certainly pumped and we were so keen to do another that we booked another venue for the next day. Highly addictive, and great fun!!

Such Good Fun. We booked to take our 12 year old daughter and two friends but think we had even more fun than they did. We couldn't believe how quickly the hour went by and all three girls were on a high when we finished with 1min left! Puzzles were just at the right level - challenging but not too hard - and plenty of them to keep us all busy. Highly recommended.

Great game with lots to do!. We have been to a variety of escape the room games and this certainly ranks near the top. The theme (Steampunk) is good and the room reflected it throughout.There were tons of puzzles, both mental and physical, that nonetheless were solvable within the time. There were lots of different types of puzzles and some were certainly unique! A large number could be done in parallel which would be good for a team.The balance of difficulty was good and tending to the more difficult end of the escape game spectrum. We managed to escape with only a few minutes left.All in all a great escape game so if you enjoy this type of entertainment I would thoroughly recommend it.
First escape game we've tried. And it was AMAZING. We did it as a group of five friends and had a fantastic time. Don't hesitate, go for it!

Great for adults and kids. We were looking for something to do with the kids (10 & 13 years) on a dull day and this was perfect. A fun and bonding time as you all work together to solve the puzzles. . Help is at hand via the walkie talkie if needed, which was a great help, but didn't give the game away. Did a few price comparisons and this came out as more reasonable. Our first experience of an escape game and we will certainly go again.

Mental and physical puzzles to solve - genius!. A group of friends and I have been to escape rooms around the world (we're a bit addicted to them) and I have to say this is one of the best. There's a simple reason why this is so - it's not the building (it's hard to spot), nor the waiting area (it consists of a sofa) but the fact that the game room is so well designed. Instead of simply trying to solve a set of puzzles involving maps and shapes, this also has several physical puzzles that you need to solve.We managed to complete the game - just - and the payoff is special and unusual. I really hope the designers of the room create a second one - I can't wait to try it.

Fantastic fun!. Having always enjoyed a puzzle or two, we were looking forward to our first foray into escape rooms and we weren't disappointed! The clues were varied and numerous, but not prohibitively difficult. The guy who runs the company (lovely bloke) was on hand via a walkie talkie to prod us in the right direction (metaphorically!) in case we got stuck and all 5 of us had a great time. I would thoroughly recommend, and I look forward to seeing what's next!!

Am absolute must! . 3 of us went in not sure what to expect. The timer immediately starts counting down and you find yourselves panicking and scrambling for clues! Take friends here and find out who panics, who bosses, and who maybe isn't such a great friend in stressful situations. We loved it. The owner was accommodating and you can clearly see the effort and time he's put into this, to make it an enjoyable experience. Thank you.
Lovely stuff. Lovely guy running it, had a great time with my friends, lots of fun, not crazy difficult, definitely recommend.

Very good escape room. We visited here back in September, so the review might be a bit out of date.My friends and I were warmly met by the owner. We had a nice chat with him, he seems to be an escape room expert. The room had some amazing puzzles. Back in September, it was still a little "rough around the edges". Some labels were hand written and a bit hard to read. But that did nothing to detract from the amazing setup and story. Hopefully by now that has been fixed up. Definitely within top 3 escape rooms in London.We all enjoyed the challenge very much and would return.
Great experience. It was great fun. We didn't expect it to be so good. One of the best rooms we have done so far. If you enjoy the escape experience you must try this room.

60 minutes in another world. We played the game when my sister came to visit. I have played a few of those games before. This one was definitely one of the best. Challenging, yet not too frustrating. You completely forget the outside world for 60 minutes.

Excellent family activity. Did this for my daughter's 20th birthday x with a mixed age family group, was great fun, owner helpful, puzzles challenging and enjoyable, highly recommending it to my friends was brilliant.
Good Fun. Went there with family (young adults) and very much enjoyed the session. I would recommend it to eveyone.
Great fun!. Highly recommended we enjoyed every single minute in that room. You must to try it, best to share with friends! Thanks! ;)

Amazing Experience - worth the money. I played as part of a team of 4 and enjoyed every minute of it. The owner was really lovely, friendly and made us feel welcome. The puzzles were great and there was more than enough of them to keep us entertained. If you have been to other escape games in london and enjoyed the experience I would highly recommend trying this one out. I really hope there are more rooms in the future as i would definitely be back again.
Fantastic fun!. An excellent escape room. The puzzles were plentiful and engaging. Loved it! Hope more (different) rooms will be added in the future, as we'd love to come back. Highly recommended!

Amazing!!. Went here for my boyfriends birthday as a group of 4. We thought we could finish
Quickly but to our surprise we finished with 3 seconds remaining. Totally unexpected experience. The staff member was very friendly and so helpful. We all loved this experience!!

DO THIS. IT'S FAB. This is a must do event in London, we were a group of two adults and two teenagers and we all simply loved it. It was fast paced and challenging. So much to test you and just the right amount of help iif needed. We couldn't stop talking about our efforts afterwards. Whilst in the room each one of us either worked together or individually. Don't be put off by out of way location - just do it , it's amazing!

So many locks!. I have done escape games before, and so kind of knew how it worked. However it was still challenging, and what I liked about this one was there were activities involved too. There were a couple of things I had never seen in other escape games, and well thought out puzzles. The puzzles were very varied and it did make us think! Would highly recommend.

Very entertaining game!. We went as a group of 4 and found it to be the perfect group size for this escape room. There were so many puzzles and activities to do which meant that we were all kept busy for the whole time! We could work as a group, individually and in smaller teams to complete all of the puzzles. It was a genuinely interesting way to spend our evening and we would all recommend it!

Puzzle portal into the Steampunk era. If you’ve ever wanted, as I have, to take part in Crystal Maze, this is the place to go. This was my first Escape experience and I loved it. You and your team are "trapped" in a Steampunk themed room and you must solve the puzzles to make your escape. This escape game is packed with a variety of puzzles that must be solved within the hour, as indicated by the large clock on the wall. The puzzles themselves are a mixture of code breaking, logic and physical problems, but nothing too strenuous. While some puzzles are harder than others, all are solvable. This is an important consideration, as getting stuck can turn a fun activity into a frustrating one. Don’t worry about getting stuck at Escape Land. The host is watching your every move and is available at the end of a walkie talkie to offer hints if you need them. He even offered us advice when we went too deeply into one puzzle, making it far more complicated than it actually was. Escape Land may seem a little off the beaten track but it’s close to Cambridge Heath rail station and only a short walk from Bethnal Green tube station. There are a number of buses that serve the area and, as parking is difficult, I suggest using public transport. Our team of four had a great time and would recommend it to groups of friends, colleagues or families with older children.

Good intellectual fun!. Our First Escape experience, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! The challenges were well thought-out, and very fun to figure out as a group. Although I would recommend no more than 4 people in a group (as it would get too easy otherwise) 3-4 is probably a good number.The owner was very friendly and warm. If you get stuck in a challenge there is always an option to use the intercom (although try to avoid this!!) Overall very good fun !

Excellent and exciting puzzles. Brought some friends who had never tried escape games before, and they all loved it! The challenges were very varied and the owner had clearly put a lot of hard work and passion into this. We were four people, which I thought was optimal, considering the number of puzzles that needed attention. Sometimes we needed to work together on one puzzle, and sometimes we focused on one puzzle each. I have to admit we didn't finish on time, but we were so close we were allowed to spend another minute to escape. We booked the same day (weekday) without problems. Would recommend to anyone!

Well worth it to try something different. As a group of four adults, we found this suitably challenging and used all of our different skills- there was a mix of puzzles so that everyone could join in. We often had to ask each other for help so it was a great group activity. The puzzles were fun and worked well with the "steampunk" theme. The host was really friendly and welcoming and explained the rules really clearly to make sure we all understood before we started. Inside, the time really flew by. cannot recommend this enough.

Great family fun. We did this as a family and it was great fun. Our kids were 12, 14, and 16 years old and it was a good and challenging level for us as a family. Most problems are logical puzzles, but there are also some manual dexterity obstacles too. There were two rooms to escape from to complete the full escape. We were almost out of the second room when time ran out. The owner gave us a few more minutes and we were able to fully escape.Well set up and great fun for the whole family.I could see this as being good for corporate team building too.It wasn't super easy to find at night, but well worth it. I'd go again for sure and recommend this to others who are looking for something fun other than or beyond the normal tourist attractions in London.

You have to try this!. A group of four of us did this room together, and we've told everyone we could think of that they have to check this out. Honestly, I cannot recommend this highly enough. It is a fantastic way to spend an afternoon - we were on such a high after escaping, and couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the day. The puzzles are really clever, unique, and there are are plenty of them. The owner has a put a lot of effort and craftsmanship into creating such a challenging and engaging space. I've since tried another room with a different company, and it wasn't half as good as this.
Fantastic experience. Super experience. We really had an hour of fun with interesting and challanging gameHighly recommend!

Brilliant. We went as a family of four having never done anything like this before. We all absolutely loved it. Loads of puzzles to solve, all of which were cleverly put together, tough but not impossibly so. We needed a bit of help on occasion and the owner was proactive enough to spot this which greatly helped the flow. We didn't quite get out within the hour (1 hour 6 minutes) but still felt a sense of achievement once we'd completed it.I would highly recommend this to any family or group looking for something a bit different which will encourage you to work as a team and give you plenty to discuss afterwards. It's a bit off the beaten track but in a funny way that added to the experience!

Best Escape room yet in London. I've become ever so slightly addicted to escape rooms since tackling one in Berlin this summer. This is right up there with the best one's i've done (in Berlin and Budapest) and was far superior to any i've done in London or elsewhere in the UK. There was so much going on and a lot of creativity went into making the room. Despite having done escape rooms before it was still a very challenging room, and i reckon it would appeal to anyone. The owner was friendly and accomodating, highly recommended
Awesome hour of fun!. Would definitely recommend everyone to try it out. Well worth your money. The owner is very friendly and runs the game very well.

A great hour of fun. I went here in a group of 4. We had a brilliant time solving the puzzles and escaping from the room. I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys solving a problem and having fun. I won't write about any specifics as this would ruin it for you.

A great time!. Escape & Puzzle rooms seem to have become really popular in the last couple of years, but this was the first time we had tried one of these experiences out. I was a little apprehensive at first because it is in a very tucked away part of town, and the reception area was a little bland but as soon as the game started you are immersed into this "Steampunk" environment.So many things to figure out in so little time! So many little details you have to take note of... or wait, is that a red herring?Although you can have 5 people, I would suggest 3-4 is a better number (we were a group of 4) otherwise it would be a little bit short on space.Also I am a little smug as we had 6m 21secs to spare at the end and not everyone can escape in time.It's like the Crystal Maze but without the 80's hair-do's and jumpsuits.

So much fun, highly entertaining. I organised for my team to do this for our xmas team building outing. We booked two sessions as there is only one room and we played as two groups of 5. Booking was really easy and Sandor was great to deal with. We hadn't done anything like this before and didn't really know what to expect. What we got was so much fun. It was extremely entertaining and highly rewarding. We were totally buzzing after we'd escaped. I would highly recommend this room and am looking forward to doing another one.

Great fun!. We visited Escapeland yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed it. We were all first-timers to puzzle rooms so were a little apprehensive but it was such great fun. We would definitely do it again!
Best escape room so far!. This was my third escape room and it is by far the best one so far! Great puzzles, great ideas, great place! We are waiting the next room! ;) thank you!!

Excellent!! . Visited escape land with a couple of friends and have to say it was really good fun!!!
Highly recommend it for a small group looking for something different to do in London.

good fun. We visited escape land me my wife and daughter, needed a little help but got out with an extra 15 mins. Its good fun and a little bit off norm, I would do this again and would say you should enjoy...many thanks great evening had.

Excellent themed live escape game. I've now done five live escape games in London, two each at Hint Hunt and Clue Quest plus this one, and this is definitely right up there with the best.I have to say though, it didn't get off to a great start. The location isn't the most inspiring in the world, and the "foyer" doesn't have a patch on Clue Quest's new offices, but it's all about the room, isn't it?Of the rooms I've played, this is definitely the best in terms of theme. The Steampunk angle was a fun context for the game, and they'd woven it well into the puzzles.The puzzles themselves were varied and interesting - much less artificial than Hint Hunt's, although not as high tech and "cool" as Clue Quest's (but I guess with a Steampunk theme, that was inevitable). A couple of really fun puzzles, and some where teamwork was important which I think really added to the experience. The combination of the theme and the type of puzzles, definitely made me think of the Crystal Maze. In terms of difficulty I'd put these on the low side, but by no means easy - I can see people getting out in 40 minutes, but they're not going to breeze through. On the flip side, that means I believe all the puzzles are genuinely solvable, which is something I didn't feel at Hint Hunt.Bottom line: Clue Quest is probably better, but this is still very good and if you fancy something less about the tech and more about the theme then arguably better.

Fantastic Experience! Really well designed game. -Helpful and friendly stuff. The creator of the room stayed with us afterwards to answer all our questions. -Extremely well designed game. A lot of interesting and well balanced puzzles. -The way the room is designed promotes cooperative play which makes escaping even more rewarding. -Overall we had a fantastic night. We left with a huge smile in our faces!

Family fun. We were trying to book a live escape game to try it out on our family weekend in London. I was trying to book one of the venues closer to Central London but they were all full so we chanced this one. I'm glad we did as we suspended our disbelief for an hour and had a really fun time. We are a family of four (2 adults, 1 16 year old and 1 10 year old) and there was involvement for everyone. It's a 10-12 minute walk from Bethnal Green Tube station, just up from the V&A Museum Of Childhood so it's quite easy and quick to get to from Central London.A bit like a crossword, you sometimes have to get into the mindset of who sets the puzzles. We struggled a little bit at first but with a few hints we quickly got into our stride and managed to 'Escape' with just over four minutes to spare. We were rather chuffed!It cost us almost £90, which is a lot, even for London, and we'd love to do another one but it would have to be a lot cheaper. For a family of four I'd pay £60 to do one. I guess if you are a group of adults paying separately just over twenty quid each is pretty reasonable. Like with all things when you're paying for a family though, it normally comes out of only one pocket! But, cost, I'm glad we did it as it was a fun and challenging hour and something very different, think Crystal Maze with more of a low budget set!!

Top quality escape game. - extremely well designed game- several unique enigmas / puzzles, never seen in previous escape games (done 40 to-date)- perfectly well balanced hints- really nice ownerAll in all, one of the top European escape games

Lovely family playdate. Went there today with family of four. The decor was great, the puzzles challenging, and the guy running the show was, as others have said, very helpful. He mentioned he will be changing the layout annually so we will be back next year for more! Highly recommend.

One of the best escape game ever !. I've been there, after trying many other escape games in London and Paris, and I must say this one was among the very best. Very well designed, it keeps you busy with the searching and the logic for the entire hour. The decoration is very well thought and you go from surprises to surprises.I would recommend it to anyone, not only people fond of escape games but also newcomers as this can really adress any kind of customers.Great job !

Absolutely brilliant. I cannot recommend this enough. Very challenging and the three of us only managed to finish with 28 seconds left on the clock (and maybe with a couple of small clues...)If you were ever a fan of the Crystal Maze on Channel 4, this will be right up your street!
Clap. Clap. Clap.. This room was excellent, it bombards you with puzzles and keeps you guessing the whole way through. My friends and I had great fun, I definitely recommend it.

Great family fun!!. I would dear say anyone in any age would enjoy this.A lot of fun and a very friendly and helpful stuff.I can highly recommend it as a great way to spend an afternoon in London. We would love to do this again!

A brilliant couple of hours!!!!. Visited Escapeland as a family of four, two adults and two children age 10 and 11. It was very easy to find from Bethnal Green tube station. The host was lovely and clearly wanted us to get the most from the experience. The time we spent in the escape rooms flew by as it was completely all absorbing. It took a little while to get into the swing of the game. The puzzles were excellent and we all worked together to solve them. The children really enjoyed searching the room from top to bottom to find clues and keys and objects that were required. The host gave us hints and answered our questions but without giving too much away so we were able to continue with the game. We finished just over the hour (65mins ish) as the host very kindly gave us a little extra time as we were enjoying it so much. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hour and will be recommending to friends and family. Thank you Escapeland!

Still puzzling afterwards . First time, having only discovered it trawling TripAdvisor for ideas in London. Had a great time as a family (kids 12 & 14) working together to solve the various puzzles. No worries about getting locked in as help is available if you get stuck . The owner was very friendly and when we "escaped" even made time for my kids to complete some of the failed tasks with some hints (so you can tell it caught their imagination). Great if you like puzzles.

Brilliantly unique. I had played many of these games on my computer but doing a live action version was so much better. I was part of a team of 3 and there was plenty of games to keep us all occupied for an hour. The games were all very varied and tested many different things. All in all a great few hours of fun

Loved it!. I don't know why this one isn't as high up as the others on Tripadvisor as it is well worth a visit! We were a bit last minute and only booked a few days before we came, Escape Land was the only one that wasn't booked up. The puzzles are great and the guy that runs it was lovely. This was my first experience of an escape room but would definitely do another after visiting this one.

Great fun. Highly recommended. . We'd never done an Escape Room before. We were looking for something a bit different but weren't sure what to expect. What a blast! Went with a 19 year old and a 12 year old and us, a couple of old fogeys! Something for us all. Great family fun where everyone is involved in solving the puzzles. We escaped, sweating, with 3 seconds to spare. We all loved it. Would recommend to anyone looking for something a wee bit different to do as a family.
Great.. loved escape land and owner is a really nice guy. great stuff. slightly lower budget than cluequest, but just as much fun and with slightly better puzzles.

Challenging!. My Girlfriend and i took our Swedish friend to Escape Land, there was only 3 of us but we managed to make it out of the room with 1 second to spare! Although we did need a few clues along the way from our host who was very welcoming and polite. It was so much fun and we are already planning our next room challenge.

Great fun. The 3 of us had a hard time and only managed to finish with 20 seconds to spare. We all loved it and talked about what to do next time and if there are different rooms. Hopefully we can go back in a bit bigger group and do boys against girls. If you are looking for a different activity full of fun do this you will love it.
Addictive. Such a clever idea and developed really well! Finished with three people just two minutes before the clock! :)))))

Absolutely Fantasic. We didn't quite finish it in the hour but were given a little extra time and so managed to complete! First 30 minutes just flew by but having settled in and started to understand how it worked we worked together. There were parts that each of us managed to work out to help with the escape. Would love to do another one now!!!.
Absolutely Fantastic Fun!. We had an absolutely fabulous time at Escape Land..it's geniously thought out and is just a brilliant way to spend a few hours.

Great Fun!. My husband and I had a great time trying to solve the puzzles - didn't quite make it in time but still really enjoyed it. We were warned that it is difficult for only two people to solve all the puzzles in time but we still wanted to have a go and are very glad we did.

Best fun ever. This was the most fun I have had in ages. 4 of us did it and it was perfect level of puzzle, code breaking and logic - we finished it in 55 minutes which we were so proud of! It really got my adrenalin going running around the room looking for anything to help out and it was a proper team bonding exercise! The host was really welcoming and kind - can't wait for another room!

If you like puzzles you will love this. We completed the game as a group of 4 including 2 keen puzzlers. We found it an excellent mixture of brainy and physical problems. There were lots of nice "oh yes of course" revelation moments. We were very excited and exhilarated by finishing everything in time. Our host was very friendly and gave small clues at just the right time. Highly recommended.

Great fun and challenging. There were 3 of us, two adults and an 11 year old. The host is a really friendly guy but he is running a pretty new operation so there arent any facilities to speak of but that frankly didnt really bother us.The rooms were great fun and all three of us got into it straight away. Its amazing how quickly you start to find abstract as well as practical challenges the most important thing in the world when you are under a time limit and need to find a way out.Like many of the other reviewers we got loads of help and extra time but we did complete it and you get an enourmous sense of satisfaction from doing so and great - if a little strange - memories of teamwork and fun and achievement.My daughter absolutely loved it and so did we and what more can we ask for!!

Very smart puzzles. This was the second escape game I have done in London and loved it. The guy is really friendly but, boy- this is a tough one. We thought we would be pros having done one already but this is a lot tougher. Apparently one in three fails the task but with a sufficient group, you should be fine :)

Challenging but good fun. This is the third escape room I have played and definitely the hardest! We only had three team members and didn't ask for clues until 30 minutes in but it was tricky! The man was very friendly and you didn't feel rushed at all which was great! He happily took photos and asked lots of questions about how we found the game and discussed other people's experiences! Lots of different types of challenges but the only thing I would change would be the opportunity to find more things... There were lots of locks but most of these required 4 number combinations to be obtained through solving puzzles and things which was great if you're a high level logically thinker but otherwise they were quite abstract and I did find myself getting a little frustrated- would have been great to have more of a mix of some being hidden but overall a great experience!

Great activity. We went to escape land yesterday for a birthday (2 Couples) and had a fantastic hour. We escaped with 2 mins to spare (with a little help from the host) and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The puzzles were interesting and challenging. Hope they open a new room as we would definitely come back!

Lots of fun. My girlfriend had been talking about doing an escape room for awhile now and we discovered this one during our trip to London. The location was a bit challenging to find as google maps points you to a location across the street. Once we found it, the owner was friendly and helpful. We were locked into a room supplied with a piece of paper on a clipboard, a pen, and a walkie talkie incase we got stuck. We then had an hour to try to escape. The first room was challenging and the puzzles were very fun. The second room also had some fun puzzles but was overall less challenging (or we had gotten the hang it). With three people we managed to finish with just 3 minutes to spare. We really enjoyed ourselves and recommend it to everyone.

Above expectations in many ways. My family and I went to Escape Land this afternoon. Our children range from 7 to 13. We got a warm welcome from our host, listened carefully to his instructions and got going. Without giving anything away, I think it's fair to say that we started (very) slowly but gathered momentum. Our host gave us a few pointers (and a few extra minutes) and somehow we managed to escape.We've been discussing the experience all evening. We all want to do it again. This is pretty unusual for us.Very highly recommended.

what a brilliant hour (57 minutes actually!). The biggest challenge is finding the place! A little off the beaten track but only a 7 minute walk from Bethnal Green on the central line.
