Turn right into Partimer and look for Seth Court about 100m on the left.The place is basically an industrial unit which has been set up as a couple of rooms with a varity of puzzles in. The host, who watches your progress via cameras, offers hints if you struggle to keep things moving - although in our case we felt we were nowhere near at a dead end before he helped out - maybe we were a little behind where we should've been at that point in order to get out in the hour?The puzzles where all solveable but could do with a little tweaking to help with which solution code opened which lock.We really enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to anyone - our team was 2 adults and a 13 and 14 year old.

Team work to escape. I took my team from work as a team building event. It was the first escape game any of us had played so a real novelty and great fun. You really have to work well as a team to solve all the puzzles within an hour. It paid off as the 5 of us were able to leverage each others skills, and managed to escape with 8 minutes to spare. I would recommend it as a great activity for a small team.

Some thing different and great fun!. We went as a family, 2 adults and a 12 year old. Finding the place was a little tricky but once in the room host was great and got us sorted quickly.So without giving anything away, 3 people going at the end of a long weekend of doing stuff in London is probably not the best idea unless you take some brain food with you (which of course we didn't!). Anyway, that's our excuse for not getting out in time despite a fair amount of help and an extra five minutes!Regardless of that, we had an amazing time and it's great fun being challenged to think laterally while trying to take in everything else that's going on. Being a bit slow to start only meant we had to really kick into gear at the half way mark! Having a mix of ages and left hand/right hand brain thinkers would help a lot so go in numbers!The room host was brilliant, pointing us in the right direction and helping out when we were unable to do some stuff. Our 12 year old loved it especially when we got to the very last part and tried to open the door, her face when she realised she knew where the final key was made it a priceless experience!

The Krypton Maze. Growing up watching The Crystal Maze and Krypton Factor these live escape games are a dream come true for me. Have done both rooms in ClueQuest and this was equally as fun. The only criticism is that we could not really understand the guy on the radio very well and even after he repeated himself it we still could not understand. We went as a three and did manage to get out with a couple of added minutes. This is highly recommended, great fun and a bit different but do suggest going with a minimum of 4 people :)

Brilliant fun. A group of 3 of us (all adults) went along for this. It was the first time doing this sort of an event for all of us and we absolutely loved it. We didn't make it out but we got very close, I think next time we will know how to adjust our strategy and have much better chances. The game was a lot of fun and definitely challenging and the staff very friendly. We got there a fair bit early and they were happy to let us start early. I would definitely recommend this one, and we will definitely be going back to have another go when a different room is set up.

Great fun. We really enjoyed this one - not as hard as HintHunt, and the guy who runs it lets you alone and responds only when you ask for hints, which was even better. It's not in the best or most scenic area of town, but very safe to and easy enough to get to. The puzzles are very satisfying - just the right level of difficulty - we finished in 53 minutes, and would highly recommend it.

Another great puzzle room in London!. We've done pretty much all the other rooms in London and some in Germany and Budapest, and this one is another great one definitely worth the time and money! Had a fair bit of puzzle types we haven't seen before and plenty of room / things to do for 5 people, unlike some of the other rooms that are quite cramped with a person or two pretty much standing around.

Definitely do this- so much fun!. Went as a group of 4 (2 couples in 20s) so many different puzzles so everyone has something to do. Loads of fun and really exciting, we were talking about it all evening and want to try other ones now. Would definitely recommend! Agree with what other reviews have said about the host, he talks to you through a walkie talkie so is not distracting and doesn't interfere, but will help when it is needed. Go and do this!

We love room escapes. We've been to a couple of room escapes now and Escape land didnt' let us down. Three of us turned up and as usual you don't know what to expect. On a difficulty level I would say that this was quite hard and some lateral thinking needed to be done. Whilst we didn't need any pointers from the host we had had a walkie talkie if we had got stuck. All in all a good hour spent and all three of us were relieved to get out with just 39 secs to spare. It would probably be easier with more people as some of the puzzles and challenges are time consuming. I'll leave it ther as I dont want to add any spoilers but this is well worth a visit.

Great alternative fun. Had no idea what to expect but had a brilliant hour or so. We were a group of 4 late 20s and were down to our last padlock when we ran out of time! (Also have to admit we had some much needed pointers from the extremely helpful host!).Would highly recommend. Great, unexpected fun though takes a little while for your mind to get into puzzle solving mode (not sure mine ever really did in truth!). Really well planned and executed and lovely staff/ organiser to keep you on track. What is it? Two connected rooms full of inter-connected puzzles and locks which you have to work through via clues, keys and combination codes to 'escape' within 1 hour. (We didn't quite make it!)

Wish we could do it again!. A group of five of us did this recently and it was great fun. There were plenty of puzzles, so everyone could be working on something different at the same time, but because everything is related you still had to team up for the solutions.Our visually impaired friend found it difficult to read some of the clues because the writing was too small. It wasn't a problem for the team overall, but would have increased her enjoyment.Overall though, it was fantastic and we all wanted to go straight back in and do it again with new puzzles! Highly recommended!

Brilliant. We went in a group of 3. Didn't know what to expect but it actually exceeded our expectations. It was fun, challenging and interesting. Cleverly done and really entertaining. Definitely would recommend this for fun. I guess in a group of at least 4 people it would be more manageable to complete tasks on time.

Fun but challenging escape experience. My 14-year-old daughter and I went to this. We originally had three members in our group but one was unable to come. They let us play anyway, which was nice, but warned us we would have trouble finishing. We had a great time even though, as they predicted, we were unable to finish in time. It was difficult to move quickly enough with just the two of us, so we recommend at least 4 members to a group. The host was incredibly kind, giving us extra time because we were one person short. He also gave us hints when we got stuck, but not before we really needed them. As for the puzzles themselves, they were difficult but not impossible. Well worth it despite it being off the beaten path- the street is right opposite the Cambridge Heath rail station.

Good Fun. Me and 3 friends went to this. The puzzles were a challenge without being impossible and we all had a lot of fun working together to complete the game and escape. Would recommend as a fun group activity.

Highly recommend. Went in a group of 6, all early 20 year old professionals for a bday. Very good alternative activity for London, albeit a little weird. Drinks at Satan's Whiskers rounded off a great night. Would definitely recommend.
Good Challenge. Went with my mate Dave and a few other mates for his birthday. The puzzles were quite tricky, but I managed to carry the team to victory

Great challenge!. Went there with 2 of my friends and once we entered the room there were so many mazes and tasks to challenge our logical skills that we barely made it in time :) Great experience, would definitely recommend going there and testing your abilities!

A LOT of fun!. Went with family - two adults and two teens - and we had a great time! Didn't know what to expect as we'd never even heard of escape games (not big in US, I guess), but we REALLY enjoyed it. Room puzzles are challenging but not frustrating and the attendant was really helpful and nice.

So much fun!. Yesterday was my 4th attempt at an escape game, having done two others in London as well as one in Budapest. I loved them all but must say Escape Land was my favourite! We played with 4 people and just managed to make it out under an hour with only a few clues. Was so much fun! Highly recommended.

Vive la difference! - An alternative fun experience.. I love Room Escape games on my computer so it was very exciting to do it for real. Nothing too taxing on the brain and plenty of help from our host. Timing was spot on for 3 of us (there are 2 optional quizzes that we didn't get round to but we did escape the room) and I was impressed at how a relatively 'empty' room could keep us looking and puzzling for so long. Well worth a visit.

Great visit. We took our cousins to Escape Land on Saturday and had a really good time. We had been to a similar site before and had taken our cousins as it was local to them and they had never been. They loved it and we really enjoyed it. The games and the puzzles were good and we would highly recommend it to others. We did crack the room but only just..... Looking forward to doing more of these games. Well done Escape Land you were spot on.

Great fun for a family and/or friends. This was a great experienced. It allowed us to work in small groups within the team to solve challenges. It used a variety of skills to complete the 'objectives'. The facility was clean and tidy, however I would suggest a minimum age of 18 as some of the challenges were quite involved.

Great fun, highly recommended. Really interesting theme and setting for this puzzle based experience. The difficulty, variety and quantity of puzzles was just right to keep you occupied for the time allotted. It was very exciting and fun to do, especially in a group of four people, as we were. The host was very helpful with giving out hints when needed. I'd love to come back, it is definitely something I would recommend for a group to do together.

Great experience. We arrived not knowing what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. The puzzles, riddles and games were not impossibly hard but some did take time to work out. I would definitely recommend Escape Land as it's something very different and I would have loved it to continue for longer!

Great fun for a group of friends!. Plus points:-Amazing decor and well-executed steampunk theme-Great variety of puzzles with varying difficulty-Accommodating host who knows how to keep the flow of the game going (aka: not leaving you frustrated for 20minutes)-Interesting puzzles kept us fully occupied for the duration of 60minutesThe puzzles were novel and definitely solvable if you keep your mind engaged at all times. I've been to other escape games and this definitely ranked among the top! I especially loved the steampunk theme. Also, the puzzles had varying levels of difficulty which means everyone in a group can contribute in some way,not only the intelligent ones!I have to give special mention to the host, who was especially accommodating and understanding the whole way through. In comparison to other escape games I've been to, he knew exactly when to provide hints when needed. This is a huge boon especially when you consider in other escape games, the host does not know when to interject or when to leave you to your own devices. Bad hosts leave you stuck in a dead-end for 20 minutes or refuse to provide hints because it's 'against the rules', turning what should be a fun activity into a frustrating one. But this host was absolutely on-point with his valuable (!!) inputs which helped to keep the flow of the game going,and he always respected your intelligence all the way through.I cannot stress the importance of a good host enough, you can have the best puzzles in the world but if it cannot be solved, then it wont be appreciated! The emphasis should be on having fun,not on being competitive!

lovely stuff. This was a great room escape irl! We'd done Hint Hunt before and this was similar but had enough fresh and different puzzles to keep us fascinated, and make it really tough to get through! We loved it. Luckily we made it out or we could have ended up locked in a different time for ever!

Brilliant and different!!. This is such a great idea. We went not fully knowing what to expect but we weren't disappointed. It's a simple concept but great fun and the kids really enjoyed it too (they were better than the adults). I suspect It's something you can only really do once unless the game was changed but I would definitely recommend giving it a go.

An hour of mind boggling fun. Brilliant time at escape land. Trying to solve challenging and fun puzzles as the minutes tick by. Brilliant achievement when you open the final door!Only thing I would change is to add more rooms! Had so much fun I would have carried on another hour.
Fun challenge. Great fun, the puzzles are challenging but not too difficult and the design is really interesting. Would definitely recommend.

So much fun. A group of 4 of us decided to try this experience. I am so glad we did. The puzzles were fiendish and fun. We managed to make it out in time with 5 mins to spare! It is a great experience and really something for people to get their teeth into. It gave me a taste for escape games, and I will be trying more.

Good fun. Did this as a group of three and the time flew by as we frantically solved puzzles to escape the room! Very much felt like being on Crystal Maze - a good fun challenge and something different to do on an evening. Recommended.

Work of Genius!. The game happened by chance as we found this on groupon.However, it was a pleasant surprise...Mind boggling series of puzzles and clues which ask you to find the cryptic codes to open the many padlocks on a door to get out of the room. That is your task.It was for an hour and the time flew by and we never realised. Surely one of the fastest and most engaging 60 minutes.Best for 3-6 participants. If you think you are sharp, you ought to try it out!Genius!!

Amazing challenges with a perfect theme!. Even though we only were two, we just managed to solve it within the time limit. The puzzles were challenging, but we never felt stuck. The props are amazing, and fit the steampunk theme perfectly.
Brilliant. It was the first time I have done something like that and it was great. Really enjoyed it! Would recomend it big time! So much fun and you just can't get enough!

Nice little experience. Went as a group of 4 friends. Concept is simple and is basically an extended version of a mystery challenge on "The Crystal Maze." Puzzles were challenging and we barely completed it within the hour and with a few pointers from the owner. Simply put, the challenges were varied and fun and I would wholeheartedly recommend this experience to anyone. Teamwork is essential in order to complete this within the timeframe and I think you would be hard pressed as a group of 3 or less! Take a few friends and give it a whirl!

Awesome experience!!. It was quite nice to get a booking at very short notice!! Kids did this for the first time and they were thrilled. Nice concept, it is tricky and challenging. Won't divulge anymore to spoil anyone's fun!! It has easy access via bethnal green tube station (5 minutes walk) just past the children's museum or it's just opposite Cambridge Heath DLR. would highly recommend this place.

Great fun!. Very enjoyable experience and easy to book - we managed to book a slot for the same day, other similar activities in London need to be booked months in advance.Furthermore, there is one group every four hours rather than every two hours: the whole experience is less stretched, there is more time to enjoy the game and have a second look to the the clues at the end. Very good.

Teenagers loved it!. A successful 16th Birthday outing for a group of boys and a Dad. Great fun, offering lots of challenges with something for everyone. I'm sure they will be attempting the next level having managed to escape Plan 52!!

Entertainingly Intense . Our family of 4 (teenagers aged 15 and 17) had a brilliant time at Cluequest. All the staff (especially Nathanial) were excellent and the total experience was awesome - we will be going back to do more rooms!
Excellent fun!. A really brilliant fun afternoon. Great value for money. Would definitely recommend this. Lovely friendly people too!
ClueQuest is Awesome!!. We absolutely loved it - great family activity, and great night out with friends too! Enjoyed every minute - will definitely do it again!

What an outstanding activity! Go! Now!. A belated birthday/half term day out for my 12 year old, was the reason for the booking. Since visiting yesterday I've decided I don't need a reason - will definitely be going back. Oh my goodness...did we ever have a great time?! Two 12 year olds and two adults, we booked the medium difficulty challenge. Having completed this I would gauge the lower age limit at 11/12 unless you want to spend a lot of time explaining everything to your younger kids. It's clean, well equipped and professionally run.We were greeted at the door by Luke, who was to be our 'guide/coordinator/handler' and he ran through the basics; he didn't seem put off by my "is there a panic buttons because I sometimes get claustrophobic and will we be plunged into darkness and left to die in a tiny space" type questions. In total you have three rooms to "escape" from. At first, never having done this before, we spent a fair bit of time looking at each other in a "what the hell?" manner, but once we solved the first clue we were up and running. It doesn't take long before you're totally engrossed and even if we had been plunged into darkness I would have been rallying the others to carry on. We laughed, we worked as a team, we ran around like headless chickens, we solved clues, we inappropriately shouted at our kids...it was the most fun we have had for a long time. Loved it. Still laughing about it. Book it. Go. Now. You won't regret it. Thanks Luke and team...we will be back very soon!
Amazing. A fantastic experience! Thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish, made extra special by our great host, Far. We'd love to come again and try a different challenge!

Top-notch room escapeness. There's a lot of rooms escapes in London, it sometimes amazes me that some people still haven't even heard of a room escape.I've played a lot of the London ones now and so have experienced several different companies and seen the things that they get right and wrong. I think I can say that Clue Quest is the definite 2nd best in London (beaten only by the breath-taking Time Run.)Clue Quest has 3 games, (numerous copies of each), and I've played all 3.They're all solid and full of fun and innovative puzzles, often making excellent use of technology and cool mechanical puzzles too.There is a fun and silly spy theme running through all three, which gives a nice and consistent branding to the whole thing.The staff are always super friendly and the briefings always thorough and clear. Perhaps occasionally a bit too thorough... I would recommend for more experienced players keeping the briefings a bit more... brief.My favourite of the three games is their newest one; Revenge of the Sheep. It just has some really lovely ideas and puzzles in it, and a few bits of technology and hidden surprises that will make you go "ooooh wow ok that's very cool!" when they emerge.great for new and experienced players alike. The only problem with new players starting off with Clue Quest is that if they get the bug and want to try other escape game companies, many of of the others will seem a bit lacklustre or shoddy in comparison.
Excellent. This was a great trip that all of my family enjoyed. It was really fun and the clues were hidden in cool inventive ways. Will definitely try the harder level if we come to London again

Great family day out. Fantastic thing to do with family and/or friends. We were a family of 4 (Maw, Paw and 2 teenagers - 13 and 15). Staff member explained everything and in we went. Felt like a bit of a passenger as the kids were so good at working out the clues but we old ones did play our part. We escaped with 43 seconds to spare so was a really exciting finish!. Would definitely recommend and we will more than likely do this again.

Great fun and something different. This was a really great experience - I took my mum and brothers as a birthday present for her and everyone had fun. If you like solving puzzles this is a great gift idea or different day out with friends, and gives you something to talk about for ages after!Staff were really friendly and the room was really well set up, we made it out with 6 seconds to spare so just in the nick of time.

Excellent family-bonding fun!. This is a very good activity for family and friends.
Exciting and very well-organised - we wanted to do another room as soon as we'd finished this one, we'll definitely be back.

Fun, suspense, teamwork, very well organised.. Visited as part of a hen activity day, what fun!About 18 of us divided into smaller groups of mixed ages (16-80+) what a great time had by all. Would recommend for family, friends, work team building exercises, first date warm up!!! Challenging at times, often needs more than one set of skills so perfect for mixed groups. Give it a try!!

We were terrible, they were great. It was so much fun. We were terrible, that is a fact, but it was enjoyable and they made it so fun. I have never done an escape room before but a few in our group that had, said it was the best one they've done. Nathaniel, our host there, was incredibly friendly and stepped in to help us when we were clearly being massive idiots. Thanks to Nathaniel's extra clues I am finally out of that room.

Excellent repeat visit. Been here before but played a different room/challenge this time.Played against our friends who were in an identical room and they very much enjoyed it tooManaged to escape our room with 5 mins to spare!Nice friendly staff and rooms/challenges well maintained/well thought outWould recommend to everyone

Ridic-clue-lessly fun!!!. This is a brilliant way to enjoy some team work with friends or family of all ages! We were a group of 9 split between 2 rooms and were advised before starting the game of what the objective was and what we could and could not do. This got us really geared up for the game and rearing to go! Some of us had tried an escape room once before but others were completely new to this. We had so much fun and got straight into the mystery solving without hesitation. There were plenty of puzzles for everyone to get involved in and towards the end we really did need to put our heads together to try and escape - and we did! Cannot wait to book the next ClueQuest challenge with Nathaniel and the team!
Father & CEO . Very clever, exciting, professional, entertaining, suspenseful family outing! Will be back as family and also through business for executive team building.

Great fun with the family. Our family of 4 (including kids age 9 & 12) had such a brilliant time at ClueQuest we've booked into one of their other games for the Christmas holidays. Huge fun and we all really enjoyed solving the various clues and challenges together.
Lot of Fun. There have been a lot of hilarious moment, you will start to laugh very soon once inside... must try!

Great time had by all !!!. None of us had done anything like this before. We were split into 2 teams, one of 4 and one of 5 but we both had the same mission. It was brilliant fun which we all enjoyed and are still talking about. We all want to do it again. The organisation was great. Without giving too much away it was quite difficult but not impossible, unfortunately we didn't escape within the hour but did finish with a little help. It was great because it wasn't too easy, I preferred that we didn't finish rather than finding it too simple. We are all discussing when we are going to do it again so if you are looking for fun and something different, go for it.

Failed the task but such fun. Visited with American friends as a group of older contestants. What fun, and this is from a team that failed to get out in the time! We needed two time extensions. They are great at concealing the obvious. Nice people as well. Just persist and encourage every member of the team to join in.

Fun escape room, even for experienced players.. After over 50 escape rooms around the world, we are always a bit scared when going to an escape room in a new city/country, as their level and style vary from place to place.We got to the place a bit late, and met with the game-masters.The game is set in a compound of escape rooms, and there were many groups getting organized at the same time. The game-masters did the briefing expertly, and got us quickly into the room.The room itself is fun, and has a lot of riddles, so even though we are experienced, it did take us almost the entire 60 minutes to escape (using several clues)...Compared to some of the other rooms we did, it is considered a non-technological room (meaning: mainly locks and padlocks), but it was still very fun.At the end we got our secret-agent card, as well as some magnets with our pictures on them.I would recommend it to 3 experienced players or 3-5 non-experienced.

Good fun & well organised. Had a great visit for a birthday.Lots of fun and staff were great! Really enjoyed it....Played Operation Blacksheep which was of medium difficulty. Thoroughly enjoyable experience.
Great fun. Really different fun thing to doDefinitely do this againSpecial agent " Far" was very good indeed, and the task was excellent
Can't wait to try the next level!. Very clever, thought provoking and entertaining way to spend an hour, that goes by because you are so engrossed in trying to solve the problem.
Brilliant fun! . Absolutely great fun. Did the 1st room. Completed with 9 minutes to spare. Great clues. All links in well. Can't wait to go back to do the other rooms.

Brilliant Escape Room Experience. I visited clueQuest for the Plan 52 experience with a group of friends for a birthday. The whole set up was fantastic, staff were friendly and informative, and the puzzles were very imaginative. Staff were also able to give hints at appropriate points throughout the hour. My only let down was the picture we had taken at the end was never sent through to my email address, but we did have the magnets so didn't lose out on much. Would definitely go back to do the other rooms!

Really good fun. A wonderful experience and will certainly return. Would recommend 1st level if you have never been before. Our group consisted of 3 masters, a Phd, and a professionally trained searcher and we made it out with under 3 minutes from the hour! Our guide was great and would recommend for children (with adult help)

Mission Control: That was sheeptastic, over.. We did Plan 52, the first of three missions with 4 of us and Agent Farski as our contact at mission control. Between some luck and uncoordinated rambling through the clues and tasks we made it out with about 7mins to spare! It was a lot of fun and really clever how everything is worked out, extra clues were given when needed to keep things flowing - but generally is just pretty ace!

Great family fun. Tried it with my 9y old son and 17y old daughter and had a great time!! While some challenges were too difficult for younger kids, there is still stuff that they can help with. Everyone agreed on this being fun! Staff very professional.
Great activity with kids - it's addictive!. This was our second visit with our 6 & 8 year old kids. It's a really fun hour and great team working activity.

Brilliant evening of puzzles. Next to the bus stop so easy to find. Greeted very cheerfully and given clear and amusing instructions. Then into the room very efficiently. The room is well designed, full of interesting and relevant decorations. Puzzles are tricky but solvable and the room was tough enough to defeat us in an hour but they were generous enough to let us finish. Then they finish the game with a photo and small ceremony. Overall brilliantly done and great fun as well as a challenge to ones wits.

Great Idea for Teen while in London!!. We jumped into level 2 and unfortunately didn't finish in time. Recommend going for the beginner first to better understand how the game works. We lost a lot of time not knowing how to kick start. Once in, got a feel but a bit too late. Definitely if you are looking for something fun for your teen 13+ and up to do while in London, this is definitely a must. Even if you do not finish on time they walk you through the end which is great.

Cleverly thought out . Went for a birthday with parental units, brother and boyfriend. All between 30-55... We had such good fun and everyone had an input and we all worked surprising well together. I really thought we'd kill each other. I thought it would just be one room but it goes through to another two rooms all packed tighten with different types of puzzles and really gets you thinking. Shame five was the maximum persons but anymore and it would be too confusing I think- but would definitely go back and want to share with others- all good fun :) it's very rare adult can find entertainment without a bar. Sober experience in a very good way.
Great fun!. We went as part of an away day. Was great fun and good for including a wide range of ages and skills.

Bags of fun!. I booked clueQuest for five of us as part of my husband's 30th birthday weekend celebrations. I'd heard nothing but great things about this and we decided to go for the Operation Black sheep mission which was of intermediate level but was still pretty challenging. We had a briefing beforehand and once we were in the room, set about straight away gathering clues and trying to piece it all together. Story-line was fantastic, the whole thing was set up in such a clever manner, we had an amazing time, and managed to escape with 6 minutes to spare. Would highly recommend! We will be definitely going back to try another mission very soon!

Fabulous time!. Our family of 4 went here for my husband's birthday. We didn't really know what to expect. The young man who instructed us on what to do was really good. From the moment we went into the room until the time of getting out ( we didn't make it in 1 hour! ) was really enjoyable. I will recommend this to family and friends. We are planning to try another room sometime.

Exciting and challenging!!!. Awesome escaping rooms which have been researched and carefully picked from others similar venues.Really cool missions and challenging quests.Staff are really friendly and welcoming and makes your experience a true delight! Strongly recommend!

Fantastic way to spend an hour.. Had done an escape room in Dublin so wanted to do another. This one was much harder but so exciiting. It was so much fun and we were given just a few hints by our lovely host at the right times without giving anything too much away.. We finished our task with 40 seconds left so a very exciting end. I would recommend this attraction as it is the best fun and the staff are very welcoming.

Team building activity or would be suitable for a large group of friends. I took along 17 people to do two lots of rooms each in groups of 4. It was very well organised and really did engage you.The feedback I've had from the team was that they really enjoyed it and are definitely interested in doing more of the same thing in the future. I would thoroughly recommend all three of the escape room scenarios that they have - whilst the hardest one is quite difficult I have to say it was a really good setup and some of the equipment they put in these rooms has had a lot of design and thought go into it and, for the price per head, I was really impressed.I have no hesitation in recommending Cluequest for those wanting to do a team building exercise and, if you really want to challenge yourselves, do the hardest one (but it is a good idea to do the mid-level one first.Excellent experience and well done to the team at cluequest.

Fantastic Game.... This was the best experience I have ever had. Amazing game. Everything was great! HIGHLY recommended. Will try it again and again and again.The staff were amazing. We really enjoyed every part of it.Thanks for the amazing time!!!

Truly brain busting!!. Everything was great. We did the last slot at 7pm and the enthusiasm of the team was as if it was their first one of the day! The rooms were great, clues were great, really good team building exercise!!! We left there bubbling(even though we lost) and planning to go again to do level 2!
Team building visit but genuine fun. 2 groups taking part brought out the competitive instinct in everyone but with both groups making it out a good time was had by all.

A great activity to do with friends. This was our first live game experience so didn't quite know what to expect. We split into two groups and competed against each other, both teams escaped with not much time to spare. We all thoroughly enjoyed it even the more sceptical amongst us, the staff were great offering help when needed but generally leaving us to it. We did the plan 52 game and are now considering the next game. Clue quest is very well organised and very smooth, I highly recommend this!

Great game, but for me, not quite as good as HiintHunt. I really enjoyed ClueQuest. It was great fun and I do highly recommend it. For me, personally, I didn't find it quite as good as HintHunt, which is quite a bit more difficult. I don't know if it's because I did HintHunt first, but I was a lot more excited after that & felt completely buzzing to have escaped 2 mins before the end. This time we escaped 10 minutes before then end and found things much easier. The clues they give are also a bit too easy, if they'd have given us no clues, I'm pretty sure we still would've made it out with time to spare.But that said, a wonderful game, great staff (we had Sophia, who was lovely) and worth a visit.

Even better second time around. 2nd visit after completing Plan 52 1st time around. Operation Blacksheep was slightly harder, and just as much fun. Mission 2 completed and will definitely be back for Mission 3 - Revenge of the sheep some point in the future. If you're not sure it's your type of thing, don't think twice, give it a go. Once you do you'll be hooked and want to do every mission. Highly recommended.

Fantastic team building exercise. I arranged a work team building exercise here for a large group. We booked out all 4 Plan 52 rooms and raced against each other to escape. The staff were fantastic, and there was a great buzz amongst my colleagues once we'd finished. I would definitely recommend this as an activity with colleagues or friends.
Quite difficult but a lot of fun. Was a lot of fun. You really need your brain switched on, although you do get help if needed (and we were obviously struggling at times!) Would recommend this

Really good fun. Went for a work team building exercise and we all had a great time. Two different teams in the same type of room and we got out with 6mins to spare. I would definitely recommend this.

Great time with family. No wonder why this is rated as one of the best ! We did the Mission Blacksheep and enjoyed so much with all the clues and hints. More secret rooms and a lot of interesting props to be used. We will definitely recommend this place and do the other missions as well. Staffs were so friendly and helpful.

Great activity!. One of the best places I've been to for these escape type games. the plan 52 room was well thought out and great fun. Thanks to our guide Jamie who explained everything and was a great guide! Would throughly recommend to do with friends, family, work- is a brilliant team building activity!!
Excellent Team event. Great company with incredibly helpful and enthusiastic staff, The escape room was very clever and had us engaged for the whole time, the hour flew by. Highly recommend

First time . Had an amazing time trying to escape for a locked room. So much fun. We did "red box".As first timers we were a bit nervos about what would happen but the staff are fantastic. There is someone on the end of a radio at all times if you need anything, and you are able to leave the room whenever you want (but your time is still ticking). We had a wheelchair user as part of our group and the staff we very helpful. They use a moving platform to get down stairs where there are a number of rooms accessible to wheelchair users. Great games to play with family and friends.We will be back

Ranked no.1 for a reason!!. My boyfriend and I had our first try at a live escape room on holiday in Thailand and absolutely fell in love with the concept, whilst our friends who are also a couple had tried out Lady Chastity's Revenge in London and spoke so highly of that experience too. So we had been talking about trying another all together for a while, there are so many out there now to choose from but we ended up picking ClueQuest based on it being no.1 on TripAdvisor, and it DEFINITELY deserves that ranking. We went last night after dinner and a couple of drinks and being all puzzle-lovers went (optimistically!) for the hardest of the challenges with Revenge of the Sheep. Sophia looked after us and was absolutely lovely, definitely enhanced the whole experience for us, she clearly has a genuine passion for her work and had us chuckling along and getting into the spirit of the storyline before we even went in, and afterwards there was no sense of - cool so you're done now bye! Instead she gave us our awesome team photo and talked to us about more live puzzles to try and her experiences which was so helpful - we're definitely going to be trying some based on her advice!Of course I won't give much away about the room itself but I will say the production values inside the room are fantastic, the attention to detail, the number and variety of puzzles to solve is amazing. It was the quickest hour of my life! But also one of the most exhilarating and fun. You won't be disappointed, it's worth every penny.Thanks again to Sophia and the ClueQuest team!! If you design a new room at the same difficulty level or harder (haha) we'll be back in a flash xx

Great fun with some tense moments. We've been here twice now and had a great time in both instances. It can get really tense in the final minutes as you work together to escape and friendships might not survive but definitely worth giving this a try!

Great team night at ClueQuest. Great night, second time I've done it both times were awesome fun, the staff were great too, we had Far as our 'agent' at Caledonian Road, he was brilliant and put up with our groups tipsiness! - Would definitely recommend!

Mad Sheep. Work team building exercise can be horrendous. Chasing a deranged sheep at clue quest is probably one of the better ways to spend an hour "team-building". Reasonably priced, interesting premise - although I do prefer more reality based games - professional staff and most important, unlike some of its competitors, realitively easy to book. Definitely worth a visit.

Fantastically fun team-building. I'd successfully made it out of a couple of the rooms previously, and then recommended ClueQuest to my colleagues because I wanted to share this amazing experience. 25 of us split into 5 teams across three different kinds of rooms. My team completed PLAN52 which at first seems like a simple room until you realise how intricate everything is. I could gush even more about it but I won't for risk of spoiling the experience. I highly recommend CQ for anyone that likes a cryptic challenge. Once you've done one of them you'll certainly want to come back and try the others!

Very enjoyable evening. Something different but we really had a great time. There were 4 of us and we did Plan 52. It can be tough because there are a lot of codes that you almost find all at once and there are a few red herrings but in general it does guide you through plus there is someone watching in case you need help. Very good and I think we will go back to do another mission!
Fun day out for a team outing. It was great, we had lots of fun, great for a team day out. we did the medium level rooms and it was a challenge.

Amazing and want to do the others!. First time ever doing something like this, had no idea what to expect. Was great fun and exciting. The puzzles are really well done and unique. The race against the clock made it even more of a thrill. After having successfully completed it. We all wanted to go back in and do the next one! However is was booked :(. Will deffo come back again! Must go if you have never been!Shoutout to Agent Fa(not sure on the spelling of the name lol) You was awesome!

Lots of fun. Didn't really know what to expect but we had a really great time at clueQuest. It's such an original fun idea and everyone in our group aged from 9 to 49 really enjoyed it. Highly recommend it for an hour of proper old fashioned fun!

Amazing! Completely worth your time and money.. As a group of 5 adults who had never tried an escape room before we were a little worried that the whole place would be a bit too kid-like for us but boy, were we wrong! Agent Fa was brilliant from the briefing to the de-brief at the end. The puzzles aren't too difficult but they aren't ridiculously easy either and clues are supplied if and when you need them. Will definitely be going back to try another mission!

Cracked the codes... almost too quickly!. I went along with a group of 5 friends. Initially, it was a little bit daunting being in a closed room filled with riddles in order to go deeper into the maze. However the quest for clues, along with the thematic atmosphere, certainly aided our teamwork. The whole set was really well put together with every detail aptly selected. I highly recommend a visit, even if it's just once, because it was so memorable.
Great time!. Great time, nice puzzles and beautiful, beautiful rooms. We enjoy wery much. Great place and friendly service.

A fantastic hour. We were not sure what to expect but had a great time at ClueQuest! We managed to escape with ~2 min to spare and the 58 minutes raced by... 6 of us took on the challenge and succeeded by splitting up at times and working together at others.

Escaped... but wanted to stay!!!. Amusing briefing at the start to set the scene, and well constructed puzzles and clues. We were 2 couples (all friends), and was our debut on the Escape Room circuit. We made it out with just over 5 mins to spare and are now hooked.... trying to work out when we can all come back to try the harder room!!!

Had a brilliant time. Did this for team building - we all had a great time, i would definitely go back again - the games makes you think and work as a team, but the joy of when you achieve your goal by escaping the rooms is areal thrill.

Fun and challenging experience!. This escape room was really fun and challenging. It was very immersive and exciting to race against the time and work as a team to find all the clues. I'd never done anything like this before but will definitely be going back to do the difficult level. I only wish it had gone on longer- we escaped with 4 mins to spare!

Wonderful challenging experience . We have enjoyed this experience tremendously. I've tried other escape rooms but this one was a real challenge, and we took the basic level room. We have done other rooms in other places easily but this one required more. It was a true think out of the box. We enjoyed every minute. Very well organized and in a timely manner. Perfect!!!
Awesome experience.. Very friendly staff, right level of difficulty and amazing to escape in the last few seconds. Great team building activity. Really can't wait to do the next one.
Great morning out .... We had a great family day out beginning at Clue Quest which was entertaining and great fun !!! Will have to do the next room now

Brilliant team building day!. Brilliant day out! Was enjoyed by the whole team Would defiantly recommend this venue! Far better and more accommodating to big groups then any others I have visited.Would defiantly go back to try a different roomWas given nothing but positive feedback from my team, so glad I booked this place and not another venue!
Amazing Experience !. Recommended for friends looking for a different experience in London. We managed to escape in a little more than one hour... Almost nailed it

Genius to stupid in 60 seconds. I visited clueQuest with my family as a surprise birthday present and attempted Plan 52. It was a 60 minutes of non stop laughs, mixed with moments of frenzied panic. You can feel like a genius one second as you final solve a clue and really stupid the next when you realise the answer was in front of you the whole time. Our host was excellent, incredibly friendly and a real credit to Cluequest. I have to apologies as I didn't make a good note of his name (I think I was still to excited from my escapades in the room) but I think his name was Far? His contribution helped make the whole experience. The rooms aren't particular small and I don't believe anybody suffering from Claustrophobia will have any issues. You can leave via the entrance door at any time, so you aren't "trapped in". clueQuest is suitable for everyone!! I will certainly return and attempt another room!

If you like padlocks you'll love this. We went as a family group of 5 for my son's 13th birthday, he was the youngest. the rest of the group comprised 2 older teens (15 and 18) and my husband and myself.We all really enjoyed the experience, none of us had done anything like it before - we did the Plan52 room. Our host James was really friendly and helpful, he gave us a clear introduction and also helped us with some clues along the way via walkie talkie when we got really stuck. I got in a flap about the time running out towards the end, but the rest of the family were focused and we managed to work well as a team getting out with 1 min 18 secs to spare. We were told this was really good for first timers.Now we can't wait to go back and tackle the other 2 rooms. I highly recommend it, it's certainly an activity to challenge the little grey cells and something that genuinely appeals to all ages.We went on a Sunday afternoon, and to wind down afterwards (it's a bit stressful, but in a fun way) we wandered along the canal to Granary Square and drank hot chocolate and caught Pokemon before heading home.

Good Room but broken safe really spoilt it. Booked this room with some friends and overall enjoyed it however in the room there was a safe that locked you out after three incorrect guesses but the safe was broken so it sometimes thought you were pressing a different number to the one you were pressing. Due to this problem we were locked out twice meaning we had to wait for ten minutes in total for something that wasn't our fault. Very frustrating and really ruined the flow of the room. The staff confirmed this was a fault with the safe and not us.

Best escape room so far. I've done a couple of these escape rooms before and this is my favourite one so far.Everything worked well and we never felt lost or confused, the goals are clear and the puzzles clever. I would recommend to be a group of 4.We will be back to have a go at the other 2 rooms.

Far exceeded our expectations. We had a great evening at clueQuest. My wife and I went with our 2 (grown up) children and their partners to celebrate my birthday. Harriett was fantastic - she gave us a great briefing, full of humour and with just the right amount of tips and advice, all of which came in very useful during the exercise. We were then locked into our suite of rooms and needed to use all our nous to get ourselves out - subtly helped by Harriett over the wire at various key points when we were starting to flounder. It was much harder than we expected and infinitely more fun. The fact that we all enjoyed it a lot - with our ages ranging from 27 to 66 - says a lot about the appeal of this entertainment. We were all clear that we wanted to go back soon to have another go in a different set of rooms - apparently each one is different with a different set of puzzles and clues to work through.A thoroughly enjoyable evening out - and just a very short walk from Kings Cross station!

A fun way to get stressed out!. This was an excellent evening, well presented and set up, and everyone in our party thoroughly enjoyed themselves. It is a packed hour's worth of entertainment and ideal if you want to include it as part of an overall dining/entertainment package as the restaurants in the newly developed Kings Cross area are only a ten minute walk away. The games are ingeniously thought out and we could not finish our one within the allotted hour, although we were given five extra minutes and succeeded within only one added minute, so not bad for a first attempt. We will definitely return to tackle the next game in the series, which gives a good indication of how much we enjoyed ourselves, Highly recommended.

Much fun. Super fun and tricky We did it with two people and was a lot of fun. Maybe a lot of people would cause a hindrance but depends on the set up of the group I guess. Do not wear warm clothes. There's no air con and it was sweltering down there with just two of us!

Definitely worth doing!. Went with 3 other friends and it was the first "Escape Room" for all of us. It was absolutely fantastic. We were buzzing after the escape and talked about it for hours. Great activity to do with friends or family. Really challenging and puts you on the spot with the time ticking away! Friendly staff and very well organized. Will be returning to try out the next room for sure.

21st Birthday. I came here for my birthday as I wanted something different to do with my friends (2 groups of 5), and we all loved it!! We completed plan52 and it was such a great experience.The staff were very helpful and gave small clues at just the right moment (only if you wanted) so that everyone was able to complete the mission. So don't worry if you think it might be too difficult! Everyone helped solve the problems on our team, no matter what the ability. My team escaped with 18 seconds to spare and it was fantastic fun - definitely would recommend it to anybody and will be returning to complete their other missions!! Great value for money as well when comparing to other escape rooms around London.

50th birthday surprise!. Such a fun way to spend time with family for a special occasion! The game was brilliant. Really challenging but with enough success so our group didn't get too despondent! When we were really stuck the staff gave us an extra clue which was just mysterious enough not to spoil the puzzle but also just good enough to get us going again. We made it out with just seconds to go and had a thoroughly fun time.

Great fun!. We weren't too sure what to expect of this at first, but it turned out to be so much more complex and challenging than we initially thought! The room (or mission) that we did was called PLAN52. The "puzzles" were all fun and accessible to anyone - the kind of thing that requires common sense and is about the same difficulty, or level, for anyone. The staff were friendly, professional and just great in general. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to spend some time breaking codes and building teamwork skills~ We're certainly looking forward to going back and trying out some of the other rooms.

excellent fun activity. First time in one of these type of activities and we are totally hooked! Sophia explained everything and although we knew we had her there to help us if we got stuck we never felt that she was overwhelming us with info! Great job Sophia you have 5 new converts! only sad it in london and we live in cheshire! Totally loved it and was really amazed at how good it was. Loved the challenge and working together! Place was easy to find and we had suitcases and staff from the off took the suitcases to store them! just these small touches make a difference to the experience! Love love love x

Amazing afternoon of well organised fun. A 10 minute walk from Kings cross St Pancras underground station takes you through quiet residential roads. It felt like we were going the wrong way but actually having the venue set away from the busy station made it so much more pleasurable. Upon arrival (we had to buzz in) we were greeted with polite staff who were great at What they do. The briefing was informative and clear and we were Soon off to be locked in a room. With plenty of puzzles from unlocking padlocks to rubux cubes we were kept throughly busy for the 60 (actually we got out with 10 minutes to spare) minutes. The clues were not too difficult (we did level 1) but difficult enough to have had a few moments where we had no idea what to look for next. Every part of the experience was well planned and thought out. Everything inside the building was clean and themed with a great state of repair. We had our photo taken afterwards and as we went for my husbands birthday they turned it into a fridge magnet for him :) I would highly recommend Cluequest for a fun afternoon of unlocking padlocks and deciphering all the clues. We want to come back and try the other levels! The price was so reasonable so we will definitely be back :)

Great afternoon!. An easy 10 minute walk from kings cross, this was a brilliant way to spend an afternoon. The staff were great and explained everything, we went for an intermediate room which was a great challenge. Definitely recommend!

Amazeballs. We took 4 teenagers to this. I knew that the service would be good as email communication was polite and friendly.We arrived slightly late due to a derailment on the rail network but a taxi got us there.We were welcomed and I can honestly say that it exceeded my expectations. the adults supervising the girls thought that they wouldn't join in. Then the temptation became too much. What an amazing experience. The whole experience was just so clever. The 'support' received was subtle and we still felt that we had succeeded. Everyone wants to go back - I would totally recommend this x
So glad I came!. So much fun. Lots of laughs! "So cool!"Will come again. Lots of great challenges to be overcome...1.21 to go!

Exceeded expectations. Went here for a work team building event. Was not expecting to enjoy it as much as we did. Staff are really friendly and seem to enjoy their work. Whole setup within the rooms is really clever and also challenging. We did not manage to escape within the time but had a great time trying. Nice to receive a team photo immediately after finishing. Would certainly recommend and visit again.

Will definitely return. This was booked as a team afternoon out, there were 5 of us and we had an amazing time. The staff are excellent and a good laugh, the experience is brilliant, from the minute you're shut in the room the competitive side comes out and you become determined to solve the clues to get out.An hour of giggles and fun, well worth a visit, we'll definitely be returning.
Hen Do. Very interesting and enjoyable! Very good for team building too. Makes you use your brain & brawn! Worth a visit.

Serious fun!. Went as a group of 4, it was less physically and more mentally challenging than we had expected (never having done an escape room before) but way more fun. We did Plan 52 which is the recommended game to start off with - when you enter it looks really underwhelming but it's amazing how many clues they can fit in to a room that looks so simple. The briefing was ok, the lady overseeing us gave helpful hints at what felt like were the correct times and it was good to 'debrief' with her afterwards.Really looking forward to completing the remaining 2 rooms! Can't wait!Tip: Make sure the scribe is someone reliable!
Challenging & fun. Went as a group of 5 - ages 17 - 50; Really enjoyed it & will definitely go back to do the next level. We made it - but only just!

Brilliant way to spend a Birthday with your Family or friends. We are from South Africa and have done a few of these Escape Games around the World. Mr Q was one of the best ones that we have done, really kept us on our toes until the very last few seconds, BUT WE MADE IT OUT!The briefing was superb, the location was easy to find. We were a group of 6 people and you really need to keep level headed all the time. 1 hour passes so fast , when you having fun!We will be back for more

Excellent Team Building. Clue Quest was a truly great team building exercise. We had prompt, professional service from the minute we enquired, through to conclusion. The 2 ‘team leaders’ we had one the day were brilliant and we had a good laugh throughout the exercise.  My team was buzzing afterwards and couldn’t stop talking about it; even now (2 weeks down the line) they still talk about it. It was the first event I have arranged for my new manager, so I am really chuffed how well it went.Hopefully we will be back to do level 2!!

We had such a great time! Boys against the girls!. We were 12 friends - 6 couples. Girls against boys. One of the funniest things we did our London trip this weekend. The boys won by 6 minutes, we were so mad! But sooo so much fun. Would def do again in a different room. Or a different venue in a different city. Wonderful for a rainy day!

Great escape room for all ages!. We went as one adult and four teens aged 11 to 15. It was amazing! The briefing was really clear, and the actual puzzles were fab. Just hard enough to be challenging, and certainly not too easy. There was enough for everyone to do. The hints given by the instructor were really helpful. We visited HintHunt recently, and would definitely recommend ClueQuest over HintHunt, because it was a lot clearer and a more enjoyable experience. We hope to visit another of their rooms soon.

Beautifully crafted escape room. Having loved the Operation Black Sheep room, we thought we would try the Revenge of the Sheep. We were not disappointed and managed to solve it with zero seconds to spare. We were kept busy and involved throughout the hour and the clues we needed were just because we hadn't looked hard enough.Some beautifully engineered puzzles. Well done.Thoroughly recommended.

Fantastic Birthday Trip. We came in a group of 8 for a birthday event and split into two rooms of four. Such brilliant fun! We were hooked from the moment we went in until we got out with 4 minutes to spare. Highly recommend to anyone.

Enjoyed our game very much. Me and my girlfriend have visited more than 15 escape rooms and during our visit to London we took Operation Blacksheep mission in ClueQuest, although it is designed for 3+ people we did it in two with just 16 seconds remaining. I would recommend this experience to others. Room was nicely done, game was well designed, storyline was very cool and we found every puzzle entertaining.

Such good fun. I booked this for a friends birthday, there was 15 of us so we split into 3 rooms of 4 and 1 room of 3, a mixture of male and females. It was such good fun, everyone enjoyed it and can't wait to try out another escape room. Everything about ClueQuest was so detailed and professional, I really think we are going to find another place that will be able to top it! Left us all wanting to do it all over again.

Would give this 6, if I could. It's no wonder this is #1 on Tripadvisor. My wife, daughter (12) and I had an awesome time in the Plan 52 room. This is the first escape room we have done and we loved it. We managed to escape with 54 seconds on the clock, but we were given quite a lot of help. Only once were we actively told what to do, but that's probably because it was a really difficult part. The rest of the time we were pointed in the right direction to get us back on track. When I accidentally broke one of the puzzles they added an extra couple of minutes to help. At the end we had a team photo taken, which were given as a fridge magnet and a couple of spares.

Great famiy fun. Being locked in a room for an hour may seem like a dull experience, but this is far from dull! We had ages ranging from 10 up to 45years old, and everybody contributed to beat 'Operation Black Sheep' and manage to escape. The creators of the room had taken time and care to make the experience a proper puzzle, and offered coded help when necessary. We'll definitely return to do the remaining two quests.

Brilliant family fun. We visited as a family with a nine/ten year old and a thirteen year old. It was a fantastic fun event, managing to escape the room (with a couple of clues required) with three minutes to spare! Really exciting and atmospheric. The design of the puzzles / reveals were fantastic. We will be back to try the other puzzle rooms I’m sure…

Full on family fun. My 15 year old is a serious gamer & was making noises like this was going to be not much of a challenge but 5 minutes in and he was HOOKED. My 11 year old daughter was also able to add just as much to our clue-solving ability. There aren't many attractions that suit us all equally well these days but this was a real treat. We are definitely hooked.

Design of room is very intelligent. This was our first time at a escape game. We have tried the “Revenge of the Sheep” mission. The design of the game is extremely intelligent. The room was carefully built, it is beatiful, with plenty of interesting objects. The gamemaker was skillfull in helping us with additional hints just in the right measure to maximise the enjoyment of the game. I am looking forward to going back there for the two other missions they offer.
Stag do visit. Visited and completed 2 rooms. Both excellent.Definitely want to come back to try the last room.Staff where great. Website and booking process nice and simple.

Great family fun!. We came across ClueQuest online and decided to give it a shot. Our 12 year old son loves puzzles and he was very excited about this - our 10 year old daughter was a little more apprehensive. After the short introduction we were shown to our room, and the fun began! Everyone was into it, and whenever we got stuck there would be a helpful hint from mission control, delivered via walkie-talkie or video screen. As our allotted time was ticking down everyone was beginning to feel the adrenaline rush, and when we finally solved the last puzzle and opened the last lock there were high fives all around, and both our son and daughter were very pumped up. This is an extremely well designed experience, including visual, verbal, tactile, digital and numerical clues. A highlight of our trip to London.
GREAT. It was absolutely great! The room, the staff, the clues...everything really. We had an amazing time and we would definitely recommend this experience to everyone!

Loads of fun!. We went as a group of 4 having never experienced an escape room setting before. Last minute booking: we thought there was only the most challenging game left so we booked it. Luckily when we arrived the intermediate setting was free. Stayed off a bit slow as we didn't know what to do...but Richard (staff member) guide us with tiny hints to get us going. Soon all 4 of us were obsessed with the experience and wanting to solve all the clues! We didn't expect it to be as fun as it was and we are desperate now to go back for the challenging option ( so happy we didn't start with it). Thank you clue quest, thank you Richard!

Don't panic - lots of fun. We visited as a team of three (mum, dad and son) and did the medium challenge. When we arrived we had a thorough briefing of our mission and set about our task. The time went very quickly and after a few wrong turns we completed our mission and escaped with 6 seconds to go. Thanks to our excellent mission controller (John) who provided an occasional cryptic clue.Would certainly recommend

Lots of fun. We have just visited ClueQuest today with our 18 and 13 year old daughters and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I think that I (mum) enjoyed it the most. The staff were welcoming and explained the game very well. Once inside the room (we did the easiest) the clues to unlock the various things were challenging and made you think. I felt a lot of time and effort had been given to make the game interesting and fun. It was good to find something that all the family can do together. I would definitely visit again and do the slightly harder room and would recommend this place for families that want to do a fun thing together. Well done to all the staff.
Brilliant fun. You can't knock it really, it's #1 for a good reason. I've been twice and it was a thoroughly engaging, memorable and fun experience!

Excellent set up. 5 of us attempted to foil the evil powers. Age range 16-56. We all enjoyed it. The clues were set at the right level of difficulty and overall it was a very well run experience. We would definitely recommend to others and felt it was the best we had tried.

Excellent Fun - Plan 52. I went to ClueQuest last weekend with my two sisters and mum as a birthday treat and had so much fun at this escape room. I have only ever done one escape room before but this felt 100% professional and slick in operation. The game itself was challenging but achievable with good variaiton of tasks! We failed to complete it in the hour, but we were kindly given an extra couple of minutes to finish off - which was really nice. We would all really reccommend the entire experience - we will be going back to do another room in the near future!

Fun experience - something different. Took my 15 year old son and a french teenager, because we wanted to do an activity that wasn't educational or cultural. It was awesome, the hour went by so fast and we only just managed to get out in time! It was challenging but "doable" without any specialist knowledge. My son now wants to do another room with some friends for his birthday and i would love to do it with a few adult friends Highly recommend this but probably not so much fun for very young children.

Teamwork. The location is a little difficult to find but once there the team are very welcoming. The quest is about an hour long and really tests your puzzle solving limits. My sons are 16 and 13 and it's sometimes difficult to find something the whole family enjoys doing together. This was perfect! The whole family got right into it and it made us work together. You are locked in a room (don't worry, it's not claustrophobic) and you have to search the room for clues, keys and passwords. Think crystal maze with a bit of Sherlock thrown in. I won't spoil the ending but there is a countdown clock to try to beat. We'll definitely be going back. It's a short activity, great for slotting in with other things to do that day. If I could change anything, I wish there was a longer quest to do.

Fabulous family fun - so glad we booked. My daughter was celebrating her 15th birthday and asked to book this as a treat. We were a family of four, with two daughters 15 and 12, and we really enjoyed our experience at ClueQuest. The website makes booking simple, and gives you all the information you need, and the site is easy to find (and makes a nice highlight to a day out in the newly redeveloped Kings Cross area of London). We arrived a bit early, but we were made instantly welcome. An initial introduction to the game and then we were led into our ClueQuest room - there is secure space for belongings in the room. Essentially this is a locked room puzzle experience, and you need to search for clues and try and work out lock combinations and puzzles in order to progress through to the exit. No background knowledge, nor any items of general knowledge are assumed - which means that all members of the family can be involved and play a full and equal part. Although you are in a locked room, to prepare those who might be wary of the concept, you can reassure them that there is always an easy way to get out whenever you wish. Our children absolutely loved the mystery, and ransacking the room to look for clues, then working together to solve the puzzles and deactivate the locks. We were given a walkie-talkie to ask for additional clues if we got stuck, but as a family we wanted not to resort to this, and we were able to complete the challenge with seconds to spare only having to ask for one hint right at the end (it turns out that we had found everything we needed, but just had not spotted one element which had been sitting under our noses!) The whoops of joy from the whole family when we opened the last door at the last minute told their own story. Great fun. Afterwards we had a debrief, and were presented with a few photo reminders of our day. I am sure we will be back to try the other two quests. I would have not hesitation in recommending this.

Superb puzzles and level of detail is incredible. If you've never tried an escape game before, then this place is for you and I'd recommend the easy or medium room to start with. The whole thing has got a great theme and the level of detail and work that has gone into creating these rooms is huge, feels like no expense has been spared. If you've done a few escape rooms then the hard difficult is for you and you will not be disappointed as it's pretty tricky! I only regret not being able to do all 3 rooms in one go!

50th b'day outing . Great venue, great staff and a great escape experience. 4 virgin escapees and 2 that had done it before and we all had a great time. The hour shot past so quick. Highly recommended

Absolutely AMZAZING. I took my family as a surprise and we have done a few of these escape rooms and this is by far the best one so far. The puzzles are difficult and really make you think but they're not completely undoable which is what we have found with some in the past. The staff are super friendly and efficient. Wont give anything away about it but just go see it for yourself. Great fun!!

Best birthday ever! Operation BlackSheep...... My brilliant family and friends booked a surprise trip to this clueQuest event for my birthday as they know I love a good puzzle solving game or treasure hunt! For most of us, it was our first time at a live escape game. Lots of fun, laughter, trashing the rooms for clues and we solved it with 1 min to spare! Or as my cousin would put it - almost died! Must go to if you love to solve puzzles. We also split into two groups and complete with each other which made it more fun and exciting. Can't wait to try the other rooms! Brilliant fun day!!

So. Much. Fun. Had such a good time. Staff are friendly, fun. Would highly recommend this. Big thumbs up! Team of 4 I think was perfect amount but 3 or 5 would be great too. Must work together as a team! thank you cluequest

"Plan 52". A great experience that requires a lot of team work and perseverance whilst giving an enjoyable and memorable day out. Escaped with 55 seconds to spare. Will be going back to attempt the next challenge.

Amazing fun - highly recommend this!!. I recently went here on a work social and did the "easy" room - it was great fun and really good for team building but would also be good fun with friends or family too! I definitely plan on returning to do the other rooms and would recommend to anyone looking for a fun activity in London!
Plan 52. It was our first time to try a live escape game, we really enjoyed our time there. Nice staff and challenging game. We want to go again for the next level

My first escape room and won't be my last!. 6 of us (5 adults and an 11 year old) really enjoyed Plan 52 and escaped with 49 seconds to spare! We were all completely absorbed by the challenge for the whole hour! Our host Jamie was a credit to the Cluequest team. He briefed us thoroughly beforehand, communicated well with us during our escape via walkie-talkie and congratulated us on our success afterwards making us feel like heroes! A fab experience and look forward to the next mission!

Such great fun! . Went with a group of friends, & none of us knew what to expect as we hadn't done an escape room before. We had a brilliant time and everyone was eager to come back and do another room. Thanks Luke for being a great host!

I didn't think it was my thing, BUT I LOVED IT. We went here on a team building day, I thought 'how boring'. But went a long as it was compulsory. Well, after about 3mins in to the activity I was hooked, we worked together as a team to solve the different mysteries. I couldn't recommend enough to all groups of people, I am looking to go back with a group of friends soon. Brilliant day. Thank you ClueQuest!

Challenging, and loads of fun, ... as long as you don't kill your team members 1st ;-). First time doing a live escape the room challenge, and absolutely loved it. The puzzles were pretty challenging, and if you got stuck the administrators gave some pointers to move you along. The pace of the game, types of puzzles, time limit and ambiance all add to a well rounded experience that makes for a great night out.

Great visit! . Really fun event that I guess I'm not really allowed to give too many details about! Professional, well run and really inventive in the game we played. They want you to have fun so can offer subtle hints if needed so don't worry about spending 60 mins in a room feeling dense because you can't get the clue! Go and enjoy it!
Amazing! Would do it again without a doubt!!. Attended the advanced clue quest with my partner and another couple. Are ages range from 23-28 and we all had an amazing time and will defiantly be back.

Fast-Paced, Super Fun Afternoon!. I've been wanting to do ClueQuest for months now, but have only just got round to it. We had a small group, but even with 3 people our combined teamwork and morale allowed us to take down the bad guys with just over 10 minutes to spare! We were brilliantly lead by our team leader, Jamie, who after a fun, detailed and informative briefing got us in the mood for some good old fashioned problem solving. Without breaking character once, Jamie totally immersed us into the high energy and against the clock 'doomsday' experience. The game was fantastic fun, and was brilliant for developing teamwork and problem solving skills. Interestingly enough, an eclectic mix of personalities in our group allowed us to complete all tasks effectively - some taking a more mathematical approach, and others from a creative 'outside the box' angle. Whether you're right brained, or left brained, this was a fantastic and affordable way to spend an afternoon, and I would hugely recommend this experience in Kings Cross to everyone, whether or not you've done this kind of thing before!

New room and the best so far. Third visit to this excellent escape the room attraction, to challenge Professor Blacksheep in the most enjoyable and advanced room yet! Couple of first timers with us and they were thoroughly entertained. Keep 'em coming!

brilliant fun!. my friends and I went to clue quest during a reunion weekend. the three of us had a brilliant time and actually managed to escape the room with just over two minutes to spare. The outside of the building was simple but we easily spotted the sign outside. The inside was modern with an industrial type feel. Water was available while you waited and books with funky pens were on the table- intended for people to write an entry when they finished their experience(it was a really nice touch as loads of people had put loads of effort into their entry and it was interesting to look at while waiting for our host. Jamie (the lovely enthusiastic young man that was our designated host) was great and did a great job of setting the scene and making the build up to going in the room informative and fun. The room itself had clever puzzles and riddles which required team brain storming to figure out. Some of it was really challenging and some we figured out by accident. Over all we had great time and would definately go back to try the other experiences. (we chose the Mr Q yellow experience- can't remember its official name at this moment). Its family friendly but was still great fun for my friends and I (ladies in our 30s).Highly recommended.

Excellent second visit - new games please!. We returned to try the new revenge of the blacksheep and were warned at its difficulty! The game was superb and well designed. The interactive/technological element was brilliant. The team members are superb and their enthusiasm is excellent. We were delighted to have completed the room with 8 minutes to spare and without clues! More games please so we can return :-)
Fantastic. I went here for a birthday outing and we played in two teams in parallel. It was fantastic. The hour passed really fast and we were busy the whole time.

Another brilliant day out. I've done two of ClueQuest's escape rooms now - Plan 52 with a team of 11 year olds for my son's birthday and Operation Blacksheep with my son and teen daughter and a friend with her son and teen daughter. Both experiences were excellent, and got rave reviews from all involved. It's an expensive way to spend an hour, but worthwhile. The walk along Regents Canal back to St Pancras is very pleasant - we picnicked there with sandwiches from the NISA opposite ClueQuest.

Professor Blacksheep went down. See you next year.. ClueQuest is a facility that houses three different escape rooms with 9 total rooms designed for teams of 3 (89 pounds, 79 off peak for 26.30 per person) to 5 (109 pounds, 99 off peak, 19.80 per person) people with an option to add a sixth person (19.80). Book early online (a few months) especially in the summer to reserve a spot. My wife and I have done both Plan 52 (in 2015) and Operation Blacksheep (this year) rooms. Be aware that groups of 2 will be pay for the group of 3 price. Teams of 2 will have a harder time but we finished both rooms with the guidance of our handlers. Handlers communicate with teams using walkie talkies. The clues given by the handlers are meant to assist not give away answers. Both rooms have space but may a little tight with 6 players. You can opt for a team picture made into a magnet as a keepsake for 3 pounds and sign the books located at the front of the facility. There is tube access to ClueQuest that takes about 15 minutes to walk so plan accordingly. It was a lot of fun and we plan on completing the last room next year. You're going down Professor Blacksheep.

A great adventure. I took my family for my daughter's 18th birthday. We were all apprehensive about what we needed to do but soon settled in to frantic solving of numerous clues. Engaging, well presented and at times challenging too. Just the right level of difficulty with help when needed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this as an enjoyable way to spend an hour.
