So fun . I really had fun , recommend it Although there were only 14 seconds left . I will play it again , coming for the next mission .

A terrific hour for the family!. We did this as part of our 13 year old's birthday - a great reminder of how we all have different strengths and approaches and as a family activity, it was great. This escape game is efficient, very well run, the team are super friendly and engaging. An excellent way to spend an hour!

Fab family time!. Booked this as a family fun activity, 15 yr old initially ambivalent and 13 yr old not at all happy! Managed to herd family together and crossed fingers... One hour later, BIG smiles and mutual congratulations, all agreed would love to do it again. Great fun way to get the family to work together and obvious that a lot of thought and planning has gone into the setup.
Cluequest is awesome. Fab game - We loved it, just the right level of difficulty, we got out with seconds to spare. The children were great at searching for clues and everyone got stuck in.
Great. Cheap fun, healthy competition, friendly staff. They do different difficulties of room to suit you, did the medium one, finished with 10 mins to spare

Fun!. So much fun! We were a group of 4 and had no idea what to expect. We really quickly got into looking for clues and trying to solve riddles, and we made it out with 40 seconds to spare! We all want to go again and try another escape room - highly recommend it! Also, our host Adam was awesome. :)
Great fun. Even smart enough to get me to write a review which I never normally do. My 14 and 12 years old sons absolutely loved it. A must-try.

Something different and great fun!. I took my niece (19) and nephew (16) for a birthday treat. so there were only 3 of us in the team. We were welcomed and had the game explained to us clearly then locked in our room. It was great fun. Challenging, but help offered when we went too far off piste. The teens greatly enjoyed it. The fact there were only 3 of us was not an issue at all. maybe even made working together easier. Everyone was involved and made a contribution to our escape (albeit in extra time!).I'd definitely take them along again.

Great time, great staff. Very enjoyable day. The staff are very friendly and helpful - Adam was our guy.We did the 1st room yesterday and managed to complete it (just), in a group of four. Will definitely be back to do the 2nd & 3rd rooms soon.Did this with friends, but saw families enjoying themselves too. Would recommend it to anyone, a lot more enjoyable than you think it will be!
Brilliant, good time had by us all.. A really fun experience. A wide age range but we could all get involved and enjoyed clue quest. Would definitely recommend.

Very fascinating!. We found this event online and ordered before we arrived in London. Jamie was our host and he was brilliant! He told us just what we needed. The puzzles were trickey, but with a lot of thinking and creativity we just barely made it. With one second left on the clock we opened the last door! We could not reccomend this more! It was a fantastic experience, and we would love to come back!

Fantastic team building exercise!. We visited ClueQuest as part of a team building day and all I can say is fantastic! What a fun afternoon! We broke off into teams of 5 and had to solve our way through the rooms to escape, whilst racing against the other team from work. Well we escaped and won! Fantastic feeling working together to complete the task. Thank you!

The most fantastic birthday. I cannot tell you how much I've thought about our time at Clue Quest since we went. My boyfriend surprised me for my birthday. We attended in a group of 4 adults and completed 'The Plan' with 3 seconds to spare! I won't give any spoilers away but it was fantastically put together and seemed like exactly the right amount of work for the 4 of us to get through in an hour. Shout out to Adam who was an excellent advisor whilst we were inside. I believe it was absolutely worth the money. We talked about it all day afterwards and kept remembering amazing clues and how excited we felt about our breakthroughs. I would recommend ClueQuest to everyone. My only constructive comment would be that it would be much better if our team photo was emailed to us faster so I could brag on Facebook about our fantastic day.

Excellent as always . What a fantastic place , lovely staff and very friendly .It's by far the best escape room we have done and we only just made it out . I would say it is suitable for all . Well worth the money for all the fun we had

What fun!. We had such a great time at ClueQuest with children age 9, 11 and 13 - a fab family activity. The host was really friendly and helpful (we needed help!). It was nothing like we expected but we loved every minute. We can't wait to try the next quest.Thanks ClueQuest!

Mr Q's top agents... We have now completed all 3 missions at cluequest. This time round we did 'revenge of the sheep' which we sadly did not escape :( but it is the only of the 3 we didn't! And as a group of 2 we didn't feel too let down about this as we were really close to the end!! Regardless, this is an amazing experience which I would highly recommend to everyone. Cluequest have worked hard on these games and it really shows they are a cut above everyone else in the market. The staff are great so welcoming and immersed in the experience. I can't recommend this place enough, please go and try it!!I know it's a way off yet but can't wait to see what new games these guys come up with in the future and really look forward to working for Mr Q again :) Thank you cluequest!!!

Fantastic day out - can't wait to save the planet again!!. A great day out for all the extended family - an 11, 13, 47 and 80 year old to be precise. All had a great time and can't wait to have another go!!

Amazing! . Honestly the most amount of fun I've had in a while! Would recommend to any small groups that fancy doing something a bit different as it's really nothing like you first expect! Great for team building but I have to admit that you literally question everything however it's something to talk about well after you leave the room! Thanks to the staff for letting us escape, definitely coming to try the other rooms!!

Exceeded expectations. This was a really fun experience for the three of us in our family. Many of these escape games are held in dark rooms but not this one... which I was very happy about! The clues were challenging but manageable - it must be hard to get the balance right but these guys achieved it. Strongly recommend.

The best way to spend an hour. Genuinely the most fun I've ever had! I've now completed all 3 rooms, as well as other escape rooms, and can safely say nothing compares to ClueQuest. Plan 52 is a great starting point, it was our first escape room and, as a team of 5, we escaped with 8 minutes to spare. We loved it so much we came back for Black Sheep and, as a team of 4, escaped with 13 minutes to spare. When we heard ClueQuest had a new room, we couldn't book it fast enough! We completed Revenge of the Sheep today, as a team of 3, and escaped with only 36.5 seconds to spare! Definitely the most challenging room, with a success rate of only 20%, but absolutely amazing and great fun! The team are always very friendly and welcoming; Luke guided us through both Black Sheep and Revenge of the Sheep, he was lovely and friendly (even when we were screaming with only 1 minute to go!). Thank you ClueQuest, and please make a new room so we can come again! I don't know why you're still reading this, you should be booking your game!!
Excellent As Always!. Bar far the best room escape game in London! Absolute must do for friends/families. Cannot wait for them to open a fourth room - will definitely be back!

Great 14th Birthday Surprise. What a fantastic place. Great fun had as a family for our Sons 14th Birthday. It was a lot more challenging than we thought. I had always considered myself as very practical and good at problem solving ...but this didn't come easy.What a laugh and Will (our host) was encouraging, supportive and helped us when we struggled. Highly recommend and we will be returning...but maybe with 2 extra agents to help us.

So Much Fun at Clue Quest!. We were greeted with a smile and a warm welcome. The design of the place and the general story line is so cool and fun and suited all of us who are different ages (12-45) and walks of life. Even different languages (although you do have to have basic English of course). The game itself was challenging in a very fun way, and even though we didn't make it out in time - our guide helped us escape and didn't give up on us. I would definitely come again. You can feel that everything there is well made and well thought of and the energy is just awesome. And the booking process is clear and easy.

A must for all the family!. We went as a family party - ranging in age from 19 to 61 . A great time was had by all - lots of laughs and many whoops of joy when we solved the dastardly clues to save the world and expose a double agent! Friendly attentive staff were on hand if we got really stuck! Cluequest is a must of you want a frantic,fun afternoon with all your family.

An unforgettable experience.... I can't stress how much fun this event is! I've been twice now, and the second time was just as strenuous (the good kind) - it really shows off your team skills (if you have any) and how well you think under pressure; and time flies so quickly!I'd do it again numerous times!
great day out. was a bit of fun and a twist on a birthday instead of doing normal things a great way to span across all ages

Wonderful and exciting bonding experience for our family - parents, 11 and 9 year-old and their Aunt.. This is a thrilling immersive experience where you have to work out clues together as a team to find a suspect, defuse a "bomb" to save the universe and escape a room - all in 60 minutes. From the moment you enter the building your guide is in full spy mode and the suspension of disbelief begins. We did it with our 11 and 9 year olds and my sister. There is no way your can succeed without working as a team and our family solved it with 16 seconds to go. The kids said it was "even better than video games." You can't beat that!

Great experience!! . We went there as part of my sons birthday and wasn't sure what to expect. I thought the whole experience was very different to your standard type of attraction (cinema etc) but was brilliant, and I would recommend going. All of the family got involved and the time flew bye, if you like problem solving then this is for you!

Cluequest is a must. Seriously if you have a few hours spare visit Cluequest. Myself, wife and boys have just saved the universe by solving puzzles and clues - luckily the boys and wife have working brains. Absolutely fantastic and highly recommended. Many many thanks to Jamie., our host and occasional guide. He made our first experience at this type of event exciting and extremely pleasurable. That's why it is Number one on trip Advisor for fun things to do in London. We're all still buzzing.

Brilliant for a company event. We had an amazing time at ClueQuest. The escape rooms give just the right level of challenge to ensure that everyone has a great time. We've now been back twice to try out the different rooms and enjoyed the second time as much as the first.Great value for money and a memorable event that is suitable for company events, family or friends.The only area for improvement is the background stories to each room. When they are presented at the start, they feel a bit tacked on and didn't really add much to the experience.

Absolutely Fantastic. London is full of rip-off attractions, but ClueQuest is amazing value for money and, in my opinion, a fantastic day out. If you're not used to escape rooms, the premise is simple: you and your party get locked in a room and you have an hour to solve a series of problems / clues / tasks in order to 'escape.' There are several escape rooms around London, but ClueQuest have the slickest operation and excellent game mechanics in the rooms. No spoilers here, but our room involved plenty of puzzles to keep 5 adults very busy for the entire time, as well as a number of genuine 'wow' moments. The staff are excellent, very friendly, and able to lend a hand (via walkie talkie) if you need a hint. The escape rooms are well equipped and designed, and provide an excellent level of challenge. This is perfect for a group of friends, or a family (especially good for teenagers and older kids), with team building, problem solving and a genuine hit of excitement as you work your way through the challenges. ClueQuest is the best value for money attraction I've been to in London and you won't be disappointed. It'll also give you something to talk about for hours afterwards. Most London attractions that are hell-bent on parting you and your cash will try to make you buy a souvenir photo at the end. At ClueQuest, they gave us each a free one as a parting gift. I think that sums up the attention to detail and focus on a great player experience that this place has. I would advise booking well in advance, especially for peak time - these guys are rightly very popular and they do get booked up. They currently offer 3 different themed rooms here, so I'll definitely be back very soon. Fabulous day out, loads of fun, couldn't recommend it more highly.

Brilliant fun!. I booked some vouchers for Father's Day for myself and my parents to take part in a room escape. We had no idea what to expect but we had a really great time working together to solve the puzzles and we even managed to escape - with only 37 seconds to spare! Highly recommend and I will be back to try and escape from some of the other rooms! :)

GREAT FUN AND THINKING IN AND OUT OF THE BOX. we are 4 adults (over 45) who did plan 52. Got out with seconds to go. Great fun and very different entertainment. Would definitly go back and do the other two.

Great fun. We really had no idea what to expect but were very pleasantly surprised. Great organisation and Sophia gave us a brilliant briefing beforehand. There were only three of us but we managed to get through it and didn't find out until afterwards that we'd actually booked the expert level when there were two levels below this. Would definitely go again and try and take the maximum of 5 people. Easy location to find - 10 mins walk from Kings Cross - suitable for a family outing or with a bunch of friends.

Brilliant. Booked this for my boyfriend for his birthday and his family came along nicely too! It was brilliant, so fun and made you think. By far the best escape room I've been to so far- will have to try your other rooms!We will be back!

Fantastic time. My friend and I took our 3 teenage daughters (12-14 years old) and chose the easiest mission to solve. It was pitched perfectly for us, we all had to work together to solve the clues in time, it was lots of fun and challenging and we felt buzzing when we escaped with 5 minutes spare.

family fun in London. We came to ClueQuest to celebrate my son's 13th birthday and we played the sheep mutator game. It was brilliant fun! It was suitably difficult, - we did need quite a few hints! - but we did manage to succeed in our mission!! The kids - aged 16-12 all loved it - and so did the grown ups!! Our group was able to split into 2 teams and we could both play the same game at the same time - so we could measure ourselves up against each other. The game is very well constructed and all the organisation - from booking via the website, to being given our instructions was very slick. It is a great way to spend an hour or so that amuses and enthuses adults and teenagers alike. We will definitely be back to play their other games.

Another fantastic game!. Having already completed Operation Blacksheep in December, it was a popular choice by our team to return to attempt the new challenge Return Of The Sheep ! The puzzles were so different than before - some were easy but some needed our brain cells to work ! Our co-ordinator was excellent - he created the scene well at the beginning and gave a couple of hints during the game by pointing out the obvious ! Hope to return for the final game - Plan 52.

5 Minutes left on the clock!. All 4 of us had a great time. The puzzles were pretty creative and all felt great to solve. The host was full of positive energy and a great character. I'd highly recommend it for groups of 3 to let's say 5.

Best Escape Game I've Done!!. Visited Clue Quest yesterday and had an amazing time! Our leader Jamie, who over saw our game was extremely enthusiastic which made the experience even better. The escape room itself was challenging an full of unexpected surprises! Well worth the money, will visit again in the future

Defeated the evil sheep and saved the world in an epic room. Together with my partner and my 15 year old nephew, we had a blast defeating the evil black sheep in the Revenge of the Sheep Unit 2 quest.We had done a few secret rooms in London and Switzerland before, but this room clearly stands out. First, we were all deeply immersed in the game thanks to the sounds in the background (very stressful at time) and the fact that the enigma made sense in the general quest. The flow of solving the enigma was natural, we could solve enigma in our own order (some in parallel).The setup was superb, bespoke to the last detail and poetic (ala Myst video game). The enigma requires the best of all your sense to get through.Overall a captivating and highly immersive escape room which we'd recommend to anyone. There are other quests that we can't wait to discover as well. Highly addictive! So happy to have turned the evil Professor black sheep into Haggis ;-)

Great brain exercise!. Group consisted of my sister, myself & my twin daughters (ages 23-60). Staff lovely and welcoming. We did the Plan 52 mission and thought we had done a thorough search - but still missed clues. We all agreed it has been very cleverly done. Never having done one before we all really enjoyed it and are already talking of doing another. Thank you!

Professor Blacksheep Failed... This Time. We played the Operation Blacksheep room. Having played similar rooms before, this one was one of the best. All of the puzzles were challenging but not too difficult and always made sense. Our guide, Jamie, was very enthusiastic and gave clues that were actually beneficial. Overall, it was a brilliant escape room and we would definitely return to do the others.
We had a blast!. So clever and well done. We went as a family group to celebrate a birthday. All of us had a brilliant time AND we got out of our room with 3.45 mins to spare!

Fantastic . Came here for my boyfriends birthday as a group of 5, it was fantastic and we made it out with 4 mins to spare! The staff were amazing and the whole experience was fantastic. We'll definitely be back for more organised fun soon! Thank you so much Cluequest for showing us a great time, I would recommend to anyone and everyone!
Anniversary Fun for Two Couples. Great host who got us all in the mood . We had a really good time solving the clues and love our new secret agent names ! We will be back to complete another mission

Brilliant, loved it. Had a blast doing this escape room! Three others and I had a lot of fun taking on the challenge. Without giving anything away, work efficiently and have fun :)The host was very good, friendly and enthusiastic which made the whole experience much better. Definitely recommended and will return to try one of the other escape rooms!

Brilliant 14th birthday party... Took 8 girls aged 14 years to ClueQuest on Sunday. They were split into two teams. None of them had done anything like this before and were unsure what to expect. After the briefing from the young staff which they were all attentive to, they entered the room and were off on the adventure. As the girls were under 16 they had to be accompanied in the room by an adult something we had not been warned of beforehand. However it was great to be a fly on the wall. Our eldest daughter went into Mission control for a fee and watched the proceedings on cctv...Which she loved. Cannot praise the staff and experience highly enough. We all exited on a high and wand want to return as soon as possible.

So much fun . We went as a group of 10, for a friends birthday. We split into two groups and both did the same room (the first room?) simultaneously. It was my first time doing an escape room but most of the others had done one before. So although I really enjoyed it I can't compare it to others, but the consensus among my friends was that this was the best one everyone had done! It was really fun, pretty complicated but really engaging with loads of little components and parts to contend with - very interactive. The staff were really helpful and friendly only making the experience better. Thanks cluequest for a great time.

Great fun for all ages. Booked for my husband's birthday. Ages from 49 down to 12 years. First escape room we've done and this is highly recommended. I obviously do not want to spoil the experience but I will be booking the other rooms. Was really a good experience. Tip - looking for a hen/stag night? Book this - they have the same escape room x2 or x3. Play hen vs stag and see who escapes first... if you do? Enjoy!

Good fun!!. We had so much fun here! We were 6 friends who have tried several escape rooms earlier, and this is one of our favourite. We tried Operation Blacksheep. We made it out in time. Will you? :)

And the clock kept on ticking....T.O.P!!. Top experience with our group of 4 puzzling away,teamwork, riddles,cryptic descriptions and all, before you know it you will be lost in the game.Great adventure really, guided perfectly and a real challenging and teambuilding experience.Thanks a lot guys for a terrific evening.
Great day out. The quickest 60 mins of my life and great, great fun. Highly recommended. Just need a further 17 characters to validate review

A really different experience. This was a fantastic birthday surprise for my sons 12th birthday. We did this as a family of four, (daughter aged 10) and we all enjoyed it and can't wait to do the next one!5 stars.

Challenging and Fun! . This was the first room escape game I have played in London, and it was certainly the best I have done. We played in two teams of 4 in the second game (something about destroying a satellite) and both managed to escape in the time limit. The design of the game was excellent, spanning three chambers, while the methods were challenging yet not overly complex. I was pleased to see that ClueQuest has retained a focus on locks, keys and codes, and each part of the game flowed together with enviable attention to detail. We will certainly be back to try the other two rooms. Elsewhere, the staff were very friendly and really made our time enjoyable. At almost £25 per person, it isn't something you would do every week; realistically it is a little overpriced, but not by much. There is lots of choice for escape games in the capital, but I would certainly recommend this one.

The best room escape we've ever done!. The puzzles were challenging, but always made sense, and didn't contain too many red herrings. Having done a few of these types of games, this felt the most professional, and it felt like the team had really thought about every aspect of the experience.I particularly liked the "Back to Reality" button, which allows people to immediately exit the room in case they needed to use the loo, which helped allay the fears of some of our group of being stuck in a room for an hour. The waiting room was also full of boxed games, allowing those who had turned up early the opportunity to get in the right headspace.Finally, a big shout-out to our guide Jamie, who showed the perfect balance of enthusiasm, explaining things well without feeling patronising, and providing useful hints, but only when they were truly necessary.

Good fun brain exercise. Went as a team of 4 friends and had a great time in the entry level challenge - we were in the 40-50% successful exit category.As this is a child friendly puzzle our host did have a very simple script to start with, but by the end we were chatting a lot more. Remember that - if it's too complex for a kid, it's not a clue! There's 3 different rooms, the clue based (Sherlock Holmes-esque) entry level room, a bit trickier Bond-villain lair, and a super hard Mission Impossible style which apparently has only a 10% success rate!When they say a room, it's actually 2.5 rooms, once you'v completed one you get a better idea how to approach the next. If you get stuck your guide will offer some clues (or prove a distraction...)Bigger groups can apparently go head to head in a who gets out first.Anyhow, choose your team wisely, and keep your head as the clock ticks to zero!
Superb evening. Great social activity- challenging, but not too hard that you could not complete the challenges. Would do again.

Great birthday idea. I organised the room escape as my birthday party, and all of us loved it! We were 3 teams of 4, and for the room size I think it was the perfect team size. We all got to have fun and work on clues, and the hour flew by! All teams managed to escape as well, and some people met the others for the first time, so definitely a great team building idea :)
Hands down the best room escape game I've ever done!. Fantastic room escape, the puzzles are really inventive, the build quality is great, and it was a really fun team activity.

Great fun. I was slept about the storyline but once inside the room it was a challenge which kept you entertained and on your toes!Overall a great experience which I would recommend, just take somebody who is calm!!

Absolutely Brain Scratching Activity. For our official summer party, we hired 4 rooms, with 4 people in each room and after getting a very quick instructions we got locked in our assigned rooms and then the true hunt started. We weren't really sure what to expect but we were always looking for different things to try. It was a real fun and we all could participate. It was superbly organised and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Great team fun. Excellent activity, visited as part of work team event was a really good experience. Everything from the red herrings to the hidden sections was really well thought out.We will definitely come back and do this again.
Amazing afternoon for the work Summer party. Great fun and good for team building - highly recommend for anyone! The whole team enjoyed themselves.

Absolutely awesome - A good team game!!. Our group had so much fun, we thought it was going to be easy but it got you thinking and working as a team right until the end. We completed our mission with just 1 minute to go! Will definitely be going back to try the other missions!!!

Definitely deserving of the no.1 spot!. This was my ninth room escaöe experience, and first after being hired to a room escape company in my own country. The room was spot on. Interesting puzzles with just the right amount of challenge. Atmosphere was created brilliantly by both props and our game master. Definitely going to visit again on our next trip to London
Such fun!. We had the best time ever it was so gripping and so much fun! Will be getting another group of friends together so i can go again. Thanks clueQuestI will be back!!!

One of the best things to do with the kids. My husband and I visited Cluequest with our puzzle-mad children aged 9 and 7 right at the beginning of this summer holiday. It was one of the best things we have done as a family together. The puzzle room was well thought out and pitched at the right level to be challenging and rewarding at the same time. Highly recommended and will definitely come back for another mission.

An interesting evening!. This was my second visit to ClueQuest and I enjoyed it just as much as the first time around. The evening was a thank you to some work colleagues and we all had a great time. The challenges are just hard enough but without being impossible!Great venue and the staff were really friendly. I have one more challenge to try and will definitely be going again.

Brilliant!. We went along on Sunday and it was absolutely fantastic! From the moment we got through the door we were treated incredibly well and everything fully explained. With little experience we went for the introduction game and had a really fun hour. It is genuinely the most fun I've had with my clothes on in London, would highly recommend it. Looking forward to having a go at the next level at some point soon.

Fantastic team building activity. We visited as part of a team building away day in London. All of the team were engaged in the two rooms that we had booked. We were busy from start to finish and the team hosts gave each team just enough cryptic assistance to ensure that we escaped on time, but not too much to detract from the sense of satisfaction at the end. The welcome was great, the escape room was well designed with numerous puzzles and my teams came out understanding a little more about each other. Well done ClueQuest!

Brilliant.. Absolutely brilliant. Birthday present for 60th although game aimed at any age - what a professional set up - all 4 thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and yes we did manage to escape, just!! Would have no hesitation in recommending, will definitely go back for another mission.

So good we went twice in one day!. Brilliant escape room - probably the best we've been to. We had a morning appointment for the "beginner" room and enjoyed it so much we went to the second room later in the day thanks to a last minute cancellation. The whole operation is incredibly well run and organised, the puzzles are fun and engaging and I can not recommend the places highly enough. Don't miss it!

Fun time in family solving good enigmas!. First Escape room experience. We are on our mid twenties and offered it as mother's day gift. We did the Revenge of the sheep without knowing it was the most dificult of the rooms.It was awesome, a lot of fun, good enigmas and we all loved it including our mother! We had help right on time when we were really stucked (and we were a lot!).Good luck!

So so good. I'd heard great things about clue quest but was still slightly apprehensive to begin with. I just didn't know what to expect at all. But Luke gave us a brief intro and settled us in. And anyway when the clock starts ticking, all of the apprehension vanishes and you get into it immediately. We went as a group of 4 and all left the room with big grins on our faces (and with just 52 seconds to spare. Luke was a great host/facilitator, and I so thoroughly recommend the whole experience to everyone. Just don't put important items in your pocket and then forget that you put them there. That's my tip. :-) (sorry team!)
Great fun. Amazing fun - time went so quickly! Great staff, great experience - challenging but still so fun & a great team build! Already planning our return! Thank you ClueQuest!

Multi generational fun.. Time certainly flies when you are having fun. Who knew 60 minutes would pass so fast? Grandad, mom, and the teens all contributed to puzzling solving and clue finding. A laugh filled time was had by all.

Brilliant team building and so much fun. Booked all of the rooms for our office team building activity and it was fantastic. Not easy to please 42 people but cluequest managed it with their brilliant organisation and enthusiasm. Several people will be going back with friends and in teams from the office to try other games. It was so well done, we absolutely loved it. Thank you to everyone at cluequest for a fantastic evening.

Fully immersed till the last second!. Really excited to try out the newest mission - Revenge of the Sheep, and it did not disappoint! Was jam packed with things to do and in new, brilliant ways! Team work is definitely key in this game, it kept us talking for ages after, going through each step!Couldn't recommend this mission more.

Great fun. We visited as part of my hen party; we had two teams doing the same quest which was good as we could compare tactics afterwards. It was brilliant, the puzzles were hard but achievable and the staff are on hand to give you hints as well if you need! I would highly recommend to a group- great fun!

Great fun. Loved it.. My family did the entry-level escape room at ClueQuest in London in July of 2016. Would we do it again? Yes, in fact we liked it so much we did the mid-level room 2 nights later. Would we recommend it to friends? Definitely.We did this with our teen-age daughters and we had a blast. Judging by the smiles of everyone else that was there that night, everyone was having fun.If you found my review helpful, please let me know that by clicking the Helpful Button. Thanks.

The best hour I have spent in a long time! . I booked this for a team of five including two engineers and pilot. I honestly thought we would roll home with half an hour to spare but not so! The whole thing start to finish is impeccably executed, so well put together and I cannot praise the team highly enough for the hard work and attention to detail involved in this. An incredible exercise for your brain, we left absolutely buzzing and seriously considered asking them if we could go back and do a second room later that afternoon! Loved it and will definitely be back!!!

High expectations, lived up to them. Two teams, four in each, all had a good time. Not an easy challenge, and we spoke Norwegian in the room; still the staff did an excellent job of guessing what we were up to and gave appropriate clues. Only tiny drawback was that it was hard to hear instructions in the lobby with several crowds there at the same time.
Whole family loved it. We went with our kids - 15 and 12. Its rare to find something we can do together where we all take part equally. We all loved it and would really like to do it again !

Third time not so lucky. We went back as a group of 10 for the third time to take part in the latest challenge developed by the ClueQuest masterminds and can honestly say it was the hardest one yet. We split up into two teams so we could play against each other as well as the evil Professor BlackSheep, as we had done the previous two times we have visited. We really struggled, with what later looked to be quite simple things, but at the time really did leave us quite puzzled. The hour went by quickly and unfortunately for our team, we didn't get out in time, the other team did! I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a fun group activity, it's very well put together and definitely impresses. I even recommended this to our leadership team at work and they went as three teams to have a go and loved every second of it.
Brilliant fun!. Those in our group coming to ClueQuest for the first time had a great time working things out. It was still fantastic for those who'd been before. A must do!
hour of taxing fun. Went to the escape rooms on a hen do and quite enjoyed the experience. Mentally challenging through, was exhausted afterwards.

A lot of fun & very well designed. Fantastic time had by all - gets you thinking and working as a team - really well designed and the staff were all fantastic which made the experience even better. Escaped with a minute 38 left on the clock. Definitely will be back to tackle the other rooms.

Fantastic - best we have been to. Like most reviewers my wife and I have done a number of escape rooms in London and New York and have to say ClueQuest is up there with the best of them. The game was well organised, followed through and kept twisting and turning. I went with my mum and day (both in their 60s) who had never done a game before, they both really enjoyed it and came out wanting to do another game.As with all of the good games you have to book months in advance to get a weekend slot so it is not really a last minute idea.The comma from ClueQuest were excellent and despite what was said in the email the location was really simple to find as they have a whole shop front.Will be booking for another game very soon
Excellent time had. We went for a birthday. The people running it were good fun and we really enjoyed the activity. Would highly recommend! Thankyou Clue Quest
Great fun. We did this as a family group of 4 - it was great fun. Really good fun for all ages. Just the right difficulty level. We did Operation Black sheep and escaped .... Just
Great adventure . Went with a group from work - 6 of us (which I think is probably the max) and had a great time. It's a tough room but lots of fun!!
Totally Absorbing Fun. A great birthday outing for a 15 year old. A team of 3 worked well. Staff were welcoming and enthusiastic. We will be back for another mission...
Excellent experience. We booked this as a team building day for a new team, what an excellent experience. Whether it's work or leisure this is a brilliant idea and we'll be back again

Great puzzle room!. This was our 2nd puzzle/escape room experience, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Our group consisted of 2 older adults and 3 young adults. We did the Revenge of the Sheep challenge, and did succeed in saving the world (you're welcome!)My husband and I admit that without the participation of the 3 young adults we would still be stuck . . . definitely an impressive technology aspect to this. All in all, very highly recommended!

An absolute hoot - Great fun, and friendly staff :). We were a group of 8 playing Plan 52 in two rooms. Half our party arrived 15 minutes late, but the staff were welcoming, accommodating and kind throughout. The waiting area is comfortable, and drinking water is provided. We were briefed by two gentlemen, and then taken to our rooms. Each group had one kid, aged 9 and 13. The game itself is brilliantly designed, with plenty of clues and hints provided when necessary. When you've cracked the clues in the first room you get to unlock another, and have to solve the puzzles and mysteries in that room. I will be honest and admit that neither team managed to escape, and had to be helped by the staff to get out of the rooms. But that hasnt put any one of us off doing it again. It really is an experience worth doing, and the professional and courteous service provided makes it all worthwhile. In the end they gave us photos of our teams to take home, which was a lovely gesture.The only thing I think could be improved upon is the fact that the clues seem really random, i.e. there doesnt seem to be a narrative, a story, connecting them all. One doesnt naturally and organically lead to another, so that a story emerges and makes sense and propels you toward more clues - something like a picture that emerges as you start to put a puzzle together. Here, no picture actually emerged. One last thing - the parking (metered) on the road is good (surprising for London!), we were able to find 2 parking spaces with ease at a busy time of 3 PM.Thank you for a lovely experience that really took our Eid from good to great. My kids are hard to please and they were raving about it all day long, and cant wait to do another escape room.

Great half-term activity. My husband, mother in law, niece and I took on the first of the ClueQuest rooms, and it was excellent! Really great. I've done one room escape before, so knew what to expect, and it definitely doesn't disappoint. We're already looking at when we're going to do number 2. If you're umming and arring about whether or not to do it, just do it – you won't regret it.

Awesome experience, super fun! We would have done it again if we had more time : ). great for families, team building or bday party....super fun time. We would recommend to anyone! Our teen boys loved it!

Brainteasing fun. Get your grey cells working!. We did it with 30 seconds to spare - just got out - otherwise who knows what would have happened to us??? Great fun! We went with friends - but this is great for team building, families (probably with kids aged 12 upwards), birthdays etc. We muddled our way through, however, most of you are far more intelligent than us. So try it! Then go for a nice beer or glass of wine locally.

Team outing . Our newly formed team of 8 had a team building session at ClueQuest earlier today. We had 2 teams who each had the same Plan 52 game room to solve. We all had a great time and are already taking about doing the next level.
Would definitely recommend this for fun and for challenging the brain cells.

Birthday Extravaganza Activity. We have attempted many room escapes over the course of our travels and ClueQuest definitely ranks as one of the best!The story plot is taken very seriously and is very immersive, immediately drawing you into the spirit of the mission you have chosen. We chose Operation Blacksheep and we were not disappointed. While unfortunately we did not make it out in time due to a number of mishaps, we enjoyed ourselves very much. Our partner-in-crime was very lovely and she made our visit all the more entertaining! Afterwards you can create your own memory page complete with a Polaroid picture that makes your visit that much more memorable and personal.We would like to extend a big thank you to everyone at ClueQuest who made our visit a possibility!Overall my twin brother and I had a wonderful birthday experience and we would absolutely love to return and try our hand at one of the other missions in the near future!

The best in secret agent escape room fun!. What a great experience we had with this truly cerebral secret agent activity. We are great fans of room escapes for the simple nature that they make you think, they are a cooperative group activity, they keep your mind in the moment, foster team work and make it a rewarding experience for everyone participating. clueQuest is no exception and their secret agent spin is both fun and engaging. The staff are also really helpful and passionate about their work. Having visited many room escape experiences now, we would highly recommend clueQuest. It is in an easy to access location, right next door to a bus stop and only about 1 km from Kings Cross Station. We took a nice walk along the canals to get there. All in all, great value for money and really worth doing. They have three experiences to choose from, and we had a great time saving the world with Operation Black Sheep! We would like to thank everyone at clueQuest for making our experience wonderful!
Great fun - intriguing and well set-up game. If you enjoy a challenge, this is for you - and there are aspects to involve all the people in your group.
Plan 52. Great fun. Clues can be a little obscure at times but help is always available from friendly staff. Would defintely do it again.

Hen day fun . We went for an early evening hen activity. We wasn't sure what to expect but with a top mission and our lives at stake we accepted the mission... What a great hour! Will definitely go back but next time be more organised during our quest as we know what to expect. Highly recommend this activity for any group, couples, family, friends or a work team...

Already Booked Again!. This was our second trip to Clue Quest and it was another fantastic experience. After completing Plan 52, we decided to up the antics by booking in Operation BlackSheep. Our host Harriet was absolutely lovely and very accommodating. On both our trips the staff has been very friendly, informative, and enthusiastic. The room itself was excellent and quite a good degree of difficulty. Although I'm eagerly awaiting our return to tackle the final room, it will be sad when we finish all the Clue Quest room. Highly recommended to all!

Gret present, great time.....do it!. We were bought a gift voucher for ClueQuest as a 25th wedding anniversary present. What a brilliant present idea and what a brilliant thing to do. The booking experience was simple and the email communication excellent. We know London fairly well but the directions looked good for those not so familiar. The venue is in a great location only a few steps away from the hustle and bustle of Regents Park, the canal and King's Cross. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and part of an "event". The agent who briefed us was excellent. Helpful and informative while remaining in character. I'm not going to give too much away but if you enjoy cryptic challenges, problem solving, team work and not being afraid to look va little bit silly then this is definitely for you. Very, very highly recommended.

So good we had to do it twice!. I took my younger brother and sister last month as something to do in the summer holidays. A nice lady (I'm sorry, I don't remember her name)! Explained the rules and we were on our way to complete PLAN52. Despite missing a few obvious clues (and needing some very major help) we escaped with 30 seconds to spare!Considering the amount of fun the 3 of us had, I decided that it would be even more fun (& more chance of us escaping) if I invited our along too. We did slightly better on Operation BlackSheep, with 1 min 7 seconds to spare. Despite being the last group of the day, Luke was charming and funny - even spending a few minutes with us afterwards to debrief!All in all, this is a great experience for friends and family - I cant wait to come back and complete the 3rd mission!
So much fun. This was our first visit to an Escape Room and definitely won't be out last. We thoroughly enjoyed it and would definitely recommend. Big thanks to Sophia for being a great hostess

An epic evening with friends!. We came here as a group of friends for a stag do. We were met by the lovely Adam, who got us sorted out before locking us in a room. There was enough puzzling stuff to keep all of us entertained for the full hour, and it never got boring.Bring: Yourselves. That's it.Kudos to Adam for looking after us and being a very entertaining cluekeeper!
A must do!!. Came here for a friends birthday last night. Was such good fun. A definite must do! Thank you Agent Sophia and Agent O - mission completed just in the nick of time ;-)

Great Team Exxperience. We had two groups of 5 colleagues attend on the day and it was great fun. We all remarked that the hour passed very quickly. The pressure the scenario created was surprisingly real and we were all working together "under the cosh" to find the kidnapper and escape the fiendish room. Very helpful at getting us all working together and improving our communication skills as well as delivering many laughs. Would heartily recommend.

Fun and challenging. Me and my team visited here yesterday for our team building day out. It was 5 professionals so I was worried about what would be challenging enough to be fun. This was the answer. It was great fun and we all got involved and all thoroughly enjoyed it. One member is even coming back for their daughter's birthday later in the year. Great activity and great value for entertainment.

Brilliant birthday activity. Went to clueQuest with a group of friends for my 30th birthday. Had been wondering what to do and I'm really chuffed I went with clueQuest. We all had a brilliant time and were really impressed with the quality of the experience. This was both due to the staff who were really friendly and to the level of thought that had obviously gone into developing the puzzles. The staff found out that it was my birthday and made me a fridge magnet with our group photo on it which was very thoughtful. It was the first time any of us had done an escape room so we went for Plan 52. Suffice it to say that as soon as we can agree another date, we'll be booking again for Operation Blacksheep!
Excellent birthday outing.. I took three girls aged 11-13. They loved it!! superbly put together with a friendly and helpful welcome. Excellent!

Great Fun!. Booked for a group of 5! Didn't really know what to expect! At first you are briefed on your task, then shown to the first room. Without giving anything away you are given clues or you have to find them to enable to get yourself out the room you are in and into the next one against the clock. It was good fun and we really enjoyed our quest! We made it out the rooms before the end too! Recommended experience and friendly (helpful) staff. We'll be back for more fun!!

Great Way to celebrate 9th Birthday. My husband and I took 8 children ( two teams of 5) to clue Quest for our son's birthday party. It totally exceeded our expectations and all the children loved it! A fun brilliant way to work as part of a team. Definitely makes you want to go back and experience the two other rooms.

Great Fun. Went with 3 other friends (all mid-late twenties) for a fun activity during the day and we loved it! We were all a bit nervous to start with as we hadn't done anything like it before so didn't know what to expect or how hard it would be. We were thoroughly surprised at how logical it all was and by following the clues we were lead to the next. We didn't require any prior knowledge or general knowledge to get through just logical thinking and completed it within the 1 hour set time. You are allocated a quest guide as well who can communicate through a walkie talkie if you get stuck and if for any reason you want out there is an exit button. All the guys and girls that work there are great fun and really get into the spirit of the 'top secret mission' which added to it. I would definitely do another.

Really good time!. We weren't really sure what to expect but as a group of 5 mature ladies, we are always looking for different things to try. It was brilliant fun and we could all take part. It was superbly organised and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Round Table take on Operation Black Sheep. 9 of us took on the challenge of Operation Black Sheep. I'm very pleased to say that we loved it. As a group of lads aged between 25 & 43 I was dubious as to whether this type of thing would be pitched at us. However it was spot on. We all got completely immersed in it straight away. We all hope to take on the next part of the mission in the near futureThanks for a great morning.
Great escape. It was my first experience of an escape room and was a little dubious going in, but it turned out to be a fun way to spend an hour with 5 friends.

Brilliant Experience. Couldn't recommend this more. I have been to a number of live escape the room games but Clue Quest is by far the most entertaining and engaging. The variety of puzzles is unparalleled and the unique twists for each game really do make this a fantastic experience.Stop that sheep, Agent!

Our top pick for London Escape Rooms. Like the heading says, we really enjoyed our game. We were in the Black Sheep room (visited a couple other games in London) and this was the best we had in London. Highly recommended even if a bit far from public transportation. Sorry for almost taking your walkie talkie home!

A bit daunting for first time but lots of fun. We went as a group for a friends wedding present and we had never done anything like this before. It was a lot more difficult than we thought but we had picked the most difficult room apparently! That said it was a lot of fun and the guide was helpful, without spoiling it. Would definitely recommend as something to do if in London.

As good as these get. we were three people, myself and my two sons, aged 16 and 20. the welcome was informative and fun, the support wonderful, and the flexibility when we had to change times admirable. a big thank you to our guide and to the company. we signed on for Plan52 and enjoyed it. a little suggestion for Cluequest: tie in the face of the culprit to the mission.

Great fun adventure. Great idea for something different. Find a group of 3/4 friends and, have a couple of pints beforehand, test yourselves for the hour. You won't regret it. Don't forget to pee before though.

Fun family outing. Who knew an hour could go so quickly! I did this with my husband and my parents. We got out with a few minutes to spare, but it was definitely stressful at the end. I was impressed with their use of technology (others I've been to have kept it more old school). We are definitely keen to go back and do their harder rooms!

Great Father's Day fun for Family with Teenage Boys. This was such a great fun experience. We chose the Professor Blacksheep mission and loved every minute of it. It got us all running round like nutters trying to work out what the clues were and what to do. The staff were brilliant and made us feel like real spies. We completed our mission with 1 second to spare!!!! I would definitely recommend clue quest.

Birthday surprise!. I had been wanting to do this for so long and my friends surprised me for my birthday. It was good fun and time passes so quickly trying to escape! Very interactive, full of surprises and a great day. We will definitely be back for more. The staff made the experience great and we got to take a group pic at the end, which they provided in magnet.Would definitely recommend.

Great end to a wonderful weekend. We came up to London to celebrate a 'special birthday'. On the Saturday we did the usual stuff - meal and theatre in the evening.What to do on the Sunday before returning home? Something a bit different?We had stumbled across ClueQuest some months earlier when planning the weekend. Pretty much every review included the word fun so we booked it there and then.What a great decision. We (2 adults and 2 grown up children) had a fantastic time. We will definitely go back to experience one of the other rooms.Just make sure you book in advance - you won't regret it!

Family Xmas present . This is the best hour spent in a long while. Brilliant concept, enthusiastic staff, great fun! Well worth a visit - our party of 8 ages ranging from 28 to 61 had an amazing time - thanks Clue quest!!

The best group event ever!. ClueQuest is one of the most fun afternoons I have had in ages! We were planning a friend's surprise birthday afternoon and were really uninspired by all the usual things - I stumbled across ClueQuest and booked in the hope we would have an entertaining afternoon but by the end, we were all hooked! It's just brilliant - the staff are friendly and professional, the set-up is well thought-out and executed and the challenge itself - to escape from a room in an hour - is wildly exciting. We started by solving a few simple(ish!) puzzles and by the end, we were jumping up and down and screaming. My team got out with 1 second to spare, which was apparently a first... Perfect for groups, team building, older family, maybe even date nights!? Can't recommend highly enough.

Really fun way to spend an hour. Having already done the beginner's room a few months ago, we (5 of us) moved on to the intermediate room. It was brilliantly set up. We managed to solve the room in 40 minutes (nearly making a top 5 time), but were told the room has a less than 50% success rate, so try it and see if you can beat it!Very fun, lots of different types of puzzles, some requiring a team effort to solve. You get a real rush of adrenaline for the hour. Would recommend a team size of 3-5 people. 2 isn't enough and 6+ will feel cramped.

Really good fun. This was really good fun. We all became so engrossed and focussed on the game. At the end of the hour, we were all in really good spirits. This activity is so worth doing. We are definitely looking at a repeat visit.

We didn't blow up the apartment... We made it. We were a group of five adults all family members. We were greeted by a rep. He explained little bits, hints and what the aim of the game was. We were put in a room and without giving too much away we had to find clues to open the next door, to open the other door to get out the room. As you go along you will become more aware of clues and how to find the bits to open the doors. Everyone got involved when we were struggling, and when we felt we had hit a dead end we got hints to get us back on track. The whole game was so clever and carefully planned. A lot of time and effort has been made to insure all goes to plan and no one blows up the apartment. Very pleased with our team effort and would definitely go back again. Ten thumbs up from us all.

Fun afternoon for the family. Clue Quest is a fun afternoon out if you're looking for something to do with the kids. We went to Clue Quest as the birthday boy of 10 wanted to go with his friends. The idea is that you are all secret agents (you're even given names) and you have to enter a series of rooms to discover the identity of a double agent by finding clues and cracking codes. You're also against the clock as the double agent has set off some kind of device. A member of staff is assigned to help you with clues via walkie talkie if you get stuck. Staff walk you through the activity at the beginning and recap your mission once you're done. The staff are friendly, informative and engage well with the children and adults alike.The actual rooms are brilliantly laid out and set the scene for a great story. It's immersive, captures the imagination and keeps everyone engaged. The whole experience reminded me of modern Cluedo but in realtime. I would definitely recommend this if you're looking for something to do with the kids of want a fun afternoon out as part of a birthday.

Fantastic . Last weekend I was in London and don't something called ' Clue Quest ' honestly guys it was so so so so fun . You have to figure out all different puzzles and riddles around the room and try to stop a machine basically taking over the world . Had the absolute most fun I would DEFO recommend it to anyone that wants to do something fun whilst in London , well worth the time and price ✨
well done!. it wasn't our first, but it was the best of escape games that we have already tried ;) The story is good, quests are fun :) I recommend it for 4 people

Family Team work!. A really fun way to spend an hour with boys that are pretty hard to impress. Quite challenging and it made us all think and work together to escape - we managed with 50 seconds to spare.
So much fun. First time we tried escape games and it was so much fun! Slightly stressful, but the quests and puzzles were so fun. Cannot wait to go back!!
Absolutely brilliant. We've done all 3 rooms now and I'm absolutely gutted we've finished them. You HAVE to have a go! Such a rush

Recommended mind twisting. After I got over the slightly twee introduction and the "evil sheep coming to end the world nonsense", the escape rooms themselves are actually very good. If you like solving problems, you'll enjoy this. There's no physical element, just mental problems to solve. Great team experience.
Do it! . Excellent team experience. The room just gets bigger and bigger as you progress. Need to do another level. Better than the crystal maze for mind stimulation.

Challenging and fun!. The game was challenging and great fun. The clues were sometimes REALLY tricky, but teamwork and communication (plus occasional help from the staff) got us through. Everyone had a lot of fun.

Teamwork and a lot of head scratching. I have now tried all 3 of the ClueQuest games, and would definitely go again if there were any new ones opened. This time I went as part of a work team building day. It was the most difficult room and some parts of it were really hard but it was excellent for developing good links among the group and was definitely fun.

Fantastic Escape Game. I've been twice now and the team always make us feel welcome. They add to the experience and the puzzles are both challenging but attainable. I've completed two of the three missions but just in time on both occasions. Good for friends, families and work colleagues.

Birthday Escape Game. This was the third time I had visited Cluequest. I have been before for my boyfriend's birthday and for my sister's birthday.It was great fun and tricky in places. An interesting and different way to spend some time with friends/family. Richard was our leader in mission control - he was fun and clearly loves the game as much as we did. Thanks Cluequest!

Brilliant. The experience was great, the complexity of the puzzles were well pitched. Ww managed to escape with a few minutes remaining and having had 2/3 clues. The experience was made extra enjoyable by the enthusiasm of the staff.
39 SECONDS TO SPARE!!!!. Went to this with my friends today. Absolutely brilliant, Very challenging and Staff were excellent and we'll go again.

ClueQuest great event for team building. Fantastic event, loads of fun cleverly put together and nerve tinglingly exciting, especially when you solve the puzzles with seconds to go (like us!). They have three games so could do it agan with a different set of challenges. We went a a work event, everyone was really enthusiastic about the experience, thanks to the guys there for such a fun event.
Third Room at Clue Quest. Brilliant Room Escape game. Their newest room is just as exciting, and even more challenging than the other two. A great way to spend an hour!!
Loved it!. It was a great experience and we had a lot of fun! We will be definitely coming back to complete the other challenges.Strongly recommended for everyone to try it at least once!

This kind of fun could get addictive. So. Much Fun!Ten of us went and split into two teams of five to each play the "Plan52" game. Not only were we playing to make it out of the room in time, we were hoping to beat the other team. Staff were friendly and helpful, making the experience perfect. I can't recommend ClueQuest enough and will be going back to play the "Operation BlackSheep" game soon I hope. (And I'll probably never look at a combination padlock the same again.)

Amaizing fun being Mr Q's special agents. Fantastic experience. We are a family group of 5 with 3 geeks in our group so we were looking for an exciting challenge. Cluequest did not disappoint. The venue was easy to find and we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who explained our mission and told us the rules. We couldn't wait to get started. We have done the plan52 room. The 3 geeks drove right in while me and the other female member of our group tried to solve the easier puzzles. With a bit of help we escaped with 1 minute and 20 second left on the clock. It was nothing like i expected. It was much more. We were absolutely exhausted after it but in a good way. We will be back to have a go at the other missions. Also we loved the graphic design of Mr Q and the other characters.

Great fun!. I arrived at the location with my wife and daughter (16 years old), they did not have a clue what I had planned for them, but was quickly drawn into the scope of the game!It was really super fun, and we where able to solve the quest within the timeframe by working energetic with all clues and together as a team.
Great fun!. Great fun! very entertaining and nicely thought riddles! very good catering, staff are very friendly and patience with delays.

There's a reason why I keep going back....!. This was my not first... not second... but THIRD visit to Mr Qs headquarters. I have now completed all 3 existing rooms: PLAN 52, Operation Blacksheep and Revenge of the Sheep. If you have never been to Cluequest before, I would recommend attempting the challenges in this order. The storyline leads from one to the other in this order, but is NOT essential to know the storyline if you did want to attempt them in a different sequence. From personal experience, I found PLAN 52 the easiest (yet still a challenge), and Operation Blacksheep the most difficult! (we almost didn't escape this one) - but of course, it depends on your strength of teamwork, and the number of people in your room too! I personally found the 6 people in a room felt crowded (we had this for Operation Blacksheep) and 4-5 JUST the right amount. Having too many people means you miss out on some clues (especially if communication is bad!), however the positive side to this is that you can always experience the room again and solve different clues/sections for yourself!I have also completed rooms at various other escape rooms such as HintHunt and TimeRun for example, but there is obviously a good reason as to why I keep returning to ClueQuest :) I await their next challenge with anticipation!

Great birthday party location!. We took a group of 11 girls ages 9-13 to ClueQuest yesterday to celebrate my daughter's 12th birthday. They all had a GREAT time and really enjoyed it. An adult had to come into each room with them, but we did our best to just observe (although that is really hard as all you want to do is just jump right in). Both teams made it out successfully and they were talking about it for hours later and comparing notes. Great organization, clues, creativity and riddles.
Silly (but hard!) and excellent fun. Took my small team from work here for a Friday afternoon jaunt. Couldn't have done the trick any better

Fantastic way to spend an hour and save the universe!. After a top secret briefing and the chance to absorb the magnitude of our situation, we spent an hour deciphering fiendish puzzles and putting together clues using all our critical faculties.It was honestly one of the best hours entertainment I've ever had and this really stands out as one of the best things I've ever done in London, which is saying something!Can't really recommend it enough.

Great fun, very well organised. I thoroughly enjoyed Cluequest and thought it excellent throughout. Helpful and friendly staff and most importantly a very well thought out and challenging escape. The puzzles were thought provoking and caused many a 'Eureka' moment without being unnecessarily difficult or obscure.
Most awesome fun ever!. We were four of us! It was crazy fun and we did PLAN52. We finished in 53 minutes and only got one hint from the collaborators (Mr.Q).

Dont miss this - great fun. We visited as part of a stag soiree and what a great experience to take up an hour and a bit rather than just drink the day away. We split into two teams of four and the experience was enjoyed by all.You'll need your wits about you and you need to pay attention to the briefing.I wont spoil your fun BUT this is a fantastic for adults of all ages.Be aware that you are looked into a series of rooms for the challenge so check with them if claustrophobic!Overall cant rate it highly enough

Awesomely fun!!!. My friends and I, team of 4, have been to ClueQuest twice and have already booked to go for the third mission. Absolutely fun and have an hour to work together to escape. No complaints at all. The game masters were absolutely friendly and definitely cheered us on while we were solving clues. Definitely recommend this to all, whether it is friends, family, or even team building, guaranteed hours/days of discussion to follow after the game!

Brilliant experience- highly recommend!. We had heard great things about the experience and so I was very excited to receive a voucher as a Christmas present from my fiancé. We went with a friend so there were three of us and we did the Plan52 game.The whole thing is very well organised, from the initial briefing, through to the escape room and the debriefing. I'd say you definitely need AT LEAST 2 people, as there is a lot to get through in the hour!We thoroughly enjoyed it and will definitely be back again.Thanks ClueQuest!
Fun Fun Fun!. Easy to find, great facility.Lovely staff.Very fun - lots of different puzzles to solve, has some interesting ones which I've never seen before.Would recommend.

Amazing experience!. I have done another Escape Room before, however this was totally different and amazing fun! the staff were brilliant and kept in character the whole time, which made it much easier to get into the game. Help was given but only when you really needed it, so i didn't feel like I was constantly being told what to do, but equally we never felt lost in the room. We managed to complete the Red Box room with 2 minutes left to go, which was completely amazing! a thoroughly good few hours, will definitely be coming back to try out the other two rooms!

So much fun. So much fun! Did this as a group of 4 with some friends (all 25ish) and had the best time, it's not cheap but worth every penny. This was our first escape room and we didn't know what to expect but the difficultly was perfect and theme was really fun. Our host was wonderful right from the start and gave us a little nudge in the right direction when needed, but not too much. Would definitely recommend and already planning to back and try another room!

An honest review of ClueQuest . From the minute we walked in, our host Adam entertained us and made the challenge ahead exciting. The experience itself was amazing, it was bought as a present to my siblings and after doing the first room, we are now looking to book the next two rooms. Really cannot recommend it any more. Also cannot thank Adam more for his hosting, he was very entertaining and we know the whole experience was better because of him.

Escape room Black Sheep. My friends and I (total group of 6) did Black Sheep (medium difficulty) and we absolutely loved it. The escape room was well designed and a fun experience and we would all love to do it again! Highly recommended!

Fiendishly fun adventure. We have done all three rooms at Clue Quest and our only complaint would be that we've now run out of rooms to do with them! The rooms are really playfully designed with a good level of challenge, and the clue masters are great. The theme of Professor Blacksheep and his nefarious compatriots is fantastic!
Highly recommended.

Brilliant experience. Took our daughter for her 21st birthday as part of a day out in London. Wasn't sure what to expect or whether I'd like it but I have to say it was fantastic and great fun. Would definitely recommend it.

Brilliant time - we all loved it. We booked for my husband's birthday and took 2 kids aged 8 and 11. It was brilliant!! They do offer advice if you go off track but was such good fun and taxing enough for everyone to make it interesting kids loved it and want to try the others!

Something different for a rainy day. We were given vouchers for Christmas by family members who had previously been. We didn't really know what to expect as none of us had done an escape room before but I think it's probably safe to say we'd all want to do more having had such a great day. The game is completely different to anything which we have done before as a family - a fun, challenging and imaginative activity in which we were all able to participate and all found great fun. It really got the adrenaline going and we were all pretty determined to get out within the time, which we did.....with one second to spare! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun and different challenge, we were talking about it for hours after! Special thanks to Adam who guided us through our adventure without giving too much away!

Fantastic day!. I organised a group trip for my birthday-11 people signed up for 3 sessions. We all had varying experience of escape games-some people had been to other games before but some were completely new to it all. We found the varying difficulty in the games to be helpful. I myself did the more experienced challenge and it was brilliant! Found the staff to be very helpful and thorough. Overall a great day out!

UK's best escape game. We visited Cluequest as part of research for our own escape game in Kent and have done a fair few before all around Europe. Without doubt this is easily the best one we have done. On arrival we were impressed with the waiting area and the attention to detail shown by the staff on shift. They were welcoming and full of enthusiasm, setting the scene for the game superbly. Once in the room (Plan 52) we were pleased to see a very well designed set with high quality props. I won't give too much away but the game managed to combine a perfect level of difficulty with a great variety of puzzles. We escaped with 5 mins to spare and came out completely buzzing. During the post game briefing our staff member was incredibly helpful and gave us our merchandise to remember the day by. We will definitely be booking up the other two games when we next get chance.

A funny way of bringing a team together!. We went to ClueQuest for a Team Building event, and we really enjoyed it.It is very well thought, fun, and really brings people together. The team is young, fun and motivated and I can only recommend any company who would like to create a Team Building event or even a family or a group of friend to go there and have fun all together. Thanks for this!

Fantastic Team Builder!. We decided to have a ClueQuest evening as our Christmas night out in December 2015 but unfortunately we were unable to attend. ClueQuest were fantastic in that they gave us vouchers to spend once we were all able to attend.So finally 6 months later we were all able to make it and ClueQuest did not disappoint. We had a mixed bag of people attending and we all walked away feeling like winners.The clues are varied enough that you brain is working the entire time.Would highly recommend ClueQuest for any teams looking for a fun time out.

Excellent fun. Clue quest was one of the best experiences. Great fun and completely different to anything any of us have done before. We went in as 2 teams. One all girls, one the men. There is nothing physical so it was suitable for everyone including a pregnant friend.Will definitely return and have a go at one of the other rooms

Smashed it!. My partner, his sister and I have completed a few escape rooms and this one is definitely up there!
The room we escaped had a range of 'finding' and 'puzzle solving' activities which suited our trio perfectly. The rooms were very well kept and super engaging. We're going back in a few months to escape another room!

Something to get the heart racing and the brain whirring!. We visited for a friend's significant birthday. I was put in a team of three people I hadn't met (who were part of the birthday party) as we hadn't done anything like this before. We had an absolute blast! It was great fun. James our games maker was excellent. He really sold us the narrative about the game, and was really good at making sure we had fun. We left feeling very elated and bonded despite having been strangers an hour before! I would love to do something like this again.
Fantastic family escape game. ClueQuest captured my children's imagination and they actually wanted to play a second game immediately after. Just our bad luck ClueQuest was fully booked that day.
Immersive family fun. We're avid escape game players, so any game we play has to appeal to us on an intellectual level for us to be satisfied.ClueQuest succeeded!

Brilliant Birthday Surprise. We bought this as a present for my daughters birthday and she loved it.We were a party of 5 age range from 25-58 and we all loved it too!We did Operation Blacksheep and never having done anything like this before we didn't quite know what to expect but working as a team we managed to get out with 60 seconds to spare!We are all keen to do another room in the future and perhaps challenge another group of friends as well!
Perfect event for friends. Brilliant trip, definitely recommend! Great for a group of friends, makes for a perfect weekend/special occasion activity.

AWESOME. Great experience with loads of challenging riddles and puzzles to solve.. This is my 3rd visit to an escape room, and is by far, the best one. Plan 52 was great..now to challenge the other ones! Highly recommended.A+++

Amazing game!. Booked this as a Christmas present for my sister and 4 of us finally got around to going today! One of the group had already been before and highly recommended it, which is the main reason we decided to go again. Our host was called Jamie and he was such an enthusiastic guy he explained everything so well before the game we couldn't wait to get going! The game was great and obviously I'm not going to give away any spoilers but it was really challenging and so rewarding when you managing to solve the clues and progress. Eventually we escaped our game with over 10minutes remaining so we all left very satisfied!It a great game and as long as you've got a good team who communicate well and think outside the box you won't have any problems!Go, give it a go, and I promise you won't be leabing disappointed!

AMAZING!. Jamie was our ClueQuest host and he made the experience incredibly enjoyable! We did Plan52 and it was amazing! I wasn't sure what to expect but as soon as we were in the room and the clock started, we just got into it and we loved every second! This is a game for problem solving minds and a good experience to share with friends!
Great fun. Had a fantastic time with James helping us. Great way to spend an hour or so, and now want to do all the other rooms! Really great concept and excellent test of logic.
An hour of SUPERB fun with mates. We had a blast at clueQuest. Perfect plan with friends. James was a great host - thank you! We will definitely come back for more!

Challenging Fun. Great challenging and fun way to spend an hour, you'll be glad you tried it! This was my 2nd visit and I loved it as much as the first, and I still have no idea how we managed to escape! I bought this as a gift for 4 friends and they are now all booking up for a 2nd visit.

Great fun!. We went to Clue Quest as a team building for work and it was great fun. I wasn't sure whether it was really my thing, but by the end of the hour was so keen to solve the clues I couldn't believe where he time had gone! Absolutely brilliant and will be back to try the other 2 quests!

So much fun!. I took my siblings for their Christmas present.
A brilliant experience, so much fun, it exceeded expectations. I would highly recommend this to anyone!
Definitely the most fun I have had in London. The experience was amazing, nothing like anything I have done before. I definitely intend to do it again and recommend it to people of all ages.

Simply brilliant. Had heard about this and wanted to experience it ourselves. Four adults and my 8 year old son. None of us had done of these before and it was quite simply brilliant. Great briefing when we arrived, really fun and challenging rooms, loved the story. Brilliant!
Fantastic. Never done anything like this before. Took my partner and her parents. Definitely earned some brownie points. We all loved it and are keen to book our next Mission.

An hour well spent. ClueQuest is simply great fun. We went as a family of four - kids aged 22 and 20 - one of each - and it was great. have to confess we needed Jon's timely interventions but generally managed to get through on our own wits - needed every single second however. If you have an hour to spare and some chums to have a laugh with I cannot recommend this highly enough. Group of 4 ideal size.

Second room as good as the first. Back in December I did Plan 52 with 2 friends, we loved it! We got out with 2 seconds to spare and then couldn't stop talking about it for the next week! So I went back with the same 2 friends plus 2 more. This time we did it with 2 mins to spare but it was tough! Exhilarating, clever but enjoyable!Cannot recommend more highly!

Hen party activity - highlight of the weekend!. We were a group of 14 and did the plan 52. It was brilliant to be able to have all 3 groups doing the same escape room at the same time. Yes, we all were in a race to finish, but it was a brilliant hour and each group was talking about it for the rest of the day.
