Can't say too much about it because the unknown is required to get full enjoyment, but it is brilliant value for such a fun filled hour. I'll be recommending it to everyone and can't wait to go back to try the other games!
Great for team building. Went here for a team building event with my colleagues from work. Had an amazing time! Some of the puzzles were quite challenging, but we had a great time.

Brilliant. Didn't know what to expect as was bought for us (a family of 5) as a Christmas present because of its good reviews. Was expecting lots of arguments but we worked together and made it out and we all enjoyed it so much we will probably go back to do another. Can thoroughly recommend.
Saving the world!. This was really good fun! Would highly recommend for people of all ages. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Ideal for birthdays.

We did it. I was taken here as a surprise for my birthday with four others and it did not fail to impress. I would never have guessed what we were doing which is ironic as you need your detective skills. It's definitely a good thing for a group of friends to do together. It would also be a good team building/corporate day out. Well run and highly recommended.
Amazing. Amazing Saturday morning. Well spent with fab staff. Felt like a real secret agent hahah John was amazing as our mission control !! We'll be back

Fun activity with friends. This was a great thing to do for an afternoon. We went on a Friday evening with a party of three. I think that is the best minimum number.The guy who introduced us & explained everything was very friendly & efficient. They do watch you via some sort of cctv & so see when you're stuck & can offer clues if needed via walkie talkie so you don't get frustrated! ( it was actually a nice help) We are not the best latteral thinkers but we manages to get out as we were so close to the end we were given an extra few minutes! :-) We manages in 1 hour & 5 minutes in the end. There seems to be a stair lift down to the toilet area & i thing to where some rooms are so i think if you're in a wheel chair there are specific rooms that are designated for you. We actually went with a pushchair & the staff were great. They carried it for us up the 5 or 6 steps to the room we used.There is nothing 'physical' to do so we managed with the baby in a sling! But if he'd been sleeping its just you in the secure room so we could have left him in the pushchair as we did the quest. Huge fun & i felt like i had a brain workout whwen i'd finished. Definatly will go back for another room!!!

An exciting end to our Stag and Hen. This was booked as part of our joint stag and hen weekend and it was super fun. Some of the group were really into games and puzzles, so it was perfect for them. However, even the people who weren't too sure at the start were thoroughly enjoying it by the end! Unfortunately the boys team escaped before the girls, but that's just another reason to go back and try again! The staff were really friendly and helpful and clearly passionate about being able to give guests a great experience. Highly recommended for puzzle nerds and novices alike :)
Great night out. Brilliant fun, great night out with family. Highly recommend for a night out with a difference, really great experience.

Bus trip to the capital . First heard about it from my younger brother so thought we would give it a go. There were 4 of us,myself my wife Claire and my old mate Steve with his long suffering wife Diana. The min we walked in you actually felt excited as you didn't know what to expect and by the time we were assigned to our mission we were all raring to go. Brilliant and very taxing,it really tests ur brain as there are so many things to work out and only a given time to do it which also makes it more exciting. Only 2 complaints really, one was I really don't think you get enough time and the other is don't take my old mate Steve. He is a clown and with all the clues we had to figure out I couldn't help laughing at him as it reminded me of our school days. And we wasn't very bright then or now as we didn't crack it but it wasn't for the want of trying. Seriously anyone reading this has got to give it a go, I would strongly recommend you take at least 4 people but no more than 6. ENJOY GREAT LAUGH.

Revenge of the Sheep Mission. We went yesterday to complete the new Mission they launched in March 2016. As a group of 4, we finished the mission with 52 seconds to spare! It was absolutely brilliant and super fun. I was told this is the most difficult one out of the three, maybe I should have started with level 1 but oh well, love a challenge! Our mission control guy, Richard, was super friendly and explained everything really well before we started.I'll definitely go back to do the other 2!

Birthday surprise for teenager. Loved every minute. It was our first ever escape room and I've never felt so excited waiting to start. Our guide was excellent and got us all full of anticipation. 2 adults and three teenagers, we got out with 3mins to spare. Definitely take the over 10s with you as kids are needed to think differently to adults.

Highly recommend!. We did the Plan52 mission (recommended if you haven't been before as it's the start of the storyline) in a team of 4 (all in our 20s) and had such a great time. The game is very well planned out. A nice change from our usual London activities (pub). Will definitely be back for the other missions!

Brilliant Fun!. We had a brilliant time solving the clues and all working together. 4 of us went as a family for my daughter's 18th and we had a brilliant time. A very different experience we would highly recommend. Great staff and friendly welcome.

The best 60 minutes I've had in London.. Great day out for friends and family of all ages. I attending with a group of 12 people, from ages 16 - 80, all of which had a brilliant time.There is no physical or agility requirements, just good lateral thinking. If you have spent time shouting at a television when watching people play game shows like the crystal maze, then this is for you. Consider this a hour long game of the crystal maze, with mental and skill challenges ,except you have to factor in teamwork. I cant wait to go back and play the other game. Five Stars From me

Amazing time!. Brilliant place will be recommending to my friends. Staff were lovely and gave us a little helping hand when we needed it.was booked as a joint hen and stag both loved the surprise! Hope they expand to more locations soon.

Really fun experience!. Went with 3 girl friends and we had such a fun time. They allowed us to stay for an extra 15 mins over the allotted hour which helped us out!Would definitely go again and recommend for any groups, whether friends, family, or work.

Excellent fun!!!. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our escape at Clue Quest! My children are 11 and 15 and the clues etc seemed to be pitched very well for us and them. I would totally recommend the experience!

Awesome evening out. We went with another couple and had a great time. It is a puzzle with rooms and hints. Great fun if you like this type of entertainment. I would highly recommend it. There are three different levels, so if you like it you can go back for more!

Good host, good puzzle, great fun!. Second escape room I've done, very different to the first but just as fun. The room was quite number based with a good amount of challenge and variety. Definitely recommend to anyone looking at doing something more fun than sinking £20 quid down the pub. Such a buzz after completing it!

Great fun. Such good fun, all of us had a great time trying to save the world :-)). Very friendly staff 'Agents', Will definitely be back soon. To try out one of your other games Great day out, for groups of friends and families, although I wouldn't recommend it for primary age children i think they might be bored as quite tricky.
Excape room. So much fun! Friendly staff and a great group activity! Really good way to spend an afternoon before heading to the pub.
What a great team building exercise!. Amazing escape game to do with family, friends or colleagues. Such a great value for money as well. Highly recommend it!
Coolest experience ever!. Very smart and creative, I would definitely recommend this place! So much fun to go with your friends and unlock some clues!

Amazing experience. We went to ClueQuest as part of a three day workshop. There were a couple of people that were sceptic about this in the beginning, but even those people came out very thrilled about the great experience, racing hearts and so much fun!

Probably the best escape room in London. Out of the 30ish escape rooms I've done worldwide, clueQuest has some of the best ones. In particular, "Revenge of the Sheep" was probably the *single best* escape room I've ever done.The puzzles are clever, not too simple nor impossible, require teamwork at times, are part of a fun story, and use advanced technology for an amazing experience.I highly recommend clueQuest and will definitely come back as soon as they build a new room.

Great fun, great way to spend an hour trying to save the world from the evil sheep.... The new offices that these guys are in is easy to find as it actually has a shop front. The staff are fun and friendly and help set the mood and tone of the mission.......its like a real life Crystal Maze / Krypton Factor type encounter as they REALLY do lock you in a room!!!The rooms are fun and enjoyable, the trick to it is having the right mix of friends with you in the room as all your skills and teamwork really come to the fore and if your too busy arguing amongst yourself your not gonna get out in time........(dont worry they do watch your progress on the cameras and give you handy prompts if you get stuck)Iv done all 3 levels of escape that these guys do, which goes to show how great it is. Id also like to point out that I managed to escape all 3 rooms......lol

The best fun!. Five of us did this for a birthday treat. We had the best time ever. Jamilla was an excellent front person and got us into the spirit of the game straight away. It was my first time in an escape game and definitely won't be my last. We managed the escape with 6 mins to spare and were delayed for the rest of the day. Recommended for sure.

Best escape room Ive done. If you want to save the world from imminent doom this is the game for you. Clue quest is particularly well planned out with various problems to solve in a well executed bunker. Ive done these rooms with friends, on a hen do and as a day out with my teenage neice, it really is fun for all the family. Enjoy.
Awesome Fun!!. Great fun - good team building - great staff - overall was awesome!!I would definately recommend this to work colleagues and groups of friends..

ClueQuest . The best escape game!! Staff are friendly and in character, the game uses digital props as well as normal ones to get you moving. One hour soon runs out. Guttered I didn't know about the through the looking glass collaboration with ClueQuest! Tickets are all sold out now. ☹️

Excellent afternoon out!. This was booked as a surprise for my 40th birthday as the older you get, what do you buy someone? I didn't really know what to expect, but it turned out to be a great hour of fun (or actually just short as we saved the world with 11 minutes to spare!). The staff were really friendly and welcoming and we played Plan52. There were five of us frantically searching for clues and wondering what things meant, but a cheer of joy each time we found a new combination to unlock the door! My auntie was in her element, If you're looking for something different to do for a birthday or a team building day for work, this is something I'd definitely recommend. It's a bit of escapism, good fun I'll be looking to go back to play in a different room. Thank you Clue Quest for a lovely afternoon.

Saved the world!. You be glad to know the world is safe again. Mr Q reports that Agents Maverick and Storm teamed up with Star and Flash to defeat the double agent and disarm the doomsday device, with just 7 minutes to spare!
Great fun, would do again!. This was great for fun and team-building. We wish it could have gone on and on! We did Mission #1 but we'll definitely be doing #2 soon :)

Amazing escape room!. The ClueQuest team was very friendly, enthusiastic and cheering along passionately, while we just managed to escape on time (only 14 s left, phew!). I recommend to not go as a too big group (we were four and I was always a bit sad to miss what others did).

Cluequest - the return. After failing (reasonably miserably) at my first attempt, I went back to Cluequest to see if a different room, and different team would improve my escaping skills. Operation BlackSheep is a similar set up to Plan 52, with several levels of frustrating, interspersed with fleeting victories. Happily, we managed to free ourselves with only a minute or two to spare, but things definitely got a lot more panicky in the last ten or so minutes. I'd definitely recommend playing the rooms in order (perhaps this one felt easier as you're just more familiar with the set up and have a vague idea of what is expected of you). Overall, we loved it and I can't wait to go back and attempt the most recent addition.
Great fun!. More difficult than expected which only made it more fun. Clever construction and meant team work was necessary, we made it out eventually with some helpful hints!

Really good fun, 10/10 would do again.. Such a good idea for a day out. Loved the creativity, and the race against the clock. We finished with 1min 50secs left, got our hearts racing for sure. Can't wait for the next installment!

A narrow escape!. Our experience at ClueQuest was BRILLIANT. I had no idea what to expect, but it turned out better than anything I could have imagined. The puzzles are difficult to solve but you don't need any prior knowledge, so they were equally accessible to everyone in our team — which was ideal. Our quest was run by James who was brilliant — he gave us the perfect amount of helpful hints EXACTLY when we needed them, and helped us escape the room with just eight seconds to spare!!We couldn't stop talking about it for hours after we left — revisiting all our favourite moments. I would recommend this to ANYONE!

Great fun . We visited clue quest as a family for my husbands birthday and had a brilliant time. We just about escaped! All four of us, including our 12 and 13 year olds had to work flat out to solve all the clues. I would highly recommend this either with family, friends or colleagues.

Baaarilliant...🐏. So much fun. We did Revenge of the Sheep which they said is the trickiest so maybe starting with an easier one would have been good as it was our first time. Really great though, a fantastic hour well spent.

Excellent escape game and puzzles. Visited as part of a birthday for one of the group. Up to 6 people per room with a mixture of puzzles and quizzes to solve with a funny backstory. Had a great experience here. Would go again and thoroughly recommend.
Great fun . Really good fun. Got out with 52 seconds to go. Totally nailed it. Turns out I'm much better at puzzles than my partner. 10/10

Amazing!. Went with a group of friends having done some other escape rooms and had a great day: - great for competitive and inquisitive people- well laid out rooms with clever design - somewhat annoying story telling before entering the room but you can zone out for this - helpful hints and tips from the staff when required - got a little gift for having the third fastest time everWill return for the new room soon!
Loved every second of it!. Fantastic room, enthusiastic guide, all around perfect experience. We made it 6 seconds before the universe exploded. Thank us later.

Excellent way to spend time with friends . Visiting friends in London and booked to go to this having never been to an escape game before. Had a really good time, and really enjoyed working out the clues. We bypassed a couple by accident, but the gamesmaster talked us through the bits where we struggled. Would highly recommend.

ClueQuest Chaos. This was a work team-building evening, which is usually quite lame. In this case, however, it was team building in every sense. We had a wonderful time, and you won't believe how fast an hour goes. The game has many different aspects, so everyone had a chance to shine. The buzz when we managed to finish within the time limit is indescribable. We're definitely going to do it again - a different room this time!
Great Family Day Out. This was booked for a birthday, what a fantastic family day out.Te staff were great and the experience amazing ,we are looking forward to booking our next adventure.

Fabulous day. This was our second visit to Clue Quest and we loved it just as much as the first time. Puzzles were great fun and challenging. Plenty for everyone to get involved with, and walkie-talkie prompts when really stuck.We made it out with 1.56 to spare! Really recommend a visit!
Amazing. Loved it. Fantastic way to spend an hour. Really good value for money, the staff were great and the experience amazing. Don't hesitate to book!

Teambuilding/Family building at its finest. The Cluequest location is in a less touristy area of London and was a nice walk from the Underground. Buses are available, but we preferred to walk. Our family of 5, including teenage kids had a wonderful time trying to use the clues to escape. It is a must-do at London for families. The Cluequest staff were great (and helpful with hints), and upon finishing (escaping), our kids asked to do another room. After Cluequest, take a walk along Regents river toward Camden. Great afternoon for teens!

Great family day out. I booked this for my Dad and the rest of our family for his birthday after a friend had participated in a similar game. Location was easy to find, and the guy that welcomed us in was very friendly. The 'story' was a bit tenuous, and in fact we didn't actually find the answer to it - it became more about escaping the room. The setup of the room/s was excellent and there was lots to do. My mum was a bit nervous about coming along as she didn't think she'd like being trapped in a room, and wasn't confident she'd know what to do. However, there was so much to look at, and so many potential clues to find, she was fine. The walkie talkie system worked well in giving us hints when we'd missed something obvious. Would love to know what happens if you DON'T solve the problem to escape! Thoroughly recommmend - we went for dinner afterwards and it was all we talked about!

Such good fun!!! Will go again!. This was such a fun experience and so different from anything we've done before. We went with our Dad (we're aged 24, 21 and 18) and were already planning our next visit!!! Can see how it would be good for groups of friends, work teams and younger families too. Great bonding experience. We throughly enjoyed, the staff were so friendly and helpful - we had James who made it really fun. I would definitely recommend!!!

Great fun. Four of us took part, it was easy to locate and the team gave a good welcome.The activity was harder than I thought, there were different puzzles for different types of minds, so each of us had the satisfaction of solving something. You have support throughout via a walkie talkie, nice to know if you get really stuck you can move on. Would love to do it again and would recommend

Absolutely fantastic- a must-do!. We've done escape room experiences in the past but this was by far the best one we've ever done. The staff are absolutely wonderful-engaging, friendly, helpful, and kind. The setting is great, very well thought out and user-friendly, and the escape rooms are just brilliant. The experience is well worth the money- whether it's a family fun day or a corporate team building event, the rooms are challenging, exhilarating and above all fun! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves from start to finish and would highly recommend!

60th Birthday Treat!. I wanted something that would appeal to my 15 year old and my 27 year old as well as my husband. We had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed the challenge! My youngest ransacked the place, my eldest used her considerable intelligence, my husband was methodical and I was... bemused! Such fun and something for every age. We did come to blows a couple of times, which must be fun for the people listening! Thoroughly recommend the experience - can't wait to do it again!

Another excellent room!. We've previously completed ClueQuest's other 2 rooms and this one is yet another challenging and fun room, with some great tech involved. The only comment I would make is that the room needs to be completed sequentially; we had a team of 5 and the way the room is set up is that, for the most part, all 5 people have to be doing the same thing. With other rooms, people can be doing different tasks at the same time. That being said, it's great fun! We had a boys team versus a girls team and, yet again, the girls won!

Great fun for the whole family!. I booked ClueQuest for my brother's birthday for a bit of evening entertainment! We played the game as a group of 6 (wide age range from early 20s to mid 60s) and all really enjoyed the game! I've played 2 escape games before, however this one was noticeably different. Without going into too much detail (don't want to ruin the surprise!), the décor of the room, range of interactions you had with the clues and creativity shown in some of the props/clues was superb. It was our choice to go against the recommendation and play as a 6 because we wanted to all be involved, however I'd say the optimum group size is about 4 - that gives everyone enough to do, without stretching the team too much. The game is designed to suit children and adults, some elements are looking for hidden objects, others are solving clues. The game is heavily themed and follows a narrative which I really enjoyed, it perhaps means however, that after completing all 3 games on offer you'd have to wait for a new game to be initiated to spark your interest. After the game we got a couple of nice tokens from the staff to take home to remember our experience by, a lovely touch. The facilities are modern, clean and spacious - this differs from some of the other escape games I've done which have clearly been done on a very low budget and are like going to someone's flat! A great experience - we escaped with 4 minutes to spare, thanks to the team for making my brother's birthday so much fun!

Fantastic setup and excellent family experience. Besides our older son, It was our first visit to an escape room and we enjoyed every minute of it.The room was very difficult but yet fun and challenging and with a little help we managed to move forward until we solved it. The riddles are built in a way that it requires a team work and everybody needs to participate and contribute which is great and rewardingWould highly recommend it ! (although a little expensive - 100 GBP for 5)

Fun event for our team. My team of 8 went to ClueQuest as a fun outing. We split into two groups but both groups did the same escape (they have multiple rooms). We had a great time figuring out the clues and managing to escape within the hour time.Highly recommend this for folks looking for something challenging and fun to do as a group.

Great fun if you like puzzles!. Cryptic clues came in all forms - mental and mildly physical and we were helped by one or two strategically placed clues. Great fun, not too difficult but challenging and highly recommended

Great Escape Game in London. Recently visited ClueQuest with my Family and we had a great time. Difficult (we made it out with 0:01 left on the clock), but not so complicated that my 14 and 10 year old children felt left out. The crew at ClueQuest made the experience very enjoyable and took great care of us. I highly recommend giving one of their games a try next time you're in London.

Prof. Blacksheep + Mr Q. = An Amazing Time!. We found it a little difficult to find the building as it is not extremely well-signed but we got there! THeir Google Maps directions are spot on but my phone's battery was low..... :-/ Great reception by staff; good furniture set up on entrance; very cleverly arranged and engaging quest (intermediate level); help throughout (just enough to make you realise that you are on the right track!); photo at the end. Just needed a coffee machine at Reception!An amazing experience and we will certainly do it again.Patricia Bird + 12 friends :-)

A briliiant, unique& fun experience. We loved this event. We were 2 adults and 2 teenagers - a great way to have a bit of fun and a bit of a bonding experience as well! A very positive experience for all of us even though we didnt manage to escape within the hour! it was great however to then actually be allowed to complete the game!Really good fun and we were very well looked after by the organisers.

A lot of fun and brilliantly set up. Four of us visited having never taken part in anything like this and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Luke was a fantastic guide for our team and made it engaging and entertaining. It is a really good event for a group of friends whether you like puzzles and games or not. They have multiple rooms so will definitely be back to test ourselves again.

Great Fun. We went here with a couple of friends (4 of us) and it was great fun.It was a great hour of pure fun and teamwork which made for a fantastic afternoon outWe are definitely going to go back to tackle the other puzzles.A guy called Will looked after us fantastically well - the service was fantastic.Thanks to ClueQuest and see you again soon.

Amazing hour of fun, suspense and horror when you realise you might not beat the clock...... Booked ClueQuest's Plan 52 Escape room and went in with an open mind, as an escape room newbie, I was not expecting much. We had a team of 5, two who had previously done escape rooms in the past when notably more excited before the game started. Staff were extremely friendly, professional and helpful. Once we were in the room, s***t got serious, an hour to escape, a story unfolding. Puzzles were not as easy to solve as I had hoped which really put the edge onto our team, we escaped with only 25 seconds left on the clock and what a rush it was. I immediately wanted to try their other rooms. Always would recommend this place.

Intense hour of fun. Went as a team event with 15 work colleagues not really knowing what to expect. WOW. 1 hour of very clever, ingenious fun trying to get out of a room no bigger than most people's living room. Well worth every penny and we saved the world with 46 seconds to spare.

Great people shame about the props. This is a really good and relatively inexpensive works trip and the staff are brilliant in all respect - really engaged and engaging - funny and helpful. The Clues and the quest do need a little more thought - some did not work at all and others were...clunky. We did have a lot of fun but it would be more fun if they tightened up the games / clues so that they actually do what they are supposed to do.
fun and innovative !. Went to cluequest with a few friends on my birthday and it was definitely the highlight of my evening. The staff are lovely and I can't wait to come back and do the other 2 !

So much fun ... even for 5 Frenchies!! Pas de problème pour les étrangers!. We were welcomed by lovely Julia who took time to explain everything and stopped when needed for me to translate into French for my nephew and nieces.Julia gave us the right amount of help when needed. The room was amazing and the props and technology really impressed us.Pas besoin de savoir parler très bien l'anglais..au moins une personne dans l'équipe doit pouvoir communiquer mais peut traduire pour les autres.We had an awesome experience and I would like to thank Julia again for being such a great host and so kind to us ...even if we were pretty slow at times!Will definitely go again!

Saving the World was fun!. The mission is simple: deactivate a bomb, save the world. The rules are simple: look for clues, that lead to other clues, to unlock the next piece of the puzzle. The path however, is not so simple!! Literally everything in the room means something, so be sharp!A great way to spend an hour or so with friends (or colleagues in a team building exercise!). I'd highly recommend doing this is you like a challenge and want to use your brain on an evening out! Now....for the next mission!

Great activity for friends, enjoyed our first time. Came here with a group of friends, 5 of us in total. Never having done anything like this before we did the first mission Plan:52. We successfully completed the mission with 12 minutes to spare and 0 clues used which I think was pretty good but we did have a bit of luck and didn't too stuck at any point. I was surprised at the quantity of tasks that needed solving in the allotted hour so you definitely needed to work quickly to solve everything in time and good team coordination is clearly a big factor. The staff were great, including the ones in the office sorting out booking issues. We all really enjoyed it and look forward to coming back for one of the other missions.

Great fun. We've done a few of these escape games now and booked this one as an activity for visiting family friends from the North. Its always difficult to find things that teens will join in with and enjoy. This is always without fail, the one activity that mine are always very positive about doing and really up for. ClueQuest was no exception. Well organised, friendly and a great game. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and can understand why they score so highly on the trip adviser ratings.

2nd time Just as good as the first. I completed the 3rd mission yesterday having been once before, and found again that ClueQuest has that perfect mix of panic,confusion and success that makes it so enjoyable! Can't recommend it enough.

Despite the fact that we were rubbish .... ... oh what fun we had. This is a really good set up, and the staff were great. Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to do something a bit different and we will return soon if only to try to do better next time!

Hen party competition!. We didn't know what to expect, but this activity was so entertaining, we were 2 teams competing against each other to escape the rooms . Clues were challenging but fun, we definitely used our brains and worked together ! Brill, will try again without a doubt!

Great fun for the whole family. The rooms are well designed and if you struggle with a particular clue, the staff members can give you hints over the radio. The great thing about this is if you are struggling on a particularly tricky bit you won't be sitting around getting frustrated.Basically the pace is good,
Amazing experience for the family. Great attraction. I have been twice and will be back for their third game. I have done quite a few escape games and ClueQuest ranks right in the top with a couple.

Exciting and very clever concept. Myself and three friends headed to Clue quest on the recommendation of another friend and must say what a fantastic idea. We were greeted at the door by a very friendly member of staff and were shown to some seats whilst the Clue quest concept was explained to us by Will, a very friendly and helpful member of the team, little did we know he would be a bit of a hero to us throughout our experience. We were then shown to our "room" where our challenge began and without giving too much away I can say we were met with lots of different challenges and clues to help us work out who the spy was and help us escape out of the room. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to try something different or just fancy a fun evening out, we can't wait to go back and try another "room".

Fantastic,challer, family fun. We did clue quest last week as a birthday present for my husband. We had 2 adults and 1 ten year old, we found it very challenging but lots of fun. We will be talking about the clues for ages. I think 3 or 4 people would work best, any more and you may start arguing. There is just so much going on at times is seems overwhelming but you gradually work out each clue. It is very easy to get to from kings cross and makes me want to try another escape game again.

Amazingly and lovingly built, and a great challenge. This was my third time visiting clueQuest, and it's managed to outdo itself once again. This puzzle game room was brilliantly designed with a high tech element and also plenty of original ideas. Tremendous fun. Very enthusiastic staff and just the right amount of nudges when you stall out. We completed Revenge of the Sheep with 5:19 left on the clock and having used 2 clues.

An amazingly awesome experience!. This was our second visit to ClueQuest and we were even more hyped-up than before. The anticipation of being locked in another set of rooms and trying to escape from them in under an hour had us all buzzing with excitement. We were not disappointed, Plan 52 was fiendishly clever and we had so much fun finding our way out. We did much better than our last mission and found the help given to us by our wonderful guide was just right to keep us moving forward. If I could, I would give ClueQuest a 5+ rating as the whole experience is brilliantly managed. The staff in the centre are charming, patient and superb hosts. We will treasure the photo they took of us after our escape (it looks like we have all just run a marathon) and the family-building experience we shared. Keep up the good work guys!

Excellent Experience - Highly Recommended. From the reception to the briefing area you are immediately involved in 'the game'. The staff are very enthusiastic and encourage you to get in the right frame of mind to become an excellent game player. Before you know it you are in the room from which you must escape and the clock is ticking. No spoilers here but Operation Blacksheep is a brilliant quest and it left you wanting to do another immediately afterwards because you learnt something about yourself and your group when you were puzzling your way out! What a fabulous experience which has been carefully tailored to meet a wide audience. I would highly recommend and cant wait to go back to escape again!

Brilliant experience!. Had a lot of fun at ClueQuest, I like the idea that they try to link their different rooms. We completed Plan 52 and will definitely be back to complete the other 2. We had an 11 year old with us who was extremely happy that we managed to solve the puzzles and escape, he felt like a genius for the rest of the day :) Would definitely recommend it. The staff are awesome and they make it special by giving you your official ID card and group picture to commemorate the day.

Quite possibly the most fun I've ever had . A group of us did Plan 52 a few months ago and returned at the weekend to attempt Operation BlackSheep. We completed Plan 52 with 8 minutes to spare, and Operation BlackSheep with 12. Close enough to make it exciting, but not so close that we were scratching each other's eyes out! I genuinely think this is the best way to spend an hour, quite possibly the most fun I've ever had! I didn't know how Operation BlackSheep was going to live up to how amazing Plan 52 was, but if anything it exceeded expectations! I cannot recommended ClueQuest enough, and we will definitely be returning for Revenge of the Sheep.

ClueQuest. What a great way to spend an hour!! Went with my family (2 teenage girls) and we all loved it. You get a great buzz every time you solve a clue and we have been talking about it together for a few days after.The staff, we had Sofia to help us are brilliant from the explanation to the after care.Would recommend this to any family or business who want to something a little different to bond you all.

Excellent adventure for broad age range. For a short but immersive and interactive family outing, this trip proved to be a real success to all 10 of us involved. We booked two 'rooms' of the original adventure and comprised one group of mixed adults/teens and one group of 11-12 year olds. The support provided to both groups by staff was excellent, the level of the challenges varied and appropriate - and inclusive to all present. As groups need to be getting on with a number of tasks simultaneously, there was little space for any individuals to dominate either group, which was a relief in relation to the 11-12 year olds! I can see this being enjoyable for adults of any age, and tweenie children and above.

Another brilliant visit. Came back to attempt another challenge (this time Operation Black Sheep) and enjoyed it just as much as last time. A brilliant activity to do with the 2 young adults in our family with everyone involved and working as a team. Have recommended it to friends who have all loved it as well. Really pleased that, in the new larger premises, there are more rooms, including a new (3rd) mission, so that you don't need to book so far in advance meaning not so long to wait for a slot! Such a cleverly thought out experience. Already looking at dates for our next visit.

Fun for all ages. The family were given a voucher for Christmas and it turned out to be the best present ever! The puzzles were challenging and fun, kept the whole family entertained and not a single argument!Will definitely be back for a go at one of the other rooms.

Fun experience. Very clever and well thought out challenge. There were 5 in our team, not sure we would have managed with any less than 5 of us in the given time, as we all contributed equally. We loved the experience. Its something unique to do in London and would definitely recommend it to anyone interested in this sort of thing.

Such a great thing to do for family fun. I've played a lot of online room escape games with DD2, so we thought we'd try out a live version for a holiday treat. We had a brilliant time solving puzzles and cracked it (with a bit of help from our gamesmaster) even though we were a team of two.

Two teams, only one winner . We visited for a friend's birthday and had too many people to all take part together so we had two teams competing against each other in separate rooms doing the same challenge. The unknown element of how the other team was doing added to the excitement and the clues were all very clever! Really good fun!

Clue quest . We had a brilliant time here. I took my daughter who is 14 and 3 friends as a birthday celebration. They loved every minute and worked really well as a team to solve the clues.
Brilliantly thought out, absorbing and entertaining - you really feel like a super spy. I would recommend it - we will definitely be going again.

Excellent fun. Four of us enjoyed a frantic, focused and fun hour trying to solve puzzles and escape the room. No specific knowledge is required and a lot of thought has gone into the whole experience. We all came away wanting to do another and would highly recommend.

Such fun!. Well we can't tell any secrets as we are all now agents, but this was pitched at the right level. Different puzzles kept you thoroughly entertained as a team and individuals. We'll be back to try them all!

Good fun for a first experience!. I wasn't sure what to expect but what I was greeted with was fun friendly staff and a good, challenging puzzle game. The puzzles were interesting and varied in difficulty and has certainly given me the bug for these type of games going forward.

Good fun. This escape game was lots of fun but definitely one of the more difficult ones I've done. The staff are friendly and helpful.
I've been in more imaginative escape games but this has some fun puzzles. Worth doing if you've played a couple of games before.

Addictive! . Cluequest is so much fun! Perfect group number is 3-4. You get an hour to solve your way out of a room/series of rooms. Different difficulty levels available. We've been twice now, starting with the easier one, then coming back for the more difficult one, and this time with a strategy for best approach as well!Highly recommend for a birthday or as an activity with a small number of friends and then dinner straight after for the necessary debrief!!!

16th Birthday family adventure. My daughter asked to do clue quest for her birthday. She had been before and loved it. Staff were great at introducing the aim of the quest and we had a great time solving the puzzles. A great experience for family friends or colleagues. Will definitely be back!

So fun - book 2 in a row!!. I have done ClueQuest twice now - it is so addictive. I always come out wanting to do it again, straight away. The team are lovely and it is awesome fun - great for families, friends or teams.

Really good fun - the fastest hour of your life!. Had a great time here for my husband's 31st birthday. We were 4 adults and all escape room novices.Don't want to give too much away but the game is brilliant and not too difficult puzzle-wise, just a lot to get through in the time. You could definitely do this with teenagers and mature children. Staff are really welcoming and friendly and will help you along if you get a bit stuck doing the puzzles.I suspect there may have been an error in our room set-up but it didn't matter much and we were given 6 extra minutes to escape to make up for it, only 2 of which we needed.If you're curious about ClueQuest then don't wait any longer - just book. Once you're done and the fun is over you're in an interesting part of town: we went for a lovely short walk down by the canal, admiring the canal boats, and had a glass of Champers in St Pancras to top it all off. Wonderful experience which we will definitely be repeating. Looking forward to going back to try one of the other games.

Great family fun!. We experienced an escape game on our recent visit to London from the US. The staff was very welcoming and gave us all the details we needed to get started. Our 2 teens got very competitive and thankfully we solved all the puzzles and riddles by working together. It was a great family fun night!

A Great Escape!. It was a birthday treat from my daughter to her hubby. Great set-up. Fastest hour ever with some tense moments. We scraped through - just! It's not easy, although no degree required for the clues, just check and re-check because the thing is usually staring you in the face. Very grateful for the JIT tips and hints over the walkie talkie without which we would have missed vital info. Enjoyed every agonizing minute and now want to do the next room challenge!

Superb family fun. All five of us thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We took our three teenage sons. The quest was challenging but fun and our gamesmaster gave us just the right amount of hints when needed. Our teenagers were positively buzzing when they came out and we are all looking forward to another quest together when we are next looking to spend some family time together. Think the boys would like to have the experience with their friends, too, as a birthday present. Thoroughly recommended!

Engaging, exhilirating & exciting. This was fantastic. This was my first go at an escape room and it did not disappoint. We had an hour to escape 3 rooms. I can't give anything away but it really tests your reasoning and team working skills. It was thoroughly exciting and I would strongly recommend going. I would do it with a minimum of 4 people per team.
Brilliant family fun!. Great way to spend time with teenagers! Challenges were varied testing logic and intuition. Enthusiastic staff, good standard of facility. Teenage boys want to go back asap!!

Excellent fun!. Booked online. There are different themes. We were taken very well care of and our host had our back the whole time. Range of puzzles appealing to logic and intuition . Teenager and child enjoyed working together on it.

Good starting point. Clue quest was the first escape game I have ever done and I think it was a great starting point for me! It was fairly welcoming and the games master was very attentive. I also really liked the keep sake at the end. The venue was pretty good although not as elaborately decorated as the ones I've been to since. The game was also pretty good and they had some interesting puzzles. Especially the last hurdle. I felt the decoration could have been better overall, and some of the puzzles more reDily worked. Overall I would say it was a good experience and I liked it, although some other rooms may be more challenging and more theatrical!

Absolutely amazing!!. Had the BEST time completing Operation Blacksheep! It was my first experience of the room escapes, and it certainly lived up to its reputation. The planning that must go in to getting the rooms set up is second to none, it's incredibly clever and was one of the best times I've had with my friends. Despite the pressure of the clock ticking away we still had a really good laugh, and even better we managed to escape! Would highly recommend and can't wait to try another one of the rooms!

Great fun - exceeded expectations!. Had a really fun time, and would highly recommend. Had been looking forward to this for ages, and exceeded my expectations. 4 of us, in one of the more basic games. All had plenty to do: challenging, but achievable, and a good mix of problems to solve, things to find, and clues to figure out.Staff were great, really well supported to make sure we got the most out of our day. They went above and beyond, and even compensated us because the room set-up want quite right, even though we hadnt noticed. Will definitely be back to try another!

Great fun. What a nice experience. Great fun for all the family , we were there with our grown up children and really enjoyed the experience.
Well thought out, very clever. We would definitely do this again.

Best day out ever!!!!! . Incredibly clever and one of the best experiences I've had with friends!
It's like The Crystal Maze meets Fort Boyard meets 2016...
So we'll designed and definitely one event not to be missed!
Agent Brains xxxx
P.s lovely staff too! Definitely would go on another mission soon!

Great Group activity even better booking two rooms making it a competition!. Booked this as a surprise for my wife. Very fun activity as a group, makes you think and something different. They put alot of thought into the escape room. No way cheap or tacky. Would highly recommend it and the staff are very friendly. Booked 2 rooms as 2 groups of 3 managed to complete the event in the time limit and was alot of fun. Would go again to complete the other rooms.

Great fun, made even more memorable by our amazing host Harriet. Me and my boyfriend came here with my brother and his girlfriend. The place is very professionally done and the actual quest was put together very well. We all had an amazing time. Our host, Harriet, was in particular very good. She was great at getting us to buy in to the game and was very chatty and friendly. A great laugh, I would highly recommend, if a bit on the pricey side.

Family fun with older kids . This our second time playing this sort of game. We went with another family , and had 2 identical rooms. Parents vs teens ( parents lost!) Really friendly staff, and a fun activity for families with older kids.

Great birthday fun. Booked this for my sister's birthday and we had a fab hour of fun. I've done an escape room in Manchester and this one was so much better - better concept, puzzles and more slick. Our host was friendly and got in to the spirit of it all, which helped us too, and gave my sister a free magnet as it was her birthday. There were three of us in total which felt fine but I do wonder whether we would have felt cramped had there been just one or two more people in there with us. However we had a great time and would happily recommend!

First experience of a Live Escape Room. We had a group of 5 who were all new to this type of experience. I booked it after reading reviews and searching online. ClueQuest was voted of the best but also most affordable.It worked out to be £19.80pp and they were prompt with starting the experience. From the get go, we were immersed in a world where we were the agents! My friend did think it was a bit 'naf' in the beginning ( perhaps more suitable for children) but I LOVED IT!Anyways, we left feeling that it was def worth the money- great afternoon out and cannot wait to do the other ones!

Fantastic hour of fun!. This place is an escape-the-room style game, with clues and keys galore. You have an hour, which adds a bit of drama to your escape, and a radio to communicate with your Intelligence Officer (a staff member) who provides clues when you need them to ensure you're never stuck without an idea of what to do. A really well implemented system and our Intelligence officer was really friendly and helpful. Would recommend this to anyone who has an afternoon free in London!

Good fun. This is the second one of these escape room I've done now and whilst it was good I did think the other one was better. This one was ok but lots of just finding keys and numbers. Good fun hour though. We beat the time by about 10 mins which was good (according to the woman who was our helper). Definitely recommend though

Great Fun. A great family experience which was a lot of fun.I'd suggest it would be ideal for children from 12 upwards.A clever concept, but it was the friendly, helpful staff, who provided just the right amount of hints and clues to keep things moving along but without making it too easy, that made the whole event very enjoyable.Everyone we met seemed to have had a great time.

AWESOME! . Best fun thing we've done in London to date. A MUST on your London must do list.
We laughed the whole way through and time flew. We did it but only just

Fantastic experience - fun, teamwork, problem solving. A truly fantastic experience, which really gets your problem solving and teamwork skills going. I went with three others and completed Plan52, and i look forward to going again to complete the other games. Couldn't recommend highly enough

Funtastic!. Who knew how much fun a family could have in 1 hour shut in a room?! We were more clueless than cluequest to begin with, but Jon, our friendly, enthusiastic agent, helped us just enough to keep the pace up and the excitement revving! Everyone in the group seemed to add something and it was really bonding and what a change to be together without someone being distracted by their phone.We can't wait to return to complete the next mission.
Great fun!. We went with our team of school teachers, slit into 3 teams, great fun had by all! It was hard enough to keep everyone engaged and no one lost interest.

Revenge of the Sheep - another fantastic game from ClueQuest!. I've been playing escape rooms for two and a half years now, and during that time I've played over 50 games. I've played amazing games, I've played terrible games and pretty much everything in between. It's safe to say that ClueQuest is right up there with the best of them. In the London scene it's one of my three favourite games (and I've played 30+), and the other two in the group are both significantly more expensive at £30-40 per person.If you've never played an escape room before, then start with Operation Blacksheep or Plan 52 which are a little easier, but still great quality games. Their best game, though, is definitely the new addition, "Revenge of the Sheep". It's a wonderful mix of puzzles spanning a wide range of types, from mechanical to technological and from obvious to subtle. They've judged the difficulty level perfectly - I think this will be a good challenge for any escapers, whatever their experience - you *can* get out without clues, but it will be incredibly tough! Don't be afraid of playing because it sounds difficult though - your games maker will be on hand to help you if you get stuck.Speaking of which, the games makers are all very friendly and do a great job before and after. You really get the feeling that they're part of the team and not just employees going through the motions - they seemed genuinely excited when we escaped!I'm not sure why you're still reading - go and book your game!

Revenge of the Sheep. We were one of the first teams to trial the new room "Revenge of the Sheep". We have completed 4 other escape games in the past, but hadn't got around to trying either of the other cluequest games. After playing the new game I can definitely say we will be back at some point to complete the other two!First off the waiting area is very welcoming and the staff are super friendly, making us feel at ease while we waited to start our game.The briefing was clear, and then we were off!Can't say too much as I don't want to spoil any surprises but the puzzles were fun and there were a few surprises along the way which we really enjoyed.After we completed our mission, the staff sat with us for a while and discussed the game, and their enthusiasm for the job really shone through.Will definitely be back!

Revenge of the Sheep: brilliant fun. As long term Cluequest fans we couldn't wait to get our hooves on Revenge of the Sheep and I'm pleased to say their third game is absolutely amazing. It makes better use of advanced technology than ever and without giving anything away there are a few genuine 'wow' moments throughout the time in the room. The Cluequest team are massively welcoming, enthusiastic and have a brilliant new home just north of Kings Cross. All three Cluequest adventures share the same theme and characters which really sets them apart from the competition. If you've done a CQ adventure before then you'll love Revenge of the Sheep - if you're new to CQ or escape games altogether you're definitely in for a treat too.Highly recommended.

Don't waste time reading reviews - book ClueQuest now!!!!!. ClueQuest is brilliant!It's like a cross between the Crystal Maze and Kryptonfactor but to really enjoy it the first time, don't read up to much about it - not fully knowing what to expect is part of what makes it so great the first time.My mates and I have done the first two challenges and with a third challenge launching this month, we have plans to go again.A lot of thought has gone into ClueQuest - not just the challenge itself, but the staff, atmosphere, decor and little extras.One bit of advice, ClueQuest is based a bus journey from Kings Cross Station and the particular area it is set up in is a bit of a dive. So if you want food/drinks beforehand, go somewhere else - you won't find anywhere decent near ClueQuest.

We had a lot of fun and the time flew! Revenge Trial.. Somehow, our session that I booked over four months ago was over-booked, so they got us to trial the new game 'Revenge of Black Sheep'. This was the first of these 'scape room' games that we have played, so we didn't know what to expect. They watched us find the clues and if we were spending too long in an area or getting stuck, they gave us hints so we would solve the game in time. We had a really fun time, but I have to give it a 4 out of 5 because we had to trial this as the game we booked (52) was over-booked. We did receive passes for our next game for free though, but for the inconvenience, I have to score a 4...I'd give it 4.5 out of five though just for the mess-up.

So much fun. This is one of the best escape game experiences I've had in London, very well put together and just the right amount of clues given while you're in there. I'd highly recommend going with 2 teams and seeing who gets out first, the excitement at the end adds to the experience.

Just AMAZING!. Our first room escape experience and most definitely not our last, we did the original room Plan 52, and it was just brilliant. Really challenging, not too many clues needed and we made it out with only a few minutes to spare! Cannot WAIT to go and try Operation BlackSheep.

Amazing experience!. We've did a similar experience before with another company but I think Cluequest just edges it.The tasks were challenging but fun at the same time. We just about managed to escape! (After a bit of confusion at first when we thought we had escaped, to find out that there was one more door to open!)Thoroughly recommend to anyone who fancies trying something a bit different!

Operation BlackSheep. . Absolutely brilliant evening! Booked with work colleagues for team night out and we all loved it! Really well put together, great story and very entertaining!Proudly only one radio message and no clues used! Out at 6m39s!Looking forward to your new room/story to try!

One of the best!. This is the 4th escape room I have done and definitely one of my favourites. Our host Michael was great, funny and welcoming. We explained to him at the end that we had been to another escape in Birmingham (Escape Live) and had since been informed that some of the puzzles there were copied from clue quest. This did mean that we had a slight helping hand with a couple of the puzzles inside the room, but as there were only two of us it was a good help along the way. Michael was great with hints and tips giving us a nudge along the way when we were struggling, but didn't make things too easy for us either. We managed to escaped after being given a little bit of extra time as we were on the final puzzle at 60 minutes we managed to get out after another 4 added minutes. We will definitely be back to clue quest to try out the other games, the only downside is there is no option for two players meaning we did have to pay the extra for 3 people which is a shame. However to make up for it we each got a free magnet with our picture on. This was a really nice touch. Although this game did work out more expensive for us as a two I wouldn't mind paying the extra again for such a good game. There is clearly a lot of time and effort put in here and the hospitality was great too.
Amazing. Visiting from LA and this was the best one we tried. I've done over 80 room escapes and this is the one in London you should not miss!!

ClueQuest - They have awesome reviews for a reason. Me and my wife did both rooms back to back in February. We had heard that they were good and definitely agree.The location is great, the staff are knowledgeable and very friendly and the room design is excellent.Very well thought out rooms that their designers must have worked very hard on, some really cool tech puzzles that really capture the imagination.Highly recommended!

One Of The Best Escape Games.. This is one of the best escape games I've done (I think I've done 9 now across England/New York) & one of the few we've managed to escape from.Short walk from Kings Cross Station, nothing too far, easy to find no problems there and the exterior has good signage so you know exactly where you're heading. Really friendly welcome by the staff, made us feel at ease offered us use of the toilets and a drink etc really nice which you don't always get. The puzzles were quite challenging at the start but we always seem to suffer with brain freeze when we start these games! Unfortunately we were kinda given an unfair advantage as many of the elements in this game have been stolen by a company in Birmingham which we did discuss with the 'Game Masters' at the end of the game.I Won't give any spoilers for the puzzles or the story of the game but there are different puzzles in this game that I've not seen anywhere else! Our 'Game Master' would occasionally throw us a hint on the TV when we were in need which was helpful as it was like he actually wanted us to escape where as other companies just leave you to it. We were only a two but we managed to escape with an additional 4 or so minutes I Can't quite remember, would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking at trying one of these games, we will definitely be back for more, just a pity that we have to pay for 3 people as we are only ever a duo but we did get some fridge magnets which is another thing not offered by other escape games.Our 'Game Master' was Michael he was a hoot, really nice, helpful and friendly, hopefully he's gone and researched this Birmingham game we informed him of.Will be back to play more!

A total must if you're in london. This will be the second time that I have been to ClueQuest to complete one of their rooms and it didn't disappoint! From the moment you step in, to the final puzzle you will have a great time. I've done several puzzle rooms before and this is by far one of my favorites. If you're experienced in puzzle rooms or not you will have an amazing time with friends or family trying to work together to get out I can't wait for the new room to open at the end of this month so I can go back a third time!

Amazing experience. Went with friends and family. We booked two rooms so competed against each other. From the moment you step through the doors you are made to feel welcome. The game itself was well planned and we had a brilliant time. We would highly recommend going.. Just beware 60 minutes goes quickly

Great way to spend an hour. I visited ClueQuest this morning with 4 colleagues/friends, it was great fun. I don't want to say too much that may ruin the experience for others, but suffice to say we escaped our room with 40 seconds to spare... so a full hour of entertainment and clue solving. I would recommend this experience to most - families, friends, colleague for birthdays, team building or just something to do in your free time. Weekend booking is essential. Very well organised and great set up.
Interesting and Fun!!. Very well organised and had a amazing time. Was the first time i went and gets you really thinking outside the box. Great team-building and fun activity
Great Experience!. Looking for something fun to do as a family - LOVED clueQuest ... top notch from beginning to end and so much fun!
Brilliant. A great concept managed really well. We were made to feel very welcome and the staff made sure our experience flowed so that we were always facing something new! Brilliant.

Fantastic . We didn't know what to expect as I had booked after looking at reviews on trip advisor .We had an absolutely amazing time haven't had so much fun and laughed so much in ages great place to go well done clue quest we will definitely be coming to do another mission
SO MUCH FUN!. Highly recommended... fantastic time! Challenging, really gets you thinking and working together with your friends and/or family! something different as a social activity :)

Excellent escape room experience!. The session was well organized and the staff were very friendly and enthusiastic, making the experience excellent. The storyline was very convincing and you get sucked into the game. We managed to escape the room with 6 seconds to spare, I am already planning my next visit! I would definitely recommend this experience!

Hen do fun! . Absolutely amazing, 19 of us in a group split in to different rooms, we all had a brilliant time! Such a great idea, and good to do something different! Highly recommend, thank you clue quest!

Best thing to do in London. Amazing activity to take part in. Everything about it was brilliantly conceived and executed. Really well looked after too by the guys who work there. Honestly couldn't recommend it more.

Cluequest review. Thank you all for a very enjoyable experience yesterday afternoon- great fun and a great thing to do for our team away day. thank you for the free photo of us all, this was good for communication, and working collaboratively. Highly recommend this escape room and its good your looking at ways to make improvements and introducing a new game/challenge in March.

Great 40th team fun!. Loved our afternoon at Cluequest, delighted with our success (with a few clues) can't wait to have another shot now we have our heads round what to do. Richard was ace thank you....

Wie will be back Me Q!!. It's a smooth operation over at CQ Headquarters.The people there are awesome and the event itself did not disappoint.Really fun & definitely a serious test of the brain - don't go unless you're prepared to get your thinking cap on from the start.We will definitely return to do the next ones in the series.

Record Breaking Fun. As far as Escape Games go, definitely one of the best. We went as part of a stag do on yesterday evening and were in the OBS room. Great theme. Love the door. Professional. The staff are boundlessly enthusiastic and their brief was helpful and to the point. No object will be used more than once and all padlocks have a line of reference. The room was great. Very few red herrings. Structured with several discrete stages. Clever puzzles and problems requiring teamwork and good communication. It does look like most people make it out though (all 14 of us made it out), so perhaps it can be a bit longer? Though, definitely a great experience and can't recommend it enough! Also, if you break our record and do it in less than 30 mins they'll give you mugs and let you into the command room (which was awesome)! :D

Great fun!. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it was a great way to spend an hour. The game was very well organised and it all got rather tense! We had 9 secs to spare before we escaped. Would recommend it highly but maybe not for very young children. Our son is 7 and enjoyed it so much.

Great group fun!. My group had so much fun trying to complete the 'mission' (even though we weren't successful!). The staff was very nice. We thought it was a little hard to find, and we were waiting outside for a few minutes before someone could let us in. The 'mission' was challenging and very fun!
Great time!. Very good experience, the cluequest team were very nice and helpful. A lot of laughs and excitement!

Very well thought out, and lots of fun. The staff were fantastic and their enthusiasm really made it for me. The game is very very clever and just the right level of difficulty that you don't sail through it, but not so hard it's no fun either. If you're stuck the staff can give you little prods along the way, just enough to keep the game going. Really really lots of fun, and I would recommend to anyone.

There are better Escape Room Games. I have tried a few escape room games in London and thought that this was the weakest I had tried. It was not nearly as challenging and as a team we often found that we were standing around waiting for others to complete a task before we could move onto another one. In other Escape Room Games we had going that different people were always completing different tasks simultaneously keeping everyone occupied. Because the overall game was not as challenging I would reccomend is for younger children who were in their early teens and up.
A fantastic time!. A brilliant experience with great puzzles, friendly staff, and awesome design. Fantastic all round! Bravo!

Brilliant fun!. Our friend had booked us into this for a surprise on our overnight stay in London. It was brilliant & we all want to do the other room now! Really fun, interesting and something a bit different. We were very happy we finished with 5 minutes to spare. I would highly recommend it & I'm pretty sure we will be back when we come to London again!

A Great Way To Spend an Evening. I was bought a four person voucher for my Birthay and it was definitely one of the best presents.On the day we were running late and the staff at Cluequest were really helpful and reassuring. The place itself was easy to find and close to King Cross station. Once there the staff were brilliant and really set the mood. The game itself was challenging with a mix of different puzzles, the radio and occasional hints just to nudge us in the right direction were very helpful! I would recommend this to anyone and will be looking to return to try my hand at a different escape.

Fun. This was a fun activity to do that requires good communication and team work. If you start to miss things then your assigned staff member will give you advice. Would definitely go again! They have different quests and challenges with different levels of difficulty too so not just a one time visit!

Excellent Experience. This game is the best thing I did in my trip to London. I have seen ClueQuest is game number One in TripAdvisor's recommendations, so I booked with them to try it.It started with a gentle welcoming from the staff and he gave us a brief about our mission. They make you feel that you are true agent and you have to save the world.Some puzzle are easy while some are hard. But fortunately we succeed to complete the puzzle and save the world.
Family half term fun. Wonderful experience, got us all thinking and we loved it. The ClueQuest team looked after us really well. Hugely enjoyable and definitely want to do again.

Plan 52 and Operation Blacksheep FANTASTIC. I did both of Cluequests escape games and loved both of them. My favourite was Operation Blacksheep. Full of surprises, twists and turns! This was my 8th escape game and it was my No.1 favourite in England! A fully immersive experience, and despite doing lots of escape games, this was in no way predictable and had new aspects. Went with my dad and friend and was a perfect team size. Enough for everyone to do little bits each and participate in the fun! Would recommend to anyone!!!

Fab escape rooms!. My friends, Fiancé and I have done about 13 escape rooms so far across London, 2 of which have been at ClueQuest - Plan 52 and Operation Blacksheep. ClueQuest stands out amongst most as the theming is good, the puzzles are different and they really change your mind and team work.The staff are friendly and the whole experience is fun for all.If you're looking for an activity with lots of challenging team fun, you should definitely book one of the rooms here! ....We'll be back for the next room when it's open!

Family Team!. I took my sons to see how their minds really work It was the first time we had been to ClueQuest and we absolutely loved it!!The hour went past so quickly but we managed to escape with 6 minutes to spare with no help. We will definitely return to try the new game you are devising. Thank you.

Utterly fab way to have fun with kids!. We went as a team of 2 adults and 3 children age 12,11 and 10 and it was just perfect for that age group. Without much of a strategy we just got stuck in, flinging stuff everywhere, running around like mad, no coordination whatsoever, just chaos but we managed to accomplish our mission with a tiny bit of time to spare. How we did it i have no idea but we came out buzzing, the kids loved it, lots of ' that was awesome Mum' so in short a real treat and a crowd pleaser.Highly recommended.

Superb escape game! Will be heading back.. Really good game, excellent staff who run things like clockwork. The game is brilliant, we played blacksheep and would return when the new game in launched.Thanks!!!

Great fun. This was a Christmas present for our family and we were not sure what to expect. It turned out to be a brilliant event which we all thoroughly enjoyed. We had great fun solving the clues and actually worked as a team without any arguments! Can't wait to go back and try our hand at Operation Black Sheep.

Fab day out with my partner and his sister - highly recommended!. We had a great time doing this escape game. Done a few before but this had some new puzzles and fun things which completely stumped us! Got out 3 min before time was up. Highly recommended!

Sherlock by name.... Having the family name 'Sherlock', I went in to this experience determined to escape! Myself and a group of friends visited ClueQuest and we're not disappointed. Go in with no preconceptions, and think logically! Such an amazing time. Very fun, and creates just the right amount of tension! We escaped, with 5 minute to spare! Must do again!!

Great fun! Want to go back immediately!. Have tried both of the puzzles now, black sheep with friends and plan 52 with my family. Both times had such a great time, the puzzles are clever and interesting - the difficulty is challenging but anyone can do well/ badly. Managed to get out with 9 minutes to spare but it was very hard work! Want to go back straight away, lovely staff who make it very exciting :)

Tried both - Black Sheep is best. We tried both games here... PLAN52 and Operation Black Sheep.Both excellent games. We preferred Black Sheep of the two as slightly more atmospheric. Padlocks can be a bit fiddly and not always open easily.Really good puzzles, including several "team" elements.
Really great fun. We weren't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised staff were really friendly the whole experience was amazing definitely going again

Actually what it says on the tin... Justly deserves high rating... . Having spotted ClueQuest on TripAdvisor we visited as a family (mum, dad 3x teenagers) not quite knowing what to expect, except that it would be different. And it was and it was great fun. Clever puzzles to solve with a helping hand a shortwave radio away. Great fun and really satisfying to finish. If you want an alternative to museums or high thrills ClueQuest is well worth a visit.

Really good way to spend an hour!. Four of us went to ClueQuest, had an amazing time. It really was a lot of fun, and the game was really well thought out. It needed a lot of teamwork to solve the puzzle, and an hour flew by. There is a lot of concurrent activity, so it means that each member of the team can be doing something, rather than one or two people being able to take the lead. We will be going back for new games!

Great fun for all the family!. We went here during half term with our 2 children (12 and 15). It was so much fun. If you like puzzles and remember the Crystal Maze, then this is for you. it really makes you work as a team and listen to each other. Our kids thoroughly enjoyed this and we would definitely do it again. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and made us feel really welcome.Afterwards we walked along the canal to Camden too, which was lovely.The one downside for this is the cost. At £90 for an hour, it is alot of money.
Family fun!. Really great way to spend an hour. Challenge your brain, work as a team and can you escape before time is up? Lots of fun. Highly recommended.

Great fun - really well done! Mum & two kids. I was there yesterday with my two kids (12 and 9) and we all absolutely enjoyed it. The guy who looked after us was very friendly and did a great job and the puzzles in our escape room were really well thought through. The hour went SO QUICK. My daughter is 9 and she really enjoyed the game but I would agree with their website that kids shouldn't be much younger than that, 8 could be just about ok.

Just the best family fun!. We visited as a family of 4 (kids are 14 &11) in half term and had the best hour of fun. We all had our moments of genius and worked brilliantly as a team. This was our first escape room experience and we will definitely be back. Highly recommend this as a great family bonding activity and we kept talking about it for days after, so obviously made an impact.

Great fun for everyone including teenage boys !. We booked this as a family of 4 including 2 teenage boys who can be hard to please. We had never done anything like this before so were a bit apprehensive as had no idea what to expect. The puzzles were challenging but we managed to escape with 2 clues and 1 minute to spare. The whole concept did take a bit of getting used to and i'm sure we'd be quicker now that we've done it once . We will definitely be going back for more !

Really good fun - would definitely recommend!. A group of 4 of us went last night and it was such great fun. The staff were really friendly and welcoming and the whole experience was great. I would definitely recommend this as a fun evening out,

Incredible fun experience with plenty of surprises!. I've been to ClueQuest twice now, once to complete Plan52 and once for the Blacksheep. Both times were equally as exciting. First time I went with work and second time with my boyfriend and friends. Both quests have a similar level of difficulty and surprises. So glad to have escaped in the nick of time on both occasions, with around 2 mins to spare! The staff are lovely and spent time after we escaped to do a really interesting debrief where they were more than happy to answer all our questions. Can't wait for another quest to be designed :)

Great team building exercise!. Spent a great hour here yesteday afternoon with my team of 6. Completed Plan 52 with three minutes to spare, and the whole team had a great time. Fantastic experience, can't recommend it highly enough!

Escape the room fun. We booked this as a group of 5 adults having been to something similar before.The staff were very friendly especially Riley who looked after us that day.The rooms were fairly large with plenty for each of us to do. The puzzles required some thought but were not too hard.We escaped with 1 clue with just over 13 minutes to spare. We will definitely be coming back to try rooms 2 and 3, hopefully next time we can get out with no clues.

Work Social Evening. This was our second visit to clueQuest and it did not disappoint!!The whole team had a great time and we are already planning our next visit when the new room is ready!! Excellent group activity.

Corporate Team Building. I booked this venue for a team building / fun exercise for our team at work. We had a large number to cater for and ClueQuest were brilliant in going the extra mile to accomodate us!All of my emails were replied to within a few hours and the team were all so helpful and made the booking proceess so easy!So much good feedback from everyone who attended!! great fun and well organised :)
Brilliant time. Played here last weekend. Very enjoyable activity as a family. We will definitely be back. Many thanks.

The most fun I had on a Saturday night in ages. Visited ClueQuest for my friends birthday at the weekend where we put ourselves into teams of 4 or 5 as there was 13 of us that went.We all played the same escape game so that we were all doing the same thing and could have a bit of banter about who won!Without giving too much away I have to say it was a fantastic game and a really enjoyable mix of logic, problem solving and providing you all get along, working as a team! The tasks were well thought out and keep you on your toes, plus if you know your up against others in another room it made us want to beat them more!The whole time we were there I really enjoyed it and would happily go back again to try a different game.I suppose if I had to be critical it is quite expensive at £20 each when you think there could be 5 in a room which is £100 straight away. However I suppose there is costs for running and maintaining the place plus paying the staff who run it. For the enjoyment level though I did not begrudge paying it.I would strongly recommend ClueQuest to anyone who wants a fun hour or so trying something you don't do every day. Oh and my team won to make it that bit better!
Hen party fun . Came here for a friend's hen party and we split up into groups of 4, it was a great way to get the group interacting! The quest was lots of fun to do - would happily return!
Brilliant fun. We went as a group of 8 (2 teams of 4) from work - everyone had a fantastic time, thoroughly recommend.

BOOK IT!!!!. I got this as a gift for my boyfriend's birthday. When he not so subtly mentioned escape games I was a little apprehensive. I booked it for four of us and it was honestly the best gift I have ever got anyone (and myself!). It is so much fun. All four of us couldn't be more different and we all loved it.
