You really get lost in it and it is so much more professional and real than you could hope for. For someone who winced at spending money on an escape game I am a convert! Booking the second one asap. You'll come out full of adrenalin searching for a pub to talk about the experience!!!
Rach. Fabulous fun for anyone who loves solving puzzles. I went with a couple of friends and had a great time. I can't wait to try out the other rooms!

Great fun. Visited ClueQuest yesterday evening with friends, due to the amount of us we split ourselves into 3 teams. I was actually surprised at how the game was set out. Not as easy as I thought it would be. My team sadly lost and didn't beat the clock :( I need to do another one of these games. I don't like being beaten! Highly recommend ClueQuest. Just choose your team wisely.

A Brilliant Afternoon team building. The words 'team building exercise' probably strike fear into people; too many bad experiences doing improvisations at business seminars, and being asked to "think outside the box".But here's a chance to do a team building exercise where you really do have to think to get out of the box!!! Obviously Escape Games have become incredibly popular of late and if you grew up on shows like Crystal Maze and Fort Boyard and thought "I want to do that!" then you will love this.The premise is ridiculous, (you must help a mouse defeat an evil sheep), but the silliness is part of this games charm. Obviously I can't say too much about the puzzles but they really got our small team thinking and really forced us to play to each other's strengths. Having done similar games before in larger groups unsuccessfully. I would recommend doing it in a smallish group - 4 seemed to work really well for us. It was interesting to see that there was another group there that split into two teams to race against each other as well as the clock. The staff were very friendly and enthusiastic and genuinely seemed pleased for our success. After a tough year at work, it was nice to go and do something fun, slightly ridiculous and different. A thoroughly enjoyable afternoon - I would have give it 5 stars even if we hadn't managed to complete it!!!

Best one so far!. A group of friends tried this for a birthday and it honestly, got us hooked. Obviously I'm not going to give away anything but just to say, as long as you can solve puzzles/riddles you should be ok.This was the first we did, then we went back for their second room and now looking to go and try their third (new) room.As our group was fairly large we split into 2 identical rooms and started at the same time (I don't mean to show off but I was on the winning team both times).This got us hooked and we've been to find similar ones in friend's home cities and we've now done 3 more and are planning another in a couple of weeks. All were great but this one still stands head and shoulders above them.The whole team there deserve a massive thank you for making it so enjoyable!

Great start to our team night out!. ClueQuest is definitely worth a visit. I took my team here as the surprise start to our night out and we had a great time (and escaped with time to spare).It was well thought out and you get a few extra clues if you need a bit of help. This is a great activity for office parties, groups of friends, families, hen/stags - anyone really.Thank you to the team at ClueQuest.

Absolutely amazing and fun experience!. This escape game is purely marvellous! Very well thought-through and captivating puzzles, more than enough to make the hour in the room one of the most thrilling ever!
Becoming a yearly trip. I first went last year and loved it, came back to do a 2nd quest and was brilliant! Keep bringing us more rooms! Cant wait to do the third next year! Highly recommended!!

Such a fun game! Really gets you thinking!. I booked 4 games for 20 people for a hen do activity and everyone had such a great time. It was so entertaining and you really have to think outside of the box which everyone enjoyed! I would highly recommend people giving this activity a go,

A Great Game. I have done other escape games but this has been the best. The staff were friendly and fun, and the room was very cleverly thought-out, with lots of different types of puzzle - some of which can be solved individually and some which required real teamwork and co-ordination.

Fun packed 60 minutes!. We booked ClueQuest for a birthday occasion, and it certainly did not disappoint! This was more than just a room escape, from entering the place we were involved in a storyline which added to the experience and shows clearly the thought that has gone into ClueQuest from all staff involved! Big thanks to our hosts who made it more enjoyable with their fun and humour. Being a group of 10, we booked out 2 identical rooms for some friendly competition! The option to accommodate large groups of people makes ClueQuest more unique and fun. The clues are very cleverly thought out, and the hour just flew by (we made it out with 17 seconds remaining!). Whether you are a family with kids, a group of work colleague or friends, everyone will enjoy ClueQuest! We are already looking forward to returning to try out the new room opening later in 2016!
Loved it !. 60 min of pure entertainment!Will definitely go back there to do the other rooms!(Really nice staff as well).
Great fun. Six of us did one of the escape room challenges. Really well organised and great fun. Highly recommended

Great experience. Good gaming space. With well thought out challenges There are some very challenging elements that can lead you into frustrating dead ends, but they actually make the game more challenging. It's a pure Escape game and a great place to start with new players.

Best escape game in London. Given the promising reviews, we took a chance at ClueQuest. So far, it's the best escape game we have tried, we have only tried 4-5 rooms but this was really really good. The staff are friendly and the conduct of the game was excellent. Clues are just that, a clue and not more which is good. There is a timer in the room(s) which is very helpful. Very creative puzzles which I found to be the best thing about ClueQuest. We will definitely be returning to have a crack at their other room(s). Well done and thank you for the game!
Great day with great company! . Wow! What an amazing hour at ClueQuest. The staff are really good and the quest itself is amazing. Definitely will be going to do the other room!

What a place!. After being bought this as a Christmas present and searching the web for any clues I was quite excited as the website gives you nothing which I believe makes it a better experience. It's hard to review something where it is a must see and don't want to spoil it for other people. Cut a long story short it great for team building lots of fun and very challenging because we failed the challenge it makes me want to go back and try again. Recommend highly!!!

Great team bonding and a lot of brain teasing fun. The 5 of us who make up Beyond Local took a day out to accept the Plan52 challenge and just about succeeded. I can't say much about it, other than you get locked in a room and have 1 hour to figure out how to escape. We are 5 very different people with different skills and each of us contributed to our escape with about 2 minutes left. We all want to go back and pit our wits against Operation Blacksheep soon

Amazing fun. I had done one escape room before this (Trapped in a Room with a Zombie), but have to say that this one was particularly well executed. As a group of 4, it felt like we had the perfect amount of people to work together and do multiple puzzles at the same time without getting on top of each other. Pleased to say we made it out with 6 minutes to spare! But not without some occasional well-timed guidance from mission control over the radio. The puzzles were stretching but achievable and really required us all to keep up with what everyone had found and what areas there were remaining to explore. Getting the complimentary photo and fridge magnet at the end was a nice touch, and I would wholeheartedly recommend this to anybody who has already or never done an escape room type event!

What a cool day out!. Looking for something different, our pub quiz team went for this for the annual outing.So glad we did, what a load of fun. Won't spoil it by giving anything away, but are already talking about going back and doing one of the other roomsHighly recommended, great staff, and plenty of watering holes and eateries in the vicinity if you want to make a day of it, like we did.

Perfect party for teenagers. I took 14 kids (mostly 15-16, two 13) to Cluequest for a 16th birthday party. I had to join in as one of the friends cancelled fairly last minute and we all had great fun. I have already had one mother asking for the name of the place as her daughter loved it so much and my son wants more of the same for his birthday. We went for the intermediate game as the easier one was booked up. None of us escaped on time but we were allowed to finish (with some help). We will look forward to the launch of the third room too. Highly recommended as a birthday event and it has the advantage of being at least a little intellectual which went down well with other parents as we are in the middle of GCSEs.

So much fun !!. Went a long with a team of work colleagues, we spilt into two teams to create some competition, it was really fun!! We managed to escape with a minute to spare, it was tougher then expected but in a good way!! It gave everyone in the team a chance to contribute and team work was the only way out! I've wanted to try and Escape Game for a long time now and this was a perfect experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be back for more!!
the last ten minutes. my faVORITE was operation blacksheep so much fun really recommend it to any on from 1-100! i felt so tense

Superb!!. Booked this a surprise birthday/christmas combination present for two of my friend's. All three of us absolutely loved this, great set up as you enter, the staff assistants was very helpful, welcoming and informative and the rooms themselves are well planned and thought out and the puzzles and riddles enabled us to work as a team. The clues were helpful at the appropriate time and we felt so many moments of victory once we'd solved the next clue, right up until our victorious finish! Cannot recommend this highly enough and is worthy of all the amazing review's it's received, will be back to try one of the other challenges!!

So much fun! . Had a great time here - there were 6 of us and we split into two teams as we're a competitive bunch! Loved solving the clues and the whole setup was really impressive. Really lovely and helpful staff, and they prompted us just when we needed it. Would highly recommend.

Great fun for teenagers!. I booked Plan52 for my daughter's 16th Birthday party on her request. She had been to another Escape Room. She and four friends were shown the room where they had to escape from. They had 60 minutes to do it. I sat and read my book whilst I waited. I could hear screams of enjoyment from the room during the time. When they escaped they were full of excitement from the experience. They all want to go back and do more. The staff were lovely and really played the part. Well done to everyone. See you soon.

Excellent organisation, fun game, friendly staff. This was not the first "escape game" we played as a team, but it was one of the most enjoyable. The riddles were very well thought through - they were demanding, but not overwhelming and overall quite enjoyable.The location is very easy to reach from Kings Cross, the premises are very nice and the staff very friendly. Would be very happy to return and try the other escape rooms available in ClueQuest!

Good Fun. Great present idea - probably not something you'd ever buy for yourself but a great hour spent & an original gift idea. Did this in a group of 4 which was perfect i'd say & the staff were game too.
Great family entertainment. Great fun. Went as a family and all enjoyed. A very busy hour of puzzle solving and the time flew by. Staff were great throughout. Thoroughly recommend.

Great family fun!. Fabulous fun - we went with a family group ranging in age from 13 to 73 and had an absolute ball. We really enjoyed the puzzles and were impressed with the variety and the whole set up - there was a lot more to it than we expected. Can't wait to go back again!

Challenging, fun and exhilarating!!!. This is such a great way to spend and hour, and it will keep you buzzing for hours after! It is so clever, and really gets the grey matter working. The members of staff are brilliant and really set the scene, and the story lines are great! Can't wait for the third room to be ready - bring on the next challenge!!!!!

Amazing Experience. We went to ClueQuest on recommendation and had very little idea what to expect. It was fabulous. The most fun I've had in years. Cannot believe it was only an hour. We went as 2 groups in 2 rooms and competed against each other to finish first. Loved every minute and will definitely go back for the next adventure.

Lateral thinking required!!. A great way to spend an hour and virtually no arguments! The clues are very clever and you definitely need your thinking cap on. Will certainly go again and try the other game. Oh yes and we did escape within the hour - just!!

A Real Fun way to spend an HOUR!!. One more activity that my family wants to repeat on every visit!!6 in a group (3 adults and 3 kids(8,12,14)). All of us LOVED it.Yes...we got extra tips here and there to Escape the room. Though we spent an hour getting out of the escape room, we spent HOURS talking about what we missed and overlooked and what we were good at. Lovely super fun fast paced activity!!

A real life puzzle!!!. I booked this as a birthday gift voucher for my 15 year old daughter, it was easy to book on-line with very good communication and a handy email reminder the day before with directions.We took the train to Kings cross station and walked about 10 mins up Caledonian road.The staff were friendly and welcoming and introduced the concept of the game.The four of us really enjoyed the game and I think the combination of quick moving and thinking teenagers (15yrs and 19yrs) worked well with their slower more methodical middle aged parents.It was challenging, exciting and fairly pressurised.The hints came just at the right time and we were happily given 3 extra minutes so we could solve the puzzle ourselves which gave us all a sense of satisfaction.I liked that we had the opportunity to discuss our game with the staff afterwards and the fridge magnet given as a memento.We would all like to go back and try the other game. Its not cheap for a family but great as a present or with a group of friends ( who pay for themselves !!)

Glorious Failure reveals Teamwork Necessary!. Attended the secret location in North London to test our family ability to collectively solve puzzles (and save the world)The test was surprisingly challenging and great fun as you battle to solve the clues and escape whilst the clock ticks down.Perhaps it was the late night before but tempers were a tiny bit frayed and our teamwork left something to be desired. Which is leathal!I highly recommend Clue Quest. We shall be back to take our revenge on Mr Q.....

Great fun had by all. We tried out the Quest52 for our work xmas party, 3 very competitive teams, and we had so much fun! Every single person enjoyed the experience, very clever how they are designed.We are already talking about booking the other quest for a re-match.Will be recommending to all.Thanks for a great time.

Fantastic experience - cannot recommend enough!!. We did ClueQuest as a party for our 13 yr old son and it could not have been better! It was extremely well organised, very friendly, and just amazing fun. Very inventive, intriguing, and it just kept getting better. The boys were buzzing at the end and have not stopped talking about it since! Go!!

A great hours fun!. This is by far the best escape room I have done. Ive tried 2 others since but they don't stack up. It really is great fun and would be good for almost anyone who likes puzzles or a challenge! I wholeheartedly recommend this.

Highlight of our holidays!. We were looking for something completely different...and we got it! Planning an annual few days in London, we were looking for something a bit different. The reviews we read on Trip Advisor convinced us that this was the closest we might ever get to the Crystal Maze, although my husband remained a bit sceptical about it being particularly challenging, or even that much fun.It seems to be something that attracts mainly adults, and lots of office parties towards Christmas, but we braved it with our 4 children of 15, 13,11 and 10 (the youngest they have seen there, we were told). All I can say is, we all completely, totally loved every minute of the mad, frenzied hour. Even my husband was hugely impressed by the thought that has gone into ClueQuest, and the resulting game. What was really astonishing is that all 6 of us worked together (sometimes in a fairly haphazard way!), and there was not one single argument or stressful word said during the hour (or rather the 58 minutes which it took us to escape!). We just could not believe how much fun it was, and how quickly the time went.Do NOT miss this if you have a family that enjoys puzzles, solving clues, any kind of mental challenge. We cannot recommend it highly enough. My 10 year old daughter has asked top go back for her birthday next autumn, and I can say with certainty that we absolutely will be back to try one of the other challenges (we were told that a third is starting in the spring 2016 - hooray!).Thank you for a really brilliant time - we are still talking about it more than anything else we have done for ages.

Genius. The boys loved it. I took a party of 5 10-11 year old boys and they thought it was fantastic. We made the deadline with 58 seconds to spare which made the finish even more nail biting! Highly recommended.

Brilliant for adults and kids!. I have been to Cluequest before with my family (2 adults and 2 children 16 and 12) and my youngest daughter asked to go again with her friends on her birthday. I took her and her 4 friends (12 yr and 13yr) on Mon 14th. They tried Plan 52 and thoroughly enjoyed it. They loved the walkie talkie and they said the hour flew by. They were talking non stop when they came out! They ran out of time but were so close to escaping. My daughter said it was even better the second time! We managed to park on Caledonian Road and paid for the maximum of 2 hours parking for £4.80 which was just the right amount of time.

Clue quest for birthday. Amazing fun!! Totally recommend it to all you mind-game people. My only advice; think seriously fast!! I would say best team size is not more than 4 people. We split into two teams and raced each other, as well as the clock. Finished with 7 mins to spare!
Great fun. Went as part of a work event and thoroughly enjoyed it - it's a race against time and goes so. Quickly. Will definitely return to try the other room

Well constructed and hi-tech. We did the "Plan 52" room and it is a very well constructed game. There are lots of different types of puzzles, and the construction of the game is excellent - with a lot of really impressive props.There are a few rooms, which is great as it means that larger groups can play against each other.The game is well mastered, and well executed. It is enjoyable - but, at least for me, a little on the "clinical" side compared to it's European counterparts.A great attraction for a first time escape room player.

Great fun and challenging. When we arrived we must have been the oldest group by far, my mum is in her 70's but we were made to feel just as welcome. Thank goodness we had a couple of younger people with us though :) we worked great as a team and really enjoyed it , the hour flew by and we all agreed we would love to do it again. It's great fun for youngsters and adults alike regardless of your age give it a go.

Challenging and fun- will be coming back to try the other game!. I went with 2 friends to the PLAN52 (red box) challenge and we all loved it! It was much more challenging than I thought it would be, as I know it's suitable for everyone, but they made it quite hard to find the clues- it wasn't straight forward! If they notice you're struggling however they will give you a small hint to point you in the right direction.All had a great time and we were lucky to get 10 extra minutes to complete the challenge! Would recommend to anyone- give it a go!
Great activity for mixed ages!. I did the quest with my 2 adult sons. We had a great time and had a great sense of achievement when we completed it. Whoever thought this up is very clever!!!

Exciting escape team challenge. Challenging but good fun. Really gets you thinking outside of the box and puts you to the test, especially when you're up against the clock and in our case against work colleagues in other teams. This made it even more competitive. Managed to escape with only 4 minutes to spare. Well thought out game with a variety of clues to solve which you can do in groups or individually. Highly recommended.

What an escape !!. Very clever, extremely interesting and quite a flowing experience. Certain aspects of the game are mind blowing and I must say we were great at managing to escape with only 3:21 minutes left. Well done to your creativity and organization. A definite 'recommend'.

A nice way to spend an hour 🧀. Well well well. Little tip. Take some clever people with you, we had 3 of these , with us, boy did we need them! and wear your good glasses, not the pound shop ones !!! Bring someone who's good at locks maybe an ex-cat burglar, from Peckham. Take some one who's, good at "Cluedo" and know their way around when your have assembled your crack team of 24, your off. Enjoy. It was good fun, different and an experience for us more mature folk, now where's da "weather-spoons" O ya we got out with a minute ⌛️to spare!!!!!! Mmmm wonder what the fastest time is???⏲
Great evening - perfect birthday present!. Really fun evening, would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something a bit different to sitting in a pub (this can be done before and after! :)

Fantastic Birthday Experience!. My friends booked this for me as a birthday treat as I love puzzles and challenges - Loved every second of it! Well organised and suitable for all. Would definitely recommend!

Fantastic fun and very clever!. 5 of us came to take part in the Live Escape Game. It was fantastic! It's quite a challenge to get out in the hour, but we succeeded and we all came out buzzing. Our contact for the event was Jordan; he was a really nice guy and very good at setting the scene and giving us our instructions. We will definitely return and take part in another challenge and I'd definitely recommend it!

Good for a large and small groups. Came to ClueQuest as part of a group of 9 for a stag do activity. I'd done an escape game or two before but nothing as complex as this. All the puzzles were varied from each other and the ambient music really added to the tension surrounding our mission and escape.I would definitely recommend ClueQuest and look forward to trying the other room at some point.

Very well thought out, lots to fill the hour. Nine work colleagues split into two teams and played Plot 52 racing against each other as our Christmas work party. Everyone really enjoyed themselves and the hosts were excellent. Particularly good was the sheer number and variety of puzzles to solve. It meant that there was constantly something for everyone to think about and everyone got their shining Eureka! moment.We all left buzzing and were still laughing about it this morning at work.

Great Family Fun!. We had an absolute blast. Very family friendly event. With 3 kids (ages 14, 12, and 10) it was perfect. The puzzles were challenging enough but never tedious. We can't wait to go again. This place also has multiple scenarios but be sure to book an appointment in advance. The staff members were so friendly and fun.

stag do activity. We had an epic time at Cluequest on Saturday. We were 16 people with 4 teams of 4 and we were all impressed by just how much fun this was. Recommended activity for a stag do as well - the guys there handled us very well indeed. We will certainly consider coming back for the blacksheep activity..

Clue Quest, a fantastic hour!!. Having always loved puzzle games, I persuaded 7 friends (all 40 somethings!) to join me at Clue Quest. We booked two rooms, having read that 3 to 5 people made the best team number. Both teams thoroughly enjoyed themselves, piecing together the clues that we found in the rooms. Fortunately we both managed to escape just in time, with just a bit of competition between us...one team beat the other by a mere minute!!! A really enjoyable way to spend an hour, we will definitely be back for the next mission!
Work Christmas party. Went here with a large group split into 3 teams. It was very clever and extremely enjoyable definitely going again.

Crystal maze level fun!. Unbelievable experience. We were a bit sceptical when we first walked into the venue, as it looked a little small... But wow were we wrong! So impressive was the set up and the way each puzzle led to the next was sensational. Must try for friends and family
Cluequest, Kings Cross, London. Brilliant concept and great use of an hour on a Saturday night. Minds are still buzz from the experience this morning!

Brilliant time!!!. Great way to spend an hour!!. From the moment you enter the building you are in a different world. Clues are difficult enough to be challenging and help is always there if needed! Made it out with 3 minutes to go.... Excellent setup and scenarios. Thoroughly recommended.

Excellent fun, great challenge, highly recommended. This was a birthday present for my 15 ear old son and our first time at this type of event; so we were unsure what to expect.From the minute you walk through the door your experience begins...transported to a world of espionage. We were faced with challenge upon challenge,sneaky clue after clue. What a brilliant way to spend an hour.It is sometimes difficult to find something that a 15 year old son and a 22 year old daughter will both enjoy. We this was definitely it! Can't recommend highly enough....we are planning to return soon.
really great room. we went to their first room. really good. and gm riley was awesome. some interesting clues, some sneaky, all of them cool.

Teambuilding event. This was the first time I did something like this, so did not really know what to expect. I was sent their with some work colleagues for a team building event. All in all, a great experience and can definitely recommend this, not just for work colleagues but also for friends and families. I don't want to spoiler here too much, but the riddles were really creative and well thought through. Staff were extremely friendly, made us feel welcome from the beginning and were very helpful when we got stuck.I will be back for sure!
CLUEQUEST - A great night out!. We completed Cluequest's second room last night and thoroughly enjoyed it's mix of fast paced puzzles. We got a real buzz from escaping within the time limit.

An. ClueQuest has got to be one of the most fun hours I have ever spent. Having never done an Escape Game before, I was slightly concerned on booking ClueQuest that a) it would be too easy, b) it would live up to the expectations set by the glowing reviews left on TripAdvisor, c) it wouldn't be worth the money. I am pleased to say that all of my concerns turned out to be completely unfounded. I will definitely be booking another one. An excellent way to spend time in London, but book early as slots go quickly.

Amazing experience!. I booked the Plan 52 mission for my husbands 29th birthday. There was a big group of us so we had to split into two teams (ended up being more fun this way as we competed against eachother) . We really enjoyed the experience. I've been to something similar in the past but I preferred Cluequest as you don't have to be a genius - it's a great a chellenge for the average person! The staff were really friendly and even gave us a complimentary fridge magnet for the birthday boy! I will definitely return for Operation Blacksheep. Well worth the money!!

Absolutely fantastic. I booked this for me and 11 friends (roughly mid 30's), and must say my friends and I loved, clever concept, well hosted by the team on the night. Will definitely be looking at doing something similar again or the other game Cluequest run. People say you people only write bad reviews and they are probably right so for me to spend this time to review must speak volumes. Excellent fun evening......

Brain Blast!. Well firstly, don't keep it a surprise...the birthday boys I treated thought we were off to football!After the initial disappointment, the team (4 adults and 2 children aged 13 and 14) really got into it.One hour locked in a series of rooms, clue and code breaking.Good fun...with three minutes to spare (though we did need help!).clueQuest have a variety of missions, so I would definitely return again.Top tip, without giving too much away, just because you have left a room doesn't mean that the clues you have found should be left behind.

Excellent attraction that makes you feel quite smart in the process.. We arrived to a massive door and an even bigger welcome. The two fellows running the place were so kind, informative and seemed like they enjoyed their jobs. The story line for the room is great fun too (Obviously I wont be giving any spoilers, all I will say is let yourself go and get stuck into it)We managed to beat the room and escape, we won against our friends who were in the other team!The design is fantastic. Cryptic and well thought out. You can even get hints and tips from the crew if you need them.I would highly recommend this to everyone.

Up there with the best !!. This was the 5th escape room we had done - we are a family of 5, mixed ages and abilities. We went to ClueQuest for Sophia's 26th birthday and we were not disappointed with the room we chose.Easy to find and a nice welcome. Lovely clean, bright and comfy waiting area and a very good briefing to start by Riley our Misson Control man. Excellent game - really made you think. flowed well and we only need 1 clue in the whole game to get out in time. Quite clever and we will certainly be back to do the other room here. I can see why they are so booked up, very professional all the way through.Clue Quest is certainly well worth a visit especially if you have done a couple of escape rooms before - this was one of the best games we have done and we had a great time.Riley did a debrief before we left, absolutely no rush to get us out and gave us some nice photos and a fridge magnet for our daughter. Friendly team and I would highly recommend ClueQuest - we had a great time and will definitely be back.

A must-do team/family activity. I was looking for a team building event my team and I could do while in London - this is where we landed. Had no idea what to expect - but from the initial communications through the running of the event to the photo at the end, this was a fabulous experience. We set it up as a competition between two teams in two identical rooms and that made it even more fun. We'll be back to try to crack the code of the room we didn't see this time. Highly recommended! Thanks to the whole team running this for making everything so seamless!
So much fun. This was our second escape game and by far the best from start to finish.The only thing I can say is look,look and look again!

Great Fun and Really Well Thought Out. I recently booked in for Operation Blacksheep with a couple of mates from work and we had an ace time! The idea is really well thought out with puzzles that are challenging but are logical. We managed to escape in exactly 60 mins - the girl looking after our team was really helpful and thankfully thought it was hilarious to see what a state our mission apartment was in. Would definitely go again.

Work Team Building. We went to ClueQuest as part of a work team building day. We were in 2 teams of 5, each team in a separate room. We were given a briefing then locked in a room with clues to find our way out within an hour.It was great fun and I really enjoyed working out all the ingenious clues as part of a team. The staff were excellent and I would highly recommend doing this as a group activity and for something that is a little bit different.

Great team building exercise!. I took my team from work to Clue Quest in November and we had a brilliant time. The game was extremely fun and also mentally challenging, so we had to work well as a team to complete it. I'd also recommend this for families or groups of friends, as it is the perfect way to have a fun 60 minutes (or slightly less if you're really good!) I hope to be back to tackle the other room sometime soon!

Amazing Idea for a group of friends, family or colleagues!. This was a fantastic start to my mums birthday plans, 5 of us went down and wasn't sure what to expect, buit from the minute we arrived, the mission started, with a fun brief and in to the apartment we went. Our team work and co-operation was tested, and with so much for us all to think about individually and together, it worked perfectly. Was so exciting as the clock counted down and we broke out with 63 seconds to spare! Awesome! Would recommend to everyone!

Brilliant. Fantastic game! Really gets you thinking and working as a team! Race against the clock so have to work well and efficiently!
Did it with 7 mins to spare!
What a great idea!. A fantastic experience especially for teenagers. Great to find something different in London that isn't eating or drinking. Very well done, thank you

Good but could have been great. A really great concept, and a fun way to spend an hour with some friends, but I felt that the execution could have been a little better.Most of the puzzles were entertaining, and the whole experience was tense and exciting, but I felt that the storyline was quite weak.By the end, it felt as though we were solving a number of puzzles, just for the sake of it, and there was no debrief, or explanation of who or what we had saved, or what the consequences were of not doing so.As I said, you've got a very good concept, just need to improve the finer details.

Great Fun!. Went to ClueQuest yesterday and had a really good time. You have an hour to solve clues in order to escape from a series of rooms. You need at least 3 of you in a team, otherwise you might not complete the puzzles in the time allotted. Would thoroughly recommend.

WOW. What can I say? Probably one of the best experiences I have ever had. Challenging, fun, annoying, exciting, frustrating....a rollercoaster ride! What a fantastic experience!! I went with our work customer service department, a team of 12, boys vs girls... each person contributed to solving the puzzles and all thoroughly enjoyed it. If you are considering going, go!!!!!

Fun & Challenging. Went with some friends and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Well thought out and a fantastic start to a great evening. The hour whizzed past so quickly it was like being in a time machine! I highly recommend this experience.

AN HOUR WELL SPENT. We were two mums and three kids aged 13-16, and all five of us were on our knees looking for clues and having a blast. The hour just zoomed by and we loved every minute of it. Never succeeded in getting out, but enjoyed the struggle. I definitely recommend it if you or your kids like adventure.
So much fun!!. Been living in London for a few years now and its one of the best things i have ever done in this city!! One hour felt like one minute!! People go go go!!!

Great Fun. From Kings Cross Station it's a 10-15 minute walk (depending how fast/slow) along the Caledonian Road. You could easily miss it as entrance on left walking north between shops. On entering the staff were lovely, offered water and explained mission. We were 4 couples and we split boys against girls; the two rooms were the same so the challenge was on!!!! Absolutely amazing fun, really interesting, and definitely engaged the brain.This should definitely be on your list of something fab do do if you have just over an hour and a half to spare. We booked in advance and could not get an evening slot, so recommend you book early for a special occasion and a particular time if wanted.

Brilliantly timed and amazing creativity. We did the destroy and evacuate game for my birthday on a weekday night. Team of 4 which seemed ideal. Anything more than might be overkill. We completed the task with seconds to spare which was such an adrenaline rush. It seems so aptly timed and the complexity of the tasks is high enough to make it a good game but not too complex so as to discourage playing. All in all, a night well spent. Glad we signed up as detectives. Looking forward to more quests :)

Thrilling experience. I went with my partner and two friends, the whole experience made me feel as though I was in the Crystal Maze! I loved the constant search for clues, trying numbers in locks and the feeling of fear that crept up on me as the time ticked down. We needed 30 seconds more to escape. We're definitely going to come back and do the other room, and I hope that it isn't long before they get the next room up and going too. An experience that I would recommend to anyone who enjoyes puzzles, games and The Crystal Maze.

Addicting experience. One of the most interesting activities I have ever experienced!We were a team of 6 people and on the mission everyone was so engaged to look for clues that at the end we didn't believe how one hour flew by in a glance! And the effect was still there even after we went out to grab something to eat. We we still feeling like we need to do some puzzle and solve something to unlock doors, and as if behind every sound and thing we saw there was a hidden message!I recommend ClueQuest to everyone irrespective of age, profession or whatever else!

Great fun!. We managed to escape with 56s to spare! Well designed game, helpful games master. Loved the team photos. Would go back again and try the other rooms. My only hesitation is the price... Other escape rooms charge on average £16 and are equally fun.

Amazing Experience and good fun for all!. Had a really good time here, my first one and we just missed the timings by a few minutes!! However because we were so close we were given an extra 9 minutes. We got there wih an extra 3 minutes and it was really exciting at the end! (If we didn't get that we would have left unhappy haha!!) they gave us clues just enough to not give it totally away which is helpful and it was really well organised. I would go again but probably in 6 months time!

Fantastic evening of fun. This is the 3rd time I have experienced the 'room escape' genre and this is the best yet. We booked 2 rooms with teams of 4 people. Upon arriving 10 minutes late we were greeted by our guide for the event and things were explained very well and the scene was set. After the quick explanation we were shown to our room and the fun began! The hour flew by, and my team escape with 30 seconds remaining! The puzzles we great and unlike previous escape rooms I had tried they did not look tired and worn. Our guide Richard was great and led us along with the odd hint along the way.We enjoyed it so much that we have already booked to go back to try the operation black sheep room.A fantastic experience.Gre

Time is ticking!!. James - We are board game addicts so this was high on our list of things to do on our trip to London. Everyone was needed to solve section of the game. I would suggest a minimum age of 9 years if you are a small team. The whole experience was worth the money and we will be returning. Kaya - IT WAS AMAZING!!!! It was really good because you are locked in the room but there is a button to press if you need a wee. Its so good. I wanted to do the second rooms straight after but it was booked. It seems a really popular place. I recommend if you like puzzle you have to go there. But I’m not telling you any clues!!Jen - We came up to London for the weekend and visited Kidzania, Hard Rock, and Charlie and The Chocolate Factory. All amazing but the visit to Clue Quest was the highlight!!! Don’t be intimidated if you have not done anything like this before. It was our first time and we were just team of 3. (Two adults one 9 year old) The staff watch you from cameras and are very very good at judging how you are doing. They help you out with hints and not once did they hint when not needed! They were greatly appreciated!!!!I won’t give anything away but all i can say is you will not be disappointed at visiting here. We are still chatting about months later and about to book the second challenge!!!!

Clue quest London. What a great concept! Brilliant for family bonding/team building. We had a fantastic, if a little frantic hour trying to work our way out with 4 minutes to spare! Our kids aged 15,13 and 9 all loved it. Never done anything like this before, we can't wait to come again to try the next challenge.

Didn't disappoint yet again!. Having already done ClueQuest last year, we were excited to try out one of the newer rooms. One thing that must be said is that ClueQuest has absolutely great customer service; from your arrival you are designated a personal "hacker" who explains the rules, makes you feel comfortable, and provides hints and tips whilst you're inside the room. As it can get quite frustrating when you're not sure how to solve a puzzle, it's so wonderful to have someone who will gently nudge you in the right direction without giving too much away, allowing you to still feel like you've accomplished something yourself! The puzzles are all very clever and well made, and require a lot of teamwork and cooperation, as well as imagination! We managed to finish with about 2 minutes to spare, so these games are very well-timed- I can't even imagine the amount of effort that must go into them! In general, you should take part in ClueQuest as 3-4 players, as this makes the puzzles much less harder to solve. I also recommend a minimum age of around 12, although depending on the dexterity of your children, they might very well end up solving the puzzles before you do!As always, great work ClueQuest, can't wait to be back again next year...
Such fun!. We had such a great time, did not know what to expect. Suffice to say we want to return soon to do the second mystery!

Brilliant fun . Had a brilliant time at cluequest, very entertaining. It had a nice waiting area and nice staff too. A great place to go couldn't recommended it highly enough. Relatively easy to find too and I like that they gave us pictures at the end it was a nice touch!

Clever! And very entertaining.. We did Plan52 and I have to say it was so much fun. I am not really one for games but this was really enjoyable and had a great time.The staff were great and knew everything there was to know. We did it in a group of four, which seemed like a good number, but you can do larger groups.I won't say too much as it will spoil the fun. All I would say is that it isn't scary (no one jumps out at you), it isn't claustrophobic (whilst the rooms are internal, they are a decent size and you can actually always get out if you need the loo or anything) and it isn't so difficult that you have to be mega intelligent to work out the clues.
Best room escape experience ever!. Awesome, clever, intense, BEST ESCAPE ROOM EVER. I recommend this to all of you, younger or older, frinds and families alike.
Amazing!. A group of 5 including a 12 year old, all of us had an amazing time. It exceeded our expectations. Can't wait to book our next room!

You will love it!. We had so much fun! Two people did not know what to expect when we got there and had no clue as it was a surprise. It is fair to say we all loved it and it was a great start on the day! The one hour will just fly by! We will be back!
Work Team Bonding. We had such a great time at Cluequest. It was really challenging but great fun and an excellent activity for team building. Great value for money, would definitely recommend.
VERY GOOD EXPERIENCE. very good n fun experience.very helpful and friendly staff.A fun filled hour for me and my friends.will def be back again.thanksthoroughly recommend

Fantastic Hen Do. What a fantastic afternoon - such a laugh! Very clever and really gets you working as a team. Can be a little bit stressful towards the end but so much fun. And the staff are amazing as well and will give you a few hints if you're struggling a bit! Well worth a visit and will be returning for the other room as well! Would highly recommend.

Everyone should try this. We didn't know what to expect from this as the website was a bit vague but it just added to the mystery.Much to our surprise we completed it in time and are looking to book to go again.
Brilliant. We all had a fantastic time. Great idea, great experience, great staff! Our kids and their friends loved it and so did we!

Top day out. What a truly great day out. A very unique experience. We went in a group of 4 and that was about right. The staff will give you clues if they see you getting stuck too. We will definitely be going back to do the harder puzzle room.

Couldn't recommend more. Made a TripAdvisor account purely to recommend ClueQuest.
Fun for all ages and abilities- you'll love it.

Wasn't expecting to say this - but it was SO cool!. Definitely worth the experience - hard to explain what it is - you just need to go!! It's absolutely awesome. The staff was great as well. Go for it!!!

Brilliant experience - definitely worth doing!!. Fantastic mind challenging experience! My boyfriend booked two rooms for my birthday and everyone loved it! It was superbly organised, the escape was a unique experience. The mission itself was challenging and had a variety of different scenarios to keep you entertained and guessing throughout. The staff were excellent and helpful - we were very late for our escape and luckily the staff were patient with us. I am definitely going to book the other mission in the foreseeable future!

The most stressful fun you will ever have!. I organised a work team building event for 20 people at this venue and it was fantastic! Yes it is stressful but in a fun way as there is lots to do in a short period of time but that makes it much more fun. I don't want to spoil it too much for you but it is very well organised and for the price its defiantly worth it.

AMAZING...... !!!! fun. Amazing fun we booked this for birthday treat and The puzzles were really interesting and were quite impressive tech-wise , including the use of computers, radios and plenty of props to make the quest intriguing way to find clues this experience fun and very interesting the hours will fly by I can assure you this was one hours of pure adrenalin we managed to escape with seconds to spare complete the missions, superb experience would love to travel back up and do again

What a great time . Wasn't sure what to expect, I had been told about this by friends but it's not something that I was expecting. It is definitely better than I expected and we used just under the full hour. Would recommend this for any group activity with a difference.

Best Thing I've Done in London. I discovered this through Tripadvisor, so thought I'd return and repay the favour. This escape the room challenge was incredibly fun. There were 3 of us in our early 20s, and we all escaped with 30 seconds to spare. I hear many others weren't so lucky...The puzzles are accessible for everyone, without being too easy, and continued to be varied throughout .The Cluequest team have this planned really well, given how tight the time felt. They were good at working out when exactly we were stuck and needed a quick hint to get us going again too.My one minor criticism is that the story was quite ropey. But it set the scene, and allowed everyone to focus on the puzzles, which I suppose was the point.I don't want to ruin it by saying anything more, but honestly, just go. You will not regret it.

Clue quest great team building exercise. Our team of 20 went yesterday and played both games. A really enjoyable experience would recommend it thoroughly. Even better my team won the challenge. Fabulous time thank you.

The best birthday ever!. We had 3 teams of 12 people in their mid 30th-40th. It is difficult to surprise any of these guests with something special. But this time it was a great success! Even though it was on Wednesday at 9 pm and everyone was after work, every single guest enjoyed this game and his/her time enormously! Thanks for those who organised and created all this! We had a great evening and loads of memories! We will do it again soon!

Super Sluething Fun. I brought a team of 21 people from work as a team building event and let me tell you that ClueQuest did not disappoint!! This escape game is a filled with fantastic riddle and problem solving secret agent antics! As a team of varying ages and personalities; every single person told me afterward that they thoroughly enjoyed the experience! The hosts at ClueQuest are excellent and I simply cannot recommend the experience highly enough! AG

An impressive escape room with some high tech challenges. I really enjoyed both escape rooms at ClueQuest. The puzzles were really interesting and were quite impressive tech-wise compared to other escape rooms, including the use of computers, cameras and switchboards. In both rooms my team needed just over an hour to complete the missions, but we were allowed the extra time and given prompts to help us escape. It's hard to say which room I preferred, both had exciting elements and well thought out puzzles to complete. I would recommend a team of 4 as ideal. I look forward to trying out the third room once it's ready!

Fastest Hour of my Life. I was taken here for my friends birthday and it was great. The reception area was very laid back and relaxing which was nice with a couple of little tester activities (jenga, yes/no game etc.) We then got a nice intro from our guides and we were sent into the room. When in the room we had the perfect amount of clues amd our guide was really good. We did not get out in time, where our other group did but the experience was just as fun. We were then talked through where we went wrong before being moved back to reception for our group photo and we wrote in the guest book. Overall, a great time althouh only downfall was the less realistic idea of having animals as our boss. Prehaps are more mature situation would have set the scene a little better.

Incredibly fun hour!. Easy to find and very inventive puzzles. Great value for money. It was like being in Crystal Maze! Definitely useful having 5 people; any fewer and would have been tricky! Friendly and helpful staff during the booking and game process.

Clue Quest. We took our friend as part of her hen do, and we were dressed up as minions!Our games master was absolutely excellent. I've never done anything like this before, bit this was seriously great. I didn't know what to expect, but the hour flew by, packed full of puzzles and clues. We managed to escape with under a minute remaining, and got free fridge magnets of our group photo because of out awesome outfits.The room we escaped from had only a 30% escape rate- so we every smug for the rest of the day.I highly reccommend
Great Team Building. We had a really good time at Clue Quest. We took a team of 25 and used 5 rooms. It was good fun and got everyone working together. Very good as a team building exercise.

A great thing to do with teams. The team at ClueQuest did a fantastic job on our day there. We had 14 people, ran both exercises (Plan 52 and Operation Blacksheep) and had a huge amount of fun and learned a lot about how to work together. The set up is very challenging and expertly produced. I thoroughly recommend it. Thanks to Jake and Nee for looking after us so well.

One of the best Escape Rooms in London. I've become a bit of an escape room addict and booked to play Operation Blacksheep at ClueQuest. They obviously have great reviews and I can only add to it. They were amazing in every way.We were greeted by the games master who explained our mission and I couldn't wait to get stuck in. As soon as we stepped in the room it was non stop fun, finding clues, solving puzzles, revealing hidden doors using our brains and skills. Team work is so important and we work well as a team of 4 and managed to escape with a few minutes remaining.I would definitely recommend this escape room to anyone as its by far one of the best I've tried. You should definitely book this!

The best escape game in London. We have done quite a few escape games in London. ClueQuest is one of the best. So many different unexpected puzzles and twists along the way. I would highly recommend to anyone. I would say that 4 is the optimal number in the room. We will be back soon to try their other rooms.

Nerve-jangling (up to) 60 minutes of pure fun and intrigue. Save the world from destruction ... what better cause is there in the name of lighthearted but intense fun. Money well spent and lovely walks along the canal to add to the experience.

Great place to visit. I strongly recommend this place as a great form of an alternative entertainment. I am a foreigner and was afraid not to understand all clues in ClueQuest, but everything was really intuitive. Thanks, guys!

Great fun with workmates. Had a great time for our team bonding afternoon. Even better that our team won and escaped first! And out of the trickiest room to escape I must add! Definitely recommend with work, friends, family etc.

Amazing! . This was by far THE BEST team game I have ever played. It tested every part of my cognitive ability and Im so glad for the experience.
Highly recommend going!

Crystal Maze meets Krypton Factor & Prison Break. Arriving at the venue with not one single clue of what to expect I was a little apprehensive but my fears were dispelled when our host gave us our beefing. Without giving too much away, we had a very fun and enjoyable time locked in a puzzle filled room with limited direction of what to do and how to proceed. Sound scary? Well it it wasn't. It was more thrill than fear. Having to engage your brain and work as a team to solve the puzzles and escape the room was exhilarating, frustrating but also very rewarding.All in all a very enjoyable time. Can't recommend highlly enough.
Fantastic night out.. So much better than I expected, the puzzles were intricate and the hosts were charming. All my fault loved it too.

What a brilliant idea!!!. This place is incredible!!! A must for anyone who likes puzzles, who's played those "escape" or "room" games on their tablet, or just for people who like challenging the grey matter! Great staff, and an exhilarating attraction. You must go!!!

Just do it!. So much better than I thought it would be! Went with three work friends after work and thought it was so much fun.I ended up leaving with a sweat as I was running around so much and my brain was running on overtime.Just book it seriously - the storyline was fun, the staff member who we dealt with was hilarious and the puzzles etc. are imaginative.

Awesome experience!. An awesome activity to do to built teamwork and just overall a brilliant experience for everyone. We went as a group of teenagers and we managed to get out without having to be super intelligent! The staff were also very friendly and informative. We would definitely recommend this to our friends and we would go again and try the other mission.

One of the best. I've done dozens of escape rooms, and this one is definitely in my top 3, and top 1 in London so far.Everything makes perfect sense, there are many parts in the game, many different kind of puzzles, it's very well implemented.There were 4 of us, we solved Operation Blacksheep in less than 50 minutes without hints, which we were very proud of, and it was extremely fun!Would highly recommend this escape room!

Out with 30 seconds to spare!. After reading so many great reviews on ClueQuest, finally got round to organising it for me & 3 friends and it did not disappoint!Everything from the staff who were there to meet and talk us through the 'mission' and then once we were in the room, the attention of detail was incredible. I don't want to give too much away on here but all I'd say is this is definitely worth it!And we made it out with 30 seconds to spare :)

Escape with numbers. Second time playing these 'escape' games. Plus: engaging, good for those new to the experience, good value for time involved, great welcome & pre intro to the game. Negatives: too similar problem based i.e. numbers, locks etc, not good for colour blind gamers, no real story line to carry through the experience.

Great event. We had a stag group in two rooms. The staff were great, and the activity was just difficult enough to be engaging, without being frustrating.
Highly recommended

Secret Agents to the rescue. Had a really good night last night. Great staff who talk you through your 'mission' before being locked in a room. You have an hour to escape. Such a novel idea. Great fun. We went as a family of four. Great laugh trying to work together as a team and not all run around like headless chickens. Would highly recommend this activity.

Great fun!. Great game with well thought out puzzles and tricks! They allowed us to bring in my one year old daughter which was helpful (not in the game of course) but as tourists with no babysitting options it really helped.

Really good fun.... very well thought out!. We went as a family of 4.... (2 grown up children!) and had a fantastic time... we all loved it and it was funny and very interesting to note how we all approached the challenge differently!.... imagine would be great for team building or a job interview haha!Our helper hostess? gamesmaker? Candice.... was extremely good at her job... friendly and helpful but also very professional.... perfect!Even though the outside of the building doesnt look that promising... the reception area inside is bright, spacious enough and welcoming. The rooms were very imaginative and without a few helpful hints I don't think we would have got out in within the hour!It is not at all scary... just gets very tense !Everyone would definitely go back.

First experience definitely will not be the last. Really great fun hour for all ages, took my two kids aged 11 and 6 and they both thoroughly enjoyed the experience. If it wasn't for some secret help from the team we probably would be still stuck in the room but it all added to the fun. We started off all calm and collected and at the end were running around like loonies! We had a great time. I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a team building family fun hour.

Great Team Building couple of hours.. Went with a group of 10 work colleagues and what a great experience it was. Although the task itself is only an hour long, it does feel longer. Our group was split into 3 teams and each team was debriefed as to what to do/expect. The instructors where good at explaining and joined in on the banter of our group, despite remaining professional. The building it is set in, is deceiving as its on a main road amongst shops, but the rooms that you are placed in to unlock codes are cleverly thought provoking. A really enjoyable hour out and would highly recommend.

Great fun and a good work out for the "little grey cells"!. A group of 5 of us did the "Plan 52" game for a birthday celebration. We had great fun and we all got to use our respective detective skills, whether it be searching for clues or solving different kinds of puzzles and tasks. You don't need any prior knowledge or experience - just throw yourself into it and try everything! The hour goes very quickly. We escaped with just 29 seconds to go, so things were getting rather manic by the end, but that only served to make it even more fun! We'll definitely be going back to try the other game.

Exceeded my expectations. On a weekend break to London my daughter and her partner suggested we try clueQuest. I quite like puzzle shows like Crystal Maze so was game, but thought it would be a bit tame to be honest. My wife doesn't like games and never takes part in our Xmas board game sessions. She came to make up the numbers and was, frankly, dreading it. Well, she enjoyed it and participated fully. She actually was a bit of a star and we all enjoyed the experience enormously. It's very well thought out and run, with just the right balance of leaving the team to work the puzzles out and offering clues via the walkie-talkies/in-room screens (we needed two clues, which isn't too bad!). This would also make an excellent corporate team-building event too.

Really good fun. I had never heard of escape rooms before, so had no idea what to expect, but without giving anything away, it's a really fun and challenging experience to solve clues against the clock to escape from a series of rooms. It was really fun, and different, and we want to go back and do the other one now!

Open until 23:00! Good for all ages from 8 or 9 yrs up. A great 70 mins spent searching for clues in a 3 room space on the Cally Rd.You get 60 mins to complete your mission but a further 10 mins is given if you reach a certain point before completion.I didn't know what to expect as I didn't read any reviews & we were all taken in by the whole experience ...the 70 mins felt half that as it was go go go...not physical, not for high IQ people only & not just for adults either!2 Adults & 2 kids (under 13) = £90...not sure if this is on par with other London attractions as we live here & don't visit that many..worth it? YES! we're going again at Christmas for the other challenge 'The Black Sheep'...whatever that is :-)

Absolutely Amazing fun... Cluequest really was the highlight of our London day out. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. We visited cluequest as two mums with a 13 year old daughter each. The difficult age to entertain. Had a few doubts as to whether we would manage to get out and no idea what to expect. We were completely amazed by how cleverly the whole thing is put together so much work has gone into setting it up. The lady who dealt with us was lovely and helpful and really enthusiastic about it all which enhanced our experience even more. What a lovely job to have.A little hint here and there was needed along the way and a little extra time to get ourselves out , which we were glad they let us have. This by no means spoilt our fun though it was the best hours entertainment we have had in a while .We will definately return again.

Best Escape Room So Far!. We had a brilliant time. Most of us have done several escape rooms (in various countries) and I think this is the best by far! It wasn't easy and we escaped with only a few minutes to goIf you like a challenge, you'll love it.Very friendly staff and professional too. Will definitely go again (in another room).

Very good fun. Just been on the Cluequest for the second time this year. Very very good and I highly recommend it. Operation Blacksheep we finished the game within 5 minutes of it ending, and Operation 52 we finished within 3 minutes.If you have an option to choose, I preferred Operation BlackSheep, but both rooms are excellent and very challenging.

Awesome fun. ! This is not a clue or hidden message ! The game was great fun, and the team (Michael) made it an awesome experience my friends and I will never forget. Definitely would recommend this if you want to laugh, scream, run around like a headless chicken, and feel like a true spy who is really good at opening locks. - Detective Hawk P.S THANKS AGAIN MICHAEL (Definitely request him)
Cluequest Fun. A fantastic experience for a wide age range, staff very polite and helpful, a real challenge not easy at all

Brilliant experience, very thoughtful team and a perfect activity for small/large groups. I can't rate these guys highly enough. I've been and done both games at ClueQuest, once as a couple and the second occasion very recently as a group of five. Both occasions were awesome because of the game and staff.The first occasion I came as a duo with my fiancé, about a year ago, and the ClueQuest team was so accommodating after we had been scammed on the same day (on my fiancé's birthday!) for another escape room game I had bought through Wowcher. We only went in to enquire about prices and when we could book, but they went out their way to get us to do the game on the same day, in about 15-20 minutes! We even had a chat with the manager, who was lovely so customer service alone here is second to none.The second occasion we came, which was at ClueQuest's new premises in King's Cross, I came as a group of five with my parents, sister and fiancé. Both games were totally different experiences so we didn't feel like we were going in knowing what was going to happen - except for the main rules. We really enjoyed both rooms, couldn't pick a favourite because they both had different styles of challenges. And my 60-year-old dad cannot stop raving about it!The price is worth the experience, and I'm looking forward to ClueQuest opening up more rooms in the future. Thanks team ClueQuest.

POSSIBLY THE MOST FUN I'VE EVER HAD. Quite possibly the most fun I've ever had, absolutely fantastic from start to finish. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the game itself was incredibly fun (and challenging!). We were a group of five, and managed it with just 8 minutes remaining! It exceeded all of my expectations, and I cannot recommend it enough. BOOK NOW!!

Fantastic, fun and frustrating! . 4 of us went to ClueQuest as part of a weekend in London.The venue is a 15 minute stroll from Kings cross St Pancras underground and it is very easy to find (I used the map on my phone, no problem).We had a ten minute briefing which set the scene before we went into one of the many rooms.I won't give anything away but what we experienced was amazing. Fiendishly clever and a little frustrating but well worth it. The staff are great, they really get into character and help you out a little if you need it.10/10, thank you for a great experience.

Brilliant mind challenge!!. Myself and 5 others were booked into cluequest on 27/08/15 and truth be told I didn't think I would enjoy it and I wasn't particularly looking forward to it........ How wrong was I!!! Absolutely brilliant!!! For obvious reasons I won't disclose what happens in the rooms so if your curious go and have a go!! You won't be dissapointed!! Really gets your brain working!! Got out with 4 minutes to spare!! We are secret spy's!!!

Absolutely brilliant. This was a birthday present from my friends, so along with my husband we were a group of 4. I was a little apprehensive as I had no idea what to expect but have to say it was just brilliant. What a fantastic idea. Whoever created it is a genius. As soon as we got into the room we immediately got caught up in it all. We worked brilliantly together as a team, each of us finding our forte in trying to solve the problem and the codes. It really is ingenious and I cannot recommend it highly enough. I'm pleased to say that we did escape and I can't wait to go back and have another go
AWESOME!!. Loved every minute of it! Very well thought out puzzles and very well structured 😊 I'm definitely hoping to go back and undertake the Blacksheep challenge next!

Brilliant!. Took our sons aged 17 & 15 with their cousins aged 13 & 9. My wife and I both went in with them. All of us had a great deal of fun trying to crack the clues and puzzles. The hour flew by and at the end we felt under pressure to get to open the last door as the seconds ticked away. All six of us throughly enjoyed it, as shown by the almighty cheer when we emerged from the last room. The staff were excellent and friendly. The youngest was very nervous before the start, but decided to give it a go when the nice lady showed him the button which would let him leave at any time. I think this would suit children over about 6, if helped by an adult and could be used as a team building exercise by a company. Definitely book in advance on their web site.There are two puzzle rooms currently, and they are opening a third soon. We will return and do these.

Fantastic experience. We loved this. Two adults and 3 children 15 to 8 and all were able to contribute. Really good fun. Suitably cryptic clues given when we ere going round in circles and well timed challenges to fill the hour. We escaped with a couple of minutes to go by a trick of luck, really, guessing the last coup,e of numbers quickly, but would probably have got there 'properly' with another 10 mins. Felt we started slowly but got into the pace after 20 mins. Advice would be to make sure your team understands how to communicate - all need to be looking, observing, searching and double checking each other in case some thing has been missed, Essential to keep talking to each other and joining things together. Will return to do the next level, we hope. Deservedly at the top of the list of things to do in London.

Top banana. We had a very good time, and the host was really nice and friendly. The rooms were pretty cool too and not as easy as we thought, but we still managed to win with 1.28 seconds to spare. We were even given a complimentary key tag as it was one of my friends birthday! Would certainly recommend this to anyone over 15 and we would definitely go again!
Absolutley amazing!!. Fantastic! Ages 43 to 12 attended and all loved it! well worth a visit! use your brain in ways you didnt know you could! great from start to finish
Nice escape room. Great fun. Didn't expect the experience to be like how it was, but it was much better than expected. Several heart stopping moments.

Excellent team building fun. Eleven of us went here on a team night out and raced in two teams to escape the room. We got out with just 1.42 on the clock for one team and 1.39 for the other. We all had such fun, were well looked after and thoroughly enjoyed the evening. The venue is a longer walk from Kings Cross than we expected so would leave ourselves more time when we go again, and we will be going again for round two....

Become a special agent!. An hour to get out of a locked room puts pressure on a team to work together and coordinate findings. Plenty of clues to solve to keep everyone in the team involved regardless of age and intelligence! Excellent value.
When you get bored of going to the pub for entertainment... it is like playing a board game but much more active and dynamic! great fun!stuck in a room solving puzzles. time just flies by..

Brilliant Birthday. My family all met up in London for my birthday, There were 8 of us ranging in age from 15 - 73 and we had two rooms booked to play simultaneously against each otherIt was a battle of the best, the teens against the oldies to see who had the better problem solving skills and ability to escape from the locked room.This attraction is fun, different, difficult and really taxes the brain. And we all loved every second of it.In fact, we are planning to go back again, and do the 2nd set of rooms, just because we enjoyed it SO much.Oh, and did age and wisdom win the challenge? No, of course not.... the kids beat us all!

fantastic Family Fun. Having trouble finding things to do in London with teenage family.
This was a great place to visit.
Challenged the family to work together under pressure, ans find new strengths in all of us.
We highly recommend this and will be back to tackle the other themed challenges soon.

Fantastic experience - highly recommend. I echo the other reviews. Our office went (large group of 30) as a teambuilding event; possible if you can book a date/time where all 6 rooms are available, so that you can all do it at the same time in 6 teams of 3-6 people each. A great exercise to do as a corporate teambuilding event. Staff were fantastic and know what they're doing. Really well done, can't imagine anyone who'd find this too easy or not have a great time getting really into it.
Simply Amazing. Went there for my good friend's birthday. The clue quest was challenging and fun! The team member looking after us was great. Definitely would recommend!

Best room I have been to. I have been to ten rooms, and this is hands down the best one. We felt like we got in a great flow of things which lasted the whole hour, and we still needed 3 extra minutes to get out of the room. For us it was a perfect mix of "wow" factor and just fun puzzles. Well deserving of their spot on top of the tripadvisor list.

Thoroughly enjoyable event!. My daughter had tackled one of these rooms in Hungary and suggested that our family of 5 should have a go. It was lots of fun and as a group we worked well as a team to successfully solve the clues. Really recommend this. We certainly would go again to a similar Escape Game.

Fun experience!!. Had been to HintHunt before (and loved it) and wanted to see if ClueQuest could better it.And did it?TBH - pretty much exactly the same experience - but still fab and highly recommended.Took our family (2 adults 2 teens) 48 mins to complete the room and we had loads of fun in the process.Planing to go back to try their 2nd (and forthcoming 3rd) rooms soon...
Great team activity. Booked 4 rooms for my work colleagues. Everyone enjoyed it and was surprised it took them longer than they originally thought it would to escape. Well worth trying out!

Great fun !!!. We went with 6 teenagers(12-16), booked two rooms , had an hour to work out all the clues and puzzles , and we just had so much fun!!! The staff were great and it was harder than we expected but with some helpful hints along the way we managed to get out just in timeHighly recommended for anyone who likes puzzles and we would love to come back again soon!

Escapism at its best. This was a birthday treat from my sons and their partners. We were not sure what to expect but we're all pleasantly surprised. After an introduction to the mission all 5 of us entered the room. It took a few minutes to start working as a team each with different strengths. Everyone was able to offer something to solving the puzzles.Great fun and an hour passed in a flash. Highly recommended

If you have a spare hour then you have to do this!. A very original idea that draws you in. Without giving anything away you are placed into a room, with a few instructions and then left to work everything else out! Although you have an hour to solve the puzzle it soon flies by and you realise you are running out of time. The organisation is excellent and if you are truly stuck the 'mysterious' control room offer some cryptic advice!We are very excited to return to try the next room.

Good fun. 2 brothers. 7 kids. 4 adults. 2 teams. 1 winner ! Good fun for everyone.
Top tip if you want the younger ones to also enjoy it - remember it's a game and help them (re)discover clues found by the adults.
Great family activity. We came with our two teenagers (13+16). Exelent for family bonfing. We all continued to smile hours after the mission ended

Lots of fun for 10+ age group. I went today to Cluequest with a 10 year old, 13 year old and two 16 year olds. Being locked in a room seemed a bit odd to them, by the end of it (when we were literally screaming at each other as we got out with a minute to spare!) they were fully converted. A short-ish walk from King Cross station, make sure you print out directions as they really help and write down the number - handy as we were late due to the circle line train delays! Our host was fab, gave great clues that weren't easy. We all thoroughly enjoyed solving all the different things. I'd say under 10's might find it hard or get bored but it's so great for teens and above. We would all definitely return!The fastest, most fun but definitely by the end most stressful hour of my life!

Great birthday treat. A great activity to do with mates. We managed to get out with 1 second to spare with lots of shouting numbers out and luckily he typed the numbers in fast enough to open the lock. Highly recommended

Wish we could get back for more!. We went with our 14 year old daughter and everyone was super excited with this form of evening entertainment. She had a great time out-playing the adults - yet, ultimately it was combining the varied talents of everyone on the team that got us out (well, okay, and some hints by the Spymaster towards the end when we started losing focus).We were in London for a week-long holiday and this hour was certainly one of the highlights.

Spectacular. Did not know what to expect. Didn't matter. It was WAY better than we could have imagined. Loved it so much, went back two days after first visit to try second room challenge. Just as entertaining the second time. If you are travelling with teens and looking for something a bit different, this is a must. Staff are really accommodating and fun.

Brilliant. Wont say to much about the game , dont want to spoil it . What a superb experience , excellently run will definitely do the other rooms .Managed to escape with 3 minutes to spare phew!!!!! If your able have a go its worth it

Painfully frustrating fun. Really fun way to spend an hr! It takes about 10 mins to get your brain focused in the right directions and stop yourself just tearing through the room, but once you do, it is fully immersive! Would 100% recommend to anyone who enjoys puzzles, riddles, or just generally feeling like a secret agent.

Family Fun Game. This was a great family game. My husband and I bought our teenage children (boy and girl) and our 20 years old daughter. Everyone enjoyed it. THey took a family photo and made it a magnet.....too small though. We took a cab there, but I would suggest using public transportation and eat before you go. There aren't many options in the area.

MI5 here we come!!. If you enjoy problem solving, using observational skills, and working with a team against the clock then look no further. This was a birthday treat for me which I shared with my husband, daughter and son-in-law. All of us thoroughly enjoyed ourselves particularly as we completed our mission with 13.47 mins to spare. Want to know more.... Sorry you'll have to book and have a go as this tape will self-destruct in 60 seconds............... Agent Star over and out.

Mega fun, mega entertaining, well worth the money!. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were fully immersed in a gripping and exciting storyline with a host who couldn't have been more helpful or interested in our experience (Thanks Doug!)The room we entered (Plan52) was really well set out, with loads of objects and clues to find which, as the game progressed, had a natural flow and sense of achievement attached. As we had a walkie talkie, and there was a microphone in each room, our host could pick up if we were very stuck, and offer subtle hints as to where we needed to go next, which didn't impose on our gameplay or immersion in the story. He certainly didn't tell us how to do it, rather nudged us in the right direction, and all the way through kept in character with the storyline.
