The rooms had a really good mixture of physical, logical and mathematical problems. Part of the appeal to us is having to find bits and bobs, useful or not, and we enjoyed having a clipboard to log our items and write down anything we thought would be useful for later.We were given 5 minutes extra time to complete the last puzzle, and this meant that we left the room feeling a sense of accomplishment. The storyline kept going until we left the building, and Doug was interested in how we found the game, praised us where appropriate but also had a joke with us when we'd got something quite simple wrong.Altogether this was a brilliant experience, and we are now booked to go and do the second game and we are really looking forward to going back.

Brilliant Fun:. Four of us, two couples, went here last weekend to try this out not knowing what to expect. I won't ruin it or give anything away but it's safe to say that this is without a doubt one of the best ways to spend an hour or so in London. Great fun, challenging, engaging. Whatever you're expecting it's more. I had read nothing in advance (I'd advise you to do the same). Just enjoy it. Our guide/mentor was especially friendly and helpful. What are you waiting for. BOOK NOW!

What a great start to a Sunday!!. We had a weekend in London and my boyfriend's family fancied something a bit different so they booked ClueQuest. I didn't have any expectations at all and hadn't thought that much about it until we arrived. It was a little bit hot in the reception area but it had a really nice friendly atmosphere so we didn't mind waiting there for a little while. On arrival into the room, I was surprised at how well thought out the puzzle was. You really had to get your brain in gear but in a really good way!! Great for team building and the guys hosting were so friendly. Perfect for all capabilities and easy to get to from Kings Cross Station. Thanks for a great morning, I definitely recommend!

Great fun and very well run. We had a great time at Clue Quest, found the whole experience interesting and fun. It's definitely something for the family or even a group of friends. The people that run it are very helpful and make the whole experience memorable. It's on our list to do again.
Excellent!. So much fun and really well organised!! I loved it.Great with friends, but also for a team building activity too

Great Fun, woud definitely recomment a visit!. I visited ClueQuest with my husband, daughter (21) and her boyfriend as part of graduation celebrations, just to do something different and it was a great success. The clues were challenging but we did manage to get out with 1 minutes 6 seconds to spare with just a few clues along the way. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for a fun but challenging hour. Great for friends, families or business teambuilding.
Lots of fun and a great experience to share!. We were still talking about it an hour later, no need to say more... I can really recommend to anyone that wants to share a nice event as a group!

Fun day out . Booked this for my friends birthday..was such a good experiencing. Got all of our minds working! The people who work there are great and really friendly. We all had a great time! Unfortunately we did not finish on time :-( but we were assisted at the end on solving the clues!

Fantastic experience and great hosts!!!. We had a great time with a group of 4 people, we went with plan52 which we thought would be childs play but I can assure you that you will be challenged! Agent O (our host) was extremely helpful as Agent O allowed us to pray in a separate room which was very nice! I would recommend this to absolutely anyone, we didn't think it would be our cup of tea but oh how we were wrong....planning our next trip already.

Brilliant. This was a great way to spend an hour or so. The whole family loved it, almost done it in the hour but because we were so close we got an extra 6 mins and managed to escape. A must for all.

Excellent. Really good way to spend an hour! (Well just under!)..
Look forward to go back and try the other room and also when hopefully the mobile unit is active

Fantastic fun. Visited ClueQuest with our family of 2 adults and 3 kids (ages from 8-14) for the Plan52 game, with absolutely no idea as to what to expect, having been lured by glowing Trip Advisor reviews. All members of our family got really involved - even the 8 year old - and it was tremendous fun trying to figure out the clues to escape the room in 60 minutes (which we managed to do!). Would definitely recommend as a fun bonding experience and, although there was a bit of intra-family bickering on a few occasions, we all came out smiling and buzzing with excitement. We would definitely do something similar again.

Brilliant Fun!!. We took 2 rooms as part of our work's social and competed to see who would get out first. Was really good fun, makes you question everything around you. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and want to come back and try out the other operations! Highly recommend this.

Go to Clue Quest!. We had a FABULOUS time at Clue Quest. We have been to another escape room in Richmond ,VA, so we have some experience, but we pleased with the differences. It was challenging and a great time - a highlight of our trip. We have three teenage boys, but we all LOVED it.

Excellent way to spend an hour.. Have you seen the film Saw? Well this is just like this, but without the inevitable blood and gore at the end. Locked in a room surrounded by clues and with 60 minutes to get out. It's fun and exciting but not easy. I'd say it's best to go in a team of 4 and WORK TOGETHER. Staff are very friendly and will lend a hand if needs be. Excellent afternoon. and would love to go again to play in the second room.
what great fun! . what a great way to spend the evening. it was great fun and really made you think and question everything. I would.highly recommend it to everyone!

so close!. This attraction was very people-friendly right from the start. As soon as we walked into the building, we were greeted by an well-dressed attendant who sat us down in the waiting room and offered us a drink and said our game would not be long. She was honest, and we were briefed by our mission controller and he told us exactly what to do as he led us to our room, which we had one hour to escape from. We felt confident that we would succeed. We didn't, however, and were really close to the finish. I recommend this to anyone who is a lover of detective work and escape games. You do not need any special skills, just logic and common sense.
Highly unusual . This was perfect for a work away day or team building excersice without having to go out of london - highly unusual format and puzzles, a bit like being in the crystal maze

Best Team Building Exercise To Date!. I went with 4 other colleagues to ClueQuest on 30/07/15 and it really was so much fun. The staff there was really welcoming and friendly. They made you feel like you really was about to embark on a secret mission. The rooms were challenging which made it a great opportunity to find out how well you work with your team mates and to find out what each others strengths are and use them to your advantage. I would definitely recommend this to anyone, in fact I have already sent the link for ClueQuest to a number of my colleagues this morning. Looking forward to book my next mission with ClueQuest!!!

Highlight of the trip . I reserved for clue quest live escape game and not knowing what to expect with my 3 kids (4 years ,11 and 9 ) it turned out to be the highlight of our trip to London . Adrenaline rush , puzzles , mind itching laughter , stress all types of feelings and emotions through this hour . Even my 4 year old was involved and found us some real beneficial things in the room :) my kids still remember the fun they had in this hour and we r looking forward to try another rooms while in London :) this activity is best ever

A great challenge. A birthday treat and what a treat had such good fun, everyone thinks they are smart enough to solve the puzzles in the hour, not many do! But great fun trying. We did, see if you can. Staff friendly and helpful... But not too helpful.

Great night and a challenge. The rooms are challenging, the staff are great. As pet of a night out but not a night out on its own, it's fantastic. Try to take two teams of people, get two identical rooms and race out!
Excellent Evening. We went to clueQuest to celebrate my birthday and had a really good time, the team there are great and really enjoy what they do. We'll be going back again it was that good!

60 min of craziness ... absolutely amazing ☺. Me and my friends had an absolute crazy time escaping the room ... clue quest turned out to be much much better than my expectation ... intellectual madness and team work at the same time ... reminded me of crystal maze ...We wish them all the luck for their future .. and we hope to visit this place soon ... ciao ☺

Literally the most fun you can have in 1 hour without getting naked. It was so much fun, nothing like the rush of adrenaline you get as the time is counting down. The room is well set up, the hosts helpful, the puzzles puzzling. I've visited HintHunt also, both are excellent fun and I can't recommend either over the other one.

BEST FUN YOU CAN HAVE IN 6O MINUTES IN LONDON. This is the second escape game we have done recently and I cannot recommend it enough. Brilliant way to spend 1 hour in London and our team of 3 escaped with just 22 seconds to spare! I would definitely recommend this event for a work/team bonding event or just a fun afternoon with friends & family. It would also be a good ice breaker if you were with a group of friends who didn't know each other very well.
Really fun!. A great fun, challenging day out. We as a group of 5 finished the 'training style' escape room with 6 minutes to spare. Would love to try out the other rooms!

Like being on the crystal maze. Absolutely loved this - it is completely absorbing and brilliant fun. Went with a group of people from work and all of us really enjoyed it. We've all been raving about how good it is to others and are hoping to come back and do a different room soon. Not surprised this is number 1 in tripadvisor!

Absolutely Brilliant!. We, a team of young middle aged people arrived here wondering if it would be more suited to a youngerr clientele. How wrong we were! We absolutely loved it! It was an excellent team game and kept you on your toes for the full hour! Not easy but achievable - just! Well worth the time and money. If you are thinking about it - just do it!

Priceless family bonding experience!. My wife and I took our two daughters aged 12 and 10 to London. ClueQuest was listed on some internet articles as a top 10 type experience to do with kids. We booked our spot for our last day of the trip thinking it would be mildly entertaining.But it was a blow away fun experience! What a fantastic way to top off our trip. Also discovered how fast thinking the kids were..and how slow thinking I had become :)Highly recommend it.
Lock and lode. Took my team here for a team building/bonding- all had a good time (even though my team lost!) Recommend this

Family competition . We had two families of four compete in two rooms. Children ranged from 10-15 years old. Staff was excellent, competition was a blast, and we were all challenged yet had many successes in our hour. Highly recommend as something to do in London to spice up the usual tourist itinerary.

The Best Fun I've Ever Had In London. The immensely high reviews for this are entirely deserved. I have lived in London for almost 10 years and I've never found something so engaging to do with friends. It's truly, truly invigorating. Everything from the friendly and personal attention from your host (we had Doug, who was ace) to the game itself is so brilliantly worked out. Congratulations ClueQuest, what you've created is truly fantastic.

Fantastic family afternoon. We went as a team of 2 adults, 3 teenagers and a 9 year old (who was kindly also allowed in with us, even though there's meant to be a maximum of 5 people). Without exception, everyone had a fantastic time and was able to contribute. We're already planning on when to go back and try the other mission! Yes, it's expensive, but a great way to spend an hour and get the grey matter going

Everybody needs to experience ClueQuest!. Went along with my son, daughter and their partners with very little idea of what was involved.What a brilliant event!The venue is tucked away about a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross and there are bars and restaurants along the way, although I'd recommend leaving them for your return, assuming you manage to escape!As a group of five, and without really setting our strategy, we all knuckled in and started finding and solving clues. A couple of minor technical glitches extended our escape by a few minutes, but escape we did!The staff were excellent. The venue is perfect without the distractions of a bar etc. I'd definitely do it again, but of course it would need to be a different challenge.Excellent!

Brilliant 60 minutes. This is something very different. The game challenges the brain cells, is good for logical thinkers and problem solvers. If you get stuck the staff will give you a clue to get you moving but not too much to spoil the came. Excellent fun, can't wait to try the other game.

So much fun!. This was a really fun experience! I had no idea what to expect--but it didn't matter. They explain what you need to do and then they help you throughout your time there. The staff is excellent and does everything in their power to make sure you have a good experience. In fact, when we showed up it turns out that I had inadvertently booked for the following week, not the week we were there. Instead of turning us away, Vickie, a staff member who wasn't on duty at that time, checked and found that there was an open room and she ran a game for us. I was so impressed at how seamlessly she did this and how kind and fun she was. Thank you so much! We will come back!

The most family fun you can have in an hour!. My family and I did this Escape game on a recent visit to London. The staff clearly care about what they are doing and go out of their way to carefully manage your hour for the most fun. This was one of the highlights of our trip and well worth the cost. I would highly recommend this well planned game with lots of twists and turns. I would definitely go back to do their other game on another visit.

Fantastic!. I'd do it again in a heartbeat! I can't say enough good things about ClueQuest, it was so much fun. The whole family participated, and pulled together as a team. Just enough hints given so that we didn't get frustrated, but we were allowed to figure it out ourselves. Just go do it!

Brilliant entertainment, will go again!. If your reading this it's because you are considering going, well consider no more and just book!!I wanted something to do in London with a couple who moved to Australia a couple of years ago that were back for a holiday. I didn't want to do the normal attractions like the theater/cinema where you sit in the dark in silence. Clue Quest was perfect!Its challenging enough to make you think but not so challenging as to be impossible and depressing. Like i said we were a group that hadn't seen each other for years so as long as your with people your conformable with you don't need to have "practiced." The venue is easy to find, newly decorated and well laid out. The staff on arrival were friendly, engaging and welcoming.Overall one of the best things I've ever done in London.
Awesome and well planed game for groups.. This is a brilliant and well developed game. We had a great night. If you are planing to go make a reservation, because they are very popular.

Brilliant. Excellent idea and so well executed. It was hard for our team of one adult and three children but Richard was brilliantly encouraging and the trip was a huge success. Thank you and we will be back !

Brilliant fun for mixed age groups. I went with my nieces 18 & 16 and my kids 13 & 12. We were all really entertained and each one of us was able to contribute in solving the puzzles before us. Great exercise in communication and teamwork. We all loved the experience, can't believe how quickly the hour flew by. We were granted an extra couple of minutes, so didn't quite make the hour deadline. Really good location near Kings Cross, Regents Canal and all the great restaurants nearby.

Excellent Team Building Event. Really enjoyed taking my team here for a team building event. I had done something similar in Switzerland with some friends and thought it would be great to see how my team responded to the challenge.We were split into two groups, everyone really enjoyed it, although it wasn't easy. There was a good sense of co-operation and teamwork and competition between the two groups. My only criticism was that it was very hot during one section of the mission.Would definitely recommend for team building or just for fun with friends.

A different kind of activity to do in London. Very much recommended!!. I've never had so much fun! Everything about this experience was amazing. If you're looking for something different and exciting to do in London THIS is the place to go to!
Great Day Out. Great day out with the family racing against the clock and clues to escape a very well thought out rooom. Would recommend.

Brilliant. Didn't quite know what to expect but enjoyed every minute of it. We went as a group of 6 and managed to escape the room with almost 4 minutes to spare. So pleased. Will definitely go back for the second room at some stage. Thanks for a great time.

Fantastic fun and excellent Value for Money. Brilliant fun. So clever and staff were great. We were a team of 6 and we all LOVED IT! we are booking again tomorrow for the next room! If you like puzzles or the Crystal Maze - book this now!

Really a lot of fun!. This was just a great activity. My family and I had an absolute blast racing against the clock to escape the room and save the world! The staff provides subtle (and sometimes not so subtle) hints along the way so that you never remain frustrated for too long. We had just about finished the final puzzle when we ran out of time and the staff gave us an extra 5 minutes to get out of the room. We only needed an extra ~2 minutes or so. We were so close! We will definitely visit ClueQuest again the next time we are in London.

Solid, well crafted escape room game. Having played a couple in Germany I was prepared for what was in store. The host were new and keen. The game it's self operation black sheep was a little generic in terms of scenario but it was nonethe less w solids gme play experience. There are a few to o many padlocks for my liking at the expensive of some really ingenious puzzles that I have seen else where. A solid 4/5 but not the pure genius that these games have the potential to be.

amazing time with the family. we had a super hr working together to solve the puzzles...i must admit i was sceptical as sometimes even a simple family board game ends in a heated discussion.haha..but we all really enjoyed it...we will go back for more when we are local again......the best fun we have had as a family in a very long time...thanks clue quest !

Absolutely amazing!. I wish I could give this a higher rating. Although we didnt finish it it was still absolutely fantastic! It had the perfect balance of not being simple and easy but not over complex. I would definitely recommend this to anyone of any age!

Best part of our trip. Our family of four spent the best hour of our entire trip here. From arrival to departure the whole experience was simply magical. Special shout out to Michael. This is a must for all!
Nice!. We went there for a double date with some friends. We had really nice time. The game requires you to cooperate, be creative and solve problems efficiently. Loads of fun!

Fantastic time!. Went here on our recent vacation to London. Found out about it on TripAdvisor and the positive reviews sealed the deal. It was terrific! I don't understand why there aren't places like this in the U.S. The time flew by and every one of us were able to contribute to solving the puzzles to get us out of the rooms. We were a group of 4 (Dad, 45; Mom, 45; son, 9; Grandmother, 79). Everyone was involved and loved it! Would definitely do one of the other sections next time we're in London!

Amazing. Got this as a Christmas present and didn't know what to expect. Had a brilliant time! It was exciting, fun and exhilarating. It relied on teamwork so I suggest taking 4-5 people. The staff was friendly and overall, just fantastic! Fully recommended!
Great Challenges.. Will be back for sure and spread the word.Recommendations: Opt for longer quest periods, make optional quests outdoor around in the city, make advancing levels.

Awesome!. An excellent, well planned and executed game that everyone will enjoy, we made it out with 48 seconds to spare!!! I highly recommend this as the highlight of your trip to London, don't miss it, we are still talking about it days later...!

Great start to family 18th birthday trip. As part of probably one of last holidays as a family of four, now our two children are aged 18 and 20 and either going to Uni or already gone, I decided we would spend 4 days in London and start with ClueQuest as a surprise. This was a huge success and had us all working hard as a family to get out within the 60mins. Made it with 2 minutes to spare (after a few clues) and it left us buzzing for the rest of the day. All want to go back and do the new challenge so maybe I will get another family trip !

Great teens birthday activity. We had a great time in 2 teams in Op Blacksheep for a 13 YO birthday party. One team broke out with 2 min left, the other nearly made it but failed at the last minute! Very little adult help. The new venue in Kings Cross is fantastic, bright and clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

Highly recommended!. Fantastic and fun experience. Definitely gets your brain going! Went with a group of friends and we all enjoyed it. Won't give anything away but what I will say is that it's absolutely worth paying a visit to ClueQuest!

Brilliant!. What a fantastic afternoon we had at clueQuest! Went with 2 friends and the best time. Felt very looked after by our 'agent' and the room was challenging but fun with a huge range of different problems and puzzles to solve. Don't want to give the game away too much but please go to clueQuest - you won't regret it!

Would recommend if you want something different. It was fun from the moment they let us into the building. I don't want to say too much and give away anything. It was challenging, fun and a great time with friends. Will almost definitely go back for another challenge.

So much fun!. If you'd like to experience a new and different form of entertainment give ClueQuest a try. Located 10 minutes walk from St Pancras station it's quite easy to get to. Booked well in advance since it's popular in London at the moment. As their website says, don't arrive very early for your timeslot since there is limited waiting space. Upon arrival we were briefed about our mission and given basic instructions about how the game works...then locked in the room with an hour to escape! The room has many fun and challenging puzzles to solve with each one leading to the next. Some require multiple steps to solve. None of the challenges require physical strength and the game is totally appropriate for children (we have two 13 year olds and a 15 year old). The clues might be a little difficult for younger kids. We managed to escape with just a few seconds to spare. ClueQuest is different and really entertaining...highly recommended!

Awesome Family Fun. Went with my Mom, Aunt and Cousin and we had a blast. A lot of fun and a great night out. I highly recommend it for anyone that wants to take family, friends or colleagues out for a great night.

a brilliantly entertaining evening!. This was a fantastic family experience, two groups, mixed ages from 18 to 60+, all thoroughly enjoyed it. Would recommend to anyone who wants an outing with a difference, great fun, much laughter as well as satisfaction as we worked our way through the challenges - and they were challenging! The staff were extremely welcoming, and on hand to ensure we all had a really good time. Very highly recommended.
Black sheep operation, tough but worth it. Second visit to clueQuest and was not disappointed please, please design another. You have to do this

Awesome sauce!. An excellent, fun alternative to getting plastered. It really is sooo much fun, you will get completely into it - I have now been to four - two here and two at hint hunt down next to Euston station. Clue quest is the better quality of the two - bigger rooms, and more rooms to unlock than hint hunt as part of your quest. I thoroughly enjoyed it and was really buzzing when I came out

Great experience and loads of fun!. I have only good things to say about ClueQuest! A couple of people in our team had done similar things before but it was nowhere near as good as this. They start the whole experience from when you enter and everything is very self explanatory so there was no prior experience necessary. The staff are very polite and fun so i definitely want to try their other escape room if i get the chance. (We did the blacksheep one which was fantastic and I thoroughly recommend it!)

AMAZING. There is no experience like it!!! There is nothing i can compare it too, it is so unusual and not your normal night out. your literately in a live escape game. It was great from beginning, it is a great team building exercise. You have to work together and its not simple as you would think (i cannot give you any information as it will ruin it). Its all about team work and common sense to work your way through. It is an experience i will be booking again, without a doubt. The staff are friendly and make it all a great experience. I went with 4 other friends and it was a team of 5 and it was £21.80 per person which was well worth it. I was told about this via a friend so i though i would book it. My friends were so skeptical and did not really want to go, now they want to book the other mission and telling everyone around them about it. A friend estimated we would complete it in 20 minutes, BOY was he wrong lol It was such a rush and a big high to have completed it with only 1 minute 11 seconds left. We felt great walking out of there. i cannot wait to do it again. You have never felt so smart and so dumb at the same time, it definitely brings out the best and make you notice your mind set.

Second time and still great fun. Visited for the second time and played the other game, Blacksheep and can't wait for new games so we can go again. Great fun for all, really enjoyed our afternoon at Cluequest

So much fun. Visited here as a group of friends. It's a fantastic environment and is so much fun. The staff are so friendly and welcoming and the game is really engaging and pitched just right to be challenging but fun! The group I went with was a friend and then friends of hers who I didn't know and it was a great ice breaker! There were groups of all varieties, there were corporate groups, families, friends - it's suited for everyone and I can't wait to go back and try the other challenge! A fantastic alternative activity!

Excellent family fun - pitched at just the right level.. From start to finish staff were enthusiastic, polite and encouraging. We found the challenges were pitched at just the right level to ensure that everyone in our team (age 10-50) were fully included. We were well supported and guided throughout the game and we finished on a real high. Really great value for money.

This is simply the best 1 hour we had for a long long time.. This is simply the best 1 hour we had for a long long time. Frankly the best use of the roughly 25£ per head that it costs. Great for a set of people who have started working together to bond very well.Will prefer not to disclose any details of the 'mission'.
Great fun for a team outing. Superb entertainment. One of the best hours that I have spent in a long time. Excellent as a team building exercise.

A great way to spend 60 mins!. The whole experience was fantastic from start to finish, the member of staff we were working with was lovely, friendly and VERY helpful in times of despair!!! We will be defo coming back to do another room and seeing if we can beat our time! Anyone who hasn't done this before, what are you waiting for?! It was great, advice would be to check everywhere and everything...oh and check your spellings!!Thanks for a great experience!

Fantastic fun - brilliant!. This is a very clever concept - challenging and entertaining plus great to do in a group. We went for my dads birthday as a surprise and all had a great time. the set up and staff are great.Have recommended to all my friends and cant wait to do the other challenge soon

Good for teamwork and for getting your mind working under pressure.. You need to book well ahead to get a weekend slot. I had a voucher for a Christmas present and booked at short notice due to everyone's timetable. We could therefore only get a 9.00am or 9.20am slot. It is a short walk from King's Cross.There were 5 of us with ages ranging from 25 to 55. I went with my grown up children and their other halves. It is great for teambuilding or just to see how other people's minds work.Despite the early start our brains soon got into gear and it was good to see everyone working as a team. It is difficult but I am sure once you have done one of these that you would be quicker on the uptake with future ones. They are in the process of making a harder one whilst there is another scenario already on offer. 35% of teams get out of the rooms within the allocated hour.We made it with 10 mins to spare despite a 5 min penalty for getting a code wrong 3 times in a row. Watching the timer counting down certainly adds to the pressure.The staff were all very helpful and welcoming. Despite the fact they were fully booked we did not feel we were being "processed through" at all. We all agreed we wanted to do another one in the future.I would also recommend a walk along the Regents Canal towards Camden afterwards. We all enjoyed a hearty brunch.
Great fun escaping! . Really enjoyed our experience here, great for a group of friends. It's a little expensive (we went to even better ones in Budapest for a fraction of the price) but that's London

Fantastic Fun - Very Cleverly Put Together. We were a troupe of 20 on a business outing. We went last week and still can not stop talking about it. We will definitely be re-booking and recommending ClueQuest. Much thought went into the games and it showed. The staff were friendly and really got into character for our missions. Loved it, loved it, loved it!!!

Fantastic fun-filled hour - deservedly no 1 in London. Went with two teenage daughters (aged 15 and 17) and all agreed that this was one of if not the most enjoyable thing we did during four packed days in London.It was our first ever live escape game and we had no idea what to expect. We were given a really friendly welcome and a fun introduction, with clear instructions but very little given away about the mission at hand. We did the red box room, which was challenging and very enjoyable. We subsequently did another escape room elsewhere in London and this one was by far the more enjoyable experience - it was much more do-able, many of the puzzles could be worked out without assistance but when we were struggling we were given helpful pointers (as opposed to being directly told the answer). Great variety of challenges, puzzles and we all wanted to do another one as soon as we had finished - getting out with a couple of minutes to spare. A great sense of achievement but it would be huge fun whether you succeed in your mission or not, and can't recommend it highly enough - if you are in two minds whether to do it - GO FOR IT! You won't regret it, it's not scary, just fun albeit with a bit of pressure as the clock is ticking down!! Can't wait for the next trip to London when the Blacksheep challenge will be number one on our 'to do' list. Thanks to our two games masters for looking after us so well and making it an amazing experience for myself and my daughters!

Absolutely brilliant, challenging and fun!!. This is our 3rd escape game that we've done, and our favourite to date. Our host, Andrew, was brilliant. Really got us in the zone for the game, and explained everything extremely well - both before and after. The game was challenging, absorbing, extremely well thought out and had something for everyone. Still, it was do-able and we got out with 8.51 to spare. Phew!!! We did Operation Blacksheep and can't wait to go back again for the other game.
Escape with your friendships!. Great birthday in a group of 5. This is the third 'escape' game I've done and was the best. Really reccommend.

Fun and engaging. There were four of us taking part. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The task itself was really engaging and entertaining. We found it more challenging than expected, but had a great time. I would definitely recommend it as an alternative to the usual team building activities.

Time flies when you're having fun. 3 of us went along after work, arrived quite tired and not rally sure if we're up for it. Really friendly welcome from the staff, relaxing intro and dealt considerately with the claustrophobia worries of one of us (it was not a problem). Then we started the challenge/puzzle/mission and man does it draw you in and get you engaged. You will not believe how fast time seems to flash by while you're in there.And then it gives you lots to talk about when you finally do go to the pub!All 3 of us want to the black sheep one now.

Amusing Thursday Night. Went to ClueQuest as a group of 4 in mid-20's (except Dave, late 20's). All had a really good time - despite not making it out in time! Challenging and excellent alternative to our usual evenings in London. Highly recommend for all ages/abilities.
Best. Bday. Ever.. It was really entertaining and we had the most fun ever together.Her mom promised she could come back fir her birthday but this time,we are going with another girl as well.

Great fun. Three us played the red box room. Staff were helpful and into the concept. Room was challenging but doable and we escaped with 4minutes 46 seconds to spared. Will return to do the other room

Great fun for those who enjoy a challenge. My boyfriend and did this just the two of us. We were completely absorbed in the experience. The game was fun yet challenging. The team were great, friendly, professional and helpful. Our adrenaline was certainly pumping as the clock was ticking! We'd highly recommend it, it didn't matter that there was only two of us- just made it a bit more of a challenge!The layout of the building was new and clean, and the door was pretty awesome too- instantly felt as though you were 007.

Great fun!. The staff is so nice. We had missed our train and ran late. They couldn't have been more accommodating. We had my 6 year old son with us. You could tell he was really into being a spy. It was very challenging. Lots of thinking involved. I recommend it for people of all ages.

So much fun. I highly recommend ClueQuest. We did this as a team event (2 teams of 6 people, each team in their own room). You get sucked into the action, the clues, the mind games. You feel like a child, in the best spy movie ever.
It's so much fun and gets everyone buzzing and talking about it for hours!

Awesome.. I arranged this for my girlfriend's birthday - it was worth every penny. If you're debating whether to book this, just do it!The team were really lovely and smiley and genuinely excited when we made it out! All this despite the fact we arrived late - they could have made a big deal out of it but didn't, because they're great.I'll be recommending this to everyone I know in the hope I get to go again sometime soon. Thank you for a great evening ClueQuest!

Fantastic. Must do in London. This please is great, get in while relatively undiscovered. Look on trip advisor, and an escape room experience is top in most cities.It is live play, great fun, logic games and team working.It really is amazing excitement and fun.Cluequest have it spot on. Well done.

Really fun and interesting!. This is a great activity for anyone who loves a good puzzle and discovery. I went with a group of five of my friends and we had a lot of fun. I was full of suspense and you really had to use your brain. Much better than a night out!

Absolutley brilliant - loved it!. A group of four of us in our 30s undertook Plan 52 as a present for my brother. We were all pretty skeptical and on the way i was wondering if I had booked the right thing and how good it would be. The game was absolutely brilliant and really clever. I have no idea where the hour went but the four of us were full engaged the whole time. I've already recommended this to friends and will be back to crack Blacksheep with my friends over from Australia in July. Love it!!!

Brill!. This was a fab thing to do with our 14 and 12 year old sons. It's very well done and once in you're quickly engrossed in the task. The time goes very quickly but I think we had just as much fun afterwards analysing our performance, or lack of, over lunch. Will be taking youngest son back for a birthday treat with his friends, after all he was the best out of our bunch and me, well suffice to say I was the weakest link ;-) A word to the wise, don't over think it!
The Parker's. Great fun, we cracked it and managed to get out of the rooms (operation black sheep ) with 30 sec spare we will defo go back and do another room .

Amazing escape experience. I tried a couple of rooms before, but this was definitely the best escape experience I ever had. The puzzles were really challenging and solving them gave me great confidence, it felt really good. Although it was a 3-5 people room, we managed to get out just as a team of two - though we only had 12 seconds left in the end so imagine the adrenaline we got:) You better go and try it for yourself!:)

Even better than expected!. Amazing experience, even better than we expected - the rooms are challenging but not impossible, a great team activity to make a change from drinks at the pub every weekend.

Best birthday party I've ever had. This was hands down the best group activity I have ever been to in London, and made for an unforgettable birthday party! The clues were extremely well thought out, challenging us without being too hard to get our heads around, and the staff were so helpful and friendly. I definitely want to come back soon and try their other rooms!!

Amazing way to spend and hour. We visited Clue Quest on a trip to London as a surprise for the kids. Having read lots of reviews I was expecting this to be good. However, this surpassed expectations. A manic hour passed very quickly and this was intense fun. We all really enjoyed it and I would thoroughly recommend for families (we managed to get through it with no arguments or a divorce!). Also thanks to our Gamesmaker who was very welcoming and made our visit relaxed and entertaining.

Gamers paradise - chaotic but fun!. 4 of us took part in this yesterday and had a brilliant time. We had no idea what to expect but its essentially a real life version of a puzzle computer game that you complete in a group. Would highly recommend as an alternative activity either with friends or family.
Job done Mr Q!. Couldn't recommend ClueQuest enough!! There were never ending doors of surprises and challenges...sweaty palms as the seconds counted down...but we did it with 1 second to spare!!

Great fun. Been to another similar venue last year, but this was by far the better experience. On arrival we were made welcome and given our brief, all very tongue in cheek but this added to the fun. The game last an hour and we (wife and 2 x 15 year olds) escaped and saved the world with 1 minute 39 seconds to spare. Photo and ClueQuest secret agent cards were a great free touch at the end. The hour goes by far too quickly, it's that good! Highly recommend if you are going to London.

One of the best in London. At the time of doing this , it would have been my hands down favourite escape game in london. It has been put into second by time run, but thats a personal opinion. it still sits high above a few others. We will still be at the front of the queue for any new games.
Incredible Team Building Experience. Such a great afternoon out. The Cluequest team were attentive and friendly, and made for a great experience! would definitely recommend!
Sets a fair standard. This was our favourite game in london until time run has come along. It still sets a fair standard and we will be visiting again next month.

Loads of fun for everyone. I had heard about escape rooms, but was a little sceptic whether it only was for children or not, but it was a lot of fun for us as well (four people at 40).It will almost definately take the full hour, and is a great way to kill some time, dont forget to book in advance since it seems like others like this place too.

Unique Fun. It's a bit off the beaten path but well worth the drive. There were 3 of us - 2 adults and my 10 yr old daughter and we all had a blast. It's a brilliant concept and extremely well organized. Great family activity and a nice excuse to use your brain while on holiday.

Excellent activity!. We were 3 people and we did the first room "Plan52" and it was amazing! It is very well organized, the instructions were very clear and the staff was awesome! It has many elements in it so doing it with only two people might be a bit difficult. We enjoyed every second of it and I highly recommend it! :)

ClueQuest the live escape . Brilliant! !
A must try if you enjoy challenges, puzzles & feel you missed your calling as a secret agent 😆
Great game; great handler; best way to spend an hour after work or at the weekend ... highly recommended

A great way to spend an hour. My friends and I had a great time at cluequest. Everything is so well done and thought out. You get such a sense of accomplishment from getting through and working as a team, we actually felt like we'd saved the world. Highly recommend! :)
Terrific fun. 6 guys, early 30s and entirely cynical but loved every minute. Highly recommended for a party of any age.

Incomparably awesome. You arrive thinking it might be like the crystal maze, but once you get inside the room and the sfx come on over the speakers, a wicked haunting feeling sets in. So many locks, so much to take in! It's been visibly lovingly crafted with so much attention to detail, and GUARANTEED everyone in your team will find themselves having a fantastic time as they get immersed in the experience. Kudos to the ClueQuest team, they've done a really excellent job!

You need to experience this!. Such a fun experience, great at team-building or having a (competitive) laugh with mates if you're in different teams. Have done both PLAN 52 and Operation Blacksheep and both are exciting - you feel like you're secret agents! Good dollop of tongue-in-cheek humour thrown in by the makers too. Really fun worthwhile experience!

Amazing time. Honestly it was much better experience than I expected.Once you get into flow of game - totally enjoyable.Our team have been in the room Operation BlackSheep.I am definetely coming back to try the other room.

Fun and Challenging. This is an excellent way to spend an hour teambonding with your mates and working your brains around a fun set of clues. Defenately recommend if u're into board games and the like and do bring some friends along, it gets quite challenging!

Great experience. I went with 2 teams of 4 and we raced head to head in the Black Sheep rooms. The rooms are great fun and a great challenge to get finished in the hour. The staff were pleasant and helpful. All round a really enjoyable afternoon out.

So much fun!!. We are in London for our 15th anniversary and I wanted to surprise my husband with something fun that was outside the 'normal' London tourist attractions. ClueQuest did the trick!! We both loved it and although we didn't escape in time, we had a blast! Our assistant Johnny was so pleasant and helpful - he really helped to make our experience so enjoyable! As soon as we were done, my husband wanted to try one of the other rooms, and we really wish there was something like this in the U.S. The only negative is they do not have pricing or rooms for 2 people...you have to pay for a 3-person game. Other than that, no complaints and it was a most enjoyable time!

Great great great fun!. Conversations beforehand went something like;"It's got loads of five start reviews on TripAdvisor...""We'll see..."Conversations afterward went something like:"When can we do the other room?"

Fantastic Fun!. Was really excited to try this and it certainly didn't disappoint! Our team of three all really enjoyed the puzzles. We spent ages when we got out discussing how we'd individually solved parts and which were the best bits we'd figured out together. The sounds/music added a really great atmosphere and as a fairly small team we were very grateful for just the right level of hints and help.

Very good . We were a group of five and we all loved it! There was a good mixture of clues and challenges and it's incredible how the 60 minutes go so fast. Will definitely come again to try the other room.

The Adventure Game for 2015! Great fun!. We booked this as a group of friends who loved 'The Adventure Game' in the 1980s. It turned in to a brilliant, fun and very exciting evening with plenty of surprises. We 'escaped' with 5 seconds to spare! Highly recommended for anyone wanting to do something different. We are going to book the next mission really soon as we are all hooked! Book it, you won't be disappointed.

Great fun. ClueQuest is great fun and ideal as a team building activity or a bit of weekend fun. The puzzle and clues are challenging but not too hard. The good news is that the staff give you some extra clues if you get stuck.The staff were also friendly and we had a great time.High recommended!

AMAZING ESCAPE!!!!. We booked Cluequest for a work afternoon out and it was brilliant. Lots of fun and interesting problems to solve and worked well as a team building experience too. Couldn't recommend more highly!

Brilliantly executed!. I attended ClueQuest on a team day out and it far surpassed my expectations. The whole experience was great fun and brilliantly thought out. As the clock counts down you really do feel the pressure! I highly recommend this for an afternoon with friends or as a Team Building exercise for your work colleagues. I really cannot recommend this highly enough and I will be coming back.

Well worth a try. I have done both games here and both are good fun. Requires you to think outside the box and quite cryptically. Something very different to most other experiences around. Well worth a visit

Challenging and good fun, already booked again. This was the first escape the room type experience and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were really friendly and really got us into the mood of the challenge. We chose the plan 52 challenge and had two teams up against each other. Both teams got out within 30 secs of each other and with only around 3 mins remaining so it was definitely a challenge.We have booked Operation black sheep for a few weeks time and am looking forward to it.
Think outside the box. It was a really fun experience that got the whole group thinking. It was funny to see the panic set in as the clock ticked down. Definitely worth a go.

First experience ever - and loved it!. This was my first escape room experience, back in February. I went with some friends, and we LOVED it! We did the Black Sheep room and had such a good time, it was brilliant. Since then, I've done loads of other escape rooms across Europe, and ClueQuest is still one of the best. My husband and I are going back later this month to attempt Area 52 as a twosome, and hopefully defeat the room!

We are going back soon...don't hesitate to book!. This experience was so exhilarating and so much fun, my family and I are already planning when next to go back! We hadn't been before and therefore we didn't know exactly what to expect but once we got going, it was clear to us all that this challenge was worth every penny!It is a must do and great for all different types of people across different age groups. This can also be done for so many reasons, team building, birthdays, stag dos etc...

Great time. Such a fun and exciting way to spend an evening out. Price seemed abit steep initially for an hours worth of fun, but was worth it in retrospect. Three of us went, with the boys being abit sceptical about my idea of how to spend a Saturday night. Everyone had an amazing time, I was mentally exhausted by the end of it, and from our recommendation more of our friends also got to enjoy it! By the way, we got out with literally seconds to spare but had some help with the clues from the front desk – thanks =D
What a different way to have fun...... Excellent time had by all, I didn't know how valuable seconds were until you make it out of the room with just 11 to spare! Can't wait to have another go....
Secret mission accomplished !. We have been here today and had such a good time! Really didn't know what to expect but it was so good we all want to go again !

Recomended. A brilliant day and something different to do. All members of the group loved it, it was more difficult than i thought, which was a good thing as sitting in the waiting area makes it seem more basic than it is. Staff were helpful without being intrusive, would definitely do this again and try out the other room.

Can't think of a better way for an hour to whizz by!. This was our second and eagerly awaited visit. The new premises are so much better, but the whole experience has not changed. From the moment you enter the heavy wooden entrance door to the moment you leave it is just a fantastic experience. The staff are fantastic and if you manage to escape within the hour you feel such an achievement. Don't worry if you think you won't be able to do it common sense, team work and thinking outside the box is more important than brains alone. If you get the chance just book it, I am sure you won't regret it. It may seem a little expensive but it is money well spent in my opinion.

Loved it! I will be back. . I had never heard of this, but was taken here as part of a surprise trip. It was so much fun! It was a great way to get people talking and working together to solve the puzzle. I don't want to say too much as I don't want to give away what happens. But I will say I will be back again for another quest.
Cluequest= fab. Absolutely great fun! My brain has never worked so hard! The time flew by definitely recommend to everyone! Great experience, thank you,

So much fun - Time flew by. We played Plan 52 and our family was 2 adults and 2 children ages 16 and 12. We had every intention of working as a team but once we entered the room, we all went in different directions - chaos ensued! The hour flew by and has left us with so much to talk/debate about. It really was a fun experience and my personal observation was that our 12 year old was better than the rest of us put together! So glad that there are different rooms as we will definitely be coming back. Thank you Agent Jordan for being so friendly (and helpful).

Enjoyed every minute. ClueQuest was my first escape room style experience (I have done one more since then) and was outrageously fun. Went in a group of 5 and played the Professor Black Sheep room.The staff are enthusiastic and friendly, they really try to sell you the story which was fun light-hearted. The room layout and puzzles have really been thought through - they are challenging, varied and also have some humour to them. One moment you are solving puzzles, unlocking chests and the next you are breaking down a door!Even though we were a big group everyone could get involved as the puzzle required teamwork. You also have a walkie-talkie to talk to the staff if you get stuck which is a nice touch. I though this escape room was a lot better than Hint Hunt - tasks were more varied, the room was designed better and the puzzles followed on naturally (Hint Hunt was a lot more down to chance/luck or the staff hints). The group photo at the end & team cards are an added bonus and a little momento you can take home with you. Highly recommend! Will be coming back again to solve Mr Q's Apartment.

Awesome!!!. I had the chance to play their 2 games and it was really good. The immersive environnent made me forget it was a game and we all really got into it. Best live game experience! Not to mention the staff who are welcoming and smiling and make you feel at ease. Thumbs up guys! I keep recommending it to many people.

Brilliant Fun!!!. Did this with my partner and my brother and his girlfriend! I don't know what we really expected beforehand but it was so much more!!! So well planned & thought out, harder than I though it would be but not impossible!!! We all thoroughly enjoyed it and didn't argue once which apparantly never really happens! Lol Would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a challenge and not expensive! We will be back to to the other challenge!!

Great time, got out of the room very quickly!. Went with two group, raced each other in the same set up. The other team got out with 58 secs difference.Slightly easier than HintHunt, but would definitely recommend for a first time escape the room.

Clue Quest Kings Cross.. A group of 10 if us went for a team building exercise, We split into two teams and fortunately i was on the winning team, We had lots of fun trying to solve all the clues in Mr Q's Apartment. I would highly recommend Clue Quest to anyone who’s up for having some fun and loves a challenge. Looking forward to going back and doing the next challenge - Prof Black Sheep.
Fantastic! . Visited last week for a team building activity. Great fun and an hour goes really quickly! Great for just about anyone from about 13 up.

Great fun - worth it. Bought this as a birthday present for my niece who visited us from Germany. We didn't really know what to expect and I showed her some clips of crystal maze to give her and her friend a flavour. We were locked in a room and then .................. You'll have to go yourself as we can not share the details with you or we would have to kill you.Don't be worried - In case of need there are helpful hints.All I can say it was great fun.We went for operation black sheep.
Amazingly fun escapism. We went as a group of 10 friends and split into two teams of 5. A really fun hour that goes by in what feels like a second. I highly recommend!!!
Exceeded expectations. Had a fantastic time, even though we didn't manage to escape in time. Great fun for all types of groups. Will defiantly be going back.

Excellent for team bonding!. I originally went with on my sisters corporate bonding exercise and loved it so much that I took my own company a few months later. Really clever concept- having to escape into different rooms, solving mini brain teasers in a bid to save the world while nothing is ever as it seems! Personally I think it's best if you have a big group so you can 'race' each other. Hurry up and finish the new rooms please so I can visit again!

We all want to go back.. All five of us had a brilliant time. We were all utterly absorbed in what we were doing and were a bit astonished to find that the hour was disappearing so quickly. It was very cleverly managed, when we got stuck help was immediately available; we felt really looked after. We also really appreciated the time that the staff spent with us afterwards talking about how well/badly we had done. Even having read all the good reviews on TripAdvisor it was better than we thought it was going to be.

Go as a group to share the fun.. Enjoyed the ClueQuest as a party of 11 celebrating a 30th birthday party. Lots of competition competing as two teams....
Perhaps there was too much expectation on my behalf. I enjoyed it but not that much.
I would say that £22 per person for a one hour experience is a bit steep.

Mindblowing!. Me and my team had an amazing experience yesterday at Cluequest, can not recommend it highly enough, it definitely blew the cobwebs away from those brain cells in a fun and stimulating way :) The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back Agent Q!

Fun end to a trip to London. We are a family of four--40s, 16 and 10 years old. We did Plan 52 and escaped with 6 minutes to spare! The clues came in when we needed them and it was so fun. All of us had a great time. Definitely recommend!

Great Fun (Altho' a little bit expensive). My husband and I, our two adult daughters & their partners, had a great time escaping!! It is very challenging and a lot of fun. We really didn't know what to expect and it was very well done. I felt it was a bit expensive for an hour (marginally under 20 pounds per person) but I don't regret going. There is lots to do in London, but if you want a different experience for a change, then I certainly recommend this.

Fantastic work teambuild session - we escaped with seconds to spare.... We had a fabulous time at Cluequest. The staff were fantastic and very helpful. We went as a workplace sales team of mixed ages, and found it was great for bringing us together as a team, and we were so pleased to have escaped in under an hour. we arrived a little early and not knowing the area we weren't sure where to eat lunch, some info on surrounding restaurants would be good when you book. we ate at the chicken shop across the road and had a few dodgy tummies...The only improvement I could suggest would to have a coffee area for debriefs, and for your team to be given a bit more time afterwards to sit and discuss what you did well. Thanks for a fab day!

Great fun, everyone loved it. All the other reviews pretty much say it all. Great fun for a family group and an opportunity to work together solving problems, finding clues and cracking codes to find the way out. Not at all claustrophobic and highly recommended,

FABULOUS!!. We done the black sheep room yesterday, my god what an excellent and exciting event ! The team that work at cluequest are amazing and really get you in the mindset of the whole game , well done everyone ! We cannot wait to come back and do Plan 52, if you haven't already been , BOOK NOW !

ClueQuest - "the best thing we have ever done in London" my son age 11. "Best birthday ever" - I booked this for my son's 16th birthday as a family outing - we are a family of 7 with children ranging from 11-18. Not knowing what to expect, but safe in the knowledge we love a challenge we arrived to find very friendly staff waiting to introduce us to the experience. Without saying too much for want of ruining it for future ClueQuesters it was absolutely amazing. We took 2 Unit 52 challenges as there were too many of us for one challenge which was without a doubt the right thing to do. For one hour we solved puzzles and clues to find out way out of Unit 52. All of us, without a doubt thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience and have talked about it for days. It is not alway as easy trying to please everyone, but this certainly did it !

Really excellent. Wasn't sure if I'd enjoy this kind of thing, or if I'd be any good, but it was brilliant. Really enjoyed it - we were talking about it the whole way back afterwards and I've just recommended it to a bunch of friends. If you want something a bit different that's more than just sitting around, definitely give it a go!

Great fun and saved the world before lunch!. Top fun at Cluequest yesterday for my birthday. Really well constructed mission - challenging but solvable. Ben in the control room was really good also in giving just enough hints when we were floundering but leaving us to crack the rest ourselves. Would highly recommend this and we are already planning our return trip to complete the other challenge.

This is the best thing I have done with my children for years.. I entered the room thinking there could well be blood on the walls before the hour was up, being locked in the same room as my two teenage children seemed like a recipe for arguements & back stabbing. 57minutes 20 seconds later, when we pushed the door open, we came out as team Clayton. This is the best thing I have done with my children for years. We will return for the other room. You do not need to be brainy anyone can play this, all you need is a bit of common sense.
Awesome!. Absolutely fantastic! We can't wait to return and try the other room. If you love puzzles you will love this.
So stressfull! but so good!!. wonderful wonderful wonderful ...it was so much fun even though I was a bit panicked...but we got out with 32s to spare! really cleverly done...!!!

Must do this on a trip with friends!!. Exciting game for everyone!We went with a group of friends and decided to book the two similar rooms, one team girls, one team boys...Funniest and most competitive hour of our trip to London!! :-) It was so much fun! Didn't know what to expect before we started and we ended up so happy that we figured it out in time! :-) only 25s to spare... The boys beat us by a few minutes, but whatever, we'll get them the next time in the other room.... See you then!

A great family bonding experience. I bought this as a family gift for Christmas for myself, husband and children aged 16 and 18. We had an absolute blast! It's just amazing how quickly you immerse yourself in the activity. It is hard but we thoroughly enjoyed working through the clues and pulling together as a team. we would all recommend Cluequest without a doubt!

I wish there was more, excellent place!. I love this place! At first i thought it was going to be an easy, cheesy place but it's definitely proved me wrong. It's a very fun, interactive, real-life puzzle. Good for teens, children, couples- anyone really! I definitley recommend this to anyone who wants a little adventure.
An hour of pure fun. Went as a group of 5 and it was just great fun - something a bit different, a great idea and everyone enjoyed themselves!

Still great fun!. Having enjoyed playing Operation BlackSheep back in December, I really looked forward to trying Plan52. Everyone in our group of four got into the puzzle-solving spirit and we even managed to escape the room with time to spare!I really liked the new location and waiting area and thought the venue was fairly easy to find from King's Cross Station (the entrance is almost directly opposite a Nisa Local).If a new mission were to be added to the list, we'd definitely return!
Great fun!. Was perfect for our teenagers and also provided an opportunity to hang out in a less-travelled (by tourists) part of town before/after the adventure.

Hard- But so much fun!. A lot harder than i thought it was going to be, pretty sure i didnt contribute anything to the team effort! but we got out with 21 seconds to go...! Really good fun though, the hour goes so fast. definitely worth a visit for something different!

really fresh and fun way to spend time, really absorbing and entertaining. Fun for all ages and abilities, really unlike things you have done before, seems expensive for an hour of fun but well worth the money for the experience, very enjoyable, want to go again now

A really good night out. We went on a saturday night and played Operation Blacksheep. We weren't sure what to expect but what we got was an action packed hour.The venue doesn't look terribly appealing from the outside, the street is on is a little run down and the shop front had the shutters down but once you are inside they have some seating areas where you wait as a team for your guide.We were booked for the 9pm slot and it was a little confusing that we were told to arrive at 9.20, as it happened we were running a little late as it look longer than expected to walk from KIngs Cross (I wouldn't use maps on your iphone, it took us a weird way) so we got there at 9.10 and it was all very calm and organised when we arrived. There are toilets on site and they were clean.Our guide explained the game clearly to us, gave us the necessary components to take into the game with us and then lead the way. You are asked not to talk about the game too much so not to ruin it for others so all i'll say is that they have taken a lot of time and effort in designing the game and it shows. It is intricate and very cleverly done. You will be busy for the entire time you are there, you really don't need any specialist skills just a brain. We managed to get out in the time but only with a few minutes to spare.The game itself is 60 minutes but you should allow yourself an extra 30 minutes to an hour for the pre game explanation and the post game debrief.It is probably better for adults and older children, it might be a bit difficult for young children to stay focused for the whole hour.

Fantastic escape game - an hour of great fun!. ClueQuest is a great, hour long escape game based near Kings Cross. Having received a voucher as a christmas present, we went in a group of four and played the PLAN52 game. After a short briefing you enter the game and must solve a series of puzzles to save the world within the hour. We made it out with just 2 mins 50 to spare! The staff are friendly and enthusiastic and welcoming and puzzles just the right level of difficulty to keep you entertained for the hour. We will definitely be going back for Operation BlackSheep.

Try it! Save the World!!. We were four women looking for something different to do while in London for a couple of days & this was it!! We had a brilliant time and according to our 'agent' did very well considering we had never tried anything like this previously - I would very highly recommend this for any mix of ages & abilities - we had no idea at all what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed our mission....I won't give anything away! I would suggest booking in advance as it was fully booked & very busy during our slot, but well worth the money (I think we paid £20pp) & is something we will remember & laugh about for a long time! This was one of those things I wish my kids (20 -30 year olds) had been able to enjoy with me...I think a return is on the cards at some point!

clueQuest. One of the best things I have done in London! I was initially skeptical of the difficulty of the puzzles however they were very well thought out and intellectually stimulating! We all had so much fun and would definitely go back again to try out the other puzzles!

So much fun, great for a family. I loved it so much, I'm going again in a month!! I went with my family, we're all above 25, so a more grown up family adventure. We all got involved, and our cluequest leader was great, don't want to say too much or I will spoil it! I'm going with a group of friends in a few weeks, I wouldn't recommend drinks beforehand, you have to concentrate!!

Best thing have done in a long time. THIS.IS.AWESOME. Live in London and will be recommend this to everyone. If fact I have done to everyone at work today! I don't want to give anything away but essentially you are in a room with up to 4 other friends and there are certain items in the room. You have to find clues in the items to crack the codes to the padlocks. Unlocking a padlock provides a clue to another padlock and you keep going until you unlock all padlocks in order to break out of the room. It's fun, something different and you will be on a big high when you leave. I understand there are two different rooms to break out of, although there are a few of the same room so if you had two groups of 4/5 you could go at the same time and see who breaks out first. You MUST go.
Whole Family Loved It!. What a blast! All the kids - ages, 17, 14, 11 and 9 said it was one of the best parts of vacation. Something totally different than shopping, museums, eating, etc.

...Best hours fun with your clothes on and sober!!. I'll start by saying our team of four WILL go back! We were two couples (32 - 49yrs young) not really knowing what to expect, but up for a challenge. Awesome fun! We did Operation Blacksheep - saved the world and escaped with 4.36 minutes to go. No spoilers here, but you don't need to be physically fit or mathematically talented to do this....just enjoy puzzling things through or looking at things from different angles. Teamwork rocks. I have no idea what this cost as my hub got me this as an early 50th present - perfect gift...worth whatever he paid for it!

Amazing! . How they think these challenges up is beyond me. We went with my parents, my brother and my girlfriend us all in our 20s.Time goes quickly but really good fun and cannot recommend enough. We did Operation Blacksheep and escaped...just.Something different and will certainly be returning to complete the other challenges!

SUPERB Escape Game!!! . Great experience with a lot of fantastic elements! No mathematical puzzles from lock to lock but super cool surprising mechanics. Compare to the Hint Hunt and the Escape Hunt in Brussels this was far better! Definitely one of the best ways to spend your time in London for a few hours.

Escaped Professor Blacksleep by a Whisker. Have been to both escape rooms now, one at the new and expanded Kings Cross site and one at the previous Shoreditch site. The experience is incredibly good fun, very good value for money and is appropriate to a wide variety of social settings - families, friends, couples, workmates could all engage in it. The puzzles are challenging but don't require any specific level of education or prior knowledge, its mostly common sense and logic, and figuring out codes for padlocks amongst other things. The staff have always had a big smile on their face and give an appropriate (but not overly intrusive) level of assistance in the rooms if needed. Fully recommended to Londoners and visitors to the capital

Exciting! . I've been to two other escape rooms in the near past and I have to say that this was the most difficult and exciting! We had so much fun! Would definitely try that again!My only criticism is that it's quite expensive. It was about £30 per person (£89 for 3 people). All the others I have been to (but abroad) were about 15 euros.

SO MUCH FUN!!. After waiting months to play (my parents visit to the UK) my expectations were set pretty high...Not only was it everything I expected, it was so much more! I don't want to give anything away but I will say we played PLAN52 with 4 people and I really think 4 people was the perfect number of people. It was such great fun, you can barely believe an hour can go by so quickly! We made it out and emerged with such great memories, we can't wait to play the other game soon!!! Don't hesitate, plan a game and become a secret agent!!!
Loved it!. I would definitely recommend that everyone tries this escape game. I went as part of a group of 4 and we all loved it! Such good fun.

Best hour I've spent in a very long time!. I took my two daughters (aged 23 and 24) as a christmas present. We honestly had the best time - I thought it'd be fun but it was so much more than I could have ever imagined. Can't give too much away but if you're thinking of going - go! You won't be disappointed.

What a rush!. There's nothing like a room full of challenges and a ticking clock to get your adrenalin going! The staff were really friendly and well organised; the puzzles were a great mix of easy and hard; and it was all round great fun. Book now!Interestingly, the people who were most sceptical about it before we went were the most effusive in their praise afterwards. Just showing it's perfect even for the cynics!

Great fun. Not quite sure what to expect when turning up to a rather dismal building with 3 friends but alls well after entering and being greated with pleasant staff.This is well organised,challenging , and importantly great fun and I believe moving to new premises shortly.

Time flies! loved it , nice staff, clever game!. Some friends and I went here tonight, after over a months waiting we were really excited and Alex was a great host. The 60 minutes fewl buy and was worth bout £20 each. Wont ruin the suprise but reccommend it to anyone. We worked as a team and were really happy at the end

If you like room escapes, do this!. ClueQuest is the second room escape I have done and it definitely lived up to the reputation it has built up here on Tripadvisor. Very challenging and clever games, it definitely gives your brain a workout!I know they are moving to new premises soon so I will be back to check out their other game.If you have a family or a group of friends that like puzzles and a challenge then book this.If you are a group of tourists who enjoy puzzles/room escape games then book this.
Absolutely brilliant - buzzing at the end. Great idea, good prize and the people who run it are great. Loved every minute... Was buzzing with excitement at the end.

Great fun. Got to experience this game while visiting in london,although my daughter had to book way in advance it was totally worth it.We arrived a few minutes early and were greeted promptly by a very nice staff member who explained the game to us and made sure we knew what to expect.Without giving any details away we had fun exploring the rooms and did manage to get out with just a few extra minutes.Our team ages ranged from 35-65 so fun was had by all.The only drawback was the bathroom facility,I think the could pay a little more attention to the cleanliness of it,it was quite dirty.

One of the bes things we've ever done!. I booked this for my boyfriend's birthday; we were a group of 5 (aged 22-26) and were really looking forward to it. I was apprehensive that the puzzles to solve wouldn't be tricky enough, but they were of perfect difficulty - had us scratching our heads but not impossible! ClueQuest was literally one of the best things I have ever done, and the rest of my group agree. We cannot wait to go back for Operation BlackSheep (we did Plan 52).Our unit cost £108 for 5 of us - just over £20 each for that much fun is a bargain, really. A quick mention of the staff - I rather ignorantly cannot remember the name of the guy who inducted us - he was quite tall, dark and had an accent and he was funny, engaging and super friendly - a real asset to the organisation. All in all ClueQuest is an amazingly original, fun and exciting thing to do - I could not recommend it enough… we got out with 17 minutes and 39 seconds to spare, with no clues….think you can beat that? ;)

Great fun. Voucher was biught as a present by our sons we werent sure what to expect but had great fun with the friends we took. Sadly we didnt manage to escape in under the hour but it didnt bother us at all and made the afternoon last longer. Would love to go again and try another challenge. Something different to do in London and very enjoyable. Highly recommended.

So much fun!. Great activity I surprised some friends with this over the weekend, so much fun, so different to anything else around London! We managed to get out with 6 minutes to spare but the clues were so creative and well thought outDid take an hour and wished it could have been longer - need to try out Operation Blacksheep next time! Thanks

Best thing I've done with the girls in ages!. None of us had ever done anything like this before so we didn't really know what to expect. Our guide was called Sylvie and she was absolutely lovely. After a brief introduction, we went in and the fun began. There was never a dull moment. The hour flew by as we kept uncovering more things to do and more puzzles to solve. It was challenging but not impossible and honestly some of the best fun our group of friends has had in a long time. I would highly recommend this to anyone and we cannot wait to go back to do their other quest.

Fantastic 5 star must do in London. wow - absolutely fantastic experience - time flies when you are working against the clock and really chuffed with how well the wife and I worked as a team but in all honesty it needs a team of more than 2 to beat the evil Black Sheep

AMAZING!. I do not tend to write reviews for Attractions, however this one totally deserves it! If you like either playing detective or puzzles, you will definitely love ClueQuest! Even if you are not into puzzles, this attraction will be an amazing experience! My boyfriend and myself went with another couple and when we finished we just wanted to do it all over again! We will definitely try "stage two" now!
Excellent. Great fun. Three of us got out with 25seconds to spare. Great fun. Highly recommended! Don't let the cat see the mouse .
Take the teenagers. Brilliant-my top reccomendation for impressing the teenagers at half term! Havent done anything like this befor but would definitely try the other Quest
Utterly brilliant. Without doubt one of the best hour's fun you can have with your clothes on. Whether you do this with family, friends or colleagues, this is a clever, intriguing and genuinely

Barclay Girls'. Fantastic for a team building day out! We'd split into two teams, Team J and Team M. The adrenaline was pumping fast knowing Team J were closeby in the room next door, trying to solve the clues as quickly as possible to see who would get out first! With only 14 seconds to spare Team M made it out first!! Screams of delight were heard throughout the corridors, followed 13 seconds later by Team J!!! Cannot recommend Clue Quest highly enough!!

Brilliant Family Fun. We had such a great time at ClueQuest - our fifteen year old son and fourteen year old daughter absolutely loved it, and solved most of the clues themselves. Rose was a big help with clues when needed. We definitely want to go back sometime, and I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone wanting an hour of inventive and clever fun.

AMAZING fun for everyone.. I recently completed my mission with Mr Q and his agents and although I was hesitant to begin with, I soon realised this was one of the best couple of hours I'd ever spent having fun.Me and some friends were struggling to find something to do in London (weird, right?) and stumbled across Clue Quest on this site. It seemed a little scary - with no information really online and all we were told is that we'd be locked in a room!!!!! We still booked. I think that might tell us something about us more than Clue Quest.We were greeted by our special agent of the day, Ben - a northerner (always a good sign) who "briefed" us on our mission with equal amounts of fun and tension mixed in. The staff clearly love their jobs here and I must say how much fun Ben brought to it. He was friendly, efficient when we needed his help and just very good at his job - something you don't often see at tourist attractions in London!!We were then locked in a room and had to escape.
