No idea what to do for the first 3 or 4 minutes but rather than running around screaming (which crossed our minds) we ended up working as a team and, although I'm not going to spoil anything for future secret spies, we managed to succeed in our mission - JUST!!!!With the perfect amount of fun and eduction/mind activity mixed in, Clue Quest was definitely the best thing I've done for fun and I can't wait to get back there to try another mission...and maybe see if Mr Q is single.Cant recommend it enough.

Jonathan Creek and 007 rolled into one!. Great for groups of all ages looking for something different to do! It's well run, friendly and a great challenge for the secret agent wannabes out there. We went as a group of four (mid 20s) and couldn't stop talking about it after completing our mission. Can't wait to attempt the other missions...

Loved it!. This was a Christmas present for me and my partner from my parents - they'd paid for 4 of us to complete this so we chose 2 friends to go with. We all had no idea what to expect, but all thought it was absolutely brilliant. Something completely different to do in London that is fun, interactive and gets you thinking a bit! Can't wait to go back and do it again! Only feedback I would give is that the toilets were in pretty bad condition but since they will be changing location shortly this should be solved.

Family visit - brilliant fun. Very clever.. Happened to be looking for an activity for my son's birthday when I came across ClueQuest. Although we didn't do it for his birthday, I booked it up as a special family night out and we are all so so glad we did! It was possibly one of the cleverest evenings out I've ever had. Can't wait to go back for round two! Absolutely never experienced anything quite like it - and not to be missed.

Something completely different. As regular visitors to London, it was great to find something completely different for our family to try. We have children aged 17, 15 and 10. ClueQuest was so clever, completely challenging for the adults, yet equally absorbing for our 10 year old. The staff were brilliant too. It was a huge hit, we were there with another family and all agreed we will definitely return. 40 seconds left!

Unbelievable, exciting...AMAZING. This place is amazing. A group of 4 (all males in mid 20s) did this at the weekend. It is done so professionally. The game is pure genius. I don't know what else to say other than just do this. It is like nothing else in london.

CLUEquest fun and frolics. As 5 old friends we came together in February to ClueQuest and LOVED every minute, already planning abnother trip to try the other room.. highly recommended and great fun...

Outstanding!!!!!!!!!. Went to Operation Black Sheep as had already done Plan B and loved it so much. Was a little worried because one of our team dropped out at the last minute leaving us with only 3, but it was incredible!! The production values are great and it challenged us with each of our team solving different parts. This really is the most fun you can have as a group/family and you will be talking about it for a long time after!! We can't wait for them to move to the new location as there will be a new challenge there!! 20 seconds to spare!!!!!!!!!!!

Fantastic fun for the whole family. The family were a bit uncertain when told the afternoon would be spent locked in a room trying to escape. After an hour of immense fun for the children of our family and our two daughters we emerged mentally tired but keen for more.

Amazing!!. We went to ClueQuest with no idea of how it worked or what was going to happen. The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. We went as 2 teams, starting at the same time so see which team could get out the quickest. Turns out, we both got out at exactly 60 minutes - apparently never happened before. All in all, it was an amazing experience and we all plan on going back in the summer to do the second mission. I would definitely recommend this to everybody.

Great time had by all. Went along with absolutely no idea what we were letting ourselves in for. Went with my two children and niece, 14, 16 and 18 and thought we may be well out of our depth but had an absolutely great time. The ClueQuest team were very supportive and would recommend this to one and all,it's not often I come across something all the family enjoy. Keep up the good work.

great and different night out. right in the heart of Shoreditch and different and great night out convenient for the station and all the bars and restaurants- went on to Pizza east successful works night out

Great fun, great time!. Had so much fun! The team member who greeted us and showed us the game was really lovely and welcoming. As a group of nerds we expected to get out really quickly but the game was challenging enough to keep us amused for the whole hour. Would definitely recommend and will be going back for another mission!

Fantastic way to spend an hour in London!. To be locked in a room with my husband and three children for an hour..........and all of us come out alive with a great big smile on our faces pays testament to how great this place is! Great value for money, well thought out, excellent staff and brilliant challenge. It was interesting to see how differently young minds worked from mine and my husband's but amazingly we worked well as a team and got out with almost 8 minutes to spare! Great buzz! Have recommended it already to two friends with family in their early twenties and it has gone down really well with both families!
Great fun!. Group of 4 friends in mid twenties. A great activity to do in London, very well organised, good staff, worth the money. We are definitely going back to try Operation Black Sheep!

An excellent time!. Our family of 5 went over the Christmas holidays. We weren't really sure what to expect, but the ClueQuest experience was amazing and would absolutely recommend it! Our children are 10, 15 and 18 and it was entertaining for all. It's a great and unique way to spend time as a family or with a group of friends!

Absolutely brilliant: every adults dream fun . This place is amazing.Perfect for us adults who love fun and games but realise adults in the kids park is just not ok ha.Really well set up and worth every penny.The staff are really really lovely and the game/ mission itself is brilliant and very very clever. Go and have a fab time. I am coming back ASAP. Books up months in advance because it really is fantastic.

Excellent set up & worth a visit.. This is by far the best locked room game I have taken part in, in London. Well set up with an interesting story (Operation Black Sheep). We found it challenging but achievable. Made it out with 19 seconds to spare. Compared to a previous experience I would say this company offer great value for money and don't interrupt the game as much.Be prepared to argue with your friends and family!

So much fun!. We went as a family of four to ClueQuest and didn't really know what to expect. As soon as you arrive the experience begins and you start getting excited about the next 60 mins. I don't want to go in to any detail as wouldn't want to ruin the experience for anyone. If your looking for something fun to do with friends, family or even for a work do then definitely go along. We had such a fun afternoon, it was exciting, spontaneous and so clever.We're going to book another one as we can't wait to escape again!
Amazing experience! Great fun!. Very exciting and challenging experience! Went there with friends and had great fun!One hour passes really quickly! A definite to do!

The most professional and fun escape room in London. We are regular visitors of ClueQuest and we've never been let down. The team lead by Zolly, Peter and the crew is very professional indeed, starting from the booking system and ending with the photos you get at the end. Having done both their rooms twice already we decided this time to just get this experience for our staff. Our guide was nice enough to let the two of us into the mission control centre and watch our team solve one clue after another even with sound provided by a second set of headphones. We very much appreciated this as otherwise we would have been quite bored and anxious for an hour, not knowing how our guys are doing. I understand this is not the usual practice, but maybe it could become? It surely would be a way of attracting regular customers. We have done other escape games in London, but always concluded that ClueQuest rooms are the best thought out ones. Their clues are tricky but logical and have a clear path from one to another unlike in some other escape games where once you have solved one clue, it does not move you forward and you always have to come back to the beginning and start again. There is no fun in that as it lacks the excitement you get when you can actually see how you're progressing.

Fantastic experience for all ages. As two 60 somethings, accompanied by our daughter and son-in-law, who bought this experience for us for Christmas, we were somewhat puzzled to arrive at a dowdy looking building adjacent to a building site, ten minutes walk from Liverpool Street Station. We were greeted by the ever smiling and lovely Candice who explained the plot and who would watch over us for the next hour. What followed next was simply brilliant. Taken into a separate part of the building, locked in and told we had to save the world in an hour. A vast array of puzzles and clues to solve, it reminded me somewhat of the Crystal Maze TV programme from a few years ago. We did save the world, albeit with a few helpful pieces of guidance from Candice over the two-way radio, with just a few seconds to spare. We emerged victorious, absolutely buzzing, having loved every second. i cannot imagine that there is anything similar to this that is this good. Do we want to do it again? Too right we do! Brilliant family experience, or for teams of work colleagues or groups of friends. Wow!

Brilliant time!. We were a group of 5 who took on the Plan52 challenge at the weekend - and what a laugh we had. I have to compliment the staff - who were very accommodating and responded promptly to my few questions once I had a booking. Without giving anything away - the game itself was brilliant! We were group of 5 friends and everyone wants to come back to take on the 2nd challenge! one of the best things we've ever done in London :-)
Utterly brilliant!. 2nd visit, so did the black sheep game. The game, venue and staff are fantastic. Loved every second. Highly recommend

Teamwork and brainwork. What better way to spend an hour in a group of 5 trying to escape from a locked room? Ingenious puzzles to solve, with no prior knowledge of anything required really. Fantastic sets, varied types of challenges, a huge countdown clock! Very friendly and helpful staff too!

A proper mental workout!. We were lucky enough to snap up a voucher to Cluequest's Shoreditch venue in a charity auction. We opted for the Plan52 game as our friends had done black sheep before.Without giving anything away it was tough! There are some really tricky clues to solve and time just flies! We did need a couple of hints from Mr Q to get to the end with just 1.19 on the clock! Great fun!They told us a new game is under development and they are looking to move to a bigger site. Can't wait so we can go back and try the next challenge.

Great way for friends to spend an hour. Brilliant activity for friends or probably businesses (you must get on with people you work with before you do this though!). Very well thought out and the right level of challenge; a combination of commons sense and metal agility!

What A Fantastic Night!. We can not fault this is any way. There were 9 of us that had booked this event for a birthday, and all had such a fun and amazing time.
Highly recommend this to anyone.
Massive thanks to the team there, you were all fab!

Operation BlackSheep. Booked this as a surprise family activity for my wife's birthday as I fancied something a bit different. I had completed an Escape room in Denver Colorado so had a rough idea what to expect but this was a totally new experience for my family. I don't want to give anything way but it was a SUPERB experience and we had a wonderful time. It was really great to see the whole family get absorbed by the operation and work together on our escape. We managed to get out with only a few minutes left on the clock which was the icing on the cake, The team at ClueQuest were excellent all the way through from the making the booking to saying goodbye at the end. I am really pleased we chose this activity and will come back again in the future.

Well worth experiencing!!. Group of 30-something guys and two dad's!! Enjoyable experience for all... great to do as a competition between two groups and a nice brain-engaging way to spend an hour... Great facility, well set up and good staff. A great idea and well worth doing. One of the guys signed his work team up the next day!

Excellent - great fun!. I was little doubtful that this could live up to the hype... but it totally surpassed my expectations! I arranged it as a birthday present, for my brothers 21st; there were three of us in the group and we all got stuck into our role's as secret agents!
Great fun, good value. Great fun, good puzzles, friendly helpful staff, not a bad word to say! Well worth the 5 stars and the place on tripadvisor near the top attractions.

Fantastic fun and value for money!. We were a party of 5 and needed a short 1 hour team event , this fitted fantastically and we really enjoyed ourselves.The imagination of some of the clues were really clever and the 1 hour went past really quick!

Best birthday . The minute i heard about this i had to book it for my birthday (booking 2 months in advance- its that popular). However managed to go on my bday. It lived up too all expectations and we booked 2 rooms of plan 52 and had a small competition. If you love problem solving games. You gotta try it. We will all be returning for the other room and any future rooms as well. The staff were fantastic. Thank you

It was great fun. We (18 year old son and his parents) almost got out in time but as our group was small and we'd almost got to the end when the time ran out we were allowed a few extra minutes and in that time we solved the final puzzle and escaped! It was a fun activity and was good for the 3 of us to work together - something that rarely happens! We'll go back and do a different game - and suspect may find it a bit easier now we know roughly what to do!
Superb!. Plan52 was an excellent game - challenging, very well devised, but also great fun. Would thoroughly recommend. Will definitely return to take on the other game - hooked!

60 min of excitement and fun!!. If you enjoy with challenges , clever quizzes and teamwork , you souldnt miss that . It's is real fun . We are going to repeat soooon :))) if you are worried because of the language , don't worry you don't need to be English native to escape :)
Fabtastic. Original, challenging (but not too hard) and a lot of fun. Simple idea but lights up the brain trying to crack puzzle after puzzle. Couldn't recommend it enough.

Second Time Visiting, just as good as the first time!. Had such a good time the first time around (Operation Black Sheep), we returned to do the other room (Plan 52).Since doing the first room, we visited two other exit games in London (Escape Land and Escape Rooms). I definitely enjoyed ClueQuest the most. I can't recommend it enough. From the staff, to the puzzles, everything is just top notch. We would go again if we could! Can't wait till they move to their new location and open a new room.

Lots of Fun!. This was the second time I've been to an "escape room" game place. I highly recommend it! It is a lot of fun and everyone will have a great time. There were 10 of us in our group so we split into two team in two identical rooms. As we were quite competitive, we wanted to beat the other team (which we did by 3 seconds!). Definitely lots of fun and recommend it to everyone.
An awesome game. Went to this type of quest for the first time and must admit that it was truly amazing. Will definitely re visit on my next visit to London.
Excellent fun. Had a brilliant time for god sons 16th also had an 11 year old with us and everyone was able to input and help out with the clues it was brilliant such great fun would recommend to all

Great Fun. A friend suggested I'd enjoy ClueQuest and they were right! I went with my fiancee, brother and sister in law for some family bonding fun and it was great. We didn't really know what to expect but once we got into it it was all over too quick....we'll be back to complete Black Sheep, having escaped with 43 seconds on the clock! Thanks for such a different kind of Friday evening entertainment!

Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Went to ClueQuest on recommendation and it didn't disappoint. Great fun. Tense and exciting.The intro was slightly cheesy, but once we were in the swing it was all good.Facilities bit basic, but would still recommend :)

Amazing!. I went to clue quest this past weekend on a company trip to London. I wasn't sure what to expect other than my team mates saying they'd heard really good things about it.I'm quite an action - adrenaline sort of person, paintballing/go-karting are my sort of activities.However, long story short, I was pleasantly surprised and we had 60 minutes to escape the array of rooms ahead of us. The clues were so well thought out an hidden, and each clue was more surprising and had us thoroughly entertained! We escaped with a buzz of adrenaline and 56 seconds to spare! Had us smiling for the rest of the day.

Great for team building, morale and getting your party started... This is the second type of 'escape the room' event I have done. One in NYC and the second at Clue Quest. Clue Quest has the clues about right in terms of how hard they are and achieve-ability. Great for getting people to work towards a common goal and it really was fun.

Excellent. Did this after HintHunt and it was fantastic! The concept is amazing and you have such a good time. You are basically in a room and you have to get out - it is not scary nor claustrophobic but high pressure and a lot of fun....Definitely recommend - and they even took a group picture for us afterwards! The only downfall is that I wished they could cater for a larger group so work teams or groups of friends could play the same game without having to do different rooms - or at least link the rooms somehow?BTW I went quite awhile before Feb 2014 but had to review when this came up on my feed.

Absolutely Fantastic. Bought this for my husbands Christmas present, it was fantastic. Such good fun, and such an adrenalin rush when the clock counts down to almost the end! We managed to get out the door with 2 mins 16 left on the clock! best experience ever!

if you love puzzles this is your kinda thing. Me and my housemates did the "plan 52" room, and it was so much fun! We were a team of 5 and all felt the pressure when the countdown began and we were locked in. The first 5 min we were panicking and picking up different objects, just trying to make sense of how to play the game. Somehow, different things that one person found randomly fit something else that a group of 2 were trying to solve. It didn't feel like team work at first, but everyone found and figured out different elements and in the end we made it out with 10 min to spare!It was great fun, and everyone who likes puzzles should try this!

Great group activity. I had previously completed HintHunt and so knew roughly what to expect from an hour in ClueQuest. The team were very friendly, the experience was well organised and the whole experience was different enough from Hinthunt that it was great fun. The location was a bit out of the way and the toilet facilities weren't great - but the experience was worth putting up with both of those things. I recommend to all lovers of clue solving games, anyone looking for team bonding and anyone looking to do something different with a free hour.

Great day out with Friends! Would love to do again!. This was such a fantastic day out - having to escape through rooms and get clues while the timer is running out... Every time you thought youd cracked it youd find yourself in another room or just a step closer! Our team managed to get out with 43 seconds to go! - It was a tense moment to say the least! x
Really worth it! Exciting. Have done all the rooms. Enough space for larger teams allows everyone to get involved and be working on different things Very creative tasks/puzzles

An enjoyable evening but poor location. Went with the family after having booked quite some time in advance. It was not as clean as I had expected and not very conveniently locatedThought it was extremely expensive for what we got
Great fun!. Took my family for Christmas and we all had a great time and have already discussed going back to do the second room!
Worthwhile!. Something different! Hard but great fun! Don't think Mr Q will be recruiting us as his agents but we will definitely go and try the other room. Well worth a visit!

Family fun!. We're a family of 5, ages 12-17 plus 2 adults! We loved this! Slightly tricky to find and not clearly signed from the main road. however, once inside, we were well looked after. The hour whizzed by! We succeeded with mere moments left...and instantly talked about trying the other room.....next time! Highly recommend. We ate at the Drunken Monkey before..just round the corner on the main road..fab!

Brilliant idea!. Went as a family of 4 with 17 and 18 year old children for my husband's birthday and had a brilliant time. Had never done anything like this before but will definitely go again (there are 2 different challenges). My daughter said it was the most stressful but the most fun hour she'd ever had! Everything is explained beforehand and then helpful hints are given if they are needed during the challenge. Would highly recommend for a family with older teenagers looking for something different to do which the whole family will enjoy. Very clever idea and something we will keep talking about. You need to book quite a while in advance, especially if you want a slot at the weekend, but it is worth the wait. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Brilliant.. 7 adults 3 teenagers. As soon as we finished, family asked if we could skip lunch and go again. Says it all!
Time flew by and we definitely visit again.

Great fun. We were hosted by Alice who was great and we had a fabulous time - I have honestly never known an hour fly by quicker. There were 5 of us - age range 21 to 50 - and we escaped just in the nick of time! I've already recommended it to friends and will definitely go again. I would love to take more people next time so that we can have two teams playing against each other.

Highly recommended. Our group consisted of two 22 year olds and three 50 year old women, for a birthday. Three of us (guess which three!) had never been to an escape-the-room type experience before. Our task was very clearly explained to us and our mission commander was particularly accommodating and friendly. We won't reveal much about the challenge itself but suffice to say that it was very varied, exciting and just the right level of difficulty. This is a great bonding experience that got everyone involved, regardless of age (and intelligence!).We payed extra for some fridge magnets of our team - but these were very poor quality and we had to wait a while for them so that was disappointing. The place was a little hard to find as well. Neither of these detracted from what was an enjoyable, challenging and unique birthday experience.

Great family day out. We had a great time yesterday with our family taking part in the cluequest challenge. The staff were great, location fun and the challenge unlike anything else we had done. We were there for 90 minutes - and the time flew by. We then spent the rest of the evening chatting and laughing about what went well and what we struggled on. Well worth the money for a family treat. We will definitely be back to face the other challenge in a few months.

Incredible. I had been looking for inspiration for team building activity and some friends recommended ClueQuest so I had no hesitation booking! Firstly the team were very helpful with my booking requirements. Then the actual event... It is a lot harder than I thought it would be and absolutely a challenge, great for corporate team building or just a fun thing to do with family or friends! The room is really well thought out and the clues and how it all unfolds is very clever.

What fun. Didn't really know what to expect. 4 adults and a 9 year old, we all had so much fun escaping. By not giving anything away makes this so much better for all those wanting an enjoyable thinking hour. Will definitely return. Great for all & would recommend for employee team building.

Clue Quest. Visited with my family on 27th December....had an excellent time.My husband and I had done Hint Hunt in November.....so had some idea of what to expectWithout giving too much away .....would give Clue Quest 5 out of 5

My second time here. This is my second review for ClueQuest. I went here again with office colleagues, and this time we played their Operation Blacksheep game. I am amazed at the thought gone in planning out each and every challenge. Can't wait for new games to come soon :-)

Operation Blacksheep- the return. I did the Plan 52 room last year and loved it so made a return to take on Operation Blacksheep. Both rooms are great and very different. Blacksheep was great but unfortunately didn't make it out on time this time. It was the first experience of Cluequest for my friends though and they all loved it. Look forward to when they create a third room!

So MUCH fun!. I booked ClueQuest as a fun family outing over the Christmas holidays without knowing much about it, and was not disappointed. We had a blast! The hour flew by. Often it's difficult to find entertaining activities to do with your teenage children. ClueQuest was perfect. My 13-year-old son was in his element, while my initially sceptical 15-year-old daughter was won over in seconds. The staff were friendly and helpful, the company's email communication prior to our visit was informative and useful, and the location surprisingly easy to find.Go on, book it. You won't be disappointed.

Lots of Fun. We had a great time at ClueQuest! Fun for the entire family. Took a cab ride from our hotel and as we arrived the area seemed a little shady with the construction going on and the building was not well marked. We were not sure we had come to the right place but once inside the staff was super friendly and we are so glad we took the time to experience ClueQuest. I would highly recommend a visit.

Absolutely brilliant. Went to clue quest on 17 December 2014. I booked for 2 groups of 5 . Our ages were between 30 and 59 and we all had a brilliant time. None of us knew what to expect but we felt we all contributed to working out the clues. The staff were friendly and very helpful when needed. Very clever and unusual would highly recommend to anyone who wants to do something a bit different. Can't wait for the new rooms to be created and we will be back .........
Great fun. Did this over Christmas with 5 adults - great fun, I was useless but had a great team around me. The host was nice and welcoming and we would definitely recommend it.

Brilliant Experience. Called on the day and managed to fit a group of 8 of us in within a few hours. Ended up staying and missing our train home but didn't mind as we had so much fun. Great atmosphere, something unique and which will be remembered for a long time. Highly recommended.

A fun game for all the family. We wanted to do something as a family which was fun for our teenagers and us.Clue Quest is just the place to go. My daughter- 17 1/2 was not keen on coming along and moaned a fair bit about going. My 15 year old son was really looking forward to it as he is a logical thinker and saw this as a challenge to be conquered! Once through our briefing and locked in the room my Daughter literally came alive!! no more moaning and you really need the teamwork to make it happen!! Some bits were relatively straightforward and other clues were really hard to get but staff can give subtle clues to help if you get really stuck, by way of a monitor.We conquered the challenge with only 1 minute and 52 seconds left with not too many clues given - hurrah !! So quite a thrilling end and lots of high fives going on! We all had a great time and loved the buzz of getting the next clue worked out!!4 was the perfect ratio of people but 6 is probably too many? Only downside was the dirty ladies toilets & no loo roll/hand towels left and generally very messy on Friday. I pointed it out pre-game and nothing was done as my daughter said there was still no loo roll over an hour later and believe me they were grubby! Hence rating 4 instead of 5.That aside we would all definitely recommend this to do for all and we hope to return one day to try the other challenge that they set. Great concept - well done guys and MR Q !!

A fabulously fun evening out with family & friends. We were 2 families - we all had such fun and highly recommend you give it a go. Our kids (ages 13, 14 & 15) were in one room fighting against time - and against us x4 parents in another room. You don't need to be fit/active/physical - you just need to work as a team (and try not to argue/get stressed), and find/follow the clues. Its current location is walking distance from Brick Lane - so we pre booked a meal beforehand and it was a fantastic evening out for all ages. My son was asking me to book the next mission as soon as we walked out the building. We can't wait to go again on the next mission!

If your teenagers refuse to go to yet another museum....... This is a great activity for parents and teens! However, although the website says you can do it too with 2 persons, this really is stretching it a bit, to me 3 is the minimum. Bring your own toiletpaper, none is provided and they are quite dirty (therefore 4 stars instead of 5)
Good organised fun. Unique, fun and refreshing to have your problem solving skills put to the test. A little expensive but it does feel worth it during and afterwards

Clue quest put's your brain to work :-). We were really looking forward to this appointment with Mr. Q :-) and it was amazing. Clue quest puts you through different challenging situations and makes you aware of your stress limit :-) and indeed teaches you about successfull teamwork.We had a great time and enjoyed every moment of it. We definitely will go again.Thanks Mr. Q

Great family fun!!. My husband and 12 year old son love puzzles; my two teenagers (17 and 15) were not so sure. But ClueQuest was a blast for our whole family. Located in an unassuming warehouse, the company has created a very unique and challenging game that will enage even the most reluctant! Definitely a must do!
Agent Flash reporting in!. Excellent game for all abilities and ages. Great staff, cool vibe and a challenge that had us talking for hours afterwards!

Brilliant fun in London that's not what you'd usually do.. My wife booked ClueQuest online before we arrived. I went along with it with mixed feelings but I was so wrong. We had a great time. The challenges are not overwhelming and this is something you can do with your whole family including teens! The only criticism is that the toilets are not great but this really trying to find a negative when there really isn't one.

Excellent brain challenge!. A group of eight family and friends spent a very happy hour at Cluequest - tested our lateral thinking skills, laughed and whooped for joy and generally had a great time. Thank you to the team. This activity is to be recommended - ideal age group over 13, and excellent bonding or team building exercise.
Great fun. Failed both rooms but had a blast doing them. Hard to go into too muuch detail about this experience without ruining it for others but great fun for groups.
A 'must do' in London. Family day out - no arguments and an enjoyable hour of fun for everyone. Would thoroughly recommend. Friendly staff, liked them a lot. Great experience!

Cluequest Review. We really enjoyed the Cluequest Challenge. It was innovative, multidimensional and used many different methods of clue formats which tried our intellect, patience and teamwork. A family of five, we got rather panicky as the digital clock was running out of time. However we were reassured through the intercom by Richard Hardy (our controller) that there was still time to solve the final puzzles. Overall one or two additional clues helped us escape in time with a great sense of achievement. A great group activity!

Fantastically frustrating fun.. Annoyingly we didn't make it out in the hour but we had great fun trying (although there were a few arguments) - there were three of us (one of us was 10 - although the 10 year old proved to be open to sticking keys anywhere and finding clues than we were). The staff member who greeted us and clearly gave us guidance through the screen throughout was fantastic - very professional. We didn't know what to expect at first as the location was not where we expected and did not look as slick and professional as the website so we were a bit apprehensive but the room and the many, many clues,riddles and puzzles within were top notch. Fantastic and would love to do it again.

Can't wait to go back!!!!. This was by far the best thing we did in London!!! The clue quest team were absolutely wonderful and helpful, especially Julia. It was our first time here, we didn't know what to expect but it was so much fun I hadn't expected it to be this good! Just remember the main point of the mission is to work as a team ;)

Mission impossible. A unique experience. 17 years of university life between the group did not prepare us for the task ahead. Time moved quickly and we failed to use the clues found to our advantage. I would recommend clue quest to any aspiring detective/spy. Would like to revisit now we are aware of how to use the clues.We were warmly greeted by staff who also offered us assistance via Walkie talkie when we were unable to utilise the clues found.

Brilliant fun. We had a fantastic time yesterday at the Clue Quest, Family of four , our children 13 & 11 years absolutely loved it. We all worked together as a team trying to solve the clues and puzzles. The staff were amazing and helped us a couple of times when we stuck :) We will definitely return next year and try a different room. Thank you for a brill time.

Superb experience. My wife had booked this as a family treat so none of us knew what to expect but what an excellent time we had. Adults and kids (ranging from ages 12 to 20) thought this a brilliant and incredible experience. A fantastic balance between fun, problem solving, lateral thinking and team-work - we can't wait to re-book to try the other challenge. Would thoroughly recommend for families, groups of friends or work colleagues.

Awesome. I would recommend cluequest to anyone and everyone. It was a pulse raising experience that relied on team work and common sense.A brilliant hour. We loved every second, including the 1 second left on the clock when we exited the room!

If you enjoy challenges - try this!. My codename is Agent King. I graduted from Mr. Q´s school for agents this December, and I am proud of it. A room full of mindboggling challenges like puzzles and codes to open keylocks.Thanks guys for an enjoyable experience - maybe we come back in some time to try the other room :-)Only negative thing I can think about is Cluequests address - it is a bit far out!

Don't miss this!. What a great time! Our group of four had the Special Agent challenge of saving the world in 60 minutes by solving clues, cracking codes and working as a team. We had a fantastic time that was supported by one of their outstanding staff, Richard. Other groups clearly felt the same way indicated by their loud cheers as they too saved the world. This is a must-do!

Fantastic Fun - something different!. This was my second visit to Cluequest. The first was with friends and then I returned with a group of 20 for a work team-building event. I was pleased to find that the group really, really enjoyed the experience and had great fun.I'd not heard of this concept of a 'live escape game' before going myself, but I can absolutely see why it gets the great reviews it does.Cluequest does not have a fancy premises or many frills, but it doesn't need to because what it offers is that good. I could easily see it expanding in the near future as word spreads.I would recommend a visit to anyone.
A great experience. Cleverly thrilling, laced with adrenaline and intelligence. This young team (average age 13) found it challenging but succeeded with nearly 2 mins to spare!

Highly recommended - such fun!. This was our first escape room experience and I can highly recommend it. A bit expensive for a family but it was a perfect activity for us, 2 adults and 2 kids (aged 11 + 13) who loves to use logic and solve puzzles. The staff is super friendly and play the game very convincingly so we all got into it. We managed to escape the room with a few seconds to go and left totally high on adrenalin and in really good moods. Still talking about it and will definately go again.

Really, really good fun. The first mission is to find the place with the building work that is going on!! Once inside we had a great time, one family against another. We did the office. Got out in 62 mins so we were quite pleased. Clues are pretty logical but everything in the room has a point. Probably the most fun venue we've been to this year. The countdown clock adds a sense of real urgency. I would play the mission impossible theme at the very end. When they have a new room we'll go again. We had a couple of 12 year olds with us and they were fine with everything. The 'helpers' were great with their clues when we were a bit stuck ( not often). It's an interesting place to be so high in London's ratings. It's obvious not Buckingham Palace etc but then it's probably not for tourists, but they would love it as well.

Absolutely Brilliant. This experience was totally new to me & my 3 friends. It was so original and well executed! We had a blast, even with hangovers :-) I would sincerely recommend this to anyone that enjoys using their brains, common sense and lateral thinking....The best team/friendship building experience I have ever done!!!We managed to complete the task in the time, but had to have another 5 minutes to get out of the room.....we did it with a second to spare! The only advice I would give, is make sure whoever is taking notes, takes good, exact ones :-)I won't say anymore because I would hate to give anything away....

Got to go. Amazing attraction for any age lots of fun and so exciting you must work as a team excellent value,is a little hard to find need more signs but that's part of the fun will be back with more friends great gift for the hard to buy for ...

So much fun!. Our team of four was locked in a room with an hour to work out how to escape before the time ran out. We all thought it was a lot of fun even though it was difficult not to get panicked by the countdown clock. We were so busy trying to solve the game that the time just flew by. Can't wait to try another room!(We got to ClueQuest via Hearn Street, off Curtain Road. We followed the street all the way round and found the building entrance opposite the construction site on Plough Yard.)
Fiendish and fun. Such a great idea, and well executed. Really looking forward to the 2nd (and, soon, 3rd) rooms.Great and terrible for friendships.

Addictively Brilliant!. A bit hard to find, and you usually need to book months in advance but worth it!We took over every room here for our office Christmas party this year. Fun, friendly hosts and they gently guide you through the games. We did the office and really enjoyed the challenges. They are not as complicated as at Hint Hunt and we only needed 2 clues to help us when we got stuck. (At hint hunt we needed constant clues which we felt like we were not doing well! But I think it's just a different way if playing there)So now I have played both Clue Quest and Hint Hunt I would say go to Clue Quest as it's more logical to solve the clues without help. But both still great fun.

Brilliant experience. Having turned up to what appeared to be a disused warehouse, I was a little apprehensive about what the experience was going to be like. I have to say it was the most fun I've had for quite some time. Lots of different puzzles, great for building teamwork skills and enthusiastic staff. Would highly recommend to anyone. Reasonably priced too.

Awesome!. Went there with 3 friends and we had a ball. The whole experience was even made better by our "host" Sylvie, who entertained us and put us in the story right from the start. We felt like kids in an adult-size game room! I would recommend it to anyone looking for different fun experience, and already planning to come back with more friends (and compete on 2 rooms).

Real-life "Escape" game - Rocks!. If you've ever played one of those "Escape the Room" type games on your mobile, then this just takes things to the next level! If you haven't, don't don't worry, the concept is simple and the clues leave a true sense of gratifying accomplishment when you figure them out. I went with a bunch of people I hated, I hate them less now. Thanks ClueQuest :-)

So different. A small team of 3 ... a secret mission to accomplish ... clues to unravel ... I've never done anything like this before and I am really glad I did. It was interesting, gripping, fun, and it has generated loads of conversation since. In fact I can't think of anything else that has provoked such discussion. I think we'll be fondly reminiscing for a long time. We went for afternoon tea afterwards - and felt we thoroughly deserved it. A very memorable experience.

Cluequest . We went as a family of five - we found staff very friendly and helpful. Because of construction work do leave plenty of time to get there as can be difficult to find. ..but that's all part of the adventure. The concept was really good and we succeeded our mission with 7.5 minutes to spare. Do try this out. We will be going back!

Loved it!. Fantastic place - loved the setup. Staff were really welcoming and fantastic at taking us through, and our group of hardened riddle-solvers found it pretty challenging and managed to solve the rooms with 3 minutes to spare! Recommended for couples, groups up to maybe 7 or 8 (there were 5 of us) and others who want to have a go at something that feels like a real-life computer/puzzle game!

Do it!. Not sure what to expect when a group of five of us went from work. Really good concept well executed. Everyone should try this, I'll be taking friends and family sometime in the future, perhaps when the new challenge is in place.

Fun, frantic and fabulous!. The guys at Cluequest were amazing, right through from dealing with my booking (which in itself needed Secret Agent assistance!) to the quest itself!Based on the reviews I had great expectations but it was so much better than I'd hoped for, the game was challenging, incredibly well thought out and there was more than enough to keep all four of us busy in a small space! We had brilliant time and escaped with 8 minutes to spare, whereupon one of our party promptly got stuck in the toilet! (well, secret agents are human too!)Thanks to Alice and the team for a great day, we'll be back soon for our next mission!

A different fun filled day out :). We went as a family team of 4, for my hard to please sons 16th birthday. We travelled by train and I found the venue easy to find by following the map sent, go via Worship street and you end up pretty much on top of Hearn street. Two of our party were a bit sceptical about participating in the game and were planning on sitting back and watching us other two solve the puzzles, within 30 seconds of being in the room coats were off, sleeves were rolled up and all four of us were well into trying to solve all the clues :) I don`t want to give anything away and spoil future gamers experience, but will say that all four of us had the most fun. You do need to work as a team even if you split into pairs, as time will fly by and there is so much to do. We did escape the room with a very respectable 4.36 minutes left on the clock much to our delighted surprise !!! My two teenage children and (I`m not joining in) husband all said they had the best day and were asking when we could go back to try the second scenario room and were all still smiling when we got home later that night :) Thank you to the creators for a wonderful different concept, a fun day out that doesn`t involve scaring the wits out of us, and to the lovely friendly staff.

Fun and a great change of pace. I agree completely with Mike from Cape Town. The only annoying part was finding the place was a quest in itself. It's not their fault add it's due to construction but I wish they'd update their web site with the info. They did mention the construction but their route wasn't up to date and it was another 5 to 10 minute walk to get there, which isn't a problem except you have to be there on time. So plan accordingly. Ok too much time spent on that inconsequential negative. I have given it five stars even after that. The corn ball intro given by our team leader was delivered with complete sincerity that had me chuckling and then pulling for the guy. The quest was fun and definitely worth it. Great for kids and still fun for an old guy.

Fantastic!!!!. My friends and I did something similar before so when we saw this we knew we had to try... It did not disappoint hilarious!!!!! Great fun and Ben (our group assistant) made it more fun for us with pics etc... Great fun! Pics to take away an the fridge magnet was a great take away for the birthday girl! We totes did it with 7 minutes to spare and we would be hired lol! Go!!!!

Original, challenging, well-designed and fun. 14 of us split into 4 teams for the ClueQuest challenge. The venue is a little hard to find, down a street where there are building works and no entry signs. Once inside we were warmly welcomed, put at ease, and given full explanations of how the Quest works, This was all done in a good humoured but professional manner and the inevitable health and safety/fire escape routine was mentioned, although this is not a physical activity and there is absolutely no risk involved and nothing 'scary' about it.Saying too much would spoil the fun for others, but the challenges are well-designed, properly prepared and implemented, and the support given to players is outstanding. This is something suitable for people of any age although young children under about 10 might have difficulty with some of the concepts. It does not require specific knowledge of anything, although a good command of English would be needed to understand some of the clues.A fun activity and the staff on hand obviously think so too, which makes it even more enjoyable.

Perfect teenage birthday party. Took my 14 year old daughter and four friends for a brilliantly different birthday party--I kept it a surprise and gave them riddles to solve on the way to ClueQuest as we rode the train. We even had other travellers joining in :) as keen puzzlers they were thrilled to discover we were needed as special operatives for Operation Blacksheep. The storyline and role playing just makes it all the more fun. Proud to report that my young teens completed the mission in record time! We all loved every minute :)

awesome fun locked away. My self and 3 friends went on wed 3rd and had a blast.Bit hard to find but so worth it! Funky waiting area (didn't wait long)Game was challenging, exiting but we cracked it!!!Sylvie was our helper on the day and was friendly, engaged with us, made us laugh and came to congratulate us when we won.Will be coming back for the other game for sure.And would recommend to anyone.

A great idea, but feel it could have been made a lot better!. After seeing this attraction on tripadvisor me and three friends went here for a friends birthday. To be honest we did feel a little bit disappointed after expecting a bit more from this. The area you wait in before going in looked more like a charity shop with mis-matched furniture and dull decor. After a quick briefing and to be honest the main thing I felt let down by was the story line, which I won't give away but it just did not make any sense! It was just a bit stupid?! If it had been something a bit more realistic with things inside the rooms which actually related to the story line a bit more. It is actually quite difficult which was good, but just felt everything was so random! I actually felt a bit funny when I came out lol There could have been a few more effects to make the experience a bit more exciting such as music, things which move or that you interact with , rather than just lots of locks!
Great fun. Really well put together activity, with enough twists and turbs to keep you going. Fab value for money. Nice staff and atmosphere

4 people in a room - and how to escape. We where 4 people aged 15, 48, 51 and 52 and we all had great fun.We succeded in working together, being time pressured, being smart - and suplementing each other, so we could succeed. When you thought you nearly had a clue, your team mate could refine the clue, so we had the right solution.Great fun, great thinking to make a place like this - and I can fully recommend to go there.NBThe first quest actually is to find the place at all, as there is construction nearby - so a bit of fun involved in getting there, as you have to pass a sign saying "no pedestrians" :-)ClueQuest sent a mail with extra instructions the day before, so that was great service.

Awesome fun for team building. Took our team of 16 to Cluequest, we broke into 4 groups of 4, whcih meant two teams could play against each other in two different quests. Was great fun, the team (which are a diverse bunch) all thoroughly enjoyed it. I've also doen previously with friends and was equally as much fun. Def recommend to others

Great eve with friends. Feels a bit like Crystal Maze/ CSI. Had a few drinks in Shoreditch then did a 10pm session. Our host/guide was friendly and wide awake and enthusiastic.
Would recommend - and would probably go again for the other 'mission'

Hard but great. Really good fun, and the woman who introduced us/helped over the walkie-talkie was lovely! We didn't manage to finish (we were nowhere near) but would love to go again and try the other room.

More fun than we imagined. We did this with our 18 year old son and had a blast. We had no idea what this was all about but now we want to do it again! I recommend this with friends. It's challenging and all about team work.
Great Fun. Went in a little sceptical but was absolutely great fun with the team, highly recommend this activity

Team building event! Great hours entertainment. Visited clue quest yesterday as a team building event with our sales team.
It was a great experience, lots of fun and enjoyed by the whole team.
We undertook the plan52 challenge and we were a team of five.
Couldn't recommend highly enough.

Super hard!. Despite the fact we failed at being secret agents, we had a great time! Apparently there are two different tasks, one easier than the other. We got the hard one and found it super difficult but it was a fun thing to do and the hour flew by! We dissected where we went wrong over afternoon tea at Brown's hotel! Well worth a visit, especially on a cold, wet day. It's a laugh even if you don't succeed!

Completely different from any other activity in London. Won't give anything away, but if you like puzzles, this is the game for you! Lends itself to both families and groups of adults. We went as two couples and it was amazing. Going back at the next opportunity for the other game!

What fun!. We were in London for a few days with our 20 year old son and were searching for some suitable entertainment for all 3 of us - and this hit the spot! Very exciting adventure with 60 minutes to solve clues to move on to the next stage, there were a few red herrings but timely prompts were provided when appropriate. We didn't manage to complete our mission in the allotted time but our special agent let us finish it anyway so we knew what we had missed. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Definitely recommend.

so much fun!. My friend and I were vacationing in London for a week and decided to try this based on the tripadvisor reviews. Our friends thought we were crazy because "why would we choose to spend an hour locked in a room when there is all of London to explore" but we are so glad we did this. Clue quest was a highlight of our trip. We were a team of two (which is super difficult) and we ended up not getting out of the room within the time limit but we still had a great time. Everyone working there is super friendly and helpful and all of the clues were set up in a really really creative way. We kept talking about this the rest of our week. Overall we had a great time. This is definitely a must for anyone visiting London.

One of the best attractions in London!. if you go in without knowing much about it and accept the unusual introduction without being cynical or thinking of it as being childish, you will be in for one of the best surprises in London. The puzzles involved are cleverly designed and skilfully laid out to create moments of excitement, discovery, exasperation and tension that make you think you are in a spy movie :))The joy of unlocking something or a code working in the right place is a fantastic feeling, especially if the whole team is involved. And you will certainly get your money's worth as you will still be in there until the very last seconds even with outside help.I would recommend this to everyone as a perfect form of escapism. Hopefully there will be a new room in 2015!!!
Best cheesy day out in London. At first you think, what are we doing here but within 10 minutes you're running around trying to find the clues to beat the clock!The best activity I've done in London

Great for team-building, friends, even a date!. I put together an offsite for my team and someone suggested this as an activity. Knowing very little about it, I took a leap and it was so worth it! It delivers the 'teamwork' message in practical form and is a whole lot of fun! Every person played a role and throroughly enjoyed the activity. I'm being very cryptic and not giving much away because if I do it spoils the fun! Just go, do it and lose yourself in the activity and you'll get a lot out of it.

Quality adventure but use a toilet elsewhere first !. Cracking concept and a challenge for our group of two adults and two children. Makes you think and work as a team. Not gonna give anything away about the challenge itself other than it is worth doing.The toilets in the building are disgusting and my daughter was not able to use the Ladies lavatory due to their condition. The Gents weren't much better.We'll be back to do the other challenge, but will ensure we don't require the washroom facilities!

Great fun. Was taken here for my Birthday last week not knowing what to expect. Was completely submerged in the game for an hour and really enjoyed it. Looking forward to going back and playing the second game soon. Recommend it to anyone.
Stimulating evening. Loved the locked-in treasure hunt, it does test your lateral thinking skills - it feels great when you crack the clues - fabulous team game!

Wonderful. 10 am Sunday morning and we had to get our brains into gear. No trouble finding the place. There was plenty of room to sit and wait for my brother. I agree with other reviewers that the toilets were not very nice and not a loo roll in sight !We all really enjoyed it and did manage to solve all the clues and escape in time. I thought it was better organised that hinthunt and would definitely go again.

Clue Quest challenge. Having randomly booked after a friend suggested we would enjoy Clue Quest, we really didn't know what to expect and had travelled from the south coast just to play the game. However, we had such fun and can't stop talking about it - Its really worth a go I'd highly recommend it....

Excellent. Brilliant , better than we had imagined. Would highly recommend it. Great fun solving all the clues & working together as a team. We will be back to do the other rooms. Best fun we have had in London for ages.

Great fun for all!. I booked ClueQuest for myself, my mum and my brother as a birthday present to them both and we all turned up yesterday not really knowing what to expect. I can honestly say it's one of the best attractions I've been to!! We worked together as a dysfunction yet successful team (we got out with 6:28 to spare). We couldn't stop talking about how clever it was all the way home. I've convinced one of my colleagues into going for a stag doo and I plan to re-visit to play Black Sheep!! Would definitely recommend this to all.

Fantastic!. Likes - an excellent way to spend a couple of hours. It was original and like nothing we'd experienced before. Real entertainment with real value for money.
Dislikes - the location was a tad difficult to find.

Family teambuilding!. We went here with our teenage daughter (14) and had a great time! Neither language nor age is an issue in this game so its suitable for anyone from anywhere. We had never been on something similar and did not know what to expect. But it was great fun !! We did need some (a lot of.....) help and we got extra minutes and YES we got out :-) with only seconds left.Getting there was easy, just follow the instructions received. We came in the evening and the alley you go through is dark and unwelcomming, but its nothing of this when you arrive at Cluequest.It was so much fun, I really want to do this again!!!
ClueQuest. What a great concept. I really enjoyed ClueQuest , working as a team to escape the room was so much fun and team building. We are so doing it again.

Super time. As with the others, concur with the game - great time had by all, despite a couple of technical hitches. Kids (12 & 13) thought it was brilliant.Definately be back for the other room.Downside was the most disgusting toilets in London, whilst not CQs overall problem as a shared building but do need to impress on the management company that faeces left around the floors isn't quite good enough.

Highlight of our London trip!. We tried Plan 52 (redbox) for the first time last weekend as a group of 5. It was the first time any of us had done something like this but we had an amazing time. All the puzzles were fun but challenging at the same time and we made it out with just under 8 minutes to spare. Would most definitely recommend going and we cannot wait to go back and try the Black Sheep challenge! Was talking about it for days after and telling anyone that would listen about the whole experience.
Original and great fast paced fun!. Had such a good time at Cluequest, really well laid out rooms covered in clues and surprises, definitely want to go again and try the other room!

Great fun!. Equally as good as our hinthunt experience earlier in the year. Allowed our family of 6 into the room together, whereas hinthunt would only allow 5. We escaped with almost 8 minutes to spare and left feeling very pleased with ourselves and thoroughly entertained. It's not the easiest place in the world to find and the toilets were a bit grotty but the staff were great and the puzzles fun and challenging. Would definitely return and recommend it to anyone who like me wanted to participate in the crystal maze growing up!

ClueQuest latest challenge. Operation Black Sheep is just brilliant. A fair bit harder then Plan 52, but we made it - just! The new location is excellent and the welcome and support team are superb. It took a good hour or two for heart rates to return to normal but the jubilation lasted for days! A must do for the brave and the bold :-) Or just for fun day out with friends and family

Great social event. First review I've ever done on here. We went last night as part of a work social event and had 2 teams of 5 and 4. We came out within a minute of each other. Everyone had great fun and I'd happily recommend it anyone of any age range!

Its brilliant. I wouldn't normally bother to review on here but felt compelled to as it really is that good! We did the challenges as a company team social event. We hired all 4 rooms at the same time - which is quite difficult as it is so popular so had a lead time of about 2.5months (?!) but it was all worth it. Without exception, everyone just loved it. It is by no means 'childish', in fact, it is really very challenging, but not too challenging that it becomes frustrating. Cant recommend it more!
60 minute and you are all there.... Brilliant place to be and they indulge you so damn sweetly that excitement is on for all and no one feels left out. this perhaps is a landmark place in london

Brilliant thankyou. It was really different and really fun! It was great to have a new kind of challenge and it was a brilliant team activity!
Thank you

Awesome. Organised Cluequest for 30 of my colleagues...and it was a resounding success, everyone absolutely loved the activity!! We're all thinking about going back to do one of the scenario we haven't done. I don't want to say too much about it not to reveal anything, but just go and check out for yourself...it's brilliant!!!

Even better than you think. Having been to another live escape game in Germany, I had high expectations. Often this proves disastrous, but not on this occasion. Well run, well priced and incredibly challenging, adrenalin pumping and fun. Thanks guys..... Me and my colleagues had an absolute blast! We did manage the puzzle within the hour, and this was a final thrill at the end! Highly recommend!

Fun, exciting, challenging!. Went as a couple after reading the reviews but unsure of what it would be like given it was just that two of us. Came out thinking why we had never done this before!Exciting fun activity for couples too, even though it isn't marketed as such.

Deservedly at the top!!!. Absolutely top activity, went as a group of 4 and were rewarded with an intellectually stimulating, frenetic and thrilling experience. Would be good any time of day or any day of the week, well organised and very satisfying. RECOMMEND
Really enjoyable. Fantastic way to spend an evening. Very well run. We really enjoyed our experience. Will definitely be back to do the other room!

Excellent! Brilliant! You must do it!. We did this on Saturday as a family of 4 adults and my 11 year old nephew. It was so much fun, so exciting, I can't even begin to say how good it was. You get 60 minutes to complete all the puzzles etc, and the closer we got to the end the more frantic we got! Can't wait to go and do the other game, and I hope they keep bringing new ones out, we'd try them all. We were still buzzing and talking about it hours later on the train home. Thank you Mr Q, we will be back!
You need to try it yourself!. Best experience ever! feels like you are on a TV show playing the escape game with your team! highly highly recommended :) Thank you Cluequest!

Brilliant game. I booked this for my husbands birthday, there were 11 of us split into two teams and we all thought it was great fun.I would highly recommend this experience to all and we'll definitely be back to complete the other mission.
Wonderful. Amazing experience. We had so much fun and enjoyed every moment of it. Will definitely go back soon!

ALL of the FUN!. Didn't know what to expect at all before we went to this yesterday, and it was Amazing. Perfectly organised with tons of thought to detail. Staff were great too. One of the best activities I have done in London in a long time.. make sure you give it a go.
Quests rule!. That is amazing. My first quest ever. Slightly hard to do this on a foreign language, but nice activity for sure.

Excellent Experience. This is a hidden gem of a place. Whilst we had directions we had difficulty finding the place but when we did we were so impressed. We are a family of three with a 13yr old boy who all thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Weren't too sure what to expect before visiting and obviously can't give too much away but the tasks set were excellent and well thought out. Although each of us had a 'role' to play we pretty much lost track of that within the first 15 mins and then realised teamwork is what makes it work. Were very tempted to go straight back in to the 2nd challenge but restrained ourselves - we will definitely be returning though to do it. Can't stress enough how good this place is
Brilliant. Really good fun. Recommend it to anyone. Best not to know to much about it beforegand. Can see why its number 1 attraction in London
Absorbing adrenalin fuelled hour!. Great fun & something totally different! Friendly staff. Great talking point for the rest of the day! Highly recommended.

Fab evening. Can't reveal too much of the game clearly, however, it was a very worthwhile experience. We were a team of four, and the clues and puzzles were interesting and inventive. There were some red herrings, but it was all part of the fun. Well thought-out, and can't wait to check out the "next challenge" which is Black Sheep. Also, I must say thank you to the staff who waited for us (we were about 10 min late) and gave us a really warm welcome. They took care of us throughout our whole time there which was greatly appreciated. Thanks ClueQuest!
Fantastic and different. Great to visit with friends. A different experience that challenges you whilst having fun. HIGHLY recommended.

Brilliant Time!. We hired 3 rooms for 3 teams of colleagues - we all loved it, it was so much fun! We typically over thought things and didn't appreciate the advice given until we came out. We really want to do it again!

Totally worth it.. Heard about ClueQuest from a co-worker, and decided to try it out with some friends. It was really a lot of fun solving the puzzles together. ClueQuest is great for teambuilding, birthday celebrations or simply an alternative weekend activity!

Fantastic. This game is very fun and addictive, the staff is very friendly. the price is not low but it is definitely worth
Visited April 2014

A good challenge and fun all way through. Went as 2 teams of 5 colleagues each, we had an hour of puzzles, fun and competitive spirit to solve the problems and after fulfilling the tasks escape from the game to reality. Great idea, good support from the ClueQuest guys. You can test how you can cooperate as the challenges are getting more complex by the end.

AMAZING!. Such a brilliant idea. Went with work for a team building event. After the 7 of us split into 2 teams we then reached each other to see which team came out first. My brain physically hurt trying to crack the clues and codes and there was plenty of laughter and team spirit. Will definitely be back to try the second mission. Cannot recommend this attraction enough, it's simply brilliant.

Awesome. What an absolute gem this place was I've never had so much fun being locked in a room for an hour!As a family of four we all enjoyed this experience and all worked well as a team to work out the clues and escape the room.Will return to try the other challenge/ mission I won't say much more except : "you must try this"You won't be disappointed

Fantastic!. We didn't really know what to expect when we arrived but when it all started it was a lot of fun.Our youngest kid (9 year) turned out to be our most valuable team member.This was really fun for the whole family and we can highly recommend it!Our kids are 9, 10 and 16 and they were all engaged in solving the mystery.Clue Quest beats the more famous "must-do-things" in London like for example London Eye.Give this activity a chance. You will not regret it!

Excellent entertainment - can't wait to go again. We booked two rooms at the same time for our daughter's 13th birthday, taking 10 of us in total including my 10 year old and 7 year old. When we arrived, I did wonder what we had done - the street and building are pretty grungy and my daughter always likes to do something none of her friends have done before for a party, so I told the girls if nothing else we'd have a laugh about how bad it was. I couldn't have been more wrong. It was fantastic fun, and we were competing against the other room so even more tense! Everyone loved it - no-one could quite believe how much but we did. We couldn't stop talking about it over lunch and I am very keen to go again with a group of adults. 13/14 year olds are a great age for it. My 10 year old was a bit young, but still really enjoyed it. Very well put together and worth the money.
Great Fun while Training your Brain. Great for team building, bachelor party, or fun with friends / family members. We went with 4 of us and it was a lot of fun doing the 'puzzles' solving the clues.

Fun alternative. After hearing about Clue Quest from an aquaintance, I booked our team of four for the event. I have to say, my team wasn't overly excited about this. However, it definitely brings out the competitive spirit in even the hesitant.It's hard to describe the experience without giving away some of the trade secrets, I do think you have to do the first challenge with a very open mind. You need to experience it once and then change strategies after seeing how it works. Our team agreed that coming back for a second attempt would greatly help our chance to be successful.My best advice is to do your homework on the location. It's off a small alley several blocks from the commercial area. Allow at least 20-25 minutes to locate Clue Quest from the Liverpool tube station. We asked for directions at least four times and even once we were on the correct "alley" someone couldn't direct us to the actual address a few yards away. It's located in a building with a push button doorbell entry. There aren't many signs or indications that you found the right location so again, allow extra time in case you need it. It was fun, and definitely made us want to do it again.

GOOD FUN. A very enjoyable afternoon, my 9 year old son was able to take an active part in the event and really enjoyed it. We failed to complete the task in the time allotted but were not pressured to leave and enjoyed our "handler" entering to help us complete the task without simply passing on the information, our son was still challenged by her clues and made to feel very grown up.

Excellent family fun. We did Plan 52 with our teenagers (17 and 14) and had a terrific time working as a team to solve the clues. The game is full of surprises and very cleverly designed to ensure you feel challenged but not stuck. We will definitely be back for Operation Blacksheep.

Mission: Black Sheep KABOOOM. I booked this for my sister's 21st Birthday, and the team consisted of my 50 something mother and father, 30 something year old boyfriend and I. I talk about ages, because it was my immediate fear that my parents would find it dull and childish, and my sister who is an 'adult' now, would feel like she was at a crèche. My fears almost immediately subsided, the game challenged us all and forced us to work together. We absolutely loved it, even internal agro didn't ruin it! Thank you so much for such a memorable, fun and fantastic mission! Our host was equally fantastic, you could tell he enjoyed it - which makes such a difference.

Great great great family fun! Loved it!. This was fabulous. We did ClueQuest on the last day of a 4 day trip to London but wish we had done it at the beginning so we could have done another challenge! It was that much fun! I had read the reviews so had high hopes and they were all met. The staff were lovely, especially Richard (our Clue Dude as my son called him). We are a family of 4 with 2 boys 10 and 12 and everyone enjoyed it. It was a great antidote for the boys who didn't want to see another thing but rather wanted an activity. Loved also that it was suitable to for all shaped, sizes and fitness levels.cant say to much as would spoil the fun for future goers except to say..do it!! You won't regret it.Two tips:It is located in the business area of London and so bit away from Oxford Circus etc. and a bit tricky to find. The directions on the website are good. But leave yourself plenty time to get there unlike us who were tearing in at the last minute.The website says 9+ and that is a good guide but if three of the party were 9+ and the rest are younger that could work i would say.

Exhilarating Fun!. Took part in the Operation Blacksheep quest as part of a team building exercise with some work colleague and we were shocked at how much fun we had in this experience. It's definitely a challenge and requires you to be quick thinking in order to complete the quest within 60mins...(felt like the time flew by for us!) I have already booked the other room for December (Plan 52) with my friends and can't wait to see what clever ideas are behind this room. Good job Team ClueQuest!

Worth every penny - a MUST do in London. Had a wonderful time doing this. It was really fast moving, challenging but fun, and the staff were wonderful. Such an adrenaline rush, and great brain exercise too. I've been recommending this to everyone since I went!

One of the greatest, and cheapest, attractions in London. Decided to do this with my mates and girlfriend for her birthday. Showed up and Margarita (apologies if spelt wrong) let us in and was thoroughly fantastic the whole evening. Amazing experience and cannot wait to do the next one.

Great family fun. My wife and I took our two children (16,12) and our nephew (17) to this, a little unsure what to expect but have to admit it was a fabulous 90mins or so. I won't give anything away but if you have teenage kids and love solving puzzles, then this is for you. We were chatting about it for hours after and it was great as we all had to work as a team. Only tip I'd give is it is a little difficult to find, so do leave a little extra time in getting there. Definitely go again for the other mission

Great fun!. We came here feeling both nervous and excited, having never done anything like this before. We really chose to try this on a whim. We didn't know anyone who had tried it but it was listed as top activity to do in London by Tripadvisor. On arrival we were told what was involved before we started by a very friendly, helpful lady ( we think her name was Rose). The escape game was very tough but we had a great time and loved every minute of it, working together as a team. We came out feeling quite elated and definitely wanting to return to try another game in the future. We talked about it for ages - I can't remember a time when I had packed so much into 1 hour. Though the time flew in one way, in another it felt like we had been there for hours because we had done so much. I can see how someone could become quite addicted to this! Thoroughly recommend this to anyone - friends or for a teambuilding day at work. Try it - you definitely won't be disappointed.

Amazing. 4 friends for for a birthday and had an amazing time. Great idea, good fun and you do not have to be a genius to take part. Can't wait to go and do the 2nd room. I hope in the near future the rooms get changed so we can come back for more!

Great experience - well recomended. I booked this as a surprise visit for a family day out. Not any of us had a clue of what to expect but on arrival we quickly understood that we were there as agents to save the world.10 minutes later we were locked in our designated room and had an hour to think our way through all the cryptic clues.Every now and then our radio crackled from our friendly agent with a little nudge of a clue to point us in the right direction.This was an unusual way to spend a few hours but most enjoyable. The game is fun and don't worry if you get stuck as there is help at hand from your friendly agent who is monitoring your progress.We would have done much better but I am sure my wife was a double agent trying to foil our progress by forgetting to check all the licks properly.We already have booked the other room!

Great fun for everyone in the family!. My mum, boyfriend, best friend and I went to Cluequest recently and it was awesome! Really enthusiastic staff members and so much attention to detail in creating the clues. We will definitely go back to take on a different room soon. Would highly recommend.

Great activity for teenagers. The first challenge of this activity is finding it! It's in a back lane in Shoreditch! It lasts one hour and is utterly absorbing and the whole family enjoyed it. Worth the money and would visit again.
Loved it. Took 3 of my kids and my wife last week and it was great. Not easy ( thanks God they help you along the way) Cant wait to try again.

12 minutes to spare. Boom!. Brilliant! Felt the first challenge was finding the place and was slightly nervous as not entirely sure what to expect but honestly can't recommend this place enough! We accepted Mr Q's mission and had just under an hour of pure fun - dashing here and there, solving his clues to 'escape the room and save the universe' We were a group of two couples and once we stopped overthinking the puzzles, we whizzed through the room. Brilliant fun, something completely different to usual weekend activities and we talked about it for a good while after - will be back for another mission! Over and out - Agent Brain ;)

A high octane experience for the whole family. My family of five, including children aged 7 to 13, had a go at "saving the world" from Professor BlackSheep at Cluequest. It was our second escape room. The site is slightly tricky to find and a bit off the beaten track. Once inside the environment is relaxed, friendly and professional. We were given clear instructions and started our challenge.Without giving anything away, we were all involved in solving the clues and reached a satisfying conclusion - with occasional guidance from our attentive host.It was a fantastic experience and we plan to book another one soon.Highly recommended - if you like to exercise your brain!

So much fun. 1 hour of pure exhilaration. It was fun, tense, exciting, nerve-wracking, frustrating, different and a unique way to spend an evening. I went with an all girls team and raced another set of friends in the other room. It was great, never before has an hour passed by so quickly.

Brilliant . Undertook the challenge with a couple of friends that had bought it for my birthday present. It was brilliantly different and had a great time. Would definitely go back to try one of the other rooms. Don't want to give too much away but if you want something a little different from the typical London attractions then I can't recommend this highly enough.
Great fun!. Spending an hour here will top your stay in London.Book early because this seems to be very popular!
