Fantabaroo. Brilliant!! Family of four (16 and over), we had such fun tackling Operation Black Sheep. Quickest hour ever! Staff extremely friendly and on hand with hints if needed. Definitely recommend and will definitely attempt a different challenge in the future! Thanks cluequest!

100% Recommendation. Booked 'Plan 52' for a work team building event and we were all so impressed! I think there were a few sceptical faces when we arrived but once we were in the room everybody got into the swing of it and loved every minute of it! We would all recommend it for groups or friends, colleagues, families etc. We are booking again to do the second room in a few months time.

Highlight of our London trip!. Was an amazing experience - something neither of us had done before. We had a group of 5 and we all absolutely loved it! A great brain teaser and has everyone working together. Will definitely be visiting again to do the "Operation Black Sheep" challenge.
cluequest. lived up to the hype - great family bonding activity! very clever concept, great staff. will be going back to try the next room.

A fun experience.... Was a fun experience at a reasonable price however was disappointed overall as I was expecting a lot more from the number 1 attraction on trip advisor. I think there could be a lot more effects to make the experience a bit more dramatic, for example I wouldn't even have noticed if we had run out of time... there was no sound affects or anything when you only had a little amount of time remaining and little things like this would improve the experience . I would do a different room again but would not be in a rush to go back.
Great brain teaser. If you like puzzle solving this is a must. We managed to escape with 42 seconds to spare. Very well organised Excellent birthday present from my son Of
Awesome and well planned!. The staff were very friendly and communicated the game well. It was all very well planned!Great for groups of friends or team building! Definitely will be going back!

Something different. The quickest hour of my life trying to solve puzzles to escape a locked room. Brilliant fun for friends & family and would also be a good corporate event, just to find out how effective your teams are. Props, setup and staff very good.

As much fun as we'd hoped it would be!. Having taken a while to find ClueQuest as the road is currently under construction, we were slightly skeptical about the activity initially. We were sat down in a room for a while and left by ourselves for roughly 15 minutes, by which point we started assuming we'd made a mistake in booking this attraction. However, after the 15 minutes were up, we were greeted enthusiastically by a member of staff, who was incredibly helpful in answering any questions we had, and seemed to be very enthusiastic about her job. Once we were led inside the room, we had absolutely no idea where to start. But luckily, the employee that had greeted us was available at all times, and sent us a few hints to get us started. Once we'd figured out the general gist of what we were meant to do, we stopped running around like headless chickens and got to work. The scenery is very well done, and the puzzles are ingeniously crafted. If anyone is worried that they won't be able to solve them, don't be! Most of them just require common sense and being vigilant to your surroundings. And if you're ever stuck, the staff member assigned to you will help you out in the form of some cryptic hints. They never give you the answers straight up, which makes you feel like you accomplished something even if you required some sort of aid. All in all, we managed to finish with 9 seconds to spare, which felt incredible. We can't wait to come back to try the next room, which we will most definitely be doing!

Fun family activity. We enjoyed our ClueQuest adventure--it was a great family bonding activity, as we all had to work together to solve the puzzles. We have been to similar attractions in other cities before, and we all agreed this was our favorite.

Excellent team building. Our experience was brilliant from the moment we stepped into Plough Yard, there were people milling around that pointed us in the correct direction. Once we arrived we were given a full briefing and put at ease about being "locked" in a room. It was a fantastic way to spend an hour, it made everyone work together and it was surprising how tense it got when the clock ticked down (even knowing we weren't actually going to explode).My team now want to return ASAP to complete the second room.
Always Wonderful. It's a place of comfort and familiarity just minutes after arrival. People are actually nice to each, and welcome the opportunity to assist visitors.

Fun 'office bonding'. One of the more fun office bonding activities I have done. A fun hour trying to solve puzzles to get out of a room, guess the closest to the crystal maze you can get. Hosts were gave a good introduction made everyone feel at ease and lightened the mood ready for the competition to begin!

Unique enjoyable experience that made us think "out of the box"!. The challenges of the enigmas are the driving force behind this against the clock absorbing mission...Not a second to lose...decisions decisions, searching for meanings...identifying "red herrings" against vital clues, raiding rooms...putting the pieces of the puzzles together to unlock yet another mystery..getting our little "eager to save the universe" team (mum, dad, 2 teenagers) to work closely together, solving the problems and hunting for hidden keys in the most ingenious and varied ways!Felt like a real life "professor Layton"!Not physically demanding...but our grey cells had a praiseworthy workout!We just made it..with 47 seconds to go...and a little help from our lovely, in character, young lady"mentor"!Well deserved first place attraction in London!!!!!Cant wait to do the second mission with/against a group of friends next time! Girls V Boys ll be fun!

Everything is awesome when you're part of a team!. Went for a birthday, Operation BlackSheep group of three was the perfect size. Spend an hour doing something different to staring at a screen! You'll love it.
Fun!!. Great fun and so well designed and organised. The best activity for friends or parties looking for something totally unique to do.

A lot of fun!. We had a lot of fun at ClueQuest in Plan52. Mr. Q drove us hard, but we (think we) outsmarted him (or her...'Mr' is a good cover for a woman)...we made it out!I have done a few Escape Rooms in London and of the ones I did, ClueQuest is the one I think would be best suited for non-native speakers - so if you have family of friends from abroad, this is a very fun and exciting activity to do. While it officially lasts for 1 hour (or less if you manage to escape)...the anticipation and the after-math will keep you entertained for much longer!

Great fun - just do it!. Was slightly nervous that ClueQuest had been overhyped on here. Not at all though - what a cracking experience!Great fun from start to finish and the whole experience is timed pretty much perfectly with sufficient level of difficulty to keep you working, but not completly stumped.Went with 3 colleagues to the Operation Blacksheep room and will be going back for the other challenge before the year is out!

Bring on the next mission. Visited ClueQuest with two friends yesterday not quite knowing exactly what to expect but thoroughly impressed - booked on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and had an amazing time. The hour went surprisingly quickly as we progressed through the challenges on Plan52 which really tested the three of us! We have all said we'll be back to try Operation Black Sheep (and hopefully more missions in the future) - well done to all the ClueQuest team!
Great trip with 4 12 year olds. A fantastic time doing Operation Black Sheep with 4 twelve year olds - got out with 37 seconds to spare :-) Thanks to the ClueQuest team who were wonderful!

The best hour you can spend in London. ClueQuest is such fun for all - I can't recommend it highly enough! We've now done both rooms (plan 52 and operation black sheep) and both were excellent. We just hope they develop another room soon as we'd definitely come back for more...!!

Great experience for family or group. We thoroughly enjoyed it even though there were just the two of us. We wished our children were there with us. Younger ones can help with searching for physical clues.Finding the place is a clue quest as well!!

Such a great idea. I organised a group of 16 of us to head to Clue Quest for my sister's 30th birthday. Not really completely understanding what it was or how it worked, I couldn't have been more impressed. From arranging a group booking quite a way in advance and confirming numbers later then adding more at the last moment, the whole process was easy. When we all arrived on the day we split into three teams and headed off for the hour challenge. The rooms are so clever and well thought out (god knows how they figure it out!) The staff were great, playing out the game the whole time, and jumping in with clues or help as and when needed. Such a great option for a team building, birthday party, stag or hen do or just for no reason whatsoever too I guess!
Great fun ! Highly recommended!!. My friends and I had a lot of fun. The clues are really clever and the team running the place is just great. Definitely worth the price!

Awesome!. Did operation Blacksheep in 2 groups of 5 as part of a celebration. The staff were great and communicated the instructions clearly. Our progress was monitored and the staff gave us additional clues if we appear stuck. It was great and everyone enjoyed it! We were all given a Polaroid group photo to keep as a souvenir and the birthday girl received a magnet with the photo on on. Appreciate the kind gesture ClueQuest!

Brilliant fun!. We took our new teenager for her birthday treat with 4 of her friends on Saturday and they had the time of their lives! They all came out exhilarated and completely wired announcing that they needed to come again. That's not because they didn't complete the challenge - hats off to them, they did, but because they are planning some parents vs. teens challenges etc. So from a parental point of view I cannot fault this place. Staff are great, good value for money, the challenge itself scores top marks & lovely touch to have team photo at the end.Those not taking part can't see anything, not a negative though as we took a walk up to Box Park and Brick Lane. Apparently not many teen groups do this. Can't think why. This is something really different and if the reaction of our group is anything to go by, ticks all the boxes and that's not easy with teens!
great fun. An hour of hunting for clues in a locked room. 5 adults trying to find clues to get out and save the world. Well organised. We will be going again.
So much fun. Did clue quest with a group of 4. Excellent fun, everyone enjoyed it! Something different to do in a cool part of london!

OMG This is so so fun. This is such a fun experience with friends or family and even funnier I think when you are just a little bit tipsy. Myself and 3 other friends decided to give it a go. Sadly we didn't out smart Professor black sheep but we had a bloody good time trying to. Jake our games master was brilliant. Teamwork and I think having fun is the key to a successful game and possibly some quick thinking seeing as you only have an hour to get out the room. This is the most fun I have ever had in a locked room! So going back again.

Surprisingly good. Today is the the day after our fantastic experience at Cluequest. I sometimes read these reviews and don't really believe them no matter how many good reviews, but this time I have to say Cluequest was surprisingly good.Five of us for a birthday did this. We started slowly but got into it and for a full hour we loved looking for clues everywhere and managed to finish with 23 seconds to spare!I would definitely recommend for someone who wants different but fun experience to the normal Shoreditch drinking activities.

Impossible not to like. Visited with a group of 5 adults (in our twenties and thirties) and had a brilliant time.I won't say too much about the event itself but it feels like a real-life video game, and is genuinely something everybody could enjoy.Don't hesitate - just book it!

Great fun. Coming back for the next room.. Ever since I was told about this I knew it was going to be great. It's a great idea and I enjoy playing the point-and-click games so having a live version is excellent.It was exactly as expected with clever puzzles and locks. The story that went with the room gave a nice twist and we managed to get out in 57 mins (beating the other team of friends by a few seconds). The layout is great, the staff are great and even the location is well hidden. Definitely worth going too with out a doubt!

Just do it!. four 50 year olds on a wet Tuesday evening made the effort to trip up to town.........worth every minute!Great to use your brain as part of a team....fun! It also hi lighted the adrenaline fuelled despots in the group and the True workers. We will return!

Fun, video-game like experience!. We first heard about escape rooms while in Prague and decided to book this one in London. It's pretty much as close as it gets to a live-action version of a point-and-click puzzle computer game! It's insanely awesome! The clues aren't that hard to get and the immersive experience is unbelievable. We escaped the room in the final minute which made it all even more exciting!The staff is really nice and the facilities are quite neat. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good game!
Perfect fun for the hole family. We loved everything...it was such a fun for us ,exciting. But not easy to find ...*g* ..is this the first quest ??

Everything we thought and we escaped too. With the very existence of humankind at stake, we put aside pretty family disputes to provide a coherent attack on the room and escape intact. Awesome family fun!

Wow, wow, wow!. Right, so we (four adults and two kids, ages 8 and 11) went in with pretty high expectations but not really knowing what to expect. At the end we all thought it was an amazing experience and couldn't stop talking about it for ages.Getting there doesn't start well. It's down a dodgy backstreet and there is essentially no street signage. The foyer doesn't look particularly impressive, but our host was great and did a good job of getting us ready and in the mood.Then you are taken to the room (we did the Satellite room), the host says "Good luck", shuts the door, the timer starts counting down from 60 minutes and......well the rest would be telling. Our team of six completed the room with three seconds to spare and it was nail biting. A serious degree of teamwork is required but our two kids had no worries being positive contributors and even solving a few puzzles which stumped the adults. We all left on a high and look forward to returning.

Highlight of our London trip. Absolutely deserves the number 1 spot. Believe all positive things said about this experience.Firstly, you will have to book at least a few weeks in advance as it books out. Our first puzzle was finding the venue, due to roadworks right in front of the entrance. It is a little tricky to find, but the directions on the website are pretty good and you should be able to call them if you get totally lost.There is nothing physically taxing and no local knowledge needed (We were concerned there might be some local thing we'd need to know, but there wasn't anything). We were a group of 2, even though groups of 3-5 people is recommended and we managed to escape, so if you're tossing up whether it's worth it for just 2 people, the answer is YES DEFINITELY. The only thing we regret is not booking both escapes.

Something different!. A sibling group of 4 of various ages, we spent a great fun hour trying to escape from the rooms. We were so involved in working out the puzzles, we didn't realise how fast time was flying!A great concept with friendly 'mission control' getting in touch with tips and more clues, when we were getting stuck and frustrated! We managed to escape the rooms with just 1:47 mins to spare, phew. I didn't know what to expect at all when I arrived at the location, but once you're at the location, you're put to ease to know that no experience of any kind is required. Though it may help if you're good at cryptic clues! All that is required is a bit of common sense, and inquisitiveness. If you're a nosey person, who enjoys rummaging through things, then you'll have fun in here!

You must do it!!. So you think that you are observant, clever and MI5 would be lucky to have you? That silly games will not test you at all? That this will be a walkover for you? You wont need hints because you will sail through? Have a rude awakening then at Cluequest! Had a fantastic time Friday with family (24 to 64) solving Plan 52 . Its much harder than you think but really so simple! Gamesmasters fun, friendly and helpful. Simple concept expertly put together. So much fun, cant wait to try Black Sheep. Well done all involved. Excellent group activity. Wish there were 10 more quests to come back for!! Thanks for a great time. In London? You must try this!

Enjoyed it as much as last time!. We returned to Clue Quest to attempt the second room, Operation Black Sheep and were not disappointed. We did struggle, maybe because there were 4 of us instead of 6, maybe because the second room is harder?! We still had a great time and although we didn't quite finish, they still. took the time to guide us through the remainder of the game. Great concept and very well executed, highly recommended.

Even having seen the reviews, I wasn't expecting it to be this good!. Really good fun, such a simple concept and very well excecuted. We did the Black Sheep game and the entire group of 5 were involved right from the start. It's hard to describe without spoliers, so I won't, but if you haven't tried something like this before you really need to!

Great fun. This was great family fun. Our teenage boys went straight into the role as agents and were all over the place looking for clues. The puzzles were well-made, testing our team spirits as well as logic. Brilliant!

Time well spent!. Passed by London and tried to escape - fantastic unforgateble experience! Very friendly staff, lots of well-done puzzles! Can't wait to try with the black sheep =)
Thank you, guys!

Fantastic fun. We did this for our team day at work and had a blast. The whole set up was really clever and extremely well thought through. It tests your brain and teamwork while remaining fun and you get a clue every now and again if you get too stuck. We can't wait to go back for the Black Sheep game.

Another great visit!. Did the Black Sheep game this time. Great fun once again even tough we struggled! It really is a great concept and a great way to spend an hour with friends. It is really well run and excellent value for money. Now we need a third game!

A fantastic experience. There is a reason this is the #1 thing to do in London on Tripadvisor!. My friends and I cannot recommend enough! Our handler was great fun, we all were having a good time before we even got started on the actual escape game. The puzzles themselves were ingenious and will not be what you expect! The level of difficulty was near perfect; enough to really get you thinking but not enough to feel that the puzzles are anywhere near impossible, and either way your handler will always be there to give you a helpful clue via walkie-talkie if you need it.We finished with 2m20s to spare and the feeling was brilliant! Again, cannot recommend enough!

Fun and different!. Going to the pub with friends is always good fun, but if you're looking for a way to switch up a day out, this is the place to do it! My husband and I went with two good friends, and we had so much fun. If you have a group that works well together and loves a bit of nerdy fun, this is ideal for you. And don't try to figure out too much before showing up. The mystery before is half of the fun!

Amazingly different!. Met our handler Alice in reception and she guided us on our mission for Mr Q. Have to say we had an AMZAZING hour! Can't give away too much information about the mission but it is the best fun we have had in forever! Thoroughly recommend it! Remember your thinking caps and to work as a team! And remember clues are everywhere! ;) Thanks Alice & Mr Q, we will see you again!

Well worth the money. Excellent concept and a real great team building experience, or in our case a family bonding experience. Clues were not too difficult or too easy. Really brilliant game:)The first real test is to find the place!!!
Good fun. Very different. Good fun. I would note don't expect anything high tech. The surroundings are dated but the games are all new

Real 5 star stuff.. Brilliant. All four of us had a blast for the hour. Non of us could find fault. Well done to the guys and girls at cluequest. The premises is not signed outside (like all top secret locations ) with the name etc so trust the address supplied. It is there.
Awesome. Such a fun evening ! We were in a team of 5, only £20 each. Would recommend it to anyone. Seriously do it !!

Surprisingly Good. We were 4 people in ClueQuest. It is a game, we had to complete some "missions". It was very entertaining and challenging.
I recommend.

The Matrix and Total Recall in one!. This was, SERIOUSLY, the most fun thing our family has ever done together and we have traveled the world first class. Anyone who likes riddles, puzzles, or espionage movies will love this! The requirement of teamwork, riddle solving, memory, foreshadows, and predictions are all required. Disney nor Universal Studios could pack this much fun and entertainment into 60 minutes. 11 Plough Yard rocked my world! I WILL be going back to do this again.
Most fun!!. This was brilliant! We got out with 8 minutes to spare. Loved every minute with it and came out just wanting the whole world to be like a game of ClueQuest!!

Worth it. To me it was something new/different. We were 2 couples and we all agreed that it was a great experience. The game was challenging yet depended on common sense, team work and trying to think out-of-the-box. We were 13 minutes short for winning which was a bit of a disappointment but we did it nevertheless.I would definitely go again next time I am in London if I had the company.

Can't recommend highly enough!. This was a fantastic experience, we had so much fun. The staff are super friendly and enthusiastic and the hidden clue room has been created with so much detail. If you are looking for something a bit different and a fun way to spend an afternoon then I would definitely suggest you give this experience a go!
Everyone should try this! Amazing!. Fantastic experience can't wait to go back for the second game, Operation Blacksheep!We were a group of 3

New venue, new game, same amazing experience. Went back to play the second game (Operation Blacksheep) in their new venue near Liverpool Street. Same amazing experience as last time - in fact, slightly better. I've now done both Hint Hunt and Clue Quest, and while the former is very good, Clue Quest wins. It's got better puzzles, that don't feel shoehorned in, and the range from low to high tech is brilliant. Highly recommended

an outstanding palace. this was the frist time i visit to this restaurant so it was a bit hard to find. Otherwise staff is very friendly and welcoming. we enjoyed it so much with full energy. Highly recommend

Great fun. I took a team of 12 on a company team building day to London and we found ClueQuest to be absolutely brilliant. Very helpful staff, clues were given only when needed and the whole experience was excellent and I will be recommending the experience to everyone. Thanks. :)

Something different - great family fun. You need to try it!. Brilliant! - went with my husband and two sons - age 13 and 11 and we all really enjoyed it. Great family fun and we all needed to work together to solve the clues. Something for everybody though as sometimes the adults solved the clues and sometimes the kids showed us how to do it! Was so nice to do something as a family that the kids enjoyed as well and not a console in sight!!!!Very slight downside is the cost - was a bit expensive but saying that it's something different that you don't do every day. We brought it for my son's birthday and he said that it was one of the best birthday presents ever! My other son wants to do the other room for his birthday later in the year.There definitely needs to be more things like this. We had a great time and managed to escape! Would definitely recommend it - can't wait to do the other room

outstanding. This was our second visit to ClueQuest and we loved it. Staff are welcoming and helpful. Took three teenage girls and they can't wait to go back again. Thanks ClueQuest for a great evening.

Just book it - you will never have the chance again!. So much fun and not something I have seen anywhere else. Johnny was our guide - he was excellent and extremely forgiving when we called to say we were 10, then 20 minutes behind. Of all the activities we did in London, this was my absolute favorite. Email communication with them was extremely easy - they helped me with some booking trouble, as well as provided several helpful emails with very specific directions etc. A must!

Fun night!. We had a really fun night at ClueQuest. It's definitely something different you don't do every day. Big thanks to Max who was very patient with us, as some of us were not completely sober during the experience.
Good fun for an hour, but shame about the location. Very difficult to find, even for 4 people who live in London. However we enjoyed the experience when there, and will be back to try the black room!
Cluequest. Did this with my girls aged 12 & 14. We all thought it was brilliant fun and will definitely be doing the other room. Just do it!

team night out at ClueQuest. We did the plan52 escape for our quarterly team night out. there were 10 of us in total so booked 2 rooms. I can honestly say it was one of the best team nights out weve had! it made us think while also keeping our adrenalin pumping as we tried to beat the time! one team managed to make it out whilst the other did not :-(. That being said we will certainly be back to take on the black sheep! watch this space!!

Superb!! An exciting and clever attraction!. We did the plan52 escape game - it was not what I was expecting at all but sooo fun! Really good for any type of group - those who know each other well or those who want an 'icebreaker' or team building activity. Extremely clever set up and really exciting - especially if you manage to escape the room (we did with none second to spare!)!! You dont need to be clever, all you need is common sense and some enthusiasm! Great game for all :-) cant wait to do operation black sheep!

Most stressful entertainment; best fun in years. Truly Awesome.. We arrived at the nondescript building, only to be greeted by Ben, our host, who ushered us into a quaint little living room set up. We were offered water and lazed into our rocking chairs for our Top Secret briefing. The staff here seem to love their jobs. Genuinely. They're helpful, friendly, interact enthusiastically and appear to be really nice guys. We went for my cousin's 26th birthday and other groups appeared to be everything from families with 10year olds, to couples. The website recommends groups of 3 minimum and I agree that fewer than 3 might have been too hard. The team work comes really naturally once you're in there, and basic life skills appear all you need, but unless you're an innately curious person, this might prove too much, as the room ends up looking as though it's been ransacked by a Jumanji stampede. After an hour of piecing together clues (if you're really stuck, the game master comes to your aid with little hints and cryptic messages) you feel exhausted both mentally and physically. Thank goodness its but a stone's throw from Brick Lane yumminess! I've not had such awesome amusing fun in years. Honestly. The three of us were out of breath at the end and had drunk all of the water we'd taken in with us. Strongly recommend taking a bottle! I guarantee I will be back to do Operation Black Sheep soon. Nice touch: as it was cousin's bday, they gave him a little keepsake pressie. Nothing special, but who gives things away free anymore?

Lots of fun. Was a bit hard to find- we joked that the first quest was to find the way!But once we got there- as a family of 4, all adults- we had a great time, and i regretted not booking both missions... Will come back for the second one one day!
So much fun. Did this for part of a hendo and was such a great laugh, really gets your adrenaline going. Would most definitely reccommend to any party size.
So fun!. A way to get the kids having fun and stimulating brain cells without dragging them through another stuffy museum.

Not the best thing to do with your time in London. We enjoyed ourselves but there are far more interesting things to do in LondonThe location is in a 'fast developing/still pretty seedy' area north of Liverpool street station. An area worth visiting for food,nightlife. The reception area is crummy and the introduction by the Hungarian host quite mumbled and unclear.Once in the rooms it is fun working individually and as a family group to solve the puzzles. You are being given clues to keep you going so that you will probably solve the puzzles 'just in time'

Great experience!. We have tried similar attractions before and this was at least as much fun! We managed to get out with a few minutes to spare and not many clues. Will definitely be back to try out the other challenge! Definitely an experience that should be top of your 'things to do in London' list. (N.B. We are a family of 5 adults not teens....)

5 star - no doubt. Seriously one of the best things to do in London! Exciting, fun, makes you think, makes you move, makes you laugh. Do not hesitate just go on their website and book a slot.You work your way through it yourself but when you're stuck (and you will be) they will help you so don't panic.If you have ever played one of these exit room games on your iPhone, you have an idea what it's about. If you haven't, imagine being locked in a room with puzzles, drawers with keys and more puzzles, padlocks, keys etc. You solve a puzzle, you have a code, you open a padlock, you have a key etcetc and you have 60min to get out of the room. But you need no special skills, you need your common sense and your team. Brilliantly made, very nice and helpful staff, good location (close to tube station).

Loads of fun for all!. Such a fun alternative activity for central London. I went with my husband, brother, sister in law and nephew and even though we are all different ages we all came out raving and buzzing from the game. We can't wait to do the other room!

Brilliant game, lots of fun for groups. I booked ClueQuest for my sisters Hen party having heard about it from colleagues were planning on taking clients. I'm not allowed to give anything away regarding the game itself, but it was brilliant fun and not like anything I have experienced before. My only negative comment is that the reception area and briefing area before the game was a bit shabby and considering the 'backstory' you are given before you enter the game, it would have been more suitable if it was a smarter setting.Besides that, I recommend it to everyone. at something like £20 a head its a brilliant group activity and a stones throw from locals bars where you can go after to completely dissect your experience with your peers.

Insanely epic!. We saved the world with 2 seconds to spare. Can't beat that. This is really a must do for anyone visiting London. No matter what age or skill or ability. Staff were very helpful and fun. The game was challenging and well run although there was one technical hitch it was easily sorted out as the staff were very on top of things. The only downside is the location is in a bit of a seedy little alley.

A great alternative family activity for your jaded teenagers. This is a great, alternative family activity that will get the teenagers in your life engaged and excited without the need for a screen.Solutions to the puzzles are multi-layered, requiring some nimble lateral thinking and teamwork. It's obvious a lot of thought has gone into the set up of each puzzle.Thoroughly recommend it and wonder when they'll branch out internationally and open a ClueQuest in Melbourne.

Top Secret Spy Stuff. A week in London and this was definitely one of the highlights! What a fantastic time we had. Two man team is still worth the effort and with a little help from mission control we made it out. London is safe for another hour!These rooms will soon be popping up all over and when Q comes to Orlando we will be back on another mission. I can't wait.CrAcKle. ...CrAcKle. ...Maverick Out....CrAcKle

Lots of fun for the family. My wife signed us up prior to leaving for London. We had a great time, even though we sacrificed our lives to save the world!Part of the fun was just trying to find the place.

Creative, Challenging, Fun!. We only had one day to spend in London because of a connecting flight the next day. Looked online to see what might be a fun thing to do with our family (3 teenagers). So glad we found CLUEQUEST !!
We thoroughly enjoyed it. It was very challenging and creatively put together. We would highly recommend it to others!

Brilliant experience. Highly recommended.. Really great idea, excellent experience. Did this today, staff really friendly and helpful. My family enjoyed our time together. We bonded and worked as a team to solve it. Definitely book up to do the other quest.

Great fun for everyone!. I booked this activity after reading all reviews on Tripadvisor and they are all true! We had a great time the whole family and my boys (8 and 11) loved it. I hope I have the opportunity to go back to London soon again and I will for sure book ClueQuest again. At first you don't understand anything and you even thing you have ended up at the wrong place, but you haven't and your understanding gets better...

A real challenge. Something different to do on vacation. Well run but does create some heated debates among family members as it is truly a challenge to complete, which, alas, we did not complete in the time allotted.

Very clever and fun!. We tried not to read about what goes on inside the room so we were surprised and able to solve the mission on our own. The area where HQ is located is up and coming so it added to the charm of the experience. I would recommend doing this in a group, more fun! Don't want to say much except that you must try this!!

Awesome !!! Really good fun and everyone in the family enjoyed it. Five of us went - youngest was 13 - and everyone really enjoyed it. I won't say too much about what happens but you get put into a room with things on the wall and various objects and you have to solve things and find more objects that open locks and reveal more stuff and then eventually escape. It took us just over an hour to complete and we got stuck at various points, but there is someone watching via a camera who sends clues on a radio or a TV screen that help so you're never totally floundering.The family want to go back and solve the other puzzle which we might do later in the year (there are two - we did black sheep),The only downside if there is one is that the location was a bit hard to find

Absolutely unique experience! . My friend & I took our 2 teenagers as was so highly recommended whilst visiting london and we weren't dissapointed- it truly was a unique super fun experience for all of us - we completed our mission too which topped the day off lol great times we will return for another challenge!

Fantastic fun. If you grew up loving the crystal maze or secretly thinking you would make a really good spy then this is for you. Six of us took on the challenge and escaped with 8 minutes to spare. Loved every second and can't wait to go back and do the other one. As with other reviews don't judge a book by its cover, the building is not up to much but the game is fab...good luck agents!!

fantastic experience. Really great fun, something totally different as a visitor experience. The first 5 minutes were tense as we all rushed around like headless chickens until we got into the swing of it, and then it was an hour of excitement! Really pleased we completed the task, can't wait to do the second room. Provided you have a few brain cells then you'll love it!

Clue Quest London. Sherlock would have been proud, while Moriarty confounded! My Daughter discovered Clue Quest on Tripadvisor, her one special request was that we partake in this attraction on our London vacation. What a fantastic fun filled family bonding experience. Literally every family member contributed greatly to unwind our mystery. Locks, clues, codes, mystery, laughter and fun,fun,fun. Afterward, Mr Q's top agent admitted to us that our family ranked at the uppermost level in unwinding our mystery, this was achieved by solving the mystery quickly with the least assistance needed. To that, we simply stated..... "Elementary my dear Mr.Q".

Excellent family activity. This turned out to be a really worthwhile experience for the whole family. Our two boys (11 and 13) threw themselves into the challenge and probably outshone the adults with their logical thinking. The Black Sheep challenge has been planned meticulously - we were really, really impressed with the effort that has gone into making it. Thank you for the experience!

ClueQuest = Highly Recommended!. Definitely a must try in London! Went during August 2014 with a team of 4 and it was purely amazing & exhilarating! I honestly think that it would be rare to find someone regretting for participating in ClueQuest.
Brilliant Fun. most highly recommended. breathe slowly, think calmly, deduce logically, and you will have unbelievable thrill playing this game.

Fantastic Family Fun!. This was a unique activity that was equally fun for the kids (ages 12 & 15) and adults. Basically, you have to work together to solve various clues and logic "puzzles." It was very challenging, but the staff give you hints when needed. We had a great sense of accomplishment when we solved it with less than 2 minutes to go. Of all the things we did in 8 days of fantastic London sightseeing, the kids probably would select this as their activity.

Absolute fun!. First time we did an activity like this and it was unlike anything we've ever experienced! We had a team of 4 and were taken into another world searching for all the clues to get through to the end. We managed to finish it with about 15 seconds to spare but tired at the end of it! Highly recommended! Heaps of fun!

This was great fun - go and do it. Came to Cluequest as surprise for 23 and 20 year old 'kids' on day out in London who were totally unimpressed when we walked in the door.Once the game started they thought it was fantastic and really got into the spirit of the game; the hour whizzed by and we were kept guessing all the way. We will come and do the next game when we come to London again.It was grgat

Fantastic Family Fun. We are a family of four age range 10 - 47. We all enjoyed playing Clue Quest, the youngest enjoyed searching for clues and the oldest put the grey matter to work. We couldn't believe how fast the hour went. We just made it out of the room with minutes to spare. It is a little difficult to find (especially as they had closed the road when we visited) so give yourself plenty of time to get from the tube to Clue Quest.Thank you for a great hour of fun from the Earnshaws
Great fun. We all had great fun as a family, from the youngest to the oldest! Can't wait to come back and try the other room.

Raven's escaped...just. I can't remember how exactly I came across ClueQuest one day, but after reading about it it reminded me of the Crystal Maze and my childhood. Wishing to be part of a team on the show instead of shouting at a TV screen. And at last here it was the chance to do just that. I wrangled a few girls from work to come along, and although our journey there was a lengthy one due to road closures and a confused bus driver we managed to find the building after a long walk. The building is tucked to one side and a nightclub was in full swing when we turned up for our game at 8pm. We were led into the waiting area, and after a while we were explained what type of things were to happen to us within the hour. Our excitement turned to nerves as we walked to our "room" and awaited the clock to start.Not spoiling anything, we started off thinking we would not have a clue what to do, but after the first reveal, everything started rolling at great speed. It was a great way to work as a team outside of work, and pulling together as we did (As well as a lot of frustrated moments) we managed to escape with 5 seconds left, even though we had an incident with the door to leave.It was an amazing hour bring us all together as we defeated the Blacksheep. Will be back for Plan52 and hopefully more game rooms to come.Thank you ClueQuest from the RavenGirls
Superb. I would highly recommend Clue Quest. It is frustratingly good and definately one of the best things to do on a visit to London
Hen Do. Unbelievably brilliant, going again soon!!! The staff were so friendly and made it so exciting we genuinely thought we'd get recruited to MI5

Brilliant Fun. Operation Black Sheep - my fourth room escape and best so far. Loved the mission and the rooms. Can't say too much without spoiling it. What I will say though is , hurry up Mr Q I can't wait to go on my next mission.
got out with 26 seconds to spare. Brilliant experience. Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it wasnt quite as good / well though out as a similar experience in london called HintHunt

Great activity for a group of people. We did this activity for my sisters hen do. We were all late 20's in age and the people didn't all know each other (plus we had some pregnant people) so wanted an activity based thing to do. When I first arrived I was worried as did not look that good a venue but once we started it was amazing. We were in two groups of 6 and that was good. We did plan 52 and got out, really well done activity and different to other things in London, I would recommend to others!

Superb hen-do activity!. This was recommended to me by a friend. We had two teams of 6 (consisting of very smart, late-20s women) to celebrate a hen-do. The building is quite nondescript which was ideal, as it was a complete surprise to the hen when we got there and pressed the buzzer for entry. We did the Black Sheep challenge and found it really enjoyable, and great for helping people get to know each other. Teams of 6 were slightly over the recommended size but worked well for this challenge. The guys working that day were really helpful and enthusiastic - thanks!

Absolutely Genius - Great fun!. I would highly recommend this experience to any one who enjoys a mind boggling challenge. It definitely tests your cognitive skills! A lot of fun to do with your family, friends or work colleagues. You find yourself shouting at each other like you're trapped in a real situation. The staff are professional and know what to do to ensure that you have a fantastic experience. Thanks.

Great way to start a London Trip with Teenagers. Teenagers can be a challenge. I was looking for a way to bring my 10 year old and 15 year old onto the same page as we started an almost 3 week trip through Europe. The game is not easy and the transparencies on the maps did not line up but the staff is very young and friendly and they keep trying to help you. They watch you and send silly clues over an intercom to keep you going. Before long everyone was laughing and running around searching through drawers and under desks for clues. My 10 year old had fun finding the clues and my 15 year old was able to put them together. We had a great time together as a family and would definitely do it again.

One of the most fun trips ever!. Was even more fun than expected with lots of variety with the clues and challenges set. We were all buzzing and talking about it days later. Great fun would recommend to anyone with older children or groups of friends.the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Too expensive for what you get. I was really excited about ClueQuest after reading all the positive reviews, but perhaps that's why my expectations were too high. It is definitely good for someone who likes puzzles, but I wished we weren't given as many hints, but left to struggle for longer, even if it meant we would not be out in time (we did get out in time with the help of hints). I think figuring things out entirely on our own would have been even more rewarding.Overall, my team agreed that this was too expensive for what it was - just a room with locks (one of which was actually broken in our room). I do want to do it again just cause I am a puzzle addict, but it's not gonna happen anytime soon with a student budget.

Absolutely brilliant!. I booked this for something to do with my family on my birthday and I was not disappointed! We had a brilliant time from start to finish. It was engaging, fun and got our pulses racing to ensure we got out within the 60 minutes. The clues and puzzles were well thought out and at the right level of difficulty. Overall we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to all families or groups looking for something different to do! Would suggest to anyone going, to get to it via the spitalfields side as we had a nightmare trying to get there the other way!

The joy.... The joy when we got out of operation black sheep was amazing! We cut it close and escaped with 1.40 to spare! The whole experience was fantastic from the greeting to the game maker.A real challenge and you will need to work as a team to escape! We will 100% be back. Who knew an hour could go so fast!

Awesome !. I've never known an hour pass so quickly. This was enormous fun and if you are a group/ family of 3-5 I can't recommend it enough. The staff were friendly and smiling and the whole concept is outstanding. Just don't be put off by the rather less than glamorous street in which the place is set. Money VERY well spent on this trip to London. We will go again next time.JW

You won't be disappointed!. Brilliant! Five of my family went as a birthday treat from my sister (not sure how she'll be able to top this present). Now firstly, don't be put off by the outwardly appearance of the building. We were greeted by a friendly member of Mr Q's staff and given our mission briefing. Then escorted to our mission, which we would then have to escape within an hour. I can't explain the mind boggling awesomeness that was to follow. I suggest going in a group of 3 or more, because if you hit a mental wall it's better to have more people to bounce ideas around. We all got fully involved and loved every minute of it. The only minor downside is the mission felt quite short. But that was party due to our mental prowess as we escaped with 14 minutes to spare. The whole experience was ingenious and we'd all happily go again. I will Definitely recommend to family and friends. I recommend Everyone should give it a go. 5 STARS all round!!"The Endor Forestry Committee - 23/8/14"

Great experience!. We did the experience which was not easy, yet lots of fun. The staff was great, very helpfull. The location only added to the mystery. We will come back for more, heard there are more escape choices.

Interesting and fun way to spend an afternoon!. Came here with 3 friends not really knowing what to expect. From the moment we entered, Vanessa was friendly and made the game exciting for us. Can't say too much without giving the game away but it was a fantastic activity to do, not easy but just hard enough to test you. Great team building activity!We escaped... 2.14 minutes left. Fab venue, very well thought out and helpful staff... Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to people to do.

Loved it. I would definitely recommend cluequest. Getting to the location was a little tricky but that seemed to add to the entire experience. We were surprised the whole way through it but all of us (myself and 2 preteens) had a blast. Well done!

Fun, unique team activity. Did this activity with my Husband and 2 Sons, ages 17 & 20. They were a bit sceptical to start but ended up really enjoying it! It was quite tricky but it was a thrill to successfully escape. My 17 yr old can't wait to do another activity but it was quite expensive. My only advice would be to give yourself plenty of time to get there as the location is hard to find. We also got delayed with a subway strike & a road closed to foot traffic.

Yet another 5 star rating!. For some inexplicable reason, a couple of negative reviews have cropped up. But don't listen to the naysayers. The overwhelming number of "excellent" ratings is fully justified.ClueQuest is a fun, challenging way to spend an hour or so. But don't worry if you start to struggle with the clues because instead of watching as you stand around frustrated, they offer you a number of helpful hints so that you can progress. The experience is completely geared towards your enjoyment so winning or losing doesn't really matter. Mission complete as far as I'm concerned because we had a whale of a time.A lot of love and care has clearly gone into ClueQuest: from the small touches that personalise the experience, to the framed photos around the reception, including the brothers who started the whole thing. It's a family business that has grown rapidly since moving to Liverpool Street, mainly through Trip Advisor and word of mouth, which further proves its merits as a worthwhile London experience. Believe the hype!I cannot wait to see what they have in store for us next.P.S. The Romanian (not French) lady who hosted the experience for us was lovely which only made us love ClueQuest more!

15 seconds to spare!. Excellent family fun for all. We all enjoyed our quest working together to solve the tricky clues and passwords. A last minute scramble allowed us to get out with 15 seconds to spare. There is help via your walkie talkie if you do get stuck so don't worry that you'll be left awaiting inspiration for an hour. There are two diffrent quests, so we will definately return and try the other one. Highly recommend for those who don't take things too seriously and want to spend a fun hour with family or friends.

Wonderful invention. I was there with my kids 5,9,12. I must to say that the two little kids didn't like the game ( maybe because they aren't speaking english). The 12 y.o. child & myself very enjoy from the game.Wonderful way to spent a hour.

Superb. Took the family for their first ClueQuest experience. They loved it. Only criticism, it was too short. I had been before, different room, different company and seriously enjoyed doing it for a second time. Try it for it is such a good game for young and old.
Great fun. Went with my work team. Was a bit dubious beforehand but everyone loved it and wants to go back again. A fun couple of hours.

Absolutely Amazing!. I wasn't sure what to expect but I'm most certainly glad I did this.It is a very short walk from Liverpool Street Station, although we initially walked past it as we were looking for a sign but when we looked for the building number we immediately found it. When we entered we were slightly sceptical as it just seemed like a dark office area but once the briefing and escape began everything was fine.The staff were very enthusiastic and friendly, with our group's staff member joking around with the group's communicator whilst we were in the room. The room was a lot different than we all had expected and the puzzles were a lot more interactive than we had previously thought. Each puzzle in the room was unique and had their own challenges but we still managed to escape with five minutes to spare :D!It was much better than we had initially expected. The only downside was that we weren't allowed to use our superpowers! I would most definitely return to try the other room.

So much fun!. Like many other posts, I certainly do not want to give anything away, but it was such a good time. A little tricky to find the location and it does not look like much from the outside, but super clever riddles, etc. went with my husband, 12 yr old daughter and 9 yr old son.. Everyone participated and loved it!

Perfect for family with teenager(s). We visited with two adults and a 14 year old and had a fantastic time. We were nervous about whether we'd complete the quest as a group of 3, but after deciding who would take the lead, who'd be on comms and who on clipboard for recording clues, we became thoroughly engrossed and absorbed. The hour flew by - fortunately we escaped with just over 5 minutes to spare! - and we'll definitely be returning at a later date to try another room. Very highly recommended for family groups. Loved the souvenir photo afterwards :)

Good laugh. Really well organsied, the team that greeted and breifed us were great- the actual quest itself was really challenging and fun. Our team was a good mixture of logical brains and out-of-the-box thinkers so we worked really well- escaped with 12mins to spare... the dude was quite impressed with us- will def recommend to friends!

AMAZING fun. We went to ClueQuest on a saturday girls night out. We had a blast and we can't wait to go again - to the next level challenge. I don't want to write too much here to avoid spoiling the surprises to whoever goes. All I can say it is tons of fun. And try to take your smarter and most proactive friends with you - teamwork is mandatory to be successful.
Awesome fun!. I don't want to give anything away so I won't say anything about it. Just trust me that this is a great fun and original activity to do with a group of friends! 5/5!

Fun-Tasking. Booked ClueQuest for three teenage boys and two adults on a recent trip to London.All five of us had a great time tasks and clues trying and difficult at times as they should be making us work as a team and pull together.Great experience and great fun for adults and teenagers alike. Highly recommend it
Fabulous. My friends and I had an amazing time at ClueQuest. We now call ourselves Team Awesome having annihilated the room with 15 minutes on the clock left. We will be coming back!

Adrenaline. A great hour (plus a little extra) spent! It brought our family of three together as a team, and we worked together very well. We soon discovered our strengths and weaknesses, and each little success was gratifying. We would definitely go back for the second puzzle and look forward to more activities like this. Go Q!

brilliant!. Booked this for four children aged 13-14! I didnt go in with them because I wanted them to think for themselves and not have to take the easy way out and ask for my help. They were just amazing and absolutely loved it. They didnt finish on time but got very close to the end before the host went in to help them. Our host Andrew was absolutely brilliant. From the very outset he connected with the children and made them feel totally at ease! Thank you so much Andrew and Cluequest for a truly memorable experience.

Amazing puzzle experience. Went on for one hour plus fun puzzle as a birthday gift. More challenging then expected, definitely extremely well build and full of unexpected challenges. Please allocate a bit of time to the journey as the building itself is a bit 'hidden'.

Granddaughters birthday. Brilliant!! So very easy to book, the most helpful, enthusiastic people who work there and the most exciting present for my Granddaughter. She and her friends loved it! Very highly recommended.

Great fun!. I visited ClueQuest with my husband and 2 teenage sons. It was great fun working as a team and how we managed to solve all the clues I'll never know. Think I'd still be in there if it had just been up to me!!! It was a very unique experience but thoroughly enjoyable. Ben the agent recruiter was great at setting the scene right from the get go. Go try it!!!

a little more introduction/instruction. I would love a do over, this was more complicated than we expected. If you go be sure to write every thing down that you find and where you found it I wish the hostess had told and explained the importance of doing this . Next time we will do better. Be sure to find out the exact location it is really hard to find in a narrow back street. Over all it was a fun out of the box activity and well run.

Excellent - can't wait to experience more. It was an excellent group experience, although our group did not complete within the hour, I just wanted to go again - Would suggest you give it a try especially if you love solving puzzles and want to save the world - Awesome!!!!

Something different!. Clue Quest was fun and a kind of mind-bender. Don't go in thinking that you will definitely get the solution easily! It was our first experience. It was a lot more complicated than we thought, but we enjoyed the hour we spent there. Our hostess came in when the time had expired and explained the stuff we hadn't figured out. I can see how it would get more fun and easier (in a way) if you had done it before, so give it a go to get acquainted with the concept and have some fun thinking outside the box! It was different from the other things we did in London (and definitely not in a touristy neighborhood!) I would like to do it again, trying to solve a different room.
Excellent. very entertaining, You do not understand how time passes, to reveal something together is very enjoyable especially for families
Fabulous Fun. Went with a friend and our 2 teenage sons. Can't recommend it highly enough. Lots of fun and so nice to do something different. Book now!

Exceeded my expectations!!. If you are an uber nerd like me and love games such as : Myst, the 7th Guest, Phantasmagoria, The Room, you will love this venue.I strongly recommend ClueQuest, we had SO much fun. We are already planning on going back and doing the other room.We did Operation Black Sheep, it was really well done! Still thinking about it days later. You will not be disappointed.

Absolutely Excellent!. Go. Go now. Then once you've completed one mission, go again and do the other. We went as a team of three friends and had an absolutely brilliant experience, SO much fun! Will definitely be going again if they create a new mission.

Awesome fun!!. Visited here as a group of 4. An amazing experience from start to end - such a fun time solving all the clues, working as a team and having infinite amounts of fun throughout. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Note that you will be raving about this for hours afterwards!!

Could not recommend Cluequest highly enough!. Such a great evening, still cannot believe how much fun it was! Pleased to say that we defeated Professor Blacksheep, and we can't wait to try another challenge from Cluequest!I booked for myself and 3 friends after noticing it was the number 1 attraction in London on Trip Advisor. I really didn't have a clue what we were getting ourselves in for, and was worried I'd made a mistake when we arrived! However, it was such a great experience, and so different to anything else out there that I've ever heard of. Totally worth the money, we loved it!

Fantastic. I went with 3 friends and had a brilliant time. Everyone was really friendly and put the effort in the make the whole experience unique. The actual clues and challenges were at a perfect level for us as well. Would definitely recommend.

Family of Four with Teenagers. What a great experience. We had a 10pm appointment and I am glad I scouted out the location before our appointment as the building is a bit hard to find. We had a great time. Highly recommended for any kind of team building exercise. Great family activity. Teenagers were skeptical when Dad booked, but loved it. We were travelling to London from US and this was a great, fun, out of the ordinary activity!!

Brilliant!!. I wanted to thank Mr Q and his team for the 90 minutes of "fun" we had on Friday. All of our 15 participants (3 teams of 5) enjoyed it immensely with at least 8 wanting to back to try the other room.Our claustrophobic member was so engrossed within the first few minutes that she was soon completely at ease in the room.This is a brilliant, clever and fun experience. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Beyond Amazing!. Without a doubt this was the most exciting and entertaining thing we did during our time in London (and that includes London Eye, Phantom of the Opera and going on a day trip to Windsor Castle and Stonehenge [even though those were all amazing]). Hands down the most fun we had, it is very obvious as to why they are rated #1 attraction. As soon as we finished we wanted to go back through and do it again. If you go to London without doing Clue Quest you have missed out on an amazing time.
Really fun. I went with 3 friends and we had a really good time, I would definitely recommend it to people and will go back at some point to play a different room!

So much fun. Went along with some friends in June, wasn't entirely sure what to expect. We had so much fun, it's a real challenge, and we failed with about two steps to go, disappointed, but we will return, you haven't got the best of us yet Mr Q! Highly recommend!

Excellent fun. Four of us went to celebrate my birthday. We had a great time, the staff made us very welcome, and added to the experience. You need to work as a team, it's quite challenging at times, and you find yourselves caught up in the need to beat the clock. We did it with 2.14 left, and the sense of achievement was amazing.CAN YOU DO IT???
Lots to enjoy for all ages. We arrived at the tucked away alley, and had a great time solving the (not always easy) puzzles! Worth a visit! :)

Terrific "Adult" Family Activity. My young adult daughters and I participated together (group of 3) - had an absolutely terrific time solving the puzzles, laughing and working together. Very proud to report we escaped with one second left! A memorable experience that left us all wanting to try the next game. It's a very unique activity. Loved the fact different group members shone at different times - it was terrific.

Really great fun. We visited here - family of 5 - ages of children ranging from 12 to 20. Really great fun. Even "too cool' teenagers got really engaged, got their competitive juices flowing when they were up against the clock. Staff were really nice, and gave small clues when things were getting tense. Thoroughly enjoyed it and would recommend it to anyone!
Amazing. Our team of four, two 13 year old boys my wife and I had a great timeI was pure chaos at times but we saved the world with 20s to spareLooking forward to going again to do B52

Must experience!. Went with my hubby and brother in laws and was a fantastic part of the evening and couldn't stop talking about the experience afterwards.Definitely will be going again, its a fantastic family day out and also would be a great work team building experience.
genius event. Loved it. Visited with sister, niece and hubby and had a great time. Something for all of us to get involved in and a great team building opportunity for companies to do too.

Must, just don't skip it. Visited with 3 old teenagers. They just loved it, they were all the time 100% in focus and found the challenges truly nice. Don't expect to solve everything but the coacher helps you an even offered us an extension of time. The whole experience is very well organized. The activity is expensive but worth the money.
Amazing day out with friends. This is one of the most random yet entertaining things I've ever experienced. Don't want to give anything away but it's a must for a date, friends or family day out.
AMAZING. what a fun way to spend ur trip. It was definitely one of the highlights of mine. Was soooo much fun. Couldnt reccommend it highly enough!!

Outstanding. Visited with 2 teenage children, myself and my parents and we had an outstanding experience!!!. From the moment we arrived to the second we left we were challenged and stimulated. Everyone had a thoroughly enjoyable time and everyone participated with each of us being good at different things : really made us work together!!

Very good, very clever. My boyfriend his 11 year old son and myself visited last week, we did operation black sheep, we really enjoyed this as it was something very different, good fun, very clever, unfortunately we failed our task, we'll be back!!! If I can give you any tips at all, from the moment you step in the room take note of every bit of info as it all adds up in the end, brilliant hour, good luck guys!!!
This was so much fun!. The energies and excitement just kept on flowing all hour long. It was challenging, yet achievable through team work and cooperation.Keep up the great work :)

Amazing fun. 1 hour very well spent! We went as a group of 8 people (in our late 20s and early 30s) and loved it. Booked two rooms, far in advance, so that we could compete (4 vs 4). Can't tell you much more, but it's lots of fun! Not scary, just exciting

Real fun!. We had really great time with our family. Our 13 year old boys were so thrilled, that they said, it was best experience during our London trip! Our 5 year old daughter was with us and she was also amused and helping us to escape. So, we will be back :) Thank you! Highly recommended!

One hour goes really fast!. Took on the Blacksheep operation with my adult siblings and a 14 year old. We started off really well then the number of puzzles came thick and fast... Lots of variety of puzzles and clue solving which made it even more interesting but proved our teamwork was pretty awful! Really good fun! We didn't manage to save the World in time but came close! Really good that the staff let us go through any remaining puzzles so we know what we had left. Would be great if you could have a slightly longer time if you had kids so you could involve them with each clue. Would definitely do it again but maybe without my sister...

Great Fun For Everyone. What a great time, we didn't have a clue what we were walking into. We were greeted by the ClueQuest team who were very good and explained everything very clearly, and made the visit. The tasks were great fun, and included a lot of puzzles/ searching. Suitable for anyone who wants a challenge. highly recommended!
Visit to cluequest. Excellent game, challenging and well tested, friendly staff, would go again! Highly recommended for anyone up for an hour of puzzle solving and teamwork!

A Fun Day Out. An excellent & fun way to test your logic, problem solving & communication for friends, family or just general team building. We did Operation blacksheep & it's great value for money.Will definitely be going again

Great experience. ClueQuest was even better than expected!We were in one of the Plan 52 rooms and managed to escape with three minutes to spare. The puzzles were challenging but achievable and the whole thing was pretty mysterious, which added to the fun. The staff were really friendly and the whole thing was great value for money - highly recommend.
So fun!. We had an absolute blast! Unique experience! Great for competitive families. Really made us think. We got bonus time and then made it out!

Totally awesome!!. Best fun ever had within 60 mins! Loved the whole experience, well thought out and put together puzzles, challenging and fun! Great value for money and staff were great too, made us feel very at home... all in all a great day out!! Highly recomend and can't wait to go back for black sheep!!
Had a great time, surpassed all expectations.. Really enjoyed myself at cluequest. Really well made puzzles and we'll be back for some Operation Black Sheep!

Awesome!!!!!. Didn't really want to go but girlfriend wanted to.......really glad i went as it was brilliant, very well fought out and the actors played there part exceptionally well!! Worth every penny!!
Great fun. We had a team of 4. The guy who helped us was really good fun. We had so much fun and we managed to escape! Would defiantly recommend this as an activity to do!

Must do for mystery minded families. Great and unusual time with ClueQuest. Prepare for a rigorous, intense and enjoyable hour bonding with family or work members. We did with 10, 12 year old girls and it was a blast. Recommend not doing day of arrival in London if visiting from abroad as requires fully alert brains! Also, location can be hard to find...make sure to double check. Andrew was an outstanding guide!

Perfect. It is perfect. The pacing, the difficulty the surprises. We needed an extra 4 minutes but we knew where we made mistakes and could have done it in the time. But even so we had the most fun ever.

We Will Return. the four of us went last week (mum, dad, 15yr old and 11 yr old), the place was in a slightly odd location, but it didnt matter once you were in. Daughter wasnt too sure when we got there, but after 5 mins in the room she really threw herself into it. You have communication with the team out of the the room and you get the odd clue if your looking stuck. there is also a emergency key should you really need to get out for the loo or something. We completed the challenge and hope to come back later in the year to try black sheep.

31 second TRIUMPH!. What an amazing hour! Everything about it from arrival to departure was slick and well organised. A team of four of us, 2 adults and 2 teens was a perfect combination. It is very challenging but such fabulous fun. The hour passes really quickly and you have 2 way radios so the cluequest team can help you if they see you are struggling. Don't worry if you are claustrophobic, you can keep the entry door unlocked so that you can simply walk out at anytime if you want to.We are definitely booking to go back soon. This was one of the best things we have ever done as a family! Really rewarding and we haven't stopped talking about it and telling our friends. If you are not sure whether to try it or not - we'd say a definite YES!

Fantastic afternoon team building event...really recommended. You've got to think 535 people cant love this THAT much? Well - out of the 10 of us in two teams....EVERYONE there said it was really really good fun, got us all working together and the 'mission control' teams knew just when to prompt and when to leave us alone. Couldn't recommend highly enough as a business event for smaller teams. Would be equally good as a family or friends group.Top marks ClueQuest... hope that the new missions that are being added are just as good as the one we did, and we get a chance to come back and have another go.Would like'd to have had drinks available, but water was there, and you can always take your own...Really fun. Do it.

Amazing Experience. We recently had an employee appreciation night out and booked two rooms at ClueQuest after seeing it was rated #1 on Trip Advisor. We had to compete in two teams to escape the room the quickest. Our team escaped with 28 seconds to spare. It was absolutely brilliant! The staff were helpful, friendly and very organised. I highly recommend this for team building or just a fun night out with friends. Very reasonably priced and just one of the coolest things I've ever done.
AMAZING. Had the best time ever a Clue Quest! Very organised and staff are extremely friendly and helpful!! Such a fun experience - would definitely recommend!!

Canadians try Clue Quest!. Hi there! We had a great time doing Clue Quest while we were on vacation. We found the building a little hard to find but once we realized the warehouse was where we needed to be we were good. The storyline and the puzzles were awesome. We were a team of 3 and finished with a minute 30 left or so. Very fun! Recommend for sure!
Great fun. Must-do activity when in London, great fun, although we did not manage to escape in time. But we'll be back !

You cannot fail to enjoy this!. Fantastic concept, where team-work and problem-solving are put to the test in an extremely fun environment. You cannot help but get a buzz from the adrenalin. Made it out with 2 minutes and 39 seconds to spare and felt like we had conquered the world!

Exceptional and beyond . I visited with family and we had a 3 year old, 8 and 10 and haven't seen them engaged and excited about anything like Clue quest. We went there for fun and we ended up with way more. GO AND DISCOVER

Awesome time - You'll definitely want to do this!. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor we booked our reservation to check it out and we totally had a blast at ClueQuest. With the clock ticking and our strategy setup we went into the first room thinking "This is it?" We found out that there was much more than we expected and everyone had an awesome time contributing to solving the many puzzles to find the next clue and successfully complete our escape. We'll definitely be going back. The only negative is that the rooms were too warm and they need better AC. Be sure to book in advance as they are frequently booked several weeks out.

Very good but they need aircon!. I went with a few friends and it was a really good experience! I have done 2 now, one with family and another with friends and they both were excellent. Quite tricky but great fun and really well thought out!!! The staff were really good too i thought.The only problem was there was NO airconditioning. It was almost unbearable!!! Just a fan or something would be better than melting in a room for an hour. Also there were a few tenchincal difficulities the second time round but credit where credits due, the staff handled the sitution very well and we completed the challenge :) I would reccomend this to anyone! ...But bring your own fan!

Totally deserves its #1 trip advisor rating. I had been looking for activities for our teenagers while in London and saw this was #1 on trip advisor. I'd never heard of ClueQuest but booked some months ago as I could see it was very popular. The place was a little tricky to find and compared to America it has a low budget feel about it but this has to be one of the best activities we have done as a family. Our youngest child is 10 and oldest 17 and everyone was engaged and not too much conflict! It surpassed everyone's expectations and if not already booked we would be going back next week to complete the other room. Excellent activity.

Amazing day for work team building!. My team at work of 18 people split into three groups of 6 yesterday to complete ClueQuest's orginal Plan52 as well as Operation Black Sheep - we had SO much fun! Being in the team that completed OBS I am recommending to anybody who will listen to take part in this newest addition to the set up - there was tangible excitement, ooohinng and ahhing and a genuine sense of accomplishment as each task was overcome, code cracked and clue acquired! It's usually pretty hard to please 18 people on a staff away day, but "best away day ever" is the consensus! The staff were friendly and chatty, enthusiatic, organised, patient and helpful. I will definitely be going back with friends , and probably family when they come to visit! Just superb.

Fun and unusual hour. We've been in London this week-end and had booked in advance the only time-slot available (late evening) as we had seen the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. Our team-work was rather poor and at that time (22:20) we were not exactly fresh, but we had great fun and would definitely advise this further.

A great way to find out why you can't win the amazing race!. Staff at ClueQuest tried to make us feel like we were in an important mission as agents, which made my 12 and 11 year-old boys very excited before even starting the challenge. We had no idea what was to be done but it was fun to get through all of them at the end. We argued, we fought, we criticized each other as in any family but it was so much fun working together as a team to complete the mission! Now we know for sure the likelihood for us to win the amazing race is rather slim......

Great fun!. Did it yesterday with two 19 year olds and really enjoyed it. We knew what to expect as we'd already done Hint Hunt - this was just as much fun. The staff were really friendly and the waiting area makes it easier if you arrive a little early. Would highly recommend for anyone over the age of about 13.

almost too much fun. from the moment we entered we were enthralled. The set up was professional and our guide was hugely friendly and welcoming. I won't give anything away about the actual task but I can say it was amazing; extremely clever, well thought through and just awesome! Do it .

Absolutely Fantastic!. ClueQuest was an amazing experience and an absolute must do in London. Without revealing too much, the object is to get out of a series of three rooms by looking for clues and such. The staff is very helpful and you can request to leave the door unlocked if you are not comfortable with this. The staff provides additional hints to help you along the process. ClueQuest is fun and safe, it is something the whole family will enjoy. I went with teenagers, preteens, middle aged adults, and seniors and everyone had a marvelous time!

Fantastic Fun: Book in Advance if from Abroad. Based on its top rating on TripAdvisor we decided to try ClueQuest when visiting from Canada. We had not thought to book in advance and when we got to England we discovered only a single slot was available during our stay. We grabbed it and wow, it was a ton of fun. So my word of advice is once your plane tickets are booked, book this.We managed to complete the puzzle and "escape" with a small amount of help from our "control agent". He/She monitors you and helps nudge you along if you haven't made appropriate progress in appropriate time. We only needed a few nudges and it all worked out nicely as we finished with perhaps 2 minutes to spare. Everyone in the family contributed to solving the various puzzles and everyone had a good time. I could see this as a fun team building exercise or perhaps team crushing exercise if you fail to solve the problem. We've never seen an activity like this before, and for that novelty alone its worth it, but I was impressed with the overall quality of the "game". We'd have gone back to do their other game as well, but there was no availability.We got there by tube which was easy. It seemed a longer walk to Plough St than the google map indicated, but it was there and we did arrive with plenty of time.I wouldn't bring very young kids, but once they are preteens I think they'll do well enough at helping to solve the puzzles.and searching the room(s).When asked, our kids chose this as the most interesting thing they did/saw in London.

Intellectual games. Great way to spend a couple of hours - locked in a series of rooms trying to figure your way out. All the time knowing you have the information available somewhere. Great for families that are competitive or, as we did it, two work groups wanting a social event more than just boozing and eating - although we did the eating after with boasting about who did best at what. Great fun
