What a blast. We did not know what to expect but the reviews I read made me think it would be fun. It was more than fun, it was an experience we still talk about today as about the best part of our trip in Europe. We were very lucky that they had one opening available while we were in London. It helps to have teens that have played lots of video games, they're good at this kind of stuff. We'll do it again next time we're in London.

Awesome activity for a family. I booked this for a family with 23- and 25-year old sons. I thought it would be a fun activity for all of us, and it did not disappoint. It was challenging but not so difficult as to be impossible. A very enjoyable time. I highly recommend it! Andrew, our host, was delightful.

So Much to See and Do in London! 4 Days Are Not Enough!. Nothing lacking in London. Shopping, sight-seeing and food. Come weekend, the atmosphere is electrifying. However, it is just very crowded - from the shopping malls to the tube stations, people and more people everywhere.

Superb activity. I went with a stag do and we split into two groups. Both groups had excellent times, despite not everyone knowing each other. Most members of the group picked this as their favorite activity at the end of the day- they were still talking their brilliance (or not) solving the puzzles when very pissed on the last train home.

Absolutely (and a unexpectedly) Brilliant!. A brilliant way to spend 60 minutes. We had no idea what to expect and were a little unsure sitting in the reception area before we headed off for our "mission", "what the hell is this" crossed all our minds.We couldn't have had more fun - it's fantastically clever, lots of twists and turns but you don't need to be a genuis to take part. We left on a high of excitement already in agreement we would come again and try another "mission". I couldn't recommened trying this out more. And so refreshing to do something genuinally very new in London. Thank you!

Huge fun and interesting experience. We decided to do this activity because of there trip advisor rating and were not disappointed! Location is a little tricky to find, you have to follow the instructions closely as there is no obvious sign on the the building. It took us a while to warm up but having kids in the room was a plus, as they randomly went exploring and found clues that were not obvious to us. We made it out with 11 seconds on the clock!!! So much fun and for something really different in London, give it a go.

Great fun for everyone. Was not sure what to expect but it was great fun. Didn't need to be a brain box to complete it just need to be good at noticing things. Really enjoyed it and the people who organised it explains it well. We did it on a hen with quite a lot of girls in 2 groups and it was such fun. Would enjoy doing it again.

Exciting!. We went to ClueQuest as a team of 4 and had a great time. The clues and puzzles are challenging and if you are struggling then extra hints can be beamed in to the room so that you are never struggling over one thing for too long. We were very close to escaping in the hour, and we were very grateful to be allowed the extra 10 minutes we needed to be able to complete the escape. It would have been disappointing to fail!! Brilliant alternative activity for a night out, and I believe there is another one open in Liverpool Street that we will be sure to try in the near future.
The great escape. Fantastic experience. Eight of us went and two teams raced to be the first to escape. We were all buzzing, even the losing side!. Highly recommended

Great unexpected fun!!. I must admit I was unsure about our day at ClueQuest...but I could not be more wrong...this was a great test of your mental capacity and your observation skills. We had a great time and would look forward to their next challenge.
Very entertaining. Great fun and highly recommended for families and friends. It starts out relatively easy and quickly ramps up in terms of problem complexity.

Surprisingly fun!!!!!. we used this as a team building event. split into teams of 4. we were all sceptical and rather concerned and slightly scared if not negative.... by the end of the 60 mins we'd been challenged and came out the winners and buzzing for the rest of the evening. I would recommend it as a totally different experience. A lot of fun. Certainly up for going again as there are 2 rooms to crack!

Amazing!!. Absolutely fantastic experience from the moment you get there with the very entertaining briefing! It was so clever, the hour went amazingly quickly, and there was a real adrenaline rush coming up to the finish! Hope to try out a different room soon! Would highly recommend.

Wish I could do 6 Stars!. We came mid July 2014 - we took a team of 16 people split into 4 teams of 4. We used this a teambuilding excercise for work. We sat around at the begining of the activity talking in small groups quietly. After the most amazing fun and jaw droppingly clever rooms which gave us loads of 'wow' moments, we cam out and all of us were talking animatedly and were buzzing! The whole team were laughing and we didnt hear one negative comment. We cant wait to come again. Keep building more rooms please!!
Brilliant!. Lots of fun, wasn't sure what to think when I arrived but it was great. Telling all my friends to give it a go!
Enjoyed it. whe we went to this place we never expected we ll enjoy it like it was. A place must to visit!! My friends used to talk me about it, but never that it could be like i recibed.

A Unique Experience.. Very cool and different from anything I've ever done. Extremely challenging. I can't wait to do it again. The time flew by and I only wish it could have been a 2 hour experience.

What great entertainment. Four of us turned up at this building tucked away in the back streets wondering quite what to expect. We were 'briefed' about our mission and led to our room. From the minute we entered the room the mind boggling fun started. We had a ball solving our puzzles and figuring out our clues. We got out with. 6 minutes to spare but would have happily spent another hour in this problem solving environment. Great time was had by all. It was crystal maze for real.
Great fun!!. Amazing time today!! Good way to get your brain pumping and avoid jet lag. Both my wife and I highly recommend!!!!!!!!!!!
What a fun thing to do! Even with just 2 of us!. My son and I loved this! The people that run it are great. The whole experience was a blast! We want to do the new room now!

fast track. fabulous, we did fast track as we had a lot to fit in and would suggest that is a good idea if you are short of time. We have never bothered before but did this as a special occasion and certainly glad that we did. The photos package we thought was a little expensive but guess its London after all. Do remember to smile at the end of the trip to catch the camera tho!!
Cracking fun!. Went last weekend and have to say it was marvellous! Great fun for the family!! Know why its #1 ranked on TA! The helper "K" was great and made us feel very welcome.

Lots of Fun. I went to Clue Quest with 4 18-23yos. We had 2 rooms so we could race. Everyone had a great time. The hour flew past. The game was challenging but with the right clues we were able to escape. During the rest of out trip this experience was talked about the most. I highly recommend this to anyone with older teens or adults. I wish there were more similar games in the US

Saving the world in 60 minutes. For fun families travelling with tweens and/or teens (especially gamers), ClueQuest is a nice break from visiting the typical London tourist attractions. Your team of secret agents is given 60 minutes to break out of a room by deciphering clues and solving puzzles. Pass the test and you save the world! We had a great time. You don't want to do this with fewer than three or more than five people. The first mystery is actually finding the location of ClueQuest which was down a hidden street in a discreetly marked building. For lunch visit nearby Pizza East or one of the eateries at BoxPark.We can't wait to go back!

Fantastic Family Fun. I booked this experience for the day of my son's 14th birthday (July 5th) and was hoping that the visit would live up to all the excellent reviews - I was not disappointed. We were made to feel welcome as soon as we arrived and soon met our very patient guide for the event who explained everything to us (and even answered all my 11 year old son's detailed questions!). The experience was exhilarating right from the moment we walked into the room and the euphoria we experienced when we solved a puzzle together was fantastic. The whole concept is very clever, well thought out and superbly executed. We would love to return to do another challenge in the future. It gave me a unique opportunity to see how we worked together as a family and I was pleasantly surprised. Our one hour train journey home went as quickly as our time at ClueQuest as we talked non-stop about our experience; re-living each minute all over again! My son will never forget his 14th birthday - thank you ClueQuest.

This is a must. I went her with some friends/ work colleagues and felt like it was a childhood dream come true. If you remember The Crystal Maze hosted by Richard O'Brien then you will have an idea of what it's about. To put it simply, you are locked in a room and you have to solve the various clues in order to get out in 60 minutes. There were 10 of us and we split into groups of 5 with one group doing Operation Black Ops and the other doing Unit 51. This activity is great for any kind of team work, whether it be with friends, family or work colleagues.

Fantastic experience with a bit of tension thrown in..... We were a group ranging from 25 - 60, two teams of a 5 and a 6.....it was really good fun, kept everyone involved and never has an hour gone by so quickly! Highly entertaining fun for everyone.

A must when in London!. We have been to a similiar venue in Budapest, and really looked forward to get challenged at ClueQuest! And WOW!! Fantastic challenge and great fun. If you live in London or visit, it doesn't matter, you have to try this!

The Fastest Hour Ever!. We were intrigued by the high rating so we had to give it a shot. We thought the ticket price was a little high, but after we completed the escape, we felt it was worth our time and money. Unfortunately, one of our team members couldn’t find the location so we were a team of 3 – but we escaped. Great fun! This activity is good for all ages.

Finished with 2 seconds to go !!. My wife, 17 year old daughter and 15 year old son visited on July 2nd 2014. Everyone enjoyed this - fun, silly introduction followed by 60 minutes locked in one room that led to two further rooms. We escaped with 2 seconds on the clock though to be honest only because of the hints provided every so often on the TV screen in each room - would have been interesting to see how long it would REALLY have taken ! My wife and I watched the kids solve most of the puzzles and helped when they slowed done or started to get disorganized - nice to see them come into their own a bit. Good fun and well worth the time and money.

Much better than expected! Worth a visit. I booked this online through Groupon, with little or no expectation and to just have something to do with my partner on a day off! It was great fun, so clever and the concept is fabulous! It is worth a visit as couples, as a family, with friends or even work friends! You can't imagine what it'll be like until you experience it! So fun, something completely different and I will be visiting their new one soon!

Original, fun, well thought-out. We visited this place in July/ 2014 with 3 children aged 13, 9 and 9. The concept is highly original and the time goes by quickly. The puzzles require you to think fast and clues are given to help you when needed.Unfortunately, explaining exactly what goes on in there will ruin your fun so you just have to try it to see for yourself!Everyone had a great time and staff was very friendly. The kids are not English speakers but that wasn't a problem when with adults speaking the language.I would go again to their new quest tomorrow if I could. Be sure to book ahead as this activity is sold out weeks ahead (on weekends)

Very Fun Experience for the Whole Family. I found ClueQuest on tripadvisor and booked a time for my family trip to London. You can have a team of up to five people which was perfect for us. We found this to be a very unique and fun experience for everyone. The game is set up very well and promotes teamwork and patience. It may seem a bit silly to some people, but if you can put that aside, it is a lot of fun and quite challenging.

It was so much fun. Thanks for the great scape. We had so much fun. Really new experience to enjoy with friends. Is something that you don´t expect at all. And... zas! you are into a room with your team with the feeling that you are gonna be locked there for at least 1 hour if you don´t escape first. Discover the way to go out of the room is great. Everyone in the team is finding something that is helping the team to win. It was really nice to have this kind of experience because now I´m looking forward for the next one.

Unique!. A unique experience that had us talking about it hours later! We had 2 teams go head to head in identical rooms to see who could escpae in the fastest time. Great fun, and definitely will be returning to see what the newest room (Blacksheep) has to offer. Apparently new rooms are designed every 6 months, so looking forward to what comes next! :)

Shall I add to the praise?. This place is very good. A good laugh, I did it with my 2, 20-something children and it was excellent fun. It is perfectly timed, a great range of clues and all very brain foxing. Must do!

Weekend Stay. The location could hardly be any better in that you are within walking distance to several attractions and amenities.I find it difficult to fault anything in that everything and every one is so organized to please.

Sooooo much fun. I wasn't quite sure what to expect when my friend recommended we go. Boy was I pleasantly surprised, it was an amazing amount of fun. We barely finished with 3 minutes on the clock and had our brains working overtime. The rest of they day we were on a high and couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was. My only regret is that we didn't plan ahead and book a second visit as we weren't able to get in again before our trip ended. If the description of the game sounds even remotely interesting to you then you will have an amazing time. Don't miss it.

Back Again and Awed Again!. We've returned this time with new agents, and weren't sure about how my mother and brother would enjoy the cracking of codes, but they LOVED IT! And it was such a bonus for us as this was CQ's newest room, Operation Blacksheep, whom we cracked in the nick of time! We were very proud of ourselves, and managed to tackle as a team with no quarrels. We can't recommend this new form of family fun entertainment enough! Go. Go. Go.

Awesome, just awesome!!. This is definitely one of the most unique and enjoyable experiences we have had in London! We would thoroughly recommend this and it would be good for family/friends/workmates! The level of difficulty is just right as it is challenging yet so much fun at the same time, if your reading this then just book already!!

Absolutely Brilliant!. Visited here on Thursday 26 June, a family of 4 adults and two children aged 14 and 10. The best ever fun. Just when you think you've solved a clue, another one comes along! Thanks to Andrew for keeping us on track - I cannot rate this event highly enough. Well done to all at ClueQuest for a really excellent time. Well deserves the Number One slot.

Quickest 60 Minutes Ever. If you want time to fly, do ClueQuest. 60 minutes will go by quicker then you can ever imagine. We were a team of three; two adults and our 13 year old granddaughter. What a great way to learn how we work as a team and individually. We got stuck several times and were nicely prompted with a small clue so we could make forward progress. To provide details would spoil the surprise for others. We will simply say that it was amazing and exciting and challenging and energizing and got a thumbs up from all three of us. We wish we had pre-booked a couple more adventures. Fun, fun, fun!!!!

Fab fun. I didn't really know what to expect before I got there and I simply went off of the reviews. But Cluequest was fab. Really fun, really different.....and yes, really stressful. I highly recommend for groups of friends!

Great fun !. Very cool! Had a great time - lots of fun puzzles with varying difficulty, all fits together nicely and executed with humour
Highly recommended to everyone!

Brilliant! . We were a group of two adults and three teens, and had the best "together time" in ages! Great fun and very challenging. Bonus is a visit to brick lane close by afterwards for some nice indian food

The best sight in London!. A fantastastic, stunning and amazing experience!
The clues are easy to understand but puzzling because of their vastness.
English skills are optional, there is few to translate, but if you want advice, you should be able to communicate in basic english language

Great Experience!. My husband and I brought our 3 children ages 17, 15, and 9. We had a great time and all the children participated. My oldest said this is the experience in London she will never forget.

Amazing night. We loved our evening at Cluequest. I would suggest any family or teen+ group try this activity. My kids (20 and 21) had such a good time. We are hoping to find a similar place in the US.

AMAZING!!. Just been to ClueQuest for my 30th Birthday with my family and it was the best experience ever! We had never done anything like it before.... and had no idea what to expect, but seriously don't have any hesitation.... just do it! It's not easy, you definitely have to work together and stay focussed. It's something different, and well worth the visit!

Believe all the reviews....this is superb!!!. Just been to ClueQuest today with my mum,dad,husband and sister for a birthday treat. Walking down a side street, in a very unusual spot, a warehouse which looked nothing from the outside. I can only say one thing - GO!!!! It was the best experience ever. We have one request to the owners......come to Scotland. What a great idea....thanks to the staff!!

8m 40s left.... Say no more!!. Went in a group of 4, great fun and totally got into the spirit. Done these before in America and was concerned it would be too easy, but it was taxing enough to make it fun. The staff were funny and joined in with our raucous behaviour. It was a bit hard to find the building but that is the only negative. We had the best time of the day, can you do better?

Great time for teens and parents!. Our family of five, with two parents and three sons, ages 20,19 and 14, had an absolutely fantastic time working together to figure out the mystery during our visit to ClueQuest. Our mento, Richard, was smart, funny, witty and supportive. Loved the entire game and really felt like we'd accomplished something important when we got out of the final room with less than 30 seconds to spare. Wish we lived closer to London so we could go back and try the new room. Highly recommend this to all. Well worth it. One of the highlights of our tript to London.

What a rush!. One my friends initially thought this is experience was going to be boring. She trudged her way to the place. Boy oh boy was she wrong. The word fun is not sufficient to describe the experience. The clues are well hidden and very well thought of.Finding the place in itself is like doing the clue quest. Unassuming. Sadly we did not get to finish the quest but the team did help us out after our time has ended.At the end of the day, the quest rounds up my trip. I am very glad that i get to book it at the last minute.For those of you who are interested, please do not book the quest too late. It gets snapped up easily. Hurry!

Back for a 2nd time!. Back for the 2nd room, operation black sheep. Did this last night....Really enjoyed it. Managed to get out with 1min 45 secs to spare. The guy who worked there said there was around a 28% success rate for this game so we were chuffed we got out! Totally recommended!

very fun!. This was a very fun adventure for our family of four. Our family is full of type A people who generally do not collaborate but they did for this and it was a total blast! It's pretty tricky and our two kids were much better at it than the adults. Very unusual and everyone really enjoyed it!

Loved it. My three teenage sons and I loved this adventure. The clues were challenging enough without being too difficult. Although we didn't solve the quest, the boys immediately wanted to do it again. They were extremely excited. My only con is that it is very expensive for 1 hour.

a ton of fun. Great experience with a group of friends! We were 5 researchers from Cambridge and the challenges were so diverse that we really had to think and cooperate. Really good fun, heartily recommend it!

Nail Biting & Awesome!. A-mazing! I have never experienced anything like this before. Nail biting from start to finish. Plan52 was great and I definitely plan to visit again for BlackSheep on my next trip to London.

Puzzlingly Good. A fantastic experience for anyone with the slightest interest in puzzles or games. If you get stuck the staff will send a stream of helpful clues to get you on your way. Came with 3 people, but felt that 4 would have been ideal. Perhaps the hardest part was finding the place, as it's in an unmarked building down an alley.

Best group activity in London!. I've been living in London for years and always try to experience new places and activities but this was on another level! By far the most exciting and challenging way to spend time with friends! We all had a genuinely good time and enjoyed every minute of it! Also managed to escape with 3 minutes left :)

Nothing but fun. Turned up thinking it was a joke, the building didn't looked hidden and shady, but it just added to the mystery! The concept is brilliant and I recommend it for groups of friends or family as a great bonding exercise. It's really fun and competitive, worth every penny! Go for it.

Awesome. I never knew anything like this existed, but we decided to try it out because it was so highly rated, and we are game people, and we are so glad we did! We were a group of four, and we also had two babies in the room that we were trying to keep happy without distracting us. We made it with over a minute to spare, and we had a blast! I highly recommend this activity.

Fun with a difference. Great fun, especially if you are a bit of a geek (like me). I completed the challenge with my boyfriend so it can be done with just two people, but I think 3 or 4 tops would have been the ideal number.

Love a challenge. I went in a group of 5. We're into challenges like these and had played similar games. It was such fun and so incredibly clever. We're looking to book into the 2nd room as soon as possible.
Best experience. The only thing you should know before you go is that you have to go and do it. Very interesting experience that you won't forget!
It totally rocks. It's true guys. I can't say more: you just must visit it. As long as trip advisor asks me for more characters, I'll just put some more heeeeere.

Excellent . 14 fellas went to London to watch the footy and to stop us hitting the pub all day spent an hour at cluequest and have to say was thoroughly enjoyable. Didn't no what to expect but would highly recommend a visit.

Mind blowing!. I really don't want to give anything away but this is one heck of an experience! Those 60 minutes force you to think laterally and make sure your heart rate never settles! An absolute must-do! Worth every penny!

A really great way to spend an hour!. We did this in a group of 5 for my son's 22nd birthday.... we all thoroughly enjoyed it, it was challenging without being impossible....the occasional hint from "mission control" - when we were on the right track, but not quite there - was very useful, without making it too easy. We will go back and do the other mission at some point. The staff are great. Not quite sure why some people have commented on location or the building.... there is so much information on the website on how to find the place, and what does it matter that its in what appears to be an old office block?? Very well set up, and excellent value for money. I would recommend this for groups of friends, or families with older children.

A new Experience. 60 minutes you will be in adrenal rush to solve the puzzle. We played this real life game with another team of our group. Its tough to solve although we were able to solve 60% of the puzzles. Must GO !

Challenging and a great laugh! . This is one of those rare places that has really got the activity right. I won't give anything away but it's great fun, and enough of a challenge without being too difficult. A group of five of us worked perfectly and we had a great laugh and managed to finish in time! The idea is genius and the staff are awesome. On the other hand, a few things we didn't like. The starting speech was a little childish considering we were all over 20 and the game is far too difficult for very young children so it seemed a bit out of place, also the location is in a wierd alley and it wasn't easy to find! Lastly the decor of the escape room was great, but the rest of the place looked a bit cobbled together of random furniture and didn't look all too professional. Beyond these minor shortcomings, it's such a unique activity and a rewarding experience, I would definitely recommend it! I liked how all the puzzles were explained to us in full at the end because we had so many questions!

Awesome return visit. Took my team to this yesterday and, as expected, we had a great time. The team running the game give you just enough clues to keep you going but you still have to use your brain! Really good fun and the only thing I'm gutted about is that I have now done both rooms. Can't wait for a new challenge!

"Great way to spend an hour". We travelled half way around the world and can say it was well worth it! We went with our 11 year old twins and found it be a great family challenge. We didn't quite finish it in time but were given some extra minutes. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Well worth a visit.
Must do activity. We definitely kept the best till last, the most enjoyable, infuriating hour you will spend in London. Bring the teens and show them that they don't know everything.

Great family fun. We were not entirely sure what to expect, but found this to be fun, challenging, and unique. We learned a lot about ourselves as a family and would recommend it highly. Do not lose heart if you have a bit of trouble finding the location. It is worth the trip!
Great fun. Thanks for a really enjoyable evening - loved every minute, and we were chuffed that we managed to escape with 22 seconds to spare. Please open more rooms so we can keep coming back!

We finally got out!. Didn't know what to expect at first but WOW this is so much fun and full of surprises! Did this with my parents and sister- we were a bit slow at the beginning but eventually got into the swing of it. Very original and they should definitely make more of these! Great for a family day out. Unfortunately we didn't get out in time but Mr Q gave us 6 minutes extra!Would recommend for all ages - no younger than 13!

So much fun! And we broke the escape time record!. Great with friends - a real test for working as a team, and satisfyingly challening - full details (no spoilers!) on my blog: http://hyhoi.com/2014/06/cluequest-live-escape-game/

The most fun you can have in one hour. Located in a non-descript building, at first you don't expect much, but once you meet your mentor and start your mission, its an hour or so of pure fun. My wife and I were able to do with as a two person team, so don't be afraid to attempt this as a duo! A must do if you're in London!

Great laugh and nice way to spend a rainy day in london. Went there with some friends. a little skeptical at first as we feared it would be rather childish and easy to escape. We were very wrong. The guide who explained how it worked was very friendly and made us have a right laugh. The games were very different from each other and kept us on our toes the whole time. We had so much fun and look forwards to trying it again. I have also managed to convince my bosses to have a corporate event there where we will have every team challenge each other should be a great corporate event and team bonding. It will also show us who is good under pressure and who will crack. Pretty sure our Back office team (where i work) should be the best and most prepared.

Must Do!. Going in, I didnt really know what to expect but the ratings say it all. This is seriously good fun and I cant wait to come back and try the other room - and our group got out with 12 mins to spare! Beat that!

Great for kids. My son celebrated his 9th birthday by taking a few of his friends to ClueQuest. I was initially a bit apprehensive about whether it would be too difficult for them, so my husband went along as a "team member" to assist if it got too difficult.Well, it went really well. The kids all LOVED! Afterward at our birthday tea, the kids reported all of the cool puzzles they had to solve, and how they had to work together to solve them. They actually sat at the table congratulating each other on their individual contributions to the team and talked about the strengths of each child.So, if you are living in London and want to do something for your child that is challenging, stimulating and that will teach them to work as a team, this is definitely a must!

It is one thing you should not miss doing in LONDON. When I first read about ClueQuest on Trip advisor I was intrigued, so I initially wanted to book 2 rooms since we were 8 individuals and wanted to compete against each other, but since the attraction was fully booked , we booked just one room for 5, but still on the day 6 of us went to the attraction. the whole family were skeptical , and did not want to go. But let me tell you "it was one of the highlights of our trip". You are locked into a room for one hour with your group in attempt to find clues and your way out. The task is not as easy as it is while playing online (escape the Room) , very challenging, but extremely fun. it did not help that some of us did not speak english very well but still we got alot of encouragement and though we did not make it in time we had loads of fun. once you book , they send you all the details on how to get there and though the place is a bit remote, don't get discouraged, it adds to the mystery to the game. it is fun for friends, family and suitable for all ages. I do recommend it for not only tourist but even as a small team building exercise .

Fun times saving the world. Came in from Copenhagen and tried the escape game at clue quest... I have to say that it was such a fun time and our guide was such a genuinely nice and happy person, you can feel that he really loves his work and that shines through! Would go back again tomorrow and give it another go!

Excellent fun for us, grandparents and teenager.. We wasn't sure what to expect but we all really enjoyed our time our guide was great at helping us along and giving us clues along the way if we got stuck. Thanks again for a fun memorable time.

Great team building game!. We went as a work team of 5 and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The game was well designed, full of variety and cryptic challenges against the clock. We even managed to get out with only minutes to spare adding to the excitement and sense of achievement! It was surprisingly so much fun we are already planning our next visit as a team to do the Black Sheep challenge! I will never look at combination locks the same way again. Highly recommend as a team building event but also would be great fun with friends and family.Have to also say thanks to the Cluequest team who were very flexible and opened early for us to play.

We had an amazing time. This is one of the best activities I've done in a long time. We were a group of five friends, all very different, but everyone had a great time. Would recommend it to anyone who likes problem solving in the slightest. It's kind of like being inside your own adventure game! Loads of fun! //The Scandinavian Team

You will no regret playing this game! SO MUCH FUN!! And very different than any other "tourist attraction" out there.. I was a bit spectacle about this clue quest game, and now that I've done it and completed on time- I was SO WORTH IT! This game was so much fun! I played with my 3 other family members and we all really worked together, laughed, and were really puzzled with the game, but nonetheless, we completed! I don't want to give any spoilers on what you do (cause then it would ruin your fun), but I was traveling Europe for 10 days, and this was my favorite part of my vacation! I would definitely do this again!!!

Not only do you escape the room but you escape the real world for a while - we all need that sometimes.. 2nd time here and can't wait for more - beware it's so addictive These guys have outdone themselves again. We loved every minute of it, we thought the first room coulnt be topped but we had a totally different experience with just as much challenge, fun and excitement. Everything is explained perfectly and the right clues are given if needed. There's no doubt, this is a must do. Thanks ClueQuest

Started out great and only got better. Our group of 5 randomly googled Cluequest before flying to London and the experience was well worth the £20 per head we paid. It is a crazy experience from start to finish and we were completely pumped the whole time. Perhaps the best thing about Cluequest as an attraction is that anyone (above the age of 15 or so) can enjoy it; there are no difficult references to pop culture and no real physical challenges - just you and your friends'/family's minds sweating it out in a very cool environment. Ill happily recommend this escape game to anyone wanting to try something different whilst staying in London. Very clever stuff! You'll be frustrated, sweaty,happy and excited non stop for 60 minutes!
Everyone loved it!. I can't tell you much except to say that all 12 of us LOVED it. We had a great time, and 8/12 made it out in time!

Great fun!. We've done both rooms at HintHunt, so ClueQuest was the obvious thing to do next! Very little to choose between the two companies, so do whichever's easiest for you in terms of location and availability. Brilliant hour of fun! Will be booking up to do the second room straightaway.

Something off the beaten track . Booked cluequest as I had seen it on trip advisor and I'm always looking for different things to do in London. We went as a group of 4 for a friend's birthday and we all absolutely enjoyed the experience so much we are already looking at going back for the second experience! I would recommend this to anyone whether it be work related team building or a but of competition between friends/ family!

Awesome experience. Our family (me, my wife, my son (17) and my daugther (15) dared to take on this challenge. And we didn't regret. It was one of our highlights on our London trip. The organization worked perfectly, the instruction were very clear (also for us non-natives) and the quests were really cool.Quite certain we will go back for the latest Quest.
Excellent. Definitely recommend everyone to go! Great fun. Need to book well in advance as clearly v popular. Give yourself ten mins extra to find place-as is in an unusual location

A great experience. We did ClueQuest as a team building exercise, and it was by far the best type of team building experience we have had. It was a lot of fun, challenging but not impossible, and designed so that everyone was engaged in the activities. It is hard to describe without giving too much away, but it was much much better than any of us could have expected. We plan to go again and try one of the other courses.

Excellent Team-Building Exercise!. I visited Clue Quest yesterday as part of a team-building exercise for work and highly enjoyed solving puzzles and mysteries. I cannot say I was the most clever one on my team, but I enjoyed it all the same, especially when I was awarded with the title of Secret Agent at the end of it. Our two "guides" were also brilliant, very engaging and funny and provided some very clear instructions, yet did not reveal too much of what would happen to us! Great fun! I would most certainly go again!
18th birthday trip. Great fun had by all, would absolutely recommend. Challenging but in a good way, 2 teenagers and parents and all enjoyed it!
Great work do!. Fun, quirky work do - which didn't cost a lot! Everyone was still talking about it, hours afterwards. Great team building event, without being cheesey. Would certainly recommend!

Brilliant!. Cluequest really is as good as everyone on here says. The puzzles are just at the right level, not ridiculously easy or difficult - they make you think- and the sense of tension as the time runs down is palpable. I (an adult) did this with 4 girls aged 14 and 12, we finished with about 13 seconds to spare!!!

One of the best things to do in London. I went with some friends last Saturday and we all had an amazing time. It was an absolutely mental 60 mintues of clue finding, code breaking, laughter and loads of fun. Its not easy but thats why its fun. It gets the adrenalin pumping while you race against the clock to complete your mission and escape the room.If you are looking for something different to do, you will definitely enjoy this. Just go. You'll thank me later ;)

Do it!. A totally unique experience that is well worth the money. It's perfectly pitched - just the right level of challenge with hints and clues where needed to keep you on track. Our group of five adults did it with just over a minute to spare and will be going back to attempt the next room..! The attention to detail is incredible - get it booked!

Superb!. My wife and I, along with 2 friends took on Operation Blacksheep at ClueQuest over the weekend and we were extremely impressed with how well designed and how much fun we had. We had previously done a live escape game in Singapore, but ClueQuest was so much slicker and well organised. The way it is ran is very clever and it was such a great experience. No spoilers here about the day as a whole, but i would highly recommend giving ClueQuest a go.

Something different - would go again.. Great activity that gets you all working together; all ages in our group loved it and would definitely go again. No special skills needed - just common sense and communication. It's been ages since we did something totally different to the norm and would recommend it to anyone looking for a challenge with teens upwards.
Great fun. This is just great - don't hesitate and just book it, well worth the money! You also get a cute little photo.

Mind-bogglingly unique. ClueQuest was recommended to us while on another unique event (2.8 Hours Later) - as a group we had more faith in our mental prowess than our physical fitness so it sounded ideal. We arrived late on a Friday evening and straight away we were dropped in this amazingly atmospheric experience. What followed was just over an hour of truly unique fun, teamwork and brain-melting challenge. It was an experience I cannot recommend highly enough.
Amazing my teenagers spoke!. What an amazing way to bond as a family, great for team building , ice breaking or the start to a great night out, just don't get big headed and put the price up

I loved it!. Can't really say too much as it would give it away. We went with older teens 16 and 19, plus us parents. We all enjoyed the experience.We went on a bank holiday so parking was free and easy to find.Highly recommend for families with teens.

Amazingly imaginative and like nothing I have ever done before .. Me, my mum and friends went to clue quest in May, great weather and a beautiful location filled with street art. We did adults v teens and of course we, teens won. Amazing experience that I would recommend to all. Pulse for hours after I was trying to see clues in everything.i would Defiantly go again !!

The best! Addictive and tons of fun. I took my husband and 3 older children (ages 16, 15 & 12). I wanted to find something different to do in London with them and wasn't disappointed, we all had a blast! So much so, that we will definitely come back and try Operation Black Sheep (we completed Plan 52). I would highly recommend it, well worth a visit.

Amazing. Simply amazing! Incredible game plan, just when you think it cannot get more challenging, it does!It's an amazing and different thing to do in London. Highly recommended for small groups of friends (preferably 3-4 people. More than that and you'll be in each other's way)It's very rewarding and mentally challenging!I won't say more to avoid giving away too much!

The most fun I had in a long time!. Been to London a few times but this is the first time I got to do this game. Thrilling and fun! Must-do! We played the PLAN 52 and we left the apartment with just 6 seconds to spare! So nerve wrecking but incredibly exciting! We were in three and I think 3 (or maybe 4) is the perfect number. 5 might be too much. Can't wait to try the Black Sheep!

Fun, addictive and rewarding. We were 9 people with a wide mix of ages. We chose to compete on Plan 52 in 2 teams just to add some extra pressure to the time limit. It's not like anything else I've been on - it is best experienced without spoilers. Most relevant thing I can say is that everyone wants to go back and try BlackSheep now. It's not scary or physical and you don't need any special knowledge. it is very addictive (afterwards in the restaurant we found ourselves still looking for clues) and it gives you a real buzz. I highly recommend.

Great fun!. Took a group of friends as a surprise and we all really enjoyed ourselves. It was great fun and we managed to escape, with a time extension and a little help!! Would highly recommend as a group activity 😊

So MUCH fun. Had an absolutely WONDERFUL 60 minutes! Too much fun. If you want to spend 60 minutes thinking outside of the box, this is the place to visit. Words cannot express how much fun we three adults had. We continue to talk about Clue Quest two days after we had our try. ABSOLUTELY a must.
Best night EVER. Incredible night. Best ever ... So much fun solving problems and Julia was an incredible hostess / briefing spy ... Big big props. We WILL be back. Dun dun duuuuun.

Unique experience - lots of fun. An exciting hour - we couldn't believe it when the time was up. It was only two of us that attempted the challenge, and although we did receive a few timely hints, we needed a bit more than the allotted time to complete. It was awesome to see it through to the end and I would definitely go back to try one of the other challenges on a future visit to London.

GREAT FUN - GREAT CONCEPT - GO. Went as a family group of 5 adults and what a fantastic way to enjoy 60 minutes. We attended the Plan 52 assignment - obviously can't say too much about what this involves as it would totally spoil the experience. Our "master of events" was Johnny - really great guy and everyone we came into contact with were very friendly and welcoming All I can say is if you like having fun with family/friends, enjoy trying different things, love puzzles or if you just like breathing - you will love this. We are going back to try Blacksheep. Go - you won't be sorry.

genuinely excellent. Different, fun, challenging and unique. Added to all that in a superb part of London to then wander, drink,shop or chill out in. I would suggest 4 is about the appropriate number to all participate. Definitely recommend.

Fantastic!. We went as a group of 4 and had a BLAST! As other reviews have said, it's fun, competitive, slightly frustrating at times but pitched perfectly. Weren't quite sure what to expect when we turned up, but was a lot of fun once we got into it. Would work really well as a work team-building event, stag/hen do and more.

1 hour. Multiple Problems. Mr Q expects..... Is there a better way to spend an hour in London? I doubt it!I can't tell you too much - Mr Q has spies everywhere - but what i can say is that this is (in no particular order):Fun,Funny,Exhilarating,Challenging,Wonderful,Entertaining,Tense,Brilliant,Nerve-wracking,Enjoyable,Well-OrganisedFun (have i mentioned that already?!?!?!)Superb!Book Now! You won't be disappointed!Small Print - We went in a group of three (aged 31-38) and that seemed just about the right amount of people for what Mr Q had in store for us....

Totally worth it. If you're reading about this place then you're interested. Just go for it. The staff are welcoming, helpful and fun. The challenge itself is pitched about right and you'll have assistance if you need it. Just take along a few friends and get ready for the clock countdown! It might seem a bit expensive for what it sounds like but, having done it, totally worth it.

Great fun, even better than expected!. We went as a group of 5 and loved it - simple but really good fun in an hour, we were chatting about how good the clues were after, and working out why things were there and just how well the puzzles fitted together. Good value entertainment, and would definitely come back to do the Black Sheep experience some time soon!

Brilliant fun :). We'd read the reviews and booked to go for a family member's birthday. We weren't disappointed! There were five of us ranging from mid 30s to mid 60s and we all had a hoot! We're seriously thinking about trying one of the other rooms next time. Definitely would recommend.
great fun....and suspense!!. Myself and friends had a great time trying to work as a team to gather the clues to unlock the doors. Highly recommended.

Great value fun in the heart of the city. Fantastic way to spend an hour ! We went as a group from work and from the moment we arrived thoroughly enjoyed it. Stephanie who welcomed us was great, the briefing very clear and the whole experience in the room was fantastic. Won't spoil anything by giving away the secrets but it is challenging without being impossible and there is enough help from 'mission control' to stop you getting frustrated. Great stuff and amazing value too ! Would recommend for friends, family or work.

Brilliant fun, challenging & worth every penny!. We paid approx. £20 each and we were going to be locked in a room for an hour. I have never laughed and been so competitive! I cannot give too much away but this would be perfect for families, couples, friends and colleagues. I want to go back and try the Black Sheep. Make more please so I can keep coming!!

Book now!. Went as a group of 8 on 14 May - it was so much fun!I organised the trip as part of a work team build with absolutely no idea what to expect. You have a little briefing when you arrive then you're taken to your room where you have to solve the clues to try to escape. It's a real race against time - my team did not have a second spare when we managed to escape!Everybody really seemed to enjoy themselves. I cannot wait to return for Operation Blacksheep - would 100% recommend :)

Mind blowing!. Went with a team of 4 on 13/5/14 , didn't know what to expect and turned out to be totally crazy and fun. Defiantly gets your Brian's ticking and a real big buzz once you have finished. Will defo recommend this as a super cool thing to do on a random day in London. Everyone MUST try! Thanks clue quest for a great fun day, will be seeing you soon.:)
Very fun. Amazing experience and lots of fun. Defo a must when in this part of London. It is down a side road so may be hard to find however once ur there it is great fun

FANTASTIC!!!. What a fantastic experience! The staff kept in character throughout and are incredibly friendly. The game was amazing, and we were in fits of laughter trying to crack the clues... Just amazing. We were buzzing for for the rest of the day!

A total mind bend but good fun. Loved it, but you need to have your wits about you. Its tough to do, but once you get into the swing of the structure and the clues and how to use them, it becomes fairly straight forward.We used it as a team building exercise, two new teams split up in groups made it a good way to challenge us to work together.Great way to spend a rainy day.

Amazing! Best group activity out there!!. Came here last week as a group of 6 and we had the best time ever!! Everything was so much fun and we all got really into it - even though some of clues were pretty challenging! We walked from Liverpool st to the place which isn't far at all but make sure you don't walk too far as we were looking for a main side street, but its actually down a quiet alleyway! Anyway we were greeted quickly and we were soon told our 'mission'! Shortly after arriving you're thrown quite quickly into the room with a lot of information being told beforehand (plus a padlock lesson) and not really much idea what to expect but everything soon makes sense once you work out the clues! Me and my friends all thought it'd be really easy, but it's actually a lot more challenging than it looks (especially the last part) and we managed to escape with just 35 seconds left on the clock! We were talking about it for ages afterwards and we all said how much fun it was and that it's so different from a normal day out! The staff were really nice and friendly (even storing my suitcase for me) and i'm pretty sure they had a good laugh watching me and my friends being clueless! I don't think we could recommend this place anymore! Afterwards it's easy to see why this is the number 1 attraction in London! Just go!!

Amazing. I did it tonight...and it was absolutely great!!! So bad we don't have anything like this in Italy! I will recommend it to my friends for sure!! And I'll come back in my mext trip to London! Great job guys!:)

Do it!. Always on the hunt to find new and different things to do when visiting London and this absolutely came up trumps! We were a team of 3 which included a 14 year old and we all loved it. The game really draws you in and it took us a few minutes to get our heads in the right space. Don't discount any clues but beware of the red herrings.....I will say no more, just go see for yourself!We were talking about the game for the rest of the day and way into the next....awesome and simple concept that works and worth every penny.Staff onsite were brilliant too :-) Will be back soon to do Operation Black Sheep!

Great fun for a group of 5!. Such a great idea and a really original and exciting thing to do as a family! We got given it as a Christmas present by a family member. We were really well guided through the whole thing and it was just the right level of difficulty for us - we got out with only 4 mins to spare! Great fun for families/work colleagues! Thanks Clue Quest for a lovely day out! x

We did it and there was only 2. We had a brilliant time here and the staff were great. Armed with a map its not difficult to find. Any just incase you are put off if there's only 2 of you, we actually got of of Plan 52 on our own. Well with some well timed hints... Its a great bit of exercise for the brain!
Awesome. This was one of the best things we did during our stay in London. I was in a group of three and it was immensely fun. A must do for everyone!

Excellent Fun. I was a bit unsure of going to this game. On entering its easy to think the surroundings and decore of the place isa bit naff. However, within minutes of the game starting you realise how clever an idea it is. My group of 5 people absolutely loved our game and would not hesitate to go back and play the next level. I highly recommend this attraction to all tourists in London looking for something fun and mentally challenging. Just don't let the building a surroundings put you off! A*
Amazing!. It's better than you could ever imagine! Look forward for our next visit! Very friendly staff, clever idea!

Really fun. If you are traveling to London looking for some funny things to - try ClueQuest and you wount be dissapointed. ClueQuest works for friends, groups - young as olders, teambuilding and family.

Great fun!. We had no idea what to expect, and were pleasantly surprised! This adventure turned into a top highlight of our trip to London. The puzzles are quite challenging and creative. Perfect family adventure with teens.
Excellent from start to finish. Really well put together, much more challenging than I thought! Great for team bonding/birthdays/Tuesdays.
Love it !. Clue Quest was the best live escape we have done so far. Black Sheep was awesome, it is the perfect mix of... everything ! (Do it to know more !) :-)

SO MUCH FUN!!!. A must do, it is so much fun. We were struggling to find a birthday present for my 11 year old nephew and we came across ClueQuest. We booked to do the plan52 room back in January, he loved it, although I think me and my partner may have loved it more. My eldest nephew turned 13 recently so booked ClueQuest again and did the black sheep operation room on Sunday (4 May), again it was excellent. An hour locked in a room trying to solve crazy puzzle, what's not to love. I am now working on my boos to arrange a team building trip to ClueQuest.
Fascinating. Great experience, altough prettry expensive.The staff were nice, but the place is a bit far away. It was intersting and challenging.
Great fun. So much fun, I would definitely come again. It's something different to do in London and is worth the money, gets the blood pumping for sure!

Amazing experience. Definitely something I would do again, absolutely amazing how it is all set out and the brainwork needed. I would recommend this to anyone, incredible experience, especially if you're more of logical-minded person. I am planning on booking a return trip ASAP.
Big fun. Family fun, also with kids aged from 8 years! Hard to find but once inside, the adventure starts. Good coaching with relevant clues!

"ClueQuest is the best". We really have a lot of fun at this life escape game, we ain't got any problem with language (not being native english) we spend one crazy hour solving stuff and than several days talking and laughing about. The crew was really enthousiast and sympatic.

Definitely must be tried. We were a group of four. And we all had amazing time. We tried out operation blacksheep which is a new room that I can tell you nothing about other that it is fun, exciting and a bit tricky so don't waste your time, put your brain to work and book tickets to clueQuest because no matter where you go this will stand out as one of the highlights of your trip!

Brilliant Fun. Visited here as a group of 8 friends. We competed in 2 teams of 4 to try and escape the same room. Very well organised and the staff were really friendly. It is, as they advertise it, just like a real life room escape game. Everyone can take part and no general knowledge is required. Both teams escaped (just!) with a time difference of only 3 seconds. Will definitely visit again!

Fantastic Experience!. Cluequest was a terrific afternoon for our family. This is a great (and low cost) experience for families, groups, co-workers, couples...you-name-it. Any group from 2-6 would be a perfect size to best enjoy this unique and challenging project. It is for locals as well as visitors. Easy to get to (Liverpool St. Station and 5 min walk) with several good eateries within minutes. Worth the booking!

Fab time, something different!. Clearly can't say too much about the 'game' but really enjoyed it. Venue not terribly easy to find so be prepared. When we arrived though we were warmly welcomed before starting our adventure, totally different, very clever and highly recommend! We were 2 adults with 11 & 13 yr olds, wouldn't suggest much younger, but groups of big kids wanting to take on the challenge, go for it!
Absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended for families with teenage kids. We had so much fun there. Will be back for sure. Looking forward to completing another mission!
51 minutes of Pure fun. Had a fantastic time at Clue Quest. We went as a group of 8. One group escaped in 51 mins the other lot are still there! Couldnt recommend more, very fun and a real challenge

So much fun!. From start to finish we were hooked! You feel like an excitable kid in a candy store trying to contain yourself with so many fun puzzles to solve. The operation is really cleverly thought out. Can't wait to try the next one!

Highly recommended!. We, a group of three people, went to ClueQuest last week. We didn't know much about the concept, apart from the fact that you are locked up in a room and you have an hour to escape. At the beginning we weren't quite sure how to begin but with some luck and kind hints from Mr. Q we started to get an idea what to do. The hour went by really fast and there were times when you actually hoped the time would stop.You can always argue whether this is the "best thing to do in London". I mean there are just so many things to do and see and I guess it really depends on what kinds of activities you like in general. However, ClueQuest is something completely different and it is hard to believe that anyone would be completely disappointed in it.Important note to anyone wondering: you don't necessarily have to speak English as your first language. At least we survived well though our English isn't perfect.

So much fun. I went along with my two daughters and their partners to the new venue, found it a bit difficult to find, but the buiding is much bigger than their previous premisis.Again we had a fantasic time and would recommend it to anyone that likes a challenge, its fast and furious trying to solve the clues ( and there are many) before the hour is up.Cant wait for the next challenge . Well done to all that put so much hard work into this great game

Good times. Friends of ours were visiting from the States so we decided to take them to ClueQuest for something different to do. We all had great night out doing the game, such a brilliant experience. We will definitely be back again to try other operations.

Best hour ever!. There is a reason this is the top rated attraction in London! The first challenge is finding the building (look for the Drunken Monkey Pub). Once there we were greeted by our friendly game master. Our family of 2 adults and 2 teens then raced around for an hour in an attempt to escape from the room. Puzzles were varied and challenging but you are given hints if required. This was the kids favourite part of the trip. Close to Shoreditch and Brick Lane to escape the tourist crowds too.

Fantastic idea!. I went along to ClueQuest last week accompanied by my student daughter (21) and my two nieces aged 14 and 11. We all agreed at the end that it was one of the best things we have ever done in London. It is hard to do justice to it in a written review - it is something that you really need to experience for yourself. All four of us were able to participate and clues are given when you need them, so definitely something that everyone can enjoy at any age. Would definitely recommend!

Great family fun. As a "something different" to our family city trip to London, I booked an 'escape' with Clue Quest .... Not really sure what to expect !Not disappointed . It was great.We are family of 5 (kids aged 8,12 & 14) Very cleverly made ,very friendly staff ..... Kids loved it !We did some great stuff in London , but this rated up there high, in our "great memory of our trip" list Thanks to the Clue Quest team.

Great Time!!!. It seemed like finding the location was harder that doing the game. After finally locating the place we (2 couples) had a GREAT TIME playing ClueQuest. Would definitely recommend doing it (with 4-6 people) if you have the time.

Fantastic!. I came here back in November with a few people and it was great! I did not tell my boyfriend we were going to this so he was slighly confused when I took him to this industrial unit...when he realised we were going to solve some puzzles though he quickly became as excited as we were. The guy who helped us (sorry, I can't remember your name!) gave us just the right amount of nudging in the right direction. Would love to do something similar to this again! Thanks CQ!

Great Fun. Went for our son`s 21st birthday treat whilst doing the London weekend.Did not know what to expect but fantastically surprised we all had great fun the 4 of us..team work came into play, we all had ideas that helped the mission. Extremely friendly staff, who were very helpful before we even started. Daughter has it on her list for her 21st next year, have been telling all we know to go and have fun...So different to normal London activities.

Unexpected Fun. Our small group of 4 from Chicago Illinois was not sure what to expect. It took us a while just to find the place - but when we did, we were surprised at how much fun we had. We would recommend this for all age groups, couples, families with both young and older kids.

Dying to go back and try the other room!!!. An absolutely fun filled hour! It's adventurous, silly and fun but also mentally challenging!! Had a blast... in the two years of living in London this is by far the most fun I’ve had!!

Great group activity. Booked ClueQuest operation Blacksheep for my friend's birthday for a group of 4 people. we had so much fun solving the clues and getting out the trap set by Mr Q with 7mn left to spare.Team work is really key. Really awesome experience. Really want to get locked again!

Great Team Event. What a brilliant way to spend an hour! We did Cluequest as part of a team day for work, booking both rooms so we could compete against each other - and boy did we compete! . It is always difficult to find an original and entertaining event for our work team days, but you fulfilled this in buckets!! For excercises in team work, cooperation and listening to each other it's hard to imagine better. My only criticism would be that it was over too quickly but we will certainly be going back when the second room is built for Operation Blacksheep.

Best thing to do in London!. You have to go here!! I had high expectations after reading all of the brilliant reviews on here but it was even better than I expected. Everything is so well set up and so much fun! I would happily go and do it all over again. It really makes you think and is a great thing to do with a few friends. This is definitely my favourite thing that I have done in London. Just brilliant!!
Fantastic. Clue quest was amazing!!!Finding the keys and codes was fun and challenging in a 1 hour journey. Great team work needed. Hope you enjoy !!!

What a fantastic experience!!!. We was taken to Clue Quest as a surprise for my husbands birthday. We didn't know what Clue Quest was and it was so exciting waiting to be taken into "our room". Our friends had done Unit52 before but this was our first time. We did Operation Blacksheep which is their newer game! I wont say too much because I don't want to spoil it for you but all I can say is it was fantastic, such a brilliant experience. You leave there wanting more! We are going to book up to go and do the other game! As soon as a new game comes out we will be there! Do it with your friends, you will love it so much! Enjoy!!

Worth every minute!!. Just back now from ClueQuest! Honestly one of the most fun activities I've done anywhere in the world! It makes you work as a team, makes you tense, make you think incredibly logically, and makes you use all your different skills, while throwing a few catches in the middle! We did the Operation B52 which was awesome! And we will definitely be back again to try the other operations!The staff are really friendly and the setup and pre-talk they give makes you feel at ease but still knowing you have a job to do! Thanks guys, loved every second of it!
A must!. A great activity for the whole family. Be quick! time fliesThe team is very professional and helpfulWe can't wait to go back to test the new one.
Would go here every week if I could!!!!. Went to London for a couple of days with my other half, teenage daughter and her friend and we loved our 60 minutes of becoming agents!!! Recommend 100%!!!!
Amazing experience!!!. Its worth going there, If there would be a choice to give more stars to clue Quest I would have given 5 more to it. Its a must visit attraction.

Operation Black Sheep!. Went with our two teenagers, ages 12 and 16. Having done Hint Hunt last summer, we knew kind of what to expect. We found OBS comparable to the Zen Room at Hint Hunt, but liked this theme much better. Some really wild clues and puzzles required thinking outside the box and lots of teamwork!!! Thanks to a few timely 'hints' from the moderator, we were able to make it through. Had one mechanical glitch along the way, but the staff took care of it and added a few minutes to our time. Nice touch. We had a blast! Will try the other room next time we're in London.

Jan. An absolute must to do! Its an activity for everyone young and old. ( Our party was 2 pensioners, 2 adults and 1 x 28yr old ). We were very apprehensive not knowing what to expect , would we manage it and or even enjoy it. We were'nt disappointed. The staff were great, we were assisted through the process and even managed to escape! Can't tell you exactly what we did as you have to experience it for yourself. We are already encouraging friends to go and would definately try out the new game when we come back for another visit.

Great fun with teens. A very different day out. We didn't know what to expect and I don't want to say too much as it is something you must experience first hand. Great staff and we all came out planning our next visit.

Great fun. We didn't know what to expect other than we had to solve clues and had an hour to do so, when we arrived all was explained and then we were left to our own devices. We discovered talents we didn't know we had, how we work as a team and also our usual habit of leaving things to the last minute, meaning our escape with 17 secs to spare! Enjoyed our time in Cluequest.

Great fun!. My family is v hard to please but all four of us (lazy mum, geeky dad, surly teen, and strictly-electronic-only ten year old boy) loved it.Just enough pressure and hints to get us through. Would def go again!

So much fun crammed into one hour.. I have done both rooms at ClueQuest now (we successfully completed Operation Blacksheep last night!) and both times I have had a blast, as has everyone in my group. I can't recommend it enough. Get there. You will be bonded and exhilarated as you leave.

Best way to "waist" an hour!. ClueQuest is so much fun! Me and my friends had absolutely no idea what to expect and had an awesome time!!!!! It's so much fun, we we're as excited as little school kids a the night before Christmas once we made it out. We saved the world!!!!! :-) we definitely will come back soon! We all highly recommend it. (Oh, and our mother tounge is not englisch, which we don't think was a problem.)
Fun fun fun. Great family night together. Interesting, challenging and really funny. The team is great. A must for anyone visiting London.

Perfect for teens and adults together.. My daughter was very keen to take a team of friends along to pit their wit against the enemy and so we booked for the school holidays.It was superb value and great fun. We were welcomed in to the building and the scene was set with good humour and as though this was fresh and interesting to the organisers too. The challenges were a good mix of moderately difficult and fiendishly difficult. We weren't left to flounder though. One of the teens who came along had the best summary:"The experience was truly 100% epic and I loved it to bits and it was awesome and argh!!!"

Excellent fun. There are not many activities that keep all my teenage children occupied, challenged and amused for an hour but this certainly did. Great fun for me too. We all want to return to try the other game. Very friendly and helpful staff too.

Brain challenging fun playground !. Its worth it. Give a new experience to yourself and your brain. 2 teenage kids and parents from Denmark will never regret or forget this special event. Use logic , teamwork and your imagination.You get to be a detective for an hour. The people behind the game are very friendly and patient. Dont worry, just do it and enjoy.

Exciting and nerve racking. Good for families aged 10+. We added to our fun by booking this experience on our recent trip to London. It was certainly one of the highlights of our vacation. Our children aged 14 and 18 both loved it. I think that those under 9 or 10 would probably not be able to fully participate in this challenge. We found it on trip advisor and had been a bit concerned before booking that we would need to know local history or have some local expertise (we are from the US), but this was clearly not the case. The puzzles are solvable with a general fund of knowledge and the ability to work as a team. It was a little tough to find their location, so be sure to give yourself a few extra minutes. We did this as an evening activity to end our day of sightseeing and it was a terrific.

Amazing experience!. 5 of us did this for a friend's birthday and we all absolutely loved it! We picked Operation Black sheep which was challenging but so much fun, definitely recommend this to anyone. Staff were great, in particular Will. Easy location to get to and we are already looking to book our next challenge.

AMAZING!. We took our two boys to this as an Easter holidays treat and it was the highlight of the holidays. Absolutely brilliant concept, and so well executed. Our 16 year old was very good, but the 12 year old struggled (though this didn't deter his enjoyment). For a party of adults this would be fantastic, and such a great team building experience. We somehow managed to complete the task - it was really challenging through. Quite hard to find the venue so give yourself plenty of time to find it.

A really fun way to spend an hour in London. This was booked by a friend of ours as my Birthday present. We'd heard about it from Trip Advisor, as it was and currently (at time of writing) still is the number one thing to do in London, but we knew very little else. Our friend had picked Operation Black Sheep. On arriving, having found the unassuming building where it's all based, you are given a basic briefing by one of the friendly staff and then taken to start your mission. Part of the fun is not knowing what to expect, the staff even ask that you not reveal anything you have seen to others. We all really enjoyed our time completing operation Black Sheep, it was an intense and entertaining hour. We're frequent visitors to central London (most weekends) and we like to try out different things each time, and of all the things we have tried or visited this is definitely near the top of our list. It was so entertaining that on the way home afterwards we booked ourselves in for Plan52 at the end of May. Fingers crossed it will be as much fun as Operation Black Sheep.

Excellent. If you want to have a different type of a good time then grab a few mates and get to cluequest for a fun time to remember!!! This is 100% fun where age doesnt matter and even children can have a great time i will not get into any detail purely because i wouldnt want to spoil it for anyone but if you live in london its worth going for it.

Great fun, and far more challenging than we had expected!. We booked ClueQuest as part of our trip to London as a way to catch up with some local friends. It was great! Challenging and far more difficult than we expected - work as a team or you won't have a hope!

Brilliant fun!. Surprised my husband on his 50th Birthday with a trip to Clue Quest. Such good fun, managed to solve some clues but our ageing brains didn't manage all of them! But we enjoyed ever minute and will be returning again soon. Staff great too
Fantastic! Can't stop smiling!. Extremely engaging, intense, and so worth the price. This is a must. Please please go to this. Everyone who goes must go.

Unique, challenging and great fun!. We took teenagers aged from 13 - 16. We booked Black Sheet and Plan52 and put an adult in each room with the two teenage groups. I would recommend at least one adult goes in with this age group this just to help things along. We all really enjoyed the challenges which were completely varied - neither group managed to get out in the hour but that didn't spoil the enjoyment. Came out buzzing about the challenges and can't wait to go back to do the room we missed. Very clever activity. Definitely need to work as a good team to succeed!Highly recommend this for any group with members from 13 years old - 93 years old!Many congrats to the Hungarian brothers that created one of the coolest things to do in London!!
Fun. We had an amazing time trying to escape the room. I can't give anything away but some of the puzzles certainly did challenge us.
Great Hour!!!. One of the BEST to-do things in London. Keep it up guys!! A great way to spend an hour and talk about it all week later.

Such a great idea!. Went here for a friend's birthday and absolutely loved it. If you used to like the Crystal Maze or now like those Escape Room apps this is definitely the activity for you! We went as two teams which took the element of competition to a whole new level. Great fun and good value for money. Have been raving about this to anyone who will listen. Can't wait to go back and try the new mission.

Fantastic night!. We completed (yippee!) the task as a group of 5. Definitely challenging but really enjoyable, great range of puzzles. I don't want to say what I enjoyed most as its much better to discover yourself. The staff were brilliant and really friendly, and they gave us printed photos of the team at the end, which was a nice touch. Would highly recommend.

Fantastic. Went for a birthday outing with six adults, so booked the two identical rooms and played 3 girls v 3 boys. Girls won by 2 minutes! Brilliant hour just flew by with so much to do and work out. It is very cleverly put together, just like a real life "escape from..." computer game. Everyone needs to work together to find everything so I think 3 would be the minimum number of people per room. We appreciated the hints given when we got a bit stuck so the game kept moving. Deserves it's top rating, staff make it a fun event, and I now carry my secret agent card with me at all times!

Fantastic!. If you're going to London, go here! You wont regret it!The idea is so creative, and also well done. We had great fun trying to get out. The staff was excellent as well. I wont say much about the mission, but you will be impressed. Definetly going back! Worth every penny!

A brilliant way to spend an hour.. We didn't know what to expect and as my kids are 9 & 13, I didn't know what they would think and how they would do in there, but they loved it!! The younger one was great at finding things low down. We'll definatly go back and would highly recommend this!!! 😄👍

Clever and original. Unique experience (at least for now). Well thought-out. The challenge was extremely difficult, but the Clue Quest leader would offer additional clues at opportune times to help our group through. My 14 year old son absolutely loved it. Highly recommended, but don't go there expecting to breeze right through the game. It takes a great deal of mental energy, and the more you put into it, the more you'll get out.

Great fun and excitement. Our group of 5 including my older parents and my 11 year old boy thoroughly enjoyed ClueQuest. We escaped the room with a mere 1:47 left on the clock. Great idea for a business.

A fantastic idea.. Brilliantly pitched so it's challenging enough to keep you guessing but not so hard that you can't do it. We had a team of 4 which felt perfect. No one was left out and we didn't trip over each other. It was like stepping into a computer game :-)

Great experience, great time. When you arrive at ClueQuest, you don't really know what to expect. You just know you're on a mission to save yourself and the world. Well, the experience is great, and all depends on your confidence and communication with your team. The staff completes the experience, making it funny and amusing. I highly recommend it!

Epic!!!. Cluequest was so unique and amazing!!! Went with two friends for a birthday and was the best birthday ever!! Everyone was so friendly and such a great atmosphere! Definitely recommend it to everyone!!! Thank you Cluequest!!
Amazing!!!. Such a unique amazing experience! Would recommended highly to everyone. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Great activity- Thank you Mr Q!

Good day out in London. Went as a family group of 5 - kids 11 & 14 loved it. ( More than 2 enthusiastic children would have been hard to keep track of what they were finding!). We all thought it was a very enjoyable experience and great value for money. It was an hour of good concentrated effort. It is cleverly done - the attention to detail makes it! Staff welcoming and friendly throughout.Well done clueQuest!

Clue Quest. What can I say? Booked this for a surprise for my hubby. He plays 'escape the room' apps all the time on the iPad.... We had an absolute blast. Team of 4 ( needed all 4 of us I would say), we had to escape 2 rooms in an hour. We did it with seconds to spare! Loved it and talked about it for ages after. Booking fir the different room for May half term!Highly recommend this

A good kind of brain ache!!. Such fun! We went as a group of four adults. Two of us had been to a similar game before, the other two had no idea what to expect. The mission briefing you're given before you start builds you up and your pulse is already racing even before they lock you in the room. Its mind bending and stressful at times, especially when you get to the last 5 minutes on the clock, but well worth it. Watch out, there are a few red herrings to mislead you! I'll definitely go again if they have a new challenge! Great for team building with colleagues or just to have fun for an hour with family & friends. Something really different.... A good kind of brain ache!

Ingenious!. An absolutely brilliant way to spend an hour. It was fun, frantic and exciting. All 5 of us thoroughly enjoyed the experience and talked about it for hours afterwards. Such a clever idea and very well executed. I will recommend it to all my friends and hope to go again soon!

Fun afternoon. We were jet lagged so we weren't as clever as necessary. They were very accommodating - we were a bit late as well. My daughter age 9 was a bit young, but still enjoyed. My 12 year old was the most helpful. I recommend but don't be foggy brained when you arrive!

Awesome. Spent the quickest hour of our lives attempting to complete the challenge in what I can only describe as the best thing we have done in a long time. Talked and laughed about it for hours afterwards. Deffo gonna do a different room soon. Well worth a visit and well done cluequest. X
loads of fun. good team building exercises. I took my team here and we had a great fun day. We stretched ourselves beyond imagination :)
