Fantastic!. Loads of fun - I really recommend this! We thought we were so smart, but it was quite tricky! We didn't finish, but the quest coordinator took us through the rest of the puzzle. If you are looking into doing this - I would say definitely!

Great time!. I took my husband and mother-in-law to clueQuest on a recent visit to London. We all love puzzles, and we had a terrific time. The hour flew by so quickly! I could have gone on solving puzzles for another four hours. There were enough puzzles to work on that we could take different areas of the room and then collect the clues as we found them. Some puzzles required teamwork to solve, and others could be done on your own. I think this would be the perfect corporate team-building activity (much better than rope courses and trust falls). This would also be great fun for families with children because the puzzles range in complexity. Our host was also very nice and friendly. We loved the storyline that went along with the puzzles.Oh--we were worried that the rooms might trigger claustrophobia since you get locked in. If that's also a concern of yours, don't worry. The rooms are spacious and well-lit, and you have access to an easy escape if you need it.

So much fun!. I went on this quest with two family members. I didn't know what to expect, which set the right mood of mystery. It was fun to work together to figure out clues--really can't say more without spoiling it. I have recommended clueQuest to my friends and coworkers, and I would go again any time.

A great experience. Myself and four of my family had a wonderful time today trying to escape from the locked rooms! There were plenty of cryptic clues in each room but if we appeared to be struggling a little we were given an helping hand. Everything was very professionally done and I am looking forward to going again when a new quest becomes available. A must for anyone who likes to solve puzzles
Amazing. I went with family, we had a total of three groups. Needless to say everyone really enjoyed themselves. Looking forward to the new rooms that!
Amazing. This is an amazing experience you get to be a detective for an hour finding clues unlocking doors and saving the world would defiantly recommend to everyone.

Great fun!. Found out about this place by pure luck, but was a great activity to finish off a day out. Organisers were really friendly and a good laugh, the activity has to be kept secret but it is amazing and great for all ages and groups. Cannot wait for them to create a new quest or extend the old one... Will definitely go again if they do! Great service, great fun... Great price!
Excellent experience. Such a fun immersive experience. I'd not done anything like it before and I enjoyed every second. Highly recommended!

Amazing! Best thing I've done this year. Organisers are really friendly and nice. The actual activity was really great, worked as a team, testing your skills in finding and determining clues. Would recommend to everyone.

Can't recommend this enough - do it!. I saw this by chance, and thank goodness for that. We had a brilliant time.! It's actually quite local to us anyway, so we parked there (plenty of parking, you just ask for a visitor permit on arrival), but it's also on the Victoria Line and would be worth the tube journey.We managed to escape with a couple of minutes to spare and were actually disappointed that it was all over - we wanted to keep going! There is so much I want to rave about this experience, but don't want to ruin it for anyone thinking of booking. Don't think about it for a moment longer. I'm recommending it to everyone. Excellent!

It's a secret!. It took us 56:46 seconds working as a team to get out of the room!! We have never done anything like this before and hadn't practised so the fact that we escaped was as much of a surprise to us as to anyone else.It's a really fun thing to do, trying to solve the puzzles & clues, there were a few 'Red Herrings' along the way but we did it.I would recommend you give it a try and we would love to do it again.

Boys V Girls. An absolute blast! We didnt know quite what to expect but we all had so much fun! A challenging and enjoyable experience which brings out the spy side of you. Locked in a room for an hour with the clock ticking, challenging yourselves, solving puzzles and working together whilst laughing and may i add - sweating. A totally awesome experience! Totally recommended!! Absolutely up for the next one.

Great fun. Four of us had an amazing time here with two friends that were visiting. It's a bit out of the way as others have said, but even though we were a few minutes late we had no trouble. Everyone was super friendly and the experience itself was soooooo much fun. We can't wait until they open their new rooms in a few months to check those out too! The owner is from Hungray and said these are quite big in Budapest too. Can't wait to try one out in a few months!

Amazing!. Such a fun experience! Amazing how quickly your brain can work when you're up against a timer! Did it with 58 seconds left! Such a fun little thing to do and had a really good laugh. Highly recommended!

Brilliant experience for our group of 11 year old boys!. It's often very difficult to find something fun, interesting and challenging on a Saturday morning that is until I came across ClueQuest. What a brilliant find! The boys who are aged 11 loved working together to solve the numerous clues together to make it before the hour expired. Really well thought out and detailed game, really interesting and fun. Highly recommend!! We will be back to try out the new rooms when they arrive.

Great fun and a real challenge. We booked this as something different to do for our son's 13th birthday and it was fantastic! There were 3 of us in the team and we all enjoyed it immensely. Some of the puzzles were really challenging but as you are working as a team someone usually had a brainwave at some point! I would recommend this for families, friends, team building events anyone who enjoys puzzles will love this. We will definitely be back next time we are down in London, I can't recommend this highly enough.

Book this NOW!!. This was bought for my sister's birthday, and I can honestly say it's one the most brilliant things we have ever done! Four of us went, and we laughed our way through every element of this challenging but fun event. There is fun for all ages (and capabilities!) and I cannot recommend it highly enough. Brilliant fun, fantastic staff and I can't wait for the new rooms to open so we can go again!

Great Fun!. Anyone who enjoys any kind of puzzle solving / game playing will thoroughly enjoy this experience. It's a kind of cross between The Crystal Maze and Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy. The puzzles are challenging but not impossible, and the recommended number of 3-5 players means that even if some of you are stuck, one of you should still get the eureka moment. There are red herrings too, so not everything you find will actually be part of a puzzle (very annoying when you've been racking your brain to see how it fits in!). The game is well organised, and the organiser(s) friendly and welcoming - you get the sense they enjoyed watching you solving the puzzles as much as you enjoyed soving them. It looks a bit out of the way, but is actually very easy to get to from central London. It'll be interesting to see how often they change the puzzles, and whether that means you can go back more than once - I'd happily do somehting similar again!

The most amazing fun.. As a surprise my partner booked me and four friends into a game at Clue Quest. It took us 46 minutes (with no clues) to escape. It was challenging, exciting and thrilling. I could not recommend it highly enough. We escaped six hours ago and I'm still smiling. Brilliant!

Great Night out. We booked for 10 people, boys v girls ....everyone had a great time, a lot of fun, awesome night out would recommend to everyone to experience. We can't wait to go back for a re-match.

A fantastic way to spend an afternoon for all ages. We have just had the best time ever. It is sometimes tricky to find an activity to suit all three of us - 59, 51 and 12. This was just perfect. We only had a vague idea of what to expect. Cluequest is not in the most accessible area but worth the little effort to get there with easy parking once you have arrived. Gabor and Stephanie were so hospitable and made us feel really welcome, set up the event and built the anticipation well. I think we ran around like headless chickens for the first ten minutes but soon got into the zone. We didn't actually make it to the end within our alloted time but there was no point where we were being rushed out to make way for the next group. Instead, Gabor and Stephanie talked us through the clues we missed and allowed us the extra time to finish off Cluequest with their help. We all left buzzing. Give Cluequest a go. You won't be disappointed. We will be back when they open their second Cluequest in the same building.

Fantastic fun!. After our initial prep we were let loose at Clue Quest and it was amazing fun! Great team work, individual sleuthing and pure luck got us through with 5 seconds to spare. What a fantastic night, I would recommend it to everyone who likes to investigate, have fun and run around. Great night out with friends.

100% fun and challenge!. Such a great experience! 60 minutes seems like 60 seconds and there's a surprise at every corner! So much fun combined with racking the brain! The hosts are very welcoming and funny and make the whole experience worthwhile! Recommend to anyone- young or old!

Such Good Fun!!! Totally recommended.... A friend took us along, after he saw an offer, and it was so much fun. The four of us managed to complete this with 2:08 to spare - which we were well pleased about! None of us knew what to expect and arrived to meet Gabor, who inducted us into the nature of our experience. It was such good fun, really well put together and properly tested our reasoning skills. This would be suitable for all people, and can imagine is as great for a group of friends as it is a family. Would totally do this again (with new quests) and highly recommend to anyone.

Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!. This was a Birthday present and I had no idea what to expect...but we all LOVED it. Such a cool idea and it really makes you think and is challenging yet fun. The clues are hidden all over the place so everyone gets involved and plays a part. The staff are friendly and loads of fun. Would recommend this to everyone.Nicole

Unique and thoroughly enjoyable!. I took my boyfriend here with some friends as a suprise birthday gift. It turned out to be the perfect trip, we all had a great time and got very excited solving all the puzzles. It was much more professional and detailled than I was expecting and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this to anyone who has the slightest interest in solving puzzles and working as a team, and I'm definitely coming back again when new rooms are available. The best trip out I've ever had!

Great fun!. I heard about this kind of game from a friend and decided to visit ClueQuest.We went as a group of 3 and had a really good time. I can see this type of game becoming a big thing over the coming years as it's fun for all ages and a different challenge altogether!

Fantastic experience. Such a unique way to spend an evening, loved it and a great sense of achievement if you manage to get out within the hour. The organisers are fantastic and make the whole experience even better. Would definitely recommend!

What's the opposite of boring and run of the mill?? This is!. I was a bit dubious at first as I had never been and was not sure what to expect. However, the staff were amazingly welcoming and made at least 50% of the experience. That's not to take away how good the rest of the experience was; interesting and worth while. I would recommend anyone to go and try it. Best in 4 or more otherwise you might find it harder to achieve the 60 min goal. Think crystal maze but without having to get wet or be on tv :)

Finally, something a bit different!. As a more mature team (no-one under 25!) we were a bit worried this might not be for us-however on getting there we were assured that it catered for all ages and it absolutely did! The first 10 minutes we were pretty baffled as to how the game worked, but you soon get into the swing of it. Great game concept and really is something for everyone to do - an hour just flew by! Staff were friendly and enthusiastic, building in a story and giving hints where needed. Can't wait for them to open another game so we can go again!

Great fun!. I was dreading this outing as I'm a bit claustrophobic but I went with my husband and grandson and had a really exciting time. Some of the clues were a bit obscure and there were a lot of "red herrings" but overall I would recommend this to any would be spies!

Absolutely Fantastic! A must do in London!. I had a fantastic time! Having read the previous Trip Advisor reviews I was very excited and had high hopes! It was better than I thought! The team got so excited when a key or code was found! Looking forward to the two new rooms being built for November and March! Will 100% return to complete these 2 new rooms!

Incredible fun - you've got to try it. This is a really unique and challenging experience. You're constantly stimulated from the moment the door shuts behind you to when you solve the final puzzle (if you get there!). Our host was great and explained things very clearly; you can sense their enthusiasm and love of the game which adds to the whole experience. Don't be put off by the location, it's an easy walk from Tottenham Hale station, and when you're finished you'll be on such a high from the adrenaline that you won't care where you are. This is such an exciting and different thing to do, and you won't have experienced anything like it. I'll definitely be returning when they launch their new puzzles.

60 minutes of panic!. Absolutely work checking out if you enjoy the 100 doors type games. Clues are provided by the hosts if you get stuck, other than that it's down to you and your friends to ransack the rooms to unlock the doors to the exit. Remember that just because you've left one room it doesn't mean you're finished with it!

Had an amazing time!. My friend sorted out a day of random activities and none of us had any idea what we were going to be doing. The best activity of the day was definitely clueQuest, it's such a unique idea and it was great fun for a group of friends (there were four of us) to work together to solve the problems!I'll definitely be returning when they open their second set of rooms!

Better than Imagined. Because of the nature of the evening, we hadn't set our expectations high. We thought it would be a couple of cross-words, finish a game of connect-4 and call it a night. However the event is the best fun we've had in London. Everybody really, really enjoyed themselves and the hosts (in mission control) were brilliant at getting us in the mood for escaping the room. Especially considering we did the late-night, 10pm session so actually had to escape or we couldn't get home. We managed to escape in just under an hour with a couple of clues from Mission Control. We would definitely recommend this and look forward to new rooms opening.

A totally different experience!. Booked this on Groupon as something different for my daughter's 14th birthday with her friends. Didn't know what to expect, and we weren't disappointed. All 8 girls loved it and said it was the best birthday "party" they'd ever been to. One team made it out the other didn't, so plenty of bragging rights! They all want to go again once the new rooms are open - and this time we'll give it a go as well.

Great afternoon of fun. We took our friends as a surprise as a birthday gift. They didn't know what was happening until we were greated by our mission controllers ( who were very friendly, helpful and good in character ) we found the clues just the right level- hard enough to make us think but not impossible!! Can't wait for more rooms to be opened in Bibember we will be ack for another mission......

excellent so much fun. What a brilliant concept. Crystal Maze and The Da Vinci Code all rolled into 1 hour of fun. The clock counting down adds real excitement and pressure, we barely made it out with only one second remaining!
Absolutely excellent!. Really good experience, even finding the building was a bit of an exercise! Great way to spend a few hours. Really enjoyed it!

Amazing and such great fun!!. My boyfriend and I spent the weekend in London and stumbled across ClueQuest on a google search of "things to do in London" and were intrigued so booked it....we were definitely not disappointed!! I can honestly say the whole experience; from the friendly and helpful staff to the detail gone into the planning of the challenge was excellent. Although it is recommended for 3-5 people, we braved it as a couple and the staff were brilliant in making slight alterations to suit 2 people, including giving us some much needed clues!! Highly recommend giving ClueQuest a go, so different from anything we've ever done and can't wait to go back in November to try out the new room!!

We'll be talking about it for years, fantastic. We decided to do something different and try out Cluequest and we were so glad we did. The 1 hr task is challenging but never frustrating as timely prompts from the organisers soon get you back on track. It's all well thought out and the staff were brilliant and equally enthusiastic. Book it now! Will be back in November for the new room.

Brilliant way to spend a couple of hours!. Excellent experience which appeals to all ages. Works well with friends or as a team building. Would definately recommend and looking forward to the new room opening!!

Brilliant Locked Room Adventure Game!. Highly recommend this to everyone! Amazing way to spend an hour with friends! We had such a fun time and enjoyed the clues and challenges. It just gets better and better and working against the clock is such a thrill. Altogether absolutely brilliant and a great birthday treat for my friend. Can't wait for more rooms...

An amazingly unique experience!. Thoroughly enjoyed our 'escape'! We made it with 11 seconds to spare!This is so unique, we've never done anything like it before. Clues and tasks were sufficiently challenging (sometimes frustratingly so!) but accessible enough to be rewarding, especially with the helpful hints! We can't wait for them to expand to more rooms in the near future and we are already looking forward to going back! Thanks for a brilliant time!

Fantastic hour of fun.. If you love puzzles and friends who can stayed focused for an hour then this is the place for you.I took part in a group of 5 and the puzzles definitely cover a wide range of areas. Each member of our team brought their own strengths to the table and so we were able to escape the room.The key is to search individually rather than grouping together and most importantly communicate what you've found with you're team and make sure to double check every corner of the room (preferably get a second person to double check).We had an absolutely amazing time. I can't recommend this place enough.

Awesome!!. We had such a great time! Massively exceeded my expectations, great experience, challenging, great all round experience and excellent service. We were 2 groups of 3, so the first group was able to watch the 2nd at work, which was great. I can't wait for the more rooms to be available, will definately go back!

Gets You Working as a Team. Recommend this for families - but would work for a group of friends or a work team-builder. Getting there by public transport is ok - get the tube or train to Tottenham Hale station; go out the station exit where the buses to Stanstead go from; past the bus stops and right onto Watermead Way. Cross the dual carriageway at the lights where you go left along Burdock Road (by the red railings of the Techno Park). Turn right and follow signs for Main Reception. All in all it's a five minute walk.The challenge is just right - there are plenty of clues available if you need them. And it makes for a really engaging, enjoyable experience where you have to work together to escape. The only draw back is that for a few days afterwards you may find yourself checking the underside of tables and looking for hidden numerical sequences in all sorts of places!

Excellent. At last something new in entertainment. Took the family to try this out two 16 year older a 20year old and two mid 40,s. It was a great hour and a half. Challenging and fun team work. The staff were friendly and helpful and the venue was clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend. The time flew. Would definitely go again.
Random awesome fun. This was such a good time. We had no idea what to expect, but had loads of fun. Such a simple idea but so well executed. Really recommend as a different day out with friends.

AMAZING!!!!!!. Just literally got back from Cluquest and I had to write a review about how good it was. An hour of challenging fun which has to be experienced to fully appreciate. A truly one off experience I would recommend to everyone, I can't wait to go back to try the new rooms!!

Absolutely amazing. One of the best hours of my life! We got this on groupon and didn't have a clue what to expect. Very friendly hosts that got us in the spirit of solving clues. Challenging clues that kept us working as a team throughout! Just made it with 36 seconds to spare. A nice photo at the end to remember the day. Would recommend to anyone and everyone! Fantastic!!

Well worth it. We went as a group of 4 - I had very little pre-knowledge which was a good thing. Very fun, and we just managed to 'win' in the hour. Wont say too much more as it would lessen the experience!Will be going back when they add new content.

Excellent but needed a little more time - Kish. I went with my family. We really enjoyed the experience. We ran out of time to escape the final room. Half hour more we would have escaped. It is well organised and you are being watched all the time. Worth it!

Such a fab evening. So much better than I could have imagined. My friend bought this for us as a Groupon. We didn't know what to expect. We thought perhaps we'd be sitting at tables doing wordsearches & sudoku. Won't say too much as don't want to give the game away but we had an hour of real fun. It was great to work with our friends as a team. Our host was lovely & fun. Will def go again when there are new rooms

A must for anyone who likes a challenge!. An hour well spent!! Very well organised and a very cool concept. All for a reasonable price. Definitely one of a kind and one of the best ways to spend an evening :)

So difficult we couldn't even find the place! ;P. 3 of us went for clueQuest and had trouble locating the carpark (it was night time and pouring in our defence but still didn't bode well for our sleuthing skills!). The host was very friendly and rescued us before we embarrassed ourselves totally. Boy, did we underestimate the game! It was sufficiently difficult without being too frustrating and we totally enjoyed what felt like a very short hour. The 'warning' clues were brilliant and didn't give away too much. It was really good fun and the host was kind enough to let us finish the game with his help (he let us finish the game ourselves but gave us major clues). We felt bad taking so long since we were the last group. We really recommend it but it would be easier with a group of 4 or more. Don't expect to have the time to ponder over clues for too long! Would definitely go back again when they have more rooms. Excited already!!! Oh and the photograph taken and given to all three of us as a memento was a nice touch. FUN FUN FUN!

Clue Quest. Fantastic experience. Would do it again and again if my mind could be erased so I didn't know where to find things. Such a great time had by all. The puzzles were very clever. In fact the whole thing was really cleverly done. Everyone should do this as least once!

Best One hour I've spent!. This experience game really took the cake! I hardly even noticed we were in there for an hour and I wished I could go back in time so I could do it all over again!Mr Q sent us to save the world in 60 minutes, and fortunately for you, we did!! Took us 59 minutes and 10 seconds too!The game itself was immensely fun and challenging even for avid puzzle solvers, from solving the puzzles and riddles to actually searching for the puzzles to be solved! some were right in front of us and we didn't spot them outright!Most of all, you get to see 2-4 of your friends, rampaging around the room like headless chickens! Would do this again in a heartbeat!Can't wait for Mr Q to set up his new room(s) this winter!

Full of surprises. The less you know, the more fun this can be... Without giving much away, you're tasked with solving a whole heap of mini-puzzles within the hour to escape from a set of rooms. There's a lot to do in the time and you genuinely have to work as a team of 3, 4 or 5 people to get out of the room in time.The set-up is very friendly, with safety and comfort very much in mind. It's quite a challenge but you are fed clues if you get seriously stuck. It's ideal for a wide range of people - families with older children, groups of friends or even as a business team building exercise.The location is very handy for the Tube and the North Circular (free parking on site too) so give it a go!

Brill. Had such a great time with MrQ! Would strongly recommend this experience.We started off a bit slow but made it out of the room with a minute to spare!!...thanks to a few clues :)Its such a clever idea and very well executed

SO fun!. Such a different thing to do, but so much fun. Easy to find, near a tube station. Gabor was friendly, got into the role, gave us the instructions for the mission, and only told us what we needed to know. We just managed to solve the clues and get out of the room before out time was up. We were given a few extra clues, but not too many, so felt a real sense of achievement when we got out of the room. Something unique to do, and easy to get to from Central London, indoors so good when British weather plays up.Recommend you do it at least once - looking forward to going again when there are new rooms!
Lots of fun!!!. Went to Cluequest today - had a group of 5 people and it was a lot of fun! Worth 60 mins of your time! Will definitely go again once they open up more rooms.

Something different- This is going to be big really big in London one day!. Absolutely amazing experience- great hosts! A brilliant day out with friends / family. Something different - it's basically like being the lead characters in your own 007 movie. The concept is simple- use the clues to get the codes to get out of the rooms in 60 mins, but the way it is created is so smart- it must take some real brains to set up the scenario- almost everything set up in the room is there for a reason. Go there with an open mind (don't be put off by the location) and you won't be disappointed.

Absolutely brilliant. Great fun for the whole family. Went to this with my parents and partner, and we had the best time. Gabo who runs the event is so charming and fun, and looks like he is having fun. Can't give away too much of the quest itself because that would spoil it, but if you've ever played an escape the room style adventure game then you will love it. The tasks are challenging, even for a group of 4 adults, but it's great fun and very satisfying working it all out.The only disappointment is that I can't go again, until they reconfigure the puzzles!
Worth the trip to a Zone 3 tube stop!. Very friendly and a unique experience worth taking the kids. It was fun for all of us and well thought out with clues and hints! Just go!

ClueQuest is brilliant even for the Clueless!. My sister, niece and I tried out ClueQuest today, we were not expecting to be much good but just wanted to do something different and something fun. That we certainly got and we did much better than we anticipated although we didn't manage to complete the quest within the hour. A brilliant, challenging and well thought idea which I hope does really well. Our Hungarian ClueQuest agent, gave us our mission and instructions and told us only what we needed to know. He was really friendly, good humoured and made us feel at ease. We all loved it and enjoyed it immensely. This is something for everyone, for family and friends or even for the corporate market for a great team building activity. We look forward to coming again, and seeing any more locked rooms - now we know that you really do have to look into every nook and cranny in the room, never assume there is nothing else inside a cupboard draw, plant pot or behind a cushion! Thanks you guys we LOVED IT!! Agent Ivana, 007 and Dani. :-)

Room escape at its best!. This attraction is a must for anyone who has sat for hours trying to find clues in the room escape games that are available on PC's and mobile phones. I went with my daughter, son-in-law, husband and granddaughter, it was totally amazing. We were briefed very well before entering the room and wow what an experience. The hour went so quickly but we enjoyed every minute, we were buzzing when we came out and haven't stopped talking about it since. This activity is for anyone looking for something different to do with family, friends or work colleagues. We all became secret agents and had our picture taken at the end with fridge magnets to take home. The directions given to find the building are very clear and made it easy to locate and is very close to the station. Thank you for such an amazing morning and we hope to see you again in the future.

We saved the world!. I have always wanted to do something like this and when I saw the groupon for cluequest I was immediately sold. I am happy to say it surpassed my expectations and hope the business does really well. Me and my friends can't wait to come back for more! If you are looking for something to do with friends or family, I'd highly recommend this. It's such a fun experience and the hour flew by. At the end of it, we were left wanting to do more! I also have to praise the lovely guy who managed our game. He was extremely friendly and funny, and made the experience very enjoyable. I'd easily pay full price for this experience again if they do make new rooms :)

Interesting, challenging and fun. If you've enjoyed watching programmes like 'The Adventure game' or 'The Crystal Maze' then this is for you. A very different, fun way to spend an hour, you are locked in a room and have 60 minutes to solve puzzles and clues to padlock combinations to escape the room (or rooms!). The game is very cleverly designed and the guy running it was not only very cute but friendly and helpful. We were pretty hopeless and would probably have needed another 30 minutes. I can't wait until they add another room so I can give it another try! Highly recommended.

Great fun - something unique!. We had six people go to ClueQuest, and split up into teams of 3. It was one of the highlights of our time in London and something we will remember doing together - a great change of pace from the normal tourist attractions. The host was really friendly, explained everything well, and added to the experience! Directions on ClueQuest's website made it really easy to get to on the Tube, so don't worry about it being away from other tourist attractions. Definitely worth going and checking out - we did it with family, but would be fun for co-workers, friends, or any group!

Perfect for any group. Think of those free escape games on the internet when you wake up in a strange room and you need to find and solve clues to escape. This is EXACTLY like that. Its "The Crystal Maze" without the harmonica (though there is some cool 'movie soundtrack' music piped through to add to the atmosphere.)I went with my 11 year old son and my 29 year old boyfriend as a "team building" exercise for our new family. We've been to Laser Quest shooting things, bowling, arcades, museums, climbing walls, films and restaurants in a range of cities of varying price and quality and CLUE QUEST is without a doubt the best thing we have enjoyed so far.Both my boys are still talking about it two weeks later and I am booking my friends at work to go very soon. You will absolutely not regret going to this attraction. While you may have reservations about the experience or the suitability for your little gang but I can assure you that it will be the best thing you do. We cannot wait to have the new rooms open up so we can do it again!

A fantastic hour of brain teasing excitement. My 3 boys (aged 11 to 15) and I visited Clue Quest this weekend and had a blast.As has been mentioned, the location is a bit out of the way (though there is a tube station not far away), so pay attention to the directions.Once you get there, the host does a great job of making you feel welcome and preparing you for the challenges ahead.Without giving anything away, you are locked in a room and must escape. You will be faced with an escalating series of puzzles which do not require specialist knowledge or super strength. Anyone can take part. And while the minutes of your hour seem to be ticking away slowly enough at first, time is suddenly running away from you. You have to put on your best team work to get through all the challenges.We were just 2 minutes short of escaping the room and the kids were raving about the place once we were done. They had tons of fun and worked together for that whole hour (something that's not always a given between brothers :) ).Everyone had a fantastic time and we'd love to visit the new location if Clue Quest really opens one this autumn.

Unforgettable experience!. Although it does seem a little pricey, this will be something you will talk about for a long time. Its something you can tell people you have done and they will wish they were with you when you did it. It was completely worth it. The location was a little dodgy but the receptionist was lovely and the guy running clueQuest made you feel welcome right away. It was very well thought out and very well planned. We played the game with 3 people and it was challenging but very captivating. Just needed 5 more minutes! Once we were done we came straight home and looked for more live room escapes in London to do! Brilliant idea and very well executed! I just wish that clueQuest had more rooms available now to play!

Great experience. The aim of the game is to escape a room in 60 minutes solving a series of puzzles and misteries. For anyone liking escapism games is the best experience you can have in London. Well detailed and very good attention to details on every imaginable aspect makes this experience a "must do". Even better if you are able to escape the room in the allowed time (we weren´t, but that doesn´t change the fact that we enjoyed it thoroughly).The location, close to a tube station, is easy to find, but a more central location would push this attraction even further.Try it!

Absolutely amazing experience!. This experience is so hard to put in words, but me and my siblings loved every minute of it and agreed that it was the highlight of our holiday. It's the closest feeling I've had to when I was a child and was obsessed with adventure/ role playing type computer games, absolutely thrilling. A must try for anyone with a sense of adventure!
Brilliant Fun. A great activity for an hour. clueQuest is really fun, enjoyable and most importantly suitable for anyone. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Definitely worth doing!

An awesome idea that's even better to play. The concept is a brilliant one - 60 minutes to solve a series of clever clues to escape a locked room. Or possibly rooms? Just you wait and see! Actually, don't wait, you only have an hour to escape. And man, will you have fun doing it. The game is very well put together: the pacing and escalation of puzzles is just right and it never feels unfairly complicated. You'll have joyful moments of realisation as you figure things out for yourself, and the advice given when you're truly stuck is nicely done and cryptic. I can't recommend this experience highly enough - you'll feel genuinely triumphant as you solve it, and have loads of laughs on the way. Quick before it sells out!

cluequest fun unique something for everyone. Had a great time at clue quest in Tottenham Hale. With out spoiling to much about the details its a room escape puzzle solving maze of fun. Tests you and pushes you to the peak of your mental abilities all the while making it fun at the same time. I would recommend that you go with 2 groups to see which team does it faster.would highly consider going again because its so much fun.

Can't wait to go again. I went to this with 4 friends in July 2013 and we all had a fantastic time. The guy who met us was friendly, professional and funny and the game itself was challenging, fun and way exceeded my expectations. We managed to escape with a few minutes to spare (phew!).We've all agreed we'll be going back again if and when they do another one.Something unique to do in London. Highly recommended!

As good as Hint Hunt. The best thing I can say about this new business is that it is as good as HintHunt and that says a lot. The place is a bit hidden in a tech park so please keep an eye on the isntructions to find the place beforehand. Nevertheless, the staff is fantastic and helpful. Made our experience wonderful and had great patience with us. The facilities are good and the design of the game is absolutely fantastic. You might need some hints but nothing is crazy. Most of the time, you will be amazed how you passed clues in front of your eyes. I believe that is a great activity with friends or family. I think the price is justified and the experience is of something that it is hard to match even in London.Go for it, it is worth trying!

Glorious fun. I can only thank the friend I have who found this so many times. This was a wonderful way to spend 60 minutes - it was as much fun as it sounds. If you're like me and screaming "shut up and take my money!" but for the fear that it might turn out to be a disappointment well then worry not; it lived up to the ideas I had in my mind for how cool it would be.

What an amazing time!!!. We wanted to do something different as a family (kids aged 10-15), and came across an offer for Cluequest on Groupon.It was amazing fun and just hit the right spot in terms of difficulty/challenge. Possibly an extra 15 minutes to be able to solve everything would have been welcome.It was really well run and we were helped through by clues popping up on screen when we appeared to be stuck. It was all very original and well thought-out. They mentioned they might be opening up another game with more rooms in the Autumn and we will definitely go back if that happens.Thanks for a great afternoon of fun.
Great fun!!!. We went with a family, 2 kids 14 & 11. So much fun & stress at the same.. can't wait for them to do a new area to go again. HIGHLY recommended!!

We Made It!!!!. We were looking for something to do as a family to entertain a visiting family member and this was ideal! We had so much fun working through the clues and codes together and Gabs was very accommodating and helpful! It's local, and such a good team activity! I would recommend this to any groups/teams/friends/families who enjoy a mind challenge. Looking forward to the next stage of the challenge!

Great Family Fun!. While in London, we were looking for something fun to do. We came across this company and luckily they had a last minute opening for us. We had a hard time finding them at first. It's located in a large corporate building and their were no signs to show the way, but after asking around, we finally found it. They were quite new and had not gotten the signs put up yet, but it was worth the trouble. They probably have signs now.Very nice people, and the game was amazing! We are a family of 4, and we had such a great time working together to solve the clues to open the doors. I wish we had a place like that in the states...and the next time to go to London, we will definitely do it again!The whole thing is designed to complete in about an hour. They give you clues if you need them via a radio and tv system. It was really cool! Never have we done anything like it. It's a great idea and if you are ever in London, you have to try this out! It's for groups of 3-8 I think. Thanks Clue Quest for a great time! One of the highlights of our trip!!!

Absolutely fantastic escape experience. Our team had previously been to HintHunt, another room escape game, and loved it, so when we saw there was a new room escape company, we leapt right on it.We were thrilled to discover it was even better than HintHunt. These games are apparently massive in Hungary, but only just starting here. It's a simple premise - you're locked in a room, you have to solve a load of puzzles to get out. If you've ever watched Now Get Out of That or the Crystal Maze or the Adventure Game and wished you could have a go, you will absolutely love this experience. The first thing you have to do is search thoroughly - clues could be anywhere, and some are very deviously hidden. Then you have to solve the clues to unlock cupboards and boxes - which lead to more clues. The thing I especially love about ClueQuest is that it's designed to be possible to solve without help. At HintHunt, they constantly feed you hints through a monitor, and without those hints you'd have no chance of solving the room. But at ClueQuest, you really get to test your mettle, because they don't give you clues unless you ask for them (or you're very obviously in need of help). We didn't ask for a single clue, and were all the more proud of our success as a result.The puzzles are really creative, the rooms are beautifully put together, and all in all I'd recommend this to absolutely anyone. Don't be put off by the trek to Tottenham Hale, or by the slightly battered business park - ClueQuest itself is an absolute joy. It's a brand new business (hence the out-of-town location - doubtless they'll move somewhere more central once they've been going for a while) and run by some really lovely guys. Gabor's enthusiasm at our success made the experience even more fun, and we had a lovely time after the escape re-living the game puzzles with him!

Challenging, fun and frenetic!. From the minute we stepped into the game's first room, we were hooked. Fiendish and ingenious puzzles are everywhere, with codes to be worked out, padlocks to be unlocked and secrets to find. It's definitely a team game, at times we were working things out individually, at others all trying to crack codes as a team. And when we got stuck, there were extra subtle clues to point us in the right direction, courtesy of the games master watching us scurry round the room via CCTV! A scary soundtrack heightens the tension and the countdown clock keeps your heart racing.... we escaped with 9 seconds to spare and tumbled out of the room energised, excited and very very pleased to have worked it out. clueQuest is based near Tottenham Hale and it's a bit of a mission to find it - but in a way, that all adds to the experience.

Fantastic brain workout!. clueQuest was epic - our team, veterans of a similar London game called HintHunt, loved the challenges and the creativity behind the room. Although the location isn't as central as HH, taking half an hour on the tube from Paddington, it's close enough to the underground station and has plenty of parking. The CQ team are a massively friendly bunch and we had a whale of a time. Of course, that may have been because we were the first paying customers ever and because we completed it in 51 of the 60 minutes available - consider that our challenge! Definitely worth the trip.

Fantastic! We are still smiling from the experience!. We would thoroughly recommend a trip to the Mystery Cube! This was an hour of fantastic family fun that tested our brains and abilities to work together and as individuals towards the Escape. It was great finding an escape room in South West London.That we didn't quite escape doesn't matter, we had great fun trying and we were still buzzing with the excitement the day after. This was our first escape room and it will be difficult to beat. Our thanks go to Professor QB who was the perfect host.We challenge our friends to see if they can manage what we came so close to...Escape!!

Super fun escape game!. We went as a group of 4 and had a great time, even though we didn't quite make it out in time! It has everything you'd expect from an escape game, but you get to all work simultaneously on different things rather than all 4 of you having to work on same task before moving on. Really good variety of puzzles to solve and the Professor is good fun. Apologies for all our swearing in the cube!! Tension was high!
Great fun!. A brilliantly fun and challenging escape room experience. The hour flew by and I would highly recommend it!
Great fun. First experience of escape room, it was great fun, went as a group of 4 which is probably a good size. The host was very good made the visit nice and fun. definitely recommend.

Still Smiling after a week. This was the first escape room we've done so wasn't sure what to expect but it was amazing!! There were four of us and there was loads for everyone to do, none of us were ever just standing around waiting for someone else to solve something, with a good variety of puzzles.We left with a real buzz and it's a shame we can't do it again.Above all the host was great fun, thanks very much Professor!

awesome . location is good if you live close by as it isnt in central london. had low expectations as it is located in an industrial area...went in to the qurst and came out buzzying. Loved every moment of the quest and difinatly above my expectations . very challenging for the two of us. absolutely recommend!

Great fun. Very entertaining trip. Mystery cube is simple but great fun. The professor who guides you through does a very good job of adding to the intrigue. Took my 12 year old and his mate for a trip and we all had a great time.

First Class Mystery Magic. From start to finish, this was simply amazing. Beautifully hosted, tantalisingly tricky and worth every penny. This is a must for beginners and 'seasoned' escapists alike. We had a ball - thank you professor!!

Very good yet barely themed puzzle box. The room is great fun with lots of interesting and often original puzzles. Full custom-built puzzle-box-type room, not just and apartment with lots of "don't touch this light switch" stickers. Medium difficulty, nice host. Very non-linear, so it won't happen that one player solves a puzzles while the others wait for them. Only minus point for a few bits which depend on "finding things" instead of "solving things", but definitely a recommendation for new and experienced players.

Excellent family fun. If you're looking for something a little different on a Sunday afternoon. Look no further. Mystery cube is great value for money and excellent fun. Get yourself locked in a cube and try an beat the clock to solve all the puzzles to free yourself. We went as a family of five and met the wonderful Miss Terry who after giving us our safety talked monitored us from a far to make sure we didn't get stranded. Great mental work out and a lot of fun. Can't say anymore as I wouldn't want to spoil the surprise.

Trapped in the Mystery Cube. Our session in the Mystery Cube was a birthday party treat for my daughter and two other 11yo children. I was worried they would struggle - but they had a huge amount of fun, and their fast, curious approach to everything was infectious. The whole experience was very well put together...would absolutely recommend it.

The quickest hour ever. I can't believe how fast this hour went.
I went with three friends and had a great time searching for clues and keys. 4 seemed to be a good number as we could play to our individual strengths. I would highly recommended!
Really hope another cube lands somewhere again so I can have another go!

Excellent fun with the puzzles and codes!. We had a fabulous time and spent ages afterward trying to figure out all the different bits to help it all make sense. We went as a group of four which felt ideal-enough to get the clues but also kept very busy over the hour! The professor was very entertaining and the mystery cube was clearly very well thought out and designed. Can't recommend this highly enough as an excellent way to get your brain working - solving each clue was way more satisfying than I expected!!
Fantastically puzzling ^^. Great puzzles everywhere, everything was always relevant. As a note, probably best to do this as a bigger group of 3 or 4, because there's a lot to do!

Awesomely fun, can't wait for the next chapter!. The professor was a very entertaining character and we were drawn into an exciting and mysterious adventure from the start. Was impressed how imaginative and intriguing the experience was. It was a super fun and out the box (or should I say in the box, I'm not sure) afternoon and thoroughly recommend it!

Great experience made fantastic by the staff. I took my girlfriend and her family to the mystery cube experience for her birthday. The professor who greeted us was both funny and welcoming and added a personal touch which made the experience much more enjoyable. He explained the secrets of the cube to us and we began the challenge. The hour flew by as we were surrounded by a number of different puzzles and challenges that were taxing but exciting and got steadily more difficult as time went on. Overall it was a great experience and I would 100% recommend it to anyone!

Definitely hope there is a sequel... . So what happens when a random cube appears out of nowhere in an office in Morden? People get to have a great time! Our guide was helpful and funny, the cube exciting and fairly challenging, definitely for 2 players but very fair. It's good for both escape game veterans and new players in my opinion, just go in with an open mind and prepare to have fun solving a whole range of puzzles. Thankyou very much.

Great evening!. Really enjoyable evening, the professor was amazing and really made this a great experience- highly recommend, the cube was challenging but fun and a great way to spend time with friends!
Date. Took the miss here for a date and had so much fun. I can't say to much as it would give the game away but highly recommend it

Great fun, definitely reccomend!. A brilliant way to engage your brain and have fun whilst doing it. The professor is great as well and really helps bring the experience to life. If you want something to do as a group or even a couple that's fun and a bit different then give this a go.

Excellent dose of mystery fun!. Really enjoyable escape room game. As a family, we've done a couple now and the energy and enthusiasm of the owner is infectious. Stay in character all the way through (it's an alien mystery cube!!) if that's your thing or just really enjoy the puzzles, games and suspense of getting out within the allocated time. Lots and lots of fun - with the observation summary afterwards being a key part of the entertainment!

Great experience!. Well,when arriving we thought we'd been stitched up as is on an industrial site with no signs.. Finally found the right building and thought oh no this looks bad lol.. As soon as we were in and got taken through the rules etc it started to feel better- the lady was great! The experience itself was fantastic- won't say too much to ruin it but me and the rest of the group had an amazing time, loving every min, working together to solve things. Very clever and I'll be going to more of these in other areas.

Brilliant!. My first time going to a Mystery-Cube, which became a really fun experience! A very great place with a very fun and enthusiastic Professor. Don't worry about the location, just make it a part of you entering at the Mystery-Cube. This is a very fun and challenging Cube - go for it!

One of the best escape rooms in London!. As a veteran escape room player, this is surprisingly one of the best that I've ever played. Probably in my top 3 rooms out of over 20.The room is unfortunately under the radar as it low budget, not highly advertised and in a difficult to reach location, but it is honestly worth the trip and more people should try it. The home-brew puzzles are fun, original, non-linear and the owner is enthusiastic. You can tell that his passion shines throughout the room.A must go for all players!

Different and delivered. As a group of people that have done a varying experience of escape games we enjoyed the difference that mystery cube offered!It was fun and offered a difference in terms on a non linear escape game. However some of the puzzles were slightly off centre...... Some sort of code not going to discuss furtherBest thing about the game was the games master who took a very personal touch to the game and offered a great degree of banter before hand.Overral very different but enjoyable! Good guy and different

A great escape!. Highly recommend. An excellent way to spend an hour of your life. More fun than I anticipated and really liked the way you got to solve some clues on your own and then come to get as a team at the same time and work together to escape. The nutty professor who greeted us was pretty funny too. Went away feeling motivated and it is well worth the money.

The mystery cube delivered!. We had so much fun the time just flew by! There were surprises from start to finish - and that's coming from 3 psychology students!! Would deffo recommend to others Now I want to do so more escape rooms!!

An absolute blast!. Though the location of the mystery cube can be a little mysterious, we had no trouble in finding it and were quickly greeted by Professor QB, who put on an absolutely wonderful act! (Oh sorry, not an act - it's all 100% true!)We were two couples, and we found the experience fantastic. Unlike other escape rooms (two of us had done another escape room before), this one is completely non-linear, so that everyone was busy solving different clues. The beauty of it is that we then had to work together to make all the clues line up! There are some very unique and lovely touches to the experience, which I won't reveal here so as to not spoil it for others who go solve the mystery of the cube! But I cannot recommend this place enough.Thanks for having us!

Good for first time escapers. This is a good escape game, which would be worth a visit if you're in the area... making a specific journey from the other side of London might be a bit of a schlep.The game is relatively easy compared to others I have done- we were mostly first timers and got out with over 15 minutes to spare, but we have been very close friends for more than 15 years, so perhaps worked better together as a team compared to others.Brilliant fun and I'm glad we did it, but not the best option for experienced gamers and location is a bit out of the way.

La FrenchFamily Team #ChampagneCamembert. This escape room is really fun !It was personally my second time. The enigmas and the room itself are really well thought. The scenario and the ambiance are amazing and, oh dear, the game master is just hilarious. I will not speak about the many jokes. But you will have one awesome hour, trust me.

didn't know what to expect but went away really buzzy and motivated - a great experience. odd arrival - middle of an industrial estate with no signage but more than made up by the experience. Some really challenging puzzles requiring a range of different approaches and solutions and a good combination of solo and team work. Great sense of achievement at the end and the feedback session was excellent.
BEST THING EVER!. The professor is so so fun! Loved the experience and would want to visit again when I get back to london. The puzzles were amazing, and engaging.

Fantastic - great escape room. You must try it!. This was a great escape room. As others have said it was a little strange pulling up and trying to find the entrance (no signs or anything to guide you bar a name next to the buzzer). The cube itself though is well designed and the puzzles entertaining. It was challenging enough to keep 5 of us busy at the same time but not too challenging as we managed to get out in time. Lots of different bits to be individually working on at the same time rather all focusing on the same one puzzle which was cool. Host was very friendly and added to its fun.

Awesome. I went with some colleagues from work as a team building event and it surpassed my expectations. Great fun, and worked well as an exercise in problem solving and communication for a team. I'd highly recommend it to others.Don't be put off by the mundane location as you approach the premises, the experience was genuinely excellent.

So much fun :). Went with my husband, and the fun started before we even walked through the door. The host was great, we were made very welcome, and she was very funny. It was our first room escape, so we weren't quite sure what to expect – and it was a kind of lo-tech Crystal Maze. The puzzles were a great mix of very challenging with a few simple ones thrown in to keep you from getting frustrated. I'm going to say no more for fear of giving away the farm, but suffice it to say: we're still locked in. It's tough but fair. Two people will be pushed for time, but on the upside, communication was probably simpler... Enjoy!

Great fun!!. Went with a team of 4 13 year olds and they absolutely loved it. The professor was a great host and the cube game was a great experience. We nearly managed to escape but I suspect too much chatting from the girls meant we ran out of time! The girls loved it though and still talk about it after a month!

Aha, I found something!. The first challenge is finding the venue as it is very cleverly concealed inside a non-descript building. Once inside, it was well worth it! The cube is very cleverly designed and you are briefed extensively before entering. The puzzles are well designed and there are a large variety that everyone will be able to try and solve.

Excellent!! Can't rate it high enough, so much fun.. This was our first room escape and we were a little bit sceptical when we arrived at the Industrial Estate where it is located - but as soon as we were placed in the room that melted away and we had the time of our lives! It really was an amazing time - I can't rate it high enough. This is the only room escape we've done so I can't compare it to others, but I would say that it was an excellent introduction to this type of experience: so anyone who has ever wanted to have a go at The Crystal Maze should definitely give it a go!Our guide (Miss Teri) was also excellent, lovely and welcoming - all around an ideal experience. I imagine this would be a great birthday present, day out or team building activity.
Great fun. Loved the website when we booked. Had high hopes for the game and was not disappointed. Very simply setup but great puzzles (and a freebie!). Highly enjoyable :)

The Best Brain Blast! . Guys! Pick a compatible group of people and definitely do this! Everything is intricately designed, clever and so fun and satisfying!Firstly a massive congrats to Prof P on being a great host and frankly an awesome person!! Value for money, an experience like no other!PS. And Yes we did escape boom bang!

You gotta try it!. Booked the cube as part of my 40th on the 9th July. Me the wife, son and daughter. What can i say...Amazing, so much to do in such a short time, really good for team building or just some rare family time. We managed to escape with only 49 seconds to go which made this even more exciting. Professor P was great host, i would recommend this to anyone, great value for money too! Thanks Mystery Cube....the Barnard family

An experience I will never forget!. Would definitely recommend the mystery cube to anyone thinking of taking part in an escape room. It was challenging, fun and well planned! Professor P was a brilliant host - he definitely made the experience that extra bit special.
Mysterious. great host, great fun, quirky and well planned.The location was easy to find, and the price was worth it!

Great fun for any group of big kids!. We took on the Mystery Cube as a family, with 3 of the 5 members having not played an escape game before. At the end of some great challenges and some excellent hosting by The Professor, we escaped the cube and didn't stop talking about it all night. It's a real buzz for anyone who loves a puzzle and is perfect for a small group of friends or family - would definitely recommend!

a great family activity to get everyone involved. the time went really quickly because you get lost in all of the activity looking for every detail , the man who did it for us was great and really got you in the mood by setting the scene . this was the first time we had ever done the puzzle as a family and we really enjoyed it ,definitely would recommend it , probably one of the best experiences !!!!!!!!!!

So much fun. 2 Aussies and 2 Brits took on the cube, we got out with seconds to spare which was stressful! The Grumpy Professor really adds to the experience and the tension . Was an absolute blast, would recommend it to anyone. Remember it's a mystery!!!
Good fun, tough challenge. Booked as a surprise birthday activity. Excellent fun. Would recommend to all. Can't say much more... it's a mystery ...;)

Fun!. We were looking for something a bit different to do during a family holiday so decided to give this a try as it was close to where we were staying. We didn't regret it. The whole experience was great from beginning to end. I have been to escape rooms before but this was the best yet. The "professor" was an excellent host and really added to the whole experience. Sadly we didn't quite make our escape but we all thoroughly enjoyed our time in the cube.
Totally amazing and immersive experience . Fastest hour ever! So much fun and so well designed... A lot of love and attention to detail has gone into this!!! Couldn't recommend it more highly

Awesome fun!. We were a party of two - my teenage son thought it would be a good way to celebrate my birthday! Well, he was right.Neither of us had done anything like this before so we didn't know what to expect. It all takes place in a fairly normal looking office building - but the game is anything but ordinary. Lots of challenges and great fun. We both had a blast and would highly recommend it.

Birthday awesomeness . This was the best birthday present ever! We went with our friend for her 18th, and we're just blown away. Don't be put off by difficulties in finding the place, it's well worth it once you get there. Sadly we were unable to solve the mystery cube despite being so confident, it was just the right level of challenge and fun! Miss Terry (Mystery haha) was so kind and welcoming, and a very good actress. We really felt special, like real VIPs, and we would definitely go back again. I would recommend this to anyone, sorry Miss Terry for leaving this review for so long!

Family fun. We went as a family of 5 to celebrate a birthday and really enjoyed ourselves. Never done anything like this before and went with certain amount of trepidation but was very pleasantly surprised to find I enjoyed myself as the rest of the team seemed to. Easy to engage with, everyone involved and just the right amount of challenge and success. We came out still talking and buzzing about it. Thanks!

Great fun and a big challenge. This was my first Escape Room and I really enjoyed it. Went with my sister and 2 nephews. Miss Terry was lovely and made our experience very enjoyable. I found the clues quite challenging, and a mixture of skills were needed to solve them. Team work is essential. It was exciting working against the clock to escape the cube, and I would recommend the experience.

In a galaxy far far away.... We did it!. What a great hour of fun! Think logically and laterally and have fun doing it. We had a great afternoon doing the mystery cube, our first escape room experience, and will definitely do some more. Any tips? Nope, it'll spoil the fun!

Great Fun!. This was an experience well worth the money!. I took some close friends and also friends of friends and it was a great bonding experience. As most people have said it is located in a slightely strange place but the actual Mystery cube and literally everything else is an amazing experience!. I highly recommend everyone tries this !

Escape the Cube!. First escape experience so I don't have anything to compare to, but this was brilliant! The puzzles are so much fun and aren't easy to solve. We didn't escape but luckily Miss Terry was there to rescue us :) we'll definitely be doing more of these. Highly recommended.
Super fabulous. I have to mention, She( Miss terry) the Hungarian girl is the best host ever. She is extremely sweet, love her smile! !!!!

Certainly a Mystery!. For my partner's birthday I wanted to try something new, different and exciting. Mystery cube was every part of that and more. An enjoyable hour spent, our only wish being more time! The experience was fun and captivating. Will definitely look into doing more activities like this. Strongly recommend anyone who enjoys mystery to give this a go!

Escape from the Cube! best hour ever!. What a fantastic afternoon at the mystery cube. Don't be put off by location (I'm just terrible with directions.) But from the minute you are welcomed via the intercom, the game has begun. Miss Tery is delightful and prepares you fully for the experience. Best hour in the cube, definitely not enough time! nearly broke out! no secrets revealed, you'll have to try it for yourself! I highly recommend, did this as a 'date' great team building exercise, brings out the geek in you! it is truly wonderful and NOT as easy as you may think! First experience of an escape room and cannot wait to do another one! Enjoy!

Fantastic way to spend an hour!. While visiting London, my husband and I decided to do an escape game. We chose the mystery cube based on reviews and availability. While we were a little surprised at the remote location (far away from all of the tourist things in London and any shopping/restaurants), we found the experience to be fantastic! Professor QB was extremely nice and its a great touch that notes he's taken during your escape are shared with you at the end. While we did escape, I wouldn't say that the puzzles were easy. We've done a few escape rooms in Florida, but this one is probably the best one we've done so far! I would definitely recommend giving the mystery cube a go!!!

Don't hesitate - one of the best hours ever!. Went with my brother (24) and my cousin (15) and it exceeded my expectations massively. My first ever escape game - it was challenging, fast paced and required everyone to group together. Left exhilarated and grinning from ear to ear.

Brilliant Day!. I bought this as a present for my boyfriends birthday and we were not disappointed! It was our first ever escape room so we were a bit nervous about what to expect but the experience was the perfect level of challenging and the hour absolutely flew by! We had so much fun and would love to do it again. Could not recommend this more highly for people looking to try out an escape room.

The shortest hour ever!. The Mystery Cube was our first experience of an escape room and we booked it as a family for my daugther's 14th birthday. We couldn't have asked for more. Professor QB was welcoming, fun and very tongue in cheek. The Cube doesn't take it all too seriously.The cube is very well designed to keep everyone occupied all the time working together and individually to solve all of the puzzles, and all of the time the 'heartbeat' of the cube is counting down. We managed to solve the Cube but the watchful eye of Professor QB was ever present to make sure all was going according to plan!Excellent fun, thanks so much.

Brilliant!. We visited Mystery Cube today as a group of five and had a great time. I would 100% recommend the experience to anyone, we had three experienced escape roomers and two first-timers and we all loved it. Professor QB was a great host, we all laughed a lot and exercised our brains too. Thank you so much for a great experience, I'll definitely be recommending you to anyone who'll listen!
Great mind boogling experience. Great concept. Friendly staff. Certainly gets the old grey matter working. Brilliant for friends/family looking for that something different to do.
Gets you thinking . Fantastic fun really gets you thinking working out the clues We didn't manage to escape the cube but we really had a great time

An enjoyable escape room with some original concepts. Having done a fair few escape rooms now, we were delighted to try out Mystery Cube in Wimbledon. A very enjoyable room with some nice puzzles to try. A room that would definitely be enjoyed by experienced teams.

Favourite escape game. Have been on a few of these types of games and this is by far my favourite. Nice simple concept, without too many rules. No prior knowledge needed, just logical thinking.Game has some nice touches which I wont share. Host was great, friendly and got in to the spirit of the game

Great fun for a birthday! . This was really good fun and all of our first attempt at an escape room game. There were 4 of us in the cube and we had to work together to solve a lot of puzzles to get out. It wasn't too hard to solve the puzzles but it wasn't too simple to spoil the fun. You can have clues to help but we didn't want any and still got out with 11 minutes to spare. Great fun and can't wait to do another one of these escape rooms.

Funny and challenging!. We booked an experience for two (this is one of the few games in town that can be played by such a small team) without really knowing what to expect since it was our first ever escape room. We were welcomed by "Miss Terry" who was an excellent host and after a brief introduction she led us to the "mystery cube"! I won't say much about the enigmas inside (to avoid spoilers and also because they are quite complicated to explain here!) but it feels like living one of those old adventure games like Monkey Island. Note that the hour you are given to solve the game goes very quickly, adding even more challenge to the experience. We were only two people and unfortunately we didn't manage to "escape", however we got really close and we can say that the experience is feasible and highly enjoiable even for a small team like ours. Do not worry about claustrophobia or scary stuff: the place is spacious enough and there are no jumpscares.

A problem solving extravaganza!. We had a fantastic afternoon at the Mystery Cube. From the moment we arrived, we were laughing at the amazing welcome from Professor QB. The room itself was immersive and challenging. There are an array of puzzles to solve which are sure to keep any visitor thoroughly entertained. I don't want to spoil the fun - you need to go and experience this for yourself!

Really good fun. My girlfriend and I had never done an escape room before, but we went with two friends of ours who are seasoned escape room veterans. All of us really enjoyed it. The staff set the scene really well and the cube itself was very enjoyable and challenging! Strongly recommended fun day out.
Highly recommended. My first breakout room and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I'd recommend the Mystery Cube to anyone looking for a fun and different night out.

Awesome!!. Absolutely loved it!! Very well put together :)Well set out so that teams work independently and puzzles are varied and not linear which was great! Prof QB was exceptional. Totally recommend and very decently priced!

First and definitely not last breakout room. Excellent breakout room, would highly recommend to anyone! The room was the perfect level of difficulty and engaged us fully for the whole hour with fun puzzles. The room was immersive and well laid out. We had a lot of fun and will be trying many more breakout rooms as a result!

Great time at the mystery cube. I really enjoyed myself at the mystery cube. The host (I'm sorry I've completely forgotten his name) was fantastic, friendly and very funny (pressure).The room itself was well designed and I enjoyed playing it. One of the better escape games I've played and I loved the feedback at the end of the game. It was very personal and I would recommend to anyone.

A fantastic experience!!. Professor QB greeted us at the beginning and got the experience off to a great fun start. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to try something different - my sister and I hadn't done an Escape Room before but after this will be visiting another one before long.Great fun!

Brain teasing fun. Went with friends on a Sunday afternoon and it was the perfect activity.If you're familiar with the concept of escape rooms then this won't be different, the whole room was lovingly hand made with excellent clues that were definitely challenging but very achievable - a wide variety of brain teasers, skill challenges and lateral thinking.The host, Miss Terry (geddit?) was very friendly and accommodating and really adds to the overall experience - it's obvious that she's spent a lot of time invested in the cube and it definitely pays off!The room can get quite hot with everyone inside, t-shirt and jeans was fine for me.There's a locker to put your coats and valuables in which you keep the key for, no charge. Toilet facilities also available.Having solved it, it's a shame that I won't be able to do it again - great value for money and a really entertaining afternoon!
Great fun. We went as a family of 5 and all had a really good time in the mystery cube.. The host was great and will definatly go back if they offer another room...

Fun and a great challenge! . This is the second "escape room" activity that I have been to and I took my sister and a friend who hadn't been to one before at all. We all loved it and had great fun! The Professor was very funny and was very much part of the enjoyment of the afternoon. He was engaging and had us all laughing within a few minutes. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for an escape room challenge. Especially as an alternative to some of the central London ones. Good luck on your mission! And don't be put off by the surroundings or thinking you're lost - it's well worth finding it :)

How good they are isn't a mystery. We played Mystery Cube during a day that we did 7 escape rooms in one day. Having done over 50 now we have seen it all but Mystery Cube was different and it was a great experience.Firstly the Miss Terry was very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome, we were actually running behind and were going to miss our slot however she was kind enough to still let us play!The location is a little bit tucked away but not too much of an issue, being a very unstable mystery cube I am sure it is where it needs to be.The game itself was fantastic, everything by hand and lovingly crafted. Some really awesome puzzles and clues to solve, a lot to do but it never felt overwhelming. A great variety of different types as well, one thing that I found with this room was the sheer amount of Aha!/Eureka! moments that made it such a pleasure to play!So, if you are up for a mystery and an escape room that is a bit different we highly recommend Mystery CubeOnly thing we would say is that clue delivery could be better, either putting in a speaker inside the room as I am slightly hard of hearing it wasn't always possible to exactly hear everything Miss Terry was saying.Anyway, 5 stars all the way!

Fantastic family fun. Went to mystery cube with my mum and sisters as a belated mothers day present. We all had a great time - truly exhausted by the end.. quickest hour of our lives!! Lots of fun, lots of banter and lots of sibling rivalry!! The Grumpy Professor made our experience complete - a great host and made it a very personal experience!! Would thoroughly recommend for families, friends or work colleagues.

highly recommended fun. first time ever tried a game room like this and wasn't sure what to expect as an average family of 2 adults and 2 children 12 and 10 years. Not the easiest to find as no signage but if you go for number 19 and look at the listings on intercom will be fine.All of us really enjoyed the experience, I'm sure there are regular, serious escape room players but despite our perhaps less than coherent approach at times really gets the adrenaline going and the fact you all have a part to play was great. All of us found the experience such fun and although only an hour in duration it felt like a well-spent afternoon!Professor QB is a gent and very welcoming. Alot a thought has obviously gone into the game but whatever you're looking for this is highly recommended.

Superb Fun (can not remember much of the hour though). A brilliant time was had by all, a completely enjoyable hour which went so quickly. We were laughing all the way through from the point we were greeted. I would highly recommend it, great value, great fun and gets your brain working.This was our first time doing something like this, and we were at ease from the point we arrived (please do not be put off by the surrounding area)

Excellent (but don't remember anything!). Got bought an experience here for my birthday with my two teenage boys - never done one of these before so not sure what to expect. The Professor was excellent and gave a great intro before we entered the cube. Seemed to think we all had an amazing time in there but for some reason none of us can remember anything when we came out!!I can thoroughly recommend this to keep teenagers (17 and 15) busy and entertained for an hour and was something that we could all enjoy together.Go on, give it a go.......

Fantastic escape room, really well done.. I've been to a few escape rooms before and this has been my favourite! I came with my brother and sister for my sister's birthday and they both loved it too (they had never been to an escape room before). I'd definitely recommend it to newbies and pro-escapers alike.Professor QB who greeted us was very friendly and had some stellar jokes. The cube itself had a great mix of puzzles and challenges, with some very satisfying mysteries to solve. I think it hit exactly the right level of difficulty. We managed to escape in 42 minutes!What really sets apart Mystery Cube is the de-brief following the cube. There was a really great, personalised break down of how we had done and how we had worked together which was really nice to hear. A personal favourite was the quotes from us in the cube, very funny to know what we were saying in the moment!It was also great value for money. I highly recommend.

Good fun!. Went to the Cube as a team of 4. Only one of us had tried escape room things before so 3 of us were unsure of what to expect, The 'Professor' was really friendly and funny and explained what it was about and the 'rules'! We did manage to escape and had a good laugh trying! Would definitely recommend this to others. Allow about an hour and a half or so for the visit, an hour for the cube and time for your instructions and photos.
