G. Had a great time at the mystery cube in Wimbledon.We went as a family of four and really enjoyed the challenge.Our host was really friendly, funny and very helpful when we got stuck with some of the puzzles.Really good value for money and a fun experience for all ages.

Friends day out at mystery cube . Had a fantastic time would highly recommend to anyone thought we would be rubbish at this but it was such good fun and staff were brilliant, did it in a respectable time to so quite proud of ourselves !

Great fun. Great experience .... Thoroughly enjoyed our time in the cube, challenging but not impossible. Would recommend it to anyone who asked, even got an "awesome" from the teenagers!!Thanks for a great family time

Hilarious outing with my parents & partner. This was an utterly hilarious way to spend an hour! On arrival at 'hq', my parents (who had been gifted the cube experience against their will) were sceptical, sarcastic & surly when met by the professor. He handled them beautifully & had us chuckling in no time. The cube itself was a blast! We loved the challenge, frustrating but not entirely impossible. The sense of achievement & team work was well worth the money. I have recommended to several friends. Do give it a go. We had such a giggle!

Great experience and great fun!. I turned up to the site and was rather nervous considering the surroundings. However, once inside and once we had been greeted by the host it was absolutely fantastic experience from then on. I have played similar games but this one was pretty original and ensured that there was enough going on for everyone in the group to be getting involved. Having said that it was still a really good team building experience. Highly recommend this for a day out. Cheap, great fun and very clever.
Awesome . Amazing experience recommend it to anyone who wants a challenge and something different an hour well spent and definitely worth the money

Great Fun!. I've been to many escape games in London, this is definitely one of the good ones. The scene was convincing, puzzles were clever but not too hard to solve. As some previous customers said, the venue is a little far out, but don't be put off. It really was a lot of fun. :)

Brilliant fun with our adult family. The venue looks a bit questionable but don't be put off. The games host was very entertaining and the game itself which we solved with only seconds to spare was very well thought out and appealed to both parents in their 50-60 and their 20 something daughters. Requires some team work but we survived without falling out so would recommend it, lots of fun.

An excellent experience at great value!. A group of 5 of us participated in this experience - our first escape room activity.The host submerged us in the experience from the start with a fun, in-character, briefing. The room itself was well thought through and very challenging. The post-game analysis afterwards was very insightful and fun and meant we all left with a fantastic buzz - vowing to repeat the experience!A great overall experience and highly recommended.

Loved it!. It's slightly hard to find, as there is no outside sign on the building. Other than that, we loved it! We found it just challenging enough to be fun, and we really enjoyed the analysis at the end. The host was great. This was the highlight of our week. A great way to spend time together. Would repeat - if we could!

Excellent Game! Definitely recommended!. We went for a friend's 30th birthday and had the time of our lives! It was well thought out, really fun and the host was really friendly making our experience a memorable one. Reminded us of an extended crystal maze type game-thoroughly enjoyable!

Excellent escape game in London for a good price. I went to this escape game with my family (4 adults) and we chose this particular game as it was a quick drive from where we are, had great reviews and was much better value than many of the games in central London.The host was great - setting the scene from the moment we entered and was hilarious as well. He chatted us through the game in the right amount of detail and did it in a way that wasn't boring.The game itself was fantastic - really challenging but at the same time all of the puzzles were solveable. We had the ask for some help occasionally when we forgot what codes we used and couldn't get a lock to work. In previous games I have had to ask for help to fully solve clues as I got completely stuck. The fact that we just needed guidance for this game and escaped as the clock hit 60 minutes shows that the game is the right level of challenging.The clue and puzzles themselves were nice and varied and nothing was too repetitive (not always the case with escape games). Lots of thought has gone into this game and you can tell that the creator is passionate.Getting feedback at the end and analysis on our personalities and how we worked as a team was a lovely extra bonus which we all enjoyed.Looking forward to a possible Mystery Cube 2!

Great fun!. Miss Terry greeted us and stayed in character through out which made the experience really good! she explained the process of the game and what we would have to do so that we felt very prepared going into the cube. The puzzles were well thought out and everything had a purpose so it was quick to grasp the concept and get going. After we completed out mission Miss Terry was gave her observations of areas we did very well as a team and also helped us with puzzles we struggled with! We managed to complete the mystery cube in 54 mins! Well worth the trip!!!

Great fun. Mystery Cube was our first Escape Room experience and it left us engrossed and keen for more. It was taxing enough to add pressure and a fair amount of confusion.
Don't be put off by the location as Miss Terry creates an amusing atmosphere and the Cube has it's own charm. We particularly liked her post-game analysis.

Must Add on your To Do List. The host was fantastic, very welcoming. Started the Mystery Cube theme right from the very first point of contact and remained in character throughout.The mystery cube itself was a fun, thrilling, frustrating and crazy adventure with your comrades. Definitely a must do with friends and family. Put your thinking caps on and look out for the smaller details!! Don't Panic!!Have fun!

Excellent Fun!. We were met by our lovely host who explained everything about the Mystery Cube! We had only done one escape adventure before, so were keen to try another and we were not let down with this one. Excellent puzzles and it was challenging enough to keep the 2 of us working the whole time. Nothing was straight forward, and I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

Fab time!. A group of four of us visited the mystery cube and we had a great time. Don't be too worried about the somewhat unusual location on the business park.Miss Terry was a great host with lots of enthusiasm which added to the experience.We've done quite a few escape rooms between the four of us, but we all agreed this one ranked up near the top. Lots of interesting and different puzzles and games.The price is pretty good - £20 each for a group of 4.Give it a go!

Amazing discoveries in the cube !. Fantastic and fun end of a day! 4 of us went into the cube after some great explanations and introductions to this unique adventure by Prof QB. A lot of challenges and excitement for all ages !

Family Day Out. Well, what can I say that hasn't already been said. This really is a fantastic experience. I went to the cube with my Mum and two sisters, we got of the tube and walked through the business park leading to number 19, when we arrived we started to worry and wonder if we were in the right place. With alot of worry and no answer to the buzzer I called the number to check we were in fact at the right locatin. We were VERY early as wasn't sure of where to go. It was confirmed we were indeed in the correct place and were soon invited in the building by very 'odd' person. Still worrying what we had let ourself into the Prof entered and wow it was fantastic, so much fun. This was our first escape room and it was truely amazing! We laughed so much and hour flew by, even if we did not escape (still stuck here in the void) it was brilliant! I thank you cube for what was our most talked about moment in London and I am sure will be for a long time. Thank you!

Mystery Cube demystified?. Myself, my partner and my two teenagers did the Mystery Cube in Wimbledon on Mother's Day - any excuse to bribe the teenagers to spend some time with me... Professor QD was adept at explaining what our mission was in our allotted hour which flew by. It was fun and puzzling and frustrating all at the same time. Can't say much more as it would obviously be a spoiler save to say that it's highly recommendable.

Excellent Adventure !!. You'll get off the tube, walk into Businessy Park surroundings, and eventually arrive at an office block. Is this part of the room escape? Fret not, because you'll be greeted by Miss Terry, who will warn you of the dangers ahead! Mystery Cube goes to show that as long as you have logic, a high calibre of puzzles, and an engaging back-story with a great host, you can build a big box, and then turn it into a room escape. Well thought out, and a good variety of codes to break, gave our team of three a good run for our money! Although we did get out after 46 minutes, I think we were 'on form' that day, as we didn't spend time faffing about on any particular clue, so with some hesitation could have easily been locked in! With the recent UK explosion of escape room, this one can hold its own, and is highly recommended.

Best value for money escape game experience. The whole experience is recommended. Having played several escape games before, this is definitely one of the better ones. To be honest, for the price, it is very likely the best game we've tried taking into account the cost. The puzzles were inventive and varied which is essential. There is a screen telling the time. The host (Miss Terry) was very good indeed and sounds like she's a true escape gamer which helps as she understand what makes the experience work.Overall, highly recommended! although it's slightly out of central London and a short walk but the game is definitely worthwhile and for the price as well. I'd put it up as one of my top 4 games I've tried irrespective of the price.
So much fun!. There were four in our team. We had such a great time. Our host was excellent. I won't give anything away, you need to book this NOW!

Ella's 15th birthday party. Mysterious, challenging and great for teamwork. Not easy at all. Really good fun for all. That hour flies past! Slightly tricky to find - a small sticker on an intercom is the only clue that you are in the right place. Thoroughly recommend it.

Fantastic fun in a box. This is a fantastically fun escape room that I heartily recommend you try. I've been to about 50 round the world, and this is definitely one of the good ones. Are there better ones in London? Yes - Time Run and ClueQuest for example, but this is significantly cheaper.If you've never tried an escape room then this is a great intro. If you've already tried one, then this is great value for money.Good puzzles, great hosts and lots and lots of fun.

fun and no arguing. We went as a family of 5 for my sons 21st Birthday.Everyone warned us that we would argue as we are all control freaks.Surprise it didn't happen!From the minute we turned up it was a bundle of laughs, the Proff was brilliant very welcoming and amusing.The Cube was great, the time flew by and I don't know who was more surprised when we completed it within the hour.This was our first locked room experience and we loved it, would absolutely recommend to everyone.Wimbledon station is a 10-15 minute walk away so easy to get to.If I had any criticism, it would be that it could have had a sign outside saying Mystery Cube, but as long as you know that it is 19 Deer Park Road, you will find it.

Good Fun. It was not the easiest place to find tucked away on an industrial estate, but we did, you get a brief once you are there, on the do's and dont's of what not to do once in the Cube, Once inside the Cube you are given an hour to work out the codes and find keys that will open padlocks, work out puzzles to reveal codes, to enable you to get out, there were 5 of us, and we managed it in just under 48 mins, this was not bad, as only 35% make it out in the time..We all enjoyed this, and would recommend this as a good bit of fun...

Fun times in a cube. My girlfriend and I did the mystery cube as my brother had told us about a different room escape that he had done and it sounded like fun.We both had a brilliant time solving the clues, which were challenging but not ridiculously hard like we were expecting. And we would definitely recommend this to people.

Great experience ! Definitely recommended!. Went as a group of two and had an brilliant hour at the Mystery Cube! It was challenging as two (would probably be better with 3-4 people) but we still completely loved it. We were laughing for the entire time and have recommended it to friends. The "professor" was very welcoming and fun and made the whole experience even more awesome.

Great unusual Valentine's Day activity. We had a great time on our Valentine's day trip do the Mystery Cube. Miss Terry was lovely, and the experience was challenging yet exciting. We would recommend to fans of mysteriousness.

A MUST-DO and your best hour for a group, family of 4-5 in the London Area. Great and really quite difficult Game, requiring Audio, Visual, Logic, Aquatic (Oh Yes) and Numerical Skills. Even Bagpuss has a role!. Professor QB added real value to the experience by providing team building feedback, in our case a stamp of the foot, by a frustrated parent with a cry of Rookie mistake, when The Cube suggested a clue.

How much fun can you have at the Mystery Cube?. The answer is lots! We are a family of four (kids are 11 & 14), and undertook our first mission and escape room puzzle, for the most excellent Professer QB (formerly of Lightwater Country Park!), today. As all the other comments have said, it's great fun, really challenging, and eye opening in seeing how people interact together under some pressure, with a real sense of satisfaction when (or if) you escape. I'd love to tell you some detail, but it's all gone a bit foggy.....like everyone else has said here, you have to try it! Highly recommended (although I'd say not for U6's really).
Amazing!!!. We had a great time at the Mystery Cube, time flies by so quick when you are in there. Definately would recommend to anyone!

Just Brilliant. Mystery cube was just so much fun!! Quite intense at times but super exciting, we all throughly enjoyed ourselves and the whole experience was made even better by the charismatic Professor QB (who knew tamil!). We would definitely recommend it :)

Amazing experience! . One member of our group was running late, the Professor nicely wait for him to arrive so that we could start all together. As soon as we started he explained with jokes what we should expect and our mission but fortunately, what happened was unexpected! We had an amazing experience in Professor's cube! We advise everyone to go and have fun!I personally had experienced two other escape games, but the Mystery Cube was one of the best.
Suggest for couples . It was great game. I played it with my wife and we enjoyed our time. The host was so kind and helpful. The best thing that you can play it with group of two.

Great!. My first mystery game, so I was a bit anxious as to what to expect, but was really enjoyable, nearly escaped was pretty close! Great alternative to a night out, or a date night, something interesting to do!

MUST BE DONE!!. A really great experience. It really was so much fun!! Professor QB was top notch (He would actually make a great comedian). He set the scene really well which made the overall experience even better.Great puzzles, great set, and if you get far enough you even get a little treat (No spoilers here)Yes we got out! With time to spare!! (no bragging.....maybe a little)But we were there to do a job for Prof. QB...Mission complete!I suggest you try the mission for yourself!!
Such a fun date. The whole experience was fantastic. It is a real challenge for 2 people and it really tested our thinking skills. I've recommended it to my friends already.

GREAT TIME!!!. This is the best thing you could do to have fun ! I've played those exiting games before on my ipad and i found them quite interesting, but doing it for real, touching the objects, putting the codes, finding the keys... It makes such a difference! Yes you need to focus, yes you need teamwork, but don't freak out, just think! Plus if you're nice, the cube can help you sometimes... Definitely do it, you'll get to meet this really nice professor, you'll have tons of fun and you'll have awesome memorie!!!
Brilliant fun. We had a great time visiting mystery cube this evening. Really well designed and thought out! Our first time trying an escape room. Will definitely recommend to friends and family

Great day. We had such an amazing day here at mystery cube. There were five of us and we managed to make it out. There's a room where you have to find codes and keys using the puzzles. Some of the puzzles baffled the hell out of me and some we all couldn't do. Our quote of the day was 'has anyone done the balls!!'. Thanks professor we had a good day and it's the only one in south london so that a bonus too.

Incredible experience!. This was our first escape room, and was an exciting, challenging and fun hour! Seemed to be the only escape room in London that would allow just 2 players, which was a bonus. Really friendly 'professor' who made the overall experience even better. SO glad we went, and cant wait to try another escape room. Great value for money!

Brilliant first escape room experience. First time we've done something like this, had never heard of escape rooms before. We found Mystery Cube through reading TripAdvisor reviews and have to say it fully lived up to the many 5* reviews. Our time absolutely flew by, completely absorbing and fun with friendly and humourous help from the Prof as needed. Puzzles varied and challenging, with loads to do, though not so much we couldn't get through it as a couple. There were some head scratching moments and in the end it was a real race against time, we got the door open with seconds to go and felt really pleased with ourselves. We'll definitely be on the look out for more of these and would highly recommend this to others experienced with escape cubes or newbies like ourselves.

Brilliant, highly recommended.. This was a surprise christmas present from my wife; for myself, my brother and various sons/nephews, i.e. a group of 5 (youngest 11).I hadn't heard of this type of experience before so was very intrigued as to what was involved!On arrival Professor QB was an instant hit, engaging the whole group, funny and friendly.Don't want to give anything away, but we all got fully immersed in solving all the puzzles,which were very cleverly designed, appealing to all ages - I'd been a bit concerned beforehand that our younger team players might find it too challenging and lose interest but couldn't have been more wrong! Not to say the puzzles are easy ( they're not!), but by putting our heads together as a team meant we managed to escape the cube (just!).Everyone was buzzing afterwards and the Prof gave us a debrief to rate our effort and make us even more pleased with ourselves for escaping!Fantastic, very well done, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Mystery Cube for a moment. A great experience out of the ordinary.

Fantastic fun!. This is a really well put together escape game with a fun little back story to give it a bit of character. The owner/operator clearly loves running it and was a fantastic host - playing the part of a whacky professor with gusto and aplomb. 4 of us gave it a go - 3 with previous escape room experience - but the game would work well with any number (between 2 and 5). Mystery cube is a bit out of the way, but not that far, and is totally worth the walk. Definitely recommend, and thank you Professor!

Excellent fun birthday activity!. Really loved this. I've done something similar before, but the four friends I went with never had so I was a bit worried that it wouldn't be their cup of tea. Thankfully, they all really enjoyed themselves and we are planning on doing another one soon. The Professor is great, really funny and friendly. The cube itself has been nicely designed and the puzzles are hard enough to be challenging but still fun. We completed the mission with a few minutes to spare, so we were all happy. The analysis bit at the end was hilarious. Don't hesitate to book, this is great fun, great value and a memorable experience!

Want to do it all over again! . Had so much fun in the mystery cube today with my brother and his gf, the Prof QB really enhanced the experience with his humour too! It was challenging and got you to use lots of different methods/logic and puzzles. I will be recommending to all my friends and would love to do it all over again! I also messed up my booking (my error) and the Prof was great at recognising this and getting in touch to reschedule for the correct date and time.

One of the best escape rooms in London. Went yesterday as a group of 4. We are experienced gamers and as a group have done most of the rooms in London as well as escape rooms in Lisbon, Santorini, and Malaysia. This is one of the best rooms in London. The puzzles are fantastic and innovative; not the most technologically gimmicked but very fun and rewarding. And of course we did get the 2nd best time (Professor QB - I'm still disappointed in the team. 2nd is first loser as far as I'm concerned...) Recommended for all!

Great Mysterious Fun. The mystery cube was great fun. It was put together really well, we were greeted by the professor who was really welcoming and funny. It was definitely an enjoyable experience and would recommend it to those who want a wonderful day out.

Great escape room challenge . Me and 3 others did this escape room challenge recently. It was well run, friendly and really enjoyable. I definitely think it was worth the cost. We managed to get out but did need a clue to help. It is a bit tucked away but we found it alright.

Great Visit. We all enjoyed the mystery cube as a family and definitely recommend it to those who want to have a wonderful time together. We were looking for something different, challenging and exciting to do in the half-term break and definitely found it! It tested our thinking faculties to a greater level and with a very friendly atmosphere. Prof QB was the secret to the success of our mission which was to have a fantastic time as a family! :-)
Great fun for the whole family. Really good fun for everyone in the unlikeliest of places. Problem solving that everyone can join in with - v enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Great fun!. This is wonderful, imaginative, fun stuff. We were met by the Professor who introduced us to the mysterious Cube and gave us clues when needed - like "Get me out of here without the spiders" said our eldest! You have to use logic intuition and teamwork to "escape" within an hour. Absolutely loved it - well done Prof!

Tremendous fun. We came as a group of 4 for a fun activity in our Christmas holiday, and we certainly were not disappointed. We were warmly greeted by the very funny Prof QB. However, due to some reckless public transport decisions we found ourselves running 10 minutes late. We were worried we'd lose that 10 minutes from our allotted time but Prof QB told us not to worry about it and he allowed us the extra time. He made us feel at home, introducing us to the story of the Mystery Cube and what the objective of our visit should be, all interspersed with great humour. The actual escape room was exceptional fun. We had done other escape rooms previously that were perhaps a bit more 'linear' in terms of what you had to do to escape ie it was obvious that in order to progress you needed to unlock certain locks in a particular order. However in the Mystery Cube the problem solving was a lot less linear. This made for a more satisfying challenge because you had to work harder to figure out how each aspect of the escape room fits in with other aspects. The challenges of the escape room were also very diverse. We were presented with a wide range of puzzles and problems that ensured we were kept very busy during our allotted time!Our group escaped (just) and Prof QB, who had been observing us the whole time, gave us a detailed breakdown of how well we did throughout and we had a nice chat about the experience. Certainly one of the best parts of the experience was the warmth and kindness (and humour) of Prof QB, all the way from start to finish. He made us feel very at home.I would thoroughly recommend Mystery Cube to escape room veterans and escape room virgins alike. A very fun activity indeed! I have already eagerly mentioned this to friends and family, and will continue to recommend - well worth it!

Great fun. The friendly Prof QB guided the team of 4 teens and one barely responsible adult through their mission. Great puzzles to test their brain power, common sense and teamwork. Challenging and fun, the perfect way to spend a wintery afternoon. It has well planned clues with timely tips to get you back on track if you get too bogged down.

Amazingly fun escape room - whether you're experienced or not. Must do!. We made it out with less than 2 minutes to spare! We did it in a group of four, which fit easily into the cuuuube.Easiest way to sum it up is to list it all in points1. StaffProfessor was lovely and funny but also had a good briefing. Clues offered when asked were helpful and guiding but didn't reveal too much, so you still had to think them through!2. AtmosphereThe mystery cube has many secrets and the overall mystery cube effect was great. Very mysterious.3. Variety and number of puzzlesWe've done at least 5+ puzzles in various countries (lisbon, portugal, london) and this was unique in that you solve the puzzles at your own pace, but you can almost set your own direction, but puzzles are linked to other puzzles. With a whole mix of puzzles, from creative to instructional to 'oh duh that was really obvious if you think about it', it's great for a variety of ages.4. TeamworkGreat for teamwork but also individual work, sometimes you worked on stuff together and sometimes you could figure something out yourself, which was nice in our group of 4 since everyone got stuck in.5.Fun.It's fun! and funny! And there are little surprises that come up that make you smile, made it feel way more personal and welcoming.It was so great that I booked less than 2 hours later after completing our mission, this mysterycube quest for my family members for Christmas. I'm so excited for them to try this.

The Great Escape. This was sooooo much fun. Took my girlfriend and cousins along as a surprise and we all really enjoyed it. Staff on hand were really helpful with booking enquiries and on the day. I really would recommend it to all those who love puzzles, adventure and unique experiences.
A fun challenge. Four of us did this yesterday. It is very challenging and great fun. We made it out with eight minutes to spare. Recommended if you like puzzles.

Mystery escape.... We have done quite a lot of Escape Room over Europe and this one have a particulary taste. We particulary appreciated it. You don't have to follow a path but choose your own, the welcome is extremely friendly, a lot of unique realisations, ... The cube atmosphere is pretty not fake and the experience is really worth it !

Great fun!. A group of 4 friends tackled the mystery cube! Was brilliant, makes you all work together and loads of great ideas and clues to get you thinking! Time goes very fast, but not a dull moment! Thank you Mystery Cube! We had a great time!

Really nice room!. The cube is really nice and the Professor really helpful! The room has many clues and the 1 hour time limit really flies! Definitely a great way to spend an afternoon with friends in south London! The sweet surprise worth the visit by itself ;)

Best escape room yet. Having averaged 10 escape rooms each, this was by far the best. Loads of great clues to keep you thinking for the whole time. Great host, helps when needed and really friendly. Definitely recommend to couples and groups, well worth a visit!

That was a blast!. Went to this with 3 friends and had a good time. Loads of tasks to keep everyone going and working forwards towards the goal. This ain't your mama's mystery room. Consider this the upper level of the mystery room scene. How so? They do a great job of making it emersive ( don't want to give anything away) and enough things to work with but they are there to help(from the distance of speakers) if need be, or if you don't want the help you can choose not to accept it too which is all good. If you are victorious they even have a little surprise for you at the end. Oh and another whilst in play. ;)I want to go back and do it again but alas that would be cheating.

High density of original puzzles!. I went there one evening with a couple of friends (i.e. we were 3 people), to do something different. We had done some escape rooms before, but this one surprised us. It was densely packed with challenging puzzles that require quite organised teamwork, and we just loved it! It had some very original details that I will not reveal, and which definitely set the Mystery Cube apart from other places. The Professor is also a very special character who helped (un)settle us about the mysterious contents of the cube. Totally recommendable, for families and groups of friends of all ages!

Fun and challenging!. Crystal maze comes to mind. None of us had ever done an escape room before. This was great fun! Would be perfect for team building but also just something different to do with your friends. The professor was fab! When we made it out, it was great to hear his excited re-telling of what happened in there. Cos we were just as excited! Can't wait for him to put the pic up that he promised us!! Oh and very good value for money...don't let the location deter you!

Awesome experience! Fantastic host, brilliantly designed and just great fun!. I bought this as a birthday gift for my boyfriend and we loved it from start to finish. Our host, The Professor, had great banter and set it up as a fantastically funny and novel experience. It was our first visit to an escape game so we didn't know what to expect. Compared with the other ones I had looked into, the Mystery Cube gave the option for just two people to take part and was brilliant value for money. The cube itself is so well designed with some really good puzzles to solve. It was well balanced in terms of its level of difficulty too - it certainly challenged us but without being so difficult that it took the fun out of it. It's location on an industrial estate adds to the intrigue and it's really accessible on public transport - we took the tube and walked in just ten mins or so. I will be wholeheartedly recommending this to friends! Exceptional.

Interactive puzzle fun for all the family or for friends of any age!. Had a fantastic time here yesterday for my brother's birthday. The Mystery Cube was a brilliant combination of various different challenges, puzzles and tasks that required the whole family to work together and utilise one another's skills.For the whole hour there was not one dull moment and everyone was busy either working together or doing their own challenges.Unfortunately we only just missed out on finishing (just two challenges left!) but we still thoroughly enjoyed the experience!A big thanks to the Professor and his assistant, who were very helpful and friendly, and good luck to anyone else who tries to solve the cube!

Perfect! Very entertaining and the right level of a challenge! . This was my first live escape room after playing many games like this on my phonr. The puzzles were of perfect challenge and allowed me and my girlfriend to get through just in the nick of time! Our host Professor Qb was very welcoming and kept us entertained. I strongly recommend anyone to get down and take on the cube!

Fun experience!. Having been to an escape room adventure before I thought I knew what to expect from the Mystery Cube. It was much better though! There were plenty of clues, which kept us busy for the entire hour. They weren't too tricky, so it didn't leave us unsure of what to do next but at the same time weren't too easy to be able to walk out of the room too quickly. The clues were diverse and fun to crack. The "Professor" was great - in character and funny. My dad, who I invited to this experience as a birthday present, had never been before and loved it! I would recommend this to my friends and if they come up with any new ideas i will definitely come and try it!

Perfect thing to do with your teenage kids!!. There aren't many things that two 16 year olds would enjoy doing with their parents and parent's friends - but this is definitely one of them! Both our boys thought the whole thing was ' awesome' and ' sick' (????) . And for once they were not embarrassed to be with us......We all had a really fun evening too! 100% recommend the mystery cube and Prof QB!

Really fun event!. We have attended several escape games, but this one is from far the best. It is really well designed. I won't disclose any details to not spoil the fun, but I definitely recommend it!

Great way to spend an hour. This was our first secret room type experience, and it was enthralling and kept us occupied for the length of time it took us to escape. 4 people was the right number of people. If going at the weekend, the industrial estate is empty so parking shouldn't be an issue

Brilliant . Firstly, a massive thank you to Professor QB who's squeezed us into the mystery cube (not literally) at the last minute.All I can say is that the three of us absolutely loved our time in the mystery cube from start to finish. The challenges in the cube were varied and enjoyable. The clues from Professor QB were helpful enough to keep us busy and thinking without spoiling the challenge, although we were gutted that we had to rely on any clues given to us whatsoever! We managed to escape the cube in 51 minutes which we were pretty happy with. I could go on but I feel like I'd be giving too much away... Suffice to say all 3 of us would definitely recommend this experience to friends and family.

Good fun. We had no idea what to expect, there were no tell tale signs. Once inside we met our guide and started the game. From the very start we were sucked in. The hour FLEW by so quick as we were engrossed in the puzzles. I could have played for another 10 hours without any feeling of being hungry or need to go to the bathroom. Every puzzle that we solved, we felt excitement. Special thanks to Miss Tery for being an amazing guide and I hope my surgery techniques was adequete

Best hour of my life. I don't really know what else to say?It was great, fun, challenging but not to the point you want to rip out your hair. Amazing customer service by the lovely gentlemen. The picture taken at the end was just a fantastic token to take away.100% would recommend.100% worth the money.100% will force you to do it.Little side note is when looking for the cube don't look out for building signs of "mystery cube" look for the building number instead.

Absolutely brilliant!!. I wasn't too sure what to expect when I booked this....but all I am going to say is that is was brilliant fun. I'm now hooked on exit games and can't wait to try some more. Staff were great. Will definitely recommend :)

Great fun, very immersive.. We went into the Mystery Cube as a group of two and, although we didn't quite escape, we had a great time.The Cube was completely immersive, from the moment we entered and were met by Professor QB to the moment we left.The whole escape room has been thought out very well and has quite a lot of ideas we have not seen in other escape games.Thank you for a great time Professor QB!

Escape rooms should be cubes. Set in an unsuspecting industrial estate in South Wimbledon, Professor QB or an associate will meet you at the door to introduce himself and guide you into the briefing area where the rules and backstory of the Cube will be given to you. We were a team of 5 and there was *plenty* for you all to be doing in that 60 minutes to achieve your goal and "escape". I've played a few of these games and this was right up there for challenge and interest. You need no prior knowledge, just a good logical mind that can see connections between seemingly random things.And the host is brilliant. He loves what he has created and you should too. Don't be put off "comparing" it to other games, because it was really good fun and you'll talk about it with your team at length afterwards.
Fun, unique experience. Very fun experience. The more the merrier; there were 4 of us and we were all kept very busy! Unique narrative and very friendly welcome :-) Would definitely recommend!
Awesome. Best idea in a while. Such a good team activity - highly recommended. We did it with another couple, it's a great way to get to know each other better. Bloody difficult though!

In the magic 30% of escapees - fantastic mysterious fun.. Didn't know what to expect when booking this but was very pleasantly surprised. Very well presented by "Professor QB". Can't say much more but would highly recommend. Paid £70 for a group of 5.46 minutes is our time to beat..

We escaped! ... but somehow have forgotten all the details :). We went as a group of 5 to celebrate a birthday and try to branch out from the standard "let's go to the pub" (although to be fair we did that afterwards). The location is not clearly signed but trust the address and you will find the "Mystery Cube" buzzer ... first puzzle solved. The Professor was a great host and definitely got us involved from the get go. You can tell a lot of thought went into this and it is really rewarding when you figure things out.My pieces of advice would be:- Try to go with a group of 4-5 as there are plenty of activities and it is fun working in groups of 2-3 while others crack on;- Have a group with different strengths, e.g. logic, detail, organisation; as the challenges appeal to different people and working with others always worked best;- Keep going ... sometimes you can get frustrated but your team mates and the Professor are there to help.Overall a great activity and something I have already started recommending to friends and colleagues.

Didn't manage to escape but still great.. Last minute booking but so glad we did. I have done a previous room escape with an established company and Mystery Cube really managed to live up to that. We turned up as a group of 5 with age ranges 7-72. The "Professor" did suggest that 7 year olds may find it too tough but he let us decide. We decided to go in and I have to say our 2 boys really enjoyed it and worked hard to figure out lots of the clues with us. If your children are into puzzles and are patient then I would highly recommend this. The actual venue was a bit hard to find as it wasn't very well signed outside but once in the Professor was very friendly and helpful and made the whole stay very good. We all had a great time and would highly recommend you try this. Thanks very much.

Lots of fun!. A friend of mine was down in the area for the weekend, and having done a couple of escape rooms before we decided this would be worth a go. Usually there are 3 of us doing this sort of thing, so we were a bit apprehensive at only having two but were reassured it would be fine.Our trip inside the Mystery Cube was great, and there were a lot of original puzzles to get our heads around.Miss Terry was an excellent hostess too. I'd definitely recommend this to others, the best escape room I've done!

IT TOTALLY WORTH TO GO. I went with 2 of my friend for her leaving party ! Such an amazing experience and even though we did not win,WE enjoyed a lot and talked about it for the day ! First experience with an escape room but not LAST :-) Miss terry who took care of us along our mission was funny and very kind.

Great Fun!!!. In brief: Do it!!Took my friends here yesterday (Sunday 28th June 2015) as a surprise and everyone – including my husband who generally enjoys pretending to be underwhelmed by most things I suggest – had a brilliant time!As there were 6 of us, we had to be split into two teams. I liaised directly with the Prof, and because only one Mystery Cube has landed to date, he came up with an itinerary which allowed both missions to be completed with the smallest time lag between sessions.None of us had ever done one of these challenges before – and some members of our group didn’t even know these types of challenges existed – however, no previous experience is necessary.An excellent group and team building activity. If another Mystery Cube were to land, we would certainly return to try and solve the mystery!!!

Awesome experience!. Definitely recommend the Mystery Cube! The hosts put excellent effort into building the atmosphere and storyline, and the puzzles are fun and varied, with a lot of physical puzzles as well as the usual locks and codes. They're reasonably new - whoops, I meant to say, the Cube landed very recently... ;) but they are really putting in a lot of effort. I enjoyed this more than ClueQuest!The location is out in the sticks a bit, right in the middle of an industrial estate, you might feel like you're going the wrong way, don't let this put you off :) When you get to the main building, go to the main entrance and look for the buzzer labelled "Mystery Cube".

Challenging, fun, and suitable for any age.. This was our first escape room (We are a group of 5.) We went for the Mystery Cube as it has solid reviews and we were not disappointed! The Mystery Cube is a fantastic experience and a lot of fun! It was a challenge which is what I am pleased about (I did not want it to be easy) and the hosts are extremely warm, welcoming and helpful. We went as a group of 5 adults (mid twenties-thirties) as a birthday activity and every single one of us loved it. Would highly recommend to anyone of any age. Thank again Mystery Cube and looking forward to you bringing out a new game.

Trip to Thorpe park followed by an escape room. Wow just brilliant wonderful lady running it who let us in early. Not far from Thorpe park. So many clues inside and a real story line behind the cube. Just sooo much fun!!

Great fun, well worth the trip. The dense inner workings of the Mystery Cube contain something for everything, making it especially good for beginners and mixed groups. Experienced room escapists won't be bored, though -- the sheer variety of puzzles, both in terms of form and difficulty, ensure that you'll always have something to be working on.It's also just really good fun, with lots of devious (but never unfair) bits and some sweet surprises. Professor QB was an excellent host, ensuring that the mission didn't get bogged down but never hurrying us. You can ask for help if you feel stuck, and you can also decide whether or not to accept any offered hints; I greatly appreciated having such a choice, even if we did end up accepting the hints in the end...Some other escape rooms have a bit of a mass-produced feel to them. In contrast, the Mystery Cube is clearly its own creature. Well worth the exploration!(The Mystery Cube's landing site inside an office building means it can't be easily spotted from outside, which initially baffled us. But just check the intercom list once you get to 19 Deer Park Road and you'll spot it.)

Brilliant Fun. This was our first escape room, so we had no idea of what to expect. We went as a group of five adult family members and all really enjoyed the afternoon. Without giving anything away, the hosts were there to meet us and give us a brief outline of what to look out for and set the tone for what was to come. I love puzzles and this is one that the whole family can experience and work together to reach the conclusion. We found we worked as a team and couldn't stop talking about the experience after we'd left. Thanks for a great afternoon's fun. Definitely recommended.Tip: It's easy to find on a South Wimbledon industrial estate which was quiet on Saturday. We were all thirsty on arrival, but found quite a good burger bar near Wickes where we were able to get a cuppa.

Unusual but really good fun afternoon!. This was our first room escape and I picked it as a present for my husband as it was one of the few that allowed couples rather groups of at least three. It was really enjoyable and we made it out! Such a friendly experience (with really good recommendations for lunch!). It's such a shame we can't go and do it again! Well worth a visit!We walked through the nearby park on our way, past the lovely city zoo. I did wonder if we'd got the right place when we got close - it's quiet at weekends!! But it is easy to find!

Mind boggling and good fun. Never done an escape room before this one but can definitely say i will be doing more from now on. My partner had booked it as a surprise for our anniversary and we both had no idea what to expect. Miss terry was a great host and the cube was fun and challenging. Definitely recommend to others!

Superb experience!. That was sooo cool! Very very nice experience!
It is very rich on different kinds of tasks. Also creatively decorated which makes a strong atmosphere :-)
I would definitely recommend this challenge to everyone!

Cubenauts For Life!. Having done a few escape rooms, this is by far the best London room we've tried! Professor QB and Miss Terry are superb hosts and the clues are both innovative and exciting. The adrenaline was still flowing a full hour after which is a sure sign that the Mystery Cube is the real deal.We cannot wait for the Cube to divide so we can come back and give it another go!Thank you very much! From Ayla & Andrew :-)
Amazing. Loved it it's so fun would recommend it to anyone adventurous who enjoys a challenge staff was very welcoming and friendly 10/10

Amazing!. This was our first escape game and we absolutely loved it! I went with my partner for his birthday and had no idea what to expect. We couldn't tell you what happened after experiencing some type of short term memory less but I do remember that it was challenging yet not impossible. We never managed to escape within 60 minutes but we were able to escape this strange universe. The man and lady that were running it were very informative and gave us subtle clues when we got there, they totally got us mentally ready for what was ahead. They were completely genuine, nice people. We were slightly late but this wasn't a problem. We had 20% off so paid £40 for two people which seems slightly expensive but is cheaper than other escape games in London and you get free snacks! We would definitely recommend going!

Fantastically complex and involving. This was our third exit room game so we knew what to expect and we weren't at all disappointed. Lots of challenging, complex and interesting puzzles to complete to escape the cube. The hosts are really committed to the back story and incredibly friendly. This is a fun thing to do with mates but would also make an excellent team building exercise or HR recruitment assessment. They even provide snacks! Definitely recommend the Mystery Cube, hope they do well and expand to do other rooms or locations, would go again.

First escape game experience - great fun. This was our first 'escape game' experience and we loved it. We chose Mystery Cube as it's only one of two in London that accommodates two players. Quite an odd location but once you've found the place (not very well signed) the staff are really friendly, and we entered the cube well prepped on our mission and things to look out for. The puzzles were definitely challenging, but clues are available as and when needed. Overall a great experience, and would definitely like to try others in London after this visit.

Fantastic way to celebrate!!. Absolutely brilliant night!! My husband, two children (14 and 16) and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at the Mystery Cube. The mysteries were challenging enough for my husband to struggle with, but also had plenty for my sons to solve as well. There were enough puzzles for all of us to attempt and they were also quite varied so were able to play to all of our strengths. I booked the Mystery Cube for my son's 16th birthday and he enjoyed every single minute of our time in the Cube. I would definitely recommend giving this "locked room" experience a try!!

Absolutely Brilliant!. The Mystery Cube was my first escape-the-room game and I really did not know what to expect. I could only imagine myself trapped in a room like in Saw, having to solve impossible puzzles a la Only Connect! Both very scary…Well, the Mystery Cube was really fun. Being immersed in a very special universe, entrapped in space and time, hunting for clues, is like no other game: in this one, you are the actor in the unfolding quest for the exit, which makes this whole experience quite exciting.I thought the clues and enigmas were very clever and well thought out. I liked how apparently random things gradually came together. The organisers must have had a lot of fun building it all. I particularly enjoyed the rewarding lightbulb moments when you connect clues together and unleash another one that you know will get you closer to exit.There is so much going on from every corner of the room that everyone is involved and has to communicate with the others. So it is a great team building (or marriage counselling!) activity.My only frustration is that I can’t tell too much about it. All I can say is just go and see for yourself, you won't regret it!

Argh! Only one minute left!. Located not even a 10 minute walk from South Wimbledon tube station, the mystery cube landed in a very ordinary looking building in a business park, looking around thinking to ourselves we've probably been conned... However, after asking a number of confused builders, obviously affected by the mystery cube, we were greeted by the professors.Very friendly and professional, the professors briefed us on the proceedings, then led us to the cube, which you can hear through the walls and as you enter the building. The two of us then were shown into the cube, and the door locked behind us.Unfortunately, the cube heavily affected us and we have both completely forgotten what happened in there, except that the challenges we faced were very nicely and intelligently thought up. Again, unfortunate, but we didn't manage to escape and were transported off to some other worldly dimension, luckily though the professors were able to alter the affects and just about brought us back to reality.Thoroughly recommend, huge amount of fun and a good challenge, for anyone whether an escape room beginner or whether you've done them before (I've done escape rooms before, my partner hadn't) We are a 19year old couple, but would definitely recommend this for any age.

Confused Cubenauts. We are two cubenauts who appear to have suffered partial short-term memory loss. Whilst we would like to say more about the experience, this has rendered us unable to. What we do remember is that the cube was very professionally made and very well thought out. Whilst the details are hazy, we definitely thoroughly enjoyed whatever happened inside this cube of wonder. Really well looked after too by the professor, huge thumbs up. We would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Hands down best exit game in London. At the time of this review, I have done most of the exit games in London. Including Cluequest, Escape Land, Escape Rooms and Escape Hunt (Hint hunt is booked!). My friends and I saw that Mystery Cube was opening and jumped at the chance to try it out for half-price. Our expectations weren't that high. Located outside of central London (Wimbledon) in an office building we really thought it would be a bit unpolished.The area was deserted on the weekend when we arrived. The building old and filled with offices. Although this part of the cube experience indeed appeared unpolished (its not like they could change the building anyway), once you begin the game, it is ANYTHING but unpolished. I want to write more about just how AMAZING this game was but that would ruin the mystery. This exit game is obviously run by dedicated gamers who understand what makes an awesome challenge (difficult enough, yet no weird leaps in logic, randomness or guesswork). I can faithfully say that it is hands down the best exit game in London at the moment. I foresee them being booked up quickly since they only have the 1 room. This is one game not to miss.My friends and I have all been dreaming about the game the last few days. It is the first time that an exit room has stuck with us for so long. The theme, story and puzzles just meshed so well it was truly like being inside a puzzle video game. We wish so much that we could wipe our memories and play this one over and over again.

Extremely charming, well-thought out. Excellent.. This was my second escape-the-room style game, having done one in Budapest back in November, and became instantly hooked. Based in an industrial state between South Wimbledon and Morden Underground stations, it isn't an *ideal* location, but wasn't too tough to get to, and the price is very good for a London room it seems. Puzzles were consistently thought-provoking, with a mix of simple and more complex ones. There were a lot of key and combination locks, which meant that there was a constant feeling of satisfaction that you want from this type of activity. The room itself was pretty small, having been built within your standard office building, but that doesn't take away from the fact that it was a great experience.Highly recommended if you like puzzle rooms 5/5

Great fun; exciting and a great way to spend some time with your friends/family.. We booked "grandpa's last will' following a recommendation from a friend and as part of a day's celebration for one of our group's birthday. The location, near Bermondsey tube, is a little difficult to find so, allow a few extra minutes. Reception is very friendly with a clear briefing and all questions dealt with. The puzzles are interesting,varied and not so difficult that they can't be solved. You are in walkie-talkie contact for the full time you are in the locked room and, should you get really stuck, you have the option to get up to 3 hints/clues to help you progress and still succeed. There are a couple of surprises along the way and a sense of achievement once you complete the escape. To be honest we overran by about 1 minute but we were advised that most (75-85%) tend to complete within the hour. We Will definitely be going back to do the other two locked rooms.

Brilliant Day Out. An absolutely brilliant day out with the family today at Lock'd. Intelligently crafted escape room, beautifully put together - keeps you on your toes the whole way through and some really exciting moments too! Lovely staff and the man who runs it is a genius - looking forward to going back and seeing what they've come up with for their next rooms!Rosie

Amazing setting to have fun in.. I went here for my sisters birthday and had a great time with my family. We had no idea what we were in for but were really taken by our surroundings. The moment we arrived at the venue we were warmingly greeted, offered bottles of water and chocolates. Then briefed on the puzzle we would be entering. After entering the room the fun really began. Our surroundings really set a mood the was cinematic in nature. The theme continued and we remained consistently pleasantly surprised, however, I don't want to give too much away in order not to spoil it for anyone else embarking on the adventure.
Great fun for novices. The puzzle starts with finding your way into the place itself but once there, it proved to be good fun and challenging.

First escape room exeprience. This was the first escape room we have done and we weren't disappointed! It was well set up although a little tricky to find and email communication with the organisers was incredibly poor so can definitely be improved. Once there though- such good fun. We had a great experience!

Disappointing - much better escape rooms out there. We went with a group of a 4 friends, all of whom have tried 2 or 3 escape rooms in various locations in London and abroad.It's really hard to find and badly posted so leave plenty of time. Ring 108 on the buzzers next to the door with the giant 'Bourbon' writing next to it. There's no atmosphere on arrival either which is a shame as I've been to excellent places where they set the scene and really get you into the right mind set. The team here were perfectly nice but it felt like a bare bones effort.This continued into the room itself. The room we booked (Perpetuum) was apparently "glitchy" so we had to swap on arrival to the museum heist room as we didn't want to do the easier Grandpa room. We were finished within 35 minutes and didn't really get stretched at any point. That in itself wasdisappointing as I'd read good reviews on that room and that's why we selected this location! We felt that compared to others we'd tried, this room was mostly about hunting for things, there was very little in the way of logic puzzles or things to make you think. It was all very much an anticlimax when we realised we'd finished it and that was all there was to do in the room.It might be ok as a first time escape room, or for younger teams who are looking for a hide and seek style challenge but if you're looking for technology, a good scene setting or a grey matter work out then I think other places might be a better bet. (Time run in East London for example is 10 times better and worth the extra few quid)Perhaps the other rooms are better? All in all we felt that £108 for 30 minutes of average entertainment was an awful lot of money. We almost asked if we could do another room simply to get our money's worth!

Pleasantly surprised. Had a great evening out with some friends. The puzzles were challenging but not demoralising and the staff were helpful and friendly. I look forward to going again and sampling some of the other rooms!

A bit lacking in atmosphere. As a late booking we were only able to book the museum escape which i understand is the easiest of the games.There are nice nice touches to the puzzle but props and story rather basic. Would have preferred more clues rather than finding things hidden in the rooms.The other thing which may be part of the whole experience is there are absolutely no visible signs what building this is located in. We had to ring and ask a security guard before we found the intercom and buzzed to be let in.

Normally being confined to a room for an hour is a punishment, but.... We found this little gem while Googling for something different to do than our usual day out in London. It wasn't hard to find and a fairly short walk from the nearest Tube station (though we all walk a lot so check the distance for this yourself!). We arrived to a warm welcome and friendly, helpful advice about our task. It was a hot day and bottles of water were provided. We spent an hour solving clues to escape the locked room. No equipment is needed that isn't at hand-but take your glasses if you wear them. I'll leave no spoilers, but just say there were surprises none of us predicted. A fun hour where we all learned about our own skills as well as each others. We escaped the room and are all looking forward to trying another.

Something different . We've been to London a few times so we thought we would look for something different. We chose lockd in Bermondsey. Close to the tube if you navigate properly. The game itself is a bit confusing. Following the instructions not to be too forceful or touching any electrical items is sound advise but don't hide any clues in said items or use locks that need a bit of force. All in all a frustrating day
Challenging puzzles with surprises. Went there with friends and had a lot of fun in one of the rooms - the puzzles were challenging and there were a couple of surprises as well.

A fun and clever puzzle, with surprises and friendly staff.. The place was a little hard to find, but well worth it when we did. We were greeted with a smile and the instructions before we entered were clear. We played through the Grandpa's Last Will room, and we finished it with only a few minutes to spare - the difficulty was just right for our group of 4. It's tough to describe the puzzle itself without spoiling it, but we had a good time and I'd recommend it to others.

Good fun, odd location. Once you get over the very strange location it's in... The event itself is fun. Great with friends or family, and suitably difficult without being disheartening. Could have been a little more 'professional', but on the whole, a good experience.

Lock'd experience. We were a party of 5, ages 8, 12, 15, 35 and 63. We found the building ok, the door to get in is on the left of the B block, you have to use the intercom to get in (tap 108 on the keypad). This was the first ever escape room we have done so we chose the Grandpas last will room which is the easiest. We all really enjoyed it, some clues were easy, others more tricky and we did have to ask for help three times. The room did get hot, we visited on a warm day which didn't help. A bottle of water and plastic cups were supplied in the room.The lady on the front desk was very friendly and helpful and she did give us a few extra minutes to complete the room. We would go back and do another room :)

Horrendous customer service. I booked Lock'd for a teambuilding exercise for my team at work. A week before the booking, I had to make an alteration and needed my receipts, and so spent an entire week trying to get in touch with Lock'd, with dozens of phone calls and a couple of emails, all to no response. The experience itself was above average, but let down a little by a bit of an ambivalence to faulty or broken elements. They were unable to give me a receipt, and I was told that the person who could was reachable via the email address.It has been 10 days since the event and I have once again emailed Lock'd, to no avail. The lack of professionalism is astonishing - with dozens of other escape games around London, I wouldn't bother going there.

Great fun!!. Took my 14 year old son here for a birthday treat as we were out in London. It was good fun and as we were a 2 they let us have a little more time to allow us to solve it which was nice!!I'd recommend it to anyone!!

Really disappointing. I have played a lot of escape rooms in London, and also a few in Vegas, so I definitely feel qualified to give a fair review of this experience. My friends and I booked to play 2 rooms at the same time, and split the group into 2 sets of 3 - 1 group in Grandpa's Last Will, and us in Perpetuum. We did struggle to find the venue (which seems common based on other reviews), but when we did arrive, the staff seemed friendly and explained the rules and walkie talkies well. A lady named Ella escorted us into our room, and gave us the backstory to the theme etc. Mid explanation, she realised the room had not been reset properly, and looked at an open box on the wall saying "oh, shoot. He's forgotten to put the key back". We were then asked to leave the room so she could hide the key again, but obviously we now knew we were looking for a key to open the grey box! Our time eventually started, but we were only given a sand timer for reference (most escape rooms have countdown clocks etc and screens to deliver clues at tactical moments). We were told to just use the walkies to ask how long we had left if we wanted a time check. The escape consists of 2 rooms - the first of which was really good. We solved the puzzles quickly, and made our way into the 2nd room where things became more complicated. We were encouraged to ask for help, which we did, but Ella was the point of contact for 3 rooms being played simultaneously, and it took a long time for her to respond to us each time we called her. Also, although you are on CCTV, no one was watching, as we kept being given hints for parts of the room we hadn't uncovered or solved yet. For example, "oh, you need to look at the mug. Oh, you haven't found the mug yet. Ummmmmm, what bit of the room are you at again?" There was also a part which involved positioning something into a very specific location (won't give it away) but the sensor was way off, meaning that the location was actually away from where the clue had lead us. After calling her several times, Ella explained that we needed to "just move it around until it works, it's not the exact location anymore". We wasted so much time on this, and waiting for her to respond to us. At one point, she actually answered our increasingly frustrated calls with "sorry guys, but I've been busy with the other teams, there's 3 of you all needing help at once". Mid way through the second room, we asked for a time check. Again, it took several tries at calling Ella to receive a response, in which we were told "well, you started at 42 mins past, and it's now 24 mins past". When you are racing the clock, this really isn't what you want to hear! We asked for another clue, and again, she struggled to help us as she didn't know exactly where we were at in the room (because she wasn't watching us). Eventually, our walkie talkie stopped working altogether, and we were left screaming for help because we knew we only had a few mins of time left to complete the room. Ella eventually heard us, and came into the room apologising for the broken radio and for not having noticed us flapping for help. She then informed us that we'd "run out of time anyway, and the next group are here, so shall i just finish the room for you so you can see how it would have worked?" Conceptually, this is a good escape room with some clever touches and hard to solve puzzles. One visual element in particular is excellent. However, I am massively disappointed with the experience. One person managing 3 rooms is a ridiculous ask, and ruined our game. We were left feeling incredibly frustrated, and wishing we'd booked somewhere else. I feel sorry for Ella, as although she was very friendly, she stood no chance of responding to 3 teams effectively. If you want a proper escape room experience, where you are not just left to your own devices, I would highly recommend ClueQuest. They have a large team of people watching and listening to you at all times, and you certainly won't feel abandoned!

Tricky. Had so much fun when we attempted 'Grandpa's Last Will' recently. There were only two of us, but we managed to find/solve most of the puzzles. The lady there was super nice and checked in with us to see if we needed clues (we thought we didn't... turns out we were wrong!) She also warned us when we were running out of time! Some of the puzzles were really tricky, but satisfying when we worked them out. There is so much stuff in there though its hard to tell what is a clue and what isn't! Highly recommend, especially for beginners.

Grandpa's Last Will- Really Recommend!. 3 of us played Grandpa's last will and had a great time.Lock'd were very accommodating of us, and switched our booking for us when one of the party had to change her travel plans, so thumbs up to them for being so flexible.The game was not the most sophisticated compared to the others I have done, but this made it no less enjoyable. In terms of difficulty, I would put it at average- if you have done several escape rooms in the past, you will probably find this on the easier end, but still some challenging elements, so worth a visit. We had 2 first time escape gamers and 1 who had done several and we got out with 5 mins to spare.

Look elsewhere for escape game!. The setup of the escape games at Lock'd is mediocre at best. The puzzles in the room are average and we experienced several missing clues, which resulted in a less than favorable experience. We were not impressed that you have to receive clues through a basic waklie-talkie device. The top-notch games that we have played have monitors in the room displaying the time left and give clues when needed. Lock'd didn't even have a timer in the room! We had to use our timer on our phone!We also experienced a very inattentive gamemaster while playing. Our walkie-talkie wasn't working properly at first, and the gamemaster should have noticed this had they been properly watching the monitors. We had to exit the room to get the gamemaster's attention, and eventually had to switch out the walkie-talkies. There were also times where we were asking for clues and received no response resulting in lost time.I would search elsewhere for better games as there are many of them in the London area. A great alternative to Lock'd if you are looking for something in this area would be Archimedes Inspiration. Archimedes Inspiration just opened in the same building complex and offers London's first fully-automated escape room. We had a much better experience at this escape room.

Great fun. I've played two of the rooms here and both were great fun, with lots of surprises and several 'wow' moments in each. Grandpa's Last Will was particularly excellent in my opinion. This is a fab way to spend an hour and really good value for money. The 13 year old I took really enjoyed himself and the puzzles are perfectly pitched for everyone to enjoy. Friendly and helpful staff make the whole visit a delight. Definitely one of the best things you can do in London, whether it's with family, friends or work colleagues.

A tremendous afternoon. I visited Lock'd last week with a group of friends and had one of my best afternoons in london in ages. It was marvellous and I shall be returning soon to test my mettle in the other puzzle rooms!
Grandpa's Last Will room . Truly wonderful experience of Grandpa's Last Will room! I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes the quests!
Brilliant fun. Such a great time at this escape game. Lovely staff. Would recommend to everyone. Harder than I thought it would be but a great concept. Would do another

Excellent Game, 2 down, 1 to go!. Lock'd really is an excellent game experience. So far we have completed Grandpa's will and the Museum Heist but we will be back very soon to try the final room. An excellent activity for a birthday or just for something to do after work or on a weekend. Highly recommended :)

Excellent concept . What a great experience. We eagerly turned up and had chosen Grandpa's last will. Excited and not sure what to expect we were took to our room and was set to task! The guy who welcomed us and gave us an overview really kind and helpful, sadly we failed but couldn't have been more happier with the experience. Nice to use the old grey matter for a change. Would love to try the other rooms and next time in the capital will seek it out!

Really fun! Definitely recommend it!. I came here with a couple of friends and tried out the museum warehouse escape room.It was really fun, loads of stuff to do and keeps you on your toes, definitely recommend going here, going to try out the other ones soon!

Fun times, with fun rhymes. The set up was funny and interesting, staff are helpful and friendly , and the puzzles are actually really quite hard. There is a lot of thought gone into providing each root with unique clues and interesting aesthetics. I would recommend this for anyone looking for something different and that you can do without alcohol or spending a bomb.

Hard to find but well worth it - excellent game. I've been to quite a few escape room experiences, including a few others in London. This is one of the more expensive ones but it has to be said it's an excellent one. There are three games and we did the Museum Warehouse. The quality of the room and the puzzles is superior to other escape rooms I've experiences, including some nice technology that was really clever. It's not just a case of trying to find a key or a four-digit code, you're actually looking for something physical to deactivate the door.It's not that easy to find the place, and they could certainly do with more outdoor signage. Waiting room could do with a bit more decor, and a drink vending machine would do well - it's thirsty work clue-hunting for an hour.Otherwise this is great and I'm really keen to try another room!
Great mind exercise game! . What a great way to spend time with friends! I thoroughly enjoyed myself there! Love it! Definitely will want to come back again for the other room!!!

Really good activity a little expensive. Did this one as a couple (grandfathers will) and really enjoyed it. Totally underrated how much fun this would be and also how much thought required but over all a really good day! Great attention to detail with a very helpful worker there who kept a close eye on you during the task at hand with hints if needed. Would like to go back again and try the other rooms but a little on the expensive side

A great fun mind exercise!. We were a group of 11 adults celebrating our friends 20th wedding anniversary (one of many activities we did around London that day). We had a bit of trouble finding it at first but as this was a surprise for our friends it added to the intrigue as to what we were doing! The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and it was fantastic fun. We split into two groups for two different challenges and tried as hard as we could not to tell each other what we did in case we go again! Great fun, unusual and a good mind exercise, yet not so hard that you don't enjoy it. Thoroughly recommended.
Lots if fun. It was really exciting and fun . Different to anything I've done before. A great challenge to get you thinking!
So much fun! Deffo recommend!. We had an absolute blast. I would highly recommend this. With the rise in technology it's good to use your brain for a change.
Great. An enjoyable and novel experience! Thoroughly enjoyed unearthing the clues one by one, a very well thought of concept! looking forward to more escape rooms!
Out of the box. The rooms were interesting and most of them requires you to think out of the box. Excited to try the new rooms.

Really fun. Went with group of 11 and split into groups in different rooms in a race of who gets out 1st!! Everyone had great fun!! Adults and kids all enjoyed it very much!! A lil pricey but wats cheap nowadays lol

Got the style and a story but lacking substance. This is my 5th "Escape the Room" experience (4 in London and 1 in Bristol) and although there was so much going for this experience, we left feeling a little flat and unimpressed. The set up was really good in fairness and had lots of potential; most of the things were electronic and automated and very little human interaction from the organisers, good quality design and interesting puzzles. Where it was left down was in introduction (which was very functionary), the room felt empty and the atmosphere was lacking. Some simple suggestions would be to add a visual countdown of the time on a screen to build suspense, make the room a bit 'fuller' in terms of props and a better build up of the story beforehand (or maybe a smoke machine!). I'd still recommend it though for a first time 'escape the roomer' :-)

Museum Warehouse. Great way to spend an hour. Location was a little tricky to find, my daughter was excited to discover it was in an old biscuit factory but alas no bourbons were to be found. Staff were friendly and set the scene well and the puzzles were tricky but very solvable, when we asked for help we groaned when we realised what we had missed. I only had two very minor gripes. There's a safe that has an electronic keypad which we thought had broken but it simply stopped working if you put the code in wrong too many times. It powered up again after a while but it was really frustrating. Also a couple of the combination locks were very difficult to manipulate but that could possibly be me being overexcited! We made it out in 51 mins but we have done a couple of these before. A great morning.

Excellent experience. Highly recommend it. It was our first time to do it and we had to figure out ourselves what to do. It is an intelligent game, we really enjoyed it. It is a game which requires you to run your brain quickly in order to solve the puzzles one by one

What a fun experience!. My boyfriend had booked this for our 6 year anniversary, and it isn't your "typical romantic outing", but I'll be honest - I will so do this again! It's an activity for everyone of all ages; friends, couples and families, and I recommend it to anyone who's looking for a new but different experience. Even if you've done it before, and you're into mystery/clue games, and escape rooms, I would recommend this place. A lot of thought and creativity has gone into this, and the guys in charge were really friendly so they help ease your nerves (if like me, you don't like the idea of 1. failing a mission, and 2. not being able to escape!). This sort of game also shows what kind of person you are, and your dynamics as a team. I would definitely be coming back to do this again! Thanks for a great experience! :)

Fab Fun To solve Puzzles. I spent the other Saturday afternoon here with Old work colleagues, as we hadn't seen each other for over a Year we wanted to do something different and Lock'd definitely ticked this box. We had such fun solving the puzzle to find the stolen art pieces, with Seconds away from finding the last bit we sadly run out of time. The hour went so quick but I would highly recommend the Museum warehouse this was excellent
Time flies when your having fun. Fantastic way to buzz charge your day,I went with 3 friends and had a great time only wished we could of stayed longer.Loved it !!!!

Rather boring. The escape we tried was Grandpa's Last Will. The puzzles were very similar one to another, making the game rather boring. We were two and managed to escape in less than 60 min.The location is not very easy to find, but following a map is OK. There was a mistake made by the stuff at a certain puzzle; they gave us some extra time to compensate what we had lost trying to solve that one.I have to mention that we both have escaped from various rooms, the reason for booking this one being that they accepted a team of only two.
Great experience. One of the best activities I have ever done, it's a great way to have fun with your friends & family!!
Team building. A great way to challenge your mind and solve puzzles if you're a puzzle fanatic. Also a perfect event for a birthday surprise.
Good. It was very interesting and challenging to the mind and builds team work among your friends but was in a weird location.

Great escape room. Having done a few escape rooms before, I can say I really enjoyed lock'd. We did the Grandpa's Last Will room and only got out with a few minutes to spare, despite the fact it's meant to be one of the easier rooms. There were some puzzles that really kept us busy. I loved the design, and there were a few pretty ingenious features that I haven't seen in any other escape rooms.Overall, we really enjoyed it!
