First timer. Did this as a family (two kids aged 10 and 15 years). We all got into it, and as a first time found it very exciting being up against the clock to solve the 'puzzles'. Would certainly do this type of activity again.

Disappointing. It was our second escape for my friends and I and compared to the first one we had it was not that entertaining. At least for the first part of the game. I can't tell exactly why we didn't like it without spoiling but we did Grandpa's will. Some combinations were really clever to find. We did have a good time even though we almost gave up at one point.

Museum Warehouse. Went on Good Friday with my sisters to do the Museum Warehouse challenge. We had never done an escape room before so it took us a while to get into the right mindset but it was totally brilliant. The hour long time limit absolutely flew by we were having such a great time. Although we didn't quite complete it that didn't take away from the experience at all. Staff were lovely. Only thing we found was direction on the website weren't great - if you're go down Drummond Road as per the map, it is actually on the Biscuit Factory site which we didn't realise!! Otherwise totally awesome experience which I would 100% recommend.

Grandpa's Last Will. Went yesterday with 2 friends. We wasted about 10 minutes trying to crack a code that we had managed to crack without realising - complete fluke and couldn't elaborate without spoiling it. The guys hosting said this had never happened before - I guess we were just unlucky. We didn't complete the mission but had a brilliant time trying. Really well thought out puzzles, clues and red herrings. This was our first time trying out an 'escape room' and we all loved it so much we will definitely be back for more - brilliant fun.

2 rooms with mates. So this was my 3rd room I've done and first here at lock'd. Couple of things let it down compared to other rooms I've done. It's hard to find the location give yourself plenty of time to find the venue. Bit more of a heads up on website wouldn't of hurt. Hosts didn't really seem to care out of the 13 players playing 3 rooms only 4 were on time due to getting lost. Seemed to be a common problem yet clear instructions on website aren't there which u would thought be logical to do. My group did museum warehouse. The puzzle itself wasn't too hard to be honest I wouldn't of rated it 4 out of 5. We got out in 51 mins but we did have 2 technical issues with 2 locks not working. Cost us good 5 minutes putting in correct codes and the locks not activating properly before asking hosts to come in and sort it.My other mates newbies to escape rooms did grandpa last will and solved it in 56 mins with 4 people. Feedback they enjoyed their room and had a good experience of escape rooms. I won't be looking to go back and do other rooms here sadly. More challenging rooms elsewhere to find with better hosts and working locks.

Great time. This was our second escape room and choose Grandpa's Will as we had our 2 younger boys with us so we thought we would go for the easier room. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and finished with a couple of minutes to spare! We will go back and to the other 2 rooms

Needs more.... My fiancé, friends and i have now done about 13 escape rooms across London, we did this in October 2015 and have to say this was one of the least inventive and quite boring rooms.We did the 'Museum Warehouse' room and escaped in under 25mins. Whilst you could say this is partly down to our experience at these things, most rooms we've done have kept us in for 35-45mins on average and have been well themed and thought out.When we opened the door at the end, we expected either another room or an extra part to it, only to be told 'that's it'. I think more thought needs to go into the theming and puzzles included.

Exceptional Customer Service. I had planned to go to Lock'd with a group of 6 friends, 3 couples so we didn't want to be split into 2 groups of 3. After speaking with Lock'd they were happy to make an exception and let all 6 go together, instead of the usual 5 person max.Unfortunately after this, I had to cancel the evening due to circumstances and after speaking with Lock'd they were happy to give me a full refund, without much fuss at all.I have to say I was very impressed with their customer service and I will 100% be going back to them at a future date to finally take part in one of their games.

Fun and Friendly!. I went on valentines day with my girlfriend and we had a blast! We did Museum Warehouse and thought the puzzles where well thought out with a theme that really immersed us in the game. Although we did not complete the game Phil (one of the staff) was really friendly and showed us the rest of the puzzle even thought they where short for time. As a bonus we also got chocolates as it was valentines day and this was defiantly a nice touch.

Great Experience!. Lock'd is a live escape game in London, were we did one of the rooms.First i was skeptical about this type of games, but in the end i loved the experience and it was a great time with my girlfriend.It's an ideal exercise for couples, familys, friends and also team buildings.Could come back to do other rooms!

A GREAT EXPERIENCE. A great experience in solving a series of puzzles & clues to collect hidden items to allow you to be released from a locked room/s. It can be a bit frustrating when you think that you have solved a clue only to find you haven't. You have an hour to escape the room which is not as easy as it might seem as some of the clues can be very cryptic. Try it out you will have great fun and a good laugh, we were talking about it for ages and would love to do it again.
Excellent fun. Me and the wife played Feb 2016 and had a lot of fun. Probably the best escape room we've done. Great staff, great rooms. Many thanks

Close, but broken. I've done a few of these escape games and the others have been very good, good story around them, good execution etc. Unfortunately this one was lacking. It wasn't lacking due to being too challenging or too easy, it was spot on in that regard. The issue we had was that a key aspect of solving the puzzle was broken. We specifically asked the staff (using the walkie-talkie provided) if this bit was broken and they said no. Five minutes later they radioed us and said that actually it was broken so we had to turn a plug off and on to reset the system and bypass it - kind of ruins the whole experience. The outcome was that we failed on the last task due to being out of time, the time we lost by trying to do something that was impossible due to the broken bit! A decent person would have tacked that time on at the end so we could complete it and at least leave feeling happy, instead we left feeling cheated. Good concept, good tasks, but they really need to make sure the technology is able to withstand the use it gets. So despite it being fun and tricky, I much prefer the games by Handmade Mysteries and Escape the Room where there is more attention to detail and atmosphere.

Great activity for the weekend. We came in two groups of 3 and each did a different room. Both were a lot of fun and a lot more challenging than we thought! We';d never done anything like this before but it was challenging enough that we had a great time and the team were really supportive and gave us clues via walkie talkie when we needed them! Staff are amazing and so friendly and helpful. We had a really great time and would definitely recommend it to any groups teenage years above

A Sweet Escape. Myself and 2 friends visited Lock'd on saturday 06/02/16 and had a great time! the first challenge is to find the place, although apparently this is a common theme with escape rooms.when we arrived we were waiting a little for them to reset the rooms as people had overrun slightly before us but it was no issue, were given bottles of water and kept well informed.we completed the museum warehouse room in 53 minutes, and the time flew by! we felt that the challenges were well considered and definitely thought provoking.only downside for us was that when we asked for a clue they did tell us outright where a key was, this should really just be narrowed down to a general area and maybe not be so specific.All in all we had a great time and would definitely come back to try the other roomsThanks!
Brilliant. Really nice staff, great setup. We did the hardest room and had a fantastic time. Really clever and interesting problem solving.

Museum Warehouse. Don’t tend to write reviews but Museum Warehouse was an incredible experience. Truly entertaining and challenging! Definitely look forward to the new rooms opening soon. Well done Lock’d Games London!

Nice escape game!. We enjoyed this game with multiple items to find. I can't say more without giving away the game. Staff were friendly and offered help if required via a walkie talkie. No screen with timer but again, staff would anounce the time. Overall a good escape game but we tried the starter room that they had. Will try the next level and see how it goes.

Good fun. Went last week to do grandpa's will, which is the easiest game they have (they have 3 different rooms when we went). Staff is really friendly and helpful and the best thing about the place is that they admit couples to play. Escaping was fun, but with too many keys and padlocks which becomes sligthly monotonous and the end of the game. Another inconvenience is that we did not have a countdown clock to realize the time left that we had. In summary, good fun and definitely coming back to play the other rooms!

Excellent. Arranged for myself and another person to take on the grandpa's last will challenge, had no idea what to expect when we got there.The experience itself was brilliant, we managed to complete the task just within the allotted time and that in itself was a very rewarding feeling. The help along the way was just enough to get you thinking without giving it away.Overall would definitely go back, this time I think im ready for a bigger challenge.

Fun but Simple. I went with a group of 5 to the Escape Room 'Lock'd'. The experience was fun however there wasn't any exciting music or much of a story built around the 'escape', it was located in a biscuit factory and they had rented out a floor, it seemed a little cheap even though the price was pretty steep for what we got. The clues were clever and it was well thought out but the guy on the walkie-talkie (who was meant to give hints if stuck) ended up telling us exactly where the keys were or what we were looking for. It was fun but very average - seeing as most escape rooms are the same price you could maybe find somewhere better.

Great team building activity. We went to lock'd as part of a work day out and had a great time. The choice of rooms meant that we could all take part at the same time and even compete! A great time was had by all.

Excellent staff. We visited Lock'd today as a group of 10 and had a great time in two seperate rooms. There was a slight admin error on our arrival which was superbly handled by the charming Phil and his collegue. We will definitely be visting again to try out other senerios. A great afternoon for our group which varied in age from 53 to 16

Helpful caring stuff. We turned up and there was a miss communication over the booking. Phil and his colleague really did theirbest to sort the issue out and went out of their way to accommodate us so that our 2 families had a memorable day. Staff so helpful throughout attraction.

great night. Really enjoyed Lock'd, the staff were very helpful and the game was a lot of fun......a bit tricky to locate the building...we had to call the venue for directions but we found it in the end..all in all great night.

Great for Christmas party!. We hired two of the rooms and split into teams. Really exciting & imaginative puzzles for everyone to participate in solving. Challenging (but not impossible) and a lot of fun - would recommend!
Great fun!. Loved it! Definetly going again to try another room :) It´s so much fun to these kind of activity!!! The staff was great too, very, very nice and helpful!
Lock'd. Great fun will definitely be going back again!! Was a little tricky to find but staff were very helpful.

We want to go back for more. We wanted to go back for more pretty much as soon as we left. The hosts were extremely friendly and their welcoming attitude and enthusiasm were ideal to get us in the mood. The room was very cleverly set up and everything from he props to the wall colours made the setting come to life. We found the puzzles to be clever, ingenious and challenging and finishing just with seconds to spare we left really hyped and ready for more. I am so pleased that we've found this awesome new thing to do in London

Fab time!. We just completed one of the Lock'd games as part of our work Christmas party. We chose a slightly harder puzzle because we had just done another live escape game in Berlin. The staff were really helpful and the puzzle was really challenging and we had a lot of fun. I would definitely recommend it although I'm not sure if there is some strange meta-game going on because the actual venue was really hard to find so we had to get in before we could get out :-)

Very Good Fun. We were a bit skeptical initially about this but once we were in the room it was great fun trying to solve the puzzles. Some were easier to solve than others which made it a great introduction to this type of activity for someone who hasn't done this before. The 2 guys who run the experience are really friendly and make you feel welcome and are happy to help with some clues as you go. Highly recommend and we're already thinking about when we can go back to try the other rooms.
It was nice.. Pretty interesting but not very cozy environment. The equipment is very old and It was too dark but the rest was good.

Great work!. Being our third room escape of the day they had a high bar to meet. Although not the best of the day, it was fantastic (the other one would be a hard one to beat). Great theme, layout and set of puzzles. We look forward to setting the record on your hardest room ;-)

Good fun!. Our two teams had a great time at Lock'd. One team got out - my team didn't! The staff were really friendly and helpful, offering much-needed clues intermittently. I'll definitely go back and would highly recommend it.

First Escape!. Brilliant anyone from about 8 years up can do this. Definately going back.
We got out despite i think they wished we had remained locked in.
A very noisey bunch of girls. Get those brain cells going and don't rule out the obvious!
Sorry no photos it would ruin your fun!

Great birthday mini-adventure!. As total newbies, we didn't know what to expect, but everything was explained well and we were soon engrossed in the hunt for clues and solving puzzles. The time flew by and we only just completed the challenge in the time available. OK, so we're not the fastest, but at least we obtained maximum value for money from the experience! We'll be back to try one of the other rooms and would thoroughly recommend Lock'd.

A London must do!. Was absolutely fantastic! We did the Great Grandfather's Will room and had a great time was something really different and a great start to a night out. We are already planning our next trip back would highly recommend! Staff were great, really friendly and helpful:)
Wow. Great place, great to do something different. Highly recommend to enjoy yourself after stressful day at work.
Great team bonding exercise. Excellent fun, and just the right level of hints given to enable us to get through it whilst still convincing ourselves that we worked most of it out ourselves!

Great entertainment with family, friends or colleagues!. My kids and I solved the mystery of Grandpa's Last Will and we had a great time doing so! A great way to teach team work, decomposing a big problem into smaller ones and logical reasoning. A novel and entertaining way to spend the afternoon. We will visit again to attempt to solve the other mysteries.

Best escape room in London. My friends and I have done about ten different escape rooms in London and this was by far our favourite set - well-designed and challenging, the theming was great and the right amount of surprises to keep you guessing!

Best leisure time in London. Visited Grandpa's Last Will with a friend and his two kids (12 and 14 years old). Overall had an amazing afternoon! - Kids loved it, said they would recommend it to their friends at school.Previously, I visited quests in Singapore and Hong Kong but Lockd exceeded my expectations in terms of puzzle's creativity and complexity (not easy and not extremely difficult requiring PhD in nuclear physics to solve problems). Highly recommend visiting with friends, couples, kids..Very addictive, will definitely visit their other two quests.

Amazing game. We had a great time inside. Lots of thinking and searching for clues to solve the puzzle and get out of that room. The staff were helpful. It was our first time there. And they suggest a beginner level puzzle and we took it. You will not regret it. And you will not forget it.

Exciting experience . I have tried a few Escape games in London with friends. "Lock'd' was definitely amongst the top ones we have visited. Firstly, the game we chose had a different concept from the others we used to play, which made it more clear and exciting to play. Second, amazing organisation of the plot and ideas in the game overall, definitely worth spending money and time at Lock'd!!

Great afternoon winter game. This is a perfect idea to escape the winter cold for an hour (or less!). I've done a few escape games and this one was really great! It was a nice challenge to escape from 3 rooms (we did the museum game). Lots of fun!

Tech failure. We have done escape rooms all over the world and the room we chose was very tech dependent, so we were excited to try it. But several steps were literally broken. Thus, we were not able to open locks or even complete the room because of technological difficulties. Super frustrating and, at the end, actually pointless.

Good way to spend an hour. Has a great time at Lock'd. Would have preferred the story to have been sold a bit better at the beginning but would recommend this to anyone who wants to be a sleuth for an hour.

A great time - 39 minutes!. This was our first experience of playing an escape game - so we are unable to compare it to others, nevertheless, we had a great experience. High quality immersion experience and we already have plans to go back to do another one!
Escape!. This is so much fun, such a brilliant idea for something to do, the guys who worked there were both really nice and all my group had a wicked time!

Very enjoyable and challenging game. I really enjoyed my recent visit to Lock'd. The rooms and decorations were a bit more basic than other escape the room games I have done however the game itself was great and was sufficiently challenging and very absorbing. We went for a friend's birthday and all really enjoyed it.
Lockd. It was awesome!! strongly recommend it! Challenging and fun. Something different to do if you are bored of bars and restaurants.

Brilliant evening out. Definitely recommend.. I went with my boyfriend and his parents for his 24th birthday night. It was excellent. We had absolutely no idea what to expect and so had tried to go in with an open mind to avoid disappointment, however we didn't need to. It was excellent. We did the museum warehouse room and were pleasantly surprised that there were multiple sections to the escaping. That was great. Definitely recommend. Will be booking another in the new year.

Great Family Fun. We did this challenge for fun whilst my 19 year old daughter was home from Uni, she and our 2 sons (age 16 + 13) got fully engrossed and we all had to work together to escape. We all brought different skills to the challenge and they left saying, can we do this again some time Mum!!

amazing two games and two hours I will never forget!. It a surprise gift for my birthday in June 2015. Thrilling experience that has a lot of WOWs and unexpected plot twists. My teenager daughter was extremely excited as well. Cannot recommend more!
Friendly support of Lock'd team was much appreciated

Brilliant fun. Couldn't recommend this more!Went along as part of a day out in london for my sisters 40th. We were a group of 8 so split into 2 teams of 4, occupying 2 of the rooms. Both teams had the most brilliant time and and left with huge smiles!The guys running it were lovely, very helpful and wonderful at explaining everything, they even got a bottle of bubbly for my sister with it being such a landmark celebration! Highly recommend to all and will be back to try the other rooms soon, i hope :).Huge thank you to the Lock'd team for a wonderful morning!
great fun but a lot of money for an hour. Really fun but could have done with a few more rooms to un lock as it was £88 for 4 of us for an hour.
Lock'd. Great fun, 14 of us attended and split into 3 rooms - full of clues and riddles, we won't spoil the fun but it's fantastic and would highly recommend!

Brilliant experience. Great afternoon out with our teenage children. It was difficult enough to make it challenging and the staff were incredibly helpful when we got stuck (without giving too much away). Definitely worth the money and will go again.

Best indoor experience in London.. Such a fun time with friends! Good way to use your brain and have a good time doing it! LOVED it. From the friendly and entertaining staff who prepared is and got us in the zone (and gave us a helpful hint or two in riddle form) to the amazingly planned out clues and brilliantly decorated room it was the best tourist thing I've done in London thus far!
Great fun. Four of us did Grandpa's Last Will - good fun. Not too difficult at 3 out of 5 level. Certainly thinking about coming back and trying the next level.

Great Fun. This was bought as a surprise birthday present. First challenge was to find, in the dark, the right door to entrance (you will understand if you go there). Once inside, had no idea what to expect. Given a briefing before entering room (we did grandpa's last will) then given an hour to find clues to unlock the ???Brilliant fun and between the 5 of us we completed the challenge - though we did need to ask for 2 'hints' along the way. Time went far too fast and all agreed we would love to do a different room another time.
Amazing. This was such fun, I really enjoyed it, really well thought out and such a great experience, I would recommend to anyone.

Best Birthday suprise. My parents booked a suprise trip for my 35th birthday. I had no idea what to expect but loved every minute of it. Would have loved to have done other challenges on the day as the hour went so quickly. A real bonding experience for my parents and sisters working together as a team and we did it with 10minutes to spare. Attention to detail with authentic props and clever electronics to make the tasks more complex and interesting. Highly recommend. :-)
Brilliant!. Our first escape room experience. Enjoyed it so much we went right back and booked a different senario straight after! Good fun. Helpful staff. Will return!

Really good!. Did this with my 2 kids aged 9 and 10. It was really good fun as something never tried before. Clues do not require academic skills or maths prowess, just logic and observation. I would recommend to thrcehole family and it is a great team builder too!

Great fun.. Went along with our 11 year old and 13 year old and we we all loved it. Plenty of puzzles to keep us busy. A challenge without being too hard and help was on hand if we needed it. Took us a while to find the right building though. Was thinking this must have been part of the challenge!!!
Museum Madness!. It was fun, great idea for small families or a group of friends. Puzzles were challenging but not unachievable. Would definitely do another.
Pefect weekend. I think it is one of the perfect games we have ever played as a family. We will defenetely attend the other rooms soon.
Lockd grandpas mission. Amazing experience- recommend to anyone! All ages and types of people. It was a Great day out- thank you! !

First time at an escape room. It was quite a challenge to find the location. Would advise you to give yourself plenty of time.We tried "Grandpa's last will". Took a bit of time to get into the right mind set, but we got a good hang of it by the end of the game. All four of us loved it and are ready for more.
Awesome. It was fun and challenging. It took us some time to understand how and where to search for the clues but afterwards it was soo much fun.

Such a great idea!. What a great idea... It's not in the centre of London but easy to find. We only had a group of three but we still had great fun trying to put together all the clues. Highly recommend it.. It's addictive once you do one room you will want to do another

My daughters and I loved this!!. 5 min walk from Bermondsey Tube and we arrived at Block B of the Biscuit Factory. On arrival we buzzed in and really didn't know what to expect.....then we were given our instructions and the challenge began.It took us fifty minutes to escape the Grandpas Will room and we loved it. My daughters (aged 14 & 11) raved about it over dinner afterwards and have already requested we go back and do the other rooms.Such a great idea!

Great team evening out!. Would highly recommend for a team evening out or team bonding activity, good fun to compete in small teams in each of the different rooms.It was challenging, frustrating and great fun at the same time - different from the usual bowling/karaoke night out.Couldn't recommend it enough!
Family Fun (all over 30). Great time and fun in the medium difficulty lock-in. See if your family can work together, we only just, luckily there is fab staff on hand to help out.

Dad (42) Daughters (12 and 10) - 42 minutes. We had a great time. I own an IT company and am pretty good with puzzles, so with only one hint (not requested over the walkie-talkie) the girls and I still had a good time solving puzzles together. This was our first "real" room puzzle (vs apps like The Room and The Room 2) and the timer made us work hard and fast to solve the clues. Neat and unexpected events in the situation/puzzle made this a great time as a family. Young guys running the event seemed to genuinely care that we had a good time. Has a raw realistic feel - not too gimmicky or franchised into a TV/Disney/Internet state. But also not too "we're new and cool" heavy-handed, either. Highly recommended as long as your kids are smart and over 9 or 10. Had to explain how we (I) solved a few of the puzzles after the event, but that didn't diminish from the overall experience - just part of being a parent.
Fantastic experience. Excellent experience I would recommend for people of any age and group size. I I hope to visit again to try out the other rooms.
Good fun. A group of 5 of adults. We really enjoyed Museum Warehouse and we would do another game in the future
Great adventure in London. My friends and I went the Grandpa's last wish room - it was the first time for my friends. We enjoyed a lot - it is exciting and great fun! Thanks!!
good fun!. It was good fun and I enjoyed myself very much. Can only recommend it! Ideal for building up team spirit too!
Great fun, team building task. Great fun....can't wait to try it again in another room.The place could be better signed to get there but just being picky !

Awesome fun !. It was such a great fun !!! We were five friends and most of us are "tech" people so we thought all puzzles will be easy and trivial for us. But it wasn't ! It was really good, challenging and entertaining and it took us 50 minutes to complete the room! Lots of laughs and then even more laughs discussing how we approached puzzles and ways or thinking! Definitely going to try another room next week. Now we are hooked !
Great fun in an unexpected location. Very attentive staff member showed us the ropes and we enjoyed our time with the museum mystery. would definitely go back to try other games there.

Great Fun!. We went to Lock'd on 9th October; two teams of 5 visited Grandpa's Last Will and Museum Warehouse - what a great concept!! Good fun, brain taxing and a great event for team building - all 10 of us thoroughly enjoyed it and are looking to organise another event soon!

So much Fun !. We went here for my cousin's birthday and it didn't disappoint. We enjoyed every minute. If you haven't done this type of game before Grandpa's will was sooo much fun. Thank you for an awesome night out.

Excellent fun!. Had a brilliant time here. Finding the place is actually the first challenge of your trip, but once that has been overcome, the fun only increases. We inadvertently picked the hardest of the three rooms available, but that only made it that much sweeter when we managed to succeed in time.Overall this is well worth the time to visit. The guy there was great, really helpful, and the game was genuinely tricky! Would visit again :)

Great family activity. This was our first escape room game- we played the museum room game, it was fantastic!We all enjoyed it as much as each other and we were talking about it all day afterwards!One tip- the place was slightly tricky to find so make sure you get there early.
Fantastic experience. Lock'd more than lived up to expectations, great for a group activity with friends and family, a good level of challenge etc. Only complaint was that it went by too quickly!

Really fun and definitely a brain teaser. We came here as part of a trip to London. The whole thing was really fun. We had such a good time and will definitely be retiring to try the other rooms. Only downside was that it is pretty difficult to find. But the guy on the phone was really helpful.

Great hour of fun. First time we have tried escape games and booked last minute with Locked who had a free slot on Saturday morning. Family of 4 including 14 and 17 year old. We did Grandpa's last will. Brilliant game, really enjoyed the clues (you get bailed out a few times if they can see you are struggling as you are being watched on CCTV). We discovered that as a family we don't work very well as a team under pressure!!! Managed to escape with a few minutes to spare. All was very well organised although the location was not obvious and a few more signs outside would be good. We parked up within the complex but I'm not sure if that is possible during the week.

A lot of fun!. Finding the venue wasn't easy (I thought it was part of the task!) but once we found it, the experience was very enjoyable.Innovative, challenging, fun. Great group activity and well run.
Good fun. A good afternoon out. The games are fun and brain testing and the staff friendly and helpful. Well recommended.

Great Experience!. If you are looking for something different to do - this is excellent! We went down as a family of 5 and an hour has never gone so quickly.. We did Grandpa's Last Will and found it just hard enough! Great day, great staff!

Good fun. Lock'd was good fun, but we all left wanting to do more.
It's a little hard to find tucked away on an industrial estate. But once inside the staff are friendly and the games are really good fun.

Great!. We were a group of 5 friends (2 couples + 1) playing "The Grandpa's Will". We really enjoyed the game, although we had to use 2 hints (which should indicate that the game is not as easy as one would think).
I think the difficulty is quite balanced.

Brilliant!. The difficulty of the puzzle was just right to fill the hour, meaning we did it in the nick of time so it was very exciting! Would recommend to friends and go back to do different puzzles.

Great fun for families. It was our first try of a locked room challenge and we had great fun. The children are 9 and 7 years old and, whilst it was a bit beyond them (us!), we were all really engaged throughout and it was such great fun. Thanks to the help of the host we cracked imthe challenge which was a huge result. Highly recommended.
Great fun!. We had a brilliant time, annoyed that we needed a hint just for the final clue!! Wanted to do another one straight away, definitely a sign of having a good time.
lock'd was a lock. Good fun. Variety of rooms. We had the 'art theft' room. Was good fun. Other friends in other rooms. Overall good time had by all
Great team fun. Great fun with our kids, 12, 10 and 9. An opportunity for them to work together, get on and enjoy themselves with us helping and guiding when necessary.

Excellent fun. We took 14 people to Lock'd for a 30th birthday and had a blast. We didn't know a huge amount about 'exit rooms' before attending but would definitely go back for another.Perfect for anyone who likes team puzzles. The guys who run it were really helpful and accommodating during the booking process.
Lock'd In Review. A very Fun and Enjoyable activity. The staff were very friendly and engaging. With humor. I would recommend to anyone who enjoys puzzle games of all sorts.

Great Fun. We as a family were looking for something different to do in London over the weekend and what an adventure going to Locked proved to be! We all had a great time with this well thought out escape room, Not to difficult and not to easy just enough to keep all of us interested! We did the Grandpas Will room and would recommend this to anyone that wants to enjoy something that's great fun for all! Highly recommend you give it a go you wont regret it! See you soon to try another room!
Amazing fun you have to try this. Fabulous experience, great fun and a brilliant date. Definitely a good work out for your brain and mental agility

Great Day Out. Just one of the activities that really appeal to a lot of people. It's great fun and really good because you feel as though you know all your friends a lot more afterwards. As well really helpful and kind people who work there.

No Spoilers! Fantastic Time!. Fantastic, fun and really interesting. If you're looking for a really different, unique and engrossing thing to do in London then Lock'd is the place to go. We had a brilliant time from start to finish and the customer service was great, the man in charge was very helpful and made us feel welcome. We can't wait to go back and try another room!
Great customer service and loads of fun!. It was great fun for all of us, the only negative was that we finished very early, so it'll be nice to try the harder one with maybe fewer people.

Good Fun and something different. We went as a group of 11 and split between 2 rooms. We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. This is challenging and fun for anyone. I would highly recommend giving Lock'd a go.

Super fun & simple. The game is quite fun and it's good for all sorts of people! Good for friends or company team building! Just be careful with the directions from google maps: it will take you to wrong place, follow the instructions on the website

Family fun. Overall, a very unique experience. Kept everyone busy for the hour, but perhaps allow another 15 minutes on top of that, as it took a while getting used to the set-up.A little pricey but would go again.
Enjoyable and unique challenge. Fantastic fun and a really interesting set of challenges. Slightly brief (35 mins it took us for £20 each between 5), but even so would visit again!

Excellent! A unique and fun idea. We had a wonderful time at Lock'd. We completed the slightly harder Museum Warehouse room in a team of 5 and had an absolute blast -- if you're looking for a really different, unique and engrossing thing to do on a day in London, then definitely go for this. It took us a while to get into the mindset, but once we did we had great fun exploring everything and piecing the puzzle together. The guide was helpful and seemed genuinely excited about the enterprise. When the next level room starts up, this will definitely be on my list of things to do again.

If you're debating whether or not to do it - just do!!. The concept of this game is awesome and the activity itself lived up to the promise. Thoroughly enjoyable, great level of challenge and would definitely do it again
Brilliant. Had a fantastic time at Lock'd with a group of friends. Can't wait to try their new rooms! A great experience
Good fun!. Great way to spend an afternoon, really fun and challenging! Did the Museum room and requires team effort.

Fantastic, extremely fun event!. This was my first time doing an 'escape' type of activity, and it was absolutely brilliant! The host was extremely welcoming and friendly, which is so important. We had to complete all sorts of puzzles and find clues, everything was very cleverly thought through and was seamless! We were all on such a high when we finally escaped the room! Absolutely recommend this, and will be going back again!
So much fun!. Something different and really enjoyable! Laid out authentically and well thought out. Would definitely do again!

First visit to an exit game. We saw an item on the BBC news travel show about exit games. It looked fascinating but we couldn't really justify a trip overseas to be shut in a room for an hour. We were delighted to find they are springing up in London. If you like interactive theatre like Punchdrunk and Shunt this will certainly appeal. Our only comment on Museum Warehouse is that as first timers and in a group of two we didn't manage to finish - we got 3/4 of the way through and had an enjoyable time. It is worth putting in the effort beforehand to make a slightly larger group.
Great fun and perfectly suited to team building too!. Without giving too much away it was a lot of fun to work out the puzzles under pressure. Go with at least 3-4 people and have fun!

Lots of fun. This was the first time I had been to an escape room so I had no idea what to expect, but it was so much fun! We did the Museum Warehouse game as a group of 5 and it was challenging but very well organised and we just managed to complete it in time. Would recommend to anyone.
Fantastic fun. A great way to spend an hour! Took my girlfriend here as something different to do on our anniversary, have recommended this to everyone I've spoken to about it since.

Great escape room venue. Having done most of the escape rooms in London, I can confidently say that Lock'd is one of the best escape room companies in the capital. There are better rooms in London, but they're few and far between.Lock'd have a good setup in the Biscuit Factory near Bermondsey, with a large waiting room and plenty of bathroom facilities. We were hosted by the owners, which is always good - they genuinely care about the experience and any feedback you have.The two games they currently have open are both very good when compared to others in London. On the website they're rated as slightly different difficulty levels, but we found them pretty much the same level - the difference between them was more that the Museum Warehouse is more "technical" and Grandpa's Last Will is more visual. With three people we found ourselves going from beginning to end with barely a break, and were all always heavily involved. You could play with five people, but I'd say that three or four is optimal. Both rooms are nicely decorated, the props are good and the puzzles seem robust - no wondering whether you're going to break anything as you "ransack" the rooms. The one thing that disappointed me was the lack of a "wow" puzzle. I really like to have one puzzle in the room that makes me so impressed that makes me stop in my tracks. That said, there were plenty of good puzzles, so I'm really being picky here.If you're only going to ever play a single escape room in London then I think there are a couple of better choices (Time Run and Clue Quest), but if you've played one already, if Bermondsey is particularly convenient or if you think you might play others in the future, then I think Lock'd's rooms are thoroughly good ones to play.
Fantastic!. Just finished Grandpa's Last Will - still can't believe we've done it. Simply recommend to everyone.

Awesome experience!. Did not know what to expect as this was my first room escape experience. My partner booked it for us as a surprise and WOW what a surprise it was! :D We really had so much fun. The room was great and just when we thought we had sussed it - there was a whole nother chapter of the journey! I could not recommend this place enough - will hopefully be coming back to try out the other rooms :)Summary: Amazing. Great Fun. Worth every penny.

Really good fun!. We unfortunately went there the day after a big party and we were very hangovered but we still had a lot of fun!I would recommend to be fresh if you wish to finish it (unlike us!) as it is actually quite difficult!

Fun family activity. We loved our experience with Grandpa's Will. Perfect family fun. We had not been sure what to expect but it was great. Perfect for all ages - worked with our three boys aged 14, 12 and almost 10. We all loved the concept and the adrenaline rush of racing against the clock to solve the clues. Highly recommend it.

Great fun. First time at an escape room game. Attended with 10, 12, two 14 year olds and nan to play Grandpa's Last Will. Worred that the game maybe too old for the kids. Daniel our Quest Master was amazing. He guided the kids through the quest and pitched the hints to their level (they needed a few hints to get through!). All came out full of smiles and were still talking about the quest over dinner that evening. Great team building and family time spent together. Will definitely go back to try the other quest

Fantastic. This was our first time trying out an escape room game and the whole group of us (4) really enjoyed it. The puzzles in Grandpa's last will were at just the right level for everyone in the group to enjoy solving without getting frustrated :). We're looking forward to returning to try the museum warehouse room.
Awesome experience!. didn't expect much considering the quality of other rooms on the market, but these guys blew me away! keep up the great work! looking forward to your new escapes! cheers!

Good fun for evenings after work. The place was great, four of us did the Museum task and was good fun. It was my very first escape room adventure, same for another guy while the other two had done it before. One of them is a seasoned veteran and he told us the room is better than most, I'll just say it was great :)

Fantastic Startup. Expect big things. . My dad and I were looking for something to do in London, and we stumbled across the idea of doing one of these "escape rooms". After looking at a couple places, we decided that Lock'd seemed like a good fit. It's located down a couple back streets and in the back of a building complex, the rawness of the location even contributing to the experience, so don't be deterred if you can't at first find it. Just follow the instructions provided in the email (which we did not). Lock'd was a great introduction to escape rooms. The challenges were well thought out and had a consistent theme. We had three rooms to get through, which kept it exciting. We never knew what would lie behind the next door. Hints were provided when it looked like we were moving too slowly on a particular clue. The challenges were difficult, but doable. As we soon found out, a large part of the difficulty comes from thoroughly searching every inch of the room. Great staff, unique facility, and fun game. Would absolutely recommend.

Can't recommend better day out with kids. We went there yesterday with my husband and kids to try their Grandpa's last will. Our task was to find the will of some rich excentric man who passed away. Can't tell more without giving it away. What a surprise in the middle of the game! Kids can't stop talking about it and we're going to try their second game next weekend. Reflecting back, they made us parents feel kids ourselves - all those Disney stories became real for a moment. Recommend for everyone and wish best of luck to the designers, we're their fans.

Intriguing intelligence and fun. I felt myself little James Bond while breaking into some storage. Oh god, they made me feel a Hollywood star with all those tiny gadgets and stuff. Complexity is awesome but we managed to crack it. Shame they were fully booked I'd try their other games next time.

Fantastic experience. Our son and his partner booked this after she had been on another event and said we would love it - she was right. It was our first time trying to crack the code in an escape room, so we needed a few hints, as we weren't quite sure at first what we were looking for. We became really absorbed in the task and got quite a buzz when we found/solved the clues. It was like nothing I've ever done before: great fun, challenging and exciting. I would definitely love to do it again.

Tricky but fun. We had a team of 5, which may have been too many because there was confusion as to who did had done what. As a result we kept asking for hints. But there were some satisfying puzzles, and in retrospect we really should have been able to figure them out for ourselves.

Great way to spend a weekend!!!. We chose Lock'd rooms for our friends catch up Sunday and booked 2 rooms at one time 5 ppl in each room. It was fun for all of us - new experience, challenging tasks and team spirit. I would definitely recommend it as a great way to spend the weekend (going to pub after that is highly recommended :))

Grandpa's Last Will in 49 min!. It was our first time in escape-room, so we decided to start with the easier room "Grandpa Last Will". We finished it in 49 min with couple of hints. Not bad for the first time :) Great experience, quite challenging as for me. Will definitely come back for more difficult one.
Great escape room. This was my first time doing an escape room and thoroughly enjoyed it. I'd definitely recommend it and would do another one

A good "starter" room escape. I went here this evening for my friend's birthday. If you haven't done a room escape before, and you love puzzles, logic games and interactive experiences, then I would recommend doing this one as an introduction. You'll have a great time.however, I have been to quite a few of these now and there are definitely better ones in London. I would do those after you've done this one. This was fun, but quite basic. Not basic in difficulty level, (that was quite good), but in production value / design / storyline immersion. If you have been to some of the other more extravagant ones, you'll spot where these guys could make some big improvements.There was a lot of padlock and keys, and not too many other types of imaginative puzzles, and there was no timer on the wall to tell you how long you had left, the only room escape ive been to that has been lacking this useful feature.Some of the props in the rooms felt a bit random and not in keeping with any particular theme.The guys who let us in and briefed us were very friendly, but nothing about the pre-game bit felt very slick - I would have preferred it if they had been in character, for a more immersive experience. The only room escape I have been to that has had this nice touch has been Time Run, and more experienced room escapers will undoubtedly prefer somewhere like that. Lock'd is definitely worth going to, and I look forward to trying out their other rooms.

Exciting and immersive experience!. We tried both rooms and we will do it again when there will be more. Great design of all the artefacts and equipment, catching stories, a lot of unexpected surprises during the missions. The complexity of puzzles is precisely at the level to keep you busy all the way through but in the same it is possible to complete it in an hour. A very good combination of intrigue, challenges, support and safety.
Fun and different. This is a new idea and I like it. I hope that they bring in more scenarios soon. Once more people visit, hopefully the scenarios and props will increase.

Amazing Fun. Me, my wife and a friend went to Lock'd after a reccomendation from a work colleague. It's the first time we have tried a locked room puzzle and it we all really really enjoyed it. Will definately be returning to try some of the other rooms!

Great puzzles, great fun. Two rooms in a row! We booked Grandpa's Will in advance. We liked it a lot! We were really lucky that day and happy two know that Museum Warehouse was available that time. So we went for it. So proud of us - we escaped both rooms! Overal, great puzzles, great fun and very friendly host :)

Fantastic, experience!. A truly different way to spend an hour - so exciting, challenging and fun. If you're into problem solving and crime thrillers, this is one for you. Never experienced anything like it. Can't wait to try the other challenges by Lock'd!
Very good. Good chance to challenge a brain. Nice place.Friendly staff. Just an hour but so much fun.I had never done anything like this but once tried I really want to return and try more.
Amazing!. Great fun! We play the "granfather's will", and we had great time! If you are in London just spend an hour to play this game, you'll won't regret!

Brilliant!. Brilliant fun. We weren't sure what to expect really as none of us had ever done anything like this before, but would definitely recommend! Solving the puzzles and piecing all the evidence together was great fun and we will definitely be back to try one of the other mysteries.
So much fun!. It's a bit hard to find, but once you do it's so much fun! We're booking again soon to try the other room!

Engaging and fun. This is the first escape room we have ever visited, however we went with two of my friends who have been to quite a few of them before.It was absolutely a very fun experience, the puzzles were imaginative, the environment nicely set up, with a lot of nice touches to submerge you to the game context.We definitely want to try some more escape rooms now and will be returning to try the other rooms available at Lock'd.

Excellent activity. A great idea to do with friends, colleagues and your kids. You'll discover that everyone has a different 'special' skill: some are better with numbers and codes, others are more curious and stick their noses in unusual places finding clues and keys, some are more observant or think out of the box, others organise the clues and put things in order... A very entertaining way to realise that 1+1 is more than 2 and helpfulness outperforms individual intelligence.
amazing!. Fantastic place! Really enjoyed and cant wait to go back to try the next room! Also exciting to hear about upcoming rooms in the future.

So much fun! Will go again for sure!. I recently went to Lock'd for my birthday with a group of 10. I had never done anything like this before so was unsure of what to expect - although I had heard it was great.We were able to play against each other however we were playing different games, one was classed as more difficult, so maybe don't attempt to beat each other on time or number of clues!We all had an amazing time, it was a lot of fun and the member of staff we met was very friendly.It is a bit difficult to find so leave extra time in case you get lost!Overall, I had an incredible time and will definitely play again!

Fantastic way to spent your leisure time!. It was my first time playing exit game, and I was so surprised with the whole experience. The host was very helpful, friendly and professional! The room itself, (Grandpa's will, I guess) was made with dedication to details. We asked for help 1 time, which was very helpful, and eventually we finished the game in 47 minutes. I'd recommend to play a group of 3-4, use "out-of-the-box" thinking, imagination and logic. All in all great experience!

Preferred Hint Hunt.... We played Grandpa's last will with 4 players. The place is a little tricky to find, so allow plenty of time to get there. Head for block B - its straight ahead on the right. Our friends were running late, and they were flexible with our start time so that was really helpful.We had played Hint Hunt before, but our friends hadn't, so we thought this would be a good introduction to this sort of game. We completed this in 35 minutes, so felt a little cheated out of our 'hour', compared to HH which we finished with 37 seconds left on the clock.We didn't feel the same level of exhilaration as we had experienced when we played HH, and it felt very key based, more different types of puzzles are required.There is no countdown clock on the wall, so you have no idea how long you've been in the room which is a little annoying. You communicate via radio to receive a clue, which again would be better if it was via a screen.I'd say go and make up your own mind, but if you've done a game before, maybe try a more difficult room.

Unforgettable. Absolutely amazing - I've never had more fun. Went with work for an Away Day. It generated some great team work. But I can't wait to return in my own time with friends to do the other room! The puzzles were just hard enough and the hints just right.

Escape the Room event at Lock'd. Fantastic event all round. Friendly and professional concierge in charge of an efficient and effective establishment. Our group tackled the tougher of the two challenge rooms; the story thread that tied the puzzles together was interesting and entertaining, and the tasks themselves were of a very high quality. Thoroughly engaging, testing, intuitive, a wide variety of novel and imaginative tasks were set to be completed in a very appropriate timeframe; from the allotted 60 minutes, our team made it out with just 90 seconds to spare! Intense conclusion!I would thoroughly recommend this experience and am eagerly anticipating the opening of their third challenge room :)

Great starter game/one for the family. Lovely staff (coped well with our being late), puzzles good intro to exit games and kids loved it despite being pretty young. they both felt they had contributed something.

You'll enjoy this is you like logic puzzles. This was the first of these puzzles we'd done and we found it hard, but we enjoyed the challenge. We asked for help 3 times and the clues we were given were just nudges in the right direction, so we still felt really satisfied when we finished it with 2 mins to spare. A fun experience, I'd say you need several people in your team and you have to be patient and work things through with a bit of imagination.

Great birthday activity with friends . None of us had played an escape game before, despite having heard lots about them. It's a brilliant idea and the Lock'd team executed it very well. We went for the easier of the two rooms, but in hindsight we maybe should have gone for the harder one. We absolutely loved Grandpa's Last Will, but an extra challenge or two would have been even better! We didn't want it to end! We made it out in 42 minutes and had a great time, I can't wait to play another one! We will definitely be back to play Museum Warehouse and Lock'd's 3rd room, when they have finished creating it. Thank you for a very entertaining activity!

Great fun. We've participated in several Escape Rooms over the last few months, and this has been the best of the bunch - we did the Grandpa's Last Will room.Challenging without being impossible. It is a very well-crafted puzzle with lots of really innovative mechanics, and more than a few surprises.Extremely enjoyable. We can't wait to do the other room!

Completed first room and immediately did the second!. We started with Grandpa's Last Will where we had to solve a variety of puzzles to find a will and escape. We then also completed the Museum Warehouse having thoroughly enjoyed the first room.We enjoyed the variety of puzzles in both rooms and the combination of traditional puzzles with high tech variants. The puzzle designers have put a lot of thought into them.The rooms were some of the easier ones that we have done however we thoroughly enjoyed the originality and would strongly recommend them.

Awesome fun. Really good fun and well run. A great night was had with friends and family - very Crystal Maze but no shell suits.Bit tricky to find the place but that wasn't part of the challenge!! Leave enough time to get lost en route.
Fun and tricky. Enjoyable escape the room with some interesting and new tricks, lots of keys! Have done a few of these in London before, and this is a good one.

The best Escape Room we've tried!. The escape room we tried at Lock'd was brilliantly crafted (The Museum Room). The best thing about it was the balance and deft design. Many escape rooms, Hint Hunt being the notable culprit, set a nigh on impossible puzzle, which can only be solved with countless clues from the staff. This approach leaves you feeling a little cheated, not to mention stupid, and you don't get such a feeling of achievement, because you feel like you've had your hand held for the most part. This is where Lock'd is different. The Lock'd room we tried was the perfect balance of challenging vs intuitive. The puzzle was tough to solve, but we were able to solve it almost all on our own and with seconds to spare! We felt a much greater sense of achievement at the end of it, compared to when we completed Hint Hint. We asked for help a few times, but these moments were always us being a bit stupid, and I suspect many groups could complete the room with no help at all.Alexander at Lock'd was very friendly and welcoming, and we certainly plan to go back and play the other rooms when we get the chance.I would highly recommend this experience to anyone - it is extremely fun and I'm delighted it exists in London. One tip would be to arrive a fair bit before your time because the building is quite hard to find within the industrial park it is in.

Grandpa's Last Will. This was the second time we had done an escape room, the first being HintHunt. We found the place quite easily and had a warm welcome as we had just phoned up to see if they had a slot free. We had a great introduction/story to start and in we went. Found this room a lot better than HintHunt and we only needed 1 small clue the whole game. Nice surprises and we found the game flowed a lot better than HintHunt. I would say if you hadn't tried an escape game before Grandpa's Last Will is an excellent start and highly recommended. We were a family team of 5 and we all really enjoyed this game and escaped in just 35 minutes. We liked Lock'd so much we are planning to go back and do the 2nd room very soon and we were told a 3rd room is in progress. Excellent fun and very well run
Fantastic Experience. First time time at one of these quests.. What a great experience! Highly recommend this; challenging, imaginative, clever and intriguing!Don't miss it!

Amazing experience!. I tried several rooms of this kind before, and Lock'd impressed me a lot!Interesting twists and enigmas oriented on analytical skills, attention to details and a bit of intuition!Unexpected turns of the process kept me excited during the whole game!Perfect way to spend unforgettable time and have a bit of brainstorming. Grandpa's Will room is just stunning! It's obviously not what it looks like! Highly advised to come and check! You definitely won't regret!

Absolutely great fun (very hard to find)!!. I went with a small group of friends and we had a fab time!! Lots of twists and really required lateral thinking!! Very tricky to find, I'd really recommend plenty of time to find it or a taxi from the station!!!Definitely recommend this experience (we did Grandpas last will, but we'll be going back to try the other one)!!!
Fantastic!. Great experience! It was the first when we played such games and it was a real fun! Puzzles are so creative and absolutely different, I didn't expect that I would like the game so much!

great fun - hard to find. We had a fantastic time. We were shown into a room that didn't look like much until we started working! It was a great experience and would definitely like to try other escape games. We did Grandpa's Last Will and really enjoyed it.We had a lot of trouble finding the location and Lock'd was not signposted on the road or the building. However the man on duty was really kind and after we phoned he came down to find us and gave us the full time even though we were quite late after searching for the building.

Awesome - Must try. Grandpa's Will holds some amazing surprises - Try it!. A truly great and unique experience - nothing to compare it to before you've tried it. Probably people who've played similar computer games will find their way around it slightly faster but it's really easy to get the grips of and everyone is guaranteed to have fun. Finding the clues and solving the puzzles delivers a great sense of team accomplishment :)

Amazing experience! A childhood dream came true!. The game is thrilling, clever and entertaining! I do not want to give any specific details about the rooms in order not to spoil the unexpected experience, but can certainly say that the organizers have created really imaginative stories and tricks. The decors are extremely well thought and have the potential to immerse you directly in the story. I recommend this experience to everyone!

Excellent fun for all the family. We were looking for something to do with our daughter, (11) in the Easter Hols. Came across these escape room activities on Tripadvisor, so decided to give it a go. As Lock'd is fairly new we were able to book close to the day.Booking was straight forward with clear directions to the venue, a short journey from London Bridge station. Thought we were lost at first, but then found the new Business development & a welcoming Alexander to greet us newbies!We didn't quite finish in time but it was a fantastic experience. Will definitely be back to do another room. Our daughter wanted to go back straight away! Cannot recommend this highly enough for family entertainment.

Really good fun!. We took our parents and did the easier of the two choices - "Grandpa's will". The problem was well thought through, nicely presented and just a really enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. It was a little on the simple side, but was identified on the website as the easier of the options.Great stuff!

So cool that we did the two escape rooms in a row !. I am very keen on escape games and I tried the bulk of it in France. Lock'd was very fun and have original tricks. The guy challenged us saying that we were not able to escape from the hard one of his two rooms, so we did both and it was really fun ! Pour les français, aucun souci, il n'y a quasiment rien d'écrit (à part peut être un message dans chacune des énigmes), tout le reste est de la logique et du fun !

Next stop Hatton Garden.... As someone who has grown up immersed in the worlds of Indiana Jones, Ethan Hunt et al. this was a great way to see how my friends and I lived up to our own expectations.We took on two of the challenges, 'museum break-in' and 'grandpa's will', providing the perfect assault course for circumnavigating security systems and testing our brainpower. Whilst the first of these seemed fairly straightforward, there are some rather testing elements to the course which certainly had the five of us straining our grey-matter.Would definitely recommend, and look forward to the future courses (I hear there will be lasers involved...).

Fantastic fun!. A group of five of us had a fantastic time at Lock'd. I'd recommend it to anyone. Only reason I rate it 4 rather than 5 is because we were finished a bit quicker than I would have expected (we were done in 40 mins - they said this is unusual though so obviously indicative that we were awesome!) and the directions on how to get there could have been a little clearer. Overall though, great fun, great staff and a great recommendation from me.

Can't wait to go back for the next challenge!. I'd never done a room escape challenge before, despite being a massive puzzle enthusiast. I went with four friends, all in our mid-twenties, and had a great time solving the Grandfather's Last Will and Museum Warehouse puzzles...in fact, we set new records for both puzzles. :) It was especially nice to find something fun to do that didn't involve drinking or stuffing our faces...Room escapes seem to be gaining popularity in London but I know TA's number one and longest-running company has a two month waiting list (!), whereas this one seems fairly new and as such is much easier to book. I'd absolutely recommend it! (The Museum puzzle was harder so go for that one if you like to be challenged.)The game designers, a physicist and a cryptographer, are currently working on a third game, which we cannot WAIT to have a change to solve.

Great challenge and nothing bad I expected. Not having done this before was a little sceptical however we had a great time - stimulating the mind and very well thoughtout puzzels to crack the code(s). Great fun for all the family or work colleagues without iPad or computer games!

Really great fun. Will definitely be going back.. We booked this on kind of a whim when looking for something to do during the Easter holidays. We were all so pleased that we did. We took on the Grandfather's will room and throughout we were all regularly exclaiming that this was "the best thing ever". We will definitely return and will tell all friends and families about the experience. This type of thing is what experiencing London is really about and you should definitely do it.

Well thought-out with a variety of puzzles. We attempted this in a group of three. We had never tried an exit game before, so we weren't sure what to expect, though we have all had experience with other similar puzzle genres. We went for the Museum Warehouse scenario and found it nicely atmospheric and about the right level of difficulty. (We managed to solve it with seconds to spare, though we did need a hint for one of the puzzles.) The two people running it are very friendly and make you feel comfortable. I hope to return to try their new scenario when it becomes available.
Great fun and good value for money. Had a great time as part of a hen party. Rooms & puzzles were well thought through with a few surprises thrown in too :) Good fun!

Great experience. We went as part of a day celebrating a friend getting married. Had never been to an exit game before but we all had heard of several and wanted to try one. It was a brilliant experience and the time flew by whilst we were in the room. Great fun to find & solve clues with friends, would highly recommend to anyone looking for something different to do with friends.

Great fun!. We went as a group of girls for a hen-do event and really got a buzz out of solving the puzzles. We split in two groups and did the two challenges and both teams managed to break out within the hour.It was a good level of challenge but if you are really stuck you can get some hints through a walkie talkie. Recommended!
Fantastic fun . Visited yesterday with my partner and my teenage daugter. Had a fab time and already looking at booking again. Would highly recommend to anyone - cannot wait to go back x

Very exciting!. I've been to many other escape room games in London and I have to say, this is another really good family-fun event. 5 of us played Grandpa's Last Will and it was entertaining as well as surprising. I will definitely return to try out the other rooms. When I found out it was just controlled by one guy and his friend, it's amazing to see what they have achieved.

Well done Exit Game. Would love to Return.. Having tried every other exit game in London, my friends and I were happy to see that Lock'd had opened up. We did the Museum Warehouse and had a blast.The game was very well refined. The puzzles at a good level and no jumps in logic. I would recommend this exit game especially to people new to the genre. It was not the hardest we've encountered, but we still had to think hard about a few puzzles. It was definitely enjoyable.We are looking forward to returning once their new room opens up.
Really, really good fun!. Showed up with three brothers as part of a stag do. First time, no expectations but was the highlight of an otherwise also great day. Simply put - very highly recommended.

Great fun, good challenge. Having tried ClueQuest, I was interested to see how this relatively new start-up. We tried the Grandpa's Last Will, in which you have to find said document. A series of puzzles, challenges and red herrings which are clever enough to require brains, lateral thinking and teamwork, but not so difficult as to be unachievable.My only comment is that the aim in each case is very similar - a few different types of goals and puzzles would help.Overall a fun, challenging night.

Adrenaline pumped night at the museum!. We played the Museum Warehouse as a group of 4. This was my 4th time playing an escape game (having previously played in Oxford and Melbourne) and I found the warehouse to be the most intelligently thought out of them all. It was evident that the creators, Alexander (physicist) and his partner (cryptographer I think?) had put a lot of effort into designing scenarios which were different and enjoyable without being overwhelmingly challenging to solve. The puzzles were varied and original but most of all, relevant to the underlying story. The game was well paced and there was excellent use of space.As it is still in its early stages, Alexander asked for our feedback at the end, and I am sure they will be continuously improving different aspects of the game to make it even more refined.

Interesting and Fun. Like the previous reviewer, I wasn't sure what to expect from this. I'd never been to an escape room before (nor had my two friends), and when we decided to visit one last minute we found everything was completely booked up until my friend came across Lock'd. It's a new company, so not really out there yet (I couldn't find it on google), but it's definitely worth a visit! Having never been to an escape room before, nor to this area of London, we were all a bit new and unsure of what to expect, but the man that helped us was very friendly and helpful. It is clear from the rooms that they were designed with care. You will need different types of strategies to unlock secrets, but designers have also taken into account the aesthetics of the rooms, and understand the importance of creating an authentic experience. Some of the design is really admirable. I also quite like the fact that this is a recent start-up, as I like to support new businesses. We were terrible at solving the different puzzles, but enjoyed the first experience so much we also did the other room available. It's perfect for a group of 3 friends. I can't really compare these rooms to any other escape rooms, but I would definitely go here again to try new stories, this was so much fun!

Really liked it. This was the first time I'd played a game like this and I liked it. It's very much like a computer game quest, but the in the real world, which makes it really cool.At Lock'd I've tried the Grandpa's Will quest that took me about 40 minutes to solve. It's better to come with friends as playing alone wouldn't have been so fun.

Incredibly fun!. Having only heard of this from a friend, I didn't quite know what to expect, but I have to say it was the most fun I have had in London for years!Starting with the team, who are really lovely and you can tell they have put a lot of effort into this place and the attention to detail is obvious. And the experience itself is just so great, we had a team of 3 friends which I think was perfect. We bonded, laughed, strategised, used our brain and ended up leaving on a real high, totally energised.It's the perfect place to go with friends, or team building for business. I can't wait to go again!

Great entertainment and challenge for your brain. I enjoyed every moment spent locked in the room, there are so many interesting brain teasers inside. It's an amazing experience to share with friends or colleagues. You spend one hour together looking for new clues and feeling good once you managed to solve each new puzzle. Great organization and very attentive team behind the project! Thank you for wonderful experience :) I am looking forward to trying new stories and new rooms.

Fantastic family fun. Even as a family of complete novices we had a fantastic experience celebrating my wife's 50th birthday. Kou and the team were amazing from the minute we booked! We're definitely coming back !!!
Great Experience. Really good fun, would recommend to anyone looking for a puzzle escape room. We managed to escape which is always a plus!

A truly amazing escape game!!. This is definitely one of the best three escape games we have played in London. (we have played more than 20), Very unique approach with no locks, just really well thought puzzles to play as a group! Definitely a must do if you are into escape games!!

Amazing!!! Increíble!!!. They have a really unique scape room. The guys are really friendly and treat us wonderfully. The puzzles are great and the atmosphere is superb. Totally worth it. And of course coco their dog is lovely:)

First escape room I have visited in UK. It is amazing!. I have played numerous escape rooms in the past, so I can say I am a bit experienced. I have moved in UK a few months back but only now I got the chance to play an ER in London and this was so unique and different.The staff is very friendly, the lounge looks amazing, it was the first escape room with a real mascot (a cute, fluffy samoyed puppy) and the room I've played is amazing: incredible story, unique puzzles and enjoyable to play

Amazing experience in AI Escape. I decided to go the this escape room after recommendation from a friend. I went my my parents and my sister and we had a great time! I had been to other escape rooms before and didn't expect to be blown away, but I definitely was. The staff was really friendly, the story behind the escape was very well thought of, and everything was really well automatized. I really recommend this escape room to anyone who is looking to have a great time and do a different activity in London, and even to escape room enthusiasts!

The experience with AI Escape is one of a kind. When you have to organise a group activity of 11 people, you'll find it a hard job. Of course, going hiking in Peak District and safariing in London Zoo could be options but sometimes it just sounds too exhausting or too normal to interest your picky friends. So if you fancy something original and intellectually dynamic and don't bother to be away from central London too far, AI Escape will be your perfect alternative where provides extraordinary live room escape experience and excellent customer service. The escape room 101 - Leo's Path - can only accommodate up to 6 people. However if you arrive with more than 6 participants, you can split in two teams. While one team is trying to make their way out of the room, the other can enjoy snacks and various entertainment facilities in common room from strawberry and cream flavoured Pim Pom lollipops to a video game console. When the first team finished their game, they can be the controller of their fellows' team. Believe me, there is so much fun to be the controller monitoring your friends’ doing as you can never imagine what people are capable of when they are desperate to get out of a locked room.The highlight of AI Escape, as their name suggests, are their fully automated settings. Solving puzzles is a linear progression here and you can only achieve it by logic reasoning and deducing. Attention to details and teamwork are also crucial. In post-game discussion with my friends, we all agree this room escape could also be a nice place to hold corporate events. Besides the room, AI Escape also owns a superstar dog - Coco. She is so adorable and everyone loves her and I bet Coco is the sufficient reason for you to pay a visit.

Eureka. This is the best escape room experience I have had. The host is very friendly and Coco is SUPER CUTE! The escape room is fully automated and the dedication they have put into designing the room is impressive! Overall an amazing experience and I can't wait to visit again when they open the new rooms.
Great fun with friends. All those settings and triggers are automatic, puzzles are not too hard but not too easy either. Had a great experience there with friends! Definitely recommend it!
Excellent. Highly recommended. All machines are automated and nicely set. The hosts are very friendly and provided games when we were waiting. Ps the dog Coco is so cute.
Great activity, really interesting and engaging. I really enjoyed the escape room. It was just the right level of challenge, and it kept us engaged throughout. I would definitely recommend a visit.

Fun experience and adorable puppy!!. Absolutely lovely couple who made us feel very welcome. Really loved the game – we found it hard at first but soon got in to the swing of it! Will definitely come back to try out the news rooms once they are ready. Also, their puppy is insanely adorable!!!

Very fun and unusual!. Really impressive escape room - had a brilliant afternoon out with friends. The room itself is really fun and interactive - very high tech. The story was very well thought out and I liked how the game focuses on solving puzzles and using the fully-automated tech rather than just searching for keys. The puzzles are a good challenge but you can get clues and hints if it's too hard! Would recommend this to everyone!

Amazing high tech escape room. This is the best escape room I've ever been to by far. It's technologically advanced with hints delivered by iPhone and there's an electronic writing pad for scribbling notes on. The room is difficult but very rewarding. A lot of 'out of the box' thinking required. I'm really looking forward to going back and playing in their 2nd room which they've almost finished making.Aside from the game itself, the staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. I couldn't stop staring at the huge biceps of the Spanish-Taiwanese staff member and his amazing skill on a segway (yes they have a segway).Overall, great fun suitable for everyone. I'd highly recommend this escape room!

Wow. We have completed a few escape rooms but this had a completely different style in that it was linear. The room had an amazing atmosphere and the owners were really friendly. Looking forward to their new room

Unique, tricky, and fun for all!. Two of us conquered this "escape room" style puzzle game (with a few hints along the way of course) with just a couple minutes remaining. This was my second time doing an escape game and my friend's first- he was sad when it was over! The puzzles throughout the game are varied and really challenge you to think both logically and creatively. The friendly AI Escape hosts are awesome and very friendly, flexible, and communicative. They are currently getting new rooms set up and I'll definitely be back to give them a go next time I'm in London. Thanks again!

Fun & different!. Much better than other escape rooms I've tried in London and a great way to spend time with friends on the weekend. Fully automated and linear so you have to use team work to solve each puzzle to get to the next. Lovely hosts and the theme is very unique and quite romantic. Definitely recommend :)

We got out!. Archimedes Inspiration was a couple of hours extremely well spent! The tasks were challenging and integrated really well into the room's storyline.
