If you're looking for something to make you think, and a place to have a laugh with some friends, I would highly recommend this; better than others I've been to by far. I'd definitely head back to try another one of their rooms!

Leo's path. Tried Leo's path this weekend and it was really fun. Quite tough but you can request hints if necessary! It's the most modern I've been too, knitted out and automated which is cool. Apparently they're opening some new rooms soon. Looking forward to it!

Archimedes fun. Really enjoyed my first escape room experience. Great setup, both inside the room and when you first enter. I went with friends who had been to other escape rooms and they said that this was by far the best one! I liked the automated nature of it. Excited to try their next room!

Exciting experience!. I've attended to different escape games in different cities and this is the best one by far! I went with some friends that didn't know anything about this kind of games. We played the Leo's path we had a very good time :-)We got amazed by the high quality of the game: everything is fully automated, great level of detail, good storyline, great puzzles.. and the staff was extremely nice as well!I saw things there that I haven't seen in any other escape room; you will definitely be surprised.100% recommendable! good luck and enjoy :-)!

A unique escape experience!. This was my third escape room experience and was pleased at how different and unique Leo's Path turned out to be. We felt welcome as soon as we arrived with an offering of water and free storage for our valuables. The staff were so lovely and explained what to do in the room. The room is fully automated so it felt very rewarding to solve a puzzle to progress to the next stage (with not a padlock in sight!). The storyline was immersive and interesting with the right level of challenge to keep our group completely entertained. We loved working together and felt a great sense of closure and achievement at the close of the room. The staff were kind enough to take us through the room and explain each puzzle after we had finished. In the foyer, there are also exciting gadgets to try out which makes the escape an even more full and exciting experience. We are excited to return once the further rooms open. Highly recommended!

A memory for life. First time at escape with a 13 and an 8 year old. The team is lovely and have created a great setting with a storyline built into the escape game. Cues are varied in difficulty and type and gave each of us opportunities to shine. Thank you for a great memory to talk about, and we'll definitely be back again.

Fun and unique way to spend an evening in London!. I visited the Leo's Path escape room last week as part of a group of 5. I really enjoyed it! The room was designed creatively and although it was challenging, it was fun to see our group work together to solve each puzzle. There was loads of cheering each time we progressed to the next stage! This was my first escape room and I found the whole experience really rewarding. Once you get into the rhythm of the puzzles and clues the hour flies by. I would thoroughly recommend it. The hosts were very welcoming, and it was interesting afterwards to hear the background of how the game was created.
Great experience. Friendly and helpful staff, and great, challenging escape room. Hopefully will be able to do the other room at some point. Highly recommended A+++++

Incredibly clever and great fun - Kind passionate owners!. We called into AI Escape at 22:45 and asked if they would take us for an escape at 11pm! They kindly (and unexpectedly) agreed and we walked straight over. The entrance is slightly difficult to find which is ironic and a bit of extra fun for escape enthusiasts!When we arrived we were offered water and given the low down on the room's rules and need to know aspects then watched a short video. Very soon after we were in the room and having a blast! I'll say no more about the escape itself except the fact that it's great fun and challenging.One thing to note is that this room is different from others I've seen in the way that it is fully automated, i.e a linear design where you go from puzzle to puzzle rather than frantically searching around not knowing what to do.All in all an awesome experience and look forward to the new rooms!!

The best escape in London. First of all, they are the nicest hosts ever! A poignant story that get you in at first glance. No padlocks, no manual brute force. Pure imagination. The decoration was simply compelling. The overall experience was amazing!
Super fun. Very smart and well planned game which keeps you on your toes for its entirety!! Very enjoyable and lovely people :)

FUN FUN FUN!!. This was my first go at an escape room experience and it didn't disappoint. We were a team of two fiftysomething adults along with my 18 year old son. There aren't many things that we enjoy together but this bridged the generation gap and left us all with smiles on our faces - a truly bonding team experience. I didn't really know what to expect but the helpers explained everything clearly beforehand and were there as backup throughout via phone hints if we got really stuck. Their enthusiasm was infectious and got us in the mood for a really fun hour of brain frying challenges. The room was of really impressive quality both in design and gadgetry and had lots of fun props to help or hinder us through our journey to find Leo. We finished off with a thorough debrief from a team who clearly love their work.I'm looking forward to trying out their new room just as soon as it opens.

Fantastic experience!. Four of us played the Leo's path. The decoration and the setups are extremely delicate, better than most of escape games I have played. Some of setup will actually surprise the player. The enigma is not extremely difficult and somehow pedogogical thus is suitable for friends, couples and even family with young children to enjoy a wonderful afternoon gathering. Howard

Amazing experience with all elaborate designs and details. We are escape game lovers from Taiwan and we've joined many great ones. We can easily tell a well designed game from details. AI is not extremely difficult but you will definitely be amazed and surprised again and again during the whole period. The two founders created the game themselves, so they are literally knowledgable and passionate to lead every player into the amazing experience through the game - Leo's Path.

We enjoy a lot!. Great game!The hosts were really nice and explained every details in the game for us.The game has merged the puzzle and the story pretty well and the automated devices were also amazing!

An awesome experience. I attended the AI Escape rooms with very little idea of what to expect and was absolutely blown away! The room was challenging, fun, and altogether a great experience. I specifically liked how it encouraged us to think differently and work together as a team, and the fact that the theme was so different to other escape rooms I have heard about. Our hosts were friendly and helpful and seem to genuinely enjoy meeting each group that comes through the doors. I will be recommending to all my friends and visitors to London.
So much fun!. I highly recommend this experience! It's a unique (and heart warming) journey for everyone involved and really gets the brain working!

Really great fun for team mates. I was a bit apprehensive at the idea of an escape room, but it was so much fun, not at all scary but exhilarating and intriguing. Much more 'Crystal Maze' when I was expecting 'Saw'! The idea isn't that you have to 'escape' because you're in danger, rather you have to solve a series of puzzles in order to complete a quest. I would definitely recommend this for birthdays, stag & hen dos and work away days as it's really great team building.

What fun. Good time after a false start when a fire alarm fault meant we had to abandon the game. A week later all sorted and a free game to boot!Pitched just right for us, we did most of it without help but had 3 or 4 hints to keep us going.Very friendly staffHave a go on the web way if you have never done it before.Well done. We will be back.

Good service and fun experience. This was our first time in an escape room, and we was very good taken care of. The instructions was good, the personell was very service minded and helpful. And of course, the game was exciting and challenging. For us, trying this for the first time, this was a new and good experience.

Different from most escape rooms, and a techie paradise. The padlock-less nature of this room definitely makes it an outlier in the genre. The game itself is well-constructed but what stood out for us were the production values evident in the entire game experience. From the pre-game briefing to the debrief, the game-masters' passion for escape rooms and enthusiasm for sharing it with the world is clear. We probably spent as much time playing with the "toys" and finding out how things worked as playing the game itself - and certainly learned a thing or two about the gizmos available to make all the magic happen. Thanks for a great start to the weekend! Will be back for more!
Different. Different is how I can explain this experience, if you are in London... mandatory visit this place and enjoy the adventure, vibrant and real sounds!

New and excellent. This is a new escape experience. I had never tried one before, but it was a great time. Their room (soon to be rooms) is fully automated and is mainly puzzle-solving. There is not a bunch of tearing things apart and looking for random clues/objects. My grou was very impressed. The game masters are very friendly and helpful.

Great for team building exercise. I took 3 of my team members to work through the escape room, and we found the challenges very interesting. What I particularly liked was that the challenges and overall themes were linked, and they were clever!
Great experience!. starIt was my first time doing an escape room and it was awesome! Very friendly staff, well organized and the puzzles were really creative. Definitely recommend :)

first time and loved it!. This was my first time in an escape room, what a great experience, the theme was a particularly strong point in both mine and my seasoned escape room partners opinion and we all liked the linear style formation. Great fun and I look forward to AI's new room opening up shortly!

Excellent. I've done a number of escape rooms in the last year, and this is definitely in the top ones that I have done. The puzzles are linear (in that you have to solve one after the other) which I prefer as you get a real sense of excitement together when one of you finally cracks the solution. There was a strong theme with some really unique puzzles and constant excitement and surprises. Highly recommended!

Amazing fun!!!. Simply fantastic! Went with a group of 5. Every second was heart pumping. The stuffs were nice. The puzzles were well designed.Unlike the other room escaping games, the story was nice and touching. Can't wait to go back to the other rooms.
Amazing Escape Room!. We did the Leo's Path escape room. It was challenging, but fun and engaging. Great for teamwork as well. Definitely recommend.

Definitely one of the best escape rooms in London. Leo's path is the first fully automatic escape room in London. Have tried couple of escape rooms in London, most are about detective, agent, or murder mystery; and the props are not so impressive. Have to say that I am not a big fan of shredded paper and padlocks. So this is definitely the perfect escape room for me. It is not scary, your life is never in danger, and you are not thrilled by other "killers" or "investigators". And the story is completely new. Can't talk too much details otherwise wouldn't be so much fun when you experience it. Well you'd better try yourself. And it's a good time to try with couple of friends. If you finish earlier, you could ask the staff to enjoy the experience of "game controller". Definitely will recommend to other friends.

The best escape room in London. I had played several escape rooms in London, but this room is outstanding from others: first, the puzzles and ideas are new and different, and require players to think out of box; second, the room is very new, and all puzzles are fully automated; and third the owners are very friendly, and will go through all puzzles again after the game. I will definitely come again when the new themes are ready.

An excellent experience. Friend organised the room escape as a birthday activity. The room was engaging and kept us busy for the entire time with the staff working with our organisor to hide gifts throughout the puzzles and set up a cake/prosecco celebration at the end.Overall the experience was amazing with the staff going above and beyond to accomodate our celebrations.Many thanks

Great hour spent!. The owners are very friendly, and prepared us well before we are put into the room for the challenge! I shall not reveal too much here as I strongly recommend you go and try it yourself.

The best escape room I have played. I had played escape rooms before but this has been definitely my favourite experience. The room is fully automated, and the way you interact with the puzzles is great, as well as how everything connects so well with a storyline which unfolds as you progress through the puzzles. I won't mention any specific points so I don't spoil the surprises for future players, but some of the ways in which you interact with the room are very special and well thought.They also have a few very cool gadgets at the reception. Make sure you don't leave without trying the segway and the piano!Definitely recommended! I can't wait to try some of their new rooms :)

Wonderful experience in this difficult escape room. We were a group of 4 and two of us had never done an Escape Room before. We escaped less than a minute before the end, and it was a truly different experience from where I (having been to several escape rooms before) had escaped from before. The riddles in the room as well as the decoration all followed the storyline of "Leo's Path", so there were no random riddles. It was also the first fully automated room I had been to, and this was also very interesting to see and a nice change to the other rooms I had done so far. The staff was really friendly, and they went through the room with us after we finished to explain every riddle, and also gave a little insight on what other groups struggled with in comparison to us, or where others were faster while it took us very long. You could see the owners were very dedicated to their game themselves, and they even created a small fun riddle for us to find the way from the tube station to the location of the Escape Room. Thank you for this wonderful experience that I can and will highly recommend!

Expertly crafted escape room. This one was a first for me, an escape room without any padlocks, and after completing Leo's Path I've got to admit that I'm a convert to the padlock-less room.The room is a masterpiece in design, everything you see and do works to precision and there is no need to turn the room upside-down looking for those keys and codes.As we were just a team of 2 then it was a full on hour of puzzling and one or two puzzles did give us some problems, but the hint system is easy to use and the reward for solving each puzzle is a beautifully crafted piece of engineering revealing what you need for the next puzzle.The entire narrative for the room is well written so that the entire journey is significant and not just the usual of "get out with object x" which appears in many other rooms.Well worth the journey out of the city centre, and I look forward to returning for the other rooms that AI Escape have planned.

Al Escape. An excellent time here with two very kind hearted and amazing hosts! We went as a group of four friends and had such a great time! A very well thought out room and very fun for those who like an intellectual challenge! Definitely tests team work and problem solving skills and a very unique and different escape room! Had a fantastic time and looking to go back again!

First time play the room escape. Interesting storyline which got me thinking. Amazing staffs :)! I love the interesting decorations in the reception area. Will definitely visit again with my friends to try out other rooms in the store!

When love meets work. I'm italian so I apologize for my english! Someone thinks I'm an escape room expert due the fact I own the mine in my country but when I played AI (the "quest for Leo") I started to play thinking out-of-the-boxIt's a very nice game with a great storyboard and a background music that take the players to be part of the story! Also the "set design" is a big part of the game: it's perfect for the story (sorry: no spoilers!)!Talking about the game under a tech view.. I liked the electronic background solutions that are totally invisible to the players and this thing means a great work behind! It's the perfect timing (action-reaction) that gives the impression to the players that they solved a game and if someone has played others escapes knows what I mean (=third person activation... too bad , no magic!)Talking about Mrs and Mr I.... many english (and italian) escape rooms owners should learn from this beautiful couple what the word "welcome" means: simply the best!Waiting for your next steps I'm watching you!Luca

Focused Theme. A great weekend of brainteasers in a group of four at this new start-up. Apart from being pleasantly surprised by the automated elements of the room, these provided for a memorable experience keeping the puzzles aligned with the progression of the storyline. To top it up, the gadget showroom provided ample non-cranial fun afterwards - the segway is a must try!

A bit too hard for me, but awesome Company. Iv'e played a lot of rooms and this game itself for me was too hard, but I understand they are a new company so they are slowly improving the room. Quite a bit of it I just couldn't get my head around without having to ask for hints so that naturally took away the fun of it. But overall it was still fun and they had interesting puzzles. The room itself is very well designed though and at some points I really did enjoy myself. It's a fully automated room, no keys, no padlocks but I personally prefer a mix of both hands on and electrical. I wish the room had had more puzzles that were easier and funner as oppose to a few hard ones.The people who run this place are the loveliest people ever! They really welcome you and we had a good laugh with them after we did the room. They also let me play on there Segway/Hoverboard and gave me a free awesome Pen *Thumbs up*. They have really made the rooms and reception look really nice and well presented and they seem to put so much passion into what they create. So I hope they will listen to feedback because they have so much potential to become an awesome Escape Room Company as they have only been going a month.

Really fun day.. This was my first escape room experience and I really enjoyed it. I haven't laughed so much in a long time. Although me and my friend found the puzzle difficult at first we were given hints when needed to make sure we didn't get bored. I would definitely come back her again and bring friends. The owners couldn't be friendlier and gave me a really positive first experience to escape rooms. Definitely recommend.

Fantastic AI escape experience!. From the immersive storyline to the well thought out clues, the Archimedes Inspiration is like no other escape room experiences in town. When you first walk in to the room, it becomes apparent that smart technology is central to the entire experience - the music backdrop, lighting, and automated trap compartments all come together so seamlessly that it will both surprise and delight. I went with a group of 4, and there were many moments when we found ourselves deeply amazed at the unfolding events as we progress through the game. I think that the AI elements in itself already made the experience worthwhile. Of course, the storyline and puzzles were all on par and cleverly laid out to really spark your mind and imagination.If you love escape rooms and smart tech, Archimedes Inspiration is definitely not one to be missed!

Top Escape Room - Fun for the whole family. I have been to a few Escape Rooms in London and this one is definitely one of the best ones. The amount of effort that had been put into the puzzles, the design and the introduction was fantastic. There were five of us in the group, three of them had never done anything like this before but they thought it was a great experience.The place is very easy to find (although we managed to miss the door - so, how dumb do you think we felt before we had even gotten started). The introduction given to us was clear and concise, and also very fun. The lady explained everything in detail to the 'newbies' and really encouraged us to have fun.Once you go inside the room, it's fully automated and the clues are great as they follow a storyline. The theme was great and the puzzles were excellent. I can't give too much away or else I will spoil it all for you.However, I would definitely recommend it. I would bring young children as it is too complex for them. The youngest in our group was 17 and she thoroughly enjoyed the experience (and was buzzing for days after).We actually hung around for a bit to speak with the owners (who are so so friendly) and

Unique, Spectacular, Collaborative, Innovative, and - FUN!. This is a top-class escape room like no other! I am a keen problem-solver and have been to many European as well as Chinese escape rooms but none have amazed me as much as this one.There is a strong balance between fun and puzzle complexity. I thoroughly enjoyed the way the designers integrated technological factors into each task - whilst maintaining an overall story throughout the experience. Excellent stuff!Aside from the actual escape room experience - the environment of the venue is like no-other. Electronic keyboard, Mini-segway, Super High-def TV, I would whole-heartedly recommend this escape room. I can't wait for their next escape room (as they change it periodically to keep thrill seekers like myself wanting more!).so yea....so sum up my experiences:GO GO GO GO GO!!!

This is a must-go for Escape Room lovers!. I love escape rooms and was thrilled when I heard about this one. My friends and I are keen clue-solvers, but above all else we value a story that is really immersive and strings the clues together. Leo's Path gave us exactly that - a unique story with a lot of fun and difficult challenges. The feedback was that we were very quick in some of the parts that other teams really struggled, but slightly slow in the "easier" bits. It shows that this place is super multi-dimensional, and is a fun challenge for everyone. I can't wait to go again for the remaining 4 story rooms! I also encourage everyone to take a look at the funky technology stuff they have!

Fun, exciting, innovative and surprising experience! Great leisure option in London!. It has been one of the best leisure experiences in London. I have visited a couple of room escapes before in other cities, but Archimedes Inspiration is a totally new concept. They combine very sophisticated technology, with innovative gadgets and great effects with a really deep and engaging story that makes the experience unique.As they are becoming quite successful, my group had to wait for a short time at reception which was actually fun. At the waiting area they have a number of techy gadgets that you can try and play around which makes it actually fun to wait. The staff are very friendly and are happy to explain how all the new tech stuff they have work. I loved the smart piano they have!They place might be a bit difficult to find at the beginning, so make sure to go a bit earlier, plus you will be able to play with their gadgets too.

A fantastic experience - highly recommended!. This was my first Escape Room experience - I didn't know what to expect, but was incredibly impressed! It was extremely enjoyable, using logic and and a physical element. No spoilers - but the room is very well themed and hugely enjoyable. The two hosts are great - very friendly and welcoming. There were just two of us who did it - challenging but very fun. (Don't worry about being rubbish - we were! The hosts helped us through the event with clues. We didn't do in an hour!) Great Experience. Thanks!

Amazing Experience. I've never gone to an escape room experience, and I was really curious about this new place. The ambience in the rooms is so great and real, and the riddles to solve are just addictive!!! The further you go they more complex they get, and the more you feel the underlying story! Expect some surprises ;)

Brainy fun- so addictive!. I have been here twice, first time as a player and second time as a hint-giver to watch my friends play from the office. Both experiences were fun in completely different ways and well worth the trip!The theme 'Leo's Path' has a well thought out route and can be quite challenging, but as a first time player it did not put me off- it only made me want to come back and try out other themes as I'm sure next time I can do better!! I would definitely recommend Archimedes Inspiration!

Great fun, excellent experience!. Storyline is very well-thought out, challenging but with the game controller feature, you have the ability to adjust to your own level.Very friendly owners who are enthusiastic about what they do. They actually created and set all the pros and scenes themselves.Loved it, definitely coming back again!

Fun time!. We went a group of 4 people and had a great time! Room itself is quite challenging and will make your brain burn for an hour, as Leo is not easy to find! :P. Everything in the room is fully automated and quite impressive. They have just opened in March and the owners are nice people willing to help you make the most out of the game. Also in reception they have cool gadgets for you to have fun and explore while you wait. Looking forward to try the other rooms...
Great experience, fun but challenging. Thank you very much for a great time! The escape room was fun and for those who are looking for challenge, you'll be satisfied!

Great escape room!!. Really enjoyed our visit!
Great clues and setting with very good host :)
Would recommend to everyone!
Great fun!. We went for my mothers bday and had a great time. You have an hour to escape and it goes fast! The puzzles are brilliant. Highly recommended!

Completely and utterly brilliant!. We decided to do this as a London treat between a museum and theatre trip and were not disappointed None of us had ever done this before and with an age range of 12-48 the 5 of us had no idea what to expect! With 3 out of the 5 of us dyslexic it has some interesting moments trying to work out the codes in the right order but we stormed through it and escaped in 49 mins! The room set up is brilliantly done, the props fantastic, the staff friendly and helpful and the noises they have in the background help to add to the whole experience. I can not recommend this enough to you. Please give it a go- you will love it!

Great fun!!. If you are looking for something different to do on a weekend, I strongly recommend you to try Escape plan.. My friends and I had so much fun trying to solve all the puzzles and get out of the rooms. One thing to remember: You enter as friends so come out as friends as well:) The staff were so helpful throughout the game so we felt very comfortable. We managed to finish it in time but we might come back again to challenge ourselves:)

Lots of fun!. Four of us booked to go to this Escape Experience. We hadn't done one before and so didn't know what to expect. We were made to feel very welcome and had a good introduction to put us at ease. Our hour in the room was great fun. At different points we worked individually, in pairs and as a four to solve the puzzles with support at the end of a walkie-talkie for when we went totally off track. We felt the pressure at the end but escaped with 31 seconds to spare and still speaking to each other! We all agreed that we had thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would love to do another escape game in the near future.

A wonderful experience!. We had a great time today. The staff is very nice and flexible. We made a mistake in choosing the date but they enabled us to come on the first available time slot they had. Each one of us got a personal reference during the game. The kids played an important role. The game is very smart and we really enjoyed the game. Highly recommended!

First time escape - great fun!. We did this as a team of six and had a whale of a time. The rooms were effective with plenty of special effects and background noise. The clues were ingenious but do-able and we clawed our way out with a minute to spare! Good value for money, good front of house staff, great entertainment. Highly recommended 5*.
Great fun!. Booked for my daughters birthday, very original, great surroundings, will do it again, this time for the adults!

Great fun for kids and adults. We visited Escape Plan for my daughter's 12th birthday party. We had a lot of fun, the children were entertained for the full hour. I was worried that they would be too young but we were provided with excellent guidance that kept each child focused on an activity they could achieve, and allowed us to get to the end. Highly recommended!
Great fun. A great way to spend an hour, lots of fun was had by all our group The briefing was excellent and the time flew by.

First time escapers!. We went as a family team of six, we're still speaking to one another and we got out, just, in our sixty minutes! Excellent experience we all really enjoyed the challenge once we actually worked out how to follow the clues!!!

Family of 6. We visited in October 2016 and had a fantastic time! We're keen puzzlists and so I was worried when booking what level the puzzles would be! They were spot on and we managed to escape with a mere 1m30s spare!!! Carlos was excellent and on hand to help if we started looking lost! Thoroughly recommend! Our group age ranged from 28-60 and all thoroughly enjoyed.
Fantastic evening activity. The best activity I've ever paid for. well constructed and tremendous fun. We were 5 people, wouldn't recommend doing with more than 5
We escaped!. Excellent - all of us had a great time problem solving and eventually escaped with seconds to spare. Great atmosphere and challenging puzzles.

Great night our. Having done over 20 room escapes in London, I can say that this one is among the best. While it was a bit pricier than some of the others, that's my own fault for choosing to come at peak time, and there was a lot about it I really liked so it was great value for money.Here's a quick list of what I think they got right:- Very welcoming hosts. Although they weren't in character and the pre-game introduction wasn't at all immersive, they were very friendly and explained everything throughly. We also had a nice chat afterwards about other room escapes.- perfect clue system whereby we were in control of when to receive a hint.- in the end we never asked for one because the puzzles were designed so well that we never got so stuck that we couldn't work out how to continue. However it wasn't too easy because we escaped literally as the clock hit 0:00, so in that sense the difficulty level for us was pitched absolutely perfectly. There was an exciting sense of panic in the last 2 minutes, as we stared at the last puzzle trying as a team to work it out. It was very satisfying when we did.- good opportunities for all team members being able to work on multiple things at once.- theming in the room was great - authentically felt like the 1940s. there were lots of nice physical puzzles and some items that felt ingeniously designed, in a home-made kind of way.- my favourite part, which I haven't seen in any other room escape, was a coding system whereby a drawn symbol next to each padlock gives you an idea which puzzle will provide you with the code for it. This is brilliant because it removes the very un-fun need to try a 4 digit solution randomly on each of the dozen padlocks in the room until one of them opens - a frustration I have experienced in several other room escapes. I love when there is a logical path through the game, so that no arbitrary guesswork is needed. They got that aspect of the design very right.I think my only feedback would be to try and keep the rules and introduction at the beginning a bit snappier.Really great night out, the people who run it have done a fantastic job and I look forward to playing your second room when it opens.

Excellent escape - great birthday. I booked escape room as a birthday event, with the max group size of 7. We were well prepped by Brendan prior to entering and told to expect to be close to the wire... We made it out, just! The man knows what he's talking about :)The puzzles are ingenious and overall flow of the escape felt perfect, we were all busy and the hour flew by. I can't recommend enough while also fearful of spoilers, but a must do!Only word of advice is to head to the cafe for entry into illife yd, as we got a little lost following Google maps to the letter!

Brilliant fun!. First time any of us had done an escape room so we weren't sure what to expect! It was great fun - exactly the right level of challenge, run by really lovely people! No spoilers for the room - plenty to keep a team of 7 occupied for just under an hour!

Fantastic Fun. We visited Escape Plan as a family of 6 to celebrate a 60th birthday. We had a great time. The puzzles were challenging but do-able with a bit of patience. The set-up and props were brilliant and really helped to set the mood. We managed to escape with just over two minutes to spare; it got quite intense towards the end!I would highly recommend Escape Plan for anyone looking for a fun way to spend an afternoon.

Great fun and pitched at the right level. Host is very friendly and engaging, he is also explains the rules very clearly and carefully, ensuring everyone understands.The game itself is pitched at exactly the right level, there are puzzles that are relatively easy, some that are very hard and the majority which are somewhere in between. We breezed through the first 20 minutes of the hour, and I think a bit of complacency may have set in as we suddenly found ourselves floundering with only 15 minutes left and a substantial amount of the journey remaining. The atmosphere is brilliant as well - the props and sounds really add to the feeling of being trapped in a Prisoner of War camp. Would really recommend as a business team building exercise. There were 7 of us and it really encouraged us to think and work together. I understand they are planning another room, and we will definitely be signing up to do that one. The price is very reasonable as well - a team of 7 will only pay £16.42 each.

Great fun and lots of puzzles!. Went yesterday with a group of friends - we had a great time! The "set" was great and there was plenty for us all to do. We really enjoyed the puzzles, which were varied I'm style and difficulty.The guys running it are also really friendly and helpful if you need any hints!

A fantastic hour of fun. We had not done an escape room adventure before and chose Escape Plan because it had excellent reviews in Time Out and on Trip Advisor. I can see why it got those reviews - a truly excellent morning was had by me, my husband and our two nephews and niece who are 18, 13 and 15. I won't talk too much about the actual adventure experience so as not to give the experience away but the set up, clues and props were all excellent. Super helpful and friendly staff and in my opinion great value for money! We did it in 55 mins with only a few hints so it was a nail biter! Our teenagers loved it as much as the adults did! Go and enjoy.
Escape Plan Family game. We visited to celebrate a birthday our first experience of an escape game. Very friendly staff with clear instructions. Ingenious puzzles the time passed very quickly

Great family day out. AS one's offspring get older it becomes increasingly difficult to find ways to keep everyone entertained - this was the perfect answer. Very well constructed room, clues that were tricky without being impossible, and all ended without tears and everyone feeling good. Hats off to Tim and the team and we look forward to news of their next 'escape room'
great fun. Friendly staff and a really great experience for a group of teenage guys. Would recommend to a group who wants a challenge and something differnt.

Great fun for teenagers and their Mums !. Six of us attended Escape Plan and all of us had great fun. The time whizzed by thanks to lots of clues and puzzles. There was something for everyone to do and get involved with. A very entertaining afternoon. The location was tucked away in Kennington but close to Underground links. The rooms were full of great props. The staff were lovely with a warm welcome and good explanation of what was involved for us novices. Our first escape room, it won't be our last! Overall a great experience and well worth the money!

Immersive and enjoyable experience. We experienced Escape Plan as a fairly last minute social gathering. We were a group of 6 visiting London for the day and needed an activity we could all do together. I'd taken part in an escape game in Newcastle before so looked online for one close to central London. After reading some positive reviews we decided to book Escape Plan. We all found it to be a very enjoyable experience. The thing that separated Escape Plan from the previous escape game was it's commitment to providing a believable period setting. There were lots of interesting puzzles all of which were challenging without being too abstract. I'd definitely recommend this to groups of friends who were looking for a fun hour or so within a reasonable distance of central London.

Great fun, well organised!. We attended Escape Plan for a stag do. Everyone who took part had a fantastic time, and we all continued discussing the puzzles set after we left! Brendan and Carlos were friendly and professional. A memorable experience all round.

An excellent afternoon. Had a great afternoon playing this with a couple friends, they have a great variety of puzzles that test a variety of skills. We went with three of us, but I think four or five people stand the best chance of getting out in less than an hour. Highly recommend!
Amazing experience. Very well done. All the questions and tricks where very smart.we have enjoyed it all so much.was an amazing one hour and 15min spent in the rooms

Awesome experience. This was our 3rd escape room and this one was the best. The clues were very creative and the dressing of the rooms the most professional that we have seen. Brendon was also a really nice guy who helped make our experience the best.

Highly recommended!. Had a brilliant time here. Great set-up, great puzzles and enthusiastic engaging staff. We've been to several escape rooms and this is definitely one of the best :D
They were also very accommodating when we were running extremely late for our appointment for which we remain eternally grateful.

Brilliant fun and well worth the money!. We went as a group of four as part of a work 'team building' day. The game is very well thought out, well organised and the staff are lovely. The puzzles are the right balance of challenging, but achievable and hints are given to stop you from going too far off course! The room and props were fantastic with a great photo opportunity at the end. We all had a lot of fun and were all able to contribute. I highly recommend this to any group looking for a fun and novel afternoon of entertainment!

Great fun and great puzzles!. Teens and parents cooperating, communicating and having a great time?!? It can happen here! We did this game at the end of a weeklong tourist trip and our teens are still talking about it weeks later. Thanks for a great time, Escape Plan! We "grown ups" had intended to stand aside and let the kids do all the work, but the instant it started we couldn't help ourselves, and it became a crazy fun team effort! This is great fun for family groups, double dates, or even meeting other like-minded strangers! Leave time afterward to enjoy your post-escape tales; you will compare notes with your comrades.

Excellent Escape game which really makes you think!. This is a very well worked escape plan, a group of 6 lads all did this and was very challenging (althou the beer may not have helped) the overall experience was great and even thou we didnt quite make it in time (was 5 minutes over again blame the alcohol!) it was very satisfying. The staff in charge where great , well organised and explained it all clearly!

We all absolutely loved it!. We booked escape plan for our son's 11th birthday and went as a family of 5. We are both in our 30's and the children are 17, 15 and 11. I was concerned I'd feel a bit claustrophobic but I needn't have worried. The room was light, bright and airy with brilliant props and something for us all to do. It wasn't too hard or too easy; we got some great tips before we entered and the amount of help when inside the room was just right. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and came out smiling. Fantastic way to spend time together without modern technology getting in the way. Would definitely recommend it and can't wait to do another one.

An epic adventure. 4 of us took on the challenge and were initially confused and excited. Once we calmed down a bit, we actually made some progress. It's great fun and occasionally intense. Clearly a lot of work has gone in to the room and the attention to detail and clever bits of engineering here and there really make it. Really tempted to do it again to try and beat the 60 minutes deadline next time!

Very entertaining:))). The hostess was excellent, explained everything and gave us few hints to guess. Overall it was successful way to spend time with all family and everyone made his own contribution. Fun and challenge for every age:))
Really good fun!. We went for a work social - was great fun, challenging but not too hard. Theme,puzzles and story all well thought through.

Great Afternoon - Challenging fun. We went to Escape plan as a family group -Grandma, Grandpa, Mum Dad and 2 teenage boys. What fun we had! It was great working together on the different challenges. Everyone had their chance to contribute. We made it out with 56secs to spare and the adrenaline rushing!! I could definitely recommend it especially for the competitive logical thinkers.

A different family event. We were looking for something different as a present for our son's family. Escape plan looked very interesting. It exceeded our expectations. The grandchildren loved the problem solving and grew very excited as the last few minutes passed to solve the escape. Just 56 seconds remained as we finally solved the last clue and escaped the room. The clues are really well thought through and we would recommend this adventure to anyone or group as great fun.

Fantastic way to spend time with family. We went as a group of five, 2 parents a 20 year old, 18 year old and 11 year old. We found it very absorbing, everyone contributed to the escape of the family and we only just made it but it was lovely to work as a team and the sense of achievement felt by the younger members of the team was brilliant. Everyone has their own strengths which often don't get recognised by siblings, or parents! we all left with a buzz and something to talk about over dinner, maybe the parents weren't so stupid as the 18 year old assumed and the 11 year old can hold her own with puzzle solving. We chose Escape Plan as reviews suggested it was more of a thinking Escape room, we were not disappointed. The two chaps who run the room are brilliant, and obviously had fun setting up the challenges and puzzles. Best afternoons entertainment we have had in a long time.

Intense fun!!!. Had such a great time!!! We were 3 adults and two teens, and had great fun learning about how we all approach the problems differently! Made it out with seconds to spare, keeping the experience intense all the way through (thanks also to a well-timed hint from our overseer!). The space is not large (thank goodness actually, because we needed to use the whole space!) but it's very well set up and designed very thoughtfully! The spot is in an adorable little courtyard, then you head upstairs. Was very quiet area in the evening, but might be a great spot for lunch/tea earlier. Highly recommend. Our group of 5 was just about the perfect size... I think you could manage with 3, be great with 4, but six might be too crowded/chaotic. Enjoy, enjoy! We'll talk about it for a long long time!
Excellent... Really good fun. This is a brilliant experience. Really challenging and enjoyable. A huge sense of achievement when you solve a puzzle.

Well worth a visit. All 7 of us who attended would recommend Escape Rooms. There were lots of challenging puzzles that kept us all busy. We only just made it out in time, but the sense of urgency definitely added to the experience. Hannah and Carlos who were working that evening were very friendly and enthusiastic. Escape plan was good value and well worth a visit.

Brilliantly immersive puzzling fun. This experience was absolutely top class. There were all sorts of different types of puzzles for different types of minds to solve, and you had to work together as a group as well as individually. The way the experience is set up was just great. So immersive and entertaining, with a real sense of impending panic. We absolutely loved our time trying to escape and would definitely like to try out another one by the same company soon.HIGHLY recommend this for a fun activity with friends or colleagues.

Amazing story, great room escape!. We were really impressed about the whole decoration and set, the story kept us really into it. We loved the "non-electronic" way the room was designed, and the level of difficult was perfect, not easy and not frustrating. Our host was very kind and explained to us everything. Recommend it!

Good day out!. Provided something different for us all to do, went with my girlfriend and took my parents along with us. Escape Plan kept everybody entertained for the hour as we made our escape.I would definitely recommend to somebody looking for something a bit different to do, especially if you like a bit of a mental challenge. Go ahead and make a booking if you think you have got what it takes to escape, we managed to escape with under a minute to spare!!

Fun Afternoon. Had a really fun time at Escape plan yesterday. Brendan our host was friendly and very helpful throughout our escape. Our team of 3 found it challenging but very rewarding. Lots of funny moments in a well planned and themed escape room.

Escaped by the skin of our teeth!. I brought 6 of my colleagues along with me to Escape Plan as a team building exercise. We didn't know what to expect as none of us had ever been to an escape room but we had the best time! Our adrenaline was pumped and we left their feeling exhausted from the mental challenge, but we all loved it and agreed we'd love to go back for the next one. We had 2.15 seconds left on the clock when we managed to escape, despite us thinking about 5 minutes earlier that there was no way we'd make it in time. Really great experience and interesting way to learn about different skills the team have. Highly recommended.
Great fun. A really fun escape room with tricky puzzles. Their pre-game scene-setting could be improved but u can't fault the quality of the puzzles and props inside the room.
Would go again!!. Was so good! Would do again! Really enjoyed it! About two clues off finishing it! Defiantly worth it!

So much fun!. Came here for a mini team building exercise. We had so much fun, it was quite a challenge as there were 3 of us but with a couple of hints, we got out with 30 seconds to go! 100% recommended!

Good short burst of fun. If youre looking for a way to spend an hour and you arent paying for it then this is good clean fun and something abit different. Not the most sophisticated puzzles in the world, but challenging enough to keep everyone entertained.
Excellent Fun!. Had a really brilliant time! Organisers were really friendly and helpful. They made sure they didn't make it too easy for us (or too difficult!) Thank you!

London day out with friends. I booked for a group of school friends at Escape Plan and with most having already done a few escape rooms previously, we had some expectations of what to expect but were also intrigued by the new story and challenge. The experience was brilliant, we all had such a great time and managed to get out in just over 45minutes! We had to all split up on tasks and found that the most effective, and it really was a great team building activity even for friends who had known each other for 10+ years! I would highly recommend, all the staff were really welcoming and friendly and I can't wait for them to expand to more rooms when we will definitely be re-visiting to take on the new challenges!

Awesome. I have done a few escape rooms and this one was very good. Warm welcome, the people there are really friendly and make sure you have the best experience. The scenario we did was very nice, not to easy, not too hard. Would definitely recommend.
Amazing. It was a real pleasure to solve these riddles! The atmosphere is very authentic and the staff is great. 200% recommended

Insightful & fun :-). We did this as a part of some staff training. We found it very useful, insightful and very good fun! There were 7 in our group so we had 1 group of 4 and one group of 3. The sessions were very professionally done and the team working feedback was most helpful. The eccentric coffee shop next door is also most useful in entertaining the group not taking part. Well worth the time.

Great experience. We had an excellent time at Escape Plan. The task was well explained by our host, and was lots of fun. The puzzles were challenging and varied, and the set was well thought out. Would recommend.

Awesome Time. Escape Plan was the highlight of our trip to London. The place is kind of hard to find. As soon as you hit Iliffe Yard it is a small door on the left (above the little corner shop). The sign is tiny. The staff is awesome and the escape is creative and challenging. It was SUPER HOT up there though - dress in comfortable (light) clothes. The staff really knows how to run it - they pay close attention and go out of their way to make sure you have a fun time. I HIGHLY recommend it. The staff was GREAT.

Great family fun!. Being complete escape room novices we weren't sure what to expect but the briefing at the beginning was really helpful & we thoroughly enjoyed the whole thing - loved the fact that we all played our parts in solving the puzzles & clues & worked as a team - would definitely recommend & the people running this escape room were extremely helpful & friendly

Very fun, team activity. Great time here, very nice host that did a great job guiding us with not too much information. Loved the story and setting, a lot of very clever enigmas to figure out. This is one of many escape games i have played and I really found it very fun - not only for me but also for other members of the team who were doing their first escape game. Would definitely recommend!

Made it out!. I booked this for my partners 25th birthday. We have a team of 5, 3 of us where first timers and 2 had done a different escape room in the past. There is lots to do and not everything had to be in a specific order so it was easy to divide the task and give us all something to do in the beginning. My partner and I did feel like there was sometime that too many people doing the same thing but it worked as a good break for the 60 mins time limit we where given. I would definable do it or another escape room again.

Good fun, good puzzles. I did this with a group of 3. Great fun, tough and interesting puzzles, enough to keep us all flat out for an hour of solid puzzling. We scraped through with about 5 seconds left on the clock... and with a little judicious assistance from the game-master. Nice atmospheric set-up and a good range of different types and difficulties of puzzle. Highly recommended.

Great team building event! . We did this for a team away day and it was fantastic! Such a fun experience and great way of making you work as a team and also seeing individuals expertise. Thanks for a great morning!

Fantastic way to spend an evening. We loved this game. A great location where we were met at the gate, briefed, then let loose in our bid to escape the pow camp. Really well thought out puzzles, some first rate props, and all supported by great service. Really recommended!
Great evening out. We thoroughly enjoyed this team bonding exercise. A good challenge, well run and great value for money. Would definitely visit again if we didn't already know how to escape!

So good!. This was mine, and everyone in the group's, first escape room. From what i'd heard from people i sort of knew what to expect, but i had no idea how much fun it would be. This one was well made, very well set up and hosted perfectly. I was in a group of 3 x Latvians, 1 Swede and me, an Englishman - yet we still managed to escape with everyone playing their part. Obviously english language helps, but even if you have people who's first language isn't english you can still get through it, as we did. Our time was quite good, yet i still think it could've been better! The location is about 10 minutes from the Elephant & Castle tube station and was pretty easy to find. Definitely worth going, and very reasonably priced especially if you have a group of 5 or so.
Awesome. Really fun interactive activity to start off a stag do! Was really well themed and put together, and the people running it were brilliant :)
Excellent!. Had an amazing time - very friendly staff providing a very fun day out! Would reccomend to everyone, cheaper but definitely not overshadowed by others

Best Thing We Did in London!. The entire family had a blast! We've never done an escape room before and Escape Plan far exceeded our expectations. They were kind enough to open on a Monday for our son's birthday since we were visiting from overseas. It's hard to say who had the most fun -- our three kids ages 7-10 or the parents. Escape Plan did an amazing job with the scenery, the set-up, the story line, and the sound effects. The staff was terrific, too. There were plenty of puzzles to keep the family busy for an hour of action-packed fun. We loved it and wish we could go back again.

Fantastic way to spend an hour!!. Booked this for my birthday with a group of friends and we were all really excited about Escape Plan but in reality it exceeded our expectations. The hosts were lovely and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience from start to finish! I've already recommended it to several others. Brilliant!!

Great fun. There are many puzzles with very smart / neak tricks. Many of the puzzle ran in parallel, which kept our group of 5 busy at all times.The staff was super friendly too. Loved the experience xD

Brilliant, definitely recommend!. I would definitely recommend Escape Plan for a really fun way to spend an hour. The staff were very friendly and really interested in us as a group and my 4 friends and I had an awesome time. Puzzles were really varied and there were plenty of them to keep us amused. It's smaller than some of the bigger escape the room options out there but that meant it had a more personal touch which we found really great. Definitely book your slot now!

So much to do!!. I'm a big fan of escape game, but that one was really great because there is so much to do! We were 6 in the room and as you have a lot of puzzles to solve in parallel, everybody was quite busy the whole way.On top of this, the atmosphere is really well created.I definitely recommend!
Brillant !!!. The game is absolutely great ! Full of surprises and well organised ! The staff is super friendly and funny !! We had an amazing time! Will definitely recommend it !!! :)
We did it!. We had a fantastic time escaping the room. The staff were lovely and we'd definitely recommend this!

A Great Team Challenge. We have an escape room team and we have done a few of these between us now. We all agreed that this was a great way to spend an hour and embarrassingly we only just finished in time. It is one of the more difficult escape rooms we have come across, but it was still very doable. The location is a little bit odd and perhaps more could be invested into the props. A couple of things gave accidental clues, because of where they had become worn out in certain places. It sounds a little bit vague, but I don't want to ruin it for any future visitors. Worth a visit.

A warm welcome, well organised and a fantastic sense of achievement had by all!. Used a Stag event to book this as something a little unusual (no one except me had done anything like this before), requiring a bit of brain and giving a competitive edge to get out before time runs out. Once the others got the idea of what they were supposed to do, they were well into it and we escaped with 5mins to go which made for a great sense of achievement and teamwork for the rest of the day.Throughout the session, there were plenty of clues to find and puzzles to solve which kept everyone's energy up, even for a our larger group. Thank you Escape Plan - I look forwards to more rooms in the future.

Amazing time!!!. This was such a fantastic experience! Two of our group had tried this type of thing before but my hubby and I never had. We loved every minute of it and we're very proud of our time of 50 minutes. Easy to find, nice location near Kennington tube station. The briefing was great, made to feel very welcome and given all the info we needed to get going.Inside the experience the puzzles were great, testing out the grey matter and we loved it. Getting a group photo at the end was great too especially using the props.We will definitely be looking out for anymore games developed by these guys and be returning! In the meantime we shall just have to recommend it to everyone else!
Excellent. My visit to exscape plan was brilliant I was in a group of 5 we worked very well and managed to get out of the room in the hour we were given

Spot on. Everything about it was just right - the quirky location added to the story, the puzzles were set at the right level. And of course we made it out, just in time. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience. 5 work colleagues.
Excellent adventure!. A fantastic evening out. Great level of challenge, intrigue, excitement. Would thoroughly recommend!

Excellent room not easy but great. A very good authentic room .
Difficult quizzes
We were 3 people and it wasn't easy but they gave us extra time to solve all the puzzles.
Great room

Great fun from a great host. Really cool. It was our first time and we had great fun. Excellent setting. Fantastic for a birthday celebration for a small group. We are all housemates and we surprised two birthday guys with a fun and alternative evening

Incredible Experience. Two teams of us attended Escape Plan without really knowing what to expect, and with quite severe hangovers (we were on a stag weekend). I have to say, this was the absolute highlight of the weekend and a fantastic experience that I wish we could repeat! Brendan was patient, helpful and gave really interesting and honest feedback. I can't thank the team enough for hosting us - and I can't recommend this highly enough.

Spiffing Fun !! . Brilliant experience for small group 4-6 - we made it with 47 seconds to spare ! The hour flew by and we really enjoyed the exercises - WELL DONE ! Escape plan is a super war time game - lots of props and fun challenges.
Great Experience. Our first visit to this type of attraction. Excellent all round. Visited with 4 kids (11-17) and they loved it. Highly recommended!

Fab war themed escape room!. This is the fourth escape room we have been to and it didn't disappoint. The first challenge starts with locating it as it's in a secured street, once in the staff are friendly and helpful. We had the run down of information we would need once in the room which was helpful. The room itself is done completely in war theme and was superb, really added to the whole experience. The puzzles were challenging but not unsolveable and we did most without any clues, and escaped with 7 minutes remaining! There is plenty to be getting on with so players don't get bored and don't have to concentrate on the same puzzles. We would def recommend!

Great Family Experience. This was our first experience of this type and we will definitely be doing more. We did this as a family of four kids are 11 and 13 and all really enjoyed it.Theme is tense but not too scary, puzzles are well thought out and sufficiently varied so everyone was able to make a contribution to the team using different skills. Instructions at the beginning were clear for everyone and staff were very friendly and welcoming.Throughly recommend.
A brilliant evening!. So much fun, tense and exciting and a brilliant alternative night out. Loved it. Already looking forward to hearing about the next one planned.

Great STen do. 60 mins of fun.. Mix of guys and girls for a bride to be party.
Had loads of fun. From the 1st to the last min was exhilarating. Everyone in the group had a great time and it was their 1st escape room.
The girls who were seeing to us, we're very friendly and helpful.
Would be a great present!. First time doing anything like this. 4 of us had a great time there, We'd recommend it for all ages 17-70!

Great fun!. This was a brilliant way to spend an hour! The puzzles were extremely well thought out and devilishly fun. The setting was brilliant with a lot of attention detail! It was one of the highlights of my Birthday and I would definitely recommend it!

Great fun and very professional. We had a brilliant time at Escape Plan for my husband Harry's birthday. The team at Escape Plan were very professional and we really enjoyed everything - clever puzzles, and good briefing and debriefing. Highly recommended!

Landi and friends. An experience. Brandon made us feel very comfortable and most welcome. Everything was focused to ensure we had lots of fun. Thanks, we'll be back as soon as you have a new escape at up.

Fantastic . This place is brilliant, a fantastic day out I will definitely go again . The 2 girls who ran it were amazing . They explained everything in the briefing and gave us some good advice before locking us in the room . The puzzles were challenging and varied but not impossible. Don't be put off by the location , this is a fun day out for people of all ages and gets you all working together. Our team got out with less than a minute to go !! I can't wait till they get a new game so we can go again .

Well thought out and atmospheric!. I don't want to say too much - and then spoil the experience for others. The location is a bit tucked away but worth the effort of finding it. The props and setting do enhance the atmosphere. The objective - which is to escape from a WW2 POW camp - is well executed with the clues/puzzles thought out to be "do-able" but testing.The facilitators do monitor you and, via walkie-talkie - can help you along if yiu get bogged down. The staff were extremely friendly and enthusiastic. And they were also very keen and receptive to feedback (ours was all positive).Loved it.

Good experience and game. My colleagues and I enjoyed ourselves greatly at Escape Plan. The theming of the room is decent, with no anachronisms or objects inappropriate to a 2nd World War setting. The clues were there... if you could only find them. The hosts mostly left us to our own devices — they flagged that they would not volunteer clues — and we finished with 2 minutes 14 seconds left.This is a pretty small unit so don't arrive early, because there is nowhere whatsoever to go!Where could it improve? Some doors/objects had 2, 3, or 4 locks on them which seemed a little unnatural. And it's amongst the more expensive rooms in London at nearly £30 a head for a team of 4. But that's about the limit.

Great fun. We successfully escaped from the baddies in 58 minutes so although we cut it fine we feel that we had excellent value for money. As a group of 4 adults we found the escape room to be challenging yet fun and it played to different sets of strengths so we all got to enjoy the excitement of being the one to open the padlock at different times. The props were great and the whole thing was well thought out. We would highly recommend this escape room and we look forward to more rooms in the future.

Great team building. We went as a group of 7 work colleagues for a team building event and it was great fun. It is very well organised and thought out. Without giving away any spoilers, the puzzles are all different and it's great to see how different people think to solve the different challenges. I'd definitely recommend this.
Top notch fun. Good puzzles, immersive experience. We had a fantastic time and left on a puzzle solving high! Would do it again when they have another set up

5* would escape again!. Although a second time would be less fun knowing the answers. But really, we had a fantastic time.We were warmly welcomed and well looked after. The puzzles felt well pitched and varied. The set was brilliant and the props gave for a good experience.So, we did need a bit of help but it was gently proffered when appropriate and in a way that didn't detract at all from the experience.Will be keeping a keen eye out for the next project from Brendan.We enjoyed the "post match analysis" given by the hosts though one of our group took a bit of the feedback to heart so please be gentle. :)

Loved it. This was a great London activity. The aim is to interpret clues, open locks and escape from the room in only 60 minutes. We escaped with a minute to spare .....and can tell you no more ....find out for yourself. We were a family of four - ages 29 - 60. All loved it, enjoyed the challenge and are still talking about how we could have done better. This is only for you if you can work as a team, enjoy puzzles and don't 'lose your temper with others' ? You work at a fast pace but it is suitable for all adult ages. Don't forget your glasses if you need them for reading. Great coffee at the little shop downstairs too.
So much fun. I would definitely recommend this place it was so much fun and the staff are so friendly. Although it's a challenge
Escape plan WW2. This is a well organised, fun event which we played as a family. The problems were challenging yet we just managed to escape with 3 minutes to spare! A great activity, thank you!

Decent experience. if you want to have 1-1,5 hour fun with your mates, this is the place to be. You are back in World war II, trapped in one room (2 actually!) with several puzzles to solve in specific time. The game's difficulty is exactly in the right level - not too easy, not too difficult. Nice location near Kennington tube station and friendly people organizing this escape game - what else to do need for an adventurous evening in London?

Great experience!. What an hour! We left feeling like we really had just escaped from a POW camp!There's not much to say that hasn't been said already, but it's really worth going along and giving the experience a try. Great game and set and excellent friendly staff. You won't regret it.

Escape Plan. Booked as a reunion with uni friends. Friendly and welcoming atmosphere and easy to find as it's above the Electric Elephant Cafe! Puzzles were challenging and so much fun, would definitely recommend the experience to anyone and everyone!
Great fun!. Absolutely hilarious. Had a fabulous time. Well organised and great puzzles. Would highly recommend!

The Great Escape. My niece and I came to Escape Plan with no idea what was going to happen. Brendan had been very helpful in the pre-booking and our host for the session, Valerie, was brilliant. The puzzles were so clever and quite difficult for people like us with no escape plan knowledge .... But we escaped with just over a minute to spare.... Nail biting till the end.... Great way to spend an hour .... Loved it. Thank You Valerie.

One of the best we have done. Went to Escape Plan last night - great event. Well organised, friendly staff, high quality props and good puzzles.Good feedback and not too much help given - but just enough to prevent us getting frustratedIf you are looking for a good escape game or an introduction to the wonderful world of escaping then look no further.

Brilliant way to spend an afternoon. Had never done an escape room before, so wasn't sure what to expect. The welcome was very friendly, with a good briefing and helpful tips before we started. The premise based on the logbook of a WWII POW was brilliant for us history buffs, and the settings and props felt really authentic. The puzzles kept everyone busy and were varied in type, with a big thrill every time we got one right. The 3 clues were offered and used, and we were so pleased to make it out within the time. All in all a brilliant experience which I totally recommend.
Brilliant!!. Would definitely recommend it!! Done in a very clever way, great fun and you definitely won't regret it!!!

Family time. This was our 2nd escape game for 4 of us & 1st one for the other 2. Brendan was a fantastic host, even though we were a little late arriving he didn't rush us , he still took the time to explain everything & made sure we were there to enjoy our experience.The clues were hard but too hard & when we thought we needed a hint he aimed us the right direction so that we wouldn't need one, we escaped in 52 minutes & we really pleased with the feedback he gave us about our chaotic, hectic approach but stating that we listened to each other well when someone was talking. Great time had by all thanks again.
Great Escape. We had a great time trying to escape! The props were good and plenty of different skills required to solve. Suitable for adults and older children.

What can we do in London today?. Had a fantastic time with my godchildren - 14 and 16 - at Escape Plan last week. They absolutely loved the whole experience - from the storyline to solving the last clue - and didn't have too many hints either! Would highly recommend this activity and can't wait to hear about new premises/alternative themes. Will definitely return and our thanks to all the staff - so friendly and helpful.

Such fun!. This was most of our first experience of an escape room, and we were a mixed age group of 6. We found it so much fun - for both the teens and the adults. Everyone seemed to contribute and find clues in their own way. The cafe downstairs is also great!

Beautifully put together. I was expecting this to be an anonymous corporate kind of experience. And it wasn't at all. We went as a family and it was a lot of fun. Absorbing and clever. At the end Brendan and Valerie went through the different ways that each of us had contributed to the teamwork which gave another dimension to it and made it personal. Highly recommended.

Great Teen Outing. I booked this for my 14 yr old boy's birthday. This is a tricky age to find good activities for however he and his friends,( and his 19 yr old brother )all loved the experience saying it was fun, challenging and the guys who ran it were really good too.

Fantastic way to pass the hour, such a laugh . This was a surprise organised for us on our girls date day out. while we were apprehensive to start, we had a fantastic time and felt really good about out escape - not impossible bit definitely not too easy. Well run and a great way to pass the hour! Thanks guys.

The best escape plan yet.. We went here for a birthday. The host was more than friendly and introduced us to the game easily. We all had a excellent time. The challenges and puzzles were mind challenging and overall was worth every penny. We had a great time working as a team to solve on how to escape.
Great day at Escape Plan. Birthday celebration. Something really different and engaging. Good fun, involves the whole family . Definitely recommend

Great fun!. This was out first experience of an escape game, and it was a great experience. I'd booked it for myself and family members for Christmas, and they didn't know what they were going into London to do until a literal 5 minutes before we were due to arrive!We were welcomed, and given an introduction, some tips, and some necessary props, and then let loose in the room. The room is watched with video cameras, and we have walkie-talkie communication in case hints were needed.Our team completed it in 47 minutes 42 seconds (no hints), so just off of the leaderboard. We didn't really find the clues too difficult (and they weren't too easy either), but others clearly do as there were quite a few who didn't escape in time during the week we went.What we all really liked, was the time spent afterwards with the organisers, who gave us feedback about how we did and how others typically do, and we could give feedback to them about how we found it and what the thinking was behind some of our actions.We'll definitely be booking up to other escape games after this experience. Thank you!
Excellent!. Great plot, layout and series of puzzles! Hosts were super friendly! Would definitely do it again! ☺️ Challenging yet fun!

Excellent escaping fun!. We were down a team member when we arrived at Escape Plan but we were not put off at being just two brains instead of three. We were given a lovely welcome and briefing. This escape room is brilliant! A great theme with such careful attention to detail. Towards the end we could have done with another brain and pair of eyes but we had a fantastic time. Can't wait for the new room now!!Highly recommended. Go, go, go!
Awesome Escape. Definitely one of the best escape rooms we've done in London - well thought through puzzles and loads of fun. Go go go!

Fantastic family fun. We visited Escape Plan on Easter Monday and had a really brilliant hour and a half of entertainment.Started with a great brief from the staff who were very friendly and helpful. We have only done one other of these types of experience and I have to say it did not disappoint.We actually manage to escape with something like 47 seconds left. It was so much fun and at the end the staff offered us some feedback on how we each performed which was extremely interesting and very funny.I can't recommend it enough and we were still all talking about it 2 hours later over dinner!

Brilliantly conceived, beautifully executed and charmingly run.. There were 7 of us ranging in age from 15 - 49, but this particular experience is constructed in such a clever, non linear way, that every single one of us was kept busy throughout the hour. There's a very good mix of tasks, different types, of varying difficulty, so everybody can contribute something. The rooms are beautifully and charmingly styled and this escape experience would make an exceptionally good first choice for anybody hesitant about the idea of being locked in a room. Most of all, it was just really, really, really good fun. Our best escape experience so far.

Family day out. Had an amazing time at escape plan. Brendan was a great welcome to the experience. The attention to detail and thought process of each puzzle was to a very high standard. All was relevant to the back story and it really felt that they'd taken the time to fit things together perfectly to ensure our time there was enjoyed to the max. Super impressed. Lots of laughs. I hope they make another so we can revisit this company again. And I must say after visiting other escape rooms that have a far bigger set up I was truly more impressed with this one. Thanks so much for a great day.
Fun filled afternoon. It was a brilliant work/team building activity. Well organised, challenging and fun. I would thoroughly recommend it for a group of friends or as a work do.

fantastic afternoon!. SO much fun! They were really friendly and helpful, and the room was realistic with fun and challenging puzzles! The costumes were fabulous too ;) Definitely go (for all ages, we had a 13 and 49 year old there and both of them and all in between had a really fun day).

Soooooo good!. Took my boyfriend as a surprise for his birthday and it was everything I'd hoped it would be and more. Brendan and Valerie are both awesome and you know you're going to have great fun from the minute you walk through the door. The puzzles are challenging without being horribly frustrating and the setting is brilliantly tense. Even the view from the windows is perfect!We escaped with a minute to spare and were so excited! The final puzzle is a bit of a Hollywood moment. We were buzzing for hours afterwards!My boyfriend said later "that's the best thing I've ever done". Either he's lead a very sheltered life or Escape Plan is spot on. I'm going with the latter...

We all enjoyed very much . We participated as a group of 6 - ages between 10 and 52 !The group included both males and femalesHaving never done that before we didn't know what to expect.Everyone in the party found it excellent fun and all participated. We couldn't believe how quick the hour went ! The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful and we were emailed a group photo afterwards. We would definitely recommend others to try it out

Excellent fun. This was our first escape room experience. There were 6 in our group, made up of three adults (40 ish) two 13 year old boys and one 10 year old boy. We did the WW2 scenario, which was to escape from a PoW camp. It involved a lot of searching, talking and brain scratching but we all had a great time. The staff were great, and offered help when needed. Our 10 year old was excellent at the searching, whilst the teenagers excelled at the problem solving. Overall a great success, and an excellent way to spend 90 minutes.

Great escape room, even for two people . My boyfriend and I did it together. We have done some escape rooms before (four different ones), but we were told the chances of escaping were pretty slim when we were only two people. We got out in about 70 minutes (we originally got 60 minutes, but we got extra time because no one was after us). We had a lot of fun although it irritates me that we should've gotten the last clue faster and maybe gotten out in time. The room had many clues that could be solved in parallel, so the ideal number of participants (if you have a little experience) is three or four people. Two is still a lot of fun, and I think five would be fine. We didn't get a lot of clues, which we were happy about. We asked for clues a couple if times when we needed it. If you're doing an escape room in London, I would highly recommend this one!

Fantastic . Four of us had fantastic time. Brendan and Valerie were super welcoming. The escape room was brilliant, and it made our whole day. So close to Kennington tube, and a great thing for friends or colleagues. Am guessing 4-6 is the best number of people.
