Review of escape the room the adventure begins. Excellent really enjoyed this ,5 of us went for my sons 26 th birthday , friendly Staff ., made you feel relaxed , excellent fun experience to get out of POW camp really recommend this had no idea what to expect was beyond are expectations

Best ever!!. Four of us went to Escape Plan for a birthday celebration, we have done escape rooms before in the same group. The props, and setting and story of Escape Plan was the best yet. Fantastic attention to detail and good quality throughout. Have not stopped recommending this to people since!!
awsome. Perfect game, an overall good experience. Can be recomended to others, that likes a good puzzle. Thx.

Great game run by great people. Escape plan was exactly as entertaining as we hoped it would be. My husband and I had already done about 6 other escape rooms but the couple we brought were complete beginners. The game is challenging but doable especially since we had some prior experience. On a side note, i would like to add that there was a technical problem with online booking/paypal, and as a result another team was booked at the same time as us. Brendan was sorting it out and trying to make it possible for both teams to play. I really appreciate the effort he put in to make it happen because otherwise we wouldnt have been able to play at all! We were visiting london for the weekend and it was awesome that we were able to make it. So thank you Brendan!
Best room escape in London!. Puzzles are very well designed. Really good experience. Stuff super nice.5 star recommended to everyone :)
Well worth it!. 4 of us had a fantastic evening, The host especially made it fantastically enjoyable, And we will be looking out to book again soon when a new room is available.

Fantastic day out with great staff. Absolutely loved this experience. From the minute we got there we felt the entire outfit was very well run & well thought out. The briefing was spot on with important information highlighted to maximise chances of getting out & our host was with us at all times with a few helpful hints when we were completely off track. The rooms were well lit, very well decorated & the clues were hard but easy enough to work out. We just failed to escape (seconds...) but found it so enjoyable I have already recommended it to other friends.
Awesome experiance!. An incredible evening of brain teasers and fun! 1 hour to escape from this world war 2 POW camp themed room. We managed 52 minutes see if you can beat us!

Great Room, Great Host. We went here as part of a family day out for my Dad's 60th birthday. For most of us it was our first escape room experience and it was absolutely fantastic. Well thought out puzzles and a friendly and funny host was a fantastic introduction into the escape room experience. Even our more experienced escapee really rated it.Can highly recommend. The only complaint I can level is that we couldn't do it again!
Great fun. I visited this place for my dad's birthday and have to say it as great fun , the games were really well thought it and I would certainly recommend it

Really well-designed escape room. Had a great time at Escape Plan. It was really well-designed and our team found the puzzles were at just the right difficulty level - challenging enough to feel a sense of achievement at completing them, but not impossible! The props and sound effects and the overall room design was great too, and the staff were friendly.The only reason I haven't scored it 5/5 is that the waiting facilities are a bit limited, but the experience itself was brilliant.

highly recommended. Went with work colleagues as a treat. Had never been to an escape room experience before but this was great. Just the right level of difficulty, meaning we got out with only two minutes to spare, fantastic attention to detail, and it allowed everyone to be doing something important at the same time, rather than standing around watching someone else do it. Will go again. Brendan the manager was also very good and gave us insights into the way we work as a team at the end which was an added bonus!

Fantastic, highly recommended!. Visited with 3 friends for a small stag do and it was fantastic. A bit dubious at first, the location, a first floor flat, is down an old cobbled street, but once you see the inside and the set up it really works, it all adds to the vibe! The room it's self is set up like a POW camp, loads of the props are genuine, or they look it anyway, and such detail and thought has gone into everything. What made it for us what that the experience was so tactile. You didn't just figure out a code and then click, click, click the box opens by itself with some clever mechanisms and such, it's all manual, with clever vintage gadgets and such. YOU crack the code, YOU find the lock, YOU enter the code, it's all on you and brain! Love it!

Fantastic Afternoon. I came to Escape Plan with a group of work friends, none of us have ever done anything like this before, I found out about Escape Plan on Facebook as a friend had posted about having done it so I suggested it to the girls at work, one seemed sceptical and was worried we would get locked in and would never be able to leave, but to her surprise we did manage to escape (after being given 10 minutes of extra time we escaped, with 2 minutes to spare!) and she solved the final clue to get us out! There was a wide range of the types of puzzles we had to solve and it was constant, non-stop fun, there was 5 of us and we seemed to split up into two groups and each tried different puzzles. The staff were fantastic, before, during and after! It was a thoroughly enjoyable day, would definitely recommend this to anyone, and I think we have all got the live escape rooms bug now! 10/10!!!!

Good fun. Took my daughter for her16th birthday on Thursday with friends and family (age range 12 - 55). It was something we had never done before and (although we weren't as fast as we were hoping!) every single one of us thoroughly enjoyed our first 'escape' experience. The thing that made it really great however was Brendan. Knowing it was a birthday surprise for my daughter, he had the novel idea of hiding her presents as a little bonus for her to find at the end, thereby making it just that little bit more bespoke and special - a service I doubt the higher rated venues on here would provide. Escape Plan is great for older kids and adults of all ages and I would thoroughly recommend it. Word of advice tho: some clues can be a little bit on the small side so don't forget your reading glasses! Thanks again for a fantastic time Brendan.

Pleasant Surprise. My son booked this for his brother's 40th and I have to say I wasn't looking forward to it at all. Not my thing, I am an OAP, and the thought of playing a game of "trying to escape from a pow camp" was not exactly my idea of fun. BUT IT WAS GREAT!!!!!! I really enjoyed it, and Hoggies Heroes (what we called out group) did it in 53 minutes - you are allowed an hour to find and solve the clues to get you out. There was 6 of us (all over the age of 35) and we did struggle with some of the clues.....would be great fun for younger children though, probably 12 upwards. If you are looking for an hour of fun mixed with creativity then this is it!!!!

Quality quizzing and great fun. First ever Escape Plan and will be coming back for more. Really well conceived and slickly executed with a range of puzzles to suit all members of the group. Nice creative concept too.

Just piles of fun!. Despite the guy who ran it (Brendan or Brenda? - who incidentally was a top man!) it was a really really enjoyable and value for money experience! For sure would recommend it - only downside is that my wife, daughters & their boyfriends got out as well!!!
first ever escape. A well run event with helpful staff and a great venue. Was evident that a lot of planning had gone into the puzzle, which were of the appropriate difficulty. Recommended.

A review from a couple of Omanis. We did not know what to expect. However, it turned out to be much better than we thought. It was a great experience. Definitely will visit again in the future. The owners are beyond nice. We loved the whole experience.

Really Fun Way to spend an hour!. This was our first time in an Escape room and there were only three of us instead of six. None the less the staff adapted so we had a great time exercising our little grey cells and working together to solve the puzzles. I would definitely do more of these, it gives you a real buzz!

Brilliant time had by all!. Great place, very welcoming. Scenario was intriguing, props well thought out and the problems at exactly the right level of complexity to keep us all engaged. We made it with 2 minutes to spare and felt very proud of ourselves! I would definitely recommend - a great way to spend an hour.

Great fun and really smart display!. I've never done this before and I went with some friends for a birthday surprise - I think I had more fun than the birthday girl! We've had an amazing time, at the end we thought we were spies escaping from the enemy :)

Excellent experience with the family. We were a party of two adults and four 13-year olds. The venue was in an interesting part of London, in an artisan's yard surrounded by Victorian tenement housing. Brendan, our host, was very friendly and welcoming. The escape rooms were well-themed with WW2 props. The clues were very well thought out. Our team had a thoroughly absorbing and stimulating time and we made it out just in time.
Brilliant Escape Room. We've done lots of Escape Rooms. This is one of the best. Very atmospheric, great theme and wonderful puzzles. We all had lots of fun!

Absolutely brilliant, do it!!!. As a family (2 teenage boys with mom and dad) we have done a few escape rooms and enjoy doing them together. This was one of the best we have done. The theming was great and different to many others which was nice. The people running the game were lovely and welcoming - it seemed like they really wanted us to have fun. An odd to say but the room had natural light which made a pleasant change from being normally in a dark room. But the best thing was that the puzzles were nicely challenging - you could get there but needed to think and locks were tagged so that you didn't have to spend time randomly keying in numbers. We had a blast and spent the rest of the morning talking about what we had solved and what we had struggled with. I will look out for new rooms here next time I am in London because this one was so well done. Thank you!

Fantastic fun on the great escape!. We found Escape Plan on trip advisor & we're delighted to get the last slot during school half term. The organisers were very welcoming & explained everything thoroughly.The game itself was challenging, fun & certainly got the grey matter working! We were determined to do it without help (you can ask for up to three hints) but had to give in as we were running out of time. However with one hint we solved it with a couple of minutes to spare!It's great for teamwork & was definitely a recommended activity for teenagers (who were far more on the ball than the adults!). We can also recommend the Electric Elephant Cafe below for delicious cakes, which we treated ourselves to first for brain fuel!

I think we got lucky.... This was the first escape room any of our party had done ( unbelievably as all of us just love this kind of thing) and I have to say it was superb from beginning to end. From initial enquiry to enjoying the cobbled mews location, quirky coffee bar and friendly, droll Brendan this was a brilliantly observed world war 2 escape adventure providing excellent puzzles in a well designed and put together space. In we breezed thinking that we would definitely come out well ahead of the time limit ....probably only down to some last minute hints that we got out at all. Looking to do some more now and just hope that we haven't found the best first.

Great themed escape game. We have done a number of different escape games across London now, and this was a good one. Unlike some, it was all very logical, and the setting in the fabulous old mews building was perfect for the theme. Good fun, and we even solved it with time to spare.

Had a blast. If someone had said we'd be locked in a room for an hour and had to find a way out, and that we'd pay someone for the privilege, I'd think they were nuts... but there we were... and we had a brilliant time!! Since then I have been telling everyone about it - it's so much fun, and very entertaining. I highly recommend it. Great theme, great space, great host. Well worth it :)

Fun way to stretch your brain. Our first escape room so we had no idea what to expect. Brendan and Megan were friendly, gave us all the pre-information and rules we needed and made sure we knew what to do. The puzzles were varied, challenging and ingenious. Very atmospheric. Great fun.
Even better than we expected. We went as a group of 6 who'd never done an escape room before- and it exceeded all expectations! Great fun, would definitely recommend.

Something different, great fun. We had a fantastic time at Escape Plan. Never been before but will definitely go again. Was very well thought out and was pretty challenging. You really have to think about what you're doing and, with good teamwork (and, in our case, a few hints) you can get through it - albeit 3 minutes late!! Loved every minute of it and Brendan and his assistant were great hosts. Highly recommend it.

Best Puzzle Room. I've been to 2 other puzzle rooms to date and this was the best one. The puzzles were more challenging, requiring thinking and logic. There was very little of the "find a key in a boot" which make up a lot of the challenges in other rooms.

Escaped in the nick of time!. We made it out with a minute to spare!! Well thought out and good fun, would definitely recommend it. The organisers were great and kept us on the right track without giving too much away. They even picked up our tab from the coffee shop downstairs as they were running 20 minutes late.

We made it!. Great fun. Did this escape room with four friends. Three hadn't done escape rooms before and it was a great introduction for them . Well organised and themed escape room run really professionally - thanks Brendan!
We escaped!!!!. Superb fun, we would highly recommend! Something that we will be talking and reminiscing about for a long time to come. Absolutely brilliant.

Escape plan is excellent !. Well thought overall. Clues and hints were relevant to the context of this escape room (war captivity and escape), creating an intriguing atmosphere. The problems to be solved were not easy but were logically structured in a meaningful way. The overall decoration was very well in tune with the room's theme. It does not help if the whole team focuses on a single clue and it works faster if two teams work in parallel. Definitely worth the experience !

Great atmospheric experience!. Our group of seven adults had a great time at Escape Plan. I really liked that there was a story theme that tied it together, unlike another puzzle room game I attended in San Francisco. The puzzles were challenging but not too hard. Our group didn't get stuck anywhere (42 minutes is the time to beat) but each puzzle felt like it was an achievement when we got it. I particularly enjoyed the sound effects which faded into the background and gave a sense of immersion.

First class puzzle solving!!. An excellent evening solving brilliant puzzles at escape Plan. A fun scenario, great props and atmosphere and above all some great puzzles pitched at exactly the right level. The office desk in the Comandant's office is a real gem!

Excellent activity - so much fun!. I took my mum and dad here for their Christmas present and we had a GREAT time! The rooms were brilliantly furnished and decorated as POW camp and the puzzles were difficult enough to get the brain ticking without being impossible. I would recommend Escape Plan to everyone, we came out full of adrenaline and buzzing from a great afternoon.

Best escape room I've been to. My friends and I went as a group of three and had such a good time. It's organised really well and you get into the game very quickly. I think this one is more challenging than others that I've been to. Would definitely recommend. Thank you for making it so much fun!

A Great Theme and Escape Game. This was my third escape game but the first one I've done in the UK. We were a mixed group with two of us having played other games before and two newbies. We were fully briefed by our guide before being locked in the room. It actually felt pretty authentic, the room was decorated really well and the clues were challenging to find and make sense of, in a good way. We liked the way hints were optional, as some games give these out freely, it meant we were even happier when we escaped! There were a good number of hints and challenges which kept four of us busy on different tasks. This game is definitely worth a visit. As a hint, the venue is down a gated side street and we initially walked straight past! When you reach the cafe stop walking!

A very fun evening. We went there as a party of 5 (4 adults and a 11 year old kid). It was amazing!It was our first "escape room" experience and I do not regret choosing this specific one.The puzzles are all quite different so everyone could get involved, the host is very nice and follows our progression so he can give us a hint if needed during the experience.We managed to escape 30 seconds before the full 60 mins and it was a big adrenaline rush towards the end!

Great room!. Very fun and entertaining 60 minutes! We were the 200th team to successfully escape inside the 60 mins! Woo!Our group of 4 seemed like the perfect number. Everyone had something to do. Helped us get through all the puzzles faster with two teams of two working together.

Fabulously Fun Challenge Day!. Escape Plan Ltd in Elephant and Castle - absolutely brilliant way to spend an hour/day out. You have 60 minutes to work as a team to solve a variety of puzzles - logic, lateral thinking, etc. Brilliant family/team activity - the hour flew by! Definitely recommend it for a 'different ' day out. We worked with a lovely guy called Brendan - would TOTALLY recommend, 4 was a good number. Could do with more, might be tricky with less - unless you're geniuses!!
Fantastic experience!. Did this with a group of friends and loved it! The set up and clues were really well done and the time flew by! A really fun experience and would highly recommend it.

Excellent experience!. We had a fantastic time at Escape Plan. We brought our two kids (11 and 13) and it was an excellent experience for all of us. We had a lot of fun. No need to be fluent in English. A must-do for a families visiting London.

Classic morseing around . This was the first escape room adventure for all of us. we went as a family of four but it would be suited to mates or colleagues too. it was really well organised, great location, close to station and right next to a great cafe- the electric elephant. Brendan was really welcoming and explained things really well. The rooms and game were of a high quality- good props, sound effects and clever mind teasers. It was pitched at the right level, you would be pushing your boundaries but it was doable, though we got stuck on the codes and had to use the hints. It was really really great fun and the time flew by. I reckon though that not all these games are created equally and that a lot is dependant on the designers and imagination and dedication of those involved. I will be recommending this to friends- the theme was great, the props and puzzles were on point and the hosts were charming and helpful. We will be doing more of these in the future and following this company to see what they host next. Thanks for a great day.

top notch. we went as a group of 5 as a birthday treat, brendan was really friendly, we had loads of fun, the clues were challenging but achievable so it was perfect, the theme was great and overall had a smashing time

The most fun!!!. I organised going to this with my family as a surprise for my Dads 60th birthday and it was the most fantastic evening! It was such a memorable and fun activity. As a group it was great, there were puzzles that suited everyone, and each one of us loved it. Its so well organised and the production value was amazing. It was so immersive and creatively put together. None of us had ever done an escape room before, and we all said we do it again. I'd advise everyone to do this, it suits everyone. I'm 19 and loved it and my dad was turning 60 and loved it. Well worth the money such a fun activity!!

Great Service. I haven't actually been able to go and try an escape room yet. However, I incorrectly booked a room for the wrong date when I had friends visiting me. I paid £115 for the room but was no longer able to go. I emailed them and withing a few days they refunded the full amount I paid. They understood the mistake I made and asked me if I could go on an alternative date. I highly recommend going on service alone!

Awesome WW2 game!. I wanted something quirky for a date night and this was fantastic. We had a great laugh finding the clues and solving the puzzles to escape the POW camp. The host, Brendan monitored our progress throughout and offered hints to ensure that we didn't waste too much time going down dead ends as there were only two of us. Very authentic props and soundtrack add to the experience - we had a brilliant time, thank you!

Great Time!. The Escape Plan experience was well done. The puzzles were very creative and had a little something for everyone. The moderator of the game was very helpful and did a great job setting the stage for the game as not everyone in our group had participated in an escape the room activity. Highly recommended!

The Great Escape. Booked Escape Plan as something different for my daughters 15th birthday with 7 family and friends. . Brendan who was our guide during our escape was a great host and they even managed to build in a hidden cake for my daughters birthday. The whole experience was excellent and we can't wait to do it again when the theme is changed.

Great fun for pretty much anyone. We went to the Escape Plan yesterday - and it didn't disappoint. It's a little tricky to find, but it's worth it. The set-up is really well done, the puzzles are just the right side of challenging and the whole experience felt like a very well put together story. A great hour for all ages.

Fantastic Fun! . Brendon and Hannah were perfect host and chipped in just at the right time with helpful hints and humour.The "game" itself is brilliantly thought out and plays to a number of strength. In short - great fun, professionally run, and would (and will be) recommend it to anybody who listens.Will be looking out for there next new experience!

Escape Plan - Great Fun !. We have a little experience of Escape Rooms and decided to give this one a go after reviewing the various options in London. It was an excellent choice. The host was very friendly and explained the rules very thoroughly before we started. We all got stuck in, and after nearly an hour of frantic searching and solving of clues, we escaped with just over a minute to spare. Highly recommended. We will be watching with interest for the same company opening up a new room.
Great experience!. Really cool fun escape room experience, the host is friendly and explains everything in detail. Good to do with friends or business team building, absolutely recommended!

A real test of the mind and great fun!. As we had the day off we thought it would be fun to challenge the brain and do something different. Escape Plan did just that and more! Stepping back into the World War era, all the challenges were historically relevant and so cleverly thought out. I was so impressed! For a two we made it out (just!) and had a thoroughly engaging and thought-provoking hour. I highly recommend to anyone, even in a couple! Thank you Brendan!

Great experience. I went with my two sons, ages 10 and 13. The puzzle was a little tough for us but we were given guidance which helped. (Neighborhood is a little less picturesque than normal tourist places).

Great fun at Escape Plan. We visited Escape Plan as a family in December. Not having done anything like this before we weren't sure what to expect however we weren't disappointed and really enjoyed the whole experience. Brendan and Hannah were really welcoming and friendly and explained the game before we started and despite initially wondering if we would ever worki it out we soon got stuck in and completed it in just over 55 minutes so were able to escape! I would highly recommend Escape Plan to anyone that wants to do something different as a small group. Great fun!

Had amazing time. Really enjoyed our visit - 4 teen boys (13 - 16 year age range) and 2 Mums. The theming was excellent and really can't fault anything. The host really got us into the spirit and involved all team members from the off. Will definitely be back if another escape room is organised. We did it with 4 minutes to spare!
Really Good Fun!. We had a really good time and enjoyed having to think outside the box.The staff were friendly and welcoming. The experience could have been more dramatic, with the use of lightning.

Fun for family. Although it does not look much from outside , it is very well set up and the challenges and puzzles can be done at the same time by different people in the group , making it ideal for a group/familyVery well done ! we have a lot of fun

Excellent night out. I'm not usually the target demo for this kind of thing, but it was a real thrill. The puzzles were engaging and required team work & the excitment really ramped up towards the end.
Great way to spend an hour or so. Really good fun for people of all ages. We had a great time. Friendly and helpful staff who helped t o make the experience even more enjoyable.

A brilliant and challenging night out!. I was really excited to do this as I love live escape events and this certainly didn't disappoint. One of the best bits for me was the set which looked fantastic and very authentic. The puzzles were great as there was a good range to suit all abilities and lots which required a team effort! I would happily recommend this as a brilliant activity with friends or family.

Great experience. Highly recommend!. I was in a tram of 3 with my wife and sis-in-law, and we escaped with 1 second to spare! The game was detailed, fun, exciting and fast paced. The atmosphere was great and you felt as though you'd been transported back in time. Really kept us on our toes an was a true bonding experience. Great for everyone. It's a must, if you're in London.
Amazing fun. We did this for my birthday in December. My whole team came out buzzing afterwards, it was really exciting. Anyone would love it.
Great escape. Really good afternoon out with friends. Tough but fun game, great host. Definitely worth doing.----

Great one to try!. Took my parents here while they were visiting as none had ever done this before and thought it'd be a new experience (4 adults doing this). Thoroughly enjoyed it and all were really into it. Well put together and thought out puzzles, solvable but without being too easy and needs everyone to pull together properly! Definitely recommend it and we'll certainly be going back if / when they have a new room available

Great experience, 100% recommend. Had a wonderful time, challenging but achievable and everyone felt included. Really good value for money. Can't give enough praise as it was run so well and everyone had a great time.

Fantastic Birthday - Unforgettable memory. Planned this for 5 of us for my 22nd birthday. None of us had played anything like it before. It was the perfect level of difficulty - allowing for tension, fun and the thrill of success.Furthermore, Brendon was lovely. We got lost and were running late. He contacted me to give us directions, hid a birthday cake in the room and was genuinely a very funny and great guy!We would definitely play his new game when its available. Highly recommended!

Fantastic family fun.. Booked this for my 14 year old daughter, her friend and myself. None of us have done anything like this before and were not too sure what to expect. We were met by the guy at our allotted time and found him to be very friendly and enthusiastic. He went through the briefing before we started and made sure that all of us were involved and contributed. I will not spoil any of the attraction itself but it was huge fun with some very clever and well thought out puzzles. There was a sound track in the back ground that as the time went on added to the tension and the atmosphere. We did manage to escape....just. I think there was about a minute left and we did use up some of our hints. We all left there buzzing and with a great sense of achievement. Would definitely go again when they plan a new scenario sometime time next year. Worth every penny and is something a little different.

Perfect Christmas event. We chose Escape Plan to host our experience due to how professional the company appeared from their website, compared to other suppliers.The team were incredibly flexible to meet our requirements and they didn’t disappoint on the night. The challenges in the room were the perfect level of complexity and they were varied enough to keep it interesting.I would actively encourage people to visit this attraction and I’m looking forward to the company expanding next year

Perfect team Christmas!. Chose Escape Plan to celebrate Christmas with our small team from work. Couldn't have chosen better! The experience is expertly put together with fantastic attention to detail. Brendan gave us a great briefing before we tackled the challenge. Excellent way to spend an hour (or less hopefully!) Highly recommended.

Brilliant team activity . We completed escape plan as a team day for our Christmas 'do'. We wanted something different and this was spot on. The puzzles were pitched just right - hard but not demoralising and the escape plan staff were great. They put you at ease at the start and made sure you remained immersed in the game to the end. There is also a great cafe on the corner where you can meet and while away an hour before you go in called the Electric Elephant.

Great brilliant amazing!. Try it! You will love taking part in this challenging yet exciting activity! Riddles are very clever and executed with great care which makes getting out of the room within the 60 minutes even more rewarding. The 1940s props are great. I would recommend to it to novice and seasoned escapees. Don't miss out!
Brilliant group activity. This was my first room escape in the UK and I have to say it was excellent, really engaging story, helpful host and great puzzles. I'd highly recommend it.
Great fun. Took my team to escape plan for our Christmas outing and despite not finishing on time we had a great time and felt totally involved in the 1940's themeThank you

Great experience and very...mysterious riddles!. The location and cafe next door are very intriguing.The host was great and despite a minor unexpected problem (not Escape Plan's responsibility) he managed to offer us a great experience and even allow us some extra time.Our guests who came from Greece specifically for this love every minute of it, so it is definitely worth a try!

What a great way to pass an hour or so. Don't stop to think, just do it.. While visiting our son and daughter in law in London, the four of us went for an afternoon visit to stretch our powers of deduction and, for a first time undertaking something like this, we had a ball. While we didn't quite meet the targets, we had so much fun undertaking the various challenges and Brendan our host was most welcoming and gracious. This to us is a fairly new style of entertainment and is well worth having a go. You won't be disappointed.

Great team night out. This was the first time any of us had done one of these challenges. It was excellent, full of laughs and confusion! Great set up and the coaching was necessary and very amusing. It was great to do things that were not technology driven - chalkboard and brain power (limited in our team!) is all you need.

Fun for all the family. Was recommended to me by a colleague who did a team building here. So I decided to hold my son's 11th birthday party here with a couple of his friends and his sister. Boy o boy did they have fun. The venue was a little bit difficult to find (first challenge out of the way). No signage over the door. The puzzles are complex enough to be intriguing without being too difficult for young-ish children. Brendon was a fantastic host. He was very patient with the young explorers (and sometimes with the older ones). There was a little cafe next door where we grabbed some hot chocolate and would recommend Elephantastic for pizza later. All in all, a very enjoyable afternoon out for the family. Certainly has whetted my appetite for escape adventures.

"I don't want to do team working...". Hard to add to any of the other recent reviews. I took all my team of 7 as part of our Christmas celebrations. Everyone really enjoyed the experience, including one of us who had said beforehand that 'I don't want to do team working as part of our Christmas celebrations'. My wife is now planning to attend with friends and we shall come back to their next room (when it is ready) with our teenagers.

Team Building/Xmas Doo. Visited as part of a day in London for Christmas celebrations for our company. It was definitely a highlight. Puzzles were perfectly pitched to be challenging but not impossible. Overall, an incredibly well thought through experience with great props, attention to detail and leaving you talking about it for hours after Looking forward to when they have another room developed as we will be back!

Best Room Escape. This room escape was by far the best we've been through. It's a fantastically well-thought-through game, in equal measures challenging, fun and interesting. There's something for everyone and it's a great activity to bring friends/family/workmates together (would be a great idea for team-building for work!!). The hosts - Brendan and Hannah - are really friendly and helpful and the overall experience makes for a really fun day out.

Fantastic fun - highly recommended. We were a group of four friends, and was our first room escape experience.We had a great time, excellent puzzles and superb attention to detail. All the puzzles were intuative, so even though none of us had ever done this before we all knew what we were doing straight away, thanks also to the thorough briefing. We didn't stop talking about it for the rest of the weekend.

Lots of fun. Went there with some colleagues for a work outing - we had a great time. The puzzles were clever and challenging and but not impossible. The staff was very helpful, throughout - I had problems booking, and they followed up immediately and quickly resolved the issue. Highy recommended!
SO GREAT!. This escape room was one of the most challenging ones we did! There is so much to it, and it really makes you think! It was a lot of fun and really rewarding in the end!

What a fantastic adventure. both children and adults had a fabulous time escaping.I would recommend this event to anyone who likes puzzles. Not complicated if you think things through. Organisers watching to offer prompts so that you are always moving on.Our children are 12 and want to try another. They were fully engaged in the activity for the whole hour and were delighted and disappointed when we escaped. Disappointed because it ended but happy we managed to get out.I would also recommend this event as a team building exercise. You have to work together to solve many different types of problems in order to proceed through the game so great for communication skills.Looking forward to the next adventure

Great fun and very rewarding. We were a group of six aged between 29 and 68 and we all thoroughly enjoyed our time at Escape Plan. It was our first escape room experience so we weren't really sure what to expect but it one of the best things we've done as a family for a long long time. The puzzles and tasks were set at just the right level to be challenging but not too hard to become frustrating. We're really looking forward to going back when they have a new room up and running. Would definitely recommend!!

A-MAZE-ING!!!!!. A phenomenal experience-suitable for all, there is something for everyone to get involved in! The experience tests the grey matter and immerses you in 1945, the props were fab and the story was detailed, informative and imaginative. I am now an escape room addict-I NEED to do more! Fantastic for birthdays, work dos or just to spend an hour with friends-groups of around 4 people work best but you can do with more or less

Escape Plan. This was such a great experience. We had never done anything like this before and didn't know what to expect. We were totally amazed at how enjoyable it was and still talk about it today. We would highly recommend this attraction.

Great activity for all. Went with a 14 year old and 11 year old. All of us never been before. We had a really great time. Really friendly staff who made you feel very welcome and gave assistance where needed whilst still allowing you to be challenged. Highly recommend!
Fun for all the family. We really enjoyed this. It was great to have a theme to it - added a further element of interest. Definitely recommended.

Brilliant!. Escape Plan was so much fun - good variety of tasks and challenges and the theme makes it more interesting than your average escape game. We did it as a 2 and even though we needed (only slightly!) more time, it was still doable, and we loved it. I'd say the optimal number is 3-4, as you want to each have enough to do. I'm still buzzing over how fun it was!!

Brilliant Escape Room -- Ingenious and Well-Executed Scenario -- A Must Do. We have visited other escape rooms and this was by far one of the best, if not the best, we have experienced. You are immersed in a compelling scenario, complete with sound effects, and treated to dozens of clever and clear puzzles. Unlike some of the other escape rooms we have visited, every puzzle made logical sense and all puzzles came together in a believable way which led to escaping the POW camp. It is clear they put a lot of thought into the creation of this master escape room, and we had a terrific time. Good for the whole family.

Another Great Escape Game In London. Have become a bit of an escape game addict this year, there has been some awesome and some dire games, this being one of the top ones we have played and only the second we have managed to escape!Fewer and fewer of these games accommodate for 2 people games so we just have to take a gamble on those that do, thankfully this was a great choice.We were a team of 2 so surprisingly we were allowed an additional 10 minutes, (we needed it) but that was a great help and nothing we had seen before. Our game master was really helpful and friendly, made us feel really welcome and relaxed as we arrived at the location, he was also giving us tips and clues you felt like he was rooting for you to get out, not all game masters are this enthusiastic about their customers. Obviously not going to include any spoilers but this was game, similar to enigma escape was an immersive experience which gives it the edge over other games, there is a story and purpose which makes the game worth playing. Different challenges and tasks in this game that actually require some skill and logic not just an hour searching for keys, and as previously stated we escaped which is always a good thing!

Absolutely brilliant. Visited Escape Plan with a group of friends as our first trip to an escape room. This was by far one of the best experiences I have ever done. The game was so well thought out, we were a group of 6 and all of us were busily rushing about for the full hour. The hosts were excellent, they were friendly and gave help when needed without giving away too much information. We managed to get out of the room with 1 minute and 40 seconds left to go. Even now we are all still buzzing from the great time we all had. One of our group had been to an escape room before but felt that Escape Plan was far better. This is an absolute must to take part in.

Ingeniously devised and very authentic. I've played a few escape room games and this is one of the best. Some really authentic touches lend it a real world war 2 theme, while the puzzles are varied and fun. The venue itself gets plenty of light, unlike a lot of escape room games, which was a nice bonus given that we were doing it during the day when it was sunny!

Great fun and cleverly devised. My first experience of this type of entertainment. Well put together by a friendly and helpful couple. It gave the whole family plenty to exercise their deductive skills and made for an amusing and challenging hour's worth of frenetic activity. Also provided plenty of talking points after the event. It's just a pity that, due to it's nature, we couldn't do the whole thing again.

Excellent. This place is brilliant, at first it seems like it's in an odd location, however when your there it's a fantastic experience. Great fun and fully enjoyed the experience.
Highly recommended!

Brilliant!. Myself, my mum and step dad visited the Escape Plan and we thoroughly enjoyed it! The WW2 theme interested all of us and the puzzles were extremely gripping. I would 100% recommend this for a fun activity to complete in London! Great Fun!
Brilliant WW2 themed escape game. Myself and three other females went over the weekend. Was amazing and we will definitely be going back next year when the team bring out a new game!

Great fun, totally immersive. We went on a Friday night after work, finding it a short walk away from Kennington on the Northern line.The experience began with a briefing on what to expect and some tips to avoid any unexpected irritations such as not having the right knack when handling the padlocks.After that the tension ramps up to full and you stay there for the full one hour - we only just made it out with a minute to spare after two tips from 'the voice above'. Your experience is monitored by the organisers to ensure if you are close you don't get too stuck and to give you a nudge or a clue whenever you like. This is arranged with a walkie talkie and you are observed through cameras.Sound effects help give the WWII feeling and everything around you feels totally authentic. Unfortunately this even meant resorting to scrawling on a chalk board for some of the trickier challenges.The organisers themselves were very friendly and accommodating when one of the party joined us late into the briefing. There is a complimentary team photo taken at the end and then you can be pointed in the direction of a drinking hole if desired - the organisers have good knowledge of what the local area has to offer.

Such a fun, different and interesting experience!. After my sister recommended I try out this 'Escape Plan' I booked it for me and 3 other friends, which at first I thought might have been too small a group but I thought it actually turned out to be better that way because it meant we could work closer together as a team to discover the clues and crack the code! When we arrived, we didn't really know what to expect as we'd never done anything like it before but I am so glad we did because everyone of us had such a laugh and the person running it all was so funny and made the experience even more worth while! We thought it was really good value for money and we can't wait to go to more of the upcoming 'Escape Plans' in the future!

Well thought out, well presented, great fun!. One of my friends had done something similar to this while in Cape town and when the opportunity came up to try one with him in London I jumped at the chance. If you have never done something like this before it is a series of puzzles set in a locked room (or rooms) that need solving to open combination locks to move on to the next puzzle. Some puzzles can be solved in parallel to speed things along. The ultimate aim being to escape the room.We had spent the morning in the Imperial War Museum (only about 15-20 minutes walk away) so were in the mood for this excellent WW2 themed diversion. We were a team of five and although it seemed a bit hectic at times you definitely need a few bodies to spread the puzzles about and get them solved, if you manage it with only three brains you have done really well! The host (Brendan) was friendly and helpful with a few pointers along the way, and it was paced really well to keep us going until we escaped within the last ten minutes.I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone and will be looking out for the planned follow up next year!

Fun for mature teenage group. This was the first escape room that we had been to, so didn't know what to expect. I had booked the experience for a group of 5 mature teenage boys who I knew would engage with the concept. I was able to sit in the room with them without taking part and, I must say, it was just as enjoyable to watch them but very difficult not to join in! This was a highly detailed set up, professionally run, good location with a handy cafe below. Everyone came out buzzing. Great fun!

An adventure!. We were a group of 6 and each one of us absolutely loved it. I've been to several escape rooms and this room was very unique, challenging, well thought of and had an interesting story to it. The service was excellent! And I would definitely recommend it to everyone I know. 5 s!

Don't mention the war. I mentioned it once but I think I got away with it... . Myself and a group of 5 friends turned up not knowing quite what to expect from the discreet exterior, but we were well welcomed and the owner who made a concerted effort to learn our names and get us involved. Despite only two rooms, there was plenty for all 6 of us to work on and figure out for the full hour, with well-made props and a good atmosphere.
A great day out!. We had a work-day-out at Escape Plan and had great fun working together as a team to figure out clues and beat the clock. I highly recommend it!

A JOLLY GOOD TIME WAS HAD BY ALL -(STOP)-. FAO all POWS -(STOP)- Escape Plan is a fiendish imprisonment in one of Jerry's infernal camps -(STOP)- you'll need to have your deerstalkers at the ready and your grey matter primed -(STOP)- spiffing setting and ruddy tricky puzzles -(STOP)- a jolly good time was had by all -(STOP)- hoping they get a second room soon -(STOP)- Escape Plan, please please please don't -(STOP)-

Awesome Event! . I decided on wanting to do something different for my birthday with friends and had heard great reviews about this new concept of Escape Rooms so when I researched the idea, I came across Escape Plan and the reviews were great so thought it would be great to try. Nobody in the group had done this before and we were very excited about the challenge. Great concept and each room was well thought out with the right level of difficulty! Our host Brendan was brillant and the little clues along the way to keep us on track really helped! Cannot wait for the next adventure in the pipeline and I would highly recommend this to anybody who loves a challenge and wants to have some fun!

Escape Plan. I tried out Escape Plan a few weeks ago with some friends and we all had a great time. The clues were challenging enough to keep us busy but not so difficult that we were completely lost. Brendan explained everything very clearly at the start and was on-hand to give us our 3 hints when we needed them. We were a team of 5 which worked perfectly, everyone was able to contribute but we could still keep track of what everyone was doing. The themed aspect was very well done and we enjoyed dressing up a bit at the end. Looking forward to the next challenge when it is released!

Brilliant fun!. I picked this particular escape game for a half term activity (2 adults and 3 children - 12 x 2 and 11) after reading very positive reviews. We had not done one before so did not know what to expect. Brendan (our very charming host) confirmed the level was not too easy which suited us perfectly as we wanted a challenge. The attention to detail in the layout of the room was excellent and it seemed such a good idea to have a nostalgic theme rather than high-tech gadgets. After a rather slow start we did speed up and realised towards the end we would need to use some hints or we would never get out in time. It seemed impossible but we escaped with just over a minute to go. The escape rate is just over 60% in the allotted time which seems about right. I would thoroughly recommend the experience. Brendan is hoping to open a second room with a continuation theme - can't wait!

great experience for wide age group. We oldies took our two sons (in their 20's) to this experience and we all loved it. You really need to use your little grey matter and work as a team to beat the clock in this great experience, different from anything else available in London.
True escape plan. A well set up rooms, made for true feeling of an escape plan. I found it smart and different attraction for couples and teens, where they can use logic and senses.

Fantastic escape room with an inimitable style. I've done a number of escape rooms and Escape Plan was easily the most atmospheric. Some truly fantastic and period-appropriate puzzles, and excellent sound design really helped complete the illusion! My group of four - three of whom had never done an escape room before - had a fantastic and frenetic time. Highly recommended.
Brilliant night. Six of us tried our wits at The Escape Plan and just cracked it with 1 minute 40 seconds to go. It was an absolutely fab night and the host was great. Definitely recommend it.

Company Event - Had a blast!. A group of work colleagues selected Escape Plan for our team activity before dinner and we are so glad that we did.The event is well themed and the game play well thought out. There is a time limit to break out of the rooms and you are given tips as you play to make sure you keep on moving in the right direction (could get a bit flat otherwise). Well coordinated, good tempo and most importantly, fun!Brilliant event to do as a team. Interesting to see the different characters come out in this unique Escape Game.Thanks to Escape Plan for a brilliant evening.

Fantastic birthday celebration. Did this for a birthday celebration, everything was great, the info before, the host, the game itself was a lot of fun. We all really enjoyed the day! Would definitely recommend this to others!
So much fun!. Escape Plan was so much fun, me and my friends managed to escape in the last minute and we couldn't stop talking about it after! Would recommend to any age :)

Worth every single penny. Ive done previous versions of this game, and this was really top notch. Just the right amount of difficulty to make you really wrack your brains, but also not frustratingly impossible. We went as a group of 4 (mid-late twenties). I agree with the description that this is the ideal number. Any more and we'd have crowded each other. I can't wait for the next room to open. Id go back in a heartbeat and Id recommend it to all of my friends.

best thing I've done in London for ages. dont want to give away the story too much, but if you want an amazing hour's experience, this could be it. we went as a group of 6 from age 10 to 40 and a bit as an alternative birthday present for my daughter. the whole thing was set up brilliantly, down to every little detail of second world war pow camp; the noises, the atmosphere, loved it all. everyone in our group absolutely loved it and got really involved. can't wait for the next instalment, brendan thanks that was great.

Great fun for anyone. We went a long as a group of 5 and had no idea what to expect. Was met by Brendan who is the organiser and creative man behind the game. Brendan gave us a bit of back ground and off we went, Was a great event. Really enjoyed it . great for team work and for anyone who likes solving things. Highly recommend it. well thought out game.

Great fun. Went in a team of 5 and had a great time trying to escape. The location, setting, attention to detail and complexity level of puzzles were all very good and well thought out. We escaped with 40 seconds to spare...would recommend highly.

Another excellent Room Escape puzzler in London. My friends and I have done quite a few room escape live puzzlers in London now and this is definitely up there amongst the best. The current venue is a beautiful little London courtyard (which Brendan, our very genial host, told us used to be the local workhouse) and once you're inside the escape space the production design is convincing and detailed. The basic premise is that you're POW trying to escape using clues left by a previous prisoner. The puzzles are all 'on topic' and varied, although my one tiny criticism is that are maybe one too many 'lock combination' puzzles. On the other hand there were a few puzzles that I've not seen in any other room escape so there was enough innovation to be interesting for even the hard core puzzler. We barely used any hints but Brendan is on hand at the end of a walkie talkie if you need more help. Overall, this was tricky enough to be fun and challenging without being frustratingly complex. My team and I love these games and we'd highly recommend this one. We'll definitely be back as and when there's a new room ready to play.

Brilliant, just brilliant. Went in with my wife as a birthday surprise. We both just LOVED it. Great atmosphere, great riddles, just the right amount of help when you get stuck. The team is super friendly and made us feel right at home. HIGHLY recommended!

Just brilliant!. I must start this by saying this would not be my usual pick of activity, but I was bowled over.The whole experience is fantastic-it's hard to give details without giving anything away. The premise is that you are prisoners of war who have to work as a team to gather clues to escape within an hour.All the clues and games are incredibly well put together-they are challenging without being impossible-we did get out with minutes to spare! Every member of my group agreed they loved it. I just wish I could do it all again.Even if you think this isn't 'your thing', I urge you to try it, as it will be the most fun you can have in an hour!

Good fun, buzzing for hours afterwards. I've done a few escape rooms before, so I knew generally what to expect. The puzzles were tricky but not impossible, well laid out and fun. It wasn't all about picking locks, there were some interesting and quite impressive props to play around with, but I won't spoil the surprises :) Brendan, who runs it all, is really friendly and made us feel really welcome. He emailed me back immediately when I asked if I could add another player. There were 7 of us, which is a lot, but this particular escape room has a lot of puzzles on-the-go so we were never all concentrating on the same thing.We got out with 1 minute 12 seconds to spare. The tally mark on the board showed how balanced the room was, with approximately half of the people managing to escape.Everyone in my group had a great time and we were talking about it for ages afterwards. Highly recommended!

Great WW2-escape room. Convinced by my younger brother that escape rooms is a good way sto spend som time in a big city, we searched the internet for anyone With a last minute booking avaiable. By chance, EscapePlan had a slot available. Though picking this particular Escape Room by chance, we were not let down.I obviously wont give anything away about the escape itself apart from that it has a WW2-team, and that you are supposed to escape from a prison camp given a diary before being locked into the camp and finding hints during Your search. You can ask for Clues, but the tasks should be doable without them (we needed clues, however, as this was our first time).The escape in itself was great, the tasks difficult (it has a 60% escape rate which is good - if it was too easy, it would be boring). Though none of us are great WW2-fans, I liked the fact that it had a team, and they'd done quite a good job getting hold of different kind of WW2 paraphernalia.The owner of the Place told du they'd soon be expanding With one more WW2-based Escape room, would love to go back for this!So, don your beret, tighten your buckles, step into those armyboots, and do your best to beat The Rakes in the prison Escape.
Challanging and fun. went there yesteday with two friends we had a lot of fun it was more challanging than many other rooms I the felt pressure.
Just in time. This was an amazing experience and was really well thought out. I would absolutely recommend this to everyone who is up for a bit of fun and a challenge.

Fantastic hour of fun and brain teasing! . The location blends in perfectly with the story line of this escape the room game. Slightly tricky to find, but the cafe is just to the left of the gates, we ended up at a different gate due to a taxi driver who didn't have much of "the knowledge" lol. We arrived and we're warmly welcomed by Brendan. He left us Bob's journal to browse while he finished setting up the room (we were early). He explained the rules and showed us all we needed to know then led us to the room. Once inside we had an hour of fun, frustration, joy and head scratching! Tremendous fun! Won't give away anything from inside the room, as it would spoil the game, but needless to say everything was spot on! Have played another escape room before but the back story here was far superior and the props and puzzles were spot on! Brendan was tremendous at his role, no hints unless asked to provide them but would point us in right direction if we were almost there but struggling to quite solve the puzzle. We all agree Escape Plan was the superior of the two we have played. Highly recommended by us! We look forward to Brendans next Escape Room next year!

Brilliant fun. I went yesterday for a birthday surprise and it was one of best things I've done in a long time. The puzzles were fun, clever and challenging. Our team of five made it out with one minute to spare - everyone was on cloud nine afterwards! Couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Great Day Out!. I went with 4 friends and we loved it! We had a birthday celebration and that gets put into the game which was a bonus. The host was really good and keeps you going until the end. The clues were perfect for the theme and loved that you have to really think about them and work together as a team. A great day out for everyone!

Great fun for all the family. This was our first time to an escape room (me and 2 sons, 14 and 11). I read a number of reviews online before selecting this one and was not disappointed!When we arrived we were met by Ben who was very friendly and took the time to explain the whole concept to us before we started. He told us the background story and gave some helpful items to my sons - then we were locked in!The level of puzzles and amount of things to do and investigate was perfect. We were all kept busy investigating and discovering for the whole 60 minutes. Ben was perfect at giving guidance just at the right time so that we all kept on track without getting completely stuck.The whole layout and props were great as well, keeping to the theme of WWII perfectly. We managed to escape just after the 60 minutes (using all our clues of course!).Both boys had such a wonderful time they did not stop talking about it all the way home.For us this was just the perfect start to escape room.I can't wait until they create another room as well, since i would definitely come back.You won't be disappointed!

Great escape room, wonderful host, good puzzles, great construction. I've done over 20 escape rooms now, and I'd put this in the top 25%. Theme is good, with lots of period props and puzzles that fit with the story line. Host was fantastic - fun intro, very friendly and more than happy to chat with us after about the puzzles. Good range of puzzles, there were a fair number of combination locks, but each one had a hint that made it clear which puzzle would open it, which avoided the potential frustration of trying out each code in ten different places. Some fantastic mechanics to the puzzles. They'd kept it low tech, in keeping with the theme, but that didn't mean the puzzle solutions weren't impressive - they'd used great mechanics instead of technology to wow us. Plenty to keep all six of us occupied for over 50 minutes which was surprising. It would definitely be a challenge for two or three people to get through the depth of puzzles in an hour! Clues were on an asking basis, which suited us fine. Officially you get up to three, but in practice, I'm pretty sure you'll get more if you're struggling. A nice touch is that each clue will give you the solution to one puzzle, but they won't just give you the solution straight away, they'll start hinting and the gradually give you more help, but it won't count as a second clue until you want help with a separate puzzle.All six of us thoroughly enjoyed "the Adventure Begins". All we're left asking is "when will the Adventure Continue?" .
Great Day out!. For anyone looking for a true interactive experience this is the place to go! It great theme and story line and proved a good challenge, would recommend to everyone!
Great fun!. We visited yesterday and didn't know what to expect - it was great fun and very well thought out. Would certainly recommend as an activity to do with friends or colleagues.

Lovely escape room. I have played many escape rooms and also run our own game in Amsterdam. This one has been one of the most pleasurable I have played in the last months. The amount of detail and the authenticity of the objects in the room is very special. No fancy electronics but well thought through mechanic puzzles that fit the theme. Also loads of puzzles and many things to find so that it kept everyone in our team busy throughout the whole experience. All in all a great experience, very much recommended!

Absolutely brilliant!!. I have done a few live escape games in London now and I chose Escape plan on this occasion because of the positive reviews I saw on tripadvisor. I can confirm that they are accurate! Having done one of the top rated escape games on tripadvisor and a couple others I would rate Escape Plan as one of the best ones I've done. There was a proper story line which flowed and there were plenty of puzzles which allowed everyone to participant in the escape. The location of where it was also matched to the theme of the game. It is very obvious that a lot of thought was put in to executing this game and Branden was a fantastic host. Escape plan has only started up, so there is currently only one room and I hope that another escape room is introduced as I would definitely return to try it out.It was a fantastic day out and I would recommend to anyone to try this one out. You will not be disappointed!

Fantastic experience. This was our first experience of this type of activity and as a family we had such a brilliant afternoon. We have not yet stopped talking about it! The 2 teenagers (18 and 15) were totally involved and can't wait to do another one. It was extremely well organised, very friendly and welcoming. We were a family team of 4 and each of us were totally immersed in the challenge. We highly recommend this activity and rate it a top 5 star experience.

Very authentic and entertaining experience!. If you have an interest in escape the room experiences or want to try one out - this is for you. This was my first escape experience and it was a very pleasant one - it's not frustratingly difficult and it's not too easy, it strikes a good balance by making you think and suitably rewarding you when you do solve a puzzle. You will be thrown straight into the deep end when you're put into the room and are expected to get yourself out - it is incredibly fun and the realism of the setting, props and sound effects will really immerse you in this experience.Mentioning the sounds; they are actually brilliant! They sound realistic and aid in your enjoyment of the experience and were clearly created professionally and with authenticity in mind. The competitive element is still there and is actually quite motivating - you can see the times of other teams and you'll naturally want to beat their time and prove that you're the better puzzle solver! You won't need to bring anything, you're not allowed to take phones etc inside the experience and at the end you'll have a professional quality photo taken of you and your group which will be uploaded to social media for you to share/download etc. Just make sure you bring your thinking hat.This event will last about an hour or so - it's very dependant on how long it takes you to solve the room, but you'll enjoy every minute and it's relatively cheap considering! This event is for all ages so take whoever you like!
Fun for all. Four of us went two mums and two sons. We had a very enjoyable time here and would certainly recommend it, especially for mixed ages.

Amazing Birthday Surprise!!!. A must for the fan of the click and point games!!I was surprised on my Birthday with this amazing experience, and I was blown away!A very warm welcome as you enter and lots of encouragement from the host through out,as you battle your way through room after room, cracking puzzles aimed at all ages, leading to one goal your escape.Fantastic team building fun that will test your nerve and whit.There are many other escape base games around London, but this by far the best.Enjoy

Fun for everyone. If you are considering any others dont - do Escape Plan it was awesome - although I havent done any others My brother had already done an escape room and said this was much better - there was a real story and plot to follow. Everyone in our group loved it (even the ones who only originally came along as a my birthday treat) It was such a great experience. The clues were all different testing our range of skills and observation abilities. I would definitely recommend to everyone and would even go again if I could. Book now before everyone finds out about this!

Amazing!!. What started as a 'let's book it and we will see' turned out to be AMAZING!!Everybody in the group straight away got into the game - the puzzles are a challenge but not unbreakable and the backdrop is cleverly setup! I would recommend it to everyone!

Such a fun evening!. This was brilliant! I'd never been to an escape the room experience, and I would highly recommend it and definitely go back once their next one opens. Our host was really friendly and looked after us so well. The game itself was fun and exciting, with just enough of a challenge to engage us, but without us giving up completely. We made it out with 17 seconds to spare so it was a nail-biting finish!
Excellent Day!. Such a great experience! Really great space and very atmospheric! Really enjoyable day and highly recommended!

Would 100% recommend!. I took part in escape plan a few weeks ago with 5 friends and we had a brilliant time! Having not done anything like this previously we weren't sure what to expect yet on arrival everything was clearly explained and any queries we had were resolved. One of the best parts of the experience was the world war 2 theme throughout and it was evident that a lot of time and thought had been spent creating such an exciting experience! We managed to just escape with seconds to spare but this added to the thrill of the game and we couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the day! I would fully recommend this activity and have continued to tell friends and family about it ever since!

Superb fun!. Arrived for our first escape game experience and it did not disappoint. Upon arrival we were met by Brendan who gave us a really friendly and helpful introduction to the game and we were ready to go. We got fully immersed in the game, with the strong story line, props, music and even where the actual building is situated it created the perfect believable setting. Completing the puzzles were challenging at times but really fun, the nature of the game means that there is always multiple things going on (i.e. not the whole group solving one puzzle at a time) meaning you can solve several puzzles each with everyone having their 'eureka' moment and cry out 'I've got it!'.It became more frantic towards the end when you know time is quickly ticking away, but with the variety of clues and puzzles there is something for everyone to really get stuck in! It was a brilliant way to spend an hour with friends on a mission to escape. Brendan also mentioned that there is sequel in the pipeline, which we can't wait to do - so hope it comes out soon!

Excellent for Families. We were a family with 2 children aged 11 & 14. All of us thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would recommend it. This was the first escape type event we have attended and we were well looked after and would go back if further adventures are added to the one we have done.

Fantastic Fun!. We were looking for something different, unusual and fun for my daughters 15th birthday. We certainly found it with EscapePlan. We had never done anything like this before so didn't know what to expect. We had great fun, everyone found a puzzle they could do and sometimes we needed a 'hint' just so we didn't get stuck. The hour sped by and we would all love to do another. Brilliant fun!

Wonderful attention to detail. Went with a group of friends. First off, the location is perfect. Set on the first floor of a small unit down a cobbled street, the whole area blends into the tone of the design. It happened to be raining at the time which is exactly the when I recommend you play (obviously if it's not raining go anyway). The atmosphere was incredible, working your way through with the weather lending some depth to the clever and subtle sound design. They have a leader board on display when you arrive which gives you something to aim for heading in. Well put together. Every set piece is well designed, well made and simply great fun to interact with. As with all games of this kind there were some in world limitations, but at no point did they jar with the experience at all. Props to the props master! This is a classic escape the room game with a well worked story threaded into each of the challenges. If I'm honest, it's the story that had me going more than anything else. The only thing keeping this from 5 stars is that I believe there are a couple gameplay issues I think need revising.Winning, or escaping (which we did) isn't what's important with Escape Plan. It's an experience and great story. If you intend on going, which you should, bring a full team.

Excellent Story. I came to escape plan with a few friends having got the escape room bug from playing a different one earlier on in the day. I must say I had one of the best hours of my life.You greeted by a friendly gentlemen (sorry cannot remember the name) and led upstairs where straight away everything is explained to you. You're then thrown in to what is an amazing story and idea. The street it's in adds to feel of being in WW2 as well. The puzzles and side stories were amazing. If I have to be picky it would be the gap above and below of the first wall knowing that's where you've just come from. It would be nice to be completely shut off from the real world. But that is only if I had to do a negative.Overall I can hardly remember the clues or puzzles in full as there was so much happening at once and team work was a must. Exciting stuff!Excellent day out!!!!
Brilliant Experience. We were 15 seconds off escaping! Very challenging! I'd really recommend this different and extremely well thought out experience.

Brains at the ready. Small but perfectly formed, this was a fantastic way to spend an hour trying to get out of a room. Ridiculously clever puzzles to solve, clues to find and codes to break all against the back drop of WWII and against the clock! Takes some clever types or you'll never get out. We took the kids (12 & 13), it was hard for them but harder still for us. Totally brilliant. Check it out.

Fantastic. Really great night, I've done a few escape rooms now and this one was definitely right up there- very different from all the others and very creative in its approach, as well as pretty challenging (got out with 2 seconds to spare!)

Excellent fun!!!. We did escape plan in a group of 5 friends and we managed to escape with just 2 seconds to spare! It was a great adrenaline rush! The puzzles are very clever and a great test of logic. I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting london for the day or for a bit of fun after work.The only bad thing is I want to do it again!!! Please make another game soon!!!

Superb. The experience was absolutely brilliant and perfect if you are looking for something a little different and a bit more challenging to fill your evening. There was a role for everyone and I would highly recommend!

Brilliant escape game!. A great way to spend an evening, totally immersive game with fantastic props and clever clues! This was my first time doing an escape game and I loved it! It's great to do something a bit different with friends rather than just go for drinks, and you get a real buzz afterwards! Looking forward to doing it again - next time I want to bring my parents along! My dad would love the war theme!

Brilliant game, escape-tastic!. Went along on a Saturday as two groups of four friends, we all really enjoyed the experience. I've done a few Escape Games now and this certainly ranks as one of the best. The Escape Plan team were very accommodating for the large group of us, the game flowed very well, with some very clever challenges to figure out. Cafe downstairs does some good grub too! Definitely recommend doing it as a weekend / after work activity for a group of mates.

So good you'll want to be recaptured!. Outstanding immersive experience in a truly unique and charming setting. Intriguing and challenging, this experience is a must for those who enjoy logic and puzzles. We arrived a slightly arrogant and complacent quartet and left inspired and absolutely buzzing! Not to be missed.

Simple Fantastic. I'm a youth worker and I took 5 young people aged 14-18 to take part in it! SO good, ambiance was excellent and challenges where different to other escape rooms. There is a great combination of both practical and intelligent puzzles - if I could do it again I would do!Really well priced also!

Really fun activity to do with your friends!. Definitely do this if you're looking for something different and fun to do with a group of people. The set, music and puzzles are amazing and really clever. It all looks so good and it is a very exciting way to spend an hour. The theme makes it really different to other games and this one is definitely up there with the best.Can't wait for the next room!

A brilliant evening with friends!. Last Thursday a group of 4 friends and I visited Escape Plan Ltd. Two of our group had never been to a live escape room before, so had no clue what to expect, while the rest of us had very high expectations for what was about to unfold... From the moment we entered the room we felt like we were launched back to 1945. The aesthetics of the room and audio were second to none and really enhanced the experience for me. There was so much to explore and take in that at one point in the game, I looked up and all of my friends were totally immersed in an activity - clearly we were all determined to escape! Escape Plan Ltd was great for the variety of puzzles incorporated into the plot too. Half of the enjoyment is solving a puzzle and afterwards we all felt that we had contributed something to our escape.I would definitely recommend Escape Plan to anyone who is into problem solving or just looking for an adventure. The look and feel of the game is better than I have experienced at other games and also makes you feel like you've got good value for money. I can't wait for the team to build a second room!P.S. The food at the cafe downstairs is worth a visit too!

Amazing war-themed escape game!. I was lucky enough to be one of the first visitors to Escape Plan and I was amazed at how slick the whole experience was at this early stage in it's life. I've played 3 escape games now and this one is just as good as my previous favourite which is one of the longest running and well known games - this is high praise as I often tell people about how much I loved the other game! The war theme is great and the owners, Brendan and Kerry, have clearly gone to a lot of trouble to create the immersive environment by sourcing amazing props and creating games and puzzles appropriate to the time period they are trying to capture.I would thoroughly recommend this game to both those that are new to escape games and those that have played a few and want a new challenge. It's brilliant!

Birthday escape room. Booked this new escape room for my wife's birthday as it was one of the few that has room for 6 in one go. We have tried other established rooms and although this is a brand new company with a newly opened room (opened the Friday before we visited) it was fantastic, brilliantly themed with really great puzzles, music and sound effects ratcheting up the pressure as the clock ticks down. This room might be a new room but it is definitely one of the best out there!! if you decide to open another room we will be back!!!

Excellent immersive adventure in central London. We had a great time at Escape Plan - Kerry and Brendan were really welcoming and explained the concept really well. The whole experience was extremely immersive right down to the audio, so we really felt like we were in 1945! The puzzles were imaginative with the right level of challenge for seasoned hint gamers such as ourselves. There were puzzles for all levels and types of people.Enjoyed the whole experience and look forward to what these guys come up with next..

Absolutely Fabulous! . What an amazing game with such friendly staff and a brilliant adventure, the puzzles and plot were fantastic with a few scary bit too to get the heart pumping, we managed to escape and loved every second of it, highly recommend to anyone.....

A challenging & thrilling escape room!. This is the third escape room I have tried now, and Secret Studio definitely tops them all! We played as a team of 4 and we were all very impressed with the story, props and variety of puzzles. Although we didn't manage to escape the room within the hour, this is the first time we have been allowed a few more minutes to complete the game for ourselves. Overall a great activity, even with the few scary moments!

Very fun, nerve-wracking, jumpy and a great team-building event. This was my 3rd escape room and it compared favourably. I'd recommend it to everyone. Only little complaint was how the story lined up with the things we were doing. I'm not entirely sure we know what we actually achieved having completed the room with 3 seconds to spare! (won't say more so I don't give anything away).
Tuesday club. Clever,unusual,nail biting ,terrific.would urge anyone who fancies a challenge a good laugh and a bit of a scare to give this a go.great fun!
