What a blast! Engaging and well thought out. Great way to spend an hour :>. This was an engaging and fun experience from start to finish. From the introduction to the game from our lovely host Oscar to the nail biting final seconds of the game, Secret Studio delivered a experience you won't soon forget. I don't want to give anything away, but the story line was well thought out and you really had to work as a team to get out of the room. It wasn't easy but that's what made it so engaging.If you're looking for something a little different and want to use your puzzle solving skills - this is for you.Good luck!
Birthday Bash. Fantastic clue based game, the whole family had a lot of fun working out the clues. Timely assistance and the ending is something my wife and daughter will never forget...

Very good!. Visited Secret Studio while in London with a friend. The location was very easy to access and just a short walk from the nearest tube station which was Tottenham Court Road. We were greeted by our game host who gave us a good briefing of what we will be doing as well as the introduction to the story. The game itself had some brilliant uses of video to assist you through the story and some really good secrets. It was very well set out and did make you feel like you were in a 70's film studio. We did find this game a little challenging with only 2 people however it was still achievable after a few hints and a little bit of extra time. Overall, a great experience!

Thrilling and tense till the last second. The game was well thought-out, engaging and well-timed. The immersive atmosphere makes you forget that you are indeed playing a game. The storyline added credibility to the whole situation and enhanced the experience that much more. The people who run it were approachable and enthusiastic (from the moment we pressed the doorbell). Would definitely recommend to others and would go again.

WOW.......Just amazing - you need to do this.... NOW!!!. Myself, my partner, my sister, her husband and their daughter decided to give this ago while visiting London - we didn't know what to expect and was a little nervous bit the team at Secret Studio were amazing, very friendly and chatty. Everything from the email communication to turning up right down to completing and finishing the game was just amazing, well thought out and well executed. We finished with 6 minutes to spare which was a great relief and achievement.If your in London you need to check this place out......we will definitely be recommending this to everyone we know.Well done guys at Secret Studio for creating something different, fun and exciting.

Team Oscar's Escape attempt. This was a surprise birthday treat arranged in secret for my sister's 21st. What an afternoon we had! Our team of 5 enjoyed every minute solving the puzzles and trying to escape. We were all really disappointed that we ran over by 34 seconds, and spent a long time afterwards "debriefing" and deciding who was to blame! Gamesmasters Josh and Oscar were very friendly and helped us out along the way. A fantastic activity! Would definitely recommend!

Two was not a crowd!. Myself and a friend were looking for 1-2 quirky things to do in London over the weekend. The idea of the 'escape room' came up and we browsed the many offerings in London. Secret Studio stood out to us mainly because of the film studio angle the story took. The experience didn't disappoint. There were only two of us but we found it manageable, albeit with a few hints from time to time. The hour flew by as we desperately searched and tried to piece the puzzle together. Overall, I'd recommend this to anybody who likes puzzles/riddles etc. The hosts were friendly, clear and enthusiastic which is what you want. Do it!!!!!!!!!

three generations of fun. We took our son, his wife and our granddaughter [15] today and we had a wonderful time, the lads that run this are so personable and committed, all in all a great experience and I hope they are successful, Thanks 'The Winners'

Thundercats win!. Fantastically fun and constructed secret games. It was aimed at the right level and had more practical games than some of the other secret games done before. The guys running the show were fantastic and really helpful!

Awesome adventure. We took on the games master to celebrate a birthday, it was SO much fun. The whole thing was bizarre yet awesome and I would recommend it to anyone. Just remember to take your thinking caps!

fun experience. We decided to schedule our escape room experience on the same day that we visited the British Museum. We had read about these rooms and had been talking about trying one for awhile. This was a fun first experience. As soon as the clock started, we began our frantic search for our way out. The clues provided during the hour were helpful and we finished just over the hour. We made some silly mistakes along the way and still laugh about them. This was a good activity to do with our teenage son and I imagine we will try escape rooms when we travel to other cities.

Great escape game. Great set up and story line. Better than other games we have played. Full of twists and surprises. Over 14 is a good age guide. Well worth an hour out of your day whilst in London. Woke us up and set us buzzing for the day

Escapalisious!. I have tried a number of escape games in London and this is really very special! We did it as a group of friends Saturday night with high expectations and we were not disappointed! This is a very clever game. Innovative puzzles, super fun twists and a few pulse raising surprises. High production value and authenticity. Great production team. Highly recommend a visit (just do it!). It's one of those things where you wish you could do it over and over again, so make sure you make the most of it first time round! Bring on the sequel!

Well worth a visit!. I booked Secret Studio as part of our three day London trip, based on the great reviews I'd read on tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to them all! My 17 and 15 year old niece and nephew and myself loved it. Thanks to Josh, our game master, for giving us hints when we got stuck and also letting us run a few minutes over the hour to finish the game, which by the way we didn't realise until we were finished.....the hour flies!!It's all very well thought out and put together and suits all ages from 14 up. These lads are very friendly and deserve to do well with this. Would definitely recommend Secret Studio for something completely different on your trip to London.The craic was mighty!!

Great fun. Great experience, none of us had tried anything similar before, and they had to guess where we were in the game cause we didn't speak English! The hints they gave were perfect and kept the tension high! Great fun! Some of the films didn't work, but maybe that was our fault as we kept plugging in and out everything we could find.

The best one yet!. I've escaped 4 rooms in Athens, 1 in Seoul and 3 in London and this one is by far the best one yet - Everything from the build up prior to our arrival (the email with instructions) to the execution of the room. I would HIGHLY recommend this to everyone - Team Ben are still talking about this room 24 hours after doing it! Good bits:- Great customer service - Olly is the best!- Amazing back story- The best execution I've ever experienced- Chilling, goosebump feeling as you complete the room- Room setup/layout- Surprises- Activities to get the clues- Awesome links between the task, story, hints and clues- The water- The toilets- EVERY-GOD-DAMN-THING!Improvements:- Score board of top 10 best escape times each month?- A sequal!Words can't describe how much fun me and my team had! We're still buzzing and can't wait to go back to see these guys again for a new room!
Secret studio . This was an amazing game, very dramatic loads of fun. Better than other similar types of games! Great location and nice password entry'

Brilliant ! Brilliant ! Brilliant !. What truly excellent fun - I can't recommend Secret Studio and the folks there highly enough. We visited on Fri 24th July at 7pm and managed to escape 59 minutes and 14 seconds later... it's not often that I am a jibbering squealing wreck, but as those last few seconds counted down, and the surprises kept on coming, that's exactly what I was. Great team, great story, great set-up, great fun... I'm so impressed I am taking my work colleagues back next month for team event... can't wait !

What fun. Didn't know what to expect but that was part of the intrigue. Clever, full of twists and turns giving a real sense of achievement. Great working together as a team giving a fun experience. Time well spent . Excellent, highly recommended.
Excellent Trip!. Having been to a few escape rooms, I can definitely say this was one of the better ones. Really friendly team and interesting and varied puzzles - would definitely recommend!

Brilliant ! Excellent Fun! And just the right amount of scary!. We were a team of 1adult and 2 teenagers. We didn't know what to expect but we love murder mystery and thoroughly enjoyed this. It was challenging, intelligent, good craic, completely absorbing, raised a few screams and a lot of laughs. We managed to get it done within the hour- just about- with a lot of tactful help from a very encouraging Josh! In the great tradition of one of the greatest murder mysteries (The Mousetrap), we can't tell you any more of course..... This is a great way to spend time with people you get along with or want to get along with. We're sorry we can't do it again now we know the plot! Highly recommend this. Team Belfast

So different and an absolute blast. Both my sister and I agree that this was hands down one of the most fun things we've ever done together. The game is clever and challenging, the staff so accommodating and friendly, and the experience absolutely worth the cost. When we left, we had the biggest smiles on our faces and still laugh about what happened during that hour. A must while in London:)

I'm almost jealous of anyone who hasn't done it yet, because it's so much fun!. I organised an evening at Secret Studio for myself and team at work. There are 6 of us in total, guys and girls ranging from 22 - 35, so often our ideas of what we want from a team night are quite different!We arrived for the 7pm booking and met Oscar (after saying the secret password to get in). He was lovely and gave us all the information we needed before locking us in the room for what became an hour of roller coaster emotions. Without giving too much away, we were challenged/surprised/scared/frustrated/loads of other things, by what awaited us. The task tests your individual logic, but also hugely tests your ability to work as a team. Everyone had their own moments of glory and came away with their favorite bits. The studio is so well set up and there is a lot more to it than meets the eye initially. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to do something different with a group of friends, colleagues, family (might be a bit risky if you're competitive). We managed to get out in the allocated hour, but it was a very close shave and everyone was frantic at the end. It was so enjoyable and a really unique experience. I'm almost jealous of anyone who hasn't done it yet, because it's so much fun!
Just great. An immersive experience and the team behind it were warm and welcoming.Really found out who in our group was good at which things and how they complemented each other.

Team Awsome!!. Josh, thank you! This was a great activity and highly recommended! Even my mother wants to have a go! We started our hen do with this and it was a great bonding activity for those who didn't know each other, the hen absolutely loved it and said it was the best one shed done to date! Lovely people from initial booking tohrough to the game, very helpful and very accommodating! Will look out for any future rooms! Thanks Sarah ( trip organiser)

Hen do party surprise. We started of our hen do morning with this treat! most of us had no idea what to expect! highly recommended! wow what an experience. i cant wait to do another one in the future, what i had in mind was actually 10x more amazing when we did the event! so many laughs, great for people who love to solve puzzles, or love murder mysteries. it was like being thrown into a Hitchcock or agatha christie novel with a the interactivity any computer game lover would be completely at home with ^^ I simply must go again. team awesome rule! beat the challenge with adrenaline pumping brain cogs whirring and a good fee minutes still on the clock ;)

It was just such a load of fun!. My husband & I were treated to this surprise by our son and daughter-in-law. We had no idea where we were going and what we were in for. We travelled up from Southampton on a wet wet wet day. From the moment we were let in, we forgot the rain and the magic began...and the pace was fast. For the most part the younger brains were the more agile (teachers...yay!) but we kept pace and had to do things together to crack the code. The organising team had just the right approach - to encourage, to dare, to scare and amuse and were just such a nice bunch. Recommend for family bonding!
Team Awesome Sauce. Had lots of fun. Very interesting unlike any other escape room I have been in. If your in the area definitely go was so worth it :)

Best escape game in london. At the time of visting by far the best game in London. Hosts were fantastic, the game was unique, exciting and interesting, had really high production values and a couple of awesome surprises. They did cancel on us but gave us a free game at a time of our choosing because of it so no complaints! The only thing they need to improve is their booking system. 10/10

Awesome!. Great fun, definitely got the adrenaline pumping! This is my second experience with an escape room and I found this one had a great number of original ideas and presented just the right level of challenge. Thanks, Secret Studio!

Fantastic and immersive. This was a fantastic and enjoyable experience, it has a great plot and the puzzles are brilliant! Friendly and very helpful (but not too helpful!) staff! You definitely won't regret it!
Great fun. Great fun, well organised and a fantastic activity. Would highly recommend as an event with friends and colleagues.

Different & interesting!. I've never been to an escape room before and this was so fun and affordable! Every task required team work, the tasks weren't necessary difficult to solve but I know it would have taken me twice as long to figure everything out without a team! I enjoyed it so much, it was so interesting and I'd consider it for future group activities! I'd gladly do it again! Loved it!!

Brilliant!. The highlight of our trip to london. Having lived there over 15 years hard to find events / activities that we've not already done so to speak. The whole experience was memorable even weeks later. Top team, top thought / brains behind the problem solving, top price. What's not to like. New to this but has so got us hooked. A must if in the city.
Like nothing else around!. Not like anything I've ever experienced. Mentally stimulating but still lots of laughs, and the surprises never end. Great value, a stellar way to pass an hour!

Can't recommend highly enough!!!. We went as a group of seven adults and it was so much fun!! Some of us had tried other locked rooms before but (without giving anything away) Secret Studio has a number of unique features and twists that set it apart from the other rooms we had tried. The level was pitched exactly right so that it was challenging but not so difficult that you had to rely on the games master for constant clues. If you haven't tried a locked room before and aren't sure you will enjoy it - you will !!

OMG! Just brilliant. BEST FUN in 60 minutes!. After reviewing many of the escape games on Trip Advisor, I chose this one. Went with 2 friends and 1 of them had absolutely no idea what we were doing. We were a little early when arriving at Museum Street, so we had a drink in the Camera Café opposite which kind of added to the theme! Upon arrival at the secret door, my friend was still non the wiser as to what we were doing! When she learnt moments later that she was going to be locked in a room she was both apprehensive and excited! Josh was brilliant and from the moment we were locked in the room, we got to work as a team, which is soooooo important if you want to escape within the 60 minutes. The twists and turns are just fab. So pleased we made it to the very end. We are going to be talking about this for years.......everything was just brilliant and one part of the 'game' was just hilariously funny! Can't say anymore as it would ruin the surprises. If you are unsure which escape game to try first, definitely recommend this one....you won't be disappointed.
Secret studio experience. Fantastic, unusual and fun experience. Can't say too much or will spoil it. You must see for yourself!

Great experience. Me and my colleagues did Secret Studio as part as our team building day and what an experience it was. The detail in the game is extraordinary and, without giving too much away, there are a couple of twist and turns that might give you the odd heart flutter. Dont think about doing this - DO IT!!!!

Tension, Drama and Jumps. Two friends and I did the secret studio, and it was amazing!! So well thought out and planned, kept us entertained and on our toes the whole way through! We have been to many other escape games and we rate this one as the best so far! We choose the impossible difficulty flavour and it was the right level for us. Incredible game guys, a must try. Awesome value for money as well.
BESTEST THING EVER!. Really fun. Not too easy and not too difficult. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who likes fun or enjoying themself. A***++++

Absolutely fantastic. I went with a group of 8 to celebrate two 19th birthdays and it was completely unlike anything I've ever done and outlived any expectations I had! Having seen and done most typical things in London this was by far the best outing ever. The staff were really friendly and engaging which makes you even more involved and excited for whats to come, All I can say is that you need to go!!

Amazing!. Came here yesterday for my 19th birthday with a group of friends. It was absolutely brilliant. There was 8 of us so we split into two groups and the first group got to watch the second do theirs. It was hilarious watching them! I would deffo recommend this venue, it's great for everyone and the staff are really funny and friendly!
The crow flies south at midnight. . Be aware fellow travelers. Do not eat fruit, especially bananas before entering the room. They can smell it, they always do.
Brilliant!!!!!. Great experience,lots of twists and fun clues that make it very engaging! Would thoroughly recommend it to anyone who wants a day out with family and friends! Excellent time!

Fantastic, brain teasing, spooky fun!. I went with a group of 6 to Secret Studio as a surprise and I absolutely loved it - they have thought through the whole concept really carefully and have paid close attention to detail which helped make the whole experience so enjoyable and unpredictable!I highly recommend it and am already persuading friends they must go! Hard to explain much without giving away the surprises - it was so much fun - we were smiling the rest of the day!

Hen Do Escape... This was absolutely brilliant! Came for my friend's hen do one Saturday morning. The guys were really friendly and the game itself was great! Working as a team to race around solving clues is so much fun. Make sure you try this.. It's bloody brilliant!

10/10 would do it again!. It was the first escape game I'd triee out and I was thoroughly impressed by how good it turned out to be and at how much fun I had. If I didnt know all the solutions to the problems I would redo it over and over again. I would strongly recommend trying it out!!!

Absolutely amazing!. Turning up I wasn't sure what to expect as I had no prior knowledge to what the event actually was. My friend asked me and a couple of others to come along with him and so we all went. The people who worked there were outstanding and friendly, easily sharing humor with me and all my friends which lightened the mood and allowed us to get comfortable. The escape itself was fantastic, especially towards the end where time was running out and the stakes got even higher as we were trying to finish within the time given causing all of us to panic and try as hard as we could to solve all the excellently crafted puzzles, which were not easy to solve and provided fun and challenging environments. It was very fun to do especially with lots of friends and I will definitely go to all the other studios spread around London.It is an exit game not to miss whether you have done others or not!

amazing experience, would love to do it again now!. i was going in completely unaware of escape games, and what a way to start! a brilliant back-story combined with the most amazing friendly team of people makes this, in my opinion, one of the best experiences in London at the moment.

BRAVO!! An exit game NOT to miss. Play this one now!. My friends and I have done most of the exit games in London. Secret studio is one of the top 3 we've played. A bit different than the standard, find key, find code, open lock repeat. This game made it feel like we had stepped into a movie. Great use of technology and story line. Very good atmosphere. Well planned out. Fun puzzles. Guaranteed fun time. This is another case of where we wish we could wipe our memories and play again. I am still thinking about this one days later.

Top drawer!!. Had no idea what to expect except it was some kind of mystery puzzle game. Awesome fun, we did this in two teams as part of a stag do and it gave a really exciting start to the day! Cant say much without giving the game away but if you like thinking outside the box, puzzles, murder mysteries and the crystal maze then this is probably for you. Team work is essential, we had five in our team and it was a great bonding experience enjoyed by all! Its just a shame you can only really do this once.... can't wait for them to come up with another!!

Great fun!. We are a family of four who successfully completed our mission with only a few minutes to spare... We have been to a few other escape rooms in the past and would rank this among the best with some really creative challenges.

Couldn't stop thinking about it for a couple days...amazing!!. It was the first escape room we did but it definitely set some really high bars for the rest. The whole experience was very exciting, spooky at times and marvelous overall. It was 5 of us doing it (I don't think 6 people would be too much even though they don't recommend it on the site) and at first we were exploring the quest individually while in the end we started doing things in very synchronised way. I just wanted to outline a couple of other things that I liked: - Location: Perfect, just in front of the Brit Museum - was super easy to find- Time slot: Even though we arrived 5 mins late and were really worried it was fine- Room: super authentic. amazing mix between vintage and modern technology. - Gamemaster: Zo was the coolest dude ever- Price: This was one of the reasons why we chose Secret Studio as opposed to other rooms. All in all, top notch experience. HIGHLY recommended to all. Hope you guys do well and looking forward to new rooms you come up with! Mr D @ Bad Familia

Great, really professional and fun!. Had a brilliant time at Secret Studios yesterday for a hen do. Wasn't sure what to expect but they were really friendly and once the game started the time whizzed away while we tried to piece together all the clues and puzzles. Loads of interesting twists and turns and retro details, helpful clues when we needed them and lots of fun had by all! Can't recommend this too highly! Also felt very pleased with ourselves for making it out in time!

Best way to spend an hour!. Had only done one escape before in Vienna which was brilliant so my expectations were high but thankfully Secret Studio surpassed my expectations with a great puzzle, story and ingenious hidden surprises that left me and my group for more. However, I don't want to give any of them away (; Oh and btw, teamwork really helps

Highly Recommend! So much Fun. Absolutely brilliant! The best 60 minutes of fun we've had in a long time. The staff were great (friendly and fun) and gave encouragement along the way. I highly recommend Secret Studio!

Fantastic Experience!. This was the first escape game I have done, and I'll definitely be trying more after this.Everything from getting in to the venue, to the briefing, to the experience itself was fantastic and well thought out. We went as a group of 6 which is the maximum you can have, and we needed all 6 brains!The guys working there are really friendly and service is excellent.The only downside is that now I've done it, I can't do it again!

Bloody Brilliant!. Was taken here for the start of my hen party, and it was such good fun. The time went really quickly and we just finished it on time; we were in a team of five which seemed like the perfect size to me. Proud to say that we escaped the room with a minute to spare. The people who run the event were lovely and very clever to come up with the concept, won't tell you too much about that as it will give the game away, but it was really well put together! Thanks again for a fun day out! Cath ;)
Really really great. Secret studio is amazing! The story was great, the layout of the room is very clever. We had a great time.
Fantastic Puzzle Game!. This was my first escape game and was fantastic- the atmosphere was incredible and obviously a lot of hard work had gone in to make this just the right level of challenging.

Fun guaranteed! Must visit!. Went to Secret Studio with my boyfriend. Even before booking over the phone, the staff were so friendly and helpful. This didn't change when we arrived. Great location too as tourists from out of London we easily got there with not much hassle. The venue was very mysterious and made me feel like I'm actually in the game. Had a total laugh and an overall amazing experience. Oh, and the price is more than worth it. There has definitely been lots of time and effort put into this. Highly recommend this adventure. Thank you for the amazing time guys :) #Stena

must do it!. This was the first escape room I have done. We were only two, but the staff managed to let us finish the puzzles almost in time, by arranging slightly the story and by giving us some clues from time to time. Very friendly staff and very captivating story, more and more when you start understanding how it works. Fantastic experience!

Best yet!. Out of all of the escapes that I've tried, this has to be the best. There is great variety....and such atmosphere!! Outstanding gamesmaster and great location. A fantastic afternoon out! Thank you!

Must do!!!. I was in London for my best mates birthday so I thought I'd book the 4 of us in for a laugh..... It was hilarious from start to finish. Great game and clues! What made it exceptionally brilliant and different to all the other breakout providers was its personality. The guys (and gals) who run the place were brilliant. Thanks for a great time!!

A superb surprise. For me and my group of friends, Secret Studio was stag do activity and no-one knew what to expect. To our surprise, it was really, really good. Our hour helped break down barriers between people who didn't know each other, was a mentally stimulating challenge, and aside from all that was a lot of fun. I'd absolutely recommend Secret Studio to any group of friends or colleagues, for almost any occasion. It really was genuinely brilliant.

Want to do it again!. The only bad thing about Secret Studio is that it ends. It was almost an hour of honest-to-god fun and I would recommend it to anyone. Went on Saturday, 20th June 2015 as part of a stag do. I can't compliment the creators and staff enough. It was well thought out and beautifully executed. I enjoyed it even more than I thought I would. Bloody brilliant.

sixty minutes of secret sleuthing... well, 54 actually. Artfully staged and bursting with nostalgia the stage is set with clues and conundrums to help you escape the room in less than an hour. Lots to do and figure out so this is a great way to spend an hour with a few friends. Thoroughly enjoyed it, I take my hat off to The Secret Studio's creators and staff, good job!

An escape game for grown ups, ridiculously enjoyable. I've never been a fan of escape games or anything that smacks of 'team building' but Secret Studio completely changed my perspective. It's executed in an intelligent and artful way, by people who obviously love good storytelling. Other similar experiences out there can seem very corporate and naff, but this is different. There is a logistical element to the experience, but you don't have to be great at problem solving as you're given clues to help you along. The storyline blends with the game brilliantly, so you feel like your immersed in a film rather than waiting for the *BOO* moment on a ghost train. The production value is high, so it very much feels like a grown-up experience. Highly recommend it for an unconventional group day out, especially if you're a film fan looking for something more than an evening at your local Odeon. This is better than Crystal Maze, and believe me, I bloody well loved Crystal Maze.

The office outing.... Went on Thursday 18th June 2015. What a spectacular experience!I truly didn't want it to end. All curious cats, in fact ANYone who wants a hilarious evening with friends, go to Secret Studio.

Great, mysterious fun. Went the other day as a group of three. Fantastic stuff. The immersion element is very effective, right from the get-go you feel as though you've been transported to a weird and mysterious alternate dimension. Gathering all of the elements to solve each bit of the puzzle was extremely good fun. A big thanks to the gamemasters who did a great job.Wish I could wipe my memory and do it again!

Best Room Escape In The UK !!. This was my fifth room escape in the UK, and it was certainly the best! Without giving anything away, the clues/puzzles are presented in a much more interactive way, and the monitoring of the whole game by the Secret Studio team was more enjoyable and innovative that other room escapes. Clever introduction, great theme running through it, and well thought out logic is evident throughout. Congrats to the team for coming up with the design! Looking forward to room #2 - feel free to let us try it out for you #;0)

It's better than the Aztec Zone in Crystal Maze!. Truly a unique, well thought detailed concept. We were enchanted as soon as we stepped in "the room". If you are thinking of something different and cool with a small group of people this is perfect. It's rare to find something that doesn't involve booze, sports, that's and both mentally challenging and entertains. Thanks guys!

Fun few hours of mystery!. What an excellent experience.... Very well thought out with lots of twists and turns! Little hints along the way definitely helped. Would certainly recommend this... Whether you go with friends or colleagues, it's a fun few hours of mystery solving!

Totally thrilling and very very clever. Tremendous experience. Such a phenomenal concept. Really didn't think we would have that much fun. Went in feeling a little apprehensive as we were didn't know how it could work but it really does! GO DO IT!

GO AND DO THIS!. I've never experienced anything like it, the second you step in to the Secret Studio you are immersed into another world of mystery, intrigue, puzzle...Really well planned, this real life Cluedo it’s perfect If you want to spend an hour challenging yourself whilst having a laugh with friends then look no further because this is the perfect activity for it.the staff are lovely, we had So much fun! I would definitely recommend it.

Great fun! Just enough hints!. Went with 3 other adults. two of us had done a breakout game before, the other two hadn't even heard of them. we all really enjoyed it. good storyline, spooky setting. there were just enough hints to help with the clues. super friendly staff.
Great!. This game was spooky, funny, scary and completely absorbing, we were all completely swept up in the world it catapulted us into. We loved it!

Simply brilliant. I can't see anybody not enjoying themselves during this fantastic and very well designed game! I've never experienced anything like it and I really thought I was transported into another world. If you want to spend an hour challenging yourself whilst having a laugh with friends then look no further because this is the perfect activity for it. 11 out of 10!

Transported to another Life .... a life of Mystery and Secrets !!!. This is one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had in a Long time. Me and my friend were instantly transported to another life once through the doors of secret studio. Secrets ..Puzzles .. Clues ..and Riddles, Lots to do, work out and fiddle.Secrets ..Stories .. things there and here, all surrounded by great Atmosphere.Work out these Enigmas using Body and Mind. And escape this place quickly in just enough time. FANTASTIC !! THANK YOU !!

Amazing . A really really good day out with friends. Challenging yet fun really like nothing i had experienced before. Wish I could do it again and again! Would recommend for a day out for teenagers family's or friends of most ages! It's like living in a board game, can't praise it enough!

Absolutely smashing!!!. This was so much fun! I couldn't recommend it more! I went with a bunch of friends and we thoroughly enjoyed it! It's like real life cluedo and would be great for team building events, birthdays or just having a laugh with your mates! GO!! You'd be silly not to!

Awesome!. A brilliantly devised escape game, the staff are lovely and ensure you have handy hints along the way if needed, without molly-coddling. Quite mentally challenging after a few pints but great fun and a real sense of achievement if you manage to escape! Evidently lots of effort spent on the props, sets and story also. Really good fun and a refreshing change from the norm.
Good fun!. I did this with friends after work. It was difficult and frustrating at times, but we all felt a real sense of achievement after breaking out! There is a pub right outside to celebrate.

Secret studio. Top stuff! I thought the escape game was really well designed and I would definitely recommend it. Make sure you're are mentally prepared, as it's not something to do when you're hung over. There is a pub right outside to celebrate you're escape, if you do manage to escape that is.

So much fun!!. We absolutely loved it! It was the first time we had done anything like it before. The staff were great! From my initial enquiry to arriving on the day, they made the experience so much fun. The clues were suitably challenging for our feeble minds and the encouragement along the way was great! I cannot recommend Secret Studios enough!

Secret Studios was awesome, I felt like an actual detective!. It was amazing, and I had never done anything like this before. It made me feel like I was solving a real crime. I would definitely recommend Secret Studios to anyone as it is such a unique experience.

An hour that's gone in a flash.. I'm not going to say much more than:
"Go and do this!"
If I say too much more I'll spoil your experience.
So, to conclude, it's a full on immersive experience and the hour you spend there will be the shortest of your life, it truly goes in a flash.

Secret studio. Really great bunch of people! I had never done a escape game before but found it incredibly good. An interesting storyline which made us feel fully immersed in the plot. Nice friendly staff and incredibly enthusiastic manager made the experience great!!

Bloody Marvelous. A great group of staff - very helpful and friendly. The game itself was by far the best I have ever played. A really great narrative with clues that help the story build throughout. It has the right balance of being challenging but not frustrating. I am recommending this to all my friends, a great hour spent and thoroughly worth the price

great choice of birthday present for my friend. I'm fast becoming a bit of a room-escape addict, what with all the new ones that have opened in London recently. I've done about 7 or 8 now, and all have the good bits and bad bits. I would definitely rate this in the top 3.GOOD BITS:- the customer service was brilliant, the best I've experienced at one of these. Very friendly and chatty guys- really great atmosphere inside the room. It has a bit of a spooky feel, and they have gone to great lengths to create the right ambience, using old retro props, and great use of lighting and technology- some of the puzzles were really fun and original- a great surprise twist near the end- good attention to backstory- great themingAREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT (in my opinion):- I loved the idea of the pre-briefing video, which also featured again in-game, but it felt a bit cheesy and not in keeping with the 70s vibe of the rest of it. It wasn't that brilliantly acted either. If I was them I would consider re-shooting that to match the high quality of the other footage used in the game.- as with most of the other room escapes I've been to, some of the solutions to the clues and puzzles felt a bit too random, and without much logic. It often felt like we would never have worked out certain things if we hadn't had on-screen help from Oscar (who was lovely by the way). I think as well as just giving random clues, there should always be some sort of hint as to how they fit together, or some sort of organisation and logic behind it.This is still in the preview stage so I'm sure they will iron out a few of these little wrinkles. But considering the fact it's in preview stage, this was already remarkably polished and very fun. All in all, a great night out, compares very favourably against other room escapes, and very good value for money.

2.21 seconds to go...!. Our friends had taken part in several escape games in Europe and recommended them, so we decided to do this one in London as a team. Secret Studios turned out to be up there with the best of them! So much fun and a great background story to create some real tension. Our experience was particularly fraught with 2 mins 21 to go...! Harry and Oscar were great games masters and provided some surprises along the way. Would definitely recommend you get yourselves there, then they might make more so we can go again!
Wish I could do it again. Great way to spend an exhilarating fun hour in central London. I'd go if you are with people of a similar age or a family - also good for corporate I'd say!
YOU HAVE TO DO IT!. So much fun, absolutely amazing and so worth it! Really well planned, and such a great chance to have proper interactive gaming experience where it's just up to you and your team!

Excellent hour for Team Small Shoes. This was the first time any of our team had done this sort of activity and we are now wondering when we can do it again. Great fun and ingenious with great organisation.

Too good to keep a secret!. If you want something different to do for a birthday, or want a change from visiting museums, or just want to do something fun with friends, go to Secret Studio! Four of us went on Saturday afternoon. I'd never played an Escape Game before so didn't know what to expect, but we had a brilliant time. The Games Master was really helpful and made us feel very relaxed. Once we got going it was great fun trying to puzzle everything out against the clock. I loved the Hitchcock theme, it really felt like we'd gone back in time. You have to work together so I think it would be a great thing to do for team bonding. It doesn't matter if you get stuck because the Games Master sends you hints and pulls you back if you go off in completely the wrong direction. Location is great and easy to find. Highly recommend.
A great time had by all. Fabulous location, looks great inside, beautifully designed, very well done, our whole group were highly entertained throughout and had a laugh. I would highly recommend.
So much fun!. A really unique way to spend some time! Works really well as a bonding experience. Great location and easy to find. A great time was had by all !

Most fun I've had in ages. I have done other escape games - this was the best I have done, in many ways. Such an adrenaline rush and some inspired touches. Those who have done it will know what I mean! Definitely don't miss this one!

Original escape room with atmosphere. I've said for a while that escape rooms need to not just have great puzzles, but build a proper story and atmosphere. Well, Secret Studio did that in abundance. The fact that they come from a film making rather than puzzling/engineering background really showed, with a beautifully crafted "set" that had plenty of atmosphere.Even before you get into the room, they start setting the scene, and once inside it grows and grows. One aspect of how I judge escape rooms is on the number of new puzzle mechanics they have. This more than delivers on that front, with almost no padlocks, and lots of cool ways of solving problems. That said, it wasn't perfect - some of the puzzles seemed unlikely to be solved without hints and the gamesmaster was too keen, too early on to provide hints - we'd been in about five minutes and were still happily searching them room when we got the first one. It seemed to improve as time went on and we got fewer interruptions, with less obvious clues. Note that it was still in preview mode when we went, so they may fix these flaws.If you don't mind needing a few hints along the way or if the story is a key part of escape rooms to you then I'd highly recommend it.

An exciting hour to spend in London!. Escape rooms in London are awfully pricey so I had to pick just one to go to since I couldn't afford more. I'm so glad this was the one I picked! I was kinda nervous since it's pretty new and didn't have a whole lot of reviews (though, the existing ones are excellent) but I was surprised to see how professional it was. First of all, There was a very interesting story behind the game which made it a lot more exciting. Second, the interior design and the tools being used are authentic and super cool, really, there's so much thought put into the small details. Third! the staff is brilliant. The tasks are a bit complicated but the staff helped us a lot. Also, you need to have basic understanding of english to complete the tasks. Since we were a group of three, and two of us kinda struggle with english - they were so kind to give us a bit of extra time so I could translate. I also have to mention the beautiful website (although, at the moment, reservations are available only via phone, and as a tourist that was a bit complicated for me so I hope that changes in the future). All in all - a wonderful experience. The three of us had so much fun - so really, if you're wondering on which escape room you're gonna bankrupt yourself, don't hesitate. :)

Beautifully atmospheric, clever and complex. A fabulous escape game with plenty of puzzles and things to explore, set in a classic film studio. Secret Studio has been designed with real care and attention to detail and the result is very atmospheric and great fun.I would definitely recommend a visit to anyone coming to Bloomsbury.

A fun way to spend an hour in London!. This was definitely one of the most fun things we did in London! Sara and staff are extremely friendly and professional and have created an amazing and challenging game that anyone can enjoy! From the beginning they made us feel welcome and it was clear that they had a passion and excitement for their business. This is the best escape room we have done and the amount of detail in the setting and the clues was fabulous! All 5 of our team highly recommend the Secret Studios and we will be back again next time we're visiting. Hopefully room #2 will be up and running by then. :)Thank you Sara and Secret Studios for a fantastic night!

Great fun, something different. me and my two friends visited Secret Studio's last week and it was great fun! We were greeted with welcoming staff and were all ready to take the mission.... It was awesome, finding clues and trying to get through tasks! It was challenging at points, but working together is key. I would recommend Secret Studios to all!!

Best Escape Room I've Been Too!. Really well put together, so much attention to detail and a real range of puzzle's and activities. Not to give too much away but you really feel like your in another world full of different rooms and atmospheres. Highly recommended (perfect thing to do before or after the British Museum)

Great afternoon of brain training. What a challenge - Wonderful afternoon spent with the family (even our teenagers worked together and didn't argue!)Would highly recommend Secret Studio for a fun brain teasing adventure

Do yourself a favour.... Secret studio was a blast. We visited secret studio to kick of a Hen's night. I can't rate it high enough. I loved the balance between being challenged, entertained and just laughing at ourselves. The whole experience flew past as we were so lost in the adventure. I will certainly be returning with some work colelgaues to test our team work!

Great activity to do with friends. . Having done previous escape games, I'd had experience of good and less good ones. Secret studio definitely rates highly. Great concept, great atmosphere, and the 'enforced' teamwork is an added bonus. Do yourself a favour and have a go!

Fun times!. I'll confess I'm not much of a puzzle/gamer person but this place really is worth a visit. From the beginning I was intrigued as to how to solve the puzzle to get out of the rooms. Well thought-out and challenging game, which was genuinely a lot of fun!!!

Wonderfully charming and inventive.. Secret Studio is a tremendously cathartic experience, that challenges you and your friends and family in many different ways. The originality and creativity of the company makes the experience even more special. It is clear a lot of heart went into the business and I would undoubtedly recommend this to anyone and everyone. A 10/10 experience!

A brilliant day out!. Secret Studio is a fantastic, unique alternative to the usual London attractions!I went with a group of friends not knowing entirely what to expect and we all really enjoyed it, though I also see it being perfect for families and corporate events. The experience was really fun as well as challenging, leaving us with immense satisfaction after successfully escaping the room. Definitely recommended.

A unique and thrilling experience. I went with 2 of my friends and had a fantastic experience. I recommend Secret Studios to anyone looking for something different. It felt like being in an episode of 'Sherlock'.

So much fun! Spooky, funny and really got us thinking!. The second you step in to the secret studio you are immersed into another world. Having to work together with your mates, against the time makes it both challenging but also so much fun. It's such a good way to spend an hour of your day! The spooky elements really got me, but watching my mates getting frightened was hilarious! Brilliant experience.

Like being in your own real life game of Cluedo. Nothing like a good conundrum to get your brain working. Trying to figure out each clue and how things fit together means that you have a highly engaging experience with friends. A thoroughly enjoyable session.

Such an unusual and fun way to spend an afternoon!. I had been to Hint Hunt before and wanted to try another escape game.. I went to Secret Studio with some friends who had never done that sort of attraction. It was fantastic! It looks amazing and was so much fun. More hi tech than Hint Hunt. I really recommend to do this if you have a spare couple of hours in London. Conveniently located too, right by the British museum really close to Oxford Street and Covent Garden.

Hitchcock inspired thrills in this interactive lock in game. Secret Studio is a lock in puzzle game with a lot of twists! Escape within the hour is the mission, and I had 2 friends to help me. Thank god I did, as this is a game of skill, wit and observation. There's a lot to do, and the attention to detail and props that are in the room are brilliant. Being into my films, there's a lot of joy in seeing the style of old classic movies being mixed with modern technology. It's immersive and the Secret Studio team have created an atmosphere that is full of suspense and keeps ramping in excitement. A few areas we struggled with, but the ever watchful staff kept us on the right track if we were getting distracted. There's a lot to love about Secret Studio, one was our host Danny who's enthusiasm for the game was infectious. Full of tricks and mind games, we loved it, and learned who is a good at taking instructions on our team...apparently not me! Top rating for the newest escape room game on the block.

Mystery, puzzles and drama!. I went with a few good friends and we all really enjoyed it. It is a great blend of drama, atmosphere and excitement as you try to escape. If you are a gamer, puzzler or even if you don't think this is for you I would recommend you try it. It is a great location and esy to find. The staff are all very friendly. the event itself is awesome. So go for it! see if you can get out!
Its like being in your very own film noir. An utterly absorbing and enchanting experience. The authentic visual details takes you back in time.

"A unique and thoroughly engaging entertainment". Three friends and I spent a wonderfully engaging hour at Secret Studio this afternoon. I've never done anything remotely like this (is there anything remotely like this?) and I loved it. It really is an ingenious, and seemingly unique, idea; like an interactive, mystery-based computer game come to life - only more intriguing, cryptic and atmospheric. One is transported to another time and place, and concerned only with solving the riddle at hand - so it really takes you out of yourself, whilst at the same time being highly sociable fun; everyone gets involved. By turns light-hearted and unnerving, the attention to detail is remarkable - very much like being in a classic whodunit film. We found that the experience should ideally be completed by a trip to the pub afterwards; spending a further hour dissecting the clues over a pint! Highly recommended to anyone in search of something stimulating and different. The location is also perfect for a day out sightseeing in central London.

Really enjoyable - better than I expected. I went to Secret Studio with some work colleagues as part of a "team building" day. On first impressions, I didn't really think this would be my cup of tea - but I was really impressed. It was great fun and the attention to detail was excellent throughout. There isn't much more that can be said without giving too much away - but very much recommended.

And now for something completely different.. My wife and I went with two young friends to Secret Studio, on their advice we refrained from investigating what the experience would be about. It was absolutely brilliant, an extraordinary piece of staging, it is difficult to review the day, without giving away too much of the experience, enough to say, it's great, it's fun, intriguing, stimulating and most, most unusual. You must work together and act as a team to progress, and as this became more apparent, the fun level rocketed. The developers have done a superb job, so much care and thought has gone into the Secret Studio experience, and this was born out by how well it worked with such a large age spread, we the end of fifty, they the beginning of twenty. Also the fact that we relived the game and our thoughts about, and parts in it with such mirth and hilarity later over a greatly extended lunch.I do not know of any similar experiences to compare it with in the capital, and that sums it up, it is unique, visit before the rush. (I'm hoping they will do gift vouchers, as this really is the present for when you want to make an impression)

Great fun!. A fun, exciting and challenging afternoon in London! Secret Studio would be a great activity for groups of friends, families and corporate teams and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to try something different from the usual tourist attractions London has to offer!

Brilliant fun. I had no idea what to expect - I am not really a gamesy type of person, so didn't think Secret Studio would be for me, but I was amazed how absorbing and exciting it was. Really great fun. I recommend it.

Really fun day out. Went with a few friends (aged 16 and 17) and had great fun, would definitely recommend it for people looking for a different type of day out with friends or even family. Easy to get to and not too expensive either! Staff are also very friendly and helpful

Great fun for all ages. 7 of us booked as part of my brothers 18th birthday celebrations and we all enjoyed it thoroughly. It is so well thought out and put together, the two agents that ran the mission were always in character and great fun. We left itching to book the next mission! Highly recommended!

James Bond V's Major X-Plow-Shun. Part of a 50th Birthday weekend, great way to spend Sunday morning. very clever clues, Agent November was a first class agent. all 6 of us had a really good time. would recommend it. good value for money lots of fun

Went for a birthday - awesome, definitely recommend. Went to major x plow shun- It was absolutely awesome!
Went as a group of 7 of us, aged 20-30. Clues were challenging but very satisfying - we all got very into it, didn't even notice the rain!
Great fun- would definitely recommend. We are going to do the other challenges now too.

So much fun!. We completed the Major X-Plow-Shun for my husband’s birthday. We had a party of 5 ages: 65, 64, 40, 39 and 5. We all had a great time, though after a while we took turns have our child “help” different ones of us. Some clues involved photos and those were the best to have him help with. I’ve done one other thing like this (escape room) and this one was really fantastic. The clues ranged in difficulty so some were quick and some took several minutes. We finished with 3 minutes to spare. It was a fantastic day out and I highly recommend it!We had lunch at the pub before we did our quest. I planned that we’d arrive there 1 hour before our game, but I wish I planned 90 minutes. The pub wasn’t full but because it’s tapas (so lots of different things to cook) it took a longer time to get our food than I am used to at most restaurants. But the food was excellent so we may go back just to eat there.

Brilliant!!! . Agent November is like an escape game but you are out and about in London and HAVE to run!! It's ace. From starting in the cellar of the coffee shop and meeting the detective right through to the very end,running as fast as you can to solve the crime. I've recommended this to everyone I've spoken to!! Do it, it's ace!!

MAJOR X PLOW-SHUN. Well what a fantastic time we had. There were 6 of us and we were a little daunted as information is limited (we now realise its so nothing is spoilt about the game) Very well planned and set up. We all thoroughly enjoyed and managed to complete with 3 minutes left! we will certainly be booking for the murder mystery next year.Take the plunge and give it a go you won't be dissappointed.

So much harder than we expected!. We held a team building day in London on Friday 22nd July and were looking for an unusual event. Agent November was absolutely perfect, we're only a team of 7 and the game is for 3-7 so it was perfect. I honestly don't know how anyone in a smaller team finishes though, it was really challenging and involved a lot of people looking at us like we were mad as we ran around the park. I don't really know what we were expecting but everyone had a fantastic time and Agent Archer never stepped out of character. I would definitely recommend this if you're looking for a good value team building exercise in the city.

Great fun for my husbands 65th birthday not just for the youngsters'. A good challenge for the old brain and great fun. Suitable for mixed ages and small groups we were only 3 people aged 32, 58 and 65.

A bit different, and very fun.. Did this as part of stag do, very enjoyable! If you wanna go to Yates, neck shots an badly dance to Rihanna... probably not for you. However as a daytime start to the day was great... the 'agent' (quizmaster) was sound, tailored it to a bunch of 25-30 year old guys perfectly.

Great afternoon out. It's a really fun thing to do with the family. It's certainly different and it's very well done and clever. You may think you'll crack it no problem but it's harder than you might think! I thoroughly recommend it to anyone with teenage children

Bonkers ! But what fun !!. Brilliant time had with family to celebrate a birthday. Well organised and once warmed up, we found ourselves running about the park without any concern of what we looked like!
Will definitely be recommending this activitiy to others.

Kept 7 15 year old boys entertained - RESULT!!. Booked this for my son's birthday. He and his friends were worried it wouldn't be 'cool' enough for them (or whatever terminology they use) but they all had a super time. If they hadn't wasted the first 20 minutes, they might have completed the mission. They declared it worth getting up early for on a Sunday morning - no higher praise from teenagers.

Really original and excellent fun!. I organised this for a friend's stag do, we had all done the standard stag stuff a million times so wanted something more original. As we had a big group they organised two of the "major x plosion" games to run simultaneously so we could do it as a competition.It is all really well planned and the game itself was challenging but achievable, each time we cracked a clue it felt really good! I won't say much about the game itself to avoid spoilers. In the end one team succeeded in the mission with 1 minute left on the timer and the other team ran out of time! The Agents who ran our games were very engaging and kept in character well. To start with a number of our group felt a bit self concious running around with hats and walkie talkies but by the end we all got into it. One chap said it was the most fun thing he's ever done in London! Highly recommended from us, I may well organise one of the other games soon too!

Great afternoon birthday treat. This was a great birthday present for our mum - a really original and fun way to spend the afternoon. Our team of 5 did the Rainbow Syndicate, which was just the right level of difficulty to challenge us but also give us a hope of solving it, which we did!If you're looking for something slightly different to do for a special occasion, or even just for something unusual to do with friends, I'd highly recommend Agent November.
Solved with 48 seconds remaining!. Brilliant detective game, lots of fun and very challenging. Solved with 48 seconds to go! Highly recommended.
Murder!. We had a brilliant afternoon solving the murder mystery, lots of laughs. We were a large group (9) but it still worked. I would recommend to anyone who wants a real brain challenge.

Brilliant!. We had a brilliant time doing this challenge. The clues were challenging, the location really good, the staff awesome. We didn't complete the challenge and the weather was rubbish but we all thoroughly enjoyed it. I won't go into too much detail not to ruin the surprise, but we've done a few of these and I would definitely recommend agent November and look forward to trying another one!

A perfect afternoon with friends in London. What a fun afternoon! The venue had great coffee and food. The time we spent there was full of action. Show up with a good attitude and a be ready for a fun time. We stopped by in the afternoon before going on a long walk around town and spending an evening in the theater - was the perfect thing to get the day started. If I lived in London, I would definitely go to some of the other adventures. A great day for tourists, friends, family, or even a random group of people to have a good time!
So good!. Fantastic, fast paced, well organised and lots of fun! Can't recommend enough!Brilliant for groups of friends and for something a bit different

Great fun with the Rainbow Syndicate!. Had a wonderful time with this clue-solving/Scavenger-hint type game with Agents Echo and November. We really enjoyed that it was all over a neighborhood and the game was very well thought out. I would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys active games!

Cracked the egg hunt this year!. Went looking for a fun activity Easter Sunday for family and friends and found Agent November. Mission Major Ex-Plow-Shun was great fun from start to finish and well thought out in terms of challenge, time needed and location. Will be back to try another mission.

Dial N(athan) for Murder. Received a gift voucher for an Agent November game as a birthday present, and had a fantastic time compiling a team and picking our challenge! We went for the "5 brain" complexity of the murder mystery and were not disappointed; a great fusion of immersive theatre and puzzle solving that kept us all engrossed. Really nice details and some great logic problems to solve - highly recommended as a fun day out.

Can't recommend enough - absolutely brilliant. This is my third escape challenge, and I thought it was absolutely brilliant. We were a team of five adults and we picked the indoor escape which Agent November combines with a lunch in a pub. The whole thing was absolutely brilliant. I don't want to give anything away, but the food was great, the location perfect and the challenge itself was one of the hardest but most satisfying that I've completed. There's so much to get done that working together is crucial. We really liked the way that the whole experience from the first to the last second of being at the location was part of the story. Really, really memorable day out with some great friends. Thanks, Agent November!

Daughter's 14th birthday surprise weekend.... This was a brilliantly put together detective game. Agent November was lovely and kindly gave nudges in the right direction where required which helped three teenage girls and a mum stop London from being attacked by the disgruntled Mr X Plow Shun with 16 seconds to spare! I'm now very tempted to try another one of his challenges - especially if next time ww could do a it with the mums vs the dads vs the kids! #competitivemum

Something different to do with your friends!. We are a geeky group of friends, we love games and puzzles and have done a few treasure hunts around London. We had a great time doing this and would definitely recommend it to others!It's well worth the money, you can see how much time and effort goes in to each one so the price divided by 6 of you is affordable.We played Major X Ploshon, it was alot harder than we had anticipated and it really pushed our mental capacity. I dont want to tell you too much as I dont want to spoil any suprises but I will say that the use of walky talkies was def a highlight which the whole group were raving about.The pub where we met was very nice and worth a mention. The barmaid couldnt crack a smile which was a shame but there was a great selection of food and ales, somewhere we could have pitched up all day.Do it before the price goes up! x

Great fun - we laughed a lot!. This (be a detective - solve a crime) was a surprise birthday activity for me, organised by my two grown-up children; so just the three of us taking part, but could have easily involved more folk. What a great idea. Really good fun. Gets your brain cells ticking over. Fab meeting venue too. Absolutely loved it.

Fantastic, fun - will definitely be back!. We are still buzzing from our fab night at Agent November's Murder Mystery yesterday.Agent November himself really sets the scene and the puzzles are ingenious! Even though we didn't quite solve the crime, we had a great evening and will definitely be back to take on one of his other mysteries! 2 of us had done an escape room before, 2 hadn't but it didn't make any difference as everyone gets stuck know in in their own way. The Somerstown Coffee House is a great location for a pre-puzzle drink but also perfectly fits the murder mystery story - and the food is delicious! We stayed around in the room for about 2 hours afterwards chatting, figuring out where we went wrong in our investigations and just enjoying the atmosphere. There were 4 in our party and I would not want too many more doing the same puzzle. £40 might seem expensive for one person's evening entertainment but considering £15 of that is first food, £25 is great value!We have already been on the website to see which we will be doing next!Thanks for a great evening and see you soon!
Great Birthday party for my 10year old Son. This was a lot of fun for my son and his friends to do - none of them had done anything like this before and all of them are desperate to do another again

Great fun!. Took part in the murder mystery for my birthday. It was a great event and something a little different to make it worthwhile for friends travelling!The whole evening was a great experience and different to most of the other escape games I've done (& I've tried quite a few!) Agent Nathan met us at the venue and maintained character so well throughout it really added to the overall experience!During the organisational process he was great at responding to my queries and dealing with all the various requests. He even recommended nearby places for us to move on to celebrate when we'd successfully solved the mystery!!!Overall a brilliant experience that I'd highly recommend to anyone who enjoys puzzles!

Spies in the maling. Great fun! A group of 6 of us took on Agent November's challenge and it was a fantastic way to spend the afternoon working as a team. Agent November really sets the mood for the event right from booking and the clues are very clever. I would definitely recommend Agent November games for anyone looking for something a bit different.

Fantastic experience- highly recommended. Agent November organised 2 Major X Plow-Shun games to run for me simultaneously for my birthday party. He was really helpful and informative and was quick to get back to all of my queries in the lead up to the event. Even when it was predicted to rain last minute, he offered a number of alternatives in case we needed to stay inside which was very helpful. (Only rained for a couple of minutes in the end so did the whole game outside!). The cafe where the game starts is lovely and the parks where the rest of the games happen is an ideal location. As for the games themselves, I totally did not know what to expect but all I can say is that it was really fantastic and so much fun!!! Everybody in my group had a great time, with one of my friends even saying it's the 'best game he has experienced as an adult'.The way it is put together is witty and challenging but really exciting at the same time. I could not recommend it more highly. There are clues, things to think about under pressure, things to find. All really great fun.Anyone who likes treasure hunts, escape rooms or just a fun game, you will love this!!

Top Quality Team Bonding & Stag Party Fun. I took a couple of our teams from work on a team bonding exercise and remembered a friend from the running club- Agent November himself- so thought I'd give it a try.We split into 2 teams, both doing the same puzzle but in different bits of London. We all got stuck into the puzzles even though it was a typical, dreary, damp London afternoon (a little bit of rain, overcast and windy). Excellent fun was had all round- the puzzles are demanding, the 'Agent' supervisors are fun and engaging and the whole experience is well organised and thought through.This is a much better idea than the 'escape rooms' as you can run around and shout and chat on the walkie talkies- but of course you're at mercy of the weather.I'll definitely be recommending this (already have in fact) and will hopefully be doing some of the other puzzles in the future.

Great team bonding exercise. We went on an Agent November mission yesterday morning as an away-morning for our team. It was very engaging and thought provoking, and we were very satisfied to finish with time to spare!Agent Echo (Edward) was a great host and helped us along the way when we needed it.Would recommend to anyone who is fond of puzzles, cracking codes, and saving London, of course!

Amazing Murder Mystery on location. Agent November organised a Murder Mystery on location at our Google offices, which I can warmly recommend as a team activity. The clues were well thought out, execution was perfect, and everyone had a blast solving the mystery! Thank you!

Amazing Experience. I have now done all 3 Agent November adventures and every single one is brilliant. Today we did the murder mystery - a sort of murder mystery with escape room. We so enjoyed it, I cannot recommend this highly enough!

Brilliant escape game. I have now done three different Agent November games, two outdoors and one indoors, with a variety of teammates, 4 of us per team each time, and they have all been great fun. Even the wet weather of the outdoor one we did in November didn't spoil it (I've resisted the temptation to write "failed to dampen our spirits". Oh, damn, I almost resisted). Today we did "Keep Calm and Trust November", which was indoors and included an excellent lunch in the Somerstown coffee house. We just managed to solve the clues with about 30 seconds left to go. I'd definitely recommend all three of the games.

Couldn't recommend this enough!. My partner and I have done a good few escape rooms now and decided to book one for his brother and his wife and children (9 and 13). We decided on this one partly due to the fact that they, unlike many, allowed a group of 6 people, but mainly because of the brilliant reviews....please ignore the only bad review on here which is completely unfair, and frankly unhelpful, as the writer did not even play the game!We booked it for 2pm and were told to be at a certain location by this time. We got there early and had some lunch (which comes highly recommended!)and then the fun began!Right from the off there were clues and puzzles to solve. Ones that the kids could get heavily involved in but also more difficult ones for the oldies to dig their teeth into. The kids especially enjoyed watching their parents running around a park talking to each other with walkie talkies. The experience lasted about an hour and a half and we loved every second of it.....especially the last 20 where we basked in glory having solved it by the skin of our teeth!!A huge thank you to Agent November who looked after us all very well. Of all the escape games that we've played this is definitely one of the best!

Excellent Adventure!. This was a really fun birthday surprise for my brother! We all enjoyed following the clues and felt like we were really on a mission! I dont want to spoil the surprise or reveal any clues but I can highly recomend this as a good bit of fun! We ranged in age from 25-53 and all enjoyed it equally!

really smart and fun. I went there twice in a week, first time in a big group, and second time (and second mission) we were only two. Both times were brilliant, it's really smartly done and will keep your brain busy for an hour. I definitely recommend it.

Fun, gives adrenaline, exercise, makes you feel like you are on a real mission. This has to be one of the best indoor/outdoor mysteries I have ever done. The game takes place in Euston firstly in a Coffee House and then in a park) Me and my friends played the Major X Plow-Shun challenge. We had to help save the world from a nuclear destruction from Major X Plow-Shiun. We had to find objects and solve clues to crack the code to disarm the nuclear device. You are firstly met by Agent November where you are briefed, given a waiver to sign, create you team name and given a choice of different detective hats to wear throughout your mission and walkie-talkies. No smartphones needed. You are then handed a letter this will then lead you onto seek out hidden objects around the coffee house. Once all the objects are found you are then given a map to a park (no bigger than a football field). This is then where we stayed to solve clues and seek out keys which was hidden everywhere within the park. The puzzles vary from picture puzzles, props etc. to help you solve and crack the code to disarm the device and save the world. Some of the clues given you have to have a collective imagination and think outside the box to solve. If at anytime we got stuck Agent November was there for brief guidance. We just ran out of time within seconds so alas the world was destroyed. I really felt like I was Aneka from Challenge Aneka but a detective version. I highly recommend to anyone that loves mysteries / treasure hunts.

Excellent afternoon being a secret agent!. A group of friends solving a mixture of puzzles within a time frame. Excellently organised.
Everything needed is provided by agent November.
It lasted between 1h30-2h, perfect amount of time.
We met in a pub before to have a few drinks.

Great fun, not least for escape room fans. I'd recommend an Agent November mission to people seeking a puzzle-based adventure, anyone who's ever secretly wanted to be a spy (and haven't we all?), as well as escape room enthusiasts looking for something familiar yet different. The experience is a great mix of solving clues, paying attention to your surroundings, espionage (of sorts), and some good old-fashioned intuition -- all while wearing a stylish trilby.Our Major X Plow-Shun mission began with a clandestine rendezvous and some initial indoor clue-following, which was a fun way to start and a good warm-up for beginners. Then it was off to begin the mission in earnest, under the friendly eye of Agent November himself (who later put up with a lot of silliness that went on via walkie-talkie).There's something for everyone to do and the minutes fly by -- our team of four was kept busy, without the tasks ever seeming too tedious. Even an experienced escape room fan should find plenty that's original and fun in this mission; I especially enjoyed some of the 'investigative' work that comes in later.It was great to save London in the end, of course, but it would have been a worthwhile even if we hadn't. Fun, appropriately challenging, yet still suitable for all levels of experience/activity (I will confess to being the person who did the least running around in my group). Sadly, I'm not based in London, but I'm definitely hoping to take on another mission when I'm next in the country!

Brilliant team event!. I wanted to do something fun but interactive for my work team, and after searching online found the Agent November website. It looked ideal, and after straightforward communication with Nathan we completed our five missions on Friday. All the feedback from my guys has been outstanding - we had a whale of a time!! I personally did the murder mystery which was really good fun. I was also very impressed with the fantastic organisation that clearly went into running five simultaneous games. I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone, and it was excellent value for money.

Really fun activity for hen weekend. Took part in Agent November as part of my hen weekend celebrations with my family. Nathan put so much effort in to organising to run two of the Major X Plow Shun games for us at the same time so we could compete in teams. We all had a fantastic time running around trying to solve the clues! It was a lot of fun, very well thought out and planned, with fun ways to get everyone in to character. Made my weekend very memorable and would highly recommend. Thanks Agent November!

Hilarious Hen Do Activity . What a fantastic activity. Fabulous pub to start off in with loads of giggles following as we failed to nominate a leader & just jumped in feet first. Nathan was great fun & tolerated all my ridiculous questions asked over the spy radios - can't say my favourite part as don't want to ruin any surprises but there are lots of them & I loved every minute. Thank you!!

So much fun! For 6 Adults!. This was so much fun. We didn't know what to expect whether it was be for kids and we'd not enjoy it but oh my goodness it was great! Would definitely do another one of agent November's cases on another occasion! Thanks Agent November!

Agent November. We did this as a family, with three children aged 13, 12 and 9. Loads of fun, and with some helpful hints along the way from Agent November, we managed to diffuse the bomb with 39 seconds to spare! All in all a very different, and fun thing to do in London, and it got all the children excited and running around to solve clues.Highly recommend, especially on a lovely summers day, as it takes place outside.

Book Now!!. We traveled to London, where we were going to see a West End show, and whilst we were there, my mum suggested that we could try a 'spy challenge' as she phrased it. Of course, being teenagers, we groaned, but it was one of the best things I've done! Agent November, or Nathan, was funny and a great character, really bringing the spy world to life. The puzzles themselves were inventive and challenging, forcing you to think creatively and re-examine things in new ways. If you can, do! It was the best fun that I've had with my family for a while!

Amazing afternoon's entertainment. We had my cousins over from Canada and were looking to do something different in London that was away from the normal tourist trail and stumbled across this.We did the Rainbow Syndicate mission and had an absolute blast. The puzzles were perfectly targeted so we got them all, even if we needed a little nudge every now and then. Some of the injects were brilliant and it was really well organised and run.We managed to crack the case with minutes to spare, we all ached from laughing and stayed for a well earned pint at the end, we'd had that much fun!

Murder Mystery- fantastic fun. Just finished the new game- Murder Mystery. We found the antidote! Absolutely fantastic experience, we had so much fun and turns out we're smarter than we expected! The level of planning and detail is amazing and Agent Nathan was great fun. Original, challenging and we had a private dining room after. Would highly recommend.
Great fun!. Great, well designed games for some fantastic fun with friends. Right level of difficulty to get the cogs in your brain turn but without giving you a headache. ACE!
Agent November. Really good afternoon exploring the local area, finding clues and working together to solve the mystery!

Fun afternoon activity. Great as team building experience, or just a fun afternoon activity for you and your friends.
Competitive, funny and challenging.

Great concept. Had a great experience taking part in one of the Agent November missions with a group of friends. Very well organised, the right level of difficultly, and really good fun.
