Would highly recommend giving it a go - particularly in the summer months when the outside location gives it an edge over the other similar experiences avaliable in London. Host also fantastic.

An exciting, fun and different experience. This was an excellent experience. There were 12 of us in a group and we all had a really good time. We had a mix of ages and everyone enjoyed themselves. The people who organised it are excellent and will make sure everyone gets involved. I strongly recommend this to anyone looking for something interesting to do. It is suitable for all different sorts of groups.

A wicked experience!. 5 of my friends and I set across London to foil the deadly Rainbow Squad, you'll all be pleased to hear that they were foiled in their plots! We all had a great time and were really impressed with how well the time had been planned and executed. I would definitely recommend the experience and will be looking to get another group together for some of the other missions! Well done Agent November!

Well planned, very clever and great fun. We completed the Rainbow Syndicate game as a birthday event for my Husband. From the moment we were given the first envelope which contained puzzles, room plans and a key, we were in the zone. We had to track down the gang’s weapons and swag. The puzzles had us walking through the local streets, searching for clues. It was very well planned, so much more than a treasure hunt. The pace was good, we felt under pressure but everyone could contribute, our group’s ages ranged from mid 40s to 70 and we all had a fantastic time. We managed to track down the gang with minutes to spare and we recovered the gold. We'll be back to try another game soon. I'll definitely be recommending it to friends.

Cracking activity!. Took part in Agent November as part of a hen party and we had a great time (and managed to save London from oblivion too, which is always nice). Really well structured, cleverly thought out game run by an affable and enthusiasic chap. Can't wait to try his other puzzle adventures!

Fantastic!. A group of 5 of us successfully saved London from a crazed terrorist! I don't want to give too much away so as not to spoil it for others but the entire mission was energetic, innovative and fun and really really enjoyable! We can't wait to go back and take on the Rainbow syndicate!

Crystal Maze meets Spy Mission. We did this for a friend's stag do and had a blast saving London from the deranged Major X Plow-Shun. The set up was very well done- it had obviously taken a lot of time and effort to make it an immersive experience- and the puzzles were a good range of difficulties so it engaged everyone in the party. Agent November was friendly but professional and helped to keep things moving. We're already considering using one of the other missions as an excuse for a reunion later in the year!

So much fun!!!. The first time we've ever done something like this and it was amazing!!! Even though we died after not stopping the bomb in time the whole experience was so much fun and agent November himself was a wonderful host! Obviously a huge amount of time and effort had gone into making the adventure as detailed and intricate as possible. 5 more minutes and we would have cracked it I'm sure! Would recommend it to anyone as children would love to run around the park looking for clues and less mobile people would be able to do a lot of the puzzle solving too.

Great fun.  We attempted the mission as a couple and even though we didn't quite complete it, we had a great time. Very well thought out and organised game. Agent November was also very friendly and helpful. We will be going back to attempt more missions.  Highly recommend.

Great fun and well executed!. 5 of my friends and I signed up to complete Agent November's adventure one Sunday afternoon with little knowledge of what to expect. The game was very well organised and executed, and Agent November himself was friendly, fun and helpful.We thoroughly enjoyed the game and would definitely recommend it to others as an enjoyable way to pass a Sunday afternoon!

Awesome!!. I booked this for approx 30 of my team to do a whole day of team activities - we did all 3 of the missions - they are all different, challenging and a MASSIVE amount of fun.We also organised food and drink through these guys, which made it an absolute breeze to have a corporate team day to remember.Massive thanks to Agent November for everything, get busy with creating more missions - we will be back to break yet more world records :o)

You think you are smart enough? I challenge you!. A great puzzle solving experience that requires a serious amount of though. Will you be able to prevent a big explosion in London? Well, we didn't, but we did have an amazing time! Agents November and Lima did their best to guide us but also not to spoil the fun! I am definately going back to try the other puzzles. I will get my revenge! :P Thank you for a wonderful time Agents!

So much fun!. We found this attraction through trip advisor and decided to do it for a friends birthday on a Saturday afternoon. Didn't really know what to expect (which made it even better). Very exciting and funny! We really got into a roles and couldn't stop laughing about it for the rest of the day. Great activity! Looking forward to doing other activities by agent November!

A day to remember. This is a must do for all ages! My husband and I took my younger siblings; ages 9, 12 and 14. We had the most incredible time solving the puzzle! An amazing and unique way to spend time with family! We will definitely return to do one of the other scavenger hunts! Thank you so much to Agent Nathan for guiding us through the day!

The best outdoors puzzle solving game in London!!. We were celebrating my birthday party. I didn't know where my friends where driving me and it turned out to be one of the most enjoyable puzzle solving games I've ever played. It wasn't limited to several rooms as usual and we had to walk to gather all the pieces to solve the different puzzles. Nathan, the organiser, kept us engaged all the time with the theme and everyone had a blast. 100% recommendable

What a fab GIRLY evening with Agent November. A girly group of 10 meeting up for reunion after a very long time over the Rainbow Syndicate Mission. What a lovely and entertaining evening that left us chatting about it for days and everyone who saw the pictures were intrigued too. Agent November provides the hats and macs for the real experience and it is very real. We needed a fair bit of help as could not stop giggling all night. Super bonding experience, very well planned and thought out and Nathan is extremely kind and helpful.

Puzzling in the sun . If you're a fan of solving puzzles and/or disarming bombs then Agent November is for you. As big escape game fans (having done all of Clue Quest and Hint Hunt) we fancied Agent November - specifically Major X-Plow-Shun - as it looked to take the same recipie but add in some outdoor action. Happy to say it's great fun and definitely worth doing. We were lucky in that it stayed clear but Agent November does carry umbrellas if you need them. He also has an original model ipad which is definitely worth its weight in gold. Agent November - highly recommended. And good luck in beating our time - we did it with nine minutes to spare, a new record!

Great Fun!!. My friends and I had a great time doing Agent November. It was so well put together and we did it with 34seconds to spare!! Great laugh as well has making you focus on the task at hand. Highly recommend it for a something different to do in London and to do with your friends. Thank you to Agent November!!
Excellent.. Great game. Well constructed. Not too easy, not too difficult. Just right. I wish that he had more as I would love to do it again!

Novel and heaps of fun!. A group of 7 of us did the rainbow syndicate game and thoroughly enjoyed it. It's such a fun and novel way to enjoy London and I loved how throughout the experience you never knew what was coming. Very well organised and good value for money.
The great game. We were a team of 4 vs major x. Brilliantly constructed game. Well thought out and well mentored by Agent November.

Incredibly fun game!. Agent November was an exhilarating clue-hunt game. Brilliantly thought out and well-hosted by agent November himself, I'd highly recommend this experience as one of the most fun things to do in London. Do remember to wrap up warm though!

Definitely go . Did this today (feb 1) with 5 friends - great fun, well organised and something a little different to all the escape room games popping up. Not as physical as you might think, so I wouldn't worry about that. Wear warm clothes and sensible shoes! I hope agent November does really well, it deserves to. Thanks.

Hillarious!!!. Great fun from this experience and even more looking at Agent November's face while we where running like crazy trying to find the clues. We enjoyed the whole thing since the beginning! And Agent November helped a lot!

Amazing, Brain-teasing puzzle. I really enjoyed this along with my friends. There is lots of thinking and puzzles which is a great change to the other street games which generally involve a lot of running. Having said that, the tension really hits as the timer ticks down. We managed to finish the puzzle with just 24 seconds on the clock. Phew!! Would definitely recommend to anyone for a team building and exciting activity with a bit of a difference. The whole event is very well organised and at no time are you abandoned which can happen with some other street games. The whole game is safe and enjoyable for all ages. Highly recommended. Need more games like this!

Fab day!. We did this activity for our work Christmas party and it was amazing! It was a fun and different challenge for a work event, very well thought through with great props and clues.We are really looking forward to his next activity. Definitely recommend for work party, birthdays or even stag and hen party!Started in the pub so was easy access to toilets and to get a drink/food beforehand.

Be a spy for a couple of hours. Come on, we all want to be spies - fancy finding clues and deducing questions for a couple of hours in London? Got a few of you that want to work together (we had 6), OK working to a deadline - some and save London from the evil genius who wants to blow up the city.We had a great time, with huge tension at the end and finally finished with less than one minute to go - All able assisted by Agent November himself. Especially good if you are looking for something to do in London during the day.

Sure why wouldn't you?!. There were 6 of us in our late 20's working together to find passwords, codes, clues and solve riddles before the 60-minute ticking time bomb went off. We figured it out with 8 seconds to go!! Agent November had it well organised so that you immediately felt part of the excitement.A great game to play if you have an afternoon in London. I would highly recommend getting involved. Thanks again for a great time Agent November!

Fantastic fun!. Agent November game makes a nice change from the traditional escape games, we didn't know what to expect and the multiple locations made it really interesting. I would advise playing with more than 2 people - we almost succeeded the goal (about 5 minutes more and we'd have got it) but we had a really great time. The theme/back story is good and the games are cleverly set around the locations. Hints were only given when we really needed which was great. Be prepared to run around and become detectives! One of the best games I have played, definitely worth seeking out in London.

Fun and unique experience. A fun and original experience in London - four of us in early 30s played. While we only spent 90 minutes with Agent November the experience was a talking point for the rest of the day.One of us was initially pretty sceptical (perhaps a couple more pre-drinks might have helped) but eventually even she got well into solving the clues. Highly recommended. Would probably work quite well as a corporate team building exercise for a small team too.

Great fun!. I took part in Agent November last week with my family. We like to do adventure/escape activities so this was exactly what we were looking for. I loved the spy theme - it was great to go charging around finding clues and working out puzzles. It was just the right balance of difficult to be challenging but without being impossible to work out. I would definitely recommend if you like to solve puzzles against the clock whilst trying to work cohesively with your family or friends!

Excellent Team Fun. Well organised and thoroughly entertaining! I've tried a few puzzle rooms/games and this is definitely one of my favourites. We had a blast today and I would definitely recommend to check it out.

Fabulous and Fun. My group of 6 played the Agent November game on Monday and it was excellent! From finding clues hidden in different locations, working out hints and uncovering unformation, the time flew by as we raced to complete our task! It was just hard enough to make it challenging and encouraging us to think, but not so hard that it seemed impossible. I'd like to say we completed the task in time but...well, we almost did! Everybody had a great time and we talked about how wonderful it was for the rest of the day. I would definitely recommend Agent November to anybody looking for something a bit different to do in London, or for people who enjoy treasure hunts/quizes, etc. An awesome time!

Very well put together and a blast to play. Played with friends this weekend and had a great time. We've done pretty much all of the puzzle/escape rooms in London and quite a few around Europe and this one ranks among the top! We loved the multiple locations, the outdoor aspect of it (including the walkie talkies!), the story-line, and how well the puzzles flowed together. Overall just a blast to play. Really looking forward to playing their other puzzle and any new ones they open up!

Unique and fun!. A slight twist to the traditional Escape rooms popping up all over London and just as fun. You have an hour to save the world, you'll have to find the details out yourself! Great storyline and well planned / executed. Would highly recommend for a fun afternoon activity and/or team building event.

One of the best puzzle games!. My friends and I have done most of the puzzle rooms/escape games around London, and this is one if the best- on par with Hint Hunt and Clue Quest, but additionally exciting because it's outdoors and in real life. Good story line and actually challenging clues!

Great way to explore London. Like all the best days, this one began in the pub. I played Agent November's spinoff game "the Rainbow Syndicate" with a group of friends. The Rainbow Syndicate had robbed the pub but left some clues as to their whereabouts and after a quick hunt around the pub we were off on the streets of North London following the clues, solving puzzles and hunting down the robbers against the clock all the time with Agent November keeping a watchful eye over us to prevent us straying too far off course. It's difficult to say much more without giving the game away, but it's a great way to spend an hour or so with a group of friends, using your brains and noticing things in London that otherwise you wouldn't give a second thought to. I'm hoping to go back and play the main Agent November game soon.

Brilliant alternative fun.. A friend asked me to go along with him to Agent November. We didn't know the other people playing, but that didn't matter. We all worked together well playing the game and in the end we solved it with less than a minute left on the clock. Great fun, that I would recomend to anybody.

Excellent Original Fun. An excellent afternoon out. Agent November is a great activity for smallish groups. Very original and well planned, if you fancy yourself as a bit of a sleuth then you'll love it!
A good range of clue finding, using your initiative and problem solving; thank you Agent November!

Great fun for team building or for pleasure alone. My colleagues and I had really rich and engaging experience with Agent November. A great set up starting with some treasure hunting in the Doric Arch pub followed by the main bomb-disarming task in great surroundings.The puzzles were stretching and very much needed a collective imagination to solve. We completed the task with fewer than 5 minutes to go and the tension was palpable but with a gentle nudge from Agent N, we saved the city.Very much recommend it if you'd like something original and creative to do in London

A most excellent afternoon out. This was a well thought out puzzle solving game. Clues were intricate and taxing. The added time dimension tests the team. We all really enjoyed it despite it raining during our hour.

Alot of fun and something a little different.... Before going I have to admit I wasn't quite sure what to expect. The outcome however was a great surprise. Its hard to tell you about it without spoiling the enjoyment that is to come but if you're looking for something fun to do in London which is a little bit interesting, a little bit different, gets your mind working, challenging (without being overly so) and fun then this may be the activity for you. This is something you could easily do with a group of friends as well as with your family or both if you so wish. This is honestly something I tell my friends they should do when they come to London.

Your London activity solution!. A maniacal and diabolical baddie has left clues which he believes no one can solve....or can they? London is on the line - only your intelligence and quick thinking stands between you and the end of the city. Good luck! Played this with my 12 year old son and we both really enjoyed it.

Highly recommend. Agent November was a fun event and would be great for all ages. The game is really clever and we had a good laugh running around solving puzzles with the group. There was so much going on simultaneously you really had to work together to figure it out in the time limit. We all went down to the pub afterwards and kept talking about it. My friends and I were looking for something different to do and this was just the ticket. I'd love to take my family when they visit.

Fun experience. I was trying to think of something different for my boyfriend and I to do on a Sunday afternoon- I was looking at escape rooms and this is definitely more affordable than most at about £22 each rather than £40 as I had seen some priced at. I've never done anything like this before and was unsurprisingly naff at solving the puzzle (we didn't complete it), I feel part of this was due to the fact we were paired with another couple and we didn't all work together. Overall I thought it was very intriguing and exciting and Gabriel was excellent. If I were to go again I would go with friends or family to work as a team. I would definitely recommend as something a bit different to try! Also, the pub is fantastic for a drink after!
ACE. Great fun, a little creepy, a little sexy and well worth it. Gabriel our host was amazing. We did the one in east london! 'Peoples park tavern' Vicky park.

Incredible!. Me and my friends had the BEST time solving Lady Chastity's devilish riddles! There is clearly a tremendous amount of effort put into designing the game and the host, Gabriel, really made the whole experience come to life. I challenge you to find a more intense, entertaining, exciting way to spend an hour that rewards your efforts with a bottle of wine at the end! Don't hesitate. Book a spot right now.

A great way to spend an hour. Pros = Price was very reasonable, Puzzle was interesting and pretty challenging, Host (Gabriel) was great, atmosphere was very good (pervading sense of tension without resorting to cheap jump scares). A bottle of wine to be won if you complete the puzzle (which is a nice touch).Cons = The pub was a bit busy when we did it (Sunday afternoon). If you fancy a pint and some food afterwards, consider timing (as otherwise you will likely be waiting around for some time).Verdict = A very pleasant way to spend a hour. This is the best puzzle room I have done in London.

Worth a visit!. I had done a few escape rooms and this was definitely one of the better (and harder!) ones.A lot of effort has clearly gone into the formulation of this game. The host and room itself were excellent and very immersive. The clues were pretty difficult and it was very hot on the room so don't wear too many layers!The pub in which the room is located nice (although the music was pretty loud so we struggled to have a chat before the room) and there is an awesome arcade area upstairs.Worth a visit!
Great group activity!. Brilliant experience as an added element to a night out. Exciting clues and story and Gabriel was great and stayed in character the whole time - with good wit and humour

Too exciting! . A fantastic experience. Went with friends and the staff member who looked after us was brilliant. AND WE WON.with only 8 seconds spare it was very close we had a great time big BIG thanks to Gabriel.

Great Experience - Escapism At Its Best. I bought this for my boyfriend as quirky anniversary present - and months later we are still raving about how great it was, and are talking about booking it again with the whole family! Gabriel is a great host, funny and on hand to help if you get stuck with the clues. We were also really impressed that our group got given 2 bottles of wine at the end, one for us and one for the group of four who did it with us. I was tentative about doing this, as I'm easily spooked, but I highly recommend giving this a go! Escapism at its greatest!

A brilliant evening. Superbly done and Gabriel was brilliant.. If you haven't tried one of these. You must do it. The pub it's located in is a marvellous mix of shabby chic. Looks thrown together but I bet it's had millions spent on it. And the most amazing gin selection. Best garden area I've ever seen.

So much fun!!. This was my first escape room experience and it was brilliant! Being a bit of a claustrophobe, the idea of unlocking a bottle of wine was much more reassuring than being locked in a small, dark room. Gabriel was excellent and the clues were really challenging. Have already recommended to everyone I know!

Enjoyable Mystery solving - Pub has good burgers too. The Peoples Park Tavern is a really cool space, it's nice to go before the mystery room to hang out in the outside area if possible! The mystery game was fun and not quite as intense as other escape rooms can be. It was an interesting room and Gabriel was an excellent host. Winning the wine was a real plus!

Fun, scary, well done!. The experience was great, Gabriel is really good at creating the mood. This was my first escape room experience so I was fumbling around quite a bit but Gabriel was always giving us a push in the right direction. Definitely doing one again as soon as possible!

Good fun. Brilliant themed escape game. Gabriel our host stayed in character throughout. Small very hot room. The hour of clue solving whizzed by. Lots of red herrings thrown in to keep you guessing. We went as a family of 5 so had the room to ourselves. If you go as a couple they do say that they may fill the room with others. I personally wouldn't want to do it with people I don't have a very good relationship with. If nothing else if you do win, how do you share the bottle of wine prize?

A fine Vintage of an Escape Game!. This was a brilliantly themed escape game! The Gamesmaster Gabriel gave us a wonderful introduction to the wolrd of the game, perfectly pitching the mood. The game was fluid, connected it's puzzles and themes well, and was made to a high standard. It was my first escape game (despite having worked in the Secret Studio for a good while) and I couldn't have had a better introduction!

Exiting experience. I heard about puzzle rooms about a year ago and I really wanted to experience it myself. My partner and I are foreigners and probably that is why it was challenging for us to solve the clues. However our host Gabriel was extremely helpful and as a result we came back home with a bottle from the Lady Chastity's Reserve. We did not even understood how fast the time flue. Honestly when we solved the last riddle, we were very disappointed that it has finished. We were completely rapt in the story and the room. We can not wait for the next room to be built. Thank you for the experience. :)
Brilliant hour!. A great experience and the hour flew by in no time as we scrambled to solve the clues to succeed. Re Gabriel - what a wonderful actor. We'll be back next year to achieve the bottle!

Brilliant stuff. I booked this as part of a stag do. While I wouldn't advise having too many beers before you go - the room is sweltering and you need to be super sharp to finish it - it was an awesome idea. The clues are so literal, and even though we overthought some of them, we were really impressed with the way it was set up.Book well in advance as spaces go quickly. If you're there on a Saturday book a table in the bar (the Four Thieves) as it gets packed out.

Absolutely Fantastic. Our host Gabriel instantly set the scene and we were all instantly hooked by the mission!The puzzle was challenging and we were very close to not succeeding which added to the sense of achievement when we solved the mystery. Highly recommended.

The Best Puzzle Room in London. I've done 5 puzzle rooms in London and this is by far and away my team's favourite one. From the start, it's set in a pub. This put us off at first but it's actually a brilliant idea as it's a good place to meet, eat, and have a pre or post event drink. There's also an awesome retro arcade in the pub!It's close to a station, a short 5 minutes walk from Clapham Junction.Secondly you're greeted by an excellent, and scary lady called Gabriel who really sets the scene. The room itself is dark, dingy, smokey and so well decorated. The puzzles are tough but fun and solvable, and the chain of solving is well thought out.It even gives you a prize if you're lucky enough to win.I can't recommend this place enough!

Excellent evening. What a good laugh! A group of my friends and I booked the escape room on a whim as a surprise for one of my friend's birthday and we won!!! This is great for bonding and team building with your friends. The story was brilliant, set was incredible and it was definitely worth the money! Gabriel (the character who guides you through the clues) was genius! Very helpful but you didn't feel like he was interrupting your game. One little mention is that the room does get pretty hot! This is mainly due to all the brains working so hard on the clues ;) Make sure you dress in light clothing. I would 100% recommend this to everyone. It would be great for friends night out, hen/stag parties, couples and work colleagues.

Amazingly good fun. We visited Lady Chastity as a couple for a birthday treat and managed to prize the bottle from Lady Chastity with just 15 seconds to spare. Fantastically good fun and the host Gabrielle was awesome...loved him. I would highly recommend booking this for a date night with a difference you will love it.
A lot of fun. Truly great, it was the first time we did one of these. The hour passed very quickly, and it is so much fun to keep advancing and discovering the new clues. Highly recommended!

Great experience. Really fun day out for my birthday with some friends, very reasonably priced compared to escape rooms I've done previously in London. Hosts were fantastic and room very nicely themed.One thing that was frustrating was clues that were read aloud were said in a very long-winded poetic way and we were like 'come on get on with it you're using our time'.Great pub as well with really nice garden for a few beers in the sunshine

Lots of fun, fantastic experience. We're big escape room fans and do them all the time at home, so we wanted to try one on our trip abroad. Lady Chastity's Reserve was not only one of the most reasonably priced, it was a brilliant time. Our host was excellent; he stayed in character very well (I suspect he may be trying to make a go as an actor) and was very funny and friendly. We were admittedly also very fond of him because he knew we were Canadian and didn't mistakenly call us American.)The room itself was immersive, fantastically decorated, just the right amount of creepy, and challenging enough to be fun but not frustrating. All of the puzzles were well laid out and when we asked for hints they were helpful but not a dead giveaway. All in all, I would happily recommend Lady Chastity's Reserve as an excellent time, and I can't commend our host enough. He really made the experience for us.
Ruddy good fun. A great way to spend an hour.The puzzles are challenging without being too difficult, and the tension ratchets up as time runs out, but the brilliant Gabriel is on hand to help.

Belter of a day. This was my first experience of a room escape activity and it was a great introduction! The puzzles were challenging but between 4 of us we got there in the end. I'm slightly disappointed to read that other people won Lady chastity's bottle of wine. I was informed I had won the last one in existence. It's definitely worth going even if I have taken the last bottle of wine

Fun hour, Gabriel is great!. Both my husband and I have done a few escape rooms but never together so we thought we'd give it a go & hope it didn't end in divorce! We were hoping it would just be us but of course there's always the chance others will be on your team if there's only 2 of you. We were joined by another couple. Gabriel was brilliant, and made it for us. It's small and dark but it's meant to be and it works well. We got out with 10 mins to go & look forward to trying out our bottle of Lady Chastity's reserve and it's aphrodisiac qualities very soon ;0)Plenty of bars\restaurants around Clapham, the one it's in looks pretty good but we already had other plans.

Absolutely well done, in character, full of surprises.... We had a group of six, and we were all busy the whole hour searching and doing things. Yes a little warm but hey is that not good, we have some summer, there are some fans in there if you have time to stand still lol. So if you are going on a hot day wear light clothing. There is a place to leave your other things safely while you play. Boy we made a mess, the clues were fun, the surprises made it even better. We all did different things rushing to sort out the answers. I enjoyed every moment, Gabrielle was so amazingly good in character and the room was also in keeping. I would recommend this as a fun evening for you and your friends. Go try it.
Specialised Best Man hunt. It was a bit hot, but they did provide fans, what i love the most is that they personalised the event and went so smoothly it was great fun and my guests enjoyed it.

Too hot and uncomfortable . We've just come out of this experience as a group of 3, joined with another couple to make a 5. The host is fantastic in character and helps add to the atmosphere but be warned - it's way too hot in that room and be prepared to not be able to see for an hour. The lighting is bad and puts a lot of strain on the eyes and despite the air conditioning units and fans, it was 5 very excited people crammed into a very tiny room for an hour - the temperature soon creeps up!There are a lot of a rules so make sure you don't break any or you do get yelled at!We weren't able to finish the puzzle and afterwards, despite asking - weren't given any more story or information so we left feeling very unfulfilled. The clues are presented in random orders and in my opinion - are not easy to follow, and I've done a few escape rooms. Puzzle wise - a hour is not enough time but after an hour, you very much need to escape for some oxygen and light...I appreciate the effort having gone into setting this up but believe it still needs some work to make it a memorable experience!

A great idea for a birthday night out. We did this in a group of 6, it was a fantastic experience, well worth the money. Without revealing too much, it's cracking cryptic codes to unlock three levels to release the prize, a bottle of wine! I would absolutely recommend. Gabriel the host was great, he was in character from the start and made us all feel on edge in the room! Although we didn't crack the code, we all had a brilliant time. Thanks Gabriel and Four Thieves!

Such a good giggle! . Went here as a couple of couples and enjoyed it immensely! We were met promptly by Gabriel our host who (in the most fabulous character) explained the what's where's do's and don'ts, then into find Lady chastitys reserve! Brilliant fun, it is hard enough to make you think but easy enough to not get too stuck and you have Gabriel to help you out, would recommend to anyone even if you're not a puzzle person for sheer fun factor! Very well thought out, plus the venue (four theives) is quirky pub that has nice food for before or after. Can't recommend enough!!

A totally new experience - do it!. Our host Gabriel set the scene perfectly and her storytelling was brilliant. She stayed in character throughout and although made us feel at ease, she also gave enough sense of urgency of the mystery we had to solve. I'd go back just to see her!The puzzles were great and pressure mounts as time ticks on.TIP - the room is boiling so don't wear many layers! Can't wait to try some more. We left on a total buzz. Pub is great fun too so worth a visit.

Amazing! . We went with 4 friends and it was an excellent game set-up and execution! Really loved it! Big fun!!! Before or after, you can have food/drinks in the nice pub/beer garden as well. We were German/French without any native speaker, so sometimes a little challenging but we made it nevertheless. Go there - big fun for the group! Can also be a great team-building activity for companies!

A great game of laughs . What an absolutely laugh this place is, clever and challenging. Although we were rubbish at most of the solving, it was so very clever and a lot of thought put into it. once we got it we weren't to bad. Extremely thrilling, mind boggling and quite hard lol. It's an hour only but it's so very very good. It's a must and a great team day out. Excellent and Gabrielle played her part so very well and convincing.

Great night with amazing host Gabriel. We had absolutely no idea what to expect but once in the game with Gabriel's brilliant narration, we were right into it. Would definitely recommend this as a fun and alternative night out. (Also the four thieves is a really cool bar, should definitely go for a couple of drinks whilst there)
Thrilling!. Very thrilling, and fun for a group of adults. A bit difficult!! but that's part of the fun. not for the the faint hearted and claustrophobes :)

Great fun room and great host Gabriel. Loved the room and especially loved Gabriel - he was an amazing actor and very amusing. Thought he gave us a few too many clues but overall the room was really fun and very clever. It's also a really cool pub that the room is in. We were expecting a dingy weird pub but it was actually lovely - great outside area and even their own home brewed beer!

A right laugh. As part of a group of 6 girls in their late 20s this was a hilarious outing! we're all a bit jumpy and the experience gave us a chance to indulge in lots of silliness and cackling. Gabriel was great at setting the tone, and though it was boiling in the room (one of the hottest days of July) we all felt like this added to the atmosphere! Just book in some time afterwards to sit and cool down with one of the frozen margaritas or an aperol spritz afterwards in the pub!

World class puzzle room. Having played puzzle rooms around the world, I'm must say this is the best and most original I've been to. Immersive game play, brilliantly scripted and fantastically hosted, I can't recommend it strongly enough. The Four Thieves is also a great pub to start and end your adventure. Suitable for beginners, but probably not suitable for thick people.

Great, original new idea and a fun, different way to spend an evening!. I was bought this as a birthday present recently and had no idea what to expect. The game itself was very, very fun, really quite hard and pretty spooky too. The host, Gabriel, was a great character and was a big help, especially considering we were supposed to have another group of 3 join us. All together a hell of a lot of fun and a great date for me and my boyfriend.We won!

Great fun with Lady Chastity. I booked this for my boyfriend and I for our anniversary as something new we've never done before and it did not disappoint. I'd read it is quite atmospheric and being an absolute wimp we had a drink or two before to calm my nerves. You can also take a drink down with you which is a nice touch (although you soon forget about it once your down there). As there were only two of us we were partnered with another couple but added something a bit different!As everyone has said Gabriel is brilliant and whilst he has a creepy exterior he really does help you out.The hour flew by and really didn't think we would complete it but managed to unlock the wine with 2 minutes to spare.My advice would be to look everywhere!

Converted Escape Room Newbies! Brilliant!. As newbies to the escape room concept we weren't too sure what to expect but the immersive game experience tucked away in a lovely unassuming pub in Clapham was a winning combination - we absolutely loved it! Gabriel was a brilliant host, the puzzles and clues were witty and tricky in equal measure and it's amazing what a prized bottle of wine can do to motivation levels! Lady Chastity's storyline threading throughout definitely adds another dimension to the experience and the room is really well set up. We worried that we may have been at a disadvantage with there only being 2 of us but don't let this deter you, it's still really fun and we still managed to win (with like 1 min to go!). Absolutely recommend this to others
Well worth your time!. Had a great time solving the fun puzzles in the room. Went with a friend and got paired up with another group, but it didn't detract from the experience! Well worth the price.

A fun experience. We did the Escape room at Four Thieves in Clapham and had a great time! On the plus side we also got out and won wine. A great experience even for just a small group (just the two of us) and the staff were amazing. Thank you!

Great fun - good concept and setup. The Lady Chastity's Reserve escape rooms (there are two - one for up to five people and one for up to six people, with slightly different clues) are located in the Four Thieves pub, which is a good start as it's a really nice pub with good beers. The escape room staff get thoroughly into character and have the outfits to match. The rooms have been put together well to feel like dark, nasty cellars, and the puzzles are about the right level of hardness on average. My only feedback would be that Lady Chastity (i.e. the man doing the scary falsetto)'s voice is a bit more screechy than is necessary to evoke the mood, and the voice-over descriptions go on a bit long when you've got the notebook to consult as well.
Such good fun. We went as a team of 6 and none of us really knew what to expect. But we all had a brilliant time. We won the wine just before the timer run out! Would recommend this to anyone.

Really good fun!. We really enjoyed this experience. It started our evening off brilliantly and we particularly loved Gabriel's theatrical performance at the start. We were all a bit tipsy and giggly, but we immediately got lost in his story, mesmerising! The clues were challenging, but manageable and it was very well thought out. Also affordable compared to other escape experiences we have taken part in. Thank you! :)

Excellent Fun - Highly Recommended. I had not researched the room so I was in for a great surprise. I nearly didn't have the guts to stay in the room but I am glad I did. The humour used is well balanced with the spooky atmosphere. I would highly recommend this escape room and have already told everyone I know to go. Gabriel was excellent.

Great Fun. I planned this as a birthday surprise experience and it was great to try out something different. It was great fun and very well set up! It was definitely more challenging then I thought it would be too!

Brilliant fun. Brilliantly thought out, theatrical escape room. I'd recommend this to anyone who's partial to a laugh and a puzzle. Also it was very friendly to beginners - it was our first escape room and we got on great!

Brilliant Fun. We love puzzles & games and this is one of the best we've experienced as it's a far more interactive & theatrical experience than many other Escape rooms. There were 2 of us & we got about 2/3rd of the way through so would recommend for smart, less hungover couples & bigger groups. Not for a first date though- we had to slow dance at one point!

Really good fun. I've visited a few escape rooms recently and have to say I really enjoyed this one and feel it's one of the better escape rooms out there. The props and room were well thought out, the host Gabriel was great fun and clues were given when we got really stuck. We managed to escape with a few minutes spare. Great value for money, will recommend it to others.

Totally absorbing.. This is a really fun and immersive escape room experience. Gabriel, the guide stays delightfully in character and the clues are really challenging. Definitely recommend. The atmosphere and the whole experience set our evening off to a brilliant start and, if you get through all the clues and release the coveted bottle of wine, you're permitted to drink it in the pub afterwards. It's not a bad tipple either :)

Excellent Escape Room, Awful Bouncers. We visited for a birthday celebration on a Friday night. The 6 of us had played escape rooms before and this is one of the best in London with very clever puzzles! What did let it down was the bouncers outside the four thieves that were very rude, as we arrived after a meal out we were immediately told in an aggressive manner that "we had been abusive at another club in Clapham and weren't going to be allowed in"! Considering we were all sober and we had come from pizza express at just after 9 we couldn't work out if it was part of the experience but it certainly put us off straight away! I let out a smile thinking it was all an act and part of the experience and was rudely told "by the look on your face you know exactly what I'm talking about". We were told to get against the wall and had barriers thrust upon us and had to wait outside until we were finally let in after examination of our booking confirmation. At every other escape room we were greeted extremely well in a friendly manner but being accused and ultimately being told to turn away was a shock and did impact our experience. We observed others getting turned away with elaborate excuses so this can't have been a one off! When we finally got into the pub and met Gabriel the experience was flawless though, I guess operating inside a popular venue has its perks and flaws!

Scary!! Makes it all the more exciting. I am really not a person who likes scary things, I'm a squealer! So thankfully Gabriel noticed that and turned the scariness down a notch and let me know what would be the worst thing that would happen. This really was an amazing escape game, so much thought has gone in to the puzzles to make them varied and novel. The 'theme' is done really very well, and makes this escape game better than some others.
Great fun. Loved the whole experience the puzzles are very clever and sometime so simple, but you dont know it, best thing was Gabriel, takes the experience to a different level. Loved it.

Great fun had by all. I organised this for a work event and we had two teams one in each room playing not only against the clock, but against each other. It was a really good way to spend an hour in a room trying to solve the clues to win the bottle of wine. It was very well done and Gabriel, our host, was great fun and played the part extremely well. The pub where it's located is a fabulous location as well. Very much recommend this for something fun and interactive to do. Above all we won the bottle of wine and we were the winning team out of the two as our colleagues failed to even finish (haha!) in the allotted time. Everyone really enjoyed it and we would definitely recommend.
Amazing Fun . Amazing me and my friends loved it. It was something different.we will definitely be coming back! The pub was amazing and so was the food I recommend the spicy chicken burger

Fun way to spend an afternoon. The experience was fun - they've got a good atmosphere and have the right levels of helping you solve while still making you work. Plus the reward for solving the clues is pretty great!

Hilarious, spooky and loads and loads of fun!. Best group activity of our trip. Recommend this to everyone who doesn't just want to bar hop and eat. Also a great way to get friends together and have an hour full of clues, mystery and brain rattling fun!

Completely immersive experience! . This was such an awesome experience and I'd love to do it again!!The host, Gabriel, is wonderfully weird! As we arrived at the pub we were told to follow him to the room where the adventure/madness would begin! I can't give too much away about the room or the task but let me just say that this was a brilliant way to spend an hour. I took a group of 20 somethings friends and had a great time! You're given a series of clues you must crack in order to achieve the main objective. Each clue brought along even more spookiness and fun! You must go if you like cracking riddles, clues and having a laugh/the odd shriek of fear in the process :) The only downside: I wish it could have lasted longer- time just flew by!

Exceeded expectations. Value for money. Highly professional.. There are a plethora of these 'escape' games to choose from, and I carefully researched all the ones in and around the London area, but Lady Chastity's Reserve (not Revenge, as I kept calling it) piqued my interest. The location was ideal for the three of us in our group: just a short walk through Clapham high street from the train station. On arrival at The Four Thieves pub, our group sat down for a scrummy roast dinner and cider while enjoying the live music in the fantastic venue. After that, the game's host, Gabriel, came over to meet us and took us upstairs......We left our bags and coats in a secure location before being shown into the room, where Gabriel - who impressively stayed in character the whole time - explained the game. We were issued with torches, then Gabriel made his exit before the lights in the room dimmed. I won't spoil the fun for those hoping to take part, but if you love puzzles and TV mysteries and have an inquisitive nature - and don't mind the odd double-entendre and spooky noise - you won't be disappointed with this game. As there were only three of us, we were given a couple of hints by Gabriel to help us along, though we did manage to complete the game and rescue the Reserve with a few minutes to spare. Tip: spread out and explore everywhere and investigate everything.Following the game, our group were provided with glasses so we could quaff the delicious Reserve in the pub before leaving. I can't recommend this game highly enough. The staff in the pub were efficient; Gabriel was a great host; and compared with other 'escape' games, this experience is relatively cheap. Thank you for having us!Team Bishop's Finger

A completely immersive, other-worldly, experience!. A few of us went along to play the game last week, and right off the bat, our fantastic host Gabriel was in character and we were immediately transported to another world and time! We had a lot of fun, the hour went by incredibly quickly and we managed (with some help from Gabriel) to solve the mystery and grab our prize. Highly recommend as a unique and fun group activity experience!

What a fantasic way to spend an hour!. My friends and I really enjoyed this escape room. We'd done others in the past but particularly enjoyed the strong gothic theme in this one. Gabriel the host made it an unforgettable afternoon. Lots of fun! And the pub was great too.

@ Black Lion, Brighton. This was an amazing adventure. Our host Gabriel was enchanting, captivating and made the event come alive. We completed our tasks with 5 minutes to spare, winning the fabled bottle of wine, and Gabriel would guide us just enough if we became stuck at any point.Challenging but do-able, GREAT fun, great venue, and great food.

AMAZING! WONDERFUL! GO GO GO!. I booked the room for a friends birthday and it completely exceeded all expectations!! Compared to other escape rooms in London this one is the most affordable and in my opinion (I have been to others) THE BEST!! The host Gabriel really makes it - he was amazing and really made the experience different from your usual escape rooms. The theatricality of the hour (without giving anything away) really sets this game above the rest. The perfect combination of The Crystal Maze and Punchdrunk!
Loads of fun!!!!. Went along with friends and had so much fun in that hour. Props and people are excellent and add wonderfully to the experience. I would recommend to anyone (over 18)

Great evening.... It was a really fun game and Gabriel was a great host. Atmosphere was set and hunt challenging yet we had enough help to win :) Only thing: if you do like wine, do not drink the bottle you win :D

Awesome fun!!. I went with a group of friends after reading rave reviews and hearing great things from others who'd done it. We were not disappointed! The hour flew by and we had a brilliant time. So many thoughtful little touches. Would thoroughly recommend. I'll be back when the next game opens
What a great experience!. I went with a group of friends for the first time and thoroughly enjoyed myself there! Love it! Definitely will want to come back again for the other room!!!

Winner winner, chicken dinner!. Went for our friends birthday present! We had a really great time, and were still talking about it for hours afterwards!Upon researching the place (or places in London to do this type of thing) This was the only place that there was a physical prize at the end, which we managed to win with 7 seconds left! (with Gabriel's help) - Would defo recommend !
Best hour of my life! . Couldn't fault this experience was great fun, thrilling and the perfect amount of spooky!! Really recommend that everyone tries this.

Lots of fun - do it!. We went as a group of five friends at the People's Park Tavern, which was a 10-15 minute walk from Homerton Overground station. The game was fantastic fun, the enclosed dark room, scenario and host 'Gabriel' all help to create a great atmosphere. The difficultly of the challenges was about right, listen to the hint that Gabriel gives you before you start! We really enjoyed it, argued over who had the right ideas, laughed at ourselves, and felt a sense of achievement at finishing the challenge! This was our first go at an 'escape room game' and this has lead to us wanting to try more. The experience is in a room in the tavern off to the left as you enter via the front, and the pub is well worth staying in afterwards to discuss how you got on. Enjoy!

Brilliant. A lot of fun. Very immersive experience. Gabriel met us at the bar and told us the tale of Lady Chastity before leaving us to tackle the clues to unlocking the final bottle of her reserve. Brilliant way to spend an hour ☺

Uniquely brilliant!!. What a great evening, wonderfully hosted by 'Gabriel' and everything laid out and planned beautifully!!Although we as a team failed miserably, I blame the wives, I would still recommend it to all as something to experience at least once!!

We lost - but we had a blast!. This was a treat for my brithday. Although we were only a team of 2 (the other group of 4 pulled out just before going in), we had a blast trying to figure this out. We were a little slow mentally after a long day, but our Gabriel was fun (in-character throughout) and provided us with enough hints to push us forward when we needed it, even with a sly extra hints when we were really struggling. On another day I think we would have done it!The setting was scary enough (as 2 scaredy cats) that I always thought something was coming behind me and that may have slowed me down.I would recommend for a group a little larger than 2, as with 2 you really both have to be on the ball. Would recommend to others and wish I could go back and do it again and win it!

Our First Escape Room!. Booked this for my other half's birthday as it was the only escape room available for a minimum of 2 people. We arrived and had two other couples participating with us - We finished in 50 minutes great team effort and had such a great time! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for date night/day with a difference. The host Gabriel was absolutely brilliant can't wait to return! You really get into the game everything is extremely realistic and it does feel like your somewhere in a creepy film. Not to mention the beer garden at the People's Tavern was great to get a few drinks in before the fun!

Excellent, immersive fun. Completed the challenge (with 3 seconds remaining!) last week at the 4 thieves in Clapham - and all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Very keen to try some more of these games, although any others will be hard pushed to beat this one. Well worth doing!

Get ready to be immersed!. We took on the challenge at the Four Thieves in a team of four. Our host Gabriel was entertaining and helpful from start to finish. The game itself had some excellent jumps and twists which meant the time flew by. We loved the challenge of escaping and some of the puzzles were fantastic (I won't give anything away!) I would highly recommend this experience for anyone wanting to experience something a bit different!

Great team building excercise. Really enjoyed this experience, very well thought out and very challenging. After the challenge (which we all failed to complete fully) we retired to the booths in the beer garden and had a great time....just what the team needed after a very successful but challenging year.

Great fun!. 6 of us went at 10pm on a Friday night (Four Thieves) after several hours of drinking - which only made it more difficult and stressful, it was such a laugh! We had "young lady Gabriel" who was so enthusiastic and stayed in character the whole time. As we were all somewhat inebriated we had to end up asking for help the full 3 times, but we managed to complete it. Creepy, challenging and exciting - massively recommend. First escape room experience, slightly worried I may have started with one of the best..!
Really good fun!. An extra treat for my son's 21st and o k to do with the old folks!!! The time went really quickly and we all had great fun.

Fantastic. Nine of us did this as two teams of 4 and 5 and everyone absolutely loved it. The set-up and clues were done really well and Gabriel was fantastic. We all agreed we'd love to do another one, I would highly recommend this to everyone.

Fantastic experience. What a great thing to do on a Sunday afternoon. This was my first time trying this sort of thing and I loved it. My team and I are already making plans to try the other puzzle experiences that are on offer.Was very challenging but with the help of the excellent angle Gabriel we managed to solve it all. He gave us just the right amount of clues which gave us the satisfaction of working it out ourselves but pushed us forwards when we were stuck.We did it as a group of five which I think was just right.Would definitely recommend this to everybody.

Excellent experience. From the moment we began this game Gabriel our host made sure we were fully immersed and made the experience all the better. It was a thrilling and challenging game with some frights thrown in for good measure. We completed the challenge with a minute to spare and thoroughly enjoyed every moment. A brilliant experience that I would recommend to anyone.

Excellent. Cheaper than most other similar experiences in London and really well thought out. Did this on a hangover so Gabriel's clues and help were much appreciated! And you can take your drink in from the pub. Bonus!
Brilliant fun . Went here recently with friends and enjoyed it a lot! Have done Time Run in Hackney before and this rivals it in a completely different way. Good fun all round!

Fun, immersive, challenging game. We've taken part in several "escape rooms" around London, and this was probably the best. The puzzles themselves are challenging without becoming frustrating. The room is interactive with an array of both audio and visual clues. Finally, our host, Gabriel was fantastic. He greeted our team in character and really added the experience. 5/5 - top notch - Please add a second room so that we can come back!

Really fun night. We thoroughly enjoyed this challenge. I've done one before in Bank and this one was far more immersive and fun. Our host, Gabriel was so great at setting the scene which made the night for us.

Great fun. We had great fun at Lady Chastity's Reserve and would highly recommend this entertaining and fun activity. Our host was funny and great at getting you involved in the story. The game itself was tricky but in a good way. We managed to complete it and were delighted at finishing it before the allotted time. The games room in the adjacent room was excellent as well as the bar downstairs.

SO much fun!. What a great way to spend an hour! My first escape room experience - fantastic atmosphere - spine-chilling with some jumpy moments, but not too frightening for the more sensitive participants in our group. Real effort has gone into props; it was such an enjoyable space to explore.The activities were challenging but not impossible - right at the top end of our ability, but satisfying and achievable. The affable host was ready with clues when we needed them, without being interfering - a fine line but he straddled it perfectly. And we won the wine! Hurray!

Amazing experience!. Firstly can I praise Gabriel for being a brilliant host. He greeted us in character straight away, gave us the story of Lady Chasity and provided us with a bunch of insults for the lads I was with! The room was so good and very well laid out, it was interesting and the storyline fitted well throughout with the clues. We escaped with one minute and one second remaining, much more complex than I thought and I would highly recommend to anyone!

Lady Chastity's Reserve. AMAZING! Had a great time solving the mystery of Lady Chastity's Reserve. Team Cwtch thoroughly enjoyed themselves with only a mere twenty seconds to spare! Gabriel really brought the experience to life. Would strongly recommend this to any group looking for a fun and different challenge and experience. Once again a special thanks to Gabriel who was amazing throughout . A+++++

Such a great evening . How refreshing to do something really interactive with friends, reminds me of the medieval area in the crystal maze. You totally immerse yourself in the experience and escape into the world they have expertly created. My only criticism is that I wanted it to last even longer but the time limit does give it urgency. I absolutely loved it, finally a chance to turn off your phone and communicate and work as a team. The host Gabriel does a fantastic job of being unnerving. Haven't had so much fun for ages.

FANTASTIC. AMAZING. So much fun, something unique to do in London and a great way to spend a afternoon. Fully immersive, not a moment to think about anything else.. a great dose of escapism on my birthday.

Really good fun!. Everything about this was great - from the pub that it's in (The Four Thieves do great food, have an incredible range of Gin and have a massive games room upstairs, which is brilliant) to the immersive game itself. Gabriel, the task master, is fantastic. He greets you and is instantly in character. He had us all laughing and excited at the same time. I think the thing that impressed me the most was how they manage to fit in so much in such a small place. We all worked together really well (it really helps to listen to everyone) and because there's an hourglass in the room with you, we really felt the intensity of the game.I would recommend this to anyone who likes challenges and trick questions (and wine) and will be letting all my friends know about it. We'd been wanting to try it for months and it's well worth it!

Fantastic. When we arrived we asked for Gabriel at the bar! He soon arrived after we ordered a very reasonable round of drinks. He led us up the stairs through the retro arcade then proceeded to tell the story of Lady Chastity and her special reserve! We were not disappointed! we had scares and thrills and more importantly the escape room was very immersive.

Brilliantly themed. I've been to a couple of other escape rooms but this one was my favourite by far. Great atmosphere, great story, and of course the bonus of winning the wine at the end too. Gabriel really made it come alive.

Such a great experience. Firstly, my team were awful and failed miserably, however we had the most amazing time! You are thrown into the experience straight away, you really do have to work as a team! And some things really are obvious, try not to overthink like we did and lose half your time on the first find!!I have never done anything like this and would love to give it another go to try and complete it! If you're looking for an hour to kill on a trip to London definitely give this a go. The games room upstairs in the pub is amazing!!

Really good - just go with people you know!. I went here with a friend as it is one of the few escape rooms where you can go as a 2 and be paired up with another 2.The game itself was great - really interesting story line and the aim of unlocking the wine rather than escaping was a bit different. The concept is very different to other escape games, the main difference I found is that you all work on solving clues together as you have an order in which to solve them. Usually people can explore the room and solve clues as they go and therefore focus on clues that use their skills.We were paired up with a couple that were quite quiet and didn't seem to want to follow the 'rules' of the room (listening to Lady C for what to actually do). This made the whole game quite challenging and despite the fact that we got the wine in the last few minutes, I think it would have been even more enjoyable had I done it only with people I knew.Overall great concept, good props and theme. Could benefit from a few more tasks so that people get to be a bit more involved if their skills aren't suited to a certain task.

Captivating, suspense, problem solving, mystery. A true delight! Wonderfully surprising! Go Now!. WOW what an awesome time we had today at Lady Chastity's Reserve at The Four Thieves for my partners birthday. Gabriel was incredible. Captivating and brings a whole new level of awesome to the game. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and had a lovely day! We won the wine, which was also tasty. I believe we had 16mins 20 remaining, so I think we did pretty well. The venue is amazing too. It is so easy to lose several hours here having fun. Great staff too! But I do feel like i need to reiterate how wonderful Gabriel is. Going above and beyond! Thanks for making our day!Love from The Band Of Excellence.
So much fun!. I loved it - and my team won with only about a minute to spare! I would recommend this to anyone! Great fun!

Great fun, Gabriel was amazing and Good Set Up!. My friends and I have done a few escape rooms. This was a little different to others - Gabriel was a great addition and performed her role very well! The ultimate win was getting the wine which most escape rooms haven't had - it's more just to get out of the room! We had a great time. The challenges were difficult though!
AMAZING!. The game was well thought and the host Gabriel was just GREAT! Great actor, great companion and great help. Definitely worth trying! You won't regret it!

The best way to "earn" wine that I've ever found. Five friends and I just tried the version at The Black Lion in Brighton, which is utterly fantastic. Gabriel sets the scene beautifully (and spookily!), and the hour absolutely flew by. We agreed afterwards that the game probably works better with a slightly smaller team (4 or 5) so everyone can fully take part in each puzzle, but we all brought our own skills to it too (mine was mostly jumping at ghostly noises). I'd heartily recommend it, and the fact we solved the mystery made Lady Chastity's wine taste all the sweeter!

LOVED THIS. ❤️❤️❤️. SO much fun. Went to Four Thieves but have already booked a return visit to the one in East London this weekend. Wish there were more things to do like this. FIVE HEARTS AND A CRYSTAL BALL.❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Brilliant experience - would recommend to everyone!. I bought this as a gift for a friend of mine, the two of us took on the challenge at The People's Park Tavern in Hackney. First of all the food and staff were top notch. Secondly, our host Gabriel was brilliantly in character throughout, came and met us at our table and showed us into the room which was wonderfully set up - a perfect combination of spooky and intriguing! He helped us as much as he could (which was lucky, I don't think we would have gotten as far without him) and added real value to the whole experience. The hour we spent in there was full of giggles, puzzlement, cries of 'Gabriel, HELP!' and the odd scream. We absolutely loved it and have been raving about the experience to anyone who will listen. Has to be experienced to be believed!

Exquisite, enjoyable, humorous. Fun times with Lady Chastity! My friends kept our visit as a surprise birthday gift. It was my first experience of this type and I absolutely relished it. We were five in total and I think four to five people is the right amount. We all had a great time - laughed, screamed, jumped, panicked.The room was very well decorated and put you straight into the mood of the story. It had a pleasant, indeed "homemade", atmosphere. The puzzles were moderately challenging, and if I had to point toward a negative aspect, I'd say that sometimes it felt like there was a gap between clues, truncating the flow of the game a bit. I guess maybe that's where your imagination and creativity would come in. Last but not least, Gabriel, our host, was simply brilliant! He was a combination of captivating story-telling, arcaneness and witty humour made all the difference in the game - I could easily watch him perform a whole story-book.Looking forward to their next mystery!

Terrific fun, atmospheric and just the right level of challenge. This wasa a surprise birthday outing for one of my housemates (we'd clubbed together to buy a voucher for the game), and he really didn't know what he was in for until we arrived at the Four Thieves. It was a fantastic hour with avuncular and witty advice, from the always in character Gabriel, spurring us on with indelicate hints to achieve the prize. Luckily we hadn't drunk too much before we entered the game - you do need your wits about you. It was great to do in a group - everybody contributes - our self described dippy hippy member of the group surprised herself by being the main person to solve one of the more difficult clues. And the accountant got scared - jumped six inches in the air at one point. It was a great idea to go for which I take all the credit!
Birthday!. We travelled from Ipswich to have this experience and it was WORTH EVERY MINUTE!! please go and check it out. Gabriel was fab and the room was genius.

Very good concept but slightly frustrated. This was my Girlfriend and my first Escape the Room game. The game itself was very good, but we were not :-) we massively ran out of time. Which leads to my two issues:1) as a couple we were paired with another couple. I suggest going with people you know2) as newbies we had absolutely no idea of rules and were not even aware there was a time limit. I would go again though

Brilliant, and surprisingly challenging!. We went there for our netball social last week and it was exceptionally good. Great value. The room was actually quite tricky to solve, perhaps due to the limited time (when you've had a couple of vinos) and space (when there's five of you clambering around in the dark). The room is tiny but the venue is absolutely enormous and lots of fun. It is very popular though, so we'd suggest you get there with plenty of time to spare, save any unnecessary mishaps with queues and bouncers. Highly recommended!
Would recommend to everyone. This is brilliant fun and Gabriel was a brilliant host. We had 4 in our group and felt this was the perfect amount whilst being difficult it was not impossible.

It was a shame to have to return to the real world!. Treated three friends to a surprise encounter with Lady Chastity and we certainly weren’t disappointed! Gabriel proved to be a very entertaining, affable and helpful host. Amazing how your mind works when under pressure to solve a series of baffling clues. The hour spent locked in a gothic room was intriguing, challenging and above all hugely enjoyable. 4 participants was the perfect number and it was great to be able to enjoy the whole experience on our own as a team. We felt transported to another time & place for an hour and it was a shame to have to return to the real world.

Great fun on date night. We really enjoyed this. It was our first escape room and something a bit different for a rare date night. We got paired with another couple for an early evening slot, which meant there was time for dinner and drinks afterwards too.

Too much fun. Gabriel was a wonderful host...this was certainly one of the most fun and unusual activities I've experienced for a while. Couldn't recommend it more...although I must say, like other have mentioned, 4 would be a more suitable number for a group.

A fun hour of puzzles and challenges with a charming host. We have been to other 'Escape Rooms' and this is an excellent version. Other games had more than one room so we kept thinking we would move on BUT this is our only negative and due to our own preconceptions.The game is witty and fun. The host is super and makes the evening special. I would definately recommend it. The Four Thieves pub is brilliant so leave time to enjoy being there too.

First Time Escaper. This was my first time doing any type of escape. I found it very interesting and elaborate. Would have preferred to have been given less verbal hints, but the group we ended up with did require the helping hand.

Fab escape game - they take couples!. Gabriel was a fantastic host! Some of the clues were quite complicated but hearing Gabriel's voice with subtle hints were often very much appreciated! The setting was ideal but unexpected and lots of objects to be turned over in our search for clues! It's nice to have an escape game that allows couples to join groups although it would be better to go with a group of your own friends. Thanks so much Gabriel, a real treat!

Exceptional!. An amazing experience! Gabriel is great and really played his part well, not breaking character the entire time we were there. The room was tricky, which is what you want, but all solvable. There isn't much worth writing in a review, you simply have to do it yourself to see how great it is! Amazing! (And a bottle of wine at the end of you complete it, a nice bonus)

Wonderful immersive experience. I've done a lot of escape rooms and this really stands out as something a bit different and special - as an experience it's one of the best.Firstly, the pub it is hosted in (the People's Park Tavern in East London) is excellent - brews its own (good) beer, bags of character and has a huge outdoor space that would be great in summer.The main thing that sets this room apart is the atmosphere it creates - from the host Gabriel (who really plays his character delightfully - some rooms just put you in a room and tell you to get out but he's a big part of this experience), to the story and the constant innuendo, to the dark and mysterious set up of the room itself with some marvellous props and a few surprises within... It all combines to feeling that you're a part of something rather than just in a room solving puzzles.The puzzles themselves are good and fair, they weren't really anything special themselves, but they didn't need to be given everything else!We apparently broke the record by about 7 minutes, which means that we probably got too many hints - we didn't ask for any but whenever we were being slow we were quickly given a bit of a nudge - always very subtly, but it was always enough. Given the time, I think Gabriel could probably have left us stewing a bit more!All-in-all I'd strongly recommend this for any fans of (or newbies to) escape rooms or immersive theatre - it's on the boundary between the two and does a great job of both.

Something different to do on a Saturday night. We had a great time spending an hour trying to unshackle Lady Chastity's Reserve and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something a bit different to do on a Saturday night. Although none of us had ever done an "escape game" before (note that Lady Chastity's Reserve isn't strictly an "escape game" because you aren't really trying to escape), we all got the impression that this one was far more immersive and entertaining than other games that we imagine to be pretty corporate and one-dimensional. This was largely thanks to the well thought-out plotline filled with innuendos and believable twists and turns, the creepy set and a convincing, and hilarious, performance from the host, Gabriel. The tasks themselves catered for all interests, were really engaging and suitably challenging. The one thing we would say, however, is that the game is probably best suited to teams of 3 or 4 (we took part as two teams of 5) because the room is very small and the tasks are very linear, so it was difficult for the whole team to get involved in all of the challenges at once.But all in all, this was one of the best Saturday nights we have all had in a while! Keep up the good work Gabriel!

Great fun!. This was a fantastic experience from start to finish. Our host, Gabriel, was very nice and entertaining (and very patient when we were a bit slow on the uptake...!). I did it with my boyfriend at People's Park Tavern on a Sunday at 5pm and no one was added to our group so I suppose it was a good, off-peak time to go (my understanding is that groups of 2 are usually put in with other people). It was a lot of fun and perfectly paced, although we nearly didn't make it (1 minute to go!) so maybe it's preferable to try it with 3 people? The People's Park Tavern itself is really lovely, it's got a lot of space, live music, and a second bar upstairs with 50 craft beers. Make sure you check it out! Lady Chastity's Reserve takes place in 2 hidden rooms behind the main bar. Book it now and have fun!

If you book anything to do in London with friends, make it this! . Great experience from start to finish. The game is challenging, fun and memorable. Gabriel is a fantastic character and with a bit of help we won the bottle with 5 mins to spare! Very highly recommended, we had a team of 5.

Exciting, engaging, unusual and alot of fun!!. Absolutely loved this experience at The Four Thieves. The host was brilliant from the get go, really making you believe the story and never slipping from character. The games room itself was challenging, so much fun, fast paced and do-able. Exactly what you want on a saturday night! If you book as a two you will most likely get put in a group with 2-3 others, which is what happened with us. This was actually even better as you get to meet new people in a completely different environment, so no problems there. I have already been recommending this to all my friends and will continue to do so. Great value for money too!

Brilliant mystery solving experience . We did this in the People's Park Tavern in East London and were joined by 4 other people. Gabriel is an excellent host and really makes the experience even more enjoyable. The excitement at solving puzzles in a darkened room in return for wine as the prize cannot be beaten. The script is hilarious and I highly recommend this as a date night with a difference or an experience with a group of friends.
Brilliant! . Had so much fun tonight! Gabriel is a most wonderful host. And thank goodness for his help or we would never have finished! Would definitely recommend!

Really good. This is a lot of fun. Paced exactly right (we finished with 5 minutes to go). The double entendre laden script was actually pretty funny as well. If they organize another one, we'll definitely go.We had five players and it was fine, but four is probably the optimal number.

Failed miserably... but had great fun doing so!. I booked this for myself and my boyfriend. Gabriel really made the experience and it was very atmospheric and a bit creepy! Some of the tasks were pretty hard I thought, and although we were very close to finishing a few bits got us a bit stumped and we ran out of time. Really good fun though and would definitely book something like this again!

Utterly Brilliant. A superb evening out. Gabriel was incredible at creating the ghostly atmosphere from the outset and once in the secret room of tricks, it was a mind boggling maze of epic codes to break and clues to decipher. Fantastic fun! I'd highly recommend it.

Brighton game. Knowing only roughly what to expect, we had a brilliant evening. It took us a while to get into the swing of knowing what on earth we were supposed to be doing, but Gabriel helped us on our way and we really enjoyed thinking 'outside the box' to solve the clues and win Lady Chastity's Reserve. Highly recommended!

Excellent Game. It was a gift from my better half, and with just us two, it was very enjoyable and a real challenge. With a 'little' help from Gabriel, we got the prize!!! Very good idea and one I’d recommend to anybody who loves the idea of solving your very own puzzle.

Very fun activity date!. Never having done this sort of 'escape the room' activity, from the first sighting of Gabriel through to the bitter end, when luckily, we clutched a bottle of Lady Chastity's Reserve, it was thoroughly enjoyable!

Excellent idea. We received a gift voucher for the experience for Christmas and absolutely loved it. It's a very simple concept but it has been executed extremely well. Only bit of feedback - the wine could be better ;)

Fantastic Puzzles. First 'escape the room' puzzle we have done and absolutely loved this. We were a party of 2 and were joined by another 2 which was actually great fun. We had to get help 3 times and managed to unlock the wine with a minute to go. Would definitely recommend to friends and family. Loved the bar the game is in tol

Puzzle Fun - would recommend. First experience of an escape game and really enjoyed it; would recommend. As a group of two we were joined by two others, four seemed an ideal number of players for the size of the room and the puzzles. Our Gabriel host was excellent. Great that you can win a bottle of wine.
