Great Time Had by All. Went to the People Park Tavern version in Hackney. Everyone had fun. The host was excellent. For the price, found it to be excellent value for an hour of entertainment (plus another hour of drinking our winnings).Only potential downside... It says it accommodates up to 6 players at a time, we had 5 and at time were a bit cramped in the room and it was difficult to all gather around a specific clue. Wasn't bad overall but 6 might be too many.

Great fun and got the grey matter working. we had great fun taking on this challenge. the puzzles were clever and not too easy so had us going right to the wire. It was well managed and the character aspect made it a bit different.

Fantastic escape room. There seem to be a wide choice of escape rooms available and having read the reviews for this one, it immediately stood out as providing something a little bit different and out of the ordinary and that really appealed. The host Gabriel was excellent in helping to create a spooky atmosphere and us 5 girls showed our appreciation by screaming more than is probably necessary during the game. I would say it's a fantastic way to spend an hour, it's fun, often challenging and excellent value for money compared with most other escape rooms. Plus the pub it is held in is great for a drink both before and afterwards.

Good game, good game. It was well done, our host - guide - prompt was very polished and affable. My only criticism would be the venue was a little cramped or at 5 participants we were too many. Good fun, we managed to finish inside the time with the help of a few hints.

Great puzzle game. Booked with my dad (75) over christmas for something different to do. We were matched up with two young girls who were great team members. Gabriel explains the rules and you enter quite a small room, I think 4 is ideal and I'm glad there is a fan in the room as it's quite warm. The puzzles were just about right to get you thinking and Gabriel can help you when you need it. Had a really great time and we completed with 7 minutes to go. Best value for money puzzle game I've done. Highly recommended. Hope there is a new room so I can go back.

Entertaining if not slightly unnerving!!. So we had a 7.30pm booking and had dinner and a drink in the pub before which was well worth it, because there is no time to socialise once the mystery starts.First off, Gabriel is awesome. Constantly in character and very entertaining. It starts off with a speech from Gabriel that gives you that uneasy feeling of anxiety, like a ride at Disneyland ("it's meant for kids so as an adult it'll be fine...right?!?) and there's a point where you think it's either going to get really scary or scary in a fun way.Luckily it's the latter. I'll say no more at risk of spoilers, but our session was 54 minutes of intense concentration. But fun!

Spooky, challenging and very entertaining!. Set in a the side room of a bustling pub with a lively atmosphere, Lady Chastity's Reserve was a great way to spend an hour. We were met at the door by host Gabriel who led us into the game room which was well presented ands unitary creepy, although being dark and quite cramped it may be a little much for anyone prone to claustrophobia). The puzzles were challenging enough to keep four adults guessing, but not so impossible that we floundered. The ever-witty Gabriel is on hand to offer hints and tips if you get truly stumped and the props, voice overs and special effects provide a nicely spooky atmosphere.We finished with about ten minutes to spare and will be first in line for tickets should Handmade Mysteries produce another game.

Escape Room & Food. I have to say this is our first Escape room experience, and it was excellent. There were 5 of us and everyone enjoyed the experience.The layout was great, the props and atmosphere of the set were awesome.We were given just enough to work with, and on the couple of occasions we got a bit stuck, mainly down to us thinking too far outside the box, a subtle hint was given, not enough to solve the problem altogether but to push us in the right direction which kept us moving along instead of stagnating.The host made the whole experience, Gabriel set the atmosphere and was a please to talk to, both in and out of the experience.I would recommend this room to anyone wanting to be challenged but not too much that you need some headache pills after, and the Tavern its self was an awesome venue, with great food and drinkThank you for the experience, we will be keeping our eyes peeled for the new room opening next year.

Great new experience for old friends. We picked Lady Chastity's Reserve as it was in a great pub and had a lot of good reviews on here.We were disappointed. First impressions, were that the room was very small, but they do pack a lot of activity in.Our games master was committed to the guise and really helped us get into it too and the game was varied and had lots of different layers and puzzles.Great start to the night, provided a lot of conversation and the prize wasn't too bad either for a night out.
Atmospheric & excellent fun!. Great atmosphere and setting. Wonderful game with a fun story. You can feel the love that has gone into this room. Definitely worth a round!

Different kind of date night. Booked this on yPlan not knowing what to expect. Different take on the escape game craze. Captivating and somewhat scary host and a challenging yet cleverly put together clue game. Great atmosphere, great fun. I would recommend 2 or 3 players as 4 or 5 could get crowded.
Fab-u-lous!!. Fab Freaky Friday hanging out with my little bro Michael and the lovely Dawn, Ben and Alex. Puzzles galore and a wonderful host - thank you Gabriel!

Great fun but quite warm. Had a great evening with 4 friends at Lady Chastity's Reserve. Being located in a really great pub meant we could have dinner and a drink before hand in the same venue, and then go up to the games room in the pub to continue the fun afterwards. The host didnt break character from the moment we met him and the room was really well decorated, which really added to the experience. The game itself was brilliant - the right level of challenge, not to easy and not too hard either and it was really nice to get a prize at the end. I had been to a similar event a few weeks before, which although was much bigger, didnt match up in terms of atmosphere.The only slight negative was the size of the room - it was really small and got very hot with 5 people in there. Althought this in no way makes me want to give a lower rating - i would definitely recommend this, I would just say wear cool clothing!!

Wonderful wee game. This is well worth seeking out. We had so much fun. The owners have definitely put their heart and soul into the game. I would nearly do this one again with a different set of friends.
So much fun . Recommended for a group of friends. Lots of fun under pressure. Atmospheric for a small room. And if you solve it all there's a prize at the end ...

Highly entertaining! (Brighton). We had an amazing experience under Gabriel's supervision - the room decoration was stunning and really evoked a sense of spookiness. Apart from my constant screaming, it was a highly enjoyable evening. A well crafted and immersive game - highly recommend!

Amazing and Entertaining!. Kicked off our work Christmas Party celebrations with this escape room challenge. Throughly enjoyed ourselves and our host Gabriel's hilarious innuendos. Would recommend this experience to anyone! Thanks for an amazing evening!

Brilliant and great fun!. Went with work colleagues and throughly enjoyed it! Our host Gabriel was great and helped us out when we were stuck (thank you!). His great acting mixed in with the creepy decor of the room really gives it all a special atmosphere that just makes the whole experience that much better. Puzzles were challenging and inventive and the special effects were pretty fun too :) Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fun evening out. - Team JLH!

AMAZING!! Best thing to do in London yet!. Firstly The Four Thieves is the greatest place on earth so amazing setting! Our host Gabrielle was brilliant and set the scene perfectly. The clues were really clever and we loved every minute! Would do again and cant recommend enough!
Good Laugh. Thoroughly enjoyed this little challenge and would highly recommend to anyone :) Me personally, i'd have been happy to continue another hour!

Fantastic night!. We had a great night, full of surprises, riddles & clues. Gabrielle, the host was fantastic & really got us into the spirit of the night. We were continuously on our toes looking for clues & ways to free the reserve. We went as a group of 5, I'd say 4 would be the ideal number as it's quite a tight squeeze once you are all hunting for clues around the room. Slightly cheaper than some of the more we'll know escape room in central London & would recommend it to anyone new to these types of game. Ps - it's set in very nice pub too, so great for drinks before & after!

Amazing and unusual experience!. All 5 members of our team had a fantastic time and I'm sure we'll be talking about this for years to come. A fairly challenging escape room with a nice touch of humour. I can't write a review about this game without mentioning our excellent host Gabrielle, who looked and acted the part perfectly - he was really the icing on the cake. Would definitely recommend this experience!
Great fun!!!. A group of 5 friends tackled the puzzles of Lady Chastity - fun, ingenious, different, this is highly recommended!!!
Birthday Surprise! . Great Fun! Gabriel was a super character! Top banana time had! The puzzles were varied and involved various props. It was far funnier than I thought it would be!

Fantastic, different, quirky experience. Went with a couple of friends and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Gabriel, the host, is brilliant and on hand to provide a few clues when you're struggling. The game is fun, challenging but perfectly doable if you apply yourself (and don't have too many drinks beforehand).We were a team of 3 and so paired with another couple for our experience and together we solved the puzzle with about 3 minutes to spare. For those wondering (as I did) it isn't scary. It's for over 18s as it's set in a pub and the content is adult themed but there's nothing that will give you nightmares

Fans of Puzzles and "The Crystal Maze" will love it !. I visited the Brighton attraction in the Black Lion Pub.The game is for between 4 and 6 people and I was in a group of 4.The live action puzzle is very interactive and definitely makes you think.There is very little physical activity as the puzzles were mostly mental tests.The ambience puts you right in the mood and the host (for us it was Gabriel) was very helpful, funny and just a little bit scary.Definitely recommended for a group of friends.A great time was had by everyone on our group. Oh, and we solved the puzzle too !!

A really really fun time!. I throughly enjoyed the puzzles.We were in a group of three and paired with another group of 2, I thought having 5 people total made solving it a bit too easy, but it was a fun time anyways.Gabriel, the host, was very friendly and attentive and just an overall great addition to the atmosphere.Will deffinitelly go back if they have new rooms.

Crystal Meth Maze. If you're a fan of Crystal Maze then you need to check this out. Amazing fun and a genuine challenge! Brilliant spooky atmosphere with an amazing sense of humor added in. Highly recommend!

Spooky Sexy Fun Times!. Absolutely fantastic experience! A little bit spooky, a little bit raunchy and overall fun was to be had by all. Fans of Knightmare or The Crystal Maze are going to love this. Enter the macabre world of Lady Chastity's burnt-out vineyard and you'll be fully engrossed in the brain boggling puzzles in a matter of minutes. This creepy live-action puzzle is great for rainy days or team building exercises. I'd recommend it to anyone stopping in Brighton over the weekend.
Great escape!. The best escape room experience I've had so far! We had a great time, and the host was excellent. Very atmospheric!

SO FUN!. It was our first escape room, and it was a blast! There was only two of us so we timed out -- OOPS! It was still a fun time, and the room had a cool theme to it! Gabriel was in full character and made the time in the room extra creepy and a blast!!

Do this!. Lady Chastity's Reserve was brilliant! We had so much fun!! Gabriel is a real star. It is obvious how much he enjoys his job. He also went out of his way to work when it was his lunch break after we arrived late. We were so grateful that he worked with us. The props also were very impressive! Great experience!
Fun afternoon out. This is a well organised and developed game. The clues were challenging but not too hard. Recommended as a fun activity!

Still trying to work out some of the clues lol . I had no idea what I had let myself in for as my cousin booked the night for us but had the best night ever! (Don't worry no zombies jumping out of the shadows to scare you lol) Defo worth checking out guys.....Great date or mates night

excellent date night or fun with friends. Gabriel the host was excellent. He fit right into the part. We had a great time as a couple and met another nice couple there and we solved the mystery. Nice fun hour. If you haven't done it, it's fun and worth it.

A memorable proposal. Met with the lovely Gabriel the day before to plan how I would propose to my partner after we completed the game. It went without a glitch, we had so much fun and I can't recomend it highly enough. If you want to play with 3 or less people then email before you book to see if they can facilitate that you play alone, instead of putting groups together. They were good enough to do it for my very special day. :) Thank you all so much, we will definitely return if/when you make a new game/room, and sing your praises to everyone who will listen!

Fun group mystery solving night. A group of us went to this last week as the latest in several immersive mystery solving game events we've been to, and it was a fun hour spent trying to solve the riddles. However the room was very small and hot, so would have been better with fewer people (we were five) so that everyone could be actively involved in trying to crack the puzzles. It was quite scary (for those of us with a nervy disposition!) but entertaining and Gabriel's character was brilliant.

An exciting and different night out! Book this people!!. I turned up at the pub not knowing what to expect. But what a great night! The experience was immersive, challenging and most improtantly fun! And our host, Gabriel, was great and added to the intrigue. We won the wine (go Team Lady Chastity's Luvvers!), but the feeling of achievement was what stood out!It is definitely a great way to spend a Friday night. :)
Fantastic. I have done many of these experiances across the world and this is one of the best. Not the biggest escape game but full of character and fun experiance.

Fantastic experience . Gabriel is a character you will remember for a long time and makes the game really interesting. The puzzles are quite clever and the story line quite easy to follow. Just concetrate and cooperate well with your team mates and the bottle of wine is yours!

Excellent Alternative Date Experience. Not knowing what to expect, we ventured into this quant unassuming pub to be greeted by a colourful character in a suit by the name of Gabriel. Leading us to a blood spattered door I started to get the impression that this was not your ordinary secret room experience. The puzzles were fun, challenging and spooky. The decor was positively haunting. An amazing experience and exceptionally different game. Great for a quirky date

Exciting, immersive and challenging! A super fun "different" night out! :). Me and a few friends played the game with two strangers, we all got along really well and managed to complete the game! The challenges were tough but got your brain going and the detective in you out, and having Gabriel -the hilarious and helpful host- there to help if necessary was useful! The decor was amazing and really transported you away. Will definitely be recommending this to friends :) Thanks x

Excellent birthday celebration. A group of nine of us had a super time sleuthing at this event. We split into two teams and took it in turns to solve the mystery. I was a bit worried what the other team would do whilst we were In there but I need not have worries as the pub itself is fantastic - loads to do. The mystery element was challenging but doable, and the host was superb. I thoroughly recommend this for an evening's entertainment.

Super fun night out. Didn't know quite what to expect when I booked this, and my friends were wondering what I'd got them into. But it exceeded all our expectations, it was so fun! There were four of us, two avid computer gamers and two who aren't into anything like that, and we all had an equally enjoyable time solving the puzzles and getting into the spirit of the game.
Great fun!. Worth a visit, great fun a good mix of humour and puzzles and the host makes it with his excellent acting and helpful hints if needed.

Great fun. Loads of fun, really well thought out. The actor was very entertaining (and made us jump a few times!) Just the right amount of challenge to feel against-the-clock but still possible. Loved it.
A little bit spooky, a lot of fun. A great activity for a group of friends - challenging but not impossible. A really good laugh, and high quality experience. Would definitely recommend.

Amazing Experience. Loved every minute! From the beginning you are instantly brought in with the theme and concept. We were a team of two joined with another group of three and it worked. Would definitely recommend this escape game to anyone who loves puzzles and riddles, or anyone who is up for doing something a bit different.

Great fun and a unique activity in London. What great fun! fantastic activity to try with your friends - sufficiently challenging but always a good laugh, test your skills on this magical game hosted by an extremely knowledgeable and friendly fellow - Mr. Gabriel. Cant wait to try the different games they have being set up in Brighton and north London.

Fruity, well-bodied, mature... and a little heady. You need to use your head to squeeze the Reserve from Lady C's secret compartment... she's a little on the dry side herself, but the single bottle leftover from her Last Party is satisfyingly juicy. Solve risqué riddles and the pertest of puzzles under the bowler-hatted Gabriel's ever-helpful eye to win favour from the saucy, if sadly late, lady. Meet Gabriel in the bar at the 4 Thieves - a great pub, just a short walk from Clapham Junction. He'll guide you into the cobwebbed cellar rumoured to contain the old relic herself (and the phantasmagoric wardrobe which sits chained up for your protection in the corner). Good luck... and bottoms up!
Great birthday surprise! . I went with 3 friends for my birthday and had a great time! Thank you to Gabriel for hosting! Would definitely recommend! (Brighton)

So much fun!. We had a thoroughly good time as we unravelled the mystery of Lady C's reserve. Funny, spooky and appropriately challenging (thanks to Gabriel's helpful hints). Would recommend it to anyone who liked The Crystal Maze as a child. Book tickets now!

Scary but fun puzzle game! . A great game and at a competitive price. Very scary with some really great brain teasers. Well set up and a brilliant host. Would definitely come back if they make a new room :). Appreciated the wine at the end, a lovely keepsake!

Not for the weak minded. We where greeted by Gabriel who was our games master for the evening, his presence and personality where perfect for this event, I will not give any spoilers but if you like puzzles games and thinking out side the box this is amazing night out, good for friends and team nights out, 10/10 will go again with different friends for more fun and greater challenges!
Great!. So much fun! Bit different and gets you thinking. Great with a group of 4. Did it for a work night out and worked really well.

Fantastic fun and a night out with a difference!. We had not done anything quite like this before so had no real idea of what exactly to expect. It turned out to be a fun and challenging hour of puzzle-wrangling. Our host for the game, Gabriel was charming and entertaining. I can thoroughly recommend this as a great way to enliven a night out, and to test your problem solving skills.

A great way to spend an hour in Brighton.. I was not at all sure when my son (adult) suggested this for his birthday trip, but we went along, and had a fabulous time. Gabriel the host does a fantastic job of setting the scene and providing encouragement when needed. The game itself is conducted in a darkened room with an eerie assortment of props and noises. By torchlight you have to try to solve a mixture of puzzles, which have just the right level of trickiness. We managed to win the bottle of Lady Chastity's wine with minutes to spare. It was altogether an enjoyable, if unusual way to spend an hour in Brighton.

Boss this. We've done escape rooms before on the continent but they're proper trendy here now, aren't they? So wasn't too sure what to expect after booking one in a pub down the road.However, it's top notch. The host, Gabriel, is a great character for setting the mood straight away. The room itself is well themed and there are some suitably creepy parts of the experience. The puzzles are a nice mix between easy and quite hard - we finished with about 10 minutes to go but you can imagine some teams not finishing at all, sone puzzles will stump. Plus if you win you get a free alcoholic prize. Hooray!Overall it's a lot of fun, good value for money and a brilliant way to spend the evening. Highly recommend.

Amazing Time! (Brighton). Had such a laugh doing this, the Black Lion is nice and laid back, with friendly staff and good food. Good music too!The game itself was brilliant and the host Gabriel was great fun. We were both blown away by how atmospheric it was, really transported you into a different world.Would love to do this again, but now we know all the puzzles - hope they come up with another game soon so we can go again!

Absolutely brilliant, well orchestrated, excellent value for money, so much fun!. Myself and 11 friends played Lady Chastity's Reserve on the 17th of October 2015. We didn't really know what to expect as we've not done anything like this before.From the word go, we were really impressed. Gabriel, the host, was a superb individual! A great actor with a wicked sense of humour and genuine kindness. (There was a mix up with one of our bookings, but he sorted this really swiftly without making any kind of fuss (he even stayed in character throughout the conversation!) - he worked through his lunch break in order to ensure that the problem was resolved, which it was. It was very refreshing compared to the usual response you get from people - things like 'there's nothing I can do about that' or 'it's not my problem.' In actual fact, it wasn't Gabriel's problem or error at all, but it wasn't ours either and so he sorted it. Top bloke.)The game itself was brilliant fun. We played in three teams, back to back. I can't say too much or it will spoil the game for other players - but it was very well thought through, very well put together, and very well orchestrated. Props were good quality and riddlesand puzzles were just the right level of difficulty - with the option to get a clues from Gabriel available on three occasions if the teams wanted. Puzzles to solve were varied and inventive. Full of innuendo and very silly humour which we loved, the game exceeded our expectations. At the end, Gabriel revealed our times and crowed one team the champions. But we all won Lady Chastity's fabled aphrodisiac wine, much to our delight!The pub where the the game is located, The Four Thieves in London, is also great. It was perfect for teams to hang out when it wasn't their turn to play. Some ate, and the food was good. Drinks were reasonably priced for London. An eccentric host also ran games of Bingo and other fun stuff during the afternoon for those who wanted to join, with prizes! Upstairs was an old music hall transformed into a games room with a second bar - it had ping pong, giant 90s video games on a projector, pinball, and a giant remote control car track with a commentator - really good fun. Would recommend! I'm only sad that we can't playLady Chastity's Reserve all over again now that we've done it, as we'd know what to do! But we'd all recommend this to anybody who likes a bit of silly humour and is looking for something fun and unusual to do.If I could suggest one improvement, it would be the booking process for a large group. At the moment there is no way to book two or more games at once on the website or over the phone, and this meant we had to pay the booking fee three times in order to secure three slots for our players. It's only a small detail and really in the grand scheme of things didn't matter, but I think larger groups would appreciate the option to pay for all their games in bulk.Overall, a fantastic experience, give it a go, you won't regret it! Special thanks to Gabriel who is a total star!

Better than the Dance of Baccus. Through a small unassuming door in a south west London pub we found Gabriel, a man, perhaps, who told us a tale and led us deeper into his dark and mysterious world. We saw things we cannot unseen, we did things of which we can never speak, and I found out that I'm much less cool in a crisis than I thought I'd be. Thank you, Gabriel. Whatever you are.

Lady Chastity will keep you entertained!. Definitely the best room escape experience I had so far. The puzzles are very entertaining and creative. Even the brightest minds will be up for a good hour of challenges. Our host, Gabriel is brilliant and does a wonderful job at immersing everyone into the story of Lady Chastity.An absolute must for anyone who loves room escapes. Oh and as for the bar itself, it has got everything ranging from pool table, table tennis and arcade games.
Superbly themed. Well paced, very atmospheric, variety of puzzles. Gabriel performance really added to the atmosphere.
SO GREAT!. Really great, the hour flew by, the host Gabriel is the icing on the cake. I loved every minute and would recommend doing it

Great fun and something different. It was a lovely way to spend a Sunday afternoon. Gabriel is great, he is always in character and sets the scene really well! The venue and room was good and fitted the theme well. This is definitely something I would recommend anyone does. We stayed and had lunch in the trendy pub afterwards. Good fun!

Brighton - A rip roaring experience!. A fantastic time was had by all, laughter from the start and frantic panicking throughout! I cant recommend this enough for an alternative way to spend an hour of your day.
You wont forget it!!!

Total immersion with a good brain teaser. One of the better room escape I've done so far. The atmosphere allows you to get caught up with the theme. The host played the role really well and ensure you are always "On" track. The puzzles was a good teaser and you definitely will get a good challenge if you dare to enter Lady Chastity's chamber! Great fun for a group of friends in a winter's cold
Excellent. A really fun game. The host is amusing; helpful bit doesn't give anything away. The room is big enough for a group and for everyone to have a role.
Awesome experience!. A must. Worth it. Great fun and challenging experience to give you an example of mystery and puzzle solving! The host makes it for you!

Best of it's kind!. I booked this for a friend's birthday - the two of us had done escape game experiences before (in America) - as a group of 4. Gabriel was fantastic, he both facilitated and distracted from the game, in a great and entertaining way. His commentary was superb but it was making us laugh a bit too much!! Although that was great as we weren't taking ourselves seriously (who would at Lady Chastity's Reserve?!).We needed maybe a minute or two more, so we left gutted! But the whole experience was fantastic, much more plot driven and clear-cut than previous escapology games I've done; it had a real purpose. It was so brilliantly devised as a game of this kind, I can't recommend it enough!

very fun and exiting evening !. We've played with an other couple. It was funny, hard but fortunately Gabriel (a) ;-) was here to help us. Nice old designed room. And we got this last lady chastity wine bottle !

Truly Awesome - Book it Now :). What a brilliant event. Gabriel is a star and makes this activity the entertaining and unique experience it is. He pitches his role just right, giving an air of mystery and intrigue with charm and enthusiasm. The mystery itself is brilliantly planned and executed - not too complicated its over-whelming but challenging enough that you have to employ the grey cells. Thanks for a great experience Gabriel, we all loved it and it made a family Birthday outing truly entertaining, all the better for your generosity with clues when we were up against the clock. Don't hesitate - book it now you certainly won't regret it. Brilliant!
Well worth a visit!. Fantastic experience. Anyone who like mystery games or room escapes will love this. Have a drink in the pub after to go over the fun.

Good fun in London. This place did exceed expectations, being the first game of it's type we had ever been to before. The host was great and gave little clues where needed (usually by appearing behind us un-noticed.) I'd recommend this to anyone looking to do something a bit different in London. Also, we didn't get a chance to stay in the bar/restaurant which this game is situated in, but it seemed lovely.

Fun evening!. Great fun! A few drinks and a bit of food in the bar first, which has a nice little garden area at the back too. The puzzles were challenging enough to be interesting but with a few clues we navigated them pretty well and the effects were silly/spooky. We had a real giggle but don't expect some big posh hi tech set up. In my opinion that's not a negative though!

Amazing experience (Brighton). My husband booked this experience as part of my surprise birthday weekend in Brighton. I had absolutely no idea what was going on and I have to say the whole experience was AMAZING. Gabriel was a great host and gave us the much needed help. The event is set up well and really makes you work for that bottle of wine! It was only my husband and I for our experience and I think that worked really well for us (namely because we’re both so competitive!). Overall it was a great experience and one I would definitely recommend to others.
Fun puzzles and wine. Excellent fun. Great atmosphere. Good puzzles. Well acted by the narrator/ chaperone. Would recommend highly esp when rainy!
Great Escape Game. I have done a number of immersive experiences and escape rooms and this was very high up there! The host Gabriel was great and I would recommend to all my friends.

Perfect team night out. 14 of us came along for a team night out and everyone thoroughly enjoyed it. Everyone could easily participate. The wine was delicious and everyone's been raving about it since.

Fun and alternative night out. I had a couple of friends over form the US and was looking for something weird and British to do. This did not disappoint!We were the last party of the night (10pm) and it was great fun. Very spooky and full of atmosphere thanks to 'Gabriel' our host.I've done another mystery escape room type event before which was a bit manufactured, this felt like you were in a proper London pub and was a bit tongue in cheek ... it made us laugh :o)

Brilliant night. Great fun, very well designed and thoroughly absorbing! Went to the Brighton location room was good size and was in a team of 5 which worked well. Gabriel was a great host too, thoroughly entertaining. Highly recommended!

Pant Pissingly Funny. A first timer at this sort of game so had no idea what to expect and am an absolute convert. Super clever in the way that it's set up and awesome production/set design. Thank God for Gabriel's assistance though, (we had to use all three of our life lines - I blame the gin). Japes, scrapes, mystery, intrigue and booze. What's not to like?

Great Fun. Host Gabriel is just brilliant. The game was fun and absorbing, even the bottle of wine was good! On top of this the game is based in a proper old pub, the Sunday lunch was excellent, the deserts were huge and the games room upstairs is a wonderful place to while away the rest of your afternoon. Will definitely go back when they develop a new game or a new level. Go, you can't fail to have a brilliant time!
Fantastic night out. Really good fun, perfectly themed the whole way through and well thought out - it is worth a whole evening out as the pub is also lovely

Hilarious and intelligent. Great entertainment, hilariously rude and brought to life excellently by the host Gabriel! Having done 3 escape rooms already this rates very favourably and I'm looking forward to a sequel.

Easy to book and great fun. Booked it last minute through Plan. Probably not as difficult as other escape rooms, but more atmosphere and fun. Great location for drinks and dinner afterwards. If you get the wine, you can even celebrate your success in the pub.

So much fun!. I booked this not knowing exactly what it would be like but having a fair idea as I love playing escape room games online. t did not disappoint! went with my boyfriend and we both loved it and thought it a novel way to spend the evening. Gabriel was wonderful and without him we may not have won the wine with 3 seconds to spare. He was kind of like looking at the walk-through of a game but didn't tell us what to do but gave more clues which was helpful. We loved it and can't wait for new games to be introduced, We want to experience something like this again!

Greatest Evening Out. I booked Lady Chastity's Reserve as a surprise birthday present for my friend, so she had no idea what to expect but she absolutely loved it. Gabriel, the guide and riddle-assistant was cheeky, entertaining and incredibly helpful. While playing the game he is always there to give hints (in our case, quite a few) and he never broke character. We were allowed to take our drinks into the room, which may or may not have hinder us, but proves how relaxed and fun the whole evening is. I would highly recommend this to anyone, although would say that it is quite a small room so if there are loads of you prepare to get sweaty. Overall, it was just the best.
Amazing night out! . Had no idea what to expect when we but couldn't have imagined it being any better. Fantastic host, great experience and delicious wine!

Amazing fun!!!!. Best way to spend an hour, would really recommend this fun experience. Gabriel the games master was fantastic and entertaining, and was able to create along with the amazing room a really great story. The puzzles were challenging and surprising, never a dull or predictable moment. Amazing evening out, couldn't recommend enough.

In the Zone. Great experience offering something a little bit different. We played as a group of 4 (2 couples) Gabriel as an actor makes it setting the scene as soon as you arrive so you feel immersed in the game straight away and until the very end if you are lucky enough to complete the challenges. Good fun trying to solve the riddles, rhymes and mysteries in an action packed hour. Highly recommended

Small room, big fun. Unlike any other escape room we've done, this was a hugely entertaining hour on a Friday night. Gabriel the host had us smiling from the minute he came to get us from our table in the pub. His introduction was a real highlight and he kept a watchful eye over us throughout, even taking us by surprise with the occasional piece of advice as we made our way through the clues. A cleverly constructed game in which time really flies. Great night and highly recommended. Can't wait for the next one!
Amazing Fun. Would recommend this experience. Great time had by the whole team. Gabriel's acting skills are very believable. Have a go yourself!

Epic hour!. Never done anything like this before but had such a great time! Gabriel is very believable from the beginning as he guides you through the mystery. Expect a fun challenge... now stop reading this review and get this booked!

Great atmosphere. One of the smaller and less difficult escape rooms, but what it lacks in size, it makes up for in captivating story, whole set up and especially acting skills of gamemaster Gabriel. Combine this all with great beer and burgers (escape room is located in the basement of the pub The Four Thieves) and you can be sure of having great evening!

Great fun for groups!. I've been to a few of these escape games now and this one was definitely a bit different in a good way! Others I've been to have had cleverer and more ingenious puzzles, although this one was charming as it had its own character and an unique atmosphere. Set in a great pub with lovely gardens, this makes an excellent evening out.

Fun alternative to the 'escape room'. Lady Chastity's reserve is a fun and different take on the esape room experience.I did it with 4 friends, and we all really enjoyed it. I have been to HintHunt, ClueQuest etc and I have to say this is one of the best. The set up of the room, the props used, the puzzles... all of them original and challenging.Gabriel himself is great in charater, and really adds to the experience.Just for the record, we completed Lady Chastity's Reserve with 5 minutes to go!Have fun, it's a great concept, I will do again if/when the set-up changes.

Witty, clever, spooky and incredibly fun!. Really recommend this experience! Handmade mysteries have created a brilliant story with very clever puzzles for you to solve. We had so much fun with this! Immersive, mind-bending and incredibly fun, would recommend this to everybody! Located in a lovely pub in Clapham Junction where you can enjoy your prize after the game.

Interactive, melon-twisting, fun with your friends.. I really wasn't sure what was going to happen when Gabriel led us down some dark stairs, in the middle of a cool pub in Clapham Junction. A few minutes later, back-story explained, we were working as a team to break codes in search of the elusive prize, a bottle of fine-wine. 57 minutes and a pint of cold lager later we exited Lady Chastity's lair victorious, having really enjoyed the immersive experience, the clever puzzles and esepcially Gabriel's witty and welcome interventions. I can think of all sorts of situtaions where this game would provide great entertainment value, not leas a first date, but in our case it was just a good old laugh with some mates. Definitely worth a try, well done Handmade Mysteries, looking forward to discovering your next venture...

Great concept and plenty of fun finding Lady Chastity's Special Reserve!. I have not done anything similar before and had no idea what to expect but thought Hand Made Mysteries have done this really well - great fun and an hour well spent. We finished the game (2 minutes to spare) - its about the right difficulty, challenging but not impossible and the outstanding host Gabriel is on hand if you get stuck. We spent another hour after the game recounting the experience and it left us with plenty to laugh about. The pub is great too with an awesome games room upstairs. Definitely recommend you check it out. There is air con as well now, I noticed a previous review said there was none.

A mysterious time full of brain-twisting wit and fun. Solving clues to gain Lady Chastity's Wine was an activity I would recommend to all. Fun for anyone with a little cash and a group of good mates. It was well worth the price and winning was difficult enough to make it a challenge but still tantalisingly feasible such as to keep you guessing till the very last second.

Great innovative way to spend an hour in London!. This was my first 'immersive' experience and have to say it was a great way to stretch the brain! Gabriel was perfect for the role a truly helps to set the scene and get you in the role. I'm surprised how quick an hour passed and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to have a bit of escapism whilst having to concentrate on a fun task. Well done all!

Different experience. It was very entertaining and different from other escape rooms. Big advantage is Gabriel, the "usher" who really gets you in the mood and never steps out of the role throughout the whole attraction. The atmosphere of the room is unique and just a bit scary (funnily scary though). Some of the puzzles are very innovative. As for the downsizes - If you book your visit as a couple or as a team of three you are facing a possibility that some other couple may join you. The room is very small and I can't imagine searching for the clues with two or three people that I don't know. I would also recommend not to exceed the number of three as it is hard to picture how can 5 people functionally cooperate in such a confined space. Otherwise it is extremely enjoyable and, unlike other escape rooms in London, it is affordable.

Very creative. It was a very unique experience and we enjoyed the concept a great deal. The host Gabriel was brilliant and played his role really well.The only slight downside was that being a team of two, we were paired with a team of three who appeared to forget that we were also part of the whole team. Gabriel did speak to us afterwards and apologise and to be honest it wasn't such a big deal that it spoiled the event, however it is something I would be more cautious of when booking something similar in the future.

One of the best things I've done in London. A group of friends and I booked to do this as an alternative surprise party for a friend with a fondness for immersive theatre. It most certainly exceeded all our expectations.Gabriel, the host, is incredible and delivers the story of Lady Chastity very well, which allowed our group to become interested in the story as well as working as a way to build some tension and excitement before the games began. He often peeked into the room to keep an eye on us and to give us hints when we needed them, which was useful but it never felt like we were being given too much help.Irritatingly the review from TimeOut did affect the experience for me as it made the show sound as if it were meant to be scary, and so I prepared myself for what may have been a show filled with jump scares. However, the only times I jumped were when the smoke machine in the to went off, and during an instance in which Gabriel entered the room almost silently and appeared behind me suddenly. I screamed, leapt into the air, my arms flailing around, before laughing at how ridiculous I was being. Gabriel clearly wasn't expecting that reaction, and ended up bent over double laughing and had to take a moment to calm down outside, which led to a lot of jokes at my expense afterwards.The room in which the game takes place is not massive, but it doesn't need to be, because what it lacks in size it most certainly makes up in character, and there is always enough room to complete all the puzzles. This was with a team of five: the maximum number of players allowed in the room at once. With any more players in the room it would have been a struggle.The tasks often result in finding a combination, but due to the variety of tasks available this is never an issue. They were challenging, but not so difficult that they couldn't be completed within the allotted hour we were given. Earning the wine at the end of the game felt like an achievement, and tasted all the better because we had earned it.All in all, Lady Chastity's Reserve is a brilliant and reasonably priced game located in a great pub in Battersea. It is welcoming, fun, and entertaining. I have never come across anything quite as quirky as this, and having had such a good time here, if this group create any new games I will be desperate to play them as soon as possible.

Lady Chastity escape room - Fantastic. Better than any other escape room I've been to!Really great theatrical host that added to the experience!Fantastic use of props, light and sound!Interesting and engaging puzzles!We finished with a few seconds to go which meant that we got to take back a bottle of the Lady Chastity's famous wine!

Great way to pass a few hours. Really good fun, Gabriel is a great host and the puzzles were interesting enough. Room is cosy but 5 of us managed ok. Pub itself is very nice, staff were friendly and had a well earned pint after our efforts.

Great fun evening out. This was so much fun! Gabriel made the event even more enjoyable by playing such a good character! My only complaint is that the room is too hot and needs AC! It was so stuffy but if they had AC the cold would probably had to the effect of the event!

Can't recommend enough!. What a brilliant night out!I had booked this evening as a surprise birthday present for my friend as neither of us had tried anything like this before. Let's just say I am now her favourite friend! We were met by Gabriel who was brilliant and hilarious (give that man a raise!) and he really helped add to the mystery of the night!There were only 2 of us which we thought was perfect for the size of the the room (but also we're just selfish and wanted it all to ourselves!) and we managed to beat the clock and win the wine!The puzzles were tricky but clear enough to figure out and we had such a good time! This was our first 'puzzle room' experience and it's going to be tough to beat!Thank you so much!

Really great - Gabriel is fab!. We had so much fun at this escape room, Gabriel was amazing. My only complaint would be that we had to play the game with another couple, I booked this one because it was the only one London that had the option for 2 players, I didn't realise until we arrived that we had been put with strangers. This probably wouldn't have been a problem if the other couple had been fun..but they weren't... and I think they slowed us down a little.

The Half Whits triumphed .... with a little bit of help!. My daughter booked this for our family as we were visiting her for the weekend. Our team consisted of my Husband (49), me (51), our Daughter (25) and Son (18). It was really good fun! We did find it quite difficult and got quite a bit of help from the marvellous Gabriel but I'm pleased to say we cracked it with 3 seconds to spare :-) A great experience and a lovely and interesting way for our family to spend time together.

Fun but can improve. We went with 4 people and it was a fun experience but it was a bit short - it would have been better for 2 people as the room is quite small as well. It would be nicer to have several rooms to explore like other escape rooms in London. The host was great, the acting, design and atmosphere was brilliant.

Amazing production value for an escape game. I've done two escape games in Vancouver, one in Los Angeles and now one in London. I've loved them all, but out of these, the Lady Chastity game stands out as the one with the greatest production value. The props are special made for this game, the music, sound effects, recorded voices, books, tools etc, all custom made for this very game. And it is fun! I was in a stupid mindset when I did the game, and so was everybody else. I don't think the game is THAT hard, but we struggled. We got a fair bit of help from our guide, perhaps too much, because we didn't deserve to win the game (it was a close shave!) but we all felt damn good grabbing that bottle! All in all, LOVED the game and recommend it to anyone! (who is old enough)

Blew my mind out sideways.. Beautifully constructed and incredibly clever! The host Gabriel is shamanicly good at immersing you in the scenario. The game is all about lateral thinking so pick friends from all backgrounds with all strengths as there really is something for everyone to do well at. don't get cocky though! time flys at Concord speed the second you are in. I can't wait for the next game! would definitely go again, an evening you can't forget. The Wine tastes like victory itself! and the rumour about it is true....

Something different...in a very good way!. After being escorted to Lady Chastity's Reserve the game began, Gabriel the dapper assistant to your clue solving skills was brilliant and really helped you fully submerse yourself in the game. It's something different to do and its only an hour so there is really no reason to not do it. The game itself does really test you so if you do eventually solve to clues you'll value the prize even that bit more.The Four Thieves pub itself offers a fantastic night with its eccentric charm, brilliant beer garden and kitted out games room, so when I arrived with my two friends I could tell it was going to be a good night and it was! In the words of Shia LaBeouf JUST DO IT!

Really fun and entertaining. Great value, even though is only an hour - it felt like longer and was really good fun. The pub is good too - with their games room upstairs so is a good night out. Gabriel was funny and entertaining and helpful when the help was needed. I would recommend it.

fantastic. Me and three friends attended at this experience on 1 august for my friend's birthday. From beginning to end it was brilliant. Gabriel who showed us to room was very entertaining. The experience itself was extremely well presented and thought out. Excellent entertainment and also excellent value. We managed to complete the puzzle in 50 mins. I would like to see a league table on the website so we could compare how we did when compared to other teams. Would highly recommend this.

An hour really isn't that long.... Just spent an hour doing this and it did not feel like it at all! Managed to finish with a shameful two seconds remaining! Highly recommend over a weekend argument in IKEA instead!! Great host!

Brilliant fun!. I bought this experience for my boyfriend for his 22nd birthday. I researched for a long time which experience to purchase - as there are a lot of different escape room-type experiences and venues across London - but chose this one based on the fact that it was one of the few places that we could take part as just a two, and it was a little cheaper than the others.I'm so glad we did buy this one as, although I haven't done any others, it seemed very much more immersive and detective like that others on offer. Plus the prospect of winning some red wine and eating a delicious meal in a nice pub was attractive!The pub itself is really lovely, with a 'ginyard' with very tasty gin drinks on offer, and a great selection of food too (the Four Thieves burger was to die for).Gabriel, the host, was absolutely fantastic! He incorporated the perfect amount of fun and playfulness with seriousness in order for us to understand what to do. The room is quite small, so I would actually recommend doing this in a smaller group. I would think any more than 4 would be a squish. The game itself was the perfect level of challenge and fun for us and we completed it with 9 minutes to spare - very proud! The whole thing was great fun! I don't usually like this sort of immersive gaming but I loved every second of it; the mystery, the challenge, the logic needed and the story were awesome.I would recommend it to anyone.

Laterally amazing! ;) . Me and my darling boyfriend have just made it out of Lady Chastity's Reserve, bottle in hand and apparently we made it onto the leader board. This place is amazing, the staff in the Four Thieves are really friendly and Gabriel who is the host to your escape game is utterly spectacular! He makes it. We loved every second, so much so that I wanted to go again. I recommend anyone to go here if you're in London (if you not, then go out of your way to go. I hear they're making a sequel too so I shall be returning)

Happy Hens!. I organised Lady Chastity's Reserve as part of a hen do and it was a lot of fun. I'm very into games and I love escape room games, so this was right up my street. There wasn't as much searching for clues and objects which I really enjoy doing, but there was a lot to solve and the puzzles were really challenging. The unique thing about this game is the strong and spooky atmosphere created, which plunges you into the story and brings it to life. We did an embarrassing amount of screaming, I have to admit, but it was all part of the fun! It is clear that a lot of time and thought has been invested in the design of the room and each aspect of the game itself and I would definitely love to try any future games following on from this one :)In summary, I would recommend you try this, whether it's something totally new to you or whether you're a bit of a games lover like me and whether it's with friends, family or an unusual date - if you don't try, you'll never know!

Good experience, very friendly and enthusiastic. It was really fun, and we all had a good time. Different to others I've done in the past as you have the chance to win something, so there's more focus on the goal.We were a little disappointed that there was a limited amount of room, and think that extra space would make it so much better.The host was really enthusiastic and we loved the atmosphere created by this.

an hour of mystery :). we had a great time while trying to find the bottle and complete the tasks within the time. The host Gabriel was just lovely, explaining the game pointing us in the right direction and creating the atmosphere:)even though room is pretty small definitely not claustrophobic, plenty of clues and unusual things to look around, good fun we managed to complete the task with no spare time!!listen carefully when 'The Lady' talks to you :)

Hidden gem. Having played a few escape rooms before this was by far the best presented. Gabriel was welcoming, entertaining and excellent throughout.
Best bits:
The set and surprises throughout.
Gabriel and the back story.
The pub is great.
Suggestions:
One too many free clues from Gabriel.
More puzzles that require 2+ players at once.
Highly recommended!

Innuendo laden, immersive, fun escape room. When I look back over the 15 or so "escape rooms" I've visited in London, many of the details merge together and it's not always easy to remember which room was which. I doubt that will ever be an issue with Lady Chastity's Reserve! They've gone to a lot of trouble picking their host and designing the room to really immerse people in the game. Let's start at the beginning: The venue is excellent - a lively pub in an area with plenty of nearby restaurants, or if you're feeling lazy, food is served in the bar itself. Once you arrive, you're greeted by Gabriel who is, frankly, amazing. He really sets the scene, but knows how thickly to layer it on - he walked the line of making us feel very slightly uncomfortable without it ever feeling unpleasant. Nervous, without feeling scared.After entering the room there are a number of fun puzzles to solve, with a very clear goal and some good clues to help you along the way if you get stuck. For the more experienced players, you might get a little frustrated by the linearity of the game (although for novices, that's probably a good thing) and by the number of codes/padlocks - most steps resulted in a code or a key, rather than anything cleverer.As for the ending: The game has a very satisfying finish and a sense of completion that probably beats every other escape room I've attended. Oh, and for once they're reasonable about taking photos in the room - don't spoil the game for others, but feel free to take pictures. Not that we had time :-)In summary - OK puzzles, more than made up for by a fantastic host, great venue and great ambiance.(Full disclosure - I won free entry to this in a competition, although it hasn't in any way affected my write up)

Great Way To Spend An Hour. The hard core quiz team went to this last night. It's hard to review without spoilers but it's an hour of fantastically fast paced fun. We were battling against the clock, rather than other teams, and had all manner of puzzles to solve to win our bottle of wine. It's creepy without being scary, and at least you can take a drink in with you - advised, as in the current location it does get quite hot. I'm hoping they develop some new games soon.

An entertaining escape.. It's tricky to review 'Lady Chastity', for the simple reason I knew very little about it when I took part, and that, without doubt, is the best way to approach itSo I'm going to keep this brief. This is an excellent way to spend an hour with mates. Gabriel, the host, is fantastic. The game was far harder than I imagined, and all the better for it, and the time flew by in a delightful blur of detective work, deducing and dashing around (ok, and in our case, a fair bit of simple dumb luck)Lady Chastity was my first 'Escape Room' experience, if they are all even half as fun it certainly won't be my last

So worth while!! Great fun and so easy to get carried away!!. I came to across this team game when looking for Escape games in London, and while it's not necessarily an Escape game, it is so immersive, it is so easy to get carried away! I have to admit me and my friends were rubbish and didn't even win! But even though we didn't, we would love to go back, such a nice way to pass just over an hour by the time you get in, get a drink and get going!Everything is really well done, and although slightly cringey at times, it all made it enjoyable for everyone! Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

This is one lock in you'll never forget. Lady Chastity’s Reserve may be one of London’s newest attractions, but the quest for her magical wine is already of the finest vintage. This was my first taste of an escape room and for anyone else who hasn’t tried one of these immersive experiences, it does exactly what it says on the tin – challenges you and your friends to a series of riddles and puzzles which allow you to escape the room. Think an exciting, twisted game show – with the fantastic Gabriel as your host. The name is somewhat ironic, because as soon as I’d escaped I wanted to go back for more. In a city where you think you’ve experienced everything, Lady Chastity’s Reserve is a must do – a really different, fun and exciting way to spend an afternoon or evening. This is one lock in you’ll never forget!

An afternoon well spent!. Have always wanted to try escape room games - thought we'd use this as a taster. It exceeded our expectations and we had so much fun that I am now worried other escape room games we try in the future are going to be disappointing! Kudos to the host who is also the mastermind of the game :) thank you Gabriel for a wonderful time.
Unique and unforgettable experience. This is a really unique and immersive production unlike anything else i've experienced. Great host and game design, bravo on creating something different.
Such fun!. I did this with my parents and two friends and we had such a great time. Great for all ages and just something different and interesting to do in London.

Mystery, intrigue, wine... what more could you want?. Great fun for a group of mates.We just about managed to win the wine in time. The Lady is unforgiving and pretty dark in places. Would recommend to anyone after something different.

Brilliant, clever and challenging!. This was our first foray into the world of escape games and it certaintly didn't disappoint! The setting of the scene was excellent and atmosphere created and held excellently throughout. The challenges were clever and just the right level of difficulty. Would definitely recommend to anyone...In fact I haven't shut up about it since!

Truly chilling. Prepare to be blown away by the intricacy of this game. Bring your A game. Would recommend to bring a team with you as each of your different interpretative strengths will ensure success with each puzzle. Gabriel the host adds to the chillingly dark atmosphere. Best thing I've done in London in a long time!

Great night out!!!. did this as a double date! good fun although a little difficult, defintiely dont want to be having a few drinks prior! gabriel the host was great!
highly recommend thanks!! also great venue for pre and post drinks.

Expect the unexpected..... The whole experience totally surpassed expectations, as well as being GREAT fun and a brilliant way to mix up an evening at the pub. The game is very clever, full of surprises, and really challenging. It was interesting to see the different strengths (and competitive streaks) each person brought to the game! Highly recommended - looking forward to playing the next game by Handmade Mysteries.

Got to live out my Goonies fantasy!!!. Really enjoyed this game from start to finish! The clues were pitched at just the right level so that trying to decipher them in time was a good challenge. I even got to have a 'Goonies' moment (you'll find out what I mean if you play the game!) A great thing to do with a group of mates of an evening, and the pub itself was pretty sweet. Highly recommended!

I felt like I was on a darker, dirtier version of the Crystal Maze - brilliant fun!. Excellent fun! They have gone to real effort to create a dark and dirty victorian atmosphere and Gabriel the host really adds to this. Having never done an experience like this before, I was unsure what to expect but I was not disappointed. The puzzles inside are challenging, requiring some good mental dexterity - probably shouldn't have had 2 pints before going in!! Overall, good value, really good fun and when you're done, the pub serves great food too.

Lady Chastity's Reserve offers a totally unique, interactive experience. It was impeccably organised and presented!. We used Lady Chastity's Reserve as part of our Company Team Building Event and has a completely enjoyable night. It offered us something totally unique and was presented impeccably. We were able to have a personalised night, with company relevant jokes and details, which made the experience all the more interactive! Gabriel the host, presented the whole evening with great showmanship and made the whole experience fun and immersive. It was a great experience that promoted team work and problem solving, whilst moving away from the typical corporate events. Everyone in the company had a fantastic night and we would recommend the event to anyone seeking a unique and mysterious thriller!

[Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] brilliant!!!. Lady Chastity's Reserve is [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] excellent! I had a [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] awesome time - admittedly the puzzles can be [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] taxing on the old noggin' at times but it's well worth it for the sheer [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] thrill of winning and you get a bottle of [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] wine as a [Expletive Removed by Moderator 42B] reward! Fantastic night out. Great night out and thoroughly enjoyable. Gabriel was a superb host and very graciously helped us not look too stupid when it took us a bit too long to get some of the more obvious clues! Would recommend this to everyone. Great fun.

Give the grapes a good squeeze. Absolutely loved this game. Gabriel the host was a star and not at all fazed by us wrecking the props (well he did tell us to not over think the clues and so we took them literally). The game takes under an hour, which some of the team felt was too short, but it suited me just fine. The team after us failed to complete the task, which made our prize wine taste all the sweeter.

very well organised - Gabriel was really good. This is my third experience now and I would say it was good. Gabriel was very good and created the atmosphere. The room is very small especially for 5 people. The clues are tough in some instances. We thought we had 60 mins inside but you actually only get 45 mins. Great pub and only 10 mins walk from the station.

Fun-tasmagorical. What a fantastic evening, what a fantastic game! I love all things phantasmagorical and this was just awesome. Some of the riddles and puzzles were really challenging but with the right combo of brains and persistence we WON!!! Highly recommended!

Haunting, hilarious and handmade!!!. Enter if you dare... My friends and I managed to complete the game just in time!! It was the best of fun and we learnt a lot about each other. The room the game is in really sets the mood and it feels like you're in a movie! Such fun. Would recommend to anyone who is bored of the everyday things to do in London.
Jolly good fun. A cracking room-escape type event. Pretty much perfectly set up for an hour with the puzzles not too tricky, but enough of them to keep you thinking.
Fantastic attraction!. We had a fantastic time. It's a great fun to play, and there will be a prize to win as well! Great atmosphere, highly recommended.

Great alternative date night. A fantastic mystery game, just the right level of difficulty and silliness, great production values and something a bit different. Would heartily recommend for a fun night out with a date or with a group of friends.

Marvelicious!!. Best game ever played ! Recomand to evreyoane who wants a real challenge . I used to play on my computer this kind of game . But never in real life . I was surprised good . I really enjoyed ! Good clues , good voice . Good job !

Absolutely awesome!. I had absolutely no preconceptions about Lady Chastity's Reserve, so didn't know what to expect. I went along as part of a company afternoon out and we split into two teams with the challenge of who could solve the mystery first.The whole experience from start to finish was incredible. We had a really fun and theatrical host who was like a gothic bohemian ring master. The room itself was brilliantly designed right down to the finest detail - which made for a really spooky and atmospheric encounter.Others in the group said it was SO much better than any other 'escape room' experiences they had tried and that they wanted to do it again.I could not recommend this more! Perfect for a group of friends who want do do something a bit different or as a great company team building day. It's set in a really cool pub in in Clapham called the Four Thieves so you can all have a drink and a bite to eat afterwards.Do it! It's amazing
Super fun. Super fun, this was an awesome experience. Great game for groups, make sure you listen to the clues. Highly recommended.

What a great team building afternoon!. Such great fun! I booked this for a Friday afternoon of team building and couldn't have been happier with the outcome - we split into 2 teams of 4 and went head to head in trying to solve the mystery. 'Girls on top' were the winners (of course), but we all came out with adrenalin pumping having had an awesome afternoon. Highly recommend for friends, tourists and corporates!

Great alternative night out. Didn't really know what to expect but I was blown away by this spooky, immersive team game. The level of detail and intricacy to the games and the brilliant acting by 'Gabriel' drew you in and the time flew by!A really brilliant alternative to the cinema or a few beers - in fact it's in a pub so combine with a few beers!

Not your average escape game!. An adrenaline-fuelled hour of puzzles that weren't too difficult but also not too easy so at the end we really felt like we had worked hard for the prize. Really great atmosphere and Gabriellle (our clue master) was fantastic! Highly recommend!!

Do yourself a favour – book now!. This is a really fun and challenging escape room game. The narrator brings the whole storyline to life and the room itself has been cleverly put together so that it is difficult enough without being impossible. And our team won, which is always a bonus! Give it a go, you won't be disappointed.

The most fun you can have in Battersea!. These guys have created an atmospheric and challenging game which is superb for tourists, a bunch of mates or a corporate team building event. I screamed, I laughed and had the best time. Brilliantly creative. Highly recommended.

Atmospheric fun - I actually screamed. I played the game with three friends last week. Wasn't sure what to expect as not really a fan, or very good at, 'puzzles' but actually had a blast. Winning the wine is obviously a bonus, but the game itself is hard but not impossible and the decor/atmosphere/host are all really creepy and unnerving. I had a good time being made to jump and actually screamed at one point. Very clever and brilliant fun!

An escape room with personality. I've been to a bunch of these escape room games in London and this one was the first to really get me into the storyline and narrative. The puzzles are just the right level to make you feel like you've achieved something without being too frustrating and the narrative around it his funny and engaging. Really atmospheric!Another great thing about it is the fact that it's in a pub so you can easily make a night of it. Big recommendation for a unique date.

Incase you never got a chance to be on the Crystal Maze...... Great fun, and something entirely new. Guarantee that you'll have a good laugh playing this game, and using your teams brain power to solve the clues. A really memorable experience, and great venue.

The top of the pack. I've played 28 (if I've counted right) escape room games now, nearly all of them in London. They're usually fun, even the less good ones are more fun than most other options for ways to spend an hour. But it seems unanimously agreed by all experienced players that Time Run is the best. Here's why:- production value. Not just a lot of money has gone into this, but also a lot of love and talent.- the sets are head and shoulders above anything else you'll play in London, probably in the U.K. They aren't just decorated rooms, they are like movie sets, fully immersive, like you're properly inside an adventure game.- even the pre-game bit is amazing. The front door is awesome, the host greets you fully in character, and while he gives you your story and instructions, the immersive experience has already started. This hardly ever happens in room escapes, and this is one of the things that really sets it apart.- all this great stuff could have been really let down if the puzzle design was a bit shoddy. Luckily this isn't the case, they've nailed that too. the puzzles all fit in perfectly with the themed settings, and had a clear logic that was often challenging but the solutions never felt unfair or too random.I regularly review the room escapes I go to on Trip Advisor, and I hardly ever award five stars. This is because Time Run sets the bar for what a five star game is like, and nothing else really comes close.

Amazing immersive fun - Work team loved it! Do this!!. Fantastic from start to finish. As soon as the doors open the fun begins with actors in character to really give an immersive experience. The rooms are challenging and fun and fantastically themed from throughout the ages.10 of us went from the office for a team building experience and all thoroughly enjoyed it!

Absolutely amazing - book!!!. I've done quite a few 'escape the rooms' and this one was by far the best. The rooms were fantastically themed and the puzzles were just the right amount of challenge. We came out of the room amazed and wanting to do more! Couldn't recommend it enough.
Good fun. Went for a work team building exercise. Had a laugh and it held everyone's attention - we didn't realise we'd been in there nearly 2 hours!

Not worth missing!. Arriving with no clue what we'd let ourselves into, we were overwhelmed at the end with how thrilling this was. With just the 3 of us we didn't quite complete it, but we gave it a good shot! The actors were brilliant and made the whole thing more credible. This is definitely worth going to, a brilliant family event!
Great design. One of the top 5 best-designed game environments out of many room escape games I had a pleasure of playing. The intro is a bit long, but it is worth it. If you are in London - DO IT!

Excellent fun!. I bought this as a birthday gift for someone having played other escape games in the same group, so we had a fair idea that we would enjoy it. It's actually the best escape game we've played in terms of storyline and scenery. The rooms are really well put together and you can see they have a decent budget for it. As soon as you enter the building for the briefing, your host is in character which really adds to the excitement. The whole experience is theatrical and entertaining.Although you're on your feet for the whole time, there's nothing too physically demanding so no great fitness level required or particular dress code.We didn't actually escape in time, although I think we were close, but nevertheless we really had a lot of fun trying! I would definitely recommend this particular escape game, it's slightly more expensive than some of the others I've played but you really get what you pay for.

Great fun in beautiful sets. This is the first "escape room" game I've ever played, and I wasn't sure what to expect. It's really good fun, and it brings out the competitive side as your team tries its best to solve the riddle in front of you. You spend most of your time in 3 different rooms, all very different and beautifully put together. It's challenging, but you do get some helpful hints if it looks like your team is struggling. We went as a group of 5, which is probably 1 too many, but it still worked.

Fabulous from start to finish. Without revealing too much from start to finish this experience takes you into a world of time travelling, with a great sense of humour in the beginning to prepare you for your journey.This time run is very well organised, the props & rooms are realistic and you get a true feeling of being engaged. I would recommend this experience for even the less experienced room escapes such as myself.

Wicked time and very fun 😍. I really wasn't sure what to expect when we arrived, it started in a room with an introduction and it went from there.... I won't go into what happens after that as it'll spoil things for people who are yet to experience this awesome experience. We had such a great time and it made us work together which was lots of fun. I highly recommend Time Run

Great fun, great challenge.. Went as a team of 5 family and friends. Loved the whole experience. Very well organised, good story and fabulous scene setting from the organisers. The puzzles were challenging enough that we were all involved all the time but not too difficult to be disheartening. This is the third escape room we've done as a team and definitely the best so far. Would definitely recommend it. We will be back soon for the next adventure.

Amazing team activity. This was such a fun experience - it really gets your brain ticking. The attention to detail in each of the rooms was fantastic and the Time Run team who introduced us to the activity and spoke with us after were excellent. I would definitely recommend this and would do this again in the new rooms that they are launching soon.
Such a fun activity. It was one of the most fun things I have done - it was a great team activity. Would 100% recommend to anyone

An exciting hour full of brain exercise!. This was the first time we did an Escape Room. It was recommended to me by my boss and I decided to surprise my boyfriend for his Birthday with the help of his sister. None of us had done any (real life) Escape Rooms, though plenty of computer game experience. But we managed to successfully finish it.It was so much fun and there was so much to do that we really didn't feel the hour go by! Would absolutely recommend it! The team who take care of you were great fun and took extremely good care of us! We enjoyed it so much that we wish we could do it again.Will definitely try their next escape room!
Fantastic, so much fun!. The staff were all excellent, and unlike other escape rooms I've done, the organisation was impeccable. I would absolutely do it again with a new puzzle!
amazing. This is the 4th escape room I did.We went as a Family and most of us have been to escape rooms before.We were all extremely impressed with each room.Totally worth it.A bit pricey though.

An absolute blast. I've never played an escape room game before, but if they're anything like this one then I'll be planning plenty of excursions to others in the future. I went with two friends and we had an absolute blast traveling between the three rooms/time periods to recover an ancient artifact. (And we succeeded, too!) The story and actors are good campy fun, pulling you straight into the time traveling scenario and world from the moment the doors open, and the puzzles are a nice blend of problem-solving and cooperation so that everyone has something to do. There were a couple times when the props were harder to manipulate that they needed to be, but it wasn't a big enough issue to warrant marking this down a notch.Overall a great way to spend a couple hours, well worth the trek outside of the center of the city. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun, nerdy activity to do with a group while they're in or around London.

So much fun teh hour flew past - agian please!. I went on this with for a work jolly and my expectations were mixed - I really didn't think it would be my 'thing'. I couldn't have been more wrong! The standard of production was a mazing , the challenges were hard but do-able and the time flew past!

A top notch escape game. One of the best escape games I've played. We went as a team of two which makes it very expensive but had heard such good things about it that we wanted to check it out. Really liked the different themes and rooms. Only downsides were the price and we had to wait a while for the rooms to be reset, even though there were very clear instructions about arriving exactly on time to make sure everything runs smoothly, which meant the host was having to entertain us for a long time before we went into the room. And then there were more instructions before finally being able to play the game. That all said the set was fantastic and it's definitely worth trying. Good mix of physical and mental puzzles - definitely something for everyone.

Best escape room game I've ever played. There are escape rooms and then there is "Time Run". The whole experience was out of this world from the moment you arrive at the door from the moment you leave. You definitely feel like you're travelling in time during the whole hour. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the decor was outstanding and the puzzles were fun and varied. I only wish there were more games like this one.

Really good fun. Really good fun. Loved the first and last room and interactive nature. Plus good for team working skills. My only complaint was I found the last room to be too dark for someone with impaired vision and I think this contributed to us not completing to success. Really enjoyed my first such experience, and look forward to doing others.

Time Run. we had never done an escape room before but decided to try one out as we had heard a lot about it.
