It was brilliant and extremely clever, i would definitely recommend time run as it was fantastically built and very fun. sadly we did not finish but by the end we didn't mind as we had all had a great time.Not so easy to find - an unmarked roll-up grill - use your Google Maps and wait for the roll up to open..

Perfect for teenagers and their Dad!. Can not praise this escape room enough. It's not often anymore that you can be considered cool by teenagers but I think we managed it..by taking our 12 and 15 year old here. They love every moment of it, each room was fantastic and the puzzles were so clever. A must if you have the chance to go. My husband was the biggest kid and adore the whole experience. The staff are wonderful and you are immune into the experience straight away. A real fun must do in London young or old. It's great fun and really brings you all together.

Step back in time. What a fantastic experience. Part "Adventure Game" (for those who remember it), part "Indiana Jones" and part "Back to the Future", "Time Run" engrossed three of us for a couple of hours on a fascinating journey across the centuries. Hidden away in the depths of East London, you literally enter another world. Beautifully presented and realised, it's a great challenge to your mind, your relationships and your sense of adventure. I thoroughly enjoyed it and was left exhilarated... just the way you want it from an escape adventure. I don't want to spoil it for you, so just go!

Immersive and well-structured. I'd heard good things about this experience and so I was prepared to pay a little more, and it was entirely worth the money. So much love and attention has gone into every part of this - you get entirely lost in the experience for an hour. Really high-end stuff: I'll be doing the next adventure when it comes out!

Superb escape room experience . I'd never done an escape room before but this was a seriously enjoyable experience. From the moment you enter you are immersed in the full storyline with great actors getting you organised and in the mood for the game. You get an hour to solve the puzzles to allow you to move from one room to another to reach the ultimate goal. We were in two teams, each competing in identical parallel rooms to see who could finish first. The attention to detail was superb, the puzzles challenging but manageable with some helpful clues on the way and the time flies in great funTwo tips: first of all you get an hour in the game but budget at least 90 mins for the whole experience (briefings etc) and secondly the venue doesn't have a sign outside looking "hidden" so is probably really easy to miss. Make sure you know the address and you'll be fine

A fantastic escape room. We have done many escape rooms as a family and this definitely rates as our favourite. From the moment we arrived, the staff and staging were excellent. No spoilers but the experience was challenging with appropriate and amusing clues when required! There has been great thought and investment here...can't wait for a new experience so we can come back. Book it!

Escaped... Just!!!. I've done a fair few of these Escape Rooms now and, this is probably the best one I have done so far. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, you are completely and utterly immersed into the world of time travel. The actor that greeted us was just brilliant, very funny and really added to the whole experience. The game itself last 90 minutes and takes you through 3 rooms, each a different time period from past and future. I won't ruin what each room is, but one thing for sure, they are extremely well made and each room looks and feels nothing like the next.Would definitely recommend this Escape Room to anyone. Whether it is your first escape room or you have done many, it is a really great experience and something really fun to do in London!

Absolutely brilliant escape room. Definitely by far one of the best escape rooms I've been too. Staff were great so creative and responsive lots of fun and adventure. The puzzles and problem solving is excellent a good mix of brain taxing activities with a good theme throughout and a few hints when you really need it. We did it as a team building exercise and it was spot on lots of fun for any group and really high quality. Highly recommend, great location too for food and drinks after.

Would recommend to anyone!. The whole experience from start to end is thoroughly planned out and well done. I won't go into much detail as it might be a spoiler but I'd recommend anyone to go. If you grew up watching shows like Crystal Maze then you'll love Time Run.
Great fun. Had a brilliant time here. Great set-up, great puzzles and enthusiastic engaging staff. We've been to several escape rooms and this is definitely one of the best :D
Simply awesome. Never done one of these before, i was continually surprised by the thought, effort and complexity put into this escape. I loved all 63 minutes of it!

One of the best escape room experiences in London. Challenging, clever and really different - I've done a lot of Escape Rooms and this one was great - really clever, and with enough variety to keep you on your toes. Can't wait for them to create another run!
Amazing!. So amusing, all the guys were so good, and kept in character which made the experience very authentic! Would definitely return!

Amazing!. This really got the grey matter working! It was fun, challenging and well thought out. The hosts really got into character and the fun started the minute you entered the warehouse. Just wish I had all day to do the challenges rather than an hour as this would have been a true reflection of the speed my brain works!

Really Good Room Escape!. Time run was great. We went there in a group of 4 and had an amazing time. I've been to an Escape Room before and this was much better: surprising, immersive setting and interesting challenges!

Brilliant and exciting. It is the best entertainment for a really interesting afternoon. It is truly atmospheric, professional and so well organized, from the minute you arrive to when you have finished. it is not an easy time journey and the puzzles are unusual and challenging, you do need to be in a team of at least four, however we went in a group of eight and split up into two groups - best way to enjoy the experience. It was awesome - the best.

What an amazing adventure, one of the best Escape Rooms yet. Wow, the moment you step through the door you are in for a treat, this is not just an Escape Room but a real adventure. So much thought & money has been invested into the staging & effects with this game you really are immersed into an adventure with this Escape Game.This is probably one of the best Escape Rooms in London. The puzzles etc set at just the right level of difficulty for both beginners and experienced gamers a like, with the odd hint here & there available should you get stuck, to keep the game moving at just the right pace.Don't hesitate to book this Escape Room you will not be disappointed & it is really easy to find, being just a 3 minute walk from London Fields Overground station.Like all Escape Rooms I'd suggest a quick look on google maps at street view to make sure you know how to find it.Enjoy !

A run through time. The escape rooms of all escape rooms. From the moment you ring the bell and enter into the world of Time Run, you are emersed into a world that doesn't falter until the end. The Escape room in London leaving you wondering where the last hour or so has gone. Highly recommended and in our case a very well received birthday present. A team of four was a good number wouldn't suggest a team bigger than 6.

If only I could travel back in time and do it again.... You just have to go and experience this for yourself. It is a must do when in London. Haven't had so much fun in years. I found everything with this escape room experience just absolutely brilliant! Can't wait for them to make a new game. I'll be there.
unexpected time travel experience. I was not expecting to travel through time (on a Sunday no less) but ended up all over the space-time continuum. Most excellent dude.

Brilliant fun and intrigue. My first experience of an 'escape room' and I was not disappointed. From start to finish, it was exciting, unpredictable and tons of fun! The sets were awesome and clues helped along the way when we got really stuck! Can't wait for the next puzzle to return! Really recommend!

Great fun. Had a great time, fun for the whole family- good for the teenagers !
You have to work together , so good for bonding.

Fantastic. We did this as a hen party and thought it was brilliant. Haven't done any other escape rooms before so have no comparison but found this challenging, fun and very well thought out. Would highly recommend.

Went for a birthday party, not having done an escape room adventure before... Not knowing what to expect, I arrived a the warehouse area just in time to start the game. This was my first escape room adventure, and the bar was set high. The briefing and instructions were well produced, with the employee/cast-member staying in character. After the instructions, the game started. They do a wonderful job of immersing you into the game. I don't want to give away any spoilers, but overall, it was very well produced, and you get the sense that the organizers are watching what you're doing to the point that they will help steer you back in the right direction if you are too far out there. We didn't solve the puzzle - we got very close, and probably needed another 10 minutes. Still, this experience has had me looking for other escape room adventures. Highly recommended!
Make time for Time Run!. 3 rooms, various puzzles, team building and all in 1 hour.How could you go wrong? We all learned something about ourselves for sure!

Fantastic challenge that's fun and involves everyone. This was a great evening, it's a really good group challenge and is suitable for everyone. There are little puzzles to complete and it's totally immersive. We had a mixed group and everyone enjoyed it and managed to solve some little piece. There are lots of bits to think about and the setting is really impressive so you can't help but get involved. A good story line to follow and you really get into the theme of each particular room. Such a laugh.

Ever wanted to go on a real adventure? Time Run is your chance!. My friends and I had been really keen to check out Time Run having done a couple of other 'escape' games, and we had the most fabulous time. Time Run lives up to the hype - it's probably the best there is. The attention to detail, the quality of the experience, the production values, the acting (yes, there's acting!) were all amazing, and the puzzles and length of the experience challenging enough without being overwhelming or stopping us in our tracks. We found the Lance of Longinus with only 5 minutes to spare, and wish we could do it all again. Thank you, Luna, Babbage and Aubrey - we'll be back for your next mission!

Great fun. We went there on a stag do and thoroughly enjoyed it. The intro was humourous, and the 3 rooms sufficiently challenging but not impossible. Playing against the other team added a competitive dimension. Overall thoroughly recommended.

Everyone should come and try this.. This is the best escape room experience I have had. We went for a hen party and was great to compete against the other team. Really does get you going when you can see time running out. But worth every penny. Would happily do it all over again.

What a great day. Don't let the surrounding area put you off! This is truly a great experience. Run by enthusiastic and well rehearsed staff.
We loved it.

Very, Very Slick. We've done HintHunt, ClueQuest and EscapeReading and TimeRun has the most polished production values, by far. The staff, narrative and props are so well done, it's all of film set quality from end to end. While we did get out, we found the escape experience a little underwhelming. It seemed so polished and scripted it became almost impersonal - Disney-fied and corporate. The puzzles weren't quite innovative enough to match the dazzle of the decor, it's expensive and it's a fair trek through town too.That said, it's a must-see for escape room fans to appreciate the sheer opulence - it's over far too quick.
Boys trip to London. We had a total blast going here, everything was on point! The staff was really into it and the quality of the rooms was absolutely amazing!

Fantastic - very professional. The staff were totally into the story and good actors, never breaking character from the moment we entered the building.The story was interesting and the rooms were decorated and themed in a very impressive way to make the experience seem very immersive. Went as a team of 6 and we all agreed it was a fantastic way to spend an afternoon. I would recommend this as an activity to everyone!

British Wheelchair Basketball - Team Building. We had a fabulous day at Time Run. It was a thoroughly surreal and enjoyable experience. Excellent team building activity and totally accessible for people in wheelchairs. I would strongly recommend it.

Incredible fun!. I organised a trip to Time Run for my office and it was a huge success. Right from the beginning there was a lot of excitement when we had to turn up and ring the doorbell right on time. The actor in the first room was then very entertaining, joking with our group and delivering his instructions in an interactive and funny way. The experience itself was SO MUCH FUN. The puzzles are pretty difficult, but with a little bit of help from our robot friend we managed to get through - and two of the four groups succeeded in finding the lance!! One recommendation - make sure you actually read the clues properly before launching into trying to solve the puzzles... That would definitely have sped up our experience and made it a little less painful for the poor 'robot.'The theming throughout the experience is also amazing and makes for a really immersive game. You go through 3 rooms, each themed as different times in history, and the pressure to get through the rooms makes it a great team game. It was also super easy to make my group booking, and the team was super responsive and helpful the whole way through. The hour went far too quickly - I will definitely be back when they release a second run!! Side note - we booked Wringer and Mangle for drinks and nibbles. It is a 2 minute walk from Time Run and a really nice bar/restaurant.

Brilliant activity for team event. Party of nine work colleagues looking to do something a bit different. Trekked up to London and across but it was well worth it. Very well thought out with a good background story. We formed 2 teams and it was brilliant to compete against each other without knowing how the other team was doing. Would highly recommend it.
Awesome day out. This was my first time doing this sort of live action/escape game, well worth it, lots of fun, you enter different rooms with different puzzles to get through. Highly recommend!!
Awesome !. We had a wonderful time at Time Run. The scenery and the characters are amazing, it's really as is we were time-travelling ! (and yes, we got the lance!)

The BEST Escape Room in the WORLD!. I've been to well over a dozen escape rooms, across 3 continents and 5 countries. Time Run tops them all. The level of drama and story immersion is unparalleled. The puzzles are varied in form and solution. The theme allows for surprising twists and turns.I felt as though we were playing an old-school PC adventure game: Space Quest, Monkey Island and more blended together. Never a dull moment, great fun and excellent at bringing the team together.The Disney World of Escape Rooms!
Challenging but achievable . Well balanced series of puzzles with excellent staff. Really well put together. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Best time ever . A stimulating, fun and exhilarating experience. For those adventurers who just feel like doing something different and exciting. Fun for all ages and any personality.
Get ready to feel like an actual super hero for a night. So cool 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽

The best in town!. Wow! You can not top this one! Came with 2 girls 11,14 with previous escape room experience- attantion to detail, friendliness, humor and dedication of the team was without fault, yes, you have to pay a bit more but the experience is so worth it! Sadly we run out of time and needed another 10 minutes to complete but we left with superb feelings and it realy did not matter at the end, thoroughly recommend it!

Fabulous!!!. This was our first escape/puzzle room and we enjoyed it enormously. I had researched puzzle rooms in London, read reviews, and this facility is highly regarded for good reason. The host, story, physical surroundings and challenges are all first rate. We were a group of 5--2 older and 3 young adults. We did succeed in solving the puzzle, with 3 seconds remaining! Totally enchanting, very highly recommended!

Great Time! Wish I could do it Again. Excellent escape room: it was elaborate, detailed, fun, and a delight! Honestly, the puzzles were not as logically challenging as I've done in the past--but we still didn't finish on time. My only suggestion is they could make the quest goal a little more interesting, but I had a great time. Wish i could go through it again. Also very close to the overground which was convenient.
Fantastic experience, very well produced. This was the best escape game I've done by far, with beautifully produced decors and fun puzzles which are just the right difficulty

Brilliant afternoon of fun. This was high tec - quite tricky at times and so brilliant to work as a team against the others on Emily's hen do - we all were sad that we ran out of time and could of played for a lot longer - highly recommend this game

Out of this world. Organised this as part of a team building exercise and the team were blown away. The Time Run team are incredible, there's a detailed story behind the quest and each room has been created with a breathtaking amount of detail. You definitely feel like you've stepped back in time. Set up really well, with the mystery starting right at the front door! Would absolutely do this again, already booking a slot there with friends!

Superb. We had a fantastic couple of hours at Time Run. We came with two friends, neither of whom had played an escape room game before, and they came out raving about it. Obviously, I won't spoil the games themselves, but they were varied and incredibly detailed, sufficiently challenging to be a real stretch but, above all, really great fun.We look forward to going back.

THE BEST set escape game, difficult, briliant intro actors, definately going again. we went a month or so ago now and straight away the actors are getting you engaged, making you laugh setting up the story. We've done plenty of escape games as a bit of a laugh and this was one we struggled with and did not complete. SO so close

Time run brill. We went for a birthday day out and it was brill. The team there work really hard and make it more fun. When we finished in there we wanted to do it all again and looking forward to rebooking in the future. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for something different fun and challenging. Good luck time runners X

Great escape room experience. The best escape room experience I've had. Couldn't fault the theme, actors, or puzzles. As a group of 4 we thought the puzzle difficulty was just right. Would love to do another!My only gripe is that one of the rooms was a little too dark. It added to the atmosphere but I really struggled to see what I was doing!

So much fun!!. It was my first escape room experienced and a memorable one! Great rooms with a variety of challenges. We didn't manage to finish on time but still had loads of fun. Totally recommended.
Best escape game ever!!. I have done over 29 different games in 6 different countries and this is hands down my favourite!! A must do if you enjoy escape games!!

Excellent experience . This was a great adventure. Solving puzzles to get through the three rooms inside the 1 hour time limit was a great way of working as a team with the adrenaline rushing to beat the clock. Highly recommended a must do experience

Simply brilliant!. This is the most fun my friends and I have had in a long time. Amazing attention to details, fun and challenging puzzles. The hour went by so fast, we wish we could do that over and over again!The staff is incredible, thank you so much!I would recommend it for anyone who loves puzzle games. It's not physically challenging, so I'd say anyone can do it and enjoy it (though you do have to stand and walk around for a little over an hour).Money absolutely well spent. I can't wait for a new Time Run adventure to be ready!

Time to get your puzzle on!. Went as a group of five and loved it! It was easy to get to and easy to locate and I loved the mysterious outside part! The beginning guy was funny! The rooms were hard but not impossible - we completed it! The rooms were fantastic looking and very challenging .. Not sure if we'd of made it if we weren't all there!I'm not going to say too much so I don't give the game away but I'd definitely recommend it!!!!!

Puzzling time travel. Oh my what a puzzling time our group of four had travelling through time and space looking for the lost lance. The door outside gave no clue what to expect inside but once through your transported back to a lost era. There were various taxing puzzles to solve in first room, which if successfully done opened up next room. Challenge was all the more fun as you were given time limit to finish and were up against another team.If you got completely stuck a robot was on hand to assist - in our case quite a lot ! We may not of completed last task but we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.Amazing how quick an hour goes - wicked concept just hope there's more games to try.

Such fun. it has been my first room escape experience and I didn't know what to expect. I had seen good reviews but could never predict how much fun it turned out to be! absolutely loved it! it was a great team building experience and I can't wait to go back with my friends

Excellent escape game. First escape game experience for all three members of our team. Challenging and really good fun in every way. Fun characters, creative setup, varied puzzles. Highly recommend it!

Unique experience. Went with my husband and 14 year old son and had absolutely wonderful time.
We have tried escape rooms before and love them - but this the Time Run is outstanding in so many ways.
But I would spoil the fun if I were to tell you more. Spoilers do no good ;)

Great experience. The initial welcome is first rate and really gets you in the mood. Great interaction during the experience helps with the mysteries and great sense of achievement working things out as a team. Recommended!

A fun escape room through time and space . I went here with some friends and it was a great time. The staff are friendly as well as hilarious. Everyone had a great time. The puzzles were organized well for groups. They are designed so you can split up in a room while working toward the larger goal together. Everyone left the place energized and happy.

Amazing experience . Throughly enjoyed this place. We went for a 30th birthday outing and I couldn't recommend it more. 5 of us were there and couldn't have done it with less. Relied on everyone's skills and knowledge but throughly enjoyed it. The puzzles in each room were fantastic and so creative

Awesome and challenging team activity. My team of six international participants joined this game with no previous experience of "escape room" games from before. It turned out to be an excellent way to have fun, challenge our logical and puzzle solving abilities with a really large amount of codes to crack, problems to solve and mysteries to beat.The cast/actors were excellent and did their fair part of making the atmosphere feel genuine and really built up the back story really neat. Highly recommended!
Amazing. Recommend for everyone looking for a fun quality room escape experience. Best room escape I've tried so far.Both fun and challenging.

Best. Escape Room. Ever.. I live in Los Angeles, and basically do a new escape room every chance I get. So imagine my surprise when the best escape room I've ever done was not in the land of movies, but in London! Absolutely spectacular from start to finish!
Fun challenge. Very interesting place, three rooms and intersting enigmas,puzzles etc...Good quality in everything

Best Escape game i've ever done. I love this escape game - so theatrical and everyone was totally in character. From the enterance when the two doors open, to when we finish. It was so much fun and time went so fast - i wish i could go back and do it again. I would definitely recommend this one but I think you need more that two people (we were a few mins from finishing)
Really good fun. The sets were great and the puzzles challenging. A good mix of comedy with the introduction and brain work with all the puzzles! I'll be recommending to my friends.

Please make more Time Run's!!. Honestly what a fun activity! It's amazing how quickly you get sucked in to the puzzles, and doing it with a group of friends meant we spent the rest of the day/evening laughing and talking about nothing else. The production value was excellent and the puzzles truly challenging, but just the perfect amount of excitement. Would recommend highly to anyone and am already planning on taking my colleagues back as a team building exercise. Please make even more rooms and challenges! Would love to do again.
Great fun and really well done! . Fantastic escape experience - quite hard to complete so pitched at the right level, great set and really professional staff. I would definitely recommend

Amazing and excellent production. For an escape room venue, this is one the highest quality productions I have been too. Everything was beautiful made and recreated. It has an great coherent story with a huge variety of puzzles and lot of surprises. Highly recommended!!!
Super fun time!. Great fun, interesting story and cool set. The actors created a thrilling atmosphere which definitely added the extra mile!I would absolutely suggest this experience!

Game and a show. Full entertainment . This has been my favorite escape game that I have attempted! There is so much interaction happening at all times and with a constant feed of new challenges to keep my brain fired. From the moment we knocked on the door I was impressed. Thanks Time Run!

One of the best escape games we've played. For the past year and a half my boyfriend and I have done an escape game in every country we've visited and Time Run in London was escape number 9. It was absolutely fantastic and up there with the best of them, creating a truly immersive experience. Some other games we've played have been repetitive, or required similar skills over and over, but not Time Run - every team member had a role to play and brought something to the table. The "time travel" plot works brilliantly for an escape game and the staff were amazing at setting the scene. Far superior to a number of others we have played .

Great puzzles, great environments, loads of fun!. Went with friends and had an absolute blast. It's immersive from the very beginning, all the environments are really detailed and interesting and the puzzles are extremely satisfying to solve. We got more and more excited as we went from room to room and didn't want it to finish. Memorable activity and tons of fun, would highly recommend!

The best escape game I've done!. Tried Time Run with a group of friends - we'd all done a couple of escape games before so knew roughly what to expect, but this has set the bar very high indeed! Very immersive from the start (i.e., the entrance!!) with excellent staff who really get you into the spirit of things. In terms of the game itself, it is very involved and seemed a lot more along the lines of things like Crystal Maze than some of the other games I've done, which is - of course - a good thing! Brilliant puzzles (not too hard, not too easy) with hints just when we needed them. We weren't left on our own for too long when we'd come to a dead end, but equally were left alone to figure things out enough to make it satisfying. We were also given an extra five minutes as we were very close to solving the final puzzle, which was a nice touch - and great to figure it out for ourselves rather than have to leave frustrated. Please make more games so we can come back!!

Perfect puzzling. It started with Aubrey our guide taking us through the health and safety details. It was dealt with hilariously. All of us cackling throughout. Great waistcoat too!The puzzles themselves were challenging but entertaining and I was bought in totally by the plot.A dream of an afternoon out. Bring capable friends.

First time in a high-tech escape room. Did not disappoint!. Great game introduction. It was our first time with a high-tech escape game, so we were unsure what to expect. Fantastic props.What could be better would be a waiting area out of the wind and rain. The debrief could be improved to be on par with the introduction. Overall still a very enjoyable game. We succeeded in escaping, of course!

Fabulous. It was a surprised activity organised by friends and we could not have imagined what we were going to do. It was an amazing different activity. We wished it was for longer as we had so much fun. Highly recommend it.

Had A Blast. This is my only experience with an escape room, but it was great. Our group had a really good time working together to figure out all the puzzles and experiencing the story & scenes. The actors did a wonderful job with their characters and putting you in the right frame of mind. We made it through by the skin of our teeth so it seemed like an appropriate level of difficulty for the time frame.

Great fun. We did this in 2 teams, battling it out to see who could complete it first. I can honestly say we all had a fantastic time and spent the remainder of the evening talking about what happened when. Very well put together and would highly highly recommend.

Loved it. My son bought us thus experience for my birthday. He has done several escape room games and said this was his best yet. The experience was lovely and immersive. The set up at the beginning was great and got us in the mood for our adventure. Without giving any spoilers I would just like to say that the sets were great, the puzzles challenging but do-able and with the right amount of hints when we were clearly going too far off piste. You actually go through time portals to three different rooms which makes it feel like you are making progress. Loved the whole experience and would definitely go again to their next adventure

Proper, proper good.. Time Run was really, really well thought through, and very slickly executed. I felt thoroughly immersed in the rooms they'd created. It felt a bit like a secret cinema event, but with an element of jeopardy.It's just brilliantly done. Well done to all involved. Will definitely go again once the next set of challenges are in place. In fact, I might invite a different group of friends to go to do the current Time Run again, and make myself look like I possess uber-logic. Loved it.

Family Fantastic!!. I bought this as a Christmas present for my husband and his two daughters aged 17 and 21. They went this weekend and came out saying it was the best thing they'd ever done. They also got through it which they were thrilled about. My husband said it was such fun and interactive, a really special experience. They drove in and got parking directly outside the venue on a Saturday afternoon. Fantastic. Thank you to Nick and his team, I will keep spreading the word.

Brilliant fun!!. There were 5 of us in our team, and we all throughly enjoyed our adventure through time. We had 60 minutes to solve 3 puzzles which flew past really quickly. We did manage to complete our adventure with 35 seconds to spare!! I would recommend this to anyone wanting to do something different. You don't have to be super intelligent, just logical thinkers do the best.

If you are going to extend the "escape room" experience - this is how to do it.. Time Run is not an "escape room" - although there is one element that lovers of the classic "live escape game" will be quite satisfied with. It extends the concept to an experience, with the briefing performed by an actor (or if not - an exceptional host), and a "characterised" gamesmaster to assist you. It offers the "crystal maze" activity style puzzles, and, as I said, your classic escape as well all packaged in a truly superb set which enables you to completely subscribe to the concept.Yes, as some of the reviews have said, a lot of what happens needs human interaction - not that you can see it - it's stage managed extremely well, but this can mean that sometimes, if you complete a puzzle slightly unconventionally, you can be "guided" to do it again.Also, for people who come from far away, there isn't a lot around the area, and the time slot is very precise. Once you get in you'll see why - but you may want to either leave more time than you need to stop off to go to the loo etc beforehand, or be absolutely spot on to get in and use theirs. This is less of a problem for Londoners.People also talk about the cost - but the reality is, you get 2 hours entertainment (including being performed to, as well as totally immersed in a really high budget set, and challenged with puzzles) for half, if not a third the price of a theatre ticket. ...and if you compare it on cost to some of the other conventional escape rooms in London - Time Run's value for money is extremely clear.It is an excellent experience - and personally, I think better than the Crystal Maze (but I'm quite theatrical). It isn't a pure escape room, and it would sell escape rooms short to make a comparison on style. However, we loved it, and would happily recommend.
Big adventure w. So much fun in so short of time. We all loved it. We all hade problem to sleep after the timerun. We will be back sometime.

Immersive, Entertaining, Highly Engaging. Myself and a group of friends made a last minute booking for this and I am very happy the choice was made. An extremely memorable event, expertly presented, full of humour all of which you are 100% immersed in. Props to the actors that run the event.The puzzles were highly engaging requiring sjust the right amount of thinking power, almost like the old Crystal Maze TV show puzzles.Can't recommend this enough, although sadly I can only see it being a one-off experience. Perhaps that's what makes it so memorable though.

Something different. I went on the Time Run as part of a stag do & it was great, really nicely thought out and fun to do, lots of problem solving tasks and all very engaging. If you're looking for something different, get your problem solving brains round this!

Incredibly alternative utterly engaging. If you are looking for something immersive, interesting, exciting and different then I would thoroughly recommend this. We went on a mixed stag-do over 10 (taking part in two teams) and ever single person said how much they enjoyed the experience. Everyone was gripped by the challenges and draw in to take part and contribute. Imagine a cross between the Crystal Maze and Indiana Jones. Simply awesome.

Great showmanship!. Great Escape Game, with focus on story and with amazing props. The introduction was the best one I've seen and the story was well thought of. The puzzles were good, quite a lot of them also. The team I played with are pretty experienced when it comes to these type of games and we almost utilized the full time in solving everything. Only downside would be the hints, seeing one didn't ask for them actively but was given them. With the ammount of puzzles and time available my guess is that this is the for the best though, so not really a complaint.

Unlike anything other. Time Run is an escape room experience unlike any other. Feels absolutely like you are being taken on a wild adventure. Loved it so much. Doubt any other escape room will ever top this (unless they make another!)

Taking Escape Rooms to a New Dimension. Of the 20 or so Escape Rooms I have tried around Europe, including London, this is by far the best. From the moment we were met by our host to the moment we left the building, the experience was just amazing.We are an experienced team of 2 players but I must say that 3 would have been more ideal on this occasion. The puzzles were very cleverly thought out and certainly challenging, though there was perhaps a little too much to get through for the 2 of us. I can now see why they recommend a minimum of 3 players. Fortunately, help was never far away when we needed it.The attention to detail and the quality of the props added to the overall experience.Our initial thoughts were that the price was maybe a little high, compared with the other escapre rooms in London. However, it didn't take us long to realise that this one was well worth the extra pounds.The staff were incredible and even rather amusing.Time Run far exceeded our expectations and I would strongly recommend it to anyone trying to find something fun and interesting to do in London.

Very cleverly done and a lot of fun!. Witty storytelling and interaction with the group; great staging as you venture through the different portals and just the right level of difficulty. Great fun for a hen do!
So much fun!. Went as part of a hens weekend and we had the best of times. Got completely lost in the experience! Would absolutely go again for new rooms. Next time we will make it all the way

Fantastic game with the most elaborate set! Brilliant!. We have done several very good escape games in different countries but this is by far the best most elaborate set! Extremely well done... friendly staff who did amazing job of being "in character"... would definitely like to go back to when they open a new room... you will not be disappointed.Just don't be put off by the location!

Best experience ever. A family day out - bought it for Christmas for 6 of us. All over 21, 3 generations, we all had so much fun, having great team work and bonding time. Experience I will remember for a long long time - Crystal maze meets Indiana jones with a hint of Bond

Amazing set, fantastic experience!. For a group of friends or a family who enjoy puzzle solving together, this is really an unbeatable experience. The set design is incredible and the challenges are innovative. Was an incredibly exciting evening and at a phenomenal price too! Would highly recommend!

Get Lost...In Time!. This was the first time I've ever went on a Locked Room/Escape experience and I came to the event with a skeptical view. Mainly because I never really thought an immersive puzzle-solving game could be this good. As you reach the venue you are not disappointed as the entrance itself was designed to give the the 'Time Runners' an instant feel that they are entering a weird and mysterious event. Not to mention you won't have to spend time wondering if you got the right address.The event starts with a tutorial from a friendly 'Time Traveler' who, in my opinion, really puts himself into character. not to mention you can joke about with him and he'll respond in kind. Although do take it seriously when he talks about interacting with the environment because the last thing they, and your team, needs is to ruin the whole experience. Yes you have the freedom to touch and move things, but don't be forceful, it's Time-Travel, you don't want to create unnecessary butterfly effects :P. There are several time-zones that you visit during your adventures with really interesting, clever and engaging puzzles. Yes you can probably guess how to solve it but there is always help, in the form of an android, if you are really stuck. I guess this is one aspect which I wasn't sure whether it helped us or the other team (we were a group of friends competing against each other). So you never know if the android was using the same criteria to see if people are 'stuck'. This can affect the time in which you finish the puzzles. Overall it's very good. It's better when you're competing against another group of friends so I'd say bring around 8-10 people to form two groups.I am definitely going to it again if they set up new time-zones, so hurry up you lot and go on this Time-Run so they can start making new ones!

Brilliant, had an amazing time. Went with my co-workers and we had a very exciting time. I would absolutely recommend this as a team building activity. Can't wait for the next runs they are developing!

Amazing!. The setup is quite simply amazing. You can tell that a lot of time & effort has been spent and we enjoyed it as a family. I would however say that for puzzle lovers, this game is not as enjoyable as it could be. Theme is amazing and atmosphere is truly immersive but puzzles were weak. One aspect is that the staff are obviously controlling puzzles/doors so you feel like you are in a walk through as opposed to the feeling one is meant to get in an escape game. Having said that, definitely go!

Amazing time, great sets, accommodating hosts. Having done (and thoroughly enjoyed) HintHunt, I can honestly say that this was even better! What sets this one apart from other escape rooms is the entire story and setting. It's more than just a background murder/mystery setting though; from the beginning you're drawn into a whole creative and imaginative story and it really does feel like you're playing a game/in a movie! The rooms are all themed and the puzzles are themed accordingly to their environment which makes this truly a unique experience.The puzzles are challenging but not impossible, just the right amount!Also, our hosts were incredibly flexible. We booked 4 tickets but showed up with 6 people on the day, and we were able to pay for the extra 2 at the door with no hassle. Furthermore, majority of our team turned up incredibly late yet the hosts did everything possible to not have to turn them away which was very appreciated. (Although, I would recommend not being late by even a minute, as the entrance experience was really worth it and it was a shame the rest of our team missed it. Also, whilst they did accommodate us for 6 people, it was a bit too much, I'd say 4 players is the ideal number).The only negative I can say is the price, it is quite expensive. But whilst I wish the price was cheaper, I can honestly say that you shouldn't let the price be the deciding factor - this is so worth it, and i'm quite convinced we won't find another escape room as captivating as this!
Fabulous! . Really high budget place. So much effort has gone into the story, the rooms, the props and of course the puzzles! Well worth the money, would thoroughly recommend to anyone.

Like playing a video game, only real!!. Wasn't sure what to expect as I got roped into it last minute, but it was great fun. I'll be dropping by with a thank-you can of WD-40 for Babbage at some point soon.

Amazing experience!. This was the best game EVER! I admit this was the greatest experience I had in London. The rooms are designed in the best way you can imagine. The host was very friendly. I have been to other escape rooms as well but I totally recommend you to go to this one.

Brilliant!. Went here recently with some friends and cannot recommend it more! The host was extremely funny and entertaining throughout the introduction. The puzzles were tricky but not impossible. There was lot to immerse yourself in and the story was great too! Loved it! Great activity to do with friends and family.

Excellent Design, Hosting and Puzzles. funny introduction from the host was a great start to the experience. I've done more than a handful of these sorts of escape room events in London and everyone in my team agreed that it was the best we'd been too. Needless to say, I don't want to talk about it too much as it may spoil for others. Well worth the price!
Fun fun fun. Well worth the time, and a fun way to spend some time with friends or co-workers. So if you are in London, go have some fun.

Even better than I expected. Had such a good laugh, would recommend going in a bigger group as there were only 3 of us and it was difficult to complete all the challenges in time. Despite not completing it was still great! Amazing set, you get so lost in the challenges and story. Something anyone would enjoy, the tasks are genuinely challenging at times and very immersive
Great one hours fun. Went with the team from work. A really well thought and challenging hour for all to enjoy, challenges that everyone can join in. Dr Aubrey was very good.

Fantastic fun. Having never done anything like this before I was a bit unsure of what to expect but from the moment we arrived the experience was just fantastic. We did it as a family of 4 and all of us were able to participate and get fully involved. It was well organised and the tasks and puzzles were challenging but help is at hand when needed from the friendly robot! Great for team building events or just as a fun activity for a group of friends or a family experience. Would definitely recommend giving it a go if you get the chance. Hope to do another one in the future.

Brilliant fun for all the family . From the moment we entered and met the excellent Dr Aubrey we all suspended belief and fully believed in the story that we were about to participate in, mainly down to the fantastic attention to detail and acting. The rooms were all very well designed with the puzzles just being on the right side of tricky with help coming from the robot Babbage at just the right time. All of our team (2 adults, 3 kids )had a brilliant time and would definitely recommend to anyone.

The BEST escape room in UK. Myself and my two friends went to experience the Time Run escape room to celebrate a birthday and we had the best time. 24 hours later I'm still thinking about how we could have shaved a few minutes off of our time!The whole thing is just perfect: great actors, an elaborate set and brilliantly puzzling mysteries to solve. It is great fun and an excellent team building task too. This company have thought about every little detail. The price isn't cheap, but worth every penny; I'd even pay more! I wish I could do it all again. :-)

Time Run- April 2016. Seven of us took the 12 noon time slot and enjoyed every minute - a great concept, brilliantly well run and organised. Totally original way to spend an early afternoon- thank you!

Fantastic fun! worth every penny. This is a brilliant, immersive experience, right from the moment you arrive at the beautiful door and ring the doorbell. The sets were great, convincing with excellent attention to detail, the puzzles were definitely challenging and cleverly designed, and the attention to detail was amazing. Dr Aubrey should have a special mention as he kept up his character without pause for a lot longer than normal whilst something was sorted inside - serious ad-libbing, wholly committed to his role!We were a team of three, my two teenage sons and me, their Mum. It was brilliant to do something challenging where we were all participating equally and as a team. I have never taken them somewhere where they were so enthusiastic and on a high afterwards, all wish we could do it again and can't wait for the next challenge - we will be first in the queue. And even better we just did it! Escaping in 59minutes and 12 seconds, with a whole 48 seconds to spare!

Fantastic Fun!. We had a fantastic time. The tasks were all achievable but definitely challenging. I was completely immersed as soon as we started the first task. I could have easily stayed in there for another hour!

Awesome! Completely recommended.. Awesome experience! Totally recommended for anyone wanting to have a great time living adventure and solving interesting puzzles. Really immersive as well and excellent atmosphere, which helps you be focused and live the experience to its fullest.
Great Fun!. Time run is simply amazing! The immersive experience, friendly and accommodating staff as well as the whole design was perfect. Couldn't ask for anytjing more!

Excellent experience. From the moment you approach the front door they immerse you in the experience. Interesting and creative puzzles with great theming and attention to detail. The staff are excellent and clearly passionate about what they do.The price is higher than other escape rooms in London, and there is a reason why. A high quality experience from beginning to end. Fantastic.
Excellent outing . Proper, testing your wit, competitiveness and team work. A great place for friends and close family leave the hangers on behind! Lol

cool fun. part of a day of birthday celebrations! great fun, feelgood, adrenaline filled adventure. This was really challenging and only 25% of players succeed, so it feels good to complete the quest successfully!
Time Run Fun. Time Run is a fun group activity, the most tech savvy escape room game in London - I recommend taking a larger group of friends.

Fantastic production but somehow not owerawed. We went in with really high expectations given the reviews which may form part of the problem. The production and design is amazing, lots of toys and gadgets to entertain. The introduction was really good (slightly long) with the host definitely giving it his all. Without giving anything away, some parts were brilliant classic escape game stuff (3rd part) but some were more physical and too many instructions were given from the get go. It may be fun if you are planning on following instructions/doing more physical activities and seeing an outcome but not if you are hoping to use your wits to think your way out. This may be from just two of us playing the game and hence we felt some activities were more time consuming rather than a puzzle but that part will definitely suit new gamers in a larger group. I'm sure they will find this very fun. Overall, it's definitely one of the best ranked ones out there and in terms of production, maybe even the best, but somehow, for us, only the last part of the game was excellent, the first two, not the best due to reasons mentioned.

Love it!!. I always wanted to go and I went yesterday with my friends since I'm moving back to my country this week. It was very fun and I made a good memory there. We ran out of time so we would like to go again!! It was opened on Easter Sunday so I guess it's opened most of the time. Also there was a proper setting for the staffs which they acted well and they were very funny and nice:D I really felt like I was in a magical place. Just being curious how many rooms there are to solve.

Fantastic Fun. A group of us went to Time run for my 40th birthday. A few friends had been to escape rooms before and I found this one through Time magazine who rated it extremely highly. We booked both rooms (group of 11 of us) and raced against each other. Brilliantly done and fantastic fun - really enjoyed it and the hour+ whipped around. Our friends who had been to other escape rooms across Europe thought this was the best they had ever been to.

Out of this world!. From the moment you arrive at the location, you are transported into a all encompassing alternate reality. The concept is excellent and the execution is even better.The staff stayed in character throughout which only enhanced our enjoyment.I have done more than 15 escape rooms in 6 countries over the past few years, and although we didn't make it out (only the second time that's happened to me) it was probably the best escape room I've ever been to.It was expensive compared to other Escape Rooms I've been to, but was certainly well worth it.I can not recommend Time Run highly enough!

Fab fun - a great afternoon with friends . We came here for a friends birthday. Not knowing what to expect at all, we all had a brilliant time. From the moment you stepped through the door on an unassuming London Street, you were transported right into the centre of the action. Aubrey started the event off brilliantly, and was in character from the moment we entered. The activities are fun and varied and require enough brainwork to make you feel like you're using it but not so much that you need to be a Mensa member! To anyone wondering whether to do it or not, I definitely recommend - Good luck!
Awesome. Just awesome. So so clever. If you are wondering whether doing this is a good idea or money well spent then the answer is yes.

The most fun you'll ever have trying to get out of rooms. The theming, introduction, puzzles, staff, and experience in general are extremely well-crafted and lent hands to a simply incredible afternoon.

Amazing!!!. So much fun!! Very very well designed. I have to say I did not expect it to be so good but was I pleasantly surprised. Everything was designed to the last detail, the games and riddles were very clever and fun and the staff/actors were all brilliant! Totally recommend it.

So much fun. Impressed by elaborate sets? Got a brain? Enjoy using it? Enjoy being locked in a room with 3 or 4 friends? This is too much fun to miss. Please go to help the next one so that we can go again :-)

Excellent immersive experience. Spent a great afternoon at Tim Run, overall fantastic experience, no complaints :) you're well-prepped with instructions beforehand, both through email and at the actual venue, the challenges are pretty creative, and the different rooms are very well decorated so it's a great immersive experience. Make sure to go with a fun group!

Time that Run for it is a lot of Fun!. If you are thinking of going to this, as you seek a challenge, enjoy puzzles and problem solving, something a bit different, then my immediate advice is to don't think and just go as it will deliver all of that and more!!Literally from the moment we entered to the moment we left we had a truly wonderful evening indeed. The whole set-up is expertly done and literally takes you back in time igniting your imagination beyond the real. Before arrival to the venue, you are greeted by a majestic set of doors that open sideways, and greeted immediately by professionals that are in character the whole duration of your journey. You are well looked after and i thought that every staff member I came across was amazing at looking after us, answering our questions, and best of all making our experience that much more.....I will not reveal anything about the journey or its contents. That is for you to discover and experience. :-)A team of 4 is the right amount of people to be taking part and anything more in my opinion would be too many bodies which could prove problematic in terms of space and team play in general. Time Run = Time Fun. Go treat yourselves and enjoy the journey - you won't regret it.

Awesome Fun!. Had great fun at Time Run. Excellent themed escape room. A bit out of the way from central London, but a few nearby restaurants and not far on the overground Tube from Liverpool Station. Really excellent set design. Generally good acting by the pre and post hosts. Multiple time slots and themed rooms run simultaneously so more chance of getting a reservation than at other escape rooms that only have one set of rooms running per hour. Three consecutive themed rooms in this venue. They jump in with hints in a non-invasive way as well. Good attention to detail in the rooms. Took our 13 year old. Hard to find things we can do together at this age. A little dark in some of the rooms. Asthmatics be careful. there is a fog machine in use.
Best escape room I 've done so far. It was a very elaborate set up and you are really running against time. The venue is a bit outside of central but it is worth it.
Well thought out. This place has been well thought out. Good fun for a few mates, or two teams if you can round up a few more. Would suit a work teambuilding exercise too.

Different and well worthwhile in a group. Unique team escape challenge against the clock - great for a group. Weird location on an industrial road but easy to get to. Really well conceived and managed, this will not disappoint - good for any adult age

The best in London. I've done a number of the escape rooms games in London and this was definitely the best. You pay more but it is well worth the extra money for the full experience offered here and the variety of challenges.

A unique and fun experience. It is fun, it is different, it is exciting.
I very much enjoyed the people, the setting, the concept.
It definitely worths it and even if you don't manage to sort out the mission, you will definitely enjoy yourselves. Just gather your friends and book.

A journey through time. I wasn't sure what to expect when I was told this was what I was going to be doing on a Sunday afternoon.. A bit aprihensive but that soon disappeared when i stepped in to the past and I found myself in awe of what was about to happen. A fantastic team building exercise that tests time skills, team players and memory. Anyone considering it go for it you may also learn a thing or two :)

A journey through time and escape rooms. This was straight off the bat an excellent experience, as soon as you are greeted into the first office you are brought into the strange world of Time Run.Time Run is an incredible immersive experience, you have several rooms you end up moving through all of which the budget is through the roof. Absolutely done to perfection!I do feel this is a different escape the room experience and is more of an Adventure room, the puzzles while clever are not overly complicated and so what you get is more of an experience. Which can't be faulted at all as that experience is incredible!Highly recommended for any family or group of friends for a really fun hour.Only thing that could be improved is that fact you have to wait outside until your exact slot, meaning if it's especially cold then it can be a pain having to wait.

Very impressed! Awesome experience!. I wasn't sure what to expect with this, never having done anything quite like it before and there are a few of these style of events cropping up all over London, so wasn't sure what the quality would be like. I can honestly say from beginning to end it was fantastic!! Can't give too much away as it will ruin it for future time runners, but the staff, setup and whole event was professional, high quality and well worth the ticket price, a thoroughly enjoyable experience!

Great Fun! Perfect for Team Building. I wanted an experience where our team at work could be split and we could race to get out the quickest. I was recommended this 'escape room' experience by one of the staff at Escape Room in Southwark. It was fantastic, everyone really enjoyed themselves and didn't want it to end. The full experience is perfect from booking, communication before arriving and after and of course during the escape is perfect. The only problem is now I can't take more people there because I know how to do the puzzles.

Visit for the Time(run) of your life!. I cannot go into many details in an effort to not spoil another's experience!From the moment you walk in the door to the moment you leave the staff make great efforts to fully immerse you in the experience.Fantastic props, great acting and high quality sets mean that throwing yourself into the theme is easy to do!My only complaint is that now I have visited I can't go again until they change the puzzles!Do yourself a favour and book today!

Great family / Team building fun - We were so close. If you are a fan of puzzles, point and click adventures, board games then Time-Run is a fun, exciting escape the room immersive experience. Even waiting outside the door waiting for our allotted time to arrive was exciting.Lots of puzzles to solve, combinations locks to open, tasks to accomplish in a series of rooms to complete. Not suitable for very young children, more for secondary school aged kids who can really involved in it all.Note They did give us a little bit of extra time which was kind. Staff were great and really friendly and clearly want you to solve the whole experience.. You get hints along the way, which are necessary given that you have an hour to solve all three rooms. Do it!
Excellent fun. Did this as part of a stag do, the staff were brilliant, a real laugh and the event itself far exceeded expectations, do it
Great experience!. If you like escape rooms, you shouldn't miss this one. Really challenging and creative puzzles; wonderful story, decor, multimedia, props and a completely immersive atmosphere.

Phenomenal. I've done 12 escape games in 4 different countries and this was the best by far. Great theme, clever and immersive design, the staff were excellent (impressively remaining in character throughout) and superbly satisfying puzzles. A little out of the way and more pricey than others but definitely well worth it. Spectacular.

Fun activity for family get-together. The activity was great from the start at the mysterious door. We were a family group of 7 aged from 58 to 24. Great welcome and introduction - funny and got us involved. We went as 2 teams (3 and 4) competing against each other but that didn't really matter. There were plenty of challenges and we were all busy working on things the whole time. Definitely enough to keep us engaged. Everyone enjoyed it. I would definitely recommend it as a fun activity - we were talking about it and comparing notes with the others for a long time afterwards!

great fun with a team of puzzlers. We booked this because there were 10 of us, and it could accommodate 2 teams of 5 in parallel, but were a bit worried about the location - it turned out to be very easy to get to. From the minute we entered the door everyone was made to feel special and part of Time Run. The initial briefing was very professional but we still didn't quite know what we were in for as we went through the portal. We had mixed teams aged 16-61 and everyone really enjoyed it and was able to do their bit in solving the many different puzzles. Although we were pleased we found the artefact, we were all buzzing and ready to do more - looking forward to new games in the future.

Superb from start to finish. An experience from start to finish. Excellent at making you feel like you really are involved in a time run adventure. Loved the mystery of the entrance, with excellent humour and acting in the introduction.Definitely recommend it! Also well tailored to different levels of clue solving ability!!

Fantastic, fast paced fun adrenaline fuelled adventure through time with friends on a Friday.. The most, fantastic, fast paced fun adrenaline fuelled adventure through time with friends on a Friday. LOVED it from the moment the mysterious large ancient sands of time doors open to the minute you realise your time has run out. The end puzzle is still baffling us, definitely be going back to try again (after some intensive team training!)

Great experience . Absolutely loved Time Run! Great range of challenges and the feedback at the end really summed up our team! The Candy shop burglars will definitely be back to complete our quest. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity!!

Absolutely terrific!. Did the Time Run yesterday with hubby and brothers in law and we absolutely had a ball - we left exhilarated. Truly - I don't usually write sensational reviews- but there is no other way to describe the fun that we had. I would recommend this for anyone - take your mum, you nephew, your workmates - you will have a great time. From the moment you arrive outside the ornate door with the mysterious door bell - you are sucked into another time, total immersion in the game and oodles of fun!

Great game, cut back on the talking!. I've done a lot of Escape Games and this takes it to the next level. Great fun, exciting and original. However, after arriving on time it wasn't for another 35 minutes before we started our game, After being briefed by the actor in reception, we had what was another 5 minute brief via video. Then at the end there was another debrief and to be honest I'd rather talk about the experience between my group on the way out rather than hear about what the "staff" thought about our game. Just all seems a bit over kill. The game itself was fantastic, well put together and the whole grouped enjoyed it. It would have got 5 stars if there was less talking, well worth a visit.
Time run......immersive fun!. Great entertainment and excitement. Loved the clues and moving parts. Will be back.....to the future, past or present. Do the time warp!

Great way to spend 60 mins. I didn't know WHAT to expect when I walked down the street with a knackers yard down one side and industrial units on the other. But the second you see the ornate doors of Time Run, you know you're in for a good time! The door bell states only ring when it's you're allotted time. When you do, the large door slides up and shuts again. (There was someone banging on it after 5 mins, was not sure if they were late or had forgotten something, but the doors were not re-opened for anyone!)There are various escape rooms throughout London but I chose this one as it didn't mean being locked in just one room for the entire time and this is reflected in the price. The idea is to solve clues so you can journey through various days in time. The clues were clever and the four of us thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff are not going to be winning any oscars any time soon but they help explain the day very well. Would love to rebook and do it all again (hopefully get a little further next time as still not sure how many rooms (spaces in time!) they actually have. The fact that they give you a review of your puzzle solving skills at the end is a great bonus. Truly engaging and awesome experience.
Challenging and brilliant fun!. Great actors and brilliant puzzles made the experience!! completed it in under an hour so very happy!

Enthralling and Emersive!. As soon as you walk through those bronze doors; invited in by the excellent actor who plays his role with conviction and obvious delight you feel fully immersed in the fantastical world Time Run have created for you. Costumes, rooms and props have been created with attention to detail to film set quality standards. A good mixture of puzzles in perfectly themed rooms follows with an impending sense of jeopardy created by having a timer counting down the hour you have left to escape. This is only the second escape room I have done but I can't see how it could be done better than this. Highly recommended!
Thrilling!!Emocionante!!. We had a wonderfull time! The challenge was good fun! Really nice staff!Lo pasamos genial! El desafio fue muy divertido! El equipo muy majo!

Fun, well-produced adventure room(s). We decided to do this as a work team-building activity. From the moment of arrival we were impressed by the attention to detail and to the production quality. Hard to provide a detailed review as I'd want to enjoy spoilers, but a good variety of puzzles and some fun acting / roleplay as well. Well worth a trip if you enjoy escape rooms and similar activities.
Great time. Really enjoyed this new version of the escape game - lots of different style challenges with a great theme and cast - good value for money

Time travel at its finest. Great day out. Well worth the money and it's amazing just how into the story you get. Working as a team is key to crack the interactive puzzles and complete the story within the time. Brilliant challenge. Great staff. A good laugh. Would definitely recommend!

Absolutely great!. I extremely enjoyed this escape game with my friends! It was a great experience from the beginning to the very end. At first we were a little bit confused where to go but that is also a thing what made this game so exciting. The actors where great and it was so much fun! We felt like in another universe for the time we have been there and the details are just amazing. I preferred "the future" the most, I felt like I am part of a movie! I definitely recommend going there with a group of at least 4, just saying! ;)
Highly recommended!. Brilliant fun, great sets and the puzzles are just the right level of challenging. Our team of five made it out with just over five minutes left on the clock.
Birthday. Excellent fun. Challenging brain using problem solving activity. We were so frustratingly close to finishing. Highly recommend

Best escape the room challenge so far.... This is my fourth escape the room challenge and it is by far the best. I was a bit apprehensive about the cost of Time Run compared to other escape the room challenges, but you absolutely get your moneys worth! The whole production of the experience was to such a high standard that you were immersed in the experience form the moment you arrive. I would highly recommend paying the extra to do this challenge!

The most polished and engaging escape room I've ever done.. I've done more than a dozen escape rooms in three different countries and Time Run is quite possibly the best one of them all. The production was top notch with beautiful design; the puzzles were high quality and required novel insights without any irrational leaps of logic; and everything worked smoothly and reliably. I was very impressed and recommend it to novices and experienced 'escapers' alike. If you're a visitor from abroad and enjoy escape rooms, don't leave London without trying it.We had a great time, and we're looking forward to their next one!

AMAZING time travel!. I went here for my birthday and it was my first experience of an escape room and it did not disappoint! From the moment of knocking on the door we had so much fun!The actors were so professional and really added to the authenticity of the place and the enjoyment. The layout of the different rooms as we made our way through the rooms was magical! It really was like being in an Egyptian Tomb or Hitler's office- it was brilliant!The games themselves were quite puzzling as well so it was not just an easy walk through; it required real brain power and thought! But it was so so fun and I would highly recommend this place. Amazing day out for friends to do together!

A Brilliant Way to Spend a Friday Night. Time Run was brilliant! The high production values and attention to detail were evident from the moment you stepped through the door and then for the next 90 minutes you were in fully immersive themed experience. As a big Crystal Maze fan this was a great way to begin an evening and the challenge proved to be great team building exercise. As a group of friends we learnt a lot about how we operated as a team, but this would also be fun for those who are not so familiar. Whether you complete it or not there is a definite sense of achievement and unity at the end, as well as an appreciation for those that make the experience what it is.

You won't regret taking a trip through time!. Absolutely fantastic experience Time Running with our family! If you love the unknown, adventure, puzzles and even a bit of cheeky humor then you won't regret taking a voyage through time with the Time Run team! We loved every second of it and would love to come back again for another trip! Absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for a completely unique escape the room experience. Bring your kids, your family, your friends, your grandma! (Just make sure you have your thinking caps on!)

Loved it!. Went with a group of 7 30-32year old girls. We did it as 2 teams at the same time - one team of 3 and one team of 4, neither team finished but both were very close to finishing! We had a fantastic time, we're all sort of personalities and everyone loved it. The staff were amazing! Coped very well with a rowdy group of over-excited women!
Lots of fun!. Highly recommend this. Very well done, a truly interactive experience from beginning to end, and a lot of fun. A great thing to do with friends. Looking forward to new runs already!
Everyone should try it!. If you've ever seen 'The Crystal Maze' and thought you could do better, get a few mates and give this a go. We'd never done anything like it before, but it was immensely fun!

“If in London and you want something different this is it!”. Test your mind and your body in a challenge through time and space! Can you make it to the end in this phenomenal performance and puzzle experience? It's Crystal Maze and Krypton Factor on acid... and all the better for it!
Amazing!. Brilliant fun - a great team bonding exercise that really got us thinking. We'd highly recommend it!

Fun problem-solving. Although my original session got postponed due to a power failure, Time Run really is a lot of fun! It involves a lot of fun puzzles and really help you and whoever is working alongside you bond as a team. I had never done any escape room-esque activities and this really is a great way to spend an hour or so!

Incredible experience, a must visit. An escape challenge through time and space - with phenomenal production value, brilliant performances, and superbly crafted puzzles. If you liked the Crystal Maze you'll love this!

Fantastic family afternoon over several centuries. Four of us tried this on a Sunday afternoon. None of us had ever done anything like it before but we always enjoyed The Crystal Maze so thought we'd give this a go. It was an amazing experience, we all enjoyed it immensely. The briefing was hilarious and really got us into it from the start (One piece of advice - don't ring the bell early unless you don't mind being put in your place!) The puzzles are well thought out and there was a real sense of achievement when we finished. The journey home was full of conversation about the various puzzles and about who had solved them and how.

UH-mazing. This is a really excellent escape room, with every detail thought out from the minute you step through the door. It was an excellent experience, I would highly recommend!! I can't think of anything they could do to improve it, and only wish I could do it again!

Excellent presentation and content, both challenging and entertaining!. Having tried a couple of escape rooms before, I was surprised at the level of detail that has gone into creating this amazing puzzle. A+ for presentation and content!

Top class!. I had previously done a similar escape game in Sydney as didn't think it got much better than that but I was wrong! Time Run was so well put together, the sets are outstanding and the watchful eye and helpful hint make it so it doesn't feel impossible and it's still fun! Would recommend to anyone, not just to people looking for a similar day out, but to anyone wanting a good day in London! I love that you are immersed in the story from the very beginning and there is no 'reception' and 'boring beginnings'!. Loved it. Good job!

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!. I've played numerous escape rooms around Europe and I must say this is probably one of the best. I can't remember the last time I left an escape room this pumped and excited. Overall experience was great, really good storyline, very well designed rooms and will definitely visit again

A rare and precious fun filled historical adventure circa London Fields station!. A full 5* to Time Run for a super fun time. Two of us travelled with Babbage (a robot commentating helper) as our only other sidekick, despite this we ran through three different worlds in one hour! Many tricky crystal maze style games got us thinking under pressure, with a little logic and much skill we prevented the lance from going in to the wrong hands (the mission was actually to retrieve the lance, oops!). I can't forget to say how good the intro and interiors were, other worldly! Time Run's an East London JEM not to be missed! P.S arrive early to grab a drink at Dandy next door, this way you won't be late for your specific arrival to TR.

If I could give more than 5 stars I would!. This was my second experience of an escape game and while I gave the previous one 5 stars, Time Run was a class above! From the moment you arrive you are immersed in the story and experience. The staff / actors are fantastic, the chap that welcomed us in had us thoroughly "warmed up" in moments. The game itself was fantastic and really challenged us, I am ashamed to say, (we didn't escape)!! I only wish I hadn't done it so I could do it over again. The website says they are working on a new game and I can't wait to try that one. I couldn't recommend Time Run more highly - enjoy!

Fantastic concept, mediocre execution.. Really enjoyed the overall experience and the immersion from the off - from the moment you arrive at the location you're on the journey!A few negatives really spoiled the event for me; doors not opening when they should, computer crashes requiring external intervention and items falling off the wall! Could do with some maintenance checks before sending teams through to ensure these are resolved. Time was not added for these failures unfortunately. Overall I'd strongly recommend you visit - it's an experience like no other and definitely worth doing. Just a shame it didn't all go as smoothly as it should.
Good fun. Great sets.. The puzzles are good, and sufficiently difficult. The sets are amazing and very immersive. Worth the money.

I challenge you to find more fun in one hour. From the moment we arrived we knew it was going to be a bit special. Our host remained in perfect character the entire time.Great challenges with just the right amount of hints made the whole thing run brilliantly. A must see/do experience.

Epic!. Awesome! We went for my girlfriend's dad's 60th, it was great for all 4 of us. Practical and mentally challenging in just the right amounts. Very well thought through, the clues are given at the right times and the overall experience is of a very professional and we'll thought through adventure! Would defo recommend. I can't wait til they open another one/change it round a bit!

A thrilling, immersive adventure. Loved it!. Our first escape room adventure and it was a really fantastic experience. We went with our two teenagers as we were tryng to find an activity which all of us could enjoy together. Everyone was involved at every stage and each of us had our little break through moments. At times we all had to work as a team and at other times we all spilt up on different tasks. When we were totally stuck we were given a little extra help from the Time Run team. It was great to have actors in role interacting with us and the attention to detail in the set was truly impressive. Would love to do more of these activities now, but from the reviews I have read Time Run are probably the best, so the others might be a bit of a dissapointment. Probably one of the most enjoyable activities we have ever done as a family. More, more, more please!!

Wow - this is really special. I've done about a dozen escape rooms - deliberately choosing those that are particularly well rated by aficionados - and this was something else. From the entertaining briefing (the best I've had), to the variety and immersiveness of the rooms and puzzles, to the quality of production of the set, it's all absolutely top-drawer.
