I just felt I was constantly on an adventure for the duration of this incredible experience.I'd been told repeatedly that this was the best escape room in London and so my expectations were sky-high, but they were never dashed.Just don't make this your first escape room, otherwise there are some other excellent rooms out there that will feel a bit disappointing by comparison.
Fantastico!!!. Incredible! Great challenges and puzzles and the sets blow you away. Wowzer! Everybody must go go go!!!

Brilliant fun!. All round great fun, and a really exciting experience from start to finish. The welcome by Aubrey was hilarious and set the scene for the adventure ahead. The rooms themselves were realistic and the puzzles were challenging. We didn't have many hints at all, and really enjoyed every step.A great evening out!

Totally worth it.. Finally went here after reading about this place for a long while. Such a great experience as soon as you get into the door (or in this case, portal). Aubrey was a great fun character who made us all feel comfortable from the start, and he didn't break character the whole time when speaking to us. The rooms are very well designed and feel authentic once you get going. The puzzles are ver clever, and the whole experience really makes you work as a team. Definitely recommend going here for team building! We were very impressed, and wish we could do it all again. Totally worth going along and trying for yourself.

High production values and inventive puzzles. Great for an alternative night out with friends - you learn something about yourself and how you work in teams. The sets were very detailed and the puzzles were challenging, but not impossible.

Great Experience. Had loads of fun solving the well-crafted puzzles. It had an exciting storyline, and excellent production value. You can tell that loads of effort went into the construction, combing through the details.
Like being in Dr Who . This game is really satisfying as you each solve tricky puzzles and work together. The set design is impeccable. I immediately want to do it again!

Disappointing, not worth the money. We were really disappointed by this escape room for many reasons. Firstly, there is no welcoming area, you just have to wait for your time slot in the street, even if it's raining, thought inside, the is enough space to place a sofa at least. Secondly, we asked if it is warm inside the rooms, the guide told us that "it will be getting warmer", but in reality it was really freezing, the rooms are so cold that you'd better stay in you puffer coat if you have one, it's physical torture to be there. Thirdly, the guide himself was so unfrienly and unwelcoming, he put us off immediately by making some sarcastic jokes and rude comments of us, which were really low, for example, he said to the guy who is relly thin and not very tall "i see you are the strongest here". It was so strange to find such an ungentlemanly behaviour in a person who is supposed to be "a Victorian gentleman". Moreover, his accent was not very clear and when we asked him questions he made fun of us in a rude manner! Fourthly, strangely enough we had to wait for the other team (who was running late) to join us, though, it was not written on the site that there will be another team at all. Why should we be dependent on some other people? Fifthly, there is no logic in the puzzles at all and you understand quite fast that it is not you who play the game, but instead, you are being played: the riddles are solved not by you, but by "operators" of the game, who push the button at a certain time. You are even given some clues when you don't want to and that can be skipped, really. Though the operators keep a very close eye on you and your progress (which is very considerate and attentive), from the beginning to the end there is no sense of achievement as you realize that it was not you, who made the progress, you just don't believe in it! There are so many clues written everywhere, so many texts - just because without them it's impossible to solve the problems as they are absolutely illogical and not coherent. Though the idea is very interesting, there is so much potential in it, the rooms are not connected in a logical manner. It was not worth the money and it doesn't deserve all the positive reviews.
Awesome. Think Crystal Maze, think team, think fun. Our little clan had a great time finding out if when the going gets tough we hang together or not.

Fun and Amazing Attention to Detail. The most fun you can have in an hour and a half! Amazing attention to detail and wonderful special effects make this a standout escape room. Much better than others I have been to!

Brilliant!. TimeRun really deserves their name, we really travelled in time and felt like we are not anymore in XXI century. A rare escape game where you have a great story behind. Reminds that of serial about H.G.Wells. Rush and get your finger in the adventure. Great decorations, would certainly do it again.
Crystal Maze eat your heart out!. So much fun, amazing sets! Don't really want to say too much as being shrouded in secrecy is part of the game. If you're thinking about booking it though, Do!

Brilliant Experience. This was a finely crafted adventure that never dropped its mask. Attention to detail and performance was great and the puzzles were a good mix to engage with different ages and interests. Family demanded to go back as soon as we walked out the door. It is expensive but having done it I would say the price is fair and worth it. Very intensive.

Go do it immediately -- you will have so much fun. Of all the escape rooms I've done, this one was the best in terms of complete and immersive theming, variety of challenges, and creative use of technology. From the time the mysterious door opens to the moment you are ushered back into reality, you will have an utter blast. Do it. Do it now.

A thematic journey. Everything was planned with greatest care. From the entry to the exit, this run through time was consistent with the theme. Dr. Aubrey added some character and humo(u)r.While we didn't complete the journey successfully , we were able to see all of the tremendous commitment to making this an immersive experience.Well done, Time Run!

Good fun and well done. Never been to an escape room experience before. It was a great hour of fun. Balance being both mentally challenging - but not so esoteric to be undoable. Theatre of rooms themselves was very well done.

Great family fun. Chose this as a Christmas holiday family jaunt - 2 adults, a 16 yr old and a 22 year old. This was perfect as it was challenging, fun and works for a wide age group. The guide, Aubrey, was charming and engaging. The rooms are very professionally done (nice to have 3...many of these have just one room). One of the rooms is quite dark and hard to see the puzzles and instructions...luckily we had young eyes with us or we'd have been floundering. Still had an absolutely brilliant time. Recommended.

A great evening out. It was quite challenging at times but really, really good fun. The whole experience was personalised, and hints were given when needed, so we didn't get stuck, but at no point it was just simple. A very authentic experience, I felt like the Indiana Jones at one point! Would highly recommend anyone, and would do again!! (This was Christmas party with the team at work, but would equally do this with friends/family.)

Surprisingly good fun. Wasn't sure what to expect here, I kinda imagined it might be a few fairly trivial puzzles and some hammily acted videos to set the scene.But I was really surprised at how slick it all was, really great props and equipment, and some fun special effects. The 'hosts' (presenters?) are quirky and funCan't say too much without ruining it, but from the moment the big wooden doors slide open and you step inside, its a lot of fun, and there's enough different tasks and skills so that everyone in a group can contribute somethingIt was actually quite challenging too. We were a group of three and although we came close, we failed to complete it in time. I much prefer this to it being too easy though.

Fun, fun, fun. Time Run is such a great experience. Great production, with friendly & fully engaged time run 'players'. Great for a team of 4-5. Our time run was just tricky enough to keep us interested for the entire run through time. I would highly recommend for anyone.

Time Run Fun. An excellent activity. Entertaining introduction. A good variety of escape rooms. Good combination of problem solving and a few hints!90 minutes went quickly. Easy to get to from London Fields station.

Challenging and entertaining fun!. This was my first time in an 'escape room' type puzzle game and I found it hugely enjoyable. The puzzles really challenge you to work well as a team and the format is more akin to a live computer game than just a set of puzzles. There is a narrative that runs through connecting the rooms so you really feel you are taking part in a live adventure. I highly recommend!

Great Fun!. What a great thing to do for a team day out, We had lots of fun, definitely worth a visit! The staff are very witty and Dr Aubrey is fab! The only down side is that it all goes so quickly, but I guess that's time travel for you!

Truly the king of kings. I've done several live 'escape rooms' puzzles in the last year since having found out about their existence and can honestly say this is by far the best. It's a highly immersive experience with some very well thought out puzzles, which really do require you to work as a team. Also, whereas some puzzle rooms just require you to find codes to unlock things with more codes in, this puzzle really has good variety beyond simple codes.

One of the best things to do in London!. This was a lot of fun and a must try! My friends and I found it to be really immersive and the hour just flew by. There was three of us in the team and we succeeded in completing it with 53 seconds left!The puzzles are all really well put together, requiring you to work individually and together as a team. I'm now a bit sad as I really want to go again but can't because I know too much! Here's hoping they make some new rooms.
Great team night out. A really good night out. Perfect for team building and all the games were good and challenging. I'd love to go back and do this again!

Absolutely amazing - must do it!. A great way to spend an hour or so - production value is brilliant, definitely the best escape room I have ever been to. Really entertaining, I'd highly recommend Time Run to anyone.

Great fun. a super hour. Time Run is very well presented and the challenges are very enjoyable. Sadly we had a technical hitch and a light did not shine where it should - we wasted about 20 minutes on this but they only credited us with an extra 8 minutes so we did not complete all the challenges. Who knows if we would have done but we felt very cheated.So overall the experience was soured but if all had run well it would have been very good.
entertaining and engaging. tips: allocate human resource and time. certain task is better to be focus by one member and some better by a few.

Simply Amazing. I have done escape rooms in Asia, the USA, and Europe, and this is by far one of the best, if not THE best. Very modern equipment, fantastic story line, and a wonderful cast of employees. My partner and our friends had an incredible experience!

Immediately wanted to go again!. Wonderful sets transport you into various points in time utterly convincingly. The puzzles are great fun, challenging and original. The whole adventure has a lovely touch of humour and the hour zooms by as you remain utterly engrossed in the game. We all came out wishing they had a second adenture we could book ourselves in for immediately. It's basically like a real life version of a puzzle section of a great computer game, like Unchartered or Portal. Definitely going to be buying people tickets for this as gifts. We all agreed we'd have paid more than we did for the experience.
So much fun!. Really fun and challenging, the hour went so quickly! It was really well executed and great to do with mates or work colleagues.

Great fun! The hour flies by... From the moment you step through the door the whole thing is really well done, from the introduction to the attention to detail in each of the rooms (times) you visit. Sadly our team didn't manage to 'save the world' but we all still had a fantastic time. I would definitely recommend this!

Fantastic fun, tricky but rewarding!. After reading rave reviews online, my housemate booked this as a house trip for another housemate's birthday. It was fantastic! Even standing outside the sandtimer on the front door was exciting. Aubrey stayed so in character throughout our introduction, and was excellent fun. The adventure itself was definitely hard but really good - they watched you live and this meant you got personalised help from the little robotic creature Babbage as you went (instead of the stock hints you get at other similar escape rooms). Overall, I simply loved it.

Brilliant use of an hour.... What more is there to add that others have not said, great sets, great cast, and a great selection of puzzle in each time zone..We were a team of three and while we solved the game, we did it in 64 minutes not the 60 you are supposed to, problem was we were overthinking some of the puzzles...The only bit of advice I will give you is if you are the first team of the day they may have a roller shutter over the door, The instructions say "Ring the doorbell on the wooden doors by the Time Run Logo", the problem is if they have the shutter down the next door is wooden, has 5 or 6 bell pushes and none have the Logo.They have two rooms but they are the same game, so we are looking forward to them expanding and bringing new games And the London fields Brewery is not too far away..

Amazing Fun For the Family / Team Building Experience. This was my first experience with the new genre of "escape room" games, and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. We went as a family of four including two teenage boys. The location is in an up and coming "hipster" section of London; we took public transportation to get there with no problems as it is an easy walk from the London Fields over-ground train stop taken from the Liverpool Street station. We were greeted by a very funny actor (a bit of a young David Mitchell lookalike) dressed in a Victorian England costume who explained "the quest" to the two teams there, and then we were off. We had a bit over an hour to solve clues and puzzles in order to advance over three rooms, each from a different era of time, with lots of helpful hints thrown our via various mediums way by an out-of-sight mentor watching our progress. It was mentally challenging and fun, and a great family team building experience as we had to work hard and fast together to solve the clues to advance to the next room. At the end of the quest, we received an evaluation of our team's efforts in an official debriefing. Well worth the admission price, I would recommend this highly to families with teenagers or older, or to teams from a workplace. Hope to see this in the USA soon!

Brilliant Fun; Few tweaks and it could be AMAZING. NO SPOILERS. Went to this with 3 other friends. Overall we though that the production value was very good, and liked the fact that you could get some help along the way. We thought the introduction bit was a bit too laboured, and would've preferred to potentially have used this time to have a bit more time to complete the mission. The main bit that we struggled on was that it was far too dark to see some of the things that needed to be seen. I realise this was probably to aid atmosphere, but it costs us valuable time and did make some members of the team feel a but redundant at times. I also think the extra time at the end may be good to potentially go see some of the other rooms again o take photos, much like other immersive productions. Overall, would recommend, but not sure if it would be too hard for younger members of the family to partake in. However, really good fun.
INCREDIBLE!! Highly recommend . Amazon experience, my first escape room experience and won't be my last. Highly recommend this one!!! Hotline bling :D

Brilliant fun, really well done. No spoilers. Excellent acting, characters and sets. Huge amount of fun. All in all takes around 2 hours but time flies. Well worth the money and would go again 100% when it gets updated with new runs.

The most fun I've had with my clothes on in years.. Brilliantly atmospheric, fantastically fun - a lot of care, time and effort has obviously gone into the production of this attraction and it really, really shows. Well done to everyone involved. I LOVED it.
Excellent. The actors don't leave the role any time, the rooms are very well build and the puzzles are great. Perfect for all family
FRANIC MANIC EXCITING BUBBLY!!!. It was absolutely BRILLIANT. Very exciting, and each room setting was complete surprise. I wish I could do it all again!!

Good fun, memorable experience. Myself and a group of 8 friends visited Time Run on a Saturday evening and had a great time. The introduction sets a scene before you are launched into a race against time contest against your companions. The challenges test your teamwork, logic, observation and time management skills. The story is that you are being transported between time zones with a different set of challenges in each zone, which are linked by portals - doors which unlock once the challenge is complete. It is real fun, and our entire group had a good time - I have recommended it to management at my office as Time Run would make a great team bonding exercise. I thought the whole concept was put together very well, and the actors who introduced us at the beginning and congratulated us at the end were excellent, particularly considering it was 9pm on a Saturday night.

Timeless Fun!. Generally like this kind of thing and was really impressed at the attention to detail here. The only thing I would say is the initial briefing is a little long, but apart from that, it was full of surprises, really challenged us but in a fun way, and we were completely full of excitement and embraced the whole thing. We also talked about it at length after we came out. There were only 3 of us which I would say is enough really, but 4 would also be fine. I hope they do more of these as I would love to do it again, although no point going back to this one as there would be no surprise. So, please go and experience it - really worth it!

First Escape Room. Okay, first Escape Room. I had no idea what it was going to be about. I went into the event totally blind.The First actor you meet was a wonderful introduction to the event. He obviously really enjoyed the role. Did not switch off the role or broke character. This was essential for you the audience to get into the spirit of the event. As we're the actors at the end.The props were high quality and the production of the videos made everything fit together seamlessly. I am not saying I believed I was travelling through time. However, this has obviously been put together with great thought, love and care. Which makes a really enjoyable hour, and you get a real sense of achievement when your team achieves every puzzle.This is a tricky review to write because you want to say everything that was good about it without spoiling the event for others.Needless to say there are countless things that are good about this escape room. I felt like I was in the crystal maze for an hour.There is plenty of scope for this company to make many more escape rooms in the same format. I hope that they do with the same love and care that they did this one.Actually I hope they buy an old 10 story hotel and make it in to a resort.David Ward

Great fun. From the moment you arrive at the appropriately themed front entrance you are propelled into a theatrical adventure. The whole experience is well planned and very funny at times. A very unique thing to do and we would definitely recommend. Although the actual challenge lasts for around one hour I would probably allow for 1.5 hours as the introduction etc takes some time but it's all part of the experience. Many thanks

An amazing team experience. Time Run was a great experience! Right from the start I loved every minute. The plot was very well thought through, the rooms were really well designed and the clues were very clever. As a team we worked well together and felt that we all played our part in finding out the clues in each room. It's your own real chance to be part of the Crystal Maze - something I've always wanted to try!! Brilliant fun!

Brilliant. Go. It's really very good. Have done loads of escape rooms and this was spectacular. Absolutely jaw dropping sets and effects and meaty puzzles requiring teamwork as well as everyone getting a chance to solve. Really good. Well worth the money.

Expensive but awesome . Had always wanted to do escape room and never gotten then chance to until friends in London wanted to during our visit. Was one of most fun things we did during our week here. Really well done and highly recommend. Lots of fun despite being a bit expensive.

Great team fun and 'something different'. We had a great time doing this in a team of 5, captivated our imagination and excitement to complete the challenge! Highly recommend as something to do with friends or a team building activity not based on boozing! .....although there are lots of places to go nearby afterwards!

Team day out. Wow, so much fun!!! We absolutely loved this, what a great team build.
You're split into groups to solve puzzles as you travel trough time, yes through time......
If you can crack the last room and gain the prize you're a better person than me!
Enjoy!!

Fantastic, fun day out, felt like I was on the Crystal Maze. This is perfect for teens / young adults, ideally for a group of friends who can split into two groups. We had a huge amount of fun travelling through time, solving various challenges. I would definitely recommend it...just wish I could forget it so that I have the opportunity to do it all over again! Experience made more authentic by the fantastic introduction and the attention to detail.

I wish I could forget the experience... So i could do it all over again!!. Having done a few escape rooms (including one in Switzerland), I had a rough idea of what to expect with Time Run. My expectations were exceeded. The whole experience is thoroughly enjoyable, right from the hosts introduction to "your mission through time and space".The escape room itself was great and had an amazing "Crystal Maze" feel to it. Personalised hints were given to us when it seemed that we had started to get stuck, and the quality of the whole experience was extremely high.After we managed to escape (5 minutes after the timer went off), we were given a run down of our performance by a member of the "extraction team" and shown our prize. All the hosts remained in character, and were very helpful and accommodating.One word of caution: Have a team name in mind when you go. You have to choose one before you go in, and since nobody in my team is particularly good at acting under pressure, many jokes and bad puns were had at the expense of team "Craig David"
Excellent. Done a few of these and this was definately the best. A lot of effort has clearly gone into the production and story.

A Very Excellent Adventure. After an amusing introduction by your immaculately attired host, off you go on an adventure through time, tackling team challenges in an attempt to save the world. If you have seen Crystal Maze you have an idea of what to expect, except that there are no physical challenges. Your mum could, for example, do this. What struck me most was the attention to detail. Your host is permanently in character. The challenges have a very high production quality. This makes the experience very immersive. If you are prepared to enter into the spirit of it and embrace it you will have a great time.

So much fun!. This is so much fun! Its like The Crystal Maze but better because you are in it! Go with three or four people and enjoy - that way, they can make more of these in the future. I cant bloody wait!

Brilliant!. I've done several other escape the room style things, in London and other cities, and this is easily the best one. Strong theme throughout the rooms (it's multi room like many), interesting puzzles, and each room is quite different. Simply excellent quality in every aspect! Not sure what else to say, if you enjoy these sort of experiences, definitely give this one a go. Wouldn't attempt it with less than 3 people, although perhaps they wouldn't let you anyway.

Great fun!. Went with a group of 4 and we loved it, great sets and atmosphere throughout and the puzzles were good fun. If you are a fan of the Crystal Maze or just want to try something a little different then this is well worth checking out!

Challenging, immersive, fun!. Took my dad here as a surprise when he came to visit. Could not be more pleased (well maybe if we won!). Amazing experience, challenging puzzles and definitely not easy. The attention to detail is astounding and you really get into the story line and feel so involved. Would highly recommend to families, groups of friends or work events. Simply awesome, can't wait to try again...and hopefully make it out in time!
Amazing Fun, Totally Different!. This is a must if your looking at it book it!!! You won't be disappointed!!! Such a laugh and very challenaging.

Super fun!. We were a family team of time runners (kids ages 13 and 15) and everyone got involved. Without trying to spoil the suprise my son's experience playing Unchartered on the playstation helped with some of the tasks! Was a brilliant experience and throughly recommend.

Absolutely Amazing & FUN!. If you are thinking of booking Time Run - BOOK it and do not hesitate! We had such a great time, I have been telling all my friends to do it! We were a group of four and we completed it in 64 minutes (they gave us extra time as we were soooo close). There is such a massive drinking / pub culture in London so it is great to experience something that is fun, creative and exhilarating - without the requirement of alcohol!

The Most Fun I've Had In A Garage In East London. It took us a few minutes to find the place, but the unprepossessing front is all part of the image for this wonderful little adventure through time and space. I've heard about these sorts of games from friends, but had never expected the whole experience to be so immersive. From the moment we stepped through the door, we'd entered an old-timey extravaganza, and although we definitely all that the giggles for the first few minutes, the next hour was deadly serious. I was continually impressed by the attention to detail and the design in general. The graphics were fantastic, and the props felt well-crafted and added to the sense of realism. We quite happily could have spent two hours rather than just the one in the place, and there wasn't at all a sense of wanting to get out after the final challenge. The staff were brilliant at their roles, and the live response of them during the challenge was very impressive.
Totally different.... It's easy to get caught in the booze culture of London, but this provides a welcome change! Exciting, stimulating and absolutely engrossing!! Just do it...

Absolutely loved it!. Having struggled to find our way to Time Run, we had serious doubts about ever finding our way out of it! Didn't quite manage to solve all the puzzles. No near and yet so far! But we had a fantastic time solving the ones we could and more than impressed ourselves! Please hurry and add some new adventures. In the words of Arnie: "We will be back!" Meantime we will be telling everyone we know to book.One thing that held us up: all 3 of us are in our 50s and even with our strongest glasses on, we couldn't see the numbers on the locks etc. I'm SURE we would have finished the tasks on time otherwise. (Well, at least that's our excuse). Next time we come, please can we have a torch?

Literally one of the best things I've ever done. Really great experience, perfectly executed and thoroughly good fun. The rooms are so well thought out and the attention to detail makes the whole experience brilliant. We're all dying to find another one like this but I don't think we will ever find one as good!!!

If you had to do one thing in London, it should be this. This is brilliant. If you always wanted to go on a children's game show like 'Legends of the Hidden temple' or 'The Crystal maze', then this for you. Even if you didn't always want to go on one of those shows, then this is for you. It's completely immersive and lots of fun.

Immersive, exciting, a whole experience beginning to end!. Your experience starts the second you "Please press the bell exactly at the time of your slot". Brilliantly acted immersive experience, every detail considered to take you to a new world as the story is explained and your tasks uncovered across 3 rooms. Even the ending (which I won't ruin) was a brilliant touch! Totally exceeded my expectations of these games and in such an unassuming location.We took part as two teams on a work away day. I'd recommend for friends, families, or colleagues alike.

Best escape game!. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave you are whisked away to another time and dimension in a fully immersive game. As soon as we'd completed it we wanted to be whisked away on another adventure. It differs a little from traditional room escape games where you're not trying to escape in the time allowed, but rather trying to locate a specific object in the time allowed, and that adds something to it. There's a wonderful story woven into it that makes it feel like more than a simple 'get out of here as fast as you can' game. Brilliant.

Brilliant!!!!!. We were so impressed with Time Run! The actors, sets and puzzles were all amazing. When you arrive (exactly on your time, not a minute before!) you are immersed straight into the Time Run universe. There is a reasonably long intro but it sets the scene well and the actors are fantastic at dealing with slightly hyperactive adults.There has clearly been a lot of thought, time and effort go into the rooms, and it shows in the layout and attention to detail with the props.The puzzles were great, some of them were quite hard but the clues that came through when we were stuck normally put us on the right track.I hope a new room gets opened soon as I really want to go back! Definitely worth it, we all had a fantastic time - thanks Time Run team!

We want more!. There's no other way to say this...we want more! It has been my very first experience of this kind as part of a team building activity and I know it has set the bar very high. The mix of skills required to 'travel through time' is fantastic and I felt my brain challenged throughout - I really cannot recommend it enough for something different to do in a group of friends or for team building. Fingers crossed they come up with a second run, they wouldn't be short on demand.

intergalactic fun. one word -Brilliant! I would recommend everyone to try this escape room, the best I have tried by far. The challenges are not easy but they are enjoyable. The actors are realistic and very witty and charming. I am looking forward to them expanding so i can return!

a fabulous different style of evening entertainment. I went with my sister and her boyfriend.We were running late so it was a challenge itself to get there on time.Loved the pre email and ease of online booking.The guy you first meet is fantastic, very friendly, very mysterious.Without giving anything away, it was so much like crystal maze we left the place buzzing and we didn't even get out on time!We had no idea what it was going to be like but it really was fantastic!!

#1 Escape Game. Difficult and interesting puzzles that I have not seen anywhere else, requiring full use of logic, physical ingenuity, and teamwork. Polished and professional decor and props set over a large floor space makes you feel immersed as an explorer in the world of the game. Clearly a labour of love by very talented people, and at least twice as good as the next best escape game available in London. If another room is released I will play it as soon as I can.

A really great day out!. I've been to escape rooms before, design wise this one takes it to the next level.The sets are excellently made and well designed to give you a very immersive feel. There is a good feel to the introduction and the whole lay-out is done in a very interesting manner.The staff are great, albeit a little hammy- but they are supposed to be and were really into the roles so it was enjoyable. They were very friendly and engaging. The puzzles themselves are good, however there is a lot of handholding and you don't feel that you have solved a puzzle sometimes as the actions didn't always correlate to the result (having said that there were some really tricky ones!). All in all Time Run is an amazing day out and worth it price wise.

A must do - absolutely brilliant!. I haven't been to any other escape room type activities before so had really been looking forward to this - and it was far better than I could have imagined! The introduction was quite long but the actor doing the introduction was good and put up with a group of cheeky over excited 30+yr olds quite well! The actual game and set up of the rooms is just brilliant, each room had a very different feel and atmosphere to it and I like the interactivity with someone clearly watching you from somewhere. Without saying much more and ruining it, yes its expensive but really good fun and really well put together - a definite must do!

Best escape game in London. Really, really good. Do it. The sets are spectacular and the lead up to the actual run is also way bigger than the others I've been on. The slightly higher price than others is absolutely worth it.

Best Escape Room by a mile. This was the 2nd escape room i have done in London and it is significantly better than the other. The puzzles were just as good in the other escape room, but the production value at Time Run is much more impressive. It really feels like you are in an episode of the crystal maze with staff in role and immaculately decorated rooms. I definitely recommend this escape room, but if you are planning to try more than one, maybe don't do this one first as it might make the others feel a little disappointing in comparison!
SO MUCH FUN!. This was the coolest thing I have done! So much fun and really engaging! you will definitely want to come back.

Great fun. This was my first escape room and it was really, really good fun - much, much better than I had expected an escape room to be. Would really recommend it and am only sad that I can't do it again!

Brilliant and extremely fun. We went to the event as a part of a birthday and it was so much fun we are already waiting on the next runs to be available!!! Strongly recommend to anybody. Perfect for groups or even small team building events.
The commitment and friendly staff altogether with the well thought activities was just PERFECt!

Brilliant Experience. We booked this event as part of a friends meet up in London. When we arrived I was slightly concerned as we were in back road, waiting outside a warehouse somewhere in London which had graffiti on the door. Was not expecting much.How wrong was I! From the door opening you are taking into a different world. It was an amazing experience and I really enjoyed taking part in it. The variety of the challenges and rooms was huge and really made you think and work as a team.If anything I would have loved to be able to have stayed longer and done a couple more rooms! Cant wait for the scenario to change, I will be going back!!! A must for any group visiting London who want a fun thing to do.

Extremely Enjoyable. Wasn't the easiest place to find because we were first group in the morning - there is no signage outside and when we arrived there was a shutter down over the door. However, this really added to the already growing sense of intrigue I had about the place. From the moment we stepped inside we were immediately immersed in the notion of time travel. Each of the tasks/activites was extremely well thought out and forced you to think outside the box from the very start. Would 100% recommend to everyone!

AMAZING. We're over for a London weekend, it was absolutely fantastic. Would recommend to anyone, and would love to do it again. If you're in two minds...DO IT! The commitment to detail, the incredibly friendly staff and the overall experience was the absolute highlight of our trip! THANK YOU!

Amazing details. Time Run is brilliant! I went with some friends in August 2015 and the experience is great - as soon as you step through the door the attention to detail in creating the space is fantastic. Our host was very enthusiastic and a pleasure to talk to, and when you go through into the puzzle rooms - well, I don't want to spoil it. But there are some really good moments where you'll look at each other and say "Oh, that was clever!". We couldn't stop giggling throughout - the whole thing is very well made with a range of puzzles and special effects and it's a great way to have fun with a group of friends. We only just managed to succeed in the challenge but still feel very proud of ourselves!

Great fun, thought out really well. This was great fun, me and 4 others went for my birthday arranged by my partner, it was great fun and better then i could have hoped for, I love the fact that because of it obscure location and strict instructions for entry that only people going and paid will know where it is allows the actors to be in character straight away and not having to deal with tickets etcWill 100% go again

Cryptic time travel brain teaser. Absolutely marvellous. The team or person who came up with the idea then planned the puzzles, built the sets and dressed the rooms, wrote the script and so on must be a wonderfully talented, creative and playful bunch. It was an immersive experience - planned to perfection. Loved it and only wish I could go again - send all your friends so they can make enough to build a second one. Definitely do this if you like solving problems.

So much fun, very well curated experience. I've been to another escape-type game in London before and this one was much cooler and better done. As soon as we walked in we were welcomed by staff in character - it got us pumped to get started. Every little detail was so realistic and the experience was so fun and exciting. It was challenging but also very satisfying - and it helped that we won with less than a minute to go! This is a great group activity.

excellent experience!!. From the moment you get the first electronic mail, it is exciting! The journey starts with the presentation of one of Luna's collegues. He will put you inmediately in the correct atmosphere. An hour will go by, but time will go like seconds, and you will have a lot of fun! Totally recomenedable!
Amazing. I went with friends and had an amazing time. The staff were super friendly and helpful. That 60 minutes went really fast. I am definitely going back!

Awesome Experience!. I can't recommend this enough, from the very start to the end this was simply brilliant. I've been to escape games all over Europe but this one striked me by how authentic and historic each experience was. Not easy, but achievable and thoroughly fun. Great staff too. Thanks TimeRun!
The day we saved the world!. The best fun from the moment the door to all time portals revealed itself, to our return to the here and now. Excellent!
Great experience. Really fun , great variety of tasks ,a mixture of hard and easy tasks.great team building exercise and 3 fantastic room!

Best experience ever. We tried a lot of "Live Escape Games" but this one is BY FAR the best. Best decorations, best story, best people working there. Without spoiling anything, the game is so intelligent, you will ACTUALLY feel like travelling through time. I definitely recommend this game (Lance of Longinus). Important : A good understanding of English may be useful to fully understand the story and a couple of riddles, more than the average escape game.Trust me, after you try this one, every other seems a bit cheap :pEnjoy !Romain

Thrilling adventure through time and space!. This escape room was super amazing fun. The production values were high throughout, and the live performers were cordial and funny. It was definitely worth the time and the money, and I look forward to Luna's next call to adventure!

Thrilling Three's Great Escape. We took part in Time Run with our ten year old son - who was expecting great things. He wasn't disappointed. The attention to detail is incredible - we became really involved very quickly. And it genuinely is a challenge, while still being accessible to children (the minimum age is ten, and I think this is probably just right). I won't give anything away, just be prepared to use your grey matter. Really good fun. Wish we could have another go! Ooh - and there's a cracking place to eat just across the way at Climson's.

Excellent fun at Time Run!. Great fun! Loved that the hosts were in character, it really helped to set the scene and create an exciting atmosphere! We visited last week for a team building activity. Although we were split into 2 teams as there were 7 of us in total, it was fun to catch up at the end and re-live the experience! I really can't wait for another room so we can come again!!!!

Best Escape Game Experience. I have played a number of escape games in the UK in the last year or so.Having done very little in the last 6 months my friend was recommended to make the trip to a new game called Time Run in London.It was amazing to see how these games have moved on.The game is fairly off the beaten track but once you get there it is a completely theatrical experience. Although the initial host staying in character is a bit cringe worthy, the rooms look amazing, unlike many of the other escape games we have played.The puzzles are good but it is the story and design of the rooms and games that makes this the best game we have played.Really enjoyed it, looking forward to the next time run.

Great fun. Tremendous fun. High production values, good puzzles, well-organised. Really enjoyed this. I haven't done a room-escape thing before, but my friends who joined me had, and they said this one compared very favourably.

Great stag fun!. We started here on a stag do and had a brilliant time. The production values were amazing and the whole thing was great fun from the second we stepped in. The guys running the whole experience were very funny and created a great atmosphere. I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone. I just wish I could go back and do it all over again!

fun fun fun. loved this, great concept, good challenges, if only we had 5 more minutes :). highly recommended if you like escape the room games..not too physical but teamwork needed.an immersive experience that takes you out of the real world for a while.

Great fun prepare to use your brain. As a treat for my nephews, it's ~£30 a head. I surprised them by taking them to a sketchy end of town to a non descript warehouse. We entered and were greeted by a very well dressed actor in character who explained the story. You are then taken on the journey , I won't give away the details. It's pretty cool. however it's very expensive it's the only escape room I have been to but I enjoyed this and would recommend it

Would love to travel back in time - to do it again. Time run is a very elaborate high quality experience that clearly lifts escape rooms to a next level and I very much appreciate that. I loved the decoration and the acting and on many levels this experience is far above above other escape room experience I had so far. This doesn't mean that it isn't without flaws. There are some things that could have been improved, but I don't want to go into detail with the danger to spoil something ;) Nevertheless Time Run is a very special and excellent experience and you clearly don't want to miss out on it!
So fun. If you like puzzles and pretending you're in another world this is for you. Great set design. Good actors. Overall very well done.
Really good fun. The guys at Time Run have gone to astonishing effort to make this experience fun and authentic. It is really very impressive.We had great fun! I would highly recommend it!
Really immersive, surprising amount of attention to detail. For anyone who loves puzzles, interesting themes, and has played the Ocarina of Time's sand temple, this is a must.

An awesome interactive experience!. Time Run is the sort of attraction that has to be experienced, and any review would not do it justice as it is a personal experience, one which I thoroughly enjoyed!
time run. loved every minute of it, cant wait to do another, great sets, great staff and something different to do

Impressive immersive set-piece. A real narrative driven escape room experience with excellent production values. From the very get-go at the golden gate to the final escape through the last portal it is a thrilling adventure through time and space itself. Beautiful decors, realistic acting and quite original puzzles. One can indeed see what one payed for. A few minuscule points of criticism is that there is slightly too little time for the players to solve the puzzles themselves which means you might be getting hints before you have had a chance to solve things yourselves.
A fun morning. Well thought-out and well made escape room. The puzzles were clever, the environments well made, the story was clear and drawing. An hour flew by.

Immersive, mentally challenging but great fun too. If you've ever seen the Crystal Maze you'll know what to expect - rooms with puzzles that you have to solve to progress through to the next room, a time limit and increasing dopamine hits as your team gets closer to the ultimate goal of finding the missing artefact. From the moment you go through the door into Aubrey's early Edwardian office, you are immersed in the world of Luna Fox and her intelligent clockwork man, Babbage. The rooms are beautifully created and very detailed. You have real-time chats with Babbage as you make your way through and at every stage the puzzles are a stretch but doable by a team of 3-5 (well, we did it with a team of 3, but with only 7 seconds left on the clock, so a fourth team member might have made it a little less fraught!). You don't need any special historical knowledge to do the puzzles as all the information you need is provided, though it doesn't hurt to google the name of the artefact you're looking for before you get there (for us it was the Lance of Longinus) just for a bit of background interest - it makes no difference for solving the puzzles. Would probably need at least 3 adults per team but it is suitable for a teenager to be on your team, too. Takes no more than an hour (there's a time limit on the game) and is slick and well-paced. London Fields has plenty of cafes and pubs nearby for before and afterwards, and it's about ten minutes' walk from Hackney Central station. Not really very easy for wheelchair access although I think it would just about be doable (though I'd contact them to check what they think first). They have storage for bags, and toilets before you go in. I thoroughly recommend this for an afternoon out.

One of the more expensive, but better escape rooms. Quite pricey at £30 for an esape room in London, but once you see the rooms, props and graphis used you'll understand why.Time Run is one of the better escape room's in London, without giving too much away, the clues and puzzles are imaginative and original that requires team work to get them done. You really do need at least 3. I think 4 is the ideal number, 5 might be a bit much! The main concept is time travel, in my opinion that is better than the usual 'you are a detective' storyline.An hour doesnt feel like long to crack the 3 rooms, and I liked how you are trying to retrieve an ancient artifact, instead of actually trying to escape.Great fun, and worth the extra money

Great experience - loved every part of it. Loved the whole experience, right from the arrival and mystery created up to the challenges themselves - Everything was really well done, the quality of the rooms was great, it felt like a lot of thought had been put into every aspect. We were a group of 5 - 3 around 30 yrs old, 1 18yr old gamer and 1 19yr old - We all had an amazing time and would definitely reccomend it to others, infact have done already!
Just brilliant!. Very well designed puzzles, outstanding sets. There's not much to say except it is definitely worth giving it a shot.

Amazing! soo much fun !. This place is a must try if you're looking for something fun and different to do in London!!! i went with a group of friends between 21-23 age group - however I think it would also be great for family's! Can;t wait for them to make a new set up so we can do it again!!
Great fun! Challenging and enjoyable.. Fun puzzles to work out the challenge. Challenging but accessible. I would recommend this to anyone. I think that three people is the ideal number.

Brilliant experience! Cant stop talking about it.. What a great experience. My first escape room(s) and it was well worth the money. There is no point in describing it as words cant cover how much we enjoyed it. The sets are great and it feels like the people behind love their job! I'm not surprised.

The best escape game I've done. Not just an escape game, but immersive theatre.. I don't want to give too much away but suffice to say I've done several "escape games" - ie Crystal Maze esque puzzle games including Hint Hunt, Clue Quest, Escape Rooms and a few in different countries.This one is in a different league. It was incredibly immersive, the attention to detail was excellent and the whole thing felt very high budget. This isn't just an escape game but also immersive theatre.It's difficult, there's lots to do and clearly a lot of time and effort has gone into this. I would recommend to anyone and everyone!

Amazing. Ok, I have been to quite a few different escape rooms and I have to say this is the BEST one I have been to.. They have put in so much effort to the props, the actors and the puzzles are fun and engaging. It is one of the pricier escape rooms but if im honest I would gladly pay this price again for more experiences of this quality. Thanks Time Run for a fantastic experience!

Amazing unique experience!. We went as a team of four and had an amazing time. It's something different and a lot of fun. Great puzzles and decor, just wish it was a little longer as we were so close to completing it!Great friendly staff. Really can't recommend time run enough!

A must see. This is one of the better escape the room adventure where they attempt to set some sort of scene. This combination of story building and puzzle solving is what makes the experience unique and exciting. The staff are very friendly and add to the story by remaining in character.

An amazing experience. Work as a team to solve some fantastic puzzles... But be quick! If you think you aren't very good at problem solving, don't worry because you will get plenty of helpful hints to help you on your journey. Our group weren't successful but we all loved every minute. I think we might now be addicted to it now... We can't wait to try another one!

Amazing experience. It was most definitely worth the money, I enjoyed every second of the experience. My family was impressed with how much they had to offer. We got an hour and we did 3 rooms in different time periods. I felt like we had a good amount of time and whenever we were stuck they would give us clues through a screen. Very fun!

Great fun!. My group and I were so impressed with Time Run. There has been such thought and attention to detail put in to every element of the experience and we enjoyed it from start to finish. I really recommend Time Run if you're looking for an escape room type event as it seems to be the best, and I certainly hope to return should any other adventures crop up in the future. Thanks for such a unique and memorable evening.

The best thing to do in London now!. What an hour of fun filled adventure we had! I haven't experienced an event like Time Run before and it is truly amazing. Out of all the experiential events I've gone to in London over the last few years this wins hands down. The whole experience has been so cleverly thought out and built. Would recommend to all!

Still talking about it now .... This was SO MUCH fun, a few days later our team are still sending emails back and forth - going over the experience and trying to piece it all together. No doubt there have already been a lot of Crystal Maze comparisons but I'm going to make it too. You're thrust into a sequence of themed rooms, each containing a series of puzzles/codes you must work out as a team. It's hands-on, high-energy and beautifully detailed. Both the sets and the puzzles themselves are very clever with excellent attention to detail. We were really impressed with the obvious care and attention that had gone into crafting the experience. It's was really quite challenging! There was a lot of humour in there too, above everything we just had a great, fun time. We'll be looking forward to seeing what they do next.

Brilliant fun!. I was one of a team of 4 people doing this, and we all loved it! For two of us it was our first time at this sort of event but that was no barrier to engaging in the activities there. The rooms were wonderfully dressed, the clues hard to find, but not too hard (and there was help if you got stuck), and there was enough there to keep everyone busy and motivated all the time. Being against the clock kept the team moving forward briskly and different types of skills were useful throughout so everyone could contribute positively. The initial briefing and the post run debrief were both informative and entertaining. We left feeling we had both had fun and achieved something! I'd definitely recommend this.

Incredibly inventive and fun way to spend an hour. The minute we stepped through the door, we had a smile on our face! The whole experience had been very well and creatively constructed and was really brilliant and not too commercialised which made it even better! The actors were superb, the challenges challenging enough without being impossible! Our 11 year old son asked if we could do it again straight after we left!
Very funny!. It was a funny hour and we almost made it! It was our first experience and surely we will do it again!

How to spend a Sunday evening. Aubrey (23 Aug) - you are fantastic! Scene set perfectly and amusingly and although had no idea what to expect I couldn't wait to start. In the rooms your hints and encouraging comments were great - just a little nudge to set befuddled brains in the right direction and felt quite invigorated by the end. Absolutely loved it and would recommend it 100%.

stop asking questions and sign up now. The best, most thought out and well themed "room escape" yet! The design (both game design and artistic) were wonderful... even how they integrated with the surrounding area. There were a ton of puzzles, all solvable, and with varying difficulty. You do need to work with your team to solve some of them.

Great to do something different and done really well!!!. We went in 2 family groups making 2 teams of 4. age range 10 to 45. We hadn't visited this type of locked puzzle room before so can't compare it, however we all agreed we had a great time. This one seems really well run. a good range of puzzles - in authentic rooms - I think if you were very smart you could probably get on and puzzle solve from the off or like us if you needed quite a bit of help then the hints were there as needed. The time flew by and all of us were able to participate. I really goo thing to do as a group that was active, fun and needed us to work together. Big thanks to the Time Run team for making it a great experience!

Best afternoon spent at Time Run! . I had no idea what to expect when I agreed to go to Time Run but now I realise that the less you know about it the better. The experience that I had was incredibly fun, exciting and challenging. I loved the theatre of it and was very impressed with the set up and theatrical value. I would highly recommend this to anyone and would love to do it again.

Really fun and enteratining. A great night out, lots of laughs, very well designed, charming actors . Great sets and a wonderful venue.We had a really good evening despite none of us being familiar in advance with what was entailed. Highly recommended. .

Go for the experience; it's about more than the puzzles. I've played lots of escape rooms (elsewhere), but nothing quite like Time Run, and I mean that in the best possible way.It's not just the impeccably in-character greeting that you receive before embarking on your quest, or the dazzlingly high production values that await. Every puzzle is embedded seamlessly into the narrative, with parts of the experience playing out more as a natural exploration of the environment (you're Time Runners, of course you're investigating your surroundings) rather than having the "we're in an escape room, what do we do now" sort of feel. The special effects and very responsive rooms only add to the immersion.Admittedly, if you pursue the Lance of Longinus with puzzles as your priority, you might be disappointed. Some tasks are heavier on execution than inspiration, and could come across as tiresome (especially if you're in a smaller group). The adherence to plot also means that there are few 'pure' puzzles of the cryptic, multilayered sort you might expect in a typical escape room, and more of just figuring out what's going on.But that's just quibbling. As a sheer experience, Time Run is something I'd recommend to anyone. Arrive ready to have an adventure.
Good fun and challenging. The Set is excellent, the story flows well and problems are varied.Overall an exciting and challenging game where passes very quickly. Definitely recommend
Innovative and brilliant fun filled experience. Great group activity either for friends or family of all ages. Good team building experience but also GREAT FUN!

Unsure which escape room to choose? - Pick this one!. This was the 4th escape room I've played, and was easily the best overall experience. What makes Time Run unique is the immersive experience - clearly a lot of thought, time, effort and money have gone into the creation of each room. Excellent storyline and seamless puzzles of varying difficulty make for a great all-round package.More expensive than most, but well worth it, feels just like you're on The Crystal Maze. One not to be missed!

Well put together. I organised this as a stag do activity. I think it had a mixed reception amongst the party but certainly provided a talking point! The whole activity is well designed and moves along at a good pace.
Top tip - leave an 1 1/2 hours for this activity if you are planning events for afterwards!!

Great fun! . Fantastic concept. You're trapped and have to find your way out and finish the quest. They really went to town on the set design and was very believable.
Highly recommended for doing something really fun and different with friends in London.
No wonder it's doing so well..

A brilliant experience all round. Time Run is a beautifully designed interactive puzzle with excellent sets, the closest you can get to the crystal maze. Challenging and fun, can't think of a better way to spend an evening out in London right now.

Impressive. We went to time run as the start of a escape room marathon, and after doing 5 in a span of 48 hours I have this to say; time run had the best introduction, the actor was really good and it was the only time we had fun while being told the rules. The sets and surroundings were amazing, must have cost a fortune. Unfortunately it wasn't quite our type of room, we thought it was hard to get in a rhythm, a lot of sound clips and text we needed to hear/read and we constantly needed hints. The debriefing was also way below what we hoped for. That said I think most people would absolutely love it and there was many truly impressive features.

Gameplay and set quality above and beyond my expectations. Time Run's puzzle gameplay is fantastic and I would heartily recommend it to anyone based on that alone, but its real strength lies in how much it values the user experience. Throughout my time (run) I felt challenged, excited, determined and, most importantly, welcomed. Don't miss it.

A class above ClueQuest. The best 'escape the room' experience I've had (way better than ClueQuest)!The actors are great and really get into it, the sets are amazing and the puzzles really well thought out. Unlike other similar venues there is actually a decent plot / story line which really adds to the realism. Clearly a high level of production effort has been put into this, as even the cinematics were top quality. Time Run was a lot of fun and i'm looking forward to going back to their new rooms next year!If you're worried about the location - it's only 10 minutes on the train from Liverpool Street and a short (and easy) walk from the London Fields train station, don't let that put you off!
Brilliant Fun. 10 of us went at once so we had both sets of rooms booked. Was great fun to race not against each other as well as the clock. Everybody wants to go again!

So much fun we could have done played all day !!!. Not knowning what to expect we took our 10 year old daughter and her friend with us , the excitement was intense and we were not disappointed. The clues provided by Babbage helped us along the way and the girls absolutely loved it getting completely absorbed in the story. one of the rooms was a little bit scarey but that only added to the excitment of the experience. would recommend to kids as well as adults. great for a birthday treat if you have a small group. well done Time Run - can;t wait for the next installment !!
Good fun.... Was a fun experience at a reasonable price however was disappointed overall as I was expecting a lot more. I would do a different room again but would not be in a rush to go back.

Great fun! I want to do it again!. I visited Time Run with a few friends and wasn't quite sure what to expect. We were thrown into an adventure from the moment the doors were opened. The sets and attention to detail were brilliant and the cast were great. We quickly forgot that this was a 'game' and became completely immersed in the world and our desire to succeed. The tasks were challenging but achievable. The only negative is that now I know what to do, there isn't a follow up game. Another Time Run adventure soon please!

Like The Crystal Maze, but better!. A must-visit - absolutely tremendous fun! A totally immersive experience which made me feel like the hero in my own movie. My sister bought me tickets as a birthday present. I carefully selected my three most intelligent friends to give us the best chance of victory. As someone who watched The Crystal Maze all the time as a kid, and plays lots of computer games (Resident Evil & Zelda puzzles spring to mind), this was perfect for me. The puzzles were set at just the right level, and challenging enough to give a real sense of achievement when you solve them. They are also varied enough not to feel repetitive. The sets and props are wonderful and provided a terrific sense of escapism. There are also useful clues if you're stuck. The time limit was perfect - we managed to complete the challenge with seconds remaining, which added a genuine thrill to the experience. My tips would be: 1) Choose your team carefully; 2) Go to the toilet at the start; 3) Be hasty, otherwise you will run out of time! My team started at quite a leisurely pace which made the end of the game a mad rush. The staff were great and really enhanced the experience. Book your place now, you won't regret it!
Amazing!. This was an unexpected gem of an evening. Would definitely recommend, but if you are as competitive as myself be prepared to become very stressed out as you get to the end of your hour!

Flippin' AWESOME!. We had absolutely no idea what to expect, but every moment from the awesome door where you enter the building to the very end was just so much fun. We didn't succeed, but it didn't matter because we loved the stress and challenge of racing against the clock. The production value is so high and I love how interactive the experience is. Was awesome to leave our phones behind and play a game that required us to use our brains and work together as a team. I recommend going late afternoon so you can get a delicious coffee from Climpson's Arch before and then delicious Thai from their pop up stall after!

Great team game would do again and again. This is a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours with friends. Such a fantastic opportunity and one I would do countless times. Exactly like the feel of the crystal maze I loved the effort put into this attraction and we could not stop talking about it afterwards. Can't wait for the next one!

A great afternoon. I visited Time Run with some friends as part of a stag-do. We all had an amazing time!The environments were incredibly detailed, the puzzles are suitably difficult without being impossible (even after a few drinks), and the staff were brilliant.We had a few issues with booking (all my fault) and everything was handled efficiently and quickly.I would definitely recommend Time Run. I look forward to them creating a new world...

Brilliant birthday day out!. We booked three tickets to celebrate a friends birthday. I read up about it online and it seemed like it would a fun thing to do as she was only in London for a few days and had done all the usual tourist stuff before. Unfortunately only two of us could go in the end which made our time run a bit more challenging but the guide was very nice and got us very excited for the added challenge! The whole experience was brilliant! each room was so detailed and all the games were incredibly well thought out. Granted it was tricky with just two of us but the computer system Babbage was super helpful so we got through it! I would highly recommend this, great for birthdays or just something new to do with mates. Overall I loved it. I'll try to get a bigger group to go again soon!

Different escape room experience . We had a fun time. It was good, but the place was hard to find since there was no sign when we got there because we were the first appointment in the morning. We asked and no one knew where it was. 3 escapes room in one. We had a nice family time, but expected something different. We did not like the last room because it was about a very dark time in human history, it brought disturbing feelings, and it was hard to focus and enjoy it as much as the other rooms.

Unusual Experience!. Experiencing this for real is quite different from watching it on TV or playing a computer game. One of the rooms very much reminded me of a scene from "Tomb Raider" in fact, except that here you have a time limit and can only "die" once. It tests your wits for sure.

Best escape room in London - like being in a Crystal Maze room, but for an hour. Went with four friends and had a fantastic hour in this room. I've done 18 escape rooms in London (at the time of writing all of them except iLocked and Mystery Cube) and this is very clearly the best. Amazing introduction, great decoration, decent story, good puzzles. If you want to criticise then I can only pick out two things - there's a lack of amazing puzzles and the "debrief" was OK, but not amazing. It costs about a tenner more than its competitors, but it's still much better value for money, especially when you factor in that the introduction and scene setting here genuinely feel like entertainment.Stop wavering and book!

Simply incredible. A friend saw this on facebook. As I had my daughter this week I decided to give it a go.Even with the tube strike on it wasn't hard to get to. Liverpool St station and a quick overground train and we were 5mins walk from the front door.We were about 25mins early. hit the buzzer and was told (By Aubrey) to come back when it was our appointment time which we duely did.The time arrived swiftly and we rolled up again, this time though the splendid door opened wide ans we were greeted by a handsome very stylish chap by the name of Aubrey, he fashioned us with the tools needed to take on the task and off we went...To say much more would be classed as spoilers. The sets were highly polished, we racked our brains solving the puzzles with the help of Babbage the robot. We did complete the mission but not in the nicest of ways... needless to say time IS of the essence in there.We're hoping to return soon to see if we can finish it in the nice way. 5* entertainment without a doubt and well worth every penny.

Brilliant. More expensive than other escape rooms, but definitely worth it, the whole experience is so polished, and on a different scale to other escape rooms I've done. The extra money has gone into the incredible set designs, if you are looking for something different to do in London, you will love this

Time of our lives!. Amazing production values, genuinely challenging whilst still being amazing fun. Go and have an adventure! What are
you waiting for?!

Fantastic fantasy event. What an amazing experience, almost surreal. You are asked to arrive at a specific time, then having found the entrance, the doors open and you are welcomed straight into the experience. After an initial briefing you have one hour to solve it, with clues provided very cleverly to give you the best chance of being successful. We were looked after very well, in that my daughter became ill and had to pull out just after the start. We were given the choice of continuing without her or to re-book on another day. We pulled out and re-booked a free slot for the next day, so we got the chance to complete it as a family which was great, thank you Time-Run.We loved the whole experience, great sets and atmosphere, challenging and fun.

My favorite room escape experience so far!. We had previously done two room escape games in Seattle, and decided to do one while visiting friends in London. Our friends got tickets to Time Run. The ones we had done before had 12 people working together, while Time Run is for smaller groups (we had 4 people). The production value is quite high, the actor who greets you and the decor when you enter make the whole thing immersive from the start. I liked the time travel theme, and was impressed by the quality of the room design (there are several rooms/periods to progress through to find the solution). Babbage (our robot sidekick) was very helpful when we got stuck. Overall a great experience, and I would definitely come back for a different adventure the next time I visit London.

Excellent entertainment. Went tonight - in a team of 3. This is a brilliantly run pop up, with engaging actors and good sets. The puzzles are hard but they give you hints if you're struggling. We loved doing it and would definitely come back. And contrary to other reviews there was absolutely no pressure to give a positive review on trip advisor whilst we were there, in fact it wasn't mentioned at all. It's great fun. Go.

Excellent puzzling fun with great production values. This was my first experience of a room escape and it was very enjoyable indeed. The puzzles were well thought-out and pitched at a very satisfying level, and the production values in general were very strong.

Brilliantly immersive adventure game. Hand on heart, one of the best experiences we've ever had as a family. Thrilling, dramatic, exciting, tense ... it had it all.From the very start, being allowed through the Secret Door in London Fields, greeted by the handsome, twinkly, always-in-character Aubrey, and launched through a series of brilliantly actualized Time Portals, we were enthralled and captivated by this breathlessly immersive experience.Like walking into a computer game come to life - with the best 3-D graphics - and the most playable puzzles (a little like The Room 2 if you know that one.) They were challenging but doable for a team working together - and always fun and inventive, perfectly themed for the 'era' to which you had been transported.Nothing like I'd expected - far, far better - I'd give it the highest possible rating. It really was unique, and beautifully realised in terms of atmosphere, theming, playability.Tip 1: there's a little bit of not-too-demanding physical activity involved. Wear comfy clothes. Go to the loo when offered at the start.Tip 2: Don't waste any time admiring the convincing, beautiful and surprising 'rooms'. No dithering around! You need to get your team looking and thinking from the very start. Don't ever give up! there will be clues and breakthroughs.Tip 3: not much in London Fields (easily reached by overground train from Liverpool Street station, you can use your underground travel pass or Oyster of course if local) but there is a park by the Lido to sit in to calm your nerves before facing your challenge, and the trendy E5 Bakehouse for an excellent coffee and the 'best sourdough in London' under one of the railway archesTip 4: really, don't waste any time. Listen carefully to Babbage, your helpful clue-bot. Read everything. Get to work looking and finding even before you're sure how it all adds up.Tip 5: your experience starts the moment you get through the door. Be prepared to banter with Aubrey in a manner suited to a bygone age. We were taken by surprise - he was witty and urbane, we stood there like four lemons with our mouths agape and looking like the worst duffers who ever showed up. He must have been secretly sure the four of us would Play Like (the proverbial Red Dwarf) Puddings, but not a hint of that showed in his courteous manner. I'd do it again tomorrow in a heartbeat. Please, PLEASE let the same team come up with another adventure!

Brilliant hour well spent.. Straight from the entering through the enticing door you are immediately plunged into the scenario - even safety tips are given in the context of the story. The standard of the sets was excellent, the puzzles intriguing and the whole experience was far better than I could have anticipated - I thought we would literally spend the whole time in one room but no - there are several time zones to progress through. Clues are given only when needed to help you move through the game and the time just whizzed by. I would definitely go to another event by this group - perhaps they missed a trick in having two identical stories running simultaneously ? Two different ones would definitely have ensured we rebooked for the other. Well done - a great afternoon.

Too expensive for what you get, very rushed. The only reason time run just about gets some stars is primarily due to its great atmosphere and design and the story flowed well.However, everything was very rushed, it seemed like we needed to complete more things in the room but we were just rushed forward. Just to get us out.Also if English is not your first language, you probably won't have such a good experience, as some clues were audio and reading which seemed stressful for some members. Shorter intro and extra time in the room would have felt less stressful. When we finished we had a five second review and then we were shown the door! This place is expensive for what you get and there are better escape games around offering cheaper value and better customer service and satisfaction.

First class escape room. There's a lot of effort, thought and polish gone into this escape room. It is quite expensive, but it's a great experience from beginning to end, and definitely one of the very best I've done.

Excellent Fun. Excellent experience.Very well designed and set up. It was good fun throughout and the venue team were professional, friendly and humorous from start to finish. I would recommend it for team building and management exercises as well as a great way to spend time with a group of friends or family. It would make an unusual and enjoyable gift for a loved one.

a good time. I enjoyed participating in Time Run. I was initially hesitant as I'm not always the best puzzle solver but the clues given were well timed and helpful. The overall experience exceeded expectations. The set design was of high production value. If the people behind time run produce a different adventure I would definitely be interested in doing it again.

Best in London by far. Having tried mostly all the hint/escape room venues in London, this is by far the very best and puts some of the others to shame. Took my team from work and we had a great time, would recommend it to anyone and hope they make another experience for us to try.

Excellent in every way. I have been to a few 'escape the room' type experiences in London, and this one is by far the best one I have tried. My friends and I adored it. It's a really immersive experience, light-hearted and fun, with some really great puzzles that require some solid team-work. The staff were lovely too and kept in-character really well, in keeping with the story of the game. Just do it. It's wonderful and you won't be disappointed :)
Awesome experience. Really really well done, cool story, and excellent puzzles, fairly challenging but definitely do-able without too much help. Highly recommend!

Puzzle tastic. Wow wow wow what can I say this Time Run escape experience is an amazing one. You go through 3 different very different rooms during your puzzling journey. The decor in the rooms are amazing and the rooms are professionally done. The puzzles are great some easy and some hard but don't worry Babbage will be on hand to help assist you with clues if you get stuck on any particular puzzle. Me and my team managed (Life Begins) to complete in 62 minutes and we used approx. 20 clues which is average. You also only play with your friends and not strangers. However you will need 3 or more players to play. Only downside about this escape room type experience is that it is located in a odd location but saying this it would not put me and my friends off in going along to another ones of theres if they made a new adventure up. Is a must to do.
Time run!. A simply fantastic experience! An hour travelling through time solving riddles to save humanity. If you want to feel like Indiana Jones, this is the place to go.

Fantastic experience - you must do it. I've done some escape the room games before and this is head and shoulders above all the rest. Really rich environments, very diverse range of rooms and so much detail. Escape from it now!
Fun time run. Very entertaining way to spend an hour with friends or colleagues. Highly recommended. Good places to eat/drink nearby too.
Really polished escape room - great fun. Really polished escape room - great fun. Lots of attention to detail and personalised support. Would recommend highly.

A lot of fun...... If you loved the crystal maze, you will love this particular escape experience. From the moment you enter, the experience begins.
