Only a 40% pass rate, so even if you've done escape rooms before, this should challenge you :-) Anyone from 10+ will get something out of this experience however, as tasks range from easy to complex. A lot of fun ♡

Fun Team Activity. I was recommended Time Run by a 17yr old student of mine who had just been with her parents and loved it. I went with my partner and 18 and 19yr old last Sunday. There's not many days out you can do with older teenagers but this was great. You have to try and progress from one room to another by completing a number of challenges. It's great team building and a lot of fun. It's harder than you think and involved a lot of lateral thinking. Couldn't recommend it enough. It's a bit like a more complex version of crystal maze.

AMAZING!!!. This was by far one of the best things I have done in London in a long while! It was challenging, engaging, fun, creative and just really well put together. Better than any other escape the room game that I've done before. Just loved it, but gutted we lost. I will be coming back for sure and this time I'm aiming for victory. I highly recommend you gather your friends/work colleagues and try this out.

Good Afternoon Out. We went as a team of three and managed to complete the event with about a minute to spare! Well conceived, constructed and run. The puzzles are good but not impossible with help available when needed. Staff were excellent and helpful.I Thought we got a few more clues than needed, but given our final time we may not have finished if we hadn't received them.Overall an excellent afternoon.
Fantastic- fun and excitng!. A great way to spend an hour (or 90 minutes in total) but it seemed both longer and shorter as it was filled with excitement and jam-packed- I really recommend it

The BEST live escape game in London. This was the fourth live room escape game I've done, and without a doubt it was the best! The puzzles were challenging yet attainable and with five on our team I didn't feel at any point anyone was left with nothing to do. Really high production value, such a fun experience!

Incredibly fun experience, expertly put together. This was an absolutely amazing experience! If you are a fan of the Crystal maze or other shows like that, then this is 100% for you. The attention to detail, creativity, and production value of the whole experience was phenomenal, I had high expectations from what I saw online, but nothing prepared me for how brilliant the final experience was!We went at the last slot in the day, which worked well as we didnt feel too under time pressure (apart from the 1 hour of time travel of course!). The staff there were all excellent in staying in character, and gave a brilliant atmosphere (as well as being very entertaining themselves). Couldn't recommend this highly enough, my only regret is that I can't do it for the first time again! Will be very excited to do this again when they set up the next adventure!

First Room Escspe. My best man suggested this for my stag-do, and I'm so pleased he did. What a great adventure, this was my first live action room escape and now I want to do more. The staging was superb with attention to detail in the rooms. The puzzles were challenging and engaging with helpful advice on hand whenever needed, but not intrusively. If you're thinking about a room escape I would definitely tell you to do this one.

Great day!. A brilliant first exit - game. Puzzles were challenging but not impossible, and clues and were available if we were really stuck, along with a bit of banter! Would be very good for people who want to have the adventure experience without scary bits. The set was very detailed and the acting was good too. Had a great day, thanks.

The best activity in London this year!. Found a review of Time Run online and booked with friends from work. A bit nervous as I had never done anything like it before but I shouldn't have been, it was fantastic.I don't want to give too much away as that is half the fun but the things that impressed me most were the overall production value - attention to detail, sense of where you were - and the intricacy of the games. They were complex and built upon each other wonderfully.Thank you Time Run for a fantastic experience - please let Luna go on another adventure soon!

Brilliant in parts. The staff here are outstanding; extremely good at their job, wonderful to interact with, their commitment to staying in character throughout is tremendous and adds to the fun considerably. The game environments look, feel and sound superb and atmospheric; after we had escaped, I wanted to go back in and just play in them.The puzzles are... merely good, rather than matching the amazing standards of the aesthetics. We all went "Ooh" at how pretty they looked and how well they fit in to the themes, but they didn't make us go "Ahh" at how clever they were. They were enjoyable, and the degree of teamwork they emphasised was delightful, but they were not startling in their originality, and progress felt rather linear. The level of difficulty was appropriate and well-chosen; the level of depth and interconnectedness was... notably weaker than the rest of the experience.Upon leaving, our debriefing (while appropriate and perfectly charming) was a little overtly commercial and this left a slightly sour taste in the mouth. It was done as tastefully as it could have been, but it can never be completely tasteful. Another review suggests that the tactic may be actively counterproductive.Bear in mind that Time Run is rather more expensive than its competitors; even noting London rental rates, it's clear where the money has gone and where little or no expense has been spared. For such a high price, the game has to be held to the highest standards - I'd have to be convinced of excellence in the puzzles, rather than just high competence, to want to go back and pay top dollar for a second adventure - and that makes this a high four-star review rather than a low five-star review.
Brilliant, challenging, fun, interactive!. Loved Time Run - have done a lot of immersive and interactive theatre in London over the years, and this is definitely one of the best!

A brilliant experience!. We completed Time Run as part of our company's summer picnic/day out and it was fabulous! Everything was incredibly well executed and challenging. I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys problem solving and team work. Time very well spent!
One of the best experiences ever. Challenging, team-focused, fast-moving. Loved it.We visited them as a company activity and had a fantastic time.

So much yes!. I'm a Londoner and this is the first time I've written a review of something on here in my home city. I *HAD* to write this one though...Quite simply, this is brilliant. Very good production (hats off to the people who put it together and to those who keep it running), great challenges and very smart clues. Although I probably wouldnt go with very young children, I'd say it works for all ages (10+ certainly) and the fact that you are being watched and guided really helps. They'll give you help if you are stuck so that it isnt too fiendishly difficult but if you don't want any then you'll definitely be challenged!If my team hadn't completed the challenge then I would be back in a heartbeat. Loved it.

Best escape game ever!!. I have escaped 17 different rooms through 9 different companies in various countries and this is by far my favorite one so far. The theatrics and puzzles and everything!I wish I could do it again and again!

One of the best there is!. Absolutely loved it. We've done 6 of these type of attractions now and this was definitely the best so far!!Aubrey was a great host, the rooms were amazing and the puzzles challenging enough too!We were more surprised at the end to be greeted by 'Dean' who created some of the games, who told us we now hold the record for the fastest completion time of 45mins and 30secs! If you're looking to have a go at one of these, be sure to book at Time Run - you won't be disappointed!!

Superb room escape puzzler. My team of five friends found this to be a top notch live room escape game. We're veterans at these games in London and this was by far our favourite so far, thanks mostly to the superb attention to detail, the set design and the commitment of the staff to the time travelling set up. We were genuinely excited every time we opened a new portal and the puzzles and challenges (while maybe not some of the toughest we've faced) were all great fun, inventive and carried through the narrative nicely. You only get as many hints as you need and as always with these events, the time just flies by. Wonderful stuff - really hoping the Time Run team come up with a new storyline for us to come back to.

A wonderful introduction to escape rooms. Time Run was the first escape room that I had ever done and I absolutely loved it.To keep it short and sweet, Time Run hit the ball out of the park because it managed to be both mentally challenging AND consistent with the story/theme. The organisers also do a very good job with monitoring you and ensuring that you get the most out of it.
Amazing. We went as a group of 4 which was the perfect size. So immersive, and the production behind it is incredible.

Very enjoyable. Recommended by a friend, and now recommended to you! This was a great way to spend a couple of hours, in a part of London I'd never visited before. Access is easy from Liverpool Street (takes about 15 minutes to London Fields). This was a really interesting puzzle, with great set design and a real challenge. I won't say more and spoil it for anyone considering Time Run, other than give it a go, it's lots of fun!

The best escape room I've ever been to. The whole time from stepping into the door to leaving after the hour was amazing. They had thought about every detail, the puzzles varied in challenge and ability so it was fun for everyone. We all had a blast and I cant recommend Time Run highly enough. You will not regret going!

Amazing! A seriously awesome adventure! 5 stars!. Time Run is epic. It is the most fun I've had in London in years! It is perferctly crafted, challenging and exciting, just an awesome hour! I strongly recommend this to everyone, 5 stars!
Incredibly fun!. Intriguing, immersive, challenging and a lot of fun. Was sad when it finished! Definitely worth doing as a group.

So much fun! . Really enjoyed our time run experience from start to finish. Puzzles were well thought out and interesting. Would deinstalled recommended this to all my friends and it's all I've been talking about since I came back to Cornwall. Me and my family are already planning our next holiday to include something like this. Please bring one down to Cornwall :-) Very reasonable price they only strange thing was it told you the price then added a huge booking fee per person at the checkout which was annoying.

An amazing hour. My wife and I went to Time Run with another couple and could not have had more fun. From the moment we walked in the staff were in character and were so enthusiastic and authentic. The sets/rooms were impeccably dressed with the perfect props and the puzzles were just the right level of difficulty with each room having progressively more challenging puzzles. I was always a fan if Crystal Maze growing up and Time Run was a great way to have a similar experience.

Fantastically immersive experience - Five Star!. From our intrepid entrance, to our victorious exit, Time Run had me captivated throughout. This leaves other escape room challenges in the dust.Cannot wait for my next adventure with Luna and Babbage!

One of the most elaborate escape games in London. As an well seasoned escape gamer I can say that Time Run has the most elaborate and well considered setting that I have experienced yet. From the moment you arrive at the entrance gate you are instantly transported into the world of the game.They clearly had a large production budget and at times it even felt like being in a movie set with impressive special effects and sounds.The puzzles were just as challenging as in other escape games I have experienced - so my initial concern that perhaps the focus might be too much on the decor was unfounded.Sometimes the pacing felt almost overwhelming but we had a lot of fun and with a bit of tweaking (as I'm sure happens anyway as they too get more experienced - we visited shortly after they opened) this will be ironed out.Would highly Recommend to those looking for a unique experience who have never tried and escape game and also to escape game pros!

Amazing production values. I've been to a few escape rooms before but this one was in a class of its own. Amazing characters, superb environments and innovative puzzles.You would be doing yourself a serious disservice to miss this.

Among the most fun things I have done in London.. The trouble with giving a TripAdvisor review on Time Run is that I can't disclose anything that actually happens inside! In fact it's best if you know as little about it as possible before proceeding. It will suffice to say however, that it was awesome. I have done other escape games before, but this one was by far the most professionally executed, well-designed and outright fun. Merging the escape game concept with a touch of immersive theatre is genius. My only regret is that I can't explore it for the first time again. I hope that the folks behind Time Run will be considering a sequel!

Super Cool Thematic Escape Room. A great escape room that focuses on its story and makes the whole thing really atmospheric. Great work by staff, fantastic set design, amazing puzzles, pretty damn good all-rounder. Check it out!

So much fun!. I finally got to live out my dream of being a tomb raider!! I went with my boyfriend and my mother, we all had a blast. Well thought out, and an excellent crew. If you're wondering, it's not physically taxing and you don't need to wear exercise clothes - just dress comfortably and have your brain in problem-solving mode. There are good places for food and drink around the venue too. Can't recommend it highly enough!

Amazing!. From start to finish this was so much fun! The set and the actual puzzles were really well thought out and of a super high quality! We were slightly concerned that we wouldn't be clever enough ☺ but when in the game there were plenty of tips and clues from Babbage to help us along, while the last puzzle did trip us up it didn't effect the fun we had would definatley recommend to everyone, and let's just say Aubrey made a hot day hotter!!
Great fun and very slick!. Would really recommend this as a great teambuilding activity - really slick environment and fun. The Time Run team were great too, the whole experience was brilliant!
Awesome Tomb Raider fun. Totally immersive fun - was great. Much more interactive than some other puzzle rooms I've done; loved it.
something different. Highly recommended for a group for fun or as a team building exercise. Good to see new things like this coming up in London.

Awesome fun and challenges all your puzzle solving skills!. Time Run is a brilliantly thought out puzzle solving adventure that does a great job of combining the theatrical with mind-bending problems. The design and attention to detail in each 'Time Zone' was very impressive and they were extremely inventive with the way they pulled it together and their use of technology. We all had a fantastic time and am pleased to say that we made it out before the hour was up. I felt it was great value for money and recommend it to anyone who is up for a challenge!

Immersive, totally worth it and very high quality. It's all in the title really - four of us went and we all enjoyed it. We completed the time run with a few minutes to spare, but spent most of the rest of the evening talking about our favourite bits or most difficult puzzles. I'd heartily recommend it!
Time Run is awesome.. This is amazing, you must do this. All the games are amazing and you get so carried away - it's awesome.

Excellent challenge, with high production values. A very well done escape game, pitched to take just the right amount of time - one of our groups failed by a few minutes, the other succeeded by a few minutes.I was impressed by the quality of the rooms, I've done other games where there were more puzzles, but the props weren't as good. And if the puzzles take you an hour to do, the number of them doesn't matter.Would highly recommend it, I'll be going back if they do another mission, which I believe is coming after August.

An immersive and exciting experience. I didn't have a clue what to expect having never done anything like this before. Was wondering how they justified the steep ticket price until I went - wow, the attention to detail is impressive and worth every penny. I went with two friends and took my 12 year old daughter along, she's into puzzle solving games on various devices, and she absolutely loved it. It's probably 90 minutes from arriving to leaving and suitable for families, groups, team building & people who like a bit of stimulation with their fun. I was worried I'd be no use to the team but there are enough hints to prompt you through the journey and it's a very satisfying experience solving each puzzle.

Thoroughly enjoyable 60 plus minutes. This is my first time trying this sort of thing out, and I attended with 3 others who were also escape game virgins. We thought Time Run was fantastic and very well put together. Each room is very well thought out, and the introduction set the scene well. Clues are given out in each room over video link if you are struggling, so all levels of ability are catered for. Each of the three main rooms are quite distinctively different in theme and content which adds to the experience and ensures things don't get boring or repetitive. I would recommend this experience to pretty much anyone, the cost is less than you will pay to watch premier league football in London, and the experience is much more rewarding and enjoyable (said as a keen West Ham fan). Try it!

Very rich interactive experience. I was impressed with the richness of the props and objects in every room, the transition rooms, the hints and attention to details. Great work team! Hope you make a sequel!

The BEST room escape game in London. Omg it was amazing! I've done some of the other room escape games and this one has a much more professional set, props, and theatrics. The puzzles are fewer in number but more complicated which I preferred over looking for endless padlock numbers and searching the room. It was much closer to the crystal maze type feeling than other games. Well worth the money definitely go!!

Best "immersive" escape room. I've done several escape rooms in London and abroad, about 8-10 now and I'd say that Time Run was by far gave the most interesting theatrics. I'll leave it at that so not to ruin the experience but the story itself was well put together and the room was so much fun. The puzzles were also unique, albeit a bit complicated at times but that's what to be expected from an escape room. I like that they judge whether you need a hint or not vs other rooms where you are left wandering for a bit and become stubborn to ask for one. The clues were also presented very clearly, again as compared to some other rooms where you need to understand a person over a walkie talkie.DO NOT be late tho, a couple of us were about 15 min late unfortunately and they couldn't let us in. They were nice enough to stay later and give us a time slot later in the evening but only because there was availability. In summary, if you like escape rooms and immersive experiences you won't be disappointed! Highly recommended!

Very well constructed escape the room(s) adventure. This was a fantastic after-work event - genuinely interesting and good fun.Groups of three-five are recommended. I would suggest splitting into teams of 3 to make sure everyone is fully engaged in one of the many puzzles in each room. A history of gaming certainly helped so make sure someone on your team has played Zelda, Neverwinter Nights or one of the many other titles with temple puzzles, multiple keys and lots of sand!Nearby there are a couple of good bars to pass the time whilst waiting for your opponents to exit!I would return for a new adventure with Babbage!

Running out of time!. Excellent, excting mystery room game. It's obvious a LOT of thoughts and efforts have been poured in the design of the puzzles, complete with rewarding "special effects". Almost all challenges push your team to work together so it really feels like a shared adventure.
Enter the time warp!. This time next week I loved this game.It's a good old hoot. You'll run round and do stuff.Would love to do another one if they can build more!

An exciting adventure!. It's part theatre, part puzzle game and it's loads of fun! Putting you in time travel you work your way through different periods and settings with progressively more difficult challenges to complete. Clues are given along the way but beware, you have to do it before the time runs out! A really fun couple of hours challenging your mind!

Love it! Great fun and really well done.. I was surprised by this for my birthday and had no idea what was coming. It was excellent! So well done, I loved it. The team are incredible, the story line was great and the puzzles were clever and fun. The set is great, you feel like you have been transported. If you like the crystal maze you will love this.

A fantastic and unusual evening in London!. One of the best evenings we have spent in London in a very long time. Such an imaginative and creative project, and I can't recommend it highly enough. Well done to the whole creative team for developing and performing such an exciting and unusual event. We were challenged, amused, excited and uplifted! Lots of laughter and a good bit of brain exercise too!

Brilliant Fun!. (My first ever TripAdvisor review!)Time Run is an "escape the room" type experience where you and your team must solve various puzzles in the time provided... Except everything in the room can be part of the puzzle and this is where the fun begins.Firstly, the look of Time Run is flawless. I don't want to give anything away but each room really felt like a completely new world. It's really easy to set Escape Games in an office or some other mundane real world situation, so the fact that the organisers went in completely the opposite direction is really impressive.As for the puzzles themselves, they range between the pretty simple to the kind you could spend hours trying to solve. Unfortunately, you don't have hours so you and your team will need to really work together to complete everything in time.(If this sounds scary, don't worry! Hints are offered along the way to help things moving along)The sense of achievement when you solve a particularly tricky puzzle is amazing. And now I'm trying to get all my pals to go so I can compare notes with them. Also, on a less fancy level, it's super close to the station!Go! Have a brilliant time! And send my love to Babbage!

Fantastic experience - go now!. We turned up not knowing to expect really but the moment we saw the awesome door we knew it would be great fun!Very well designed sets, a great story line and great attention to detail gives a you a wonderful immersive experience that will make you feel as you have genuinely just been to another world, when you leave - you don't know what to do with yourself!Overall, I would strongly recommend this to anyone and everyone because my whole family and I all absolutely loved the whole thing!

Amazing Escape-the-Room Game. Time Run is a wonderfully created world. With challenging (but fair) puzzles, a really captivating story and an impressive, well-designed set. This is the perfect way to spend an afternoon or an evening. I did it with two friends and we all had a blast! Would definitely recommend for anyone visiting London as something not to miss!

Wonderful!. This is a fantastic way to spend an hour or so. Immersive, engaging puzzles and you very very soon find yourself utterly caught up in the story line. As time started to run out the tension ramped up and I was completely invested in achieving the goal of the game. If you get the chance then go to this! Really, it is that good.

First Game. This was the first time I'd been to this sort of event. I really enjoyed the theme and story behind it and was impressed by the inventiveness of the games / puzzles, which were very challenging and entertaining. The set dressing and special effects were first rate and enhanced the game for myself and my friends in the party.I would recommend this event to all of my other friends.

The best of its kind. Since the 'live room escape' genre really kicked off in the UK about 2 years ago, I have become a bit of an addict and have been to numerous different ones, mainly in London. Most have been fun, they've all had the good points and bad points, but all have left me thinking about certain things which could have been done better.Until now. This week I took part in Time Run for my brother's birthday. It surpassed all expectations, and is head and shoulders above any of the other room escapes I have been to. Like, 10 times better. If you're interested in room escapes / immersive experiences enough to be reading this review, I can assure you that you'll love every second of Time Run.Compared to other Room Escapes in London, here are the points where Time Run excels:- Clearly a bigger budget than others. The technology and props are slicker, the production is more polished, and the rooms are more like sets from a film - definitely like something straight from the Crystal Maze.- Fully immersive - as soon as you walk through the mysterious wooden sliding door (even THAT is cool), the person who greets and briefs you is in character. The entrance area itself is fully kitted out with mysterious objects, and feels part of the time travel storyline.- There's quite a bit of humour - it doesn't take itself too seriously.- The theming of the different rooms is excellent and varied.- The puzzles and games are brilliantly designed. Other room escapes have left me frustrated sometimes, when puzzle solutions are too obscure or seemingly random, rather than following a logical process that you can work out with the clues provided. For example, finding lots of 3 and 4 digit numbers, with no logic or direction about what needs to be used where, or why.But Time Run avoided this problem more successfully than any of the others. I always felt like I grasped how the various elements of the games linked together, and there were always clues about what needed to be used where. There weren't too many distracting red herrings, and even better, the puzzles seemed to fit in well with the storyline and have reasons behind them, rather than being random, abstract and contrived. This shows a level of expertise that went into the design that I haven't yet seen elsewhere.At the end we came out with a feeling of having just experienced something really memorable and extraordinary, and immediately wanting to do another hour of it. I was thinking about it for the rest of the day. And most of the next day too.My only advice would be, if you're new to room escapes and likely to try out a few, don't do this one first, because the others (which are still very fun) will not live up to the expectations you have after this.

Amazing 2nd Anniversary Adventure . My hubby and I had the best experience here. Never knew anything like this existed. It's worth the travel all the way from the states (Florida). 3 people is a must to get the best results but the staff was kind enough to let us 2 do it together and we did it well! It's a must that you Time Travel when you get to London.

Awesome and well put together! . Thanks to Nick for allowing me and my wife to do the time run challenge even though it was just the two of us. We REALLY wanted to try it out. It is easily the best thing I've done one my trip so far. Must do if you are ever in London. We rode a train for an hour from our hotel to participate in it and it was well worth the travel! Time Run ROCKS!

Brilliant!. I've been to 'escape the room' adventures before, but Time Run takes the title for the best one I've ever been to! The attention to deal is unreal and the setup is very cleverly done. The challenges were hard but good fun. Highly recommend it!

Great fun & something for everyone. Never done anything like this before, but it was great fun as well as a challenge. We were a family of adults in 2 groups, but this would suit anyone from a family to a corporate team building exercise. Great to have something different to do when we visit London. The staff were great too - really funny and entertaining in the briefing.
Brilliant day out!. Excellent fun, couldn't have asked for more. Great to find something a bit different, will definitely be returning!

Great fun!. Time Run really exceeded my expectations! The challenges were well thought through and it was interesting and exciting the whole way through. The staff was brilliant - really in their characters and made you feel even more like being in a different world! I would definitely recommend it and would love to do it again!

Something different in London. Always great to find something different to do in London and Time Run definitely fitted the bill. It was an excellent experience from start to finish. You are in the adventure as soon as you arrive. Lots to solve and discover = never a dull moment. My brain was reeling, but enough little prods to keep you going and not despair. Well organised, great range of puzzles and the staff were brilliant.
Worth the money!. Had an amazing time at Time Run. The design is brilliant, and the games are the right level of challenging. Loved it!

Best Thing To Do In London!. Absolutely amazing fun - really well planned and executed. We'd done one of these escape games before but this was far more ambitious and on a bigger scale with a good mix of technology, hands on puzzles and storyline. Staff were also excellent - very funny and friendly. A fantastic experience!

Brilliant!. Can't recommend this puzzle solving game more! We visited in June 2015 and were amazed by the quality of the whole experience. The host was incredibly witty and welcomed us all in to the time-run experience perfectly. There were more puzzles than I had imagined and the technology far exceeded my expectation. We just finished the puzzle and this was down to the helpful hints delivered to you as you go round - there were just the right amount to help you get round without spoon feeding you the information. Such a great afternoon - reminded me of The Crystal maze!

Re: Brilliant Fun. I recommend this to everyone! It's really original and imaginative and it gets your brain ticking over. I loved the balance of story telling and problem solving - it's very immersive and interactive. A great way to spend a couple of hours!
Fantastic. The theme and quality of this was fantastic. I had so much fun and the rooms and puzzles were well made. I really recommend getting a group of 4 and going to this.

So much fun!!!. 5 of us took part in this incredible game today, ranging in age from 13-50. We were just buzzing with excitement when we came out. The attention to detail in the various time zones you go through was incredible and the difficulty of the puzzles is pitched just right. From the moment you walk through the intriguingly carved front door, you are immersed in a different world, with actors consistently and effectively in character as you are greeted.I only wish we could go back and do another puzzle. It's pricey but worth it! Go - you can't fail to have a blast!

Amazing time (travel). This is the first escape room game I have taken part in and it didn't disappoint. It had a professional finish and was great fun. I'm sure it will take some beating...and I will be trying out some others.

So much fun!. This was so much fun - Just like the crystal maze!
Definitely recommend, the only downside is it didnt last long enough but that could be down to our quicker than average escape time of 56mins!

A fun challenging experience. I went along with my flatmates after having done something similar to this before. I have to say this beats all of the other ones i have tried hands-down. The different time periods all provide varied challenges and really encourage teamwork throughout. After completing it we retired to a nearby pub and spent the rest of the night talking about it. I promptly messaged a bunch of my mates to tell them they have to go and play this immediately. Really can't recommend this enough.
Amazing . This exceeded expectations and the commitment to the experience from staff was impressive throughout. Highly highly recommend

Great immersive experience and pretty good puzzles. We've done a lot of puzzle rooms around London and other countries.The experience part of this room blows them all away, really making you feel like there's a story and you're part of it. From the entrance door to the whole building, to the characters (both physical and digital), to the story, it keeps you engaged the whole time. Every other room does a dry one minute "here's a crap story for the room, and the rules". Not here.The puzzle bit is pretty high on the list two. A few different bits we'd never seen before in other rooms as well as some tried and trued thing. The ending had a bit of a disjointed feeling to it, but otherwise it was all logical and you could progress easily.Only other downside was being rushed out afterwards without much time to review the room with them. We met one of the designers outside though and he said they're currently building a post-run room to decompress in (otherwise we're just blocking the stairwell there), so sounds like that'll be fixed soon.Well worth doing!

5 stars is simply not enough!!!. For anyone who ever wanted to do The Crystal Maze you NEED to go and do this. Better than Hint Hunt. The scale of the production of it was very impressive. Brilliant for anyone who feels like being a big kid for a bit and being told they are officially "exceptional" at the end of it". Suitable for everyone, I really couldn't recommend it enough!

Excellent Escape The Room Adventure. This experience was well worth the price paid. From the moment we rang the bell, we were greeted by someone in character and they stayed in character throughout. That was a nice touch. It was like being in the crystal maze, it was that awesome! There are two gaming areas so two groups could be doing the game separately at the same time. Take a bunch of friends and dive into the Time Run. Highly Recommended!

Not as good as other escape games. If you have never done something like before then you will like this.You and up to 4 friends are trapped in a room with an hour tummy kiss get out. Clues are given and you solve other clues along the way. It's a lot of fun but we felt it was a bit disjointed and overly complicated. They had to give you a lot of clues to make any progress. However it is very interactive, lots of things to move around etc. Is very cleverly done.He set up is more impressive than some competitors but the story/ clues don't quite hit the mark for me.If you have never been- GO. If you have, just know it's a bit different and disjointed but you will have fun.

Worth a go. I won't go into detail so as not to spoil it for anyone, but I must say that I had a great time. We did it as a group of 4 and that was a pretty good number. 5 or 3 would work fine as well. Looking forward to the next one.

Wow!. Not sure what I was expecting, but this was way beyond anything I'd imagined. I'd feared it would be four of us sitting at a table trying to do a sudoku. How wrong I was! I won't give anything away, but the level of immersion, the attention to detail and the incidental cranial shrinkage have to be seen (or felt) to be believed. GO NOW! (Well, book first, then GO!)

One of the best activities I've done in ages - go go go!!. We went in a team of four, and from the first contact we had with the team, our expectations were high. Luckily, they were completely exceeded. You can really get immersed in the world they create - the sets were just brilliant. The puzzles are well-crafted and tricky without being impossible, and there were enough components to keep all four of us constantly occupied in each room. I have been recommending this to everyone and can't wait for them to release a new adventure!

Everyone should experience this. If you liked those puzzle mazes like Crystal Maze when you were a kid, this is perfect for you. We were a group of 5 friends, all guys on a stag party, and this was perfect. It requires teamwork, it's fast paced and really creative. An intense hour of fun and challenge. I can't recommend it more!

The best way to spend an hour in London!. Amazing! Great fun. Challenging, but fun. We were a group of four and we were working at full pace for the full 60 minutes! Very well designed, flawless implementation. Highly highly recommend.
Time run fun. One of the best ways to spend an hour in London. The effort that went into the whole set up was incredible! Would recommend it to anyone

Awesome experience - you won't regret it. So carefully put together - an absolute joy to spend 60 mins solving puzzles.I can't wait to do it again, although in only sad that it will have lost some of the mystique once you know some of the answers...

A fun Saturday afternoon adventure.. We really enjoyed it - it was definitely an other worldly experience! We were a group of 4, and I think the only negative thing I'd say is that we all left feeling very disappointed that we hadn't been able to complete the quest because of the time limit - we were having a lovely time, and then in the last chamber we were reminded that we were nearing the end of the hour, and I genuinely think that (seeing as we were being watched and helped via CCTV) we could have been given a couple of extra minutes to finish. Seems a shame, when given help all the way through anyway, to let us leave on a low...? Great, apart from that! :)

Awesome!. One of the best hours of our lives! You really got into the time travel element and believed you were there! Great skill level for everyone as clues can be given so you not stuck in one dimension. Very well planned and exciting from start to finish. Would recommend to anyone and everyone. So much fun! Staff were professional, fun & friendly!

Like live-action Indiana Jones, but with marginally less snakes.. Time RunEntering through the hourglass marked door in London Fields, you step into the laboratory of Luna Fox, Time Traveller, and are given your mission briefing by the rather madcap Aubrey, before embarking on an adventure through time. I was giddy with nerdy excitement upon the doors opening, and the wonderful performance of Aubrey had me totally immersed in the time travel shenanigans that were to follow!Unfortunately, I cannot go into much detail as to the puzzles we had to solve, as we all know about the effects time travel and “spoilers”, but I can say that they were all superbly put together and provided a real sense of success upon completion.Our intrepid outfit of four “Time Runners” were able to complete the challenge and retrieve the Lance of Longinus, thanks in part to the odd clue from Babbage, Luna Fox’s mechanical assistant. The clues never felt patronising, and were more like gentle nudges towards a part of the room that hadn’t been looked at yet. When one of our party sneezed, Babbage even said “bless you”, which really added to the already high level of immersion in the game.If I could praise one thing above all with Time Run, it’d have to be the frankly blockbuster-level production value, with each room and each puzzle looking and working like a slicker version of “The Crystal Maze”.TL:DR go do Time Run, it’s the closest you’ll ever come to being Indiana Jones.

Jump into another dimension. We have been waiting for this for a long time. The video clip of luna and babbage promised so so much and this team have really delivered.Its an artistic triumph and it takes escape games into the next dimension.The attention to detail on the set is something else. Its more of a production than an escape game. A true triumph.

A fantastic idea perfectly executed. Absolutely loved it, brilliant experience. Staff, props, sets, story and puzzles, everything was put together to the highest standard. Would recommend it to everyone. Will be keeping a keen eye out on Facebook for other similar challenges.

Fantastic Experience!. The wonderful door to the venue gave you an idea of how good this event was, and it got better and better as it went on. Fiendishly brain-teasing puzzles that required incredible logic and team-work to solve, but some helpful hints provided if you got stuck. Above all, it was a lot of fun to play. I can't recommend it highly enough and I'd love to do another event in the future.

Like actually being in The Crystal Maze, but betterer. This is genuinely one of my favourite things I've ever done. Only slightly let down by lack of actual Richard O'Brien, but you do get a consolatory time-travelling robot instead, which is pretty okay as a replacement. Guarantee that you won't be disappointed if you go.

Best Escape the Room in London. Absolutely awesome. Have done 4 "escape the room" experiences in London already, and has slightly tiring of the format. This however is superb. Builds massively on what others have done. Probably a bit more challenging (which is good!) and incredible set designs. Have taken the format to a new level! (now just waiting for them to create a new "room"!)

Outstanding fun, good value, a brilliant way to start a night out. Went with three friends, all of us late thirties or early forties. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. It's not the cheapest thing in the world to do, but I thought it was great value for money. Won't give too much away, but if you are a bit apprehensive about immersive experiences like this, don't worry. Just go with it. All four of us loved it!
Best event in London!!!!. By far the most fun you will have all year. Great fun to be had. Don't want to give too much away but book and be amazed!

Challenging, Frustrating... Amazing!. Went with a group of friends when we were at a loose end and we had the best hour or so we could have hoped for. Went into this very open-minded, which I recommend, I didn't have any preconceived thoughts but I was blown away by the whole experience. Not only did we enjoy the actual time we were there but we were talking about it for the rest of the day, what we could or should have done. Brilliant group activity, everyone in a group will bring different things to the table. Highly recommended.

Time Run...More like Time Fun!. Wasn't sure what to expect as I've never been to any escape the room games before, but a friend found it online and we thought we would give it a go with a group of us. So happy I went never experienced anything like it, so much fun! The detail is incredible, for the time I was there I fully felt as though I was a time traveller helping Luna & Babbage haha!

Better than the crystal maze!. We travelled through time this weekend for a friend’s birthday, and I have to say, it was one of the most fun adventures I have ever been on. I won’t give too much away, as the journey is all about working out the puzzle for yourself, with the help of Babbge too of course! We spilt ourselves into two groups, went on the same journey, solved the puzzle and saved the sword for Luna Fox, and all humanity! If you’ve ever watched the crystal maze and screamed at the idiotic contestants as they fail to understand how a game works, or thought how you would do better – this is for you. We all walked out and wanted another go!

Great fun for A small group. Designed for groups of 3 to 5 people time run is great fun. It starts with a bit of imersive theatre to get you orientated then off you go. Interesting puzzles to solve to escape the room and achieve your goal. Brilliant fun and highly recommended.
A fun challange. Really well organised and mysterious. Would recommend to all.Reasonably well priced although it could be a bit longer to really get stuck in.

Amazing, original, unique, fun. I went with a group of friends and had such a fun time running around the different time zones trying to work it all out. I've been to a few escape rooms in London but this one is definitely the best. Highly recommend for a group of 4 or 5.

Forget Richard O'Brien and Ed Tudor-Pole... This is just one of those experiences that you want to rave about but would prefer people to try it so you can discuss it instead. Loved every minute of the Time Run journey. Attention to detail is exceptional and the creators deserve a huge pat on the back. You'll be surprised, frustrated and leave wanting to do it all again straight away. Book your tickets now, it's an absolute must!

A new kind of adrenalin sport. This is a very intense and enjoyable way to spend an hour with friends, with a little bit of time pressure to keep the heart racing. The game itself was very well considered and the styling of each part really impressive and convincing. With that in mind it was good value too because the attention to detail was so good. Interaction with some characters along the way also helped to set the scene. We hope there's lots more of these to come.

First class challenge - I defy anyone to fail to enjoy this!. A little research indicated that this was a 'escape from a room' experience with a bunch of puzzles and lots of 'moving parts'. It was certainly that and more.First, you enter what appears to be a small business unit with a rather strange door into a sort of office with a variety of almost steam-punk artifacts around the walls and spread on the tables, and receive a briefing which cleverly both sets the scene and gets you in the right mood for what it to come. Then your group is transferred to where the action begins and start trying to work out what is relevant, what's not, and begin trying to work out what to do. It is at the same time challenging, funny, confusing, and you get a real kick out of each little advance. The approach we took was a mixture of guesswork, inspiration, logic, confusion and not having a clue interspersed with exhilaration as something works! Gradually (probably too gradually) we got the hang of interacting with the environment and began to progress.The design is superb, everyone in the team needs to work both individually and collaboratively, the sets are excellent, there is a real sense of excitement and threat, but not so much you are distracted from the job in hand. I would strongly suggest that anyone interested books early, because there's limited capacity and this is going to be a huge hit.
Time run. Myself and friends had a great afternoon, working our way through different times solving lots of fun puzzles. We all came out saying we want to go again. Really good fun.

Great Fun. Our first time experience with Time Run will be forever memorable. It was an hour that felt like time had stopped. We are hooked and don't think we've had enough of it.Time travel experience began with it's mysterious entrance and Babbage has been a great help through our challenges.Highly recommend!

Great fun. It was so much fun! Firstly, the actors are funny and in character. Then the challenge itself is very well thought through, the rooms and the decor look amazing. Good job to everyone involved!
Excellent weekend challenge. I went on a Sunday with four friends and had a great time, good mix of challenges meant all of us could provide something. Highly recommended!

A super fun night out. Had a really awesome time at Time Run. Don't want to give too much away but it's a really challenging, funny, at times frustrating, race against the clock. Like the Crystal Maze but better thought out (there is a story that links it all together). My team won with about 5 seconds to go on the clock, exhilarating!!!

Good fun. We went as a group of 5 friends and had lots of fun. Good setup and great fun solving puzzles. I imagine older children ( and child-like adults) will enjoy this. It's easier ( and faster) with 5 people than 3..

VC. Amazing experience! Totally worth the money and so much fun!
Perfect for adults and children, excellent location!

Amazing experience, so much fun!. Time Run is worth every penny. It's so much fun, if you love team thinking and the Crystal Maze then you have to do this, lots of time and effort has gone into the sets, technicals and clues. We absolutely loved it! One of the funnest 90 minutes I've ever had!

Great way of kicking off an evening. A really well thought out plan. The hour rushed by and we were unable to escape. We got help when we needed it. It was a lot of fun and just right for the age range - 12 to 50 - in our group. We would definitely recommend it to others and we will do it again.

Simple but effective. The concept was very simple....without giving too much away, I really did feel as though I was in a race against time to get out of the room. It's amazing how experiences like this, really make you work as a team and admittedly, we had a couple of drinks before we arrived so we were relaxed and ready to get immersed into our adventure! Reasonably priced with a groupon voucher. Great, as something different to do! I loved it!

Area 51. We came to london for the weekend and bored of doing shows and london eye so thought of this for a change, ive done a couple of these rooms in Cyprus and really enjoyed them, would recommend to anyone

50th birthday party. we had 20 people attend this event and utilsed all 3 rooms with each team playing two games. The games had been begun and it was a race to who finishes first. It was awesome and worth doing. The family and friends really enjoyed themselves. where did the 3 hours go we asked. The hosts for the event were great.would thoroughly recommended
First timers. Was really good. Hard to get going but great helps and clues. Lovely funny warm staff too. Already planning our next escape
Great fun. We loved Area 51, great game. Two daughters loved it too. Thank you Escape-London we will be back to try the other rooms.
Good fun. Staff very helpful, escape game was very fun and exiting would recommend and I will definitely be going back to try the other rooms

Da Vinci experience. Really pleasantly surprised by how much we all enjoyed this experience. Gets the grey matter working (we failed by the way) and the time seems to wiz by. The entrance is a little hard to find, is actually exactly as the address, but is just a single door between a bookmakers and something else so is easy to miss, but that might just have been us

Only for newbies, and still... quite bad!. My friends and I have done all 3 of their escape rooms (because of an early-bird discount), with 1 month in between each.We have done a lot of escape rooms, in London and elsewhere, so we have a lot to compare with and my review might differ a lot from other reviewers for this reason.The good:- Friendly staff.- With an early-bird discount, it was quite cheap for London.The average:- The puzzles are just OK. Some a bit stretched... Newbies will probably enjoy them since the newly discovered concept of escape room is thrilling but will likely need clues for the stretched ones. Experienced puzzle solvers will probably not find them very exciting.- Atmosphere: there is a small effort on decoration, but this is far from full inception.The bad:- 2 out of the 3 escape rooms we have done had mistakes: the first time, we escaped before having opened all the locks because one clue had been left accidentally on the table. The second time, one lock combination had been changed, hence the right combination didn't work. It took 5+ minutes for the game master to realize it and eventually let us know how to proceed. This shows not much application and we were quite disappointed not to have the full experience.- There are tons of locks to open... And no clue as of which ones to open with which combination, so we spend our time trying the different combinations we find on ALL the locks. This wastes time and doesn't bring much value to the game... Overall, this was probably some of the worst escape rooms we have done in London. Yet, if this is your first time at an escape room, not having anything to compare with, you'll probably appreciate the concept and the warm welcome anyway.

Average game with poor game masters. We have played all three games from Escape London. Each member of our team has played minimum of 10 games. Positives:All three games are in renovated and clean premises. Each game is different to the remaining ones and are thoroughly sticking to each theme.Less positive things:1) Leonardo da Vinci game: puzzles in this game are not very difficult. What spoiled our experience was that the game masters forgot to hide one important clue, which allowed us (unintentionally to short-circuit about 1/3 of the game. Since this resulted in extremely short finishing time, we were allowed back to the room and "finish" the unsolved puzzles. The overall feeling of accomplishment was gone though.2) Area 51 - This was the second game we played with this company. (We booked all three games at the same time) This game contained some more interesting puzzles, but also annoying number of identical lockers, which had to be all opened using codes made of digits. Yawn. Also, one locker's code didn't work, which meant that we wasted some 10 minutes trying to get in various variations of numbers of which we were sure it was the correct answer. When we asked for a hint, we were unnecessarily given clues to steps which we have already solved until eventually we were given the same number we already had. When we finally managed to communicate to the game masters, that we've already tried these number, he concluded that we must have somehow stumbled upon a master code and reset the code. Seriously? Since we missed out on clue hidden in this broken locker, we had to skip the following puzzle and go straight to the next locker. To top it off, after the game finished, the game master made some awkward joke about gynaecological instruments (one of the props in the game). Ew.3) Casino game - this was the last game we played in Escape London. This time all the props and clues were where they were supposed to be. This game was nicely and thematically decorated, however also contained multiple lockers with padlock - and since we didn't know which puzzle is connected to which locker, it meant trying each code in some 10 different padlocks. Not exactly fun.Overall, I'm sure you can find many much better games in London for similar money.
Great. Really fun and the guy running it was friendly and so helpful as it was the first time we have done it and needed help!
Really fun. The idea is really a good one. It was great and the guys were really friendly and allowed us to finish a little later.

Fun and challenging room. The da vinci room was fun but hard for a group of 3. We didn't mange to get out but they were really nice and gave us a couple of minutes more and after the time ran out they went through with us over the whole room. We will sure come back to do the rest of the rooms.

Casino experience. Had a brilliant time, I went with my 14 year old and a friend with her two 14 year olds. We enjoyed finding all the clues and escaping. The staff are really professional and fun. I recommend all age groups go. Looking forward to trying different rooms.

Definitely challenging and worth a visit!. The venue looks newly refurbished/modern, the staff really set up the scenario when describing your mission and are super friendly. Overall it was a great experience and definitely will be back to try the rest of the rooms! Also managed to break the record for first group to complete area 51 without any clues 😎

WE STILL CAN'T GET OVER HOW GREAT THIS PLACE IS!!!!!!!. Absolutely amazing experience and we can't wait to go back!!!! Us two girls did the Da Vinci room which was not easy but SO MUCH FUN trying to figure out all the clues etc. We did have trouble finding the place as Google/Apple Maps sent us on a mission round Shepherd's Bush but the fantastic staff were so helpful and understanding (and had great banter!), eventually the owner actually came to pick us up himself because we were so baffled as to where the address really was!!! You can 100% tell that a lot of time, effort and research has gone into making these detailed escape rooms and I highly recommend Escape London, we couldn't fault a single thing, my friend and I look forward to visiting again very soon!!!!!!!

Great fun. We went as part of our girls night out. It was great fun, quite challenging on the brain ( for us) but we really enjoyed doing something a little bit different and we are defintely going again. Maybe next time we might even escape!
Birthday surprise. We had lots of fun and great example of showing off our ability to work well as a team. Hosts were great, very enthusiastic and helpful.
Great thing to do. Great fun activity to do much more fun than I thought it would be!! Great staff!! Would recommend thisThanks for a great day escape London!!!!Thanks for a great day

Very enjoyable. My girlfriend booked this room as a birthday surprise. We did the casino room and we both loved it. We have both done many rooms before and both agreed that this one was very enjoyable. The host, Janis, was also very pleasant and made the visit even more memorable. We enjoyed it so much we came back to do another room the same day!

The Da Vinci Room. The Da Vinci Room was a great escape - good variety and style of clues. Escape-London staff very friendly, sensitive and just the right level of help.
Recommend!!!

Highly Recommended!. Took my son and his teenage friends to celebrate his Birthday. Firstly, Yannis and his colleague were very friendly and good humoured and did everything they could to make the visit fun and enjoyable. The boys did the Area 51 room which tested their brains and teamwork skills in a fun and imaginative way while working against the clock added even more excitement.They absolutely loved it. I'll be planning another visit as I really wished I'd had a go too!
Very intersting. Very good staff and intersting place, here need your brains ))) 3 quality rooms, you must try every room!Thanks you for good time

area 51. The two guys that ran the game were hilarious and made us feel comfortable around them with their humour. The games was difficult and required a number of different skill. will definitely go again

Interesting and fun!. This is the second 'Escape Room' we've been to and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.It really makes you think and as the seconds are ticking by, it puts you under pressure to finish within the hour.The clues and questions are well thought out.We did ' Area 51' and completed it in 57 minutes!I'd recommend this activity, it was very good and along with the meal we booked in a nearby restaurant, it was a very enjoyable evening.The staff were friendly and made us welcome.
Awesome!!!!. Amazing experience and staff are amazing! Really enjoyed this and would recommend this to anyone! Thanks for a brilliant time!
Casino. Very good and a very clear idea. Different to your usual escape room. Definitely worth trying this one out. Great host too!

Great fun. First experience of an escape room and really enjoyed it. Went with my 20 something son and daughter and had a lovely family time. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The hour flew by Didn't manage to escape but we weren't far off.
Area 51 experience. A really enjoyable experience. The staff were welcoming, friendly and funny. The game was interesting but not impossible. Would definitely book again
Good experience. Fun adventure. Did casino theme. Thought it would be easy but I was wrong! Challenging and exciting.

Amazing fun. Great fun, great host, great value for money. First time we have been to any of sort of escape the room so the first room we done was very difficult on the second we had an idea of what to look out for and how it works so a little easier but completely different and still have a few issues at times... would definitely recommend and will be returning to do the 3rd room soon...
Amazing hosts!. Went for a birthday and hosts were great - played birthday music, gave us chocolates! And the rooms are very thought provoking. Overall amazing experience!
Casino Escape Room. Really friendly and fun, had never done something like this before! + the decor of the rooms were cute!
Very good. Lots of fun and the right amount of difficulty. One of the cheaper escape games which I feel a wide range of people can enjoy.
Great fun!. It was really fun, great with a small group of friends, the staff are really friendly and give you clues when you're totally stuck so it never gets boring in there.

Loads of fun!. Went along with two other friends and chose the Area 51 room. It was so much fun, with really well thought out games. The people at Escape London are brilliant and added to the whole experience.

Small but fun. Being a new venue, it was not as high-tech or elaborate as some other escape games and the space was quite small for 6 people, however, the tasks were challenging and we all had a great time. The hosts were very friendly and made sure we had a good experience. Great value for money

Best escape game ever!. Been to a few before but this one was exceptional. Came on a Groupon offer with some pals and we were met by a really friendly member of staff who gave us a rundown of the game. Thoroughly recommend and will be back to try Area 51 game next!

First time unlucky, but amazing experience. A well organised place, with kind staff and great atmosphere. That was first time to me to try this game, but my friends had a go before in different places. All of us can confirm it's worth to come here and have a go. We selected the Da Vinci Room, which is a medium level room and if we have extra 15 minutes we might escape. :) It was great fun, thanks again.

Great fun. This is how to escape the pub. I could write a long review, but basically, this is great fun. It's s bit cheesy but essentially they're really good games done in a really nice way, promoted by people that seem to love what they're doing.

Most fun room I've ever played!. My husband and I are slightly addicted to escape rooms, and have played almost a 100 games across the globe. Last Monday, we played all three rooms at Escape London with some friends, and we had a great time! The Casino room is a brilliantly fun twist on the traditional escape room, with a unique twist that would definitely appeal to the more competitive teams with a little extra challenge along escaping.Area 51 managed to stump us again and again, but it contains quite a few nice little puzzles and tricks that all make sense when you put 1 + 1 together.Lastly, we played the Da Vinci themed room, where we once again had great fun rummaging through the room. This is where our team truly shone, and where we set a record for quickest time with least clues! Gem of a room!The hosts are brilliant and friendly, and obviously care much about the business. They may be new on the block, but we highly recommend visiting Escape London for newbies and experienced players alike. We hope to see them around for a long time, and hope they'll open some new rooms soon so we can be back!

Excellent escape rooms. We visited as a company day out and thoroughly enjoyed all three rooms. All were immersive and the complexity of the rooms were just right. Not easy enough and not difficult enough to not be fun! Each room was different from the previous and stuck to the theme which was great! Staff were fantastic and really engaged with our group. A warm welcome and a high five for completing the room. Great stuff! Thank you so much for having us!

Brilliant escape rooms!. Me and 3 colleagues had a day out in London and played all 3 rooms these guys have to offer.We had a fantastic time! Lovely warm welcome, some refreshments and really funny hosts. We played the casino room first which was our absolute favourite! Nice different vibe to your more traditional escape room experience, very light hearted and very, very fun!Next was Area 51 which was another great room, tricky but in all the right ways. We finished with the Da Vinci room which rounded our trip off nicely! Even sweeter because we escaped all 3 within the time limit, but they weren't easy!! Absolutely recommend and wish these guys all the best and hope they have some new rooms on offer soon! Thanks again :)

Not really impressed. I heard a lot about the escape rooms but this one was my first time and I really expected more. It was all about finding codes to unlock padlocks. I expected much more interactivity. To make everything worse, some padlocks didn't work very well and refused to open even when we found a correct key which made us waste so much time. Also the 20% discount on their website didn't work when I booked. They gave me after the code with 50% discount but I'm not sure if I'll go to try other rooms there.

Great Fun. Having tried an escape room abroad on our holidays, we were keen to do ones in London on our return and, being fairly local, we happened across Escape London and have tried two of their three rooms so far, coming close on the first and beating the second!Some of the clues are more obtuse than others, but for the most part they are solvable, sometimes with hints, without leaving you scratching your heads.The hints themselves are helpful but not too quick, so you do have to do the work yourselves. We took our kids, 9 & 5, who both enjoyed themselves, almost as much as we did, and who were both able to play a valuable part. We have yet to take on their hardest room, the Casino Room, but after Area 51 and the Da Vinci Room, we can't wait. What really sells Escape London though is the team behind it, who are without exception friendly and welcoming, to adults & kids alike. We will be back!

DA VINCI ROOM: VERY GOOD!!!. Per gli italiani: nuova Escape, appena aperta, in zona Hammersmith. La stanza di Leonardo da Vinci è ben studiata e piacevole, anche per piccoli gruppi (noi eravamo in 3: 2 adulti + figlio 15enne, avevamo già provato altre Escape Room). Questa è una delle più economiche di Londra! Un'ora volata, divertente ed ingegnosa. Meglio però che almeno una persona del team conosca bene l'inglese per comprendere anche un paio di "giochi di parole" inclusi. English: We had a great time playing the Leonardo da Vinci Room! A family of 3 (2 adults and one 15y), not in our first escape experience. The room is well designed, the puzzles/games to solve tricky enough!! A video inside the room counts down your available time, and ... gives you some hint, if you need it! (and we did! Thanks to our "game master"!) No matter if you finishes or not: fun is sure! Bonus: one of the most cheap Escape Game in London! ;-)For foreign people (like us): is required at least one person with a good English for more fun!

New Starters but Good. The rooms have different levels of difficulty. We've tried 2 of 3 and we enjoyed both. The owners are two guys who are very helpful and funny, the place is new and you can tell but they've just started. It was a good experience. We recommend it.
Holiday visit. We had great time with our family when we visited London. Would recommend as a great way of spending 2 hours. Loved it.
good experience. Me and my wife visited Escape London 1 week ago. We've done AREA51 and it was amazing. Enthusiastic staff and good puzzles. Great fun. Thanks guys.Chat conversation end

Uninspired dull escape rooms. The location was within walking distance of Shepherd's Bush and the host was friendly, but not enough to save the rooms. You can tell this is a dull franchise chain opened for the sake of a business, not for the love of escape rooms.The Da Vinci room is best out of a bad bunch as it is marginally more varied and less linear. The other two rooms are very disappointing because their main focus is a tall locker of approximately seven padlocks in a row. Out of over 20 escape rooms, this is probably the laziest and unimaginative way to present puzzles that I've encountered! It's takes immersion out of the room and condenses it into joyless unlinked little tasks.Two of the rooms had staff resetting errors where a few codes were unlocked, one of which was confusingly game breaking. To be honest, I think the overall rating should be two stars, but I acknowledge that they have just opened. The rooms are adequate and perfunctory, but with so many other good escape rooms in London, it's not worth going to this venue.

Lots of fun. Our group of friends split up to play two games, Area 51 and Escape Casino, and everyone had a great time. The game rooms are well designed and full of interesting challenges. The staff are welcoming and enthusiastic.

amazing and completely new experience, perfect for visiting with friend for fun or with colleagues as a team building.. Excellent for those who are board with day to day routine and want to try something extraordinary. Highly recommended!!!!!
Happy to see you again and again :). Thank you guys so much for the fun we experienced, that was something I look forward to repeat as many times as you keep updated. Cheers, wings up!!!

Awesome. Do you ever thought or experienced what is proper team work! I guess NO, because you never ever been involved in that properly, SO here you will be able to build excellent team work or otherwise you will not going to escape from those rooms! In my case We had best team :)

Escape Rooms. I visited the Escape Rooms for the first time with my friends. To be honest we didn't know what to expect, but after we got through 2 Rooms, we definitely want to come back with more friends. We had such a great laugh and positive emotions. I think the idea of rooms is very original and funny. Team work was very important for finding the clues and escape. We had a really great time and we laughed a lot. The actual design of rooms we though was amazing...very original. We could see that there has been put lots and lots of effort to create these rooms and make them more interesting and more attractive to people.We were very impressed.The hosts Yanis and Imants was very positive and very welcoming and they explained everything what we had to know. We could see that they enjoy what they do.I suggest to take friends and family and try these rooms. Public access is very easy. It was my first time, but not the last one for sure.Thanks to Yanis and Imants, we had a very positive afternoon.

Great fun!!!. It was such an amazing experience! Went there with my friends few weeks ago and I truly can't remember last time I had such fun! Staff was very helpful and friendly, you can not ask for more. It's worth the monies!!! 10+ stars!!!

Mr Roman. I had a great time with my friends there. Everyone who loves adventure without any consequences, should attend this place. You don't mind your time, cos is so interesting there. My advice is to visit at least once in your life this place with your family or friends, cos this place is not for loners.

Brilliant escape room in London. I would definitely recommend this escape room. The room is in the fashion of a crazy professor's study, and it is not claustrophobic at all. It is a more traditional escape room, unlike some which can have a heavy amount of electronics - which was perfect for us! We escaped with time to spare, though we did ask for clues (which were more like prompts!). The game was well paced, clever and attention to detail was excellent.
Excellent experience . Highly recommended escape room. Friendly host and great challenges. We were a mixture of escape room veterans and escape room virgins and we all enjoyed it very much.
Good fun!. Had such a good time at this escape room. Wasn't too easy or too hard. (Although we did need some clues) would recommend!

Excellent escape room! . I have done a couple of escape rooms before and think they are a great option for people who want to experience something a bit different. Unfortunately we were running late for our booking but our host was very accommodating and did not mind. The room was set up very well and each problem had to be solved in a unique way. We had a fantastic time and I would definitely recommend this experience, especially as our host was so friendly and this was much more reasonably priced than other London escape rooms.

Clever and fun escape game for groups of 2-5. It's not easy to find a challenging escape game in London with a great theme for 2 people and Mind the Game was absolutely perfect! It has a good story, well thought-out puzzles and smart hints that don't reveal the answer but, with a bit of thinking, lead you to the right direction. I went with my boyfriend on his birthday and we both loved it! All the excitement nearly made us to lose track of time. The host is lovely and enthusiastic, seemingly enjoys the game herself.I highly recommend it to smaller or larger groups, it is definitely one of the best and easily accessible escape games in London! Don't believe me? Try it for yourself!

Great game, great fun. Went with three other friends, and had a great time. Right from the first contact over the phone the staff were great, helpful and caring. Compared to the other places I called before, these made me feel the most comfortable with booking. We ate at one of the many restaurants beforehand to make it a great evening overall. The game itself was good fun, with a good variation of puzzles and tricks to work through. We finished with ten minutes to spare, although most finish it with a few minutes, so the difficulty is just right! Look forward to returning in the future, highly recommend this place!!

Clever puzzles, good service, and reasonable price for London. This was my 19th escape room experience, but I went with two friends who had never tried any before, and we all enjoyed it equally well, and escaped with just a few minutes to spare. The style is classic, but with neat puzzles that were neither too easy nor too difficult. Good service from friendly staff. Price more reasonable, and place easier to book than many other escape rooms in London. Highly recommended!

Amazing Escape Game in London! Classic style.. My partner and I have done many escape games before. This is definitely one of the best and there were lots of new puzzles that we haven't experienced before. I am surprised that they don't have more reviews on TripAdvisor. It is just amazing. So if you have any doubts, then don't and just do this game!!!!

Such fun!!. I took my sister for her birthday and we had so much fun! The puzzles were challenging, but not impossible. I really liked that clues were available only if you asked, so you could really get stuck into solving a puzzle (there were a few times we definitely needed the clues :)) A fab experience for 2, but it would still be lots of fun with 3 or 4. My favourite escape game I've done in London!!

First escape game experience! Started with the best around! . Amazing! Whole game was so well put together with such detail, really made our minds boggle, some true air punching moments! Very rewarding to solve the puzzles, gamemaster was incredibly helpful to guide us through!

Mind boggling fun - something different. Brilliant stuff - really well put together and run. Just the right balance of challenging and accessible (with a bit of help from the games master). A great night out.

GREAT FUN FOR A PERFECT DATE NIGHT!!. Had a really fun time. The Game master was really engaging and helpful and the game itself was very challenging but also tons of fun. It was our first escape room experience but we've now caught the bug!!
Excellent . Really enjoyed this game. Played it with my wife for my birthday and escaped with 6 mins to go. You'll enjoy it.. Very well designed :-)

Brilliant!!. Took my sister for her birthday, she had never played an escape game before and was as little apprehensive. The staff we so welcoming and the before game briefing was very thorough, setting the scene well. The room was immersive and full of great puzzles that I had not seen in an escape room before. I really liked the fact that clues were not forced upon you and that you could ask when you felt you needed them. I would say this is one of the best escape rooms I have played, not as technical as some but that is by no means a bad thing! So reasonably priced as well compared to others in London! Would definitely recommend it!!! We managed to escape as a two much to our surprise.
A great, short activity to do with friends. Brilliant fun! Objects were carefully hidden and the clues required a little working out but were not too challenging either. A great afternoon!

Fab experience! Something totally different!!!. We were a group of 4 'The Misfits'; this was our first experience of an Escape Room, and we didn't know what to expect! The games master was very friendly and welcoming. The hour flew by really quickly, which added to the excitement. We had great fun in completing our mission, and we can't wait to try out another room soon.

Great game master, great escape room and thoughtful throughout. Two of our group had never done an escape room, but the game masters was very welcoming and reassuring. The escape room was very thought out and really enjoyable. At certain times we had to ask for help, but these were general clueless and promoted us along the way. Fantastic experience - would highly recommend.

Great host, innovative room, and a fun experience. This escape room was a 15 minute walk from us, so it felt rude not to visit!We had had to change the date of our booking at short notice, and the owner was very accommodating in doing so.When we arrived, he was incredibly friendly, chatting away and explaining the history behind escape rooms.We undertook the challenge in a group of 5, going though moments of intense excitement (when we solved a clue!) and frustration (when nothing seemed to add up). Ultimately, it was a challenging but enthralling experience and one that I'd highly recommend

Brilliant fun, thoughtful activity lovingly created! Great value, good location. Fab for couples as well as groups. Loads of fun! The hour flies by, brilliant to exercise the old noggin in a different way. Great test of communication and teamwork with your fellow players. I learnt a lot about my own approach to logical and lateral thinking and where I / we could improve :-) Great for future reference. Apparently we got all the hard stuff quite quickly and stumbled over the simple things - very interesting! Extremely warm welcome from our Gamesmaster - you can tell a lot of care, attention and love has gone into this project, run by lovely people. You get attentive support from Gamesmaster throughout, without spoiling the game. Also, note the refreshing rarity of a game that can be played by just 2 - no compulsory 3/4+ people.10 min walk from Brondesbury station which is well connected, and bustling local area around with plenty of cafes and eateries.Highly recommend, great value - give it a go, you won't be disappointed!! Thank you for a lovely aftenoon jaunt Mind The Game. We will be back for your next creation! My top tips: work together (easier said than done!) and look closely at the items you find :-)
