Great fun. Unassuming shop front, v.friendly and helpful staff. Great room (small but that didn't matter for the 4 of us), with interesting props, and details, and clever puzzles we haven't seen in others. The whole family loved it (13 and 8 yr old kids)

Brilliant, team building challenge!. Went as a group of 4 mates, was a very engaging and challenging activity. You can ask for an unlimited number clues if you need a hand, which are tailored by the game master to your specific situation. This particular 'escape the room' activity is excellent because it's very hands on and immersive. Also, there is no real physical activity required, apart from scrambling to find the keys!, so great for all ages - just pure mental engagement. The host was very accommodating, answered all questions and was very friendly. I've already recommended this game to all my friends and recommend you to go too! Lastly, although the informational website could do with a more modern look, my payment was sent through successfully via the booking page.

Superb Escape Room. This was the A teams first Escape Room and it was an amazing experience from start to finish!The guy that runs it (my apologies but I cannot remember his name as it was back in April that we went) is fantastic, he makes sure that you really do have a great time! I do not want to give anything away so all I can say is:- If you have never had an escape room experience or your are Escape Room experts - This one is a must!

Really good fun!!!!. My husband and I took our two daughters aged 14 and 11 to play mind the game, it was brilliant fun!!! We where warmly welcomed and after a brief video explaining the game we entered the room and began out search. It's a very good family / team building game, we would all recommend it!! We escaped with 2mins 40seconds spare - phew!!!!

Fantastic Escape Room. I books this room for my boyfriends birthday as it was one of the only places where we could play as just a couple. The place was easy to find (about a ten minute walk from Queen's Park) and upon arriving we received a really friendly welcome and were talked through what we needed to do. The escape room was really well set up and clues were readily available when we needed them. The difficulty was brillIant as it certainly wasn't easy but was definitely manageable. Would 100% recommend this escape room and I hope to see more escape rooms from this company in the future. Thanks again for a great afternoon!

Very immersive "Escape the room" game. It was our first "Escape the room" type of game and I didn't know what to expect. And it was amazing: First the ambience is set before you enter the room with a little video briefing (low budget but it doesn't matter). Then once you enter the room, it's something else: the decor is wonderful and very immersive. Every detail is thought out and it really made us forget that it is a game: it feels like we are actually trying to save the world! The game is really well set, specially for a first experience. We didn't feel lost. If you are stuck the team can request a hint to help the progression. It was a great experience and i would like to erase my mind to be able to do it again!

AMAZING!!!!!!. Such a fun activity for anyone at any age! Very challenging and great for team building/bonding! We escaped with only 20 seconds to spare! The host was absolutely lovely and I would definitely buy this attraction as a gift for anyone in the future :)

Great example of an escape game. Very easy to find, Mind the Game really exceeded our expectations. Our host was very friendly and explained everything to us. Obviously, will not go into the nature of he game but it was extremely well thought out, had a great atmosphere and was challenging but really fair. Some really nice details. Very recommended from Team Eurovisioneers.

Escaped with one minute to spare - saved the world just in the nick of time. What a great fun game testing wit and skill of finding keys and figuring out a number of clues to find the sirem. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

AMAZING!!!. Having been to many escape rooms in London, this ranks among the best. Very fast paced and cleverly designed. Difficult enough for experienced players but an excellent clue system to make it enjoyable for all levels. Unlike other escape rooms, this works very well with small groups (we went with 2).

Great fun for all!. We've just come back from the great experience in Kilburn. Like all escape games it looks so unassuming on the outside and as soon as you're in you're immersed in the challenge! An awesome Sunday afternoon activity for all the family - we went with our friends son who is 11. We've done Time Run and whilst this was a but more low-fi enjoyed it just as much. Thoroughly recommended :)
Brilliant!. Great fun, good level of difficulty, well managed. Went with family and it was a great activity to do together. Highly recommend.

They bend over backwards to make sure you have the best time!. This escape room is one of a kind because they genuinely care about ensuring you have fun. They don't kick you out after your time is up and they really take the time to listen to any questions. It is incredibly well thought out, difficult and clever. Also, the room is full of amazing antiques. Old Russian maps and clocks, old suitcases, books and clothes... it feels so real!

Such a fun and different thing to do!. I took my sister here for a birthday present. There were 4 of us, and it was such a fun evening. We all got really into it, and loved solving all the clues! The guy running it was really helpful and good fun, and made the experience really enjoyable for us all. Would definitely recommend for something different to do in London!

Highly recommended for everyone!!!. It was the first time for me playing this kind of game but definitely not the last.Awesome and outstanding tasks. Not easy to solve them but the staff is helpful and very friendly. You should be visit this place at least once!! You gonna have a great fun there!

Awesome time!!!. I had a great time at this escape room. A lot of thought had been put into planning this room and it clearly shows! Not going to give away too much but it is absolutely brilliant and would highly recommend it!

Excellent birthday gift. My children (all in their 20's) gave me this experience for my birthday . We were a family team of 5 and all thoroughly enjoyed it. The hour flew by, we were all fully occupied with the challenge and managed to escape with 4 minutes to spare. We left on a high and would definitely recommend this for any puzzle loving groups of friends or families . Level of difficulty was pitched perfectly and you can request a helpful clue as needed which we did twice.

FANTASTIC! Really great time!. We had such a fantastic time doing this. It was done so well and so professionally! We had a wonderful time doing this - everyone in the group loved it and so much thought had been put into setting it up and the clues. Could not rate it more highly! Well worth the money!

Wow... Pure brilliance!. I don't write reviews, but this is one place that I have to. It's brilliant, mind aching, moments of achievements throughout! Frantic ending as we managed to complete just in time. If we could do a memory wipe and do it all again, we would. Highly recommend it. Mind The Game you've nailed it. Well done! Team "Dirty Slugs"

Birthday fun. I booked this as a birthday treat for my friend who wanted to do something a little different and it did not disappoint.We were greeted at the door by our friendly host who sat us down and briefed us on what the game would entail. After that we were led into a room and left to work out the secret serum to stop the end of the world.We were a group in our 20s/early 30s and had so much fun and apparently were one of her most excited teams. Figuring out the puzzles and clues was challenging but we made it in the end thankfully to our observant host who helped us with clues when we prompted her.Highly recommended if you want to do something a little challenging, a laugh with a group of friends and inspire some thinking outside the box.Thank you from team bisqcuits!

First Escape Room - Double Date. My cousin and his wife joined my wife and I on this Escape Room challenge. We are new to this sort of thing and fancied giving it a try. We couldn't believe how enjoyable it was. Anita our host, was fantastic, explained everything to us and helped us where possible. Our team managed to escape with 6 and a half minutes to spare. WARNING: The time goes quick, team work and communication is key to success.Would highly recommend this escape room to all people, couples and teams.We are all looking forward to trying more escape rooms in London and the UK.

Excellent. Did this with 4 friends, this was excellent. Good level of difficulty and if needed the staff member (who was lovely) gave use helpful hints but only when requested. Had a fantastic time highly recommended

Brilliant night out . We were greeted by the host, who was was friendly, welcoming and forgave us for taking ages to choose our team name! Once in the room the puzzle began. Working together (or sometimes not working quite so well together) we raced the clock to find and solve clues. The hour went so quickly and I was completely engrossed. Definitely recommend this to anyone.

Superb Experience!! Something different.... Did this experience with 3 work friends and had such a good time! The hosts were lovely, and very accommodating, and the experience itself was awesome! All of us came out of the room buzzing and couldn't wipe the smile off our faces! Have never done anything like this before, and loved every minute of it, would definitely recommend it to anyone that enjoys a puzzle, using their brain and a challenge. Definitely do it! :0)
Great fun and something different! . Really friendly staff who start your experience off. Something really fun to do as a group and was a lovely different activity for a birthday. Highly recommended!

First game - double date. My husband and his cousin and wife joined us in trying this game for the first time.We did an early starter, and we had no idea what we had let ourselves in for. Anita our host was fantastic, very friendly.It starts with a short film to set the scene, and give you your mission. Then an hour to solve the mystery and save the world. Our team managed it with 6 1/2 minutes to spare. But the hour goes really quick, you are kept busy all the time. And team work is essential. Had a great time and we are all excited to do another room soon.

Super exciting! Only one in West London!. Excellent experience. Our first time in such escape rooms. The organiser, Anita, was very helpful in explaining the game and rules. The game was accommodating - if you were stuck and she helped with some clues if we asked for it. So it was not so stressful, but at the same time it was thrilling. I'd suggest it for a group of atleast 3 (we were 4) because there are quite a lot of puzzles/clues to solve for and there's enough work for everyone! Not so pricey and comfortable location in West london, so didnt have to go all the way into the City for this. Also recommended for corporate team building - great for team work. On the whole, great stuff! Try it out!

Amazing Experience. it was amazing hour, very professional staff and helped us a lot :)very interesting game and not easy game, one hour passed like little minutes i highly recommend it for small families and couples, kids will even enjoy it more than any other game.

Who knew we were so clever? . This was our first experience of this type of game and we loved every second of it. Well thought out - clues were just right and appropriate help was given when it was needed. The lady was really helpful.Highly recommended. Only criticism is that there is only one room!

Definitely worth a visit. If solving a case and thinking outside the box is something you enjoy, mind the game is for you. An immersive experience that takes true analytical skills to solve.Time to put on your gloves to solve a mystery! #TheScientists

"Truely completely engageing !!! ". It was a birthday treat and a brilliant family evening !!.A typical family outing - laughing , thinking, cheering , cheating [ well not really - you can`t really cheat ] , jumping with joy, a few high "fives " , that feel of feeling good !! , calling each other names , but the most important thing is seeing your fellow participitants smiling and laughing and some were simply too good.I will do that again.
Mind the Game. Group of 5 friends, This was great fun and the puzzles were interesting. The game host was very friendly and helpful, and keen to make the experience rewarding :)

Mind The Game. We did this as a family with two children ages 13 and 11. This was the first time we had done anything like this before so it made it very exciting.The gentleman who greeted us was great and very welcoming. He was courteous and kind and always had a smile on his face while explaining what we were letting ourselves in for. We watched a 2min video to get us in the spirit of it before we entered the room.Once we were in the room which was just fascinating and very authentic to look at, everyone started looking for all sorts of clues. The hour absolutely flew by. We were all busy working things out and we would never have managed it without the kids! Definitely a group game, we all contributed something which helped us complete it. The game keeper helped us with hints pointing us in the right direction. All in all an excellent experience. Will definitely recommend to family, friends and colleagues. We will be going back and trying out any other rooms they make in the future. Thank you for a great time.

Hugely Enjoyable. This was the first escape room we'd tried - and the four of us loved it! The puzzles were very well-thought out and our group had an amazing time trying to solve them.Don't be fooled by the unassuming shop front, the game itself is detailed and executed wonderfully.

Amazing first time experience. This was the first time we had done anything like this. I have played games like this on my phone before but to experience it for real was amazing. The gentleman who greeted us was fantastic. He was courteous and kind and always had a smile on his face while explaining what we were letting ourselves in for. We watched a 2min video to get us amped before we entered the room.There was 5 of us in our group, none of us had never done this kind of game before which made it all the more exciting. Once we were in the room which was just fascinating to look at, everyone started looking for all sorts of clues. The hour absolutely flew by. Felt like it lasted 15mins. We were all busy working things out, one of my cousins actually surprised us with her intellect which we all thought lay dormant. Definitely a group game, we all contributed something which helped us complete the game with less than one minute to spare. We did lose a few minutes adjusting a few things to which the game keeper helped us with little hints pointing us in the right direction. All in all an excellent experience. Will definitely recommend to family, friends and colleagues. We will be going back and trying out any other rooms they make in the future.

Excellent game. We were a team of four and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We managed to escape with a few minutes to go, so it was nail biting stuff. Some genius additions make it even more exciting and you cant help but get sucked into the game with plenty of enthusiasm where the owner may need to turn the volume down on you as you may get a little too excited......oops :)

Fantastic !. We have enjoyed several escape games over London but for price this is the best.Great fun for any age. This game has some clever twists !We travelled from Clapham Junction on the overground and it took 30 minutes door to door.

Excellent escape room. This was my first escape room and on basis of my experience I'm hooked! I went with my partner, an escape games veteran. The place is very unassuming but we were welcomed in by the gamesmaster. The game is pretty challenging for two (three or four would be ideal), but our games master gave us just the right amount of additional cryptic clues when we were getting stuck to make sure we continued on in the game. I really great way to spend a hour or so!

Great one for the family ..... It's not always too easy finding activities to do with teenagers that everyone enjoys but, having previously played on various online Escape games, we thought this might be a good one for the school holidays ... and how right we were! Our children (aged 12 and 14) took to the challenge like proverbial ducks to water - getting stuck straight into the various clues and puzzles. We managed for a full 20 minutes without any help at all (and even then, the hints we were given were just enough to get us to rethink our strategies rather than giving us any answers). The hour flew by so quickly; personally I was enjoying it so much that I could have happily continued for another 30 - 60 minutes!! However, we escaped with 1 minute and 40 seconds to spare! Would thoroughly recommend; the kids already want to book to do another one!

Great for couples and small groups. Me and my boyfriend visited on a Sunday bank holiday evening and were greeted by a very friendly and welcoming host. He was informative as well as making sure we had a really fun time - which we did! Don't let the outside deter you from entering in as it really is so much fun, laid out really well and it gets the cogs clicking over!

Fun sharing experience. Friendly but professional. This escape room game was such fun with everyone contributing to the team success (saved the world with 3 minutes to spare) just the right amount of 'direction' to stop us from getting frustrated but a real work-out for the brain. The room was very atmospheric. I would definitely recommend this and look forward to my next adventure.

Awesome. This was my first experience with my partner and friends. We was unsure what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. The experience was great fun with the added bonus that we are all still talking to each other.

One of my favourite escape games. The game was well thought out and puzzles were challenging but not impossible. Really enjoyed the way the room was decorated and how puzzles were laid out. Whether you are a first timer or an escape room addicted player, you will not be disappointed! We managed to escape with just 4 mins left on the clock! The host was friendly and explained the game well. He even gave us a thorough debrief at the end of the game! 5/5 for this company and well done on a well made game!

Great fun!. I went with my family and had a great time! Very interesting, exciting and challenging. Excellent decor to set the scene and very cleverly put together game. I would highly recommend as something different to do in London with a group of friends. :)

Great fun!. What a lovely experience! Great Easter Sunday activity.Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves it was our first time playing this kind of game. It's not easy but you can be given clues if you need a little help. The lady host there was so lovely, and genuinely wants you to enjoy it. Would definitely recommend to anyone! Great game can't wait to do another soon. Thank you to mind the game for a very nice afternoon!

Great place to visit!. I took my niece here for part of her birthday treat, along with grand-ma and my husband- we all really enjoyed it! It's definitely suitable for all ages and left me wanting to come back for more- if you've got an hour to spare and want to do something different, then this is what I would recommend.

A great activity. Was a great way to spend an afternoon in London. It stretches the mind and imagination every step of the way. Can highly recommend for team building activities and family outings, it's a real treat!
Amazing!. I suggest everyone to come here! Amazing and exciting, very well made and really clever! Great for a night out with friends :)
Hour of Fun. Never attempted anything like this before and it didn't disappoint. Great hour with friends to solve the clues and find the keys and objects. Would definitely recommend it.

Great game would play again!. Went with 3 friends and had a great hour searching for clues to solve save the world! So much fun the time flew by. The game was a challenge but fun to solve. Would defiantly recommend to anyone who likes puzzles and has a competitive edge!

Great experience!. It was a great experience in a very well planned escape room. We loved every minute of the hour - it had just the right level of difficulty and we were given some subtle clues when required. In all it was a fantastic escape room experience

Really good fun- you forget everything else for the hour . Visited as 3 friends. Really well planned - effective and thoughtful. Totally absorbing. Definitely would do it again if they open another London room. Lady on reception was super kind and welcoming. Definitely a different and fun night out

Incredible. I should start this review by mentioning that I've probably done about 15 escape rooms across various countries. Some have been amazing and some have been so bad that I've contemplated calling the police to report an assault, such was the pain I felt upon leaving certain rooms. HOWEVER, the authorities are not needed here! This room was great. The difficulty was spot on. Nothing was immediately clear, but given time to think, it made sense in the end. The difficulty curve was perfect. I know this is subjective, but for me, it was spot on. There are some really nice ideas in this room. There was always something to do. If you got stuck in one area, you could leave it and move on to something else and then go back later. I've been to rooms where the puzzles were too linear and you had to solve one after the other. They have just the right amount of red herrings as well.It's a relatively new escape room and I took a chance on it, and I'm glad I did. I highly recommend it to everyone. The owner was lovely as well. I can't remember her name sadly, but she was really nice to speak to and we spoke to her at length at the end to give feedback on the room which she was really grateful for.Don't be put off by the exterior. Being completely honest, it does look a bit "run-down" on the outside. However once inside the room, you are transported to a different world entirely and it's game time!It doesn't surprise me that this room is as good as it is. The owners are Hungarian and some of the best rooms I've played were in Hungary. It actually has a Hungarian Escape Room feel to it.

A truly great and fun experience. I visited some escape rooms before (mainly in Hungary) in my life but this was definitely one of the best ones. I loved both the atmosphere and the puzzles: they were challenging but solvable. Extra point for the extremely nice and friendly owners! I would recommend for everyone to go.

Great way to spend time together!. This was our second go at exit games, and although a totally different scenario the game was excellent. Every detail had been thought about and the host and hostess were excellent. I can't thank them enough for making our day really fun. " Thank you very much, Team Hamtastic!"

Highly recommended team event for either business or with friends. We booked an appointment with Mind The Game as a Team Building Activity for our new management team. We thought it would be difficult for us to work together because we all like to lead, but it wasn't the case at all! Even if you don't know each other too well, this exercise bonds you immediately. The five of us really, really, really enjoyed it! The feeling of accomplishment, if you manage to get out within the time is fantastic! An absolute must, if you like solving problems, interpreting clues and cracking codes. We would definitely book another appointment if the Professor returned!
Brilliant good fun. Had a lovely time here and would recommend to anyone of any age over 12 ish. The staff were really professional and friendly making the experience even more enjoyable.

Great fun and well put together!. My fiancé, friends and I have now done about 13 different escape rooms over London - this was one of our top 5!When we arrived, the outside of the building made it look a bit amateurish and we were slightly concerned about the quality of what would be inside - howeve, once we entered and spoke to our host and were into the room itself, we were pleasantly surprised! The room had good theming, the puzzles were mixed (not just padlocks) and some innovative ideas/things that we hadn't seen in other rooms!After we escaped, our host was friendly and chatty and asked us for any feedback on how they could improve the room. We offered a couple of suggestions, which they seemed happy to take on board.We're hoping Mind the Game expand as we would definitely return for another room and will be recommending this to others!

Loads of fun, well organised. Went there with two friends I had visiting me from abroad. The game was really well organised as we got clues exactly when we needed them. We needed some help to finish, but we managed to get out with about 8 minutes left.Service was really good and the lady working there was super friendly and nice. Definitely got us hooked on the Escape room experience. Absolutely recommended. Visited February 2016

Amazing time. I had booked this event for my 11 year old cousin who always plays the game "can you ecape" on the ipad. It was like playing the actual game in real life. We had such an amazing time. It was hard to start with looking for all the clues but then we got stuck in and managed to escape with 1min 45 secs to go. It was really well planned out and so much to do in the room. Really enjoyed the puzzle solving and the different clues. We couldn't stop talking about it all the way home. The staff were so friendly and welcoming and it was so well organised with an introduction to the game at the beginning.Hope they can set up another room else where or changed the room round every year as would definitely do it again. Would 100% recommend this company. Thank you again for such a great time

Mind the Game..Escape room experience... Mind the Game in KilburnA fun way to spend an hour..team work, following puzzles and clues. It is not scary or physical so great for a wide age range. Would suit a group of friends, colleagues or family.Thoroughly enjoyable.

A great day for an Escape room game in London!. Had a amazing time with my wife and older kids. The game room was so interesting and we all worked hard together. The organisers were amazing and I would definitely recommend Mind the Game. Keep up the good work! Best game room in London!

Mind the Game Review. "The crazy Prof" room was great! The hosts were extremely friendly, we had a lovely intro to the room and then an amazing experience trying to escape it. We managed to escape and had a great time doing so. For us it was just right in terms of trickiness, clues and brainteasers. The experience was really good. I would say it's one of the best rooms I have done so far.My recommendation - GO THERE!!

Fantastic Experience!!. Really enjoyed this experience. Made you delve deep into your mind to connect the dots and work out the clues, and everyone naturally assumes a role within the team that compliments one another to achieve the goal of exiting the room on time. The chosen story at Mind The Game is great too - felt like super hero's when we made it out of the room with 12 minutes to spare!!! Would definitely recommend visiting here, and this experience has wet my appetite for visiting more Escape Room Games across London.

Brilliant Fun!. Me and some work colleagues were rewarded a voucher for the escape room as an incentive for doing well during the summer season. We went as a group of 5, and we didnt know what to expect at all. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the beginning and we were given a background to our chosen room, room 33! It was layed out amazingly and the puzzles and riddles were quit difficult, but the staff gave us guidence when we were close but not quit there! We made it out with 1 minute 8 seconds to spare! When we escaped we all felt accomplishment! Would definitely recommend and I would like to try the second room! Great experience overall.

Great escape room. My second experience of an escape room and really enjoyed it. We did the Pharaoh room. The clues were good but with some there was no way in hell of guessing what was needed. When hints were offered it was hard to hear over the walkie talkie. Previous experience had hints given over speakers. Other than that we thoroughly enjoyed it and managed to escape in time. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend. Look forward to doing the other one.

An excellent experience. A birthday treat from my friends. It was our first experience of an escape room and certainly won't be our last. Friendly helpful staff and great puzzles to solve that we were all able to take part in. Escaped with four minutes to spare :-)

Nice.... Hi,I've been there during my holiday in London. I was funny and the riddles were interesting.... but in my opinion too riddles in Chinese (o Japanase?) symbols... I wanted to do 4 stars but.... for two people about 94€ maybe is too expensive.

Great experience. first experience of an escape room! really good, harder than I thought it was going to be. Staff are really friendly. We didn't escape in time but they let us finish the game with some help! know what to expect next time so hopefully will escape when we do the other room. Thanks guys for a great time!

Team building day out. I didn't really know what to expect from this but all I can say is that it was great!!! Don't get me wrong I was getting very stressed out trying to solve all the clues but it was so much fun at the same time!! We did 3 women in Room 33 and 4 men in the Pharaoh room...annoyingly they escaped 30 seconds before we did, but as i thought we weren't going to complete it at all I didn't really care!! Thoroughly enjoyed by all and was a great start to our team day out.

SO much fun! . I booked this as a surprise for my boyfriend and his twin brothers birthday treat, and was not disappointed. The three of us have never done any type of escape room before so we were completely new to this. I booked room 33 as there had been some great reviews on it. It was full of fun and really put your skills to the test, I liked the mixture of the type of puzzles we had to solve and it was really hands on which made it really enjoyable. The staff were great and very friendly and keen to help when we got stuck haha. We didn't get out in time due to being complete beginners but that has just made me want to go back and try more! I would highly recommend it and I would suggest at least 3 or 4 people go in the room.

Great experience. Staff are great. Very friendly indeed. Didn't know what to expect but it was a great fun-filled hour. We had 2 adults and 4 teens and am proud to say we made it out with 2 1/2 minutes to spare! Highly recommend for an exciting and fun experience which is a bit different from the norm. Only minor point was the room itself was boiling despite a fan running. But have to say, it was a pretty warm day today. Give it a try!

Great fun in room 33. I booked this as a surprise for my boyfriends birthday. We were a group of 4 and none of us had done anything similar previously and only one of us had even heard about this type of activity. We all had such a good time, it was brilliant. It was challenging and really made you think but we all had a good laugh and managed to escape the room just before the time finished. We loved it so much we have booked another similar one and will return to the escape room as soon as there is availability. Also the staff are super friendly and made the experience even better.

Your Mission, should you choose to accept it........ A fantastic experience that was equal parts Mission Impossible and The Crystal Maze rolled into one. We did this as a team building exercise for a staff away day and it totally hit the mark. This was our first time at Escape Rooms but it certainly won't be the last, it was a lot of fun and the staff were extermely friendly and really helpful when it came to some handy hints to get us back on track.It's definitely fun for all ages and for all sorts of occasions.

Best escape rooms . So much fun -by far the best escape rooms we have been to!!
Would recommend for family, friends and work colleagues. Really gets your brain going! Great experience

Brilliant day out with Team and Clients!. We took over both Room 33 and Pharaohs Chamber - and both received brilliant reviews! Both teams managed to get out thankfully!! Staff were brilliant - and gave reassurance and helpful clues when we were struggling!! Would definitely recommend this to anyone - a great way to spend an hour.. but you end up talking and laughing about it for the rest of the day!

Great Fun. booked this experience for 28th August 2016 and was not disappointed. 4 of us participated and we escaped with 2 mins 39 secs to spare. the puzzles are tricky yet not too tricky making the time spent in there fun. would highly recommend.

Down to the wire.... What a brilliant experience. As none of us had done an escape challenge before it was new for all of us. It is surprising how fast the clock ticks when you are under pressure. The Room 33 challenge really got the brain cells churning, finding the clues then piecing them together. We literally escaped at the last second. We would definitely do another one. Great value for money and the staff were really friendly and helpful.
Escape rooms. Fantastic experience. Friendly and helpful staff. Had a great evening and managed to escape with just 20 seconds left on the clock.

Wow, wow, wow.... We booked Escape rooms without any expectations as this was our first time... None of us played this game before. Well, it DID exceed our expectations. Great game, finding clues, time ticking away. We managed to escape with only 9 minutes in spare.. Pia thank you for a great experience. :)

Great challenging game. So we attended Escape room to attempt the Pharaoh Chambers. I had mixed expectations from previous reviews I had read. When we arrived the lovely staff welcomed us with smiles and greetings. Then one of them began to give our introduction, although at times he spoke fast and I failed to remember his pointers....So I had to ask him to repeat some things, he was kindly a lot slower the 2nd time around. Anyways we finally enter the room and without giving too much away we were faced with mind boggling challenges, yet I was lucky enough to have two team members (my son n husband) who just thrive on these things. All in all we finished with 4 minutes to go and only used one hint on what we found to be quite a tricky task. And apparently that day we were the first team so far to escape!! The staff are amazing and constantly reassure you and make you feel comfortable and the game is definitely worth the money....we are looking forward to room 33...

Clueless. Had our Staff away day at the Escape Rooms, good team building. Had fun trying to solve the clues, didn't realise how quick the time went. Brilliant start to our away day, which geared us on for the afternoon.Would recommend Escape Rooms to friends and family, Brilliant.Thank you Escape Rooms. Fantastic job.

Something different, but bring your brain and a lot of friends!. A mate of mine had done one of the rooms here previously and had a lot of good things to say about it. A group of five of us decided to do the other room and see if we could escape. Suffice to say we did within the allotted time.The escape room is a lot more fun if you have more people. The allocated max (without penalty) is 6 so see if you can rustle up that amount of people for the room. Also think abstractly and have fun. Our problem is that we didn't work together as much as we could.We had a good host along the way to ask questions here and there.

Room 33... Awesome!!. Me and my two teenage kids did this. Arrived early and got started straight away. Explained very well by staff member. Locker to place our belongings in. The time flew by but we escaped with about 5 mins to spare. It was honestly the best hours fun I've had. I would recommend to anyone but if you love puzzles and quizzes then this is an ideal thing to do. I booked well in advance as I wanted an early time slot. Well worth checking out if you're in London and want a little break from sightseeing.

Great family fun!. I purchased a 6 x man ticket as a xmas gift for my family. I was worried that 6 would be too many, but we had a fantastic time. We did Room 33 and managed to escape with 5.30 minutes to go with 2 hints. This was the first escape room any of us had done and we had a great time, it was a challenge and was fun! We will definitely come back to try the Pharaoh room! Ladies.. Top Tip... Do NOT wear a skirt!

Room 33 - fantastic!. We completed Room 33 with 6 minutes to spare, thanks to our brilliant host Boris. I have done quite a few escape games before and Room 33 is definitely up there with the best of them. There are enough puzzles to keep it very interesting and at the same time you don't feel overwhelmed with the amount of challenges ahead. Will definitely be back to play the Pharaoh's Chamber!

Second Visit just as good as the first. This is the second time we have been to the escape rooms here and both are as equally challenging and with varied activities. We were a group of 3 for Room 33 and only two for the Egyptian theme but we managed to solve it, with just the one hint in Room 33 and none in the Egyptian room.I would recommend a group of 3 or 4 as there is enough to be solved simultaneously at that point without being too hard.Both of the rooms are great fun and have different challenge styles, certainly one is not significantly harder than the other.Age wise it would be hard for younger audiences to tackle all of the puzzles or make the lateral leaps required unless they are exceptionally into puzzles, so if you have young teenagers I would recommend an adult in there to help them along.

Room 33 - what a fun challenge . A couple of friends and I successfully escaped from room 33. It was much more fun than I had anticipated, the challenges were pretty difficult and time went so quickly. Loved the little twist at the beginning... let's just say my friend regretted wearing a mini skirt. These events are quite addictive - I can't wait to do another. The staff here were great too. Worth a visit.

Brilliant stag do activity. Organised for a group of six guys on a stag do with a group that included quite an age mix. The puzzles were brilliant and enabled everyone to get involved and participate. Staff were energetic and very friendly. Would strongly recommend.

Such an awesome group activity!. Escape rooms are so much fun, we've done a couple in Canada and Australia. This was my first experience in the UK and I loved their rooms! The staff are fun and friendly and the rooms are great. Definitely good for groups and even if you wanna catch up with friends and do something before going out for dinner and drinks.

Fun day out!. Went here as a surprise birthday visit for a family member. I had visited an escape room before but overseas. So not everyone knew what to expect.On arrival everything was explained clearly and our mission began!Everyone really enjoyed it and lots of laughs were had by all.Would definitely return for another go and try and beat out time.Absolutely recommend!

Great time!. A group of seven us went to this escape room (we did Pharoah's Chamber) and had a great time. The room was challenging but there were still lots of opportunities to have a laugh! The staff were really helpful, there are lockers for your belongings, and we were able to start our game early. The team e-mailed us our photo really quickly too! Would definitely recommend this escape room.

Pharaoh's Chamber. Excellent attraction for all the family. Team Sundae Seven managed just in time to solve all the clues with only using 2 out of the 3 available hints. The staff were very friendly and helpful, would reccomend Escape Rooms to my friends.
Fantastic. Well worth a visit if you like a puzzle. We did Room 33- going to return for the other one.Just one thing- wear jeans...

An experience worth doing. I booked this as part of my partners birthday and the whole experience was amazing! We booked for 2.30pm but we arrived earlier and was able to go into the room at 2pm. The whole experience was brilliant. You were able to call for help if needed but this deducted time however they are also able to ring you to help you which was always at the time when you needed it. I think this is one for 3 people or more as there wasnt enough time to complete. Although the lady gave us a lil extra time to complete! All in all I will definitely be going to another experience like this....highly addictive!

Great fun, highly recommended!. We have done both rooms (Room 33 and Pharaoh's Chamber) and it was great fun! We escaped both rooms and made it to the No Hints wall the second time! I loved both themes but Room 33 has to be my favourite because of the lasers! I would highly recommend Escape Rooms.

Very fun . I came with a group of 7 people, none of us knowing what to expect. The game was great fun and there were some challenging parts to the puzzle. Don't go if your friendships already hanging by a thin string as you might end up killing eachother. Wouldn't recommend for children under 14.

Great fun. Had no idea what to expect. Had a great time with 4 friends enjoying solving the puzzles. Would recommend to others a a good way to spend time together. We were all adults. Not sure we would involve under 10 yr olds as they may get bored as not interactive.
Good Fun. Team of 4 had brilliant time, staff upbeat and friendly. Team explained what we should expect and do before going in. Rooms were easy to find. All in all a good afternoon.

Challenging.. Harder than a similar venue we did last year, although that may have been down to the abilities of my team- me included! Most of the puzzles were more biased towards thinking and logic, less on the practical so it may suit some better than others. Unfortunately we didn't manage to escape in time, but a good laugh anyway. I'd say it's ideal for adults and late teens, but not children. Definitely a good venue for a works day out.

Challenging, but FUN.. I wasn't entirely sure what to expect, but our whole group had a great time. The aim was to escape the room within an hour (or as quickly as possible) by solving a number of puzzles. The puzzles/riddles varied and required different types of thinking. This meant we had to work together and play to each other's strengths. Everybody had a moment to shine and, with a bit of hard work, we eventually escaped the room. The staff were really friendly and would offer the odd hint. Rather than spoil the experience, it prevented us from getting frustrated and allowed us to keep making progress.Possibly a little bit on the pricey side, but definitely a nice treat. Would certainly go back to do the other room.

"A good fun experience". We were not quite sure what to expect from the Escape Rooms experience but were pleasantly surprised what good fun it was and how helpful the staff were to make us feel welcome and enjoy the game. We were amazed to "escape" with 2 minutes 48 secs to spare! Some challenging puzzles and riddles, which encouraged teamwork and lateral thinking. If you are looking for something different to do as a family or group of friends, we would recommend this experience! Easy to find, a short walk from London Bridge station. A great evening, thank you Escape Rooms!

Escaped the Pharaoh's Curse . A really enjoyable hour spent solving a series of clues, we had a group of 7 ranging in ages 9, 11, 14 and 4 adults, everyone could contribute, lots of things the younger ones could help with. The chap running the session was great, obviously paying close attention to what we were doing, would drop a hint or two to stop us chasing down the wrong avenue for too long which allowed us to really enjoy all the puzzles, not get frustrated and kept us buzzing the whole way through. Excellent day out, would 100% do another!!!!
We Escaped!!!!. Fantastic, Amazing, Gripping, Heart pumping!!! All those emotions and many more.Everything and everyone was spot on! Book it, Book it now, you won't be disappointed!

Work event enjoyed by all. We took a group from the office and everyone had a great time. The puzzles were challenging but not overly difficult. I did room 33 which was a little bit repetitive (I won't reveal in what way!) and could have a little more variety in it. The teams that did Pharaoh's Chamber had a great time.
Amazing!. We visited here as part of a hen party and it was amazing. We had so much fun and we can't wait to return. The staff were so accommodating, helpful and friendly. I'd highly recommend this.

Just amazing fun. Booking online really simple and fastReasonable price and as its a fixed slot and timing if 60 minutes it was perfect for the team building event I was after.Was running late stuck in traffic and unlike other places there was a courtesy call to see if we were coming and a concern to not worry vey lovely lady helping us with directions. It is a little nerve racking at first when you enter but the guide gives you some great support clear instruction and confidence.Suitable for pretty much everyone regardless of age gender ability etcMade ever better by me and my team winning with 5 mins to spare !!!The customer service makes this an even better experience
The Great Escape!!. Simply fantastic!! I took my sales team in the hope it would bring them closer together, challenge and ultimately to have some fun. It did not disappoint!!

60 minutes - GO!. Don't think about it - book it NOW!Solve puzzles, crack codes all in the name of saving The Chinese Ming Vase!I honestly didn't know what to expect, for all I knew I was going to be locked in a room with some friends for 60 minutes and try and unscramble something. How wrong was I!A cross between The Krypton Factor and Crystal Maze, or those who don't remember those great shows try looking up the blue room app found in the App Store (nowhere as good though)I don't want to give anything away only book it you really won't regret it!Will you be in the 44% success rate?

Amazing . Me and two other friends went to escape rooms yesterday we did room 33! It was honestly so much fun but trust me it is not easy! This is the first escape experience I have been too so I cannot compare to other places but would definitely recommend a group of friends or workColleagues to give it a try!

Challenging but fun!. I'd never personally been involved in such an activity and was very sceptical to begin with. We did the Heist where we had to get to the crown jewels within an hour.The explanation of the game was very good and thorough. It was very strange when we all went inside the room and didn't know what to do first. We did eventually split into groups and figure out some of the clues - which is the most difficult thing we've ever had to do, but the challenge was well worth it and lots of fun.Would definitely do this again. We made it out with 2 minutes to spare, but we did it.

Great for inquisitive Teenagers!. took the family here, and for one hour, you are locked in a room, and the aim is to 'escape' inside the 60 minutes. There is a clock counting down the time while you are there, and you have a guide who gives occasional hints over the microphones/walky-talkies - and if you are really stuck, will give you 3 direct hints to help you crack the codes.Overall, its great for teenagers who like problem solving. Its also enough time over an hour - time flies by, but by around 55 minutes, you start to wish you could break the doors down by brute force. (I can see why they limited it to 60 minutes..!)but its fun, and kids love it.

Great fun and mentally challenging!. Bought the escape rooms challenge as a Christmas present for my kids (early 20s rather than teenagers) - and me.We didn't quite know what to expect and entered the experience with some trepidation. We were greeted by the ER team and given a quick briefing, then on into the room.It was great fun - and pretty challenging mentally! 5 of us was an ideal number of participants as we could solve the puzzles in parallel and without it being too chaotic. When you're up against the clock the time goes incredibly quickly.We'd definitely recommend escape rooms London to others and would do the other room or another venue in the future.

Christmas do...great fun! . I visited with some work colleagues as part of our Christmas do. We struggled to start with but once we got going we managed to work out each of the clues and solve the problems! We got out in 54 mins and had great fun doing the challenge! We found that it brought out the competitive nature in all of us!

All the family can get involved. We booked Escape Room for a family day out in London with 18 and 15 year old kids. I was worried that it might be too easy to solve the puzzles but we were all challenged and had great fun. The hour flew by and we've all been talking about it since. Highly recommended, well run and an unusual activity to do with all ages.

Great family school holiday activity. This was such a good way to spend an afternoon in the school holidays. The host was friendly and explained exactly what we had to do. Lockers were provided for bags and coats and we were given a pen & paper to note down anything that might be significant. We had three opportunities to get hints using a walkie talkie in case we got really stuck and when we used ours it really helped move us along. There's a good competitive element as the walls of the entrance way are decorated with pictures of other groups proudly announcing how many minutes remained when they escaped. We did it and were very proud of our 17 mins remaining time! We'd have gone straight back and done the other room if we could have, but we'll certainly book it for next time we are in London.

Amazing way to spend an hour!. There was nothing about this experience we didn't enjoy, it was really good fun. Our quiz master was very helpful and friendly. There was only two of us, but we still managed to complete and make the wall of fame!!Will definitely go back for the other room. Would recommend to anyone wanting something a little bit different

great team building exercice (as a teacher). we brought 24 french students (14 year olds) to this escape room while visiting London. And they loved it! They didn't know what an escape room was, and the only thing they wanted when the experience was over, was to know if similar rooms existed in France. Great team building exercice. lots of fun. good design. VERY nice managers helping us to give our kids a great experience. Strongly recommended.

Amazingly great. I've done several escape games before but my friends never have. I brought them to the room 33 and we loved it! The first part was really unexpected! I really recommend this room! We thought it was not hard nor easy, you just need to literally look for everywhere, for any clue to get out! It was incredibly entertaining! We managed to escape and have your faces on the wall of fame!A big thank you to Stephanie who helped us when we were stuck! :)

We had lots of fun. Our whole group really enjoyed our escape room experience. We didn't really have any expectations as to what to expect and the game itself was quite challenging. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
Couples day out!. I surprised my partner with escape rooms and we both loved it! We did room 33...and it was awesome...enjoyed every minute
Very good. Much better than expected - a group of us did room 33 and had a really enjoyable hour. Would try the other room another time as well.

Amazing Experience. . This is honestly pretty awesome. We did Room 33, which was utterly absorbing and so much fun! I'm knocking a star off for the lack of atmosphere in reception and before you enter the room. They really could just show a short video with someone in relevant costume explaining the backstory and the rules rather than leaving this to the staff, who are after all in plain clothes. The lady was very friendly and did a good job, but a sense of occasion was definitely missing at the beginning. The room itself was fantastic, with loads of varied and fun puzzles to solve. It was so cleverly constructed and I'd say the level of difficulty was very well pitched. There are hints over the radio if you get stuck. We were doing this with just two people, though the suggested minimum is three, but being keen on this kind if thing we were determined to solve it and escape. We were really in the moment, this is brilliantly executed. After we finished and made the wall of fame, we got a photo and some great memories to take home. I would recommend this to anyone who loves puzzles or mysteries. It's a great gift idea too.

30th Birthday. We did room 33 on 7th March - four of us did it wide age range. it was great fun, cryptic clues so kept you thinking against the clock, got out with just under 3 minutes to spare! Recommend as family or friends day out

Great entertainment for teenagers!. Very clever concept that kept my teenage children well entertained for just under an hour. Quite an achievement nowadays! There were just the three of us and I relaxed and watched with pride whilst my 15 year old and 12 year old solved all of the clues in Room 33. They worked together as a team which is also a rare event nowadays! A knowledge of history is not required but solving clues is essential.

Chinese Themed Room. Went with a group of friends and had an absolute blast. A really friendly welcome from the staff at Escape Rooms and a clear and lively briefing before we went into the rooms. The theme was brilliant throughout and the clues were useful when we needed them. This is the second one that we've done in London and is definitely the best - for complexity and variety of puzzles to be completed. A great experience and well worth the money!

some hard thinking but a lot of fun & different. I went with my 4 sisters and brother-in-law, for my youngest sister's 18th birthday. We were looking forward to this as we love playing games, competitions and challenges and we're quite competitive. It was a lot of fun, not easy at all, you need to think outside of the box and use all the clues to solve the puzzle. We needed to use some hints to guide us in the right way, this helped us to figure out the way to use the clues for other puzzles. Only problem we had was the lady giving us hints via the walkie talkie had a strong American accent and unfortunately for us, via the walkie talkie we struggled to understand some of what she was saying, I hope she takes no offence but we struggled to understand and that led to further confusion. The lady was lovely and very helpful and the mentioned struggle can not be helped, so we just had to work with it. We did complete the puzzle with only 1min 40secs to spare lol! It's definitely something different to try, it's fun, it's a good bonding experience and there's lot's to talk about after. I would definitely recommend to anyone that likes a fun challenge, reminded us a lot of crystal maze from the 90's :-)-no cameras allowed-apprx 5mins walk from the station-lockers are provided-you'll be there for approximately 90mins max
Mysterious. really enjoyed this no-linear quest room, my friends and I were very happy to solve all the clues on time!

Like nothing I've ever done before. I had no idea what to expect from my trip to Escape Rooms, but had been told it's like Crystal Maze meets The Cube. There were five of us in the team (me, my wife and the in laws) and the main instruction was that teamwork would be vital. Not necessarily our strong point.Initially we had not idea what was going on. We were in a room surrounded by seemingly random stuff and it was a bit of a free for all. After a while, however, we started spotting patterns, piecing things together and feeling like we were making progress. We gave up hitting completing the puzzle withing the hour limit early on, but a series of well times hints (you get three without penalty) and some directing from the very helpful staff, we grabbed victory from the jaws of defeat and made it out with 58 seconds to spare.We all had a great time and really did feel like we had achieved something. Plus we have our survivors photo up on the wall for posterity.A thoroughly enjoyable experience. Definitely recommended.

Not enough puzzles. We visited the Pharaoh room on 13 February. There were 4 of us and this was the third escape room we had done - previously Hint Hunt. Overall we all found this experience a let down - there were not enough puzzles for 4 people to do at the same time and the puzzles were too complicated, and it would be impossible to get some of them without a clue. The people were all very nice and the set up it professional.We will not be returning to Escape Rooms as it was not in the same league as Hint Hunt.

We visited for my birthday. Escape Rooms were great. I went with my family for my birthday and it was such fun. The staff were friendly and the game, Room 33, was challenging and exciting! I would recommend for sure and would love to go back and try out their other room.

Excellent experience. I came here with 3 of my other friends as a after dinner activity. We did Room 33 and it was quite a easy place to find. When we got there, the staff was very friendly and approachable. We were given clear instructions and got a briefing. There were two rooms for our room, first was a laser room which we didnt expect at all but was very fun. Second was a room full of clues and we had to escape. Our instructor was very helpful asking us if we need any clues or help from time to time. We managed to escape the room with 11 minutes remaining. I would recommend this place for any one looking to play escape rooms. I would definately come back and play the other room.

Great for Team Bonding!. We did this as a belated work Christmas do... it was surprisingly hard! There were 6 of us doing the laser room. It was lots of fun, we made it out with 6 mins to spare and with only using 2 of the 3 hints!

Great staff, great game. We have done a couple of these escape games at other locations but this was the first at this place.The staff were so friendly, informative and really passionate. This made playing the game even better.The location is great and the decoration with all the pictures on the walls looks so good.We will definitely be back to play their other room. If you haven't tried escape games, you have to, they are so fun and great team work :)
Great fun!. Great way to spend an hour in London. Five of us in it. Have done a few escape rooms before and this ranked well against the others. Looking forward to returning to do the second room

What fun! Will return to escape the second room!. The family was in London getting ready to see daughter No2 and boyfriend off travelling for four or five months - first stop India. We had time to kill in London between Lunch and Heathrow and though the Escape Rooms sounded like good fun.It certainly was! None of us had done anything like this before. We had a hour to solve the clues and riddles to get out of a Chinese themed room. It was a good 30 minutes before we really got started. The puzzles did not have to be done in any order and there was something there for each of us. In fact I think we all solved an equal number of puzzles - which was good.We made it out with 2 hints and 3 minutes and 40 seconds left on the clock!It was great fun and we will be returning to solve their second room. Now we have done one room, we hope we can do better!!!

Amazing. A complete novice, I had no idea what to expect with this! What I got was an hour and a half of fun - challenging, exciting, frustrating fun!! We raced against the clock to find our way out. Staff were incredible and everything ran to time; they didn't rush us out even though we were the last people of the day! Would definitely go again.

Great fun and a real brain teaser!. My 15 year old son did an Escape Rooms challenge with two friends for his birthday. They had a great time - the clues are not easy though! And I'd say 15 is probably the youngest you could be to work out the puzzles. The staff were great and on hand to give them hints when they got really stuck. Great afternoon out - would recommend it for something completely different to do, as well as great for team-building.

Great family fun!. Escape Rooms is a short stroll from the old London Dungeons in Tooley street. Just a small doorway and not much to look at from the outside but easy to find. A buzzer was answered immediately and we were welcomed inside.We only had to wait a couple of minutes before we were met by our friendly guide and taken downstairs to the Pharaohs Chamber. We were told the game rules and a few tips and we were off. Our family consisted of 2 (young) seniors, 2 parents and 2 teens and we completed the room with 45 seconds to spare, making it onto the wall of fame. We felt the difficulty level was pretty much perfect (although we did need a few hints to get done in the hour).Free water and lockers are provided. There are no real physical requirements and I would imagine anyone from 8-80 would enjoy it. Just dress comfortably and take your wits!Allow 1.5 hours for the whole experience. I would definitely recommend it and will be going back to try the other room soon.

Brilliant time!. We booked the Escape Room as a party of our Xmas Party outing, and we had so much fun trying to solve the puzzles. It was a bit tricky to get our head around some of them but nonetheless we probably used parts of our brain we don't usually use! The puzzles were well planned and an hour is more than enough. The 6 of us managed to complete the puzzles and light the fire for the gods (not real fire) in the Pharaohs Chamber with just 1.5 minutes left! Definitely worth the trip and if you make it you get to have a photo taken and be placed on the hall of fame. (There are a lot there already) Highly recommended.

Great fun and team working!. wow, we did not know what to expect! we went here for a girls Christmas night out. something a bit different to what we normally do. We thought it was great, great experience and I want to go back and try the other room! with a 40% success rate unfortunately we made it out in 66 minutes rather than 60! Fantastic and worth the challenge!

Great fun. Went to one abroad last year with my other half and found this here. Went with group of friends and never had so much fun. Staff were also brilliant only downside was wanted to do it again but so popular need to wait till end of next month but just shows how great it is

Great fun, highly recommended before dinner.. 6 of us decided to give this a go before eating out. You have an hour to escape from the room, the rules are clear and you have contact with the staff, who were helpful and polite. We all had great fun and enjoyed the experience. Definitely recommended.

Brilliant fun!. This was such good fun, and completely different to anything I've ever done. We did 'Room 33'. I don't want to give away too much detail but their website outlines the premise.Locked in a room we had an hour to find all the clues and gradually piece it all together to help us escape. It was great fun, everyone loved it and we escaped with 4 minutes to spare!They give you clues via a walkie talkie, so no need to despair if you're really struggling. And they won't kick you out if you get to the time limit without completing it, so you don't need to fear never knowing how it ended! It's honestly such great fun trying to work together to escape the room. It's walking distance from London Bridge station, and the staff were enthusiastic. Just make sure you check and remember EVERYTHING, and note it all down if you need to!

Fantastic!!. Went with 2 friends, wasn't sure what to expect and don't want to put too much on here in case I give it away but it was brilliant!! I can't recommend it more!! Fantastic way of spending an hour especially on a rainy day!!! Got to be done!!

Excellent hour to spend in London. We did this over the weekend and it was great fun. We (a group of 5) did the Pharaohs chamber and escaped with only 3 minutes left.The location was very easy to get to, 5 minuted from London Bridge Station. The staff were very friendly and eager to help. The room itself was very well laid out and the puzzles were great. They ranged from very easy to insanely hard. Luckily the staff are very helpful and give you 3 hints should you need them as well as help push you in the right direction.I though the room would be quite small and dark which was a bit of a worry as one of the team can get claustrophobic but it was a large very well lit room.Definitely recommend, we are already organizing a day to do the second room.

Great fun. This was the 2nd escape from a room experience I have done, but the first with escape rooms. The event was very well organised and much less abstract than the previous experience. We were a mixed group of people who have been to these before and newbies and all really enjoyed the hour. A worthwhile fun experience. Thanks to Oscar the games facilitator!
Fantastic Group Activity. Absolutely brilliant experience. It was a change from the usual activities that take place in london and it was superb value for money. A great way to have fun with friends.

we didn't escape - too proud to ask for hints !. we visited with our 2 children (17 & 20) and had a great time. we did room 33 and don't want to spoil it for anyone but you really do need to ask for hints, especially when they are offered ! although it wasn't as "technology" enabled as I expected it to be, this didn't distract from the experience.Also, listen to all the advice you are given, and maybe even think about writing it down, as we forgot some of what we were told in the introduction.

Wonderful experience.. I came to do this with a bunch of friends and I was definitely not disappointed! The staff were friendly, professional and full of smiles. As someone who hadn't done this kind of thing before, they were very helpful and patient in answering all of our questions (we asked a lot!). As for the game itself, it is quite difficult, but I think it's just right. We felt challenged without feeling that the game was impossible. The hint system they have is great, a few well timed hints through the walkie talkie is just what you need to set you on the right track without spoiling the puzzles, our member of staff never just simply told us what to do. We ended up escaping with 27 seconds left, which made for some pretty intense stuff! Overall, we had a really great time, and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for something fun and unusual in London. Just remember to book far ahead in advance!

Good fun. Great way to spend an hour while in London. My daughter booked it as she had been before, was not sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised, we played the pharaoh room which was good. The staff were very good, good family fun I would recommend it

Amazing activity. I went with my husband and 2 other couples. Had a few drinks before but went in with a "winning mentality"! I was not sure what to expect but thought the clues may be easy...little did I know there were very hard and it really is a team game. We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and want to go again, and we are in the midst of booking it! I have recommended this to various friends. Great fun we had - even though we did not manage to escape :( Staff were very nice and lovely to have the experience with!

Mediocre escape room. Our room was set up incorrectly and therefore unsolvable due to the a missing component- stressful and unsatisfying gameplay. Staff did not apologise.Mostly reasonable puzzles but several require unfair lateral leaps and are poorly clued.Shoddy and tired-looking decor and props really take you out of the game world.The worst escape room I have played.

A fun and exciting first date. Fantastic event the staff were amazing. The puzzles challenging enough. We did the chinese themed room and accomplished it in 56 mins with 2 clues and with just 2 people. Would highly recommend this place.

Different way to spend an hour. I was part of of a group of four and we played the pharaoh escape room today (Saturday 17th October) and escaped with 3 and a half minutes left! It was a fun experience but some of the puzzles were very hard to work out with no instructions at all; we had to use all of our three hints. But I suppose that's why you have them. I'd definitely recommend it but I think a little bit more direction at the start would be helpful.

So much fun and something a bit different. This is a great way to spend an hour in London. The location is easy to get to. The staff are incredibly friendly. The room is challenging and very well crafted. We loved the laser room! Thanks for a fun afternoon

Something different, engages the brain and is great fun!. A great way to spend an hour! Well crafted fun puzzles that are interesting and are not rocket science. Our hosts were welcoming and very friendly, especially the amazing Stephanie who is awesome! The puzzles all interact to keep a group busy. Help available if you get stuck, so nothing to worry about if you miss something obvious. We did Room 33 and managed to escape with 3 mins to spare.The rooms are only accessible via stairs, and a small amount of physical activity is needed at times, so not recommended for people with walking difficulties at this particular venue.We had a fun time, and would certainly do other rooms at other times.

Challenging and very satisfying . Went there with my family and there were 7 of us.We played the Pharoahs Chamber room.Service was great. We were hosted by a friendly gentleman. He made us feel welcomed and explained the rules and storyline clearly to us prior to the game. We were given a walkie talkie to get hints from the host.Location was good, not too difficult to look for as it is close to the underground station. Premise was clean with simple decoration with many previous players photos on the walls.The game itself was great, involving some interesting technologies rather than locks after locks. In fact, there wasnt many pad locks, which I was pretty impressed. The puzzles fit into the theme of the game. The puzzles were all well planned though one or two of them were a bit too difficult and maybe a little illogical/insolvable without a hint from the gamemaster. The set was a little dull and basic.The puzzles were quite difficult and i wouldnt recommend it to those who are new to escape game. We managed to escape with a few mins left.We were asked to take a group photo in the end and were given pens to draw on, (to be put on the wall of fame!) which was a nice touch to end the experience. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience and i would return for their other room.

A lot of fun!. The room was really challenging and fun. Lots of puzzles and non linear so perfect for a group. Staff was really nice. We actually arrived earlier and they didn't mind and let us in as soon as the room was ready. Room was a bit difficult so I wouldn't recommend it for beginners. Great place and experience!

There are better Escape Games out there. My friends and I visited Escape Rooms to play Pharoahs Chamber and left a little disappointed. The puzzle didn't not make sense and did not fit into the theme of the room. There were electrical devices against the walls in what was suppose to be an Egyptian tomb. We did manage to escape and felt some puzzles were really random and very difficult to solve which we needed a few hints on. The hints were given through a walkie talkie which I never find is great in an escape game because it's very unclear especially as the host's first language wasn't English. There are better Escape Games in London

Something new and very entertaining!. We played the Egyptian pharaoh room as a team of 6 and managed to escape with 5 minutes to spare!It's great fun for a bunch of mates to play and I would imagine it would be a good corporate team building event.The game itself is fairly challenging, but not so hard that it becomes frustrating and therefore boring. The staff give you a limited number of tips via a walkie talkie, which to be fair is a massive help and you can ask an unlimited number of yes/no questions. I think most teams would struggle with no tips at all.Overall I'd say great fun and would highly recommend, it's something new that I've never seen before.My only tip would be to incorporate it with a day out etc. as the game only lasts an hour at the longest and wouldn't be worth travelling to London for just to play the game. (depending where you're travelling from obviously) Especially if you're super clever and escape within 10 minutes!
We escaped just 3 mins before time!. A great experience. It's good for families, friends, and even couples. I recommended it to all my friends.

A Great Family Activity!!!. We went along to Escape Rooms and the Pharaohs Chamber, unsure about what to expect- but it was fantastic fun! There were 5 adults and 2 teenage boys - a great way to keep everyone of all ages entertained. Our Games Master was fab- the puzzles were hard but we managed to escape! Thumbs up!

Fantastic Fun. Had a great time at escape rooms near London Bridge. On arrival we were greeted by our very enthusiastic guide Boris, who clearly loves his job and done brilliantly at setting the scene for our scenario. Boris was available on the a two way radio throughout our attempt to escape from our room. He would give us gentle nudges in the right direction when we we looked stuck on particular puzzles which helped us escape with 5 minutes remaining. Would very much recommend this as a group activity. It's lots of fun and it's something you talk about for days afterwards.

Really fun for a group!. Came here with 8 people, booking two rooms to start at 10:30am on a Sunday and it was absolute mayhem/fun!! Stephanie, our room's guide in particular was amazing and made our experience really great. She put up with us four girls screaming a lot out of excitement and was so patient on the walkie talkies (during the game). We were pretty nervous going in, but the time pressure was manageable (phew we got out with time to spare!) and Room 33 was good in the sense that we didn't feel claustrophobic or creeped out of anything. Can't go into detail about the game but just had loads of fun solving the puzzles that were so clever. Really made us feel like we were in an adventure movie and everything! It was very well done and we'd love to come back to have a go at the other room!p.s. If you do come please respect the game guides by being patient, be gentle with the game props, and listen to their instructions carefully, the staff appreciate it a lot when us guests follow the rules, makes it a lot more enjoyable.

A lot of fun!. This actually turned out to be more fun that I thought it would be. I was a bit sceptical about 1 hour of puzzles and mind teasers - But it actually goes very quickly! We did Room 33 and it was all quite cleverly done. Loved the first part :-) Overall, it was challenging but not frustrating and great for team work because everyone contributes something different. Also, you can ask for hints if you get really stuck. If you have played that game Room, you have an idea of what you need to do. If I had to give it a negative, I would say only that I think it would be more fun with a few more physical challenges or interactions.

Really Fun!. This experience was loads of fun! We did the Pharaohs Chambers. There was 6 of us so we were able to have the room on our own. We escaped with 12 minutes to spare! It was so much fun that as soon as we got out, we all wanted to do the other room, but it was not available. If you love code breaking, puzzles and cryptic clues ( pun intended) you'll love this. We will be going back to do the other room soon.
Friday night out . A great but frantic night out. Definitely needed a beer afterwards. Well worth going. Booking up for Room 33 already - looking forward for more rooms to be opened.

Challenging but excellent experience. 6 of us did the Pharaoh's Chamber - was our first time in an Escape Room so wasn't sure what to expect, but we all really enjoyed it and want to go back and try the other room. The staff were very friendly and helpful with plenty of information/explanations given before we started... and during the challenge they keep track of your progress and can offer help if required and requested. Was a challenging 60 minutes, but the different types of puzzles within the room meant there was something to suit everyone in our group so we all got involved and contributed to successfully completing the room and making the wall of fame. Would highly recommend this as a fun activity for a group of friends
Work outing. Great location for a work party! We had two groups split over two rooms so tested the options out. Well managed and extremely good fun.

Challenging hour. We arrived about 20 minutes before, which was just about right. The first challenge was finding the front door. Although the address is Tooley Street, it's at the rear of the building, approached from Magdalene Street.The staff were really friendly and helpful. They have a nudge when we were on the right lines, but for example, hadn't lined some codes up perfectly.We solved the problem, but missed the target time by 2 minutes. They were kind enough to let us finish as we were so close.It's a bit rough and ready, but who cares as I wasn't looking at the quality of the pInt finish.It was a fun hour that ALL our family enjoyed.I will go again to try the other room.

Excellent experience!. Last night we went to Escape rooms for a work leaving do. I couldn't recommend it enough to anyone looking for a fun group activity. I booked by phone a few weeks earlier and was pleased with the customer service I received from the staff from the first point of contact.There were 8 of us split into two teams of 4. The two staff on duty were welcoming and accommodating, and patient with some of the merrier amongst us!!My team did room 33 and we had Anthony looking after us. He explained the storyline and helped us along the way when we needed clues. He also got into the competitive spirit, cheering with us when we beat the other team! :)The whole experience was so interesting and engaging, like nothing I've ever done before, and we left in very high spirits!Thanks Escape Rooms! Will definitely be returning to try the Pharaoh's chamber!
Staff night out. we went for a work night out. You need to make sure you have a clever team. we came last but very well organised and nice staff not to busy very enjoyable night
Quite a challenge!. Good family fun, especially under time pressure, you don't want to fail, you want to be on the wall of fame! We will go back and do the other room next time.

Awesome! . 4 first timers and we did both rooms. Both rooms had good stories and some very challenging puzzles and logic.
