Staff were enthusiastic, great with understanding when help was needed or not. Id say room 33 was our favourite out of the two, but maybe that's biased as that's the one we escaped from.
Anyone thinking of going, go!

Awesome experience!. Would totally recommend Escape Rooms. Awesome staff (great sense of humour and really welcoming) and great puzzles (harder and more sophisticated than we can imagine!). Had a brilliant time. 4 of us did this together, and it was a frantic hour, which flew by really quickly. Hint: It's better if you escape within the allotted time - which our team managed to do of course - and with style. We had 38 seconds to spare. Ps - we did the Pharoh's chamber. But would definitely return to do the other room.

Escape Room Fun. This was our Second room tackled, Room 33... It was the hardest of the two. Great family fun racing against each other even though we lost, again! Definitely recommend for family or friends or a work group outing.

Brilliant experience and staff!. We visited room 33 as a family group of five ranging in age from 20s to 60s.We all loved it - although some were more effective than others!This is such a clever set-up with challenging puzzles that really test your thinking - it is obvious that a lot of work and planning has gone into this.I must mention the young staff who are just brilliant. The young man who was assigned to us - sorry I forgot his name - was just so determined that we should enjoy the experience cleverly giving us 'hints' at just the right time, (he was not actually with us but in radio communication and could see our progress on camera). He managed to steer us in the right direction while not actually giving us answers. We managed to escape with just 1min and seconds to spare - very exciting and great sense of achievement!It was lovely to receive a photograph of our team to take home - I was also emailed a copy - great idea and much appreciated!I really recommend this experience for groups of families or friends of any age - just don't expect it to be easy!!

AMAZING. I did this for my birthday and brought three of my friends. We had such a great time, it was hard but really fun to work together to solve. We managed to get out in 48 minutes and we only used two hints. The staff were great and we would recommend this experience to anyone, especially if they love puzzles and riddles
Awesome - really different experience. Went with my family and were really looked after by the ER team. Really enjoyed it and we completed the challenge with a minute to spare!
Escape Rooms. Brilliant experience. Challenging but great fun. Perfect for the thinking person and anyone else, adults and children. Team work essential! My team will definitely return.

GREAT 40TH ANNIVERSARY TREAT. Really challenging, but great fun. We all had a great time. Managed to complete with a few hints, but went 3 or 4 minutes over so did not make it onto the wall of fame. Would recommend it. Great way to spend an hour (or maybe a bit more!)
An hour full of excitement. Escape Rooms is the right place to go on a rainy afternoon when you've seen every single sight in London! Highly recommended!

A Fun Hour in the Egyptian Room. We got out! With a little time to spare! A fun hour with a good range of puzzles. Some quite challenging. Compared with other escape rooms there was not much that our 7 year old could contribute. Set up was neat and efficient. The room was well presented. The staff were very friendly, welcoming and made sure that the groups coming and going were properly briefed and looked after. Would happily return to do the other room.

Great Hour of Entertainment . We did room 33; tricky with some clever puzzles. All automated so very slick and good support when required. Won't say any more so as to not give any clues but well worth a go if you're a fan of escape rooms!

Great afternoon activity. Had lots of fun in the Egyptian room - would highly recommend it.
Great for groups of friends 2-4 people or so?

Great fun!. Just visited today for my 21st birthday with 4 friends. We did Room 33. It was very challenging as we have never done it before, but after a few hints it's was really fun and we escaped with 9 minutes to spare! Really polite staff and the photo session afterwards was a lovely way to end it all :)

Room 33 - challenging but very fun. 5 of us did the Chinese themed room 33. Whilst it is fairly difficult, and can take a while to get started in the right direction, it is exhilarating and very high tech for an escape room. Highly recommend.

Great Fun!!!!. We did the Chinese Room 33 with a group of 5 (mothers & daughters) and had a brilliant time. The set up is very well planned out and details of the design are great, with a good balance of difficult tasks and hints. We made it just in time, 1 minute to spare, but only used 1 out of 3 available hints. I highly recommend to include this in your London tourist plans, especially as the location is very convenient near London Bridge.

Egyptian Room. My friends and I played the Egyptian Room for my birthday. None of us had ever heard of an escape room before I saw it on the Big Bang Theory so we weren't really sure what to expect. We entered the room and stood around a bit confused and wondering what to do first, but once we got stuck in it was absolutely brilliant! Every time we solved a clue or found a missing piece we got so excited! The time went so quickly and we managed to get out, but I'm sure they felt sorry for us and added more time to our clock as there was only 3 of us instead of the 5 we'd booked for.I thought it looked like fun when I booked it, but it was so much better than I expected and we can't wait for the next birthday to do the Chinese Room.

Great fun with colleagues, friends or family. We were five colleagues doing this challenge as a team building exercise. It was challenging and provided great fun for an hour (we needed the full 60 minutes to escape). We would recommend it not only for team building but also as an alternative to other forms of more traditional entertainment. The price of less than £20 per person for a group of 5 or 6 people makes it very affordable.

Something a bit different to do with your friends. Did the Pharoah's Chamber with 5 friends on a Sunday night - had a great time exploring and eventually escaping with 18 minutes to spare. We figured out the rough idea for most of the puzzles quite quickly/easily, but the big challenge for us was actually 'completing' them in the way the chamber wanted us to. The staff were helpful and reassured us via the radio that we were well on the right track and eventually we made it out having had some laughs along the way. The puzzles certainly aren't for the fainthearted - a degree of lateral thinking and creativity was needed to find the solutions - but it was engrossing and had us entertained throughout.

Great way to spend an hour in London. I booked the Escape rooms for our wedding anniversary as we both like to think we're good at solving clues/puzzles etc and we thought we'd see what all the hype was about. We had been warned that you normally need a team of 3-5 people in order to do this but some brave souls had managed to complete it with two, so I didn't hesitate in booking the Chinese Emporer's room as I knew we could do it between us. My husband didn't know about it until we got there and was actually really up for it. The staff were really friendly and introduced us to the concept of the game (as we'd never done anything like this before). We were given some instructions and then shown to our "escape room". In all honesty we were completely thrown when we first started but slowly we started to get the hang of it. Our adrenaline was pumping and we really got into the game. We did have to ask for all three clues but we got there in the end and managed to complete the puzzle with 7 seconds to go! We were so impressed with the way it was all put together and the level of effort put into it. We are going to go back with a bigger group so that we can split up and compete against each other, this time we'll do the Mummy themed room.

Not worth the money. Was disappointed ... Did not expect or want it to be easy but wow far too hard we did the find the Chinese urn ..impossible .... Really took the fun out of it ..... Very expensive for what it is ..... But would do another room if it was half the price

mind-boggling but so much fun!. Having done an escape room experience before I thought I would know what to expect but Escape rooms was very different and much more challenging than I thought. Some colleague and I decided to tackle room 33 where you have to retrieve a very precious vase. It is amazing how much detail goes into these rooms and team work and communication is very important. Our game controller was really nice and he helped out with hints which we needed a lot of but we had lots of fun and will be back to try the other room they have available. Due to popularity time slots are few and far between so I suggest if you see a date you want then book it as it will likely be gone by the time you come back after making a quick cup of tea. Remember have fun and communicate.

Challenging and fun teamwork. I took my sister and our husbands to do Pharoah's Chamber. I've never done anything like this before and am fairly crap at code breaking, but you find yourselves pooling resources and everyone contributes. We did need clues - as Exit Game Virgins some of the logic was a bit beyond us (well, beyond me, anyway.) But it was really fun and dead exiting when you actually got a clue finished! At the end we all thought that everyone else was really clever so it was a nice bonding activity. Don't have too many beers before hand by the way.

Tube Strike Visit. Booked this a couple of months ahead for our sons birthday and then found there was a tube strike on the day. Got an email from Escape Rooms telling us to phone on the day if we had problems. We did! But were told not to worry and to get here as soon as we could. We were 35 minutes late but were met with friendly smiles and went straight down to our room. We found this room the hardest of any we had done and struggled a lot. There were 5 of us and we have done a few other Escape rooms but this really stretched us all. We managed to get out with 3 hints and 5 mins to spare. I have no idea how we managed this. It was a good themed room and friendly helpful staff but not suitable for 1st timers or younger players. The toilet was also out of order which after a 3 hour journey was a big problem.

Very Satisfying and Unique Experience. Staff is super-friendly, the puzzles were just the right difficulty. This was my first escape room game and this place has definitely met our expectations. We did the Pharaoh's Chamber and will be coming back for Room 33 for sure.

If you are only doing one escape game, try another. I have to confess that a small group of my friends and I have become slightly escape room addicts... So having done a few of them I felt it just be helpful to offer a few reviews.Pharos Chamber was the third escape game room that we tried and I have to admit we were all slightly disappointed.When we got stuck, instead of giving us a hint, the assistant just told us how to solve the problem which leaves you with less satisfaction of having solved it mostly on your own. The set was a little bit dull and 'cheap' looking, and there wasn't really a narrative or story which threaded the challenges together. When we finally completed all of the puzzles the concluding 'finale' was underwhelming in that we didn't quite know that we'd finished it!If you are only going to go to one escape game, I wouldn't put this one at the top of your list...

A great experience. I bought this for my boyfriends birthday and it makes for a lovely evening! I did find it quite hard- i wont give anything away :)Super friendly staff as well! Something different, give it a go!

Escaping. Something a little different to do . Four of us had no idea what to expect and we all loved it . Quickest hour of my life . Would try a different escape room next time . Sworn to secrecy so can't tell any more about it . Try it yourself !

So much fun in 60 minutes. My team and I (seven of us) took on the Pharaoh's Chamber after an all day team meeting. None of us had done an escape room before so we didn't know quite what to expect.The escape room guys were really friendly and talked us through what would be unfolding over the next hour. We were then taken down into the room and they started the clock!The next 60 minutes were great fun. At first, with seven people in there, I wasn't sure how we were going to work together but after a few minutes the team naturally broke off into smaller groups to tackle different puzzles but then kept coming back together to discuss progress / swap over on tasks.Apparently with a 40% success rate, we were thrilled to become part of the minority and successfully complete the challenge with four minutes to spare!!As well as being great on the day, the team were also really helpful in the lead up to the day - really responsive to queries on email and the phone.Definitely recommend this, both for work colleagues and groups of friends.

Birthday Treat. . This is nicely situated under the gaze of the shard building. All of the staff were wonderfully welcoming. We played the pharaoh room, and whilst we narrowly missed completing it in an hour it was a load of fun and very challenging. You are given a nice free team photo afterwards will return.

Challenging and great fun. First escape game we've ever done and it was a really fun experience. We made it with just 5 seconds to spare (in Room 33). Some of the puzzles are very difficult. If you like logic and number puzzles and the idea of a crystal maze-style team challenge you will probably enjoy Escape Rooms.

Fabulous for a 40th birthday!. We had a blast in the Pharaoh's room at the weekend. We did it with just a minute to spare but this was only thanks to the tips from the excellent staff. Everyone in my group was really impressed and we want to go back and do the second room. Definitely recommend it!
So much fun!!. Booked this for my boyfriend's birthday with his friends. We had a blast! Will def return to do the second room option. Everyone loved it!!

Great time and cool challenge. This was great. Physical, mental and teamwork challenge -- fun time with a group of 5 friends. From crawling through laser lights to frantically working through puzzles in a complicated room, we had a blast and made it out in time! First experience like this and I thought it was well done. The team at Escape Rooms really seemed to care about their service and helping us enjoy it. Thumbs up.

Fantastic fun - highly recommended. We had a great time in Room 33, completing it with 10 mins to spare. The puzzles were really tricky and frantic. Dont read anything about it beforehand, just turn up and throw yourself into it. We had a fantastic time.

Fabulous activity...couldn't recommend more!!. I booked this for a hen party trip to London and couldn't have been more thrilled with the reaction!!!All the girls absolutely loved it!The staff are so friendly, instantly putting you at ease when you first arrive! One of our members is a nervous character and they couldn't have been more accommodating...taking her down to see the room first and just generally putting her mind at rest.The game itself is brilliant! We split into two groups so did both rooms...neither team were disappointed. We all came our frantically trying to tell our stories!If you're looking for something really fun and different, definitely go for this, I can't rave about it enough!!

Great birthday treat!. We had an absolutely amazing time in Pharaoh's room. We loved it from start to finish. Despite not managing it within the 60 minutes we came out buzzing afterwards vowing to complete the other room too.

Awesome! Fab experience - an excellent way to spend a Sunday morning!. We arrived at the Escape Rooms not really knowing what to expect. It was fairly early on a Sunday morning (the only time available) and were wary of it being a let down. We couldn't have been more wrong! There were four of us in our group (all late twenties) and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff are really welcoming and it's a really different, fun activity to do. I've been raving about it to all my friends, family and colleagues and we'll definitely come back to do the Pharaoh Room!! - Team Assassinorum Execution Force

Brilliant fun, excellent customer service!. We have visited Escape Rooms three times in total. The first time there was an error with our booking, which meant we had to be turned away. However, the staff were very apologetic, refunded our travel costs, and offered to give us our next experience for free.The second time (which was indeed free) we entered the Pharaoh's Chamber. Having never done anything like this before we struggled with some of the puzzles and used all three hints, however we really enjoyed the experience and escaped the room with seven minutes to spare.On our third visit we took on the challenge of Room 33, a Chinese-themed room. We emailed the company before hand to check our booking had gone through, still remembering our first visit. They replied that yes, we were definitely booked in, and apologised again for our first experience. We found Room 33 just as fun as the Pharaoh's Chamber, although having now got the hang of how these things work we managed to escape with only one hint and 22 minutes to spare! The staff were happy to take our photo in a room filled with lasers, and we left victorious.Definitely recommended for groups of adult friends, or families with older children.

Great cross-generational fun :). Had a terrific time in the Pharaoh room. Grandparents, parents and kids working in (almost) perfect harmony! The staff were very welcoming and helped us get the most out of our hour in the puzzle room. A lovely experience that worked for all ages (12 through to 78) and one we will all remember.

Great party for 12 year old with a mixed group of friends - different and fun. My son had his birthday here today - one guest was late but the venue was flexible and allowed boys to start when last guest arrived. Complex puzzles and lots to keep 6 participants involved. A great place for a party.

Pharoahs Chamber. I consider this game just about impossible to do, BUT the set is amazing and if they were to make the puzzles a bit easier, it could be a very good escape game. You enter what is probably one of the best sets that you will see in an escape room. All the Egyptian gold and pharoah stuff are brilliant. The format of the game is non linear, so everyone could concentrate on different tasks and different corners of the room. it does have two major drwbacks for me. Some of the puzzles are just about impossible to solve , just far too abstract and nowhere near logical enough. The other problem is a common pet hate of mine in escape games... WALKIE TALKIES. They seem to be used in games where the location of the room is inconvenient to hook up to tv monitors for communication between the players and the game controllers. The walkie talkie here was just rubbish and made communication quite a problem. All that said, you have to admire the set, and if they would just re think their idea of ridiculously abstract puzzles, they would have a brilliant game, in my opinion.

A fun and challenging activity. We visited Escape Rooms for my best friend's hen in May 2015. The booking process was very simple and straightforward, with Kevin doing his best to answer my numerous questions (such as, is this suitable for a pregnant person!).The location is a bit difficult to find as the registered address on Tooley Street is not the venue at which the activity is held. However, this was a minor glitch. As it was a Sunday, finding parking on Tooley Street was not a problem.On arrival, the friendly team at Escape Rooms gave us a warm welcome and imparted clear instructions for the game. There were lockers available for us to store our belongings, which was a helpful touch.Without giving too much away, the game itself was challenging but lots of fun. The hens didn't know each other very well, so it was a perfect bonding activity. We also had the opportunity to have our photo taken at the end, to decorate the frame and display it at our chosen spot at the venue.The staff at Escape Rooms enhanced our experience with their friendly and easygoing attitude. Overall, Escape Rooms is an enjoyable and mentally-stimulating activity which is perfect for hen/birthday parties.

So much fun!. We went to Escape Rooms as part of a birthday celebrations weekend. We didnt really know what to expect apart from some of the blurb that they provide, which made it even more tense! It was so much fun and we had an absolute ball trying to work our way out of the rooms. Great location and the staff are so lovely!!! Perfect to follow up with a celebratory/ consolatory cocktail at the Shard!!! Can't wait to go next time and attempt the other room!!!
Fantastic night. Great staff and a fun room. A lot of entertainment for an evening with friends. Everyone at the venue was great at ensuring we had a good time.
Simply amazing. The experience is just incredible. Unbelievable how good all the mechanical parts work.I highly recomend anyone who want to enjoy for an hour to go there.
do it. had a fab time , sadly we did not get out in time ,but i will be trying room 33 soon .defo worth doing .

Great first experience. Great fun and anybody can take part, friendly staff explain everything and make the whole experience special. I definitely recommend you have a go. We will be going again very soon!!

What a great time!. We went to Escape Rooms for a team outing. Both of our teams did the Pharaoh Chambers and loved it. It was very challenging in the most enjoyable way and was so satisfying to get everything done. We finished in just over a minute past the allotted hour - gutted we couldn't do it in time!We can't wait to go back and try the other room. My only tip is to divide and conquer.

Room 33 - Great Fun,. 5 of us had no idea what to expect as had never played any computer based games which the rooms are based on.Boris was our guide (who watches from another room and helps along the way - 3 clues are allowed) - he was so lovely and helped with a few hints to point us in the right direction. I'm not quite sure how it all came together but we managed to escape with 8 minutes to spare and it felt wonderful! High fives, hugs and laughter all round!Thank you Boris.....and we will book again to try the other room.

Lots of fun!. I'd heard of these events for a while but this was my first time playing one. It was fun - the staff were friendly, the riddles were varied so everyone could contribute, the adrenaline just at the right level, and we came away exhilarated, Good value for a very entertaining hour!

Great for team building!. We chose Escape Rooms as part of our team building day and we really enjoyed it. This is the first time I've experienced anything like it and I haven't stopped recommending it since. I just wish the establishment was bigger-with more rooms, so we could continue visiting. I am definitely going to give room 33 a go the next time I'm there. We were in the pharaoh's chamber this time and the puzzles, although hard, were very enjoyable. The one hour time limit was just enough to keep everyone interested! The people that work there are also very helpful and made the experience all the more enjoyable.

Fantastic!. We did the room 33 escape with 7 minutes to spare so were very proud of ourselves! Our team ranged from ages 8 to 75 and we all loved it. The kids rated it as one of the best things they'd ever done and instantly wanted to have a go at the Pharaoh room. The guys who ran the event were really great, just enough information but no wasted time. The older members of our team were very grateful to be allowed to by-pass the wriggle on the floor through the laser section! Would highly recommend a visit.

One of the best Escape Rooms in London. I've now been to nine escape rooms in London, and Room 33 was clearly up there with the best. If you're only going to try one, then for me it's a coin flip between Escape Rooms and Clue Quest for the best experience.The host was enthusiastic and engaging, the room was full of interesting puzzles and the overall experience was great.If you're a fan of the genre, then this stands out because of its non linearity and the unusual mechanics for the puzzles - don't expect this to be a series of numbers/keys for padlocks.
Managers day out. Great place to help with team building! We had loads of fun. Their customer service is great. Definitely worth it.. Will be going back again!
Lots of fun. Great fun at Escape Rooms in London Bridge. Really well put together puzzles, with helpful and friendly staff.

For 2 people: do NOT book the Pharoah Chamber!. Do not misunderstand me: it was a great fun and wonderful spent money and time! But we didn't make it :(The owner told us that the other room is simpler and is recommended for 2 people. It is pity we didn't know this, may be is worth mentioning in site.Pharoah Chamber is very interesting and challenging. Well I can't say more :pMay be if we would be more experienced in Escape games, we could do it in time or with less clues... May be one day we will back to London and have our revenge in the second room!
Great!. It was awesome fun, especially for me who's only done this kind of stuff in online games. The race against the clock was great, the riddles challenging, the design good. Highly recommended!

Amazing time, thank you for the experience. Myself and my friends went to do Room 33 last week and it was absolutely fantastic. More challenging than I expected however, without giving too much away I must mention that the lasers were fantastic and was definitely a different experience as well as something I don't believe I could of done anywhere else. Our team leader Antony, was a fantastic help, guiding us through without giving too much away and was very enthusiastic with us which helped build up the excitement and experience! Credit to him! We also got to have our photo on the wall! I will be back for the other two rooms! And I hope to see more rooms in the future. Great fun for everyone!
Great fun. Three of us managed to escape with 6 mins to spare. Great fun and very reasonably priced too. Staff very helpful.

Great activity sure to test your puzzle skills!. Went with 4 other people to room 33 where we had to steal a vase from a room (to access the vase we had to solve different tasks). Required good retention skills and some parts were hard to solve but you are allowed 3 hints from a member of staff (who observes you through a camera).all in all it was a unique experience and I would love to try it again

Excellent afternoon! Would defo do it again!!. Once of the best room escapes I've done! I booked this after attempting another room escape in Manchester with my husband, this time we went in a bigger group and it is much easier than going in just a couple! The staff were very helpful and lovely, they pointed us along in the right direction and gave us just enough help for us to solve the puzzle without telling us the answers completely. The room itself was great, it was filled with lots of fun and challenging puzzles which really made us think, but we escaped with 7 minutes to go! Sooo happy we got out!! Thank you for a great day out!

Amazingly thought out and great fun!. I went with a group of friends for a birthday party. We didn't really know what to expect as none of us had done a similar game before but we loved every minute of it! We chose the Pharaoh's Chamber and the puzzles were extremely clever and it was so much fun figuring them out as a group. The hints were very helpful as well, allowing us to understand what we were meant to do in detail. I would definitely recommend it to someone who is looking for a great activity to do with friends or family! I'd love to go back and try the other room too!

Challenging, but not impossible!. I went with my wife for her birthday after checking with Escape Rooms that it was fine to just have a group of 2 people. We did the Pharaohs Escape and thoroughly enjoyed it. There was a small technological glitch that meant we just went over the hour, but we claimed victory anyway! You definitely need 3 people for one of the puzzles, but the guys there are on a walkie talkie and will come in to help. The puzzles themselves ranged from basic to downright fiendish - but if you can think laterally as well as logically, it's quite easy to flow from one to the other. I'd definitely go back to do the other room they have as really enjoyed this - not sure my wife enjoyed it as much, but that was mainly due to me doing all the puzzles! The guys there were really friendly and obviously enjoy seeing how people approach the challenges in different ways.

Brilliant puzzling experience. This was our first visit to an "Escape rooms" experience and we would highly recommend it. Some really tricky puzzles which required us all to be very systematic and to work as a team if we were to escape before our time ran out. Great theme to the room which reminded us of the Crystal Maze from years gone by. A brilliant birthday treat - thank you boys!

Lower end of the spectrum for an exit game. My friends and I have done every exit game in London. Our experience at Escape rooms was unfortunately, the bottom of the barrel. We did the Pharaohs chamber.The theme had so much potential. But the execution was completely off. Puzzles that required jumps in logic (guessing). Disconnected story line. A lack of flow. Technology oriented puzzles that just ruined the atmosphere. I cannot recommend the Pharaohs chamber at Escape Rooms. Especially avoid it if you are new to the exit game genre. You will do much better, and have a better experience, at other similar establishments in London.

Room: Pharaoh's chamber: Great themed puzzle room with challanging puzzles. Went to this puzzle room with a group of 4. This room has multiple threads of puzzling going on throughout the room. One of the least 'linear' I have been to. The room is challanging and we had to use a clue to get out of this one. The room has a fantastic egyption theme and plenty of props and decoration around it. The puzzles varied throughout the room, you had to keep your eyes out for clues at all times.Overall experience - very enjoyable 2nd favorite so farPuzzling aspect - challangingRoom Theme - Fantastic Team work - plenty involved with this oneGreat puzzle. Thanks for the entertainment. Cant wait to try the next room when back in London

Great team building activity!. My team and I escaped from the Pharoh's Revenge Room yesterday and had a fantastic time, we even managed to escape! We'd like to say a big thank you to the team for such a great experience. I'd recommend this experience for work colleagues and friends!

Excellent time . Not knowing what to expect from these things,We went 6 of us, good price, to the Pharaohs roomThe puzzles were a lot harder than we imagined, but the help, support and advice we were given was excellentGreat birthday present or team bonding sessionHighly recommend

The perfect teamwork exercise!. I booked this for our office to do during a night out. None of us had never been to something similar and had no idea what to expect. As we were 11 participants we were divided into two team and got to take on one room per team. Both teams got out under less than an hour and were all ecstatic! We had the best time and I can truly recommend this to anyone who is looking to do a team event with either colleagues or friends! I honestly don't have any negative to say!
Go Team Red!!. Have just completed the Chinese themed room. 3 teams of 5. All had a great time. Would definitely recommend it. Oh, and my team won!!

Something different - Crystal Maze Style Experience. A hidden gem near Tower Bridge. Without spoiling the secrets of this experience, the Escape Rooms involves a small team of friends being locked in a room together, battling against time to solve clues and escape. There are Egyptian and Chinese themed room...what's behind the doors you have to wait and see. Great for family, friends and even work events. Try it out you won't be disappointed. http://www.escaperooms.co.uk/?gclid=CNfJvMCf-8MCFaoEwwodS0cA-A

An entertaining way to challenge the brain. I bought this as a Christmas present for my brothers and their partners and it was a great way to get together and have some fun. The tasks were fun but challenging and the handy hints helped us along the way. A friendly and different experience. I would definitely recommend it as something a little different for a get together with family or friends.

great fun. went with a group of friends to try out the smaller room (room 33). great fun, challenging puzzles and welcoming friendly staff who were able to give us some great help throughout the game without making it too easy. Would highly recommend and we are coming back to do the larger room.

Fun Challenge!. A group of 3 of us escaped from Room 33, booked as a friend's birthday treat. I had high expectations - having heard things about it - and it didn't disappoint!I thought the mixture of challenges was spot on - hadn't realised there would be some physical aspects to it... we really loved this. We were slightly baffled on a few occasions, but used our 3 'hints' to help us get back on track. Once things began to click into place, we were on a roll - and loved leaving victorious! I'd 100% recommend Escape Rooms to friends and colleagues. The staff were brilliant, challenge was good fun, and I am fortunate that this is right round the corner from where I live. Will be back to tackle the next room soon!
Great fun. We were really impressed with this Escape Room! Excellent difficulty level, and the staff made us feel very welcome.

ESCAPE!!!. Ok, firstly Jack our host ( owner ) was very friendly and gave us a quick background story towards our challenge. If you do 33 first as we did pay attention to the intro. Once locked in the room, my first reaction to the effects were WoW! There was a team of four of us which seemed the right amount for the puzzles if you split up and concentrate on certain tasks, yes some of the puzzles were cleverly designed you do have to think on a certain wavelength but overall enjoyable. Although we were out of time by just 5 minutes it didn't detract from playing the game and I would recommend this company to everyone who wants a challenge and something different. See my other review for their second room.

Already looking to book again!. This group of 40 something women had a fantastic time at the Escape Rooms last Saturday. It's not just for the 20 something geeks and gamers. My friends were a bit sceptical when we arrived for my birthday treat (that I booked for everyone), they didn't seem overly enthusiastic going in, but all came out buzzing and saying they couldn't wait to go back again and do another room.Yes, Pharaoh's Chamber was challenging, and we didn't get out in time, but that didn't stop us having a great experience. I would recommend this particular room from age 14 upwards.

Room 33. On arriving we found our guide to be very friendly and helpful - we were made to feel most welcome. Two out of the three of us had done an escape the room puzzle before in the USA. We chose Room 33 as our challenge. As soon as the door to the room was locked I felt an immediate sense of being trapped - can't say anymore without giving things away but it was a pretty good first impression. As we progressed, I felt almost overwhelmed by the amount of information and problems that were coming our way. We were able to solve some problems fairly quickly but there were a few things that ultimately we needed help with. There were only three of us so I feel we did quite well considering. Our guide offered us assistance from time to time which we were happy to accept. In the end we were out of there five minute after our one hour was up. We were grateful to be allowed this extra time, I am sure this would not be possible during busy times. All-in-all we had a great time and would recommend this to anyone!

Plenty of challenging puzzles. Three of us tackled Room 33. I liked the fact that there was plenty of scope for all three of us to tackle multiple puzzles in parallel, but it's always wise to keep each other appraised of your progress and clues.We didn't finish it all in the 60 minutes but Jack was lovely, he gave us hints, and perhaps because the room wasn't booked for the next slot he gave us the extra few minutes we needed to fully complete it. I really appreciated that. He told us that there's about a 30% success rate.I thoroughly enjoyed it and look forward to returning with more friends to tackle the Pharaoh's Chamber, and I wish them every success with this venture. I'd love for it to grow and grow.Oh - BTW - I felt that the first challenge was finding the place. Their address is R/O 134 Tooley Street. I suspect that actually means Rear Of 134 Tooley Street. When you get to 134 Tooley Street there's a side street called Magdalen St. There's a door there with 134 Tooley St. written on it. Continue road the corner onto Magdalen St (yes same name) and there's a black door with their escape logo on it. The Google street view of it (currently) doesn't show the logo. Here's a Google map link https://www.google.co.uk/maps/place/51%C2%B030'13.4%22N+0%C2%B004'54.3%22W/@51.503692,-0.0817258,21z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x0
Great fun!. Four of us booked to do Room 33 as a birthday treat. I would really recommend it - great fun and just challenging enough. We made it out in 52.5 minutes!

Great fun, but beware.... 5 of us went here for a shared birthday experience, and we are all in to board games and puzzles. We booked both rooms with a 30 min break in between and completed them both with over 10 mins to spare. The "beware" in the title was to make you aware that yes, some of the puzzles are quite challenging. If you have half an interest in codes, puzzles, maps, riddles then you will get a lot of enjoyment out of these games, but for younger children or those who find even crosswords a bit of a mystery might struggle. I have to say, that the staff are on hand to give advice and point out if you missed a clue, or as others mentioned, to offer help in solving some of the difficult puzzles (each room has about a dozen things you need to string together to win). These are all mental challenges, not physical, so you don't need to worry about hand-eye co-ordination or fitness, but you'll need your thinking-caps on!We found it very enjoyable, but it fits right into our comfort zone. As always, read the good and not so good reviews to see what you are letting yourself in for :0)

Really really difficult, but I liked the high tech nature. We did Room 33 which was very high tech, with lasers and electro-glass and stuff, but the puzzles were incredibly hard. Full details of my experience can be found on my blog - don't worry, no spoilers!: http://hyhoi.com/2015/01/escape-rooms-live-escape-game/- NinaHave You Heard Of It? | London recommendations site | HYHOI.com

We enjoyed our visit but there is room for improvement. We booked both rooms on the same day. We did Pharaoh's Chamber first and Room 33 (the Chinese room) afterwards. It was the first time we had done anything like this and so we struggled to know what to do at first. The staff are very welcoming, friendly and helpful but when you are in the rooms on your own it is not always obvious what to look for and how to solve the riddles. We didn't get out of either room in the 60 minutes but looking at photos and messages on the wall of fame plenty of other people have managed it! We enjoyed Room 33 more than Pharaoh's Chamber (apart from the Chinese music which began to get on our nerves after a while!). I agree with other reviewers that it might be helpful to have a little more of a briefing beforehand especially for those who who haven't done this type of thing before. Mikey and Kevin were really kind and helpful and I wish them every success with their Escape Rooms.

Pharaoh's Chamber - Could have been better. We booked the Pharaoh's Chamber to fit our party of six. Before we booked it came across this by chance on the net and thought it seemed to be a fun idea for the family over the festive holidays, perhaps even for my daughters birthday with her friends in the other room if we like it.We arrived to very welcoming staff, we were excited to play.We were led to our room but a room is all there is, everyone went to try do something or solve something, ok we not the brightest lol but I thought the props or special effects were a little somewhat.... lacking. There was no music to help create an atmosphere as such, just a room with simple props. The staff were nice and when we struggling they try give us clues on the walkies talkies but it is so hard to hear what they are saying over the walkies talkies.I was hoping for an hour of fun filled laughter we had a decent time but after the experience I didn't hear my daughter wanting to have this as part of her birthday party agenda with her friends no more.The staff told us the other chamber of the Chinese theme has lasers and 2 rooms to explore, sounds more fun wish we had done that instead but that room max is 5 ppl only.The experience overall is okay but for the entertainment we got from it I thought was a little pricey.

Would be more enjoyable is the puzzle was easier. I was so excited about this Escape Room but whilst everyone we met who was involved seemed lovely and helpful, it was too hard to feel a real sense of accomplishment and satisfaction because some of the clues were so hard to solve.I can't remember the figure exactly, but I am pretty sure the staff told us that only 10-20% of groups actually solve the clues in time. I've enjoyed previous escape rooms more when we were able to work out the clues but it was a race against the clock. A couple of our less keen attendees just gave up by the end and sat on the bean bags chatting...So if you're seriously into lateral thinking, you will love this, but if you're a casual puzzler who just wants an interesting night out, there might be better escape rooms out there for you.
FUN. One of the best escape rooms I've been to. Puzzles were tough but achievable. Staff are super friendly too!

Much more difficult than we thought.. This was the first time we had done anything like this and we got rather frustrated trying to work out what we had to do. We were given clues but it was still very difficult. We all want to have another go now that we understand what we should have been doing. There should be an easier room for first timers I think!

Tough puzzle but the hour did fly by. Interesting experience to take on the pharoah's tomb but I think this one's for die hard fans of the genre. There's absolutely no way my team and I would have figured this out without a lot of help from the clues. Though if you believe the messages in the foyer, some people solve the puzzles in minutes without any help at all. It was an engrossing though; we found ourselves begging for more time at the end of the allocated hour. Good exercise that rewards teams who work well together.

Suitable for bachelor parties. This was our first experience at Escape Rooms of any sort and we had a blast. Although I can't compare these to any other I can say that we had a great time. Recommended for those who like puzzles or just want to have a fun time with friends/family.Room 33 was hard but we managed - out in 48 mins.

Harder than we thought. Booked for our Christmas Party (quite a new team so we thought it would be good to do some 'team-building' before our meal)Can't say anything negative about booking, customer services etc - all very well handled and any questions I had were dealt with quickly!Only downside, is we all felt that the game needed a few more 'pointers' to say we were like 'bulls in a china shop' is an understatement. There wasnt alot of clues and we all felt a little lost. Took quite awhile to understand what we were meant to be doing - even though we had outside help.We completed the game within the time given - through luck mostly!It's a fun experience, but with a few more tweaks, this will be awesome!

Fun challenge against the clock. Fun escape activity, having to solve a number of clues to be able to exit the themed room within the hour. I did something similar in Prague which made me want to try this again. Recommend this experience to anyone who's up for something a little different.

An Excellent Afternoon Out!. This was our Third Escape event and we all throughly enjoyed it! Challenging, yet fun....A stimulating way to get all involved and thinking together.....
You don't notice the time going by!
Thoroughly recommend this event :-)
Great fun. Excellent experience. I don't want to say too much for obvious reasons but would definitely recommend!

Frustratingly brilliant!. The Pharoahs Chamber certainly gets your 'little grey cells' working. The puzzles require logic and teamwork and the feeling of excitement each time you solve a puzzle is felt by the whole team. There were 6 of us and all had a fantastic time. We will return to do Room 33.

Great family fun. Well organised, pleasant staff.
Went into the Egytian room. All had a great experience and escaped within the hour!! Will do it again.

Great time. Escape rooms was great. The room where we were was excellent, with great mysteries to be solve. It's a great experience to share with family and friends. It's not expensive and you can have an hour of fun solving puzzles to escape from the room.

Enjoyable and fun time!. We were a group of 3 trying an escape game for the first time. You get one out to find all the clues to open the door to get out. We were allowed 3 hints during that time.We had a lot of fun but also needed to clues as we were new to th game. The host was very nice and helpful.The only downside was that one of the games was broken and it didn't recognise that we already completed it. Another group had broken it previously. We would have made it out in time if it would have worked properly so it was a bit disappointing to see the time run out but when the host checked he apologised and said we made it.I would definately go again to try the other room hoping it will work perfectly this time!

ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!. Our experience was amazing. Myself and my family did room 33 recently and really enjoyed the game. The staff were fun and friendly and gave a great story at the start which helped set the atmosphere! It's something different to do and worth the money! Very enjoyable! We will be back to do the other room. Those who have never been to an escape room before should try it, it's fantastic.

excellent!. This was the fastest hour ever and brilliant fun. We managed to work together as a family team and almost solved the puzzles to unlock the door in time - just two and a half minutes over. This was something completely different for us and a definite to do again.

what a quick hour!. We had never done this type of game before and really looked forward to it. The first challenge was actually finding the place as Tooley street seems to split so you have to be able to watch two forks at the same time. Once there we did the Pharoh puzzle. We did not do very well, although with generous help and a little extra time, we got out, but we had fun. We did not know exactly what to expect and wasted a lot of time at the beginning floundering. I liked some of the puzzles and thought some of them were just a bit too random and not likely to be solved without help, unless you were practiced at this type of thing. I only thought one of them was over the top though. I had hoped that the puzzles would allow a division of effort, but they rally do not and the quarters were too close for more than one or two people to work on the current puzzle. The only complaint I would make that I really think should be rectified is that only one of our group could understand the person who monitored us and gave us the clues, the walkie talkie quality was so bad. Having isolated the issues, I think it is a matter of expectations as much as anything, and I thought it was fun and will happily go back to try the other puzzle if I am back in London. We may also try some here in the US. If you like puzzles, this should be fun, but I think there is a bit of a learning curve, so i am really looking forward to a second go.

Fun and challenging. We must admit that we assumed that we'd find this easy giving our love for and experience with puzzle games but we needed all our hints to even stand a chance! Good fun overall. Our criticism would be that at least in our room (room 33), it was very difficult to know what clues were to be pondered immediately and which ones would only be useful later.

Gets You Thinking!. I visited Escape Rooms as a Birthday treat for a friend, the person booking it also decided we would do the hardest room! (Lucky Us).To enter Escape Rooms you ring the bell at black door in the back streets of London Bridge. When answered you are let in to a reception where the game is explained, you're then led downstairs to your chosen room.You enter, the door is closed and locked and the timer starts. All you have to do now is solve the clues to escape, it's as simple as that. Did I say simple? It's not simple at all, the clues are hard, the brain has to work and you need to go at it as a team to escape.The staff are great and will offer clues if you ask, sometimes they'll see you struggling and offer a hint or two. A really good way to spend some time with friends, great fun and you'll be talking over what happened after.If you get the chance go.

We're still stuck in the room.... This is good fun but much harder than it looks. There were 6 of us and we ran out of time and used up all the clues. It is more basic than we thought it would (furniture and props) but we had a good time and got a photo momento at the end.

Great Group Experience. My family and I went to escape rooms just before Christmas as a different night out and we were thrilled at what a great time we had. The time absolutely flew by and we didn't manage to solve the puzzle in the hour time slot. Would highly recommend though to everyone. I was sceptical at first as I had never done anything like this, but was more than pleasantly surprised.

Fun, friendly service. The staff really made the experience for us on this visit.We were a team of four, none of whom had ever tried one of these 'escape room' experiences which seem to have become massively popular recently. The staff were attentive and gave us the storyline to the scenario, which sucked us straight in to the atmosphere.We completed several elements quickly, but there was plenty to keep us challenged. The staff kept a watchful eye on us and gave us a few hints, while not actually telling us exactly what to do.It has certainly whet our appetite to try other similar activities.
Great activity!. This is a hard challenge but awesome fun! I would recommend the Pharaoh room over Room 33, although both are great...

Great for team socials!. We went on a team X'mas social. it's not only a great team building exercise but also a lot of fun! The puzzles were all well thought out. Staff were helpful, friendly and encouraging. We tried the Pharoah Room and were told that is one people generally find more challenging than Room 33, with 10-15% of teams managing to make it out in an hour versus 30% for Room 33. I'd highly recommend it : )

Who needs Richard Obrien. What a great way to test your noggin and get those brain cells working.Had a great time and will definitely go back to experience other rooms.Excellent value and a unique experience.

Fun & challenging. We tried this out last night and it was great fun.There were 3 of us and we had to escape from Room 33. Without giving too much away, it's set in ancient China.The staff give a good briefing before entering the room and are on hand via walkie talkie to give you 3 hints should you need them (we did).The clues were challenging but logical and we escaped with just 30 seconds left. My friends were truly wishing this was quicker as one of us was suffering from wind and made the room even more challenging. :)If you're like puzzles and are in London, give this a go, it's great fun.

Unusual and Fun. We had a great time working as a team solving puzzles and we did manage to escape within the time. We tried the Egypt style room and it was really fun for all of us and a great way to get together. Staff were very helpful and friendly and gave clear instructions. We cannot wait to get back and try the other Room 33!

We escaped with just five minutes left!. This was one of the most fun hours - well, 55 minutes! - we have ever had as a family. Some of the puzzles were very challenging and the hints (no more than three) from our very welcoming host (who is not in the room but can watch you on CCTV and speak to you by walkie-talkie) were probably essential. We can't wait to tackle another room!

Great fun and we escaped!!. We booked this as a slightly different birthday activity with the family and really enjoyed it. Having tried Room 33 we will definitely go back to try the other one. Not suitable though for anyone who doesn't like puzzles and logic or can't crawl on the floor!Staff were very friendly and helpful

Amazing. We had a lot of fun, have done both rooms and waiting for the next one... The Egypt style room is better to play with 4 or more people. This venue is great and if you might considering to do an escape room, go for this one! It are not only pet locks you have to open!

Unexpected fun!!!. Tried this with son daughter and their partners and we all enjoyed it. Tho rather frantic we did escape with help from organiser which gave us great sense of achievement. Great way for all ages to have fun together but you should be logical- ish.

great fun!!!. we took our nephews here for a birthday treat and we had so much fun. the staff were great (especially with the hints). we escaped the room with 10 minutes to spare and all went away very happy.

Memorable and fun. Saw this was very highly rated and decided to give it a try. The young guy who worked there was adorable. The others I brought with me entered as skeptics, but left with big smiles.
Very inventive!. I have done a few of these rooms now and this one is definitely one of the more creative ones! I won't give anything else away - you have to give it a go!
Great. Great design of rooms and friendly staffs. The pharaoh's chamber is difficult and we hardly got out. Will come again for the other room!
Best experiences!. Full of fun and excitement. Great for couples/friends for a day out who are not afraid of using a bit of brain~ Definitely recommend it!
Really good experience. What a great way to spend an hour. We came out buzzed with 8 minutes to spare. Nice experience to share with friends pre dinner date. Would highly recommend

Best attraction I've been to in a while - Everyone should go. I would personally recommend this to everyone, it's very fun and something different to do instead of your usual cinema, bowling or just family meals. The staff are also SO friendly, offering water to us and guiding us through the game politely.
If you haven't gone yet then you're missing out. Don't waste your time, get booking!

Two great rooms. Well worth the visit.. The experience is divided into two rooms: The Pharaoh's Chamber and Room 33. I would highly recommend both. The puzzles are challenging - among the most challenging I have seen in London - but achievable. The staff are fantastic, and very efficient. I hope that this place expands soon!

Great family fun. We would recommend this to anyone. Both teenage sons joined in enthusiastically and although we needed a few hints we made it out just inside the hour. Kids voted it the best activity of the day, better than the dungeons. Thanks to all the team, we'll be back again to do the other room.

Good Hour Spent. Went to the Escape Rooms with partner and 14 year old son, when in to the Pharoah's Chamber.
The room was well set up and the tasks were challenging but achievable, we got out after 54 minutes.
Excellent change to the normal tourist attractions of London

Enjoyable & challenging hour or two!. A very enjoyable way to spend an hour (or two, if you try both rooms). Without giving TOO much away, you are in a room about 5m square, and need to use the clues and objects you find to get out within an hour. We failed! But with a few hints we got close. It would certainly be possible though, with some more lucid thought processes than we managed. Handily placed in an office basement 5 minutes from London Bridge. The only negative was a malfunctioning toilet but solved by a dash across the road to the nearest cafe.

So Different - Great Fun for all ages. Halloween Treat for the whole family, great day out. You only have 1 hour to crack the codes and get out 'alive' - kids were able to help with the puzzles - completed with only 23 seconds to go!

Well worth a visit !. Went to the Escape Rooms yesterday with my husband and 16 year old son. Really good to do together working as a team. The hour goes really quickly as you are occupied all the time. Staff were great !

Brilliant 30th birthday surprise. 9 of us came here as part of my birthday weekend, and we had so much fun. 5 of us (the girls!) went to the Pharaoh's Chamber, and the 4 boys went to Room 33. We absolutely loved it, it was so much fun trying to solve the riddles. The girls managed to escape in 45 minutes, and then spent 20 minutes watching the boys (fail) try to escape ;) I had no idea what to expect, and wasn't sure what level it would be pitched at. We were a fairly mixed group (no children) and we were all challenged. It was brilliant fun, and we will be looking for similar things to do in the future.Thank you to the team there.
Great cryptic fun. Great fun. Mind boggling at sometimes but great hour, needing a bit of updating with a few broken bits but brill team and a good giggle.

Great fun for a group of friends, family or work colleagues. We had a really fun visit in the Pharoah's Chamber. None of us had ever done anything like this before so we have nothing to compare it to, but we would be definitely keen to do it again.Our group was two adult females with 4 children aged 8-11. The puzzles were challenging (a bit too challenging for us if I am honest), but the lady was helpful, friendly and gave us some hints through the walkie talkies throughout to steer us in the right direction. We were allowed some additional time to try to solve them, before the lady came in to help us out and explain the final solution. The puzzles were all very different and quite clever. Without the hints, I am not sure we would have completed much more than one or two, but with some more adults in the group, I think we may have got there.We all had great fun - it was good to do something that we as adults enjoyed with the kids who had a ball. The only downside was the cost - at around £100 for the hour for 2 adults and 4 kids it is quite pricey.Nevertheless, would definitely recommend.

Good fun!. Let me start by saying we played numerous escape games, 5 in total, at different companies so can review and critique taking into consideration my past experiences. We played the Pharaoh's Room and all five of us enjoyed the experience. It has a similar concept to all the others we have played but with some very unique and clever touches. I think the negative review is unfair as ALL the games have walkie talkies so you can communicate effectively. I'm not sure how badly they played the game or didn't understand the concept to be continually told they were doing the wrong thing... The whole point is that it is an escape game and you need to break clues and solve puzzles, so yes they are going to be cryptic otherwise what would be the point. We all worked out the "cryptic" clue given at the beginning within about 15mins into the game. As for the being "cheap", we were too engaged in the game to notice that everything was not shiny Ikea new and would not expect the "treasure" to actually BE treasure. It is challenging and you do have to think, work as a team and sometimes think outside of the box - this sometimes is not for everyone. If you always wanted to go on the Crystal Maze or the Krypton Factor and want to use your brain, challenge yourself and work as a team than I would recommend these types of games, including Escape Rooms' Pharaoh Chamber.

Great Hour of fun. We went to Escape Rooms to celebrate my daughters 21st and entered Room 33 not really knowing what to expect, we left the room 58 minutes later on a real high!A few sticky moments when the 'team' lost it but all came good in the end.We are certainly planning to go back to try the second room, hopefully at Christmas

Great fun in the capital. We visited escape rooms on Saturday 18th October. We have never done anything like this before and it was fantastic. Well organised and easily located. It certainly is a challenge and we'll definitely return to try the Pharaohs' chamber.

Informal and exciting. I brought along 13 students in age 15-17 and they all loved the atmosphere and concept of the game. The host was kind and informal and his staff was smiling and helpfull.We had a great time with lots of fun. As a (newemployed) teacher I had the opportunity to look at my boys in a completely different perspective - who took leadership, who was thriving and who was not.A great game, i wouldn't hesitate to bring a new group.
Escape rooms in London. Very good puzzles, both challenging and fun.We went as a group of 4 people and we enjoyed our time there.

Well worth a visit! Will return for second room.. For those of us who can remember the Crystal Maze, this has a very similar vibe to it. You go into a themed room. We did Room 33, the "China" room and there's a countdown timer and challenging puzzles to solve if you want to escape the room in time. It's a lot of fun! The puzzles are clever, challenging and the setup is really professional. The story was well thought out and the puzzles definitely tested our mental agility although we made it out in the end (just in time!). Was also really impressed with how good the staff were at explaining everything and making us comfortable. Perfect if you want a "different" afternoon or evening and a fun time actually "doing something" with friends rather than sitting in the cinema or going for dinner. Will be booking to go back to try the second room.

we made it!!! only 30 seconds left..ahhaa. Awsome game, makes you feel like a child again when you saw al those maze and jigsaws movies and series... we wish we could do more rooms for the rest of the night :Dits a fantastic hour of entertainment

Good but very maths based. If you're a fan of maths puzzles you'll love Room 33 at Escape Rooms. However if you're more into opening locks and exploring areas this one might not be for you. The team at escape rooms are very welcoming and friendly and the setup certainly looks the part with the rooms located in the basement. Without giving away what goes on inside room 33 a lot of the emphasis is on written puzzles and riddles rather than moving walls and building things. This didn't really suit our team but may work for yours. Can't really fault the production or personnel but room 33 didn't really do it for us.

First time visit. Saw lots of these type of places on trip advisor I had never heard of these before some reviews had said similar to crystal maze so I booked this for 3 adults and 8 year old child. Friendly staff explaned the game and in we went to room 33 game, we found it pretty tricky we used our hints and the staff kindly gave us more hints but we never managed to escape I think once having tried this game the next visit would not be as hard we all enjoyed it even though we failed

Definitely will recommend it to my other friends and colleagues!. Tried the room 33 with a group of five people. So interesting! Not only mental work but also a bit 'physical work'. Managed to get out fives minutes before the timeline. Want to play the other room next time :-)

A complete eye opener!!. Having been to several other escape games around the world, the escape room definitely ranks at the very top without a shadow of a doubt. I visited their 'egyptian' room with a group of friends. The décor is very impressive and to start off it took us a little while to figure out the objectives (part of the game, of course). Then as we worked our ways through the puzzles I was gobsmacked by the cleverly designed mechanisms. It was as if I was in a hollywood studio shooting the new national treasure!! As we approached towards the end of the game the puzzles became more and more fascinating until the final door opened. We had just a couple of minutes to spare and hand on heart it was the greatest fun I ever had in an hours time. Strongly recommend to all intellectual sorts and a great teambuilding experience. TOP MARKS!!

Great Fun!. Had a great time with my friends, the staff was very friendly. It was fun at the same time challenging, we worked really hard together to solve the puzzles. Would definitely go again to try out the other room.

Nice birthday night. Six of us went to The Escape Rooms on a Tuesday evening. It was such an exciting and interesting experience for birthday celebration. The time slot of 19:30-20:30 is perfect for us gathering from different corners of the city. The puzzles were bit challenging but gave us a big sense of achievement when we got out. There were lots of laugh and shouts, we will definitely try the Egypt room next time.

Awesome experience. We were a group of five friends and all of us enjoyed the game immensely. The puzzles are hard work but very interesting. I would say it was definitely a fun evening and we will be visiting again very soon for the second room. Hope we can do the second one in time!
Poor experience. Sorry to say, nowhere near as much fun as ClueQuest. No story, poor puzzles. Time in the room didn't count down. No flow in the clues.

It's a new and a unforgettable experience!. It's a unforgettable experience! There are some very interesting puzzles need team work together. Will go again for new rooms and hope can use less time to solve the puzzles and come out.

Unmissable fun. Unforgettable experience! The rooms are very cleverly designed with mysterious ascent Egyptian and Chinese themes. It is pleasantly challenging and exciting. My friends and I had the greatest time. Shame we couldn't break out on time though ;-)

Best room escapes - maybe in the world. I've done both rooms at Escape Rooms, and I've done other escapes in the USA. Escape Rooms is the best. Without giving too much away, the flow of the problem-solving processes and the technical capabilities make for a richer and more satisfying experience. We had so much fun doing one of the rooms, we immediately booked the other one for two nights later. You will also.

Fanastic hour in London. This was so much fun. I went with my husband and in laws and we had a great time. The guy running it was very helpful and it was the right level of challenging. I reccommend booking this experience for a fun thing to do in London

Best experience I've ever had. 25th birthday perfect experience. The whole experience from walking in the door to leaving was fantastic. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. Offering advice and guidance before the activities even started. The actual activity was incredible. I have never done anything like this so had no clue what to expect. The rooms are set up with great expertise. Without giving away what to expect inside, I will just say it's slightly challenging at first but once your in the flow of the activity it's very fun. The staff are available for few hints to guide you. Which come in very handy. Although you may think 60 mins is a long time, once your inside time flies.Can't wait to to book for the other room they offer. Best event ever to kick start my 25th birthday.Thank you

Very fun. I went here with my wife and two of our friends, and it was extremely fun. We ended up coming back a couple days later to do the other room! Good puzzles, good use of technology on them, overall very inventive. I'd recommend to anyone interested in a different sort of night out--interactive and a lot to talk about over a pint after!
Great fun!. Great experience and fun!!!I suggest to anyone that likes problem solving and a bit of adventure!Challenging game in a real chinese atmosphere!

Brilliant experience!. Went for my 30th birthday with a friend. Was a great fun. The staff were brilliant and so friendly, they helped us out alot - (the puzzles are hard and it took us a while to figure it out, we nearly got locked in the chamber :S) They even gave me a birthday card, which I thought was really sweet and went the extra mile. I would definitely recommend these rooms for a group celebrating birthdays. hens. stags. - great idea for team building for corporate events. I've already recommended it to my boss! If you always wanted to be in the crystal maze, this comes pretty close! I hope they stay around for a long time ad I'm excited to try more rooms!

A different kind of fun. Came here with some mates not knowing what to expect and had a really fun time. Even if you don't win the game it's hilarious trying to figure the puzzles all out and thrilling for all when you do beat them! We will definitely be back! We did the pharaohs tomb challenge so were going for the British museum one next!

Great fun and challenging. The one hour in the room get pass really quickly! But its an hour filled with great fun and challenges. The room could be a bit difficult as you would need to link various puzzles together to escape. But I'd highly recommend this to anyone who loves a challenge.

Extremely difficult, slight language barrier. Myself (white British male, 29 years old) went with 4 Chinese girls (all 23 years old) at 2100 on 17/09/2014 and did the pharaoh puzzle. The good:1. Easy to find, Central London Bridge location2. Friendly staff3. Interesting, challenging puzzle4. Fun photo at the endThe bad:1. Staff struggled to communicate with all of us. None of the girls understood the introduction story so I had to translate from slightly broken English. This is a shame as the story does add to and slightly aid the solution. 2. Maybe we're all just rubbish at puzzle games (totally possible) but we found it ridiculously hard. The language barrier between us definitely didn't help.3. One of the puzzles didn't work even though we were sure that we did it right. She showed us the solution and it worked so I guess we did something wrong but it seems to me that some puzzles are automated when solved and some have to be seen by the staff before they qualify. Just a slight weakness. Recommendation:I would definitely say give it a go, it's quite good fun and very frustrating, in a good way. Go with a mono language group so that everyone talks about all the clues in the same language, otherwise bits are sure to be lost. The game is exactly as you'd expect. Disclaimer: this is my first escape style game, so maybe with practise I'd improve.
Very fun place. Unique experience. Have visited this twice. Two different rooms with various puzzles. Felt the achievement after broke out. Excellent place for puzzle lovers
fun day out. had fun in the new room: Room 33, it was an unforgettable 1 hour, my friends and myself all enjoyed the experience and we will be trying the other room soon.

A brilliant idea well executed.. A team of 5 of us took on the "pharaohs chamber" and it got the better of us! Great for team building. Will definitely be attempting "room 33"!!. Highly reccomend, a must try!

Great fun, amazing party choice. We did this as part of my friend's Birthday party. We enjoyed every second, and very excited by finding solution by ourself. It's a very good game idea, and great fun with friends hangout. Will definitely come back for the other room soon!

Beautiful Thought Out Room. We have done a lot of Escape Rooms. They are ALWAYS fun but some have more glitzy moving parts than others and that makes them a little more exciting. This new location has exactly that; lots of very cool features which will thrill you. The story behind the room was fun too. Brilliant job! We can't wait to go back and do the second room.

Great fun - something a bit different!. So much fun! Some puzzles were a little obscure, but was our first time, so I guess if you're more familiar with the Japanese origins, then it may make more sense. We tried Room 33 which had only been open for a couple of days, so maybe a few wrinkles to iron out. Overall a really fun way to spend an hour. In terms of age suitability, our 8 year old was able to help in most of the puzzles in some ways - and having a little one around was a definite advantage in some!

Excellent Fun!. Took cousins who were visiting from abroad - was an excellent and fun activity to do in London. Very different to usual sightseeing, museums, exhibitions etc and great fun was had by all. We were in Pharaohs chamber which was challenging but interesting. Staff were absolutely lovely and friendly. Would go back!

Challenging and fun!. Escape Rooms was a great experience. It's a fun and interesting way to spend an evening. The puzzles were challenging but enjoyable. We have done a couple of other "Escape Rooms" (and managed to get out before) but this one is completely different. We didn't quite make it out in time (3 seconds over) however we would definitely try the other room!

Challenging, exciting and something different!!!. We came as a group of 3 friends. We wanted to do something different when we met for a catch up. We didn't know what to expect, when we arrived the host explained the game and then we were in the room with 60mins to escape. The puzzles and clues were quite hard, but it was so exciting when you solved something. We had so much fun trying to rack our brains and work together. Sadly we didn't make it out but we had so much fun we want to return for room 33. Fingers crossed we will make it out :-)

Great Activity. It was truely an amazing experience! The puzzles are very interesting and challenging, the four of us couldn't make it at the end. We'll definately come back for the second room and try to do better :)

Excellent experience with friends!. It is really an excellent experience! All of us believe it is worth to try and have had great experience on that evening. The staff are very very friendly. We will definitely go to try the Room 33 when it is ready, and we will do much better this time! :-)

Very different, very fun. This is incredibly fun, a great alternative way to spend time with friends. We went as a group of five and loved the concept. The puzzles were challenging and engrossing. Although one hour sounded like a long time, it actually flew by. We will definitely return for the second room.
Excellent!!!. Excellent experience! We escaped only 3 seconds right beyond the time period;))) Really worth a try with friends!

Go. Do. This.. After having heard many positives things about escapes rooms in general, we (3 friends) wanted to try it for ourselves. No better place to go than 'Escape Rooms'.Despite the fact we were not successful on our own, we were lucky to escape in the end with help from our excellent host. We had a blast and will return shortly to try to escape from the new room...If you're doubting whether or not to do an escape room: Do. It.If you're doubting whether or not to go to Escape Rooms: Do. It.

Amazing challenge, so different, lovely staff,such a great time,try it!. Wanted to try something different for my daughter's 19th birthday and we hit the jackpot here! Absolutely amazing and the second room promises to have some really cool features.... bring it on we can't wait! Our group of five covered teens,twenties and thirties and we all came out buzzing with excitement. Hard but doable challenges had us running around the room like mad professors,code breaking so engrossed we were even trying to break codes that weren't even there! We laughed and panicked so much it felt like far longer than an hour, would definitely recommend!

a great escape!. Came as a family group 10,12,15 plus adults a little tired from all our sightseeing left totally buzzing. Despite the Pharaoh's curse beating us but we have vowed to return to face the next challenge soon. Great experience and staff where lovely. We got so engrossed in what we were doing that we couldn't believe had only been an hour. A great way to escape the usual and do something a little different whilst in London.

made a great birthday suprise present - highly recommended!. This was our groups first experience of live escape room game, and we found it to have the right balance of challenge and fun. The location is very close to London Bridge tube station (about a 5 minute walk) so it was easy to find. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly member of staff and sat in a modern waiting room. Everything was clearly explained to us and we were given a torch, pen/paper and a escape key (in case we wanted to leave as they do lock you in). There is an option to leave your belongings in a locker, however you can also take them into the room with you. After that we went down to the room which, initially was both a bit daunting and confusing, but once we had figured out what we were supposed to be doing, we really got into it! We didn't manage to complete it (although we were very close!) despite using all 3 of our clues up, so at the end they explain to you how to solve the problems you didn't complete. At the end we went back up to the main floor where a member of staff took a group photo of us and printed it out instantly, then stuck it on a piece of card so we could write messages on it, then this was put on the wall of the waiting room along with all the other photos/messages (of which there are already a lot!). He then emailed me (as I booked it) the group photo - which we thought was a nice touch.Overall - our group would strongly recommend this new attraction. It is suitable for all ages and loads of fun! Already looking forward to coming back to try out the new room!

Please all ages. We wanted a day out in London, my children are 6 9 & 18 so difficult to please all at once! We looked on trip advisor and had a fun day ending up in the escape rooms,we were greeted with a friendly welcome and explained fully what it was all about not having done anything like it before. Good to have a time slot so no hanging about, my 6 year old was a little young but had fun collecting puzzle pieces, in all we weren't the smartest but had great fun trying, would recommend it as something different to do and look forward to another room.

Absolutely Brilliant, I am like a film star. great experience ever, the decoration and game design gives me the film-like experience. I definitely will recommend all my friends to go there. it is great fun. it is such great idea for family/friends gathering. one of definite things to do in London. the Staffs are so nice, I enjoyed every min there. Love it!
