Challenging but great fun!. We were rubbish at solving the puzzles but really enjoyed the experience and would definitely have a try in the second room when it opens.
Brilliant. Something totally new. An ingenious idea, would highly recommend for families, friends etc. Didn't manage to escape but still enjoyed it and cannot wait for next room to open.
Great place!. We had a great time spending one hour in the room trying to resolve puzzles and find the final solutions. This is a just great place for fun with friends.. We enjoyed it very much.
So much fun!. Had a fantastic time in the Escape Rooms. A brilliant family activity - my 13 year old loved it. Would highly recommend it.

an worthy experience. First time to play room escape game. lots of fun with friends since u r going to be locked in one well-decorated room:). team work and some logic needed. definitely worth playing!

Great fun. It's very entertaining and great fun. The premises is centrally located, Nicely decorated and with very friendly staff. Would highly recommend for hen's or stag do, team bonding or friends hangout.
Great the team building event. Great adventure. Great team building event. Bring the online video game challenge back to reality. Looking forward to playing the other china room.
Great experience. Challenging but fun! Great location and lovely staff! The design of the game is original and unique. Recommended!

Uniquely fun. The latest entrant in the escape room craze and so they had do something slightly different and it works brilliantly! Very cleverly set up for a thoroughly entertaining hour. Be warned that you'd have to be top notch to be able to get through it with any fewer than 4 people!
Fantastic experience. Great fun, excellent customer service and challenging puzzles. Enjoyed every second. Highly recommended :-)
A great place. a great place to spend a day with friends, you are able to find different sides of your friends.Would like to try the new Chinese Room soon

Loved every minute.. This was our first escape game, and we really enjoyed it. The customer service upon arriving at the attracting was excellent, everything was explained clearly to us, in a friendly manner. I thought we would be able to complete the room within 1 hour however we were unable too, so basically we were kept entertained the entire hour. The kids and I had a terrific time, and will recommend this NEW venue to everyone.
Brilliant!. Fantastic experience. Challenging game but great fun and very well put together. More difficult than some rooms in London but some fantastic and VERY well thought through elements.

Fun escape game with a code breaking theme. I've played 120+ escape rooms now and this one is definitely one of the better ones. The underground setting is amazing, the game is well themed with some really clever moments and fun puzzles. Where this room excels is the immersion in being a codebreaker - if you're at all interested in how people broke codes during the war then I think this is going to really impress you. There is one puzzle in the game that, while highly thematic, could be a bit frustrating (or, if you look at it differently, totally authentic). If you're the sort of person that loses patience easily then be warned!Full disclosure: we were given complimentary tickets.

Brain workout!. My second escape room and very much enjoyed it! My wife and me went with my brother and his girlfriend. It was quite a bit more difficult than the one I did before but I took the challenge on and enjoyed it immensely.You have to be focused , patient, communicate well (very well!!!) and have fun. Would definitely recommend this very well thought through room to anyone!

Great fun!. We were lucky to be able to try this room out on my husband's birthday. The place was easy to find. Make sure you read through your booking confirmation email properly as it gives you some info you'll need (unless you want to stand outside the locked door for a while thinking it may be your first puzzle to solve....NOT!)!The venue was great and full of character. The room itself was challenging but extremely enjoyable. 4 of us took part and each had things to do and effort to put into the game. It was a close call but we escaped with 2 mins to spare!Well done to the brains behind this game! Great fun! Can't wait for another room!

Great fun. We were a group of two adults, two girls age 9 and a boy of 13, and we all loved it!Very well done easy to find and book.My only complaint is I wish it had been longer than an hour as we were having too much fun to stop!

Amazing experience . If you are looking for a really fun and great way to engage your brain and test how well you all work as a team - this is it!The set up is fantastic and really well organised, I could not rate our host high enough! The moment you enter you are transported to another world. We had such an amazing time and loved every minute of it!Highly recommend this activity - you will not regret it!Your challenge, should you accept it, is waiting at Mission Breakout!!

Teamwork makes the dream work. Absolutely LOVE the course! It really tested your teamwork skills and gave us a lot of laughs at the end. There were some stressful points but we pulled through in the end. Recommend this at night since it will add just a touch more to the mystique!
Amazing experience!. Staff were wonderful! The mission was great fun. Fantastic detail in an amazing location! Thanks guys!

Brilliant fun. An immersive experience with lots of great attention to detail, but not scary - we were well looked after and it was really good fun. It's very well designed to be challenging and satisfying. Such an unusual and energising way to kick off an evening (including arrival and debrief the whole experience was about 90 mins), and a great way to bring together a group of friends. Highly recommend.
Brilliant. Great brain teaser with such realistic reference to WW2. I loved the experience and will defo be back for more.
Fabulous day out. Can't recommend this escape room enough. The perfect blend of puzzle and reward, the puzzles really force your team to synergise. If you don't, you may not get out!

A truly fantastic hour!. If you love a puzzle, if you think you are clever, if you have friends that you would like to be locked in a room with then this escape room is for you. We had a great time! staff were super welcoming. The game is just hard enough that you feel you might not be able to do it but you are being watched and clues will see you right. We made it with less than a minute to spare and the 6 of us fell out panting and laughing! A great way to start our night out and as soon as the next room is built we will be back.
Great new experience!. Not easy at all but loved it! 9year olds probably too young , bit enjoyed it anyway. Would definitely do it again!
Great Birthday treat. Our family had a great time. Staff were. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend visiting to our friends.
Birthday bash. Had a great day with my friends. It is quite loud and a little scary and claustrophobic. Staff is very friendly.

Great attention to detail. I'm by no means an escape game aficionado, but I have played a few before. The attention to detail is phenomenal, and loads of fun, and I found the host to be friendly and really helpful. The puzzles, however, were a bit too difficult, and the red herrings outnumbered the actual clues, which wasted a lot of valuable time. Whilst we completed it, I can see how people would battle to complete this escape game. Overall, I found this extremely enjoyable and loads of fun, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone doing escape rooms for the first time.
Mission break out.. We had a fabulous afternoon working as a family team, and we broke out!!Highly recommended and fun!

Brilliant!. I went to this today and it was Brilliant! The setting was far more exciting than I expected with amazing attention to detail. The puzzles vary and surprise. Even the parts that aren't part of the 'Breakout' are well thought out- great entrance, fridge of drinks at the end, interesting books and nice loos!

Brilliant Family Experience. Great way to spend an hour cracking codes with the family and build on our team work! Intense to try and beat that ticking clock! We would definitely recommend this!Thank you to the great host for making it a memorable experience :)
Adventurous experience. it is a great Sunday morning experience and amazing activity. Better experience it than just reading about

Brilliantly produced. Wasn't sure what to expect, and really just wanted a peek inside the old Tube station, but the codebreaking was fantastic, really fun and well put together. It had much more variety and ingenuity than it might have done. Highly recommended.

Exciting and authentic. Highly recommend - although you need determination and be prepared to use your brains, you don't need to be a genius and it is great fun, very exciting and authentic, gets your adrenalin going. only not giving 5 stars because it might not be everyone's thing

Amazing and spinechilling. Mission Breakout is a great way to spend some time with your family and friends. Intense teamwork is needed all throughout this activity , it is a truly incredible experience

Amazing fun and far better then expected. We were a group of girls in our mid-20s and although I was a little sceptical (puzzles aren't usually my thing) I absolutely loved this! The organisers are lovely and really helpful, the venue is incredible and the experience is challenging but never leaves you feeling too frustrated or down, it just keeps moving at a good pace and keeping you guessing.

Such a good activity!!. Myself and 3 friends did this last night, and whilst two of us were worried we'd let the team down on brain power, this completely surpassed our expectations! It was so much fun, the two ladies who run the place are lovely and so into it from start to finish! Would highly recommend for a group of friends or small teams of colleagues!!

Unique, exciting experience combined with team work.. What a great activity this was. We were a group of 3 adults, one late teen and one 9 year old. Everybody brought their own skill set to the problem solving, regardless of age. I won't spoil any surprises, but suffice to say that you will not be successful at this game unless you work as a team and remain patient! Exhilarating and exciting, a great thing to do with family and/or friends. The co-owner is a lovely French lady who is happy to sit and chat to you about the attraction and its location after your hour and offer you a much needed cold drink!

Great Hour With Hard Puzzles. Excellent setting underground, lovely customer service, and very tricky puzzles! As a group with two dads and their daughters (who are both teenagers) we failed to get out under the hour, but the staff were happy to talk us through it afterwards. Clues given throughout. Teamwork is vital to success!

Escape. Absolutely marvellous and such a brain work out for the old grey matter.I am past retiring age but found it most challenging and great fun to work as a team of six family members all over 35. I would recommend this to everyone.
fun fun fun. this was a fantastic game hard at times but great fun very friendly staff and with a free drink afterwards go on give it a try you will love it thanks to all the staff great bit of fun x
Really good!. I tried this escape room with my friends and thought it was well worth it as it was a good brain workout and great fun.

Atmospheric, historic escape game. About 30 of us from work have done this escape game and all enjoyed it. The stand-out aspect for me was the location and decor - the owners have gone all out on creating an authentic wartime atmosphere. The wartime theme of the puzzles was fun too.I think we as computer science nerds found some of the puzzles perhaps a little too straightforward and for a team of 6 it felt a bit cramped. This might be due to the linear nature of some of the puzzles (you have to solve one thing before you can move on to the next) meaning we weren't able to break into smaller teams and work on different tasks in parallel. But all the teams still came back with enthusiastic feedback.The nicest part was having a drink with the owners at the end and talking through our experience :) Thanks for the fun evenings!

too much fun!!. My husband and I took our 12 year old daughter and her friends for a birthday treat. The youngest in our party was 9years old.This escape game was great fun and the hour went so fast! We all thoroughly enjoyed it and will be talking about this for many years to come. It was truly thrilling and very realistic!This is a great way to spend an hour and well worth the money!

Great Fun. The Escape Game was great - complex enough to engage everyone yet do-able - we finished with just over 5 minutes to spare!The host was lovely (her name escapes me). Warm and welcoming but she also gave us space to chat pre/post game. The venue itself was well set up. It's a shame the former station now has a bright yellow 'cash converters' sign on it (doesn't really add to the atmosphere), but that's outside the organiser's control. All in all, I'd highly recommend!

Great fun. This is the first escape the room experience I've ever participated in and really did enjoy it. The staff were very friendly and at the end offer drinks and don't rush you out and like to chat over your experience. Sometimes I felt it may have benefitted from less clues, however we still didn't escape so maybe we would of been even further behind the pace if we hadn't received some help. Would definitely recommend and do a similar experience in the future.

Entertaining WWII Themed Escape The Room. This is a fun challenge for small groups. We really enjoyed the puzzles and the atmosphere was very well crafted - they make good use of the old Tube station set up.
great fun. went family of four, did not know what to expect but was a really fun & different experience. 100% recommend.
Great night!. Brilliant night out! Great experience, nice change from pubs/cinema/theatre, leaves you with a sense of accomplishment after! highly recommend!
Absolutely brilliant. It was my first time trying the escape room experience and it was absolutely fantastic experience. Will definitely recommend it to all of my friends.
SuperB!!!. Just awesome, went with 5 of my friends and we all enjoyed it a lot! I will highly recommend it to anyone

A Trip back in time. Went to the Escape Game as part of a stag weekend. It was superb - great surroundings in an old tube station, so it really had a genuine WW2 'war bunker 'atmosphere. If you and some mates want to spend a good time one afternoon in London doing something different - try this!!!
This was amazing. This is a great day out I would recommend it to anyone I have done a few before and this is by far one of the best
Great fun. Brilliant - fun and brain taxing! Done a few before and this was good quality. Did it with four of us and wouldn't do it with fewer.

Breakout was brilliant!. We visited this after it popping up in my Facebook feed. We went with some very well seasoned escape room teammates and we all thought it was one of the best we had ever done. From the moment you walk in you are confronted by 1940s wartime England. It's very atmospheric and almost feels like you are walking onto a film set rather than a game. The video introduction and staff were very helpful and the whole escape room experience was very well thought out.
Tunnel vision.... Seemed like we were storming through it, only to just fall short at the end. Was great fun, as part of my brother's stag day.

Immersive and authentic from the moment you step inside.... I'm a massive fan of room escapes, having been to around 25 different ones now, and I'm also a bit of a geek when it comes to disused tube stations, so I had to try this!After playing, I have to say that it exceeded my expectations and is one of the very best I've played. A lot of things that have frustrated me about other room escapes, they have got right here.Here's some of the things that make it so great:- the unique selling point of Mission Breakout is its amazing location. This gives it a thoroughly immersive and authentically historical feeling that sets the mood throughout the whole game. A pre-game introductory video featuring a winston Churchill lookalike really helped add to the effect.- great use of tech and machinery that both fit in very nicely with the theme and story but also made the puzzles very fun and original. The lighting and sound effects add to the atmosphere and drama.- the puzzles were for the most part logical and solvable (not too easy though) and followed on nicely from eachother. All the clues needed were present in the room, so in hindsight none of the solutions seemed too random to get. A series of colour coded lights helped to guide you through the puzzles in the right order and I thought this was a brilliant touch that I haven't seen elsewhere.- a couple of the puzzles were very satisfying and genius and had very unexpected and cool results when solved.- a clue giving system is always handy for when a team gets stuck, and that feature was present here. Tick!- although not in character, the staff were very friendly and welcoming and I was impressed how they took the time afterwards to talk to us about the company, their plans for a 2nd game, and also gave us some complimentary drinks.My only criticism, something easily fixed, is that there was one puzzle that required us to be able to pick out some black coloured-coded wheels, amongst other colours. Not only was it not obvious that we had to do that, but unfortunately under the dim lights, the black edges looked like more of a grey or silver. So we failed to solve that puzzle even when being told by a clue to look at the black wheels, which led to us wasting quite a lot of time on that puzzle, and so failing to complete the whole game for quite a frustrating reason. I would recommend using blacker paint to make those wheels look even more black, or even better, choose a different colour instead for the ones that must be used - such as red which was a lot easier to pick out.In summary, this is well worth a visit and throughly recommended for anyone who likes puzzles, room escapes, and London Underground history! In such a great venue, it would have been a shame if the game creators has wasted the opportunity by putting together a poorly designed game. Luckily they've done a fantastic job!

One of the best escapes. Myself and a few of my friends visited this escape room today. We have done about 8 escapes rooms so far and this one is one of the best. As soon as you step into the venue your in the theme of the game and it makes the experience more enjoyable.Can't wait for their next room to open!

Great team day out!. Had an amazing time at mission breakout the escape room was brilliant! The whole experience was really good the way the place was set out got your really immersed in the experience The game was really good for team building!
Mission break out = brilliant. Really fun and affordable day out with friends. Puzzles were challenging but not impossible and the staff were lovely and friendly

An escape game in a London athmosphere. This is a very entertaining game, the story, the venue, the settings are really well done ! The owners are also very welcoming, providing you the right level of guidance! We enjoyed the experience very much and we strongly recommend it.

Great challenge. I have been to four other break out's in London and this is by far the best so far! The location is amazing and really adds to the experience. I'm looking forward to them opening another room there.
So much fun!. I had no idea what to expect and was totally nonplussed at first but this was a really great way to spend an hour with friends. Team work essential!

Such fun with friends!. Mission Breakout was awesome! There were 8 of us in total - 2 teams of 4. It is so well organised and very well thought out. It is exciting as well as such fun. I would highly recommend and will be sending my friends and work colleagues for a fun night out! Perfect for a work team building too.We will be back!!

Smart & really fun!. Amazing! The game hasn't even started and you're already in the mood as you step down in this historic air-raid shelter. A quick cinematic introduction and you're off with your mission in a room with great accessories, visual and sounds effects. The game in itself is smart, immersive and really fun!This was a great time and many thanks to the hosts who are very welcoming and friendly.See you soon for the upcoming rooms!

Fun puzzle night with friends, WWII edition. This was my second time going to an escape room in London, and all in all it was a very good experience. Well-thought-out puzzles and an impressive array of props made the game quite interesting and kept us engaged, and the location in a disused tube station was perfect for the WWII theme! The staff was very nice and kind, and after the game answered all our questions about the game and the venue. Would definitely recommend to anyone who likes this sort of puzzle games! It's not as claustrophobic as it sounds (apparently the tube station was used as a bomb shelter!) but it can get a bit stressful at times! Good teamwork a must :)

Perfect Friday Night Get Together . First experience in a breakout room and I'm already excited to try more! There were 8 of us (4 girls 4 boys) so naturally we had a battle of the sexes. It was *SO* much fun! We all got really into it trying to crack the codes and move forward. Perfect for friends or families looking for something a little different to do together. Hosted by the wonderful AC and her team who looked after us very well. The location is ideal and has a very historical feel to it being a disused tube station...high attention to detail with the decor and furnishings that really bring the WWII experience to life. Thank you for a great night - the battle will recommence in due course!!

Totally immersive and really good fun!. I booked Mission: Breakout for a girls day out with 3 of my friends. One of the party has been to different escape rooms in the past and said that this is by far the best she has seen. It really feels like a WW2 air raid shelter from the moment you enter and the room itself is cleverly designed - I like that the theme is a real historical event. The different challenges played to our individual strengths, and we got out with a couple of minutes to spare...phew! Really good fun and great value for money. I can't wait to go back when more rooms have been added!

Sooooo much fun and such a laugh!. This was mine and my 2 friends first visit to an escape room before, we had absolutely no idea what we were letting ourselves into but honestly it was sooooo much fun! I found myself thinking back to when I was in year 6 learning about world war 2. Would recommend this to ANYONE!
Great escape room. Fun and in a great location. It's very atmospheric in the tube station. Managed to get out with 1 minute to spare. Keep it up!!!

Great escape game. We were a group of 4 people and we all loved it. The story and the setting are really well made, it takes place during WW2 in a forgotten tube station where actually real people used to hide during the war! The best part is obviously the gameplay, challenging (in a good way) and fun at the same time thanks to all the real props you have to use. The people who run the place are really nice. It's definitely the best Escape room I've done so far.

Great Venue !. The venue (old South Kentish Town Tube Station) is great. From the moment you enter the building, you can feel the vibe and thrill. The game itself is well planned and full of surprises. The staff is friendly.It was my first escape game, and now I am really hooked on escape games.Will definitely recommend this !
good for team play and brain usage.. Reallly enjoyed this escape room.. was well thought out and great fun to do.. little steap on price maybe but well worth a go!
AMAZING. Great experience. Went in a group of 4, care of details and personal touch made it amazing. if you lookig for something exciting and different to do this place is a winner!

Great real-life puzzle game. Great puzzle game, great hosts.
Better than Pokemon GO and Snapchat.
59.99mins of emotional and mental warfare.
Make a vouch to stay friends before entering.
Don't rip the paper.

Enjoyable and well-themed. Six of us of all ages had a great time at Mission Breakout. The theming is well done and consistent throughout. The level of difficulty is well-balanced and the venue is unique. Staff were friendly and all ran smoothly.

Amazing, great, fabulous . We took my dad on a Saturday morning and were instantly impressed with the pictures and decor. The set is an amazing replica and the clues and challenges are really exciting getting the adrenalin pumping. Can't fault this, one of the best things I've done and might even have to say it's better than The Crystal Maze which was also great!!A must for any tube, puzzle, war, tourist, local person wanting to do something a bit different. Great value for money!!!

Such an amazing game, great staff and a well oiled ship!. Myself and a group of friends visited Mission: Breakout last weekend and have an amazing time!Upon entering the tube station, it already feels epic, walking down a long windy staircase into the unknown, upon entering we were met by the lovely guys running the game which was a nice welcome, some people may be a little nervous before entering the game and the friendly staff help settle nerves, have a little chat and get you ready for the game. We then entered the room which was really immersive! No spoilers but there's so many amazing hidden gems and events! The 60 minutes goes very quick and the game is a great balance of difficulty and you'll be working out clues, operating machines and codebreaking the whole time! It's great fun!Once the game is finished and you've hopefully escaped, you have a little time to chill out with a free drink and reflect on the game!I'm quite selective with recommendations to friends but can happily say I've recommended Mission: Breakout to everyone I've spoken to since.They're a relatively new breakout game but have definitely come in with a bang and I'm sure we'll be seeing many more great things from them soon! Id' recommend getting in soon before they get booked up as word is spreading! :DThanks for a great day guys and we'll definitely be returning soon I'm sure!
Thriller!. Amazingly well detailed and immersive environment, beautifully crafted puzzles, excellent guides and just a really, really fun time.
Loved it. Went there with some friends for a stag do and really liked it. Some nice effects. Our guide was cute too.

Really intense, challenging and fun game, a must do.. Set in a disused railway station, you're drawn into a scenario during WWII to help out Winston Churchill. I know it was only a game, but you could truly believe it! The introduction video, the venue, the noises and the time specific props and equipment all draw you fully into the scenario. A real team game and a fantastic nail biter, felt exhausted afterwards, although it wasn't a physical challenge in any way. They're going to put another game together in the near future and I can't wait. Would recommend this to anyone who likes a challenge from about age 10 upwards.Very grateful for the soft drink or water afterwards.

Amazing!. Having wanted to do a breakout room for ages, mission breakout certainly didn't disappoint! The challenges were difficult enough to keep you engaged and the room/props were great. We were a family of 5, the youngest being 23 and all we all really enjoyed ourselves. A great attraction which we all would have no hesitation in recommending.

Awesome Evening in London!. I'd heard about these types of activities in London but was apprehensive about how enjoyable they'd actually be. But I'm pleased to say that my whole group absolutely loved it! AC is a great host and is passionate about the game, the theme and the setting and this really shows. We all left buzzing and discussing every aspect of the game. Definitely recommend.

Brilliantly themed immersive escape room. This is one of the most well thought out games of this type in London. Brilliantly well designed, challenging enough to make you feel you get your money's worth but not so hard it gets frustrating, staging worthy of the theatre and a genuinely friendly team, with real passion running it. Well worth a visit!

Setting the bar for escape rooms. I've done many escape rooms, but this is the first I felt compelled to review as it was really something special.Of the pure escape room games I've done, this is by far the best I've been to in terms of being wonderfully themed and very immersive. They use the old tube abandoned Tube station brilliantly and as a Tube geek I loved that alone.But they didn't stop there, they mixed it with amazing sets that feel like they're out of a movie. Indeed those that have seen The Imitation Game will certainly get a blast from some of the elements. The quality was superb.It's nice to see them mix in things like sound effects too, which I've not seen exploited in escape rooms and really adds to the theme.Add to that, they were very friendly, chatted afterwards and gave us a cold drink as we discussed our experiences.All in all, highly recommended. It's lovely to see a piece of history resurrected - and at this level of quality they've set the bar to which all other escape rooms need to meet.
Excellent. This was my first time visiting a puzzle room and it was fantastic. Challenging, but not impossible so made for a really fun time. Amazing set and staff. 10/10 would recommend.

Real cool atmosphere! Good puzzles!. Context: I've done over 30 escape rooms over the past 3 years, so I've started become more critical of escape rooms with time. Keep that in mind when reading the negative points since even though it might not have been the best, we still all enjoyed it very much and is definitely worth going to, be it only for the location.The good:- Great historical location! It felt like sharing a bit of London history, I loved it.- The atmosphere is definitely there, the setting is quite realistic for this kind of budget.- Most puzzles are of good quality.The less good:- Some puzzles require guessing or trying until it works. I wish there were more clues to find which would lead to the path to follow. But maybe that's personal.- Some of the equipment was not so pleasant to touch... Can't really say what without spoiling some of it. It's not the cleanest space overall.- Not everything is automated, which can lead to some unexplained behaviours.

Such a Great Experience!!!. I had such an amazing time. I am a massive fan of Call Of Duty Zombies and mission breakout had a lot of similarities in term of riddles that we needed to solve which made me appreciate the whole experience the more.I will definitely take me team to Mission Breakout. It's perfect for a team-bonding activity.Topissime!!!

Mission Breakout - Fantastic experience. WOW what an amazing challenge, firstly the setting for this escape room is incredible it really is based in a diss-used part of an underground railway station which was used as an air raid shelter in WWII.The game is fast paced with many surprises, we needed a few hints and did struggle on the last stages of the game but I would absolutely recommend this escape room. We went with a couple that had no previous experience and they loved it.Our host was excellent at providing the odd tip here & there which kept the game moving at just the right pace.For information, it's located next door to cash converters, you'll see the doorway entrance with a quick look at street view on google maps, worth doing in advance.Enjoy !!

Great escape game near Camden. The setting is quite impressive and you are plunged into the war atmosphere as soon as you get down the stairs. At some point, I really thought I would have to solve enigma to get out !

SO MUCH FUN!!!!!. Such an amazing experience. Takes place in a ghost tube station in Camden, which adds a lot to the atmosphere, and you have to figure out the puzzle within 60 minutes whilst pretending to be in the blitz . One of the best evenings I've ever had. Such a thought through and clever gaming experience. There is so much to do and find and the rooms are decorated brilliantly. The lady who runs it (AC) was so lovely as well. We had a really nice chat with her after our experience too. Would definitely recommend to everyone. Will definitely go back when she adds another game :) x

Best Evening in a long time!!. I cannot recommend this escape room enough!!!! Have been to another before. But this far exceeded it!! Can't believe it has only been open a couple of weeks. It ran so smoothly. Had such a great time surprising my friend with this treat for her birthday!!! Great way to spend some time with friends!!! Wish I could do it again!! The lady who runs it was also fantastic and had us laughing throughout!!!! Completely worth the money!!!

Just Waouwwww !!. Well done to all the team behind this project, finally something very interesting to do in London ! I went there with my brother and nieces and we loved it ! The staff is very friendly and professional, Mission breakout is just a masterpiece ! Like Winston Churchill would say " However beautiful is the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results"

So much fun! . Would definitely recommend this to anybody, whether it's a group of friends, family or colleagues. Great way of bonding and working together. The host was very friendly and the venue was so authentic. Absolutely loved it!!

Absolutely loved it!!!. Me and my team of 5 enjoyed every minute of it! Host was really friendly and very helpful with the precious clues. It was such a fun experience and great way of making you work as a team. I would definitely recommend it

Escape room in a very unique location. The most eye-catching feature of this escape room is its unique location in the catacombs under the disused South Kentish Town tube station, which closed in 1924 and was used as an air-raid shelter in the Second World War. The escape room is set in that time, complete with an introduction video by Winston Churchill and lots of machinery in the room that resembles technology from the time used to decipher the Nazi codes. The venue's first room, "Codebreakers", stays true to its name and makes you operate the machinery and crack codes.As a relatively experienced team of four we felt that the total amount of puzzles was a bit low (we needed 43 minutes to escape), but their quality was on a good level and, especially with the very strong theme in the unique location, a big recommendation and very good value for money.

Amazing experience !. It was a great experience. Thank to the attention to details, the decor was so real that we could feel in a complete immersion in our mission. The history of the place makes the game even more interesting. I highly recommend Mission Breakout with no hesitation !!!!

Great fun :D. We went to Mission Breakout for a team building event, we did not know what to expect exactly - and it really blown us away :D !!!!I would heavily recommend it - already looking forward to go back!!!

Best escape room I've done. I've done three or four puzzle rooms before, and this one has been the most fun. The history behind the place adds to the charm, but the best part for me was the attention to detail on the puzzles and the theming. A fun challenge that will take up most of the full hour and best played with a few friends!

Great venue. The venue is the old South Kentish Town Tube station which gives the game lots of character. A lot of effort has been put into the interior and there's some lovely period props. The game itself was great fun with some interesting puzzles to solve. Mission: Breakout is well worth a go. There are also some good restaurants and pubs nearby so you can make night of it.

Race Against Time!. From the minute you walk in Mission: Breakout you are taken back in time. The challenges are exciting and keep you on your toes and on the edge. It's full of surprises and once you complete a section to move to the other it's a huge rush!! A must and well worth doing - Don't Miss Out

Amazing time!!!. Going as a group and someone with no prior experience I had no expectations of what was to come .... But I was not disappointed!! From the creative greeting room to then being led into a room you need to escape from was brilliant! It tested your logic and teamwork skills and shows how well you listen and work with friends or colleagues! The theme and story was so intriguing and the technology used from clue to clue was pretty cool! I totally want to go again but need my mind to forget the answers ;p ... For the record we escaped!!

Totally worth it!. I had such an amazing time, it really is a great interactive experience. In a modern world where life is so hectic, it is good to see something like this where you can step away from reality for an hour or so. The amount of thought and detail gone into the whole set-up is much better than many other escape games I have been to before.

AN ABSOLUTE MUST!. From the moment you enter the building, through to when you escape (if you're as smart as us!), the experience has you on edge with the adrenaline pumping. If you like a challenge and to test your strengths with friends, while laughing the whole way through, this is well worth a visit! If only we didn't know the answers so that we could do it all over again!

Brilliant fun. Such a great experience, really tested our concentration, common sense and team work! We went as a group of friends but you could also go as a family or as a team building event. A really immersive experience from the minute you open the front door. I wish I could erase my memory and do it again!

Joker's Asylum - Excellent storyline and theme, but overcomplicated at some points. My partner and I have done about 10 escape games now. Omescape venue is very spacious, they did very well by acquiring it. Our game master was slightly delayed, so we were joint with a different group doing a different room who have never done any escape games before. So we had to go through all the basics, which did spoil the experience a bit. The room itself is great and there is a twist to it. There are variety of puzzles which are not just based on the padlocks. Always a plus. We escaped with 6 seconds to spare!!!! However, at one point you need to go through lots of written information, which we discarded as a red herring. Unfortunately, it broke the flow of the game and we didn't come out of the game thinking "Oh Wow, the final puzzle is amazing". Overall, I would recommend this room, but it is one of the hardest we did.

The most fun you can have in an hour with your clothes on!. We went to Omescape on Sunday 16th October for my daughter's 25th birthday. We completed the Bio-hazard Laboratory in 52 mins and won a medal. Such good fun and kept us on our toes.Would recommend buying the tickets on Groupon to save money.
Fantastic !. Escaped with a minute to go with 6 13 year olds.They had a fantastic time and we would all recommend this, if fact they all want to go again

Excellent puzzles, not quite the total experience. (No Spoilers about the rooms)We've done two of the rooms now, Joker's Asylum and The Penitentiary. On the plus side, the rooms are laid out really well with a good variety of puzzles. Joker's Asylum lived up to its 5-star difficulty setting, while we completed The Penitentiary in 45 minutes with one hint so probably around 3-star difficulty. The lighting and technology are also very effective, something I've not really seen in other Escape The Room games except ClueQuest. It allowed for more unusual puzzles and this alone makes it stand out from the others.However, I would still rank it below ClueQuest for one reason - the total experience. It's not enough just doing the puzzles and escaping, you need a build-up of expectation before you enter and a debrief after, like a good dessert! ClueQuest did this really well, both before (the "briefing") and after - it gave what you did in the room some context.Omescape doesn't do this nearly as effectively. At the beginning there is a briefing but the staff didn't seem that interested (maybe they should hire an actor?) and at the end it's worse, there is no reference to what you've just done or what you've just escaped from. It feels a bit like being a cow - you've been milked, now off you go...I think once they've changed that aspect, it will elevate it to the next level.

Penitentiary Escape. Myself and four friends visited here earlier this week after getting a voucher via Groupon. For our group, three had never done an escape room before and two had only done one. The experience was great! The puzzles are challenging, the design good and whole concept kept you wanting more. The staff were very friendly and made your experience feel personal and not just another booking for them. We managed to escape the room in 29 minutes, the fastest it's ever been done!! So shocked!!! No idea how we were so fast!Would 100% recommended and will be back to try the other two!!

Excellent way to spend an hour.. Firstly I should say that I am quite an experienced Escape Room player, having played around 20 rooms in London, and so my ratings tend to seem on the harsh side, as I am comparing against other rooms I have played. This review is just for Omescape’s “Biohazard Laboratory” game, as I haven’t played the other two yet.People new to rooms escapes will definitely have a very fun time here (Biohazard Laboratory is actually a very good choice of room to introduce you to the genre), and escape room enthusiasts will too, but I’ll explain a few of the things which let it down a bit. With some improvements and tweaks made, this could definitely be a really good one.Firstly, THINGS I LIKED:- Very friendly host. Though not in character (which is rare but always gets bonus points from me), he was welcoming and explained everything properly without waffling on too long. The waiting area was nice, and had some puzzles to play with while we waited.- We didn’t have a booking, my brother and I rang on an impromptu whim, and were fitted in without any bother as they had a space available for us.- Some great theming and design inside the game, particularly the first two parts which were like a sewer. I won’t give any spoilers but the use of lighting and darkness added a memorable mood that I haven’t experienced in any other room escapes. The 2nd room looked especially cool.- Some unique sorts of puzzles. Throughout the whole game there was not one key needed to open a padlock! That made a nice change.- Some genuinely lovely uses of technology for puzzles. A lot of love and effort had obviously gone into that.- I liked that we were able to get clues whenever we wanted, and that the penalty for this would be not being included in the “used no clues” leaderboard. This meant that although some parts baffled us, we never got frustratingly stuck for too long – it was fun throughout.THINGS I WASN’T SO KEEN ON:- Some of the set design was a bit rough and ready in places. There were a few times where screws and wires were visible, or where a name plate had come unstuck from the surface it was supposed to be attached to (in the last room). There was also a hole in the wall with what looked like a cog inside. We were sure we’d have to stick something in there and turn it and were disappointed when that never happened… it was just a misleading hole. I would recommend covering that up with something.- One puzzle was a bit mathsy and complex, and another really looked like it was but actually wasn’t (in the 2nd room). I loved the actual solution to it, and feel it should have had one more tiny clue promting towards that, as it would have saved us 5 minutes of trying out unnecessary maths-based solutions.- Also, some dials which needed to be set (near the beginning) did not have arrow markers on them as you’d expect, so some black lines had been scruffily drawn on with felt tip pen. Unfortunately these had faded and in a couple of cases were barely visible, especially in the dim lighting conditions. As these are absolutely pivotal to completing the puzzle, I think this should be fixed, with a neater and more permanent arrow /marker on the dials. For aesthetics, but more importantly for function.- We only got one torch between two of us. A torch each would have been much better, as they were most definitely needed.- One of the pieces of technology near the end wasn’t working and got skipped. Even though the host afterwards said this wasn’t a pivotal part of the game, it looked very intriguing.- While some puzzles were really nice, there were a few that I think felt a bit too random and relied on guesswork and overstretched leaps of logic. Even in hindsight, the answer didn’t seem obviously right, it’s just what happened to work. This is always a bit frustrating and leaves me feeling like "oh... ok...". I prefer it when there’s a clear and logical process through the whole thing – I usually feel any gaps in this could often be helped by adding a few more subtle clues and instructions. For example how to use the metal object that you need for the last puzzle… the way it had to be used wasn’t intuitive and had to be explained to us over the walkie talkie. A little in-room instruction about things like that would have been nice. Also some of the information needed for that last puzzle, (which in itself was a bit elaborate and convoluted), was a bit too buried amongst a lot of scientific jargon, so the whole thing felt a bit wishy-washy. I would probably recommend cutting down on some of the unneeded text for that last puzzle and being more explicit about the aim.- One puzzle involved some picture symbols. Without giving too much away, in our opinion these didn’t really look like what they were supposed to and so for us it felt very much like guesswork. It didn’t help that the last one had accidentally been rotated so it was upside down, completely changing our interpretation of it. I would recommend completely redoing these symbols, making it more clear what they’re supposed to represent. I think the puzzle would still be challenging because you’d still have to work out how to use them, but at least when somebody solves what they have to do, they would then be able to go ahead and do it without being unsure or getting extra hints. In summary, it was a solid game, very enjoyable, and would be even moreso for newer players. However, the mostly excellent design work was let down a little bit in places, by some parts that were a bit sloppy or not working as they should. And a few of the puzzles whose solutions felt a bit too arbitrary and obscure (even in hindsight) led to us asking for more clues than we would have liked. I have played other rooms in London that have really nailed these elements (very slickly produced and always having satisfying, logical solutions; all the clues you need are already there in the room) but I have also played much worse rooms too, so the 3 out of 5 stars seemed most appropriate. With some of the improvements mentioned above, it would definitely jump to 4 stars. I look forward to going back and trying the other two rooms :) Thanks very much for a fun afternoon.

Penitentiary - Decent game. I took part in this escape room challenge as part of a team building activity at work, we were a team of 5 in the Penitentiary room. This is the intermediate level game and pretty tricky, you will be given a walkie talkie, pen and paper and a flashlight as your tools to solve the puzzles and riddles. If you get stuck you will get some clues from the game masters who will talk to you through the walkie talkie, these will be subtle hints rather than revealing what the solution is. You'll have 60 minutes to break out of the room. I have given this 3 stars as we managed to 'accidently' solve certain clues before the clues we needed to solve before these ones which meant we got instructions through the walkie talkie to ignore the clue for now etc. We didn't make it out on time but the game master made us go back in to finish the game even though we were pretty much ready to head back out, this kind of ruining the experience.

Highly recommended venue!. We used Omescape as a part of our team building day and it was the best choice ever. We hired all four rooms so all our staff could play at once (up to 27 people). Omescape crew is very welcoming and give brief explanation how the rooms works. Rooms itself are filled with riddles and each game leaves your brain steaming (even the difficulty 3 gives you a lot of pleasure). Plus you get all the excitement running against the clock. It's definitely a must go for anyone who likes solving puzzles. Big thank you for having us!

Hen do - team of 7. We were looking for an escape room that allowed a team of 7 in at once, and thankfully Omescape was one of those that did! We did a the Penitentiary room and we were really pleased with it. The bride-to-be had an absolutely smashing time, and everyone else loved it as well, especially the few that had never tried escape rooms before! ;) It was an interesting room from start to finish - challenging but not so much that we couldn't escape. I really want to gush about how cool some effects are but that would be giving away the fun! Overall a pretty good way to spend an hour!

Biohazard - our third game with Omescape. We had played two other games from Omescape previously - one in NY and Penintentiary in London. Each member of our team played minimum 10 other escape rooms.This review describes our experience playing Biohazard game. Positives:- really cool location - escape rooms are inside a former church and there is very spacious reception area, which is cool if you come a little earlier for your game- very nice design, consistently sticking to the theme- sophisticated puzzles using some very cool technology (although one of them didn't work properly)Negatives:- We only got two torches (team of 4) in what is very dark escape room (especially in some of its parts). I'm not sure whether this was supposed to make us work in 'couples' and to promote team work, or increase atmosphere, but only effect it had was that it was super frustrating. - One part of one puzzle was missing, because one of the previous teams has lost it. Seriously? - Game masters' attention was very inconsistent. They wouldn't let us know when we were obviously looking for the last "missing picture", and when we later in the game asked for a hint, we had to contact them several times, and try flashing the light on cameras to get their attention. However when I tried to get something out of big "aquarium", without using any special strength, to make sure there is nothing hidden inside, i was immediately told off for trying to take the room apart. (if you don't want players to do something in your game, mark it with a sticker, or don't make it that easy)Overall i think Penintentiary was a better game, but a lot could have been influenced by having different (or less busy) game masters.

Fantastic fun!. Visited with my friend and her family on a Saturday morning. There was only 3 of us so we went for the laboratory room and it was fantastic. It was just the right level of difficulty and the hints given were just enough to help without giving too much away. Will definitely be going back and I highly recommend to anyone looking for a different activity with friends or family.

Great fun.. good challenge . We've enjoyed quite a few escape rooms before , including omescape jokers asylum (kids found a bit creepy but added to excitement and it was very good challenge ) . We introduced it to our friends this time , as well as bringing our 8 yr and 13 yr old kids. We all had such good fun at penitentiary. Needed some clues so it was def challenging enough and our friends (who were new to it and didn't know what to expect) really enjoyed it and we were all trying to work the puzzles out afterwards. Very impressive tech effects , has real 'wow' factor and great fun to solve. Physical and mental fun challenge, and tense with only a few mins left. Fantastic group friends/ family activity and great value on Groupon.

Very good - but hard. Thought it would be fun to gather the troops and try one of these escape rooms I've been hearing about. None of us had been to anything like this before. We had to go for the Penitentiary (intermediate room), as there was quite a few of us and this was the only room that allowed up to 7 people. The staff were very helpful, although we did start later than the time. We genuinely didn't know what to expect. The journey took us through a couple of stages trying to get out of certain places. Started off pretty easy, but got more difficult. You definitely need time to get the brain going. If we didn't get hints along the way, I don't think we would have completed it in time. But that's what they're there for, to nudge you in the right direction, giving us just enough without taking the fun out of the challenged. Overall a good experience, although I would suggest the beginners rooms if you've never done anything like this before!

Great way to team bond!. My friends and I took a friend here for her birthday. Weve done one before elsewhere and wanted to try a different one. Good value for money and well worth it. Such a great way to work together in a team. We may not have completed within the time but they still let us continue until we broke out which i thought was very good of them. Very much recommended.

Great Fun. I went along with a group of mates & we did the Penetentiary escape room. It was great fun and a real challenge but we managed to get out with 2 seconds to spare. I would def recommend Omescape & hope to check out the other escape rooms!

Omescape London Fun. We checked out Omescape with 7 people, I think the larger group actually made it harder. Some of us had done an room escape before and some were newbies. This is a very challenging escape experience and has some tough puzzles, we escaped with 7 seconds to spare. The rooms and props were good, but I have done another one in London that was better for that, where even the introduction fit the theme of the room. That was why I gave it 4 instead of 5.Overall a very enjoyable way to spend an hour.

Excellent 30th birthday activity. Our group of 6 have never done anything like this before & we loved it. It took us a little while to get into it but there is always someone to give you clues so you don't waste too much time! Something different & a fun activity

Late Night Conundrums at Omescape!. Went as a group of 4 blokes to the 9pm showing (or puzzling?) of Biohazard. Was not disappointed. We were absolutely pitiful but enjoyed it nevertheless. The high production value is what stands out I think for Omescape compared to other escape games I've done - there are multiple rooms, huge range of props and lighting/sound effects etc. You're not just locked up in a converted apartment filled with a bunch of cheap props and low lighting, given a rough backstory for the puzzle and told to escape. Instead you're making your way through multiple film sets it almost feels like, and the puzzles often involve doing a lot more than just finding a key/unlocking a box - be warned! Can't wait to try out their other two games!

Fantastic escape game experience. I used this experience as our team building activity for our department at our church and everyone enjoyed it!It's our first escape game experience for all of us. The only thing is not all of my co-church officers were able to come as there were limited space for the game. I wanted a two identical game rooms that would accommodate 7 participants. But they only have 1 theme that is similar. I was hoping that 2 teams could compete on one another head-to-head and finish at the same time. We ended up having only 12 participants and 3 had to back down. The gaming staff are very helpful and accommodating and had been very patient with us especially when we got stuck in 1or two (or three ) of the puzzzles.

Excellent birthday evening!. This place was such a fantastic place to do something different for a birthday! We had two teams and competed against each other! The staff are amazing and professional and super helpful :) everyone had fun and the settings / rooms made the experience! Fun evening and definitely will go again! ;)

Great escape room. Loved this place - inventive, challenging and excellent set up. Would really recommend this and will definitely come back to try out the other scenarios. We used it for a team building event and would definitely do it again. Great place!
Great. This was a well put together and fun escape room. They have spent a lot of money putting it together which means it is a quality room. Loved it and will be back.
Good bit of group fun. I've been to an escape room elsewhere before. It wasn't quite as good as that one, netheless it was still a hour of fun.
Misfit bunch. Great time and loads of laughs. Not as easy as its looks but great way to spend time with loved ones and friends who are visiting

Best birthday present, going to come back soon!!. I booked in for my sisters 30th and we chose the jokers asylum, it was honestly the best experience, without giving too much away from the games its very immersive and you really feel like youre in another place. We will be back for another game soon!!!!

Excellent!. We had a group of 5 do the biohazard lab. Took us a little while to get going but it was so good! The puzzles were just hard enough that it was a challenge but not too hard that we felt we couldn't do them. When we finished our hour we all wanted to go straight back in and do another one!

A good escape room, focusing on puzzles rather than finding things. An unprepossessing building hides 3 escape rooms of differing difficulty. We did the Penitentiary which is the middle level. Lots of good puzzles to solve and the multi-level multi-colour element definitely adds to it. Thoroughly enjoyed it - would recommend.
Best Escape Room Yet!. Bought the Groupon and it was the best escape room I have done in London, really nice host and smart facilities, tricky game but we finished it in time!
Fun. I have done quite a few escape rooms before and this was a good one. Quite a varied room with different puzzles.

Birthday escape . This was such an exciting challenge. There were so many puzzles to figure out some were harder than others, but with a team of 6 we soon got out of there. We had 1 hour to work our way through the many different rooms and levels. There are 3 different level of games to try out. We did the medium level but there is an easy and hard level to try out. We already talked about going back to try out the harder level!

A challenging escape!. We went as a family of 4, and on advice booked the Bio Hazard room. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The challenge itself was well structured and required quick thinking to move from room to room. If you got stuck the staff were happy to provide useful hints over a walkie talkie. We did complete the task (with a couple of hints) just a few minutes over the time limit. Overall a very interesting and enjoyable experience. I would happily go again and recommend for families and groups.

Very enjoyable - if a little dark. This was our 2nd escape experience as a family. Unfortunately we made a mistake with the timing of our booking, which was for the penitentiary, but the staff were very courteous with us and offered the Biohazard lab instead - which was good fun. We were a family of 5 - 2 parents, 3 teenagers. The puzzles were good, & the help we got from the friendly staff was just right - so that we completed the task with 2 mins to go. My only criticism is that it is just too dark in the rooms. It is supposed to be to create atmosphere, but we were given just two torches between 5 (both of which went flat & we had to call for reinforcements). It's Ok for young eyes to squint in the dark, but us middle-aged people really struggle to read in low light, so I was quite frustrated. More light, and/or more torches!!!

Great family fun. We were a mixed bag with a age range of 10 years to 50 something. I can honestly say we throughly enjoyed ourselves and are already planning another visit. We went for the medium difficulty room. None of us had done an escape room before so did not really know what to expect. We found the rooms quite challenging but great fun. We needed a little help so clues were given, without these we may still be locked in now !!!! Well thought out rooms and great member of staff. This will certainly get the brain ticking over!!! Requires team work so great also for getting everyone involved. Would definitely recommend.

Absolutely brilliant!!!!. On arrival we were greeted by the guys on reception who were warm and extremely inviting, it was really easy to find and on entering there are tablles with puzzles on to keep you entertained, we then proceeded through to the escape room there was 6 of us and we entered the rooms. The guys are really good and you really feel like you actually trying to escape as they act the parts out, the atmosphere is intense and they have done so well with setting up the whole place, now it would spoil it for anyone that wanted to go here if i told you anything about the rooms but all i can say is YOU MUST DO IT if you are a team , family, friends, anything just do it you wont regret it!!Nice one back next month!!!

Great fun!!. A team of six 17 year olds took on the challenge and they all really enjoyed themselves.The staff were very welcoming and the rooms were well -themed. They found the Penitentiary challenging and great fun!

Super fun experience. My friends and I were in London and plays were sold out so we decided to try an escape room. I have never been so grateful with such a change in plans! Two of the four in our group had never been to an escape room. My boyfriend and I were the two inexperienced ones which added to the fun of it all. We were asked to go 10 minutes before our booked time. We did the Bio hazardous lab room. We had Nicky as our team leader who explained the goal of the game and a little back story. He was very welcoming and friendly! We had an hour to enter four separate rooms and solve a variety of tasks. All of these tasks were different puzzles which was great because each person in the group had a chance to shine and help get to the end goal! We got out with 13 minutes to spare and received a medal! It was a great adrenaline rush and we were all very excited about the situation. We 100% plan to go back but maybe with a bit more practise since the next rooms are trickier! Overall a great time!

Great puzzles. Penitentiary.So, I have been to far too many escape games, and I have to say this is one of the best I have visited. There's a great variety of puzzles, and with five people in the room no one was bored or at a loose end. I'd recommend this room to people who've not to been to a game before, but also to more experienced gamers as there were things I've never seen before.The operation could be a little slicker, and we weren't shown into our room until about 15 minutes after the time it was booked for, but that wasn't really a problem.

Escaped with 17mins to go!!!. The Jokers Asylum is an interesting concept (I don't want to say too much and give anything away!) The game is fun and logical. Great for team building or for small groups of friends. Nice touch giving the winners a medal at the end. We escaped with 17minutes to go - but we've done a few escape room challenges before! Definitely worth it if you're looking for an interesting activity in London!
Girls day out. Very well thought out , great team building activity , had a great time ,the game we chose was the hardest ..?the jokers asylum

Brilliant. Despite some negative reviews with regards to aspects of the game, this was by far my favourite escape room so far, and I've done a few! Walkie talkies only enhance the experience and force communication, plus if you do jokers asylum which is the hardest one it's a great challenge, which we did with 20 seconds to spare!
Cracking Escape Game. Had great fun here. Really high production value and very immersive. Will definitely be going back for the other rooms!

Fun. I was attending summer school at Camebridge and some friends and I chose to go to London during the weekend. We had a lot of fun doing the escaperoom at omescape! It was the first time we tried an escape room.

Escape reality. This place is awesome, I went here with my wife and friends for her birthday, we did a room Saturday, enjoyed it so much as we were walking out booked to come again on Sunday!I think Nick was a little surprised to see us again, there are a good range of different puzzles, and some very creative ways of getting the solution, very well designed.My only criticism would be that when we arrived to the big black door we couldn't figure out how to get in, there wasn't any way of opening it, and didn't seem to be a door bell or any way of getting the door to open, and there was me thinking it was about trying to escape ... not get in!

Joker's Asylum non-spoiler review. As hardcore Escape Room fanatics it's hard to find a place with a completely new twist, but Omescape's Joker's Asylum did just that.Without spoiling anything about the room, we did Joker's Asylum and were impressed to find two new "features" at Omescape which we had never found elsewhere. The only reason we're giving it 4 instead of 5 was because one of the helpers literally came into our room to give a hint at something. It was an appreciated hint but it ruined the 'locked in' theme. It was with the best of intentions though.
fun place.. Well happy. Booked for 7, took a whole hour and was reasonably priced. We did get out but only had 5 mins to spare.

First Ever Escape Room. A family day out for my daughters birthday. A new experience for all of us - not knowing what to expect. Well what a brilliant day it was. The lads who were organising it were very helpful and explained everything thoroughly making us feel at ease. We struggled at first to get going but they can give you hints or clues to get you moving. We had such fun being a team and working out the puzzles, clues and methods of elimination to work through the rooms to gain our escape! We all can't wait to do another one - think we could become addicted. Highly recommend Omescape

Fantastic. Visited with 2 friends. After having done escape rooms before we decided to do the jokers asylum. Got to say we definitely wasn't disappointed, by far the best escape room we have done. This room isn't for first timers as it was the trickiest room I have done. Would definitely return to try the other rooms.

Excellent from start to finish. from my initial enquiries all the way through to the booking it was great. I booked for my sister's 16th Birthday, she and 9 friends went for the biolab hazard. They were raving about it all the way back. Great experience for all and saved me entertaining them! Well done Omescape!

Jokers Asylum . Absolutely incredible activity. Fun from start to finish. We did the hardest room... and it really made us use our brains. Our games master Nick was totally amazing from the moment we arrived til the moment we left. Well worth the money!!! Awesome....

Joker asylum, possibly the most difficult one in London. The evening was perfect. This room escape es completely madness, full of details and decoding. Our gamemaster was so kind and ready to manage our frustration all the time, giving us the little hint we needed to move on. Great experience!

Had a really good time. This was the first escape room me and my friends ever been to and we all enjoyed it. As total beginners, we found The Penitentiary to be a bit hard..we wouldn't have finished it without bits of help..I totally recommend it and will go to the other two rooms in the near future

Joker's Asylum was awesome!. Me and 3 friends did Joker's Ayslum for a bit of fun one day and absolutely loved it!! It was such a fun experience and we were talking about it all day afterwards.
It really was very tricky and challenging which made it lots of fun and we're keen to try the other rooms now!
Would absolutely recommend it!
Awesome. Booked this for something different to do as a team building exercise for work! Really good! Team was friendly from the first request email! Everyone loved it and want to try some more!

Amazing experience!. We did the Joker's Asylum and it was so good! Good ambiance and good scenario! Excellent welcome and a real good time! I will surely do another scenario there and highly recommend it! Thanks again Omescape!

Another great escape game. Did the penitentiary room with a team of 7 of us for my birthday, having had my first escape room experience back in January, which I loved. This one definitely did not disappoint either - we were the 18th team to escape within the hour, with 13:25 to spare, and can't wait to go back to try one of the other two rooms and see our picture up on the hall of fame!

Great live escape game - perfect for a birthday celebration. 5 of us tried the Biohazard Lab room for my sister's birthday and had a really fun hour! 4 of us had never done a live escape game before and this room was a good starting room - we managed to escape with 12mins to spare! I would say it is probably a bit too easy for anyone who's done one of these escape games before but for beginners it's perfect.

One of London's better escape room companies. I've now done all 3 rooms at Omescape (and I've done another 30 or so rooms in total) and they're all very good - good production values, interesting and varied puzzles. The whole set up is friendly but slick and professional. Joker's asylum was my favourite of the rooms - not only was it the hardest of the three, the group dynamic at the start was completely different from anything I've had at other rooms and really added a new style of challenge.As a slight caveat, there's nothing absolutely outstanding in here (by escape room standards) - the sort of thing that leaves you buzzing and talking about it for days afterwards - but rooms like that are rare indeed and it's not reasonable to hold every room to that bar! To have built three rooms of this quality is a great achievement and well worthy of 5 stars!
Omescape. I went with my kids and although it was tricky we had a great time! We needed to get help a few times!
Had a great time!!. Had an amazing time. 7 girls went as a hen activity. It was a lot of fun, great theme and would definitely recommend it.
V. Good. Friendly service, built up the pre-escape atmosphere well, rooms were well designed and the puzzles sufficiently challenging, if only it didn't end so quick!
Great activity!!!. 7 girls scrabbling over clues but we made it through with a bit of help from the man on the other end of the walkie talkie! Would definitely do this again!!!

the penitentiary. 6 of us went to this ...I have never been to an escape room so had no idea what to expect but this was great. very different from what other's described. Very cleverly constructed tasks. We had a fantastic time and will do one of the others soon!
Amazing experience. The best escape room experience for me to date. It was challenging and extremely satisfying having 10 seconds on the clock before making the escape!

Loved it. I went for my birthday and did the bio hazard room. We had a great time the room was super fun and the puzzles were really cool to solve. The man who worked there was awesome and really helpful. I only wish I could have gone again straight away!

A very enjoyable and fun challenge. My girlfriend and I have played 25 rooms together and found this one to be very enjoyable.
We chose The Penetentiary game which was well thought-out and tested our skills to the limit.
The premises were easy to find and not far from King's Cross tube station. This is definitely one of the best we have tried in London.

Teenagers birthday . We visited Omescape London at the weekend for my sons 14th birthday. He took 4 other boys and they played the laboratory game. It was the first time that any of them had been to an Escape Room game so had nothing to compare it to.They managed to "escape" from the room just in time, they thoroughly enjoyed themselves and cannot wait to go back to try another room. They said that the challenges/puzzles really got them thinking and working as a team. Perfect activity for a group of teenagers (mine were all boys!) :-)

Another great room escape game in London. I took on this room escape game with my tried and tested team with whom I've done many similar games across London. This one, the Joker's Asylum, had a new twist which we hadn't found in other games and although I was nervous about this element taking some of the 'team play' out of the game, it actually worked well and made us use our communication skills in a very different way. As always with these games the puzzles are clever and there are some nice little surprises that kept even us hardened gamers amused. We made it out with 10 mins to spare which suggests that maybe the more experienced gamers will find it easier than normal but even so we were told there was only a 20% success rate. I always prefer games where clues/hints are offered via screens rather than needing to ask for them via walkie talkie but our guide intervened once or twice when we needed a small steer. Great fun as usual but I wouldn't recommend the Asylum game for complete beginners! Will probably return to do the other games sometime soon.

Really good team building event. I'd never done an escape game before so I didn't know what to expect. I did it as a team building event with my colleagues and I thought it was really fun, probably the best team building thing I've done (anything is better than building towers out of dry spaghetti, right!?). For anyone that hasn't done an escape game before, essentially you get locked in prison cells with a backstory and have to escape. There are clues in the rooms which allow you to open locks and other rooms until you escape. You have a set time to do it. I really enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and I think it's worth trying out if you haven't done it before.
Great excursion. Great experience with puzzles of varying difficulty, very challenging at times but help is available

Okay room, not as much fun as other Live Escape Games. We did the Joker's Asylum game and it felt very so-so. At the start you get split into 2 groups which isn't a great thing to do if you're doing it as a team bonding / group of friends things to do. I was on the hostage side which meant we'd solved everything in our room in 15 minutes and then stood around waiting to be rescued.The walkie-talkie thing was a nice gimmick and they really didn't work well. Made it difficult to communicate and probably been much easier if we'd just phoned each other up on our mobiles to communicate!Their were some nice puzzles in there but there were several that were just a bit weird. I'll not spoil it but on the last big one there was one that required a LOT of piecing together and another just reading a word. Also felt there could be 2 or 3 different answers to some puzzles which I wasn't keen on.All in all it was okay but much preferred Cluequest across the road.

Fantastic Room Escape in Kings Cross. We had a great time. The Penitentiary Room was filled with puzzles and games to get you thinking. We had an awesome time, Escaped the room with 57 seconds to spare.
I would definitely recommend this to all age groups, definitely get the family working as a team.
I will definitely be going back to try the other 2 rooms.

Outstanding Experience. Upon arrival, our game master did a great job of setting the mood and giving us the backstory for the Penitentiary. The room itself was very challenging and the game master gave us ample opportunity to solve all of the puzzles on our own and only gave us hints when we were really stuck. Needless to say, the whole group had a blast. We had such a good time that we inquired about another room and the game master offered the Joker's Asylum to us after a short break. The Joker's Asylum did not disappoint and surpassed the high bar that the first room set. I will recommend this experience to any friends or family and would recommend it to a complete stranger looking for a good time.
Birthday treat at Omescape. Fantastic hour spent solving the cleverly constructed puzzles to escape from The Penitentiary. Would thoroughly recommend it - can't wait to try the other rooms!

Awesome. We had so much fun trying to escape. Everyone at omescape was friendly and welcoming. The clues were difficult and challenging, we did have help as we weren't very good at escaping but what a laugh it was! Will definitely do it again.

Birthday Treat at the Joker's Asylum!. Fiance wanted to do an escape room for his Birthday so after no luck at finding avaliable dates at other escape room establishments. Thank god I found Omescape London! They had space in May 2016 and on the weekend too. We booked the Joker's Asylum and needless to say, a group of 5 boys and 1 girl - we were terrified! The Omescape team were very friendly and welcoming, they explained the rules clearly before we were made to enter our chosen room. I won't spoil the surprise but I would highly recommend you check these guys out! They also have another room avaliable now that looks very cool so maybe another trip is in order :D!

We Escaped. First time to visit this sort of challenge - and it won't be the last. We are a team of seven and traditional team building events simply don't wash. I needed something that we could do at the end of the day, be a little light hearted but also provide a challenge and get us thinking about our communications skills and our own individual talents - The Penitentiary worked for us.The online booking was simple, the price was good and on arrival it was very straight forward. Within minutes we were all immersed in the challenge to escape. There is a good use of technology and props to add to the quest and due to the nature of the challenge there was something for everyone to do throughout the hour.The time flew through and we escaped with a couple of minutes to spare. Well worth the visit.

Probably the best team building event you can do indoor for an hour. My team had an amazing time at Omescape such that some intend to go back with their friends. We played all 3 games. Detailed and well-thought through storylines giving a good sense of realism that got the adrenalin going. Well organised and friendly staff, who gave helpful tips at the right time to keep the games alive.

Great fun.. Attended with a couple of friends and I must say that it was one of the most fun and interactive things we have done. The puzzles required you to think outside the box, which made it so much more rewarding us when we figured them out. I went to another escape room the week after, which was not even close to this one.

Joker's Asylum. This was my first time visiting this place and I have to say I would go back again. We played the Joker's Asylum with 6 people.
