The game was very well thought out but it was a hard challenge, especially as we had to split into two teams and communicate through a radio. Unfortunately, we didn't finish the puzzle in time but I had a lot of fun! This is a great game to play but I would recommend it to people who have played escape games before. I will definitely come back again and try the other two games. The staff were very nice and polite.

Great fun and a mental challenge!. I had a fantastic time here with a group of old school friends. We managed to complete the Penetentiary challenge with 4 minutes to spare (and a bit of help on the way)!

Escape game fun. It really was a lot of fun! We very much enjoyed ourselves and really had to work together to solve the mysteries. You so get to use a limited amount of hints during the game (and most of ours was something like, make sure you look around the whole room, i.e on the wall behind you ha!) But it was a good, we made it out with 9 seconds to spare!Its also quite nice to work through different rooms, rather than just the one.Would recommend!

Really fun and challenging!. This was a really good experience! The Joker's Asylum was quite complicated but in a very fun way, and the guidance from the games' master (when requested) was great and helpful.

Great fun and clever puzzles with team of 5. We played their Penitentiary room (medium difficulty) on a Saturday afternoon with 5 people (aged 23-33). We have previously completed 5 other escape rooms throught London.Although we were just 1 minute short of getting out, it was great fun to play! The rooms look amazing and are in very good condition. The puzzles are just complex enough to keep it interesting without getting too frustrated. The Penitentiary room is very well designed and has some very surprising aspects. in the best way possible! Would highly recommend.
Omescape prisioner. It was a really nice experience, with enough level of complexity to be funny, interesting and not demotivating

My first escape. This was my first escape room experience and it was great. With bunch of friends we managed to escape from the penitentiary after solving lot of cool co-op puzzles. Definitely recommend!

Very good but a few teething problems. We did the penitentiary, their middle difficulty room. The initial briefing wasn't too good - their was another 'loud' group being briefed next to us and it kinda ruined the vibe. That said, the rooms experience was then good. Interesting clues and some nice physical, technical and thinking puzzles. I would say it wasn't anywhere near as 'dark' as the rather forbidding brief suggested and as novice escape room players we got out in 46 minutes which did seem swift. Like i say, though, a good experience overall

Birthday surprise for teenager. We did the Biohazard Lab. It was nowhere near as fun as ClueQuest's Operation Blacksheep.The first room was ridiculous as it wasn't working properly. We still got out in time but the last game wasn't properly working either. This is unacceptable and I don't think the people running it really care enough to fix stuff. Being in the dark with torches is boring and the puzzles too random and boring.

Hidden gem. I've done several escape rooms around europe, and this one it's been one of the best.We played "the penitenciary", presented as medium dificulty. But regardless that, it's well designed amd it has a perfect balance between key finding/padlock opening and mechanical puzzles.Overall, the experience has been great and we will repeat some time.

Great fun!. We were a group of 8 first time escape roomers who weren't sure what to expect. However it turned out to be thoroughly enjoyable hour (and 2 mins as we just failed to escape in time!). The games itself (we played the jokers asylum) was well structured and challenging, the staff were great and all in all it was an experience I've already recommended to lots of friends!

Fun but overpriced. The experience was well thought out and they made a good job of recreating the games. The location was a little dodgy and we thought we got the wrong place at first but I guess it adds to the concept. We did think it was expensive for what it was if we compare to othe activities of this sort and quality of production was ok but not amazing to account for the high charge but had a good time.

Felt like a real adventure. We attended as a family with grown up children as part of a birthday celebration. If you are a bit geeky (tick) and love solving problems (tick) you will have a great time. We did the easiest challenge - BIOLAB - which consisted of several rooms you had to progress through. It wasn't physically difficult but moving from room to room made if feel like a real adventure. Whilst it was atmospherically lit, it was not claustrophobic in any way. We will be back to tackle one of the other challenges!
Joker's Asylum; no laughing matter. More difficult than the one I have done before. The production quality was very good. Overall I really enjoyed it.

Belting Fun. Seven of us visited on a stag weekend, so the pressure was on to get out to the pub......which of course we did.The challenges presented were a mix of the more straightforward to the quite abstract. A mix of skill and luck saw us through on this occasion.Definitely recommended.
Awesome. Went twice in three nights it was so good! Highly recommended an amazing eve out!!!Great for family or friends or both!!!betond awesome

A great day out!. Went there with 5 friends on Saturday and found it thoroughly entertaining. We took on Jokers Asylum (the toughest room) and it was great. Lots of fun and really got you thinking. Will definitely be going back to try the other rooms. Couldn't recommend it enough!

Great concept but execution not perfect. This escape room was very fun and had some good twists, however the execution was not as good as others that we've done. First of all the facilitator seemed nervous and we had trouble understanding him at various points in the game. He also wasn't in character at all. That said the business was very flexible when we added another person to our team and needed to switch times. I would definitely recommend this but just don't expect the production value or execution to be as high as other rooms you may have tried.
Escape room. 6 of us went into the Joker room. Immersive and enjoyable. Tricky puzzles but a really fun hour. Would definately go again and try the other rooms.

For experienced escape roomers, 'Joker's Asylum' is a must play!. As an experienced set of escape roomers we set off to Omescape with a massive sense of intrigue. We'd read a review that hinted at a unique feature in their game 'Joker's Asylum' and we very much wanted to pit ourselves against it. We were not disappointed, it was a game full of wonderful discoveries including some great moments of teamwork and also some great personal victories, which culminated in our escape with 30 seconds to spare. I would certainly not recommend this particular room to first timers (beginners should definitely try one of their other rooms instead), but for teams with experience 'Joker's Asylum' is a must play. We loved every minute. We will certainly be back to North London to try their other rooms as well!

Great challenging fun!. Our first escape room so didnt really know what to expect but we all had a great time!We did the joker room which was very challenging but we got through it with some hints.Really well organised and well put together experience, would definitely go back to try the other rooms.

New & Unique. Had a awesome time on Saturday morning doing the Biohazard Laboratory. If it's your first time doing an 'escape room' or you're going with friends who have never done it before (like we did) this is a awesome one to start with. We already have plans to go back to try the other rooms. The puzzles are unique & the staff was really welcoming & helpful. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to do something similar. It seems to be a very new company & the room we did was on it's second day of opening. The newness of it all makes for a refreshing experience as there are no give-aways of 'used' area's / items.

Challenging and interesting. There have been two of us in the Biohazard Laboratory. The puzzles are challenging and some of them require a bit (more) of mathematics. Do not expect the classical "find the key and open the next lock" experience, every puzzle requires a different type of solution. The clues were offered when necessary. Everything inside is new and works properly. We had a great time and comparing this room with others we tried, I would definitely say it was among the best.

Fun evening!. 4 friends and I went to Omescape this evening and played the Joker Asylum room. We really enjoyed it! The room was very hard but the staff member prompted us with clues when we got stuck. The staff were really friendly.I didn't know when we booked that omescape only opened in London in march. Don't let that put you off. The puzzles in the room are extremely well put together. A potential downside of the Joker room is that you are split into 2 teams working together but in separate rooms. But omescape have other rooms where you are all on the same team - so just choose whichever you prefer. I'd definately recommend it.

Awesome!. Awesome experience! I was taking my 15 year old nephew to a game at Emirates Stadium at night (another experience!) and we were looking for sometihng to pass sometime before the game. We googled things to do around Emirates - found this online and booked, not really having a clue about what it would be. Well - it was great - we really enjoyed it. Mai the host was really friendly - she managed our experience perfectly - giving clues at just the right time and her enthusiasm about the experience really set the tone. It was an excellent auntie/nephew bonding experience - my nephew loved it. Really well done. My nephew and I are now planning different escape room challenges in his home town of Geneva, and other London experiences when he comes back - I think we're addicted. Do it!

New Game Breakout. My niece and I spent a great hour on the new Breakout Game ..... lots going on, puzzles to solve and doors to open .... we did pretty good on our own, but when requested the guidance was definitely appreciated. Thank You Sam.

Amazing experience!. Me and my boyfriend had an amazing time it was an hour full of fun! The host was very welcoming and made the whole experience fun. We played The Killer which was a very well designed game- the best so far. We are looking forward to going back to play their other game- breakout! Overall very very happy with the experience and customer service was the best I've had so far. Thank you so much will definitely be back soon and highly recommend this to anyone and everyone!!

Amazing!. There was only two of us who went and we went for my boyfriends birthday and honestly we can't wait to go back. Sam looked after us and he was attentive and lovely! Everything was set up brilliantly and 100% worth going to. We'll be back soon!!!!

Great activity! gets everyone involved. Definitely coming back!. I decided to do something different for my girlfriends 22nd birthday. I did the usual google search and came across great reviews for "Enigma Escape", I though why not give it a go. I could not be any happier with the experience! my girlfriend absolutely loved it! We went for the "breakout" activity as the serial killer one was fully booked! However, it was most definitely worth every penny! Will definitely be back to try out the other activity! Definitely recommend! great fun! plus a great way to start your day!

Enigma Escape - Escape Room Game. The venue and actual game were both really good. We were welcomed in and given snacks whilst the game and the rules were explained and watched the back story for the escape room game we were going to play. The game itself was really good with and the props added to the feeling realism. Help was provided through the screens in the game when needed. Overall a great game and would recommend Enigma Escape!

Brilliant - Thanks to Hon. Had an utterly amazing time. Honestly can say that it was the best day out I'd had in years, there is no doubt that I would 100% recommend this to entirely everyone. A big thank you to Hon for being so great and welcoming.
Enigma escape. Great challenge, great experience. Definitely would go back. Has a very out of the box thinking approach!
Great team event. Excellent fun had by all. Great event for team building but would also be great for a group of friends - thank you !!

Great fun!. Five of us went to Enigma Escape for a friend's birthday and we had a fantastic time. Our guide Mai really set the scene and was very upbeat and friendly. The escape room 'The Killer' was challenging and had lots of tasks to solve. I would definitely go back to try out their other room!

Good fun and great setup. We did this with our two teenage kids and had a great time. The location is very close to Holloway Road tube station and the staff and the setup is very professional. I won't go into details but the storyline was excellent and we're thinking of going back next week to do the second scenario.

Killer. Two of us went in and two of us escaped. "Killer" was a challenging, thrilling and immersive escape room experience. Excellent guidance - just helpful enough without ruining the fun (nothing worse than getting hints before you're ready for them!)
Definitely recommended.
Something fun. A fun thing to do and something different. We found it engaging and laughed. Game host was nice lady.

A fun teambuilding experience. We are a group of norwegians that visit London every year. So we were looking for a new, fun thing to do with friends.
This escape room was a teambuilding experience that we highly recommend to groups that wants to do something fun and new.
We got a warm welcome and had a blast!

Lengthy review alert!. Wow, I have to say that the "Breakout" game at Enigma Escape really exceeded my expectations. I have quite a bit of experience with escape rooms - think I've done about 25 now.I always enjoy them but quite a lot of them frustrate me when the puzzle answers are too random and don't really follow a very satisfying logic. So I was excited when I read that Enigma Escape pride themselves on a more realistic style of room escape. They claimed that the games are solved more through thinking "what would I actually do in this situation?" and solving clues to do with the story. Rather than, say, a random ball maze or wooden block puzzle (as fun as those are), or an arbitrary maths puzzle (less fun.)I have to say that 'Breakout' really lived up to this claim. The puzzles were all fully integrated into the plot and the 'world' of the game, and not once left me frustratedly thinking "really?!" after I'd found out an answer. I love how a storyline with characters started to emerge. This element was better than I've seen in any other escape room.The theming / set design was also very strong and technology used in a slick way. Nothing was broken - everything worked smoothly. Hints were delivered when needed via a screen - my favourite method I've seen in escape rooms. Much better than a walkie talkie. I like how there weren't loads of red herrings and unnecessary props around. And the woman who hosted was very friendly, chatty and delivered it all brilliantly. Top marks there.Not quite the best escape room I've played, but definitely in the top 5. There weren't really any amazingly clever or ingeniously original puzzles that made me go "wow", but it was great for the other reasons mentioned above. Those elements are harder to get right, and so made this one really stand out.I'd like to give just a few ideas for improvements to make it even better, hopefully without giving too much away:- the bit of information the host gave to us in the introduction, regarding a secret something to be used on one of the doors. I think it would be more satisfying to discover that info during the game, perhaps on a piece of paper with an accompanying diagram / instructions.- The thing in the last room using the contents of the crates. I think there's a missed opportunity for making that into more of a puzzle. Perhaps specific holes need to be connected, and certain ones need to be left empty. Again there could be a clue somewhere with a diagram to help solve it. If the overall game is lacking anything, I think it's a really nice juicy physical puzzle like that, one that doesn't involve keys, codes and numbers. That last room is a perfect place for it - it's almost there. Trying to keep it within the realism of the game would be tricky, but definitely doable.- Perhaps have some kind of colour / symbol coding to help find which keys go where throughout the game, as that seemed like mostly guesswork.- I really liked the puzzle for the first door code, but I think it should be made clearer that the sheet is from last week and the "invitation" is for the following week. This seemed like a bit of a guess rather than definitely right, but it would be good if it felt definitely right once you've worked it out, especially because you've only got a few attempts on the keypad before it freezes.In summary, I thoroughly recommend this for beginners (for two of my team this was their first room escape, and they loved it) but equally, a unique and refreshing angle on the genre for more experienced players.We can't wait to go back and play their other game "the killer"

Great fun! . Challenging and thrilling, highly recommend! Two of us had a few hours spare in London and decided to check out enigma escape room, were not disappointed! We were able to play straight away, very clear instructions were provided before the game. A few hints were given when were stuck and we managed to complete the game with just over a minute left. Left feeling very satisfied!

Thrilling escape game. Super fun and exciting. A good variety of puzzles and codes to crack. Definitely recommend it. We did the killer room and are hoping to do the follow up room to this another time.
Awesome. I went with my sister and two friends (all between ages of 18 and 21) and we thoroughly enjoyed it - setting is really good and the staff are very friendly and helpful when you are stuck.
Fun challenge!. This escape game was really good fun, the puzzles were interesting, a must do!! There were 2 of us and we did the Killer.

Great experience!. Really well thought out. I thoroughly enjoyed every second and will definitely be coming back. Great story line, very friendly staff and explained the rules really clearly. Great laugh and really enjoyed the team bonding.
Great time. Good time had by all. Ada gave an amazing intro and it was all so well planned. Chris lived is especially.
Such good fun. We did this as a couple on our anniversary as something different and had such a good time! Well organised and a great experience. Thank you!

Great experience!. Had a great experience at the Enigma Escape with my nephew (13) and a couple of friends. We were 4 in total. I did underestimate how hard it would be, wich i should not have. You have to work together as a team. Will recommend it to all my friends. Great experience!
Great idea for date night.. Staff lovely and puzzles challenging but not impossible. Excited for the new came coming out and give it a go.

A fun and immersive game. This was our second escape room game. We've also done ClueQuest and found it much more difficult (in fact, we didn't finish!) while this one was a lot more straight-forward and linear. We enjoyed it from start to finish and the clues were just tricky enough to keep up a good pace. We loved that the game was "realistic" and that the clues were very common sense. Would have been nice if it was a little bit longer, but all in all it was a really fun afternoon, and we'd come back to try the other games. Mai was our host - she was super friendly and great at explaining everything.

Fantastic. 4 of us tried the Killer escape room. It was a fantastic, well thought out puzzle with a really interesting theme that unravels as you work through it. 2 of us were first time escape roomers and the other 2 had tried 3 or 4 and they thought that Enigma stood up with the best they tried. Most importantly we all had a great time and felt the puzzle was challenging enough. It's a nice touch to get a couple of surprise gifts too! Hon was a great host and we will be looking to go back and take on the other escape room!
Escape. The killer escap exoirance is So much fun, highly recommend. We Want to book us in for the next one.
Great time. Had a great time at enigma. Mai had so much energy to put us in the zone and motivate us to escape. Would very much recommend!

So much fun! Highly recommended . Did this for my birthday, very pleased I chose it. Excellent idea for a team building activity or just something different to do with friends/family too.Our host was great, very friendly and even provided light snacks which was nice.Every element was well thought out from the moment we arrived to when we left the building - and yes we completed it in time.The puzzles and room layout were cleverly put together. I thought there were going to be a lot of mind boggling wordy-riddles, although I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but it was so much better than that, there were a lot of props to get involved with. The whole experience was full of laughter, excitement and nervousness. We all thoroughly enjoyed it so if you're thinking to do an escape game, book this one! We'll definitely be back to try the next game.
Great fun. Really enjoyed the experience - one of the best escape rooms I've done! Want to come back and do the second room.

Had a blast . Booked online and came there with my friend. We were only two, but had no problem solving the puzzles.
It was all great fun. And we made it out with time left on the clock :)

A very fun experience. Mai was a great host and really got us in the mood to begin our challenge (The Killer). The experience feels easy at first until you realise that there's much more to it than meets the eye :) I did this for my birthday and found it a really fun way to celebrate. It would also be perfect for a team building exercise. I'm looking forward to trying out their new experience coming soon!
Great Fun. Really good. And works for 2 people which is unusual for this type of thing. Highly recommended as an Escape thing

Awesome fun at Enigma escape. Got this a as a BDay gift for my friend ...WE did it as a pair and it was tremendous fun !! The set up of the game is very realisitic and you will be given helpful hints in case you are stuck ! Our host Mai was fantastic ...and we had a lot of fun. Enigma escape also gives you goodies at the start and at the end. Cant wait for the other room to be ready so that we could return fast !!
Super fun. What brillaint fun! Loved every second, a really emmersive experiance with a fun twist. Will definitely be going back for the next game.
Great fun!. Fantastic experience, such fun, great host. Fab puzzles and challenges. Made for a very memorable birthday! Cant wait for their next game.
Really Great experience. Had loads of fun. really well thought out and exciting. it was challenging and I will definitely be back to play a new game.

Amazing! Highly Recommend. First experience of an escape room and after hearing good things was not disappointed! Our host Hon was great and we had a really good time. Will definitely recommend and hopefully return when the next challenge is open!
Excellent Escapology. Great fun! Went as a group of 4, this escape the room was very well organised and was a real challenge, friendly staff too.

A brilliant & fun activity. An excellent experience and Ada was a brilliant host, it was harder than we anticipated & totally immerses you all into it. All our group loved it and would definitely recommend to anyone

Awesome experience. Loved Enigma Escape! Ada our host was super professional, really fun and helpful.
The game was great and got everyone involved and challenged.

Dear the killer. We had a really great time in this scape room. The best thing it's the atmosphere it has. It really gets you into the game. Also the puzzles where great. Our host Ada was amazing too. Totally worth it.

Great escape game. This was an excellent first experience of an escape room game for us. The game was interactive and Ada was a great game host. A nice thing about this particular game is that you can play with a team of only two people.
You must do this!. Excellent fun we absolutely loved it. Ada was fab and really helpful. A must do in London!! We did as a couple and it was absolutely fine.
Highly recommended. Had a brilliant time, would highly recommend! Lots of logical problem solving and fun had by all. Challenging and exciting.

Team top 1%. Excellent game! Our host Mai was fab! Looking forward to Enigma opening their second challenge!
Only downside is that it is quite expensive for four people.
Excellent!. It was our first Escape game and it was amazing! We will come back when the new room will be opened!

A great experience. Absolutely loved it! Was my first escape room, so was a little unsure what to expect, but it was loads of fun! The Harry Potter theme was executed perfectly! We had two teams of 5 and competing against each other was so much fun!

An enigmazing time.. I had a couple of issues booking this experience and then had to change the time. However contact with the team was swift, pleasant and they were extremely helpful. Onto the day itself, upon arrival Mai made us feel very welcome and set up the scenario really well whilst making is feel at ease too. The game itself is fully immersive and you can throw yourself into it or sit back and think. Your approach is up to you but the race is on. Hints are given when needed but not too quickly or regularly, the puzzles are challenging but not impossible and the whole set up works very well. There is a good story and effort has been made from start to finish. My wife did it with me and although not her sort of thing she loved it too. The little touches of popcorn and water at the start and medal and badge at the end rounded off the whole experience perfectly. Can't wait to return for the new game!
Excellent escape room. Incredibly inventive and creative escape room with a well done plot (which seems to be missing from most escape rooms) and great puzzles.

Amazing anniversary eve!. My partner and I were celebrating our 3 year anniversary and this was a great challenge! Ada was very enthusiastic and was supportive along the way. Very fun - we would 100% do it again!

Absolutely incredible experience - can't stop talking about it!. I booked the escape for me and my friend as a surprise for her birthday . Neither of us had done an escape room before, and Enigma blew us away. The game is executed really well, it is clear that so much thought has gone into each detail, making the end result so enjoyable. It was challenging, thrilling and most importantly, fun!! The hour flew by, and we left wanting to do another one straight away. Hon, our host, was great fun and made the experience run smoothly. He ensured we understood how the experience worked, and gave us lots of encouragement beforehand. Hon warned us that it is a bit more difficult as a pair, rather than a larger group, but we managed to escape with a few minutes to spare. The whole experience was fab, and if anyone is looking to try an escape room, be it for the first time, or to tick off another, I urge you to book Enigma!! It will not disappoint!! 10/10, exceeded our expectations by far!!!

A fun challenge for all the family. A fun outing for parents and teenagers . Our 17 and 15 year olds have played these types of games before and said it was the best one yet! Loved the scenario and the multi room aspects . Needed all the clues - thanks Sam!

What an Amazing Fun Experience. I have to say this game was incredible and blew away my expectations. The amount of planning and thought that went into this to give a truly ingenuous escape game shocked me. For such a great price we'll be going again for the next game when it is released by this company.You're treated well and are given a quick drink and snack at the start plus cool photos to take away with you .We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would recommend.

Killer fun. We did The Killer as a couple and it was great. We were well looked after by our host and it still felt really immersive. The challenges were varied and just the right level of difficulty. Would 100% recommend this to anyone.

The Killer game. This was a most fantastic hour. it was all so clever and the whole team of 5 of us really enjoyed it. We even escaped with 17 seconds to spare. I can highly recommend it. We booked it for our daughter's 17th birthday.
Excellent Enigma Escape. Surprises at every turn. Brilliantly smart. A great bonding experience. I look forwards to the experiencing the expansion.

The killer escape. Sooooo much fun, made my brain hurt a little! Great even for 2 people, just hard enough to make you work for it but not impossible. Really nice guy who runs this event.Can't wait to book another one!

Really great activity :). We really enjoyed our trip to Enigma Escape! The attraction was fun and immersive as we had hoped. Moreover, it had just the right level of realism. Ada our host was very friendly and professional, and we are excited to come back when the new game opens!
Awesone. Really great experience. We went as a family, all adults, and everyone contributed something. It's just such good fun. Can't recommend it highly enough
Great fun!. Really well made puzzle game. Exciting and immersive. We completed the challenge with just two minutes on the clock. Would recommend as a great day out

An excellent afternoon activity.. This was a great way to spend an hour with friends. It was challenging and exciting and I would definitely recommend. Hon was very clear with his instructions and took many photos of us at the end without complaining!

Fantastically memorable. Great twist on escape rooms. We all loved it!
Definitely worth it for novices to advanced players alike.

Faultless!. Tense, thought provoking and so much fun! Really looking forward to their new game release! The hostess Ada was interactive, knowledgable and bubbly, we hope to see you again up on the launch of the new game!

Family Fun!. We started as a group of 4, but our 11 year old decided it was going to be too scary and dropped out before we began. The Enigma Escape team was very understanding and was able to accommodate her even though she did not go through the rooms with us. The remaining 3 of us had FUN at our very first escape event. At times slightly creepy so our 11yo made the right call. This required logic and good sense, there is no need to overly think things, plus the staff gave appropriate clues when needed. We definitely recommend and look forward to our next escape adventure.

Great escape room!. We've done a fair rooms but 'The Killer' still stands as our favourite. The game begins brilliantly, starting in a small area with no obvious way out. A bit of common sense and some (slight) physicality sees you through into the main part of the game where the story slowly progresses as you logically work your way through the game.What we love about this room is that everything makes total sense, there's no abstract puzzles that are out of place with the setting and the environment feels totally realistic.There's also a lot of care given to the story, you're not just unlocking padlocks to find more puzzles, with each step you are actually learning more about what's going on.And whilst it isn't a 'scary' attraction as such (no live actors), there are two moments that made us jump!We'd definitely recommend this to anyone - smaller groups would probably work best given the linear nature of the game.

So fun! So brilliant! Looking forward to their new game!. This is one of only a few games in London that work for 2 players, so I booked it to take my husband to. It is SO good. I love the fact that everything is realistic - so you only find things in places that you would expect to find them. The set-up is good and everything's in really great condition. The people who work there are so nice, and the story is fantastic. I would recommend it to everyone who likes escape games. Definitely the best of all the escape games I've been to!
The killing. It was a very hands on, fun game which requires a lot of thought. Remember to listen to everything at the beginning, when the scene is set. Would recommend (although is pricey)

Very different and funny experience. I would recommend this for everyone, couples, family and group of friends. We went my partner and a kid of 11 and we really enjoy all of us. You have to think logically to get the answers of the place, just you have an hour to resolve it. It is very challenging activity. 300% recommended

A Killer Time!. We all went along, not sure what to expect, but we left laughing and with smiles on our faces! The experience was challenging, but not so difficult it wasn't fun, and full engaging puzzles and problems. We all particularly enjoyed the twist this had compared to other escape experiences. Also Ada was a saint for putting up with all my nonsense!
Wow. What a great escape room. Love the story and Hon was a fantastic games master. Will definitely be going back for their new room
Brilliant fun. Had such a good time, really clever, really intense and just all around great fun. Host was brilliant too.
Very good. Owner was very welcoming, worked well for two people. Would recommend to people who like solving problems

Fantastic. Been today 2 adults and two teens. We all thought it was brilliant and we'll thought out. We did solve with 5 mins to spare which made it better but well worth the money for a good hours worth of activity. I would recommend to anyone. They even give you a snack, drink and send you a photo. Don't usually do these but always use them when picking something to do so only fair to do the same.

excellent birthday gift!. Took my friend for his birthday. The game only got better as it went on! The game host Ada was great and really mad the experience more realistic (and funny). Definitely going back when the next game opens.

awesome first escape!. I really enjoyed 'The Killer' as my first escape. Kinda like being inside an atmospheric late 90s playstation game. The host was super lovely and quite a non-threatening experience (besides the spooky bits that is). Total recommend!!!
The Killer. Really enjoyed this and will definitely go back for another game when it's launched! Our group was only with 2 people as well and we both thoroughly enjoyed it!

Absolutely phenomenal!!. My boyfriend and I completed this together and we both loved every second of the experience from the moment we walked through the door. This was our first escape room, but we are now thoroughly hooked and can't wait to try out some more! Such a unique and exhilarating experience that is worth every penny... Who would know 60 minutes could fly by so fast though!! Would thoroughly recommend to anyone.

Loved it! So much fun... So well thought out, so much fun! Definitely recommend this escape game. I love how there are no pictures or clues online, so it's a total surprise when you turn up! The lady was friendly and lovely too.

Fantastic experience at our debut escape room. My husband and I had a fabulous time at Enigma Escape. Our host Hon was super friendly and explained everything perfectly. We initially felt very silly stood in the room with no idea what to do, but then you really get into the experience and become totally immersed. We were so happy to escape (not sure if we would have without a few helpful hints!) and talked about it for the rest of the afternoon. We'll definitely be back when the new room opens! Sam and Vicki.
The Killer. WOW! Absolutely fantastic, would highly recommended this event. We were greeted by Sam our very friendly host, the room set was brilliant couldn't fault it, looking forward to more
Enigma Escape - North London. Absolutely fantastic, exciting, challenging and alternative way to spend some quality time with family. Will definitely do another one

Fun escape room. Great escape room for two people, although a little expensive. Not too easy and not too hard, good variety of puzzles. Tasks slightly more physical than expected! Good atmosphere and slightly scary in tune with the room's theme. Nice touch to get a bottle of water and popcorn at the start! Highly recommended for a small group.

Fantastic experience!. Although I have heard about escape rooms before, this was my first experience of one, and I must admit it was brilliantly done! My team mate who has done quite a few before also commented on the quality of the room, the story and the clues. Highly recommended - it is a refreshingly different experience in London.

Excellent escape the room game. This is such a great escape the room game, I was super impressed with how it was done and it really got my adrenalin (and competitive nature) going. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves a challenge. Very clever.

One of the best escape rooms out there!. Brilliantly put together, great story and puzzles, expertly hosted (thanks david). We've done various rooms around the country but we both agreed that as immersive experience this was hands down the best! Highly recommend!

Unique and exciting!. This was a great escape room! I hope they make more different rooms soon. This room had a bit of a scary twist to it but nothing too scary. Involved more logical thinking than other escape rooms and they would do well to build on that an continue in that direction. In terms of difficulty I would call it medium and I'd encourage them to make their next room much trickier! We got a medal and pin for winning though and they even gave us water and snacks which was really nice, David who was running it was really friendly.

So much fun!. This game was brilliant! We played in a pair as a surprise for my partner's birthday - and absolutely loved it! It's a real challenge to work out the clues but you're being monitored by camera (you don't even notice this) as you're doing it so the team behind it can provide you with specific clues to help move you on if you get stuck. We really appreciated this as it means that the level of challenge is always pitched well to your needs and gives you a good chance of completing it in the hour. I'd say it was good value for money given how much we enjoyed it - we'd definitely play any other game they came out with!

A really good time with a great game & host.. I brought my girlfriend along to play this escape game, having not experienced one before. I can thoroughly recommend it. It was intelligently designed, with some nice surprises & variation. There was a very good standard of quality & a great host. But most importantly, it was fun! If you want to try something different & have a laugh, try this!

A fun, exciting and challenging experience!. My sister and I took our brothers as part of their 21st birthday celebrations. We had so much fun as the experience was exciting and thrilling but with logical challenges and problems to solve. We were buzzing for ages afterwards and was a really great way to spend time together. Hon is a fantastic host and lovely guy, making our time at Enigma Escapes really enjoyable!
A great themed escape room. Had a fab time trying to break out! We all enjoyed the level of trickery and we were all able to come together to solve the different puzzles.

great for a hen party. We visited enigma escape as part of a hen party and it was the perfect start to the celebrations. We loved this clever escape the room game and cant wait to come back when the next game opens!

Great fun for 2 or more people. This was our first time playing a room escape game, and I'm really glad we chose Enigma Escape! We were a group of 2, most other escape games needed 3 or 4 players minimum, so I was happy to find a game suitable for 2. The puzzles were cool, challenging enough and we did need the odd hint or two but made it out with 5 minutes to spare. Highly recommended and lots of fun!

The best time I've had losing!. We were taken here by cab and it was off the beaten path a bit. Easy to find by address. We were buzzed in a few minutes before our scheduled start time but they were ready for us. We got a scene setting introduction which led to how we got locked in and the adventure began! I can't give detail without spoilers so I will say there are physical and mental puzzles to make your way to your escape. They have groups from 3 to 5 so the 3 of us had our own room. A clock counts down the hour you have to escape and definitely heightens the tension! Staff was enthusiast and gave some clues along the way if we got stuck. Our teenage daughter loved it as much as we did and an hour went by so fast! I would recommend this to everyone!

The Killer - the greatest escape game ever!. The Killer was the greatest escape game we did! Sam is a very nice guy and he did a great job! The dekoration is awesome! Everybody should try to escape :)

Amazing experience. Fun and challenging at the same time! We had to think outside the box all the time, even when we were stressed. We were two people and finished with 28 seconds left!! Definately worth checking out :)

An all round amazing experience. We were in a party of three, I was running a bit late, so the other members of my team waited for me, on arrival I was greeted by our host for the evening, Ada, she was amazing at hyping us up, fantastically friendly and really got us excited for the experience. Truly a service to the company she works for!I won't give too much away about the game itself, but it was exhilarating and lasted a lengthy amount of time which is great as you felt incredibly immersed in what you were doing. After the experience Ada congratulated us on completing the challenge and we had our photo taken, props provided! Before I was even home, I received an email with the attached photo, to my surprise!Ada then said they have another theme in the works. I absolutely can not wait to go back and do the next one! 100% recommend! If you have the time go and do this!
EXCELLENT!. This was our first escape experience and it was better than we ever expected! Hon was awesome, super friendly and gave us much needed clues throughout! We can't wait for the next game!

Loved it. This was our first 'Escape the room' type experience so we weren't really sure what to expect. It was fantastically well organised, and pitched just right to make it challenging but achievable. We were being monitored on camera the whole time so if we got stuck for too long, we were given a cryptic clue via a tv screen to point us in the right direction. Will definitely be doing more of these, can't wait until Enigma build their second room!

Interesting and fun activity, well set-up and well run. This was out first experience of anything like this. Three of us, locked in a cage together, solving puzzles - and with a 60 min countdown timer running. It was great fun, we all enjoyed it, and the people who run this are also a pleasure to meet. I you have an hour and a half to spare, this is well worth a visit.

Brilliant! (and also a little scary...). My cousins and I have been doing room escape games for a while now, having always loved the computer versions and being avid puzzlers and detectives! We've done some great ones, and some really not so great ones, and our verdict on this one was... brilliant! It was compact, with a good story that you could follow, not too many red herrings, and fairly linear (fun!) puzzling. It also had a great physical element, that made you feel so completely a part of the story, and was quite unlike any other room escape we've done. Plus there were some great touches - popcorn, a little intro animation and prizes for getting out. Excellent work!

A total hoot. My husband and I love Escape The Room games, and this is a good 'un. There's a creepy premise, and good execution throughout. The option of hints is available, but we found this a little easier than some we've done, and didn't need many.If pushed for criticism, I'd say this is advertised as themed to do with films and the cinema, but had pretty much nothing to do with them other that the opening video. It doesn't take away from the experience at all though, and I'd happily recommend this to anyone keen for an adventure.

Escape the Killer. This is 4th escape room experience in London and I would have to say it has been one of the best. Hon is a great and friendly host and makes you feel comfortable before you go in. I also like he allowed us to really work out the puzzles without just offering us clues and making the game too easy. The story was very clever and I think was one of the best bits of the overall experience.The reason it is not a 5 star and the best one I have been in London as I think it needs some more complex puzzles and some more variety, but overall you will not leave here disappointed
Money well spent. Sam is a great host. Very warm welcome. The Killer was a great experience and very well thought out.

Great fun, I would definitely recommend.. This was my first escape game and it has definitely made me want to try more. I went as a group of three and what I particularly liked was there were occasions when the whole team needed to work together and others when you could split into smaller groups to complete multiple smaller tasks. The game host (David) was very friendly and overall this was a really fun game with tasks that weren't impossible but were not too easy either.

Absolutely 'bloody' brilliant! . This was such a brilliant experience from start to finish! Hon was a great host, there were great touches adding to the experience and an excellent, challenging and tense escape room! I would very highly recommend this escape room - I've done a few and this one is a favourite!

Great fun!. It was our first time doing an escape game and myself and my friends found this really good fun! It's quite scary but just enough to have you on your toes! I'd highly recommend it! Well worth the money too.

A captivating experience. Our host, David, immediately greeted us upon our arrival and made us feel very comfortable. We were given refreshments and a very detailed briefing with ample opportunity to ask questions. The room was challenging from the get go and very engaging. With a good storyline, the whole process inside the room remained fluid. Taking a systematic approach, sprinkling it with logic and adding communication on the top. As a team of four (Time destroyers) we managed to escape! Overall, a fantastic experience, with a good level of challenge, surprises and a very attentive host, we couldn't ask for more! Looking forward to the new room to be completed, we will definitely be returning.

I had a Killer Birthday Experience :P. My girlfriend took me to enigma escape as a surprise for my birthday and it was awesome. The staff were extremely friendly and the experience as a whole was fantastic. The Killer experience is extremely well designed start to finish and the pacing and difficulty of puzzles is spot on for the 1 hour you are given, but if you do get stuck you are given clues to nudge you back in the right direction which is nice. The puzzles were really fun to do and each tell a part of the story, really helping to build atmosphere. As a couple we had a great time and we would highly recommend this for any one looking for some thing fun to do with their partner or friends.
Fab escape room. Really enjoyed our time here. Intelligent and realistic. Thoroughly enjoyed. Also quite scary which added to the atmosphere.

Really fun. Had a go at the game as a team of 2 (me and my partner). Found it challenging but also really fun. If you get stuck at all there are hints provided.
Finished with less than 2 minute to go! Would definitely return to play a different game.
Great fun. Really inventive. And just the right level of difficulty to present a challenge without being unsolvable.can you go to a simpler thrown in. Great way to spend an hour.
Thoroughly enjoyable experience!. Good fun and awesome to play in a couple as opposed to a big group. Thoroughly enjoyable! Would return to play a new game and would recommend.
You have to try this!. If you are up to a real challenge, a good team-work and some fun experience, you have to try Enigma Escape. They have done a really good job. Thumbs up:-)

Absolutely Incredible, The Real Game Changer. I was very optimistic at first as escape games have never appealed to me but you need to go to see for your self absolutely worth it !! not giving any spoilers and the host was awesome it was a lovely experience thank you !!!

Soooo much fun!. Very immersive, excellent plot. Actually logical unlike some of these experiences which can seem nonsensical. Couldn't recommend enough. Very doable with two people which a lot of these aren't.

Fab Experience. Ada (our host) was fantastic. She gave us a really good introduction - we liked that it had a storyline - and then popcorn and a bottle of water to fuel up before the game. The experience itself was a lot more challenging than I thought which was really good. We made it out with three minutes to spare and can't wait until the next game launches!

Scares, tension and thrills!. Visited Enigma Escape with a group of three yesterday and despite the fact we were all early teens, we all really enjoyed it! Great plot, lots of scares, and, to my horror, the time flew by quickly. It reached a real climax, and was immersive and thrilling. Would definitely recommend it to anyone one the age of twelve.

Excellent Escape. This was my first time in an escape room and it has set the bar extremely high. Going in I wasn't sure what to expect, upon leaving however I came out extremely satisfied and will be coming back once the new puzzles are in place.
Debut escape. Brilliantly crafted puzzles to solve with a great flowing story line. Also a very convenient location to get to for out of towners. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, keen for more!

Fantastic first escape experience!. What a great experience. Having never taken part in an escape experience before, I was a little sceptical when some friends suggested we give it a go. I was expecting something that was badly put together and a bit cheesy but I was wrong.It was great fun from beginning to end with lots of extra touches that really made it special. It worked my brain hard - it wasn't too obvious but also not so hard that it couldn't be solved!I would definitely recommend to anyone who's into puzzles and wants to do something a little bit different. Thanks to everyone at Enigma Escape for a really great time! I will definitely be returning when your new room is finished.

Really enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The clues were challenging but not impossible and there was a lot to keep you guessing!Hon was very entertaining and friendly and also supportive when we got stuck on a clue!I look forward to seeing any potential other escape games on offer.

A must-visit escape game in London!!. David was a fantastic host! The story was immersive and challenging, I've been to over a dozen escape rooms and this is definitely amongst the top of the list of recommendations!

Not very challenging . We are escape game lovers! We tried this one out in London and it was pretty simple. The puzzles were very linear compared to other escape games I have done. We had four people and there wasn't really enough for us all to do because it was a one puzzle at a time type set up. Escape games are always fun so we enjoyed ourselves but overall very easy and would probably be good if you only have a few people or it is your first one.
Brilliant. We had an absolutely excellent time, well worth trying, can't wait to come back and try the second room when it opens!

Absolutely worth it!. We had never taken part in a challenge room in the UK before, previously only Krakow so expectations were high. 'The Killer' was an excellent mix of both physical and mental challenges following a vivid story which couldn't help but make us all feel on edge the entire time. Ada, our games master was an absolute pleasure and extremely welcoming to us all, thank you for helping to make the experience even better. We managed to escape with over 8 minutes left on the clock, looking forward to your next escape game!
Great place, very well done. Really good escape the room game, very well done and finished to a high standard. Highly recommended! Looks of on street parking around too.

Enigma Escape- The Killer Game. It was a great experience. Myself and 3 other friends went to have fun and do something different. The host was welcoming and helpful and we had a great time. I have already recommended this experience to friends, and look forward to other games that they will open.
Really great experience. Enigma Escape wasn't what I was expecting but it was a really fun experience. Lots of challenges to work out. Our host Ada was really great too.
Great fun. This was my first escape game but I loved the challenge and working in a team to solve the puzzles. Thoroughly reccomemded it.

Brilliant escape game, can't wait for the next one!. This was our first game so I wasn't sure what to expect. I am in my 50's and we were celebrating my son's 21st Birthday. There were 4 of us, and the other 3 in my party are in their 20's. The game was excellent and an hour is just the right length. Good clues and lateral thinking is involved. Such a lovely way to spend family time together.

Highly recommended. An excellent escape game. It has an intriguing start and and a clever set. More immersive than others we have done because it is story led, which makes it a bit more exciting (no spoilers!)It's a good way to get older teens out of the house and do something different. David, our game host, was great.Highly recommended.

Great fun!. It was my first Enigma Escape; hence I was not sure what to expect. It was a fantastic surprise gift from my friend; a brilliant experience and one I definitely want to repeat again. The host was very friendly and very clear in his initial introduction of the plot. The room was set up to perfection allowing the plot to unfolded naturally with the right amount of adrenaline pumping in. The puzzles and clues fell perfectly into the storyline. As a team of two, it took us initially a little bit to adjust to the unknown situation; however as soon as we managed to work as a team, the problem solving and challenges ahead became more and more exciting. It was quite a surprise when we realised we could actually beat the clock! Cannot wait for the next story to be created and an excellent way of spending time with friends! I have been converted to Enigma Escape adventures!

Heart poundingly, exciting fun!. Such great fun with some tricky but do-able puzzles to solve. The story is done really well. It's makes the whole thing quite tense and sometimes scary but incredibly exciting.
Escape game. Nice escape game. Nice show man. May be too easy and not rallye immersive.However, It has to be tried

The Great Escape Game. Most recently me and my family took part in the enigma escape challenge and had a fantastic experience. The host was brilliant, he was really kind and explained the everything perfectly. The escape itself was wicked and we shall definitely be returning to play the other games. If you ever want to do something fun with your family whilst in London you cannot go wrong with this.

Amazing!!. Brilliant story, really captivating experience and great to play even with only 2 players. The puzzles were challenging but there was always help on hand if we needed it and the hints provided were very helpful without being too obvious. Multiple rooms provide new challenges with plenty of twists and turns. Very addictive! Will recommend to all my friends and looking forward to the new story.
Great Day Out. The perfect start to a good day out with great puzzles to solve , which keeps you on your toes.Very original idea.

It didn't sound great but it was AWESOME. When I told the other half I want to be locked in a room and then solve puzzles to escape she thought I was mad! After seeing something like this on Big Band Theory, I was well up for it. Finally convinced the other half, got some other friends involved and off we went. From start to finish it was brilliant! Cleverly done, good little back story too that makes you really feel part of it. David, the host, was great too - very helpful and knowledgable. Highly recommend, there was three of us (two couples) and it was a blast.

Challenging. I would highly recommend it!Our host was great, he gave us the all the information we needed and all the handy hints/ clues.It was so much fun and we did it with 4 sec to spare.... We will definitely go there again when the new game is out ....
Enigma Escape room. Very very fun and clever game. Loved the beginning and our host (Ada) was excellent. Very good experience :)

Great fun. Well thought out with a good mix of physical and mental tasks for you to complete to finally unlock the door. We definitely do it again. Would recommend teams of about 4 people as the perfect number.
An excellent way to spend an hour. Four of is went for a friend's 40th. We loved it. We were engrossed from start to finish. I may encourage my work to do something like this.

Fantastic. Had a brilliant time here, David was our host and he was accommodating, friendly and made the experience. Would wholeheartedly recommend the experience and am looking forward to more escape games. Extremely well thought out, exciting and something completely different. Very enjoyable :)

Excellent! Money well spent!. My boyfriend and I decided to give this game a try for my birthday and I must say we had a great time! Our host during the game was really nice, ready to answer any of our questions (before the game of course), we received some small snacks, and even though both of us spoke french between us during the game we still received useful and perfectly timed hints! What I liked the most is that these hints weren't too simple to make the game less challenging and not too hard to discourage us. If you want to take a break from visiting tourist spots all day and do something out of the ordinary, this is a perfect and fun way to spend your free time!Maybe just one suggestion, even though the game in it self was very interesting and realistic, the story could be a little bit more elaborate to try to connect us more to the main characters, explain why we were imprisoned.But again this is just a suggestion, we still loved it and will definitely recommend it to our families and friends!

Brilliant fun, mentally challenging and great value for money. I booked this for my friends's 40th birthday for 4 of us. None of us had tried an escape game before so were intrigued...The basic premise is you have 1hr locked inside a puzzle game and need to solve a range of challenges to escape. You start in a small room in total darkness and have to think on your feet to work out where you are, why you're there and what to do next. Each time you solve a challenge, a new one presents itself. Some of the challenges are obvious e.g. needing to unlock a padlock. Others are more cerebral, requiring lateral thinking and close team work. What's great about the experience is that you work as a team and each person contributes a different way of problem solving to help complete the game.All the time there's a countdown timer on a screen on the wall, which increases the pressure as you get closer to zero. It adds excitement as your competitive edge kicks in and doesn't want to lose! We got stuck on one particular challenge for about 10mins before solving the riddle, which meant a race to get out in time. We scraped through with 1m42s left on the clock.I'd highly recommend this. It's something different, it forces you to use your brain and work as a team and you don't know what's next, so there's plenty of suspense and surprise. Well run and incredibly friendly staff. The only thing missing for me was the lack of real character interaction - that would take it to the next level.

The Killer - CLEARED!. Played the Killer with 3 other friends, which IMO was the optimum number of players as anymore would be too crowded in the rooms and information in the game would be rather scattered amongst ourselves which can lead to confusion if teamwork isn't the strength of a group.We were greeted by the lovely Ada and was very professional (in a fun way) and briefed us everything we needed to know.The theme and story was great!Comparing this game to a few I've played, this requires more physical interaction, which felt more fun and had a sense of realism to the storyline.Overall, I would definitely recommend anyone who has never tried an escape room experience to play the Killer as the difficulty is not too hard but not too easy or as Goldilock's puts it: "just right".P.s. They give FREEBIES!!!
Excellent. The experience was amazing, the host talked us thru how it was going to be and the theme was brilliant, you really got the felling you stepped into something they have thought through.

Excellent. I booked this as a surprise for my husbands birthday, we've never done anything like it before but we both loved the whole experience, the actual game was made well and Ada our host was great fun and knew exactly when to offer us a hint. We will definitely be coming back for the next game.

Diversely Entertaining. The host was very welcoming and friendly which got things off to a great start, and then what followed was jus the experience you expected and better, it left you puzzled, proud and entertained all at the same time and wanting to come back for more

Escaped The Killer with only 46 seconds left!. I had a wonderful time at Enigma Escape. This was my first escape room and it did not disappoint. I would absolutely recommend this to a friend. It is a weird and quirky way to spend a few hours. Check it out!

So much fun!. Visited yesterday with my Mum and 2 sisters (age 16 and 28) and we all enjoyed it so much. Dave, our host, was so helpful and friendly when we arrived a couple of minutes late too. I won't give anything away from the actual 'game' but I'd highly recommend you give it a try if you're looking for an unusual and fun pass time in London. My sister has been to the slightly more well known 'hint hunt' and said this was just as good. Will definitely be back for the next one!
The killer experience. The host was very friendly and the event was very entertaining and enjoyable. Definitely looking forward to Enigma Escape's next experience.

The Killer. David our host welcomed us, briefed us and all in all hosted the experience without a single fault. The challenges in The Killer (no spoilers!) were challenging without being frustrating, everything was manageable once you used a bit of common sense or at the most a gentle hint. The entire experience was fully immersive, putting us right in the middle of it so it truly felt like our lives depended on our thoughts and actions. We will definitely be seeing what other challenges Enigma have to offer, will be strongly recommending the killer to all.

brilliant!!. It was a struggle to find an escape room that catered to only two people and the fact that this one did was perfect. It was absolutely brilliant, and recommend everyone to face the killer!!!
The Killer. Great interactive fun! Highly recommend for any new or existing escape room fans. Puzzles were clever and the countdown clock made it even more exciting.

Perfect thing to do for a special occasion. We had a great time at Enigma Escape. It was a part of my birthday present to my boyfriend.He had done some escape games in the past, but I was a complete beginner so obviously there was a great degree of difference in terms of our levels. That said, it was perfectly fun for both of us -challenging enough but not too difficult. I felt so happy seeing my boyfriend enjoying it, so I would really recommend someone to choose this as a gift. I think it is great for families too:) A good collaboration is the key!

GREAT FUN. Me and a few other friends tried out this game and it was absolutely awesome! Level of difficulty was just perfect. Ada the lady who was there was super friendly and very welcoming too. I really recommend trying this out if you have the chance too
Brilliant. Well set up, amazing staff, intriguing story and fascinating puzzles. Kept us guessing from the moment we got in to the moment we got out.

Couch Surfers. I truly enjoyed my time. My newly found friends and I played it and we were really able to bond. It was such a great experience. Ada walked us through the instructions first, she was warm and explained the mechanics quite well. We told her our insight on each room. The game is really designed to test your skills as a team and cooperation. I would recommend this to any group of friends who are adventurous and open minded, willing to take a challenge. It wasn't easy, but it was fun!

BEST SATURDAY EVER!!. I loved this experience and got to have fun with my family. It really brings us together and makes us work as a team. The people helping us were also very nice and made sure we new everything before the game and sometimes helped us out when we were stuck!
Amazing!!. So much fun! I was dubious when it was the cheapest escape room, but it was ace! Proudly wore my "I escaped" badge the rest of the day.
Unforgettable. Enigma escape has been the most interesting experience we had in London even if it only lasted an hour.

Awesome experience. We had a great time at the enigma escape! The game was well set out and felt so life like. Sam was a great host and created such a fun exciting game. I definitely want to go back when the new game is released

A gem of an escape room for small groups. It's so hard to find escape rooms in London to cater for smaller groups. My other half and I enjoy playing in pairs - and don't even mind paying the "supplement" - but so many rooms start at 3 players. Enigma Escape is an intimate game, tucked away behind Holloway Road station that is perfect for smaller group - and ticks all the boxes of a good escape room.The host, Sam, is absolutely sparkling - he is passionate about how games run, and cares greatly about your enjoyment, and what his room has to offer.The story has clarity and makes a lot of sense. It is immersive and you are drawn in. We really enjoyed that you start (as you would in this particular plot) in a room with absolutely nothing.The puzzles are well presented and logical - with a good mix to challenge different skills sets.The production values are well conceived and overall the experience is very good value for money.We look forward to when the next room opens, and would certainly recommend this escape to new players, as well as small groups of experienced players!

Incredibly immersive. It was really nice, this is my third escape room and this one is definitely the best I've done so far. It was really immersive and interesting. We were welcomed properly and it was overall a pleasing experience. We finished 0:40 seconds before the end and it was really tense, clues helped a lot as we were only two but the challenges were up to my expectations.
A fantastic challenge!. We found this a Completely refreshing and exciting escape. The scenario was very clever and there is a genuine feeling of suspense throughout. Do it if you can!

Excellent and funny. First time, I tried something like this and I wasn't disappointed. I will recommend Enigma Escape to all. The prices are fair and the host is very nice. Next time, I come back to London, then I Will absolutely try this again!
Don't drink before math challenges!. Great fun! Our team struggled with basic maths skills after some champagne...but the clues helped a lot! Interesting challenges too!
Heaps of fun. Great time and heaps of fun for the whole family, lots of puzzles to solve and items to find to get you to the next room. All participants are needed to help solve the riddles!

Awesoooome. We really had fun doing the enigma escape. Our host David was super friendly and the game itself was not too easy and for two people actually quite challenging. I can only recommend it and will surely returned myself :)

Great escape game experience. My dad and I had a great time doing this escape game. The level of difficulty was perfect and there were lots of surprises. The set and production values were very high quality and Ada, the lady helping us, was brilliant - very friendly and welcoming and helped us out at just the right moments with much needed clues!
Amazing. There are so many hurdles, by the time you think you are about to come out ..something else pops up ..challenging n so much fun
Escape Room. A good way to have a family adventure! Convenient location, and good value for money. This is a new and unique way of entertaining the family, working as a team in a fun environment.
Super fun. It was super fun brain excercise! I would recommend everyone to try it. David was super cool host as well

Amazing and Awesome!. This was my first escape room and boy was it great. Our host Hon was incredibly friendly and made us feel at ease on arrival. We picked a great room to start with. The game itself was brilliant, lots of good puzzles to solve and incredibly atmospheric. It was so good that whilst we were down the pub after celebrating our escape, we booked another room for the following month!As a group we can't wait for Enigma to open a different scenario when we will definitely return. This trip set off a new tradition in our friendship group, so thanks a lot Enigma Escape!

Fun, logical, suitable for different types of people. I arranged the escape game (The Killer) for a few friends and one of their teenage sons. The whole group loved it. The game was based upon logic, unlike a previous game I have played and this makes the experience even more enjoyable. On arrival and throughout our visit, the host (David I believe) was enthusiastic, friendly, welcoming and a pleasure to be around. Would definitely recommend this to anyone and would certainly return for the new game they are currently building!

Do it! Perfect beginner escape!. Thoroughly recommend this escape! Just a short walk from Holloway Road tube station, so really easy to find. We arrived a few minutes late but were able to call up to pre-warn them and they were absolutely fine with it (helped that we were last of the day). Very welcoming member of staff who was clearly very passionate about Enigma. We played the game with 4 people which worked well given the space/clues. I'd say 3 would also work really well, but 5 people could be too many. I enjoyed how the clues were logical and the whole story made sense. It was made all the more enjoyable by actually escaping!

Amazing time. My wife and I did this mystery quest with her sister and brother in law and we had an amazing time!! This was the first mystery quest for some of us and it was filled with challenging yet fun puzzles and if you ever get stuck you can get hints to move along! We cut it really close at the end and the entire storyline makes you really want to beat the game on time. We highly recommend this to a group of friends, family, or for a team bonding event!
Adrenalin booster. Stimulating, captivating and above all great fun. We had an amazing time, thanks to a very well thought out game and a very attentive host
Awesome. Really good unique escape game. A fantastic time was had by all. For those experienced and inexperienced with escape games.

Great escape room that isn't too contrived. Challenging room which was a great experience with friends. They even gave us popcorn!
Looking forward to their next escape room :)

Excellent. It was great fun. David was very helpful and his instructions very clear. I'd recommend it to all my friends, and am really looking forward to the next one which is in development. Hard to think of any improvements really.
Tom Boyle

Great experience!. Great experience which we all enjoyed very much. The game involves both a bit of physical and general problem solving skills. The fact that all the problems were all logical and had a reason behind them was really well thought-through. I also enjoy the "scare" in the game as well.
Really looking forward to the next room!

AN INCREDIBLY CHALLENGING AND FUN HOUR!. 5 FRIENDS. ONE CHALLENGE. 3, 2, 1 - GO!A very well put together Escape Room, with a clever mixture of levels of difficulty within the game!We found that it took all of our different skill-sets and personalities combined to work through this game, which gave all of us a real sense of contribution and achievement as individuals and ultimately as a team.The staff were awesome, funny, very helpful and made it exciting and fun!Cant wait for them to open up their second game, which we were told will be coming soon! :-)Great work ENIGMA!

A must do!. Chose enigma escape due to the reviews and being a team of two and we are so glad we did. Have completed a escape game before each are so different this was challenging with a great story that evolved each time you solved a puzzle. Hon was great very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend this as a different experience to do whilst in London. Looking forward to the new game that will be realised soon. Keep up the good work.

Not as challenging as others. The concept and storyline for this escape room is really good but I feel it lacked in puzzles. We've done several escape rooms and usually have <5 mins left (we are a group of 2) but we had almost 12 mins left. It felt like more puzzles were needed. Some of the puzzles were different to ones we've seen before and it was a nice touch with the coins/badges. Hon was friendly and is very passionate. If you've done other escape rooms, this ones concept is really good but not as challenging as others.
Ok idea, too small and pretty basic.. Compared to other clue quests we've been to, this was pretty basic. It got better as it went along but it's definitely too small.

Great escape room. This escape room seemed quite different to other rooms, with a greater variety of puzzles to solve. It was well staged and the right level of difficulty. Would definitely do another room by this company
Brilliant!. Our host, Hon, was really friendly, and the design that went into the escape room itself was insane! Really clever and innovative. Can't wait to go back (and improve on our escape time).
Fun and exciting!. We went as a family group of three (youngest 15 years old), had so much fun and thought everything was very well timed and planned. And Hon was great! Recommended.

Excellent experience. Three of my friends and I did this on a Sunday afternoon and really enjoyed it. Fairly priced and something to do that's a bit different. The hour passed really quickly as we were so engrossed. Would definitely recommend.

Enigma escape - holloway road. Good fun - went with another young couple and four was a good amount. It was harder than I expected and was scary bit in a good and funny way - would definitely recommend this.

Best escape room I've been to. Hon was a fantastic host, everything about the experience was at a very high standard. This escape room was the most immersive, satisfying to solve, and certainly had the best fusion of story and puzzle of any escape room I've been to.

First escape room, not the last!. First time going to an escape room: a group of friends (early 20s) invited me to their regular group and we had an amazing time doing "the killer" escape. Puzzles were designed such that they'd be suitable for all sizes of groups and had a good balance of physical activity and logical thinking. Would highly recommend to anybody interested or on the fence about room escapes - incredibly fun.

Really fun experience!. We went as a group of 4 in our late 20s, and 2 of us had never done something like this before. The game was well thought out, each of us contributed to it - and it was the right level of difficulty. The game host was really friendly and chatty. I'd definitely go again, and recommend it!
Fantastic experience. Perfect level of difficulty, had a great time. Host really friendly and approachable, made the experience all the more enjoyable.

Escape room fun :-). Looking for an escape room in London which accommodates just 2 players - this was perfect. Booked as a birthday treat for my partner and a good time was had by both of us.Would definitely recommend this for people who have completed escape rooms before.

Great experience. I had some friends over from the US and was looking for something different to do with them and found this. Great experience with some challenging puzzles and really made us work together to figure it out!

Very good challenge. I had a really good time at engima escape, Our Host Sam was very informative and passionate about his game which was extremely well planned and excicuted with different challenges throughout the game. I dont want to give anything away! if youre looking for something different to do as a group or even for a team building exercise youll love it! i cant wait for the new game to start and to come back and play it!

First time at an escape room. "The Killer" is a very well-constructed escape game. It was fun and challenging. We had a great time and would recommend it to anyone wanting to try an escape room in London.

Enigma Escape. This was booked by my husband as a surprise and it was excellent, lots of fun. I'm looking forward to their new game which will be ready in six weeks. They were really friendly and I couldn't recommend enough!
So much fun! The perfect amount of challenge and achievability.. Did it in a group of 4, 2 boys, 2 girls, it was funny, difficult but feasible and we laughed a lot. Thanks Hon!
Amazing. Everything was great from start to finish. Would recommend to everyone!! Great customer service too!

Excellent fun!. Great way to spend an hour or so. Lots of lateral and logical thinking required to solve a series of puzzles to escape an initially darkened room! Went with my wife and although she is 6 months pregnant none of the challenges were too physically demanding. Easy to get to from Holloway Road tube (5 mins or so). Would definitely recommend!

Really fun and different way to spend a Sunday afternoon. Great story line, the puzzles were really clever - the first escape game any of us had ever done - so we didn't know what to expect at all. Hon was a great host. Would definitely recommend!
Good fun, well run!. Enigma Escape was a very well produced escape room. A really friendly host, a much better plot/scenario than most and a range of puzzles and challenges!
Incredible. Was given this as a gift by my girlfriend, really enjoyed it. Would 100% do it again.If you get the chance I would do it in a group no bigger than 4.
Great fun and a nice host. Great for young, old, friends, businesses or whoever you are. If you like a puzzle and having a laugh then you can't go wrong with this. Would recommend to anyone.
Great Experience!. First time and totally loved it! Extremely cleverly designed. I can't wait to try the next installment.
