We would love to try out any of the new games they have planned. I would seriously recommend this!

WOW would be an understatement!. I went to Enigma Escape as it was recommended by a friend and can say it was one of the best activities I have experienced. We turned up as a group of 4 and greeted by Hon - our host. He lead us into the briefing room and explained the experience and gave us some snack and drinks, definitely a nice touch. This was followed by a short intro video and then we get locked up.The game was awesome and kept us thinking on our feet. I wish I can talk about it in more detail but don't want to spoil the surprises for everyone. The room was cleverly built the puzzles weren't too easy or too hard. You just need to think logically and you will find a way out. We never got bored throughout our time in the room as there were so many things to do and once you find a clue, you just can't wait to reveal whats next. We manage to escape in the nick of time and wow… what a surprise at the end!You should definitely try these guys out as I guarantee you will not be disappointed.

Bloody brilliant. After completing another escape room recently, myself and a mate fancied giving another one a go. We browsed Google for quite a while but many looked like fairly generic murder mysteries whilst a lot also don't cater for 2 players. However, Enigma Escape did cater for 2 plus it has a really cool edgy horror/film theme to go with it. Being a fan of horror films, I had to give this a go. On arrival, we met Hon who is a complete legend. Enigma Escape is a new company and was helped out by crowdfunding. Nevertheless, the money has been used well as there are a lot of little nice touches that I won't spoil for anyone who decides to visit. The game itself is superb. The difference to other escape rooms is that you don't find random objects and crack codes with them. Everything is like it would be in a normal room and you have to use normal logic to get out as if you are really trapped. There are some really good puzzles throughout and the horror/tension is done really well. Five stars and I can't recommend this company enough.

Challenging, fun and enjoyable! highly recommended!. Situated minutes away from Holloway road station, the location is very easy to find and get to.We were greeted by one of the owners (Hon), who showed us around and led us into a smaller room to watch an introduction video and explained the rules. Prior to the start of the short video we were offered complimentary soft drinks and popcorn :)Once the video ended, we entered 'The Room' to begin our escape. The puzzles were very well thought out and requires logical thinking in order to over the obstacles. There is T.V screen showing the timer and if you get stuck, hints will be provided.Overall, it was an outstanding experience with great hospitality/customer service. Would definitely visit again when Enigma Escapes opens more rooms.

Enjoyable New Experience!. Myself and four friends decided to take up the challenge of escaping 'The Killer' after hearing great things about Enigma Escape via numerous social networks.The idea is pretty simple, you and your friends get locked in a small room, in which you'll then have to uncover a number of puzzles to solve, in order to escape before 'The Killer' returns. Hon, our host was very friendly and welcoming upon our arrival. After a brief explanation of what we should expect and a few general rules, we was ushered into a small dark room followed by the sound of the lock bolting shut be hide us. Without going into detail and ruining it for others, what happened from there on after only got our minds thinking and blood racing. Besides having a blast with the puzzles, I couldn't help but stop to think of how clever everything was organised. A great new experience which I would definitely want to experience again.

Awesome/Unique Escape Game. I've never done an escape game before, but I was addicted to them on my iPad. Being able to play it for real was amazing and completely immersive. I played in a group of 3 and we were constantly thinking on our feet (literally!). Some great surprises which I cannot spoil and an overall great experience. Also, the staff were very friendly and hosted the game perfectly.

Fun and thoroughly recommended!. Awesome experience and very welcoming staff. The room was well build and thought out. The puzzles weren't overly complex, though required some thinking and teamwork to solve logically. I say logically because there weren't random items hidden in weird obscure places that people wouldn't normally place unlike some other escape rooms. I'd say that the current room is geared more towards mid-teens and above. As part of the kickstarter we got shown around the place and had the opportunity to watch the next group of people try to escape the room. Advice and hints were friendly and professional, even when people were still struggling. Imagine (for those of you old enough) when Crystal maze was on the TV and you were shouting at the screen when the solutions were painfully obvious and people still failed to complete them. Location is only a few mins walk from Holloway Road underground so it was convenient and not far from the Arsenal stadium for you footie fans.Oh and free drinks, popcorn and medallions if you manage to survive which was a nice touch in comparison to competitors. Looking forward to the next room guys!!!

Great experience at Engima Escape :D. I've played a few escape games in London but the Killer at Enigma Escape really stood out for me. The theme is great! It makes you feel really involved in the story with a genuine reason to escape, and the puzzles all fit in really well. The rooms look really cool, especially the welcome area! Our host (Sam) was very friendly and welcoming, and the drinks and popcorn were a nice touch. The location was easy to find, a short walk from the tube. Will definitely be going back when more rooms open!

Excellent Escape Room Experience. Having never been to an Escape Room experience I didn't really know what to expect. Its really well located, being just around the corner from Holloway Road Tube Station. We arrived about 5 minutes before the booking. One of the games creators was on hand to explain what was going to happen and some of the rules around the game. Afterwards you are shown in introductory video and locked in your room. It was an immersive experience, with the puzzles being well thought out and not really just random stuff thrown together. There were a few surprises and there was a sense of progress through out the game. You can see how much time you have left via a television and occasionally the hosts will send in hints if you are having issues.If you like puzzle apps and games you will really appreciate what the creators of Enigma Escape have put together and we will be going back to play the second game when it gets up and running.

Another solid addition to the London Exit Game community. My wife and I had an AWESOME time at Enigma escape and highly recommend it.Having done several other exit games, I can definitely say that "The Killer" ranks in my personal top three favourites. It definitely is not the standard type of random numbers, open locks, repeat style. It is much more an experience following a theme. This is what sets Enigma apart from the crowd. The puzzles logically follow what one would try in real life, which makes it that much more fun.Besides the room, I have to say something about the owners. These are two friendly guys who definitely have a passion for the exit game genre. This passion is seen in the quality of the venue and quality of the game mechanics. They treated us really well which added to our enjoyment.Hopefully next time we are back in London, they will have a new room open, so we can come back for another round.

Our Experience at "Enigma Escape". Our game, "The Killer", lasted about an hour and myself and my twin sister arrived about 10 minutes early for it. We met our host (Hon one of the games creators) and we were shown around and taken to a smaller room to begin our escape. Hon was an entertaining host and really set the scene well, he was very approachable and hospitable. We wore comfortable clothes and had to leave our bags and phones in a safe place outside the game room. Also we were allowed to bring in our drinks with us and could leave the room at any time in case we needed a breather etc. It was a tonne of fun and really immersive. It was exciting and scary at times and the scenario/ theme was entirely believable and maintained throughout the escape.Would 100% recommend for anybody looking for a brain teasing activity and/ or who enjoys games in general. This is a truly unique experience that you and your friends won't forget any time soon.

A Real Life Video Game.... We didn't know quite what to expect when we booked to play but it was really good fun.If you like puzzle games, you will love this, it's like being immersed into a creepy video game. Staff are friendly and helpful too.We will definitely be returning soon to try the other games. :)

Amazing fun immersive experience!!. First time visiting and experiencing an escape game.Location easy to find, amazing venue, atmosphere and room designs with many surprises. The game is immersive and fun, get through it by working together. Greeted and supported by the host very well right from the start to the end! Highly recommend to play!!

Immersive, exciting and memorable!. THE EXPERIENCE: The experience really has stuck in my mind! So fun!! Full of unexpected developments and surprises, it's immersive, has an awesome setting and really gets you thinking against the clock! There were 3 of us, We had an hour to escape and were left with under 2 minutes left! So close! We'll be returning for the new rooms when available (along with bringing some new people) and have been discussing it since we went! PERFECT FOR:Definately go, would be perfect for a birthday, stag do activity, general evening activity with friends or maybe a nice alternative to a date where you work together as a couple as teams are allowed to be 5 and under! Some of the themes might be a little intense for really young kids, but teens and up would find this enjoyable. STAFF:Super friendly staff and willing to answer questions, very welcoming and enthusiastic about the project which really makes you all the more excited about the experience. FOOD:On here it says "food available for purchase" which wasn't applicable BUT they have complimentary soft drinks/water and they gave us some popcorn too :) CONCLUSION: Do it :p

Awesome scape game!. I have done some of this in London and in Spain, and this was one of the most fun games I have played. The start of the game is amazing, we never felt frustrated with any step, and the full hour was a non stop. Very clever game, based on logic. No just a lot of locks and numbers to use everywhere. VERY RECOMENDED.

Great atmosphere and a cool experience. My friends and I had a lovely time visiting Enigma Escape last week. The venue was easy to find and we were greeted by one of the owners upon arrival.I've been to a few "Escape Game" experiences in London and I'd say that this was the most realistic and engaging of the bunch. It's appropriately challenging in places and we all had to work together to escape The Killer!Best of all were the little extras we were given, a snack and drink before the game and a shiny medallion for successfully escaping. My only criticism was that the lighting when we had our photo taken was quite dark so it wasn't the best photo(Though maybe that was just part of the mood)Overall we all had a great time and I look forward to seeing what the guys come up with next!

New immersive escape game experience. This review is only going to be helpful if you have been to an escape room before.I went with a group of friends. We had all played about 5 other escape games before. This one is a bit different, Enigma Escape's USP is that they are more immersive. In the game you are part of a story which is relevant throughout unlike other rooms where the story usually stops as you enter the room and it is all about the puzzles.Pros:Visually fantastic, props are great.Best out of room experience and the hosts are good.Some really special and surprising moments in the game (spoilers if I say more).Easy to find.Slightly different experience than other London escape roomsCons:We escaped in just over 40 mins, which is the fastest we have escaped from anywhere although it was the fastest time they had so far and we are very experienced.Story driven experience meant the puzzles were the weakest part. But they were in their first week and have potential improvement.Overall 9/10. Definitely worth a try for experienced escape room players.

A great experience you won't forget soon!. WHY I BOOKED:I went over to Enigma Escape on their opening week, it luckily coincided really well with my birthday. I had booked a midday slot with my boyfriend for us to experience the immersive room escape and I wasn't disappointed.Myself and my boyfriend love video games and logic puzzles such as Portal and arcade games such as IloMilo. I decided to back this project on Kickstarter in early 2015 because I thought it would be really interesting and fun - I was spot on. THE EXPERIENCE:They recommend 90 minutes for the experience and are you're advised to arrive 10 minutes before your booked slot, your host talks you through the rules and you watch the introduction video. You're then locked in a room for 60 minutes with the goal to escape before the time runs out. After you escape (or don't), you then see a conclusion video - this changes depending on whether you made it out or not. The system was slick and the experience was like no other. Unlike other escape the room experiences, there are no actors in this. It really is you and your friends locked in a room trying to find a way out. You have the options of clues from your host if you get really stumped, and there is a screen inside the locked room so you know how much time you have left.Don't worry about being locked in the room, if you ever need a breather, there is a key hooked on the door you entered through if you really need to take a time out.You can book for teams between 2 and 5 (at the moment), it takes team work, logic and some off the wall thinking to get through the immersive experience. We had such a great time that I'm telling EVERYONE about it and am ready for the Engima Escape team to create their second experience so I can book in!CUSTOMER SERVICE:The team themselves are wonderful, Hon was our host for the experience, and he was great fun. As they also knew it was my birthday the day before our visit, we were welcomed to happy birthday banners and they even bought me a cake! If that isn't a sign of thoughtful customer service, I don't know what is!EXTRAS:You don't need to take anything extra with you. And although I've ticked food and drink available, it's more snacks than anything. But if you do get peckish for something a bit more substantial there's a pub/bar on the corner of the road it's on, and a Tesco express a stones throw away. Obviously - you're not there for food, you're there for the activity!SUMMARY:If you and your friends/partner/family love puzzles and are looking to take it up a notch, I would highly recommend Enigma Escape. It's as much fun as you expect, and a little more.

Exciting new addition to London's escape room options. I've played a variety of the escape rooms that London has to offer, and have started to get a feel for what I like. In my opinion, while this isn't the best of the rooms on offer, it's perfectly playable, particularly if you go with a smaller group (we went with five, which meant at times some of us felt less active participants in the game). It's quite linear, so you'll usually be focused on solving one challenge before moving on to the next. Having said that, clues are well delivered, at just the right moments, so your team is unlikely to get too frustrated in the room, but equally you won't feel like you're being spoon fed.The one place this stands out is that it didn't feel too contrived. That was a refreshing change - not having to find every number in the room and input on each of the padlocks. The room itself is well themed - this isn't just an office space with some props thrown in. They've gone to real trouble to get the atmosphere right. In sheer numbers of puzzles it's on the low side, but there are some quite neat ones thrown in there, and one in particular which was a particularly nice effect.Overall it's a solid escape room, well themed, but let down a bit by the intro and wrap up videos. As with all escape rooms across London, I think newbies will enjoy it because they've not get anything to compare it to. Experienced players will enjoy it for the theming and a couple of fun puzzle mechanism. Those of you in the middle might feel a little disappointed, depending on which parts of and escape room are most important to you.

kids love it! A greast family activity. combined with a really great day in London docklands, the venue was easy to get to from canary wharf station. the staff were friendly and the challenge was superbly aimed at our 3 kids. aged 11,13 and 14. we done the chaos game which involves finding clues to the next puzzle within a room. the layout was simple enough that you were not overwhelmed with information .the 40 something crystal maze generation of adults will have a great time with their teenage children.plenty of places to grab a sandwich/coffee/lunch nearby as well. we combined it with a ride on the emirates sky ride and a river bus cruise back to central London for a full day out.

Good puzzles. We went as a group of four. I think any more would be to crowded in the small room and to much input to focus. However we enjoyed ourselves and just ran out of time on the last puzzle. Suitable for all ages and a great laugh if not frustrating. The time goes very quick so you have to get off the mark pretty sharpish. When you get stuck you will be prompted with a clue so no "end off" points.

Much loved gift. I bought a Sherlock Unlock voucher on Groupon as a gift for my brother's birthday. It was really good value. He and 5 of his friends went and had a fabulous time playing Outbreak. They all thought it would be Sherlock Holmes related and it wasn't but they still had a really good time and escaped with minutes to spare. They enjoyed the set up, they dressed up for the event and had a fab evening.

Sherlock Unlock Poppycock ..... Tried this escape game with four girlfriends following a catch up over lunch at Canary Wharf but was pretty disappointed - great idea but poorly executed. There were various clues in the room to open several padlocks though no storyline to link anything or provide any interest - it was just a case of finding a number/word and trying every lock so no real sense of achievement. We escaped from the room in around 40 minutes only to find we were in another room with further clues. I'd lost interest at this point and was quite happy when the chap who was looking after us (the coordinator watches via a camera and provides additional clues via a screen if needed) came and solved the missing clues.

Fantastic afternoon. Really great moment spent to resolve all sherlock Unlock mysteries !Really enjoy and I advice to anyone to do it !!We were only two and we've tested every games "Outbreak", "Chaos", and "Mutiny".

Look for better options !!. * the game has nothing to do with sherlock holmes* the staff were very carless .. and gave us a paper to read the instructions and said whenever you finish reading the time will start.. they didnt even greet us!!* we played Outbreak which is medium difficultly. . Hints were given appropriately.*the themes they put were irrelevant. . The game has lots of locks which u have to open thats it.. nothing special.* after the game a lady with an expressionless face came and said.. well done guys .. can we take a picture for Facebook .. she took the picture and literally left the room without even saying thanks or good bye.. we didnt know should we leave ..? .. we searched for an exit and left the building.. Maybe it was part of the game to search for an exist after u complete the game.. who knows !* have tried other games which were way more better constructed than this one.. I suggest to look for Number 1 or 2 on TripAdvisor i am sure u wont find this one in the top five for a reason ! * if u have never tried An escape room before. . Try it where its well done.. so u will know how it feels like..Dont try a poorly constructed one like this.. * i think it deserves less than two stars.. but i dont wanna be cruel. *** my advice. . Try to Find better Escape Rooms and dont be misled by the good reviews..

Sherlock Unlock -. Bought this for my birthday as had done something similar in Budapest, so along with hubby and 10 friends we arrived at the venue ready to solve the mysteries. We live in north London so got a taxi to the venue as, although not difficult to find, was a lot easier for us. We split into two groups of six, girls V boys, to make it a bit more competitive and it was a really fun activity. Would thoroughly recommend, everyone enjoyed it and a good laugh. It wasn't easy and we used every second of our hour to solve the puzzles, just got out in time but most pleasing of all was we beat the men! Would definitely like to try the other games they do but the location would make me think twice and I would probably look for something more central to do a similar activity. Having said that it is great fun and if easy for you to get to, would thoroughly recommend

We Brokeout!. Easy to find and quite simply put together but a great experience.Six of us were totally engulfed for an hour finding clues and unlocking things enabling us to escape.we all loved it and will be back to make use of the 50% off offer in there new room due to open shortly.

Great fun. Purchased this on groupon and it was excellent value for money. Would highly recommend this for a great time with friends. A full hours entertainment which gets you using your brain whilst having fun with friends. We did the Chaos room and can't wait to go back and try one of the other rooms.

Loved it! . A group of us went for a birthday surprise and absolutely loved it! After never having done anything like it before we broke out of the room with 17 mins to spare! Go us! The place is a little hard to find and it is literally just a room with bits in but is a great team building task and I would definitely recommend. The day was brightened up by the very enthusiastic and friendly girl who explained everything to us. Definitely want to go back and do a harder room in the future.

Great family fun. This was our second time at an escape game . It did not have as many props and the rooms were quite bare by comparison but it was still fun. It is a great way to spend family time as age is not important and you do need to work as a team . I agree with a previous comment in that the game is better played with more people .

A great experience. Me and my sisters went as a group of 3 and we had as great time! The hints were really helpful and came at the right time and we made it out with almost 5 minutes to spare. Proving it is possible to do it with a small group, you just have to have smart people lol. The room did look a bit worn but that didn't detract from the fun that we had. Will definitely be returning and making good use of the 50% discount. I can definitely reccomend

Very basic and very little thought put in. Hm.. seems as if these people have seen an escape game and thought "we could make money doing that!"We arrived and were greeted by a friendly enough woman who led us to a back room. There was no build up or story to the game at all at this point. We were then told we could leave all our stuff in the room while we played the game. She mentioned that only they would be there so it was perfectly safe.We were then led into a tiny, hot room where the entire game was played out. The puzzles were ok but by that point we all felt pretty cheated. Having played lots of other escape games, this one didn't compare at all. We solved the game and thankfully got out of the sweaty box that was the room!To add insult to injury we went back into the back room where all out belongings were only to find about 10 other random people sat on our coats and bags etc.. not exactly secure!We paid half price for this and felt cheated. If we'd have paid full price we'd have been really pissed off. There are so many other escape games that are the same price as this one and about 100 times better. Don't waste your money or time on this one.

Give us a clue . Me and my friend done the chaos theme... My advice go with more people, we were still stuck on the first question for half an hour... The whole thing only an hour lol. They were good and helped us. Great when you get the clues. And defentlely better with more people.

2nd visit. Visited Sherlock Unlock for the 2nd time yesterday. When we went there in June they said if we booked through them for a second visit we would get 50% off. So as we had had a great time the first time we went we decided to take them up on their offer. The last time we did Breakout, so this time we did Chaos. It was really good and we had a brilliant time and we got out with more time to spare, 11 seconds last time and this time 6 minutes 20 seconds. The girl that was there (sorry can't remember her name) was lovely and helpful going through everything before we started as some things are different in each escape room. We approached things much calmer this time and only asked for clues when really stuck. If I'm being honest I preferred the Breakout better but either one is great and makes you think. There is also another room there and we would have no hesitations about going back to try that one too. An enjoyable way to spend an hour (or less if you manage to escape quicker).
Work do - great fun. We went yesterday after work and after doing 5 of these before this was one of the better ones. Would recommend it!

Cancelled 15 minutes before it started. I was sent an email 15 minutes before we were set to arrive to tell us they have double booked. Trekking to the middle of nowhere on a bank holiday was less than ideal and they didn't deal well with the situation when we got there at all - telling us how this had happened before and not offering a sufficient explanation. Unacceptable and put me off ever going again

Great family game. A great escape game, some different types of clues and puzzles we hadn't seen in others. All made to feel welcome and a couple of hints given when needed which nudged us in the right direction without making it too easy. A great way for teens, parents and grandparents to all work together for an hour!Used a group on voucher and you get a discount to do the other rooms on a return visit which we think we will!

Lots of fun!. My 17 year old son and I did Outbreak one day and Mutiny the next. Lots of fun and a great hour each day spent hanging out with my son with no phones to interrupt! Mutiny was definitely the harder of the two rooms.

Fanatstic experience. very well done at first was a bit dubious because it is an office building but the actual room and the game were very clever and proved a good challenge, well worth going and good to do as a group

Mutiny lock in room.. Brilliant hour spent with my work colleagues before dinner & drinks. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Some of the clues were a bit hard but help was offered. We made it out with 9 mins 3 secs to spare.

Great fun with colleagues!. We booked two rooms with Sherlock unlock one being chaos and the other Outbreak, both were thoroughly enjoyed by the teams, it was a great team building activity and we had a lot of laughs along the way also. It was great deciphering puzzles and trying to beat the clock! It was well organised and the staff are very attentive and pay great attention to detail. Definitely a must with either friends or family! Aliya
Excellent. Played this game with a group of Coworkers and it was great fun. The team is very helpful, friendly and accommodating.

Something different for once!. We got a deal on Groupon for Sherlock Unlock to do something different on a weekend with friends. It's quite a laugh escaping the rooms and with Canary wharf round the corner it's a good location to go out for a meal after. Not sure if they can open the windows in the building but it got very warm on a hot day in the room! All in all was a fun experience and would recommend to do with colleagues or friends.

an hour of fun!. We were a couple playing in both the "chaos" and "outbreak" rooms. Both rooms were challanging and we had a great time solving the puzzles.The crew is very kind and helpful.Bottom line, very recommended!

There are better escape rooms, poorly executed. Nice people but very disorganised and so the delivery of the experience was only average. We had the answers left in our room so then we were offered another room to escape from instead and in that, they spent 10 minutes giving us a hint for a clue we had already solved and kept telling the screen that! It was frustrating and having done another escape room in London, I was even more disappointed. I wont come back to this one - but it hasn't put me off escape rooms altogether!

Great fun and a test of your skills in solving clues. We visited with our friends and their daughter and the 6 of us set about solving the clues in the 'outbreak' game.It's a real test and gets the grey-matter working to solve the clues and move from room to room having unlocked various clues and escape routes.Simple concept and works brilliantly - the team there were lovely and couldn't have been more friendly. IF you are successful you get to take a victory picture dressed as Sherlock and Co (although my friend managed to look more Juliet Bravo than Dr Watson).Under 10's might struggle if honest. Give it a go - you'll love it!

Great for young clever minds. The place is very easy to find and you are greeted by very friendly faces. After a short explanation you're led to the room from which you must escape. We took 4 girls who were 14 and they managed to escape with 9 minutes to spare. The staff here were very encouraging to the girls and offered them 50% discount if they wanted to come back, which they will, they might even have 2 adults joining them. Would highly recommend.

Sherlock Unlock . Great fun/experience to have here with your friends/family.A nice time to work as a team and work through the riddles.Customers service was 110% lovely people with great communication.Would recommend

An hour of escapism from the London bustle. A friend came to london from scotland, having done one there he suggested we give this place a go. Was a lot of fun, Staff were supper friendly and made you feel right at ease. 3 of us went, I think if you had more we would have solved it a bit quicker but it does also depend on those in the group. We did chaos, the clues were well designed and fairly easy to work out, there were about 15 puzzles to solve in total which meant the game moved at a good pace and you didn't find yourself waiting for the next thing to happen. Will go back again soon as there are 2 other games to complete. Id say suitable for teens and up wards purely for the fact some of the clues can be cryptic and need to be come at from a variety of view points and if you use wowcher or groupon the more that play the more you save. 5*

Good for an hour of escapism!. Great fun six of us to solve the puzzles, we were lucky to have one member who had been in similar games and was on the ball so we managed to escape with 20 minutes to spare

Great team event!. We did this as a bit of a team event for a new joiner and leaver event. It was great fun and a real challenge, Would definately like to go back and try the next level as we managed to crack the code!

Unlocked my inner Sherlock . This was a really fun, interesting and engaging. It just threw you in the deep end of it all as if Sherlock himself in all his cases with no one telling where to start looking or how to look you just gotta pull your inner Sherlock out to take you and others to freedom. There were time of course where we did get hints where we were stuck.

Great fun!!!. I have bought a voucher on Groupon Web site but the code didn't work. After a call with one of the very helpful staff members we managed to book the Outbreak room. We were booked for 6 people but only 4 of us could come. It wasn't a problem. We came quite early but they welcomed us friendly and a waiting room was offered until they prepared the room for the game. Once the game was prepared, we went in and the great adventure began. We got so excited about all the padlocks and codes and riddles that when we got to the end we didn't realise it's actual end of the game and we wanted to do more and more and more :-D We had even 9 minutes left of the time! We loved the atmosphere and everything! We will definitely be back!!! Thanks for the great time we had!!!
Great afternoon. Me and a friend did this at the weekend and had a great time. Great to get your mind working and good fun. Well worth a visit
Amazing. It is a great game to play especially people who like mystery and suspense. Would definitely going to recommend my friends.

Disappointing. Done a few escape games and this (Outbreak) was definitely the weakest. No flow/order to the puzzles, no real theme, poor quality props, just a lot of padlocks and laminated pieces of paper, meaning you end up trying all manner of numbers in different padlocks. The hosting not really up to scratch... instead of setting the scene they made one of our group read out the introduction to the game...surely that's their job? Plus the room wasn't properly set up so one of the padlocks hadn't been locked.

Escape room visit. The team were incredibly helpful. I bought a wowcher voucher but unfortunately wowcher had put the wrong dates so it wasn't working. Despite this the Sherlock Unlock team were happy to accept it and booked promptly booked us in. The game was good fun and challenging. There were some slight issues with some props but overall was a great experience.

Great fun!. A group of 12 of us friends undertook the activity with 6 in each room. The staff were very friendly and the opportunity to wear the props and take pics beforehand was fun! The game itself lasted 1hr, personally I would have preferred 90 mins. The guys giving clues when we were really stuck was helpful. Definitely recommend this activity for adults and not kids as our friends didn't solve the task in time as found the mystery difficult. Thanks guys for making the day a memorable one for us all!

Great, fun experience!. Two families (children aged 9-16) went head to head.... we had a fab experience. However uninspiring the outside looks the inside certainly made up for it!! We felt we had conquered the Zombie room fairly quickly only to be thrust straight into another room... didn't see that one coming!! Great time had by all.

Amazing!. Had a fantastic evening playing Sherlock Unlock - chaos room. Was really well put together and enjoyed unlocking the codes to get out of the room - managed it with 59 seconds to spare would highly recommend .

Great fun. This was our first time in trying anything like this. I had booked this mystery room as a wedding anniversary treat and we both loved it! The clues were interesting, although somewhat difficult to begin with. Once when you got the hang of it - what clues could point to which lock etc, we got quicker and managed to solve the room even with time to spare :) We were assisted by a very kind staff member Rory and the experience was a great start for the day.
Birthday Surprise. I took my boyfriend here for a surprise birthday activity. Neither of us had done anything like it before so it was a bit of a risk. WE HAD THE BEST TIME! SO FUN!!!!

60 mins of fun. Really enjoyed this. A good mixture of difficulty- some challenges were fairly easy to decipher but that gave you a boost which, when struggling with some of the more difficult ones, was much needed. It was great for the kids in our group (one 16, the other 12) as they were able to be just as involved as the four adults. Our visitors from South Africa had never experienced anything like this before and, out of all of the normal tourist things they had done, said that this was the most enjoyable. We were made to feel very welcome.
Good fun!. Great fun. We did it as a group of 6 friends and came out buzzing. My only criticism is that it's perhaps a little too easy, as we got out with over 20 minutes left!!

More attention and effort could have made it better. We did the Chaos room. The story did not make much sense and did not add to the riddles. The riddles were OK but not great. One could see that not a lot of effort was put into the room. Since we already did in the past another escape room we know it can be much better (so much better). We had a groupon so it was ok but will not recommend it

So much fun!!!!. We had so much fun and managed to get out!! When we entered the room we didn't think we had a hope in hell but once we got into the first lock we had a burst of energy and got through the rest. Brilliantly designed and lots of fun!!!! We are booking the next one tonight!! This is the second one we have done all together and will definitely be coming back to this one!! Very friendly staff!!!!!

Loved the challenge and details. My friends's hen do started at Sherlock Unlock. Though the location was not easy to find, the team's enthusiasm compensated for it. We loved every minute! I particularly liked the polaroid photo you get at the end and the fact that they provide an array of hats to wear should you want to! We loved the challenge and happy we managed to solve the puzzles and escape the room just under an hour! The fascinating part is that you get witty clues through a screen and the whole experience feels a little like 1984!

Great Fun!. I booked this for my younger sister's 16th Birthday and accompanied her and her friends during the hour. We had a great time in the Chaos room, escaping with just over a minute to spare! The staff are lovely and the riddles do require some thinking. We were given prompts at the right time, after having made several attempts at the same riddle ourselves first. Definitely returning to try the other rooms!

unlock your way out..... Great idea to do an escape room for my sons 17th birthday surprise. They (5 of them) went into the mutiny room while my wife and I took the chaos room. Great times had by all..... 20 out of 10.

Fun 100%. Four of us went to play the new game named Mutiny. It was an amazing experience. Team was very friendly. The room it self was very well designed. We got the right feeling! Let me admit the game was not easy at all. Very challenging for 1 hour. It is all about team work and brainstorming and clues given from helpful staff helped us to escape finally. Good fun, definitely would recommend to others. Planning to go again and trying other games!

Good...but basic. . Having only done one escape room previously, I am still very much a beginner of this type of activity.There were 3 of us attempting the 'Outbreak' room, which is the medium difficulty of the three rooms available.We booked through an online discount website, giving us 50% off, which I'm glad of, as the normal price of £30 each seems very expensive for this room.On arrival, we were met by a female member of staff, who was very friendly however, there was no sort of introduction or background chat and basically, this is the door to the escape room and in you go.We thought with it being called Sherlock Unlock, branded with Sherlock Holmes type logos etc that this was the theme, however, the only thing Sherlock Holmes'y was the box of props to get your photo taken with. Perhaps the other two rooms were that theme but the outbreak wasn't...this was some sort of biological outbreak gone wrong but the room did not go with that theme.A couple of pieces of old furniture, a piece of biohazard tape over the door and a couple of puzzles....it was all a bit basic. There is a lot of room for improvement and although we were given a couple of clues (unprompted might I add) we broke out in 38 minutes. On exiting, I expected a well done, this is your time, a photo opportunity with the digital clock and perhaps a piece of A4 paper certificate of some sort with your time etc on it but there was none of that. We got asked if we would have our picture taken for their website page with the hat and pipe and magnifying glass prop, which we obliged.So in conclusion; an average and basic escape room, with an average customer experience and ok for £13 each but not for £30 each.

Amazing time!. So glad we came across this great deal, I went with a bunch of my friends and we all had an amazing. The room was difficult to escape from but they provide you with clues and it is a fantastic experience. I definitely recommend it.
Super fun experience . Amazing experience and excellent customer service! Would definitely recommend for anyone to try. We had loads of fun and the workers were super nice. 10 out of 10 experience

Fantastic. Went here with 5 other friends, and it was so fun! Did the chaos challenge and I hadn't laughed so much my entire life! The riddles weren't overly difficult but they were definitely not easy. You must work as a team though and not go your own separate ways like we did at first, but then once we worked as a team it went great. I liked the whole idea of the television with the clues, and the music in the background felt all mysterious lol it really adds to the atmosphere. I suggest you go with 6 people because I think anything less than that will be too hard! But I thoroughly enjoyed myself and I have to say the hosts are genuinely the nicest people I have met! They were very helpful and very polite. Okay and now the bit you've all been waiting for.... We eventually escaped! With 11 MINUTES to spare! :) great right? Yeah I was proud of myself... I mean us. I can't wait to go back and try the outbreak room! Very good time and glad I went =D

Wonderful experience . Firstly I would like to say the stuff there were wonderful. They in fact made the whole experience much better. We did the chaos room and I must say it was harder than I thought but ones you get the first few clues you will soon be on the right track. We were told we would be given an hour and although that might seem rather long you will soon realise how quickly the time goes by. Overall it was very enjoyable and I will definitely be going back.

Family visit. Mum & Dad went with Sammy (17) and Josh (14) and all had a great time. We did the Chaos room and thoroughly enjoyed it.Sammy wants to go back (with us!) and do the other room (zombies) for her 18th Birthday.Really enjoyable! Thanks. :-)

Escape Room first times!. Went to Sherlock Unlock today (1/6/16). Very easy to find on a small industrial estate only 5 minute walk from South Quays station. We were a bit early and when we arrived nobody was there. But the host Rory arrived within 10 minutes of us getting there. We were shown into a room where Rory explained the two rooms and how everything worked in them. He told us that clues would come up on the t.v screen in each room, or we could ask for clues if we were stuck. I must admit an hour sounded a long time but as the clock started ticking down you don't realise how the time goes so quick. It certainly brings out your groups personality traits - mine was to stay calm and work through things systematically, my youngest daughter approached everything quite laid back with no urgency which made us look at things carefully at times, and my oldest daughter, well now I know who the competitive one in the family is, looking at clues and trying to solve them in a mad frenzy, all the while shouting out to Rory to give us the next clue. We eventually broke out of the room with 11 seconds to spare. We all really enjoyed it and will try and go back to do the other room and take advantage of the 50% discount you get if you book directly on their website, which is for returning customers.

Good not Great. We were a team of 2, and having done the escape rooms at Clue Quest I had thought this would be quite similar. We did the Outbreak Challenge and managed to escape the room within the hour...with time to spare!The clues are not straightforward and you need to reply on the screen to help you. This I found weird as the screen prompts are supposed to put you in the right direction not tell you what you need to do (I realised this especialy with the typewriter part)The rooms aren't very decorated and when you escape the room the monitor (which is in the other room) says congratulations. I had expected someone to be there to say well done in person.They team who runs the games should also make sure that those booked for the rooms are allowed access. We were in the second room, at the final door figuring out the combinations to the padlocks when someone from the outside tried to get in. I assume they were lost or just morons.Overall it was a good experience but expensive for what they provide (although you get 50% off if you buy a second game).The staff need to be a bit organised and make the games more challenging. Just padlocks are quite boring.

Escape room. This was fantastic and the 6 of us that went really enjoyed it. I can't rate enough how good Sherlock Unlock was and they have two games so if there are a big group, then you can go against each other to see who gets out of the room first.

Fun and challenging zombie game. We were 2 of us, and we played the Outbreak game. Rory (our guide) made it fun, and challenging. The decorations felt a bit poor compared with other exit games and the price a bit more expensive but, the game itself was challenging and achiveable and it was a very fun time! Highlighly recommended!!.

Half-baked quest. I've tried 4 other escape rooms before, and this is by far the worst.The room we played was Outbreak, and from what I can read here Chaos seems to have similar problems.1. There is no flow of the puzzles - just a couple of doors with a bunch of padlocks on each. Trying all the codes on all of them gets very repetitive, as previous reviewers said.2. The host did not provide the helps when we asked for them - instead she seemed to decide for herself when to do it. If this is how this quest is supposed to work, this should have been explained in the beginning, as helps are provided on demand in other quests.3. SOME HELPS POINTED TO A RED HERRING. I think this is unfair as the helps are supposed to point you in the right direction. Considering that the helps are pre-written and appear on a screen, this is an inherent design flaw.4. When we escaped the room no one greeted us at the end - we only figured out that the quest is finished when we looked at the timer and saw that it stopped - then we just had to go and find the host ourselves.Anyway, I'm glad we got it cheap on a Groupon deal at least - it's too disappointing to pay the full price.

So disappointing. Unfortunately this was the worst escape room I have ever completed! I wanted to like it and the hosts were very friendly but that could not make up for the utter lack of sense inside the room. The props were cheap and tacky and actually a lot didn't work properly so even when we had the right numbers/codes we could not use them and had to be prompted to 'keep trying'. Logic and thinking outside of the box could not help us escape because the puzzles were nonsense that could not be worked out without copious clues. I have tried 5 other rooms and this one was so poor, I recommend going to another if this is not your first because escape rooms should be better thought out than this one.
Fun times. We booked the two rooms and had a great time. We were a mix of escape room "virgins" and previously experienced and every one had a fun time. Very friendly guys hosting us.

Non-immersive. We did the Chaos room and compared to other puzzle rooms I've done this one was very lacking. It had a story but it was just a piece of paper that we had to read to ourselves and it wasn't permeated throughout the room, so didn't have much point. It was far from immersive as it was in an office building and was dressed with IKEA furniture. The puzzles were basically just a load of locks to unlock which got a bit repetitive, but they weren't that. Unfortunately all the other factors let the experience down, like how were also rushed out at the end after escaping the room because we couldn't be left in the same room as the other group's possessions. With more concentration on detail and investing in some lockers would greatly improve this room.

Fun experience with challenging puzzles! (Though theme was lacking a bit). Went as a group of four and really enjoyed this experience. There are multiple clues to find and puzzles to solve, most of them quite logical but also challenging at times! A time-travel back story was provided in the Chaos version that we did but it didn't really follow through very well - not sure it's necessary, might just be worth coming up with a simpler lock-in story, otherwise would need some more work to make it relevant. This is more of a thematic point though (the only downside compared with others that we've tried that had a stronger story) - we still really enjoyed it overall!

Great fun. Booked this activity and went with 5 family members. We didn't know What to expect and I was a bit worried that the others wouldn't enjoy it. We chose to do outbreak and what great fun we had. Personally, I found the clues difficult do it was probably a good thing that there wee 6 of us as we'd most likely still be there now. The clues on the TV screen were really helpful and came when we really got stuck. We were so excited every time we solved a clue and opened a padlock. However, when we got out of the room we were shocked to find another room we needed to exit. It was good that there were lots of bits in the room that had nothing to do with the clues. It was also funny when we thought we had completed it which gave another slant to the game. We got out with 50 seconds to spare. Great host. Great fun and I would definitely recommend it. I'm looking forward to trying the other rooms and hopefully the pirate game will be launched soon.

Great fun activity for friends . I went with nine other friends and we were split into two teams and raced against time in both rooms. We worked through the clues which were challenging and both the guys that were working were extremely helpful. Both teams throughly enjoyed it as it was something different and got our minds working.

A good one for beginners. We booked this for the 2 of us to do on May bank holiday, as we had done 2 previously and really enjoyed them. We managed to escape in just under 20 minutes (and were told it was record breaking by quite some time!), yet this wasn't as simple as that. The clues and puzzles follow a linear pattern but still remains challenging, despite our quick time. The puzzles are varied and fun, and we certainly needed to work together to escape in time. The host was lovely and explained everything clearly! Thanks for a fun time. This would be recommended for those who want to try the escape room for the first time, and we are looking forward to trying the other one that Sherlock Unlock has to offer.

Great fun and challenging!. We booked the Outbreak room for 6 of us. The staff member we met was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was great fun and quite difficult, even though a couple of members of the team had done a fair few escape rooms before. We really liked the theme and the plot. All in all a great experience!

Chaos room, good fun. Booked this for 6 ladies ages ranging from 26 to 55, only one of our party had experienced an escape room before. The guy that met us was really friendly, the rooms was quite basic but the clues were well thought out. We all enjoyed ourselves, some solving more clues than others and managed to escape with 15mins to spare, we also had a few little prompts to help us otherwise we may still be in there!!! Easy location to get to about a 6 mins walk from South Quays station on the DLR. Overall a fun way to spend an hour.

An hour of brain challenging fun with friends. We had booked both the Rooms for 8 of us at Sherlock Unlock. Both the rooms with its own theme Outbreak and Chaos is fun and all the quizzes, puzzles, riddles, problems were fun to solve and all of us loved it. The set-up was nice and interesting.I would highly recommend this to anyone wishing to have some good time with friends or family.

Sherlock unlock escape room. Booked this for the 3 teen kids & 2 adults as a present. Arrived to be greeted by a very friendly man. He explained that we would be put in a room & in there would be various clues which unlock padlocks. We had great fun & managed to escape by the skin of our teeth with 7 mins to spare. Great for all ages, adults too. Highly recommend it. Went for nice lumch after in canary wharf.

Too easy perhaps?. My wife booked this for my birthday as the previous year we had booked a similar escape for my daughters birthday We all arrived early but that was no problem as no one was in the room or they had finished earlyThe young man told us the basics and that each clue only unlocked one lock this was helpful but perhaps too much soWe entered the room and flapped around for a bit but then the help on the screen started in my opinion too early as we then quickly solved the first cluesThis continued for the next 35 minutes the hints on the screen were for me a little too direct and helpful so in under 45 minutes we were finished and back outsideThe initial joy at beating the room was replaced by a sense of not being challenged enoughThe previous room we went to we beat but with less than 50 seconds to go we had help there too but only when you asked for it and you had limited chances to ask In conclusion this is probably a good room to try for a first escape room especially if you are a family with younger children but not for a serious adult team

Good family fun. This was our first escape room and as we have children ranging from 8-15 we didn't want anything too scary. The rooms themselves are quite basic but we had brilliant fun trying to find all the clues and undo the padlocks. You get sixty minutes which seems like a long time but when you get stuck for a while the time seems to fly by. We managed to escape with a minute left so everybody went home happy. The staff were really friendly and helped with clues when we were really stuck. The only thing stopping me from giving this five stars was the room set up. It was quite basic and looked like a cheap Halloween set. Other than that it was great fun and I'd definitely another one in future.

Thoroughly Enjoyable. Things started off badly when we turned up on a Sunday morning and no one was there. There was clearly a problem but having phoned up to complain we were contacted by text with a new time some 50 minutes later - fortunately there is a Pret nearby!When we returned the representative was extremly apologetic and offered satisfactory recompense and out experience began.I have to say that our family of five had a great time working out the clues and opening the locks. It wasn't easy but also not impossible - just the right level of challenge we felt.I would definately recommend Sherlock Unlock - and if it wasnt for the delayed start would have given it 5 stars.

Great fun . You are in a room with a TV screen. You are told that you are watched and can be heard. This is in case you get a bit stuck. Clues will appear on the tv if needed. We did outbreak. There were two rooms to crack. We all enjoyed it and will go back with the half price offer. There is an opportunity to take a photo at the end of your game using props that they supply. It's not physical so don't worry if your not very energetic.

Fantastic. Went here with some friends in April and we had a great time, the puzzles are very well thought out and the hints given are quite clever and not too revealing. The staff were very nice and polite and we were made to feel welcome. We did Outbreak when we went but would defiantly go back for a second time to do Chaos. 5*

Great small team event 5 minutes from Canary Wharf. It was our first Escape room experience but we will certainly be back - price point was good and if you look on Groupon or if you go twice it is 50% off. Went with co-workers on a Tuesday, there were 6 of us - good team bonding event, we did the Chaos room. We will certainly go back, it is a non-drinking related team event for literally everyone - tough to come by. Very positive experience.

Chaos Room- Challenging and extremely good fun. Received this experience as a Birthday gift and went along with my husband and 3 friends. We received a very warm welcome from the staff and once locked in the Chaos room there were lots of clues and puzzles to solve to enable us to unlock the padlocks to find further clues and finally escape. The experience was challenging and extremely good fun, we all thoroughly enjoyed it and we will definitely be returning to 'escape' from the 'Outbreak' room. Would definitely recommend this experience.

Ok experience, but not the best.. The room was poorly decorated/themed and the props cheap (lots of ikea stickers). The clues inside had nothing to do with the set up story. The host was too quick to jump in with help, before we had asked for it.
Needs work.

Good Family Fun. I went with my family - youngest being mid twenties.This was our first escape room and we found "Chaos" to be testing and entertaining (finished it with 16 secs to spare).The host Laurie had only been there a week, but he was very nice and welcoming. He also was quick to provide hints to us when we needed.Negatives:The game itself didn't really have a theme, which I guess they could improve upon. There was a plethora of locks and some seemed not to budge properly, but our host was quick to sort out the problem, if he knew that we knew the correct code. Unfortunately, the clues do not really indicate which lock it is the code for, so if you have got a 4 digit code, you will be trying every 4 digit lock going.On the whole, because of the host and it being our first experience of an escape game, I'll give this a high rating. At the end of the day, it was fun and proved a success in family-bonding.

Very poor room unfortunately :(. I really wanted to like this room, I did. But it was really not good, sorry guys. We did Chaos but based on my friend's experience the other room Outbreak was also pretty poor. There was no atmosphere setting from the host (very nice guy and perfectly helpful about the admin part of things), we were led into the room and told we had 60 mins. Fine - not a dealbreaker but 10-1=9. There were some interesting looking puzzles in there but so much IKEA furniture with the STICKER ON them it really ruins the game: 9-1=8. There so many red herrings in there (I know we need some, we always do) but when you are basically trying out all 4-digit numbers on every padlock to see if it works then you know there is no such thing as a "flow" when this game was planned. 8-1=7. There are only padlocks in the rooms, nothing else in terms of technical solutions - at some point I felt like this was a 101 in how NOT to do an escape room. 7-1=6. There were no less than 4 padlocks on the door and 2 on the drawers which meant the solving one puzzle didn't give you anything. I get that this kind of game is also for team-building & communication, but in that case please please please get different drawers/boxes/anything with pieces of one puzzle. Putting four different locks on the door is ugly, inelegant and just really not very fun: 6-5=4. There was one really interesting looking puzzle towards the end which we didn't have to crack and still escaped (and left one drawer locked)...how could that happen? 4-3=2. We didn't just blindly try numbers, I swear (though that would have worked too because padlocks were of really bad quality 2-1=1) which means there the whole room wasn't coherent! I'm really sorry guys, I can see the business case in opening an escape room in Canary Wharf and I really wanted to like it but this was the worst room I have ever done (I've de 12 in 4 cities so far: London, Budapest, Barcelona, Mumbai). Either then price this at £10 complete beginner level or better still - take a break and completely redesign the puzzles. If you are going I guess I have one piece of advice - go with less than 4 people or go alone if you are advanced and try to not look for any logical flow, just solve puzzles, ask for clues (without which there is no way to solve some of them) and move one. So far, any other escape room is better in the London market. Please don't be lazy and stay in the Wharf, just go to any other one. Sorry guys, honest opinion here.
Mid-week evening fun!. I've done a few escape games and absolutely love them! I thought the 'Chaos' scenario was well organised and worth a visit if you like puzzles and riddles.

Great team building exercise. I organised this evening out as part of our work team building and it worked a treat. Everyone had a great time and it was interesting to see how different team members were able to solve the different types of puzzles. The host made us feel very welcome and provided just some great tips without giving the game away. All in all a great experience.

Fun family experience. Exciting, tense and great fun. Wasn't sure what to expect but the experience was great fun and a lovely team experience for our family.Only improvement would have been to get feedback on how each of us performed within the group.Well worth a visit!

Family fun . Enjoyed the puzzles, and the activity as a whole is pretty testing (thanks for the timely clues!). Ambience and setting could be a bit more themed and maybe activity could benefit from a 'finale' - prize for quickest/day winner, or swap remaining time for raffle tickets for free game draw etc but on the whole a good family activity

Disappointing. Good PointsThere were one or two interesting puzzles to solveHost was friendly though a little overhelpful with providing answersBad PointsClues are unrelated to storyPresentation is poorMost clues are not interesting to solveRepetitive use of padlocks

escape a room. really enjoyed it. the staff were great in giving clues, the décor of the rooms was great. Don't be disappointed that it isn't underground and you're not actually locked up, it is in a business park and you need to break INTO a room (my friend didnt come because she is claustrophobic but actually the room you're in isnt locked and you can leave at any time if you are scared) but it is still great fun.

Find the clues and escape the room. Visited Sherlock Unlock using a groupon voucher for £49.00 instead of the usual £119.00 for six people. We had two teams of six, so we used both rooms "chaos" and "Outbreak". Having not been before wasn't sure what to expect. But we all enjoyed it and said it was a fun different way to spend an hour and does get the brain working. We managed to escape our room with 22 minutes to spare and the other group only had 2 minutes left to get out! There is a TVscreen that will provide you with hints and tips if need be. As I said, we haven't been before but somehow I do think that it could have been much more interesting and challenging, the room itself is just white painted walls with a few props and padlocks, it lacked something but I just can't put my finger on it. Another thing to bear in mind and had I really thought about it was the very location, in the Isle of Dogs, there's always a lot of traffic and it took over an hour to get there. I should have looked for a more convenient location escape room. I would say definitely try it if it is near you and only using a promotion code. I don't think it was worth £119.00 but was happy to pay the £49.00 with groupon.

Great fun!. Great premise and a good challenge. The rooms were all designed well and the clues were enough to point us in the right direction without giving anything away. Good diversity of objects to work with, and the theme 'outbreak' was interesting. The only constructive feedback we could give would be the very last lock - which I think we solved a bit too easily. That said, we were a VERY clever group and beat the average. (haha).

Disappointing Escape Room. I experienced four other escape rooms before and I can rate the Outbreak room as 1 out of 5 as it completely fails to immerse us in the quest atmosphere. The room has a bunch ikea items and plan painted white walls in a soviet themes world... The hostess was nice, but put zero effort in building up the quest leaving us to read the story of a flyer. She did a good job providing hints, but those are scripted anyway.Riddles themselves are fine and tough to crack, although they don't use much funky interaction, cool items and fun places to hide stuff that you will see in better escape rooms.All in all, I do NOT recommend this escape room, especially if it's not your first time around.
Great experience!. Great fun and highly recommended for a cool experience with friends! Would definitively come back to do the other mission!

Disappointing. Having completed a variety of room escapes across the country, we felt that this room was poor in comparison. The use of red herrings was ridiculous! The theme was lacking any and the props looked like a primary school project laminated.. The staff were young and lacked enthusiasm and took pleasure in the fact they'd put red herrings in the room

Average experience but good value. After previously completing Enigma Escape, Secret Studio and Tick Tock Unlock, my partner and I visited Sherlock Unlock for more escaping. We were greeted by a pleasant although not massively enthusiastic welcome before being quickly led through the basics and placed inside the room. My biggest criticism would be that the room just appeared like a normal room with a few props inside. Other escape rooms have had a real theme to them but this one felt a bit like a few props and padlocks were thrown inside. Puzzles were alright but didn't have much continuity to them. It felt a bit like work out a code and then apply it to all padlocks in the hope that one opens. I think Sherlock Unlock has a lot of room to grow and currently represents good value with the prices it offers. As an escape room experience though, it left me a little underwhelmed compared to the 3 others I've done so far.

Escape Game! . I went with my friends and family (6 in total) and it was so good! 1 hour to escape from the room and I couldn't complain about the experience! I've been to one abroad in Hong Kong and I still have the same nostalgia I has back then!The hosts were really good and communicative and gave us one or two clues along the way... We cleared it in 45 minutes :)9.5/10 for me :)If only they had a third room :3

Awesome! . Having done our first escape game while on a trip to amsterdam, we really wanted to do another one! Luckily for us we found this one on Groupon. Well priced for a group of 5, and the puzzles were loads of fun and we'll thought out. It would have been nice to have had a drink afterwards, but it's not something that's required!The guys were courteous and helpful.All in all loads of fun, we'll be planning to come and do the other game one day soon!

The Great Escape. Myself and four friends trekked to the isle of dogs this Wednesday and had the BEST time solving the Chaos puzzle room at Sherlock Unlock. The games and puzzles were ace, we had great fun and we would definitely go and do the second game. Do not be put off by the location, this place is worth the journey. Challenging but not impossible. And oh yes, we escaped. Plus the blonde guy who was working the place was very helpful, patient and really cute. Bonus!!

Great hour of fun. Bought this is a present for my husband through a Groupon offer and two friends came along with us. Was good value for money with the Groupon deal. Lots of clues to solve but just about the right amount of help if you needed it! We made it out with 1 min 38 secs to spare.

Good fun. It was our first time in a place like this and we really enjoyed! It was great fun however we all agreed that there is plenty of room for improvement! Decoration etc need to be much improved for the price you pay. (Even with a groupon) It's a bit home made for the moment but as I said we had a fantastic time and definitely recommend it to everyone!The staff are very welcoming and helpful all the way. It was good to get some clues on the screens!

Great fun!. We did the event as a couple - I think most people went with a group of 5-6 which would have probably worked better as there were so many problems to solve in the hour!However this didn't stop us having a great time. Spent the first ten minutes thinking we never successfully escape however the coordinator was very helpful at giving a little hint to point you in the right direction just as you were giving up hope, and by the end we were getting the hand of thinking outside of the box rather than logically! Happily we escaped in the hour, but needed to head for a drink given all the adrenaline!Great fun, we are already coordinating a time to get together with friends to try the other room.100% recommend to others!

Yay. We came with six people. At fist I thought that six would be a bit too much, but after all it was fine. There were a lot of codes to solve and so we could split up in smaller groups of two or three. I liked the over all experience and I liked the organiser. Some of the quests were very hard though so we needed clues but with those clues it was very doable!

This was great fun with my friends. Went for a mates birthday, turned up 15 minutes late but still escaped within 40 minutes! Boom! Killed it! Was a really great activity and I can't wait to go back to try to harder room.

Excellent Sherlock Unlock. What a brilliant way to spend an hour in London. Very challenging problems to be solved in order to escape and it was a great chance to work closely as a team. A real adrenaline rush as you work through the puzzles. We didn't stop talking about it all day. Excellent would certainly recommend this to others.
Fun Hour. Myself and my family had a great fun Hour working as a team to escape the rooms great clues something a bit different to do in London

Great Fun. Myself and 2 friends had a shot at this. Having experienced other escape games, this one was up to standard. Good variation of puzzles - some harder than others!Would definitely return to try one of the other rooms.

Great fun!. I went there today with family. It was brilliant, very well thought out riddles, clues etc. We were all over the place, but still managed to escape. I would definitely go back to try another room and definitely recommend this to others. The staff were lovely and very welcoming.

Great start!. I enjoyed an hour of fun. I can see a lot of potential and will definitely come back for another game soon. The puzzles are good but it needs a theme. The place is called "sherlock unlock" so I was expecting some sorts of mysteries to solve but it was more of a "escape the room" kind of game .Still enjoyed it and I would love to work for you guys :D :D

One for the team. Very well thought out puzzles, was personally impressed by the parallel nature of the game, allowing for effective teamwork. Maybe a more rewarding storyline? Or did we have to write our own ending?

Great day out. Went here as part of a work night out and it was my first experience of an escape room! Definitely worth the visit, it was great fun and definitely something to do with a group of friends for a different kind of night out.
A well thought out plan. Really well thought out, loads of fun and can't wait to try the second room. The clues were harder than I thought, and really made you think.

Wonderful experience. Wonderful hosts who are escape game enthusiast as well which always means a truly enjoyable game. We have played several games (>20) and this is definitely one of the top 5 in London. The production appears on a lower budget (don't expect a 'timerun') however, the quality of the puzzles are really interesting and different which is something you look for when you have done a few escape games. Well done to the girls for a great escape game! recommended! + the burgers by the restaurant is pretty good!
I had so much fun. This was my third escape game and it was so much better than the second one and easily as good as the first. It was a great evening. I would highly recommend.

Gets your brain working!. I went with 3 friends and didn't know what to expect. It's ace because it really gets you working together and you wonder where the time went. The staff are lovely and most importantly, because it's part of a pub you can have a well earned beer afterwards!

An amazing escape room! . My friends and I went to the escape room as a birthday surprise treat and it did not disappoint! The staff are so welcoming and friendly and really make the whole experience fun! I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for something a bit different. A lot of thought and care has gone in to the escape room which means you really have to think outside of the box to get out. The location is in The Grove pub which is great as they do very tasty burgers if you want some food afterwards. Thanks for a great evening!

Great fun. Went with a few friends and found the puzzles both challenging and rewarding. The ingenuity of the tasks was much better than other escape games I had played.A super experience with friendly and accommodating operators.

Escape extravaganza!. This was my very first escape game experience: it was utterly thrilling! The puzzles were challenging, baffling at times; the sensation of figuring it out second to none. At one point I stepped back, looked at the clock and thought we've got this! Two minutes later our world was tipped upside down and suddenly we were up against time, pulses racing, totally focused on the task, whilst screaming and laughing and hysterically trying to save the day! We did it! Fantastic bonding experience, having gone with two lovely work friends. Now can't wait to try another, but fear few will hold up to the ingenious challenges presented here.

Great fun and interesting way to get to know your family (friends) better. My daughter bought this for me as a birthday present and our family of 5(all adults) spent a very happy hour working out the puzzles that would allow us to escape from the room. It took us 58 minutes of rushing about and working alone and together for us to crack it and gave a great insight into our various problem solving styles. We all got a real thrill from having escaped within the target time even if we did need a few hints from the lovely girls that run it and who communicate with you via walkie talkie. Rather wish we had stayed for a burger and drink at the attached pub which looked great. . A very memorable and fun present.

Great night out! . This was my first experience of an escape game and it was fantastic! I can't recommend it enough. We laughed, we screamed, we got out!! The food in the pub is also brilliant and we'll worth factoring into your trip. My advice is Do it!

A top night out and loved first time experience!. This was my first ever experience of escape games and I has no clue what to expect. The pub is really fun, quirky and welcoming. We had a drink beforehand then played the game which was EXCELLENT. Really clever, creative. Exceeded my expectations!Afterwards enjoyed an excellent burger and glass of wine over a debrief. Highly recommended.

Great experience. Loads of fun!!. That was my first time doing this and absolutely loved it! Definitely recommend doing it with bunch of friends. Pure fun! We thought it might be easy before starting the game but it wasn't. It was a great challenge and everyone in the room was constantly trying to decode the bits. Super creative set. Apart from the game there is a lovely pub at the back and you can have a good food and pint of beer for £10! The chicken burger was banging. Can't recommend anymore so go and have fun...

Best hour ever!. I'd never actually done an escape room before but heard so much about them so was definitely keen to get going! This exceeded my expectations and then some!! The concept and design of the game is so so clever and I literally loved every second! I cannot recommend enough! This is a brilliant game and worth every penny! Book up now!! I am definitely an escape room geek and can't wait to play another.

Great fun. The five of us thoroughly enjoyed our 52 minutes inside the escape room and left us hungry to do lots more. Run by a really warm, enthusiastic pair of women, who'd clearly done their homework when it came to designing their puzzles, some of which were breathtaking in how beautifully they were constructed. The pub that it was connected to provided us with the perfect atmosphere for our debrief and all-in-all, we were left wanting to sing the praises of Do Stuff to anybody who'd listen.

Escape If You Can, And Laugh Doing It!. I have never done anything like this before and was absolutely amazed at the amount of fun, laughs and good times I had trying to solve the clues and find a way out.The whole atmosphere and environment has been really well thought out, with just enough ‘easy’ stuff to make sure you don’t feel completely helpless. The staff are great and are genuinely proud of the game they have created.A perfect afternoon or early evening activity for some mates. Highly recommended!

So much fun!. Really brilliant escape game. I've done a couple of others in London and this is one of the best I've ever done, really ingenious/trixy! The people running it are lovely (they let us watch our mates do it afterwards which was hilarious as well). Really highly recommended. Oh and also - it's in a pub... perfect for the debrief... !

This would be perfect for a double date!. I fell in love with escape games in Budapest last year and this was by far the best one I've ever done. You are transported to a different world! You can get a great burger in the bar too. If you haven't got the bug for it yet - do it!

Highly Recommended!. Bloody brilliant! Went for my birthday. The experience was fun, challenging and exciting. Four of us shared the experience, I laughed, I panicked,I cheered and said "oh no!" A lot. Innovative design and full of detail. The challenges are varied, difficult enough to feel challenged but totally achievable. I was buzzing when we escaped. I would highly recommend this escape room, with a great location, friendly hosts and unexpected turns once inside. Think outside the box and work ad a team. The escape room is located in a quirky little pub that serves delicious burgers and often has live music. You should go!!!

So much fun!. Cannot recommend this highly enough! I'd previously done Hint Hunt, and this was easily on par with that. In an unassuming location (though handy for drinks before and after...) yet very professionally imagined and delivered. My friend and I had great fun playing this game, which is challenging, jam-packed with clues to discover, and just thrilling.
