We both came out saying we wished we could wipe our memories so we could do it all over again! Go and play this, you won't regret it!

Definitely Worth Your Time. I had such a great time doing this escape game with my friends. The 2 ladies running the game were so warm and friendly. The game is attached to a pub where you can get reasonably priced drinks and food in the heart of Battersea. The game itself was so much fun. Really great attention to detail in the design of the escape room. Clearly a lot of thought and effort has gone into creating/building this game. Challenging, interesting, a lot of fun. It was sad when the game ended as I wish it could have gone on for ages! If only I could do it over again. Highly recommended.

Pumped for the puzzle!. Do stuff, Yes! do stuff. I struggle to find anything to do with the mrs. If it's not Cinema, restaurant or the pub, im usually stuck for ideas.So, finding this place was fantastic! God bless escape games!It may have been in a pub, but i'm not complaining!! We had fun!Thank you do stuff xx

Amazing!. My four friends and I were all new to escape rooms and this was a fantastic first experience. So much fun and challenging enough for us all! Super friendly people who run it, which made the experience all that more pleasant. Also located in a pub which makes debriefing over a few drinks even better. Would 100% recommend.

FANTASTIC FIRST TIME ESCAPE!!. My friend and I had an absolute blast this afternoon completing the Hostage Hideout escape game. Some fantastic puzzles, surprises round every corner and great organisation by Mabel. We'd never been to escape game before and thoroughly enjoyed every 52 minutes of it!Pub adjoining did a food/drink offer for those using the escape game so that was handy for a pre-game energy booster/pep talk An absolute must for anyone looking for something different to do during downtime. From Lucy & Kaisha
Great escape game. Had a brilliant eve at this escape game, just challenging enough to make things interesting, but good hints and support from the organisers. If I could do it again I would!
TOP QUALITY!!!!!. Super happy with this escape game. Challenging, great story and well set up...really enjoyed it! Compared to the others I've done-it rates pretty high!

Bags of fun!. Had an amazing time escaping from this one! The game was clearly very well thought out and a lot of fun to play. The people running it were really friendly too. Hope they do more games soon!

Cant recommend enough!!. As soon as you walk in you are greeted and made enthusiastic to get in there. Super friendly team leading it and having made it themselves (to a very high level) they are really passionate about it. A good flow, and good variety of aspects to get you thinking as well as helpful but not giveaway clues. Looking forward to them opening their second!

Great fun!. Went with family, and it was frantic and fun, but we didn't want to kill each other by the end. Escaped with 10 mins left and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Make sure you examine everything and search everywhere!Afterwards you can relax with a pint or burger n the eccentrically decorated bar.
was a great escape. Really good fun. Plenty of challenging puzzles, and good satisfaction when getting these completed as you know you're getting closer to your goal .

Frantic awesome fun!!. From the get go we were totally sucked in! Great fun with friends wildly trying to find the next clue or key! Was a real sense of achievement when we finished - some real twists and turns in there with smart puzzles. We charged up our batteries beforehand with delish burger and ales in a great bar attached (Han Solo is on the frickin' ceiling!) Highly recommended!

Amazing fun with friends. Great value, the best way to spend an hour in London! Challenging but so much fun - keeps you excited and engaged throughout. The girls that run it are brilliant and really put you at your ease. Plus it's attached to a fantastic pub with great beer which does a beer and a delicious burger for a tenner, what more could you ask for? Don't delay and book your tickets now!
Absolutely incredible!!. Everyone needs to do this, we had the best time. So clever and inventive! Escaped with 2 minutes to spare... Great location, amazing pub- great atmosphere!

So much Fun we escaped with 2mins 13seconds !!. So much fun, highly recommended!
Really well thought out escape room, many twists and turns ....one of the best ones out there! Do this Stuff!

HOSTAGE HIDEOUT - GREAT GAME!!. It was really good fun; we really enjoyed it. New company with some great ideas. Great flow in the game. Had a lot of fun. Lots of nice surprises and cool puzzles. Great people; very flexible. Definitely recommend as a nice introduction to Escape Games.

Fantastic Fun!. Had so much fun with 3 friends doing this. I've never played an escape game before and this completely exceeded my expectations! Everyone should try this as soon as they can. I'm desperate to talk to other people about it but I promise not to give anything away. If Do Stuff have any other escape games, I will go there and do stuff :-)

Woohoo!!. That was great! First game I have ever done, though I do enjoy the video game versions of these room escape games and this was brilliant. Load of challenging clues, great storyline and really unusual and challenging thing to do with friends! Couldn't recommend more (pub's burgers are great too...)

SO much fun! . Did this with three friends and had the best time!! Really clever game, would definitely recommend for an evening. We took advantage of the burger and drink for a tenner at the pub too which was awesome. I've done one other escape game and I'd say this one is a really good level of difficulty, they will chuck you clues when you really need them etc!

Awesome. Absolutely awesome! I have played escape games across Europe and I can honestly say that this is one of the best escape games I have ever played! My wife and I managed to complete it with a minute to spare! The game was challenging, but at the right level, and a load of fun. There is also an unexpected surprise which I can't spoil ;) The attention to detail in this particular escape game is amazing. Also it is situated in a really cool pub that serves great food. We had a drink before and some food after. What more could you want!

Amazing and unique experience . Me and my friends had the best time!!! Every puzzle challenged us and made us think. Would recommend this to everyone. Thank you for this amazing and unique experience. 10/10

Best escape room ever!. Mixture of everything that fries your mind, just what you expect from an escape room and much more. Good communication if you get stuck comes very handy, so you are not left scratching your head forever. Would recommend to everyone who is keen on puzzles and would defiantly go again!!
Not to be missed!. What a great place and so much fun! We had the best afternoon and would do this all again ... highly recommend. Cannot fault it in anyway.

DO IT, you'll LOVE it - DO STUFF !!. Having done a few Escape Games abroad, I was really looking forward to this one, and it did not disappoint ! It was so much fun. It was really challenging and made us think hard, but not without lots of giggles and laughter. Without giving away any spoilers, there was a part where I got sooo excited realising how much more there was to the game!!! I was very impressed with the attention to detail, which is perhaps the best i've experienced and the sheer level of the challenge. I loved how funny & attentive the girls who run it are. Oh, and the fact that its set in this quirky, fun pub was just the icing on the cake ! All in all, a fabulous game and one that i would not hesitate to recommend again and again.
Utterly brilliant. Done a few escape games , but this is a gorgeous boutique one . Friendly , intimate and most of all , great mental test ! Do it !

Something a bit different for a Saturday afternoon.... I've done one before and this was much smarter, really innovative clues and lots of different layers to the task. Loads of fun and lovely staff. Next to a rather quirky pub that did some amazing food!! Highly recommended :)

Amazing!. Brilliant puzzles, great story, soooo tense and just amazing fun!! Really cool stuff to work out, super inventive! We had a brilliant time, and loved the pub too - yummy food and good selection on tap. Thanks

Awesome Escape Game, LOVED every second!!. This was my first escape game and what a thrill it was. The minutes are ticking away and It was a real challenge to get out in time. Got those brain cells ticking and we were totally engrossed. The people who run it were really helpful and encouraging. I went with a group of friends and would definitely recommend. Its inside a quirky pub and we had some great food in the beer garden after. Want to do it again!

Highly recommend!. This was my first escape game and had a great time! Visited with 3 friends. Exciting, competitive and full of exciting, challenging puzzles! Pub attached to it has delicious food too to refuel :)

Totally Worth the Time!!!!. Absolutely Amazing fun. Thoroughly enjoyable! One word! FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!I have never written a review after an escape game despite playing over 10 games already in various location but this room is like no other!

Oh my gee! AMAZING. . Wow... I totally have to leave a raving review for this escapee game, the thought behind all aspects of it is mind blowing, so much fun and excitement, really got my Brian ticking, I can't recommend it enough, such a fun thing to do after work with friends, perfectly located in a pub to so bugger and a beer after to discuss the fun you've just had. I can't thank the girls enough for building it. You must go. Sophie :) thumbs up
A woman on the edge. My heart is pumping and I'm soaked in sweat. One word: EXHILARATINGSuch an amazing game with the perfect hosts in a really cool pub. Will be back as soon as my nerves recover.

Great experience!. This was an amazing escape game experience! I've done a few now and this was definitely one of the best ones I've played. Good amount of puzzles that keep you on your toes. Would definitely recommend if you want to do something fun in London.

Awesome escape game! . This was my 5th escape game and definitely my favourite one so far. Loved the concept and an excellent challenge. Lots of different types of puzzles that I haven't seen in other games. Would definitely recommend! Great night out.
A fantastic night out!. An amazing escape room, really fun and cool puzzles and a great storyline. Plus it's in a pub so perfect for a beer and burger afterwards (the burgers are AMAZING)

Amazing escape game!!!. The game was amazing. Played with my wife and had a wonderful time.
Great location and parking outside
Had a burger in the pub after which was immense (wild boar burger).
Would happily recommend to anyone.

The most fun you'll have being locked in a room!. Went with a group of work mates and thoroughly enjoyed this game! I've done a few elsewhere in London and in Budapest, but the rest of my group were newbies and there was a good level of challenge for all of us. Hostage Hideout is a well put together room with a great mix of puzzles and no over-reliance on any particular kind. Hosts were lovely and only gave hints when absolutely necessary which kept the game interesting, and you'd have to be an absolute pro to get out with more than a minute to spare in my opinion, there was so much to do!Also the venue is fantastic - a quirky little pub where you can have a much needed drink and nibble afterwards!Great game, great location - hope they do another one so I can go again! Highly recommended.
Great fun for the family!. Great fun day out for the family. I would definitely visit again! Lovely, friendly and helpful staff as well.

Supply Correct Address and More Signage. Directions to HintHunt are non existent, we spent nearly an hour looking for the place and therefore missed our slot. The address we were given was Drummond Crescent when in fact it is on Eversholt Street. We came to London specifically for this and it was a wasted journey and a waste of money as the staff were not willing to move us to another slot. The staff also claimed they rang us but we didn't receive any calls from them. I am never booking with them ever again and will not recommend it to anyone.
Awesome fun!. We had a great time and just got out before we were locked in the Zen room forever ;)Would recommend this place to everyone.
Marvellous. Good fun. Challenging. Requires team work. Charming staff. Really close to Euston underground station

Brilliant Fun. My daughter and I did this today. Just us! A two person team and we got out with 6 seconds to spare......Best thing we've done in ages - really great fun. Staff very helpful. We will be reliving this for some time. Thanks Hint Hunt.

Really interesting, fun and different!. I got this as a present to my ushers and best man for helping on my wedding day. Wasn't sure what to expect as nobody in our group has ever done one of these escape games before.We got an introduction to the game through the excellent host and before long we were left to our own devices.Cue frantic searching, shouting and a lot of disorganisation, we finally made it out!Well worth doing and would highly recommend it. The hour goes incredibly quick!

Fun Challenge for 21st Birthday. Great fun, exhilarating and intriguing activity. Have already recommended this to friends and family since our visit yesterday for daughter's 21st birthday. Really finished our day off on a great note. The best thing we have done for ages! Gave us a chance to be together as a family whilst working as a team to solve the clever clues and we made it out with 3 minutes to spare. Very satisfying to know you achieved success and escaped the room. The staff were amazing and made the activity really fun dropping useful hints as we needed them. Well done and thank you to all involved. We will be back!

Outing for sons 10th birthday. This was the best thing we have done in ages! Took my 12 year old and 10 year old and husband to this and we absolutely loved it!Definitely worth the money. Will be talking about this all day now.

Staff Social - Excellent Fun. We booked 4 rooms at Hint Hunt for a staff social. It was the first time anyone in the team had done an escape room and everyone really enjoyed it! It was very challenging, fun and a perfect team social. I highly recommend it to anyone considering doing an Escape Room.

Brilliant Challenge. We had 2 teams race each other in the Zen room challenge, and we all really enjoyed it. Half of us had done at least one escape room before, the other half hadn't done one at all. We both got out with a few minutes to spare.This is one of the more challenging escape rooms, particularly if you are a first timer. Nevertheless it is brilliant fun and I really recommend it. I'm sure we'll be back to try out the other room at some point.

Brilliant addictive experience in Zen rooms. Booked two zen rooms for 8 people and both teams managed to escape but with only minutes to spare!This was our first escape room experience and we all agreed that we wanted to do another one as soon as we'd escaped!The zen room wasn't our first choice but it was actually really surprising, challenging but also felt do able thanks to the hints that kept us from giving up on something we thought we'd exhausted but had actually just made a mistake on.The staff were brilliant and we'll be coming back I'm sure!

You'll need the clues!. Having done a few escape type games, we decided to see what was on offer when staying in London for a few days. We managed to escape the Zen room but only just! This was much more challenging than previous rooms we had competed but more from the point of view that the clues/items were so well hidden and obscure rather than the puzzles being difficult to work out. This was extremely fun though as it meant we were all running around like crazy at some points. I would be extremely impressed if someone managed to do it without any clues

Excellent experience. I booked this as a surprise for my partner's 40th and took a group of friends. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. Don't read anything about it, just go and enjoy the experience. Highly recommended.

Have never laughed so hard and had so much fun with my famiy. You are to solve the crime but figuring out many clues and finding puzzles etc in a "locked" room. You are being observed by an employee who will give you clues when you get too far off track. The set up is really cool and very interactive. Hard to describe, like nothing I have done before. Make sure you have a reservation. If you solve the crime before the time runs out the door opens and you "win."

6 seconds to spare. great entertainment and fun! We were a family of four with two teenagers (aged 14 and 17). I have not heard them talking and laughing so much and for so long. How we managed to escape with 6 seconds to spare? I don;t know. Great interactions, everyone contributed.

Dissapointing with no skill needed. We went as a family as a birthday treat but unfortunately it wasn’t the treat we were hoping for. We all love puzzles and problem-solving but this game is not that. It is not a game that requires any skill merely lots of people running round like headless chickens looking for keys and codes.You get locked in a room for an hour and told to solve the murder. At the end of the game you still have no idea who the murderer was or why. There is no logic or story to follow you merely have to find hidden keys and numbers to open padlocks. After thirty minutes of looking (by which time boredom was beginning to set in) clues start appearing on the screen or should I say instructions? It then becomes a game of following what you were told to achieve and merely plodding along finding things as some are placed in such obscure places. A few puzzles are included but not many and by the time the game finished I really couldn’t have cared less who the murderer was and I never found out because the aim of the game is to get out of the room not solve the mystery. This is a key flaw and left us feeling we had wasted an hour of our lives.We had expected a storyline with a progressive set of puzzles to solve which eventually led to an answer. None of this was the case. We will not be doing another hint hunt or recommending it to any one else. In future we will stick to Cluedo or the Sherlock Holmes game which at least has a definite storyline and answers to find.This was a very expensive mistake

Perfect for corporate do's. We were a corporate group of 14 that split off into four rooms to compete against each other and the clock. We had 2x detective rooms and 2x Zen rooms and 3 of the 4 groups made it out with seconds to spare. The clues were difficult but really fun and there was something to suit everyone's skills. Everyone had a great time and were asking when we can do the next one! Highly recommend this venue for any kind of group activity.
We made it. Great fun. We really enjoyed our time in the room. It really makes you think beyond the obvious of where a clue could be.

HintHunt. We went as a large group and split off into 3 teams, as a team of 5 we completed the Detective room, we completed it with 46 seconds to go and enjoyed every second of it, its great for everyone and i'm already looking to come back with other friends and do other rooms. You get a briefing before going in which is helpful but you still don't really know what to expect before you go in. Once in the room you literally have to check and double check everything, if you don't manage to complete it you get shown how to once the time runs out.some parts we found quite easy but others we struggled with, there is a timer on a TV in the corner of the room, this will beep then show hints if you are struggling which was great as we may not have figured some of it out at all without them.this is a great activity and its not too physical, no jumping/climbing around involved. great if you like a challenge.

Fantastic fun!. This was a great way to spend a bit of my brothers birthday as a family activity! We did the zen room mystery and although this was my fourth escape room challenge I think this was the most difficult! We actually just missed escaping by about 20 seconds!! It was a lot of fun and lovely way of getting the group to work together. Some very clever challenges and something for everyone to do. I will be back for one of their other games in the future.

Extremely fun and very challenging. The game is really well thought, it's a real challenge to solve, don't try when unable to think :p Staff are dropping hints if you get stuck, so it's really fun and the time went really fast.

Challenging and great fun. I went with four other friends who were a bit sceptical about the whole thing.they were won over soon after arriving by enthusiastic staff and we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience.Good location and very conveniently has a pub next door as we arrived early. I had mistakenly booked for three extra people via the online booking system. HInt Hunt gave me a voucher as compensation and we definately will go again to one of the other rooms.

So much fun and an actual challenge!. Went with a group of 4 friends, and we thoroughly enjoyed this! It was slightly pricey, however, the staff were super friendly and didn't rush us to leave by the end, and we actually managed to escape (even though going over time by a few minutes!)

Good fun with family or friends. My husband booked this as a surprise Christmas present for the family (2 late teenage boys). We had never heard of it before and until we turned up on the day had no idea where we were going! When we arrived the guy explained what we needed to do and that there would be clues in the room to help us solve the puzzles and free ourselves from the room. We did the private investigator room and thoroughly enjoyed it. Unfortunately we were 1 minute over the hour so technically we didn't escape but they let us carry on as we were so close. The clues were of average difficulty, some slightly harder than others but overall once we got out heads around the concept of what we were doing it was ok. We really enjoyed it and couldn't stop talking about it over the rest of the Christmas period. The staff were helpful and the clues were fun. We have since done 2 more rooms but these were in Thailand!
Amazing fun!!. What a brilliant concept! Went for my son's birthday as a family of 4, we all absolutely loved it, which is unusual with such a wide age range!! Would highly recommend!!!

Great themed room, not for beginners!. For a birthday surprise I was taken to the JM's Office escape room. The theme was great, trying to clear a private investigator's name as well as not get arrested for trespassing! The clues were challenging but logical and in keeping with the theme. I've been to quite a few escape rooms and I would say this was more on the challenging side! I like to think we're quite good at finding things as a team, but this room had some very sneaky places and we needed clues to find a couple. The clues to help were very timely but tried to be a bit cryptic so you still felt like you were solving the clue without being handed the solution. All in all I really enjoyed it, we escaped with just a minute and a half to go. I would suggest that if you are a beginner, this might not be the ideal room to visit, as there are quite a few red herrings and difficult hiding places. We will definitely try the Zen room next though!

Absolutely brilliant time!. I booked this up for my husband's birthday, having stumbled across this on googling things to do in London. I have to say that it was utterly brilliant. There were six in our party whose ages ranged from 82, 55, 54, 24, 17 and 14. We had the oldies in one room and the young ones in another. Without giving anything away, you had to solve a mystery and find keys and codes to unlock things. When you first enter the room you aren't really sure what to do, but then you quickly get into the swing of it. It was really clever. There were gentle hints along the way to stop any frustration. The hour went so quickly. You do have to be able to move around quickly as you are against the clock, so my 82 year old mother in law found that a little difficult at times. And you do have to get on the floor at times. I went to bed last night still buzzing from the hour, and we did nothing but talk about our experience in the car going home.I can't wait to go back and do the Zen room. Highly recommended. the staff who were briefing us were really lovely and very helpful too.

It was ok. This is the second time I have been to Hint Hunt. The hosts couldn't have been less interested in us. It just felt very much like a chore to them. Went through the basics and let us get on with it. I wouldn't recommend it

Fun afternoon for a group of ladies who had never all been together before!. Fun time. Help when it was needed, but we did pretty well. Be prepared for one person to get down on the floor, and REALLY examine everything you pick-up, touch or think you have inspected thoroughly, you may not have done so! Well worked out, timing was good and staff very obliging but not in your face. Frenette!

Cool teens loved it. Sent my daughter for her 17th with some friends, having been as a family in April. Her mates weren't sure what to expect (& thought it might be a bit geeky), but they had a ball. Failed to escape, mainly I believe because they were laughing too much, but had so much fun. And whoever was giving the clues sounds like they were enjoying watching their antics as some of the tips were funny. You now need a new room as daughter has done both !

Great, fun day out!. As a thank you from the CEO and COO, they arranged the whole team to have a team day out. The HintHunt was great, well organised and the people were fun and friendly. The game itself was great, I played the detective game and it was very creative and made you think out side the box. Being able to look around and not have to tidy as you went made me feel like I was part of the old TV programme "Finders Keepers" which was epic! The hour seemed to whizz by and it was a great time had by all. Would recommend if you like cryptic clues, riddles and solving puzzles.
Great for a team night out. Had a lot of fun, staff were friendly and helpful, would recommend (and have recommended to my colleagues!)

Best escape room in London by far. I've been to Hint Hunt twice (once for John Munroe, once for Zen Room) and I've also been to four other escape rooms in London and elsewhere. They were all fun, but Hint Hunt is by far the most thought through and best. Loved it! I'd recommend a group of 4 or 5, especially if you've never done an escape room before as it was quite challenging with 3.

Not really for kids!. Took my son for his 12th birthday on Sunday, we did Clue Quest last year and the room we did was aimed at children, he loved it so much he wanted to go back again unfortunately couldn't get in as fully booked, so though we would try this one.Great intro from the young lady,all well and good but when you get into the room there just doesn't seem to be a process, a story or a structure? I'm sure if we had been 4 adults we could have managed it better?? but with a 12 year old and a 7 year old we needed a lot of help. Trust me I'm not thick and neither is my partner but some of the things we didn't complete were just not on our radar, if I had been there 3 hours still would not have got it without the help on the TV screen. We did the Zen room which was a Japanese setting there are other settings apparently whether we picked the wrong one or it was just not right for the kids I don't know, but we all came out saying Clue quest was better. I would seriously think about taking younger children to this one as the kids were a little disappointed there wasn't more of a story to it. Venue was good, well organised and the young lady was very pleasant, so not taking anything away from the team there it just wasn't right for the kids.

Fun birthday surprise!. I arranged for a group of 18 to do 4 of the escape rooms at HintHunt for my boyfriend's birthday. We had a brilliant time: the staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were challenging, and the whole experience was fun-filled. As we were such a big group it was hard to find an escape room that could cater for our size, but HintHunt was perfect as they have 5 rooms in total. I also found they're pretty good value for money. My team did the Zen room which had a great concept and was actually quite tricky – things got pretty tense towards the end and we escaped with a minute to spare! Would definitely recommend a visit to HintHunt for groups of friends or work colleagues.

Amazing team building exercise. We went here for the start of our company do. We were able to book 3 teams of 5 and all do the same style room at the same time (so we could check which team were the winners fairly!). Needless to say every person enjoyed the activities and the whole experience immensely, it provided the right amount of challenges and puzzles but also the right amount of help if we were stuck. This is great for a work team outing as its all about working together and communication, but I would happily do it with a group of friends for fun! Really recommend this place and this activity!

Great fun!. Really loved the experience we had lots of fun but more than anything came out super happy of managing to solve the puzzle with one minute 20 seconds left! The four of us had a great time :) thank you!

Alternative fun night out in London. I had really no idea what to expect. I must say I did really enjoy the challenge. It was definitely a different night out to what I normally do - dinner, drinks, dancing. I won't give away too much but it is really different and most memorable. The location is a bit odd but the staff were nice, helpful and approachable.

Fun but flawed. We enjoyed HintHunt, our first escape room experience. We liked the variety of puzzles and the fast pace. However, we felt that some of the puzzles required the completion of too many levels to work out, and the high number of red herrings was confusing. In addition, at the end of the game (we couldn't escape!) we found the lady who had helped us to be almost critical of our performance, which felt a bit odd, and slightly dampened our enjoyment. We have subsequently visited clueQuest, which we found far superior, because of the positivity of the staff, the clarity of the pre-game briefing, and the types of puzzles involved. We did enjoy it, but there are better escape games around.

What Fantastic Fun!. We came here as an adult family group of 5 not really knowing what to expect on Sunday morning (28th August)! We were briefed by a man who clearly enjoys his job and added some comedic value to the whole experience. He also provided the perfect level of help, and cracked a few jokes along the way via the screen which was great.... we got out with 34 seconds to spare! I think this is a great experience for any group, as there is a level of personalisation from the staff working there. We did the detective room but will definitely return for the Zen room! Thank you Hint Hunt!

What an amazing, funny hour!!. We had a great time at Hint Hunt, not knowing what to expect it exceeded anything we had thought. Well thought through and not too many hints. We missed finishing it by 1 minute on the very last part, but this certainly did not dampen our enjoyment of the whole experience. I have not laughed to much in a while. well worth it!

Poor scommunication between the staff and clients.. I went here with some friends and we did one room that we all enjoyed so much we came back for more in the other room the following month with our bosses in a 2nd room. Sadly it fell flat towardss the end of our visit. We clearly didn't understand what they were trying to tell us on the promptor and I guess that as English is a second language to the game controllers they were struggling to communicate correctly to help us overcome the issue. We pointed out to them how they could have communicated the clue and how what they had told us was ambiguous at the conclusion of the game. They didn't seem at all welcoming to our constructive criticism and were rather dismissive of it. I think we left with an extra sour taste because we had all enjoyed it so much the first time that to encounter these issues the second time was very disappointing. As we were there to impress our company bosses as to what a great team building exercise this could be they only hurt future business from our company. Ihave experienced similar rooms in Warsaw and Budapest and left feeling nothing but pleased with the experience. This encounter was second rate in comparison.

Great personal and learning experience. Best learning activity to share with my group of students who spent a week in London practicing English. They enjoyed, had lots of fun and tried their best English for a whole hour. None of us had previous experience in a escape room but we will definitively try again whenever we come back.

Absolutely fantastic. We came here as part of a hen weekend and were split into two teams as I think there is a maximum number for each game, I was in the 'Sherlock Holmes' style game. The games were fun lots of challenge and a good laugh. We are very pleased to say both teams got out with some time to spare. Staff are friendly and clear with what you have to do. It's a must do if you have time while in London. Price is very reasonable, you must book, as far as I know you can't just turn up on the day. It's definitely worth a visit and highly recommended.

A triumph. Dispatched four teenagers for an 18th birthday session and all came back raving about their experience. Two had already done a HintHunt, or equivalent, in Malaysia (from where the game originates, and they thought this one vastly superior. They unanimously agreed they would go again. As a curious adult, I now plan to book up a session with a group of my own friends.

Family fun. We came here as a group of 4 (2 adults and two pre-teens) with no previous game experience and had a great time. Lots of tricky puzzles, everyone joined in and contributed and all sorts of fun. We solved it just in time, with a bit of help from the friendly staff, and couldn't stop talking about it afterwards. I'd definitely recommend it!
Great Fun!. None of us had ever done an escape the room but i had been recommended by many people and was rewarded with a very fun evening with friends!
Great team building fun!. Was a birthday treat from friends and was a fabulous time. Gets quite tense at times but stretches the mind in a fun way. Would 100% go again!

Highly recommended!! Guaranteed great night out. Went to hinthunt as recommended by timeout and had an absolutely brilliant time. We all felt the adrenaline almost coming out on a high and it really exceeded what we thought it was going to be. Excellent service, creative puzzles and great location. 5* all round
Great way to spend a rainy day!. Went here with my two teenage children. We had a great time and will be looking for an opportunity to go back and do the second room.

1st time is a charm. It was our first escape room and didn't know what to expect. This venue exceeded our expectations. Our guide was very friendly and helpful. This is a great activity for families, groups or anyone seeking team building. It was very easy to find and located near London Euston station (Underground). It was difficult yet very fun for our group of four and would be even more challenging for a smaller group, but not unattainable. We will definitely go back for another escape room experience in other cities. We had an amazing time and this was worthwhile and a very entertaining experience! Highly recommend it for rainy days or something out of the ordinary. The best part; we solved the room and escaped with six seconds to spare!

Amazing. I heard that this was good, but it exceeded my expectations. We went on a work even and we hired all 5 rooms. Afterwards everyone had nothing but positive things to say. I wont give anything away about the actual rooms/clues, but there was a good mixture of different types of clues you had to solve. I will definitely be going back to complete the other room soon!1

Amazing Experiance - Great fun!. We booked the Zen room for 5. The hour just flies by and is a lot of fun. The game is very well set up and the staff were friendly and provided useful clues. We managed to escape just in time and will definitely give the other room a go!!

Fiendish puzzles, great fun.. Having done quite a few of these room escape games now, and being avid puzzlers and sleuths, we tried to do this room without using any hints. We were warned at the beginning that it was impossible, and no-one had done it, but we tried anyway! We had to give up on that approach though fairly early on, as the puzzles were relentless and there was so much to do in the hour that we needed to take the gamesmaster's clues in the end! Ultimately, our arrogance cost us and we didn't escape, though we weren't far off! A few too many puzzles crammed in to this and a few things hidden in particularly obscure places, so if you play it, just take the hints. Though it seems a bit silly for it not to be solvable without hints, as that's part of the fun - to see how well you can do alone. A great room, but not our favourite one we've done.

Great Fun - Well Worth the Money. This was a first foray into Escape Rooms and my whole family (Me, My Wife and 2 Children 12 and 9) had an absolute blast.Well Hosted, with friendly staff who clearly explained how such games worked and then we entered into one of the Zen rooms. Didn't quite manage to finish the task but we nearly got there and had an absolute blast in the process. Everyone on the team, contributed to our progress - had fun and all of us said we wanted to do this again. Excellent. Recommended, a really, really fun way to spend an hour or so in London.

A great place for a team or family event. I wasn't sure my colleagues would enjoy this but they threw themselves into the activity and the hour flew by. In their own words it was "amazing fun" and they wanted to do another session straight after! It was great to see them so engaged and fired up - well worth the money to see their teamwork together.

JMs Office - brilliant fun. I took my family to hinthunt London on 8th August, for a birthday present. My youngest daughter was really nervous about "being rubbish" at it and didn't really know what to expect. She absolutely loved it (as we all did) and she really wants to do another! Can't recommend it enough, it's a great way to spend an hour or so and is just a great experience. If you get stuck, you get some "guidance" - not too much, but enough. Only one hitch in ours, was that one key hadn't been put back where it should have been, so our host had to come in after he realised there was a problem. We got out with 3 minutes to spare, so without the small hitch, we could have done even better! Will definitely be back soon.

Family visit with teens and adults. Absolutely brilliant!. We booked 2 x Zen rooms for 2 teams of 3. The hour just flies by, a lot of fun, very well set up. Staff provide useful clues. We didn't escape in time, just needed a few more minutes. Will definitely give the other room a go!

Absolutely cracking! Highly recommended... better than escape rooms!. Absolutely fantastic! After completing Escape rooms last year, this one was much more fun to complete, more physical things to crack/move/look for and slightly less logistical puzzles. The way they give clues/hints is hilarious, really funny. There are 2 different rooms here so I will be back to complete the second room.

Brilliant . We booked a zen room for 4 people but were one man down on the day and feeling like we might not get very far with just three - before going in our games master made it clear that a lot of groups (50%) don't manage to escape in the hour and not to feel bad if we don't - we went in thinking we'd just do our best. We made it through with 51 seconds to spare and it was BRILLIANT! Just a great fun busy time and the hour flew by. I'd recommend it to anyone - so clever.

Great fun. Family visit to the Zen room (2 adults and 11 year old). Much excitement and anticipation before we went and it didn't disappoint. Great attention to detail, tricky clues but helpful hints along the way. An hour flies by and although we didn't escape in time, we only needed an extra few minutes. Staff are enthusiastic and helpful. Will be back to do the other room!

Great team building activity or just a fun activity with friends. Hint hunt was great fun and we all had an amazing time. Hint Hunt is slightly different to other panic rooms / escape rooms etc, it takes a lot more thinking outside of the box, rather than mega complex problem solving. There is a lot to do and the hours goes mega quickly!! Staff we super friendly and helpful. The 'reception' area is a little small and could maybe be a little more professional/welcoming but you are not there for long!overall a great day and would recommend it to anyone.

Disappointed and confused... Myself and a friend have become huge fans of escape games over the past year or so trying a few different games in Birmingham and London. My friend has also visited New York and played games there too, so we are quite experienced in this field now! We often look to trip advisor for advice on which game to try next and having now completed every game at clue quest (which I HIGHLY recommend), we decided to give hint Hunt a go as it seems to be the next most popular in London. We had high hopes, especially after playing our 3rd and final game at clue quest that morning. It is safe to say we were both left feeling extremely confused and disappointed, and actually a bit angry! In comparison to all of the other games we have played this feels cheap, old and not well thought out. The storyline of the game I could not even tell you, as unlike other games I would not describe this as an 'immersive' experience. You are CONSTANTLY fired clues over the walkie talkie/tv screen and there is absolutely no way you could figure it out without some of these clues and to me that totally misses the point of the game. I want to figure out the puzzles myself, not have to be reliant on clues!I can't really say too much without giving any of the game away but I was honestly sooo disappointed with this game. We will not be heading back to play the other game!! (We played JMs Office). When we left we both looked at each other in shock really that we had just paid so much money to be so let down. Hint hunt is one of the more expensive escape games, but having always got what we paid for at clue quest and reading great reviews we weren't bothered about the cost. We are still now 2 weeks later confused at how this place has such great reviews! It feels so behind the times and basic in comparison to other games we've played. I think it's time they played some of the newer games in London and took some inspiration from them to update their game and lose the need for constant hints!!

Great fun. Family of 4, two adults and two children. We visited the Zen room, what a fantastic experience ! Did not get out on time (only needed 5 more minutes) but had a ball. Staff are amazing, really friendly and helpful. Overall an amazing experience.

We came, we conquered!. Lots of fun for a group of friends to complete. We were surprised by the set up, and were really impressed with the murder mystery case on our hands. It was a great after-work activity which is unusual and makes your brain think in ways you never thought it could!

Brilliant interactive hour of fun. Having done something similar in Birmingham, I had high hopes for Hint Hunt in London, and wasn't disappointed! I did the detective with 3 other friends, all of whom think we're pretty clever and a bit special, and only finished it with 90 seconds to spare - nerve-jangling stuff! The staff were friendly and helpful, the room and challenge were brilliantly laid out, and we had a genuinely fun time. It's team-building, challenging, exciting and ultimately very rewarding. I'd highly recommend this!Don't bother turning up more than 5 minutes before your start time - there's no waiting room, as it's a small building, so you'll just be waiting by the front door. (In fairness, they do tell you something similar in the booking confirmation).

Great family activity with teenagers. To all you parents searching for something to do with teens/tweens who are seemingly unimpressed with everything - this is for you. Other reviewers can tell you about adult fun or work team building but I'll tell you about quality family time. We took out daughter (14) and son (13) and had a magnificent time. They were engaged from the moment we showed up (we had kept it a secret). They cooperated and worked together with me and my wife. We were able to complete the challenge and exit the room with 7 seconds left. The glow carried through the rest of the day as we talked about the various puzzles through dinner and into the evening. It was fantastic to accomplish this as a family.Erik was the game director for us and did a marvelous job (understanding we had 2 teens with us) of dropping hints at appropriate times. This is a fantastic experience and I highly recommend it!

Something unusual, challenging but very enjoyable. Imagine you are a group of detectives faced with a murder mystery. You're led into a murder scene, locked into a room and given 60 minutes to find and then solve clues.The better you do the better the clues fed to you. It was daunting at first but once you started finding bits of information the more absorbing and enjoyable it became but you have to keep your eye on the clock.It was my 70th Birthday present and it was one of the most enjoyable 60 minutes spent ever. This is a must visit venue

Not really what we expected. Booked this with 3 work colleagues and none of us had ever done an escape game so we went for the highest one on trip advisor as we can really get to any in London quite easily.We were wrong to do that as this was not a game of skill. You get bunged in a room full of about 10 padlocks and number combination devices and have to then solve the clues except there aren't any real clues and there's no real path to take. It was like a free for all trying to work out if something was maybe a code for a safe or case or padlock etc and whether it was a code at all.They give you hints on a screen and said that anyone that gets out usually does it between 53 and 60 minutes - the reason for this is that around 30 minutes in, it turns from a game of having stuff everywhere not knowing what to do, to someone telling you on screen exactly what to do almost word for word or by using pictures, which wasnt really a problem solving and more just a task following exercise. Some things were also hidden in places that you would never think of and some combinations were just ridiculous theorys like (without giving too much away) taking a number of suspects date of births, working out their ages, combining them and then opening a lock - you could literally be in that room for 10 years and not think of that.What we expected was more of a team work progressive exercise where you start with just one lock and work your way through rather than loads of different locks.We will try another escape game but its not going to be Hint Hunt. Its not really enjoyable just following what to do and its literally impossible without the clues (instructions). Its also quite expensive for effectively locking you in a room for an hour.

Great Compay Event. We took about 35 people through on a Monday morning, in 9 separate rooms. I didn't do it my self (had to be the organiser of the days events) ..... but they ALL loved it.Must make time to have a go myself.
Best escape room in lonson. Really enjoyed the visit, difficult room (and we are relatively experienced) but very helpful stuff. Will come back for another room.

Great fun - we'll be back!. I organised for two teams from my work to go to HintHunt and do two of the JR's office rooms at the same time. We had 3 in one team and 4 in the other - both teams did fine, but having 4 people is definitely be the best number (which is what the HintHunt guys recommend). We had a blast and spent the rest of the day talking about how much fun it was! Obviously I won't give anything away here, but the clues are very varied and challenging, and suitable for everyone (not very physical, some of them are numerical, some logical, some scrambling around looking for something, and everyone can pitch in as there's always so much to do at once). The team at HintHunt make sure you have help if you need it (we did - a lot) and even if you don't get out on time, they'll see you through to the end so you can complete the room anyway. We're coming back to do the Japanese Zen rooms to see if we can make it within the hour!
Most excellent. We had a brilliant time, even more fun than we had imagined. And we won! Challenging and hilarious in equal measure and all really well curated by the charming Eric.

A fun and frenetic hour. Rarely have I spent such a mad, paniced and zany hour in one room - but I loved it! Combining sleuth-like clues and codes you must crack with a good old fashioned hide and seek hunt, Hint Hunt is thoroughly engrossing and SO much fun. The sense of elation every time we found a clue was palpable, and making it out with 3 minutes to spare was the icing on the cake. Highly recommended.

Great fun! (and we got out!). Took two friends as part of a weekend trip to London. Was a bit worried that we'd struggle to get out with the minimum number of players but with (more than) a few hints we managed the private detective game with about two minutes to spare. If you've done escape rooms before there are some familiar activities and hidey holes but still plenty of new puzzles and things to find. We're all into puzzles and games (the rest of the weekend we spent walking the Monopoly board) and if you are too you'll have a great time at HintHunt. Only sorry we don't live close enough to do the Zen room too!

Hint Hunt Summer Event. We had our annual staff summer event at Hint Hunt & all I can is we would highly recommend this to anyone! Great puzzles, great staff, fun atmosphere - lots of mystery that kept us all on our toes!!! Such a fun & fab day out! Don't delay book today!

A truely fabulous experience - like nothing I've ever seen before!. Incredible experience, great fun, great team building, gets your brain thinking and your heart racing as your time ticks down. Thoroughly enjoyable, fantastic staff and a very very clever experience. Both games played JM's Office and the Zen Room. Would highly recommend both. Talks of a third room coming soon :-) can't wait!

What a brilliant way to spend an hour!!. Just returned from the Hint-rooms in Euston -and what a fantastic hour spent with friends getting ourselves out of the Zen room-well , actually we didn't quite manage it in the time, but that didn't matter. Really well organised, lovely staff and just a great experience!! We all loved it and now want to do the other room.

Superb! Great Experience and we got out too!. Took my team to Hint Hunt after our business meeting and they loved it! Great experience, we'll organised and gave us lots to talk about afterwards. Will go again and try another of the rooms.

Awesome! We got out!! . This is one of the best things ever so much fun and a great team building exercise, great for family, friends and work colleagues! It's a Must do and will be back for the other room!!

Fantastic experience!. We took part as a team of 4 and the puzzles and whole set up were fantastic, friendly staff who were great fun and added to the experience. Can't recommend this more for every puzzle lover out there.

Fun, fun, fun. We were greeted by a friendly team who stay with you throughout your game. The game itself is solving problems and looking for clues to solve the problems. The team gave just the right number of hints - just when you think you don't know where to go they point you in the right direction without actually giving you the answer!

Fantastic Experience. WOW. Thats the experience in one word.Took my family for a detective game. We were well briefed and then locked in room. The next 60 mins FLEW by. We were prodded and hinted by the crew on our tv screen. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed. It was a great family "interactive: experience.
Wow!!!. We went during our lunch break from work! Its fast and exciting, everyone had so much fun. They need to make more rooms!
Fantastic! Fast paced and great fun 😀. I went with colleagues from work and it was so much fun! I want to go back straightaway and do the other room, and why aren't there more rooms?!!

Great fun - first time doing an escape room!. We had 13 people in the end and 2 groups did the Zen room, one did JM's office. All of us had a fantastic time! Hint Hunt have great customer service despite some hiccups with my original reservation the team were very accommodating so that everything went to plan in the end! The birthday boy really enjoyed the surprise and we will definitely be back.

With 4 minutes to spare - JUST!. Having taken part in a few "Escape Room" experiences in London, I thought I would struggle to find it as exciting as the others.... But I was wrong! This is a very challenging and interesting experience that is set up very well and is thoroughly thought through with LOTS of different parts to the puzzle. I found that this experience had a lot more things to find/do than other experiences, which was awesome! Lots of steps/hints/puzzles in a variety of different forms! They range from relatively simple code-breaking to REALLY abstract and cryptic.There are some other experiences in London that are more "theatrical", and have a more immersive experience, but overall, if you're a fan of Escape Rooms and you're looking for a really good challenge that really does test you, I would highly recommend! Great friendly staff as well that were very charismatic and were extremely helpful throughout!We did it as a 3, which was fine. Would say a group of 4 would work too!

Just as good the second time!. We went to Hint Hunt for the second time - this time to complete the Zen room having done JM's room last year. This game is absolutely fantastic - everyone in my group thoroughly enjoyed it and it makes no difference have already done a different room - the challenges are still really hard! Hoping they bring out the third room ready for us to try next year!

28 Seconds to Spare!!. We were in London for a day out and decided to try a new escape game. We had tried one before and felt quite ready. Well we were really surprised at how tricky it was! There was points where I felt truly clueless as to what was going on but it only added to the excitement. We were offered gentle hints that were enough to steer us back on track and really helpful though not revealing.Well I cant say anymore as Im sworn to silence and they used Men in Black mind wipers so we couldn't remember what was going on in the room. Its not far from Euston station and really easy to access. Not at all hard to find.Overall great fun!

A Brain Engaging Team Challenge. I booked HintHunt for our work 5th birthday jolly in London. There were 22 of us and we split into 5 small teams so we could all do the challenge at the same time. It was brilliant! Without giving anything away, it was a time sensitive team work brain challenge for all. We had to work together to solve the clues and escape the room. We had lots of fun and it felt like we'd done something to work our minds for the day. The service level and staff were excellent from questions and booking to during the event and after. They were friendly, fun and encouraging. Would highly recommend it to small and large groups... and there is a great pub next door for a well earned beer after ;)

Fantastic!. I took along some friends as one of them were celebrating a birthday. All though I had done my research, None of us knew what to expect! We didn't think it would be as fun as it was! we had a brilliant time and it really showed how good our friendship was when working closely together! We managed to complete it with 19 seconds to spare! Huge thanks to the guy hinting, he was a great help and made us look in places we wouldn't even think!

One of the best room escapes we've been to. We've been to several room escapes and this is definitely one of the best! We went for a friends birthday, there was a group of 10 of us - 5 per room - and the games were so much fun! Staff were helpful and friendly and the game was just the right amount of difficulty - not too easy at all (we only just made it out of the room) but not impossible and lots of varying logic puzzles so everybody felt involved. brilliant!

Great event for team-building, really makes people act as a team and rewards well!. If you're looking for an experience that requires everyone to work under pressure in a fun and completely different environment, this is an excellent activity!

Great fun. Our hour here went really quickly, and we had great fun. Lots of searching for clues, combined with a bit of logic, number puzzles and following a loose mystery, which left us working together and just about the right number of hints to keep us going, but also to feel enough of a sense of achievement when we had to figure things out for ourselves. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Would totally recommend this as something to do with friends, or for work teams to have a go at. Rooms are a max of 5 people so if there's a large group (as we were) you will be split into groups of that size or smaller for the duration. I participated in the challenge in a group of four, and that was about right as the rooms aren't huge. Very cool experience and really glad I have done this.

Fantastic experience - give it a go. 1 hour of adrenaline filled fun and excitement, completed with 1 second to spare. 4 friends turned up not knowing what to expect and from start to finish we all agreed it was a brilliant experience. Professional outfit helping when required but mostly leaving it to us to work out all the clues and hints. Bring on the next room!

Absolutely fantastic . We are a family of four with a 13 yr old girl & a 10 yr old boy. We booked the HintHunt so our kids could have a break from Museums etc. & they absolutely loved it & so did we. It was fantastic & definitely recommend it.
Great event. An excellent afternoon at Hint Hunt, solved all the clues with 5 mins to spare. Only 50% complete in the time!

First Introduction to Escape Games. Hinthunt was my first introduction to an escape game and I've been hooked ever since! I've done both games with Hinthunt and have continued to seek out new games all over London. Brilliantly clever and keeps you guessing right until the end. Highly recommended! :)

Great fun. Wasn't sure what to expect. But what an experience. Had such good fun, and the hints were greatfully received. Left with adrenalin high as we completed it. Staff were were professional and helpful. Can't wait to go back and do the other room

What a great experience. A great experience with three friends - wasn't sure what to expect !!! But it was great. Can't wait to book the other room. The hints were greatfully received and we completed it with seconds to spare. So left with adrenalin high. Thanks Hinthunt

Nerdy fun for the family. Challenging, but fun! Just enough help from the hints to keep you moving forward without giving it away. Very friendly staff. High quality puzzles and props. We solved it with 4:18 to go. But, I think it would still be fun even if you didn't solve all the puzzles. Just do it!

Great fun. went here for my boyfriends birthday was looking for something different and this defo was we did the zen room. We split into 2 teams of 4 boys against girls. the girls won with 4 mins left the boys didn't get out. will hopefully go back to do the other room and would defo recommend it if you are looking to do something different. Also it doesn't feel like you are locked in a room as i dont like small enclosed spaces and i was fine in there. The hour goes really fast too.

Amazing Activity - well worth the trip!. I was bought this experience by a friend for my birthday. Five of us went along to it and had such a fantastic time. The staff were friendly and helpful and fully embraced the game as much as we did! It is located right next to Euston station and not too far from St Pancras so accessibility is excellent. If you are looking for something a bit different I would fully recommend!

Lots of hints needed. After reading lots of reviews I booked this escape room for myself and 3 friends. It was really easy to find, just round the corner from Euston tube station. We arrived right on time, and were met at the door. After use of the facilities, we were briefed, and into the room we went. We started with gusto collecting clues but didn't make much headway - we were told that we would get hints throughout the game, but I have to say it was a little disappointing how many hints we actually needed. It was really difficult- although looking back at all the other reviews- it does make me wonder if we just weren't very good!! I will say that the room was really well organised with all the clues present and in good order. Despite the assistance we didn't make it out in the hour - but we were talked through all the remaining steps, to see how we could have succeeded.

Hen Party Activity. We had such fun at Hinthunt! The only downside was the size of the group - we were a group of 9 hens and needed to be split into two teams - but it's the game and a very minor concern. The whole experience was great from the moment we arrived and were greeted to the moment we left. I'd recommend this to anyone. We did the office game and will be back to do the zen game too.

A great way to spend an afternoon. Without giving too much away this is great fun. We did it as a team of four which seemed the right number as we were all always looking at something or trying to solve something. We did the office room which is more puzzle based while the Zen room is more searching based. Did not make it out in time - was on the last clue when the timer ran out but the staff were great and let us finish as we were so close.

if your thinking of going 100% go!. Couldn't recommend this place enough! Brilliant, fantastic, challenging, stressful!, funnyvisited 12th June with friends and managed to complete the 'Zen' room with 19 seconds spare!! Whole experience is an hour but in and out with brief introduction in 1 hour 30 mins. Not going to give anything away which is hard but go in with no clue what to expect you'll be pleasantly surprised as to how the game is played.Just go and experience it for yourself, can go as family/friends/work do its just good.Staff are a great help, specially with the hints on the screen - both before hand and after they were helpful.
Brilliant. Won't give away any clues - have to see for yourself! The Zen room was really well put together and will definitely be going back for the second room

A great laugh. Brilliant fun and something different to try when visiting London. 5 of us did the zen room which was great,the staff are on hand to help guide you if you're going wrong and there's a pub next door for your celebratory drink afterwards.

more hunt than hint. The experience was enjoyable but the puzzles were unsolvable at times and the game master needed to constantly give hints. The number of red herrings meant we felt we had all the clues but we really didnt. Having done hinthunt and clue quest now, hint hunt focusses on finding things and clue quest on clues. I prefer the clues and also there are too many red herrings in hint hunt!
Fantastic. Brilliant fun and very clever. So many clues and puzzles. 60 minutes went way to quickly. Staff were excellent and helpful. Would recommend to any groups family or friends

What a laugh. Four of us went to hinthunt as a present for one of the group. What a laugh. No-one had gone before and did not know what to expect. It turned out to be a fantastic laugh and a brilliant hour. It is very well organised and the people running it make you feel comfortable. Only point worth noting is, do not panic if you turn up a little bit early and find the doors are closed with signs saying do not enter. This is just because there is nowhere to wait inside, but do not panic. Hang around near the doors and when it is near your time slot someone will find you and direct you to the correct door for the short briefing before you begin the experience. Have fun, we did

So much better than we could have imagined !!. Absolutely loved every second.. you have no idea what to expect and it just gets more frantic as the time ticks down.... brilliant and cant wait to go back to the other room !! xx If only they would let you keep the video would be so funny !!! _ HINT HUNT start charging for video copies !!! x
Kids day out. The kids had a really great time. Want to go back to another room soon! Great idea for teenagers parties. Fantastic idea!!

A Teenage Birthday that Everyone Loved. As a mother, I took my daughter and 3 friends for her 13th Birthday. 5 people was not too many - in fact, not sure how we would have done it with fewer. I will not give anything away other than to say for 2 days it was all that the girls could talk about. We did one of the Zen rooms - it was not easy, but that is where the hints come in. Just the right amount! We have done other rooms - this was by far the most difficult, but also the most rewarding in terms of puzzles. Could not recommend more highly! In terms of ages, I am not sure I would go much younger. The staff at HintHunt made the whole experience very clear, understandable, welcoming and not at all daunting.

A great way to spend an hour. Went as part of a surprise office team event and really enjoyed it. Instructions were clear beforehand and the little hints you get during the "game" add to fun activity.Would recommend though that water is supplied as can be thirsty work!

Super fun and very cleverly put together. Visited with my husband (his birthday present) and our two children aged 9 and 12 and we totally loved it. We did the detectives office and despite being a little confused about exactly how to tackle it when we went through the door, we were soon working out codes and solving clues. The hints on screen were hugely helpful and we worked flat out for a very entertaining 60 minutes (which really flew by!). A super thing to do, and we'll be back to to the Zen room. Thank you Hint Hunt
Great experience. Escape rooms are popular lately,I recommend this room for groups of 4-5 people.The room is mystery just enough. this is absolutely cool attraction to do with your friends or family

Great fun for all ages. We visited Hinthunt as part of our research for our own escape game in Kent and have done plenty of these throughout Europe. On arrival at Hinthunt we had to leave for a little while as we were early and there was not much of a waiting area. This seems to be a common factor with games based in London and I suppose it is due to the huge rental costs in the country's capital. When we returned we were welcomed by the excellent host who explained the premise of the game to us, before taking us into the room. The set was built extremely well and it was clear that lots of time and effort had been put into creating exciting and challenging puzzles. The only negative we found here was that there was a large number of red herrings. Whilst we are not against the odd "false clue" we found that the sheer volume of them took up so much of our time that we did not have the time to properly solve the genuine clues, and therefore required too many hints from the games master. This meant that puzzles we would normally solve ourself with a little thought were done for us, taking away from the excitement and satisfaction of working something out.Overall the game was very good. The quality of the set and props, along with the enthusiasm and entertainment of the staff made for a very enjoyable day. We will definitely look at attempting their second Zen game in the future.

Excellent fun for all ages. I had advised clients to go to HintHunt for team building which they loved. I decided to book a session for my family - 2 children 10&12. Go with a sense of adventure and puzzle solving - you don't need any more info. Excellent fun for all of us, a great family activity. My daughters said they would go again and again and again!

Brilliant hour spent at Hint Hunt cant wait to go back. I had heard about this experience through face book, I had no idea what to expect but as a treat for Hubby's birthday and because he loves to solve a logic problem I booked for him, 16 yr old son and myself to experience the Zen Room. From the moment we arrived everything was perfect. We had the most exhilarating, fun and problem solving hour we have ever had and we cant wait to go back and try another room. Cant recommend it enough and will certainly be telling out friends about this hidden treasure.

Brilliant group fun. I bought a 4 person voucher for my husband as a Christmas present, and finally got round to doing it! You are greeted at the door and have the premise explained to you, and have an opportunity to ask any questions before being lead to your puzzle room.Without giving anything away, I would say they've pitched the puzzles at an extremely good level, with a variety of problems to work your way through. We managed to solve it but we weren't sure we were going to make it at one point.Great activity for friends and families, something really different to occupy an hour with.

Excellent day out with family and friends. My partner and I booked this as a Christmas gift for my parents and I have to say that the experience thoroughly exceeded our expectations. My sister and her partner joined us so we had two rooms in two teams of three (boys vs girls). The challenge was great and the time flew by. There was lots to keep us busy and all three of us were constantly hunting for clues and solving challenges. I think it would have been a struggle with less people, so I'd suggest a group of 3 - 4 per room would work best.I wouldn't recommend this as an activity for young children, but for older teens and up it's great.We solved the challenge with 55 seconds left on the clock. A great day out and fantastic fun. We're already looking to book our next challenge, the Zen Room.

Engrossing, fun very different way to spend an afternoon.. Before entering your room to begin the event a thorough explanation of the way to play hinthunt is given so you can get the most from the game. A maximum of 5 people can play in any one room. The time really flies by and you are engrossed in finding and interpreting clues. Great fun, thoroughly recommend. Ideal event to kick off birthday celebrations or just to do something different for a change. Very helpful staff too.

Excellent . Five of us tackled the Zen room during a trip to London. The staff member was great, very friendly and welcoming - and the challenge it's self was.......challenging! We had a great time, we definitely would come back again to try the other room - highly recommended.

Excellent Team Builder. Did it as a work team building event and we all had a great time!! Loved the logical clues, a lot of them weren't obvious but not too out there that you have no chance!! Got out with 14 seconds to spare, good luck :)

The hour just FLEW by!. Had a fantastic evening here. We had 5 people in our room, the Zen Room, which felt like the maximum amount to be able to fit in the room and enjoy the experience.We had a (very) slight advantage as one of our team members was able to read japanese, so I think that saved us an extra few minutes, and we actually completed the room with about 10 minutes to spare, which we were told was close to the record.There isn't really a storyline, as there are in other escape game experiences - you literally really are just thrown into a room and told to get out, but to be honest I liked it this way!

Brilliant night of fun. Me and 3 others did JM's Office and we all had an absolute blast!! This is a great way to use some brain power and have a terrific time along the way. I think this works great with a group of 4 (5 people becomes too much, in my opinion). 3-4 is ideal. The staff are amazing and help to make this loads of fun. Be prepared for the time to fly by and for 60 mins of pure excitement!!!
A different and challenging night out. Fast paced and nail biting excitement! we were 2 teams of couples with the boys competing with the girls - good laugh. You don't need brains just common sense.
Brilliant! . Absolutely loved it! Really didn't know what to expect but enjoyed every minute of it. Would highly recommend & can't wait to go back & do a different one.

Brilliant for team bonding!. I organised a social night out for my colleagues, there were 40 of us so we had two sessions with 5 rooms in each session. It was an absolutely brilliant bonding exercise! There are two types of rooms; the "Zen" rooms which are Japanese style and the "JM's office" rooms which are like Sherlock Holmes. The hour flew by so quickly and only half of the teams managed to escape in time! Full of surprises (I won't spoil them for you) - my team did JM's office but I'd love to go back again and try the Zen room. Would definitely recommend

Spring social. About 40 of us took over the venue and played in teams of 4 and 5My team escaped with a minute to spareCan't help feeling that I hindered rather than helpedDefinitely one for the under 30s

We loved it!. We did this for a surprise birthday celebration and it went down very well with everyone. We had two teams of 4, both in a 'Zen' room. I think 4 is about the right number as you need to do quite a bit of searching as well as puzzle solving. We did it just in time! The staff were very friendly and engaged, really couldn't fault it! We would definitely go back and do the other room.

So much fun. This was my second time at Hint Hunt (I did the JM Office this time, the Zen Room before) and it was just as good as I remembered. The puzzles are ingenious and we felt like proper detectives pulling the place apart and trying to piece the clues together.
Best evening ever. My friends and i had the most fun at this place, we tried the murder room and now we want to come back and tackle the other room

So much fun!!!. Brilliantly organised, such a simple concept but it was so much fun!! definitely recommend! i would definitely recommend going with the optimum (4) amount of people as the room is small and 6 peoples opinions can be a bit much to handle!

Good rooms with some adjustment potential. My girlfriend and I decided to tackle both of the rooms featured by HintHunt last weekend. We have a good degree of experience in the genre and so felt well prepared going into the process. For full transparency I should add that we fell short (a minute in one and perhaps 5 in the other) of finishing the rooms. The website does suggest 3 - 5 participants as an ideal figure and so one could also argue there were not enough of us there to find all the clues.First off the staff were very nice and attentive. I found all of the HintHunt team members to be interested and engaged in the running of the rooms and in ensuring that all had a good time.Additionally the room concepts are very good and one differed quite a bit in artistic style to those which we had previously encountered. This alone made the experience quite novel.There were, however three key drawbacks to the experience.First off the rooms rely much more on the concept of searching for things, often small things, than on actually solving riddles/puzzles (which I suspect is why at least 3 participants are recommended). I found this to be quite unbalanced as compared with past experiences. Additionally, the hints provided by the attendants, and there are many many many hints (sometimes when you'd wish you hadn't gotten one) tend to take away from the joy in trying to solve the puzzles. Hints also tend to focus on where to find hidden objects, again putting the focus much more on finding things rather than solving things.The length of the critical sequence of events also seemed quite a bit longer than in a conventional escape room. I suspect this is what adds to the overall perceived difficulty assessment of these rooms. I welcome such an approach as you get more value for your experience. But this should, again, be balanced with the constant searching for objects which is core to so many of the puzzles, as well as the continual stream of hints needed to overcome the challenge of not having found something.Lastly, there are a few worldwide standards for what not to do in an escape room. These typically involve not using excessive force, not opening up fire, electrical, utility panels and not damaging walls and fixtures. These standards are there for a reason, mainly ensuring that one does not get hurt or break the rooms. Also they ensure that certain approaches are discouraged in future room escapes. Without going into game critical detail one of the rooms required that such a standard be broken. I found this disingenuous and frankly unnecessary. it should be changed.Overall though we did have an enjoyable time. If the rooms were focused just a little bit and the searching element was slightly deemphasized, then the need for excessive clues would also be diminished. This would then more seamlessly couple with the excellent storylines in the rooms and provide a much more enjoyable escape experience.I also hear that the next room will be a submarine. Hopefully some of these comments will be taken on board and I look forward to visiting that puzzle on one of my next London trips.

Amazing. Absolutely amazing, went as two groups (one of 3, and one of 4). Didn't know what to expect and really enjoyed it. Got out about 30 seconds after the time was up.Would recommend highly to anyoneVery good location (right next to Euston station)
Great family activity. Bought this as a Christmas present for 6 family members.What a great experience and team building activity to do.Great fun we did the Zen room.Defiantly recommend.

Amazing! . This was the first escape we had done, did it after a recommendation from a friend! It was brilliant, the way they had constructed the game was fantastic, lots of quirky features and just the right amount of hints to help us when we were totally stuck or going down the wrong clue! Can't wait to return and do the other rooms!

Great fun for logic puzzle lovers!. thoroughly enjoyed this game, and it certainly got the adrenaline going towards the end of the hour! We played the Zen Room as part of an activity day of a hen do and everyone has a good time.
