Our games master was very welcoming and friendly and helped make the experience more enjoyable; although the clues towards the end of the hour did come thick and fast, and my team occasionally felt like some were unnecessary as we had already figured it out (although, obviously, the game master cannot read your mind, so I would recommend communicating with her/him, as well as your team, clearly about what you have found!). The puzzles ranged in difficulty from finding keys/objects to solving more complicated puzzles. I would recommend the game for adults with teenagers no younger than 14+ (unless they are especially good at logic puzzles). We made it out with just over 2 minutes to spare with our team of 3, and felt a great sense of achievement. I would recommend a team of 3 - 4 people, as it may feel like too many cooks with any more. The only things I would change would be to have a more comfortable/welcoming waiting area and maybe a recent leader board with escape times so that you can compare to other teams (not that I'm competitive or anything;)
Hinthunt challenge. An excellent hour spent trying to solve a murder mystery puzzle. Intriguing and challenging but great fun

First game, best ever. This was my first room escape experience and it was the best of all. And not just because it was the first ;)The game (JM's office 3) was well designed with a lot of character ;) You could feel that it has been extensively tested and the game master new exactely how to guide us through the game.I love that there was a screen in the room showing you the time and also the hints, when needed. Highly recommended despite the fact that it is a bit expensive ;) For us it was worth every penny...Just amazing!

Brilliant fun!. We did Hint Hunt as a group of 5 friends and we had a brilliant time! It was a very stressful but exciting one hour and we escaped with just over one minute to spare. Everyone got involved and we were on a real high after! Would definitely recommend to all ages.
Team Building fun!. Took my team along....a great time and well worth it! Loved the attention to detail in the rooms, theming was great. An altogether superb, immersive and intense experience!
Fun times. Booked three rooms for all our family, so much laughter and fun would recommend it to everyone, great for all ages. Staff were fab, easy to find and close to main station.

Fantastic!. This is a great day / evening activity for any group! Without giving too much away, the challenges are indeed very very challenging! I advise anyone considering a visit, to do it, it's absolutely fantastic!!! Staff are lovely, it's easy to reach etc. I want to go back!
Frustrating. A good time was had by all, didn't get out in time allotted and extremely frustrating. Adults and teenages so work for everyone.

A good time by all was had. Great Fun for all ages... We did it!! with time to spare. thank you HintHunt for a good timeIts easy to find and the staff are very helpful. We were a mixed age range from 29 to 60 and we all had fun

Fabulous time!. A great way to spend 1 hr. We were a group of 5 adults in the Zen room. We were slow to start with and lost valuable time at the beginning. The time flew by and we just missed out on finished and getting out of the room.....our hostess let us finish as we were so close to the end. There is a clock counting down and a bell that signals if a hint has been given with details clearly shown on a screen. Brilliant fun for all and we came out on a real high. Would thoroughly recommend. Very well organised. Can't wait to go again!

Great fun for everyone!. We were a team of 5 (3 x 30+ and 2 x 60+) in the Zen Room which was beautifully set out with props, possible puzzle solutions & decoys to confuse...A surprise part-way through enhanced the whole experience further.Our friendly Observer seemed to know just the right moments to provide us with clues to keep us going.All in all, a very worthwhile and enjoyable experience - we will certainly go back to pitch our wits in the other puzzle room!

GREAT FUN!. We have been to a few "room escape" experiences and this is the best by far. Executed well and great quality. We took our nephew, 13 years old, and he was our "trump card". He was great and enjoyed it as much as we did. 3 of us managed to escape with 27 seconds to spare - intense final seconds there.

Thrilling hour that's high on adrenalin and fun!. We were a team of 5 - two teenagers, two thirty-somethings and a 50+ year old. All of us loved it and came out wanting to go straight into another room. Everyone was involved from start to finish and we had the most fantastic time. Exceeded our expectations. Staff fantastic. Impossible to say too much about it without spoiling it but I would thoroughly recommend for families, teams, friends - whoever, whenever.
HintHunt. A great fun team away day out. Got use working together, but you need to be quick thinking to solve the mystery.

Never knew an hour could go so quickly!. Great fun with great friends and worked well with teenagers. We were in the Zen room and we completed it in the last few seconds which was a relief as I am quite competitive! There were lots of puzzles and hints along the way! Thank you for a great start to my holiday!

Brilliant fun. Went with my husband and 2 teenage daughters (14 & 16) and we had a fantastic time. The hour went so quickly and we trashed the room (sorry !), but we did escape with 13 seconds to spare. Thanks for the helpful hints !! My kids came out asking to go back soon and do the Zen room and we will be doing just that in next school holidays. Really great family time with no phones or screens and teenagers just having fun with their oldie parents. We will be back ...

Awesome experience - so worth the money as we will be talking about this for years!. Not knowing what to expect this definitely exceeding all expectations for my family. Going with my 16, 18 and 20 yr old boys I wondered if they would like this experience but was pleasantly surprised with how much they enjoyed it! It was intense and a lot of fun trying to work out the clues. Massive thanks to our helpful hinter!! We were all so pleased to run out the door with only 6 seconds to go!!! I recommend this to anyone who likes puzzles or just something different to do.

Below expectations. This was arranged as a birthday surprise for 5 members of the family - a chance to have fun together. The experience was fun but there was far less problem solving and challenge than expected. We had expected far more of an intellectual challenge - but nevertheless it was an hour of fun and team work. It was remarkably unstressful and their attempt with a countdown clock to stimulate stress did not work.Yes it was enjoyable but we would not rush back to repeat the experience and it is more of a nice to try than must do.

Fantastic Hour of Fun in JM's Office. Friendly Staff who really made the hour full of fun. Second visit, first was in the Zen room, and just as much fun as the first. Thank you for making this such a fabulous day. You seriously need to open more rooms!!Five Wheeler

Fantastic event. We had such a great time at HintHunt. I went with my family and we all really enjoyed it. It made us all really work together and we had such fun. The people involved were really friendly and enthusiastic. Would definitely recommend this, and we will definitely be going back for one of the other rooms.
Absolutely brilliant. Really good fun and a unique experience. Would definitely do it again. Staff is brilliant as well. Highly recommended

Amazing!. We did the zen room and loved it so much we wanted to do the other room on the same day however they were fully booked! The member of staff who talked us through everything was very helpful! Overall great fun and the clues are very cryptic! I would recommend going in a group of 4 people! And as I mentioned before ... can't wait to do the other room!
So much fun!. Hint Hunt was so so great. The staff were helpful and friendly and we had such a great experience. It's my second time there and I'll definitely be going back.

Lots of fun and very helpful staff!. We spent a lovely afternoon at HintHunt solving the Zen room. It was lots of fun and the staff member that assisted us was very helpful! Thank you to the HintHunt team for such a lovely afternoon. Would highly recommend it.

Visit 2 - The Zen Room. Our second visit to HintHunt, this time for a birthday party. (Happy 34th Dan!)We were greeted very warmly and our host didn't just 'do the basics', hetook a genuine interest in us as a group and doing whatever he could to make sure we had a great time - and we did!I don't want to spoil anything so I won't say too much, but check everything - everything!Completed in 54 minutes exactly - even our host congratulated us on a great performance.Cant wait for Room 3 - a submarine?! Sounds brilliant, just hurry up and install it and we'll be back.Thank you again - really made our night.
Hint Hunt - Fab. A most enjoyable, communal experience - gives a real sense of joint achievement and FUN. Zen room 2 is the one!
A great afternoon's problem solving!. We had a fantastic afternoon and enjoyed every minute! We can't wait to come back and try another Hint Hunt room!

Great family time!. Our family of 5, including 3 teenagers, spent an hour of what seemed to be the best time ever. Great family time working to escape this ingenious setup. We had so much fun that we planned on coming back to play the other room. Best experience with our teenagers!

Fantastic!. A great team exercise with many clues and lots of hectic and stressful fun! Do not miss this! We went in as a family of 5, and came out victorious in our escape from the room! Just remember to bring your brain with you... Might be a bit hard without it. Everyone can do it, as long as you open your mind to learning.
So much fun!. Had such a fun hour at Hint Hunt - truly loved the experience and can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!Great staff, great game, you can't go wrong with booking this.

Excellent!. Went yesterday in a group of four and tackled the zen room. The room was beautifully decorated and the puzzles were clearly of high quality. Our host was very friendly and did give us some welcomed, well timed hints. We escaped with just under two minutes to go and are looking forward to testing the detective room next! I would say a group of 4 is big enough as at times only three of us needed to be occupied and the room is rather small!

Best sixty minutes spent ever. Great idea, well set out , friendly hosts, great game for family or friends. All working together to try to escape the room. Plenty of clues and a bit of help from the game master. Excellent fun will go again.

Fun way to spend an hour. I returned to Hint Hunt for a second time yesterday this time to tackle the Zen Room with my family. Such a fun way to spend time together and the hour was over before we knew it!! ...we did manage to escape but even if we hadn't we all still would have enjoyed it. I love the concept and can't fault the game at all! Looking forward to some new rooms opening so we can come back again!!

An amazing way to spend an hour!!. This was my first escape room type of activity so I wasn't really sure what to expect. We opted for the Zen room and it was fantastic! Had an awesome time and will definitely go back to try out the other room!
Good experience. Not the best in London but still really good if you can't get a spot for Cluequest or Time run, worth a visit.

Great fun!. We had four of the rooms booked for a work event and everyone spoke really highly of the activity. The activity will last an hour but for something of this nature you need to allow 1.5 hours which is great as opposed to full on longer events which aren't to everyone's taste.My only criticism would be that the entrance is a little unassuming and the doors are locked with 'activity in progress'. Whilst you will be letting into the small waiting room when they spot you it could be unpleasant if it's bad weather!

Amazing - one not to miss!. Having taken part in a number of escape the room type activities, I was expecting something similar from hint hunt. However......this is above and beyond! A thoroughly enjoyable, action packed team game which despite being low budget and in a small venue, provided one of the most challenging and entertaining escape the room games I have visited! Having don 'JM's Office', we are heading back to tackle the 'Zen Room' in April. Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing HintHunt. Went on Sunday to do the Zen Room, really wasn't sure what to expect, so had an open mind. It was totally fantastic, if you like problem solving, this is your thing. Really fun, and it is what it says it's a HINT hunt, you couldn't complete it without the hints. A really really fun hour and will definitely go back to compete the other room. It's tough managed to just get out with 2 seconds to go. Would definitely recommend.

Great activity. My teenage son and his friends went to HintHunt and really enjoyed it - challenging but fun at the same time - really great activity for this age group and for adults too! Highly recommend.

Great fun!. We went to hint hunt yesterday and had a brilliant time! A great way to spend an hour, we had two teams and we're still talking about it. Definitely recommend. We'll be going back to do the other game. Very near Euston station so it's easy to get to. Do it :)
Brilliant. We loved our time at Hint Hint, if you think you can complete it without clues you'll be wrong! It's challenging but so much fun, highly recommend it

Amazing experience. We did the detective themed room and you can tell so much effort and detail has gone into designing it. There was 5 of us doing the room and I didn't know if this would be too many people (getting in each other's way). It turned out we all had something to do and escaped with 1 minute to go! This is definitely the best escape room I've ever done you absolutely must try it. The staff are really friendly and just complete the whole experience!

Challenging, but fun. Had a go at the Zen Room with two other girls and had a great time. Lateral thinking is definitely required and there are also a number of visual puzzles involved. Watching the clock count down really gets the adrenaline going! I've played an escape game once before, but I'd imagine it's fun no matter how many games like this you've played in the past.Teamwork is required! It's a great bonding activity. I probably wouldn't recommend this for children as it was quite challenging at times, but I'd imagine it's good fun withwhoever you go with, be it a group of friends, as a couple, or with work colleagues. The venue is very easy to find and is just a short walk from Euston station.

Awesome evening out. I would highly recommend this. We went with another couple. It is truly a team event. The hour passed so quickly. I would also recommend the Napalese restaurant up the street for afterwards (or before)
Brilliant . The hour flies by! Really good fun! Will Def be doing it again. We booked two rooms out for a group of 7. One tip....lol everywhere

Great craic!. We organised a team away day and Hint hunt was part of it. The idea of being locked in a room to solve clues in a time limit with my colleagues, definitely didn't fill me with much excitement especially as we're quite a competitive lot but I was pleasantly surprised; we had such a great time. With just 50% success rate of escaping before the time runs out, you really need your wits about you. The HH team were friendly and briefing given clear. Well worth it! It's a 'yes' from me.

AWESOME FUN!. In a nutshell, HintHunt is an escape game for small teams of 3-5 people (our team consisted of 4 people). The team has to search for clues and work through puzzles to escape from a room. Our team's chosen room for our first ever HintHunt experience was JM’s Office 2. 60 minutes sounds like a long time but the time simply FLIES as you search for and solve clues to escape.Our HintHunt venue was quite compact and the staff was very helpful and friendly. She gave us a detailed briefing beforehand and explained the rules of the game and said that the success rate to beat the game (which we did) was 50%. Overall, HintHunt is a very fun and exciting Live Escape Game Challenge and I will definitely be back with my mates to try and beat the other rooms.

You will need your wits about you. 60 minutes to find objects and work out clues to get you out of a locked room. Less than 50% of participants manage it within the hour, so the activities are quite challenging. Went with the family as a belated Christmas present and had a great time. Full briefing beforehand and our guide offered us enough clues to keep us in with a chance of success. Location is very easy to find only a few minutes from Euston Station.

Great Fun!. Very easy to find, just a few minutes walk from Euston Station. Four of us went along Sunday for a girl's evening out. Staff that welcomed us were very friendly and fully briefed us with clear instructions. We completed the Zen room with 6 minutes 11 seconds to spare....phew. The puzzles were quite challenging but if you come to a halt the staff relay cryptic 'hints' to you via a TV screen in the room to help you along. Was great fun, the clock counting backwards gets the adrenaline going! Can't wait to try another room-it's very addictive!
An hour of adrenalin rush. love this challenge, could occasionally be a little more professional but have been doing it since the beginning and just love it.Great idea that deserves success
Great fun! Perfect activity to do with friends.. You'll have a great time trying to figure out how to get out of the room in less than 60 minutes. It's a great activity to do in groups.

Great fun. We attempted to escape one of Hint Hunts's room a in under an hour as a family of four (all adult). We managed it with 30 seconds to spare, with lots of shouted instructions, searching high and low and hilarity in between. A really fun way to spend time together.

Zen Room - 1hr of fun and not at all Zen!. Visited Hint Hunt with a group of friends (4 of us in total) and completed the Zen room. I have been to escape rooms before but my friends hadn't. We received a friendly welcome and a thorough induction. We were allowed to take our bags into the room. The puzzles were challenging and there was just enough help available to make it challenging but not overly frustrating. A thoroughly fab time was had by all. Definitely recommend highly - probably not suitable for very young children (pre-teens) as quite a lot of lateral thinking is involved.
Hint Hunt in London . What a fab time we had at Hint Hunt at the weekend. An hour to get out of a room full of detective clues. Will definitely be going back to try the Zen Room. Well worth a visit x
Fantastic fun filled time - well worth a visit. Hinthunt was a fantastic experience for our family of 5 - everyone wanted to do it again. We all came away and recommended it to so many of our friends

Zen Room Hint Hunt. Loved it! We were a team of 3 doing the Zen Room set-up. It was so much fun. Previously we have done the detective agency room which we found harder. Maybe that was because we didn't know what to expect. Would definitely recommend the Zen Room one.

Good fun and we got out!. This was my first escape room and throughly enjoyed. The lady who looked after us was lovely warm and welcoming. The room escape itself was well thought out and got you thinking too. I would recommend this as a great starter room. We escaped with just over a minute to spare. And the pub next door was convenient and nice place for a post escape escapism :)

Something different with the kids. We visited with 2 adults an 3 children ages 13, 12 and 9.From the start of booking process staff were really helpful and on the day the experience was really good fun and something completely different. Everyone in group had a great time.
Brilliant! . Superb. Absolutely loved it! Sadly we didn't manage to escape but would definitely go back and do the other room there! Such a different experience to do and would highly recommend!

Different and fun !. This is a great experience for all ages . There were 4 of us in JM's office and although we didn't manage to get out we had great fun . We didn't know what to expect but as we got into it we began to really enjoy it and the time flew by. We plan to go back and try the Zen room .

So much fun. This was my first experience of an escape room and I absolutely loved it! There were 4 of us in JM's office and we managed to escape with 1min 43seconds to go. Very challenging and the hour goes so quickly! Wouldn't have been able to do it without the clues that flash on the screen every now and again. Now we want to go back and do the Zen room!

Amazing Change!. This is a great activity to do with work colleagues, friends or family! It is similar to real life cludeo!It is such good fun and truly testing!!We some how managed to complete the task with 4 minutes to spare.
Great fun.. Given as a birthday present. Challenging and great fun. Recommended! We made it our just in time and needed the helpful hints...

So much fun, wanted to do the next one immediately!. This was brilliant, we did it for a hen party in small groups and everyone loved it. Best thing I have done in ages. I'd thoroughly recommend it to any one.

Excellent games. I've now played both rooms here and they are excellent and very well run. The hints they give you are helpful and well-timed. We have played many escape games and, whilst perhaps not as immersive as some, the JM Office room is amongst the most challenging we have done. I particularly liked the style of the Zen Room and the range of puzzles in there. Looking forward to a new game soon so we can come back!

Clever idea which is great fun.. This was arranged as a family trip as a Christmas present. Such great fun. One of the kids had done this before, but a different challenge, and not managed to escape. One had done it abroad once but said it wasn't quite as cleverly done as this one.After a short briefing we were locked in the room and started our hunt for clues. One leads to another and many interrelate. Such a clever concept in a pretty small area. Get the clues right and you break into another room with more clues. Don't worry if you struggle, you will be given occasional hints if you need them via a TV screen; just enough to keep you going....As a family event it was great. The hour flies by. We managed to escape with literally 7 seconds to spare, but apparently plenty don't! It certainly gets the brain cells going, and everyone needs to be involved. A great laugh.

A good one if you do it for the first time.. If you have any experience with escape rooms, this one has no "wow" effect here. Puzzles on a good level though something unique was missing here for two of us. Our other two friends playing for the first time were impressed though.
Best fun to be had in an hour!. Brilliant concept and was so much fun. The hour flies by and we came sooo close to escaping! We went with work and everyone loved it. Will definitely be going back.

Good fun!. 4 of us spent an hour in a seemingly minimally furnished room hunting for clues to open padlocks and unlock drawers to find more clues. We had great fun working together. The organisers are very good at hiding things! Would definitely recommend it as a good family activity, an excellent way to celebrate a birthday. Thank you Hinthunt

A really brilliant experience!. My friends and I had a fabulous time, this experience really was so much fun, and the time absolutely flew by!! The staff were kind, helpful, very friendly and relaxed.I am keen to have another go :0)

So exciting!!!. One of the most exciting games you can do in an hour. The fun starts as soon as the door closes. The staff are really friendly and helpful especially if you need a hint. The hour goes really fast and when it's over you want to do it all over again.

Brilliant fun!. had absolutely no idea what to expect, as the web site gives nothing away (and quite rightly so) but friends we went with had done something similar in Bath and said would be good... thought it would be something different but didn't expect to enjoy it as much as we did. brilliant fun, challenging but not too hard and a good giggle, and we kept talking about it all weekend

Wow what a great time. This is a lot of fun.4 of us visited the Zen room on Saturday afternoon.After a quick introduction we were set to work in the room. It starts as a bit of a mad panic looking for clues, keys code etc. but after a little while things start dropping into place. You have to work together to have any change of getting out within the allotted time. Very cleverly put togetherYou are watched by one of the Hinthunt team who will occasionally provide clues if you need them.We managed to get out with 2 minutes remaining. We were so excited and chuffed with ourselves.We didn't stop speaking about it all dayCant wait to try the other room.

Came out of it buzzing. It was brilliant, we loved every minute of it, we had one issue, where we were given the wrong clue, which delayed us by a couple of minutes, which meant we would have completed it.But if I am honest it was so good, and well planned. We are going to book to do again soon to do the other room.
So much fun!. Had a great evening with family (although the side I was on lost!) Would definitely recommend and looking forward to going back for the second room!!
Great experience. Great corporate event activity. Fun but tough! Would recommend it to anyone looking for a challenge that's a bit different :)

Great fun with friends!. I visited Hint Hunt with two other friends and had a great time - it is a great challenge but you get enough (but not too much!) help along the way so that it is fun too! Thoroughly recommended.

So much fun. Will definitely be back. . Heading out on a miserably rainy night to a fairly charmless part of Euston, it needed to impress. The entrance area is small and underwhelming and we were dubious it would deliver. Staff were really friendly and gave some good pointers without being patronising. Then we entered the room. Don't want to give anything away by as our first "escape room" experience we were really pleasantly surprised. Adrenaline built as time ticked by and we had so much fun. Will definitely be back for the other (zen) room. Never known an hour to fly by so fast. Brilliant entertainment. Great concept. Can't wait for the next time.

An even better second visit. Enjoyed it last time, and even more this time. I have visited other escape rooms in the meantime, and must say that Hinthunt have an unbeatable quality and variety. Since we had been there before, we expected pretty much the same kind of puzzles as last time. We were amazed by how different the second room was, and enjoyed it even more. The location close ro Euston station is perfect - just a few stops with Northern line from the city centre - excellent for busy tourists!

Pleasantly surprised. On approaching the building it didn't look anything special and when ushered into the 'waiting area', it all appeared to be very cramped, so first impressions were not that good. However, once the experience we were about to undertake was explained to us and we started our 'challenge' it was way beyond our expectations. Whoever has put the thought into this concept is a very clever individual. We thoroughly enjoyed the challenge and couldn't believe we managed to escape with 2 seconds to spare!! Well done to the organisers for making this a totally enjoyable experience.

Big fun - recommended. We had a great experience at HintHunt. Very nice host. Very cool (Zen) and challenging room. And such a perfect ending when the door opens 2 mins before the countdown ends. We have been a group of 5 (2 parents with 3 teens, 13-16) which was a perfect mix as it helps to have people with different "expertise" in the room. I would also recommend to go with up to 5 people if possible. But see for yourself. We all had a ball, especially the younger ones. Thanks again to the HintHunt team.
Great fun and we escaped!! . After completing two other escape games, I would have to say this is one of the best! Challenging but fun at the same time! Would recommend
So much fun!. I went as part of a work trip and it was lots of fun. Staff were friendly, explained it clearly and the hour went super fast. I would definitely recommend it!

Very good . I was late and they couldn't wait (fair enough) so I missed a chunk of the game. But I do wish they waited a bit longer for me Three of us...£25 each. Expensive tbh  The overall theme was very very very good and well thought out. It definitely gets your mind thinking. There are two rooms and we have the zen room. It was very nice but also extremely hot. At one point we had to switch it off. The hints were very useful. We definitely needed spoon feeding with some of them and they were nice enough to do so hahahBut as soon as we were finished they seemed to be in a rush to get us out of the door... Wish I was able to take a good photo as a memory. This is a service they should provide. As we are not allowed to take a photo of the rooms (understandably) they should have a place where photographs are allowed. Not just the outside of the building. Would I go again ? Yes. At a cheaper price !

Best in London so far.... Having started playing Escape Games in Europe, I have been a little disappointed in the London games, but read that "Hint Hunt" was the "original" Escape Room AND created by Hungarians (Budapest is a bit of a hub for life escapes). As such I had high hopes.My other half and I have now played a number of rooms and we were "initiating" a couple who had not done one before. Whilst I would happily say this was by far one of the most engaging rooms (we did JM's Office) - it certainly isn't for the faint hearted. They say only 50% escape, and while as a pair, my OH and I have escaped oon average with around 10-15 minutes to spare, we got out of this as a four with only 2.36 left on the clock. To really enjoy it, I would recommend having done at least one other room first...not only that, but it also makes you appreciate how good Hint Hunt actually is.It is easy to find (right next to Euston Station), and there is a pub next door should you wish to go for a post-game analysis.The room itself is very interesting with a wide range of puzzles, plus a fair amount of searching, and the Gamesmastering is a particular highlight. Hints were given at exactly the right time, but not only that a very good rapport (praise and sense of humour) was built up during the game - the only place we have experienced this previously was on the Continent. It is a much more "lateral" game than ClueQuest or Escape Entertainment - the latter two we found a little linear, and in some cases a bit "lock after lock". However, you go for what you enjoy!! (There was one puzzle that seemed to require prior knowledge, which is unusual, but it might have been that we failed to find the "clue" for that - luckily we knew the answer anyway).It was the first time in a London game that we booked the second room immediately after, and have already spread the word on facebook. This game is an absolute must for seasoned players - a little experience under your belt means you stand a chance of getting out!!
Zen Room - Fantastic. Really brilliant fun! Took kids age 11/12 and they loved it. Best kids party ever.Highly recommend it.

A great escape game. I have done a few of these escape games in London and though this was better than Escape Land, the experience was not as good as ClueQuest. The actual game itself was very smart and enjoyable and they really do hide things very well. It was so much fun and thankfully we were part of the 50% that actually do escape, with less than a minute to spare. I think having a guest book or more of an experience afterwards would greatly help.

LOVED LOVED LOVED IT. We booked this as a team building exercise. It was so much fun, we all worked really well together, the time flew past and it was challenging, rewarding and totally invigorating.

Loved this challenge!. This was my first experience of a game room. I did it with my work colleagues as a fun exercise and found that it was brilliant for team building and communication. Everybody was easily able to participate as there were so many things to find and simple challenges to overcome. This would be good for families as well though probably not quite so good for children under 10. An hour was just right. Can't wait to do it again. So we'll organised.

A great way to spend an evening with friends. I got a Hinthunt voucher for my birthday, and having never done an escape room challenge really didn't know what to expect. I was completely blown away though - I loved the concept, the mystery, the challenges, and had a great time! I'd definitely recommend this as a present or as a fun evening with friends, and can't wait to come back and try the other room!
Such fun!. Definitely recommend the detective room, great for team building and something fun, social and interactive to do instead of just dinner and drinks!

Great fun! A real buzz!. We had this as the activity for our work Christmas do. It was fantastic!Of course you feel a bit under pressure at moments, but that's the whole thing of the game. We were split into four teams so we were not only competing against the clock but also against colleagues.Loads of fun and we were all buzzing when it finished! Would recommend it to groups of friends and as a work activity.

Successful escape. A great day out at one of the most compelling activities you can do in London. Enjoyable, challenging, frustrating, exciting all rolled into one. A must do for anyone that lives in London.

Fun fun fun!. My friends and I did this one night in London and didn't know what to expect. We were given a few hints along the way but some obstacles were still mind boggling. Great way to bond with people and it's made me want to do another one!
So fun!. We went with a couple of friends on a Friday evening and it was so much fun! Can't recommend it enough . Great for something different to do with friends.

SUCH GOOD FUN!. I came here least week with 3 of my other friends and i've gotta say, it was the most fun i've had for a while, in london as well! If you and your group of friends are looking some interactive fun with each other, this place is perfect. Its situated in central london where you can easily travel to. The staff are extremely friendly!!!!! You basically get put into a room and the try to find hints and escape!! It really gets you to use your brain and work with each other. TOTALLY RECOMMEND!

Very good for company events!. We went as a group of 25 as part of a company event. It was really great fun but also brought colleagues together, especially those that didn't already know each other, and required skills as a team to complete the game. Super fun and absolutely everyone has told me how much they enjoyed it. Thank you Hint Hunt.

A novel attraction organised by the right people. An imaginative and interesting activity. It is dependent on the right people running the event. We had someone who couldn't have been better and, hence, made our session great fun. Many thanks for the experience.

Great Family Fun. Went to Hint Hunt yesterday - 10 January- with four adults and a young teenager.We had an amazing time in one of the Zen rooms, lots to think about and so many varied challenges to enable our escape.Would thoroughly recommend it. Will definitely be going again to the other experience on site.

Team Build with a difference. Visited HintHunt for a team build exercise and thoroughly enjoyed it! Its a great laugh and something different to do we managed to get out of the room with 34 seconds to spare If you are thinking of going its a must!

High Octane fun!. We had a lot of fun as a family group (all adults) in the Zen room at Hint Hunt. Lots of quick thinking and team spirit. A great family outing, But I think it would be a big stretch for younger kids who might find it frustrating and difficult. you need to work fast and smart to get out!

Brilliant!. Did this with colleagues and had a wonderful time. It is great fun, challenging and the time flies by - would thoroughly recommend it. Getting out with seconds to spare was a great relief! Try it - you won't regret it.
Hint hunt was fab fun. very entertaining fun - entertaining and challenging in equal measurerecommended for anyone who likes a tricky puzzle

Best team work event for any ocassions!. Intellectually challenging, unexpected puzzles and ton of fun! It would not be common and easy to solve patterns- get ready to think really really hard. The feeling of escaping is indescribable!

Amazing and challenging fun.. You get 60 minutes to escape from a locked room and do those minutes go fast! From the start you are searching for clues and codes and solving puzzles. All four of us were on the go and needed for all 58 minutes that it took us to solve it. (Apparently there is just a 50% pass rate so well done us!) What most impressed us was the variety of the challenges, definitely something for every member of the family. And you get timely Hints from the Gamesmaster (Thanks Jessie) which helps keep you moving along.We have already planned a repeat trip to try the other locked room.

What a great experience! :). We had so much fun! An exciting, nail biting, fun experience that we would highly recommend! The four of us escaped with only 4 minutes to go... we enjoyed receiving the much needed hints and have already talked about going again. Book - you won't regret it!

A definite 5 star event. Brilliant !. Challenging but great fun. A bit of logic helps but it's more about observing, searching and talking to each other. That makes it a great event for children ( 9+ ) alongside adults. The staff are good at giving you a little nudge when you get stuck. That adds to the excitement, builds the tension and helps the hour race by.My advice to anyone thinking about doing it is --- do it ! It's a definite 5 star event.

Highly recommended - great fun. Staff were really helpful and the game was lots of fun. We needed a few hints but that added to the excitement and helped us to get very close to escaping within the hour.
SO MUCH FUN!. Highly recommended! It was brilliant fun and really quite tricky which made it all the more enjoyable.

New Years Day Escape. Had a great evening with my wife and family we managed to escape with 2 seconds to go. Our host was great giving much needed clues at the right time. We are aready booking the next trip.

Unique and good fun!. Would strongly recommend. The staff were really good and the game itself was good for a variety of ages... we didn't win but were soooo... close and it was really good fun nonetheless. Will definitely come again and do the second room to try to redeem ourselves!

Exciting and tense puzzle game . We had 5 adults and 4 teenagers in two teams. Everyone was fully involved in solving the puzzles and the time flew by. Strategically timed hints kept us all moving and there was a real sense of achievement as we went along. Luckily both teams escaped, but each with less than 2 minutes to spare. Great fun and highly recommended.

Excellent way to spend an hour. Had an excellent time at HintHunt for our annual family trip (ages 48, 48, 28, 25, 24).Booked based on reviews read previously and must say this did not disappoint!After being told that the success rate is only around 50% and the quickest time for solving was 53 minutes, we just managed to solve the mystery with only 13 seconds to spare..!

The best way to spend an hour in London. A group with 4 adults and 4 teenagers and a twelve year old split into two teams of kids vs adults, everyone had a cracking time thoroughly looked after and teenagers with grins ear to ear, especially as they beat us. Can't recommend highly enough.

Enter the mystery zone. The pace is set by the group's skill level. If you are sharp, no hints are needed. If you get stuck and need a little nudge or obsessive over a 'red herring', a hint pops up. We were fully immersed the whole time and managed to finish with only a minute to spare. Excellent fun!

Loads of fun for ages 8 and up.. So much fun. Work as a team and solve loads of clues and puzzles to get out of your room. Your get hints along the way if you find it hard. We definitely want to go again. There is a toilet on site and a small foyer/reception - but don't turn up too early as there will be no where to sit down.

Highly recommend! SO much fun.... I booked HintHunt as a Christmas present for all the family and I could not have been happier with my choice! The game itself is really very clever and gets you all working together - there are also different types of clues/hints so everyone gets a chance to use their brains and play the hero! The hour does go very fast and we managed to escape with only 25 seconds left on the clock - a real buzz! Can't wait to try the next room!

Excellent family fun. Did this as part of our Christmas day out in London and it was excellent fun, family (two adults, daughter 19, son 13) worked well as a team and we all thoroughly enjoyed it.Really gets you thinking and working as a team, host was great and gave us just enough tips to help us on but not enough to make it too easy, lots of different puzzles to solve kept us busy for the whole hour, although it seemed like 25 mins!Something different to try as a family, really pleased we did.

Brilliant Team fun. We went to Hinhunt as a company Christmas activity. It was amazing fun. We didn't realise where the hour went. Highly recommended. Excellent staff. Excellent setup of activity. Brilliant team fun.

Confused (both me and it). Lacks any coherent narrative. One minute it is the disappearance of a detective, next a number game.I understand you want to change the types of puzzles in the game, but jumping from real detective work to number puzzles or word association type clues, is jarring.Can't say much for the staff on the night we were there. Grumpy and wanted to go home. Maybe the boss should pay them an extra 15 minutes after game end time so they're not sweeping you out the door?Good idea, poorly executed.

Birthday family event. This was a second trip for a family birthday treat with older children/adults. An excellent hour spent solving puzzles, looking for clues etc. Certainly gets you thinking. We have now done both rooms and await another one. Can't say anymore as it would give things away. Top tip: make sure you talk to each other and listen to everyone's opinions.

Great Escape by Santa's Helpers . Normally we go out as a family on Christmas Eve and watch a movie but this year we went to HintHunt for something different.We have done a couple of escape rooms before but this was one of the best. We had to work hard as a team to work our way through the puzzles and we managed to escape with a couple of minutes to spare.Our host was excellent and added to the quality of our experience. We had a great time and left with big smiles on our faces.

Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant!. we went as a work team for our Xmas event and LOVED IT! it was accessible for everyone and really brought us together as a team. It was also sooooo much fun. looking forward to trying another room again soon.

Like an interactive video game for the family!. HintHunt is something different to do with the family which will remind you how your teenagers are much better at solving puzzles and games having spent so many hours practicing on various computer and video games (or perhaps they are just smarter than their parents). We have enjoyed playing both rooms as a family and everyone has skills to contribute. The hour goes by very quickly. The staff are very friendly and the overall experience is excellent. To be recommended!
All the fun. We went as a group of (very competitive) friends on New Year's Day in 2015 and split into two teams to race to see who could break out first. One of the most fun hours I had all year!

Go team Unicorn !!. I didn't know what too expect so it was an interesting experience. Great fun to do and also spend time with family and friend s. A real team building event that keeps you analyzing for a long time after the event. Everyone in our team thouroughly enjoyed it and is talking about booking the next challenge :)

Birthday family activity. We really had no idea what to expect when we arrived at the Hint Hunt venue.Being a group of 6, I had booked two identical rooms for each 3 so that it would be a bit of a race.The idea was a great fun challenge and I have never known an hour pass so quickly!It was intriguing , fun, at times frantic and quite hot as we forgot we had the air con to switch on!Would recommend Hint Hunt to any group teenage and up, wanting something different to pit your wits against!Our group was within moments of escaping but sadly our mental mathematics let us down.........

A real buzz. Was looking forward to out Hinthunt experience but hadn't anticipated what a great hour it would be. A Family game which was fun & left us with a real buzz as we completed the task with 11 seconds to spare. Don't delay book in nowgame which great ffamily g
Great fun. Great fun. Gets the grey cells working overtime and the hour seems to pass very quickly. Well worth a trip if problem solving is your thing.

Great for small groups of friends or work team building. I did this with my work team and we all really enjoyed it. Obviously I can't say anything about the details but it was great fun, really challenged you and the time flew by! We would definitely go back and try one of the other rooms. Would definitely recommend.

Great experience at Hint Hunt again. We did the original Hint Hunt room a few years ago, and have been dying to come back ever since. This time we booked the Zen room and it was superb. I had great customer service when making the booking, and they were happy to accommodate a personal request. The staff on the day are always so warm and energetic, and the Zen room was definitely harder, and rewarding - we escaped!This is an activity that really helps you find out more about each other. Turns out my dad is amazing at Japanese puzzle boxes... ;-)Well worth the money.
Fabulous. We had a fabulous time, well worth the money, and we completed the game within the hour,will definitely do it again. The Manxies
Good thing to do as a team. Enjoyed it with around 4 of us.. and had a nice time..might do something like this again and possibly the second room

Great team fun! . You have one hour to solve the puzzle and we achieved this with 2 minutes to go! An extremely rewarding and challenging event. I can thoroughly recommend this to any businesses looking for a team event.

Thoroughly Good Fun!. I recommend HintHunt 100%. I had expected it to be good, but it exceeded all expectations! A really good fun, different activity to do if you are looking for something rather than the usual dinner / drinks evening. It was more difficult than I had anticipated and we escaped with literally minutes to spare. I will certainly be back to try out the other room and have been recommending it to everyone I've spoken to since we went. I recommend it very highly indeed - enjoy!

Exhilarating, challenging and so much fun. There's something about HintHunt that makes it just that bit special. Yes, the game is fantastic (we did the Detective's Office), with great clues, red herrings and variety; the set is well build and designed - nothing out of place or cheap feeling; and it's really good value for money.However, what really makes it is the staff (or gamemakers - do they call themselves that?). Super friendly, involving and giving you just the right level of hints to ensure you progress, without allowing you to rely on them. Thanks for such a great evening - will definitely be back to try the second room!

AMAZING!!. Had an incredible time! We got out! All clues and hints are very clever and the adrenalin rush you get is amazing!You would be stupid not to book! Very very clever!!!!! Can't wait to do the next room

Fantastic 60 mins!!!. I had been looking forward to doing hint hunt for a while and it didn't disappoint! Although it was harder than I thought, we escaped with just over a minute to go. As a team of 5 we all had to work together to escape and all loved it!
Fast paced fun . Went with a work team but you could go with kids over 8 and have fun. A real test of communication skills and brainpower, so can see why it's good for teams.

Fun, challenging and very rewarding!. Best. Hour. Ever! Shortest too, unfortunately, time flew inside that room... If you like solving puzzles, this is like your dream come true! If you don't, just try it, you'll probably love it anyway!

Brilliant Group Activity. Went there this week with 4 friends and we all absolutely loved it. I had never done an escape the room before but will definitely be booking more in the future.We played JMs office which was very challenging and interesting and we managed to escape with a few minutes to spare.This is a great activity for any time of day at any time of year. You don't need to be fit or super smart to play, would suit families, friends or colleagues. £20-£25 for a full hours experience that will leave you smiling for the rest of the day is absolutely worth every penny. I just wish there were more rooms so I could keep coming back.

Nothing like it....😂. We just come back from a family weekend away to London we added this event to our schedules and what a treat it was like others we didn't really know what to expect. Little did we know what a treat was in store behind the door lol you have to work as a team to work out the clues to eventually escape with the added pressure of a ticking clock. We thought this was a very clever set up and thought out very well indeed we can't wait to book up for the zen room for our next weekend away. We haven't seen anything like this and really enjoyed it. So what you waiting for go book up you won't regret it. It really was a scream

What a Blast. We did the family thing, 5 of us, all with huge confidence that we would master the challenge. And we did, but only with generous support of clues from our hosts. Got there with 32 seconds to spare. What a rush.Highly recommend.

Team working made extremely enjoyable. A joint present to my wife and I from our children the hour spent in Zen Room 2 was one of the most enjoyable we have ever spent together and the shared delight of solving all the puzzles and escaping was a joy. The brain-teasers scattered and hidden around the room(s) brought out the particular problem solving skills in each of us and we all felt as though we had something to offer to the shared endeavor. Everything was extremely cleverly thought out but the occasional hint lead to several eureka moments.The action is non-stop throughout and although we escaped with only 37 seconds to spare at no time did we feel under extreme pressure of frustrated.Strongly recommended for friends and family alike and although most of the photos on Instagram show young people us oldies thoroughly enjoyed it too!

A great night out!. After a quick bite to eat at a near by pub we separated in to 2 groups of 4 in a race to see who could escape quickest. Was an excellent challenge and possibly some of the best 60 minutes I have paid for :D. I would whole heartly recommend to anyone who wanted to something a little different.

Bundles of Fun. We booked 3 rooms, 4 people in each room, and had a competition to see who could escape first! It is not as easy as we thought and the hints definitely helped, every single one of us had loads of fun and we would recommend this for anyone. We all escaped within 2 minutes of each other

Disappointed. We did this in Paris last August & had a wonderful time. So returning to London last week we rebooked. However we realised the day before we were due to attend we had unfortunately booked the self same room as we had had in Paris 15 months earlier. We contacted the company & they had nothing available for us to do in place of this over the days we were there. When asked they would not refund us or give us a credit for our next visit. Very poor customer care & service.

DOH - but Superb!!. After having a few pints to train the mind at a local pub, we then proceeded to Hint Hunt. The location was easy to find and the intro just enough to get going. We were then locked into the room. What a hour we had, it was absolutely brilliant, covering emotional highs, concentration and many a DOH - Homer Simpson style. Unfortunately we failed... But the experience was superb. Will definitely go again, as we really don't like to be beaten!! Maybe next time we won't drink as much beforehand. A clearer head might have helped!!!!!

Absolutely amazing team building event . What an amazing experience. We had 4 rooms booked and the hinthunt team were amazing from booking to finish. We were unfortunately delayed by bad traffic and hinthunt were amazing and still were able to fit us in. Thank you so much for such fun. Very happy to have escaped and now am an addict until next time !!! Amazing !!!

Amazing!!. My husband and I are huge escape room nerds, and wanted to give hinthunt a go despite there only being 2 of us. They said it was ok, so we rocked up and popped in! We did the office room and did manage to get out in time, but this was definitely one of the harder rooms I've done. You can tell it's really designed for more than 2 people, we rushed to get everything done! Really well organised though, and a good flow to how it all works. We're keen to go back and do the Zen room as well!

An excellent puzzle experience, ever so slightly let down by space issues.. Hint Hunt are my benchmark for a good room escape game. I've now done both rooms (JM's Office twice!), and the rooms have a good variety of styles of puzzles (and decoys). The rooms have very thorough theming providing a very immersive experience. They're also sufficiently detailed that I found that with a decent (1 year ish) time gap I'd forgotten enough that it was still satisfying a second time around with a new team.The clue mechanism works well, not too intrusive but enough to point you in the right direction if stuck (each room has a dedicated staff member watching and listening to you who can feed hints to you if they deem it necessary).The only thing that lets down the experience is the lack of waiting space. As there's only limited briefing area that's also used for a post-game success photo (if applicable!), you're not let into the building until pretty much exactly when you're asked to be there. Luckily the weather's been good when I've gone, but it would have been a poor start to the game if the weather's bad. Likewise, some of the rooms require going outside to access the basement rooms.Here's hoping that the long-awaited third room puts in an appearance soon.

FANTASTIC!!!. Went along with friends really not knowing what I'd signed myself up for, but it was one of the best London experiences/activities that I've taken part in so far. It is so, so, so much fun and a great team building exercise. We were still talking about it hours later. I really couldn't recommend it more.

Excellent hour spent. Well worth the money.. Booked this for our family of four. Two adults and a 15 and 19 year olds. Didn't really know what to expect but have to say we all thoroughly enjoyed it. We completed the challenge with a nano second to spare. Can't wait to try the other room.

A fun different adventure. My wife and I went with another couple to do JM's Office at HintHunt. This was the second escape room game I had done (the previous one was with a different company called Time Run) and it was not quite as well produced as Time Run but was none the less really fun. The challenges were not as intricate as Time Run and the set was not as well produced but I felt there were more clues to solve and a lot more red herrings. I would have liked to have received the number of hints we needed at the end so that we could have benchmarked ourselves against others and seen a list of everyone's times. I would recommend this game to friends.

Great fun!. I bought this as a present for my boyfriend's birthday. And he absolutely loved it! We both like puzzles and as an avid gamer this was right up his street. It was also great fun to do as a couple as we learned that we both think really really differently but we're still compatible. The set-up was brilliant - locked in the room with the live clues popping up on the screen. Can definitely recommend it for a fun afternoon activity.

Best birthday present!. I love playing those silly room escape games on my IPAD so my friend took me and our boyfriends to hint hunt for my birthday. It was so much fun having to solve the murder mystery and find the clues. Definitely worth it, I can't wait to go back and try the other room!

Ridiculously fun and exciting!!. Well, I never knew being locked in a room for an hour with my sister and boyfriend could be so much fun - but it was. If you're looking for a mental (and physical - in a way) challenge then look no further. This event is brilliant for Team building, family fun, birthdays, anniversaries. Any event you can think of. It was the second time I've been there (done both of the rooms now) and if there was another room I would have already booked it. Would strongly recommend to anyone, such a unique activity and lots of fun!

Great Family Fun. This is a well designed teamwork activity - so much info & so many puzzles that you have to share information and work in parallel. The game is designed to help you advance and every puzzle solved gives the team a boost! We did this with children of 9,14,16 and everyone could contribute. The whole family want to do another room on our next trip to London.

Amazing experience!. Had a great time at hint hunt along with 3 friends!It was fun yet challenging at the same time! We didn't quite make it out in the 60 minutes but we were just 1 puzzle away from doing it!Don't want to give anything away so will keep the review short. Definitely recommend!

Best team building exercise ever!!!. We had a team building event and hired out the entire venue for ourselves. Had such an incredible time! No other experience out there like it. Great way to get to know your peers. You get locked up in a room that you almost have to turn upside down looking for clues to escape. We were all buzzing by the nd of it.
Great team building fun!. We made it out with 1 second to go! Really good fun and professionally run. I would recommend this to friends or businesses looking for a great team building exercise.

Great Fun! . I visited Hint Hunt with my best friend and our partners. It was great fun, from the moment you step into the room you don't know what to expect and the seconds count down so quickly. Loved the whole experience and can see why it has been rated so high on reviews... Can't wait to go back and experience the Zen Room now!

If you miss it, you will regret it!. Fun, fun, fun, unique experience if you happen to come to London (or to any of the other places in the world where they are also located). It is difficult to add something else to the thousands of good reviews. We did it in family with 2 teenagers who said that it was the best experience in London and they wanted to do the other room. We found the place rather easily. The staff is extremely friendly. Your host will take care of your whole experience in case you are stuck, so you don’t get desperate. It is such a creative concept. We made the terrible mistake to overlook the meeting time for 2 hours! and they were so kind to let us do it because one of the rooms was available. They told us that a third room is coming soon, so we are looking forward to doing it. Many thanks Hinthunt staff for your courtesy. Be aware, this is very addictive!!!!

Great fun at Hint Hunt. Had a brilliant time at Hint Hunt. We even managed to finish with 2.59min to spare! Book in advance and make sure you all communicate. It's hard work but such fun. The host was friendly and explained everything well. Would recommend for a group bonding activity or just some friends on a night out.

Excellent way of spending time . I booked me, partner and our 14 year old son for an hour. You are locked in a room and have to get out before your hour ends. The staff are excellent and helpful. We spent an hour finding codes, working out puzzles, solving clues making things work. Occasionally we were given a hint. Though we didn't get out in time we were stepped through the process at the end and realised how close we were. Looking forward to doing another room sometime.

Do It!. So much fun! Would recommend booking in advance. We had such a great time we wanted to play another game but they were booked. Wouldn't play with less than 4 people, that's what we played with and it was perfect! Will do again!

Awesome Evening HintHunting!. Still buzzing from last nights adventure at Hint Hunt London!Myself and 9 other work colleagues had an amazing time completing JM's Office.Staff were great and the whole experience was fantastic! I want to do it again!

Fantastic. This was our second escape room experience and definitely more challenging than the first. We had 4 people and escaped with 25 seconds left thanks to a couple of quite generous hints. The staff were fantastic and we'll definitely be back to try the second room - would definitely recommend to anyone who's on the fence about escape rooms.
Great Fun. Went as a family of 5, children range from 12-17 and that wasn't a problem. Everyone had a part to play. Great fun definitely worth booking. Going back to do the other room soon. Book it!!

Great family experience. I had been looking at lots of these escaping from a room activities in London online, trying to decide which one to book. When I finally got around to choosing this company I went to book it only to find the whole of half term week was fully booked up except one time slot so I grabbed the last one. Obviously a popular thing! I had trying to find activities online which would entertain our teenagers during our stay in London and this seemed to fit the bill. We weren't disappointed. We found the building easy enough and the friendly staff explained what we had to do before showing us to the room. For the next hour we were locked in a room and myself, my husband and our teenage son and daughter tried to solve clues, find codes and numbers to combination locks in order to open drawers to get other clues and find hidden objects around the room trying in vain to get out. The big digital timer counted down on the wall showing you how many minutes you had left and occasionally a sound would tell us that the guy watching us on cctv was giving us an extra clue to help us. We never managed to get out alone (we had to be told the 4 digit number) but we were so close apparently. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and cant wait to do another room. Definitely recommend it.

Amazing!!. I did the Detective's office and it was amazing!! I don't want to give too much away but it's definitely challenging but doable. We did manage to escape with only 1 minute to spare- so there is lots to do. The staff are very funny and helpful and I would definitely recommend this for everyone.

Excellent. Fantastic: great fun, very well put together and top staff. Facilities possibly could be more polished, but I felt it all added to the fun and faintly anarchic atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone.

First time hunters. My fourteen year old wan't keen on the idea of being locked in a room for an hour with his mum and younger brother and sister but I knew he would love the challenges inside. We were not disappointed. A novel way to distract children from their gadgets and stimulate some creative thinking.Highlight of our half term!

Fantastic. Booked this as a team building activity for my team. We were 25 people in total, split into their five escape rooms, so were able to start at the same time. It was really challenging and so so much fun. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed it, and the staff were super friendly too. 2 of our 5 teams managed to get out in the nick of time. As the clock ticks down, we were running around looking all over the place - hilarious! We all plan to go back next year when more rooms/themes are introduced. And next time I hope to escape ;-)Would love it if hinthunt offered photos similar to theme park rides, with each person's concentration face on, which could be purchased after the games. Maybe an idea they could consider.Fab event, Thank you Thank you Thank you!

Teachers on half term! . Myself and 3 school teacher friends did this as a day out in half term. I had already done the detective room & so we did the Zen room. Having done the other room about a year ago it didn't make the activity any easier or less fun, I understood the process of what was going to happen but the game was exciting & fun packed! It's such a great activity to do with friends, family or work colleagues and well worth the money, we left buzzing and felt everything we saw around us for the next hour was a clue we needed to solve! Highly recommend!

AMAZING FUN!! DO IT!. 2nd time back at Hint hunt to try the Japanese maze and we had a great time again. Such good fun, don't even know where the time goes. Hint hunt please continue to create new puzzles and keep growing, everyone should do this, you wont be disappointed!

Two players-tons of fun!. I took my mum to hinthunt for her birthdsy. I took the risk & challenge of there being just the two of us rather than the recommended 3-5.We were allocated to the zen room & absolutely loved every single second. Even though there were just the two of us I don't think our experience was any different! Staff were really great from the moment I booked & the support during the game was excellent! No we didn't escape in the time but we were very close & to be honest I don't think the outcome would have been much different if there were more of us! Time flew by & we left on such a high! Recommend 100% & my mum loved her surprise! Thanks hinthunt!

perfectly paced friday fun!. 3 of us got bought the Hint Hunt experience as a birthday present - we were all nervous that we'd be rubbish but the clues were well paced to make sure you moved along but it was never too easy or too difficult. would love to go back again!
Fun night out. Did this for our housemate's birthday and it was so much fun! The guy running the place was really friendly and it was a great night.

Another great time at HintHunt. This is the second time the family has been to HintHunt, this time taking on the Zen rooms, which are even more challenging. We had a great experience again, with one group succeeding and the other not! Failure does not detract from the fun and the stress caused by time pressure. Thoroughly recommend.

Great fun but need a stiff drink. Three of us did this. We failed the task but that did not detract from the enjoyment. We got so into it that the hour sped by. I was getting stressed out as the clock ticked!!! The welcome we got was warm and Gloria who was our games master was great. She explained what we were to experience, and then when we were locked in, made sure we were on the right track without leading us too much. I think the hints are essential. Can't believe it can be cracked without some guiding hand. I would definitely do it again (different room). I'd go with a fourth person as there is a lot to get your head around and increasing the number of eyes and brains by a third would be helpful.

Hilarious hour . I would highly recommend hint hunt. I went with my family and didn't really know what to expect. We were exhausted after a full on hour of solving puzzles and didn't stop talking about it all day.

Good fun!. We came here having heard good things from friends but really had no idea what to expect. It was an intense and confusing hour, but everything makes so much sense in hindsight! Very clever and surprisingly doable if you put your mind to it! I would recommend a group of 4 (3 and you may not finish in time, but 5 would possibly be too many people in the room). Communication is so important, and just think logically! The whole experience was really great, staff were friendly and everything ran smoothly. Would recommend as a team building activity or purely for fun with friends. We hope to return to complete the second room soon!

Best money you can spend for an hours entertainment. three of us went here after trying clue quest and loving it. We found this one harder than clue quest. Staff were really nice, enthusiastic, welcoming. fun timeswe did it with 2 seconds to spare!!!Definite recommend here!

Unique experience, finally something different to do in London . This was great fun, a well organised escape hunt. The objective is to try and escape from the room us in a series of clues.. Don't want to give too much away. We went as a group of two but we would highly advise a team of minimum 3-5 as there are a lot of steps involved in escaping.

Great fun!. HintHunt is a very well run attraction in London designed for groups of 3-5 in a 'room'. I went in a larger group of 13 where we were split into 3 different rooms. The concept is a puzzle solving story based game. The session lasts 1 hour, in which the objective is to solve a lot of sub-puzzles (some very ingenious) and a final puzzle to enable exit from the room.We all found this great fun. A lot of energy was used, along with a lot of talking and a great deal of lateral thinking.Have a few beers beforehand, and go along for a different experience. We will be going back to do the other rooms!
Great team building. We did this as a team building challenge and it worked really well. The team gave great feedback after a great experience. Would definitely recommend.
Smashed the record... almost. Went for a team building activity and this place was phenomenal! Challenging puzzles, friendly staff and a nice pub next door to wait in whilst out other group finished

Great fun and lovely staff. HintHunt was great fun. I went with four friends from school, following a fun experience at another escape room game on holiday. We had to book a couple of months in advance (this seems to be a must for a Friday or a Saturday, even with two separate games or 'rooms' to choose from) but the wait was definitely worth it. Our gamemaster (Beatrix) was friendly and fun, and explained the game very clearly before we started. The game itself ('JM's Office') was great fun and enjoyed by all. We escaped with around 90 seconds to go, and will definitely be back to try the other ('Zen') room!

Five Samurai. We attended HintHunt as a birthday surprise that I organised for my boyfriend; none of us really knew what to expect so it was really exciting discovering it all and we all had a great laugh. I really think the activity depends on the people you are with. It was explained to us well enough without giving too much away and there was enough different things for us to be doing so that we were all kept busy throughout. It had elements for all us so we could all get involved and as the time was ticking down it did get more and more nerve-wracking and exciting. Yes there were elements that were quite hard so a clue came in helpful every now and then but all in all it worked well and it turned out great. We finished with just over a minute left and it felt so good when we managed to escape. We would al definitely recommend and want to do another very soon

Great kickoff activity for stag weekend. This escape room (London's first?) proved a perfect first activity for a recent stag weekend breaking the ice and helping different groups of the stag's friends from getting to know each other.The escape room is great - more twists than other escape rooms I've visited - and the space we in was perfect for 3-6 people just as advertised. Would recommend for any group of friends looking for a team building style activity, or just to see the competitive side of people come out!Well worth the money, great location between Kings Cross and Euston, and with two good pubs just a few doors down for pre/post-hinthunt beers.

Really great afternoon. We booked Hint Hunt as something to do when my boyfriend's Mum came to visit that was a bit different from our usual theatre visits. All of us had a great time. We played as a group of 5, aged from mid-20s to mid-50s and we all thought the game was excellent.The team at Hint Hunt are superb, making you feel welcome and relaxed immediately upon arrival, and taking time to explain the game really well including some useful tips on common pitfalls!Would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for an engaging and fun group activity, it was well worth the price and I would love to do another one of their game rooms.

Top Fun - Worth an Hour of Anyone's Life. Can't give too much away without spoiling it. But 4 of us had a great time and it kept us happy for a few hours later too. Not too difficult but not too easy...

Very fun afternoon. Played as a group of four twenty-somethings. The game started with a quick introduction and some essential tips for playing (i.e. this is also meant to be enjoyable for families with children so don't think too complicated, a clue we sometimes forgot during the game). After the intro we were let into the room and locked in an had to search for clues for how to get out - if stuck or following too far with a red herring, our game master would nudge us into the right direction again. The beginning was really good, and the only clues we needed were very simple (look in drawer again, you missed something) but then towards the end of the game the game master got a little more hint-happy and at times I felt like we weren't given enough time to figure things out on our own, and often the hint would come just as we'd thought of it but hadn't had time to act on yet. Overall still, most hints involved a missing item because we hadn't looked hard enough and not how to solve the puzzle once we had the pieces, so we still felt like we were playing the game and the only help was to make sure we had everything we needed to figure it out. Made it out in time with 1:30min to spare!Perhaps stretching the time limit to 1h15min would let players complete the game on their own without as much help from the game master.

62 Minutes Well Spent With Family. HintHunt London provided my wife, mom, and two daughters a fun-filled and ultimately victorious afternoon. Set inconspicuously in a small storefront opposite Euston Station, HintHunt is staffed with friendly folks who go to great lengths to create an enjoyable experience. The game room is small, but comfortable even with five participants. The puzzles demand cooperation, teamwork, and an open mind, with everyone of all abilities capable of contributing to the solutions. The one-hour game clock ticks away quickly -- and since this was our first visit -- the HintHunt team thankfully granted us an extra two minutes to solve our final clue and escape the room. We'll be visiting London regularly over the next four years while our older daughter attends university there, and most certainly have plans to challenge another HintHunt room in the future.

A thoroughly enjoyable experience, which I would unreservedly recommend. We were given this as a gift and it turned out to be one of the best presents we've had. We were made really welcome on arrival, everything was clearly explained to us, nothing was hurried or too much trouble.We were locked into a room and then had to search, research, solve puzzles and use clues to discover keys and passwords to unlock the door. We had a tv screen which showed a countdown from 60 minutes and a whiteboard to use to write notes on. Occasionally the tv would play a little tune and we were given a hint to help move us on.Near the end of the hour, we were very close to finishing, so we were given an extra 2 minutes and were thrilled to 'escape' 20 seconds over the hour. We escaped from the Zen room, but are planning to return soon and try the Office.
Def worthwhile!. So much fun! Makes your brain think. Was talking about for long afterwards.Would definitely return to do again.

Wouldn't call it an Escape Game. I found Hint Hunt on the escape games section on Trip Advisor and booked as I'm on an escape game marathon. We played JM's office which started off well but then things got complicated 10 mins in and we basically turned the room upside down. Items were randomly put in places you would never find and we were given clues literally every 2 minutes telling us what to do. We were then just following orders which never gave us a sense of achievement as we were told exactly where things were, where to put them, etc. . We only just managed to complete the game with seconds remaining however it was not an escape but placing the final item in a box ended the game. I didn't feel excited throughout the experience, I would say a bit frustrating and disappointed as we were never given the chance to put our minds to the test.

Exciting and challenging!. My daughter asked to go to this for her 10th birthday. We took one of her friends and went along. At first everyone was slightly apprehensive but once we got into the game, we all got very excited and competitive. It is a good mental workout and the children loved it. They are good at thinking outside the box, so they found a lot of the clues. Great fun!
Great Fun. This is a great way to spend an hour or so , staff are really freindly and helpful and the 'adventure' is such fun, will definitly be trying the Zen room next

Fantastic!. This was our second visit to HintHunt. This time we had two of the Zen rooms. Just as good as the office scenario. Well worth a visit if you like escape games. Just the right amount of challenge and hints to get you out in time. Really friendly and helpful staff.

Excellent work night out!. I booked a few rooms at HintHunt for a work team night out and it was fantastic! We had to book 5 rooms (2 Zen rooms and 3 JM's Office) and every group came out buzzing, as everyone escaped with less than a minute to spare - with one group literally having 1 second left on the clock!It really is a fun night out and I would definitely recommend it, especially for a team bonding experience. I was in a group who did one of the offices, but I'll definitely be going back to try one of the Zen rooms.

Had a brilliant time. We were newbies to this whole thing, whilst our friends had been before but in a different room. We found ourselves in the Zen room and would recommend this to everyone. It's a simple concept, yet utterly engrossing. Do not take anything for granted or assume anything either.Looking forward to our next visit...

Escaped in time!. I mean how much can you really write about this place without giving the game away - actually probably a lot because it certainly isn't easy! I went with my partner and two other friends and had the most amazing time - we were talking about it for such a long time after. Can't wait to go back and do the other room. We escaped with 1.42 mins left on the clock - not bad, not bad! Just incredible, thanks HintHunt!!

Hinthunt fun!. Great experience!! We did the office room first about a year ago and we succeeded with a few minutes to spare.
