We then did the Zen room this week, it was much harder but still exhilarating. I would just say that the moderator could have helped us a bit more as it was quite hard and we spent so much time on 1 game (I won't name it so that I don't spoil the surprise). It would have been nice to get more clues at this stage so that we were not stuck too long on the same thing. Overall a very good game to keep your brain alive!!
fab. Fab idea, have done both rooms, can't wait for them to add another..loads of fun, Highly recommend.

After doing the Detective Room in Paris, now the Zen room in London. HintHunt does it all right. We've done escape rooms in numerous countries, and HintHunt is right near the top as far as great rooms. Don't ignore anything! We split our family into 2 rooms or 3 people (both Zen) and made it a race. Both teams escaped, one with 1second left.Always a highlight of our trips.

Superb. This was our second time at HuntHunt's, this time we went for the Zen Room! it was Superb! do not miss this if your'e in London. hard-but-balanced puzzles and riddles, very well decorated, themed and built, and of course, Very friendly, proffesional and energetic staff. go go go!

Great time!. We went this weekend with my two boys, 9 & 12 and we all loved it! We did The Office. The clues are very well hidden (saying that, my younger son was very good at finding them, although not at solving them. I would say that you definitely need some adults in the group as it was very difficult. The hour went too quickly! My boys are already talking about going back to do the Zen room.

Best Hour Of Our Trip. We absolutely loved this! I have to admit, as we pulled up to the door in a cab, to this very innocuous building on a street near Kings Cross, I was a bit dubious but, once we got going, this turned out to be huge fun. We had a party of three, although with one being ill and another one tending to her, we were substantially down in the brains we could apply to this. Without giving too much away, this is basically a mystery you have to solve, by figuring out clues left in the room in which they lock you. As the name suggests, they watch and listen through cameras and microphones and provide you with hints as you go along, so that there's no opportunity to get completely frustrated. You'll start with lots of things to look at, and you will start to figure out questions to ask and puzzles to complete, many of which are highly interrelated. The key to this is communication - always be telling the rest of your team what you're doing, and don't necessarily all follow the same clue. Because there's a clock on the wall counting down the hour that you're in there, the pressure is on and it makes it really fun, especially towards the end when you have the gist of it and are closing in on clues thick and fast. Our only regret, other than the unplanned illness, is that we did this on our last day. Had we done it earlier, we would have absolutely come back to do it again. Fantastic time, totally recommended. We had three adults (one in a wheelchair) and two teens. I would say any group could do this, but you'll need a reasonable command of English and ideally have at least four people actively participating.

Fantastic - like being in crystal maze mental challenge - only better. We did the Hint Hunt at Euston, Evershalt Road today (afternoon) for my son's 25th birthday. It was brilliant! The team member was really welcoming and clear in all her instructions and did great job (Beatrix). The experience itself was amazing - but of course i cant share details or it would ruin it for others. Suffice to say you are locked in a room with lots of puzzles/clues to solve in an hour in order to win and get let out . It was like a crystal maze mental challenge only far better! Would definitely recommend this if you have a team of 2-5 friends and like this kind of challenge. It's quite expensive but a very memorable hour and we came out with big smiles all round (we solved it with 35 seconds to go!)

Worth the money. We were 4 friends playing, which was what they recommended. Got a short introduction and we went down into the room. I've never played a escape game before, and neither had my friends. It was very fun and extremely difficult if we haven't got clues from the staff. We nearly finished, got very close!Overall a unique experience, very fun and challenges your logical intelligence and teamwork! Fun way to spend a hour!

Totally brilliant !!!. What a fabulous idea. We took our two teenage sons and neice as a surprise a few weeks back to Hint Hunt. A little nervous that they would nt like it, boy was I wrong. They loved it. Iwould highly recommend this to all ages, a very exciting experiance.

Interesting way to spend an hour.... Not being one to normally participate in such attractions such as the Hint Hunt, having read all of the positive reviews we arrived at the venue looking forward to it, but without having a clue, (literaly,) as to what to expect. The venue itself is a mere 2-3 minute walk from Euston station, and easily found on the opposite side of the road to station. Upon entering the venue, we were greeted by our enthusiastic host, who explained exactly what we could expect, and also the mandatory safety rules. Moving swiftly into the murder room, the next hour passed in a blur. It would be inappropriate of me to give the game away but I can confim that everybody thoroughly enjoyed the experience and we actually managed to escape with a minute and a half to spare. Big shout out to our host who was supplying hints as and when needed...she kept it challenging and interesting. Top marks too to the team that hides the clues...they must have had fun thinking up some of those hiding places!Looking forward to the zen room on our next visit.

Great way to spend 60 minutes. We did Hint hunt as a family of 3 and what a great time we had. The introduction to the game was clear and informative. Don't want to give anything away about the murder mystery room only to say it beat us!!Gloria our guide was fantastic and very helpful. We can't wait to go back and do the Zen Room!

Really Fun Game! Will 100% Go Back. We went for my sisters birthday! The game was extremely fun and difficult! The staff were very friendly, will 100% recommend and will go back to try the other room!

Brilliant start to an evening. We booked HintHunt as 3 work colleagues and our partners, not really knowing what to expect. It was a fantastic hour of fun and challenge which gave us plenty to discuss and laugh about afterwards. Thoroughly recommend this to friends, colleague and families.

Fun with the girls. We have done a couple of escape games before, this wasn't the best, nor the worst. We played the Zen room. There are a few wow factors in the room but not enough for it to be amazing. All in all a good experience.We were disappointed not to get a photo at the end!

Great work day out, really fun and refreshing. We booked Hint Hunt as part of a work day out. None of us knew what to expect but within seconds of arriving, excitement built and we all really enjoyed it. It's challenging and an awesome way to build team spirit. Only 50% of people manage to solve Hint Hunt and make it out of the room in time, having managed to get out with 14 seconds to go I can definitely say the adrenaline rush and excitement of working together to solve a mystery is 100% worth it.

A fun hour. I took my team to HintHunt not really sure what to expect. We split into two teams doing the same tests to see which could finish & get out first. You do need to work as a team & you do have to work fast, as the hour is gone in an instant. Lots of clues, locks, passwords etc, some meaningful, others red herrings, just add to the buzz of finding yet another key or combination that allows you to move forward.In all everyone enjoyed the hour at HintHunt, it certainly gets the heart & senses going.

Stimulating and enjoyable start to a day out in London. Four of us took part in this escape challenge; we are good friends and work well together, which is essential. Problems have to be solved by searching for clues and using items and information discovered to reveal further, connected clues. The game lasts an hour, and hints may be given (or not) by a hidden observer to keep the game rolling and, probably, to make things last approximately that time. We had an excellent time, and the enthusiastic explanations of the member of staff we dealt with helped to make it a brilliant, fun experience

Excellent fun, really engaging and entertaining. We visited with two groups, seven children, two adults. Was a bit dubious at first but HintHunt came highly recommended by friends. And.... It's brilliant. Just brilliant. Couldn't believe the time went so quickly. Kids ranged in age from 10-17 and they were all engrossed. This would be great for corporate team building too. Don't want to give too much away but I wholeheartedly recommend and will be returning.

Energizing and refreshing team event!. Had 4 teams play the game last week and everyone loved it. After a hard day at work it refreshed all of us. Great way to build team spirit and have fun at the same time. It is not an easy game though and a lot of work has been put in to build the scripts, themes and the game materials. Highly recommended!

Brilliant! Such a fantastic idea!. Hint hunt is a brilliant day out. I read the reviews before I went but it went well over my expectations. The clues were tough but it was great fun and the hints helped massively. The 60 minutes went so quickly. We are already looking at possible dates to try the other room. Would highly recommend this. We got out with 1 minute 12 seconds to spare!!! Excellent day out for friends and/or family.

Really good fun and exciting. We went as a group of 9 and were split into a 4 and a 5. One person on each team had been before but not done the same room, so we knew roughly what to expect but no details.There is a vague premise that someone has been murdered (in the room we completed) but really, you're looking for clues/items and then trying to work out how it all fits together. You have 60 minutes to get out of the room and your remaining time is shown on a screen.Initially the team just needs to search and things then start to fall into place. After 6 minutes or so we had cracked our first clue and there was a period where we pieced several aspects together in quick succession. This isn't always the case and when you hit roadblocks or start going down a wrong path, hints are flashed up on the screen in the room. These are designed to give you enough of a guide, but not too much. It seems that there is a definite goal to get you feeling like you're pretty much there with 10 minutes or so to go. The last 10-15 were certainly very exciting and everyone was totally immersed by then. Cheering ensues for each clue passed and there's a real sense of tension in the air.We got out in 56 minutes and 33 seconds. Only about 50% of people actually manage it and the record is something like 53 minutes so we were pleased all in all!Naturally, as 2 groups we were competing with one another and this stimulated lots of chat afterwards over a few beers.I would heartily recommend this to anyone for a bit of fun and even to businesses for team building purposes!

Harder than you might think!. This was great fun. Generally speaking we knew what to expect although some of the puzzle solutions are very obscure (like the very last thing you do to open the door...). Also the back story is hard to follow and not really relevant to the experience. There's someone watching and listening in on your attempt to escape so if you get stuck the phone rings and a hint appears on a TV screen. We had something like 5-10 hints throughout and got out with 2 mins to spare. Would be very interested to know how long it would take with no hints! Will definitely do the other room set up at some point.
Brilliant. This was great, we had a vague idea of what to expect and it far exceeded that. Lots of tough clues and puzzles and so much fun. Very friendly helpful staff, defiantly recommend.

Brilliant family fun. Great fun, brilliant at uniting everyone to work together , recommend it to anyone especially with teenage children . Friendly staff who are very helpful. Looking forward to trying out the new rooms when they are up and running

Great fun. You get one hour to get out of a room to escape. You have to get several clues and keys hidden around the room. It's fun. Good for teenagers to get their teeth into but young children may find hard or boring. Only shame is once your hour is up the 'hint hunt master' comes in and shows what you missed. Even if your almost finished.

My Family Loved This. Took my husband and kids (15 and 12) here as part of a fun day out in London for my son's birthday, and we loved it. It's so hard to surprise kids with something fun and interesting these days, but HintHunt hit the spot. We did the James Murdoch room which was very hard. We got out with 27 seconds to spare! I hadn't known quite what to expect before we arrived but was very pleasantly surprised. Great people in support. Recommended.

This is a tough escape room!. I have done quite a few escape rooms now and I can say that this one is tough! Can't say too much because I don't want to give it away but they are very crafty. We made it out as a pair with 47 seconds to spare. Very fun, will be back to do the other room.
Loved it!. I took my team here for some fun team-building and they all absolutely loved it. I would wholeheartedly recommend this. The team were talking about it for hours afterwards!

A surprisingly brilliant afternoon!. After my colleagues at work booked this as an activity to do together, I have to be honest I was reluctant to go along. I didn't really understand what it was about and it seemed like it was going to be quite stressful.But I have to say it turned out to be one of best activities I have done in a long time! It was well thought out, slightly frustrating at times, but as the name suggests, a member of the HintHunt team is watching you and dropping hints via a tv screen as and when he/she feels you need it.I throughly recommend HintHunt - it really is worth doing. My suggestion is going in a group of 4 or 5 likeminded people and if you are willing to listen to each other and work as a team - it is such good fun! So much so we went back and did the other room as soon as we could.
Brilliant afternoon!. I was bought this as a Mother's Day gift. Can't recommend it highly enough we all - 2 adults and 3 children aged 12-17 - loved it. A real family bonding experience!

Great fun. I hadn't heard of HintHunt until I was given entrance as a gift for Fathers Day, which we used during the school summer holidays. The concept is quite simple: You're locked in a room and asked to solve a series of clues which will unlock the door and free you. I can't say too much without spoiling the game for others, but what a great hour we had. Time flew by and all of us (me, my wife and two young daughters 12 & 14) thoroughly enjoyed it, talking about it for ages after. There are two rooms and we chose the 'office' game. We will soon book up to do the 'zen room' game. We were also told they will be soon launching a third 'submarine' room, so no doubt we will do that one too. Good fun.

What a fantastic thing to do in central London!. We had the most amazing night for my boyfriend's birthday. We went along not really knowing what to expect but we were astounded by how quickly the time passed but also by just how much you had to think! We got out with 35 seconds to spare! I would highly recommend it to anyone!

So competitive!. Loved it! Really competitive. Our "quiz master" was lovely, friendly and made us laugh. We completed it with 41 seconds to spare on the clock. Would love to come back and try the other room!

"The Fastest Hour of Your Life". Three friends and I went to HintHunt not knowing what to expect - one of my friends did try to Google some tips beforehand and found very little! The secrecy around this escape room game is all part of the fun, so I won't say too much except to say we LOVED our race against the clock to get out of the room. We were a bit worried taking part would reveal our ineptitude to use logic - and if this is you too, please don't be put off - anyone can have a go at HintHunt, and if you get really stuck your Games Master will provide you with 'hints' when totally desperate. Before we went in we were briefed and told the hour that followed would be the fastest hour of our lives. It was. But it was also time well spent. HintHunt went beyond all our expectations - we can't wait to go back and try the other room!

This was amazing!. The puzzles are really well thought out and probably around the right level of difficulty. Help is at hand if you need it - don't feel bad about needing it - there are A LOT of things to work out and find!Our Hint Hunt Staffer Tom was super-informative with the induction and a lovely man.We got out with 48 seconds to spare, which we were pleased about! Awesome fun, all four of us enjoyed it. If I could erase my memory to go and do it again I would! :)Would make an ideal birthday gift for someone, or maybe an unusual hen/stag activity. Five stars!

Fantastic way to spend time in a Sunday. . We when as two couples and had a fantastic time. Once you find your starting point the fun just keeps on coming. We did the JM office hunt and really want to go back to do the Zen room. To the person/people that come up with these hunts two massive thumbs up!!! We will be back!

Awesome fun filled hour.. We had no preconceptions going in and actually that made the whole experience even more exciting. Once there the staff were really upbeat, fun and engaging. Its an incredibly well thought out game and just great wholesome fun for everyone. I thoroughly recommend.
Birthday Treat - Amazing!. Had an absolutely cracking time, thoroughly recommend. Not for people with poor eyesight though. Would definitely go again.

So much more fun than expected!. I organised this as our work summer party, splitting people up into two teams and booked JM's offices so we did the same challenge. We couldn't stop talking about it in the pub afterwards - who found what clue, where we got stuck. It was a blast!

Fab and fun. I went here with my family and had a really good evening. We got out with under a minute to spare! There's enough going on to keep all 5 team members busy and involved and the staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Crazy good fun. When the cab dropped us off in front of a questionable looking building that looked slightly more suited to a Laundromat or massage parlor, I got a little worried that maybe I had under-researched the experience. But the super-charming guy who explained the game to us eased my concerns. And from the second we were locked in the room, whoa!, the race was on. My two companions and I launched into a frenzied hour of trying to figure out clues, hints, and cooperation. It was an unmitigated blast. If we could have, we would have booked back in for the next day.

Something different and fantastic fun. Did Hint Hunt in a team of 4, the staff were extremely friendly and answered all of our questions. It took us a while to get going but once we did the hour soon flew by and we had a great time. Once finished we wanted to do it all over again and will certainly be booking again to complete the Zen room.
Hen do activity. Came here as part of my hen do. What a brilliant hour it was! The staff are very friendly and helpful. Very clever and what a buzz when you crack the last clue! Thanks HintHunt!

Something different. If you have nothing else to do in London and have a hour to spare with a few friends then try HintHunt. The aim is to get out of a room by solving a series of puzzles with hints and hidden clues. The briefing from the staff was OK, but took a little while to get the jist of the experience. My group was OK once we got into the zone, took just under the allowed 60mins to escape. As a one off it was OK but much better attractions to see in the city.

Fantastic way to spend an hour.. I did this with a group of friends aged 11, 13, 41, 43 and 45. We all contributed and had a great time-this one is for the whole family. At first you have no idea what the hell you are doing but it starts to become clear and you become frantic!!!We had a great time and I will definitely return to do another room. Can't recommend enough!

What a great concept - highly recommend. Even the anticipation is exciting.....the staff were really informative and fun and patient, considering they must say the same thing hundreds of times over, you would never know.Can't say any more without giving away 'clues' but I would recommend as a fun and interesting thing to do with friends/family and would make a super gift.

A fantastic team activity. I booked for myself and my team at work to do HintHunt - four of us in total. We found it to be a really great team building activity.The chap who was our "host" was really great at engaging us from the start, he gave us a full briefing beforehand and was very welcoming and friendly. The activity was the perfect level for us - challenging but not impossible - and it was such a a good way for us to spend time as a team. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for an interesting team building activity.

Great fun!. Our team at work did this as part of a night out which worked really well. We split into two teams of 4 and went head to head with losers being made to suffer in the pub next door afterwards! A challenging event which everybody can take part in - would definately do this again.

Excellent escape room game for beginners and beyond!. This was the first escape room game that I attempted and it got me hooked! Having now done a fair few around the world I would put HintHunt right up there with the best I've done. We had a group of three and had a blast, getting out with a thrilling 28 seconds left. One of the definite highlights was the way they deliver hints on a tv screen I found it much less intrusive compared to many other similar places.
Really fun... but hard!. Really enjoyed it, definitely challenging & fully time pressured. Really great activity to do with our colleagues as a fun team building activity.

Well crafted room, challenging and fun. We booked 2 Zen Rooms (2 x 3 people). Both of us JUST managed to finish. The rooms were very well crafted, but a great variety of challinging puzzles and hidden objects to search for. We had good fun and were well taken care of (service-wise). Would recommend!

Good fun. My husband and I did this with our 13 & 15 year old. They both had a great time even though the 13 year old doesn't have an inherent interest in solving puzzles. We did not solve the game but it didn't matter it was the process that was fun. This is a great team effort and a nice way to connect with friends and family. It was one of the highlights of the kids trip to London. Our guide for the game was engaging, fun and informative - we enjoyed his hints through out the game that kept us moving forward. They are located near a metro station - only a two minute walk so easy access. The area it's self has a few "girlie" shops so not a great area to hang out with kids but we found a bar with outdoor seating while we were waiting for our start time.

Brilliant Fun. A really fun way to spend an hour (if you don't get locked in of course). It's well organised and offered a real challenge without it ever getting frustrating. We can't wait to return to try out the other room, brilliant.

Great fun for the whole family. We were two families who split into 2 teams to take on the challenge. Website and booking process was very straightforward. Welcome was good and did a good job of building up the excitement and tension before we were let loose in the rooms. Success rate was claimed at 50% and both of us made it out although one team with only 6 seconds to spare! Highly recommended!

Something different and so much fun. We went with friends on Saturday night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hour went by in a flash we were having so much fun. So cleverly done. We will definitely go back and try the other room.

Absolutely brilliant - loved every minute...and 60 of them really counted!. My husband and I were bought this as a present by my brother- and sister-in-law. I was a bit sceptic at first as really didn't understand but this added to the excitement. AMAZING. Loved every minute of it. Thom was an amazing host and explained everything SO WELL. Working as a team of 4, it was brilliant. A definite MUST for all puzzle solving people and we smiled and laughed all day reminiscing what we did (or didn't do!) If you are thinking about it, think no more - do it and you will not be disappointed!

Amazing experience, great value for money. Wasn't entirely sure what to expect but turned up as email had specified and staff were friendly and welcoming. Instructions were clear and it was a challenging but fun way to spend an hour! Would highly recommend as a team building activity or alternative to a coffee with friends! Five stars.

Great Team Building Fun!. Four friends went into the zen room in July 2015, and spent 59.20 seconds trying to get out!! Really interesting game, with lots of challenging puzzles to work through. Gloria - our host - was very good at explaining everything and setting the scene and was able to make us feel comfortable enough with all information needed for the game. Can't give too much away, but can say this is the second 'escape the room' type activity I have done and thoroughly enjoyed this one - brilliant set up, slick service and very enjoyable. Would certainly recommend for small groups that want something different. Well worth the £96 we paid. Great location too.

Wonderful thing to do for London visitors and tourists. My wonderful sister in law took us here as something different to do ... It was the best and most memorable part of our short time in London.As a first time visitor and after weeks of sightseeing Europe, doing this was a refreshing change from the usual tourist activities. It's certainly not your normal 'mystery' activity and highly recommended.
Brilliant . Had lots of fun, although one hour seems like a long time, it went really quickly! Would definitely recommend it and would go again to try out the other room!

HintHunt is absolutely amazing!. HintHunt is a very well thought out puzzle, where you have to escape from a room. I enjoyed it massively and spent an amazing hour in the room. My family and I really enjoyed it and managed to get out with just two seconds to spare. If you have an hour or two free time in London I would strongly recommend going to HintHunt.

Great, great fun!. My Mum and sister had already done their other room (Detectives Room) but it was brand new to me and I must say I absolutely loved it. We didn't manage to 'escape' the Zen room within the one hour limit but were very close! The level of challenge was high, without it feeling impossible. There were a range of different games and tasks to suit people with different interests, skills and abilities. The welcome chat and post-debrief were both friendly, informative and helpful. The tips on the computer screen throughout were invaluable and are what makes the experience. The only thing I would say is that the price seemed quite steep for what it was. I know there must be a level of upkeep and maintenance but I do feel more people would go (I know it's already popular!) if the prices were lower. They may put some people off. Even if there were some discounts every now and again perhaps...

Laughed so much. Have been before and would go again as well - the best thing to do in London by far! Something there for everyone. Had a great time with my family and was a brilliant way to break the ice and introduce the boyfriend to the madness of my loved ones.

Great fun for all the family!. Best way you can spend an hour, the adrenaline rush you get as the clock counts down is like nothing else. The room is very well set up and you get totally immersed in the experience. My only issues was the entrance/waiting area is very small, but that is forgivable, given the amount of fun you will have.

Great fun for four. Not wishing to give much away this was a really fun hour (plus pre and post briefings) of solving a mystery using a range of observation, creativity, puzzle-solving, imagination and little of bit of applied knowledge. We did it with four people which seemed an ideal number.The time flew by. Mentally draining, so it's lucky it was only a short walk to the Euston Tap for a pint afterwards.

Terrific fun. Did HintHunt for first time last night as a group of four. Didn't quite know what to expect - and even when it started we did not really know what it was that we were meant to be solving - BUT that's all part of the experience. Cleverly it all starts to unfold and makes sense, like an unravelling mystery. The game gradually picks up the pace and you really start to feel the pressure to crack the clues as the clock counts down - till the last few minutes when it actually got quite frenzied! In our case we didn't make it out in time and it probably would have taken us another 15 minutes - but it really can be done, and the guys do help you along. We came out totally on a high, saying how much we all loved it and want to do it again! Terrific, unusual experience. Defy anyone not to enjoy it.

First escape experience.. I'll definitely return!. This was my first experience of an escape room type game and I would definitely recommend it! We went as a group of 12 colleagues and split into 3 teams. You're locked in a room for 60 minutes and have to find your way out by searching for clues, objects etc. There's a screen in the room that shows 'hints' should you really struggle.. which at times, we did! A simple concept but put together so well. I've been wanting to return to try out one of the other rooms but the weekends are always booked out, my advice is to book well in advance!
Good, but better in London. Worth a visit but if youve only got time to go to one or two escape rooms in London there are better places to go

A brilliant way to spend an hour. A great combination of fun and using the 'little grey cells'!. We really enjoyed the whole experience which was enhanced by the very friendly staff who seemed to genuinely care that we had fun and escaped! We are already planning to return to do the other 'room'.

The most fun you can have in 60 mins . If you are thinking of doing this, don't hesitate. I went with my sister and a few friends for her birthday. The man looking after us was informative and friendly. It was great fun, lots of puzzles and using your brain in a way you didn't think was possible. We completed the challenge with 45 seconds to spare. It made for a great talking point in the pub afterwards. We went as a group of 5 and I wouldn't recommend any less than 4. Just give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

So much fun and incredibly well put together!. An enjoyably different way to spend an evening with friends/family/colleagues. Great for those with a competitive streak and who love to be mentally challenged.

Brilliant game, whole group left excited!. Tried this with a stag party of 12 and HintHunt's 3 identical rooms allowed us to have teams of 4 race each other at the same time. The staff were friendly and helfpful. Great way to kick off a fun day as everyone left enlivened!

LOVED our visit to Hint Hunt Euston!. This is the live version of the popular Escape Games available from the app store. Our visit started with a quick briefing on fire regs etc and we were told that they would be watching and listening to us via CCTV monitors both for health and safety reasons and also to offer hints when needed. To this end, there was a computer monitor in the room that would beep at us with a typed hint if we were barking up the wrong tree. Then we were locked in a room to solve puzzles and find clues in order to escape. We had an hour and needed every bit of that, in fact we escaped with just 30 seconds to spare! I purchased this adventure at Hint Hunt for my dad's 62nd birthday for him, my mum, 2 (adult) sisters and me. This has been the best present I've ever bought him. We all had so much solving puzzles and working together, what a fun and memorable evening. We will definitely go back for the 2nd room and I cannot recommend this highly enough. Enjoy.

I have done both rooms and wish they had more!. A unique activity in London that brings out your inner child and competitiveness. The rooms are well executed and really make you think and use your brain. Yes its short and we all wish it was longer but hey that's the name of the game and the reason its so fun! If you don't get out in time don't worry, I read reviews of people complaining that it should be longer but then it would lose its edge...If you are close to solving it they will let you stay in a little longer, me and my friends got an extra 3 minutes and we solved it....the second time I went back to do the other room we made it within 56minutes. So much fun, thank you Hint Hunt for the experience, I definitely will be back when you launch a new room!

Best time ever, we came for the second room the same day. My wife, 11 yo and 15 yo sons had a blast! Working against time, solving puzzles and riddles, lying under tables, screaming, laughing, thinking hard and having great fun

Be quick!. This is great fun. You need to be very quick as every second counts! The idea and set up of this game is fantastic and very well done.The only thing I would say is that the clues you get from the staff are not great - they are too obvious. Basically, if you don't advance in the game or are too slow they start throwing hints at you, and that way you can pretty much just stumble through the game with their help and not using your brain or creativity.I would much rather have an extra 30 minutes and solve the problems without help as this can be done, but you will need little bit more time. The fact that you will need staff support to get through the game within an hour kind of kills the idea.I will definitely try a different room as I truly enjoyed this.
Great fun for all ages. A great challenge enjoyed by the whole family! Lots of puzzles to solve in less than an hour -- with the occasional hint from the moderator. Fantastic fun!

Great fun!. This was a present for my birthday so was a little unsure what was going to happen. We were in the zen room. It was great fun however we were unable to exit within the hour! Great concept and were well executed, the staff were very good.

Got out with 3 min to spare!. This is highly recommended. I wont tell you much about the contents, but let's say I've tried both rooms and would encourage a group of friends or family to come here. You can even race another group if you have enough people to get out. The rooms are full of puzzles, clues and red herrings to fill the hour. Well worth it!

fantastic enjoyed by 18 year old and 50 years olds. I bought this xmas before last for my sons and theor 4 cousins who all did the JM rooms they all enjoyed it so much that I booked again for xmas present for them all and they did the Zen rooms and we parents also joined them with their girlfriends so we did the JM room so in all 4 rooms of us and everyone enjoyed it and all want to do again (original 6 are waiting for new ones to be added!). Really great experience great fun.

A Classic Escape Game and one of London's first. I have to confess that a small group of my friends and I have become slightly escape room addicts... So having done a few of them I felt it just be helpful to offer a few reviews.This was the first escape game we tried and it was the one which got us hooked. I believe it was also one of the first ones in London. The pacing was perfect, the puzzles clever and challenging, and the guide (from Hungry where the idea originally came from) was enthusiastic and fun.What we liked about this escape room was that although there were no high tech puzzles, computer generated challenges, or special effects (as there are in time run) everything was decidedly low tech but really carefully considered and well done. We also liked that there was a subtle underlying story behind the challenge.Would recommend!

Best 60 minutes you can buy!. Brilliant experience! If you love problem solving then this is definitely for you. Thank you team Hint Hunt for making us feel like kids again! Will definitely be back to try another room

Amazing challenge. Leaves you wanting more!!! Staff very friendly and helpful and thankfully, as we didn't manage to finish within the hour, showed us just how close we were! :) will definitely be back!

HintHunt JM Room. Went with a group of five for my birthday as several rave reviews from friends and family. It lived up to expectations, absolutely brilliant and can't wait to go and try the Zen room then the up and coming submarine room - totally hooked!

Amazing . Have been wanting to at HintHunt for a while finally booked up with work colleagues and wasn't disappointed. It really is quite a fun and incredibly frustratingly good experience!We were in JMs office and definitely want to return to Zen Room as it was so much fun, great team work, exciting, frustrating, rewarding and fun time we've had!I don't want to give anything away, as you should just experience it for yourself. So worth it. Go and check it out!We didn't get out in the time, but was so much fun it didn't matter!

60 Minutes of Fun Fun Fun!. Went here as part of a team building exercise with my work colleagues and it was genuinely one of the best things I've ever done. It was seriously good fun. If you like solving puzzles and enjoyed watching Crystal Maze, this is without doubt going to be right up your street. I already want to go back!

Great team building game!. I went here with my colleagues for a team building event. We chose this Escape game because it was one of the higher rated games on Trip Advisor. Neither myself or my colleagues has done anything like this before and we all had fun and already planning our next escape hunt! Thank you Hint Hunt for a great day out. Would highly recommend!

Enjoying HintHunt London. If you have a family like mine who enjoys puzzles and games, this is a perfect stop to include in your trip to London. One hour in your choice of room gives you the opportunity as a family to work together to solve clues and puzzles so you can escape in a maximum of 1 hour. We chose the Zen room and thoroughly enjoyed testing our wits against the variety of puzzles and situations we had to work through, solving them and getting out in time.

Excellent challenge for anyone who fancies themselves able to search a room. This was my second visit to HintHunt, having enjoyed their first room quite a while ago. The Zen Room was another good challenge, a mixture of searching and problem solving. While I wish (for my pride) that they didn't need to give you hints to solve the room, we would have failed without them, and with them we finished just within the time, so it's very well balanced.
THE MOST FUN YOU CAN HAVE IN 60 MINUTES. I can confirm what previous reviewers have already stated. Exciting, fun and challenging. We will definitely be back!

Can't wait to back and try the other room. I booked this as a team event for my company and we had a fantastic time. The service from the guys there was exceptional and we had so much fun solving the puzzles and competing against each other. Really want to go back and try the other room now, was so much fun, challenging and rewarding. And a laugh!

Probably the most fun you can have in 60 minutes!. We've now done both the rooms at Hint Hunt and split our group into 2 teams to go head-to-head each time. So much fun! Both rooms are quite challenging, we've done other escape room games and these are the hardest ones we've done so far...but we made it out (just!). Brilliant thing to do with a group of mates and will give you loads to talk about at the pub afterwards. Great mix of puzzles/challenges in each room so every person will have something to contribute to help the team escape. We love these games and are always looking for the next one to do.Don't hesitate...book it!
Team Event. Most fun I have in years! An hour seemed like 15 minutes and i'm happy to say we unlocked the door with 3 minutes to spare

An awesome hour of challenging teamwork and puzzle solving. Second time for me, first for my workmates and the Zen room was just as fantastic as the Detective room. Be prepared to get a brain sweat on as HintHunt has made a fantastic venue with brilliant puzzles!They are ridiculously good at hiding things!

Work night out....... Went for a team night out. Didn't really know what to expect apart from the few reviews I had read........and what a fantastic way to spend an hour!Don't want to give anything away, but a really clever and fun way to spend time with colleagues or friends. Suffice to say it's a puzzle game with the aim of getting out of a room where you have to sleuth around to get clues, keys and generally solve puzzles. The excitement and intensity builds as time runs down and if lucky enough to solve it all, the feeling of relief when you finally get out is great. Recommended!!Got out with 17 seconds to spare too.....

Really great fun with friends!. An original way to spend a Saturday night. Really great fun with friends and good to use our brains!! Not so great if you are a bit claustrophobic and you should definitely take water (or a drink) with you - there is a corner shop a few doors up. We really loved it and made it out with 32 seconds to spare. Would definitely go back and try the other room next time.

Exhilarating!. The idea of being locked in a room with four friends for an hour didn't really get me too stirred up. However, after a quick briefing and when the door to our room was locked behind us, the adrenalin started to kick in! As many of the other reviewers have mentioned, it would be unfair to give any details away as it would spoil the experience. Suffice to say an hour can go by VERY quickly indeed and the rush of 'solving' each puzzle and finally solving the mystery with 27 seconds to spare was great. A highly recommend activity to participate in London.

A must do event!. I was part of a group of 3 and we all had an absolutely amazing time and have been talking about it ever since! Such a fun event, a must do and we will definitely be back to try the other room! Thank you to all at Hint Hunt for a cracking time.. would definitely recommend this.. if you're unsure go and do it!

Great fun with mates. I must admit I was a bit skeptical about this place. All my doubts soon disappeared when we started the activity. It was great fun and good for teamwork. We managed to escape with 6 seconds to spare. Would recommend to anyone!

Great Fun. . What a fast but enjoyable hour. I had only ever done one other room escape game in Prague which I loved and this one was more challenging. Really friendly staff greeted us and gave us a good briefing. Listen carefully to this and do as you're told....!I can highly recommend this experience.

A Fun Exciting Unique Team Bonding experience. A little imagination allows you and your two, three or four team mates to transport yourself to a fantasy scene, where you are looking to find your way out of a locked room, by finding clues, answering riddles, using keys to unlock hidden gems of information, all with the constant time pressure of the clock counting down from 60 minutes. As the deadline nears the activity becomes more frenetic with new surprises at every corner. Luckily you have the Hint advisor to nudge you in the right direction, when you inevitably stumble in your endeavours. Loved it!!... You need more rooms because I'll be coming back and hopefully this time I'll be out of that room before 00:00

Too hard and too many hints required - we felt like puppets on a string. This was our second live escape room and we absolutely loved our first outing at a different venue and were so looking forward to our second time. But we came away disappointed with the experience at HintHunt - even though we managed to escape. It was just too hard and there would be no way of escaping without the very large number of hints received. And in plenty of cases they weren't hints, they were pretty much telling you the answer. So you just felt as though you were the puppet on the end of a string waiting to be given the next answer by the puppet (games) master and not really having any clue as to what to do in the mean time. After about about half an hour one of the other people playing with me whispered this is so hard and it really was just too difficult for it to be fun with constant directions required as to what to do next (there was no logical way of knowing for yourself in many instances).This might be okay for very experienced live games players with large teams who want a real challenge but it really wasn't much fun for us unfortunately despite our games master being very nice both beforehand and afterwards.

A great, quirky idea - had so much fun!. I found hint hunt online and thought it looked like a good idea to book for my birthday. We weren't disappointed! We didn't have any huge expectations, as you can't really find out exactly what you're letting yourself in for, And my advice would be, don't try and find out, it's much better it being a surprise. The game is very well thought out, and it's a great way to work together as a team to figure out the clues, we all had certain things we were better at doing than another so it was fun to divvy out the tasks to the right person to get it done. We managed to get out of the room with 3 minutes to spare, and all came out feeling elated and somewhat hot from an exhilarating and exciting 1 hour! Nice work Hint Hunt! We'll definitely be back to try out the other room one day!Thanks!

Excellent Experience. To put it simply, this is a great adventure for those who enjoyed The Crystal Maze back in the day and fancy themselves as the next Sherlock Holmes!It is vital not to learn anything about it before you go in, so along those lines, all you should know is that it is an intense, puzzle based game where you and several friends need to work together to escape the room. That is literally all you need to know!The staff were very friendly and made you feel very engaged with the whole experience, and in terms of the game they can often be too helpful, but I guess that's better than the opposite so can't really fault them.Would definitely recommend

Amazing Zen Experience. We visited HintHunt for a second time, pretty much a year after our first visit. Originally we opted for the John Monroe's Office and only just failed. This time we took on the zen room. The Zen room was very fun and enjoyable, completely different to John Monroes office with different challenges using a completely different kind of skill set. Set up like a Japenese Zen living room that is all i can tell you as i wouldn;t want to ruin the surprise for anyone. We managed to escape with 90 seconds left to spare. This room felt more challenging even though i knew kind of what to expect this time. Hinthunt was my first experience originally of this kind of activity, i have tried two other locations (Escape Live in London and Key Hunter in Birmingham). HintHu by far has been the best of these activities and i cannot wait for them to devise a new room challenge for us to take on. I'd say the actual activity is not great for smaller children you would probably want a couple of adults with teenagers at the youngest. We had an absolut blast and i would recommend this to all my friends.

Highly addictive!. HintHunt has been in my radar for quite some time so I suggested it to my friends and they were game, although a bit unsure about what it actually was...This hour turned out to be the MOST FUN we've had in a long time! It's challenging, nerve-racking but so cleverly done that it gets you going from minute 1! I highly recommend this! No wonder there are 1,200+ excellent reviews!Can't wait to do it again!GO, GO, GO!!

Fantastic fun!. We organised HintHunt as a treat for our staff on recently completing a project. The experience is like no other. Splitting into two teams of four, we arranged that both teams completed the challenge simultaneously. Stuck in a tight space, trying to find clues and solve puzzles in order to get out was great fun and the time flew by. One team completed the challenge, the other failed but a good time was had by all and we can't wait to go back and try a different experience. Highly recommended!

really fun, but really hard. Really challenging and loads of fun. We were in the Zen room and there was no order and no clear target, which made it quite difficult for me, but this is part of the fun. Very different to anything I've ever done and it certainly gets your adrenaline going.

Great hour of fun with friends. Really enjoyed the experience of Hint Hut and would highly recommend to groups of friends/families. We were recommended this by someone we know and we were so pleased we gave it a go! Firstly we found the staff really friendly. From reading some of the other reviews, Yes, it is a bit confusing just going into a room and being told little about what it is you are looking for or going to do, but thats all part of the fun! We were a team of two couples and we worked well as a team, which made the experience more fun - so choose your team wisely!!! It was exciting, the puzzles were challenging but fun and hints were only when needed. When we finally escaped we were all buzzing with excitement and chatting about it for the rest of the day. The hour goes fast!This is definitely something a bit different and worth a go if you're someone who grew up watching the crystal maze or enjoy geocaching/treasure hunts.

Fantastic - A Must do!. We were greeted by Gloria who sat us down and explained how the game worked. All I can say is that it is the quickest 60 minutes ever! The enter experience was very well organised and really enjoyable. It is definitely worth doing if you have some time in London. I can't wait to go back and try the other scenario!!!

Very entertaining, but there is no plot. Overall we had a very good time in HintHunt London. The puzzles were interesting. In my opinion, what would have made it better was a plot. During the hour you solve many puzzles, each of which is used to solve another puzzle, but there was no plot related to the mystery. It felt like a series of puzzles. Even after we got out of the room, we didn't know who the killer was. Also, I think that it is not possible to get out of the room within 1 hour without the hints that the organizers provide throughout the game. Within 3 hours - maybe, if you are good. I would prefer to get more time but less hints. However, overall, it was entertaining and we had a lot of fun.

Great exit room. Incredibly professional customer service.. My friends and I have completed both rooms at Hint Hunt. Their staff is incredibly friendly and enthusiastic. Just the type you would hope for at an exit game. They get extra points for an attentive customer service team. An issue we had was solved promptly and to our utmost satisfaction.Some of their puzzles are devious! I cannot go into to much detail, but their rooms have some of the hardest features I've encountered in an exit game. Very polished and well thought out.We definitely preferred the Zen room over JM's office. Although, you will have fun with either.

Loved this!. A group of four of us took on JMs Office. Loved it. Very very well designed, tricky but not impossible, though you do feel the clock ticking towards the end! Loved it, highly recommend, possibly the best thing we've done in London in the four years we've lived here.
16th birthday surprise. This was a great fun activity for all the family. We all enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it to all.

Good flow. Second of this type of activity I've tried. Preferred this to escape rooms as it flowed better and had more of a structure and story. Managed to escape the private detective room which was good fun. The hour goes very quickly and so much to work out and do. The hints and the way they are delivered are really good and keep the game flowing really well right to the nail biting end.

Wish to play again and again and again .... I cannot believe how much fun we had. We were group of 4 ladies, family and friend adding a bit of entertainment to our 2 day visit in London. Week after and we still cannot stop talking about it :DVery well though through, and very clever. Welcoming and friendly staff. Loved every second of this game.
Great fun, highly recommended!. I went with a group of friends, and we had a brilliant time. The hour went by so quickly, we would have happily kept going.

Absolutely Brilliant!!. My wife booked this as a surprise for my birthday so hadnt seen anything about it prior to my visit. We were greeted by a girl called gloria, she was very friendly and explained all about the experience and the rules, it will be hard to write a detailed review without giving the game away but we went into the Zen Room, You have to solve clues and find a way out of the room with an hour to go, we did it with just under three minutes remaining. I found it alot more fun than i thought i would and you really do have to work as a team to get out. Highly recommend this! will be returning to do the other room soon!

Brilliant!. Five of us partook the challenge, the time flew by but we managed to escape with time to spare. Would definately recommend to anybody who likes puzzles, quizes, mystery games et al. Also, staff were realy friendly and enthusiastic.

Second visit - a little luke warm. I remember being wowed by my first visit in October. We went again at Easter and I would be a little more luke warm in my appreciation. I would be trying others before this one. It does have a great location though and sometimes that is as important as anything if you have a busy schedule. Overall , i still would rate my first experience 5 star (to the office) and my second visit 3 star (zen). So 4 star with a brilliant location beside euston train station is fair.

Great visit. I saw this place on trip advisor and though it looked interesting. It is not cheap, but it is innovative, entertaining and challenging - everyone enjoyed the game from a young child to teenager coaxed away from the precious play station. The format is not unlike some computer games available - I won't say more than that as I would not want to spoil the surprise. If you are near Kings Cross, St Pancras or Euston stations this place is easy walking distance and worth a visit - though make sure you book - word is spreading fast...

Superb activity for groups of friends!. we completed the game as a four, which was the perfect number. The clues and puzzles have the perfect balance of difficulty and the game unfolds continuously over the hour long game. All four of us were buzzing afterwards and full analysis of what went right (and wrong!) in the pub afterwards is a key part of the process. Quality activity.
Loved it!. My friends and I had an awesome time at HintHunt in Euston. We had no idea what to expect but it was a pretty great experience. Can't wait to go again.

Team Building at its best. Took my management team, to enhance their attention to detail, so as to be able to look closer at our business closer. Not just to accept what is presented to them first time around.

Hint Hunt was awesome. Visited hint hunt on the recommendation of a friend. We were a group of 4 adults, and had a fantastic time figuring our way out of the room! You only have one hour, which really flies by when you are looking for clues and receiving a few hints to guide you along the way. Highly recommended if you want to do something different. It's good if you're a little competitive!

Amazing and genius!. Just got back from our experience at the hinthunt - totally genius and amazing!! Would highly recommend as something to do in London, we are all totally buzzing from the experience and will definitely be returning again - so clever and well put together!

Awesome time with friends..... My friends and I went to HintHunt based on the great reviews. When we heard families with kids enjoy the activity, we were skeptical that it would be entertaining and challenging for us as professionals and students of high education. But let me tell you: it was intense! So much fun and incredibly puzzling at moments. We really appreciated the occasional hints that would come our way. We all decided it was definitely worth the time and money, being distinguished as a highlight of our time in London. Five stars for the excellent staff and experience!
We had the best time!. This was a really awesome thing to do. Went with a group of friends and we all loved it. Great value for money too.

Great fun activity for groups!. we completed the game as a four, which was the perfect number. The clues and puzzles have the perfect balance of difficulty and the game unfolds continuously over the hour long game. All four of us were buzzing afterwards and full analysis of what went right (and wrong!) in the pub afterwards is a key part of the process. Quality activity.

Absolutely brilliant experience!. Having heard about this through some friends, I booked this to celebrate my daughter's birthday with her favourite aunt. It was fantastic! My daughter loved solving the clues and the host was brilliant and helpful too. She answered all our questions and gave us some helpful hints so that we were able to be successful with 11 seconds to spare. We will definitely be coming with a bigger group to try out the Zen room. I would highly recommend - fastest and most exhilarating hour that you will ever experience!

Good fun for the family. Bought as a present for my sister after a colleague recommended it to me.Really cool idea, fun for those who like a challenge, safe to say it wasn't easy. We did the murder detective room and got out with 45 seconds to spare! Enjoyed the concept and all the clues. I thought clues would be in a slightly more logical order but this just made it harder. Looking forward to trying out the 'Zen room'. Thanks for a fun afternoon Hint Hunt!
So much Fun!!. Ah this was awesome fun. Cannot recommend enough. Definitely going back when we can.Staff were great and helpful and the attention to details made the game for us.5 *****

Work Day Out. We chose this for part of a team development day for work. It was brilliant: good fun, tested your mental agility and lateral thinking. Everybody in each team got involved and you can make it as competitive as you want. Will recommend to all who wants an hour of fun in London. Will go again definitely.

Fantastic and different activity for a hen do. We went for a friend's hen do, having heard great things about Hinthunt from a friend. It was such an interesting and fun activity that everyone enjoyed. The staff were just lovely and we definitely couldn't have done it without their hints. The puzzles were varied and kept everyone engaged. We all want to go back to escape from the other room. Also very excited about the third attraction that is opening in the summer.

EXCEPTIONAL!. A fantastic day out for everyone involved. We completed Zen Room 1 - with 17 seconds to spare! Not going to give away any details, but it's safe to say you will be challenged like never before. Couldn't recommend it highly enough. Going to book again to complete the remaining rooms!

Really fun night with friends!!!. The staff were great and friendly. The game was great fun but annoying (in the best way). If you want an activity for small groups, this is definitely the place. Can't wait to try the next room.
Amazing team activity!!!. Just did the 'hint hunt' with my team from work. The staff are exceptionally welcoming and helpful and the 'game' was fantastic! "The best team activity we have ever done"!

Fabulous team event. A a great place for a problem-solving team event for a small team of 3-5 people. We enjoyed every minute....well, actually 59 minutes and 10 seconds to successfully complete the challenge. Great value for money and an eye-opener!!! Give it a go, you'll love it!

We escaped the room!!. 5 of us attempted the Zen Room. The puzzles were varied and interesting and kept us constantly on the go. We escaped the room with a few minutes to spare so smaller groups may struggle.
So much fun!!. Have played hint hunt twice now, I love it!! It's very popular so suggest you book well in advance. I have been told they are building a third game which I can't wait to play.

30th birthday surprise!. Had a girls weekend in London for my sisters 30th birthday! As part of the celebrations we organsied a trip to hinthunt! Was fast, fun and exciting! We loved every min of the experience! Would b great for any occasion/good looking to do something that bit diff! Defo kept us all on our toes! Can't wait to go back!

Amazing amazing amazing!!. I went with my team as it was an offsite organised by our dear boss, and well, that was totally worth it :) Nothing corporate at all or what you would expect, but instead one hour (that goes super quick!!) of fun, brainstorming and team building since each of us contributed to the task! Can't detail too much what's in the activity but I can say, it will challenge your brain ;) Staff was really friendly and fun, and now I just want to do the same with my fiancee this time since this type of activity can really suit anyone, not only teams in companies but also friends, or couple activities if you fancy a bit of a change :) Awesome experience, I'll be back!
Great Family experience. Great fun for the whole family - exhilarating! No matter what age, everybody could join in and work together to beat the clock!

60 minutes of genius. We loved HintHunt - definitely a workout for the old grey matter! The time goes quickly and we were grateful for the hints from Gloria our gamesmaster. Sorting out the hints from the red herrings was challenging but very satisfying. It's a great event that can be enjoyed with a mix of ages. We'd definitely go back!

Great family bonding time!. We booked 2 of the zen rooms as there was 9 of us and we competed against each other which made it more fun! This is very challenging but so much fun as you're working really well as a team to try and beat the clock! We beat it with 1 minute to spare and it was very exciting! I want to do the other room next time!

Hardest workout ever!. From both physically running around the room for an hour, to the mental workout of solving the clues, this is definitely not for people who aren't willing to put in 100% went with my brother, his girlfriend and my sister and we loved it! Requires you're full concentration for the whole time but totally worth it- great fun! We made it out with 20 seconds to spare, the time flies by!!!

Great entertainment. . I have to say I was slightly dubious when my friend booked this experience for my birthday. However this was an awesome experience. It is an ingenious idea and brilliantly thought out. I am thinking of bringing back my team on a team building exercise, and I definitely will be back to try the other room. Thoroughly enjoyed my experience, I had a wicked time and would thoroughly recommend this without a doubt!!!!

Just in time. Great experience, managed to escape the room with only 31 seconds to spare! Our staff member was great, we couldn't have asked anything more of him. If you are looking for a brain testing 60 minutes then this is the game for you. You don't have to be a genius, you just need to get involved. We were a family team of four and each of us contributed well. If two simple 50 year olds their son and his Thai girlfriend can escape, then so could you.

Time flies!. I booked this for a company team day for 10 people and we got to experience the two rooms. We all thoroughly enjoyed it - it was superbly organised and briefed. Time flies when you are trying to solve the mysteries to escape.The rooms were challenging and well set up. We would all love to do it all again! Thank you.

Time will fly buy, in a good way. An overall, very fun experience. I did it with 2 other people and came close but didn't manage to get out of the Japanese Zen room in time. The whole experience flies- by and is very enjoyable, requiring you to search high and low for clues and split of into teams at points to cover the puzzles in time. If you want to make it put the room in time I would recommend bringing 4 or more people (i think the max is 5) as it lets you divide yourselves between the tasks more efficiently. As this is the first live puzzle escape room I've done, I have a very limited basis for comparison but would recommend it to anyone who likes solving puzzles.
so much fun. We had a brilliant time at hinthunt, really well set up, the staff were really welcoming and helpful - it was challenging and the hints came when we needed them - definitely recommend

Got out with barely seconds to spare!. Went to the JM office with 4 Uni's friends.Had a great time, and got out of the room!It's a great challenge for friends and family.We will be coming back to do the other room

Great fun for the family (esp teenagers). I agree with previous reviewers that this is a great way of spending time with teenagers.The new venue was spotlessly clean and the staff were welcoming and fun.I know that it is a lot of money for an hour but when you think about the amount of setting up and then re-setting up (after we had effectively trashed the place looking for clues) plus the fact the staff are watching (via cctv ) and advising (when we completely stuffed it up) you can see it is a highly labour intensive endeavour Hence the cost.It would be good if they did a half day version (perhaps at a reduced rate) as we all wanted to go again and put our newfound deductive skills to the test

Really really good fun. I took my small office to Hinthunt yesterday, we split into two small teams, one in each of the JM Detective Rooms. This activity went down really well, so much fun although the pressure is on with only 60 minutes to solve the puzzle! I was left feeling not so clever. This is a great idea for office days out and encourages teamwork and problem solving. I would also enjoy doing this with a group of friends. Book in advance, it fills up quickly.

Great fun and different. What a great concept and incredibly fun. If you and your friends are after a unique and enjoyable experience then this is a must! Looking forward to going back and trying a different room!

Frustratingly good fun. HintHunt is a great concept and really unique idea to do with a group of friends. It only lasts an hour, but you really dont want it longer. Our group were frustratingly close to solving the final piece of the puzzle before the timer went. We'd certainly go back and try a different room (i believe there are 3 different rooms/games to play).

so much fun. We did this with our very clever grandchildren (or course!) who were 10 & 12. We had a wonderful time. They thoroughly enjoyed it and we enjoyed doing it with them. The person we interacted with made the whole experience. We did the Zen room. I understand they will be opening a new room in London sometime next year and we will definitely put it on the schedule.

Fantastic family event. We've been before as a Christmas treat but this time went to celebrate my daughter's 14th birthday. I think my youngest son was a bit too young last time - barely 9 - but at 10 and a half, he is now more able to tackle some of the puzzles. We were in the Zen Room this time, and there's no doubt that it is pretty tough and we absolutely needed the hints, but it was brilliant fun and we all came out really buzzing! Especially since we managed to get out with 1.09 minutes to spare (we failed last time!). Will definitely come again when they get new rooms. Can't wait!
Excellent game!. We all loved every minute of our hint hunt experience. The puzzles are challenging but so much fun to work out! Thoroughly recommended!!!

Brilliant fun!!!. We bought this for one of our friend's birthday and were all a bit nervous about what to expect as the website doesn't give much away! We were met by a very friendly member of staff that gave us a warm welcome and explained a bit more that both made us more nervous and put us a bit more at ease! Very fun activity that had our hearts racing to beat the time! We found we worked very well as a team and will definitely be back to complete the 2nd room! Hopefully now we know how it works we won't get locked in!

Fantastic Experience!. I went Hint Hunt with my husband and my parents. The whole experience was excellent from start to finish! I would recommend it to anyone, we had so much fun and it was great to do something different.

Best experience we've had in a while.. We're all aged between 25-28 and had a great time with 1.49 minutes left which was a miracle. Obviously I can't give anything away but I'd recommend you go with Tomi as your game master, a very lovely and accommodating chap who answered a lot of my friend's never ending questions.The hour went by so quickly during our experience in the zen room, we are looking forward to coming back to doing to office room when we're all able to book some time off. Not sure if there's a lift but there are stairs. :)Have a good day future HintHunt goers, it's a banger!
Very Enjoyable!. Time flies when you are having fun, or locked in a room!!Solve the clues (with some hints) and spend the last minutes in blind panic...

Excellent work social. We went with a large work group for a post-office social. Not disappointed.We split into three times, which added a competitive element, and the guys at Hint Hunt were really accommodating. The way everything is put together is great, and the problems can be challenging. Some of them really stretch your mind but the sense of achievement when you get something right is great!Everybody in our group loved it, and we'd definitely go back again and recommend to others.

The fastest hour of your life!. In my quest to find a suitable activity for a boy of 18, girl of 13, mum 46 and dad 64 I was told about this by a friend, checked the reviews on here and was not disappointed! Ran speedy and efficiently (with a gentle sprinkling of humour) the staff explained what was to happen and covered all the questions we had. Then it started. The sets are clever , the puzzles taxing and the whole concept so very thoughtful.....taxing but achieveable.....but not by us! But they do show you the answers in the end,which occurred so quickly , definitely the fastest hour of your life!

An awesome way to spend an afternoon!. My mum bought myself and my husband a gift voucher for HintHunt for us and two friends as a joint 30th birthday present. Having never heard of it before, we were intrigued. We opted for the JM's office and arrived on Saturday somewhat apprehensive as to what we might face (and how badly we might do!). Bryan our host was very friendly and helpful - there was just the right amount of information given before we were locked in.Never has an hour flown past so quickly and we all came away repeating to each other how much fun it had been. The experience really got our brains going and the team work flowing - it was brilliant. Would highly recommend this as an activity for families with teenagers or groups of friends and we will definitely be going back to try the Zen room at some point.

Fantastic!!!. I played the Zen room recently with 3 others who have never visited HintHunt before and they LOVED it! Such a fun and exciting hour, it went by so quickly. Well done to the brains behind these puzzles - please hurry and bring your new room into action, I can't wait to visit again - I've now done both rooms!!

Perfect family entertainment for all ages. I booked this on the advice of a colleague because we are a family of five with children ranging in age from 19 down to 10. It's always a challenge finding something that suits them all and this was the perfect fit. None of us knew quite what to expect apart from the rave reviews we had read - and we weren't disappointed. The welcome, the staff, the cleanliness, the efficiency and the challenge itself - we all loved all of it and can't wait to come back to the Zen room , already booked for us five again for half term! I really can't recommend Hint Hunt enough; two weeks after we took part the children are still buzzing from it and mention it every day!

Fun for the family. My family (children aged 12, 16 and 18) and I played the zen room yesterday. We had a great time and the children enjoyed it very much although I think that the older ones were a bit spooked by being watched via cameras all the time.The puzzles were very varied and imaginative. I think that the story line could have been expanded more as really it was more a string of seemingly random puzzles. They give you lots of hints which you need due to the number of puzzles to solve in the time, would have been more satisfying if we had had more time and fewer hints.

Fun for all. Birthday trip for my 13 year old son, his friend, my 11year old daughter my wife and myself. a really intense hour of fun and mind streatching. There was something for all of us to enjoy, if you love puzzle solving then this is the puzzle to give a go. can't wait to do the Zen room next.
Incredible. Not too much to say about this place other than amazing and hands down the best way to spend an hour in London! I will be back to try out the other room!

Outstanding. As almost everyone says on this site, an excellent family attraction (though not for very young kids). It is very well thought out, the puzzles are quite difficult (you would not manage without the hints) and the sense of achievement when you get one right very satisfying. The staff are excellent--friendly and well informed. You can leave bags in the lobby. There is a loo on site but no drinks/food--- but plenty of that at nearby Kings Cross/Granary Square .Combined with a trip to Granary Square or the British Library, a very good day out.

A thoroughly enjoying 60 mins. our family of 4 went to hint hunt not really knowing what to expect and ended up having a brilliant time trying to solve clues, puzzles and codes. When you first enter the room you think that it is small and will not take you long to solve..... Oh how wrong you will be. The clues are brilliant and working as a team is a necessity . We loved it so much that we will be booking for the zen room as well . A great place to visit in London and would definately recommend.

An hour very well spent.. Difficult to explain what made this evening out so brilliant without giving away spoilers but this real life escape game was everything we had hoped it to be and more. Given an hour, we escaped the room that had a 50% success rate with three minutes to spare. The time flew by as we got caught up in the suspense of finding hints and herrings and trying to find clarity in the adrenalin fuelled fog of my mind. The staff / games maker was a great host and we will definitely be going back soon to try the other theme. Ideal for a group of friends and family or team bonding.

Better then all expectations. We were very excited about the concept of Hint Hunt from the moment of finding it on the internet. However it still managed to exceed all expectation for all of us and made an amazing, challanging and different day out at a bargain price.
Good fun but expencive. We didnt solve the pusle in time, but we had a great time trying. Bit too difficult for an adult and three young teens that arent too steady in english.
awesome!. a great laugh & a real challenge! The hour flew by. Would like to tell more but can't give away any secrets. Will be back!

Family challenge. Had a great time, my family of 4 vs friends family of 5, the guys who manage the place were great, enthusiastic and helpful. We did the detective's room which was great fun, you get a 15 minute briefing then in you go, and if you get stuck / are going round in circles (which I'm sure you will), they send you hints via a tv screen to help you on your way, these are well managed to try and make the most of your hour - the record is apparently just over 50 minutes and they needed hints,the success rate for the room is about 50% which our experience bore out, with use escaping with about a minute to sparer and our friends not quite escaping! Will we be going back - you betcha, the kids (13-15) and adults loved it, and kids want to go back for their birthday. The location of HintHunt is very convenient but not particularly nice, but hey, you're not paying to look at the outside of the building.

Fantastic experience. Teenage son asked me three times within leaving venue 'when can we go back?' ......booked to try the Zen room in May. Great experience for mum, step-dad and son to do something together - and got him away from his PC for a while. Staff lovely, highly recommended. Will be spreading the word.

A different day out. I booked this for 4 teenage boys. I didn't know much about Hint Hunt and truth be told, I still don't, but I do know that all 4 boys really enjoyed the challenge. It was something entirely different to their usual leisure activities and they were talking about it for ages afterwards.They all recommended I should go with a group of my friends!

Great hour of intensity and excitement. What a great way to spend an hour with your friends! We had at thoroughly enjoyable time and were incredibly challenged. One of the fastest hours of our lives but we made it out with 1 minute 28 seconds to spare.Well worth a visit!

Huge amount of fun!. Took part in the hint hunt challenge yesterday and had so much fun! Unfortunately we didn't manage to get out of the room in time, but we were pretty close. Would recommend to anyone who is looking to do something different in London. Be prepared for a challenge and an hour of clues and hints which will help you to solve the puzzle. We did the Japanese Zen room and will definitely be back to try out the other room. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Highly recommended.

No better way to spend an hour!. I had been to hint hunt some time ago for the original game and had come back to try the Zen room. It was just as good...if not better. I do not want to give anything away but so just go, try it yourself. You will not be disappointed!

Great Team Game. Found HintHunt on Tripadvisor as we were a mixed bunch of ages and abilities looking for something to do on a wet and cold day in London. Easy to find and park and a nice welcome when we got there. Had a briefing and then in we went to our room and spent the fastest hour our our lives as we tried to solve the mystery. Excellent team game and great fun. We are already planning our next trip to do the other room. I won't say anything about the game so as not to spoil the game but it's all well organised and thought out.

Brilliant Idea and Something Quite Different. 14 of us went for my birthday, we booked 3 rooms and thoroughly enjoyed it.
