Can't describe it as it would spoil it for others who haven't been yet but it was exceptionally well organised and clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful which was a bonus given that we all needed help at some point. Would definately recommend as somwhere different to go and will definately go back to try the other rooms.

Super Fun !!. We had never tried an escape game and really enjoyed our experience at HintHunt. We were on the same wavelength as our coach so hints were well timed and appropriate. Wanted to try this again, but couldn't get in so we tried another one, which wasn't as well done as HintHunt. Very friendly staff. Would definitely go back to try the other themed rooms.

Fantastic fun for groups of friends. I visited Hint Hunt yesterday with a group of four friends after someone recommended it to us. The premise is that you're locked in a room with a mystery to solve and a selection of strange clues to find, which hopefully lead to you being able to escape from the room. We managed to get out within the one hour time limit both times - though there were only 19 seconds left on the clock the first time, showing that it's a real challenge. We could easily have lost.The game is balanced by the staff sending you hints tailored to your skill level if you get completely stuck. The hints don't detract from the puzzle-solving at all; in fact, they're often quite funny and add to the tension as the clock ticks down. We met four different staff members on the day we visited and every single one was friendly, supportive and keen to make sure everyone came away with smiles on their faces.We played both of the games on offer. Apparently most people just do one, but I'm glad we decided to try both as they were very different and we turned it into a full day out with a meal in between to discuss strategies! There are actually several copies of each room so if you have a large group you can split up and 'race' the other team(s) for an even more exciting challenge.These 'room escape' games are apparently very popular in Hungary at the moment where it's developed into a major craze. I'd love to see the trend spread across the UK too which is why I'm writing a review to support this one.I highly recommend giving Hint Hunt a try if you're planning a trip to London, you won't be disappointed. Just remember to book well in advance (it's a popular attraction) and be prepared to put your brain to work! We're looking forward to the release of the upcoming third game so that we can all get together and visit again.
Quickest hour of my life!. Went as a group of 4 and one of 3. Had a really good time. And we both escaped the room. Really engaging and fun. Will definitely be back for another room!
Miss. Had a brilliant time at hint hunt was bought as a birthday gift and me and my two friends had a great day full of fun would definately recommend this will definately go back.

Fastest 1 hour of your life. I found Hint Hunt on Tripadvisor and I am so glad I did. it was real easy to find the place in London and we arrived 15 minutes early. The main lobby is very small but you are only in there for a few minutes, maybe 5. The staff was very nice and allowed us to store our carry on bags in the back as we were leaving for the airport later that same day. We were brought downstairs to the room we reserved and given all the instructions. There were four of us. Me, my wife and two teen aged sons. The hour flew by as we scrambled to try and figure out how to get out of the room. The experience was super fun and exciting. I highly recommend this to anyone traveling to London with a group or family. One side note; while we were leaving a couple came in but found out they made reservations on the wrong Tuesday. Since you pre-pay for your reservations they couldn't get a refund. They were told that their reservation would be put back up for sale but if nobody takes it they will lose their money.

Excellent! Great Team Away Day Activity. Six of us participated in two groups of three. This was the first time any of us had been to Hint Hunt and we weren't sure what to expect. Without giving the game away you have to try to escape from a room by solving puzzles......easier said than done! Apparently they have a 50% success rate......both our teams didn't manage to escape; despite this we had a great time and would highly recommend this!

Intense, Exciting Hour. I was here with 4 of my friends on a Monday afternoon. Since we arrived early, we started the game early as well. As this was our first time trying out 'escape games', we were rather clueless and did not know what to expect. The only thing we knew was we had to solve puzzles to escape the room in 60 minutes. We were really ecstatic when we managed to successfully escape the room within the time given. Brian (Sorry if I spelt your name wrongly!), our 'game master' was incredibly helpful and friendly as well! It was definitely a fantastic experience and hopefully we will be back in the future!

NO REGRETS!. THIS. THIS WAS AWESOME. Such an amazing hour, so well-spent! Time flew past, but the 5 of us had SO much fun and by the end of everything we were still buzzing with energy and adrenaline - we managed to escape with just 40 seconds to spare and when we found out we had done it we couldn't stop squealing and jumping up and down - HA! We did the Zen room, and I wouldn't say it's overly difficult, but it's no walk in the park either. The hints that they give are helpful without being too revealing, and they were timely as well. Honestly, I'd say our team had a bit of an advantage due to our cultural background, but I won't say anything to give it away! Don't let this scare you - everything is very doable - just make sure you have good teamwork and good observation skills!I'd love to go back and try the other room. Overall, this is highly, highly recommended. A bit on the pricey side for an hour's activities, but it's a great group activity and guaranteed to be enjoyed by all!!!!!!!By the way, we were a group of 5 university students - between us we study Law, Mathematics, Chemistry and Nutrition! A very interesting combination! ;)

Incredibly fun, fast paced and immensely satisfying. My friends and I booked this having read briefly about it in Time Out and not really sure what to expect and it turned out to be one of the best evening's entertainment we had had in a long time. It is better to go in not knowing much so I will be a bit vague but basically you are locked in a room with lots of puzzles, hidden parts and red herrings which you have an hour to solve and make your escape. There's a big countdown clock with your time left as you dash about, trying to solve the mystery. It is very well thought out and put together; they have put a lot of thought into making it fun, challenging but not frustrating and with the player's enjoyment at centre stage. Each team gets a monitor who will give you hints and clues on a TV screen as you play to make sure you don’t waste too long on dead-ends and pointing you in the right direction if you get completely stuck. Doing this gives it the right difficulty balance as the puzzles do require you to think but you also know that you won’t spend the whole hour just completely stuck on the first hurdle. The game remains enjoyable and fast-paced throughout and the monitor’s hints mean that it is tailored to the team’s strengths and weaknesses. Our monitor was an absolute delight and we had a good chat with him before and after the game, he was incredibly friendly, enthusiastic and really made the day extra special. I really can’t recommend this enough; it is an absolute bargain at £17 a person. You feel a real sense of accomplishment afterwards and bonded together as a team. We are already planning our next trip (there are two different scenarios you can do though) and thinking through our team tactics! Check out Hint Hunt, you definitely won’t be disappointed.

The best fun ever!!!. 4 of us took this challenge this morning, and I can honestly say we all had the best time! I loved every second of it, and wanted it to go on for longer! It exceeded our expectations and we can't wait to book again to try out the Zen Room. We would happily recommend this to everyone for something totally different to do, and a hell of a lot of fun! Thank you - we will see you again soon! X

Great Fun for the Curious. We went to HintHunt London for my Husbands 25th Birthday surprise. His cousin had been before and recommended it to us. It is a great activity if your looking for something a bit different and adventurous. We were briefed for the first 15 minutes then were taken to the Zen Room which we had booked. I won't give anything away as that would ruin the experience, but you basically have 60 minutes on the clock, which goes very quickly, to find and solve puzzles. It is so much fun and a great way to get everyone involved. We went with 5 people which is the maximum, and it worked really well. One of our friends already wants to return for his birthday in a couple of months time!

So much fun. I've done both rooms now, with different sets of friends and both times we have all absolutely loved it. It gives you such a buzz and is something that you can't stop talking about with your team mates for a long time afterwards!
The best attraction on London. Fantastic fun attraction. We've done the two rooms and the time flies by.Book well in advance for a weekend. It lasts about 1hr30 in total.

A great hour. Really enjoyed our hinthunt experience. 4 of us did the detectives room and had a great time. Throughout the hour you receive occasional 'hints' on a screen, and for me this was the only disappointment, it felt a little like, even if you escape, you kind of cheated. I don't believe it was just because we were rubbish, I think it's kind of part of the game (as apparently no1 has ever got out without needing them). Having said this, the rest of our group didn't seem bothered by it, and if guess it would need to be a 3h+ game without, which would be crazy, and even then if guess hardly anyone would get out, so it's probably right. We did have a great time though!

What a great experience!. We've heard about HintHunt but did not know much about it... That's the best way to get here :) It was an amazing experience, no doubt that this was one of the top highlights of our London vacation! We were a team of three, and we had the room to ourselves. I will not give any "hints" about this experience as it is best just to come as you are and find out yourself about it. The staff were very nice and welcoming and the overall experience was great. We can't wait to come back and check the other rooms. Loved it!

Hint hunt. What a great idea and fun way to spend an hour or more, not easy and our team got locked in but it did not spoil the enjoyment, had to book 3 months in advance but will be booking again to try the other room who knows now we have an idea how it works we may escape

Escaped to victory. This is such fun. If you like puzzles and can make up a group of 4/5 friends who are like-minded and could work well together under time pressure then this is for you. We got out with 23 seconds to spare and had a great time.

One of the best activities I have (possibly ever) done!. We were a group of 4 which seemed to work well and the whole process was fantastic. Had to book fairly far in advance for a weekday evening slot, which just shows how popular this has become. Arrived, were given a short briefing and then entered the room. I can honestly say it was one of the most fun hours I have had in a long time!Plus we escaped so all feel like actual champions :-)

Different!!. Bought tickets for my two friends for Xmas, as running out of ideas, and I couldn't have wished for a better gift. We had no idea what to expect, and yes, we got locked in, but it was a fun, brain-teasing 60 minutes and I will tell all my friends to pay a visit. Thank you.

Great idea and great fun. The idea about letting anyone becom a live detctive is great and everything at HintHunt was great. We were very welcomed and got introduced to the concept in a friendly way. Maybe a little more background to the plot would have made the start easier.We had great fun and everyone was involved to solve the puzzles. We didn't solve everything in time but that didn't make it any less fun. Highly recommended!

Hint hunt. An enjoyable event and very ingeniously designed to make it challenging. However the front scene ie the entrance could be made more cool such as staff dressed up and much better decor and special effects to enhance the experience.

great fun day out. We went to this activity with a group of friends and family of different ages (18 ~ 40 years)It was really well organised and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. The game itself was so much fun, its was explained really well and gave us just the right amount of hints to make it challenging but also achievable, its really uses your thinking skills, team building and communication skills. Cant wait to go again!!

HintHunt- fantastic. This is a great event to do with friends or even strangers for a team building day. There was only 3 of us but that didn't matter. Loved every second. Recommend it to anyone who likes to think under pressure. Going to book again and do the different room without a doubt.

Really original and great fun. I booked HintHunt for my son's 12th birthday party. We had two rooms, with one adult and four boys in each. They absolutely loved it and haven't stopped raving about it ever since. They all want to go back and play the second game. A superb experience and really different.

An hour well spent!. I visited on 22nd Feb with my Mum and sister and we did the JM Room following a recommendation from a friend. We didn't know what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed it. Anyone who likes solving puzzles would love HintHunt. Looking forward to booking again for Zen Room soon.

Great fun. After reading reviews I can say we were not disappointed! I wont lie it is a bit confusing when you first enter the room as you don't know what you are looking for, the old grey matter gets a good workout. Clues & hints are given to aid you along. We didn't make it out of the room but had an awesome day and will definitely be back again. Do not delay book Hint Hint you will not be disappointed.

Loved it. After visiting HH in Paris we thought we HAD to do it back home. Family of 5 went aged 9 - 44 and we chose the JM room having done Zen in Paris. Must admit we felt this room was harder than zen and therefore we needed a little more help from outside but it just depends what your strong points or subjects are. Staff very friendly and helpful and if you like puzzle games and problem solving then this is a must. We cant wait for a new room to be put in so we can visit again, wish I had had the business idea first !! Keep up the good work and thanks for the fun.
Great fun!!. We did this as a team building fun exercise and it was brilliant fun, cannot wait to go back and try one of the other rooms :)
Excellent moment. We spent an excellent moment at hinthunt london. We didn't see the sixty minutes pass! It was such a great experience!!

Another great time. After escaping JM office last year we thought we would return to do the Zen room on Monday. We enjoyed it just as much as the first time. Would recommend to everyone. Really enjoyed ourselves and managed to escape again.

A group workout for the brain. We visited as a family of five and had a great time. Didn't know what to expect even up until the last minute during the briefing, so the mystery never unfolds until you get in the room. Staff were friendly and "hintful" and your picture gets added to the wall of fame if you escape, which we did with just 67 seconds left on the clock. Would recommend as a family treat, birthday experience, or team building event, and would certainly like to go back and try the other room scenario at some point.

We have a lot of fun!. A friend recommended HintHunt to me and as a consequence I booked to go with my brother and his daughters for a bit of fun. We really enjoyed ourselves, and I'm planning the return trip!

Exceeded expectation.. We did JM's room. We had such a good time and absolutely loved it. I choose it as people had previously described it as similar to the crystal maize and we were intrigued. It certainly lived up to expectations. I would highly recommend it.

Amazing again! Can't wait for the new room!. After playing one of the JM's Office rooms last year we knew HAD to play the Zen room too! We loved the first one so much that we booked the second one the next day! We took on the Zen room yesterday and I'm happy to say that it didn't disappoint! We all LOVED it!! If anyone is wondering whether it's worth doing, it definitely is! Can't recommend it enough. The staff are all super lovely and helpful too! Looking forward to trying the new room in the spring!!

Brilliant!. Without doubt one of the best and most different things I've done in London. The feeling of satisfaction when you break out the room is great. JM's Office 2 is definitely worth booking. Plenty to explore and perfect for a group of 4. We can't stop talking about all the clues and how they led us to find our way out and can't wait to come back again and try out the Zen room! Thanks Hint Hunt for a great experience

Really enjoyable and refreshingly different. My friends and I took part as part of a birthday party and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The level of challenge is excellent, the hosts are friendly and welcoming and I would highly recommend it.

Great!. I was a bit worried first, also about the price, but it was worth every penny. Did the JM's office with 4 friends and we had the best time. Hours after we were will talking about our hinthunt. I can only recommend it!!

Fantastic. Four of us thoroughly enjoyed this. The hour goes sooo fast, it was an absolute hoot ! We didn't get out but we gave it a good go ! Would recommend anyone to book this . We will be looking to book for the nest room's challenge asap. The staff were so friendly and explained clearly what we should be doing. I f youre looking for something completely different you will not be disappointed.

It really is as fun as everybody says. I have a yearly trip to London with my two teenagers, an decided to try HintHunt this time. Quick and easy to reach from the centre of London by Northern Line. Easy to find close to Euston station. And so much fun. From the start, it took us 10 seconds to become totally absorbed in the game, and it was the fastest hour ever spent. Totally recommended - remember to book early, as reservations are available three months ahead an fill up fast.

Challenging. Great set up. Excellent game master to help and explain set up. Lots of challenges for all ages. We ran out of time but enjoyed trying. Ready to try another room. Great for families as an alternative to usual london activities.

60 Minutes Well Spent!. I organised this for work and we had a great time. There were 15 of us so we were in three rooms of 5. I think it works best having 4 or 5 people in the room rather than 2 or 3 for instance because you can bounce ideas off each other / have different ways of thinking. I would thoroughly recommend it for work / friends / family, whatever!
highly recommended. Had the most amazing time. Challenging enough but possible to solve. We got out!! :) great team building activity!!

Very good event. We went for a team building day for work, some of our group did the JM offices and others did the Zen room. Everyone enjoyed their experiences, and it definitely bonded us as a team.Thanks HintHunt!

Excellent evening! Would really recommend. Four of us did Hint Hunt last and it was absolutely incredible. The whole experience had been planned and organised brilliantly and everything went off without a hitch. I've already recommended it to everyone i've spoken to and definitely want to go back and do the other room!!

So Clever - An Amazing Experience!!. What an amazing experience!! I had no idea what HintHunt was about but boy, am I glad I went! It was my first escape game & without giving too much away, it was hard not get stuck in! I will DEFINATELY be booking to try the other room, an incredible experience! Cannot wait to go back!!Please please please, if there is one thing you do in London.... GO TO HINTHUNT!

Fantastic Team Building. We had a fantastic corporate team building afternoon at the hinthunt. It was seamlessly organised and our host, Gloria, was fantastic. It was an excellent way to get everyone working together and get your adrenaline going. My heart was pounding in the last ten minutes. Thank you HintHunt, I have already recommended to my friends and family!

Excellent - Brilliantly Done. I have been to a number of escape game experiences and must say that Hint Hunt is one of the best. I did the ZEN room which was brilliant and brought friends who had never experienced an escape game before. They absolutely loved it and we managed to escape with 4 seconds to spare. I have just booked the JM office room and cannot wait to visit again. Well done to the game creators, I appreciate a lot of time and effort has gone into making this exceptional game! Well worth the money as the quality of the actual game justifies the cost.

Amazing experience!. We knew from our friends that HintHunt was going to be fun, but it definitely exceeded expectations!!!! The hour flew by without almost realizing! Thanks Emi for being such a great game master! We will come back to try another room!

Excellent fun. I can't recommend HintHunt enough. I have done both rooms and both were brilliant and everyone else I know who has been has loved it.It's very well organised and the staff are great. Can't fault it.

Fantastic fun. Wasn't sure what to expect as haven't done anything like this before - but had such a great time. Very well organised and well executed. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for something a bit different to do in London
Best thing we have done for ages everyone should try it. Really great time didn't know what to expect but had been told it was good fun. Would thoroughly recommend

Best thing ever . Had heard great things about this and it certainly met expectations. Staff were friendly and helpful and it was very well organised. It was so much fun and great for team bonding. One of the best things iv done in London. Can't wait to try the other room

Can't believe how good it was. Four of us travelled to North London one Saturday morning in early January to try out HintHunt. My fiance and I had previously had a go at a similar activity in Singapore last year and found it disappointing. HintHunt was the complete opposite - what a brilliant thing to do.The hour in which you have to solve the clues inside the room to escape it goes by incredibly quickly, and you really don't have a second to lose. Our host kept sending through hints, and we really would never have finished without her. In the end we got out in about 58 minutes!I can't wait to go back and do another room. There's no wonder it gets booked up so early.The only suggestion I had would have for improvement would be to sell drinks and snacks - we had no energy left when we eventually escaped the room...

Awesome and fun night!. I went to Hinthunt with 3 of my friends. We were warmly greeted by the staff, who then gave us a briefing of what we were going to do over the next hour. We were led to our room and had to look for clues all around the room to open padlocks, doors etc and ultimately solve the mystery and escape the room. It was loads of fun! Our team just made it with seconds to spare. Highly recommend this to all! Great fun!

Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic!. Went to HintHunt with team mates this week and had no idea what to expect. With some trepidation I entered the first room and was surprised to say the least! My surprise was short lived as the clock started ticking and the game got underway! I can honestly I haven't had so much fun in ages. The game of clues is brilliantly thought out and pushes your thinking power to the limit, helped along by the amazing staff and their well times clues (that appear on a monitor) as and when you really need them. If you are looking to build on team spirit, then this is the game for you!

Amazing good fun!!. I didnt know what to expect of the Hinthunt rooms as there wasnt a lot giving it away on the site. When we got there, the staff were friendly and helpful and again, didnt give much away!I wont spoil it for others out there looking to go, but I would say that myself and the team (14 of us!) absolutely loved it. No one could fault it and it was just brilliant - we are all trying to decide when to try the other room out!!

laughs and confusion. 3 of us tried the zen room 1, we had a fantastic time, Everyone we met that worked there was lovely. The game was filled with puzzles and the need to search for keys and clues. If you enjoy escape the room games, this is perfect.We managed to escape the room but they politely gave us 2 minutes more as we were so close.You are put in the room with your friends and watched and listened to by the "game master" on a camera and microphone.We immediately wanted to play another straight after!

It gets quite intense!. As the other reviews say - not a lot to describe without giving the game away, but it's great fun. Slightly on the expensive side, but you'll leave feeling energised and chatting for a while.

A fast hour of fun.. I have been to most the attractions in London and HintHunt is by far one of the most enjoyable I have interacted with. I was not sure what to expect but once we were locked in our room and looking for clues I became immersed in this wonderful attraction. I would recommend this to anyone with a couple of hours to spare and I feel confident is saying that I guarantee you will enjoy yourselves. A good tip is to try if possible to go in with a group of 5 as five is the most you can have, but it is a much greater laugh. Everyone should visit HintHunt. Thanks for a great experience.Mike (Portsmouth)

Great way to spend an hour. Just excellent fun. Great puzzles, well curated room and atmosphere and something different. Played the Japanese game and hope to return to play the other one at some point.

Had an AMAZING time!. I cannot rate this highly enough. We went as a group of four and really loved it. Just enough clues to nudge you in the right directiom but not make it too easy. Really well hidden clues and fun puzzles to figure out. We were told there is a 50% escape rate but we managed to get out with about 5 minutes left which we felt like quite an achievement. We immediately starting figuring out when we could go back and do the other room! Thank you for such a great experience we all loved it! :)
Great fun!. Went with 3 friends and this was so much fun! Felt like a kid again for an hour and so rejuvenated, we will definitely go back to visit the other room and solve the next puzzle!

Calling brainy friends!. An activity like no other. Fortunately, I was with some clever friends and managed to make it out. A game that requires team work and a fabulous way to spend time with family and friends.
So much fun with friends!. Had a great time doing this. Its a very fun and unique afternoon getaway with friends. I would highly recommend Hint Hunt.

AMAZING. Went earlier than Feb 14 but couldn't resist rating when I saw this pop up...This is an incredible experience and so much fun - I still talk about it now! It's an escape game and whilst it is very high pressured, it is by no mean 'scary' it is the most fun you will ever have!The ONLY downfall I have is that they don't have a room big enough for a larger group of people... They do in some of the other cities (NYC) even if it catered for 6 people that would be great.Anyways go and do this you won't regret it. I have been three times!

Great experience. One adult and four 12 year olds had the best hour. All came out raving about the experience. One quote was "best day ever". All that remains to be done is to book up for the other room. Staff were fantastic and a good time was had by all.

Great fun. Surprising how much you get into it even though you know you're not going to be locked in the room forever. Were told it was a 50% success rate and we finished bang on time with four of us. Apparently no one finishes without some help so be prepared that it's a little challenging. Can imagine it's hard with only a couple of you too! Great fun though and we all got into it. Would happily go back and try another room. Take glasses if you need them for reading and maybe a little bottle of water. Enjoy!
Awesome! Best company for the game. Best one out of all the companies I've triedMore challenging and creative puzzlessolving puzzles as well as finding things that are super hiddenlove the challenge
Great experience. We had an amazing time in the Zen room. Puzzles were challenging but really fun. Looking forward to going back to another room. A must do attraction! Be prepared to book in advance.

Great concept & game! . All appears so simple but it really is not! Very entertaining hour, surprised at how much you get into it & keeps you guessing the whole way. Played the James Murdoch room, will be returning to do the Japanese game for sure!

HintHunt London. Amazing!!Had such a great time at Hint Hunt London. It had been recommended by a work colleague that had visited one abroad.As they will tell you in the beginning, they know how to hide things very well! Definitely take their advice on checking an area twice, as another team member may have missed something.This is a great activity for friends and as a work social as well.Highly recommended.I now understand why it is so popular.
Good Fun. Excellent fun. Buttock clenching end to the game. Well worth a visit! Will be returning again to play another game.

So much fun! Will be back again!. We did the John Monroe office with 2 friends for a bday gifts a yer and a half ago and loved it so much so we went back last night. Thsi time we dis the Japanese room and it was really challenging and fun again. They don't give you hints too quickly which really forces you to think but always help you if you're really stucked so you get to enjoy it no matter what. So much fun we'll be back again as we were told a new room is opening in March 2015. Can't wait! Thank you to the Hint Hunt whi are such a nice crew and for providing something really different!

Fantastic fun with family or friends. I was sceptical when my wife told me she'd booked this, but I was proved wrong. Were a family of three and it was fantastic fun. The challenges and puzzles are really tricky and will make you think, but you get hints as you go via a tv screen in the room. Whether you make it out in the time limit or not, you definitely laugh a lot and have a great time!
Great fun!. Thoroughly enjoyed our HintHunt experience. We did John Monroe's office and we have been recommending HintHunt to friends ever since. Can't wait to do another one.

Amazing Fun. HintHunt was brilliant! We had so much fun and we were buzzing about the experience for days after. We were a party of 4 and just managed to escape with under a minute to go, it was quite a challenge but still very fun. The beginning can be a little overwhelming, there are a lot of key codes and padlocks to suss out, but we thoroughly enjoyed tearing the room apart! I won't detail the experience too much since we went into it not knowing a thing, which is the best way. Would definitely recommend to a group of friends wanting to try something different. The staff member who took care of us was really friendly and helpful with his hints. I'm sure he had a good laugh watching us scream and panic towards the end!
Fun. It's a fun game that takes team work don't go if your competitive as the game needs patience, we didn't finish the puzzle as we rushed

Not as good as the one in Dubai... I'm not sure if it's because the one in dubai is new, but the one in London seemed a little run down and like it could do with a bit of a spruce up. The zen room was brilliant, no qualms about the room as it was great fun, just as stressful and just as challenging as the other style of room! I would recommended anyone who wants a challenge go, although it would be lovely if they redecorated some parts just to make it look not so tired :)

Just brilliant!. Great entertainment and fun. Went as a family group and split into two teams of four. You get locked in a room (ours was Japanese themed) full of locked doors, drawers, cupboards, pictures books, artefacts and have to search for clues and solve puzzles to find keys ( or number/letter codes and knives in one case) to open locks, doors etc. You have up to an hour to do this - we finished with 41 secs to spare!! It's brilliant for anyone who likes puzzles and mysteries. Highly recommended.

Hone your puzzle solving skills. This is a great group activity to have fun and get your mind ticking. It was very enjoyable but a very challenging test to try and escape the room. Don't want to go into too much details as it will give it away, so go find out for yourself. Highly recommend it and I'll be visiting again to try one of the other rooms.

Excellent fun for a family or group of friends. We were on holiday in London with our 16 year old son and booked Hinthunt for a family activity. We booked the Zen Room and we really enjoyed it. The hour flew in. Unfortunately, due to some poor maths on my part, we didn't escape in time. It really does take the full hour - had I done my calculations better we would have got out with only 5 seconds to spare!! If you enjoy solving puzzles and can work as a team - this is definitely for you.

Fun with then whole family or a few friends. A hour well spent searching for clues to solve a "murder-mystery." Everyone has to pitch in together to find hidden codes, open locked doors. It's only an hour and yet reveals so much about a person! But mostly it's fun and you have to forget about the rest of the world to solve the problem at hand. Both a mental work out and a mental vacation.
Brilliant. Really brilliant experience. Went in not knowing what to expect, was NOT disappointed! Very intelligent and a fun, team building exercise - mentally challenging.

Much Awesomeness . Again, I say unto all of the people who have never been or over looked this, "why have you not been?" in my opinion it should be made illegal NOT to go :-P Awesomeness sold for a worthy price! An hour of such supreme awesome amazing fan-daby-dozy time had with my brothers. Challenging, gripping and intense.

Thoroughly enjoyed!. Been to Hint Hunt twice now (They only have 2 possible games you can play)A lot of fun. Would strongly recommend it if you are competitive or like doing things in a group. It's always time pressured. We managed to win the game in our second attempt!

Brilliant!. This is Crystal Maze meets Myst, and in a really good way. You get locked in a room which has clues for the group to find and work out what to do with. The clues range in ingenuity and you are against the clock to unravel them all to open the door and get out again. All of which sounds pedestrian, not doing justice to a fun and exciting hour. It gets v booked up, but try and go, it'll make your day.Staff are helpful and make the visit work well. We did solve the mysteries and get out, but it wouldn't matter if you didn't. Its clever and engaging and very well put together. You need no prior knowledge or skills.

I rarely write reviews but................. I rarely write reviews but hint hunt deserves it. What an excellent concept and what great staff. My family can by quite cynical about "fun" things, but this was intriguing, engaging and desperate fun from the start. There was a bit of a clue to how good it was in reception when two guys turned up to do it again as just a pair. The hour went by in no time at all and with 1 minute and 14 seconds left on the clock we were all hugging each other and cheering as we finally managed to get the door open. Cant recommend it enough.As previous reviewers have said, dont do any research turn up with 3 other people and prepare to have a great time.

JM Office - Brilliant!. Family of 5 (Mum, Dad, 20, 18 and 16 year old) went as a post xmas treat. Looked at reviews and were very excited about coming. We're very competitive, and we weren't disappointed. Tom was an excellent host, and helped make the experience fun and we were thrilled to escape in exactly 57 minutes (3 mins to spare). Defo recommend to family/friends and small groups who like a challenge!

Almost as good as Crystal Maze!. Didn't know what to expect when I turned up because it was a surprise present, think it helped to add to the suspense. The staff were friendly and very informative, really cool setup with quite a few unexpected surprises. Prepare to be frustrated and excited whilst having a great time with a bunch of mates/family/colleagues.

Great fun!. Was organised by a work colleague for a fun evening team bonding type thing (which can often suck... This one didn't!). This review is brief because it would be bad to give anything away, but it's a lot of fun and highly recommended!

Brilliant fun. We arrived at a rather unassuming building with 2 teenagers (12 and 15) and not really knowing what to expect. Brian was great, giving us some guidance before we went in. The experience in the room was great, we all got involved with finding and linking a whole variety of clues over the course of a couple of rooms. We managed to escape at 56 mins. We will definitely be returning.

Great fun. We did this as a family pre Christmas activity. 2 adults and 3 children ( ages 12,14,16) kids were skeptical b4 we arrived ! Rapidly this became best family we have done in recent years and was great team exercise for us as a family. We did the "office" lots of hidden codes and clues , secret compartments etc... We almost cracked it but ran out of time after an hour. Kids are very keen to go again and do the other room....... Excellent

So much fun. I went to HintHunt with 6 friends and had the best time. When we arrived, we had a personalised briefing at the start which was great and the staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Our friend was a bit late, but the staff were happy for us to delay the game a little bit so they could still participate. Once we were in the room, it was an hour of pure adrenaline, we felt like spies. I'm happy it was quite challenging, but we managed to finish within the hour. At the end, the staff took the time to chat to us, see what we thought about the game and take pictures for us. Great experience, we'll definitely be back to try out the other room.

Not Impressive. I attended the event with family, as part of a Christmas day out. The experience was not what I expected at all. For a start, the room we were in involved no logic or reasoning, merely functional eyes and ears and limbs. The main activity was simply physically looking for clues. The actual aim of the game was also very poorly explained. As far as we could tell, the goal was to solve a crime. Not the case at all. In fact, all you do is look for information that the hints tell you and then input it into certain places. I had hoped for something more intellectually stimulating and a bit less rudimentary. Also completely unsuitable for anyone with an eyesight issue or physical disability. I realise this may seem like a minor complaint, but I think it is a slight shame. The time length is a bit odd. I understand the aim is not that everyone finishes, and clearly many enjoy the experience without finishing, but there is a sense of incompleteness. Even when he end was explained to us it made almost no logical sense, and didn't resolve the mystery we'd started off with. I think if you understand fully the kind of experience it is then it is enjoyable. For the price though, there are many alternate London experiences. My favoutite London spot is the V&A museum, which is also free!

London Must Do (action please). It is our first time in London - my 2 daughters (tween and teenager) and I. We spent a week here and visited Stonehenge, visited museums, went to Winter Wonderland, walked Westminsters, Buckingham Palace, Tower of London etc. When I asked what was their highlight of the whole trip --- they both said HintHunt. Enough said.

An original experience. This is a unique way to spend some time in London. Locked in a room, your team must find and piece together clues in order to get out. I don't want to give too much away but if you enjoy mysteries or those locked room puzzles apps/online games then this would be perfect for you. If you're looking for something different to do this is definitely well worth a go. We went as a trio and managed to escape with 4 seconds to spare. The more the merrier I suppose but too many would mean you'd all be tripping over each other and you might miss that one vital clue that will help you escape.

Unique and exciting. I went to hinthunt with my grown-up children, my daughter booked it and I agreed to go with the expectation that it wouldn't really be my cup of tea. How wrong was I? It was fantastic!The chap who introduced it was friendly and encouraging and we soon got into it with each one of us working hard to solve the quest! Words can't explain the experience but if you get a chance then book it and go! The excitement mounted as the clock ticked on and between clues and red-herrings we worked as a team in order to escape......and we did with 2 minutes to spare - Yay!It honestly is the best, most unique thing I've done for years! I can't praise this enough and I'll be booking the other room soon.
Do not miss it!. Great experience, lots of fun, challenges, adrenalin... all against the clock. Even better with family or friends, since cooperation is a must. Well worth it. Do not miss

Must do in London. Loved our evening at Hinthunt. Everything was so well executed. We have been to a similar experience in London and it's not a patch on hinthunt. My only disappointment is that they don't have more different games, so we could go back more often!! Definitely recommended for team outings!

Amazing fun and exercise for the brain. Great concept. Only wish they had more rooms as I have completed both rooms. I have done a couple Escape rooms concept events and this is the best one. Plot, tasks and atmosphere is spot on. By the end of it I was on a adrenaline high and felt like a super sleuth. Best fun I have had in a hour for ages! Make sure you have a team with mixed skills.

Terrific fun!. Locked into a room for one hour; the objective - solve the clues to gain your freedom! This was such fun! Not easy, but working as a team, we manged to solve all the clues and get out with just over a minute to spare!If you're looking for something a little different to do in London for up to 5 people, then this could be a good option. Great team building expercise. The young staff were welcoming and friendly.We all agreed that we can't wait to go back and have a go at the second room.I would say that this suits adults and older children.

Absolutely fantastic!. Didn't know what to expect with this, however has an absolutely fantastic time! Came out with such an adrenaline rush after. We did JM's office and finished with 2 mins to spare! Staff really nice and friendly and we will def be back to do the Zen room! Highly recommended!

SOOO MUCH FUN!. Perfect for a team building challenge - you are locked in a room to work as a team to solve clues. You need communication and team work to solve the clues and escape, so a perfect bonding experience. I'd say 16+, so not ideal for younger children.

Hint Hunt is a fabulously stimulating way to have fun with friends.. An hour of problem solving with clues and friends was both challenging and fun. Definitely worth a go. We will definitely do it again.

Brilliant way to spend an hour. Our family of four, including one teenager and a 20-something, came here to celebrate a lot of things happening with us. I knew about this since I had played at a similar place a few weeks earlier. It was an absolute blast. We played the Zen room. The puzzles were quite challenging and pushed us all. Even hubby was full of praise - and that is saying something! Definitely worth it - highly recommended.
Really good fun. A good family activityA bit like the TV show Crystal MazeSome of the clues were very hard to get, others were easier but overall everyone really enjoyed it

Absolutely brilliant!!!. Went here today with 3 friends and played JM's office. All I can say is it was absolutely brilliant!!! Managed to get out with 18 seconds to spare. It was worth every penny and we can't wait to go back and do the zen room. Thanks a lot Hinthunt for the most fun I've ever had in 1 hour!!!

A must for those who seek a surprising and unforgettable experience. Yesterday our team from Entura International went to this experience. Once there we were greeted by the lovely members of HintHunt who let us know what we were going to be doing. We had no expectations from the minute we entered, but as you walk into your escape room you feel a sense of eeriness and claustrophobia, and as soon as the 60 minute timer began all senses disappeared and our detective skills came into play. It was an amazing experience where teamwork is a necessity and also how the game is so clever that it kept everyone engaged the whole time. Well worth the trip and looking forward to anymore new rooms you may have coming soon.

Not stopped talking about it since!. We went to HintHunt as a group of four on an early Saturday evening and did the 'JM's Office' room. We were briefed in detail before we went in, everything was explained perfectly and when the door was locked behind us we were keen to get going. Before heading in we were told that only 50% of groups actually get out of the room before the 60 minutes is up... which just made us even more hungry to do it! I won't give away anything at all about what awaits you in the room, other than you have the time ticking down and occasionally are given clues by the member of staff outside (Who was great!). I have to say, without the clues I don't think it would be possible for anyone to finish this room within a day, but the staff member did say that they made it so that clues were necessary. Towards the end of the hour the clues were coming in thick and fast and it did mean we didn't really have time to process one clue before the next was given, but we didn't care too much as we were out and with 3 minutes 6 seconds to go! It's now Tuesday and I don't think an hour has gone past without one of our group talking about a specific element, or what we did well/what we didn't do so well! There are so many different stages to the game that it's hard to not dissect it all when you come out. Please go and do this, it's really great fun, we can't wait to go back and try our hand at the Japanese 'Zen' room next time. I only hope they develop some new rooms in the future so we can keep going back!

Intensive. The game was quite memorable and enjoyable. That moment when you suddently <SPOILER> the <SPOILER> and You're suddenly overwhelmed with new opportunities, yet have only ten minutes left, is amazing!However, at times we felt like we've been pushed with hints too hard and too often (yet our GM said she gave us relatively small amount of hints). It would be a greater challenge to have and hour and a half more time and less to no hints.

I felt like a real detective! . Such a good fun game. I'd recommend it to every one. Fun for families. Fun for adults. Fun for all. We had a group of 10. And every single one of us said we'd definitely recommend it! Staff were so polite and welcoming. The game itself kept us engaged the whole time! Quickest hour of my life! Wish i didn't know the answer so i could do it all over again!!!! :) thanks hint hint. Definitely worth the money!

Intense but fun 😁. We had a great time at hint hunt.. We started off very casually but wow does the pace quicken when you realise how quickly the time is ticking by.. So much fun, lots of brain taxing stuff.. Well worth a trip!
Great work night! . We visited hint hunt last night as part of our Christmas party, it was such fun! Its tough work but thoroughly enjoyable!
Awesome. Highly recommended. We failed but it was great fun. Genuinely gutted not to make it out! Easily something you could do on a lunch break

Blows Crystal Maze out of the water!!!. Went with a group of friends and wasn't too sure what to expect!! After being given a short introduction by the staff we were locked in the office!! I don't want to spoil it for other so all I will say is that's that was the quickest hour of our lives and having the big count down clock was useful!! I would agree with the other people who have completed this the staff are great at giving you hints just at the right times!! They definitely help point you in the right direction!! A definite must!! Looking forward to trying the other room and the new one to come!! Well recommended!!

Must event for a work teams. We went as a team of 24 and booked all the 5 rooms. We were split into 5 groups and given an individual briefing. I really do not want to say anything else. The other 23 people had no idea where they were going and suddenly they were in a room with an hour to escape. Everybody loved it age range 25 to 60 .It was one of the best team building exercises we have ever done. We then all went to the Prince Arthur the pub next door and we had a great lunch and drink discussing our adventure.

Great fun, a must to try!. Facinating concept. 6 freinds (2x3) tackled or attempted to tackle 2 same rooms, the office. You need to think so much outside the box, with so little time. We all had a great experience and the staff were very good and patient. Recommended
Excellent, great fun. Great fun. Time flies and the hour goes by very quickly. We managed to finish with 7 seconds to spare... Highly recommended! We will be back to try the other room soon!

Fabulous Entertainment. HintHunt was awesome. Great fun for the family/friends/team bonding - finding clues to solve a mystery. Challenging and exhilarating - 60 minutes has never gone so quickly for me. Fabulous concept and wonderful execution - can't wait to go again and solve another murder!

So much fun. We've done a few escape games but HintHunt is definitely one of the best. We were a team of 5 and just managed to complete the Zen Room bang on time. Service is excellent - they do provide you with much needed clues when you're stuck. There is no chance of completing the room with no help at all. We'll be back to play the other room next year! Would definitely recommend this activity - one of the best, most fun things you can do in London, especially on a cold and rainy day.
Great Fun. Excellent experience. Staff were great and very helpful. I would highly recommend this for anyone looking for a fun birthday party or group experience.
Amazing!!. We had a great time. Recommended!Great service and great experience.Will definently come back.Can't say any more without telling too much.

Great Fun. We came here for a work team away day and had a great time. Had no idea what to expect but really enjoyed it. A real challenge and fun at the same time. My team managed to escape with just over a minute to spare but one of the other teams didn't manage it. So many clues and things to work out. It made us work as a team so was the perfect activity for us. Would highly recommend as a group activity. 4-5 people ideal - any fewer and you run out of time. Staff were really friendly too.
Amazing. Just like The Crystal Maze but better! We had such a good time trying to get out of our room! For anybody who like puzzles and working under pressure this is a great activity!
Excellent for team outing. If a bunch of co-workers or friends want to do something unusual in the city, this is a must try. The concept is nice and the team makes it more fun and challenging.

Great fun!. Such fun, would thoroughly recommend to all. Choose your group wisely to maximise your chances of success as many fail. We managed it in 57 mintues, but the last few minutes were very tense.

Brilliant. Now I know why this attraction was rated so highly on TA. Such a great evening out with some friends, the hour flew by!!! Thankfully we completed with 53 seconds to spare - was SUCH an achievement - definitely thought we wouldn't make it!! Will definitely be back to try out the 2nd room!

Brilliant - so much fun. We went as a group of 5 friends. We all live in London but this is completely different and a really fun way to spend an even big before dinner! Just go :) would be great family activity too although i think children would need to be 12+... We made it out with 38 seconds to spare!

Family fun. No idea what to expect but our family of 4 had lots of fun working out clews in a well organised mystery enactmentThe game lasted an hour but needs extra time for pre and post game explanation.

A lot o fun. We did HintHunt in November 2014 in a group of 8 friends; boys versus girls. Can't belive the boys made it out and we didn't. There is something serious wrong with the universe; must be global warming. We had a marvelous time and we can only recommend it. We had Sushi at Mei Sushi in nearby Chalton Street (5 min. away) afterwards and it was just perfect as well.

Hint hunt. I found this game trip advisor and booked it a couple of months in advance as it seemed to be very popular and we certainly weren't disappointed. I have never felt the compulsion to recommend anything on a website before, ever but this well organised and thoroughly enjoyable game deserves a mention. One of the best things to do in London, a great way to get the mind buzzing and the blood pumping before heading out into the city. We were completely wrapped up in it from start to finish and indeed it was thrilling to finally solve the puzzle in the end with only seconds left to go. Cannot recommend it highly enough. The staff are also very friendly and helpful.

Great group activity. We went as a group of friends, werent too sure of what to expect but it was a great experience that all of us enjoyed throughly. We were a group of 6, so booked two rooms and split as boys vs girls. Great place for a team/group activity.

Incredible - best thing I've done in London. What an amazing experience - I would highly recommend it. I can't give too much away or it'll ruin it... You just have to go! I went in a team of 3 and it was so much fun. It was just the right difficulty level - challenging but with help along the way when you're struggling. It was such a unique interactive experience. We made it out with 29 seconds to spare!I've lived in London my whole life and it's the best thing I've done. Definitely go!
Awesome. Great idea and perfect for a Sat with friends. Spend the afternoon giving your brain a little work out before heading out for dinner

Great fun!. We bought some friends of our tickets to HintHunt as part of their wedding gift, and joined them on the day to make up the numbers. Obviously it's difficult to review without giving too much away about the game, but we had an absolutely fantastic hour puzzling away. We eventually escaped with a mere 14 seconds to spare!Again, without spoiling anything, it's worth saying that the puzzles are all pretty logical (there's nothing too abstract, or any "trick questions"), and four people seemed to be a perfect number to play with, we didn't end up on top of each other and there's more than enough to keep everyone busy at all times.Overall highly recommended, unlike any other attraction I've been to in London!

I was really surprised I loved it!. Situated in a side street behind Euston Station, Hint Hunt is really handy. We were locked in a room for 1 hour from which we had to escape by solving a number of puzzles. We missed out by one and a half minutes and were amazed that the hour passed in what seems like minutes. An interesting side effect is that you learn very quickly what the strengths and weaknesses of your relationships are!Great fun..will try a different room soon!
Fantastic team-building. We did this as a work team building activity and it was brilliant. Lots of fun, would be great to do with friends too. Many thanks Hint Hunt!

Worth every penny. Not often you feel ticket prices in London are justified for special attractions but we left this feeling very happy for the guys behind it making good money from it! Totally deserved. Great game, very smart clues and interaction.. Can't recommend it enough. Will be back to try the other room!
Brilliant. We booked the three rooms for 12 of us as part of a team social and had such fun. It was brilliantly executed by hint hunt, and one of the best socials we have had. Highly recommended.

One of the best things to do in London. I have now done both rooms at HintHunt and it is so much fun. Such an unusual and exciting experience. The staff are great and it is all pit on in such a top quality way. They say they are building a third room and I cannot wait to try it.
Fantastic. a great way of getting together with people and testing the mind at the same time. great fun for all ages!

Must do in London. If you like puzzles and quizzes then this is the place for you. Booked last minute as a Christmas treat and it was the best thing we did over the break.The staff are very accommodating and help you set up well. We did the Zen room and exited with 5 seconds to spare. Will not spoil the fun but it used every member of the 5 person team we had and the hour just flew by.Would recommend this to anyone who likes to laugh, think and solve things.

Something very different and a great way to spend an hour. Fun, fast, frenetic! Myself and 3 others had heard of it and gave it a shot for my 30th bday. We did the zen room and it kept us going right to the end... A great laugh, challenging and totally different to your run of the mill cinema trip and will give you plenty to chat about in the pub afterwards
Absolutely brilliant! . Hinthunt is great fun and definitely a real test of friendship. Be sure to visit this place but, don't give away any secrets.

FANTASTIC experience, something different for all. Four of us done the hint hunt last night, and it was BRILLIANT. Even better than I expected. What a great idea. for those looking to do something a little different this is great. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and staff were very friendly. It is difficult, we made it out with 1minute 30 seconds to spare, but at a few points I thought that we would never get out. But the clues started to come together and all worked out.Absolute fun, and will be going back to try the Zen room and the new room coming next month very soon.! Definitely give it a try!

Most fun I've had in a long time. One hour. One room. 60 minutes of adrenaline rush. SO MUCH FUN. Really nice and super friendly staff too. I wouldn't read anything about it in advance if you're going to do it.

Great family treat. We were a family group of five people, age range 60s -30s and we had a brilliant time. Our guide set the scene before we started, then the door closed behind us and the adventure began. It was great fun, quite challenging - but the hints provided just enough support to move us on. Every member of the group was totally engrossed - the clock counting down added to the general excitement. I would highly recommend the experience.  If you have ever enjoyed The Crystal Maze, then you'll love it.
Extremelly challenging and fun. Great experience for a night out with friends, challanging but very unique and satisfying (whether You manage to get out in time or not) must do! :)

Great fun!. We went for a family day out here and did the Zen Room and had so much fun! It was much better than I had expected it to be. I don't want to say too much as I do not want to give anything but it really forced us to work together. Definitely not for young families but for us (3 very different girls in our twenties plus mum and dad) it was perfect and we all really got into it. The staff were great and we will definitely be going back to do the other room!

The original escape the room game. Did this as a corporate evening. We had a great time and would highly recommend it.The only downside was that there were too many things to rifle through (mostly books) that wasn't time and slowed it down a bit
Amazing!. I loved Hint Hunt. the hour you are locked in the room goes so faat, and its fast paced and great fun. I rebooked it as a work bonding event, and everyone loved it too. well worth doing.

Fantastic fun. It's hard to review something so different when you can't really say too much without ruining it! You'll have to trust the bulk of the 1000 reviews for this experience.What doesn't give too much away is that your team will be working together to solve puzzles and if you go with friends you'll have an awesome, hilarious time.

great way to spend an hour with a few friends. went as a surprise birthday treat with a few friends where we were split into 3 separate but identical rooms we were given a briefing before we started but it still did not sink in until we were locked in the room for one hour. Then amidst a whole range of emotions we managed to piece together what needed to happen, but eternally grateful for the hints given to us by the staff.It was also great afterwards comparing our very different experiences

Great time. Best game I've played. . This is a great way to get your mind going. We made it out with only a hand full of tips. The game is great and it wasn't as easy as we thought which was good. Challenged us. Either way a must on the to do list in London. Will go back that's for sure. The staff were funny and helpful. I have no idea why people would not like this.

The fastest 60 mins ever!. Won't spoil any surprises, but suffice to say that if you're a group of 3-5 looking for an hour to fill, this will tick the box in the best way.Great fun and really challenging puzzles which are all so satisfying when they get solved. Fortunately there's support from the staff if it's needed and they manage to keep you on the right track. We just couldn't believe how quickly the hour went.Would recommend of age 14 and above.

Fastest Hour of My Life. The professor leading out Study Abroad group dropped this activity onto our itinerary, but refused to tell us anything further about it other than the name. So needless to say going into HintHunt we had no clue what to expect and to be honest I think it made the experience that much better! Since we had such a large group we actually split into 5 groups which all competed for the best time! Our group won with 1 minute and 7 seconds remaining on the clock! I don't want to say too much as I don't want to ruin the game for anyone, but we had a great time solving the puzzles! You definitely need to bring your thinking cap, because you will use it! This activity helped bring our whole group closer together as you quickly learn everyone's strengths and weaknesses! The staff was very friendly and they are just as much fun as the game itself! I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to London! It is my hope they open one up in the United States!

What great fun. I cant give away too much as it would spoil the experience , but what great fun. A hour trying to solve devilish clues to escape from the room.Fast, frantic, frustrating. A great way to spend an hour or so with friends. Help is on hand if needed from the Hint Hunt team.Thanks go to Gloria for the extra special experience you gave us in the zen room today! It made what was already a great experience a little extra special.

Brilliant fun! . My boyfriend and I along with some friends of ours visited HintHunt for my birthday weekend and we had a great time! We booked the JM Office and whilst we initially thought the room looked quite bare, there was a lot more than met the eye! Can't say too much as I don't want to ruin the experience for anyone else, but I can say it's an experience I would highly recommend to anyone looking for something a little different/unusual for a night out. We all had so much fun and are looking into booking it again for another of my friends' birthday nights.

Something completely different and fun. We went to Hint Hunt on Sunday 9th November. It is something really different and fun. it's quite mind boggling trying to solve the clues. We did not manage to complete all the clues in the 1 hour allotted time but did quite well. I would recommend this to anyone looking for something different to do. The staff are really friendly and helpful.

HintHunt fun. This is brilliant for anyone who likes CSI type puzzles and thinks they could be a detective! It is fantastic fun and great as a team building exercise or for family or friends. I would thoroughly recommend it as an amazing way to spend an hour using your brain!

Awesome fun!. This was an absolutely fantastic experience to do in London. It took A LOT of brain power, which made us very proud when we escaped with 45 seconds to spare! The hints from the fantastic and helpful staff helped a lot, and helped us out when we were very stuck! I absolutely could not recommend this enough, it was brilliant!

Amazing!. Can't recommend this highly enough. We had an amazing time and were buzzing for ages afterwards. The hour went so quickly and we couldn't stop talking about the clues and what we should have done.Perfect for a group of friends or work social. Would love to do it again!

Outstanding fun!. Very impressed with the quality of the game room and the happy, friendly staff. We first played this type of game at Trap in Budapest and we're excited to see a similar one in London.The hints you are given through the game are very helpful. And where you find the clues ingenious!Highly reccomend it, very much worth the money.
what a fun. Cool, friendly stuff.This is a real challenge for those who like to use their brain!Don't waste your time for another horrific games. Try it this!

So much fun!. HintHunt is absolutely amazing! I wanted to do something different for my birthday this year and HintHunt was definitely a good choice. We booked out three rooms for 15 people and raced against each other and the time given to escape the room using the clues hidden. We literally spent the whole hour scratching our heads, getting into uncompromising positions to find things and pulling our hair out trying to work out what we had to do next. It was an awesome experience and the guys at HintHunt are super friendly so I'd highly recommend it. We're still buzzing from it now!

High Recommended. I do not want too much praise, and it was really fun place decorated with wonderful ideas! We went to four "Zen Room". The time passed so quickly, solve the problem by combining the power as the outgoing course jaemiteotda true. Well prepared, and the explanation is a little "hint" given from the "big sister" were a big help!

Perfect for team building!. Fantastic organizational support as we attempted to find dates where we could get 5 rooms at the same time. A very warm welcome on arrival from the HintHunt team. We were separated into groups and all went into different rooms that had different themes. The rooms were impressively designed which really added a great flavour to the activity. We were surprised by how challenging the game was and the time pressure made for great fun. It really helped our team bond and find out new strengths in each other. Most of all, it was just such great fun! Would recommend it to everyone!

Simply the best - Highly recommended!!. I recently undertook Hint Hunt, and what can i say - it was the best 1 hour of my life. The team at HintHunt were fantastic and our whole group walked away elated with the experience - so much so we booked the other room for a future trip.The good reviews are all true and i would suggest this for families, friends or a work social!

Something very different. This was a brilliant way to spend an couple of hours, it had us scratching our heads, laughing at each other, patting each other on the back and running round like headless chickens. If you fancy trying something a bit different I would highly recommend this.

Great fun. We were 15 colleagues who went to HintHunt as a "team-building" event. Anyways, it was a lot fun, I believe all had a good time. You can participate in the game even though you're not fluent in English. I can highly recommend the game :)
Great intellectual stimulation. I picked this for a work team social and it worked extremely well! A fast paced and exhausting hour that set us up nicely for the Euston Tap afterwards.

Just about the most fun you can have on a rainy Monday pm. Wha a fantastic time me, hubby and our 2 teenage boys had. Our boys are at that awkward age where they don't want to do anything with us. But I managed to convince them to come along to HintHunt after it was recommended by a friend. Literally the fastest hour of your life has you searching for clues and other objects to solve the mystery and open the door. Really don't want to give anything away but YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS OUT! I couldn't sleep last night going over everything, I want to do it again! We got out with 39 seconds left on the clock, very exciting!

The best hour of my life!!. Really difficult, endlessly surprising and incredibly satisfying if you manage to escape. I didn't think it could be as much fun but it was absolutely awesome!!! The Zen Room was fantastic!!!

Most amaizng hour ever!. I was given this as a present and I can say it was one of the best I have ever received! We all had the so fun and laughed a lot. It was great to do something different in London with my friends. Highly recommended for all ages and everyone!

CHALLENGING, BUT GREAT FUN. This will be the quickest hour you will ever spend. The 'who dunnit' themed rooms are expertly equipped, challenging the quickest brain. Suitable for older teenagers as well as adults. I can't wait to endure another room.

This is simply a must do when visiting London.. What a brainwave the creator had! One of the most fun, exciting, challenging hour we've had! I am raving about it & been telling loads of Londoners about it! They hadn't even heard of it! We spent half term in & around London having travelled from NE England & this was the most original thing we have ever done. I knew of others who had done it & from August was checking the site for our available dates - as you have to plan your visit well in advance - but more than worth it. It was great for family to do together (4 of us incl 2 16yr olds) everyone loved it. I think it would also be great for a team building event (small team up to 5) - I would love to do this type of thing with my colleagues too - what a laugh & loads to talk about after. Planning our next trip so we can do the other room!!

Excellent fun. Such a great concept, and superbly executed. Very clever, frustratingly sneaky (but in a good way!), challenging, and fast paced - whenever we got a bit stuck the hints were very helpful...Parents with 13 year old boy and 9 year old girl...and we all want another go!

Wow! Family bonding at its best.... We played HintHunt this week as a family of four (two boys 13,11 and parents) and all I can say is our boys thought this one hour in London was the best time of our 4 day break. We found HintHunt easily enough and on arrival we were greeted warmly, the game explained clearly, and we were eager to start. I will not give too much away but as a family we managed to escape our room with literally a couple of minutes to spare. We all loved the logic puzzles and the challenge of getting out of the room together so much we tried to book the Zen room for the day after! You will not be disappointed, HintHunt is brilliant!!

Great fun for all!. We went to Hint Hunt for my daughters 17th birthday as a family of 5 along with 3 of her friends. We split into two teams and made it a competition to see who could get out of their room 1st! Well it was the quickest hour I've ever experienced! My youngest is 12 & the eldest (hubby ) 47 and teenagers in between and every age absolutely loved the concept of Hint Hunt! The challenge to get out of the room using codes, passwords and keys to unlock items was brilliant - trying to find all of them was very challenging but the hints that appeared on the screen were great! We will definitely try the Zen room next time and highly recommend Hint Hunt to all!
Fantastic!. Had an really great hour with my 2 teenage children. It was the highlight of their trip to London... Wish we had one in Nottingham because I want all my friends to do it too...

Such a fun experience!. I went as work do with a group of a 7 colleagues. We were split into groups of 4 /3 and booked into two parallel rooms to complete the same puzzle ‘JM’s office’. I normally write long reviews but in this instance all I will say is if you are in London 100% try and visit this attraction!! It was so much fun, I have never experienced anything like it and you really have to work together to solve it so it is a good team building activity for work. My group managed to solve the mystery and escape the room in time.... and no I am not going to tell you how!! Go along and give it a go for yourself, you won’t regret it.
amazing. I would 100% recommend hinthunt to ANYONE! I couldn't fault it, the staff were lovely and the experience was amazing! I will defiantly do it again!
SOOO much fun. The best fun activity I've done in a long timeMy friends and are were so excited to go and even so it blew our mindsA great gift for fun adventurous people

Amazeballs!. Went for a JM session for other half's birthday with a group of friends. Staff were knowledgeable, welcoming, and dropped hints at exactly the right time throughout the game. We enjoyed it so much that we're planning another one hopefully not too far in the future. Amazing experience!

Best with buddies. We went there as a group of 4 guys. We were all new to the concept, and luckily enough checked this well ahead of time before our visit to London, so we were able to book a slot - beware they are pretty well booked out for weeks. The riddles were difficult, so for newcomers we needed loads of hints, but we could manage in the end with 2 minutes to spare. The best part for us was the change of group dynamics during the game, sometimes we fighted, sometimes cheered together, and in the end happy with the escape. Great fun, I will try more of these games.

Great!!!. Can only add to all the other positive comments on here. A great experience for me and the children I was with. I think ten year olds would be the youngest children could be to get anything out of it

Fantastic Fun !. I've now gone twice! Done both their rooms and looking forward to the new room being launched! So much FUN ! Really enjoy working out the puzzles. The staff are fantastic. One of the best things to do in London.

So much fun. Four of us tried this and we were all blown away by how great it was - some high tempers occasionally but solving the puzzles and finding clues was always rewarding - even if we hadn't succeeded (with 52 seconds left!) it would have been just as much fun!
Definitely Recommend!. Been twice and loved it both times... once with friends and once with work colleagues, great fun! Would definitely recommend!

Hint Hunt addict!. I booked two parallel rooms for a birthday treat having completed a room with colleagues a few months previous. I had as much fun this time as I did the last. The experience is fun, practical and definitely keeps you on your toes! I cannot wait for the third room.

Superb Hour of Your Life!. Great way for 3-5 friends to spend an hour bonding in London. Go there with an open mind, don't read anything on the Internet before hand and just go with the flow. The guy hosting was excellent.

Great fun. My friends and I were looking for something fun and different to do and we found it at HintHunt. It was challenging but great fun, and you'd be surprised how quickly the hour goes. There were three of us and we completed the challenge with 2 minutes and 10 seconds to go. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and I would recommend this to anyone. We will definitely be going back to do the other room.

Amazing Teambuilding Activity. On our first day at a summer camp, we were taken here as a teambuilding activity. It really helped us communicate and get to know the new faces in our teams as you are forced to communicate. The game itself is thrilling and you will be on your toes at every moment as you try to crack the code.

Well-paced, challenging - very rewarding.. I've completed both the rooms at HintHunt (and I'm sure I'll sign up for the new, third room as soon as it is available).It was a great experience both times - the game is sufficiently challenging without being frustrating, with a variety of tasks to complete each time.

Brain Teaser. We did this as a team building event and had 2 teams racing against each other to work out the clues in order to escape from the room. The fact that the rooms were dressed exactly the same was a great idea so no unfair advantages! It was such a different thing for us to do and we really enjoyed working out the various puzzles within the hour - none of which are straightforward. The "hints" that came in via the tv monitor from time to time were really useful when we seemed to be hitting a blank - not telling - but just nudging a bit in the right direction.Unfortunately the other team beat mine but we then spent the next couple of hours over a drink discussing how we solved each clue - Would highly recommend for a team building event.

Brilliant hour with friends. We did JM's study as a group of four and had one of the most adrenaline fueled hours of our lives. To begin with we weren't really sure what we were looking for but the mystery began to make sense as the hour wore on and by about half way through we were sprinting around gathering information and putting everything together. A fabulous activity and we booked straight in for the Zen room... can't wait til January for that!A great hour of fun and would be perfect for groups of friends, families, or anyone who wants a brain-stretching challenge adventure. (Also, very hard to review properly without giving any of the secrets away!).
Brilliant way to spend an intense hour. Think Crystal Maze without the water traps. An hour full of brainteasers, puzzles and code cracking flew by. I think 4 is the perfect number for a team.

Very unusual, lots of fun. We've done this twice now, the kids love it. It's a very unusual thing to do - get locked into a room and spend an hour to escape using a series of codes and hidden keys. Clues are given via a video monitor in the room. It's not easy!Hint Hunt is a short walk from Euston and Kings Cross, the people working there are lovely and it's quite refreshing to find an activity that has no cafe or shop attached, just one clean loo! I recommend it.

A great experience. Hopped off the train and straight to hint hunt with a group of friends, with a warm welcome and great tips- we went to start our game. Really well thought out and so much fun. Highly recommended!

60 minutes of competitive fun. We weren't quite sure what we were letting ourselves in for so our visit to HintHunt turned out to be a very pleasant surprise.
