The welcome was very friendly and the briefing was both intriguing and helpful. We then spent 60 minutes fully engaged on the task in hand. It tested our minds and ingenuity and above all it brought out the inner child in each of us. Great fun and highly recommended for a competitive team event.
So Close. Yet so far! The host kept saying we were close to solving, but he was being diplomatic. Super fun though! We wanted to try again right away.

The best activity in London!. I came here having received a voucher as a gift, and I must say it was one of the best activities I've ever taken part in.Having seen the reviews I was intrigued, but you really have to take part yourself to see just how enjoyable it really is.I don't want to give any spoilers for potential visitors - all I can say is you'll have a great time, it's fun, challenging, often stressful but overall a fantastic experience.You've got to give this a try!

AMAZING & FUN!!!! Highly recommend HintHunt!. Went there with 3 friends as my birthday present, and this HintHunt game has been one of the best gifts I have ever received IN MY LIFE! We did the JM's office game, and it was more than just a game. Really good place to practically using my brain. The experience of it is completely new and unique - before going to the venue, my friends and I discussed about how the game was inspired and what we should prepare, but when we later on played the game in real persons with friends, is was much more than we ever expected. The levels of FUN and SATISFACTION from online games are far far beyond reaching the HintHunt games giving me/us (i.e. Fun level of HintHunt: full marks, online games are nothing) ! Moreover, the game is more than just a game: surprisingly, the game even allows me to know more about the strengths of myself and my friends, that we can see that we are in good team work, too, apart of being good friends. :) Prior to the game started, Gloria, the Game-master, was very professionally funny and friendly. She welcomed us to ask any questions to ensure that we were all familiar with how the game worked and what we should do to complete the tasks. During the game she was also very nice and patient to guide us even though that we might find the hints a bit too slowly lol. Her help and guidance indeed gave us more delight about the JM's office room game.About the design of the game, I would just love to say how amazing the details for the set up of the rooms could be. After the game ended, me and my friends just kept sharing about how fun it was and I kept laughing at myself of paying attentions to some "hints" but actually not relevant, and how proud we were to sort out the hints together. Overall to say, the game was really inspiring, challenging but so fun to overcome with. I could not imagine how satisfied I was when finishing the game. Atmosphere, therefore, was very well created there! I'd actually give the game 10 out of the 5, even though 5 is a limit!Highly recommend to play in a group of 4 to 5. Can be purely for fun and I reckon it is also very good for corporates to book HintHunt as a team-building activity. Me and my friends truly look forward to having fun once again but in Zen's room and the new one coming soon in November! Can't wait! Thanks to HintHunt and especially to Gloria!

Prepare for an hour long brain exercises. The whole experience has been amazing and challenging. As a group of 4 with various backgrounds, we managed to hit the buzzer beater at last second. Gloria, the host, has been great in preparing the rooms and guide us through the game. Some hints are really hard to pick up and I think this is the beauty of this game. We are looking forward to head to the Zen room next!

So much fun. Four of us played the JM study game and we weren't sure what to expect. It was one if the quickest and fun hours ever! We solved the game with literally seconds to spare! Would definitely recommend it. We wanted to return with the rest of the family to try the other room but they were not flexible on letting the 6 of us play together so we are now visiting cluequest instead but I would like to give the zen room a try at some point.
Hint hunt. Amazing place for team building actitivity to develop the team work Different experience . Will visit it again
Absolutely great fun !. We had so much fun in the Zen room ... family of 4 and we made it out just in time ... the kids (13 & 14) absolutely loved it!

Awesome!. Loved it! Went with 3 friends. Wont give any secrets away but a huge amount of effort goes into the clues. We made it out with a minute to spare, you will need the full hour. Really is worth a visit and I will return one day to try and complete the other room!

A-mazing!. I would recommend going as a minimum group of 4 people. We tried out the Zen room, and it was a non-stop adrenaline fuelled activity that kept our attention for the entire durations! Highly recommended! Such a clever game!

HINT HUNT. Really fun different experience- well worth the money! It was like being on the Crystal Maze and you don't stop for a second! We went in the ZEN room and couldn't believe how much thought had gone into it. Definitely going to book to do the other room!
Excellent family activity, something a bit different. We went with out two teenage daughters who loved the challenge of it. Had to work together to solve the clues. Great family activity.
Brilliant!. Really good. 10 of us went and hired out the two Japanese Zen rooms! Was good team work, you'll love it if you like solving puzzles :) Really recommend it well worth the money!

Brilliant brilliant brilliant!!!!. Oh my goodness this is the best way you will ever spend and hour of your time. It is BRILLIANT! We went with work colleagues as part of a team building day and this more than ticked that box.

Best evening out for ages. What an experience. We did it as a group or 3 and probably could have done with an extra pair of hands and additional brain power, but what fun! Quite challenging puzzles, but the hints and number of tasks keep you enthused for the whole time. Well thought out and structured .... just a shame there is only two rooms!

Amazing fun. I've done both of the rooms available (Zen and John Munroe) and really enjoyed the experience --- solved both! One or two of the puzzles are quite hard for the time allowed, but the Hints keep you going, you just need to explore and look at everything twice! Really loved it.

Great Experience. What is great about HintHunt, is you get to do it with your own group, as opposed to NY and other areas where you are grouped in with random strangers. Really great experience, and something different.

Did not match expectations. We went there expecting something great but sadly it did not match our expectations. We were a group of 8 and the SEATING AREA was not spacious enough for us to fit in. The puzzles were extremly difficult, the staff were not enthusiastic at all and the rooms were small and not well organised. However, if we had more time we may have been able to solve it. The lady just entered and started solving it herself towards the end. In CLUEQUEST they give you more time. I suggest you check out CLUEQUEST unless you like wasting your time and money.

Excellent. I invited friends to this for my birthday, not really knowing what to expect. We had trouble explaining to our families what we were doing!But, we were in for one of the best hours of our lives - this attraction is one of the best activities, not just in London, but perhaps also in England and Europe.Genuinely excellent.

One magic hour!. The staff are friendly, and HintHunt is super exciting and challenging. I can't really give out too much information, but you will have one hour to solve an abundance of clues and riddles, and it'll be the quickest hour of your life. So much fun and perfect for a group/team event!
Excellent!. We booked for a birthday treat and were not disappointed!We came out and immediately booked to do the other room - such a great experience! Loved it! Would recommend to anyone!

Fantastic fun experience - don't miss out! Try it!. Went here with my partner and teenage children into the James Murdoch room. Brilliant fun - having to crack codes and solve the crime :) Really tough challenge too...got one hour to solve the crime - they watch your efforts and give you hints along the way - good luck! Well worth the money for the experience. Really friendly staff too :) Want to go back now with my extended family to try the other rooms. They have 3 James Murdoch rooms of identical set, and I think 2 of the Japanese set - so a larger group can split into 2 or 3 and compete against each other! Not physically demanding although need to get onto the floor a couple of time so as long as one person in the group can do that, it's fine....fantastic fun! Would highly recommend it! :) PS: couldn't take photos/videos in there otherwise would give too much away for others.

Something different!. Excellent attraction, we attempted it with a group of 5 and needed a extra minute - and thus were pipped at the post. Would definitely go back for a different room and recommend to anyone young or old!

Excellent break from the 'norm'. Four 30 'somethings in London for their annual weekend away. What a brilliantly unexpected find! Had us working as a team, whooping and laughing with each clue! So clever, brilliant fun can't wait to go back and try the zen room. Give it a try you won't be disappointed!

My new favourite thing. If you like playing locked room games on your tablet or are a fan of shows like the Crystal Maze then I highly recommend this. Without saying too much and giving the game away you have 60 minutes to get out of a locked room by looking for clues. It was a lot harder than we expected and had to have a few hints. Definitely tested our lateral thinking and puzzle solving ability. Will be returning to try their other room very soon!
Incredible - such a buzz and much trickier than it seems!. Fantastic experience; really different from other activities in London and loads of fun to do as a group.
Great fun!. Excellent way to spend an hour in London. A group of 4 of us made it out with less than two minutes to go - nail biting! Highly recommended, especially if you enjoy a challenge.
Great fun. This is one of the best things to do in London, It was really good fun and challenging, and the right level of difficulty.

What an excellent idea. The title says it all. What a amazing find. So well organised and great for team building or going with mates. Staff are a good laugh and the time flies (quite literally). I won't go into detail about what it is about but it involves searching for clues and answering puzzles. Quite a la Crystal Maze but nicely different.

What a fab afternoon!. This was damn good, very exciting and the hour seemed to pass in minutes with all of the brilliant puzzles. Would definitely recommend to all, especially competitive friends and families. Cheers HintHunt ily we'll be back soon my love xxx

great fun and a real challenge!. We all had an amazing time and would go again if they have more rooms to try! We've been there twice now and I hear they have a third room on the back burner. Maybe it's in play already? all in all a really fun evening to have with friends or family. My son (16) really enjoyed himself.

Absolutely amazing!. You have to do this! It was so amazing... As soon as we finished (the Zen room), we booked to do the other room. All the staff were lovely and friendly, and always up for a laugh. The game itself is frustrating (in a good way!) and it was a brilliant way to spend an hour. So many laughs and emotions, getting out with 46 seconds to go! Not a bad word to say about it; efficiently run and just the right amount of challenge vs. enjoyment!

Hilarious and worth every penny. A cracking way to spend a random hour. Lives up to the hype. We made it out (phew!) and I can't wait to book again to do one of the other rooms. One of the best and most original things I've done in years.

Great fun. 4 of us went hinthunt Zen room on a Sunday evening, We booked about 1 month in advance. It was our first time to play escape the room type of game and great fun! Can not wait to try other ones!

Amazing. The game was great and very original. Very well made up detective story and perfectly organized. We had a great time the only thing I was sorry for that we couldn't try the other ZEN room because we didn't have enought time in London this year. Will definitely return and try the other rooms.The hosts were very friendly and helpful.

brilliant experience!. we played in three teams (same challenge for all three groups), and it was everything we had hoped for! challenging, interesting, pressure to beat the clock - and the clues had something for everyone to be able to join in. It really was about team work... there were three of us in one team, and we made it with barely 6 seconds to spare! The staff are fantastic, and the whole experience made for a great day out. suitable for families, co-workers, groupd of friends etc - I would definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys puzzles, mysteries and challenges - and to anyone who used to enjoy watching the Crystal Maze!

Kids voted this their favorite activity in London. This review is long over-due, as we visited in June 2014. This was a big family trip to Europe, with London being the first stop (and the first time to London for all three of our kids, aged 18, 14, and 12). There are so many reviews and details about this place already written that I won't repeat them again ---- suffice it to say that our kids voted this their favorite activity in London (and we saw/did quite a bit over four days), and definitely one of their favorites from the whole trip (which also covered Munich, Tuscany, and Venice). It's a great family activity, especially for those who enjoy puzzles and mysteries -- even our youngest could help because she noticed some things that we overlooked. We made it out with just a minute or so to spare, and we had to rely on a lot of clues -- but it was really fun and doesn't take too much time from other sight-seeing. We enjoyed it so much that we did a similar activity in Munich. We hope they will expand to the U.S. soon!

Awesome fun!. Cannot recommend this place highly enough. Trying to find clues and keys and figure out codes for locks to escape was great fun.We went as a team of 3 and managed to escape just in time. I thought I might find the experience claustrophobic but within about 10 seconds of being locked in I had forgotten all about that and was engrossed in looking for clues and hidden objects!Anyone who enjoys puzzles and games will love this place.

Great day for co-workers or friends. We went to HintHunt for our HR Department's Team Day out and we had an absolute blast. It was so much fun! I have already re-booked to visit again with my family when they visit from Canada in December. Great use of 60 minutes!
The best attraction I've been to in years. We went as part of a company social event and everyone loved it! An hour isn't enough and I'm already looking to go back to try the Zen room.

Brilliant!. This is a fabulous way to spend an hour in London, and I'd highly recommend it! We (four people) played the Zen room and found it to be amazingly good fun. Book well in advance - it's almost fully booked at weekends, and presumably busy during the week too. Amazing fun!

So frustrating.....you'd pay to do it again!. Being given the chance to experience the extensive range of human emotions in the space of an hour (and about 9 square meters) is not something that I'd enjoy doing but with HintHunt I would be inclined to go through this roller-coaster again. My partner and I did this with her parents......not that I'd suggest being tested like that.The thrill of achieving a goal without the assistance is great but getting assistance is a must as initially everything is so overwhelming you think that everything is a clue. With a group the clues are spaced out for everybody to have a go at solving the puzzle. We did not escape in time and honestly I had never been so frustrated. Luckily we were all able to laugh about it but I'd be itching to go back and give another a go.
SO MUCH FUN!. Joined Tripadvisor just so I can give HintHunt a review because it was a brilliant experience. Absolutely loved it and would definitely recommend it to anyone. Going back again.

Unlock the detective in you. I can't reveal much as it would spoil the purpose of the game so all I will say is we had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.The hour went by really fast and strangely enough we felt we achieved loads in so little time.We were out in 57'30. Record time for the JM room is 53'30 we were told.Teams of 4 work best they say, I agree that 5 would be one too many.I'll definitively try the Zen room on another occasion :)Piece of advice: keep your eyes open and always look twice.

Okay, Wow. My entire family went here as an idea to pass some time one day. We were lucky enough to get a same day booking. We arrived and were briefed by a incredibly nice staff and started our session. I will not spoil anything related to the story, you must find out for yourself. We escaped with 4 seconds to spare after a mad dash to the finish. The mystery was well thought out and had a few GREAT twists. I swear, this is the FASTEST way to pass an hour in existence. For people thinking that the staff butters people to give good reviews, you are wrong on every level. Book a few months in advance and be there a little early. Also, EVERYBODY MUST go to the bathroom just before or risk a catastrophic bladder emergency from which there is no escape until you run out of time, or the mystery is solved.

There's a reason theres a three month waiting list for this event!. I booked this event for my cousin who loves mind puzzles and avidly watched the Crystal Maze when we were younger. We weren't quite sure what to expect when we got there as the location was very unassuming but wow the experience that we got was incredible. Time flies when you are in there- one hour feels like ten minutes and we were so engrossed in the task we were disappointed when it all came to an end. The three of us shouted,laughed, argued and battled together and we could not stop talking about it when we left. We are hoping to tackle the Zen room next!

Can't wait for another room to open!. The best way to spend an hour in London - fun and challenging for all ages and a brilliant way to bond as a group. I have completed both rooms currently open, the second time with a group of people who had not been to HintHunt yet and did not quite understand why I was so excited to be going. After the hour had passed very quickly, and we had barely made it out, they understood my excitement completely!

Prepare to have your brain jiggled!!. Fascinating, intriguing, frustrating, engrossing, puzzling, bewildering, misleading, confusing, enlightening, amazing, enthralling! I had no idea what to expect. It was all of that plus some!! My 28 year son and his gorgeous Hungarian girlfriend bought this for me as my birthday treat so the four of us (my husband came as well) endeavoured to hunt the hints. The hour flew by. There were so many twists and turns and so many layers. It was completely brilliant and absorbing. We were within one minute of escaping!! It didn’t matter that we had been defeated we had all had a fantastic time.
Great Fun!. My wife, daughter and I tried a Zen room and managed to solve the puzzle (with a few hints!) and unlock the door before time ran out. Definitely need your thinking cap for this one!

Better Than Expected--Fun for our Entire Family. I booked this based upon TripAdvisor ratings and reviews, but I was a bit wary about whether we would like it or not. In particular, I wondered if my son (age 10) would be lost and unhappy while his genius/older teenaged sister and parents solved everything.Little did I know that my son would be the star of the show!! We learned by the time it was over that he was the best person in the family at figuring this out, AND he even solved the very last puzzle that allowed us to escape!! Truly it was a team effort and even the youngest in our group could make significant contributions.So I won't say anything else, because I don't want to spoil for you!! Loads of fun, entertaining for all ages, a great team-building exercise, and something a little different too! A definite highlight of our trip to London, in everybody's book.

Great Team work activity. I tried this with my friends and we all had a blast.It is very challenging and really needs great team work efforts.It is fun for families even.And for the one who is asking:no we did not manage to get out of the room in 60 min :( But we had greaaaaat Fun ;)

What great fun and something different. We arrived with 2 children 13 and 11 and did not know what to expect.Wow. All 4 of us were really engaged and could not wait to start the clue trail to escape.Fantastic fun. We have been talking about it for the last 7 hours. And we escaped,Can't wait to try the the room.Enjoy it!

Locked in Frenzy. Hint Hunt was a belated Father's Day present which turned into a family outing. We had no idea what to expect. Certainly no spoilers here as the element of surprise would be taken away. The whole experience reminded me of the once popular TV series: 'Crystal Maze'. Here you are locked in a room where you are challenged to problem solve as a team from clues collected from a wide variety of sources in order to get out. It was such a unique experience, thoroughly enjoyable and pleasurably exhausting,

A bit costly but utter fun. Went with my wife and few friends.. Was quite unsure as to why I am paying so much.. But must say.. it was an exciting hour... would ve given 5 star but the cost needs to be reduced for that.. :)Will be visiting for other rooms soon
Fun!. A great way to get the kid's braincells fired up without the misery of yet another museum visit. Our kids are great with lateral thinking puzzles and raced to our rescue!

A really amazing activity. Went with a group of friends (all in our early 20s) and had the best time in the Zen room. Never knew there was anything like this in the UK and would recommend to everyone of all ages. Don't want to ruin the surprise for first time goers but will definitely challenge everyone and get people to think outside the box. Sadly we didn't solve everything in the given hour but still had a great time and the guy who was supervising the group (from outside) talked us through the final steps we didn't get round to. To cut it short, this is a great activity for a great price, book today!
It's a gem!. Great fun, such a clever theme. A must do in London. I'm told there are different rooms in Budapest.

Highlight of the trip for our family as it was a complete surprise. I hadn't told anyone in the family what we were doing and they had never heard of it before so were completely unprepared. For my 'kids' aged 22 and 17, they loved that I had found something completely unexpected. Like others have said, it was great doing something as a family with no gadgets. I thought there might have been disagreements - but there was no time for that! The music was a bit intrusive to start with but added to the sense or urgency by the end.Good tip in previous review about deciding on a team name before you go! Always tricky!

Good fun!. Can only recommend this. Very well prepared and intriguing but literally unsolvable without the hints. Good fund. We had the Zen room but will certainly come back to try the other one.Very reasonably priced as well

An hour of exciting fun. Me and my three sisters came for some thing to do. We were late but HintHunt we're really kind and patient with us and we still got our full hour. I didn't know what to expect and was extremely surprised. They don't give much away on the website which is how it should be, we would love to come back and try the other rooms. Thanks

Time has never gone so fast. This is the second time we have visited Hint Hunt and we have now don't both rooms that are available. It's such an unusual thing to do but so exciting. The feeling you get when you manage to escape is so exhirating! I would definitely recommend as would the rest of my team P.s. Plan a team name in advance incase you win!

Fantastic Fun.. Our family of four (with two boys: 14 and 11) went one Saturday afternoon to solve the HintHunt puzzle. It was fantastic fun and everyone loved it. We loved figuring out the puzzles and felt especially clever to have solved it in time. Highly recommended.Top tip: Book well in advance. It's a small place, so there's not that many slots available. We booked our Saturday slot about four months ahead of time.

Challenging. The game was engaging, fun, exciting and with in reach. If only we had five more minutes we would have made our way out. Half the groups succeed. Work hard and quickly it's definitely worth it and our 20/17 year old kids loved it. A trip high light!

Intense experience. I went with 2 friends. The recommended group size is 4 but 3 was plenty. We went into the standard room. Loved every second of this murder-mystery! Felt like Sherlock for a bit. Will return to try out the Zen room.

Awesome!!. Booked this for my boyfriends birthday with a group of our friends (5 of us) and it was a brilliant experience. You are 'locked' in a room which is filled with hidden clues and keys which help you to escape the room. Definitely doesn't feel like an hour as the time slowly ticks away! One thing to improve on would maybe be the price, we paid £21 each to play which on a student budget is quite high. Maybe if they offered a student discount or some kind of offer for weekdays or something? All in all i don't think the money was wasted at all and we would love to go back.

Good fun!. Very well set up. You're not sure whether you're in the right place when you're arrive as there's no big reception or anything like that, but it sort of adds the mystery. Well worth a visit as a fun thing to do in London. I won't say anymore otherwise it'll ruin the surprise!

60mins of frenzied fun. Locked in a small room with three work friends, 60mins on the clock and a stack of endless puzzles and clues to solve to allow you to escape. What could be better ;0)All gets quite hairy as the clock rapidly ticks away and we escaped with 27 seconds on the clock. All in all, an awesome way to spend an hour, we all had a lot of fun. We'll definitely be going again to try the Zen room. Not going to give away any clues (sorry) other than follow the advice your host.

Alternative things to do in London. Absolute class way to spend an hour, though it felt ore like 10 minutes because we were having so much fun. Went with my wife and two kids (18 and 19) and we all loved it. The kids were begging to go back the next day but they were fully booked. You need to book a long way in advance. The staff are fab. We'll be back!

Stop reading reviews and book it!. This was one of the best activities I've ever done! Everyone in our group of 5 LOVED it, so much so we're booking one of the other rooms. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I don't really want to say much as I think you're better off not knowing anything. Just try it!
Escaped with 5.30 on the clock. Excellent for friends, family or work colleagues. Not as easy as you imagine. Very cleaver and well though out

Great team day out!. We went as a big group from work so had 3 rooms in use at once. We had 5 people in team. All the teams had such a good time. It’s really well planned and thought out. That one hour goes so quickly as you are constantly busy trying to work out all your clues. I would definitely recommend it. It’s just great.

Such a blast!. I'm not going to lie, when we arrived at the building...my friends and I had no idea what to expect. We showed up about 30 minutes early (per my friends instruction - she said that's what the site advises), but we were (quite rudely - our only complaint about the whole thing) asked to come back at the start time. We showed up about 5 minutes before we were supposed to start, and a very sweet lady explained a little bit about what the game. She then took us down to our room, and...well...I won't give away anymore, but I will say that it was an absolute BLAST! I've never known an hour to go by so quickly! My friends and I (ranging in age from 22 to 24) are avid mystery fans, so it was right up our alley. It's a little pricey, but if you have the money and a spare hour or so I strongly suggest trying this out!

Great team fun. Definitely going again. This was a great experience, great introduction from staff, super friendly. The room was set up excellently. I would definitely recommended this for team events, but also for groups of friends who want to do something different. Great value.

Excellent day out for the family!. Organised as a surprise event of the family - everyone loved it. I was surprised and pleased how the teenagers threw themselves into the series of tasks and puzzles and we worked well as a team. Came out feeling we'd achieved, even though we didn't manage to escape from the room in the given time. Felt like we'd had a good day out - whereas the event is only an hour. Would highly recommend for families or team bonding!

Phenomenal. could not recommend higher. Hadnt even heard of this until I bought a groupon voucher for it one day - and since this one - ive been to a couple of other similar ones round the country.none of them really compare with regards to how complex and well thought out it all was though.only downside is that the place is very difficult to find
Great fun. This place is good. You'll need to reserve in advance.You have about an hour to solve the clues, the staff do help to make sure you are not completely lost.Worth going in a group.

From ages 14 - 64, everybody had a great time!. What a wonderfully different day out with my family! We were a group of seven so we got two rooms at the same time. Had a terrific time and everybody in the family, grandparents, parents, kids and a boyfriend, had great fun while communicating a lot and exercising the brain. Tons of thanks to the HintHunt team who helped us out with our booking and made some arrangements so our whole party could come together and enjoy themselves. You need to talk together and help each other out, I find that very refreshing in these latest times of smart phones, tablets and computers. Nice to look up from the screens and do something fun together.Recommend 100%!

Fantastic fun. A wonderful way to spend some time in London. You will not regret it. You are locked in a room and have to work your way through a series of clues to escape. All of us ages 10 to 53 enjoyed it. Can't say anymore or I'd have to kill you... Trust us, go

Fun!. We walked into Hint Hunt with a great deal of confidence (2 seniors, 3 adults and a 9 year old) expecting to come out the other side of the hour high five-ing and gloating about our combined sleuthing prowess. 60 minutes later we came out defeated and humbled but with the biggest grins on our faces all around!It was so much fun, regardless of the fact that we were no where near solving anything hahaha. One piece of advise : Forget everything you know and just allow yourself to be creative, inquisitive and ridiculous, but most of all have fun!!

So much fun!. I know, the reviews are kind of cryptic about what this is all about, but you should trust us and just go. I went with my family (my 72 year old mother down to my 2 teenage girls) and we all had a terrific time. We solved the final puzzle with 1:50 to go. Don't worry, they help you along the way, but it was an incredibly fast and fun 60 minutes. I wish they'd open one near me in NY so I could go with my friends.

Great fun, even though we failed to escape. There were three of us (mom, dad, 12yo) and we had no idea what to expect. We wouldn't have made it as far as we did without the hints, but they were teetering on the edge between helpful and annoying. The best bits were the parts we figured out on our own. It was good to get a walk through debriefing of what we had left. We're all interested in doing something like that again! Definitely recommend.

Great Fun!. Had a voucher for hint hunt for my birthday and went with 5 friends.It was brilliant fun. Quite modest with regards it's settings.The staff were very friendly and informative.The actual 60min game was superb! Really challenging and encourages team working to solve the endless puzzles, etc.I would highly recommend it to everybody - if you enjoyed the crystal maze as a youngster then do this!

Lots of fun. We are a family of four, kids ages 12 and 14, and we were on our first trip to London when we did this. It was great fun. The room was hard - we solved it only with 7 seconds to spare, and got a lot of clues towards the end. It whet our appetite for doing more of these, and we immediately tried to re-book but couldn't so, we had to try another company's escape room. This was by far more professional and exciting, but again, very difficult!

Fiendishly Difficult Family Fun!. I booked this for SWMBO and our three kids as part of a couple of days in London.Getting to the venue is very straight forward, turn left out of Euston station and walk for 5 minutes and it's on the right hand side about 5 mins away.We chose the Zen room, where we had to decipher some clues and solve problems to effect our escape within 1 hour. There were plenty of hints to keep us going when we were running down some blind alleys!We escaped with 13 seconds to spare!A great way to spend an hour or so when you're in London!!

fun for all the family. Our party consisted of 2 50-somethings and 3 teenagers. This was one of the few attractions we visited in London which we ALL enjoyed. We did the Zen room and everyone wants to go back to do the other room as soon as possible.

great game, don't be late though! . We've been to Clue Quest before this game which is very similar so we wanted to play it again only a different puzzle.. For this experience we came to the game late, therfore we were to push the whole schedule behind because the day was fully booked. I guess the hint hunt person that was with us wanted us to not be any more late, thus giving us so many helping hints in order for us to finish... Bottom line is we only really solved the first third of the game and the rest was following instructions.. Still love the game, and would recommend it to people :)

Brilliant 60 minutes!. Can't recommend this enough. Went as a group of 4 friends and escaped James Murdoch's office with 4 minutes to spare. Had a great welcome from the staff and a thoroughly awesome time. So much so that we've just booked ourselves into the Zen room for another challenge in October. Can't wait!

Amazing team fun . We visited as an office team of 15 so had 3 rooms. It was fantastic! Won't give anything away but the challenges are great fun, anyone can join in & you feel really exhilarated at the end (even though none of us escaped!!) everyone has given feedback that it was great fun & we hope the rooms will be revamped so we can go again. Really fab entertainment!

Even teens like it!. We spent a great hour with our 2 teenage children here. It's very challenging - loads of clues to find and puzzle out and you have to work together. It's very well organised and the person welcoming us and beaming in clues to us was great. Thoroughly recommend it.
Something different. The quickest hour of your life! stressful fun for all the family to enjoy :) Price and out the way location is the only reason i would not return.

Excellent fun!! . There was 3 of us that went and we had no idea what to expect! It's was such good fun! Really well organised and the lady that welcomed us was very good!Def recommend!! We will be back for the other room!wish they had more rooms!!
Unexpected. I went to the Hinthunt a few months ago for a work do and was pleasantly surprised! Despite being a very simple concept I had great fun and would definitely recommend :)
Brilliant Well Worth A Visit. It's like nothing I've ever done before! We all had a fantastic time and hope to do the zen room soon! This would be a great activity for team building.
Great. Had a really good time. Have done several of these before and found HintHunt probably the most challenging. Didn't get out the room in time but we will be back to make sure we do!

Brilliant Fun!. Didn't manage to solve the room but we were sooo close! We were a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 11-year olds) and think this is a really good activity to enjoy together. Will be going again!

So much fun... I know what you are thinking- who visits London and goes to "HintHunt'!! We had 2 adults and 3 17 year olds and this was one of the highlights of our week in London. We had so much fun. In fact, we all wanted to go back a send time to tackle the 2nd room. We visited Camden Market(our favourite market in London) in the morning and for lunch, which is close by. So this turned out great- visit the market and then head to HintHunt. If we return to London- we would return to HintHunt for the second room. My only tip is- it can be hard to book a room- they fill up fast and you seem to need a paypal account- so make sure you have that handy when you go online to book your time. .

Group fun. Loved it!!!. We came to Hint Hunt as a family of 5 (children ages: 8, 10, 13) and we loved it. It's a great game, requires group work, cooperation, thinking and thorough search....We really enjoyed it, although we didn't solve the whole puzzle. And as many said before me: those were the shortest 60 minutes we've ever had...

Incredible fun!. Went with a group of 4 friends (2 couples), and we loved it! The game is incredibly well set up with the ''hint giver'' giving just the right about of hints and clues to help us out. The decor matches the theme so well, and the room even smells nice! We luckily got out with a minute to spare!

Real fun for the whole family!. Visited on 12 of August, two patents and 15 years old teenager.This was a mind-challenging adventure!The explanation before the game was brief and adequate.The game itself is real fun and you don't notice how fast the time runs.Definitely a fresh brake amidst London museums and other conventional attractions rush.

Fantastic experience. We went as five adults from the same family. We were welcomed as soon as we arrived and everything got started very promptly. The whole idea is brilliant and we really enjoyed ourselves. You don't need to do anything physically challenging, but it uses lots of brain-power and team-work. Some parts could do with some updating where they have been broken by other people, but this didn't detract from the experience.We would have happily paid more for a longer experience and wish we had a badge to show our achievement!A wonderful way to spend an hour.

Wonderful adventure - easy to combine with HP Studio Tour. We were two adults and our 18-year old daughter (all of whom are puzzle/mystery fans). We had scheduled the Warner Brothers Studio Tour leaving Euston station on the train for WJ. As I was looking around on TA, I saw reports for HintHunt and had to see what it was all about. Well...part of the mystery is you really can't know what it is all about until you get there. But, it sounded like a fun way to combine two things into one. The office of HintHunt is only a few blocks from the Euston station, so we arrived in the morning and did a noon appointment at HH. Then, walked back and got on the train for WJ to do the Harry Potter tour. This was a GREAT way to spend the day. The HintHunt adventure was so unique and so much fun...we all said we would like to do it again! How long will it be until someone opens up a HH or something similar in the US? The facility was easy to find and the staff was wonderful. I would highly recommend this for families. And, i can see the team-building aspect would be great for companies or schools. You will love every minute of it (and those minutes will go FAST!)
Absolutely excellent. hard to do a detailed review without spoiling - but if you don't absolutely love this there's something wrong with you

Good fun - a must do. Let me start by saying - hint hunt was completely booked for the 4 days we were in london . I was very impressed by their prompt & efficient reply to our waiting list request.- -soo glad we got to go We were 2 kids mom dad & uncle - ALL had fun. Loved the personal introduction . Will definitely try another one next time :) all FAQs are on website

Good fun!. We went yesterday as a treat for my sons birthday. We had a team of 5 ages ranging from 20 - 58 and I definitely felt the more brains the better! We booked the JM Office and we had no idea how the game was going to be played which adds to the excitement. Without adding any spoilers it was great fun and the hour flew by. We managed to escape the room with 13 seconds to spare and we were all buzzing from the thrill of the game.I've given the score of 4 stars rather then 5 just because we all felt that we would have liked longer in the room with less hints.

Brilliant fun, lovely staff.. We had no idea what to expect so I was worried we'd be disappointed. Both our groups loved it and we all want to return to do the Zen room. One person said it was '...the best evening out I've had in years'. Thanks to our two Hint Hunt hosts. A very well thought our concept and you will not be disappointed.

So Much Fun. Really interesting concept, dont think we would have got it without the game master giving us clues, some really inventive stuff. The less you know the better, wish there were more rooms!

You need to do this!. This was so much fun! Go with some good mates, have a fun hour and work together. I didnt know what to expect and it absolutely blew my mind! Also good for team building at work! Give it a go!!!Staff are super friendly as well

Brilliant fun for all the family!. This experience was given to us as a Christmas gift. We are a family of four (children aged 13 & 11) I had never heard of hint hunt and didn't really know what to expect! The game was great fun, it got us working together & we managed to solve it- just! As others reviews state you couldn't possibly solve it without the hints but that is the whole point & the hints add to the experience! We would definitely go back again & try the other room! Staff very friendly too! Highly recommend!

Great fun. Brilliant fun. Really well thought out and the staff are friendly and well trained. If it was outside of London I might have considered it a touch expensive, but London property and salary costs being what they are ...
Hint hunt. This was one of the best things to do to fill space in a summer holiday and is really enjoyable even if you don't finish it would defiantly recommend it

Lots of fun, but... We (family of four, w/10 and 14 year old) did the main room in July. This game is truly a lot of fun, but it does leave you on a mixed note if you don't solve it (as was the case for us). Although, we were told at the outset that only about half do solve it (despite the impression one might get from the reviews here), so I would not say we were disappointed, just left on less of a high. I wonder what the success percentage is for first-timers; I suspect that even scrambling up the room, it's good to have played this once before to solve it. As a small critique--I don't think I'm giving anything away (it's obvious from some other reviews anyway, and you're told at the outset) that the "hint" part is as important as the "hunt" part. [There is absolutely *no* way this is solvable in an hour without the hints, but on the other hand they actually add to the game play.] This might be a bit of a problem, since the complexity of the puzzle may lead players to rely a little too much on the hints after awhile; this was the case for us, I think. Also, in our case there was a little real world drama outside that, because of a lack of soundproofing, we took to be part of the game for a bit.Given all this, I'd still play it again if I had the chance.

Truly Amazing. Loved every minute, a unique experience and the best family entertainment going. When all attractions seem to be much of the same this really is different and well thought out. Would thoroughly recommend because even if you don't get out you will have fun trying and time really does fly, quickest hour ever.

A Favorite of the Family. We took the HintHunt plunge (in large measure based on TripAdvisor reviews) in early July and we were not disappointed. Young (2 teenagers and a 10-year-old) and old alike had a fast-paced and challenging session. The staff is great and the pace accelerates as the clock ticks. Believe the hype!!
Loved it!. Brilliant fun! Highly recommended! Do it now!! (And King's Cross is a 10 minute walk away if you want to somewhere to eat or drink before or afterwards - go to Caravan or the Grain Store).

Just brilliant- want to do it again!. Without giving anything away, it was like a taste of Crystal Maze. Did it with my husband and 3 friends and we only just completed in time. It was amazingly fun and really want to try one of the other rooms. Would be great if they could open a 3rd or 4th room so you can go back more. Would highly recommend- quickest 60 mins ever :)

Great Experience. It is one of those things you wish you could forgot, only so you can do it all over again!!It is packed full of fast paced actions and multiple surprises and is great to experience with friends or work colleagues.

Brilliant Experience. HintHunt is a fantastic experience to play with your family or friends, last summer my family and I played as a 5 and made it out on time. The game masters are very polite and have great personallaties . I highly recommend HintHunt.
Fabulous, a real must do. We did this as a birthday treat with two parties of 5 and it was brilliant for all ages, from 9-45! Loved it, would definitely go again!

Such good fun. Absolutely brilliant. I did this with my family (who range from Sudoku lovers to people with no interest in this type of thing at all) and we all really loved it. It's very different to anything I have done before and it is really challenging in places, but you don't get totally stuck as the people running it can give you hints. I would (and have already) recommended it to anyone that will listen!

Disappointing. We (parents and teens aged 13 and 15) booked this for our London trip as it looked fun from the reviews, and we had high expectations. The visit started badly as we were about 1 hour early (our fault), so had to wait in a gloomy pub in the middle of a hot afternoon.When our session started, we found it a bit difficult to understand the briefer, but persevered in the hot room. Started well, but the biggest disappointment was that we did not manage to finish - I had got the impression from other reviews that almost everyone did complete with a bit of help if needed, but we were about 10 mins short, despite supposedly being well ahead at half time. We did get hints from the briefer/watcher, but didn't always understand what she was saying. Far from departing on a high, we left feeling rather depressed at our inability to finish when so many reviews indicate most people succeed - and we're actually quite good at crosswords and puzzles, and are keen quiz participants. When discussing the high points of our London trip, Hinthunt doesn't even make our top 10 (rather surprisingly Globe Theatre performance was much more memorable and enthusiastically received by our teens).

Just brilliant!. Did this with work colleagues. We had 2 identical rooms.Will not give anything away.....other than to say it's flipping awesome. If you like room escape games on your phone/tablet you will LOVE this. If that's not your thing....you will still LOVE this and will get so immersed you won't know where the time has gone!!
Worth a visit!. Very exciting and challenging, and was a highlight of our trip! We finished with 44 seconds to spare, so never give up!

Lives up to the hype. What a treat!. I have to confess I was a bit skeptical of all the rave reviews on here, but gave it a shot nonetheless. We are a family of four, with two under 12s, and it was really unusual and fun. I don't wish to give anything away, but it was something all four of us could participate fully in, and it was the fastest hour of our life. Well done to the Hint Hunt staff: they were really friendly and helpful.

60 minute adrenalin rush!. We couldn't understand why a 60 minute session in a room searching for a way to get out could possibly be ranked so highly as a tourist destination - well now we know! This was SO much fun with teenagers. We emerged sweaty and buzzed with just 2 seconds to go. It's actually best to go there without knowing anything beforehand so I won't spoil it by giving info here. We walked into the room literally clueless - and it was brilliant! We'll definitely go back to try and solve another room.

Really fun. A great unique experience. I went with work as a team building exercise. It was challenging as well as rewarding. The staff are very friendly and helpful, I will be going back when they have finalised their new challenge room.

Great fun and a brilliant day out!. Hint Hunt was absolutely brilliant!Out big group of uni students was split into 2 groups of 4 and 5. The staff were very nice, welcoming, engaging and funny and really got us pumped up to go and solve the puzzles! It was brilliant way to improve our communication skills and work as a team - even though we were just going as friends!! It is ideal for businesses!The game is really fun and you really get into it, with a timer on the screen where the person communicated with us through text messages on the screen - helping us if we desperately need it! We had to search all rooms from top to Bottom and it was hilarious... Especially for the person watching us and giving us the clues!The £20 fee is so worth it, we all had a great time! It was just annoying that we missed out on solving the puzzle by 15 seconds! Fantastic day out and definitely doing it again! :)
Great team event. Amazing time doing this, took my team from work and we loved it... got out with only 2 mins to go :)
Great Fun!. Mom, Dad, three teenagers and grandma. Everyone had a great time. The room was much more than we imagined. Perfect way to end our UK vacation!
Great Fun!. Fantastic evening out and the perfect team building exercise! Cannot wait to go back again for our next escape attempt!
Team Day Out. I took my team to do this as a team-building exercise and everyone absolutely loved it! Great concept, well executed and nice staff. Also really good value for money!

Great corporate entertainment. When you tell your clients you're taking them to a really entertaining place behind Euston station, they're probably not expecting this. But they won't be disappointed. We took some of our clients to HintHunt and they loved it. Great fun. The host said, "This will be the fastest one hour of your life". And it was. The room was very well thought-through, the puzzles and clues hard enough to challenge us, but not impossible to solve (with the help of a few hints along the way). Everyone had a great time. We will definitely be going back for the second room.

Awesome. We booked four rooms for a team building event for 18 people. Every single person got involved and all were raving about it afterwards. It's an impossible task without the hints, but they are well timed to help you as much as you need. We got out with 7 seconds to spare, and the sense of achievement was fantastic.

Most fun I've had in 1 hour!. This is the best thing I've done since living in London.. I won't give anything away because it's all about the surprise, but if you are looking for a way to fill an afternoon, take your friends and head here immediately. Brought back many memories of the Crystal Maze..

Excellent fun for all ages. I booked this as a result of the reviews on this site and it was fab!! I went with my three nieces, 11, 13 and 14 and the time flew by. The whole hour is great fun and each one of us would like to go back and do a different hunt. It was exciting and thought provoking and each team member has something to give to the experience. Highly recommended.

Fun Family activity!. We went here on advice of friends who did it in Paris. So much fun! We learned a lot about all of our personalities while doing a fun, interesting activity as a family. We would have been out in 10 minutes - almost made it! The Text hints are critical!
A must do!. Totally loved this game. Walked away feeling completely exhilarated. It was just a bit too expensive for 1 hr. Cost over $150AUS. We made it in 61 mins and 42secs!
Great family fun. I did this with 2 children aged 10 and 12. We had a great time. It is a great opportunity for team work and a real challenge. A fun and different way to spend time with the family.

Great idea for "something different". What a great way to spend an hour. All of the group enjoyed the experience. I wont say too much about the challenge but it was well very well organised and pay attention to any clues. All the communication from date of booking to the day from Hint Hunt was excellent.We had two groups of three completing similar rooms against each other to add that competitve spirit, it worked well but I would recommend trying to have four in the party.

One of the best things I've ever done. We went with work colleagues to do this for our team social and I couldn't suggest this more. So much fun to work together, find the clues and the excitement, when you get something right or open a secret door is impossible to describe. Had a fantastic time, and after completing the hunt, we were still talking about this for a long time. On top of all this, we had so much laughs. Just do it! If you have the chance, just go for it!

Amazing activity!!. We did this with our 2 children aged 9 and 10, they loved it. The staff explained the rules and the objective clearly. We had no idea what to expect all becomes clear. The whole family working together, had we had another 30 seconds we would have been out. When asked what our kids did in Paris this is what they said. " we did the Hint. Hunt, it was awesome!" It makes a nice break from the usual sights of Paris. Perfect for a weekend trip. But book in Advance.

An hour well-spent before flying home. Right near the Underground and train station, and a great way to pass an hour and a half doing anything but sitting. A real challenge for a group of two adults, two teens, but propelled forward by the helpful hints of our guardian angel when we were spinning our wheels, and this made the experience more enjoyable Highly recommended.

Great Birthday Fun. Had a brilliant time, didn't really know what to expect and we were helped out a bit by our gamer (we were rubbish). We would probably still be there now (almost 16 hours later) without there clues! Would definitely recommend this to others.

Fun activity for work. Went here with work. Great idea. Fun. But i think after a long day at work , I would get a alcoholic drink in first before going, or get some Pimms cans on the way so people feel there is a break between work and play.

So Much Fun!. Absolutely loved it, would love to do it, or something like it again. Definitely recommend it to my friends, and completely agree with the minimum 3-5 people. We were only a two and we struggled, but nearly got there! Staff are really friendly. Thankyou for a great hour :)

Great fun!. HintHunt was booked as part of a hen weekend and proved to provided the perfect start to the weekend!We were in groups of 4 or 5 and as we didn't all know each other this was the perfect ice breaker as we then all had something in common to talk about for the next 2 hours ie how do you solve all the clues!!HintHunt was well organised with enthusiastic leaders, clear instructions and most of all, some crucial hints to solve the tasks!Would thoroughly recommend to one and all especially as a work team building away day....and hen/stag parties!

A unique experience. I definitely recommend having a go at this, but bring at least 2 friends so you have a fighting chance. A fun way to flex your brain but also a physical workout turning the place upside for clues with a time crunch. I can't say much more as to not spoil it.

Fantastic and very entertaining. So much fun! We read the reviews so our expectations were moderately high already - but it was absolutely fantastic! For people who like to do something a bit different and well worth a trip to london.What made it so great was the staff were fantastic - really made the experience. you dont have to go with close friends and everyone feels like they contributed. shame its only for an hour - it flies by!
Amazing. I went today with my school and we got out after the time ran out we took 61 minutes so close! Entertaining to say the least.

Awesome!. I booked the three identical 'JM's Office' rooms so our hen group could all do the activity in small groups simultaneously. The venue was easy to find and the briefing was thorough despite the guys not being able to go into specifics due to the nature of the game!It took about 20 minutes to get into the swing of things but quickly became addictive, competitive, exasperating and good fun in equal measure! The hints and clues help move the game along and my particular group were just two steps from achieving our escape which we thought was rather good going. Because it was July (and hot) or because we put so much effort into the challenge we ended up comparing notes with the other two groups in the (very handy) pub next door to quench our thirst! I will definitely recommend this to my friends and we will be back to attempt the Zen Room!!

Lots of fun. We did this with our son and friend who were both 14 and it was one of the highlights of their three week European holiday. It is only an hour, and the cost is fairly steep, especially with the exchange rate, but it was definitely a worthwhile experience and lots of fun. Our room moderator helped move us along nicely. She could tell when we were getting frustrated and stepped in just enough to help, bit not too much....we still had to think.Overall, a good diversion from typical tourist activities.

Great way to entertain older kids!. We have had many friends tell us how great Hint Hunt was- so I took the risk and booked while still in the USA, it fills up weeks in advance because it is awesome! The game was perfect for my family! My three teens with their dad had the best "event"of the vacation in JM's Office! My only regret was that I could not photograph the crazy fun!!! We are going to create our own hint hunt dinner party back home!

Not for us.... I had high expectations for this activity. This is probably best for a group of co-workers or adults. My family of four with an 11 and 13 year old maybe got 2/3rds of the way through. When they explained everything at the end it seemed a bit far fetched. Appears great for other groups, but we walked away feeling like it was a lot of money spent to feel like an idiot. Sorry, but this just wasn't the best activity for our family.

Extreme Geocaching. I had very high expectations about this after hearing from a friend about the one in Paris. It lived up to those expectations and more. Our group of 4 had an incredible, intense and immensely enjoyable 60 minutes in the Zen room and will be saving the GM room for a special occasion. It should be mandatory to have one of these in every city. LOVED it.

If only. The idea of the game is good, however an hour is not long enough. As soon as you find a clue the operators tell you what to do with it; it would be better if they left you to work things out rather than give you An answer every minute.The biggest advice I can give is don't go with competitive people who are not going to share the clues or information, or allow you to get involved - I was over the game in 40 minutes as some of my team were not going to let the rest of us be involved.
Great fun for a group of 4-5. Good fun - but book sooner rather than later as we had to wait 3 months for availability! clever set up, with a second hinthunt created for anyway who has done the 1st.

Loved it!. One of the best hours I've spent in London - the three of us did the Zen room, and completed it with merely 22 seconds to go. What a rush! Great fun for those that like puzzles of any sort.

A must see!. No matter what, if you are in London then Hinthunt is a complete must. It's 1 hour of complete genius of hide and seek, puzzle, prison escape and is incredibly fun and memorable. Your goal in one hour is to solve different puzzles I order to find the way out, and to do this, you must search through the rooms to find clues and different pieces to the puzzle to help get you out.

What a team building experience. Genuinely, one of the best things iv ever done. Got to dress like Sherlock, solve clues like Sherlock and be in a closet with my best mates.Hinthunt gets the 'team lad' thumbs up! What a game!!

So much fun!. Went here with friends because of the hype but I must say that it was well deserved. Best fun I've had in years. This is a must do for those who love mystery and detective stories. I'd love to have team building exercises here for my company. HintHunt is a must do

Loved it! It really lived up to the hype :). When I read that this was the #1 attraction in London, I set my expectations pretty high. After reading all the twitter reviews too, everyone was saying it's amazing. However, there aren't many clues as to what lies in the room and I think this is the best way! This is a live escape game but feels more like you've stepped into the Crystal Maze and chosen an hour long 'mystery'. I went with my mum, brother and boyfriend and we all found it really fun. We all found lots of clues between us and when you're struggling, a hint will spring up on the screen to help out. The timer ticking down adds some pressure, but it's all fun and doesn't feel too stressful.The actual venue is super easy to find, it's just down the road from Euston station. Theres a pub next door if you get there too early (we were a bit too eager I think!). The staff at Hinthunt were lovely and explained everything clearly. They were also fun to talk to, sounded like they really liked working there. I'd love to have that job! Nothing was too physical, it was a bit of a mental challenge but there are hints to help you if you get too stuck. We made it out with 40 seconds to go!Overall, I'd certainly recommend Hinthunt, if you love a good puzzle and enjoy detective or mystery games, book now! It really was awesome and worth every penny.

As Good as we Hoped!. We were a group of four and Hinthunt was much anticipated, we booked ages ago to get together with friends. The staff are really friendly, which makes the experience more special. We enjoyed every moment and there are a couple of real thrills. We made it with three minutes to spare! I completely recommend Hinthunt to everyone, it's a really unique experience, thank you for a fabulous afternoon.

Best fun I have had in ages. This is a phenomenon sweeping through Budapest, and now it's in London. Just brilliant. Excellent as a team building exercise, or just as a brilliant (if slightly stressful) laugh with mates. Highly recommended.

absolutely amazing fun. Went down for our sons 21st birthday treat with sister in law and husband,wife had to stay outside unfortunately as the party size is only 5. Not having been before no one knew what to expect but we all agreed it is a very well thought out but head game too do. We did manage to complete it but was 2 minutes over. Great fun all round thoroughly recommend this to any one, can't wait to try the other room as we did the Zen room. Well done guys your doing a great job

All I had hoped it would be. I had my hopes high for this... we had booked months in advance... my husband and son LOVE the escape games on their tablets so i thought this would be very fun... and i was right.. it was fun and we laughed and got snarky with each other as time ran down... the staff was fun and helpful... but not too much... just enough to keep on track ... They tell you as a bit of advice/hint... to work as a team and communicate.... let me just say... you should work as a team and communicate! Also wonderful customer service on the booking side of things when i had a question/confusion! it was such fun... my son is trying to get me to figure out how to make him a smaller scale on for his birthday party. :-)

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!. I Will certainly be doing the other rooms. If you want an hour of hard core fun then this isn't even a must, you should have already done it! P.S the experiance will not just last an hour but haunt you (in a fantastic awesome way) for the rest of your life!
Fun Fun Fun. My mother, sister and I had the best time ever here! The stuff was .very helpful and the game is brilliant. Just go :)

Great way to spend an afternoon!. My girlfriend dragged me up to this so I was a little skeptical and didn't know anything about it before arrival but it really was a great way to spend an hour. Such good fun trying to find all the hints and get yourself out within the hour, it actually felt like we were in the room for about 30 minutes but our time was up. We were in the Zen room on this visit but we'll definitely be back to check out the other room!
REALLY FIRST THING SHOULD DO IN LONDON. It is really fun and challenging, never miss it whenever in London.everybody enjoyed it even with different interests.

Great Activity- not a tourist type thing or for children. We have visited London many times and seen the sites, seen many shows, and participate in special events. We were looking for an activity to spend an afternoon with our two 20 something children who live in London. HintHunt was an excellent choice. First, we are puzzle people and love board games, computer games, challenges, etc. Second, we were eager for an activity which we could all do together which was fun. Third, we were not looking for something that was necessarily appealing to tourists. We lucked out and got an opening on a weekend with 2 days advance notice. The activity was much as we had expected from the description on line. All 4 of us (parents in their 50's and kids in their 20's) loved this challenge. We worked together on different puzzles and kept our cool. It was really, really tough. You need codes to break codes to find answers to questions which guides you to the next challenge. There is a stress level to keep going, to find new clues, to put things together, it is mental, but at times it feels like a physical challenge. In the end we were successful and opened the door of the Zen room. This is a terrific activity for adults. I would not recommend it for any children under 16 years of age, it is just too difficult and too long. It is pricey but so original, we didn't think it was overpriced. This is not a 'London' activity. It could be done anywhere in the world. It is a family or friends activity for adults and/or older teens. We loved it.

"Sweet Baby Jesus!". Two adults, two teens, and an hour of adrenalin filled fun. Will definitely do the other room next time in London. I'm glad we could also provide some humor to the staff. I want their job!

Must do attraction on London! . We had a team of 3 people, all in our 20's do Hint Hunt in London. We absolutely loved the challenge of the game, your adrenaline is on the whole 60 minutes!! Great variety of challenges to suit everyone's skills and strengths!

Great Experience with Hinthunt!. We heard about this game from a friend who played it and was so excited that he booked another game right after. We didn't know exactly what to expect - and were positively surprised. The game, which lasts only one hour, was the most exciting experience we had in a week's stay in London. If you like riddles, challenges and team work - go for it!

Fun activity for family or friends!. When we booked HintHunt we were afraid we would have trouble doing it because 2 of our group of 4 didn't speak english. We were nicely surprised by a very fun guessing and experimenting game that did not involve much of reading (in english at least haha). It is a really really fun game that left us wanting more.

Fantastic family experience. Took 3 teenagers daughters to celebrate birthday with my partner (2 x 17 year olds and 1 x 14 year old) and we had a brilliant time. Can't give much away about the game as it would spoil the experience as it's all about finding the clues and putting them together to work out how to escape The time flies by and as the pressure builds the more exciting the game gets. An amazing time was had and we definitely recommend this event and go back again!!Thank you
Great fun. Fabulous idea and the hour just flew by. Next time we are in London we will book for the other room.
So much fun and so exciting!. Great experience, it felt like the shortest hour ever, because it is so exciting and so much Fun and action!Really nice staff and wonderful ideas!!!

Brilliant hen party fun!. What a fantastic 60 minutes. We used it as a way to get to know everyone in the hen party. Brilliant game, we certainly had to use our brains, we managed to get out with 35 seconds to spare, would love to do it again in a different room!

A brilliant team work game. I booked Hint Hunt on behalf of my company Impact Research as a team bonding exercise. There were about 18 of us split across 4 rooms and after a 10 minute briefing we entered the room and started looking at the various clues in the room trying to understand the relevance of the evidence that lay before us. There is lots to look at and it requires a calm concerted effort to get to the bottom of the mystery with a few red herrings thrown in for good measure and some clues relayed to the room via a television when the team is going in completely the wrong direction.This really is a good team work task, it requires various skills (none of them are physical) and different approaches to succeed and being just one hour- it is long enough to feel worthwhile/a challenge and short enough to keep everyone engaged- unlike so many corporate away days. Personally, I feel this was a great investment- good value for money and thoroughly enjoyed by all my colleagues!
HINTHUNT HAPPENINGS. Brilliant family experience !! Can't wait to do it again !! Wish we could have done it again the next day but we booked too late.

One hour of good fun. So... one hour and four brains, a fair few helpful hints form the host and a successful escape. With 57 seconds to spare! I played the room escape games on my phone and this was a spot on translation into real life... but more challenging. The time aspect makes it exciting. It was great fun, a good challenge that was hard enough to need a few hints, but not so hard that we didn't complete the room. Only 50% complete it though, so its not easy. Very clever and great fun for a gang of three to five. Going to do another room soon!

Fantastic Family Fun!. We visited HintHunt because our 11 found it when trip planning and put it at the top of her list. Our group of 4 all LOVED the experience. A great change of pace after all our sight seeing.

Fun adventure for the whole family!. We did HintHunt Paris yesterday with our 3 generation group of 6 and really had a blast! I'm not much of a game player myself but agreed to go since my wife, daughter and 3 grandkids were going. I was pleasently surprised at how much fun it was. Working together to solve the puzzle was fun and the young lady who was our host made it a very enjoyable morning. I highly recommend the hunt and we are planning to do it again in London.

Much more fun than expected!. After reading all the positive reviews and hearing first hand from friends we decided to book this for a friends birthday. It had quite a lot to live up to! But it was honestly as good if not better than the reviews state. It was so much fun and we were talking about it for days afterwards and already planning when we could go back. The place itself is very understated and when you get there you do worry you aren't at the right place. I also started to doubt how much fun it was going to be. But once it got going it was so exciting, and really interesting to see how your friends work together when under time pressure. We were all surprised at how on edge we were, wanting to get it finished! We will certainly be going back. The only downside is it is so popular it is impossible to get a weekend slot unless you book months in advance.

HintHunt girls' 40th day out - Laura. We all had a fantastic time trying to escape and solve the murder! We managed it in just over 57 minutes (the current record being 53) and there was a real buzz and sense of purpose the whole time we were on the case! I'm slightly claustrophobic but there was such a sense of mission that it didn't really cross my mind to worry about it and there was someone right outside the room the whole time giving us timely hints! ENJOY!

Totally worth it. Loved everything about this. I won't say too much so as to not give anything away - but rest assured this is an activity that is well worth the money and makes the time fly. There were only two of us in our team, but we still managed to do pretty well and were inches from unlocking the room. Great fun!

Awesome !! Great fun !!. The point is : the less you know, the best it is.So find 2 to 4 good friends, find a time to do it and DO IT !!Just very good, very good time as a team, very good way to spend your money and very good fun ! Family, friends, workmates, flatmates, any mates, anyone can do it. It's just very well thought !Enough talking. Just go for it !

A must do attraction. This was bar far and away one of the best attractions ive ever been to. Very challenging gets your heart rate going to beat the clock, appropriate help is given although we didnt beat the target time they let us finish the puzzle and escape the room which was only a minute or so later which was very pleasing. The one problem I have with it is that was I have done the two different rooms there I wouldnt be able to do it again and again they need to expand and have more rooms I will definitely be back to have a crack at the other room. This is a must do attraction. Absolutely fantastic.

Amazing! Lots of Fun!. If you are ever lost for fun things to do in London I would highly recommend Hinthunt! My wife & two of our friends booked this six months in advance to get the slot we were looking for so be aware it is a very popular activity. We really didn't know what we were expecting but it was a lot of fun trying to work out the clues to get out of the room. I don't want to give too much away but basically you have an hour to get out of a room to by solving puzzles and clues. You have to have your detective head on as well and the hour passes quite quickly. The staff were very helpful and attentive too. It's a must-do in London!

Amazing fun. 5 of us played hint hunt last night- no exaggeration to say it's one of the best things I've done in London, and we will definitely be back to play the other room. I don't want to give away the surprises, so suffice to say it's great and you should have a go!

Great fun - thank you. I absolutely loved Hint Hunt. I celebrated my birthday with 20 people there last saturday and everyone really enjoyed it. It was a great way to mix up my friends that had never met before and take on a fun challenge together. The staff were brilliant at helping me to book multiple rooms at the same time and the whole event ran very smoothly. Thank you Hint Hunt for making my birthday so special.Alex
Awesome activity!. We had such a good time! Would highly recommend to people looking for something different to do. Went with the family (of all different ages) and we all loved it!

Favorite activity of the trip. It's always a challenge when traveling with the kids - you want them to learn and see the historic and tourist attractions, but you also want to do modern and fun things. HintHunt was the family favorite of the trip. After a brief orientation, we started the task, trying to solve the mystery. Breaking codes, finding secret objects, following hints - all with a clock counting down towards zero. We solved it just in time. The kids - 13 and 9 - were better at it than the adults. I agree that four people is an ideal number.Can't say much more without spoiling it but worth every penny.

Brilliant time !. Had a trip to london with my two daughters for couple days and planned the usual sights but this activity caught my eye and I'm so glad I booked it. Will be wrong of me to write any thing more about the hint hunt but we had a fantastic time and the staff are just great. We will go again. Best 1 hours fun we have had. :-)
Good, fun, challenging and great value.. I went with 4 friends and had a blast. Highly recommend it. Probably the best thing I've ever done in London.

London #1. Went to London with me and three friends and did alot in the short break away, however the one thing that we will not stop talking about for months is HintHunt! This is a simple idea worked together with a story to exit a room. Working together in a team and with, more than a few, clues we developed through the story collecting information and piecing together a murder scene to a tense climax as the clock hit 00:00No spoilers but I would advise going with a minimum of 4 people as you need it in order to complete the tasks. I will be going back on my next visit to the capital and hopefully complete the Zen room in the aquired 1h time length.***** :)
If you want to do something new. It's definitely a brilliant experience for the familyI went with my kids ages 9,12 And we all enjoyed it!!!!!We were at the Zen room We will definitely come back

Good fun, but a lot harder than we thought. Having read the amazing reviews, we booked as a birthday treat for my son. We were 2 adults and 2 children (aged 15 and 11). We found we were good at solving the clues/puzzles but not so good at knowing how to use this information to help us solve the challenge, even with the helpful hints on screen we didn't make it out within the hour - we were told we would have needed another 5-10 minutes to get out.Having been to many places in London as a family I definitely wouldn't say this was our number one attraction, we left feeling a bit disappointed with ourselves which wasn't ideal on my son's birthday. It was good fun but a lot harder than we thought it would be - maybe a group of 4 or 5 adults would have a much better chance of being successful.

Mel's birthday hint hunt. Five friends went into the unexpected and worked as a team to solve the various problems and puzzles. A real adrenaline rush as the clock ticks away before the time is up. We found ourselves totally caught up within the fictional elements and it all merged into reality. Can't wait to book the Zen room..

An absolute blast!. We had such a terrific time at Hint Hunt! It's amazing how immediately you are absorbed into the labyrinth of puzzles, and how the clock counting down becomes a source of agonising tension! We made it out, and immediately booked into the Zen room - we'd had so much fun, we couldn't wait to get on to the next one! Please Hint Hunt - create another few rooms!
