If we have anything like as much fun in the Zen room as we did in the office, we'll be desperate to have another go when we get out!

Super fun. I really enjoyed HintHunt - we went for my sisters 25th birthday. We made it out with 30 seconds to go!It's super intense and you have to work together to get out, it's really great because if you get stuck they will give you clues on the screen, I'm hopeless at maths so it helped a lot!! Would definitely recommend!

Best fun ever!. I went to HintHunt with a group of 15 friend and I had heard plenty of good things from reviews. We had the BEST time battling off against each other in each of the 3 John Monroe Offices, in groups of 5. I can't give anything away about the room itself, but the whole thing was really well put together and involved all 5 team members in the experience. Fantastic fun and definitely worth the money! Great team building and a great way to spend an afternoon in London.

LOVED Hinthunt. My sister, brother in law, boyfriend and I did this on our trip to London. It is a MUST. You work together to solve clues to escape a room within an hour. We had 26 seconds to spare. Would have done it again if they had another room in Paris. Loved it!

So much fun!. We took part in Hint Hunt as a team building exercise at work. It was absolutely amazing, so intricate and well planned and so much fun!
I cannot recommend it enough!

Such good fun. This is amazing and such a great activity. I couldnt recommend it highly enough. It was so exhilarating and tense as the timer keeps going down. All of us loved it and got out with 44 seconds to go.

Great Hour of Family Fun!. Excellent fun! Hubby and I did the Zen Room with our kids aged 13 and 14 and loved it! It was £92 for the four of us for one hour - a bit pricey, but very different and worth every penny. You are given a little pep talk and then locked into a room to solve loads of puzzles to solve in one hour which goes so quickly. 50% of people make it out - and we were one of them with 1 minute and 58 seconds to spare! Not sure where the 50% who don't make it out are kept as we didn't have to clamber over any bodies!Great fun and would thoroughly recommend. It is a 3 minute walk from Euston Station and if you are early there was a little cafe just before Hinthunt to grab a coffee (very cheap and cheerful - under £5 for 4 drinks!).
Adrenalin rush hour. Omg loved it! Very tense as you see the time getting close to the end. Will definitely come back to do Zen room and will recommend to friends.
Great fun very tense. What a great way to spend and hour ..... Clock ticking nerves jangling sooooo tense. Would certainly do again

Great activity for a hen party!. We had a great time at HintHunt (London) at a recent hen party.It was so much fun. Probably made better by the fact that the majority of us really didn't know what to expect so I guess we were prepared for anything! And were so pleasantly pleased.Very well organised and great fun if you don't know people. But I'm sure it would also be good with a group of good friend too. A fab team building exercise. Would love to do again, although not the same one...

2nd visit. So we completed a second room yesterday! The Zen Room. This was a slightly different experience as we now knew what to expect. But it was just as good, and just as challenging. Also, we had a customer services issue beforehand, which was dealt with very promptly and courteously. So thanks for that too.

Such a fun experience!!!. Hint Hunt was recommended to me by a black cab driver and it was the best recommendation I've ever been given. Such a unique and challenging game but SO much fun....we made it out with literally two seconds to spare and were left laughing and talking about the game for hours afterwards. If you're looking for something different to do in London then this is it....definitely worth it and great fun to do with family or friends.

The most fun I had in a long time!. I would recommend this to anyone who likes a bit of a challenge and an adventure. This was done absolutely perfectly, it was pitched at the right level and I haven't enjoyed anything like that in a long time. The staff were very nice, the escape game was so well thought of. I can't imagine how someone could be disappointed!

The best game ever!. I agree with everything said here by all the people before.We had so much fun last Friday, this is a one-of-a-kind experience. It's just something different. As they say it is really the fastest hour of your life :)so intriguing, so well built, I recommend it to anyone.The only problem is to find a free spot to book it. Places run out as soon as they are published, the first challenge is to book a spot really!But for the rest, I hope they will offer new game rooms so that we can play again soon.

A brilliantly fun, unique activity!. Had a great time at Hint Hunt this afternoon... we managed to escape with a few minutes to spare, and were buzzing for ages afterwards! I thoroughly recommend it. :)
Using Different parts of the brain. Something different, challenging and fun, not done anything like this before but wanted to have another go as soon as we were finished

So. Much. Fun.. Went along with four friends last week and it was awesome! We got so into it and as soon as it was over we wanted to do it again. 10 out of 10. If you're thinking of booking, don't hesitate!

Awesome, even for non-geeks. If you like any sort of puzzle, you will absolutely love this game. Full of puzzles, conundrums, Japanese characters and sudokus. We did the Zen room first and now really want to do the original room. Great value for 60 minutes of well organised, original and gripping discovery. However, be warned, time really does fly when you're having fun!

Brilliant!. I completed hint hunt with friends recently. As not much is given away about the game itself I had no idea what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. It was by far one of the best attractions I have done in London and would 100% recommend it! It was so much fun and so difficult to complete. It was completely different to anything else I have done but AMAZING. I would love to have a go at another room. The designers/makers of hint hunt are very clever and the game gets more and more interesting the longer you are in there. I would recommend this to every one, just make sure you concentrate and be enthusiastic while your there. The best thing about it was that you get so lost in the game you forget about where you are or what your doing after its so mentally stimulating. It was a great afternoon!!!
Awesome. Great fun and great to do something a bit different. Highly recommended! Can't wait to try the Zen room!

is it really that good? in a word YES. I was amazed that this event was the best thing to do in London according to Tripadvisor. went along today for a company team building excercise. It was brilliant. Suprising, well done and reasonably priced

Unique and thrilling. 60 minutes to escape from a room. I won't say any more but this was so much fun, and we managed it with 53 seconds to spare!!! I can't wait to come again and try out the other room!

Superb family fun. An excellent and fun challenge for me and my husband (53 & 57) and our 21 & 18 year old would-be Sherlocks. Can't add much to what has already been written below except to say GIVE IT A TRY. One of the most fun afternoons as a family we have had in years. Got out with 28 seconds to spare thanks surely due to the hours our two spend watching Cumberbatch et al!

Awesome!. So much fun! Even though we failed to escape :D You get locked into the room for one hour and have to try and escape... everything from hidden keys, codes to decipher, sudoku, robots and more. It's impossible not to get really invested and forget the time is flying.Really easy to find too, it's only about 2 minutes walk from Euston (and afterwards you're only ten minutes from Camden - bonus!)

We looked at much, we played with ONE!. In short with no spoilers, you get locked in, you have to solve the puzzle Sherlock Holmes style to get out! IT's F%$#%#$ AWESOME!!!!! No seriously this is my only 5 star review of the whole trip. My wife and I walked in last minute, they happened to have an opening, they told us the cost (gasp) and we had to see what all the fuss was about!!! IT WAS THE BEST PART OF LONDON! NO SERIOUSLY! I hate giving 5 starts cause that means things are the best they can possibly be, I usually see one or two areas that could be improved... no this was PERFECT! AND CRAZY FUN. 6 months since the trip and my wife and I still catch ourselves reliving that day, with HINT HUNT! Nothing else from the dancing to the sights have we received this long lasting joy!

Great Fun!. I really enjoyed HintHunt. We didn't manage to get out but it was so much fun trying to solve the clues and working out how to escape. It's mental rather than physical but it's different and something great to do with friends. There were only 3 of us and having an extra couple of people could have made the difference to getting us out within the time. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that likes puzzles.

Great Fun!. So I literally had no idea what to expect when my friend invited me to join her team.I'm so happy now that I've agreed to participate. It was a great fun and I enjoyed it so much!The idea of the game sounds very simple: 2 to 6 people get locked into the room and they need to get out resolving some puzzles. The time is limited to 1 hour.Basically when you enter the room you have no idea what are you looking for, but soon you realise that room is full of locked boxes, coded lockers etc. And you just literally need to open all of them to get out of the room on time. Just search everywhere and bring all bits and pieces together to resolve puzzles, to create codes. Once you stuck with the puzzle, the hint will be given on screen. It is impossible to resolve it without the hints anyway.It was 5 of us in the team and I think it is a perfect number of people to complete it. The staff is really friendly and helpful

Challenging and fun. I organised HintHunt for my b'day for 12 of us and mixed up my group of friends so not everyone knew each other well, which was a great way for them to get to know each other.The activity is really well organised, the staff were quick to respond when I would send them emails prior to the event and everything is run punctually.One of my mates was worried she wouldn't be "smart" enough for the activity (which is silly anyways because of course she's smart) but it's not an IQ test it's fun :)Book early, be on time... and have fun!

Super funny team building exercise. Such a fun team building exercise. We had a great time with the games in our room! The satisfaction when solving the puzzles is really gratifying. Highly recommended.

Excellent Afternoon. We did Boys Vs Girls in teams and booked out two offices at the same time.All the staff were friendly and helpful, and we had an excellent enjoyable afternoon. I cannot recommend HintHunt enough! We will definitely be returning for the Zen Room!
Excellent!. We thoroughly enjoyed the challenge. Well thought out and very helpful staff. Just needed a couple more minutes and we would have solved it!! Looking forward to the Zen Room next.

Amazing game!!!. The game was really good! The guy explained everything very well so that we enjoyed the whole experience a lot! Now, it's time to book HintHunt in the second, totally different room :)

Very exciting and well worth the money. It's a 21st birthday my daughter won't forget. Really good fun! We never finished the challenge in time but non the less it was so exciting that it didn't matter

a fun, original activity to do with your friends. We went on a Friday after work and before dinner with another couple. it was such good fun! It was a really good balance of difficulty and fun. My heart was racing with excitement by the end.It was also a really good talking point over dinner and made an evening out with friends extra special.We will definitely be going back to the 2nd room and I would recommend it to anyone who likes puzzles and problem solving. If you are looking for something different to do in London this is great.

Like playing the crystal maze with you all in the room!. I strongly recommend this as a group get together! It gets your mind working, fun searching for answers and with the countdown it gives you that manic 'will we' 'won't we' make it in time! Plus, I recommend going for a drink after as you'll be talking about it together for hours!
simply great fun. A great afternoon - overcome your inhibitions, get a team together and have an ertertaining original experience

Loved round two, can't wait for the third!. Absolutely brilliant experience. My friends and I completed the first game, John Monroe's Office, last year and returned this weekend for the Zen Room. It did not disappoint - just as fun, exciting, and nail biting as our first time. Fantastic way to bring people together and get your brain working at the same time as having a great time - I cannot recommend this highly enough! & HintHunt, get cracking with the third room please!!

Everyone needs to do this!!. I was bought a voucher for HintHunt for Christmas and didn't have a clue what it was about. I checked out the website and read all the reviews but still no one gives anything away which leads to a great sense of intrigue. My husband and I went with a couple of friends which is the optimum amount to play this game, although you can have up to 5 people play. The premis is very simple in that all you have to do is get out of the room before your hour is up. There are clues, keys and codes to find along the way and live hints to help you out. We managed to get out with 32 seconds to spare so it made for a frantic finish and great sense of achievement once the door opened. We are already planning our next visit as we had such a fantastic time. This is one of the most enjoyable and original things that I have ever done and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Soooooooo much fun!!. I didn't really know what to expect but this adventure was truly worthwhile and so much fun. I was a little scared that I was walking in to a snuff movie set up and that Saw was going to be waiting for me, but it wasn't like that at all. The staff were super friendly and helpful and the venue, although a little ropey and held together with duct tape in places, very much did it's job and created a good ambience. The activity was like none I have have experienced before! I can't not put in words how enjoyable it was and how much fun we all had. We managed to get out with just under 2 minutes to spare. BRILLIANT!Everyone should do this!!

A must do activity.. Just got back from a weekend in London with my sister and mum, we booked hint hunt after reading the reviews and we were very intrigued as nothing was given away. This is definitely part of the attraction as it builds the excitement and whilst discussing with friends prior to going a few references were made to crystal maze and even saw!!Even on turning up nothing was given away we were briefed prior to entering the zen room which just added to the intrigue the concept of the game is brilliant and we all enjoyed it and left wanting more I do feel that there was a couple of things that could have been done better but overall a fantastic activity and we are already discussing our next visit.

So much better than another night at the pub!. I was a bit dubious when are friends suggested we do this but it was such a brilliant night that I've recommended it to pretty much everyone. I really can't write enough good things about it, go and give it a try.

Amazing experience, surpassed all expectations!. A friend suggested this to me as an activity for a Stag Do. Looking at the concept on the website I thought I would give it a go. Originally was sceptical about the price but the reviews were so good that I thought why not. Hint Hunt is a 3min walk away from Euston station so very easy to get to.Walked into the building and was a bit shocked to see a room of chairs rather than a desk, seemed a bit weird. Was greeted by staff & we quickly were explained the challenge ahead. Straight away my group were hooked on the idea and couldn't wait to start. I don't want to give away too much about the actual experience, but it reminded us of Crystal maze & krypton factor. The booking was for 60mins, but this didn't include the introduction etc so we was there for a bit longer. I booked 2 rooms as I had a group of 7, split into 2 groups. We didn't manage to finish the task, but both groups came out excited at what they had just took part in. It was an amazing experience that really surpassed all of my expectations & was a big highlight of the Stag Do.I highly recommend it, the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable to the point where they didn't give away too much. It's a great concept, looking forward to going again and wish they have 20 rooms!!

Brilliant unique fun!. Went to HintHunt last July on a trip with friends and we were looking for interesting activities which we wouldn't be able to do at home. This did not disappoint! Easy location near Euston station and only a few minutes walk away. The girl who welcomed us and briefed us on what to do was very pleasant and approachable. The whole experience was brilliant and the time in the room trying to figure out the mystery flew by! Exhilarating and exciting we weren't bored for a minute. We tried the original room - John Monroe's office which was great and since we didn't quite make it out in time we were glad we didn't book the more difficult room. Even though that we were disappointed that we didn't figure the mystery out in time we loved the challenge anyway.Would recommend HintHunt to anyone and everyone, great for adults, kids and teens. Don't think we'll ever do an activity as unique and cleverly thought out again - a real brilliant one off!! It is pricey but worth every penny for such a good experience.

Kids loved it...but not quite as anticipated. Our family of five - 2 adults and three children ages 10, 12 and 15 were very excited to experience Hint Hunt for a night of entertainment. As we wanted it to be a complete surprise, we did not search on-line on how to win the game. Arriving at Euston Station, the street where Hint Hunt is located is not super desirable. The signs are peeling on Hint Hunt and we weren't sure if we were being scammed. As we arrived early, we knocked on a locked door and was told we were in the correct location. Our guide for the program was very friendly, but the information she shared was extremely limited. She did say that only 50% of the people make it out in time, which was surprising since it seems the far majority of reviewers made it out. There is no mention of how extensive this riddle is so it is hard to pace yourself and it is hard to see the big picture when there are so many little obstacles. With the recommendation being to check behind the other person, it was hard to move forward fast enough. With some things needing to be roughly moved and others needing gentle touch, it was challenging to understand how much to respect the Hint Hunt property. It also would have been nice to have some sort of ability to hang the items collected so it could stay somewhat organized. The concept is clever and the kids did enjoy the experience. For the adults, it was a lot of pressure to accomplish the task. Unfortunately we didn't make it out in time so while we thought it was interesting, we didn't walk away feeling like it was a wonderful night for the money.

What a great new concept. SO FUN!!. I can not imagine why people have given this 4 stars. It deserves 5 stars every time! Hinthunt is a very fresh, new game/challenge that you have to complete in 60 minutes. I know the reviews on this have been a bit vague, but after having completed the game, I understand why. You want to go into the game with very little knowledge, except that you will be working together to find things and solve puzzles. It will ALL make sense once you set foot in that room - and they do a GREAT job at explaining things beforehand. Our family of 4, with 2 young teen boys, LOVED it! We solved it with 7 seconds (7 SECONDS!) to spare! It was SO much fun! There is a Hinthunt in Paris too which we tried to book last minute but it was fully booked. BOOK EARLY! Thanks, Hinthunt. Hope you come to Los Angeles!

HintHunt or ClueQuest?. These two places are perhaps the first to live and die by Tripadvisor...they don't advertise, they just rely on users going along, having a good time, and then sharing their experience online.As a result, it's easy to think there's some scam going on...but these escape games are rather like entering a movie where you're the star and you interact with all the finest props.They are hopelessly addictive. But in order to ensure no 'hints' are given, reviews have to be rather scant in detail. You wouldn't thank me for revealing any details. Half the fun is it's all completely fresh.For the uninitiated, all you can say is these are a new breed of 'escape games' - you and up to four of your pals or family are locked in a room and you have to solve a series of puzzles to enable you to escape.Sounds potentially a bit earnest, but is actually rather thrilling.And I wouldn't really want to say any more than that.The two big players in London are HintHunt and ClueQuest - and we've now done both.HintHunt is, for this review really is about our trip here, excellently done. The room is well structured, the puzzles extremely well done. The staff are friendly. The location is very handy when exiting Euston station (about a three minute walk away).It is, however, not quite as polished as ClueQuest which, having recently moved into new offices, seems just a little more rounded as an experience. The briefing at ClueQuest is a bit more engaging and the space and facilities there make it a little more fuller.However, that is the frill to the main event - and, in truth, the two are so close for there to be next to no difference.Both are excellent fun.At some point these things are going to explode across the country. For now, enjoy them and the quality they bring.There are cheaper things to do, but your hour flies by at an incredible rate - and when it finishes you'll immediately want to do it again. A sure sign of a quality attraction.HintHunt is excellent....ditto ClueQuest...either will deliver great value.

Chose based on Tripadvisor reviews and it was Wonderful Fun. It was a great experience and in fact was the one thing my three kids said was the best part of our trip to London. Kids! I wish we'd had more time to solve everything. An hour time limit was too short for us.

Brilliant fun!. Brilliant fun!We went along in a group from work for a birthday.Can't recommend highly enough for those of you who like puzzles.I can imagine it would be an excellent team building activity if that's what you needed too.

Book now!. HintHunt was an hour extremely well spent! I did it with my family (group of 5), though I think it would be just as fun if you were to do it with 4 complete strangers! Great laugh, a challenge and extremely satisfying - if you manage to get out that is, we completed with 9 seconds to go!Will definitely come again to do the Zen room. Would thoroughly recommend - book now :)

A Great New Game. Our family group, including an 8 and a 10 year old, had a ball here. We were pretty good at solving the puzzles but hopeless at working out what to do with the answers - and didn't stand a chance of escaping! (If only we could think outside the box!) Like they say, it's the taking part that counts and we're really glad we discovered HH.

Excellent fun for all to try. I am sure if this was in a more commercial location it would be booked solid for months. Without providing any spoilers you are assigned a staff member to guide you if you struggle to locate or solve problems although this person is not physically in the room with you. We were a party of three, a twenty one year old and his parents, and although we did really well, we did not solve the crime. This does not mean that you have any less fun, it just inspires you to do better next time. I wish the creators and the staff every success and encourage anyone who likes having a good time to book this attraction.

Amazing experience!. Hint Hunt is incredible, we went as a group of four and absolutely loved it. It is so different to anything else in London and we will definitely be going back to try the other room!

Fantastic fun - give it a go!. Well, we went with the kids (just coming up to teens) and we all thought it was fabulous fun. Amazed how difficult it was to find the clues in such a small space and how hard it was - we just missed escaping in time but were so close , it felt like we had achieved something. Everyone was very excited, the pace of the game is frenetic. I really recommend this for tourists and Londoners alike - I have already started recommending it to friends. Love to see a longer version as well, as other reviewers have suggested. We will definitely return.

Absolutely brilliant!. I've done both of their rooms (John Monroe and the Zen Room) and had a fantastic time in both! Honestly one of the best things I've done in London and I am from here so that is saying alot! We did manage to get out of both rooms just in time - all in all a really fun filled activity! They are apparently bringing out a new room in the summer - can't wait!!

Very clever!. A must do! A very cleverly put together puzzle, you'll be amazed at how many clues can be hidden in a small room. I spent a while afterwards trying to remember how we gt to the finish as things move so fast.Only an hour, I would have liked a longer version, maybe less intense but lasting 2-3 hours, crystal maze style.

Amazing. I went to Hint Hunt with my friend and our partners, we all really enjoyed the experience and I have not shut up about it all weekend. We didn't manage to get out of the room, although we would of done if we have 1 minute more! we are 100% going back to do the other room, I am glad we went and can not wait for the next room! Great fun!!

Excellent fun. We were a family holiday group of 4, two early 20ish and two 50ish. We had no expectations except for good reviews. All found it difficult, but fun. We ended up in the Zen room. We will try the other next time..

A great 1 hour spent in London. Hinthunt is amazing. The staff there are very nice and helpful and the entire puzzle is very challenging but super fun at the same time. We finished it in 59:02 and loved it.
Great family fun!. We thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent at HintHunt. Our kids (10 and 14) loved the mysteries and clues. Would definitely do again in the future.

Excellent Day Out. I went to this as a day out with my family in two groups of four - I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone who wants a bit of a different adventure in London – the experience is amazing, the staff are very friendly and fun, the whole thing will have you talking for hours afterwards! Absolutely brilliant, thank you HintHunt for such a great day!

Great!. Excellent way to spend an hour. Found it all very difficult but great fun. Got help by being given various hints along the way. Very clever idea and would not hesitate in telling people to give it a go!

Spend an hour at HintHunt. Spend an adrenalin filled hour at Hint Hunt. Cannot tell you too much about it as it would spoil the fun. You just have to get out of a locked room after you have found and used the clues. Great fun, we loved it.

Great family fun. I heard about this from tripadvisor and booked it months in advance. My wife and I along with our 9 year old daughter and 11 year old son went into John Monroe office not knowing what to expect. As a family, we quickly learned how to work together for a common goal, give and listen to instructions, and have loads of fun. Probably one of the things our family will remember the most during our stay in London. Our guide Imi was great.

Time just flew!. What a great concept and a whole lot of fun. We had four adults, not particularly into detective shows or even puzzles or games but we all loved this. And we loved it for the entire 56 minutes that it took us to get out. Getting out was just a bonus! Try not to research this too much before you go; it won't help you solve it and the elements of surprise are additional points of fun. But definitely try it. I will definitely be doing it again ;-)

An excellent mind boggling puzzle solving experience. A brilliant problem solving mind boggling time! At times frustrating, stressful, intriguing but above all fun the whole time, team work is a must. An intense experience that you can't stop talking about all day long! We completed it with 3 seconds to go....just as we were about to give up! Fantastic.

Excellent escape game, can't wait to go back. We did this as part of a friend's birthday and had an excellent time. I don't want to go into too much detail otherwise it will spoil the fun, but basically in groups of 3 - 5 you have 1 hour to get out of a locked room. There were 15 of us in total in 3 identical rooms, 2 teams got out in time and the 3rd failed.There is a great mixture of clues, brain teasers and twists. They have 1 different room so we can't wait to go back again and have a go at this.Location-wise they are a 5 minute walk from Euston train station so it's brilliant.

Family Challenge. Definitely something a bit different to do and thoroughly enjoyed by the whole family. We are a family of 4 with late teenage children and are all keen on puzzles etc. We all enjoyed the challenge of finding and solving the clues and could not believe how quickly the hour went. Delighted to report that we got out with 2 minutes to spare.

Great family day out for teenagers. We (mum, dad, 16 year old daughter and 13 year old son) have just come back home having been on our Hint Hunt experience. If you are like me, clutching for straws for days out (other than eating!) when you have teenagers - this is absolutely fantastic. I don't want to give too much away but you basically communicate and pull together as one to get you way out of a room. You will be surprised how your children think so calmly and practically. We managed to solve it with literally a few minutes to spare and the help of our very kind "hinter" who was watching us by a hidden camera all the time. We can't wait to do visit again in the other room.

The best thing We've done in London. Intense, dramatic, powerful, stressful, sheer unadulterated fun! It was awesome. We did it in a team of 4 and completed it with 4 minutes to go, could not recommend this more and wish there were many more games to take on! Don't go with more than 4 people as could be too crowded in the rooms when searching for clues
Interesting. It is the best choice for people love game like me. It is very interesting :X i likeeeeee it veryyyyyy much

Fun. I booked the 6pm to 7pm slot, as I thought this would be a great activity prior to going out for the evening with friends. We all really enjoyed the experience and then had plenty to talk about through dinner !Apparently the escape rate for the Monroe Office is only 50%. Even less for the Zen room. We were given 2 minutes extra, as we were so close, and therefore did escape in one hour and 89 seconds. Not sure if that means we are truly entitled to claim victory or not !The cost seems a bit expensive, but you have to have the undivided attention of a member of staff throughout, so I think it's warranted.This activity is not particularly aimed at or of interest to tourists, but certainly is a good choice if you're used to going out in London and just want to try something a bit different. My 17 year old daughter is very keen to have a try, and it would certainly suit her and a few friends for an evening out.Good fun !

As good as the other reviews suggest. A group of 5 of use visited HintHunt on 12th april 2014. Friendly staff greet and give you a brief introduction, before you are let into your room (in our case John Monroe's Office). You have an hour to solve the mystery and escape. Whilst I won't say too much to ensure the mystery is preserved, this was challenging enough to ensure a good time, and great fun, I would recommend to anyone who wants n exciting (sometimes frantic when the timer is ticking down) way to spend an hour.Having read the high praise on here I was somewhat underwhelmed by the unassuming nature of the building exterior, but don't be fooled, the warm welcome and the thoroughly enjoyably hour we spent escaping (and yes, we did get out in time!) more than warrant the reviews.

Ultimate hour. Booked this for my daughter with 4 friends for a birthday treat. She had already attempted and succeeded room one and the Zen room didn't fail to disappoint either. All enjoyed the hour and the challenge thoroughly and would highly recommend to anyone for a very different and fun exciting time. To say anymore would spoil your own experience but I would suggest it's an absolute must.

Believe the hype. Went into the Zen Room not knowing what to expect, with only a short introduction on arrival. Intriguing, mysterious, challenging and genius in equal measure. You'll be hooked the moment the door locks behind you, and the desperate need to solve the mystery and escape will take over. An hour has never gone so fast. Hugely recommended.
Very cool. We visited hint unt family of 5 persons. The place is must have if you like puzzles. We solved it 2 minutes before the gong and went away VERY HAPPY
The best fun!. We went as a family of 4 and had the best time - we all loved it and everyone was able to contribute. You can't say much about the game but just do it!

interesting clue finder. arrived on time -- games mistress explained somewhat what the exercise was about -- was interesting though were not clear on some of the rules -- while tripadvisor says it is the number one thing to do in London - would dispute that -- did the London eye after which should be rated higher -- though having said that was an interesting hour -
Great fun!. This was incredibly fun! You probably need to go with likeminded people though! It involves running around a room, discovering things - as well as a bit of problem solving.

Fantastic!. We are a family of 5 and had the most amazing time at HintHunt. We were not sure what to expect and were truly impressed. Obviously saying too much would spoil it but if you want to have a really great experience we thoroughly recommend it.
Worth and fun!. My family and I attended HintHunt last 2 months. Its the most challenging escape games we have ever done. We really enjoyed it! and the staff are very nice.

Amazing. Went with 4 mates as birthday present, not sure what to expect but totally exceeded expectations of us all. Got the brain working and great fun had by all. Can't wait to go again, well worth the money - well done Hint Hunt

Excellent fun. Can't recommend it enough.. Tackled John Monroe's room as a team of 4 and had a fantastic time. Want to try the Zen room soon and we just wish there were more to try. Youngest on our team was 9 and we were a bit concerned that she may have been a bit too young to enjoy it but she loved the whole thing and proved to be a great asset in some of the problem solving.Staff were all very friendly and the whole setup very professional. The hour flew by (and we are sure we would have cracked it if we had five more minutes).All in all, if you're looking for something a bit different, good fun and a bit of a challenge then you can't go far wrong with Hint Hunt.

Great fun - family group of 3 - 2 adults and a 10 year old. Did the zen room with just three of us - 2 adults and a 10 year old. My 10 year old son loved the challenge and was really engaged by it. I just want to reassure anyone visiting with children this age, that he was a very successful and useful participant and has been talking about the experience ever since! We all thoroughly enjoyed the experience!

Fantastic game! Time simply flew by!. I went with my girlfriend and 2 other friends along to this. We had booked in the John Munroe room, without really knowing what to expect!Suffice to say the time absolutely flew by, with a seemingly endless supply of tricky but very rewarding little puzzles scattered throughout the room. I would highly recommend a group of adults - it may be a little too tricky for younger children.We made it out with nearly 6 minutes to spare, but felt we could have very easily also not quite made it out on time. The difficulty of the game is very well balanced.All in all, I'd say that this is a must do!
Whole experience amazing. Visited with my cousins 6 of us in all in 2 rooms and all agreed best hours fun ever and can't wait to try zen room. Would definitely recommend one not to be missed.

The most panicky, stressful, brilliant hour ever. Like all the other delighted HintHunters on here, I can't reveal too much about it. The only thing I can say is go. It's totally unique, wonderfully crazed and intense... we came out absolutely buzzing and even though we officially 'failed', we only felt euphoria for what we'd achieved.
Go, go, go!

Absolutely brilliant!. Had a fantastic time laying 'detective' for one hour. Super impressed by the sheer volume and variety of riddles and clues - very creative, highly immersive and SO much fun! Sadly, we were a few minutes short of solving the mystery, so will have to come back and try it again in a different room :-) Thanks for the brilliant experience!

Excellent! An hour flew by. We took our 9 year old daughter with us to play Hint Hunt and had the best time- our daughter said it was 'the best day ever'. It's so much fun and a great and the time flew by. The 'hosts' are great from start to finish- we are booking the Zen room soon and cannot wait.

Simply brilliant. We hired 2 rooms (both the same puzzle - John Monroe) and got two teams of four together. A couple of beers next door, some team (and trash) talking, and then we went head to head. One of the most fun hours I've had, and the Hint Hunt team really know how to make everyone have the best time. We can't wait to go back for the zen room!

Worth the waiting list. We booked this way, way in advance to get our preferred Friday evening slot but it was definitely worth the wait. We were made to feel incredibly welcome by Lazlo and the time inside the room was brilliant fun. A great way to spend 57 minutes and 40 seconds! Will be booking for the Zen room asap.

I wish I could do this on a monthly basis!. We recently visited London with some friends, and this was numero uno on my priority list. Despite trying and failing to book on the Friday, HintHunt went to great lengths to fit us in last minute on Sunday after a cancellation. Their response time and overall customer service is top-notch. I had no idea what to expect and actually thought, this is gonna be a piece of cake. Wrong! The room is so thoughtfully designed, and the mystery is multi-layered like an amazing piece of fiction. You peel off the onion thinking you are close, and then you realize you've just begun to scratch the surface. I highly recommend HintHunt UK to everyone. Couples/Families/Business I only wish we could have taken a copy of our video home with us for a good laugh, although this would certainly spoil the concept :)

Great team building event. It is difficult to describe how good HintHunt is as on paper you would not presume that it would be such and engaging and fun experience.I booked HintHunt as a team building event for my whole team. For those things it is tough finding activites that everyone will enjoy, but HintHunt did not let us down in this regard. I would highly recomend it to anyone looking for a team event or just to have some fun with their friends. It is money well spend and although you may be sceptical going in, you will come out adrenaline filled, heart pumping with a massive grin on all of your faces. It should also be noted that the staff are excellent. Really nice group of highly enthusiastic people.

Amazing and lots of fun!!!. We recently did the Zen room last week having done the John Monroe’s office last year - and I have to say probably one of the best things you can do in London right now.It's so much fun and a great feeling for the group when (if) you escape the room.We had a great "Gamesmaster" as well - but can’t remember her name  - she took us through all the rules both times we came and gave us enough hints to help us escape but not so many that it spoilt the game/challenge.I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes puzzles, teamwork and if you’re the crystal maze!Cannot wait for the new room to be added in the summer! Team Revolution.

The less you know the better. We were a group of four from Norway that knew pretty much nothing about this game, and so glad I am about that! It was a lot of fun, and the less you know beforehand, the better. Trying to figure things out, understanding that it's not right.. Amazing. :)We had one in our group that isn't very good in English, and that can make things harder. So I do reccomend that everyone going got a ok grasp of english.

Good fun. We attending HintHunt this Sunday, didn't know what to expect as having read few reviews we still wanted the surprise factor to remain. Took a while to get into the game but once you open your first lock- it gets better and better. We ran out of time and didn't get out but hey, we had an hour full of fun. The only thing was that as the glass wall in the room faced the sunny side it was really hot in the room reminding us of sauna, so hot you couldn't touch the wall- so if you could ask the staff to give you different room and not the one facing the street with dark glass wall ( i thinks there are 3 Monroe rooms and one Zen?) Wouldn't suggest more than 4 people to go into one room as it's quite small- we were three and bumped into each other all the time.

Amazing!!!. My husband, 20 year old son, and I attended HintHunt last week. The entire concept is FABULOUS! The staff are amazing ( and quite helpful), and the entire game is mentally exhausting, but ever so much fun! Well worth the money in every way!!!
Incredible!. The most fun 4 people can have in a small space whilst keeping their clothes on. Do it you won't regret it! Genuinely intriguing, an adrenalin rush that leaves you wanting more.

So Much Fun!. Hinthunt is a fantastic escape game based by Euston station.Having played 'the room' on the iPhone, I had a fair idea of what to expect from an escape game. We were met by Martina and another of her colleagues who explained the rules to us. Once these were explained we were taken down to the John Monroe office, and our hour began...The hour just seemed to fly by, there seemed to be so much to do in just an hour. At times all four of us were able to work well together to solve the various puzzles; and at other times we seemed to be running around in a blind panic! Martina was our guide and she was fantastic and made the game all the more enjoyable.I honestly cannot recommend it enough and we cannot wait to try the other room!

HintHunt Rocks!. One of the most challenging escape games we have ever done. We were sweating it out up to the last few minutes. Such a blast! Bonus: Martina and her team are awesome. You must not miss this one!

Fantastic !. I was invited here on a corporate trip, and not knowing what to expect, we met up and had a little briefing from the really nice and helpful staff then we were split into teams and "locked" in our room. Our team was made up of 5 and would think this is about right the rooms are smallish but expand, thats all I'm going to say.Be prepared to look EVERYWHERE and look again and again, some of the clues are quite hard to find, and you will kick yourself or your team member when you realise, lots of red herrings too.After an hour of pure enjoyable madness we managed to escape, with just under 2 minutes to spare.It is as the name suggests its a Hint Hunt, if you manage to find the clues and are just going off track you will get a little hint from one of the girls, but the hints can be quite cryptic so they are not a complete give away.The hour disappears and this just adds to the chaos.Really good fun have already recommended to friends and colleagues, will now go back to try the harder Zen room !! Help I'm a Project Manager get me out of here !Fantastic venue, some items looking a bit tired but thats probably due to players being a little too excited !!It is a very simple offer no drinks etc just a loo but once in the room the fun starts .
Thrilling. Hard to imagine but it is a lot of fun! We didn't make it, i.e. we didnt get out within the given 60 minutes. But we all enjoyed it. Be prepared for surprises...

We had no idea what to expect... but it was good fun!. This is an excellent way to spend an hour. We had no idea what to expect, but (without spoiling the hour for those who haven't been) it is innovative and imaginative. This is well worth doing at least once.

Brilliant!. We were looking for something a little bit different to do as tourists in London and found HintHunt. What a blast! The hour flew by, leaving us wishing we had time to do another room whilst in London. I can warmly recommend HintHunt for a fun, unique activity.

Hint Hunt excellant. Spent a manic hour with my daughters and sister before travelling home from a London weekend. Wish we had booked another hour to do the Zen room. We all enjoyed our time locked in the room, and the staff were brilliant and friendly. Who ever thought this game up is a genius.

Excellent!. This place is amazing fun and such a unique idea! I went on valentines day on a double date (!) and it was fantastic fun! The time goes so fast and really makes you bond. We played the Zen Room and I would thoroughly recommend it. The staff are incredibly friendly and make you feel very relaxed as soon as you start. Definitely will go back and try the other games!

Great way to spend an hour!. We didn't know what to expect, but I had read the many excellent reviews and they certainly were correct. The four of us had a brilliant hour - never knew an hour could go so fast! This was clever and fun and even though we didn't escape we will certainly be back for more. Our game master was friendly and had a wonderful sense of humour. Well done HintHunt.

Problem Solving Team Fun. If you love puzzles, problem solving and/or murder mysteries, Hint Hunt is definitely for you. Did the starter room in December 2013 with Son & Daughter and we had a ball. The race against the clock got our blood pumping and pulse's racing on a cold London afternoon. A Great opportunity to work as a team in a fun and exiting challenge. This is the best way to spend an hour (Even better if just under an hour!) in London, we all left on a massive high.

Fantastic!. This was our second visit to HintHunt and it was just as great as it was the first time! This go around we were joined with two different team members and booked the Zen Room. The staff was as friendly as the were the first time around which makes the experience even better. We managed to escape with three minutes to spare which was much better than our last go around in the John Monroe Room. Without giving anything away I will say that we did prefer the John Monroe Room to the Zen Room since it seemed to present a bit more of challenge since it had a storyline to go with it. That's not to say that the Zen Room wasn't challenging but a storyline could have enhanced it. Thank you for another great experience HintHunt, I'm looking forward to returning when new rooms are opened.

OMG the most amazing game!. Probably the best hour I've spent in my life! It was so amazing, the room, the game, the people! Probably the best thing I've done in London for a long time! Glad that I took part, didn't manage to escape but the game is truly amazing! Would recommend to anyone!! If your in London Hinthunt is the best place to go! Forget the other quest/escape games! This is the number 1!

In the Zen. We booked this months ago when it was the Number 1 London Tripadvisor attraction. We ended up in the Zen room which we were told has a 40% success rate with a quickest time of 53 mins to escape from.Being a competitive bunch we were eager to complete it and do it in the quickest time ever. The trick is to work as a team and to communicate. Our host was Tibi and he was fantastic. He explained in brief what would happen and how it all worked. He can see your every move via CCTV and provided some valuable hints when we overlooked something or had dismissed an item. We had all 4 of us look at one item and missed a vital clue! It's a mixture of skill, brain power and reasoning whilst being up against the clock. Did we get out in record time? No. But we did get out, and that's more than enough for us because its not as easy as it first seems. For obvious reasons what really goes on inside the rooms has to remain hush-hush. But this is a fantastic way to spend an hour and I cant recommend it enough. We fully intend to go back and try our luck in the other room.

Super fun hour with friends!. Now we understand the rave reviews first-hand and shared the enjoyment. Would fully recommend if looking for something a bit different to do with a small group. Great hints and clever game. So glad we got the opportunity play.

Awesome evening!. Wasn't at all sure what to expect when we went to Hint Hunt (bought for me as a present by a friend who had already been) but it was, truly, an AMAZING and fun hour! Cannot recommend enough - don't want to say too much or give anything away, but go with a lively couple of friends and prepare to get quite excited for an hour!

Great time for a small group. We heard of this through a friend who said it was the best thing her family did in London. It was truly something different and memorable for us. Our family of 5 (kids aged 12, 20 and 23) were all able to actively participate and contribute to us solving the Zen Room in just under 57 minutes. quite a rush! The clues are tough and there is no way you can solve the entire thing without some hints, but success is definitely dependent on your observation and creative problem solving.The website says you can do this with 3 people, but i think it would be tough within the 60 minute time limit. With 5 people, most of us were engaged in something most of the time and we could let someone stay engaged with one puzzle without distracting them for something else. 4 people would work too.HintHunt is easy to get to, across the street from Euston rail station. The staff was very friendly. (Note, there is a nice pub next door for cleansing ale after you finish, too.)
Amazing. An amazing activity for friends and family, would love to go again. One of the best ways to spend 60 mins

A great group activity in London. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. We found out about it through some friends who raved about it. It was as awesome as I had imagined, we managed to escape with 2s to spare! I will definitely be booking the zen room soon! The staff are very friendly.

Good fun way to spend an hour. We were looking for something different to do in London and given the recent ratings of this on tripadvisor we decided to give it a go.Four of us and one child (aged 9) enjoyed an hour searching, talking, arguing, laughing and trying to escape the locked room together.For me it wasn't a five star experience because some of the clues are just too abstract. If it wasn't for the guide giving hints through the TV screen then I doubt if any team would get out in an hour . For example, who would ever think of adding the suspects ages together to get a code. There are quite a few things like this and some of the clues are so well hidden that again you could probably spend all day there and not spot them.However, we thoroughly enjoyed it, it's something different and I would recommend a visit.
Cool. What a lot of fun with your clothes on.very interesting.good with about 4 or 5 people.lots of hints to be had.

Something different to do whilst in London. Managed to escape the room with 4seconds to spare. I went with two other friends and it was great fun. It's hard to write a review without giving anything away. A great way to all spend time together and teamwork is needed. Would love to do it again and try another room.
Great fun. Just as good as all the rave reviews. A brilliant way to spend an hour, great fun, staff very friendly and welcoming. Will certainly be recommending to friends.

So much fun!. Hint Hunt is a fantastic thing to do with friends, family, work colleagues, even on a double date!! I went with 4 of my uni mates and we had an amazing time - we knew nothing about it prior to arrival other than it's location and that it was a team event....everything was a mystery to us and the Hint Hunt experience is way better if it stays that way! ; ) I couldn't recommend it more highly! We had such an awesome time, we want to go back and do the other rooms ASAP! Do yourself a favour, pick up the phone and book yourself in now (if you haven't done so already).

Great fun!. Went with family and played the John Munroes office game. It was great fun and a really good interesting challenge. Had to work as a team and find your way to the different clues which are creatively hidden, gradually solving one problem which led to another and onto another...before being able to free yourself from the locked rooms. Would also be great for a team building exercise for a company etc. Was #1 rated thing to do in London when we booked, and easy to see why, great value for money! Staff were very fun and helpful too.
Great fun, well worth it. 2 adults, 2 children aged 12 and 9 - all loved it. Staff very helpful. Very enjoyable - would recommend.

Fun outing for family with teenagers. I booked the zen room as a birthday surprise - hoping my family of two teenagers and an 8 year old would like it. They were all very intrigued - we got a warm welcome and clear explanations. The experience lasts about 75 mins. It is totally different to anything we had done before - if you like puzzles and treasure hunts you will LOVE it. We had a great time - would certainly recommend this for groups.

Excellent fun!. Enjoyed it massively with a group of 5. Actually bought it for a friend's 30th to get an old bunch of friends together again. Intense at times, and ideally would have done John Monroe's room first but it's VERY popular, so went straight into the Zen Room. Completing the final puzzle with time ticking away was...to say the least...very satisfying. Perfectly paced overall and the guys monitoring each game have got great judgement. Can't wait for more rooms / development (might even go to Hungary where it originated apparently!).

Worries allayed and had a fantastic time.. Playing with a bunch of highly intelligent maths teachers who loving problem solving, I was worried that either the puzzles would be too easy, or frustratingly illogical, or requiring random knowledge and luck. I should not have worried. Let me reassure anyone who is likewise worried that this is suitably challenging without needing intellectual or much in the way of mathematical problem solving. The most important thing is being observant and working well as a team.Hints are fed into the teams to keep them working at a constantly fast, enjoyable pace and keep them from getting frustrated. It was nice to come close to beating what we were told was the record (53mins. Out Time:54mins 29 secs), and being complimented as being one of the best teams our observer had seen. How much truth there is to that, I don't know. I like to believe that it was. We were told that only half the teams made it out in the hour. Our other two teams (of five) both made it out with less than half a minute.Highly recommended as a team building exercise, for communication and a lot of fun for problem solvers of any level.

So so so much fun!. I had read all the great reviews, which is why we went, but I still didn't expect it to be as good as it was. It is exactly like all your child detective dreams come true at once. It is so much fun! You absolutely HAVE to do this as soon as you can!

AMAZING! MIND BLOWING FUN!. What can I say? I was not expecting to have this much mystery, curiosity, excitement and fun on that bleak Sunday afternoon. Not wanting to spoil the mystery for future guests, I'll keep the description of the details of this attraction as a secret and just focus on my experience. Me and four other friends had the most intense intellectual, engaging, fun filled 60 minutes of our lives! Minutes disappeared before our eyes as we worked together as a team to solve the mystery. We loved every minute and second of our time there and couldn't stop talking about it hours after we completed it! Thank you so much Hint Hunt! The only downfall is that we don't think we will find an attraction that will give us as much rush as this one!

Best fun we've had in ages.. Went as a group of 4 adults and one 12 year old. We all had a great time and would HIGHLY recommend HintHunt for the family or for small parties. Similar to online 'Escape the Room' type games, but much more fun doing it for real!
The shortest 60 mins we've every had. Great fun. Even better family spirit building. Worth every pound. Will definitely come back for the other room when back in London.

Helix Property had a brilliant time. Just back from an hour of brilliant and challenging fun at HintHunt. We managed to open the door - yehh with only 44 seconds to spare. It is exhausting and I cant wait to try the other room. Will certainly be back.

The shortest 60 minutes of my life...enjoyed every second!!. We completed the Joe Monroe's minimal in a team of three. We had a fantastic time! The staff was very friendly and supportive from the first minute. The game is exciting and thrilling, gives your brain a good exercise for 60 minutes. The hints we received were just enough to get us moving on, not "too helpful", did not ruin the fun of exploring and solving the puzzles ourselves.Definitely coming back to try the other rooms as well.

What a brilliant way to spend 58 minutes!!. If you love a bit of mystery, if you love to tear a room apart, if you love to be the one to find the key first or crack the code first, then HintHunt is for you. We were a group of three and had the most amazing time...agreed with a previous comments...make more rooms so that we can come back for more. Scrap 2 John Monroes and get 2 more created so that you get us coming back for more!
Loved it!. Everyone should do this! The only thing that I'm disappointed with is that I've done both rooms and now have to wait for them to create a third room in London. Highly recommend!

Excellent time for a family of four. we had a fantastic time. Two parents and two boys aged 11 and 14. The hour was fun and exhilarting and we definitely had to work as a team and quickly. It isn't cheap but it is good value for money and we spent the rest of the day talking about it. I think this would also be an excellent activity for a work team build event.

Fantastic for team events. A couple a weeks ago we kicked off our regional conference with a team event at HintHunt. With a team of 14 people in total we were split into 3 groups doing the same hunt (in 3 different rooms). It was brilliant: something new, entertaining and a very good way of having to work together, optimising our communications skills and have lots of fun at the same time. All 14 of us had a great time and the tone was set for a great conference. Would highly recommend this to everybody who's looking for a team event but can also imagine this is great to do with friends.

As good as it is reviewed, excellent.. Taken here as surprise, and as walking up the road thought the area not great, but when got inside was met by friendly happy staff, although the front room is a little small and limited. That said what a serb idea, really good fun and helpful, but not too many clues, this is a must for something totally different and great to laugh about amongst friends afterwards especially if one of them continually makes mistakes/doesn't find their clues. We will revisit to do the next room even though we failed the first one.

Super Fun!!!. Had an amazing time with 3 friends at Hint/Hunt, finding clues, decoding codes and solving riddles to escape the room. A brilliant evening and money well spent. definitely a must do event in London, best night out of the year so far. :-)

sooooo much fun. This is such a fun and interesting experience...my friend arranged it, told me it was a room filled with puzzles that you had to solve in 1hr! All i could think of was the 'crystal maze' programme!!!! which is why i said hell yeah!! And although it wasn't anything like the programme =( .. it was still a hilarious experience. There was screaming and shouting at each other as the clock went down and major frustration, but all in all we had a really great time! would recommend anyone from 12years up. Shame we didnt complete =( , but would still go again and try the other room!!100% GO for a random evening out!!

Different! Enganging and fun!. Really something different, and a very good way of spending an hour when visiting London. We had teenagers and one child at 9. Perfect for the older ones, but also fun for the smallest. Time flew! FUN!!

Great way to spend an hour!. We booked for 'John Monroe’s Office' and were not quite sure what to expect. a murder mystery yes but it's so much more than that. For me, the best way to describe it was a Murder Mystery Dinner Party meets The Crystal Maze with sprinkles on top!There were three of us and we were about two minutes away from getting out of the room. Some say it feels like more than an hour and others say that it goes in really quick. I think it depends on how many people you have in the team. We thought it went in really quickly and hit dead ends a few times but the lovely camera watchers were never too far away to offer us some much needed help.We solved a fair few clues to start with (and there are plenty of them) and I remember getting to the point halfway through thinking that we must be so close to completing the game only to discover even more clues that kept us scratching our heads on more than one occasion!There are a good deal of puzzles to solve with varying degrees of difficulty. One puzzle in particular had made us all wish we had listened a little more in class (ahem).While not wanting to spoil it for anyone interested in participating in this game, I would offer the following tips...Delegate:-Have one person allocated to do the writing on the board - it will fill up pretty quickly so erase what is not required as soon as you can.Strategy:-Work out whose going to do what when you enter the room, examine everything (at least three times), if you find yourself at a loss with a puzzle, swap with someone and you do something else - try and not stay too long with one puzzle - let someone else have a go...

Brilliant fun. My sister bought this for myself, husband, brother and sister in-law for Xmas. We were totally in the dark and didn't know what to expect. My sister gave us a few clues. However when we arrived we had a warm reception and the staff were very welcoming and informative. The experience was brilliant and we all had a great laugh. So much so that we are now arranging a time when we can all come back and do the other mystery!!! Highly recommend!!!

Great Family Fun at HintHunt. Spent a few days in London and this was the last activity before the journey home.......and what a way to finish. Great family fun with our children aged 17 & 13......probably not suitable for very young children and remember you are locked in a room for 1 hour! We entered the Monroe Room....and unfortunately we didn't get out but we were close.....and it was great fun......children talked about the activity all the home and that was 2 hours plus away! Staff really friendly and helpful (clue - throughout your time in the room!).....easy to find on the Eversholt Road nearest underground stop was Mornington Crescent approx 10-15 mins walk. Also very close to Campden Lock which allows you to make a great family day out. For something very different and fun this really was a blast and I highly recommend. We all want to come back and try the Zen Room!

Excellent fun. Recommend to anyone. We attended HintHunt yesterday for a team building activity with work.We split into 2 equal teams and both entered the John Monroe rooms. I don't want to tell you too much about the actual activity in case I spoil your fun but essentially you work together as a team for an hour to find clues (you are also given hints via a tv screen to help you) to get out of the room.The hour went super quick, we managed to get out of the room with 26 seconds to spare, our colleagues had 6 seconds so we beat them !The staff were very friendly.I would advise this for team building or family fun. I plan to return with family, really loved it.
Brilliant. Perfect work evening. Went here with work. Loved it. Very intense but thoroughly enjoyable. We had two groups in the Penrose scenario rooms. Want to go back and try the other room now.

Fantastic, such good fun, strongly recommend for anyone. Absolutely loved this, do not want to describe experience as it is MUCH better not knowing anything about it beforehand (it was booked by a friend when I went). We did it as a group of 4 which I think was ideal. Very well done, and staff are excellent.

Go go go!. Played HintHunt with three friends last weekend...cannot recommend it enough! I also cannot say anything about it. Just give it a go and don't do any research or hunt for spoilers....you really need to go in blind. Trust me, you will not not be disappointed.

What a day. Well, yes, it's only 60 minutes but it feels like - I don't know , 2 hours or 15 minutes.We did it with 14 seconds to spare and our wonderful guide briefed us brilliantly beforehand and, I suspect, helped us past the finishing line.I wish I knew her name because I had such a good time with my family that I totally forgot to leave any kind of financial appreciation - i.e. a proper tip.I urge you to do this, it is utterly unforgettable.And nice Eastern European lady game leader, you were great - sorry not to tip, but you may be surprised...

Very clever!. Tried HintHunt a week ago and I've had a brilliant experience! The game is really fast and challenging in a good way. The place is full of positive energy and the game masters are magnificent! Guess they have an easy task to be super nice as they know you the player is about to have great fun. We all knew this was a live game but me personally I felt the game itself actually is alive and I am the privileged to be part of it. The after side effect is also good. The nearest I could compare to is when you watch a quality movie in the cinema and the following days it keeps buzzing your mind in a gentle and sincere way making you think about all the previous experience.Well done and many thanks HintHunt family!A.H.
Just do it-such fun!. This really is an excellent adventure, can't recommend it enough...just do it, don't research prior and don't ask any questions of people who have already done it, no spoilers!
Brillant. 10/10. Totally recommend this attraction! Fab way to spend an hour. Great idea, lovely staff. Will be back for more!

If you are looking for something to do as a family ..... DO THIS !!. Visited London for the day during half term with a mixed age group of teenagers - one having aspergers and my husband and was looking for something different from the normal sight seeing. Looked on several websites and kept finding recommendations for HINT HUNT !! Booked it not really knowing what to expect and the overall vote was absolutely fab !! All loved it and with a great deal of help managed to escape !! Would absolutely recommend this especially if you need to entertain mixed ages !! Have now booked to return and try a different room !!

Awesome!. I've been struggling to find something to do as a family that we could ALL enjoy, that wasn't a theme park, and can be done in the bad English weather. I've found it. This was perfect! My kids are 12 and 14, but this would suit teens and adults alike. This was such good fun from start to finish. The time flies by. You never get bored, and in our opinion we could have been there longer. I can't say too much, but it's a cross between Professor Layton and the Crystal Maze. We will definitely be going back, and I can't recommend it highly enough. Excellent.
Funny and challenging. Every lover of detective stories have to try to become Sherlock Holmes or Hercule Poirot. Brainstorming and coordinated teamwork are the keys to success.

Brilliant!. Came here as part of a day out in London with my wife and 3 teenage daughters to celebrate my eldest's 18th birthday. Such a brilliant time, everyone was completely absorbed for the whole hour. Great fun, highly recommended.

Hinthunt London. This was the main reason for our trip into London today and must say it was worth it. Won't say anything about the actual hunt, but we all had a huge amount of fun trying to get out. Wife and kids were a bit sceptical before the start, but soon got really into it and the next hour just flew by. Will definitely be trying out the Zen room sometime soon.

The unknown!. Our son saw this on TripAdvisor and thought it would be good fun. It was more than that. An excellent idea and concept and the three of us thoroughly enjoyed the hour. Very friendly and helpful staff. Not going to tell you what we had to do as it will spoil it for you! Would definitely recommend it. You do need 3-5 people with you so take your friends along !

The fastest hour you'll experience! . Was attracted to this as it was #1 on tripadvisor and looked different. Was booked up for a few months so had been looking forward to this for a while.The reception was small and not as swish as I had expected and staff were laid back, as opposed to the more formal I was expecting. Alice was our hinter and was great. She left no stone unturned in the explanation and was very genuine. The game itself was great. It was the right level in being mysterious but achievable, with all sorts of codes and hidden clues. Wish we had half an hour more! But we did it. Will definitely try the zen room. Wish there was more of this kind of activity in London.
SOOOO Much Fun!!. Didn't make it out in time but was so excitingly FUN! Won't give anything away, cause that would spoil the excitement. Try it - you'll like it!

i don't have words. amazing experience! i did it with just one of my friends.. this was our mistake, because you need more people to enjoy this game discovering somethings!.. but i ll do this again, i m sure!
Brilliant family fun. We had the most fantastic time at hint hunt. 2 adults and 2 10 year olds spent an hour with great guidance from our hint host. Thank you

Another fantastic experience!. We did John Munroe's office 3 months ago - brilliant. Came back recently to try the Zen room. Again, brilliant. Enthusiastic staff, great hour of fun. Can't wait until they make more rooms, apparently possibly later this year.

Such a great idea. Finished with 12 seconds to go!! Didn't expect it to be so good, as I was told to expect crystal maze, but it's so much better. Can't wait for the next room. Adrenalin is pumping and now ready for a nice well deserved pint.

Fun Real Life Game!. I think the whole set up is a great idea and me and my friends hat lots of fun!! Though we didn't get out in time, it was still a great experience and I have to say, I envy the game-master for his job ^_^

Fantastic Family Fun. We had a really fun time at HintHunt London. Our two twin daughters aged 14 and our son aged 10 had such a good time looking for clues and hints. The entire Family spent an hour with adrenaline rush, good fun, and a wonderful way to Work together.We recommend this for everyone who love to have fun together.One of our best memories from our stay in London

Get your brain working. What fun, Hint Hunt has opened at The Old Biscuit Mill, Woodstock, Cape Town. We went for a team building exercise with Superbalist.com. I am glad I had a coffee this morning, we had to think on our feet to solve the mystery!I can recommend this to a group of friends, a family or for team building.Well done Hint Hunt SA!

Lived up to expectations. I can fully recommend hint hunt while visiting London. Easy to find, easy to understand, a devil of a time playing the game, but a wonderful hour for all ages. Our team was my wife and me, together with a 14,13 and 9 year old. All loved it.

Excellant ending to our weekend away !. Travelled all the way from the north east to play this game was given this as a gift from relatives. My husband son an myself thought this was absolutely amazing. Well worth a visit. Cant wait to go back to go into the zen room. Thanks to the hint hunt family.

AMAZING. A truly original experience, I cannot remember the last time an hour flew by so quickly. Our team of 4 made it out with two minutes to spare and we have not stopped talking about it since. Will be back to try the other room ASAP!

The quickest hour of my life!. So the premise of being put in a room for an hour to then find my way out, did not exactly inspire me.I though I would be claustrophobic and want to jump straight back out. Little did i know the next hour of my life would fly by, we were running around trying to get out, and the next thing we knew with 5 minutes to go the door opened! We did it and it was exhilarating and fun, and well worth it. A great team building exercise!

Loved it! . Had a fab time this weekend in the Zen room (which we found out was the advanced room) with my friends and mum! The hour flew by but we made it out! All of us worked together and loved the challenge. All the staff were friendly and now we are all desperate to try the other room. We would all highly recommend this day out for everyone. A truly fun and original concept, loved it!

Great fun - unlike anything else I've tried. Hidden away on Eversholt St near Euston station - this is a brilliant way to have fun with friends. Can't tell you any details as it would spoil the surprise other than it's a locked-room mystery to solve. Would be a great work team-bonding thing too.

Genius!. This is one of the most fun things we have done in London!Just book it, don't try to know what's going to happen!It is a very enjoyable experience! Perfect for a group of friends!The staff was super friendly and the activity is incredibly fun!I am looking forward to our next challenge!!!

You need to do this......... Fantabulous !! 3 member family team in the Zen room. Where do we start, what do we do ? Started lateral thinking and curiosity conversations. Getting the hang, devilish clues. Time ticking by. Are we nearly there ? Not quite but very close. You need to do this.......

Great fun - don't be drunk!. you probably already know what this is, like a real life cluedo. Really good fun, and spot on for an office outing, really does force you to work as a team (So don't be on the same team as anyone you hate or are competitive with...Nice and close to mainline Euston, staff look after you properly and explain everything fully. Gets really exciting as you get to the end.If puzzles and frustration isn't your thing, then stay well clear!Don't be drunk.Don't take kids...

Its so hinty hunty. Amazing. Just go. Go and book now. IF you like puzzles, the crystal maze, being a detective, logical thinking, sherlock holmes, teamwork and fun fun times you need this in your life. Read the 3 star reviews, they are all people who a) tried this with young kids (its certainly aimed at teens above) or b) dont like puzzles, the crystal maze, being a detective etc etc. All you need to know is on the website. Go and have some fun.
Hint Hunt. Absolutely brilliant. Enjoyed every minute of this although I would have struggled alone. Brilliant activity for a group of friends or team building. Would really recommend this

Just brilliant!. We booked the Zen room and was just so good...60 mins of problem solving in one of the most intelligently put together puzzles...we managed to get out with 8 seconds to spare...don't think about going, book now!

A fantastic detective game which keeps you sweating until the final second- literally.. I Hint Hunted with three other friends yesterday and had the best time! Everything was perfect- from the baron reception to the enigmatic staff- it all added to the mystery of the game.I don't want to give anything away, so won't!All I'll say is that the Hint Hunt is excellent, exciting and so much fun- a brilliant concept! Please open more rooms - I feel an addiction coming on!

Very nice thing to do, specially if you have a teenager. You enter a room and have to find clues and solve puzzles, such as finding keys and numerical codes to open several different kinds of locks. People enter a room in small groups and are accompanied by an "angel", who explains how the room works, the goal, and keeps providing clues to the group on demand, through a monitor, and sometimes with pictures! In our case, we were lucky and the instructor was nice, with a bit of eastern-europe accent. By the way, this is the type of attraction you should go only if you are reasonably knowledgeable in english; otherwise, the task will become impossible and you will miss most of the fun. We spoke english all the time, and this allowed the instructor to understand our ideas and provide better clues.I wish there were several other, different rooms, and also a different style of play, with more time to finish, like having 2h for the price of 1.5. Then the challenge becomes not only being able to finish, but also in a shorter time.

This is the #1 in my home town?. How is this the #1 attraction in London?!Of all the things to do here I have no idea why this place tops the list. It's a puzzle game, but you could be anywhere. It isn't particularly central and if you have younger kids then it'll be completely lost on them.We went with an office party and it was sort of an anti-climax. I dunno what we expected from TripAdvisor #1 but it was certainly more than this.

Great for teenagers and adults alike - brings out the detective in you!!. This place is brilliant for both teenagers and adults alike. I won't say much here but it makes for an absolutely brilliant evening out if you like puzzles or mysteries. Highly recommended, I went with a bunch of colleagues and it was a fab team night out.

I want to go again!. There are so many good reviews that I feel like I don't need to add much. I went with two friends and had a great time, it was so much fun even though we couldn't get out on time (60 minutes go by so fast!). Will definitely come beck to experience the other room and hopefully more if they expand in the future. Only disadvantage is the price (after VAT it was about 25 pounds per person) for only 1 hour of experience, but I still loved it so much :)

Birthday fun. Really enjoyed the Zen room on our first trip to HunHunt. I didn't know what to expect but was really impressed. Never known an hour to go so quick either as you get really involved in the puzzles and challenges. Perfect for four people and we managed to get out with seconds to spare.
