Will definitely go back and try the John Monroe Room later in the year.Overall an excellent activity for anyone who loves to solve puzzles and enjoys a challenge.
Top notch!. Went here last night for a work do and had a fantastic time! The staff were great, and overall this really was an awesome evening. Would definitely recommend.

Games. If you are young and energetic this is the place . the gamesmaster is very active and you have to keep up, otherwise.............
but enjoyable

Great fun!. This was a brilliant activity to do in London. We felt exhilarated by the end of the session and it definitely held more in store than we thought. The staff were really friendly and we will definitely go back to attempt the other room.
Would highly recommend it for a group of friends up for a new, exciting activity.

Excellent. I must admit i went into this very sceptical. I enjoy puzzles and have played this type of thing in a game format like the Crimson room. You have 1 hour to get out of a locked room. I thought an hour would drag and the puzzles would be pretty easyI couldnt be more wrong. We went for the Zen room, which is meant to be the hardest one. It was exciting form the moment you stepped into the room. Challenging puzzles and lots to keep everyone busy. I look forward to a new puzzle soon

Unique attraction. My family spent a hour doing something we would rarely do....and that is work together to solve a problem such as the one presented to us here in London. I would recommend this as the perfect rainy day activity for friends or family.
Great family time. Went there for the first time with our grand daughters and their cousins, on a birthday. Since then we have been regulars there. Great for families, amazing place

An exhilirating Stag Do. My husband and I took on the challenge of HintHunt for our stag do last year. We booked all 3 standard rooms and attacked them with 13 of our nearest and dearest.We successfully completed all 3 rooms within the time limit, then celebrated with a couple of bottles of champagne!Bring on the Zen room soon!
Awesome. We had such as fun time. Challenging puzzle, constant buzz. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. Total recommendation.
Family games. go with the entire family for the entire day. the gamesmaster is crazy so you will really enjoy the activities

Excellent experience!. What a great time! This was a great addition to our trip, so many of the great attractions in London are "stand and look at it" it was great to mix it up with something so active. I had a hard time picking a category of visit to put it in, it would be great with just about anyone. What happens (without giving away too much!) is you're locked in a room and have to find various clues, items, numbers, and letters hidden in, around, and on different objects. The room is filled with locked drawers, boxes, and cabinets that you have to get creative to figure out how to open! We did the Zen room and were just barely able to finish it. There is a person watching you on CCTV throughout the game and at the end you can ask questions about what you missed, where you spent too much time, etc. One piece of strategy advice: They will tell you in the beginning that each code (alpha or numeric) only opens one thing. Keep track of these on the whiteboard provided to you- You might find a code in minute 5 that opens something you find in minute 40!

What a blast!. We booked the 2 identical rooms to accommodate a good old fashioned "boys against the girls" competition! Three generations in each room and ALL had a fantastic time. The staff is so very friendly. Hint Hunt is a roller coaster of challenges! Highly recommend. Book early!

Great fun!. I visited HintHunt as part of an office team building day. The site may be nothing that special to look at from the outside... but don't let that fool you! Awesome things lie within!I'm in a bit of a bind about how much to say about the event we were involved in, as I don't wish to 'spoiler' it in any way. Some features of it: It's a fun mental workout. Engaging. Atmospheric. Very well thought out. Well paced. Loads of fun!My colleagues and I were heartily amused. It was really exciting and the time just flew by. The best team building exercise I've done.The event lasted an hour. My gut feeling is that it would be too complex for most children, although teenagers would quite likely enjoy.The guys running the place are really welcoming, friendly and pleasant. Overall a really high quality entertainment experience I'm eager to repeat!Go on, give it a try!
great experience. Here with family from australia. great concept well done. would come again and try a different room. We got aout with 7 seconds to spare, but needed plenty of hints

Unforgettable. I booked the Zen room months in advance of our arrival in London and the only spot available during our stay was on the day we arrive. After 21 hrs of flying, this was the first activity we did. My husband and I did this with our 2 teenage children, and it was so much fun! We enjoyed the challenge. Forgot about the jetlag completely. If we'll get the chance to visit London again, we'll return and try the other rooms.

A workout for the brain!. HintHunt is conveniently located on a road adjacent to Euston station and on arrival one might expect something more flashy considering the #1 status. The location, though convenient, isn't super flashy; the staff are very friendly although also quite laid back which can work for and against a visitor attraction; the waiting area is really quite small and doesn't give you a particularly marvellous initial impression of the attraction. However, as one discovers during the experience itself, things are not always as they appear on the surface!The lady who explained everything to us was very friendly and personable as well as being informative about what we needed to know plus health and safety aspects including a friendly but sufficiently firm request not to vandalise the room in our quest for answers, and very soon we had started our HintHunting experience. Even once we had begun, any interaction we had with staff managed to follow through on the friendly tone which was very cool - it felt like they were engaging with us as a group. The facilities were good (understandably a little dogged) and the puzzles were very clever. It definitely appealed to my logical brainz and I can't wait for the opportunity to come back for the next level.The price is more than reasonable for the value you get in the experience, especially as the experience continues once you leave - discussing it and thinking about it. Great fun overall, thanks HintHunt!
Great fun. A good hour of fun. Definitely worthwhile. I just wish I could go back again! The Zen room is next on my list.

Highlight of our trip. Me and my 3 teenager children have just finished a 6 week European holiday, and Hinthunt still remains one of our top activities we did. We all thoroughly enjoyed it - the hour went so quick. Only negative was I didn't book the other room to do!!

Great Activity. This is a brilliant team activity. The plot is simple, you have 60 minutes to solve clues to get out of a locked room. We had great fun throughout the 60 minutes and our brains got a real workout! If you're looking for a activity for a small group of friend then this is highly recommended.

Thrilling. We managed to book 3 rooms (15 of us) and all of us came out with the same thoughts: brilliant!! Definitely going to have to book the other room soon. Very unique and a helluva lot of fun. Highly recommended.
Brilliant fun. Do this if you are in London. We were with our three children and had a ball. Location is a bit dodgy near Euston, but easy to find and close to the tube. Naomi was very helpful !
Team day. Brilliant fun with the team. A must for work colleagues or family. We enjoyed and laugh for the hour. Very welcoming staff.
Family affair. You need to bring the entire family here. the games master is really fun and the entire time you spend there is incredible.

We liked it so much we came back the next open spot to do the other room. We loved it. Not all folks do but if you and your mates or families enjoy puzzles, mysteries, games...this is the ULTIMATE activity. There are two options and we have now completed both and were successful in our quest on both rooms. We like the first one best as there was a story that went with it more than in the Zen room. We cannot wait for them to create more rooms and opportunities. I am sad they only have two experiences since we have now done both BUT I wouldn't hesitate sending all our friends in London or Paris to do HintHunt! This is a good event if you live in London, are staying in London for prolonged period or are just sick of things historical and touristy.
Fantastic fun!. Our host was welcoming and friendly. We escaped the Zen Room with only seconds to spare! Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Would definitely recommend a visit.

We had a blast !. We had to book 2 months earlier on our visit to London nand the only available room was the Zen, Found it through trip advisor and thought i take my teenager daughters to do something different .Me and my family had a great time and it was a bonding experience for all of us.I suggest you try it at least once.

A truly unique experience in a city full of unique experiences. A friend of mine recommended this place and even his glowing report failed to live up to the actual event. The game was inventive, well thought-out and, most importantly, FUN. Would recommend to anyone - what a truly memorable activity!

Absolutely great fun - brilliant. We took our two children aged 18 and 13 to Hint Hunt and had an absolutely great time trying to solve the puzzle. You are locked in a room for an hour with a clock counting down for you to escape. You have to find codes and solve the murder mystery. It is quite ingenious! You have to work as a team and communication and creativity are the keys.A facilitator sits outside the rooms you are locked in and watches you on cameras and listens in to your attempt to get out. They sometimes provide hints for you on a TV screen which help you solve the puzzles.We has such a laugh - 1 kept on wandering off with the marker pen that you use to record things on your white board - drove my family mad!This isn't a cheap hour, but for between 3 and 5 people you can have a unforgettable time together. It costs just shy of £100 - but completely engrossing and great fun.Our facilitator was great - with a very clam and assured manner - very professional.

Excellent - been twice and loved it!. This is such great fun. Everyone leave with a smile on their face. Unfortunately there are only 2 different games and I've now played both of them, so I'm just waiting for them to come up with some new games. The first time I went with people from work on a team building exercise. The second was for my daughter's 13th birthday party in a different game. I actually think the kids were less inhibited and just threw themselves into it, but I had a great time both times and can thoroughly recommend it.
Really fun family activity! So glad we did it.. Our kids were 10 and 11 at the time. The four of us had a lot of fun trying to get out of the room. What a creative concept! The staff was great!

Fantastic family fun!. We are a family from Australia with 3 boys aged 10 to 17. Hint Hunt was a true holiday highlight for us and a totally new experience. It is easy to get to, being right next to Euston station, although there is not much else around apart from a nice pub so don't arrive too early. The challenge was 60 minutes of heart-racing fun, especially for my boys who enjoy electronic and board games. Our main regret was that we were not in London long enough to try the second room.

Brilliant family fun!!!. What a fantastic concept. My family including 12 & 17 year old boys had a brilliant time at Hint Hunt. A frantic hour of great fun. Our game master Naomi was excellent!! Just enough hinting, not too much. We were both elated and exhausted at the end but escaped with 3.57 on the clock. Well chuffed!!! Highly recommend to anyone who loves puzzles, mystery and just good old fashioned fun!! Brilliant!!

You must go.... Dont want to reveal anything substantial other than to say there arent many more imaginative, invigoration or entertaining ways to spend an hour. In a world of Playstations and ipads and virtual anything it is wonderful to immerse yourself in a completely different experience. Even if it were £50 per head i would still be raving...
Great fun!. Amazing experience - problem-solving challenge at its best! Gets the adrenaline pumping and really requires solid teamwork and communication.
good good. Games conducted for the entire family and we had a great master of games. very lively and invigorating, an experience for the entire family

Genius, Hilarious, We want more!!. If you haven't read about it yet... HintHunt has to be the coolest, most unusual and fun way to hangout with your mates / family for a couple of hours of madness.
Think Crystal Maze meets Big Brother... but you're in it.
See if you can beat our time... we were out with 3 minutes to spare!
;)
Great Family Fun. This was a fun activity for the family. Our game master made it extra fun. Would do it again any time.
Great fun. Great stressful fun. The hour flow by and it was really fun working as a team. Don't be discouraged if it seems impossible just keep going.

Amazing fun. From the website it is not exactly clear what you have to do, apart from escape from the room but this is all explained before you are locked in. The staff are very kind and friendly. We tried the Zen room, the normal one was fully booked...and it was amazing. We were 5 and we made it with a few seconds to spare, and everyone really enjoyed it and thought the hour flew by. It's very exciting and requires thinking as well as hunting for clues, it's not all trivial. Would definitely recommend. There is also a toilet and a place to store coats and bags. If you arrive very early there is a pub right next door.

You must do this. What a fabulous way to spend an hour. We were a family of four (2 boys aged 14 & 11) and it was the highlight of their day in London and we did some other pretty cool stuff. Staff super friendly and very helpful (and boy did we need some hints during our hour!)Bit of an odd location and don't be put off when you first enter - once you have been you will know what I mean but I cannot recommend it enough.

Something Different to Do - Great Fun. Close in location to Euston-St.Pancras-King's Cross. Live room escape game. Family of four (two parents/two teens). Have to escape within an hour, solving clues and puzzles with hints from staff. Was very fun, despite the fussing we did with each other.:) Very basic concepts and props, but imaginative game made up for that. Managed to escape before time was up. Price was a little high, but that was because we were paying for four in British Pounds. I suppose it would be reasonable if paying for self only. Great experience, and we all highly recommend giving it a go!

Family fun meets Clue. Great, unique family activity. Went to HintHunt during our weeklong London vacation. I could only get reservations for the last day, which worked great since we had seen most of the touristy things already. Really had no idea what to expect, except for what I saw on trip advisor, but it was fantastic. **note on reservations - originally all time slots were booked on the website, so I put our name on the waiting list and was contacted by Hinthunt within a week that 2 slots had opened up and they gave me the choice. worked great.** Location is very convenient to Euston tube, or 5 min walk to King's Cross or St. Pancreas. Also very close to British Library - good to know for the tourist so you can do multiple things in the day. The game itself was great, simple to understand, but not simple to figure out. We were challenged the whole time. The staff was great, providing helpful clues throughout from a monitor. You are only with the people you came with which was cool. As a family of 4 (46, 44, 18, 15) we had to work together, literally because there is so much stuff to figure out. The pace is somewhat fast, not a lot of sitting around... and again, the staff onitors you from a camera so if you are completely stick they send you a "hint" to move in the right direction. Bring an open mind, sharp brain, a little imagination, and fun people for a unique experience. We described it as an interactive Clue game. We walked away so glad we did it and if in London again, would do the other room.

brilliant fun!. 9 of us tackled two rooms for our work Xmas do; we were after something a bit different to do pre-lunch and booked Hint Hunt based on the great reviews.Some of us were more enthusiastic than others, but I think everyone had a good time! We'd wanted to do two of the same room between the two teams so that it was more of a direct competition but all that was available for our chosen time and date was one John Monroe's Office and the Zen Room, so we settled for that. Our team took on the Zen Room and, after much frantic thinking, quite a lot of screeching and a few clues, we made it out with almost 4 minutes to spare! (The other team didn't make it out but I don't think they were far off...)It's probably not to absolutely everyone's taste, but honestly it was so much fun and, as plenty of other people have said already, the fastest hour you will ever experience! Really clever concept and really well worked out, would definitely like to go back and try the 'easier' room :)

A nail-biting, original, thoroughly enjoyable hour!. Every now and then you'll encounter a wonderfully original new form of entertainment, and ask yourself why it hadn't been invented earlier.For me - Secret Cinema, and now, Hint Hunt fall firmly in this category.I won't give much away as to the nature of the puzzles you'll be solving - but think something between Cluedo and Crystal Maze, and you're on the right track. The most key skills you'll need will be team work, alertness, and discipline in how you manage all the information you're presented with. Time in the room passes a *lot* quicker than you imagine, and you'll have someone at hand to help point you in the right direction if you're especially stuck. All in all, I'd highly recommend this experience, and can't wait to next try the more challenging Zen room.Special thanks to the wonderful Naomi who guided us through our hunt, without whose help we wouldn't have made it out in time!

Hint Hunt is BRILLIANT!. We had such such fun at hint hunt! It's all very secretive and it really is best that it stays that way.We went in November, and it was freezing out side, but it got hot in there (mainly through how tense it got), so dress accordingly! The staff are helpful and add to mystery of the whole thing.One thing is for sure, you want to go with people you either know very well or want to get to know well as it really is a team game and you have to discover quickly each others strengths!The only downside is that there are only two rooms, so once you've done them both, you can't really go back! One single request to Hint Hunt - more rooms please!!

BRILLIANT. Myself and 2 good friends thought we'd give HintHunt a go, and we had an incredible time! A fantastic experience, I'd recommend it to any group of friends or colleagues or even families! Unfortunately we didn't escape in time, so I'd also recommend having 4 people, but definitely a must-do activity!!

So much fun! The kids LOVED it!. I read the reviews in Trip Advisor and thought it would be fun even though there isn't a clear description of what it actually is! So happy I booked the Zen Room our family ( 13 & 11 yr old daughters). Not knowing what to expect we were surprised by what it is really about! My kids LOVED it and the challenges they faced. We worked really well together as a team. When we walked out, they both said "thet was the best thing we ever did on a vacation"!! And we travel A LOT!!! The staff was friendly and helpful. I did read that people were upset that there wasn't any place to go while you waited for your appointment time. We found a pub right next door and had a drink before our time. So, waiting wasn't an issue. I would highly recommend this to anyone. My family wants to go back to London so we can do the other room challenge!

Unusual but great team experience. We went here for a Christmas work do and it was a fantastic experience, not quite what I expected.. in fact I wasn't sure what to expect! The venue is small and we were split into two teams of 4 managing to make it out of the room with only moments to spare. Really good for team bonding and we all left on a high afterwards - definitely recommended although probably not everyone's cup of tea, the other team didn't get out of the room in time and didn't enjoy it as much.

Brilliant fun. We went as a family with teenage children in jan 2014. Excellent fun and worth the effort of going to Euston. You can't say too much as it would ruin it for others but you are very entertained. You need to be prepared to think. There are no physical challenges. Negative point is their web site. Not easy to use. Organisers were friendly. There is nothing around the area where Hint Hunt is situated and the building has no facilities so stay in Euston station til 10 mins before your time slot.

Hinthunt was amazing.. Came here with my family and our family friends, so there were 8 of us. We had two rooms, and did a boys vs girls competition! Had such a great time, was really interesting and we had a great time solving the clues. It was difficult but we all absolutely loved it. Great as a family activity, but would also be good for parties. Would love to come back!!

Amazing fun. Visited Hinthunt London today 2 families in search of alternative to panto for teenage kids. Not really sure what to expect had read the reviews which all seemed good. Location was a bit odd so was a bit sceptical when we arrived as it is a very modest venue and there is nowhere to wait if you arrive more than a few minutes before your booking time. We had to go back to the station for a coffee while we waited. When we went back staff were very welcoming. and all went very well. We booked 2 rooms boys against girls and had an absolute ball. The whole experience is like nothing that we have ever done before..It had been likened to crystal maze also a bit similar to 101 rooms app but totally unique experience Every member of the team got fully involved searching for clues to escape the room. The clues are certainly not easy but you get hints when needed so that the enjoyment is maximised even if you are struggling. We felt very well looked after and even though the boys escaped within the hour and us girls didn't quite make it I would definitely recommend this activity for families with teenage kids or adults. We all laughed so much it was amazing. Really hope that this attraction grows just a little bit as you cant do the same room again so if they get 2 zen rooms we will definitely go back to try them on a boys against girls challenge. Would have been nice for the winners to get prize certificate or something but the boys gloated all day so guess that was enough and you get a group photo posted on Facebook page. It was also quite refreshing to go somewhere that wasn't total commercialism. No coffee bar no gift shop no commercialism just fun whoever thought of this was a genius well done guys will tell all my friends you deserve success

AMAZING. Four of us were booked into Hint Hunt for New Year’s Eve. This was a GREAT way to start the New year’s Eve celebration. This was our second time to visit Hint Hunt. This time we did the John Monroe office. As from my first review, this live event is AMAZING. I don’t want to give any details on what was involved as this would ruin the event. This is something you MUST experience to fully appreciate. There are no other events like this. We made it out of the room with 5 seconds to spare. The delight when the door opens is just so exhilarating. It is the most fun 60 minutes spent.

Yay Hinthunt. Number one for a reason.. We visited Hinthunt in london today, New Year's Eve, as an alternative to the family christmas panto. The kids are getting older now and their interests more diverse so reading the rave reviews we decided that this could be a fun family outing. We weren't disappointed. In two teams, 3 girls against 3 boys, we booked two John Monroe offices, were briefed and locked in and then set about our task of getting out within 60 minutes. In a huge yay to girl power the girls won! However, despite our evidently enormous detective brain capacity and super nous we unfortunately weren't in the 50% that escape the room within the hour. Bear in mind (ego strokingly) that the record for escaping the office is 53 minutes, escape is no simple task. The clues are cryptic and highly occult and the hour flies by. Thank goodness for the helpful screen hints given when necessary. Obviously, as born detectives, my daughters and I didn't need these hints (oh by golly we did need them) but they were provided regularly. A suggestion could be a prize for opposing teams, but to be honest, bragging rights are the best prize. Meeting the boys afterwards we debriefed over an early dinner at gbk and discussed how each team had used the clues and hints and also how these and about our individual team experience. It seems that the two teams, despite their virtually identical locales, had vastly different games. There isn't much I can say in way of advice without giving anything away apart from listen to your briefing before being locked in and do exactly what they say. It's easy to get distracted and forget the advice you're given but as mrs Harry hindsight, I advise you do try to remember and do. Loved it. Book and go, people. Already anticipating a group effort in the zen room whose escape rate is only 40%.
Different from anything else in London. So much fun we started with monroes office which was perfect for beginners, cant wait to try the zen room, also hosts are very good and make it very enjoyable.

So much fun. Received voucher as a birthday present from a friend in Canada who saw great reviews on tripadvisor. Was sceptical about what it was going to be like - won't give the game away to others on here, but was great, a brilliant afternoon will definitely be checking the other rooms out if only I can get a booking at a time that works (hard as is so popular).

Great Fun. We spent a week in London and thanks to other tripadvisor reviews, we decided to give this a try. We got super lucky with a cancelation that opened up a spot for my wife and I, and our three kids aged 12, 10, and 8. I think the less you know about it going into the hour the better. It was really fun and our 12 year old was immediately wanting us to try to see if we could do the Zen Room. It wasn't too much for our 8 year old, and I would say our three kids did more to help solve the room than my wife and I did. We got out with 3 minutes and 16 seconds to go, and of all the things we did with our week in London, this was the highlight for the family.

Completely different and great fun. 4 of us (aged 34-40) visited Hinthunt on 28th December as part of a Christmas gift. None of us had any idea what exactly to expect, however, we were all in agreement by the end of our 60 minutes that this was an excellent experience. We managed to complete the challenge and escape with 1min 48 sec left on the clock and all agreed that this was no easy challenge - but definitely hugely enjoyable.We were talking about the game for the rest of the evening and cannot wait to return and try our hand at the Zen room. Will definitely recommend to friends and family looking for a unique experience. We don't want to give anything away about the game itself as it would ruin the experience for you, but we would say if you are thinking about booking - do it!

Amazing!. We did HintHunt as a family as a 'Christmas bonding' exercise. After walking down a slightly odd street we were pleasantly surprised with the HintHunt building! We were booked into the Zen room which was the hardest one, but we managed to complete it with 30 seconds to go! I would recommend to anyone, except very young kids - our group was 18-50. We are not the sort of family who spend all our time playing puzzle type games, but we found that it was very easy to understand and get involved with. although not easy to complete! Hints are provided to help you reach your goal and it was a really exhilarating experience!

Brilliant fun, a good start to an evening!. My boyfriend and I booked HintHunt after seeing that it was ranked the no.1 experience in London on Tripadvisor! We went with a couple of friends before an evening out and would highly recommend it!As a previous review says, when you walk through the door to a very small, simple building you wonder what to expect. We booked the Zen room, which is the slightly harder of the two rooms, even though it was our first visit and thoroughly enjoyed it. In short, the night consists of being locked in a small japanese-style room, and finding clues and solving puzzles to get out of the room within 1 hour! The "host" sends hints to you on a television screen to guide you if you get stuck. Apparently only 40% of people make it out of the Zen room, but with the help of our host we escaped with time to spare. It was very good fun, a real bonding experience that started an evening out on a real high. The staff were all really friendly and brilliant fun.I would definitely recommend this night to anyone who has fancied a go on crystal maze or similar! Excellent value too.

Excellent!. I brought this experience for my brother (25) and sister (33) (plus my husband and I) as a Xmas present and we went on friday 27 December. The seedy area it is located in made us a little dubious as to what we had signed up for, but it was in fact great fun and brother and sister loved it! Would definitely recommend.

A must for puzzle lovers!. An hour of intense excitement, frustration and lots of fun! If you like solving puzzles and being put to the test this is the place for you. Exceeded all our expectations. Our first visit but sure to return for another challenge in 2014.

Pretty fun, but don't go out of your way. My husband and I visited here over the summer with our two teenagers, ages 14 and16. We made reservations months in advance and unfortunately all the rooms were booked except for the Zen room, which is more difficult than the original room, and this may be some of the reason for our disappointment. I consider us all fairly intelligent people and we came nowhere close to solving the puzzle. At first it was fun but quickly became tiresome and frustrating for everyone. The location was quite far from where we were staying and not close to any other attractions, so this ended up taking a full afternoon of our vacation; we did not find it worth the time and quite a disappointment after all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. I would recommend it for people who live in London looking for something different to do with friends. For tourists, I would say to spend your time and money at the many other fascinating attractions London has to offer. If you do go, start with the original room.
Great family fun. Family trip to London started off with family bonding at hinthunt. Perfect way to start off our Christmas vacation. Everyone enjoyed it

Book Yourself In to Hint Hunt!!. We LOVED Hint Hunt. Five of us went - aged 8 to 55 - and every one of us had an amazing time. It felt like the hour flew by in seconds. We don't want to give anything away….but we can't wait to go back and try the other room. Book this….you are guaranteed to have a really enjoyable and most memorable time.

Brilliant, fun experience. I booked this as a Christmas present for my Mum, Dad and Grandma and went along with them and my husband. It's a really great activity for all ages - my 88 year old Grandma really enjoyed it and could participate fully, which is rare for activities in London. The game is really good fun. It lasts an hour and goes by very quickly - you look at the clock and can't believe it's nearly at an end. At the end, we all had a big smile on our faces and I had a real feeling of wonder and exhilaration. The member of staff there to introduce the game was really nice and made us feel welcome (as well as giving us useful hints throughout the game). I would recommend this wholeheartedly - can't wait to go back and do the other room. If you're thinking about going to this - book it now - it's totally worth it.

Enjoyable time. We didn't know what to expect........... 4 friends in a room trying to get out!!!! Its very difficult to compare this to anything without spoiling your visit. It's just something to do different and something that you cannot help but enjoy.The staff are really nice and explain things well.. Its right by Euston Station so not too far to walk.

Amazing - really fun and a great family bonding experience. My sister and I bought this for my dad for his 60th birthday present. We all absolutely loved the experience, very challenging and you have to work well as a team but feels incredibly rewarding when you crack all the clues and we were on a high for the rest of the day! Thank you Hint Hunt!!

A Simply Amazing Time. We booked Hint Hunt after all of the amazing reviews for our annual staff party and to be honest we weren't quite sure what to expect! When we arrived the team were amazing (even though we were a few minutes late- Sorry!) and explained the game to us. As there was 9 of us we booked 2 'John Monroe' Offices and had a competition to see who could complete the challenge the fastest. We had an absolute blast! The hour went by so fast and we will definitely be returning to try the 'Zen' room! If you want to do something a little bit different and wildly fun then Hint Hunt is for you!

Amazing way to spend 60mins. Was not sure what to make of this at first but help was provided on the form of hints. We had the most fantastic time and can not wait to return. We will be talking about this adventure for a while. A perfect event with family or friends.

Not sure what the fuss is about. Went here as part of work xmas party. Not sure what the fuss is about. I have to admit the 1 hour went by very quickly, trying to solve the clues. But I was bored and felt forced to act like it was interesting for the sake of others in my group. Would never try it again. It depends on your personality if you will like this game

One of the best things in London!. Hinthunt is quite possibly the best attraction I've been to in London all year, and definitely the best money I've spent in a long time. Our game host was fantastic, and the hour spent in that room was the quickest and most exhilarating hour. Our whole group was still raving about the fun we had hours after the game was over, and already booking our next trip! It's a shame that there are only 2 games at the moment.. PLEASE GET MORE GAMES IN!
Amazing, original, fun!. Best way to spend an hour in London! Great staff, great value. An original experience. I recommend this to everyone!

Great fun!. A great activity for friends, you are locked in a room for and have to look for clues to solve a mystery and leave the room. Quite the challenge, but incredibly fun. I hope to try their other room(s)

New Room!!! Just as much fun. I've done hint hunt before a few years ago and had always kept a sneaky eye on their website to see if they were launching a new game. Great news, they have! The "Zen" room is a little harder than the original game, but absolutely brilliant. I can't tell you too much because it would ruin it, but think crystal maze type, locked in a room work as a team to uncover clues and get out. Do it, you'll love it.

Absolutely unique. There is a reason that this place is #1 on tripadvisor. I was a bit confused about the whole experience at first but you basically have a set period of time to get out of a room. There are assorted objects in the room which you must use. I came here with another couple who were also hungover and not in a playful mood. This soon changed as we were scrambling through this room. Its an excellent day out just opposite euston station. Cant wait to go back!

Brilliant Experience. A group of 8 of us went and it was a brilliant experience, really good fun and defo brings out the competitiveness in each player. If you enjoy puzzles and want a challenge I would recommend this with mates. A fun time was had by all
Absolutely Brilliant. Don't Miss this if you are a family or group of friends. Truly unique and lots and lots of fun. To tell you too much would be to spoil the fun.

My new favourite attraction in London!. We were a little apprehensive at the start and first impressions were a little underwhelming but as soon as we got started we had a blast. Most unique thing we have done as a family for years! All the better for escaping from John Monroe's office in 58 mins 37 seconds. Definitely recommend to any family with older children (over 10 or so) or group of friends.We will be back to try the Zen Room before too long!
Great fun. Had a really good time here, it was a lot more fun than I expected! Will definitely return to try the harder room!

Unique and fun group activity. I was excited at the prospect of HintHunt - whilst London has a lot of well known tourist activities, a lot of great places to eat, a lot of museums, a lot of bars - I'm always on the look out for something that will provide a different experience, something more fun and interactive.If you've ever watched the Crystal Maze and fancied having a go, if you're a fan of playing games, or if you're even the slightest bit competitive, you will love HintHunt. For me the idea is perfection, and the implementation is extremely good too.The basic premise is that you're locked in a room, and you have 60 minutes to try and find a way out. The rooms don't have a massive amount of objects in them, but they really need a thorough search - you might find useful things behind / underneath / inside various props, which can help you open up new areas and progress with the solving of a mystery and progressing towards your eventual escape. They say 50% of teams make it out in time; it's pitched just at the right level of difficulty, it's great fun and very exciting, especially as the deadline approaches - you'll be running around the room trying to put the last few pieces of the puzzle in place!You don't really get stuck for too long either, as the game masters can send you hints on a screen during the game to help things along. These are needed at times (nobody could get out inside an hour without any help), but they're not excessive and a good team will get out in time - a less good team won't!The venue has two different 'mysteries' available - one is duplicated in three rooms (each can take a maximum of 5 people), so groups of up to 15 can be catered for doing the same thing, and then you can have some competition to see who can escape the fastest. There's also a single room with a different mystery in, which is apparently slightly harder.My team completed the classic mystery with a couple of minutes left on the clock, I came out with adrenalin pumping and was sweating just a little from running around inside! And it was so much fun that I came home and immediately booked a return visit to try out the other room - I can't wait to go back!

Great fun!. We booked Hint Hunt for a recent office team outing. It was excellent. Such a simple idea, brilliantly constructed to deliver a totally absorbing hour of entertainment/team building (or not - we worked too independently!)

So much fun!. My brother, husband and I came here fresh off of our flight from the states and even though we were exhausted we had a great time. We didn't read anything about it before we got there, so we had no idea what we were getting into, but it definitely exceeded expectations! Loads of fun and the woman running our game was so nice and friendly! Really want to go back to London to do the other room now that we know a bit what to expect. Better yet is that it only takes up an hour of your time - really is a must do if you are in London! I believe reservations are recommended, we booked about 3 weeks in advance and still only had 2 time slots available to choose from on the day we could go.

Superb time!. I don't want to give too much away, but we had a great time.
The host or game master was friendly, the idea is a really good one and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
We seemed to struggle with the easy parts and get the difficult ones quickly, but that just added to the fun!

loved it. we did this for a friends birthday, had 2 rooms, girls vs boys! we had so much fun, a very clever idea, hard to explain what its about without revealing it all. would definetly recommend it to anyone of any age. we'll be back to do the zen room.
Unexpected and fun. A really unique concept which kept all of us engaged for what must have been the quickest hour of our life. And no we didn't get out in time but it didn't affect our enjoyment!

Highly recommended!. We decided to do HintHunt because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we are glad that we did. We have a group of 11, which included children and adults. The youngest child that we had was 6. The activity was enjoyed by all! Even though the website is correct and it is not really geared for younger children, our 6 year old was just happy to be with us and be part of the excitement.

An incredibly fun time. What an incredible little place. Found it through Tripadvisor and I'm so glad I did. It's like a Crystal-Maze-come-murder-mystery, and you have to work as a team to get out of the room. You don't need any prior knowledge, and it's all problem solving and team playing. We completed it with 90 seconds to spare, and don't try to think you can solve it all by yourself - you definitely need the hints they provide! Four is an ideal number, two people might be a bit of a stretch. If only they had more of these around, it would be truly amazing. Great fun.

45 seconds to spare. I booked to do Hint Hunt because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and it didnt disappoint!! Best hour of our weekend away! We went in and for the first 10 minutes were calmly searching the room and by the end of it we were running around tearing the place apart!! We were a group of three which I personally recommend as you still have room to think!! Best game ever! We loved it!

36 Seconds to go!. Really good fun, we went in not feeling that confident, where do we start!? but soon got stuck right in! Made some funny mistakes, we will be teasing eachother for years to come. Definately recommended! I will be telling on my mates to get on the booking site!! We got out with just 36 seconds on the clock ahhh!! Cheers HintHunt
great game!. agreat game for friendsth e zen room is hard but it was exiting and moved very fastwe didnt solved it but were very closethe staff are very friendly

Yes, it's as good as everyone says!. Went to HintHunt as a family treat for my son's 20th birthday with 15 year old sister and three of us in our 50s. It was great fun, better than I had hoped and everyone really enjoyed it. So good to find something that appeals to all ages and types - also perfect for gaming geeks like my son. And, yes, we escaped in time with one second to spare!

Something very different. My wife and I and two teenage daughters loved it, it was just brilliant. This was a birthday present to our daughter and she said it was amazing. Can not really say to much without giving it away, but it was an hour that was spent together working as a team it was very challenging. Naomi who explained the game to us was very helpful and the pre game introduction was perfect, thanks. The only down side is that there are not more than two rooms as I'm sure like us after you do the two rooms you'll be desperate to do more. Keep up the good work.

Believe the hype-It is one of the best things to do in London. I went for my birthday based on a friend's recommendation and it was so much fun. We did the John Monroe room and just got out in time. I could have happily stayed for a lot longer and by the end it was so intense. We all went to the pub after to share our experience and can't stop talking about it. The sense of achievement for getting out in time was amazing! Has it got anything to do with London? No. Is it the best thing to do in London? From my experience-yes. If you are on a short trip and want to say that you have visited the main sights of London this might not be for you but otherwise it is well worth the money, fun for all ages and well organised and thought out. I never bother to write reviews but for once I felt that this deserved one. Book it now because the waiting list is only going to get longer if people enjoy this as much as I did!

Great and fun experience with friends. Didn't really know what to expect but was intrigued after reading reviews on tripadvisor. We were a team of 4 friends and had great fun rushing around solving puzzles and finding clues and managed to escape in the nick of time! Would definitely recommend!

Mind blowing!!. We split into 2 teams of four to make it a race against each other as well as the clock and we all agreed it was one of the best things we've ever done. It is a completely unique experience and felt a bit like being in an adventure film. I can't recommend it enough. Well done hint hunt !

Family Trip to Hint Hunt. It is not always easy to find something the whole family enjoys when you have a son of 16 and a daughter of 13, but I have to say this activity ticked all the boxes. We all came out buzzing and wanting to go and do another one!
A great experience. Went with my 2 "kids" age 18 and 26, and we loved it. Solve little puzzles and use teamwork and logic to get out within an hour. Highly recommended.

Amazing!. 8 of us went to hinthunt and split in teams of 4 making it very competitive. it is completely frustrating and so addictive, the hour flies by and what starts out to be methodical and calm soon turns into frantic screaming and running around. Cannot wait to come back to try the other room - hopefully hinthunt will have some more rooms in the near future?!? Definitely the best thing to do in London.
Excellent. How observant are you really? Find out at hint hunt and know that an hour goes very fast against the clock!

Never stopped talking about it. Took wife and kids (16,15 and 9) for a mystery tour to Hinthunt. They all totally loved it, and want to go back again to the 'different' room. The hour flies by, my wife and I realising how stupid we are, whilst the kids just got on with solving clues. It's perfect for both adults and teens. Our 9 year old was just about old enough to participate, and had a great time. Naomi, our 'hint' helper was fantastic - helpful and friendly, and made our time there really enjoyable. This is a totally different, novel attraction. For the first few minutes, you are unsure what you have let yourself in for. But for the rest of the time you become totally immersed in the experience. Don't arrive early - there is limited waiting room. If you are speaking to others who have been there, don't go into detail - you will enjoy it more if you are in the dark. Finally, all the times that I wanted were full about 6 weeks out, but I put my name down on the waiting list, which worked. We thought it was great value. Went for a lovely meal afterwards, and never stopped talking about it. Fabulously different.

Perfect diversion. This was the perfect diversion on a very full week of sightseeing. Contrary to other comments about kids, our two sons (age 9 and 15) loved it as did we. The hosts were very welcoming and intriguing. Once the hunt began, there was not a moment of reflection - it's just all a mad dash for clues with collaboration and celebration along the way. We would relish seeing this concept come to NYC and would sign up in a heartbeat with friends. BTW, there's a nice pub just a few doors down where you can grab a pint and relive the experience.

One Hour~Unlimited Fun. Wen't with few friends and enjoyed a lot. It is probably the best way to spend an hour with your close ones. Friendly atmosphere and also tensed one. Team work is actually necessary or else *cough*. I guess if you are looking for some family or friends hangout, this is probably a nice place to go and try out this fun game.

Lots of fun in an hour. We did this as a family of 5 and had a lot of fun. Could you be anywhere doing this, yes and does it have anything to do with London, no, but was it fun? Absolutely yes! We had a few skeptics in the family and they too were won over.Just a fun way to spend an hour with your family.

Sooo much fun! Definitely do it!. Don't want to say too much and give the game away, but this is AWESOME!! Was invited by another friend and we played with 4 people (optimum number in my opinion).So much fun and also quite mentally challenging, so a good combination. If you are looking for something fast paced and different to do in London this is the thing for you.

Crystal maze meets Saw. Couple of friends and I tried this out and it was pretty darn awesome!! The staff member that guided us was super friendly and helped us have a great time. With puzzles of all forms, shapes and sizes this was the fastest 60 minutes I've experienced with my clothes on. The staff can see what you're up to through cctv and can communicate with you ala Saw ...only far less menacing. We got out with 2 seconds to spare...definitely going back to try the other room in the new year

Alot of fun but not great for kids. We did this specifically because at the time of booking it was trip advisors number 1 recommendation for things to do in London. It wasn't bad. The staff were really, really personable and helpful, and the whole activity was well organized. I think it may just not have been the right activity for us. First we went in with a 6, 8, and 10 year old. We thought since the site says you need 3 people to solve the puzzle and it was appropriate for kids over 9 that the other 2 would have fun playing the game but that we'd have our requisite 3. This game is way, way, way too hard for 10 year olds, let alone younger kids. Even when the game was over and everything was explained to us - we still didn't really get it. And then, it didn't really have anything to do with London. The truth is the game could be played anywhere and be exactly the same.

surprisingly good. Not my usual thing. My work team had to use up our client entertainment budget, and someone suggested this as something a bit different. It was recommended by some colleagues who had done this recently - but who quite rightly did not give away any clues- which would have if not ruined then degraded the experience.We ended up with two teams of mixed staff and clients. 4 and 5, I think the latter is probably the maximum if only due to the size of the rooms.We mostly knew each other beforehand, but the experience is brilliant at breaking down any barriers and getting people working together.Other reviewers tell what this is -basically a Sherlock Holmes mystery (appropriate in view of the proximity to Baker St), and it is a great way to spend an hour. There is I believe a harder version which you can try, if your appetite has been whetted. Really friendly staff, I remember Lazlo's name but the lady in charge of our team was great. Highly recommended, and there is a nice pub next door for pre- and post- experience lubrication!

Family fun. Our family (myself, my husband, 14 year old and 12 year old) had a fantastic time and could not believe how quickly the hour went by. It was worth the money and was a great break from sight seeing. I think 12 might be as young as would enjoy it. Our family worked together and have spoken often about it since. Excellent!

Great attraction. Don't want to ruin the fun by giving too many details. All I'll say is this was great fun, and you get to solve a mystery sherlock-holmes style. Though in my case it may have been more scooby-doo style.

Family of four makes it out in the nick of time. You can rest assures the positive reviews are fitting, our family had a great time at HintHunt! Lazlo welcomed us and guided us through the hour. It is true...you won't believe how fast it flies. HintHunt is a nice break from touring the city and it is something your group will definitely remember, I highly recommend.

AMAZING - Dont hesitate in booking!. Cant give the game away, but all I'll say is its brilliant fun and if you're unsure as to whether or not to book, don't hesitate! Its great fun, perfect for the start of a hen do as it forced everyone into getting to know one another! Fast paced, fun, different, and very clever. The only negative is that now I've done it, I cant do it again!

The quickest one hour everrrr. Had booked this place almost 2 months ago for a girls night out.. And what a great start to the night this was.. It was the fastest one hour of our lives.. It was awesome.. Trying to book the next room, but the next weekend availability is after 2.5mths.. so am booking 2 rooms- one fr the boys and one fr the girls.. Game on ;)

Like being on The Crystal Maze. The less you know, the better - so I'll keep this short.
Challenging and creative puzzles, awesome fun, truly one of the best things in London. Do it!
What fun!. I did not know anything about HintHunt until a work team-building. What a fun way to spend a couple of hours - the time just flew. Certainly recommend.
Great game. We had wonderful time, totaly awsome. The service was very polite and the game was challenging. Recomended for everyone to come and try.

Had a brilliant time - can't wait to go back!!. A great way to spend an hour with friends, colleagues, family, whoever, you get locked in a room with a whole bunch of wonderfully thought-through props, and the only way out is to solve the mystery. We decided to take a bunch of workmates, hire two rooms based on the same scenario, split ourselves into two teams (girls v boys on this occasion) and see who could puzzle their way out first. Won't mention the outcome, but we all got totally absorbed, had a brillant time, and can't wait to go back and solve one of the other mystery rooms they've got.

Blooming great fun!. 5 girls and one bloke all out on a work xmas do. 3 went into John Monroe and 3 went into the zen room.Really great fun! We weren't doing well so the organisers kindly gave us enough hints to stop us getting too frustrated and giving up. Each time we got an answer we celebrated with a cheer.neither of us solved the puzzle.. but who cares, we had fun and most definately will be back.HIGHLY recommended.

Ingenious and Interactive - just wish I could play it all over again!. I don't want to give anything away as it is best kept a secret however I would recommend this to anyone and everyone. It is like a real life Sherlock Holmes or similar to the ITunes App game The Room. You have to solve a crime using all manner of clues, hints and objects. It is very cleverly constructed and demands a high level of logical and lateral thinking. There is also someone on hand to provide hints throughout via a TV screen in the room. The female staff member guiding us was great - she was enthusiastic and engaging. The game is very interactive, the hour flies past, and you certainly have to think outside of the box. We all loved every minute of it, just wish I could forget the clues and do it all over again.All I can say is - I forecast HintHunt expanding across the UK and internationally. Please give us more rooms to play!!

All the good reviews are spot on.. My wife and I took our 10 year old granddaughter and we played as a team. Time went by so fast, we were totally engaged. The young couple who run the game are very nice and really see to it that everyone has a great time. I never thought that spending an hour trying to get out of a room could be so much fun. Go with a group that you want to bond with. This is a perfect game to play with grandchildren from 10 to 20. They won't even think about their iphone while the game is on!
Excellent and fun!. If you're looking for something different, you should check it out. It's fun and different. Quickest 1h you'll experience

Absolutely Brilliant!. If your looking for something different to do in London rather than the stereotypical attractions then I would definitely recommend booking HiintHunt! Even with some of our group not knowing much English we were still able to communicate and work together to solve the case and we did! Its pure genius! Will definitely be visiting again! Plus the staff were so helpful and friendly. Thanks for a brilliant time!

Amazing Amazing Amazing. Loved this - cant wait to go back.My friends and i tackled the Zen Room didn't make it out alive but came that close it was so frustrating, no one killed eachother and play well as a team :)Organised by a great group of people, very helpful!I cant wait to go back, i hope they open more rooms!! these rooms are so cleverly planned! great idea! must must must be trialed by all!! :)
Fun!. We had a great experience at the hinthunt. Two adults and a youth (13 years old) Will recomend it to all our friends

Brilliant!. Went with some colleagues as part of a team building day out and I have to say, it was incredibly fun...everything about it was brilliant. A must do in London! Looking forward to playing the Zen game next time - thank you for a great time!

Book early, hunt hints, have fun. My girlfriend decided to treat me by locking me in a room for an hour - and it was fantastic. Four of us took on the Zen Room (the only one free despite booking weeks in advance, it's very popular) and only just made it out alive! The room was tailored perfectly for the time limit, there's no way you're going to make it out before getting your moneys worth. We got out feeling exhilarated and instantly started planning our return. Can only hope that the popularity continues and that more rooms are added as would love to keep coming back every few months or so.There's nothing overtly 'London' about HintHunt but as it's located right next to Euston train station and takes up around an hour and a half in its entirety it could easily be fitted in to a short visit.

Excellent game for anyone. Went here with some friends and played their Zen room (supposedly the more difficult of the the two they have). It's brilliantly put together with lots of puzzles to solve. You're carefully monitored, so you can't go too far astray. Equally, there are some tough puzzles in there so don't expect it to be simple, even if you're a puzzle genius.Stop dithering - just sign up!

Great team building!. I went to Hint Hunt on a team building day with my work. We were split into three groups and all thoroughly enjoyed the day. It forced you to work together, and provided lots of excitement and fun for everyone. At the end, you really felt like you had achieved something as a team!

Amazing!. I visited HintHunt with three friends and we all thought it was fantastic.We were greeted by a lovely, friendly man who talked us through the experience and then locked us in the zen room for an hour! Mentally challenging and super fun all at once, I would recommend this activity to just about anyone - it's not a tourist attraction as much as hidden gem that all Londoners should explore! Although as I understand it's becoming very popular indeed, so make sure you book in advance. An absolute must do.

HintHunt - Justified as Trip Advisor's No.1 Rated Attraction in London. I rarely write reviews on TA and when I heard of Hinthunt being rated the number one attraction in London I was extremely sceptical. After doing this last night I would say it is completely justified and well worth a positive review. I will not ruin anything but this is a great team activity to do, it is testing yet fun and it really is as good as everybody says it is. I am already in the process of booking up a return trip so I can do the second room, and I cannot wait to escape this room in time also. I would encourage you not to be sceptical and give it a go – #amazing .SAW + The Crystal Maze + The Krypton Factor = Hinthunt ;)

What an adrenalin rush!. 9 of us went along to this today having seen it advertised on Trip Advisor...we were NOT disappointed! What a fun time! It's amazing how consumed you get by the pursuit, the time just flew by! I feel physically and mentally tired from just 1 hour of fun! I can't recommend it enough for anyone who wants to try something a little different...it's wonderful!

The best way to spend an hour in London. I had heard hint hunt was good, but have alway been dubious about such events. I was wrong to be doubtful. From the second the game started is was pressurized and fun. I did this as team building event at work and it was definitely a good way to get people to work together. I wish they had more than 2 different rooms so I could go back again and again.
Excellent - great night out. Went here with another couple and absolutely loved it.Bit of a surprise as didn't really know what to expect but absolutely loved it.Definitely recommend it.

Brilliant!! Best way to spend an hour!. Had a fabulous time in the Zen Room! My How we did not know what we had let ourselves in for, after about 10 minutes your brain clicks in and you know what your in for! and what to look for, we had an amazing time, and that's something that runs out quick, so take note of what your told before you go into the room..... write everything on the whiteboard! Great time had by all and would definitely go back! Well done HintHunt..... a pat on the back.Mandy
Amazing. Such a wonderful idea. Went with four friends from school and it was phenominal. Really recommend to anyone who likes honking outside the box.

Locked up in London!. Our family of 4 (kids are 12 and 14) had a blast at Hint Hunt! We are four weeks into a round-the -world journey and it is everyone's favorite thing we've done yet! It seems a little pricey, but it is worth it. Be forewarned that the street it's on seems a little sketchy, but it's perfectly fine. If you are interested you need to book it now. They book up weeks in advance. It's the biggest rush we've had in years. It is SO MUCH FUN!!!

The best way to spend an hour in London!. We were super excited going into Hinthunt and it definitely lived up to our expectations! We had a ton of fun working together trying to solve the challenges that would lead us out of the room. Even though we didn't make it out of the room (if we only had two more minutes we would have made it out) we still enjoyed it. The staff is very friendly and the hints we received we helpful but quite funny. We'll definitely be back to give the Zen room a chance. Try to book your "game" as soon as you know that you'll be going to London as it seems to book up fast. Even if your date is booked put in a request to try to get a time on the day you're looking for. We got lucky when we received an email about a cancellation on the day we wanted to do it. I jumped on the opportunity to do it and I'm so glad I did!

Unique experience, great fun. We've been to Hint Hunt twice now with our kids aged 14 & 11. We enjoyed both rooms hugely - I think our first visit was marginally more enjoyable just because we had no idea what to expect. Looking forward to the Hint Hunt coming up with a new challenge!
Strongly recommended!!. Amazing 1 hour with friends!!well done to the hint-hunt team!Challenging,different and a lot of fun!the next hours we could not stop talking about it!

Superb!. Hint Hunt really made it for us. It is, without a doubt, the most entertaining and fun attraction in London. Get ready for lots of surprises and absorbing challenges, one after the other, and all in 1 hour.

Amazing experience with my family. It's difficult to explain how do you feel when you come out of the room and how good and excited you are, even if you don't find the final solutions of the game. Spending an hour in London for a team building with my family was a great story. Hoping to go better next time!
The Best Time. Hint Hunt is an incredibly fun way to spend an hour with friends. Challenging, amusing and enlightening we had the best time and will be back again to take on another room.

Amazing Hour. The building isn't something to write home about and the introduction isn't all that enlightening, but this was one frantic hour once we started and we all had a ball! We participated as a family of 3, - 2 adults and one teen. Very tough clues throughout but lots of help when you need it. A most unique experience in London!

Great time!. Very nice and unexpected activity! Lot of fun :-) if you like finding things and resolve riddles you will love it!
Staff was very nice and very helpful.

Unique experience. This is a brilliant and uniqie way to spend an evening. There is nothing else like it anywhere in London. I went along with three friends and we escaped the John Monroe room with a few minutes to spare. The concept is just awesome; so much thought and research has gone into the design and set-up, and it shows. The staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming, and quickly allayed any fears or worries (who wouldn't be a bit worried about being locked in a room for an hour with no way out?!) and the feeling of euphoria when the door opens is pretty cool! I am now desperate to try the second room! I'd recommend this for teams of friends or colleagues that love games, quizzes, mysteries etc. It's suitable for all skill levels and everyone can get involved. Competitive people will love it but may get easily frustrated!

Great fun. I've been twice (different rooms) and had a blast each time. It's suitable for all ages and I recommend you have four people at least as it does get particularly tricky at times. Fortunately the host provides clues to help you if (when!) you get stuck. As others have said, the hour does fly by and you have to keep searching and re-searching. Good luck, you'll need it!

Want more of these!. I went to Hint Hunt along with 4 of my friends as part of my leaving London do. One of my friends and I had done something similar to this in the past while on holiday in Hungary, and we really looked forward to Hint Hunt after our previous experience.We most certainly were not disappointed :) Without giving away too much, the challenge was stunningly set up, and the tasks just fun fun fun. We were never left feeling frustrated for long as the lovely Hint Hunt staff would drop us subtle hints over the PA system on occassion to help us get back on track when we got stuck (and believe me, you WILL get stuck at times!). We had booked this reasonably last minute - 2 weeks before we went to play. It's hugely popular and rightly so, so I recommend that you book well in advance for this. As it was, we had to play the hardest room, the Zen Room, because of our last minute booking so it was all the more satisfying that we escaped the room with ample time to spare still :)Thank you Hint Hunt for an amazing send off, and I really do hope that you guys are able to set one up in Australia - I can't wait to be the first to line up for a room to escape here in Oz!

Where did that hour go????. This was the most amazing experience and if you do anything in London make sure this is at the top of your list.... although book early to avoid disappointment!When we arrived we were welcomed by Kitty who looked after us with care and attention the whole time we were there ~ thank you Kitty, you have obviously found your vocation in life and made the event even more enjoyable!!!Difficult to explain the evening as I don't want to give away any spoilers but it was great value for money, jam packed with surprises and utterly good fun. The four of us who attended worked really well as a team and got down to solving clues as soon as the clock started and by the end of it we were all mentally & physically drained yet completely exhilarated... fortunately there is a pizza express just round the corner which we fell into immediately after.Sadly I have to confess we did not manage to break out in the allotted time but we were so damn close, another 60 seconds and we would have cracked it.... arrggghhhh... the hour shot by!Don't take my word for it however... just do it and I promise you, you will not regret it xHintHunt we will be back and hopefully you will still have Kitty working for you... she is a great asset xx

Like being a character of a well-written Mystery novel!. This is a must-do for everyone who likes mysteries, puzzles etcetera. And everyone else, considering how you easily you can get swept-up in this game! The whole experience was, excuse my language, bloody brilliant! Whenever you get stuck, there's just enough of a hint to get you further, without spoiling too much of the seek-and-think work. I will return, that's certain. There's still another room to solve! (And hopefully, more will follow...)

Bloody brilliant!!!!!. Booked this for my sisters hen and we had the best time ever with two groups of 5 we had our own competition outside the room itself. Would reccomend this to everyone I know for a good fun day/activity out. Thank you for a wonderful time HintHunt genius!!!!!!

Brilliant!!. If you like to think on your feet and have a good laugh, this is for you. Don't want to spoil the fun, but there is a reason for all these reviews. Book early! They sell out within days of opening a new booking window.

Highly recommended. My wife bought me a visit as a birthday present and, with my brother as a necessary third brain, we had a massively fun, energetic and challenging hour. Like 'The Crystal Maze' mixed with the video game 'The Room', this is a great group activity that will have you replaying it in your head (and with each other) for hours afterwards. Highly recommended for anyone with even a passing interest in games and problem-solving.
Great Fun!. This was sooo much fun!!! We went as a group of four, by far the best attraction in London . We had no idea what to expect but loved it and want to go back again !! :)

An interesting night out, I want to try the next challenge now!. Without giving too much away (it would spoil the fun). this is great fun, where you get to work in a team and challenge yourself. I was 8 months pregnant and could still join in the fun. We were a team of four adults which was just about right. We were all kept engaged and entertained for the whole time we were solving the problem. Been talking about it all the way home. I'm definitely keen to go back and try their other puzzle at some point, and if its just as good, I hope they'll create some more.

Birthday celebrations. We went as a group of four for HintHunt not really knowing what to expect. We were greeted by a really friendly bunch of staff who quickly got us curious as to what to expect when we were finally allowed in the room. It's a brilliant team game and you come out buzzing and feeling so much closer to the people you've just shared this experience with!

Ace night out. Don't delay; find a couple of like-minded friends and book this - I promise you'll be back here the next day giving it a five star review yourself. The most fun hour I've ever spent in London - and that's saying something!
Something special!. All fans of the Crystal Maze would love this! Something truly different in the heart of London. Great for a birthday treat with a twist. Staff were superb and very welcoming.

Unusual, fun activity in London. One of the best hours I've spent. Much more interesting than spending a birthday or a evening out at the cinema or a meal. Challenging fun, great for working together with your team. I walked away and didn't stop talking about our experience for about two hours afterwards. A must try in London

Great fun. The four of us had a great time. All instructions are well explained and the actual task is fun. A good team building event or birthday idea. You must book well in advance as it seems very popular. All I can say is search, search, search and you may get out within the hour.

The best hour of fun money can buy. We heard about HintHunt through a friend and were intrigued!! We were not disappointed and had the best (and quickest) hour of fun in a long time. Team of three, 36, 33 and 14......we all had a great time and can't wait to come back! Great for teenagers through to "grown ups"

Amazing experience!. HintHunt is a brilliant idea. Such a different thing to do for a birthday. The staff are great and explain everything really well. The actual task was so much fun, my friends and I loved it. We got out in 58.40mins, which I am told is a good time. Just go! You won't regret it.
A great night out in a group. You can have up to 5 people in a room but 3 would be better. Don't want to give to much away. But if you want a good night out this is great. Book well in advance.

Definitely worth doing!. Great fun and a very different experience! Don't be put off by the price - it is well worth it. The hour just flew by and we were left wanting more! Can't wait to go back to try the other room.

Brilliant hour of fun!. I have to say this is the best hour of fun our family has had in a long time! If you like doing 'escape the room' puzzles on a computer, you'll just love this practical real life version! Excellent 'host' too, who made it all great fun. Highly recommended. We did the John Munroe room, and I've already booked us to go again to the Zen room!
Great hour of fun!. Had an amazing time, enthusiast team - such an a sense of achievement when you finish. Will defo go back to do the other rooms!
Highly recommended. This was so much fun, and the 60 minutes just flew by!! My friends and I had a really good time, it comes highly recommended!

Great Fun. A group of five of us went and had a hoot!!Recommended for sure, something different - feels like your in a movie. Only point is watch the prices as they charge VAT on top of website prices. We didn't mind too much but it was a bit of a surprise. Just go its exciting!

Quickest hour of my life!. I do not want to say too much as I do not want to spoil the surprise, but this was one of the best things I have ever done in London. You are given one hour to escape a room, with tasks to complete along the way. The hour went so fast, but as a team of four we had an amazing time and just made it out with seconds to spare. Who ever came up with the tasks inside has done a brilliant job as they are incredibly clever. We cannot wait to do the harder room!

Fun and clever. Did this with our kids and enjoyed the family experience but i cant understand why it is rated so highly on trip advisor???? when there are so many other wonderful things to see and do in this great city.Expensive for only 1 hour of entertainment.I would choose another activity over this one.
You won't be disappointed . Had no idea what to expect when we arrived but very good fun and would recommend to all! Don't look around the internet for tips as it will ruin the hour.

Believe the hype. Definitely believe everything positive that is written about Hinthunt. We spend a thoroughly enjoyable hour solving puzzle. So much to do and think about, the hour just flew by. Highly recommended. The ‘hints’ provided by the team are well placed and timed brilliantly. Can’t wait to go back and try the Zen room.

Best thing I've ever done. This was AMAZING! I wish there were more than two puzzle rooms as I want to keep doing this again and again. The best thing i've ever done. Naomi made the experience even more enjoyable by giving us 'hints' and making it fun. We're already booking the second room.

Fun hour!. We loved our game at Hint Hunt! I was a little skeptical about not knowing more going in but it ended up being a blast. Our team of three (29, 24, & 20) all had a great time working together. The staff was friendly, professional, and very helpful! Highly recommended for anyone 12+ who enjoys mysteries and solving puzzles! We would love to see different versions of this in other cities!

Great Fun. An hour for your team to solve a murder using your wits and a few (?) well-placed clues! It was just the thing to get the little grey cells going. Good thing our sharp nephew was with us or we might have never made it!

Brilliant Team Building activity!. We visited as part of a work team building day, and found the experience one of the best that we've had in many years! The game began with some trepidation and but very quickly became challenging and good fun. It made us think and work together a lot, so I'd really recommend this for anyone looking for a good team building activity, or just a good day out! It was very rewarding to manage to complete the challenge, and most importantly, quicker than our colleagues! I'd also certainly look into going again with friends in the future.

Basement fun!. What a great way to spend an hour.....the tension was palpable, the challenge was on....our family of four (teens aged 17 & 15) escaped with almost 5 minutes to spare, with just a few hints from our excellent hostess!!All enjoyed it, worthy of the high ratings, and recommended :-)

Unique experience!. I love games and this was just the most amazing unique experience. I went with my boyfriend and another couple to do the John Munroe room and then immediately booked up to do the Zen room a few months later - this was the first available slot as it is so popular. It would be a fun thing to do as a work bonding activity, with family or friends. I can't wait for them to do a new room so I can go back!

Believe the hype. We were intrigued as to how an attraction could have such universal acclaim on this most vociferous of forums and am happy to say that the hype is justified - one of the best hours i've spent in a long time. We got out with under 2 mins to spare but i just wish we didn't need so many hints! Genius.*** Tip: Search EVERYWHERE!***

Mind blowing!!!. What can I say, like nothing we have ever done before, 60 minutes went so fast. Amazing time for all (2 adults, 18 yr old and two 13 year olds). Got out with twelve seconds to spare, the last two minutes were frantic. One of the best things we have done in London. Huge thanks to Naomi (the hinthunt helper) she was good fun and soooo helpful. Will be returning to book the Zen room, can't wait.

Awesome!!!. Totally fabUlis!!!! Two teenage boys addicted to wifi and anything that has headphones - they were totally absorbed for the whole 60 mins!! We failed (but only just) and they are desperate to try the next room!! Book in advance bc it looks packed out online. Brilliant fun!!!

Great puzzle. Me and 9 friends went to HintHunt after reading the reviews here on TripAdvisor. The group split into two different rooms, but we had so much fun during the 1 hour. This was not what you had thought of at all! Thanks to the crew working there we got even more excited before we really started. The rooms were amazingly designed and planned. Absolutely worth the money and the time.Without a doubt - go HintHunting!

Simply Brilliant!. This activity was found by our 12 year old son while he was researching activities in London. This was his specific pick for the whole family and I am pleased to have the privilege to report that this was the best fun we had in all of London.
