While we enjoyed all the cultural attractions of London, and there are many worthy contenders, this activity stood out by a country mile. It was exciting, engaging in every moment and a wonderful learning experience, illustrating the dynamic nature of the bond we share as a family. It was so interesting for all of us to experience how our minds worked on an individual level and a collective one in a time pressured situation. For us, this just brought us closer together and we left the experience on a complete high. While this activity is costly one, it is our recommendation to ignore this completely. In a city that is arguably the most overpriced city in the world, with so many useless tourist trap activities, this experience when compared, is a complete bargain. We also had the opportunity in the short time to develop a relationship with the young attendant who briefed us. Timea only enhanced the overall experience and was a true credit to her company. Thank you Timea! The young entrepreneurs that thought this up are clearly geniuses and we found out that they are actually Hungarians not English. We also learned that they value their workers, which is also why I believe people have such a wonderful experience from start to finish. Clearly there are many reviews of this activity, so in this respect, I am not sure if our review will make any real difference. We will say however, that we believe it is because Hint-Hunt is the full package that it gets such an enthusiastic nod from so many. We nevertheless trust that you will find this review useful too in giving you a slightly different perspective on which to base your decision to go ahead. TIP: If you are considering this for your next trip to London, make sure you book well ahead of time, giving yourself plenty of chance to book a slot that will suit you. Irrespective of season, it seems that they are always booked and we wouldn't want you to miss out.Thank you,Lali & Family

Not what you think. Visited this with work and expected to be sent around London with a map looking for clues. So much better than that! Really simple concept but incredibly well designed, delivered and planned. Small teams work best, and time flies. We were buzzing afterwards reliving the last hour.

Jam packed fun. I could do this again and again as it's so much fun.
Don't ask any questions just book it and enjoy.
Fun for everyone :)
Loved it!

A great way to spend the afternoon!. I was on vacation with my family and booked HintHunt based on other TripAdvisor reviews noting it as a top attraction in the city. I have been to London several times, but my family had not so I thought it was worth trying since we had enough people to play the game. This turned out to be one of my daughter's favorite memories of our trip. She is 9 and was able to play with us and stay involved. With a team of 3 we were able to work together and all stay involved. The hour went by super fast and we were talking about the game well into the evening. This is a really unique game and totally family friendly. Our game master Alex was awesome and kept us on our toes! I highly recommend as a way to break up a day of site seeing. Would also be great for a team event for business. Too bad we don't have in the US.

Time flies when you're having fun!. I loved my experience at Hint Hunt! Hint hunt is something you CAN NOT MISS OUT ON! Tourist or Londoner this is a truly amazing game! Firstly a very warm welcome from the world's best staff group! next instructions, questions, jokes & bathroom brake before you are 'Locked' in a small room where you need to find pass-codes, lockets, lock codes, & items! Cool thing is that one of the AMAZING staff will be there to help you! There is a television in the room indicating time left and a when you need it- a bit of help from the master mind staff! After an hour, if you have not finished the game (which the say is likely and did not manage finish it!) your mastermind will tell you what you missed on and what distracted you which is great! And wow, just wow- it is truly amazing experience and i definitely want to come back to try another room and even the same one!

Frantic. Frustrating. Great Fun!. Won't give away too much of the detail but this is a great way to spend an hour doing something completely different with a bunch of mates, your family (with older kids), or work colleagues. Take heed though - you can't just turn up - this is a very popular activity and so you should book well in advance. For those old enough to remember "The Adventure Game" and "The Crystal Maze" - Hint Hunt is a bit like those!My friend and our kids had time to spare before we caught our train home after a holiday break in London (its about a 15/20 min walk from King's Cross). The only slot available was for the Zen room which is a bit harder than the John Munro room so we were thrown into the deep end. Our host was extremely friendly and really helpful and we escaped with only a few seconds to spare. Didn't give it the full 5 stars because it is quite expensive for one hour of entertainment, also some of the clues are well thumbed and used so sometimes a little hard to read and decipher.

Fun fun fun. I took my work team their recently as a different fun night. We all had so much fun as well as working together as a TEAM to work out all the clues. I hadn't realised that I chose the Zen room. The hardest one but we managed to get out :-) I have now booked to go and do the John room- it's addictive!
Brilliant Fun. A fantastic way to spend and hour when your at a loose end. The three of us had a frantic and exciting time solving clues and puzzles. Thanks to everyone at Hinthunt :-))

A very exciting and rewarding experience.. I visited HintHunt whilst on a Family city break in London with my partner and two teenage step sons and it was definitely the high point of the whole weekend. Upon arrival we were very warmly welcomed by our hostess who well briefed us without actually telling us anything that would spoil the challenge; and it is a challenge!! When your 60 minutes begin you neither know what you're looking for nor why you're looking for it or what you'll do with it when you find it. It's designed to get you working as a group and it cant be faulted as a bonding experience. When we finally cracked it with literally seconds left and the door swung open it was a great sense of accomplishment that gave us lots to talk about for the rest of the day. If you like a mystery or a challenge you have to get HintHunt on your London itinerary. Great fun and thoroughly recommended.

What you can get up to in an hour!!. There were plenty of games and puzzles to solve plus a few red herrings along the way. some of the clues and objects were hidden in really random places & without prompts & hints we never would have found them. A fun thing to do in London.
Great family Adventure. We enjoyed the puzzle solving a lot. It was good fun, but not easy. It really challenges your creativity to find the clues.
So much fun with a unique attraction. Pros: Exciting, unusual, close to rail, friendly staffCons: Too short, splits up groups larger than 5

Great family puzzle / team game for older kids. This was a really imaginatively devised team puzzle-solving game that had us all thinking hard, sharing thoughts and testing out ideas. The hour whisked by leaving us bemused, happy and bonded. Is actually refreshing to do something that was just for us, too, no sharing with strangers - just what is needed sometimes.

One nerve wracking hour !. This turned out to be one of the highlights of our London trip and was money and an hour very well spent ! Simple enough game where you are locked up in a room and need to get out in 60 mins with the help of clues and hints that you will keep getting on a tv monitor. Sounds simple ? Try it !

The reviews are true.. So you're looking at this review site and thinking, surely, nothing can be this entertaining.It *is*!This is literally the best and most exciting hour I spent on a recent trip to London in which I did many other things I really enjoy doing (it was the weekend of the TWE Whisky Show, which was superb) The staff are friendly, the game was intense and fantastically made, and we only *just* managed it out in time with 3:45 to spare!Upon coming out in to the fresh air, a local stopped us and asked us what the deal was. When we told him how much fun we'd had, he decided to go with a few mates one evening.If you find yourself in London, please, please visit Hint Hunt. I had a fantastic time and i'm very sure you will too, no matter who you go with. It's absolutely worth the price and I wish I could wipe the room from my memory so I could experience it a second time! :)

Superb and unusual way to spend time and bond. The place might feel a bit dingey as you walk in, but don't let that put you off. The activity is very well thought out and the monitoring throughout was spot on. Wish there were more rooms so I could keep going back!

A few hints (well, more than a few) for a fantastic hunt. What a fun hour. We went quite unprepared, were running late (literally) and didn't get out (sadly) but we still had an amazing time. The challenge is perfectly set. One hour. One room. Enough clues to keep you on track and a whole lot of puzzles and locks and challenges to keep you interested. I wish I could go back and do it again for the first time. As I can't, I'll have to settle for going back and trying the other room!
Fun Fun Fun. This place is Brilliant. It is just Fun. Everyone should go there. It is not easy to play, but that's why it is so good.

Brilliant!!!! So much fun. Hint hunt was so much fun. We went as a group of four having no idea what to expect but we were soon hunting around for clues and getting draw into the game. We did the Monroe office and the hour went so fast, we managed to escape with 3 seconds spare!! The guy was very helpful and kept us busy with clues. We were talking about it for hours after and already planning when to go back to do the Zen room. I have been recommending this to everyone.

Brilliant!. Me and my friends went to hint hunt last week and we had the most fantastic time ever. The game was so brilliantly planned and we enjoyed every minute of it. I would recommend this as an activity for anyone who is looking for something fun and different to do in London. definately recommend and you would be missing out if you did not go!

A lot of fun!. We went here on a team outing and we all had a great time. I was a little nervous at the start because the introduction was very lengthy, 3 different people spoke to us and said the exact same thing (which was a whole lot of nothing). Once we were let into the rooms though we had an absolute blast! It was fun to run around and try to solve the mystery. An hour was perfect, any more time would have been too long stuck in the room!

Most ingenious invention & game ever. Go Play!. Hint Hunt is fantastic fun. We were under so much pressure to accomplish the game, we were working up a sweat!We didn't really know what we were getting ourselves into, but had so much fun finding all the clues and trying to solve the mystery. It was adrenaline based, and so much fun. It's difficult to explain the game without giving the 1 hour activity away. It's a great game for all ages (although there probably is a "too young" age category). It's fast paced, and the key to success is good communication.The unfortunate thing about Hint Hunt is that once you have completed the 2 different games (Zen room, and John Monroe) you have done Hint Hunt. To go again and repeat a room defeats the purpose, and would be a bit like cheating, but it is possible to do, particularly if you leave a long gap (about a year or so) in between each game.Note that the Zen room and John Monroe room are separate games and need to be booked separately.The venue is easy to find near Euston station. There is a toilet on site. Go play. It's the best hour you'll have. Book well in advance though, as it is very popular!!!!

Believe the reviews!. Brilliant fun, totally different to the usual activities you might think to do in London! A group of four of us went on Saturday and couldn't stop talking about it all weekend. Despite being 25 we were running around like maniacs and shrieking with delight when we solved a clue. It's a bit like Crystal Maze and who didn't always want to go on that!

Can't think of a better way to spend an hour in London. What a fabulous way to spend an hour with friends/colleagues, for a team building event, for a family outing with teenagers. It is clever, thought-provoking, funny, frustrating (in a hilarious way), intense, sweaty and requires all kinds of differing skills to complete.Can you beat the record - we wanted to, but didn't and have to go back to explore new options.Please open more rooms with new challenges, two will not be enough!

Didn't make it out on time, but it was still great fun!!!. We were equally excited before, during and after our HintHunt experience, even though we did not find our way out on time. This alone should tell you how much fun the whole thing was. A totally unique, thrilling, frantic, original 60 minutes! Looking forward to try the other room as soon as we are back in London! If you like that sort of thing, don't miss Hint Hunt!

Amazing unique attraction. Excellent, intense, amazing. We went there with friends and didn't disappoint. To tell you the truth, we didn't exactly know what to expect but it was worth every penny. If you like intense mind games I would strongly recommend it to you!

Hint Hunt is awesome!!. We spent a very enjoyable hour at Hint Hunt. The children thoroughly enjoyed looking for the clues, and the lady looking after us and supplying our hints was lovely. Things got more frantic as our time ticked away, would we be able to escape?? Our son, aged 12, especially enjoyed it and wanted to do the other room as soon as we had finished the first!! A great experience and would thoroughly recommend it to all.

Fantastic fun!. We are a family of 4...2 boys aged 11 and 14. We all loved this experience...all of us would put it in our top 3 for things we did in London. We did not know what to expect but the whole thing exceeded any expectations we had. Brilliant for families but also small groups adults...unlike anything we have ever done.

HintHunt was a great experience. We didn't know what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff were very helpful and made our two grandchildren - ages 10 and 13 - feel very involved. They both had a fantastic time and the youngest wanted to go again - right away. Can fully recommend it as a fantastic way to spend an hour - it went too fast.

BRAIN TEASING. Excellent and exciting game. A must go in London and highly recommendable. Brain teasing, squeezing and any other adjectives you name it. It drives you insane at some point but every second and every moment you unlock a clue, it opens to a new frustration. BUT every clue solved leads to a satisfaction! It's not lame, trust me!

great family fun. we had a great family experience at hit hunt, enjoying 2 sessions, one in each room during our week in london. it appealed to ourselves and our children: 21,19 and 12, especially the youngest who enjoyed the active nature of it compared to sightseeing.whoever likes puzzles and whodunnits -who doesn't?- will love the game.The staff are wonderful and help you through the session. go on you'll love it!

Nothing short of spectacular. Exciting, challenging, fun, entertaining, confusing, frustrated and thats just a few of the emotions you will go through in 1 hour. Felt like we had saved the world once we completed the challenge. Don't really want give anything away because it will take away from the experience. The concept is unique to anything else I have experienced in London, and the execution is flawless by the people at hint hunt.

Fantastic!. Next time you're making a trip to London, make sure you book in a visit to HintHunt. An absolutely fantastic way to spend an hour. The game is brilliant, challenging and lots of fun to do with your friends. The less you know, the better the experience will be. Great staff and well worth the money. Can't wait to go back and visit the Japanese Room!

Talked about this for hours afterward!. I found HintHunt on TripAdvisor and signed up our group of four for it without really consulting them. My sister was really excited, but both of our husbands were pretty lukewarm toward it. Fortunately for me, it was amazing! By the time we were in the room and getting started, we were all four totally invested. And by the time we were finished, the adrenaline was running so high, and we couldn't believe we had made it through! All four of us agreed it was such a unique, fun experience.Seriously, we finished at 1:30pm and talked about it the entire rest of the day. The only part we were bummed about was that we weren't in London long enough to have a chance to do the second room.It was so much fun; I would highly recommend it to anyone who has ever enjoyed a good mystery story or logic or escape puzzle. Please don't get hung up on the fact that it has nothing to do with London, really; it is the number-1 rated excursion for good reason! Yes, it could be anywhere else in the world, but it isn't. It's in London. And it's totally worth an hour and a half of your time while you're there!!!

great family activity. We got locked in the John Munroe room for an hour and had a ball, it really is an intense activity that makes you work together as a team - my husband and I along with our son (12 years) had a great time and escaped with 52 seconds to go - with the help of our lovely host who gave us some valuable hints! Look hard and search the nooks and crannies.

A Unique Experience. Understandably the top rated attraction in London, HintHunt is unbelievably exciting, challenging, and like nothing you've done before! The less you know about it going into it the better, I'd say. It's easy to find and only takes one very frantic hour, so give it a shot (and good luck!)

Be sharp, be aware and have lots of fun!. We luckily managed to get a last minute booking of the John Munroe room in Sept 2013. All we knew initially was that it was the #1 rated activity in London on Tripadvisor. The introduction we received was really good, just enough for us to be prepared for what lay ahead without giving too much away. One hour of intense problem solving! I don't want to sell anything out but it was non-stop action, laughs, teamwork and revelations. Exceeded all my expectations and highly recommended to all.

Fun, innovative way to spend an evening!. This is such a brilliant concept and without giving too much away is a little like the old 'Crystal Maze' programme! The whole thing takes an hour and if you are in 2 groups you can compete amongst eachother to finish first. I have recommended this to all my friends living in London- and those that don't!

Craziest 60 Minutes EVER!. My family of four did HintHunt while visiting London this summer. My husband and I are 40-somethings and then there was our 12 year old know-it-all son and our 6 year old daughter, who was pretty much just along for the ride. Oh, and we had to do the harder "Zen Room" since that was all that was available when we reserved. So we were doomed from the start...or so we thought!Working together, the three of us (the 6 year old just kind of hung out and watched the craziness) managed to run around like crazed monkeys, shouting clues to each other as the clock ran down and things got increasingly chaotic. Using each of our strengths, which we had determined beforehand (my husband was the puzzle solver, I was the methodical one so I did all the reading and tracking of clues, and the 12 year old was the "out of box thinker" -- having someone like this is essential in this game). What's really infuriating and also awesome about this game is that just when you think you're doing well, you realize how far you still have to go! Amazingly, we actually completed the "Room" and escaped with literally seconds to spare. I'm not joking when I say we were sweating and so hyped up on adrenaline afterwards that we were recapping all the events in the room for the next 3 hours like deranged mental patients.To sum up, it was some of the most fun we had on our trip and an experience we'll never forget. It's like you're in a TV show, mixed with a game show, mixed with some sort of life or death situation. What can I say but "wow"! Loved it! Can't wait for HintHunt Miami (come on, it could happen!).

Outstanding. Myself and 3 friends did this last night. Others have described the premise so I won't bother going over that again. As I look back, I'm in awe of the design and execution. From the moment the door closes you're fully immersed in the experience - it feels like you're in a videogame or the star of a TV detective show. There's a real sense of adventure as you explore the room, which is full of surprises, each puzzle solved only throws up more questions as you race to beat the clock. The staff were friendly and good fun, and they clearly want everyone to enjoy the experience. HintHunt fully deserves the #1 spot, it's the best 'attraction' I've been to in London and I'll definitely be back to try the other challenge! Köszönöm!

Super thrill fun team play. A must try escape game, if its your first time then try to book way ahead of your planned date to be able to find a slot in the "Jon Monroe's Office", its easier then the "Zen room" which is still fun but much more challenging. So the Jon Monroe's Office is perfect for a start and you'll probably be able to do it in 60 mins - super fun super collaboration between the team and super focus on little detailed stuff.Highly recommend you try it.Staff and people helping on the game are extremely nice and motivating!

Loved every minute of 60 we had .... This was our first trip to London and based on #1 we chose this activity over the London eye or a musical.. and so glad we did!! I mean, sometimes the rating can be misleading and based on taste, but not this time.. I suggest you do the same, and skip that long line at the "Eye" :)))

Release your inner Columbo. Ah...but zat is where you are wrong 'astings! This may seem like elementary my dear Watson, but trying to explain just how good Hint Hunt is is tougher than one of Jessica Fletcher's cakes (she probably baked, I can't remember).Crappy detective analogies aside, Hint Hunt is probably the closest thing you'll get to experiencing solving a 20th century TV crime. The premise is simple, you are trapped in a locked-down murder scene with the police on the way; you have an hour to solve the crime before the police arrive and beat a confession out of you (hey, that's what they did in the olden days, right?).Four of us took part in Hint Hunt (five is probably the optimal number) and it was described before we started as "the fastest hour of your life"; this really was the fastest hour of my life, as we basically rooted around the 'crime scene', looking for clues, trying to interpret evidence and turning the place over like the marx brothers committing a burglary in a manic attempt to solve the crime and save ourselves from the impending fit-up job.Without giving anything more away it's hard to offer anything else that others haven't already said but it is truly is a great way to spend an hour. The only advice I would give is, if you *think* you might need the loo before you go in, go to the loo before you go in. One of our party foolishly declared himself un-in-need of a wee and after half an hour, was slumped in a chair, offering no help and providing only comedy entertainment with his pained expressions for the girl running the show from outside the room.
Good fun, it gets you thinking.. Very good time here, gets you thinking and there are some surprises. I will definitely be going back to try the Zen room.

Great fun. Most interesting way to spend 60 mins in the capital. Didn't know what to expect. Loved every minute. Dying to go back and do another. This could be the new craze that sweeps the UK. Let's hope so.

60 minutes of cerebral fun. We had an amazing time in the Zen Room! It was fun and we could not have done it without some assistance. I would return in a heart beat! Fingers crossed that the US gets one of these soon!!

Fantastic fun. A must do for Londoners. I can understand why some people are saying this shouldn't be the number 1 attraction in London. They're right, it's not the Tower of London, Hyde Park or the V&A but it is a huge amount of fun and something that those of us who have 'been there' and 'done that' will enjoy immensely. A brilliant way to spend an hour with friends. Big thumbs up from us
Unleash your Inner Detective!. An hour of pure excitement! We had so much fun. Mind-blowing clues and pizzles.Non-stop action. Great entertainment value!

An amazing hour. We had great fun, and the time flies so fast.You get so much "in to" the game, it is amazing.And yes, we did get out with 10 seconds to spare :-)The game requires only basic English knowledge, so if your mother-tongue is not English, do not worry.
Perfect.. We were a group of 4 friends and we loved it.It was a lot of fun and we think we should try the other room as well.In 2 words:Do it.

Hint Hunt was brilliant. My friends and I did the John Monroe room. It was so much fun. Trying to figure the puzzles was so exciting. At first you don't really know what to expect. The reception room is a tiny little room (a bit like a cab office) but this only adds to the mystery of what lays ahead. My friends and I are going to book the Zen room but, we were wondering what happens after that. As there are only two rooms, there will be nothing else to conquer. I am hoping that the organisers of Hint Hunt keep it fresh and new by adding new rooms or changing the current rooms so that we can go back again. :)
Believe the hype!. Brilliant fun - just the right level of challenge and we enjoyed every minute as they ticked away! Highly recommended, a fantastically original and entertaining experience.

Fun & challenging!. My husband and I took my parents here, and we all really enjoyed it. If you like puzzles, and are good at lateral thinking & problem solving, you will love this. Basically you have to gather as much information as you can from the different objects in a room (turning everything upside down) and are drip fed queues to help you to solve a number of interconnected puzzles which eventually lead you being freed from the room. My group finished with a couple of minutes to spare. The story was okay - although would have been improved by having more of an ending, for example, enabling the customer to solve the crime story, in addition to finding the exit to the room. I also thought the customer amenities could be improved a bit. There was only one toilet, and eight people there when we arrived- so all eight of us ended up taking in turns. Also there was no shop or water or anything - it was all very small and basic. We hailed a taxi here from about a mile away but the driver had never heard of the attraction. It's not well known in London - yet somehow it still always seems to be booked up. Make sure you book well in advance, especially for a weekend visit.

Lots of fun! Good for locals rather than tourists though.. By no means would I classify this as the no1 thing to do if you are a tourist in London. I think this is more something for the locals to check out or maybe a fun event if you've been to London many times and are looking for something totally different and non-touristy.For Londoners who love a murder mystery this is a great thing to do. Get a group of friends together and have a crack, get a few groups together and play in separate rooms at the same time and then go to the pub to compare notes afterwards (as we did), or use it as a team building work exercise.I thought it was really well organised, was different to anything else I'd ever done and I'd definitely recommend it to my friends.

Similar to a live cluedo-brilliant!. Went here for my 22nd birthday with 4 others and had a fantastic time! The puzzles are quite difficult and definitely keep you on your toes. Will most certainly go back and try 'the zen room' as again that is slightly more tricky. 100% worth it!

Even more fun than we thought it would be. We thought it would be good, but it was even better than we'd imagined. For a maximum of five people at a time, you are locked in a room and have to find clues, solve puzzles and eventually solve the mystery to get out again. It's an hour long, and it goes by so fast! It's definitely worth the money and I can't wait to do the second room.

Fun way to spend an hour, but.... We enjoyed HintHunt and found it a good way to waste an hour on a rainy day, but I can't say I'd like to do it again. We escaped with seconds to spare, found it well organised and our guide was fantastic, however it just wasn't for me. I can think of several other things to see/do in London that would top my list of must's, but HintHunt isn't one of them.

Awesome. Made it out with 57secs to spare - stressful! Had an excellent time - I really can't recommend it enough. Fastest hour of my life. My only concern is that there aren't more. Will be doing the other room soon but I need to do this again and again!

Amazing fun. Don't want to spoil to the secret but suffice to say you'll love it. Would be great for friends, acquaintances, work groups, families any group really. You don't have to be good at quizzes or trivia just be inquisitive.
Very unique experience. Hint Hunt was a lot of fun. We didn't solve the puzzles in time to escape, but we had a blast doing it!

Best attraction in London!!!. This attraction is not one of the cheapest for sure but its definately worth the price! I won't tell you much not to destroy the fun but you get locked in a room and have to solve some puzzles and find some hidden objects in order to get out. There is a lot of fun, brainstorming and you'll definately enjoy it. Me and my friends will come back for the Zen room for sure!!

A must!. This is the best game ever! I was in London for a week with my mum and 2 sisters and I'm really glad we booked to play this 1 hour game because it's totally worth it. We had fun and I'm not going to say what it's about because I'll spoil your fun but if you love to be a private investigator for an hour, it's the right game for you :)

Both my grandson and I loved it.. I was looking for interesting - and fun - things to do with my 16 year old grandson. Several members of our family were or are in law enforcement, so I thought it would be something we could do and report back to everyone how well we did. Basically, we were a group of two, which is really too small - far better would have been three or four, but they explained it was possible to get a lot out of the game - even if you don't solve the crime. They will increase the clues to accommodate the lack of players and I can say we still talk about our experiences in the "locked room".I found out a lot about how my grandson thinks under pressure and I was impressed. This is a team effort and the time absolutely whizzed by.

Great exercise for the old grey matter!. Booked this as a birthday pressie for a friend. It's a unique fun and challenging way to spend an hour whilst in London. The time really does fly by! They recommend a minimum of 3 players, we played as a pair, which was challenging but still a great game and very enjoyable. Hope hinthunt comes to the north soon!

The best "work out" in London. I took my partner and mum and her husband , we all loved it , it's the best one hour activity I've ever done , I'd recomend anyone that wants to take family or friends to something that's different , my mum loves gaming so this was just up her street

For those who like puzzles. This really is something different to go and do for an hour. Gives your brain a good workout but also fun. We really enjoying solving the puzzles to escape Dr Monroes office. We will be going back to try the Zen room.

LOVED IT!. We decided to try this out because it was #1 on here and had so many great reviews. We weren't sure what to expect but now we understand why everyone loves it! Seriously! I promise you will love it! :-)

Great work related team bonding. Was here with a group of about 12 and so we were in 3 different rooms; wasn't sure what to expect but had such a great time and my colleagues agreed. What a great way to spend 1 hour on a group bonding type of activity. I will recommend to others.

Excellent. I booked as a group of 4 for the ZEN room and then the John Munroe room. Both were very well set up and my group had an amazing time...mentally stimulating while being very fun. Will be coming back when they add more rooms
Amazing. Loved the whole show. Brought me back to my teenage years. Cast or band as these were, excellent. Their rapport with the audience was brilliant.

A fun afternoon. I'm quite a fan of all the mistery/finding objects games in electronic devices. This seemed like the same but in real life! I really enjoyed it and it is definitely something fun to do on a grey/rainy day with friends or colleagues.Just one small comment would be for when we arrived there. The girls (although very nice and friendly) went from one speech to another to say exactly the same things over and over... Apart from that, all the experience was great and FUN!

Such a great evening!. One of the best things I've done in London recently and got to share it with my friends from Germany. I had absolutely no idea what to expect from 'John Monroe's Office' as my colleague told me to just go and not try to find out anything else, so I was completely surprised (positively!!!) Got out with just under two minutes to go which gave us an adrenaline rush towards the end! The staff was brilliant and I would recommend this to absolutely everyone!! Definitely going back for the 'advanced' one!

Awesome Adventure. We had never heard of HintHunt but decided to go based on its #1 rating on Trip Advisor. It truly deserves its rating as it is a really unique and fun experience. Our group was made up of two adults and two kids ages 10 & 16 and we all had an amazing time. I would highly recommend HintHunt.
Fastest hour ever !. Great fun, highly recommended. Our family foursome was aged from 60 to 30 and we all thoroughly enjoyed the hour thanks to our amazing "guide/mentor".

Awesome!!!!. One of the best days out in London we have had in a very long time! Just what this tired city is in need of. We talked about it for hours afterwards. Hopefully this will be expanding further with more exciting games to play very soon!! We will, without a doubt, be back for more! LOVED it!!

Such fun!. One of the best evenings I've had in a long time. We were all very excited at the prospect of being locked in a room and having to search for clues to let us out with a timer looming over us counting down from 1 hour. The scene is set incredibly well with a great, thrilling and panic inducing underscore that gradually, subconsciously intensifies the experience. The clues are hard enough for you to work your ares (and brain) off but not so hard that it's impossible. The staff are incredibly nice and are clearly proud of their company and were just as excited as we were, their energy was great. Even when we got out (with 93 seconds to spare!!!) and were bursting with excitement, our games master, with big dreamy eyes, dark hair and sexy stubble, was just as thrilled that we got out in time! They go through the whole experience with you in a Big Brother way so are as immersed in your game as you. I couldn't recommend this more highly!!

Excellent adventure while in London!. My 2 adult children, my spouse, and I attempted HintHunt today. It was a fabulous adventure that required us to use the gray matter between our ears! We finished, but not without some guidance. This was tough, yet fun and a wonderful experience for all. I would highly recommend this if you have a bit of time to spare while visiting London.

Brilliant!. I booked this for 4 people as a little works outing, a bit of a team building day.It was brilliant from start to finish! The staff are wonderful and very funny and the set up is brilliant.If you are thinking of booking this as bit of fun don't even hesitate. We did solve the mystery but I think we went over by about 3 mins...BOO!!Its much harder than I thought it was going to be, but in a really good way. It really does get the old brain cells active.Anyway...book and enjoy!

A fun packed 60 minutes!. This was such a fun experience. It only takes an hour but is a full-on, brainteasing challenge! Loved it and thoroughly recommended. Cannot wait to return and try the other room.

Great place and new experiance. loved it well worth the money and good time with family recommended to every one you will try somthing new and its a very challanging game best time i had in london thank you hinthunt will try the new room in my next visit

Best family outing in London. We travelled from Australia with 10 and 7 year old boys. Knowing a few days of sightseeing would ave dulled their enthusiasm we per booked Hint Hunt , kids have not stopped talking about this. Best family activity we ave done in years . So wish there was Hint Hunt in Australia. We all had 60 minutes of very exciting fun. Totally recommend and book well in advance. Probably better to book afternoon as we booked middle of the au which did limit our tour of London tower which really needs 2 to 3 hours and does not open till 9.30

Had a great time at our Hint Hunt experience. My wife, my 22 year old daughter and I decided to try Hint Hunt during our vacation in London and WE LOVED IT! So much fun. Challenging, unique, gets your pulse pounding. I would recommend it to anyone.

This was AWESOME!. Hello World. If you're in London, you need to make time for this activity. Really! Not only is it unique, it is one hour filled with fun and excitement! Although it was for 60 minutes, the time flew by.. I won't give away any details of what went on inside the room.. but bring your thinking hat and make sure your team works well together! Our Gamemaster told us we were the loudest group she had ever heard/seen. =P Needless to say we were an excited bunch! :) Loved it, will be coming back for the second game!
One of the best things ive done, was so fun!. Was a suprise activity planned by a friend and highly recommend it as it really was the most fun hour!
Incredible!. This was fantastic! My husband was a bit unsure about this however he and my 2 teenage children aged 14 and 15 absolutely loved it. Don't hesitate to book, it is well worth it!
Great!. We split our group of 8 into 2 sessions. The game moves quickly and the staff provide hints on a computer monitor when the group hits a sticking point.

So Much Fun!. We had so much fun and would HIGHLY recommend HintHunt. The time committment does not take away from other activities since the total time is just a little over an hour. Our group included a 20 yr old, two 26 yr olds and two in our 50s - glad we had 5 as we really needed all the brainpower we could get! Perfect for pre-teens through grandparents -- but be prepared for a high-paced, action-packed hour.
Different and such fun!. Had a great time at Hint Hunt. Our teenage boys loved it too and we escaped with 3 seconds to spare. Thank you for a fabulous time. We'll be back!

Fab game and excellent way to spend a couple of hours. Awesome game, can't say too much without giving away secrets but I can highly recommend and will be visiting again to try the Zen room soon.... Completed it with minutes to spare to certainly a fun challenge. The "Gamesmasters" are excellent.

don't miss it!. I went to HintHunt in August with three friends. It's been one of the most amusing and exciting experiences ever! The game is extremely involving and we had a lot of fun. We can all speak English very well, so we didn't have any problems with the language but I wouldn't advise it to someone who doesn't understand English very well. If you happen to go to London and you want to enjoy yourself for an hour, HintHunt is the place to go! We'll definitely try another room if we go to London together again!
Brilliant fun. Great for a family with pre teens. We will return and do the other room! Would recommend to family groups.

Good fun. Loved it - there should be more all over the country!! Visited with 18 yr old daughter and husband, we were not sure what we had let ourselves in for but really enjoyed it, we didn't manage to solve it, but were sooooo close.

So much fun!. My family and I did this on our 2 week trip to London. We were in the detectives office. I wasn't really sure what to expect, but when we arrived it was thoroughly explained. Once in the room the hour seemed to fly by and we finished with a mere 17 sec. on the clock. It was a whirlwind of confusion, anxiety, but mostly fun. Would definitely go back and recommend!

A highlight of our London trip. My husband and I did an hour in the Zen room two weeks ago on our vacation in London. It was just the two of us (first time to HintHunt), and we took the last booking available, which was the most difficult room, the Zen room. More than two are ideal (especially tackling the more challenging room), but if I had to do it again, under the same circumstances, I would. We had a blast! A very unique experience. A little tip - book this when you're at your sharpest mentally - you need to be "on" - this is a great brain workout. Again, we had no choices with booking times, and we did it at the end of a busy day touring London - so we were a wee bit sluggish and weary.

the fastest hour of my life!. Did hinthunt last week with 3 friends (2 guys, 2 girls) and it was great fun! We did Dr. Monroe's office and got out with about 5 mins to spare but there were moments we thought we wouldn't be able to do it. I think 4 people is the perfect number for a team as any more and it would've been too crowded in the room. We were a group of professionals between 28-30 but it was still challenging. Felt as if I got to live out my crystal maze fantasy! This tests your skill, attention to detail and analytical ability. Would definetely recommend it to anyone looking for something fun and different to do. Looking forward to my next trip to london to try out the Zen room (supposed to be more difficult than Monroe's office).

Amazing night enjoyed by all!. We booked as a group of nine - five girls, four boys. We booked two of the john monroe rooms and split into girls and boys teams. Every single one of us came out saying it was the most fun we have had in ages! Its amazing how much everyone gets into it and as the time counts down and the music gets more tense stress levels were high. Both groups got out -such a sense of achievement! Would highly recommend to anyone- we will chat about this for a long time to come - comparing everything we could have done differently & laughing at the things we did do! The staff were brilliant giggling with us afterwards at how we had reacted!

Great choice for hangout!. it is such a lovely experience! fun for family, group of friends, couple - everyone! it is also good for visitors in London ( like me ), u just need to know English good enough to read a small text and thats it! have fun and keep it a secret :)

Top family entertainment: Fun for all!. Wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this but everyone seemed to enjoy it and the hour flew by. Great teamwork game for the family which everyone talked about for the rest of the day.

Our group loved this too! Can we get a franchise and open one in Washington DC?. Our group consisted of 2 families. We broke up into 2 groups-one of adults and one of teenagers. We all had a wonderful time. It was all that we hoped for when we read the reviews. I don't want to say to much to ruin the surprise for you, but I do believe that they can tailor this for different age groups. Both of our groups were very competitive, and the kids ended up winning much to the parents dismay! We all loved it!!! This is a must see when you are in London. Don't be put off by the outside or the neighborhood. We did have a drink first at a nearby neighborhood pub.Also, make sure that you make reservations early. We booked ours one month in advance. Many of the spots were filling up early.

Great idea and done very well. Ive now done both rooms and it is awesome to see how it has changed since I went to the first room just after opening. I am glad to see the service is still very friendly and efficient and the second room is just as fun as the first. All my friends enjoyed it just as much as I did and look forward to going back to the room they didnt do the first time around.Quite expensive, but when you consider the full time role required to run the room you can see why, with 4 people it isnt too bad and I think it is worth it.Do it!

One of the best things I have done in London and I live there. Absolutely loved this! We did the first room and then the more advance room and loved both! It was a great team building activity. We did it with friends but it would be a great office party idea as it makes you work together to solve one big puzzle by finding lots of different clues. Its like the adult version of cyrstal maze! Brilliant!

Good family fun. We booked this for our family, with 2 children aged 12 & 13. Something very different to do as a family, but so much fun. The hour went by so quickly! We would love to do it again when next in london, and we hope the idea will catch on in the USA.

Such a fun focused and crazy hour!. If you haven't been to hint hunt yet, go! It's such a fun adrelanie filled hour and the more clues you solve the more the excitement builds! Great team working game which you can't stop talking about afterwards!

Great fun for families with teens. We had our first experience of HintHunt when spending a few days in London in August 2013. Our "kids" are now 21 and 17 so we were looking for activities that all of us could enjoy doing together. We had to book a session well in advance so you need to be organised! Was interesting and challenging for all, plenty of laughs but also brought out our competitive side as we were told that only 50% teams complete the challenge within the 1 hour allocated (you do get additional clues and assistance if it looks like you are struggling so I'm not sure if it is true that only half of people succeed) - there is a big countdown clock in the room and you will not believe how quickly 60 minutes can pass!Thoroughly recommend for groups of friends or families with older kids. We would certainly plan to include another visit for the follow up scenario when we next visit London.

Great fun and would recommend it. The best thing about HintHunt is that those that have done it haven't spoiled it for those that haven't been yet! Having read the reviews I booked for myself, hubby, 22 year old and 19 year old. Was a fun hour and good to look back on the different strengths each of us had. We worked well as a team and managed to get out with 59 seconds to spare! If you fancy something that's different I would recommend this - there's nothing else like it in London!

Fun for gamers and amateur sleuths. Although pricey for a hour of entertainment, the staff is fun and welcoming, the game challenging and it's a short and easy walk from London Euston station. We were 2 adults and 1 teen and all 3 of us really enjoyed ourselves. We most likely would have gotten further along with another player.Tips: 1) reconsider coming right off a red eye-- lack of sleep might make the puzzling harder, and could make the player interactions more stressful. We went rested and were happy we did. 2) although you need to work together to solve the puzzle, everyone can focus on different areas.
Don't hesitate to book. Did this with 3 friends. We all loved it. What a brilliant way to spend an hour. Book it, you won't regret it.

Brought out my competitive side. We went as a group that was too big for one room, so we were split into two and as there were less of us, our group went into the "easier" room. It was actually hilarious to watch our group turn from normal 20 somethings, into detectives as soon as the door locked us in. We had to solve clues to escape the room within an hour. Constantly found things we didn't see before and were always surprised.I loved it and we escaped with 5 minutes to spare. Awesome!

Fastest Hour of my life!. We had team of 4: myself, my husband, our 12 year old son and my 72 year old mum. It was a great experience and we were successful with 21 seconds to spare! Our son made it all possible to solve each puzzle as he climbed every inch of the room. DO this with your family, your friends or your coworkers!

What a great surprise...make more rooms please!. We absolutely loved this. Amazing, incredible and so much fun!! I can't say much because I would give it away but this is worth every penny... please now build more rooms so we can continue to enjoy it!

Great fun.. I went here to kick off my birthday last year.I had a whale of a time, with enough puzzles to keep my team sweating till the very end.The key is to double check everything and most importantly to communicate well.

What a way to spend an hour!. Found Hint Hunt on Trip Advisor and ordered a slot online. When we got there, Alex and Alice gave us an introduction, locked us in the room and the fun began. As the minutes ticked down it got more and more intense, and we unlocked the door with 26 seconds to spare! Great fun for the entire family

Great family fun away from typical London stuff. This caught our eye on Trip Advisor and didn't disappoint. Out two daughters (11 & 13) loved it. It was a great break for them from the historic tours, museums etc. It was very challenging and required teamwork. Lots of fun!

Unique, refreshing, really enjoyable attraction. I came across HintHunt while searching through TripAdvisor for reviews on Buckingham Palace. Am I glad i chose to go to HIntHunt instead. What an amazing way to spend an hour in London. Very close to Waterloo station, with a nice pub next door for a little pre-drink before going in (just did not know what to expect!)We were a family of 4 (with 2 children 10 and 8). Our host talked us through what would happen. Little tip here - if you do have children, staff ask a number of times if you need the toilet before you go in, if you have children TAKE THEM IN even if they say they don't want to go. My son (8) needed to go after being in the room about 15 mins, i didn't think he would be allowed out of the room - host said later that he could have come out of the room to use the toilet!!The game surpassed all my expectations, we didn't solve it. My daughter (10) was brilliant and like the hosts said, great game to play with children as children will search in places that adults wouldn't look and they were right.The hour passes so quickly and the music builds at the end and you feel the panic set in.Book, book, book this - you will not regret it. We will defintely be booking again when we come back to London next year.

Very interesting. Teens really enjoyed. A very different experience that they are still talking about. Personally, I think I would be stuck in there forever if I hadn't been let out. For those "know it alls" who are up for a challenge, it is worth checking out.
Excellent fun! Def recommend. An excellent evening. We barely made it through in an hour! It goes so fast but very rewarding and have already booked to do the Zen room next time!

Lots of fun. If you're into puzzle solving in a very hands on way then this is the event for you. The operators were very friendly and very helpful when you become stuck on a clue. The best part is that you have to work fast and work together to get out. I went with my family of 5 and we still talk about it.

Loved it, loved it, loved it!. As a group of 4 work collegues/ friends we have now completed both John Monroe's office and the Zen Room. Both brilliant fun even though it really is hard to complete the challenge. The staff are very helpful and clear and give you useful 'hints' whenever you need them, which avoids frustration. If you are looking for something different and interesting to do this weekend you should book this today.

If you like puzzles or games, Hint Hunt is for you. We booked the Zen Room for our recent trip to London and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I don’t want to give anything away, but if you enjoy solving puzzles challenging games, this is a great activity for you. This would also be an excellent activity for any small teams that want a fun team building exercise. The staff are also very friendly and help to ensure it’s a great experience.

Excellent idea and game. We went to Hint Hunt yesterday, my husband, my 10 year old son and I. Couldn't recommend it enough, we had to work out who the murderer was with just a handful of clues and quite a few hints along the way! We had 15 mins left on the timer and panic struck that we wouldn't solve the case, we found ourselves being totally absorbed at this point and running round trying our hardest to solve the last of the clues!! I have never done anything like this before and we all found it brilliant fun, would defiantly recommend going here, we did it for something else to do before we watched a show.

Totally Absorbing!. Did this yesterday with husband and two 19 years old girls. Our host was extremely friendly and explained the basics to us before showing us to the room.We failed totally and didn't manage to get out in time, even though we were given quite a few clues along the way, but once our host explained to us what we had missed, it all seemed very obvious! The hour went extremely quickly.You really do need to look for clues EVERYWHERE, as they tend to be in places that you wouldn't even think of looking at.Definitely going to try the harder room now, as feel we have more of an idea of what the game is all about. It must have been a genius who invented it!Added bonus was that nearby parking was free along the road on Sunday after 5.30pm.

Amazing fun had by all. A group of 4 of us took on John Monroe's office one Friday night after work. We all thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would highly recommend it - a great and unique way to spend an hour. The challenge itself is tough but the staff are on hand to give you hints throughout to help you along. I doubt you would get far without them...The only thing to be aware of is that it is called "hinthunt" for a reason - they do give you tips to help you along, so I doubt many people fail to complete this.

What an experience!. My husband booked this and at first, two others with us were a little skeptical about it. I was in, but a little confused of what he meant by "like a maze." It wasn't like a maze, but the experience we got was phenomenal! It was fun, hands on experience of what we always wondered it would be like to "figure it out". Staff was friendly and I felt our instructor really cared for us to absorb the experience. We'd like to try the more advanced level next time! Availability is limited so book in advanced!!
Amazing!. What an amazing experience. A great way to spend 60 minutes with your family. There is much to hunt for sn and so many hints, you just have to piece it together. Highly recommend it.

AMAZEBALLS!. After reading many reviews raving about HH, I wanted to see what the fuss was about! Myself and two friends visited HH for the first time and we took on the Zen room. We weren't expecting much but WOW, oh wow.... it was the most intense, stressful, and entertaining hour we have ever experienced. Little did we know that it was going to be so so much fun. Our host was really lovely. She gave us a very warm welcoming and took great care of us! She gave us hints whenever it was necessary, but boy, she made us work really hard! We really had a great time. We do apologise for turning the room upside down. We felt really bad for making such a mess :P5* experience!! Thank you to the staff for the great day! It was the highlight of our outing :) We will definitely be back with a bigger group!!

Interesting & different. It's very refreshing when somebody comes up with a novel idea and does something different so, well done - you deserve to succeed.We visited as family of 4 (daughters aged 18 and 20) and had a enjoyable hour.However, it's not top of the tripadvisor reviews because it's the best thing in London, it's just something with fairly wide appeal and run by nice people so, a pleasant way of spending an hour.Go with an open mind and you'll enjoy it.Personally, we felt a little more guidance in advance would have been helpful as this would have meant fewer hints were needed during the game. We escaped with 15 seconds to spare but only because, by that stage, the hints had to be so blatant we were pretty much being given the answers. It is a novel experience so we're happy to recommend it but, if your time in London is short don't do it at the expense of some of the "proper" London attractions.It wouldn't be suitable for very young children, people in wheelchairs, or people who don't speak any English.

Best Experience. Me, my wife and my 3 sons visited HintHunt. At first, we didn't know anything about it. We never experinced like this "one hour game" before. So many hidden things to find, so many puzzles to solve. We worked hard as a team. Finally we could finished the puzzle just 27 seconds remaining. It was a very exciting experience. Highly recommended.

Hinthunt. Arrived as a birthday surprise, so had no idea! At first I thought what is this little poky little office! Walked in to be greeted by a lovely smiling man who asked us to take a seat! He explained a little about the game , I was still confused at this point, brief was ok , might have been good to have something to read through as a more visual person! As I wasn't sure that you could really move things around! However when I got in and saw the room , my brain started ticking over, we started to get hints and really got into the game , it was well thought out and I couldn't believe how quick the time went ! I broke the torch at one point and he put one in the room ! So funny! There's a good story and very imaginative clues and objects to discover , really gets you thinking would make a great team building or just fun hour ! An amazing birthday present " the staff are so attentive and friendly " an overall amazing experience " I came out smiling and wanting to do it again" if you don't go you'll miss out .

Great fun. We did this yesterday, such fun, would really recommend this to anyone who likes to solve clues/puzzles to get out if a room!Our host for the hour was so nice and friendly and gave us a very warm welcome . We will be back for more !
Brilliant fun. Did this with my wife and three friends. Brilliant fun, challenging with just the right amount of tips to help. Highly recommended.

A new experience. Organised a work event for 20 people. This meant we had to book 4 rooms. The event was a great success . Everyone came out raving about how much fun they had. The groups could compete against each other through how quickly they got out. The best thing about Hint Hunt is that it is something different to do & was a new experience. A few of us are already planing to go back & do the harder room. The only downside were the rooms were very hot, but the fun outweighed this. But investing in air con would not go amiss. If you want to make an evening of it, I would recommend booking tables at the Fullers pub - Parcel Yard at Kings Cross? It in 10 mins walk & is a good base if you have multiple groups.
Worth your time. We went on a family trip to London and don't regret having done this. We enjoyed it thouroughly and will be going back again. Definitely worth spending time here.

Mind blowing!. Bought this experience as a birthday present with a difference for my partner. So, the two of us arrived and were greeted by the very polite owner. He gave us the brief, which is basically solve the puzzles to find the keys and codes to open the locks which will eventually get you out of the locked room. All to be completed within 60 minutes Sounds easy hmmmm? But oh no! We watched the clock counting down as we ransacked the room for clues........thank goodness that our lovely host (who was sat outside the room watching us on his monitor run round around like headless chickens) gave us hints to help us on our way otherwise we would have been there for hours! Needless to say we didn't solve the puzzles in time, but we were so close and had so much fun in the process. Obviously the more people in the group, the more brains there are to solve the puzzles. Saying that, we would highly recommend this experience to anyone looking for something a little different. We will be talking about this for days to come yet, and will definitely try and squeeze this in again the next time we visit London. Absolutely brilliant!
We didn't get out!. This is a fun way to spend an hour in London! It is very challenging & you have to think outside the square! Good luck getting out!

The Zen room is very hard for newbies.. We had no idea what to expect, and the Zen room (the only one we could get a reservation for) was probably a bit ambitious as the first try at HintHunt. So while we didn't set any records for puzzle-solving, our family still had a great time. Next time we'd try to get a murder mystery.

Fantastic. Went in not knowing what to expect. Was the best fun I have had and have not experienced this elsewhere. We were greated by a friendly young lady who took us down to the advanced room and told us the rules. Lots of twists and it makes you think. Got out with 30 seconds to spare. Would highly recommend this to anyone!
Fanatastic fun. Me, my wife and 15 year old son all enjoyed it immensely. IT seemed much, much loner than an hour. Highly recommended.

Loved it!. My two daughters (13 & 14) and I had absolutely no idea what to expect as I booked online on the strength of other Trip Advisor reviews and the fact that this has made it to the no.1 slot! If you like Cluedo, Crystal Maze and investigative type games then this is for you. My youngest daughter in particular absolutely loved it and was buzzing afterwards and has since been trying to find x-box games that are similar! Really really fun. Think it would work brilliantly as a work team building exercise. We were in John Monroe's Office 3. We were a little slow (I could have done with another adult on the team really!) and had an awful lot of hints and were some way away from getting out of the room, or should I say rooms, as there are 2 other doors to unlock which I didn't expect. Lots of combinations to find for padlocks and safes that when unlocked reveal other clues. Brilliant concept - well done whoever thought of it. Thoroughly recommend it. The only downer - the price! Cost me £63 plus 20% VAT - £75.60! Quite expensive for an hour's entertainment but if 5 of you are splitting the cost then it's most definitely well worth it.

Best activity . After a week of historic london with our 11 year old son, this was just the most fun activity to finish our family trip. We were engaged the whole time. It was exciting, fun and challenging. Highly recomended!!!

Wasnt sure what to expect, but REALLY Good!. Was given this for our teenage boys as a gift, and we went as a family and a friend. Having had no clue what to expect, just sort of vague guess at Crystal maze concept, Parry, our lovely host gave us clear, yet intriguing advice, we just had no idea how we would use it! The hour goes really quickly, and having no concept of how it was going to progress, we went through a multiptude of emotions and stages throughout the hour. Both boys want to come back for their birthdays, and I could not recoommend it highly enough! Match that with the fact that you can park outside after 7pm, what more could you ask for in Central London? Only probelm is that currently they only have 2 different rooms to experience, so would welcome more rooms to try in the future!

Brilliant. Really really special occation. Highly recommended by my younger brother and they bought me complimentary tickets well in advance as a birthday treat as I have been trying to get for some time before with no success. Well worth a visit and i do not regret not going. well worth a visit if you have free time to go.

A Highlight of a Family Trip to London. It was a great experience for us to work as a family (2 adults, one 13-year old son). Helpful hints from Laslo came at the right moment when we seemed to steer off course. Although the room was small, there was a fan to help circulate the air. This exercise showed us how we all could work together as a family for a common cause (get out of the room). We made it out with 8 seconds to spare.

Raises the heart rate..... Being locked in a room with your fellow 'team mates' my husband and three kids 13, 15 17 for 1 hour with lots to accomplish and some music adding atmosphere can be quite a stressful time, but surprisingly we all kept our cool and found our role to play in solving the clues. You certainly need the 'Hints' during your 'Hunt' don't even think you can get through without them, but it was such a great hour. One of the highlights of our trip to Europe this summer.

So much fun!. We had a great time, the game was amazing. It was 4 of us - 2 adults and eleven year old twin boys, and the hour flew by! The hosts were so nice and room was interesting and the game fascinating! I would highly recommend this for families and groups of friends. If we are in London again we would absolutely do this again! Thanks for making our game so fun!

Amazing...Loved it!!!. Went here as part of my husband's 30th Birthday celebrations as a group of 4. We all loved it!!! Will definitely return to do the Zen room next time we are in London.It was very easy to find, right by Euston Station. We were there just over an hour, the task / puzzle takes 1 hour but there was a short instructional brief at the beginning.Conversation kept returning to this for the rest of the night we enjoyed it so much.

Great fun. Get more friends to come with you in a team. we did it in 3 and want to come back with a bigger group to do a different game. I was sceptical at the beginning thinking it would be more for children (we are in our late 20s) but was totally wrong, its really good fun!

One of the best things I have done in London!. I booked tickets for Hint Hunt after reading a review in Time Out magazine and took my brother & parents along as a surprise family activity. We weren't quite sure what to expect, but it was so much more fun than I could have imagined!! You need to think outside the box and work together as a team to work out all the clues in the 60 minute deadline, but the HintHunter team help you out whenever you get stuck so you don't waste any time. The adrenaline building up in those last few frantic minutes meant we were ecstatic when we managed to escape with 1min 53 seconds left on the clock! A great sense of achievement, and thoroughly enjoyed by all the family. I have recommended to all of my friends and can't wait to go back to do the advanced room.... Caroline (25yrs)

An hour of unique entertainment and fun!. This is quite a unique experience. Ideal for people that love to solve puzzles and mysteries. Quite challenging though with 2 people. 4 would be better.. Hopefully they will set up other rooms/mysteries so that we can come back!

Great afternoon of fun!!!. We did this as an afternoon team building event. I wont say much as it will spoil the suprise of it all, but def wasnt the just being locked in a room as I thought. Was amazing fun, would recommend. Please build some more rooms so I can come back :)

Great Fun and Something a bit Different. Four of us took on the John Monroe room for a birthday treat and it was certainly an hour well spent. You have to get your thinking caps on. Some of the tasks were quite tricky and the 4 of us are reasonably well educated! Thankfully the hints provided on screen keep you guided on the right track. Only negative I would say is that there's maybe too many red herrings / things that weren't relevantI would recommend HH to anyone but I think it would be particularly good for small team building exercises. It's in a bit of an odd location in Euston but is only a few minutes walk from the train and tube.Looking forward to a future visit to the Zen room. This one is meant to be harder so I'm not holding out much hope for success with this one!

Fun, but clearly NOT worth the hype. If you find yourself in London and have seen all the major sites and have 3-4 hours free, then this is a fun experience. Do not however, by any means, go out of your way to do Hint Hunt at the expense of doing anything else in London. This is the only time that I was thrown by Tripadvisor reviews on anything. The game itself is indeed fun and challenging, but the facilities are a bit run-down. I'm glad we tried it out, but there is NO way HintHunt should be the #1 attraction in a city like London. I don't know how it got that rating.

Fantastic puzzle solving!. Have been twice with friends and it's a great experience. It's worth doing with at least 4 people to manage the clues as it can be quite tricky. Highly recommended for a fun, stimulating activity with friends, partners or family... it's ideal for everyone.

Great Experience!. We're a family with 2 teenagers and a 9 year old. We all thoroughly enjoyed the experience and it helped develop our teamwork skills! Even the 9 year old was able to make a useful contribution.. Definitely a highlight of our trip to London and so 'different' !!! Would love to return to do the other HintHunt challenge as well.

Superb idea and great fun. This was absolutely fantastic, family of four with a nine year old and a thirteen year old.Everybody contributed in their own way and somehow after a slow start we managed to escape with 12 seconds left on the clock. Whoever came up with this concept ought to become millionaires !You have to book a timeslot months in advance it is so popular. We will be back to do the other challenge.

there is a reason this is #1 in London for families and groups. We are a family two adults, two girls, aged 14 and 12. There is a mystery to it, so I can't say much without ruining it. It is a quick hour, fun to do as a group, real true puzzle solving, some pretty tough. It is so well run, and make sure you make a reservation in advance. The only bad news is you can only do it once, although now they have a new advanced room, I can only imagine that it must be pretty tough. My girls thought is was the best thing we did in our stay in London.Everyone in the family contributed, in fact, my 12 year old figured something out that I never would have thought of. It is challenging, but fair. Also, keep in mind if you are American, there are a couple of things that make more sense to a local (i.e. the metric system).

"A great family experience". We were a group of 5 traveling with 2 teenagers. The whole family enjoyed the experience. I strongly recommend this activity. However, that day in London was too hot and the place is in need of a/c for those days. Nonetheless, we really enjoyed the experience.

A Great 59 minutes and 45 seconds. A throughily enjoyable hour for all 5 members of a family (M&D & 3 boys aged 14, 11 & 7). Highly recommended. ~Simple concept, a little tricky in places to follow what was expected but the guided hints often helped. ~We were very well looked after, ~A prize/piece of merchandise would have been nice on successful completion.~A family rate would be appropriate as it was expensive for us all.

Great fun!. Thanks to Tripadvisor, we found HintHunt, being the number 1 thing to do in London. Having no preconceive ideas, we thought that we would be in for a treat - we were not wrong!!Originally four friends, with two unable to make it, I managed to find Julia and Jessie on Facebook, who joined us for the fun and who didn't mind just joining in with us. Without them, we would very likely to have been stumped! They were great and we had a very 'quick' hour enjoying Hint Hunt and even managed to escape with just a couple of seconds to spare.Would thoroughly recommend and would definitely do it again.

Adrenaline filled hour!. Didn't know what to expect at all, and the fact that it is in this quite unattractive building made the anticipation even worse. It is such a simple concept but it completely works. Really good fun and the hour goes by in a heartbeat. If i had to be picky i would say the rooms need a little bit of tlc as they are getting a bit rough around the edges, also i would say the staff that work there could be a bit more coherent when briefing. But really none of this takes away from the experience - which is not cheap but worth it. Tip: don't just turn up - wait lists are long and need to be booked ahead.

What An Hour!. What an hour! So much fun! I arrived and my friends were running a bit late. I waited opposite as the place had an air of "snuff movie" about it. Friends arrived and we were greeted by the friendly GamesMasters. They explained everything they needed to keeping things routinely cryptic. Even going to the toilet felt a bit Cluedo....yes I searched for clues whilst in there. We went into the room and from then on it was like reliving all those Crystal Maze/Knightmare episodes from childhood! Really good fun having to work everything out...I will say no more about the inside bit. My friends and I made it out with 2 seconds to spare...On walking out we all felt like we had brought about world peace...really good fun and I will recommend it over and over again. Once you are finished I would recommend heading down to Gilbert's Gin Garden just next to St.Pancras and going over how amazing you are, (if you managed to get out), or hang your heads and plan your next trip to conquer it! The bar rustle up their own infused tonic waters and the place is beautifully grand...think modern day Hogwarts! All in all DO IT! Nowadays so few things are so ingeniously simple.
great fun. Great fun. Well organised. Hard puzzles. Great group event. Went on a work team building exercise - good for bringing a team together.

Very unique. Decided to visit as No.1 on tripadvisor and was intrigued to know what this attraction was all about. Had a route march from St. Pancras station with my family (2Ad & 3 Teenagers) as didn't want to be late and so all stroppy and tired and hot when we arrived!! Very seedy looking place and no proper reception area, all foreign staff and thought what have I let us all in for? Had a lovely introduction and talk from friendly lady who then remained are hint guide for the next hour. Without giving too much away about the game, we all had a most fabulous time in the Zen room, managed to work and have fun together for the next hour, unfortunately we failed to escape but were very close which was quite frustrating. Well worth the money because of it's unique nature. Would recommend to anyone who's up for a challenge.

Really good, believe the hype. Went with the family on a real hot August day, the room was nicely air-conditioned so do not worry about that. Nice friendly people, a very engaging and demanding game that we just about did on time - 49 seconds left on the clock - resulted in a family experience that even my teenage kids could not complain about. The concept and execution are pretty faultless in my view. Ideal for families, small groups of friends and corporate team building exercises. The time flies away very quickly and the game is so preoccupying that we didn't have time for the family argument that I was anticipating.

Come with no preconceptions, you will love this!. Attended with 3 mates all in our late 30s and found the experience fantastic. I particularly liked how it didn't feel like a corporate money making machine and we were welcomed and looked after by a dedicated member of staff the whole way through.We escaped the room with very little time to spare and when you sit in the pub afterwards analysing the game there is so much to talk about and to marvel at how the game has been constructed.I've just booked a return to the Zen room for a follow up. Can't wait to play again :)My only advice would be don't drink 3 pints beforehand as we did - there is no toilet when you are locked in the room and it doesn't help your mental agility!

Great Experience. HintHunt was great! I was travelling with my wife of twenty-five years and my two college-age kids and it was always a struggle trying to figure out things to do that all of us could enjoy. This was one of those things. If you like puzzles and analyzing clues, you have to do this. I know it's only an hour, but it's the fastest hour you'll ever experience.

If you like escape the room apps you will LOVE this!!!. I enjoy playing those escape the room apps on my phone - just like I loved classic games such as Monkey Island. This is a real life version!! I don't want to give anything away but I will say this.I was told by a friend that if you got out within the time limit you got your money back - so I told the others I was with the same thing.When we got out (and expected to get £24 back each) we weren't even a little bit disappointed not to get our money. In fact, we agreed that we would have paid anyway.I move away in 2 weeks but I really hope I get a chance to play the other room before I go.What a brilliant idea - and such a fun thing to do!

Fastest Hour ever. Not what we expected. It was so different from anything we'd ever done before. Fun and challenging. I don't want to give away too much information because that's a big part of the fun. Our hosts were very friendly and whoever came up with this concept is a genius.

Best way to spend an hour in London.. The less you know about this the better. But it's a work-out for your brain like no other. It's a great way to spend some time with friends and the staff are so enthusiastic that it's infectious! Couldn't recommend this enough to anyone.

Great fun for a family with teens!. Our family of 4 (two girls 11 & 14) had a great time. Saw the reviews on TA and booked it without really knowing what we would be doing. Turned out to be a fast paced, high pressure, exciting hour. We talked about it for hours afterward. Definitely worth the time and money! Wish they had one in Houston.

Such an entertaining 60 minutes. We were looking for attractions for our July trip to London and with HintHunt being the #1 rated attraction on Tripadvisor, we decided to give it a chance. We had a wonderful time and can now vouch that it is indeed a great passtime.It was easy to get to HintHunt by the tube, which is a great plus. Andrea at HintHunt took care of us right away and we were off to our adventure on time for our 12:15 p.m. reservation. The 60 minutes really fly by when you are having fun. What a well thought-out adventure. Our sons of 20 and 17 came along with us and they had the best time solving the challenge in the John Monroe room. It's not an easy to solve the case but it is definitely fun to do so. You will enjoy every bit of it.At the end of our session, Alex debriefed us and was as pleasant and welcoming as Andrea. Great staff.
