July 2013 escape. Family of 4 had a great time. You have 1 hour to escape from the locked room. The time flew by as one puzzle led to another and another .... Of course, there are many items in the room that are just red herrings. A staff member provides hints on a computer screen in the room to help when you seem stuck. This is where I think they excel. The pacing of the hints was done wonderfully and provided just the right amount of assistance at the right time to allow us to escape with just seconds to spare.After finishing, everyone was ready to go again -- in the other room.

great hour fun. This is a typical London game , come in have some hints and try to open locks and solve the mystery exit the room in less then 60m , very hard , practice your soduku .this is going to be the fastest hour in you indoor life.enjoy

HintHunt was fabulous!. By the time I went online to book this there were very limited options. If you want to do it - book early! I only had the choice of the "Zen" room which I later found out was more difficult than the other HintHunt challenges. Undaunted by the low success rate, our family worked together for an hour trying to solve the clues and make our way out of the room. We had so much fun. Each family members' strengths came through. It was a fun, bonding experience and made us truly work as a team. I have a 17 year old and a nine year old and they both loved it. Our nine year old was very helpful!! I highly recommend this. It was a little difficult to find the building so allow yourself plenty of time to get there. You don't want to be late - you only get an hour!!

Canadian Family of 10 Takes on Hint Hunt Experience. We can't say enough about our experience at Hint Hunt, London. We had two family teams of 5: the oldies, mature, experienced & worldly team against the young, nimble & quick team. Age ranges were from "19 - 59". Who was successful? Let's just say the oldies paid a very large pub tab that evening. We all agreed, it was a terrific bonding experience for our family and wish we had Hint Hunt in Canada. If you want to share a great experience with family, friends, co-workers, or teams, this is one we highly recommend.

Brilliant hours entertainment. A real treat.Turn sleuth for an hour with your friends and family. The key to success is an enquiring mind and good communication.Brilliant staff.Only a 5 minute walk from Euston Station.fantastic,

Surprising, different and very fun - great family activity. Don't let the shabby street and ordinary looking premises put you off - this is one of the most fun things I've ever done!!! If feels a bit pricey, but given the small scale and personal attention you get from the staff, we understand why it needs to cost what it does.We didn't know what to expect thanks to the air of mystery that previous visitors respectfully maintain.And I shall try to do the same. In short, we all loved it!We took our 18 year old daughter and her best friend, who are both Sherlock Holmes fans, and it's a perfect family activity as it helps to have a range of ages and thinking skills. Probably wouldn't recommend it for under 12s though as they may get frustrated because it is quite challenging (mentally, not physically).If you like cryptic crosswords, then you MUST try it. And that's all I'm going to say :-)
Hint Hunt is amazing. I think it is one of the greatest attractions I have ever been to. So much fun yet quite stressfull!Really nice people running it as well!Thumbs up!
Good fun. Enjoyed the game, everybody go involved, spend a lovely afternoon with friends, in fact we found it allot more captivating than originally thought.

Loved it, such great fun. This is a fantastic event, very different to anything else. When you get in the room it takes you a while to get going and start to understand what is required of you. Towards the end you need to stay calm and focussed otherwise you will just end up in a flap and get nowhere! We did manage to get out with just 20 seconds to spare - apparently one of the lucky 50% that make it out!!!When you look to doing this it may seem expensive, but it's worth every penny. Don't panic about how good you are with puzzles, nothing will prepare you for this anyway!

Fun packed hour. I was a little nervous before HintHunt, about not knowing what to expect and being locked in a room, but all of that goes out the window as soon as the timer starts. We didn't stop moving for the hour and any thirst/heat/tiredness/worry is all forgotten. On arrival we were sat in a small shabby reception area and given a brief introduction before being shown into the room. Then it was an hour of mayhem, searching high and low, trying to solve clues, getting utterly frustrated followed by the excitement of getting one step closer. The game host is watching from outside the whole time if you need anything (our pen ran out) and to give clues when you're completely stuck, unfortunately our clue screen seemed to stop working near the end and got stuck on one hint for about 20 minutes. I would definitely recommend this for groups of friends or families with older children.
Fab fab fab !!!!. We booked this as a Father's Day present. Beats any present you could buy in a shop. We went as a family and enjoyed every minute.

Great fun. This is really the best way to spend an hour with 2 teenagers. The time flew by and in fact none of us wanted it to end. Not going to give anything away as it would spoil the surprise but it was well worth the money. Going to do the "Zen" room next and can't wait to go.

Just great fun!. Fun, fun, fun, from beginning to end. If you like puzzels, this is the right place to go. The one hour you are locked in and trying to escape by solving the puzzele feels like just minutes. If you have tried Crimson Room or similar puzzles on the internet, you must try it live at HintHunt!

Kids loved it. Like everyone else, I read about Hint Hunt on Trip Advisor and was intrigued by the fabulous reviews. We were only in London for a few days and were traveling with three kids aged 16, 12 and 11. For the kids, Hint Hunt tied with the Tower of London as favorite things to do in London (and I had a private guide at the Tower!) All I will say about the hour is that we really didn't understand what in the world we were doing for the first few minutes but as the clues started to come together everyone became more animated as we tried to figure out the puzzles. We did not escape in time but the kids were ready to go back in and try again. In fact, they really wanted to go back another day and try the advanced room but we didn't have time. Book your time slot well in advance so that you don't miss out. Personally, I feel that the experience was really more for kids than adults but all in all it was a great way to spend an hour in a completely different way. We are still talking about the experience days later, so I suppose that's the best review I can possibly give. Enjoy.

A delight!. It was our first time to London and some locals here on TA tried to talk us out of playing. "Why would you do that?" they wondered, "with so much else to see? Big Ben...Westminster Abbey...?" Due to the ranking on Trip Advisor and our good fortune finding team mates online (also Americans, living in Germany and enjoying a London trip at the same time), we decided to play. It was one of the best things we did on our entire trip! SO, so fun! Some have called it "brilliant" and there is really no better word for it. Our guide/game leader was fantastic. I think she really made the game for us because she knew just how many clues to give us to let us feel like we were clever...but not too many to spoil the fun and let us out too soon! :) We escaped with 7 seconds to spare. An absolute blast. The only downside is, though they keep adding game rooms, it's always booked solid well in advance. If you are considering it, book now so you won't be disappointed to end up on the wait list.

Family fun for everyone in London!. This was the most fun we have ever had as a family! The hour flew by. We heard about it through Tripadvisor and are so glad we decided to book even though we didn't know much about it. There is something for everyone and everyone uses their own individual ideas and skills to solve the mystery. So much fun! I highly recommend it to anyone traveling to London to get away from the typical tourist circuit. The slots sell out fast so book ahead.

A lot of fun. Played HintHunt on July 2 with a couple we met online through Cruise critic. Don't want to give anything away so I'll just say that we had a lot of fun. When you first walk into the room you wonder how you will fill the hour but you are constantly working on finding clues to get yourselves out. Great concept, well presented and a lot of fun.

The best family experience in London!. I didn't know what to expect because my husband booked it after reading the recommendation by tripadvisor. Well, it really exceeded my expectations and my children 8 and 11 and us had the most fun hour ever!!!! My daughter told me to write that we escaped from the room with only 4 seconds left in the clock. We felt like Sherlock Holmes! The staff is very friendly and helpful. We all left with a smile in our faces and talking about the experience well after we finished it. I highly recommend to anyone! It was fun fun fun!! Excellent!!!

Worth the wait. I booked it weeks ago and was looking forward to it - it did not disappoint! They gave us hints and we worked hard .. and failed. But it was still amazing. Apparently the success rate is about 50/50 - it's so much fun though. I can't wait for them to have a second Zen room, so that our team of 10 can split up and compete to see who gets out quicker. The staff were hilarious too - we loved them. Would 100% recommend this to ANYBODY. Friends, family, colleagues etc. It's sooo fun!

Awesome team experience as a family!. We went as a family team of four with our 9 and 11 year old and it was definitely one of the highlights of our London trip. The team to greet us was enthusiastic and maintained the sense of mystery through the introduction and did everything they could to make sure we enjoyed our experience. One point, their reception area is quite small so plan to arrive around 5 minutes before your time.We tackled the John Monroe room challenge which provided a series of clues that built on each other that we needed to solve to gain our escape from the room. It is a real team game and there is a 60 minute time limit which builds the excitement as you get closer to your escape (or not as the case may be). There was lots of searching, figuring out clues, sequencing them and sorting out red herrings from the real clues.We did not break any records but we all came out of the experience having had a great time as a family. Everyone contributed and everyone really enjoyed.A team of 4 seemed perfect - you need all of the help that you can get but more than 5 would have been a tight squeeze in the room. It is not for very young children but our 9 and 11 year were well able to participate and enjoy.

Brilliant. What a great way to spend an hour while in London! Really well thought out with the right amount of clues, hints and puzzles for the 60 mins. Couldn't recommend enough and will be back to enjoy one of the other rooms

Failed. But had fun!. This was a lot of fun for my crew of me, husband and 15 year old. Our 12 year old was supposed to be the 4th and boy, could we have used her. But as she was sick, we ran short. We could have used another could of minutes - so close! It's a fun concept and time went by really fast.

One of the greatest must do in London. I cannot remark how much fun this activity is. I went with a group of friends and we had a great time. The staff is very friendly and the facility suits perfectly the game. We found it challenging but everything made sense when it had to. We needed some hints but that seemed normal as some things come natural and others you struggle. We did team work and had a really good time solving all the puzzles. I would strongly recommend it if you can grab a slot which seems pretty hard these days.
Brilliant. So much fun...best thing we did in london! Didn't expect to have so much fun...or for time to go by so quickly! Don't miss it!
Good fun!. Heard about HH through trip advisor and work colleagues. It really does live up to the reviews. Really fun! Recommended. We got out with 3+ mins to spare from the advanced room.
Absolutely Fantastic!!. I can't even describe how amazing this game is!! We had so much fun!! We can't wait to go back again :)

Fun Filled Hour in London. We heard about Hint Hunt through trip advisor since it was the #1 attraction we had to try it and it was so much fun we definitely know why it's #1. We had 5 in our party from 13 years old to 60 years old and we all had a great time. As the clock ticks down on your 60 minutes everyone becomes so frantic to solve the puzzle you are just running around like crazy yelling out ideas and laughing at what everyone else is doing. I would have loved to have done the other room too it was that much fun. As soon as you know you are going to London book this, it books up quick and you don't want to miss out. The only thing I would recommend is that they have a larger white board in the room for you to write down all the things you have found and your thoughts.
If you like puzzles, this is for you!. We had a blast trying to solve all of the puzzles to escape the room in one hour. This is a great activity for a family or group who likes a challenge!

So much fun for puzzle-minded people!. A great way to spend an hour with friends. You are locked in a room and have to solve a series of puzzles to get out. Sounds easy. It's not! It tests a variety of skills and team work is essentail. As you see the time ticking away you get more and more frantic as you as desperate to crack the case and prove you can do it. I have recommended to friends and this would make a great present for a big birthday or even wedding. Great fun!

Worth it!. We arrived early to the HintHunt and it was in a semi-shady part. I had read reviews, but I was still nervous. However, everything went so well once we got situated. My sisters and I had signed-up for the Zen Room. It was the most fun we had all week in London! My sisters couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was. I would definitely go again!!!

What a puzzling, fun, exciting, adrenaline-filled, funny hour!. We (me, my girlfriend and two friends - all around 25) went knowing very little about what was in store for us.We played the John Monroe room. It was really, really enjoyable; we had so much fun and once we escaped we were all just laughing at what had happened and had such a sense of achievement. The hour is really well run to ensure that you progress at a sensible pace. We solved so many clever, well designed puzzles.Cannot wait to do the second room!
Family had awesome time at HintHunt. It was challenging and very enjoyable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A time we will not forget.

So much Fun!. I read about HintHunt on Tripadvisor and it sounded like fun even though it's hard to understand what is install for you! Because of the very nature of the game being a secret-mystery-solving puzzle, you can't explain to anyone because it is so cleverly developed and meant to be exciting and surprise filled - I had so much adrenaline pumping through me trying to figure out and find clues to escape from a locked room! My 3 kids (aged 13, 11, 9) loved it too and I believe it was the best thing we did in London. Well done you guys it was a great game - can you come and make one in Australia please??

Crystal Maze meets Sherlock Holmes. I can't remember the last time I had this much fun. Me and my friends gave the John Monroe room a go. This definitly lives up to all the hype - I haven't stopped talking about it all weekend. Can't say too much as it would spoil the surprise, but if you want something different to do in London...give Hint Hunt a try! We are thinking about booking the Zen room already. We'd like to give a shout out to Tibi for being a brilliant host....we had such a laugh! Thanks guys! :)
Brilliant!. 3 of us completed the john Monroe challenge with just under 4 minutes left to go. Quickest hour ever! Great fun and great idea.

Amazing Experience. Definitely a must do when in London !!! We had an amazing time at Hint Hunt last saturday. Loads of fun and heads scratching during the hour. The concept and experience was different and great and the 5 of us enjoyed it very much. The staff was really lovely. We will be back !!

Brilliant. Decided to book this on the basis of the reviews here and it certainly lived up to the hype. Great fun and goes by in the blink of an eye. There were four of us in the John Monroe room and we managed to get out with 37 seconds to spare. What a sense of achievement! It’s difficult to describe but a murder mystery without the am dram and a little Crystal Maze thrown in seems the most appropriate. Don’t want to go into more detail as it would spoil it for others. I can thoroughly recommend if you’re looking to do something a little different from the norm.

Family Fun. Just had a blast at HintHunt! Initially, I was a little worried that our boys - ages 11 and 12 - would not be able to keep up with the clues and/or get frustrated putting things all together. No need to worry about that at ALL ... boys had a BLAST. Working together under a time limit makes everything a little more exciting, and even though we did not escape within the hour (We were almost there ...), HintHunt was still one of the highlights of our trip to London, which is saying a lot since there are a lot of cool things to do in London! We all definitely recommend HintHunt! A very original and unique idea ... tons of fun.
Amaizing. The best game ever. A must experience to go through. Waiting to book the higher level in my next visit.

Great fun. This is absolutely great! I couldn't really imagine what it was and it tourned out to be a super-fun afternoon. Clever arranged mystery and friendly stuff that run the place. Can't wait to go again.

Brilliantly addictive fun, perfect rainy day activity!!. This game absolutely entraps you. I entered as a bit of cynic (not helped by the lacklustre introduction by the game facilitators) and within minutes was swamped in the excitement and eagerness to solve the clues and escape the room.For any UK people, the best way I can describe this is Crystal Maze. This isn't just being sat in a room solving a couple of puzzles, you're immersed in a scenario where you have to rummage around a room to find clues which help you unlock things which lead you to more clues and so and so forth until you piece the last clues together to unlock the room and escape.We had 4 people, 5 is definitely the max and may have been a bit of a squeeze and a 'too many cooks' situation, 3 would've been do-able but any less would be impossible as there's just too much to do in 1 hour - we got out with 1m3s to spare!!This isn't the best thing to see/do in London but it is a wonderful way to spend 90 mins on a rainy day.

A Great Escape in London!. We had a fantastic time working together and solving the puzzles.... can't say much more - except - you should not miss the opportunity to try this very cool activity! I just wish there were more rooms to try!! Keep growing Hint Hunt - we want to come back to London and try more!

LOVED IT!!!. We were fortunate enough to be visiting London with a group of people and after reading the reviews for this, I told everyone they HAD to do this with me. They were a bit skeptical and I admit I was a bit worried that with all the hype the actual experience might be a little bit of a let down. I assure you it was not! If you like challenges and solving puzzles (and even if you don't!) its a must do. It literally is 1 hour out of your visit and you will be talking about it for the rest of the trip! It is a bit out of the way in a very non-descript building but is very close to the Euston tube stop. We walked to it from the British Museum - it was a bit farther than we thought but only took about 20 min. I have told everyone to do it if they are ever in London and I will definitely to try the other room on my next visit if we have enough people along.

Excellent and fun evening out. Last Wednesday night was my second trip to HintHunt. Once again, I had an excellent time. I went with a group of friends and we attempted the 'Zen Room'. Although we had to book 1 month in advance, the wait was worth it. We had an incredible evening out. The two friends I went with came out with big smiles on their faces having put their brains to work for a solid hour.I can't recommend this attraction enough. It's a fun, youthful and massively entertaining evening for everyone.Best of all our 'gamemaster' seemed enjoy watching us struggle with the puzzles but provided handy hints along the way.If they open another room, I will be there!

Excellent day out. Very unique and fun day, the staff were great and friendly, highly recommendable ! Need a good team of four or more people as I don't think three would be enough... Anyone go and try it out !

Brilliant!. My daughter and I were visiting London for a few days and since we like solving riddles and puzzles, decided to book HintHunt. It was the most fun we've had together in a long time! The game masters were so nice, and the game so interesting that we will definitely book the Zen room next time we're over in the UK. I can see how it works best with 3 to 5 participants, but even if there are just 2 of you, and you're willing to pay the amount to book the room (totally worth it), I can guarantee a good time.

Make sure you go to this!. My friends arranged this for my birthday and we had an amazing time, so I would definitely recommend it! We will make the effort to go back and do the other rooms available, and hopefully do even better than we did this time. The only thing I wondered about was if you'd have to leave your bag anywhere while you did the challenge but we were able to take them in with us. To give any details about the actual challenge may ruin it for you, so keep the mystery/surprise element and give it a go yourself!
Highly recommended!. The experience itself was so much fun, the staff were friendly and overall it's definately good value for money!

Amazing. Hinthunt was great and if you like quizzes or just thought provoking games you will love Hinthunt. The staff are great and it was refreshing to find something different to do on a weekend in London. It is better that you know little about Hinthunt before you go to get the maximum from the experience, but I would highly recommend Hinthunt as part of your stay in London. Parking outside the door was free on a Saturday with a good Café a few shops away. Well Done!

Great fun. Don't want to give too much away but what a great idea and what a lot of fun! 4 of us visited the "Zen Room." The hour whizzed by and we all loved the problem solving and team work involved.Well organised, well explained and the little "hints" from our "big sister" were invaluable!

Fun. Different. But London's top attraction?? Nah.... Three of us did HintHunt - two friends in our 50s, and my 20 year old son. It was extraordinarily difficult to get a booking - even by London standards, where it seems everything is booked out weeks ahead - booking 6 weeks ahead, with great difficulty we got a slot and that too only for the Zen room, which is the more "advanced" of the two available options. (By the way their system for finding available slots is extraordinarily cumbersome and tedious - if you plan to book, do expect to have to spend quite a while on it. It seems to me that this is something that could easily be improved).The build up to the experience was nicely done as the person who welcomed us explained the rules and did a great job of creating an atmosphere of mystery and challenge. And then we were locked into the room that we had to find our way out of within an hour. My son said that it was like playing a live version of an "escape" game on the computer... but I've no experience of those :)It was undoubtedly a lot of fun and the hour whizzed past. One forgot everything else - like tired feet, hunger pangs, other commonplace preoccupations like what to eat for dinner... the activity itself generated incredible focus and energy and teamwork between the three of us. In the end we were about 5 or 10 seconds away from the last step to free ourselves when we ran out of time.So, yes, fun - and very different from anything I've ever done before. But the highest rated activity to do while in London? Not even close. If you have lots of time - not to mention lots of money, because Hint Hunt is far from inexpensive - sure, go for it! I'm glad we went to see for ourselves what the fuss is all about. But in retrospect I can think of many things I'd rather have spent that amount of money on.
interesting. It was very interesting game and my family loved it. Clues , puzzles ...one thing leading to another trying to get out of the room within a time limit........super game. Loved it

Great fun, a truly unique experience for tourists and Londoners alike. It seems this place has had enough praise heaped on it that it doesn't really need any more from me!But if you vaguely like solving puzzles/challenges you will LOVE this. We completed the challenge with about 3.5 minutes to spare which I think was good going, it's really well thought out.It would be (literally) impossible to solve without the clues that the organisers drip-feed to you during the hour but that's all part of the fun. Will definitely return to do their 'zen room' challenge.

Definitely earned its place as number 1!. We were a group of 3 people, and we absolutely LOVED it! Time literally flew by, and we managed to complete it at the exact final second :) Despite being foreigners, with 2/3 having english as their second language, we still managed without a lot of difficulties. The game is AMAZING, and the experience we kept talking about all day! Loved it, Kudos to the organizers for such a wonderful game!

Great and unique experience!. We had a fabulous time at Hint Hunt. Everyone was friendly and very accommodating, and it was a completely unique experience! Parents and kids had an equally fantastic time, and we can't stop talking about it!
Great day out!. We took our Dad for his 50th Birthday and it was great fun, we were looking for something different and this was it. I would highly recommend!

Fun...fastest 1 hour, was tired going in but wide awake within 5 minutes. Suffering a bit of jet lag (9 hour flight, arrived the night before) so that's my excuse for not getting out in time. Still it was such good fun that it really didn't matter. We were only a party of 2 so went online to find a 3rd that lived in London (in case we needed some British help). Glad we did, you really need 3 people minimum. I always like to know if a place has a washroom (yes it does). You can use it before you go in but once in you'll forget all about how tired you are or if you even did need to use the facilities and didn't. Fastest 1 hour ever. Congratulations to the owners who took such a risk and have made this a great attraction. Really nice folks and really helpful. My only hint...(not a spoiler) is take a pen and a little pad of paper. You don't have to have to but so glad we did.

Brilliant. Just got back from Hint Hunt. It was so much better than I expected. We went as a family with teenagers who originally didn't want to go but within minutes were totally engaged in the game and now both want to try the other room. We got out with a minute to spare!! Would def recommend it to groups or families. I'm a bit confused by the previous review about food ?? They don't serve any!! I think their review must be for somewhere else. If you get the chance you must try it.

Amazing activity in London. A family reunion at HintHunt made for an exciting and fun evening, the premise is simple but the execution is complicated! Extended family of 10, split into 2 teams and played identical games concurrently. The time flies by, and as you near the end it descends into team work that can only be described as frantic! Our team managed it with 2mins 42 left, the other team with 48seconds left, bragging rights to us and it was the talking point for the rest of the evening!Fun, exhilerating and requires great teamwork! I'd highly recommend it for friends, family or even a work team building exercise.I don't think you can complain to much regarding the value for money, unless you fail to escape!Staff were informal but friendly and helpful, perhaps the only comment would be to streamline the briefing before the game begins.

Fantastic Must Do Activity. We went to Hint Hunt last night as a party of ten family members. We occupied the two John Munroe rooms as we were split into two teams of five. What a fantastic evening. We had so much fun. The competition was fierce and it was the shortest hour count down of our lives. The staff were very kind, friendly and helpful. We all spent the rest of the evening swapping stories. I can't remember another such fun family evening. Well done Hint Hunt - Thank You. Please hurry and get some more rooms so we can book again.

Unique and great. Well another 5* review. Went with kids 13 and 11 - and we all had a great time. Very unique - haven't experienced something like this before. Was one of the highlights of our 2 week vacation to UK. Without giving away much - advice to the hint hunt guys to speed up things right from the beginning.

Bit pricey.... Staff were fine but for £90 (family of four - 2a 2ch) lasting an hour it is (in our opinion) a bit on the pricey side...there is nothing really that can't be replicated and for this price and only an hour then we thought there would be something special in there but there wasn't...bit like going to Flamingoland and riding on a wheelbarrow instead of a roller coaster - the USP is great but not value for money (in our opinion)...and we are a family who are not obsessed with screens and computer games but this did not create £90 worth of value for us..

Unique. Really enjoyed this with family of 4 (10 and 14 years old). There was enough in the 'puzzle' to keep all the family interested and on their toes and everyone came out of it with a big adrenaline rush.

Great fun!. Hint Hunt was a great experience. Very well organised and cleverly orchestrated to give maximum fun. We enjoyed working as a team and were completely enthralled for an action packed hour escaping with 10 seconds to spare!

So much fun!. If you're looking for something different to do in London, this is it! HintHunt made for an extremely memorable double date. None of us had any idea what we had signed up for until we got there... we were slightly skeptical when we arrived at an unassuming, blacked out room off a fairly empty street in Euston, but our minds were soon put at ease after speaking to our friendly gamesmaster who explained what we'd be doing. I can't give away too much but I will say the hour flew, with all of us running around, shouting at each other and throwing things, going mad trying to work out what we were doing and why! You all get very into it and feel a real sense of accomplishment every time you find a clue, no matter how small. Lots of surprises and twists to keep things interesting - we (just!) completed it and got a real buzz when we did. Can't wait to go back and try the Zen room!

Lots to do in London. I like the range of activities in London, the Ballet, Jazz, sitting in the parks, walking around the Hampshire Heath. Nice people.I sometimes struggle to understand British expressions.

Fantastic!. It is really what everyone else has been talking about, a great time! Just off Euston station, this is a great hour to be spent in London, probably the fastest you ever will! Against their recommendation, I went alone with my husband (they recommend groups between 3-5 people), so we were very happy to be welcomed by such friendly staff. They give us some info on what is going to happen, but the details of the game only once you enter the room. The game is well put together, and although certainly challenging, we managed to not want to break anything in the room! And we got out with 5 seconds to spare! There is a nice pub just next door that also makes good space for debriefing and reliving the experience. We surely want to go back with friends to try the Zen Room!

Great Experience. Really good fun, challenging and intense. As a family we were so proud of our ability to work as a team to solve the puzzles and escape from the room with just over 2 minutes to spare. Team Pearson recommends Hint Hunt and plans to go back again soon.

The less we tell you the better this will be!. 15 of us booked this as something different to do before going out on a Friday night. We split into three rooms, with a very simple premise, escape in one hour. That's really all we can tell you about the detail but we would advise you get your smartest, geekiest friends together and see if you are able to get out. The best thing is that you are competing as much against yourself and your ability to remain calm and logical with a ticking clock right in front of you.We got out with five minutes to spare, our second room had around 90 seconds left and the team in the Zen room fell just short. The ONLY drawback was not being able to share our experience with the zen room team and would recommend a group of ten have the two identical rooms. That's a small problem though for a fantastic idea that offers great value for money.

Great fun. Booked this for a friend's birthday on a whim and it was a great success. We got out with about three minutes left and everyone in our group was gripped throughout. At lunch afterwards conversation turned to when we would be able to go back and try the next room. Something a big different and definitely memorable. Will be recommending to friends and coming back to try the Zen Room sometime.

As the children said "Awesome". The hour we spent in John Munroe"s office was a real test of how our family worked under pressure. It was so exciting and something of an adrenalin rush as things fell into place and the clock ticked down.The game was suitable for a family, we are in our 50's with a 10 and 14 year old. we liked it so much we are returning to the Zen room.

When we finished my hands were shaking.... If you think you are any kind of intellectual individual, you need to try this for a challenge. I did the John Monroe room with 4 other girls (24/25 yo) we completed this on the last SECOND! Oh my God this is so thrilling and you get so into if (after about 20 minutes of thinking 'what the hell am I supposed to be doing?') and it just leaves you in such an adrenaline rush. Booking the zen room ASAP.Go!

Awesome live Puzzle Game. Great experience. It's a real thriller being stuck and on the clock to solve your way out. Our game master was friendly and helpful. Definitely worth it to get locked in John Monroe's office.

Absolutely Awesome!!. We visited today (group of 4) John Munroe room-got out with 9 seconds to spare!Needless to say we had an awesome time-such an adrenaline rush finding clues and solving mystery! Really gets you to think & remember things under pressure.I don't think it's suitable for a group less than 4....We would have struggled!!The staff were very friendly and enthusiastic :))Location is great too-near euston station & next door to a pub for a celebratory drink :)))Definitely recommend this!!!!!

Well worth it!. My husband and I, along with another couple we met via trip advisor, enjoyed a wonderful hour at HintHunt. It was brilliant! We travel to London with some frequency and are always looking for something new and exciting to do. HintHunt is perfect for first time travelers to London as well as frequent flyers. It is well worth the time spent as well as the money. The location was less than a five minute walk from the tube stop.

A brilliant concept that works well. We attempted (and succeeded) Hinthunt last Friday. A group of 4 of us managed to complete the game with 6 seconds to spare. I will not give anything away but if you enjoy adventure style games then this is for you. Located 2 minutes fom Euston station. Will be booking the more difficult room.

Crazy experience!! :D. Did this today and it was absolutely fantastic! i live in London and this has got to be one of the best things so far! The amount of thought gone into this is unbelievable! Had a great time with friends, A MUST DO! really fun, especially for lateral thinkers! Put it down on your '100 things to do before i die' list :D completed it with 11 secs to go!!!

Great to do with friends!. We went as a group of friends and it was so much fun! It was very frustrating at times when we couldn't work out some of the clues but we managed to complete it with 11 seconds to spare! I'd love to do it again!

Brilliant!. I loved this! We did it in teams of 4 or 5 organised by my work. My team of four became totally absorbed in following the clues and getting ourselves out of the room! It's really well organised and a completely different way to spend an hour. Great team-building too, if that's what you're after.

Have a Clue?. I found this a really lovely and unique experience while in London. It wasnt too far from our hotel which was nice as we were running away the room for the hour trying to get the clues. I will say that we didnt get it in the hour but the the person in charge was soo nice to give us a little extra time as there was only two of us and we ended up being only 2 clues away from getting out. It was a fantastic experience even though it was only two of us and it is usually for more. We werent fast enough but the key is communication. The room set up was fab and I loved the clues. Can't recommend enough but the time goes faster than you think.

Fancy yourself a detective?. Our family did this yesterday. It’s a great activity to do together and see how you work as a team. When you’ve had enough double decker buses, try this for a change.It’s a bit hard to describe, but if you enjoy trying to solve mysteries, you will love this. It’s the quickest hour as time flies by as you try to get out of the room.The staff is friendly, helpful (thank goodness) and make you feel comfortable in all your awkwardness!This is a great alternative thing to do in London and I would recommend it to any group of 3 to 5 people! Good Luck!

Mind blowing. This is a 60 minute game which for the first 30 minutes you are struggling to understand why you are there, what is the game all about, and why did you pay a fairly high entrance fee to play.It is intense. We played with 2 kids and 2 adults. The kids are brilliant at finding the clues but the adults need connect the dots! And because you waste a lot of time at the start working out why you are there in this small room, the intensity of the last 10-15 minutes really sucks at your ability add up simple numbers. The experienced Hint-hunt folks are subtle with the clues too, they want to help but they want you to work it out. As as the clock ticks down to zero you realise that you are standing in a tiny thrashed room with paper and furniture all over the place and failure to escape facing you in the eyes.Briliant.

Whole Bunch of Fun!. Had a wonderful evening doing Hint Hunt with work colleagues. We were divided into three teams for the three rooms. Two teams were able to get out and the other team didn't (bwahahahaha!) Obviously I was on the winning team and we got out with 90sec to spare and the other team had about 60secs. Great outing and I definitely reccomend the experience. I can't wait to try the Zen room. ps went to a great pasta restaurant before close by.

Hint Hunt. As a group of 5, we have found Hint Hunt the most amusing thing in London during our 4 days stay. No one expected that it would be such a fun!I assume that we'll try the harder game once we come to London again.PS Young woman and man who hosted the game were very professional and nice.

Fab fun. Booked hinthunt as a treat for my daughters birthday after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Our group of three adults and two 13 and 14 year old girls had a really fab time. Part of the fun was not knowing what was going to happen and once in the room it was all go until the final seconds when we just managed to solve the puzzle. It was a very different activity and really family friendly. I will be very keen to go back and try the second puzzle room. Super hour of fun, wish it had gone on longer!
High expectations easily exceeded. Just go. As long as you're a group of moderately intelligent people, you will love this too. Will be recommending to anyone and everyone.

Simply the best!. I made a booking here because of it's rank on Tripadvisor, and I have to say that Hint Hunt exceeded our expectations in every way. An hour spent here will be the best hour you spend in London. Book this now!

An outstanding hour. Cannot overpraise this activity. 4 of us had a great time and, even better, we succeeded with just 53 seconds to spare. It's a great idea, beautifully constructed with excellent and friendly staff. None of the visit types apply so ignore the next bit.

The first rule of HintHunt is you don't talk about HintHunt!. The second rule is you don't talk about HintHunt!! But you DO tell people to give it a go! Had a wonderful hour solving clues, accepting hints and getting to escape the room. Had no idea at all about what was involved, but that added to the enjoyment. Team of 4 really seems optimum. We were charged with adrenaline when we came out...with 22 secs to spare...phew!! Thank you HintHunt. Can't wait to try the Zen Room. Wish there were many many more!
So much fun!. Just do this. It is so much fun. Have a team of four - the geekiest people you know. We had such a great time. Can't give it away. So fun!
Brilliant!. Went yesterday as a surprise for my 50th birthday and had a great time! Would highly recommend it but you have to be able to react quickly and take things in quickly to really enjoy it.

Unbelivable fun!!. I cannot tell you much, it would spoil the surprize, but my friends and I had THE BEST time trying to solve the clues, the lady giving the hints was great, giving us 'just enough' to go on. We were so euphoric getting out in 59mins and 59seconds it took a full 10 minutes before we could have our photo taken!! I would recommend this to anyone who likes figuring things out!!
Something different. An overall enjoyable experience, if your looking for something different & unique then this won't disappoint, cannot wait to go again :-) happy days

Different, diverting, and completely immersive. If you're a fan of 'room escape' games, you'll get the idea of HintHunt immediately. Except that this is in 'real life'.Team up in a group of 3-5, get 'locked' in a room, and work out the clues to escape.That's the premise - but I've hopelessly undersold it. It's very good fun indeed, beautifully executed, nothing like anything else you can do in London, and compressed into 90 minutes. (Indeed, we went as a group from work - it'll take not much more than a lunch break).No wonder they're often booked up well in advance.A couple of tips:- Got a big group (like we did)? Two of the rooms are identical, allowing for competitive play; which is excellent.- I'm not convinced this would be brilliant for under-9s; at least, not without a 1-1 adults ratio. It's just a bit too demanding.
Brilliant fun!. Clearly "mums the word" about the content of the day.. We went for a friends birthday.Teams of up to 5, working together, having fun.. It's great!

Something different. I booked this after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor for my two adult sons and 9 and 12 year old grandsons, thinking it would be a different fun experience for them all. As a previous reviewer said, it is in a slightly seedy road very near to Euston station and the building not quite what I expected. But in they went and came out saying that they had really enjoyed the experience! They didn't quite do it in the time but they had fun trying.

Great Distraction Between Museums. We are having a wonderful family vacation and are trying to cram in everything we can. This made a perfect 90m diversion, round trip, in which everyone in the family can participate. The guys running the gig were nice, friendly and helped overcome the feeling that you may have come to the wrong place. We'd go back and do the second room if there were time.

Great Evening Out. We were recommended to try this some friends. It is a great way to spend a hour or so. The Gamesmaster was really nice and she made the evening very enjoyable. It is such a great idea - think of the Crystal Maze but much harder. It is expensive but worth the money. We will be going back to try the other room.

Great time, great hosts. We visited here for a friend's birthday. Great experience. as much as they explain you really don't understand how much you are going to get involved and invested until you start. Love it, highly recommended.
Just amazing. This was a blast - can't say much more than that. Amazing experience, and the people running this were fun and pleasant.

Great fun. Go there! You'll like it, because you always liked these old Agatha Christie plots - your kids will love it, because it's like one of these point and click videogames, just that pointing and clicking is REAL. Had a absolute wonderful time there and spent hours afterwards talking about it.And yes! We escaped the Zen room with just 2 minutes left :-)

Fun packed hour. We were a group of 5 aged from daughter of 8 to grandad of 70. Everyone could contribute to solving the clues. We had a great hours fun and just got out in time! My son of 13 loved it, will go back and do the other room. Well organised and friendly staff, our game master was fantastic.

Very fun!. Looking for something beyond seeing another tourist sight? Once you've taken your teens to Kings Cross Station to see Platform 9 and 3/4 (blech!), walk just a few blocks and do HintHunt. You won't be sorry and everyone from 13 up will say it was the best thing they did in London. You are shown into a room and have 60 minutes to get out by finding clues. All the while you are monitored so that, if you get "too stuck," a hint will be texted in. This lets groups of any age have a great time.The staff is very friendly and seems to enjoy the hour as much as you. The do keep to a schedule so don't bother showing up early and definitely don't be late!

JusT go!!. Without spoiling the expirence . You cant really describe to much.. We went there 4 freinds and had a great time.. Manage to solve the mystery with 1 sek left!! Great laugh and brain teaser

So much fun. There was 5 of us who did this game. We had so much fun. Managed to find the key in 58 minutes. The lady who runs this place is so friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a fun filled afternoon.

Don't miss it. Most memorable part of London trip.. Dad and two daughters ages 12 and 10. Great fun for all. Area around the venue is a little seedy -- more interesting than dangerous or scary. Book early!

A mind blowing clue hunt!. A most difficult and challenging "escape game" (as they call it), you need to constantly search for clues and hints to figure your way out from a room within 60 minutes. I did not succeed, but had lots of fun. Highly recommended way to pass the hour. Need to book place in advance!!
fun, fast and furious. Went by quickly, so much fun with family of four working together. Just do it. I surprised our son 15, and daughter 13 liked it just as much.

Just Brilliant!. All 5 of our party varying in age from 9 - 43 thoroughly enjoyed the Hint Hunt. Sworn to secrecy it's hard to review except to say that you have to try it. We timed our visit as a climax to our trip to London as the location is a few minutes walk from Euston Station - and it did not disappoint! We were buzzing when we came out :-)

an even better return visit. Me and a group of friends return for the second time. As you know we cant really say much here, but its one of the best night out we ever had, and we have been through some really interesting ones.

Great break from sight- seeing!. We took our three kids to London for the first time - ages 10-26, and visited with Hint Hunt on our last afternoon. It was a total blast! We all had a great time and it was nice to take a break from all of the sight seeing. It's off the beaten path and if you're a tourist, you may get a little worried about the place, but don't. Wonderful, fun staff- terrific puzzles and all ages were able to help and have fun. We had a great dinner after talking about the mystery and debriefing- great fun!

An hour in a locked room is not enough time!. I first went to Hint Hunt a little over a year ago and played the Monroe room. There were 3 of us and the hour flew by. We needed about 30 more seconds to complete the room. Needless to say we were disappointed but immediately wanted to play again. So we booked to play the Zen room for the month later and completed it with 22 seconds to spare. Without giving too much away what's involved, it a cross between the Crystal Maze and Finders Keepers. If you get stuck clues are provided. If you love something different and the challenge of a complex puzzle I would strongly recommend this you.

unforgettable. At this point this is just a courtesy, as u can easily see from the average rating how unimaginably awesome this place is. I came here with a group of 4 friends and the hour we spent in there was incredible. the game is very well designed and although you are given absolutely no information on entry you manage to find your way (with some help sometimes). whether you can beat it or not i can honestly say you'll remember that one hour for a LONG time. So far one of the highlights of my stay in London and i've been here for around 8 months! if your only in london for a short vacation book it well in advance (~1 month before your visit) to make sure you get a slot, They're very popular!
Fantastic time at hint hunt. Great fun, really challenging - unique experience! We will definitely go back and try to escape from the zen room!

Great fun. I could not recommend Hinthunt higher. We had loads of fun solving or trying to solve the puzzles. It wasn't at all what we expected. The staff do everything they to make sure you enjoy it and their advice was invaluable. We're still talking about it days later. When they develop new puzzles, we'll definitely be back

More than meets the eye. My wife, her sister and husband spent a challenging and stimulating hour attempting to solve the problems presented. Great time for people who enjoy puzzle solving.Tie it in with a trip to the British Library and/or the Wellcome Trust Museum and make a half or full day outing. Check first as they plan a move in August 2013

Something different and fun to do.... Had a lot of fun for the 1 hour. We were a group of 4 adults visiting London, which was good as we formed our own team. Definitely something different to do in London. Wouldn't want to divulge any additional information...except to go for it! You won't regret it;-)

Great Family Fun. Mum, Dad and three children (20, 15 and 12) had great fun. We hadn't a clue what to expect, but we were well and helpfully briefed before the start. Then we spent the next hour working together fabulously, with only vague hints of sibling rivalry! That has to be a triumph in anybody's book! We didn't get out, but we still had a great time and also enjoyed a full post mortem during our subsequent dinner. We'll definitely give it another go when we next visit London. Extremely well done. "Great banter" according to our 15 year old. Very highly recommended.

Incredible fun!. A completely different, awesome experience. My family worked so well as a team and were all able to contribute in different ways. It was very satisfying to know we solved the clues in the hardest room and are on the wall of fame!

Something different and very entertaining. You have to booked in advance. At short notice we were able to book the Zen room. There was only two of us! It was devishly difficult but extremely entertaining and would highly recommend the experience!
Unique and fun!. This attraction stands out as it's something I've never come across before. Creative and highly engaging, very recommendable!

Amazing!!. This was an absolutely awesome experience! Two themed rooms to choose from, you have an hour to escape your chosen room through solving many puzzles and problems.SO much fun and really well made, the game masters are very good at helping you and they lovely fun people.Everyone should do it! Definitely a must.If only I could do it all over again....

Family had a brilliant time. We went as a family with our two daughters (11 and 14) and had a great time. We managed to get out with seconds to spare. We all want to go back and do the Zen room next.
Highly recommended but won't say more as don't want to spoil the surprise.
Karen

This is a must!!!!!!!!!!. We went as a group of 7 as part of a work day out. It was girls against boys in the John Monroe Rooms which added another challenge to the day. The experience just get more exciting and fun as you try to beat the clock to get out of the room. It is an absolutely brilliant idea, like being on Crystal Maze (for those of you who remember it). As previous reviews, can't say too much about what you do but take my word for it, it is absolutely brilliant. The whole experience including the lovely ladies running it is a must do, highly recommend

Amazing unique experience. Like many others, we decided to book HintHunt after stumbling across all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, #1 attraction in London is a huge achievement considering all there is to do here. Our trip to HintHunt last month was part of a family member's birthday weekend and at first we were worried it wouldn't live up to our expectations since we had NO idea what it was about. Arriving at the venue, it doesn't look like much and you'd easily walk straight past it if you didn't know. However, we enjoyed one of the best hours we'd had in a long time! I don't want to spoil the surprise but working as a team to solve clues in the John Monroe room was amazing and we all had so much fun. We cannot wait to return to try the other room! The staff were friendly, accommodating and seemed to enjoy it too! Thanks for a great afternoon.

Fantastic concept. So much fun, the staff are really friendly and they ensure (as much as they can without giving it away) that we get through the game. Definitely will go back, bring on more rooms guys. I wouldnt go for this if you are fewer than 4 people as I think it gets a bit difficult.

One of the best hours fun I've ever had. Period!. We went as a group of 5 and although I had high hopes given all the positive reviews on tripadvisor, you're never quite sure until you actually get there. Wow, it met all our expectations and then some!! We did the John Montrose office room and it's hard to say much without giving away the mystery and fun of it, but if you're in any doubt then take it from me DO THIS!! The hour went so fast and we escaped with only a couple of minutes on the clock - so exciting! Took us about an hour to come back down afterwards, as we were so pumped full of adrenaline :) already planning to come back and do the zen room as soon as we can! Easily 5 out of 5! Loved it :)

Brilliant. Everybody came into their own while doing the hardest room and we got out just in time. It took two teachers, one civil engineer, one accountant and a physicist to escape in less than an hour!! Great experience, great staff and a great addition to a day of London fun. Thanks.
Brilliant "escape a room" experience - highly recommend.. A brilliant hour's fun: there's nothing else like it. Won't say any more to spoil the fun, but would highly recommend it.

You have to do it!!!. Hinthunt is seriously a must do!!!! Sooo so fun! Although not a london-oriented attraction, it is definitely worth your time and money. I dont know when ill stop talking and bragging about my experience at hinthunt. I hope they get more rooms so i can do it again and again!!

The best attraction ever!. An amazing experience to everyone who likes to be challenged! it was exciting and mind blowing, and we kept talking about it the whole week!i highly recommand booking ahead cause they are fully booked till june!Dont miss it!

BE A DETECTIVE!!!. OMG! This is sooooo much more fun than I expect!!!!! It is just awesome! I had a interesting and challenging time there with my friends!!!! A really ordinary room that is fill with surprises and clues for you to find them! Gets your brain cracking and stir up your detective instinct! We got out in 59min 39sec!!!!!!!!!

Brain jogging? This is a sprint!. We did this as a group of 2 adults and 3 teenagers. The clock is ticking and you don't know how much is left to do. If you like puzzles, teamwork and lateral thinking, then this is for you! A most entertaining and unusual hours work.
amazing!. so much fun, cant wait to go back. The challenge was very tough, we were so close to beating it but alas it wasnt to be...next time!

Great fun. We were a group of four - two moms and two 21 year old sons. Had to drag the others there, so I was really hoping it wouldn't be a dud. Hint hunt did not disappoint. We had a blast and all four of us left on a high, rehashing what we had just been through and grinning from ear to ear. Great concept and wonderful fun staff. Just book and go with an open mind, if you are a fun person, then you will have fun.

Fantastic group activity. I love this place so much I have now been twice. I even convinced our office to go there for our Christmas party. Sadly, I probably won't be able to do it again unless they open a different room, but I would highly recommend all my friends to try it out. Think Crystal Maze (mystery games) crossed with Challenge Anneka! You really need a group of people with very different skills to be able to solve all the mysteries & find the clues so a group of friends or colleagues is perfect. The hosts are entertaining & give you exactly the amount of help you require. Keep up the good work.
Amazing adrenaline rush. Couldn't stop talking about it!!book ahead, they are always full months aheadIt's an amazing idea and I've never experienced anything like it

Such an usual thing to do - so much fun!!. Wasn't too sure what to expect but had seen good reviews about Hint Hunt and I'm so so glad we booked. It was really good fun, something different and run by very friendly (and helpful!) staff.Right by Euston Station so very handy if you're visiting London. Can't give too much away but it is a challenege and makes you think, makes you laugh so much too though.Loved it - can't wait to go back and complete(!?!) the other room :-)

We're still arguing. We booked Hint Hunt for our son's 10th birthday and to do something different in London. Hint Hunt is literally a few minutes walk from Euston, however, if you're early it is best to go to one of the coffee shops in the precinct rather than wait in the street for your slot. There were times when my husband and I looked at each other as if to say 'what on earth are we doing' but please be rest assured all will become clear in time. Be prepared to throw away your inhibitions and get stuck in - an hour goes very quickly! Think outside the box and look everywhere! We enjoyed it so much that we intend to book the John Monroe experience. A great day out was had by all (Mum, Dad, 14 and 10 year old).

Great fun, great games...we loved it!. We made it via the "waitlist"...thanks to whoever cancelled! Even if it is quite hard for beginners to made it in the"Zen Room" we really had a lot of fun. Staff is friendly and helpful and games, puzzles and riddles are really creative. Hopefully we will have this kind of fun in the near future also in Germany!

Great fun at hinthunt. I booked it as a surprise on a weekend away in London. There were 3 of us 2 guys and a girl ranging from 31 to 34. I wasn't sure what to expect bar it was something different. It ended up being great fun and we are already talking about booking the next room. We were slow getting started and my tip would be to get into to right away don't be shy - we started off a little timid. It took us a while to get into the swing of solving the puzzles but we did. We are already setting strategies for our next visit. We had a lovely introduction which gave nothing away and then were lend into a room and the game began. I can't say much or i'll give it away except we thoroughly enjoyed it. It is a good/fun way to get a group together working as a team.

A fantastic time at Hinthunt. A really great time at this attraction in London . Well worth the money we paid for four of us to be tested and work together as a team - great fun!The staff were really friendly and helpful and we can't wait to go back to do the more difficult challenge

A unique different way to experience London. We were traveling as a family, ages ranging from 12 to 75 and we have all tremendously enjoyed our HintHunt experience. The HintHunt team have brilliantly created this real life puzzle that required us all to work our minds together, solve puzzles and riddles, apply some out of the box thinking and most importantly: do it all together. It was fun, exciting and bonding experience. Different from everything else we have done.At first we were worried about English being an obstacle (with English not being our mother tongue), but this was no barrier for any of us.We will definitely com back again to try the other room on our next visit to London.

An original and amazing experience!. We arrived with no idea what to expect and were more than pleasantly surprised by what we faced in that room. We were 2 couples and found ourselves united as a team to complete the task. It was the best hour we've had for as long as I can remember and we'd thoroughly recommend it to others. Nathan, our games' master, was brilliant; he enhanced our experience.Thank you Hint Hunt, love from 'Team Murphy' xxx

And now for something completely different... As part of a special day out for my daughters 15th birthday we started at Hint Hunt. We have been to London many times and visited most attractions. This is something totally different from the norm. Great for my daughters 12 & 15 and just as good for my wife & I. We parked in the underground car park in Euston station and the place is just opposite. Great friendly staff make it an even better experience.

Great, creative event!!. We really loved HintHunt!! You have never done anything like this--it will be one of the most memorable parts of your trip to London--I promise. Great staff, well-executed concept.

Great way to start a visit to London. My family and I went to London for Spring Break. We have two kids ( ages 10 and 7). We had a fantastic time at the Hint Hut. This business is a unique way to family bound under pressure. It really tests your problem solving, coooperation, and reasoning skills. The business states they prefer kids around 10 or older but they were agreeable to letting our 7 yo play with us. The funny part is SHE was the one that found the final clue! I really hope this business continues to grow. We will deficintiely do this again when we return to London in the future. I only hope they expend and develop new rooms for people to explore and play detective!

Like nothing you have done before... Saw the reviews- #1 in London- never heard of it so thought why not? A cold wet Sunday afternoon transformed into a frenetic chaotic and hugely, entertainingly different hour of fun. Our team - 2 adults and 2 older kids (13 &11). Great time had by all!This next bit has a couple of discussion points for those who have been - you may not wish to read on if you have yet to go and have no idea what you are letting yourself in for!There were one or two things on reflection that were almost definitely unsolvable without help and we felt some degree of linear sequence might be better. Having said that, still by far the most original thing we've seen of done for ages so top marks from me!

Awesome says it all.. If you are looking for an absolute challenge, you must do HintHunt.It is an ingenious way to test your problem solving skills and it forces you to work in a team environment.My only complaint was that after one hour on HintHunt our adrenalin was flowing so strong we did not sleep all night, but the good news is we finished with 18 seconds left on the clock.You should open up a version of this in Canada, it would be an instant success.

Took the family. Nobody really had any ideal what to expect and its sort of better to keep it that way. We had the most brilliant hour. My husband and three children aged 21.17 and 14. Would highly recommend to anyone and since going I have bought two separate vouchers for people with birthdays as its a great present too.

AWESOME. This was SO AWESOME.. We were a team of four adults. We weren’t sure what we were getting into when we made the booking. W e had just read the reviews on TripAdvisor. We wanted something special to do for a 21st birthday. This certainly was special. Walking up to the building we were a bit skeptical, but once into the game, by goodness, it was so cool. The 60 minutes were the fastest ever. What a great time. We left the game so excited. We couldn’t wait to tell our friends about it. Three days later and we were still talking about what fun we had at Hint Hunt. Try it. It is so AWESOME!! I

Brilliant! Fun, exciting and totally different. A friend booked this for us and I'd had a look at the website before we went but wasn't really sure what to expect. From an unassuming doorway in Euston you enter a fabulous adventure where you have to work together as a team to solve clues to get out of the room before it's too late. I can honestly say it's one of the best hours of fun I've had, there were thrills, puzzles, excitement and the odd helping hand from the Gamemaster. We couldn't shut up when we came out and will be raving about it to anyone who'll listen. We were a group of 4 adults but there was a family with relatively young kids who played in the second room when we went and we both came out buzzing with adrenalin after our time in the room. It's probably best not to say too much about what actually happens in the room but I think you can trust that this didn't get to number 1 in the Tripadvisor rankings for no reason. This is a great experience, we're booked to come back for the second room and can't wait for more rooms to be created.

Be Sherlock Holmes and have a lot of fun... TRY IT !!!. For my birthday I planned that a couple of my friends & I was going to play HINTHUNT since I have seen the good reviews here on Tripadvisor - It was JUST AWESOME !!! At first sight it doesn't look of much - but you'll be surprised !! The HintHunt guys are very smart and kind helpers - very good service. We really enjoyed solving the Mystery of John Monroe - and we'll be back for the ZEN Room soon ! Try it !! Gone in 60 minutes ....

Everyone should try this!. Having read many fab reviews on this site before going, we had high expectations for Hint Hunt. It lived up to all of them! This is a FANTASTICALLY fun experience for all the family ( in a party of ten, we had 2 seven year olds and 2 nine year olds as well as the adults). We split into boys versus girls in the two Monroe rooms and all loved the frenetic race against the clock to solve the mystery and escape the room. truly BRILLIANT and so different to anything else available. I really can't recommend it enough.... Everyone should give it a go!

Thoroughly recommend. Had an amazing time at HintHunt!!! Stumbled across the reviews on here and thought it looked like fun so got some friends together and went without really knowing what to expect. Best decision of the year! We haven't stopped talking about it since! Cannot wait to do the second room!!

Great part of a London day - energizing and lots to talk about. I'm a local Londoner who did this last night with three other locals - but I can see why it's on TripAdvisor, it would be a fun thing to add to a London visit. Really energizing and good family or group fun - you get in and get out quickly, there's never a second you're bored, which is always a good thing on vacation (or in a group). Highly recommended as an off the beaten path (but still very central) activity.

HintHunt - absolutely AMAZING. Really quirky and unique idea - it's like being in one of those rooms in the Crystal Maze from back in the day! If you're looking for something a bit different to do with mates then I'd highly recommend it. And if you're not looking for something different, you really REALLY should.

Hinthunt London- John Monroe's Office. We were given this as a Christmas present. The BEST present ever. Middle aged parents and two teenagers engrossed, excited and challenged for an hour. Well, 56 minutes in our case! This is a stone's throw from Euston Station in central London, so we incorporated it into a day out from Birmingham. Everyone is very friendly, the 10 minutes before our slot was spent on a comfy sofa being given the few rules and hints for the ensuing game. Then we were led into an almost empty office room. The door shut behind us, the timer on the monitor started counting down from 60 minutes, and the frenetic fun began. I can't give you any details, so as not to spoil the experience for you, but if you like problem-solving, thinking outside the box and making connections, then you will love this. Think escape room game, but 3D and so much more.There is another room on the same site, the Zen Room, so we intend to book that one very soon.

Hinthunt. My two teenage children and I tackled the John Monroe room. You start with absolutely no idea of what you are looking for and have to figure out the mystery by making deductions from what you find in a seemingly normal office - in one hour! It was brilliant and definitely our favourite part of our London trip. Put it top of your list!

Lots of fun for our whole family!. We had fun putting our heads together to solve this vey clever and engaging mystery game. For old-school video game buffs, it was a bit like playing MYST in real life! We won't give anything away, but we went in with an open mind and managed some fun team work to solve the mystery.

So much fun!. I'd definitely recommend this for a totally different Friday night and possibly the quickest hour of your life!! A bit like crystal maze (although they let you out the room if you don't get out in 60 mins!)... be inquisitive and hunt for the clues!! Good luck!
tonnes of fun!. I agree with all the positive reviews, go for an unforgettably good time with friends or family! we'll be back soon for the 2nd game..

One of the most fun things I've done in London. After having been in London for the past 7 years, I've been and done many of London's standard attractions. After being invited to this by some visiting friends, I signed up without much clue as to what I was in for and I was absolutely blown away!

An experience not to be missed!! Try it and you won't regret it.... This is the greatest experience I've ever had with a group of friends/ work colleagues...it was so fun, exhilarating and cryptic. I've always wanted to have a Crystal maze type experience and this was the next closest thing. We did both rooms in a space of four months and wish there were more....I would gladly play Hint hunt very weekend! The time just passes so quickly when you're having fun. Great concept and I hope in the near future you can expand on more rooms as I'll definitely be there. The hosts were super friendly and location very convenient.

Awesome and original. In the last few days of our trip we wanted to do something a bit different and than we came a cross Hint Head. this is somekind of a group mission activity, you and your group are being held in a room for 1 hour, during that you and the group need to answer puzzels and riddles, find hidden keys and open all kind of locks. It was really cool!. definitely definitely must go there! best to book in advance because they are full most of the time!
Truly unique. I can't think of anywhere else you'd get an experience like this. It's like a real life point and click adventure. If you love puzzles then your love this!

Fantastic fun. Would highly recommend to anyone who was after something a little different in London with an inquisitive mind! I am not going to give anything away though, the less you know about it going into it the better!

Very entertaining Hour. This is a really different experience. Definitely worth an hour. It goes by so quickly. I'm not a huge puzzle or game fan of any kind and I really had a great time here. My husbands sons really got into it. I would recommend this to friends, families and even people looking for a unique office outing for team building.

Great fun. Hint Hunt was fantastic, the staff are all very helpful and the activity was great. It is hard not to give away anything but we will be back for the Zen room soon!! We were a family of four, mum, dad and two boys aged 16 & 17 and it is not often we can do something together that we all enjoy, thank you HINT HUNT, and see you soon

Reserve early, definitely worth it. I was so happy that there was available space during my short trip to England. After looking at the ratings and the concept of it, I couldn't help but feel excited. Being a huge fan of mysteries and Sherlock Holmes, this was definitely on top of my list. I went to the zen room (which is apparently pretty tough as per the info, and I can vouch for that) with my wife her sister-in-law. This was a great team bonding experience! The staff was great and extremely helpful. We actually escaped with 19 seconds to spare!The next time we are in London, we will definitely reserve early for the original room for a second taste. Reserve early, you will not be disappointed.

I ripped a room apart limb from limb!. Intense, mysterious and over far too quickly, Hint Hunt is a fantastic escape game which is simple yet bloody effective. Four of us played the game in a darkened unit set behind Euston station on a rainy evening in March. Once locked in we only had one hour to solve the clues and get the hell out. I've lived in London for 5 years and come across nothing like this so just get it done!

Hint Hunt – so much fun. I don't want to give anything away, so I'll have to be a bit cryptic, but believe me when I say that Hint Hunt is so much fun and more than worth the £20 entry. It's like trying to get out of a room in the Crystal Maze. You really do need team work to work it all out too. It doesn't matter what you're into (so long as you don't mind being in one room for an hour max) this will suit everyone.

If you're visiting London you just have to do this fantastic activity!. 5 Moms went on our annual weekend trip to London, wanting to do something a little different this year we booked a session at Hint Hut - I am so glad we did. I don't want to spoil the experience by going into detail so I'm just going to say if you're up for a laugh and want to do something completely different then you MUST book - it's one of the best things I have ever done we all loved it and couldn't stop talking about it all weekend! Book it now it's the best £18 I've spent in a long time!

LOVED IT. I took 5 of my friends (aged 22-23)....they all LOVED IT. Some even went home and booked another one as soon as they got home to go with other friends. Went in not knowing what to expect and thinking we would finish very quickly because we assumed we were that smart BUT lets just say time really flies when you having fun. It definitely brings out your competitive side. Would recommend it to anyone. Spent the rest of the night talking about.

Absolutely brilliant. Went without really knowing what I was getting myself into! Absolutely amazing experience! Don't want to give too much away but haven't had so much competitive fun in ages! Really really great and my friends and I spent the rest of the night talking about how brilliant it was!! Would recommend to everyone! I think it's a great activity! Wish there was more like it!The staff - also incredibly friendly and helpful! Top marks all round!

Fun for the whole family. We arrived somewhat nervously at Hint Hunt as part of a night out for our daughter's 15th birthday as a family of five. We had high expectations having read Trip Advisor comments but aware that teenage girls can be hard to please. The venue from the outside is somewhat underwhelming in a scruffy street next to Euston station. However we were met warmly by 2 Hungarian ladies who put us at our ease and gave us a briefing on what to expect. I don't want to give too much away because the surprise is a big part of the fun. However, we found ouselves being led down a fire escape into a locked room with an hour to escape. The next hour was a frantic shared problem solving exercise which had us as a team working out riddles, searching for clues, dismissing red herrings and sharing laughter and frustration in equal measure. We escaped with 7 seconds left on the clock and came out with grins across our faces and a real sense of achievement. Even our hard to please 15 year old really enjoyed it. Highly recommended!
Great fun!. Excellent fun - one hour in a locked room with three friends - many hours of fun afterwards discussing the event. Adrenalin powered problem solving - we will go again for the other rooms.

Amazing experience in London for everyone!. We decided to do something different on our city trip/holiday and found Hint Hunt while looking around in Tripadvisor. We were a bit nervous because we didnt really know what to expect, and being a family with one 10 year old, we had no idea what to expect. I can only say it was the best thing we did in London of all the things we did while there, it was soo much fun and we all worked together and its a great team work activity, with adrenaline pumping, brains working on full :) Excellent fun for everyone who is looking for a memorable experience! I would dear say anyone in any age would enjoy this - adults, colleagues, friends. Great host very lovely and helpful. We would love to do this again!

WONDERFUL!. We were really nervous going to HintHunt as we didn't know anyone who'd gone and just booked based on the great trip advisor reviews. Most of the fun is not knowing what to expect so I won't say much - except that it is a great experience! Our friends travelled up from Surrey to join us and we were hoping that it would meet our expectations. The facilitator was great - really into it, really helpful and courteous. We are going to book straight away to do the other room, and only wish they had 50 different variations so we could go every weekend! Amazing! Do it!

excellent fun for all!. This was such fun! The hour went so quickly! We went as a family (children 10 and 14) and it was so appropriate for all of us. Everyone could join in. The host guides each hint hunt group individually, so that it is pitched at the right level. Groups of adults would also enjoy this a lot.
