Very friendly host- we got the impression that she was enjoying it as much as us! Can't wait to go again to do the Zen room! Would love to see more of this sort of thing!

An incredible experience!. My four friends and I knew nothing about this before participating, and I would have to agree with all the other great reviews. It was one of the best, most fun-packed, adrenaline pumping, exciting, frustrating, and ultimately rewarding (all crammed into one hour of intense screeching) experiences we have had in an afternoon. DO IT! YOU WILL LOVE IT!

Like the Crystal Maze only more fun and no annoying harmonica playing in the background!. This was SUCH a brilliant way to spend an hour doing something a bit different. Went as 4 friends and laughed a lot whilst putting the old grey cells to the test. Could not recommend enough.

Brilliant Fun for All the Family!. The hour went so quickly! Won't say too much as don't want to give too much away, but well worth the money and we will be sure to visit the other 'room' next time we are in London

One of the best things to do in London.... Booked this as a surprise for my husband's birthday. Although to be honest with the little I knew about it it was a surprise for me too. There were four of us in total, we played the John Monroe game. We are already planning to re visit to do the other room. The hour sped by, we were totally involved with it.I hope the company/concept grows and evolves to have new rooms and venues. Fantastic idea.Needless to say my husband thoroughly enjoyed his birthday present...all four of us would highly recommend to anyone who likes solving puzzles and mysteries. The game is afoot....

Great event - can only recommend it. Went there with a few friends and had an hour of non-stop high-tension fun. Really felt like we were detectives, and the puzzles and brainteasers were all challenging, yet very creative and fun. Great event for team-building, or simply for a social night out with friends or family.

So much fun. Did the hinthunt last night with my husband and a good friend. We booked based on all these recommendations from trip advisor. Was met by the friendly hungarian who gave a short briefing on what we were supposed and left us to fill in the blanks. Once in the room you get bombarded with all these clues and non-clues. Really really fun. The hour sped by so fast. A great healthy amount of stress, quick thinking, teamwork, connecting dots -- all in all a great social activity. Highly recommended!!! Thank you to the organizers for all the hints and nudges.
One of the best things in London. Obviously I can say very little as it will give the game away, but if you like team challenges this is so much fun. Do it, and keep the secret!

Best Saturday evening ever. Loads of fun and excitement as well as an amazing brain-teaser. Went with a group of friends and we enjoyed every last minute. The scene is well planned with a number of unexpected twists; we really had to work to make our escape. An absolute must for visitors and locals alike.

BRINGS OUT THE INSPECTOR IN YOU!. Brilliant way to spend an hour! Locked in a basement with your team mates, there has been a Murder, and you have to work out how to get out of the room, racing against the clock!. Think Crystal Maze, but with more brain power than physical power! The game got more fun and frantic as the clocked ticked down- - excellent excellent idea! This is something that could get bigger and better - and hopefully the more popular this becomes - more rooms will be introduced. The guys that have devised this are so on to a winner! You should franchise this!!! Loved it!

HintHunt - So much fun!. A few of my friends and I did HintHunt as a birthday treat. Not knowing what to expect, we sort of had the idea that there would be clues to solve - but you don't really consider the level of detail that goes into something like that. The basic idea is to follow the clues/puzzles/riddles to get out of the room. It's been a while since I laughed that much! The whole experience was very interactive and really couldn't have been more entertaining! A good number of people to go with is about 4/5, and I don't think the rooms accommodate more than that. But more people would hinder, rather than help. From walking in to getting out we were faced with puzzles, little obstacles, some lateral thinking and looking in every nook and cranny we could find to find the things that lead to clues and solving of clues. Definitely recommended for team building - and especially if just for a bit of fun with friends. Ingenious Fun!

Everything is not what it seems, keep going and you'll get there in the end!. This was an hour well-spent hunting underneath tables, in secret safes, in books, trying to find the culprit of a murder. You have to follow clues, decipher codes, find keys and above all, think! The puzzle is intricate and very well-planned. Apparently only 50% of participants manage to leave the room before time is up (we managed with two minutes to spare!). Andrea was really friendly and helpful in our hunt.

AMAZING A MUST DO!!!. I would like to say i have never ever ever wrote a review online about anything ever but HintHunt was amazing it was the greatest experience and a load of fun the staff are lovely really really nice and really go out of there way the make your experience amazing and what a unique idea i have to say 10/10 all the way if you havent been you havent lived!!Dan

Original and fun experience. I went with some friends and had a very fun and original experience. It's just a shame that once you have tried it, you can't go back to do it again as you then know what happens!Problem solving was fun but I did feel that some of it was too much, and it was more guess work than actual clever problem solving, especially within the time constraints.

When reality beats virtual experience.... It was an absolutely fantastic experience. I have to admit that I was really sceptic at the beginiing about the possibility of playing an escape room in reality. I have to also admit that I was completely WRONG. It is much better by far. Absolutely a NOT-to-MISS experience.Please, set up new rooms. We 'll definitely come back the next time we are inLondon!!!

Very original. You're locked in a room with only an hour to solve the mysteries - and there are many!We've been twice to HintHunt: the first time, we didn't solve the murder mystery (we were only two!), but we loved it, and went again with two friends, to the Japanese-themed one, and this time we solved it, just on time. One of the technical effect didn't work, but they gave us extra time to compensate. I don't want to say too much, but if you're looking for a fun and quite cheap activity between friends that everyone will remember, if you want to test your logical and observation skills, don't look further!

Fantastic & Unique Experience. What can I say without giving anything away? This was a superb event for our little team of Sherlock Holmes’s. An hour locked in a room trying to solve a crime…look everywhere, solve riddles, think outside (whilst inside) the box.The team behind Hint Hunt have not only come up with an unique concept, but they’ve also managed to devise a clever way of keeping you entertained for the full hour without making things too easy (or indeed too hard!).If you’re looking for something that doesn’t involve drink (although there’s a good pub next door) and isn’t too physical…check it out!

One of a kind - AMAZING experience!. I have now done both the HintHunt rooms (they currently have two and are looking to add more) - and I think these are two of the funnest hours I have spent in London (and both are completely different). Did you love the Crystal Maze? Do you love a mystery? Are you a bit keen? Then this is definitely for you. 60 minutes to 'escape' and you will come out feeling like a kid at Christmas. I recommend this to anyone who lives in London or those visiting. You don't need to be amazing at Quizzes - you will get through somehow! There is nothing like it and you will not be disappointed. I only hope they get new rooms up and running soon so I can do it again!!!

Absolutely amazing experience!. We booked Hint Hunt for four people without really knowing what we were getting into - it was an absolutely fantastic experience. The people there are really friendly and set you up nicely while the puzzle itself is all kinds of fiendish. We just about managed to complete it in time and have never felt as brainy!We were joking with the staff saying they must have faked all the positive reviews but we can confirm they're very well deserved. Five out of five - excellent stuff!

It is a must do in London!!. We were in four friends and had an excepcional time.It is totally worthed!!The staff is great and fun.There is not too much to say as we do not want to give any hint away. Just do it!We are planning going back to London to do the other room. If you do not want to ve surprised, read below.Ps. It was cel. Mustard with the knife on the Library.

Must-do!. Two friends and myself had the time of our lives in John Monroe's Office! Great staff and the game was amazing! It's quite weird to book something that you have no idea about but I can really really really recommend this to everyone!PS: Thank you to the lady that helped us find the place! You should really check it out!!!

A great way to spend 60 minutes. Giving too much away would spoil your fun. All you need to know is that this simple idea has been designed an executed in such a clever and enjoyable way. The puzzles are well thought out and some very ingenious ideas are used as you progress towards your ultimate goal of escaping from the room. We will definitely be back to attempt the other room currently available and any other new rooms that the team decide to create. This attraction thoroughly deserves top marks, even though I know its heightened popularity will make the demand for bookings even greater! (Get building new rooms now please!)

Amazing!! Made it out in 58 minutes and 36 seconds!. I went last night to Hint Hunt in a group of 3, we did the John Monroe office room. Our hostess Andrea welcomed us when we arrived and gave us some basic information on what to expect, the best way to go about finding clues and some other hints and tips and then our 60 minutes began......Initially you are just manically searching for anything that might mean something but it takes about 10 minutes before you start figuring out what is important and what you want to find. It's so much fun and made me laugh because you keep finding things which you know must be useful but you have no idea why :)Andrea gave us some really helpful hints along the way and even helped us with our maths which was rubbish hahahah it was great that she was able to steer us along without giving too much away.We did manage to make it out in time (58 minutes and 36 seconds) but only just and the last few minutes were really stressful trying to lock together the last few cluesI would 100% recommend this to anyone, and we will be back to take on the Zen room challenge next!

Incredibly funny. It's complicate to describe it, but I was there last night with some friends and we had so much fun. You have to give it a try and you won't regret it. The only issue, booking is a bit complicated.

A fantastic and hugely unique way to spend an afternoon. I have been meaning to write this review ever since I went to HintHunt with my girlfriend and two friends in mid January. We didn't really know what to expect and I don't want to give too much away myself, but we had an absolutely fantastic time. We went on a Saturday afternoon, and it was perfect for this as we enjoyed a really unique hour and a bit, before discussing the whole thing over drinks for the rest of the night.I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for something a little bit different...and fancies themself and friends as amateur sleuths!

Just book it.. We weren't too sure what to expect but what a fun, original concept - something totally different that appeals to those that love puzzles, codes, lateral thinking,etc, Run by delightful staff who ensure you have a great time. Want to go back now to tackle another room. Brilliant for a family outing, group of mates, team building, work do, etc. Treat yourself and book it.

Awesome fun...give it a go!!. Wasn't quite sure what to expect and I won't go into detail so that it stays a little mysterious!My wife and I, our 21yr old son and his girlfriend and our 15yr old daughter thoroughly enjoyed it. This is something that will appeal to all ages. The time absolutely flew by and we are booking up to do the Zen Room. I just hope they add more rooms soon as we would all love to go again and again!Cannot recommend this enough! Give it a go!!!!!!!

By far the most fun thing I've done in ages. HintHunt totally lived up to my expectations - really imaginative and clever, and so much fun. I was scared it might be too tricky, but they provide clues if you're stumped (though they still make sure you have to think about things). I would recommend this to everyone and will be going back to try the second room. I wish it was longer than an hour - the time really flies. Don't read too much about it as it will ruin the fun.
Superb - Must Do!. I won't leave any details, for obvious reasons - but my advice is to just book and go along. Absolutely superb! Great fun and a brilliant concept.
OUT!!. Done in 59 minutes and 42 seconds with a crew of three! Phew!!!Very entretaining live puzzle.(I dont want to spoil it up but it was Mr. Black with the rope on the library.);>]

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! BRAVO,HintHunt!!!. AMAZING!!!! Playing the game gives you a feeling as if you were a child and a detective in one! We came by taxi and immediately ran into Atti ( a nice and shy young man-one of the creators of this wonderful game), he let us in and said:"We prefer not to eplain anything-just use your common sense and search,you have 60 minutes to escape from the scene of crime and then he added modestly- please- if you do not succeed very much and get angry-please-don't break anything-sometimes people do! At those words we laughed, the door, looking very much ordinary, was opened, we got in and there it began! Following the main idea of the creators - not to explain aything-I omit all the details how we did it- say only it was absolutely captivating and brought us a great joy every time when we found something or solve a code or combination to open the lock!'So London is a wonderful city- BUT- if you are already somehow tired of the daily routine of sightseeing and viewing all the "London icons" -HintHunt is the right place to go and to have an experience of an absolutely different kind! We were not the winners- turned out to be in one step from it-but we really enjoyed every minute of those 60 given! We wish you success- you'll like the game-we are sure!PS SIC! Some HINTS for HintHunt:1.They start to sell it to the team of three- there were two of us and after corresponding HintHunt by e-mail we found an agreement-so address them,they are flexible.2.For my compatriots coming from Russia and actually to anyone who is not a native speaker-though Atti said- you don't need much abilities to speak English to play it- yes! that's true-but yoy'll definitely need to be able to understand the written one.Why?Just go and find out why!:-) We wish you all success and a lot of fun!

Rise to the challenge. Have now done both rooms with the same band of friends.Brilliant for an afternoon's activity with friends, family, or for staff away days as team work, trouble-shooting, creative thinking and good communication is needed throughout.
Amazing. Great fun! Excellent way to spend an hour. Really friendly staff and a very well thought through game.

What can I say! Brilliant. What a well thought out intelligent activity. I went with 2 others and you go into a room filled with clues to help you solve a mystery. There is a time limit of 60 mins. The time goes so quickly. It is such a fun activity, and I would thoroughly recommend it. The staff are friendly and supportive too. Thank you

Tons of fun, can't wait to try the Zen room. I was in London just for a weekend and managed to squeeze in (and luckily found an available room) Hint Hunt in it. The room was challenging, there were only three of us and couldn't get out but were very close to it. Silvestre was our Hint Master and he was fantastic at it, he never gave information that was not needed and whenever we were stuck he would give us clues that helped us but without being too obvious (so you will still feel satisfy with your findings)The game is really well thought off and I can not wait to go back and do the Zen room. I will try to find a while 5 people team for that room though. I 100% recommend Hint Hunt

Interesting, fun and challenging1. Visited HintHunt with 3 others (family and friends) and thoroughly enjoyed the hour. It seemed to go very quickly but we were on the go for the whole time and it was an excellent way to spend an hour. Really made us work as a team as well. Friendly staff, and easy to find. Bottom line is it is highly recommended and I will probably re-visit to try the 'Zen' room.

Fantastic idea. Try this if you are 3-5 persons!! You have to solve a murder in order to get out of the room, 60 minutes time and the timer is running....!,, i do not tell you more, but great value for money!

Totally recommended!!!. If you book up anything this year make it hint hunt!! Went with 4 other friends after hearing lots of good things about this and we all loved it!! Going back for another hint hunt challenge next month!! If u love CSI style problem solving, hanging out with friends, fast-paced fun u will love this. It is truly a unique experience and if u miss it you'll miss out!!

There's a reason why everybody gives this five stars. An absolute TripAdvisor find, don't ignore the many many five stars for this wonderful interactive experience.Hinthunt is an escape game. Escape the room within an hour. Very enjoyable. Most people should do this.

Brilliant just go.. Didn't know what to expect when booked this as part of a 30th birthday. Had a fantastic time. Very clever idea. Managed to get out with only 24 seconds remaining. The organisers were very friendly and the hints were appreciated. Talked about the experience for the rest of the day and one week later, are still talking about it. Well worth a visit.

Great family activity. We have 3 teenaged boys & we all thoroughly enjoyed it! One of the highlights of the holiday despite only going for an hour. It made us work together & listen to each other. I think we were given a lot of hints!

Book it, this is awesome!. Myself and 3 friends went to Hint Hunt as a post Christmas present knowing very little about what was going to happen. The organisers were very welcoming and the introduction told us all we needed to know to feel excited without giving anything away. Any fears about being 'locked in' or concerns about small spaces disappeared instantly in a haze of anticipation! The four of us rushed about the place trying to find and solve clues and the hour flew by in a cloud of mini-achievements and giggling! There is more to achieve than you could ever imagine... Hint Hunt is a real challenge but so much fun, we felt exhilarated once we'd completed the challenge and all chatted about it in the pub for hours afterwards. Hint Hunt is excellent, I can't think of anyone I know who wouldn't LOVE it and it's amazing value too. We with the organisers the very best of luck and sincerely hope lots of people book... so they can set about creating more rooms all over the UK! Stop reading reviews... just book it!!

Fantastic fun!. I saw the good reviews when searching for something to do for my son's 18th birthday at Christmas time and came across HintHunt. In the group was myself, my husband, 19 year old daughter; 19 year old son and the 18 year old.As with all of these reviews, I do not want to give anything away but I can confirm it is excellent fun and all the family thoroughly enjoyed it - it is definitely an activity not to be missed! :)

One of the most fun things to do in London!. We went to hint hunt as a group of three. We all had a blast, it was very entertaining and got us all working together. This is very suitable for teams of all ages and it was certainly the best thing we did in London along side our lunch cruise on the Thames. The game was fun and exhilarating and gave some real escapism, I felt like a detective. I would highly recommend this to everyone and would say to not be put off by the surrounds, it's easy to get to and the ladies that run it are really helpful and nice.Next time we're in London we're going to try out the "Zen room".

HintHunt - best fun for inquisitive minds. Brilliant experience for the whole family (I'd say aged 7 upwards). Very innovative and imaginative experience, having your own Big Brother style assistant helped keep us on track. The hour flew by. Tremendous sense of accomplishment when we escaped. The family talked about this more than anything else we did in London.

so much fun. we booked both the john monroe rooms as there were 8 of us. 4 in each room. so it was going to be a competition. we all loved it. it was so much fun. trying to find the clues and get the codes....gets the adrenaline going.would defo recommend. great for team building and staff activity days.thank you very much to the hosts. they were great too. hint hunt need to come to manchester now.

Fun and original. After originally not being able to attend they were great about letting me re-book and so helpful. My friends were quite skeptical as we didn't really know what it entailed but that changed as soon as we got in there and I had one of the most entertaining and challenging hours I have spent in a long while. Would recommend to anyone looking for something a little bit different!

Amazing, Unique experience. LONDON MUST.. Genuinely one of the best attractions I've ever been to, if not the best! So unique, fun and interactive! Had such a good time and loved every minute, the two girls at the desk who run the thing were great too! Amazing concept and a must in London. Would've loved to do the Zen room too but sadly they were fully booked until next week when we'll have finished our holiday. Finished the John Monroe room with 8 seconds to spare with 4 of us which was a great buzz. Couldn't recommend more, a hidden gem and I don't see how you could be disappointed! Will definitely return next time we're in London.
Great Fun. We had a brilliant time even though we were useless and spent a lot of time giggling. We are going again to the Zen room and this time we mean business :)
Innovative & great fun. One of the most innovative and fun activities I've done. Fast paced and enjoyable with friendly staff.

Such a unique and fun activity!. One of the best ways to spend an hour in London. We were a bit sceptical about it beforehand but it turned out to be so much fun, a real life CSI/Midsomer Murders investigation! The tips and hints given throughout the challenge were very useful and made it actually possible to solve within the 60 minutes. Can't wait to do one of the other, harder rooms. Have recommended it to everyone.

great fun!. Don't be put off by its location in a slightly seedy road just past Euston station. It is well worth going.If you've ever wanted to play at being detective then this is the game for you. It is harder than I thought, but the 3 of us managed to solve the crime with 2 minutes to spare. You get hints to help you if you are getting stuck.I wish we had something like this in Bristol, all of my friends would love it.

Best way to spend an hour with your teens. We are so glad we found this and booked it. Original, fun time that your family will remember forever. A fresh break from the usual tourist stuff. A few minutes walk from Euston station. Really hoping to be able to go again sometime. Better to wait til the kids are at least mid-teens. There were 5 of us and it kept us mad busy the whole fun 60 mins trying to beat the clock. Helga was fantastic.

Must Do Activity. Locked in a room with an hour on the clock and a ton of clues holding the secret of how to get out. It sounded I teresting and the reviews were all positive so it seemed an interesting way to spend an hour. It far exceeded our expectations. The registration notes that it is a minimum of 3 and we were just a party of 2 so I emailed the HintHunt guys to find out if we could still participate. Their response was very prompt letting us know that it is harder with two and we would have to pay the rate for three but if we were game they would do their best to ensure it was a fun experience, we decided to go for it. They were easy to find from the tube. Chobski was friendly, positive and clearly explained how to play and best strategies for success and then we were locked in. I wont spoil the fun but it was a very quick hour. We were one clue short of making it out but that didn't deter from the fun. It just made us want to go back and try a different room. Unfortunately it was all booked.If you want something different and like a challenge you will love HintHunt.

A Brilliant Surprise. I met up with an old friend and his son at Euston Station. I was with my son. i had arranged this event and was intrigued as to what it would be like after reading previous reviews. My friend, being the suspicious type, had decided to check the venue out prior to meeting up with me. He said that he felt that I had been scammed as the venue was locked and he had a bad vibe!When we arrived the door was locked but at that moment the Hint Hunt crew appeared, as if by magic, behind us and let us in.From then on the adventure began and I will only say that we were not scammed and I will only describe it in one word- BRILLIANT!

A unique and brilliant concept. I can not recommend this attraction enough. My work team and I went here as something fun to do before Xmas dinner and had an excellent time. After a friendly welcome we got into the experience quickly and the hour just flew. Afterwards we were all buzzing with our accomplishment and had plenty of stories to swap. Overall I would totally recommend this as a team building exercise or just an activity for a group with an hour to kill.

The hour dissapeared in no time.... A great fun adventure where you need to solve a mystery and escape from a room. Just the right level of complexity, humour, intellectualism and amateur detective. Had a great time and would definitely return.

Best hour ever!. I would highly recommend HintHunt- it’s amazing! I can’t say too much without giving the game away, but if you're after a different, exciting, challenging hour then definitely book. I went with 9 colleagues and it’s a million times better than sitting in the pub discussing work!

The fastest, funnest hour ever. I went Hint Hunting with my husband and 2 friends this weekend and I can HIGHLY recommend it.A well thought-through entertaining game for all, we really didn't know what to expect before we went into the locked room, but now we're all desperate to do it again (and better!). We had a great time working together to solve the puzzles in the room, and when we came out we discussed it for hours - who had done what, where we had found X and what we would have done differently. This game is exactly as advertised and the creators have put in a huge amount of effort to make it enjoyable yet challenging; mind-stimulating but not frustrating. I was very very impressed and highly recommend it to groups of puzzlers - best way to spend a cold winters' afternoon ever!

The Crystal Maze meets CSI in a small room! Awesome fun.. I booked this for my dad, sister and me as something a little different to do in London, other than the museums and shows. It was definitely different, and we had a great time working together to try and escape the room. We didn't quite make it, but only just, and it didn't detract from the fun. The time went by really fast, which shows we must have been having fun, and I just wished they had something like this near where I live! We were still talking about it the next day and are already planning on a future visit with some friends. All in all a great bonding experience that also happened to be great fun!

One of the best times I've had, quite literally ever... This was one of the most fantastic experiences I've had, and it's coming off of trips to Rome and Paris. My team of two (wife and I) had to stretch every inch of our imagination to (BARELY) escape in time.. the gents who put this together did a great job of making a game that was accessible and exhilarating.I dearly love this city, and I love the treasures and pleasures London has to offer.. but if you're coming here for only a weekend, even if it's your first time, HintHint MUST be on the list.My wife and I are STILL talking about the clues.. and some of the.. non-conventional.. problem solving!Take my advice, have a go at HintHunt and enjoy the fun.

Clever, unique, and lots of fun!. We had a really great time. The timer keeps you focused, and seemed to count down way to quickly. We didn't quite get the solution in time, but we were so close. Will definitely do this again. Highly recommended!!

A great way to have a good time. This experience was even better than we imagined from the reviews & what we had seen on the website. We couldnt stop speaking about it. We were a group of 3, two adults & 1 teen. It really got us all working together & we couldnt believe how quickly the hour passed. You need to explore everywhere, and sometimes join clues together to achieve a result.I'm not going to say anymore, as part of the excitement is that you dont know really what to expect.This is an extremely clever idea and great fun. Thoroughly recommended

Great fun. A group of five of us tried out HintHunt after a recommendation and we had an absolute blast. You are locked in a room and have to solve clues in order to escape (you have an hour). Can't say much else, other than to say that is was very cleverly done! The staff were lovely and friendly, and very enthusiastic. Definetely give it a try!!
Amazing. So much fun. You're locked in a room with a number of challenges and clues as your means to escape. So cleverly put together and so much fun. Recommended to everyone!

Hints were Hunted. How hard can it be to solve a few clues and escape a room? Very! The guys at HintHunt have constructed a clever game that pushes you to your mental limits, no second can be wasted or clue overlooked as you try to solve the mystery before and around you don't forget to look behind you. Before you know it your heart is racing as fast as the time is ticking down. There are plenty of Eureka! moments when you solve one thing only to realise that it just opens up a whole new world of things to work out and frown over. Now stop reading all these reviews, book your visit and be Sherlock Holmes for an afternoon as there aren't many places in London that offer so much fun for such a decent price!

Awesome. We came away from HintHunt exhilarated and excited. When we booked we didn't know what to expect all we knew was that we were to be locked in a room and had an hour to escape! I can't reveal too much otherwise it would ruin the surprise but suffice to say that hour flew by. We worked together as a team (2 adults and 2 teens), at times the adrenalin was pumping and once we had finished we felt a real sense of achievement. Hinthunt have now created another room which we have booked for December, we can't wait to go back.If you're after something innovative, quirky, challenging, unusual but most of all fun then this is definitely for you!

HintHunt - Londons best kept secret!! Shhhh. Its Hard to describe the fun to be had at hint hunt with out giving the game away besides telling you it is one of Londons best kept secrets!me and 6 friends split into 2 groups and were both lead into a seemingly ordinary looking room. our task was to escape the room. The how and the why are for you to figure out but beware as the door closes behind you you have merely an hour to do so. Unravel the mystery, follow the clues, solve the puzzle. we escaped with 9 seconds to spare! and were elated.In the pub afterwards we spent many hours discussing with our friends in the other group 'who found this' and 'how someone solved that', it was clear their enjoyment of the experiance was every bit on a par with ours. the excitement that builds with the momentum that seems to gather as the hour progresses was almost tangible! so much so that we needed to spend this time afterwards talking about it and reliving our expiriences. The one overiding thing which we all agreed upon is that we will be returning to Hint hunt as soon as possible to attempt their latest challenge.

A fantastically frustrating way to spend a hour!. This is a great experience for anyone looking for a new challenge. The game itself involves being locked in a room (with a group of your nearest and dearest) having just one hour to escape- a hair-raising thought! In order to escape you have to work quickly to solve riddles, find clues and there is even some light arithmetic involved. If you're fast enough you are rewarded with freedom and a great sense of accomplishment. A lot of thought has been put into developing the game and there is a wide variety of different activities to keep you entertained for the full hour. Oh and trust me you WILL need the full hour- my group only just making it out in time.

Brilliant afternoon out!. I went to hinthunt with three of my friends on Saturday and had a brilliant time, I can highly recommend it as a great way to spend an afternoon in London. I was a little worried the puzzles would be either too hard or too easy but they manage to tailor it to your own group's skills whilst keeping you engaged and interested! Fantastic!

BrillianT. The first thing for ages that made me excited/happy/frustrated/scar. Awesome!!!!(I don't think I have or able to write more because it could crack the fun behind it. Let's try it, and you will see!)
